text: Literally not a thing, anything at all,  in my order was right but they gave me enough food to feed an African Village for at least a decade so I can't complain.  I ordered for me and  my brother I got enough food to feed all of Angola very pumped.  If it's midnight and you drive thru they'll hook you up with basically the whole menu from what I gather.   They did charge me an extra 2 bucks from what it said on the screen tho so 4/5 stars.

I've lived in the area for 5 years now. This taco bell used to be the worst of the fast food chains on Livingston ave. After the updated building this location has proved itself over the past 2 years to be the only good fast food joint on Livingston. They may mess your order up here and there, but hey, its taco bell. The food will be good, the employees are above average fast food employees and what more could you ask for in a late night option?

So if it's late and you are craving fast food. Skip the Wendy's or Popeye's, this is the only Livingston ave fast food restaurant that will leave you satisfied.

This is probably the worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. Severely under-staffed, they are extremely slow! I have a feeling this location will shut down soon unless new management comes in or more people are hired. Food seems fine (for Taco Bell), but as a fast food restaurant you expect your food In a timely manner, and that's where they fail miserably.
Saturday evening, 10:30pm, closed. No explanation. We've given this place several chances to improve, but sadly this is probably our last visit.
The food has good taste but if u want a bad stomach ache then go for it , not healthy at all even if its a ''third meal'' late at night.
A few years back a guy offered to take me here for breakfast....... I"ll give it two stars because it was better than a walk of shame.  Miss college

This is my local Taco Bell now and I love Taco Bell, but I will not be going here ever again. First time I waited ages, only for them to hand me 3 big bags of food. I ordered one burrito but because they deleted my order I had to wait like a million years for a feast for the people behind me... ok not that big a deal but the burrito was not good, you know how sometimes they make the beans like flavorless?

2nd time, they handed me the food and took it home. The guy asked for sauce, even double checked to make sure the right kind and then didn't put any in there. From before I even opened it up, I was hit by a smell that was not right. The smell alone made me feel nauseous, I worried the meat was bad but I couldn't see anything wrong so I tried it anyway. Tasted awful, definitely the lettuce/tomatoes had gone bad although I still suspect the meat had to be causing the smell. I was sick to my stomach with pain and explosive runs for 24 hours. 

Even if it was a fluke? Still not worth coming here ever.

Fast service, food served at the right temperature, order filled accurately. That's all a fast food restaurant needs to be successful. This one hit all three for the most part. My wife's fresco taco had some strands of cheese in it, but otherwise a perfect visit.

Stopped after leaving Disney. You'd think since they're open til 4am they'd realize maybe it gets busy close to closing time at Disney. Nope. Been sitting in line for over 20 mins. Nobody is moving. Employees wandering around inside but nothing's getting done. Multiple cars just found balky pulled out & left. Clearly this is what they employees are hoping will happen. So ridiculous. Management should seriously check into what's going on here unless they just love to lose more business & turn off customers. I've never seen this at any other Taco Bell in the country, regardless of time. Btw - arrived at midnight, not 3am or something. AVOID THIS LOCATION!!!!!
the employee is bathing in the parking lot while his friend stands and smokes blowing it at everyones car....
Like others have said, this place is always closed. At like 6:30 pm on a Tuesday, for example.
I installed yelp and created an account and wrote this review about the time it took to get a taco...all while waiting for my taco.  Terrible slow service.

I couldn't be more disgusted. I went into the restaurant instead of waiting in the 12 car deep drive through assuming I would get better more prompt service. I ordered a few soft tacos and 4 cinnamon delights. As my food was completed, I watched one of the cooks pop something into his mouth upon wrapping up my order. That jerk ate one of my cinnamon delights right in front of my face and I didn't realize it until I looked in my bag and there were only 3. Absolutely disgusting and I will never return.

Worst Taco Bell in the state.  Horrible service, barely warm food.  No one working the register. Saw an employee in the back who looked at me and started speaking to someone else in the back in a non English language. Did not reply to me when I asked if anyone was working the register. Waited a few more minutes and left without ordering.  Never again.

I do not normally come to this Taco Bell( I go to the one in Casselberry) but I was in the area doing some stuff and decided to come here, it has been a long time sense I have been inside this Taco Bell but stopped here a couple of months ago and went to the drive thru. 

I ordered a number 8, three tacos and a soft drink for a about $4.50. The food came out quick and perfect except for a few things. 

I had a good experience today, the food was good and cheap and came out good my only problem and the reason I gave this place the rating I did is because one of my tacos had a hair in it but no problem. Once I found the hairs I went up to the very nice and helpful cashier and she happily replaced it and even gave me an extra hard taco for free. 

This place has a very nice employee that took our ordered and she was so nice and friendly so kudos to this establishment for that, the place was not that clean but not bad for a usual fast food place that normally gets busy during dinner time even though we came after dinner I was expecting it to be a mess(only a few dirty tables and trays left around)

The nice girl that was working the register and taking orders was constantly cleaning the tables and keeping it all organized, I was also happy that the place was clean but that they had sweet tea and all other fountain drinks.

The place got remodeled recently and looks really nice inside and even the outside, newer tables and layout inside. The new look makes this Taco Bell more inviting and wanting people to come back. It looks like all Taco Bells in the area are growing thru this.

Last time I wrote a review on this business was 5 years ago(2007) but finally I decided to comeback and review this business again. 

Good experience and over all I like this Taco Bell, plus the service was great for a fast food joint.

I did not give this establishment five stars because there was nothing in the food that stands out for it to get five stars and the only thing that was something to remember was the good service of the employee taking our ordered.

This place makes no effort to put out decent food.  The food is dry and tastes bland.  They also screw up on the ingredients and make orders incorrectly.  It's worth the short drive to the Bethany TB.  MUCH better food there.

Someone please show this review to the amazing staff at this Taco Bell. The people there are professional, and just so incredibly kind. I live in a City where African American women are judged instantly and stereotyped to be "ghetto" or "out of control" and "unprofessional" and when I go to this Taco Bell (and yes, we are still talking about the fast food fake Mexican restaurant) the women are so professional and nice and I literally want to dump out my entire wallet and give them everything as a tip. You would have to live here to understand how uncommon it is to have a nice employee at a drive-thru window and this staff goes ABOVE and BEYOND.

At first I was a little sad that the original restaurant on this location was torn down. When I was a little kid we would go there for the 4/$1.00 hamburgers. But the place has been vacant for years and sometimes it's good to make way for the new. In this case, it was a greatly anticipated event. At this section of McLoughlin there aren't that many fast food restaurants so I was quite pleased to see something come in to compete with the Mickey D's and KFC up the road. I work in the area so having another option on the days I forget to bring a sack lunch was fabulous.

I did the drive through thing and was pleased to hear a chipper (and clear) voice ask for my order. Upon driving up to the window I discovered it was the manager himself who was taking the drive-thru orders. He was pleasant, complimentary and very friendly....not something you usually get when driving up for a bite to eat. I went back a few days later and decided to eat in. The smallish building doesn't hold a lot of dine-in traffic but it definitely had that 'new restaurant' smell.

What else can I say about Taco Bell? The food is what it is, the cost comparatively priced to other fast food establishments. But the friendly service and location will definitely draw me back again, and again, I'm certain.

I've always loved this Taco Bell location. Food was always good and filling. This time however is not one of those times. With my first bite of my nachos bel grande their was a sticker in my food that I choked on, and upon my last bite their was a huge hair covered in meat and cheese. Dear Taco Bell please pay better attention to what goes in your food.

I typically have a decent process of ordering food through this taco bell, but their idiotic policy of one order per car is plain stupid!
I am currently a passenger in a car in the drive through at this taco bell and rode along with friends who wanted to come. As soon as I knew we were leaving I had placed my online order, as to not make one gigantic order for the car, and they STILL made us drive through a separate time for a "separate order", turning this quick trip into a rather large annoyance.
Get it together T-Bell.

They are always closed. Weekends, weekdays, afternoon, evening, late night, does not matter. They are just never open. This is the most understaffed restaurant I have ever seen. I honestly have no idea why they haven't just closed it down already.

2am on a Saturday, they are out of ground beef.  Isn't that their staple?  

A little disappointed, but not horribly distraught.  At least I get to have Taco Bell!
Worst taco bell I've ever been too by far. Had tacos bean burrito and nachos and its plain garbage taste nothing like tacobell in california or illinois.

This tacobell always has really fast drive thru services 
Thalia is always very nice when I'm on drive thru and Ms hazel is very nice when I go inside
All in all I love this tacobell

I will never go to Taco Bell due to the experience I had here. Since I'm vegetarian I ordered a supreme crunch wrap with substitute beans and double checked to make sure she rang it up correctly and then after paying I looked at my receipt and didn't say substitute beans so I clarify with cashier again and she said she put it. Once I received my food, it had meat in it after I bit into it. Luckily, I saw there was meat and spit it out but I triple check with cashier that to make sure there was no meat. So, I won't be going to this Taco Bell or any other Taco Bell ever again. Horrible customer service and employees. If I had an option I would put 0/5 stars. NOT RECOMMENDED!! Go somewhere else like Tijuana flats (Tijuana flats had excellent service and food).

I don't expect much out of taco bell, so I didn't have high expectations for this location or this experience. I went through the drive thru with some friends around 11:45pm and it took too long to order and get our food for us being the only ones in the drive thru and no one else in the store. Food was not bad...about as expected. Good cheep late night snack.
Worst experience ever. Waiting 40 mins in the drive thru and they still didn't get the order right. I will never be back again

I have not been to a better Taco Bell.  Taco Bell is my favorite food and I've eaten more of it than anybody I've ever met.  I consider myself a connoisseur of Taco Bell.

I generally go from 12-1pm on the weekdays, and they are consistently quick and I am never late getting back to work.  I used to work at Taco Bell for 7 years and I know depending on the crew you have fast days and you have not-so-fast days.

The food quality is also consistently the best I've ever seen.  I know that sometimes, depending on the age and other factors the food quality can degrade, but every time I visit this Taco Bell the quality of the ingredients seems to be as if they are as fresh as possible.

Keep up the good work and you'll continue to be my favorite Taco Bell location ever!

I really wanted to try the new cap'n crunch delights!  Only reason I passed by here.  Oh and my husband loves the cool ranch dorito tacos!  Luckily, no line through the drive thru!  I had too much taco bell during my hungover days and now the difference between a real taco and a bagged taco meat!  Ha!

We are from out of town and stopped here for a cheap meal after Disney.  Went through the drive thru and the employee was super patient with us and very nice. When we got our order we drove to a parking spot to check our order. They were missing an item so I went inside to let them know. It was pretty busy and one employee told the line twice they needed to get my mini quesadilla. But they were in the zone. So I asked if they were going to do it (if not I would have left, it was only $1 ), and the Drive thru lady was so incredibly sweet and nice she apologized and took care of it and added some cinnamon twists for my family waiting in the car for me. I appreciated she took care of it. I'd come back again.

This was the worst Taco Bell I have ever experienced! I do not expect Taco Bell to be great food, it is fast food.

The shells were stale, chips are stale, the chalupa shell had not been fried and was cold. It was not editable.

I will give this order experience 3 stars.  The food was good and service was quick, although we were shorted a taco.  The main reason that has me dissatisfied is how little nacho cheese I was given with an order of nachos.  Must have been only a tablespoon in each container.  Picture is when we first took the lids off and before we even started eating.  You can do better than this Taco Bell, come on!

This TB sucks!  They consistently screw up the order, unfriendly staff (and there's usually a kitchen full of 6+ making food), always an equipment malfunction and THE SLOWEST DRIVE THRU in the history of drive thu's!  They say their average  time is 85 seconds & I have never been through faster than 5 minutes!  This had been my experience regularly after 4 years of patronizing this location.  I finally  realized they do not deserve a penny of my cash for crap service & haven't been back to this location since.

I quit eating at Taco Bell back in 2002. I had gone to the one on Hwy50 east of Orlando. We, my co-workers and I, would go here because you could get a variety of items for under $5. It was bachelor food and I wasn't making a ton of money to afford eating at Harvey's (expensive place downtown) each day.

On the day in question we had our meals and then went back to the office. After being back I started to feel weird. I actually thought I was on LSD (don't ask how i know).

I made my way down to my friend and when I reached his office my other co-worker was there talking to him. I didn't say any thing when one of them said, "you feeling funny too?"

"Yep... I feel really whacked out"

Needless to say we thought we had food poisoning and we called in to Taco Bell's hot line and to make a long story short, they ignored our complaint.

So I put in a call to the county to have the health inspector go out there but it took them four weeks to go out and inspect the place. Big help that was.

To this day I don't know what happened to us. Maybe one of the workers thought it would be fun to make people trip out or maybe we ate some cleaning fluid from the counter top that got in to our food? Dunno.

Needless to say I never went back... never. I refuse to eat their food and I'm better for it.

It's Taco Bell- I only go once in awhile, Sweetie avoids it if possible.  But we saw a commercial for the spicy "daredevils" and she said "I have a dollar!"  She knows me... I love spicy food.  She did mention concern about pain in assorted orifices.  Well, maybe not concern- she laughed and said "your ass will be on fire!"

No worries.  There are three of these spicy things, which are basically small burritos.  Flour tortilla, beans, a little meat, and tortilla strips.  Mild is chipotle, medium ("you're getting hotter," it says) is habanero, and hot ("you're on fire!") is ghost pepper. 

I started with a bite of the chipotle as a baseline, and saved most to use as a palate cleanser for the others.  Barely any heat.  Habanero had some heat, but I kept waiting for it to build and scorch me.  Nope.  Ghost pepper had more heat, but still didn't cause sweat, tears, runny nose, or yelps of pain.  I finished all three, and was full but disappointed.

Service was okay, if a bit slow.  The place is clean enough, prices are low, it's handy to the highway.  I bet they get a lot of students from the high school.  Not much reason for me to come back, but it was a decent experience.

Almost empty "Chicken Quesadilla"! 
What's a awful costumer service there! 
We are Not going to this location anymore!

I almost never write reviews but today I felt I had to. Thank you Taco Bell for being a different kind of fast food in Walpole. Every other fast food restaurant that I go to in this area I wait an enormous amount of time and the food is always mediocre whether it be cold stale not freshly cooked. But not when I go to Taco Bell. Every time I come here the food is fresh hot and comes out quick. Thank you guys for being what a fast food restaurant should be, good food, at a good price, fast.
This taco bell is so much better than the ones I've been to in Illinois. Freshly made warm and delicious, the sizes are large and satisfying too. Melt in your mouth stuff!

My review used to be 2 stars but then I received this today with some equally skimpy potato soft tacos.

I've included photos so you can see why you should never go here.

P.S. the fries were mildly warm and not good anyways. What a letdown.

Stopped in for breakfast this morning at about 8:30 a.m.  No customers were in the store.  We walked to the counter where there were 2 registers, both of them said "closed".  We stood and waited and no one greeted us.  There were 6 workers in the kitchen area of the restaurant  but no one acknowledged us being there.  After waiting several minutes my wife said "Are you open", and they said "we'll be with you in a minute."  Finally someone took our order and went to the drive through window to ring it up.

Horrible service.  Being the only customers in the store, they got my wife's order wrong and I found a piece of plastic in my coffee.  Don't think we'll ever go back there.

1:04pm February 26, Great customer service and food!! Girl at the counter was very polite I think she had red hair and an Ashley made my food and it was delicious!! It was very busy and they were fast and delivered great food! A+

Ok I stopped in today for The $5 Double Chalupa Box with 2 Hard Tacos I choose to get EVERYTHING EXTRA BEEF and made my Tacos Soft ...Everything was good I love this location because it's close to home but sometimes the drive thru can be off the chains just depends on what time you get there....so stop in or drive thru and LIVE MAS

I will be returning to try other items like the Chicken Doubledillas.

The drive through line is awful after 10 pm. You will be waiting an average of a half hour or more. Estimate yourself a good 7 minutes per car ahead of you at least. Theirs location makes good food, but the drive through is the worst on earth.

I sure do wish that I could give this Taco Bell more than 3 stars, but they were out of Fire Sauce today! Man, does that make me mad! I had to settle for their Hot Sauce instead. I need the hard stuff, man!

Otherwise, the soft chicken taco wasn't too bad, nor was the bean burrito. They would have been much better with Fire Sauce, though!
I'm going to have to carry my own Fire Sauce from now on. I guess I'll have to fill my glove compartment with it now!

I just moved to Boulder and I have attended this Taco Bell 3 times. The worst experience ever. All three times !!!! First time I i asked for a number 6 and I decided to change it before my order was complete and the guy gave me attitude about it. Got home and all my food was cold. Assuming they were mad because he said we already made what you originally ordered . Don't know why you made something before I was done ordering. ???? Second time they shorted me 1 taco and the third time they closed 15 minutes early. That is really unprofessional to do that. When i pulled up to the window they said we're closed with a look like should have known they wanted to leave early. I am never going back. If I were you I would take the extra drive and go to baseline location. This Taco Bell is TERRIBLE !!!!

Went to drive thru.

No line on a Saturday afternoon.

Very quick service.

Friendly people working the drive through.
Terrible, they probably pay their staff so little they have very poor quality food and even worse presentation. I walked out it was so bad.

The food is pretty decent for a Taco Bell. I decided to go in because the drive-thru  was so backed up. 2 people ahead of me in line. From the time I ordered to the time I got my food, it had been 10 minutes. Perhaps it was because it was 1pm? The cashier was nice, but she mis-typed in my name, which wasn't a big deal when they called out a variation of my name. At least they got my order right and quesirito was pretty good, too. 

Only thing I'd suggest is that they get the food out faster.

I've worked in restaurants, 10-12 in my day, I know the kitchen tile floor cleaner smell mixed with non-stick shoes and grease, take a bow Taco Bell, now I know what that tastes like, in my drink, I would be pissed already, but the reason I'm super upset with this is that my wife was drinking from that tea before we noticed fully that it was there, chemicals and floor muck may be in your beverage. It still lingers in my mouth 20 min later. I feel sick and that smell and awful odor is hanging in the back of my throat, oh my god, if we go to the hospital I do still have the cup, cross your fingers and hope us never eating at your restaurants again is the only thing negative that happens. Disgusting horrible restaurant experience, sick to my stomach, ewggh Lwa auggh.  By the way, my wife is 6 months pregnant.  It's beyond words, I feel greatly offended by your careless practices on sanitation! I'm sorry I have to write this, but I would feel worse if I did not

I just moved to Boulder and I have attended this Taco Bell 3 times. The worst experience ever. All three times !!!! First time I i asked for a number 6 and I decided to change it before my order was complete and the guy gave me attitude about it. Got home and all my food was cold. Assuming they were mad because he said we already made what you originally ordered . Don't know why you made something before I was done ordering. ???? Second time they shorted me 1 taco and the third time they closed 15 minutes early. That is really unprofessional to do that. When i pulled up to the window they said we're closed with a look like should have known they wanted to leave early. I am never going back. If I were you I would take the extra drive and go to baseline location. This Taco Bell is TERRIBLE !!!!
Stopped in to grab a quick bite and asked for a Mexican pizza with no beef, only beans. Ended up with a pizza full of meat. The service is great, but it ended up being a waste of money.

Lobby was closed at 11:45pm(sorry probably closed ever earlier than I arrived) even though the posted hours say 12:00AM!! While there we still people in the store and one of the worker looked at me and still didn't even open the door, when I pointed at the store hours says till 12:00AM!!!!

This is actually the worst Taco Bell you can stop at. You'd figure a drive through would mean the "fast" part of fast food, but absolutely not at this location. It has taken well over 40 minutes to even order something. The only reason I've stuck so far with the wait is just that: I'm stuck in line right now. You are better off going inside or somewhere else for food.

I went inside because the drive through line was long.  Then watched 20 plus cars go through drive through before I ever got my order.  That is so wrong!  They took my order at 6:11 and 6:38pm I finally got my 4 tacos and 2 quesadillas.  I asked to speak to the manager and asked why the 20 to 25 cars that went through the drive through after I ordered got their food first.  "She said sorry, they have a separate line".  That is not OK I told her that her job as a manager is to make sure stuff like this doesn't happen and she make changes as necessary.  She just walked away and said I could call corporate.  The manager nor employees really don't care how they treat their customers.   I have no problem with waiting if they are busy, but I do take issue waiting almost 30 minutes for a few tacos while 20+ orders after mine get filled first.     As far as food quality it was sub par compared to other taco bells.  Even my kids were like this is gross taco bell and wanted to go to the one in Oregon City.  I agree with the kids that the OC taco bell food is much better.

Gotta give some love to Taco Bell. Relatively low turnover on staffing, even though they can be brutally slow. Generous portions of sour cream if you are looking for that. Honestly though, as a regular customer of this Taco Bell, I actually know some of the employees by name. That is rare in this day in age.

Food is Taco Bell quality.

Many of times we order food and get home and it's totally wrong! For example tonight we ordered: 1 Steak XXL GSB no sour no guacamole, luckily that was correct. Many times they have added the sour cream and guacamole. Also ordered a Crunchwrap with no sour cream and well I took a big bite and bit into nothing but sour cream. Like come on, it's not that hard to follow directions. This is not the 1st time this has happened. I do believe this Taco Bell needs MORE training. I paid $3.59 just to get home and cannot eat it. Really irritates me. Please get the staff together on following what the customers order.

Something has happened where they are not as good as they were months ago. Much dirtier inside. Food seems about the same but it's just piggy inside. Bad management maybe, and a lot of unsavory characters hanging out as well.
Worst taco bell ive everrr been too. Service was slow. They got our order wrong. I know its a fast food restaurant but atleast have some pride jn your work.

I try to avoid fast food, but had to get something super quick before work last night. It's typical Taco Bell food, nothing new, but the girl that took my order was excellent! She was sweet and full of energy.  Sometimes it's just that extra effort that leaves a lasting impression!

The food is pretty good. The drive thru is always packed but it is not unreasonably slow. I've never been inside because the neighborhood isn't the best and there is a lot of foot traffic. But the food is always hot and fresh. No complaints.
Its pretty clean and the staff seem nice and courteous. The soda fountain is hit or miss and the dr. Pepper was flat. But not terrible as far as taco bells go.

Just went to the Taco Bell on Hamilton Rd. in Gahanna, OH. We placed our order and asked the person, who took our order to make certain that the preps got it right. She dismissed us by saying "they'll get it right" and not bothering to see that it happened. When we got our order it was wrong, and when we told the prep, instead of making it again, he began picking through my taco salad to remove the part that wasn't ordered. Since having someone pick through my food to remove the gross parts is not acceptable, I asked for our money back. We waited for the 'manager' (haha) to come to give us our refund, when she said she had no idea how to do it. She then made us wait further while she made a lengthy phone call, where she remarked that she didn't want to call her manager because "he was already mad". When she finally got off the phone, she informed us that we'd have to come back at 8 tomorrow morning to get our refund. When we told her that this was terrible customer service and an awful inconvenience, she couldn't have cared less. 

As of now, we're out the food and the money, and have been given a tremendous hassle over what should have been a simple transaction. We encountered incompetence from the "management" on down.

Since there are so many fast food joints in that area, we debated whether or not to go to Taco Bell before we got there, and BOY ARE WE SORRY WE CHOSE TACO BELL. 


WE WILL NEVER order food from there again.

Three cars ahead of me and it took more than 25 minutes to get tacos, wtf, a few months or more ago the place wasn't that bad, they must of changed management, I will not be going back to this Taco Bell, I am a detailed guy and I got a 5 dollar box that came in a bag, all Taco Bell food is the same, but I will go were the good service is. No more money from me to this Taco Bell.

Get it together already taco bell on 28th!!! Expect long wait times...extremely understaffed locale.
This situation is incorrigible. Why do we still come here...we must be really desperately hungry.
Always friendly and courteous! Precious reviews are right though - lines after 10PM. The crowds are to be expected though... We are at the exit to the largest theme park in Orlando.
I only order the Mexican pizza so this review is less about food and more about the wait time.    Expect to wait 20 to 30 minutes through the drive during the day and 40 to an hour at midnight

Bad service and not professional.   When it takes 15 mins to get a taco and it's the same old slop they usually serve in 1 min it's pretty bad.  Out of food and taco shells, people waiting and the staff doesn't seem to care.   Never seen so many people waiting so long to get low quality food.  Low quality isn't their fault since it's Taco Bell but everything else is.

The people who work here typically have pretty good customer service but the wait time is completely ridiculous. The past several times I've been there, the wait in the drive thru line is always no less than 15 minutes. It doesn't matter what time of the day you get there either; the wait is always awful. It's obvious that you shouldn't be offering people $12/hr if they're incapable of getting their job done in an appropriate amount of time. If this happened once or twice from time to time then that's understandable. But it is literally every time I've gone lately. Again, the customer service is usually good and all but this location is getting pretty bullshit.

Probably the worst Taco Bell I've been to which is amazing because they're always busy. Drive-thru is always backed up and it takes 15-20 minutes when you go in. Today they were out of tortillas for the stuffed burrito. So many better options in the area like Moes or Chipotle. I come here thinking it's going to be quicker but always disappointed. Not to mention the clientele is on the lower end of the the class scale.

I hate it when people expect a "fine dining service" at a fast food place. It's Taco Bell, not a five star restaurant. I give this place four stars because their food is always hot and precise when I order. The staff is very sufficient.

I actually really like this Taco Bell as far as fast food chains go. They have never gotten my order wrong in the decade or so that I have coming here. The staff is usually pretty friendly and has never had any problems with the off chance you want something modified or made special. Even during lunch the wait time is usually pretty fast and with the ability to order on mobile now has made it even easier.

The interior is always pretty clean even right after the lunch rush and even the bathrooms seem to be well maintained. all the condiments and food accessories are always stocked and the soda fountain machine appears to be cleaned regularly. I see employees go around cleaning things when there is a gap in the service.

Food quality I think is also as good as you can get from Taco Bell. I've never gotten something that felt like it was made hours ago and just sitting around. The food is always hot and made as advertised.
Worst Taco Bell ever. If you are prepared to consistently wait over 20 minutes for an incorrect order, by all means visit this location.

This restaurant is my guilty pleasure!  I hate that I love taco bell.  This location ALWAYS gets my order right.  I'm a picking vegetarian with all beans no meat orders and every single time, perfect.  They have new sauces:  Verde and Fire Roasted.  More reasons to check it out.

yum yum
Worst taco bell I've ever been to. Cold food every time. Bad beef. Not a good place to go. Better option is the one a couple miles north.

Fastest service in town.  I frequent many fast food establishments.  My order is often served faster than I can get my payment out of my wallet.  Unlike the previous reviewer, I have noticed no portion or quality variance from other taco bell restaurants.

This is really close to our office and so when I need something for lunch fast, I hit this at times.

The food is Taco Bell.

What gives this 1 star is about 20% of the time you order and then wait... and wait... and wait... Sometimes up to 20 minutes for your food.

Longest drive thru ever. Go inside and am the only person. End up being in there longer than the entire line and the person who orders after me gets their food. I'm just standing there and nobody says anything so I ask what's going on and they say my order was canceled out. Why? Why? Why? Why? Forever confused by this location. Five people standing around and not one mentions wheres this persons food? I literally had three tacos...hard, I know. Go to a different location or place altogether.

Arbitrarily closed the lobby door in our face after two other small groups arrived at 12:30am.  Yes, it is late, however if you have several other groups already ordering why direct to the drive through?   Completely inappropriate and unprofessional.  Then say in line for over 15 minutes with no movement.  Left.  Never returning to this Taco Bell again.

This is the world's slowest taco bell. This location has no sense of time management, no manager on duty, understaffed, and the employees cannot perform basic duties or keep a positive attitude. If you plan on coming here for a quick snack, be prepared to spend at least 20-30 minutes in line. Even if there is only 3 cars in line, it will still take them 25 minutes to give you a couple tacos. This review is based on many different trips I have made to this Taco Bell, not just one specific time. Corporate really needs to pay this site a visit and see what the heck is going on cuz clearly it's A MESS.

I have been here a few times and they always seem to get at least one thing wrong. I order chicken and I get steak. I ask for soft tacos and get crunchy. It's annoying when i'm on my lunch break and get the wrong thing. I shouldn't have to sit there and open up every item I order to make sure it's right.
I'm only writing this review to say that Carol is just the sweetest person I've ever come across. What a gentle woman with a sweet smile!  The food is Taco Bell, it's the same as any other.

It's Taco Bell. It really doesn't need a review. 

This location does a solid job of not messing up your order. The drive thru is quick. The window people are pretty nice... especially Miss Gloria. She rocks. 

I'm a TB fan. This is on my approved location list. I really have one. Don't hate.

I visit this location off and on, it's easy to get in and out of the drive thru pretty quickly during my lunch break from work. Well the restaurant is, I can't always say the same for Crossroads itself. But the employees are fast and friendly and I have never ran into any issues with my orders. The few times I have been inside it has been clean and orderly and the efficiency is just as good. 

I have a slight taco addiction these days so if it's meat in a shell with cheese, lettuce and sour cream and it isn't soggy or broken and you say thank you please come again, I will be happy. 

Besides, It's Taco Bell. If you pull up to the drive thru and the line isn't moving, then you should think about what time of day it is and how bad you really want the crunch wrap. The choice is really yours. Sometimes they are just busy and everyone gets call ins now and then. Be nice.

Happy Tacos!

Stopped by this Taco Bell with a family of 7 after a long day at Universal. The drive thru was quick and on point! We had a huge order and they not only got everything right, it was all freshly made and they added a bunch of extra napkins and sauces to make sure we were good to go! The drive thru manager was very friendly and confident in his staff. It was a nice change to the standard I'm use to at Taco Bell. Well done, guys!
What the hell!!!! 20 minutes 5 employees before they would even start on our food then served the window before us. Still waiting super annoyed.

If you want below average food, long wait times and sub par customer service this is the place to go. Waited in the  drive thru for 5 minutes with no one else around. No one ever came on the speaker to take my order. It was fifteen minutes past midnight. They close at 2:30 am. Didn't even see anyone at the window when I left. 

It's worth the extra 2 min drive to go to the Taco Bell on corner of Morse and Hamilton. The food there is always better and service is impeccable every time I go.
Excellent food and Customer service! I don't like that they don't have bottled mineral Water! You have to take water from the refreshments machine and it tastes bad!

5-13-16 this was an excellent experience through a drive-through. I had my two toddlers with me and I custom ordered two small waters about half-full, two burritos with no onions, and a bunch of other stuff. When I got to the window he was about to hand me my drink and noticed that it wasn't quite full. He took it back and filled it all the way to the top for me without me even having to ask. It was good customer service for a drive-through
I know it's not everyones cup of tea but I love it. Personally I think it's great !!!!! :)

I love Taco Bell to begin with, but I always love eating at this one. I always stop here on my way to or from Disney World. The food is always great tasting and fresh and the staff is always friendly. This post comes after my 6th visit here, always the same which is nice.

Ever since quickserv franchise took over the stores in the area everything's gone downhill... from the food to the friendliness and cleanliness to employee issues and higher up issues. Nothing ever gets fixed or resolved at this taco bell, seriously worst place you can go. Don't spend almost an hour waiting for your food - it isn't worth it at all!

Apparently in the last month or so corporate bought them out. Why I keep on coming back I don't know?! I'm addicted to the crunch wrap supreme. Lol I have now been in the drive-through for 30 minutes. This isn't first time it's the third time and I will not come back. Why not leave good enough alone!

This place is the bomb! 

Rolled in at 2am , they are open till 4am during the week . We had a van full of seven people who all ordered . They didn't mess up a single thing . They got everyone's order correct and the food tasted really good for such a late time to order . They were super nice and gave us tons of napkins and sauce without us having to ask ! 

A million thumbs up for this location :)

Super disappointment in my visit last night to this Taco Bell. Both quesadillas we ordered barely had any cheese inside. Then my 50 cent side of sour cream was half full. Literally less than a tablespoon. I could've just bought a tub of sour cream for 50 cents more. Way to rip me off last night Taco Bell.

This is a brand new taco bell and so far I'm very impressed! Got through the drive thru in under 5 minutes, which is amazing seeing other taco bells you wait at least 30+ minutes, the staff are super friendly, fast and the food is so fresh! Awesome, keep it up!

Worst taco bell ever. Every time we go there they have their doors locked. It's 9:00 and they say they are open till 1.. why the heck are your doors locked. I called to see and they were very rude and said they were closing early anyway.

I wanted to try their new breakfast menu this morning and was pleasantly surprised.  First off, much cheaper than your other fast food options.  I ordered the bacon waffle combo which came with hash brown and coffee and it was only 3.99! The food was good, but hard to compare because there is no other place that serves something like that. Hashbrown was served hot and crispy, just how I like it. To top it off, it was quick. Maybe too early to tell since breakfast is so new and everyone is unaware, but for now it's my better option to the alternatives which are more expensive and slower service.

Mad AND sick to my stomach! First of all the girl at the drive thru window is very unfriendly. Second, I asked for and paid for extra sour cream on my nachos supreme. I got NO sour cream at all! Third, after eating more than half of the nachos I came across a very hard unidentifiable object. I have NO idea what it is, but it is not any type of food that Taco Bell serves. Very gross. Will NEVER eat at this Taco Bell again. I do not recommend anyone else to either, unless you like foreign objects in your food!
A good Taco Bell.  I like the bean burritos without sauce and Dorito Shell Supreme Tacos without tomatoes.

Super friendly drive through staff and one of the best tasting burritos I've ever had from a Taco Bell.  So impressed that I did the survey on the receipt and wanted to review it here.  Definitely will stop by here again.

order a number 7 chicken quesadilla and practically did not have chicken eat a slice without a piece of chicken inside

This is the last time that I visit this Taco Bell
Very friendly staff. Cashier was so nice and thorough with my order. Teishawna even up sold me on the new crunch wrap sliders. Food was amazing and you can never go wrong with Baja blast!

This location is very clean, and has very nice and friendly employees. I did have one issue with my meal where the cashier had rung up the wrong item. As soon as I let them know, they let me keep the extra item and replaced it with exactly what I had ordered. All of the items I ordered had very generous portions. I would definitely recommend this location!

Pretty much adding on to what everybody else has said. This Taco Bell sucks! Always closed, long waiting times, and tonight when I went to drive through nobody even answered to take my order. I waited there for 5- 10 minutes and decided just to leave because nobody answered even though there were people inside. Seriously a terrible place!
Slowest TB in America.  15-20 minute order times are the norm.  Slow fast food? For real.
This is the Texas of Fast food. In that is no longer Mexican and everyone involved in the process has probably forgotten what the original idea was.

Literally the slowest Taco Bell in the world. The drive through takes at least thirty minutes every time no matter how many cars there are. I have tried to be slick and go inside yet it takes the same amount of time. I don't get how it can possibly always be like this. New mgmt is definitely needed.

This is the worst Taco Bell ever!! It takes so long to get through the drive thru and the dining room isn't any better! Waiting 45 min with only a few cars ahead of me is not acceptable!  It has been this way everytime I come for the past year. I suggest going down the street to another Taco Bell!
Excellent experience. I don't agree with the negative reviews. I go here for lunch all the time at work and they are quick and very polite.

Brandon with the red hair is seriously awesome. He took our order, processed our payment, went to the line and made our food AND remembered to give us our sauce when he handed the food out the window. I did not see another employee during this visit, so hats off to Brandon for keeping that drive thru moving!

THE. WORST. TACO. BELL. Hands down consistently the worst one i have ever been to. The food i have gotten from them is usually lukewarm to cold. For some strange reason it also always tastes way more bland than the other Taco Bells in the area. The staff usually seem unhappy or at the very least bored to be talking to you. I will not be going back to this one...driving a little further to one of the others in the area is totally worth it.

I have been to Taco Bells all over this great land and this one takes the churro.  I ate here once in 2004 (yes, 9 years ago) and the experience is still highlighted in my mind.  I ordered 3 items and they were all perfectly made.  Everything was put together perfectly, and then rolled into burrito form so exquisitely that it was if they were made by the hands of angels.  I received my order quickly, sat down to enjoy it, then a sweet elderly lady came to my table and asked my friends and I if we needed any sauce.  in my 20+ years of patronizing this fine franchise, this is still the only full service Taco Bell I have been to.  Piloting an airboat should have been the highlight of that fine spring day, but it was instead replaced by the incredible experience I was treated to at the world's greatest Taco Bell.

-Brandon Pyle
Worst experience ever. Be ready to sit in the drive through for an HOUR for a taco post-Disney. Be prepared for an unmagical visit.

You know that terrible feeling when you pull up to a Taco Bell at 1130pm and you're not quite sure that they're open?  The only thing you are sure of is that you desperately need some Taco Bell.  Well that's the dilemma I faced when reaching to pull the door open at 1130pm and no one else was inside except for the employees.  Alas!  They were open!  I ordered the steak quesadilla, my main staple, and a couple of side items.  The steak quesadilla satisfied my taste buds and empty stomach.  The place looked pretty clean and well-kept too.

Been coming to this Taco Bell for years and they never disappoint. I usually order with beans instead of meat and they rarely mess up my order. The service is always good and usually very quick. For a Taco Bell it is worth 5 stars. I would recommend coming here if you enjoy the Taco Bell chain.

Place was closed again this morning.  The last 3 times I tried to go there it was closed.  What PITA.  They need to get more staff.  Perhaps pay more?  Other restaurants in Boulder seem to be able to hire staff. What's up Taco Bell?

Worst Taco Bell I've ever been too. Cashier was rude, employees are walking around joking and laughing, and all the while I've been waiting 20+ mins for 4 menu items. I've witnessed at least 10 different orders been placed and none have come out in 15+ mins. This location is completely mismanaged and hope people steer clear.

This taco bell is always good but today it was terrible. The guy dressing the tacos at 12:00pm THE BUSIEST time of the day was terrible. Fire him. Thought he was on a couple of xanax or somethin. SUPER SLOW
This location has repeatedly produced such a poor service I cannot get past the register on multiple occasions. Once again Taco Bell you have achieved less than mediocrity.
Since the remodel, this place has awesome service and is generally really fast, even with a line. They don't mess up on orders and the food is hot and fresh.

Slowest. Taco. Bell. Ever.  Consistently wait a long time for uneven food.  This past Saturday we waited in line for 15 mins.  Looked like the Frito-Lay delivery person was there and apparently, everyone in the store was involved because we were stuck in the 7th circle of Hell waiting for our food.  I will try to avoid going there anymore.
Sitting in drive-thru for over 15 minutes now according to my stopwatch. This is the second time in two weeks I've waited for over 20 minutes in the drive thru. Not fast food by any means.
Food is ethnically correct, staff is well trained. However they should offer a language course for some of their more alienated employees.

The waiting time is over 45 min but I have to say everyone here is working really hard , may be management can hire more people , we stopped by to the try the Dare Devil Grillers and they were ok but won't come to this location again especially after hours .

Omg that was terrible customer service. I ordered a starburst strawberry freeze & she gave me a very watery strawberry drink because it was not a freeze. Then the cashier was yelling at me like i was deaf. Then she was constantly walking away from the window & slamming the window like i was getting on her nerves. she was so rude. The only reason they got 2 stars is because my food was hot.

I wish there was an option to give 0 stars. I stopped by here trying to get something to eat after my long bus ride from New York. I had the worst experience ever at this Taco Bell location. As soon as I got in, I was immediately asked if I was ready to order. I informed the cashier that I was not ready because I did not get a chance to look at the menu, then she disappeared for 5 minutes. Then, when she finally came back, I was ready to order meanwhile 3 customers came in, I couldn't believe that the cashier told them to skip me claiming that I was not ready to order. I immediately walked out of this place. I will never eat at Taco Bell again!

I have an allergy to dairy so I asked for my breakfast crunch wrap to be made without cheese. When I got home and took a bite of my crunch wrap I got a mouth full of cheese. It's just very upsetting that when you tell them you have an allergy that they don't respect it enough to spend a few extra minutes to just make one without cheese. I'll think twice before going back to any Tacobell establishment.
Slowest taco Bell in the entire world!!! Waited 20 minutes for my order which already took 10 minutes to order. My order was wrong, they left out 1 item. Terrible.
I gave this Taco Bell one star because I couldn't give it zero stars. Horrible service and dirty.
Food has been as good as any Taco Bell I have been to.  Sometimes they are slow, sometimes they zip you through.

I've long been a non-fan of Taco Bell's purple-pink-and-blue decor scheme. Purple and blue aren't particularly appetizing colors, and when you put these three colors together, they're more suggestive of My Little Pony than they are of fast food tacos.

Wanna know what's even less appetizing than the standard Taco Bell color scheme? A poorly-maintained complement of Taco Bell decor. Seriously, this is the most visually depressing TB I've ever been in, and I've logged a lot of time at a lot of Taco Bells.

While this TB offers the usual assortment of food that will kill you immediately interspersed with food that will kill you more slowly, the dining room atmosphere is such that whatever you wind up shoving in your face turns into a cold lump in your stomach.

Summary judgment: Get it to go.
Wow!! Stuck in the drive-thru line from hell. 5 cars, and a whopping 30 minutes later I'm free to go about the rest of my day!!!!! WTF!?!?

I've never had a bad "customer service" experience here-the employees are all very pleasant. BUT. I have yet to get a correct or timely order. I usually order the #1 Combo with no deletions or substitutions-how complicated is that? And today I waited for over 15 minutes for my food. And everyone in line had a long wait too.

Go inside. The drive thru is wicked slow, but the orders are accurate and the staff is always nice. 

 It seriously. If there's more than 2 cars in the drive thru and you don't have a compelling reason to not get out of the car, just go in. It's easily a 10 minute wait. Dining room doesn't seem to have this issue.
No more strawberry mango Frutista freeze

Standard Taco Bell fare. They don't mess anything up here, but it did seem to take a LONG time to get my food compared to other T-Bells. 

Yes, I dined in... they actually have two large LCD screens in this Taco Bell (have never seen this before).

It seemed like there were some drug dealers in the parking lot and the police came by and stopped these folks. Nothing like witnessing an arrest on the way back to my car from a Taco Bell. 

Has my life hit a new low?
It's a taco bell.  Wow.  Amazing.
Wow, 1 hour wait time for a 10 dollar purchase. Get back to hotel and order is all wrong!!! I got ripped off bad! This place needs help!

I was charged for food items by an employee (Rebecca) who neglected to put the items in my bag.  I called when I got home.   She admitted to leaving the items out of my order.   Rebecca told me next time I came in to refer to the order and I would be refunded.   My next visit I placed my order in drive-thru.   When I got to the window Rebecca was working and remember the incident but now refused not only to not refund me but also not apply a credit to my now order.   She said she was throwing my food out that was made.  I asked for a manager.   In the meantime she made me wait and since I couldn't go in the store I had no options.  A man behind me proceeded to pound and kick my car.  Tried to break the locks to get in.  Called me many names and blocking me by standing in front of my car.   This went on for several minutes.  The manager came to the window(Alex) who very professionally handled the situation.  He asked Rebecca why she didn't refund me and prevent this crime against me.  She instead let it escalate and celebrated the actions of this man who was threatening me.  Alex suggested I call the police.   I called the police and got the plates on the car of the man.  Meanwhile, I do not understand the level of mental capacity of Rebecca.  Rebecca can't figure out simple logic.  The fact that she didn't give me my food the first time and refused to at a minimum credit me demonstrates her level of competence.   She has now created a situation where Taco Bell is liable for the crime committed.

Poorly ran and operated store, this store is usually very slow and this time I Had enough, took me 17 minutes from the time I entered the drive through line to the time I exited it. This is not fast food, nor is it I'm sure a good representation of what this company stands for.

This place has staffing issues, don't know who makes the schedule but Saturday at 130 and I have been in drive thru for about 15 minutes. I could have stopped at el vaquero and ordered take out by now, what is going on here, not the first time.

An outstanding value on a strictly cost-per-calorie basis. The chalupa evokes the experience of authentic Mexican food much the way Disney's Pirates of the Caribbean simulates the real experience of being captured by pirates.

The drive through always takes forever. If you dare to go in, you may wait longer for your food than if you waited in the drive through. Was so excited when this Taco Bell was being built at this location. I love Taco Bell but this location has been a huge disappointment.
Fairly consistent service and tasty food. Went for Natural Taco Day and ordered their celebrations special of the $5 box. Came with 4 different crunchy tacos. Not a bad deal!

This has got to be one of my worst Taco Bell experiences at this location. Not once but twice my food was prepared wrong and with the amount of workers that appeared to be on duty, it seemed as if nobody cared to help when I was standing at their counter for 10 min before even being asked what was wrong. Managers were sitting at a nearby table and on their cell phones eating while all this was going on. Safe to say I will not be back to this Taco Hell.
Five stars for their great fast service and quality food. We ate there consistently for 10 Nights and no change in quality and service .. kudos
OMG. I've been stuck in this drive thru line for over 30 minutes. Have they lost the concept of fast food. Will never go to this Taco Bell again.

Always a disappointment when it comes to the quality, half stuffed burritos and yellow lettuce with a almost frozen cheese are a normal here.

ALWAYS out of the chicken rolled tacos.

And it can take longer than 10 minutes to get food here.

Went through drive through and the one time I didn't check my order before I pulled out then went home, they forgot an item! I was short a crunchy taco. I called the number listed on the receipt ( same number as what Yelp has) and it goes to a fax machine. Duh??? What to do now? Just wanted to update you on what happened when I called the Taco Bell. I spoke with Brenda, a manager, and told her what happened and she asked me to come back and she would replace my order and apologized for the situation. I went back yesterday and she was working the cash register. She remembered the phone call and within minutes I had a complete order.

Good as any Taco Bell. Quick drive thru. Pleasant drive thru girl. Quesarito is tasty! Fire Sauce rocks. Go West End Taco Bell!

A super fun activity is to get your food, then loop around, find a shady spot in the rear of the Mall West End parking lot, keep your a/c running, and just people and car watch while you enjoy your meal. What a blast you will have laughing!!

My review used to be 2 stars but then I received this today with some equally skimpy potato soft tacos.
I've included photos so you can see why you should never go here.
P.S. the fries were mildly warm and not good anyways.


WILL NOT TAKE 2 orders at once after midnight because of store policy!?
I'm going to egg this Taco Bell.

Lastly there is also a picture of the most recent visit there..
This is a DOUBLE STEAK NACHO

If I could give one star I would. It is 1 am Sunday December 30th and we came through drive through and asked to do an order on two separate tickets. The woman at the drive through was incredibly rude and told us we could not do that because of the hour it was and the staff they had. She told us we could split it card and cash and when we got to the window. We handed a 20, asked for ten back and they did not split it cash and card but took all of the cash, refused to give us change and refused to fix it. I was told that it was because their times were bad and they did not have the staff to accommodate us. I was told I could drive through the drive through two times and help her times. Incredibly unprofessional and incredibly rude. The man at the window was kind and helpful. They forgot our nachos and we had to go back anyways. Sure hope it helps that woman's "times" so she can relax and stop being so rude.

I think I'm with Stephanie W. on this one. It's just Taco Bell, but they deserve reviews too!

We come here maybe once every couple of months because the song and dance of "What do you want for dinner?" "I dunno, what do you want for dinner?" gets super annoying, we give up and say "Whatever, let's just get Taco Bell." 

We'll typically go later at night and the staff there is usually pretty friendly. We don't usually wait a super long time and our order hasn't been wrong yet!
Great taco bell, fast, clean,  & easy to use. Thanks for the friendly service.
Girl I know works there full time. She said They just had to close the store due to move and exterminator service.

If I could give less than one star I would. I just came up to the window with a friend. The lady at the drive through was going on about all the things they don't have, which was a lot. My friend jokingly said " well you should shut down, you don't have anything" and the manager chimed in and told us that if we don't have anything nice to say to the employees that we can just leave. 
I have never in my life been talked to like that. I am a paying customer and to have a manager talk to me like that is so rude. I could have been yelling at her, and she should have not said anything. A manger should not have chimed in at all, it was completely unprofessional and not necessary. I ended up leaving, without paying for the meals I was going to, to take my business elsewhere. 

I understand that there is nothing to be done about not receiving a shipment, but there are ways to handle it, and talking to a customer like she did to us, on top of being out of most of the menu is horrible. Sorry but this Taco Bell has lost my service, I will from now on go to the one in Oregon City.

Buran H. as well as his shift manager could not be worse representatives of Taco Bell, nor less caring of their patrons. We ordered eight items, 6 of which were plain ol' tacos. 20 full minutes later we'd received no food while folks who ordered after us were finally getting their food and leaving. When we politely asked about the status of our order, Bryan H. checked and told us we had been skipped. Apparently many times over. He offered no apology, and when I asked when we could expect our food to be ready, he stated he couldn't give us any sort of estimate. At all. So we finally asked for our money back. Upon refunding our money (after waiting 25 mins at that point) the shift manager then grabbed a bag of food and said "see this?" Before throwing it to the floor. Great way to treat not only us, but the other folks who were waiting patiently for their food. Obviously, Bryan H. is taking his cues from his direct supervisor. This Taco Bell has definitely seen the last of my business!

Taco Bell is one of my favorite chains. Should I ever suddenly become rich and famous and be able to have any meal I'd like every day of my life, I would still go to Taco Bell sometimes.

No one at this location has ever been rude to me. Usually, they're actually going above and beyond and being kind. I've never had an order be wrong, except one time I asked for sauce at the drive thru but didn't get any (I had some home in the fridge, it wasn't a big deal)

If you decide to dine in, there's tons of seating and the interior feels semi-updated (as far as Taco Bells go) and clean. Never had a problem except how terrible traffic is at Crossroads.

Jose the cashier was great, btw

Always hail to the Taco Bell

Yessir!  I am giving this Taco Bell joint 5 whole stars!  This TB goes above and beyond.  For serious.

I've been coming to this location for over 10 years and they have not un time messed up my order.  The staff here is actually really really friendly.  And genuinely friendly.  They never act pissed off or irritated when I ask for my usual 10 packets of fire sauce.  And they always offer me coupon deals too!

I think I've only eaten here once and felt sick.  But that's only because I got way, way, way ahead of myself when I placed my order.  Which is no one's fault but my own.  The food here is as dece as TB gets.  I mean, let's be real.. it's TB.  It's guilty pleasure, hot mess after the club food. 

Just know that his location is probably the best one in P-Town.

The girl working the late shift was rude.  She didn't even let me finish my order, and at the checkout she said only one word to me, "Sauce?" That's it, no have a nice night, no that will be $12, no asking will that be all.  Just rude

Food took over 15 minutes to come out on a Thursday around 12:15pm. I mean I know its the lunch rush, but wow! Just wow! Food was pipin hott and fresh. I asked to have my chicken quesadilla double toasted and it was amazing! Highly recommend it! 2 stars for the food, 1 star for the polite workers. 2 stars off for the long wait. 15 minutes is not acceptable to me!

We have been sitting in ur guys line forever and just wanted to say this Taco Bell has the worst service I have ever had in my life never coming back .


Sincerely .garrett

I don't care what anyone says, sometimes you just gotta have it. Last night just happened to be one of my "sometimes" & I was fully satisfied. It's Taco Bell. I know what to expect. Two mini quesadillas, 1 crunchy taco, & an order of triple stack nachos rang up to under $5.00. SWEET. The drive-thru line is almost always long here so prepare to wait if you're one of those people (me) who refuse to leave your car.

While waiting on my order I was attacked by another patron who became physically aggressive stating that he had a problem because I am white. Staff reacted by violently kicking him out of the store. I wish I could say this was a first but it's becoming the norm in west end.
These guys bust their arses everyday workin shite wage for makin shite burritos give em a break man for fuckers sake eat a frekkin taco supreme and stfu this place rocks herd core

Ok ok, So I am FINALLY going to write a review on this place. I have gave it a year to get better but it literally can not get any worse. I run a business that is not 100 yards from this taco bell and it is a fast paced business where me and my employees need to eat fast, or at least get our food in a reasonable amount of time. I would say 5 minutes from order would be reasonable.  This does not happen here.  I have been caught in the drive thru for over 45 minutes (no exaggeration) and today took the cake.  I should have learned my lesson, but I pulled in and saw the drive thru line was overflowing...poor souls.. I parked and went inside to an empty dining room. I ordered my food.  I went to use the bathroom and im not kidding, the urinal AND the toilet were overflowing, water all over the floor. The employee said they knew about it for awhile, but were too busy to handle it.  I wish I could send a pic. There were poop pieces in the hallway to the eating area.  As I was waiting for my food there was a traffic jam outside where people were trying to reverse out of the drive thru line, people were coming inside and asking for money back, an elderly man ordered just before me and he ordered ONE BURRITO SUPREME and I got my order before him which was an order for 2 people.  It seems that the business owner has done nothing to help the situation. I don't understand as if it was my business I would make sure I watched social media and also had a finger on the pulse of my business! I ordered my food per my receipt at 5pm and I just got to my work next door at 530.  Fortunately this was a little faster than normal.  They informed me they were out of Baja blast, then the guy who ordered after me they told they were out of dr pepper. There were over 20 receipts on the counter top by the register all spread out where people had got their food and just left them there to blow all over. I could see the kitchen and there was a nacho on the floor, and countless pieces of garbage all over.  I have reasonable expectations from a fast food joint, but this place is so bad I cant believe it. I feel bad for the kids working there. They have no direction. Its like their parents have gone out of town and they are trying to run a business. Someone HAS to get this place under control. Right now, I have vowed to drive the 4 miles up the street to the other taco bell and get my food there. At least I know what I will be getting.

This is the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to. I waited in the drive-through for 30 minutes, felt like I needed to turn off my car because it took so long. Almost ran out of gas waiting for this staff.

Soooo slowwww.  The line is always around the block and service is always unapologetic. Way understaffed and I would definitely not suggest stopping by for some quick munchies If you're ready to call it a night on the way home because it will take you an hour!
This is on my way to work. They are never prepared and not open at the time they say.

Like the previous person stated, I wish there was a way to only give 0 stars.  I typically don't Taco Bell, but stopped by to check out these fries everyone is talking about. I ordered from the drive through to be easier, when I pulled up there were only two cars in front of me. I ordered a $5 taco box that includes TWO tacos and fries, I waited for the two cars in front of me to get their food which took 15 mins, when I got to the window I paid for my food and asked for some sour cream, can you imagine at a taco joint sour cream is fifty four cents???? And then I had to wait another 10 mins for my two tacos and fries. Wait to top it off, now I'm even more hungry and I asked to add another taco, the young lady at the window stated, "you can't place food orders at the window." I WILL NEVER PATRONIZE THIS BUSINESS AGAIN.
Always a looooong wait time. Last time I went and complain to the girl she almost started crying it was ridiculous. Don't stop in here if in a rush or starving.

I placed what I thought was a simple order. I got 2 soft tacos and they put less and less in them all the time. The problem came when I ordered a taco salad without sour cream. Granted it was a much larger salad than the last one I got from a different location, but I said no sour cream and the receipt reflected the correct order. 

For a first visit I was not impressed.
This is the best Taco Bell in Atlanta. Very courteous and professional staff . Love the food and service.
Ridiculous wait times, staff that obviously doesn't want to be there, people deserting their posts, rude service... Never had a good experience here.
Worst wait ever. Over 45 minutes for a 12 pk of tacos and they don't tell you until after you've paid.

Ridiculous! 18 minutes in line at the drive thru in the middle of a weekday afternoon for a poorly done version of Taco Hell!  If it isn't even warm enough to melt the cheese, I have to seriously question if the food temperatures met Health Department regulations...  

The visit before this there was a sign up on the drive thru that they'd closed at 1pm due to staffing shortage. I am SO done with this place.

It's a Taco Bell, so how do you review it? I mean the food is just what you'd expect, for good or bad. Reviewing Taco Bell for the food is sort of besides the point. I'd rather talk about the full experience and rate this branch on that. 

So then, is the place clean? It was on my visit. Was the cashier friendly and helpful? She was. Did the food get out fast? Well, I parked because the drive through line was around the block and I just wanted a little snack to tide me over. But the food took nine and a half minutes for a bean burrito and a veggie loaded potato. That's a pretty long ticket time for this sort of an operation. Given that it was dinner hour and that some folks were ordering mountains of food, it's not bad. But it's also not "fast" food. 

Finally, does anyone care about a Yelp review of Taco Bell? Probably not. If you are still reading, thanks.

The wait time in the drive thru line is insane. Their line has barriers on both sides so you cannot choose to leave once you enter. From entering the line to exiting with my food it was 47 minutes. There is NO world in which it should take over 40 minutes to get a couple of tacos. Do not go to this location.

Well, it's a Taco Bell, so you basically know what you are going to get.  This one is the closest to my home, so those late evenings when I need something to eat, this is the location I head for..  I always use the drive-through, and frankly have found it no better or worse than other Taco Bell locations. The food has always been decent (again, it's a Taco Bell, so I have realistic expectations), the service has been more friendly than average, and I have never had any problems with food temperature.  This last would be a big deal for me, as I always drive it home, ten minutes away, and eat there. So I will continue to patronize this TB location when I have a semi-Mexican food craving.

I like to stop at this Taco Bell when driving on 95 because it is easy to get to. Every time I've visited, the service has been good, the dining room and bathroom are clean, and the food quality is good! No complaints about this location!
Advertising Volcano Quesarito's but not selling them anymore??  Fix your menu please...

I really don't understand what's going on with this particular Taco Bell but this is the third time this has happened to me. 

Tonight i attempted to go through the drive thru and there was 2 wet floor signs blocking the drive through. Which was fine because i didn't mind coming inside to get my food to go. So i park and walk to the door but they are locked up and closed completely. It's 10:41 PM and the sign at the door says the drive thru is open till 4 AM and the lobby  is open till 11 PM. Again, its 10:41. 

This location needs to get it together. It's so hit or miss. Sometimes i get my food and it's super fresh and delicious within a few minutes but most of the time you wait 30 minutes or longer in the drive thru for $5 worth of food and they forget half of it. Happens quite often actually. But I think the night time management and crew need to be retrained because there are seriously some issues here.

One of the worst Taco Bell in town always have long wait and new employees working every time I visit this location. There is Big sign on window saying NOW HIRING it's been there over few months, I wonder why no one wants to work at this location. 
Only reason I come here is because close to my place.
This place is yuck. I have been there twice. Service is slow. The restaurant stays dirty. The bathrooms are horrible. That's all I can say.

Average wait time over 8 minutes tonight. I've never been at such a slow Taco Bell, even window time is more than 2 minutes per vehicle- given there are 10 outside it's a 20 minute wait. What are the workers doing?

Thank you Taco Bell, due to how gross this location is, you may have assisted me with dropping weight. Typically we'd come here for our cheat day every Sunday.  However, after today we will not be returning. 90% of our order - Mexican Pizza, Chalupa Cravings Box... was inedible. Each item tasted worse then the next. All which went in the trash. Not sure if you all aren't changing oils or handling food properly. All I know, is we're not gonna return.

This is the WORST Taco Bell I have been to. I don't know why I've given them multiple chances. I'm pretty confident there isn't a manager on duty EVER and that only two kids are staffed at a time. 30 minutes we waited for food and the other times thru the drive thru have been the exact same. Multiple people in the drive thru backed out and two people inside asked for their money back, one of whom walked out because they couldn't even get the money back fast enough. Do not go here unless you have an hour to kill.

These guys always got it popping! the only late night drive thru that has any worth. i love these guys. i would die for these guys. this taco really cranks my tractor. the woman over the intercom is so friendly that i fell like she actually cares about how my day was. My order is always right and they go out of their way to be helpful!!

all these guys need a raise. 
-guy in kia soul

Not sure why I'm still waiting in this drive thru line, but at this point I'm just curious to see how long I'm going to be here. I was 3 cars from ordering for 20 minutes. Now I'm only one car from ordering as the 2 cars in front of me gave up and left.

5 minutes later I was able to order.

10 minutes after that I got my food.

Order messed up. Some lady with paetial purple hair cussed at me saying like goddamn and what not. I think it's because she though i was fat but i was ordering for 4 people. Dude that collected my money was tight tho

You probably didn't know this taco bell existed! Neither did I until I had to drive back and forth from Nelsonville multiple nights in a row, rushing to catch bands and having to do fast food as a result. But I'm glad I did, cuz this mamma jamma is open til 4 am, you chalupa chompers! With any luck, this will put a dent in my late night white castle cravings. Cuz, you know, taco bell is a way better choice. 

They've already messed up my order once, but they've also given me above par food on most other occasions, compared to other bells in the bus. And that weak ass taco bell on south high closes at like 1 a.m. wth. Brb, gotta run for the border...

I go to this location often and am usually very happy.  I order the same thing all the time, number 7 steak with a soft taco. 
My complaint is shown in the photo below. 
A quesadilla shouldn't be a pile at the end of the bag.  If you lay them flat in the bag they look as they should. This tossing in on top of the other items folded is not acceptable.  
It's not rocket science folks and happens way too often.

This is a place you might want to take a date or a friend. I came here after my latest surgery and ordered some burritos. Sometimes children come here. The restrooms have running water and are well lit. The glass on the front door is often smeared with hand prints. It smells like food inside. You can have birthday parties here. All in all, this is a place to come if you want to eat something.

So slow you can't call it fast food. The last two times I went there I went inside and the drive thru. Both times it took over 40 minutes to get fed. Unacceptable. You can go and sit down and order a steak almost anywhere else and not wait that long. I guess this franchise owner doesn't give a shit about anything.  This place needs to be shut down. I'll never go there again.

Seriously.... this Taco Bell is the worst! I understand that it's fast food. So, my expectations have been low, but the results have been much lower than low. The service is slow, unfriendly, and less than accurate.

I don't know if this is a franchise that's pinchin' pennies or what, but the amount of filling in some of their items is more than disappointing. I frequently order the shredded chicken burrito (along with many other things) and the burritos I receive have half the filling I get from other Taco Bell locations. The SCB is also supposed to include chicken, rice, cheese, and an avocado-ranch sauce. Well, 2 times in the last month I've received burritos with just shredded chicken in them, and a teeny TINY bit of cheese. 

Also, if you are looking to be serviced by a friendly face you should look elsewhere. I work in customer service, and being nice to people is the easiest part of my job. How hard is it to smile, or say, "I'll be right with you"?!?! I've walked in to order before and see that the employees are busy with the drive thru, and I get that! I don't need you to help me immediately, but at least acknowledge my presence. 

This location also has a habit of not placing all items in the bag. So, make sure to check it before you take off! 

I continue to return to this location because it's about 0.2 miles from my home, but I think I'm going to say f*** it and start driving to the location on Barbur (almost 3 miles away.) It'll be worth it to get better quality food in a more efficient manor.

Jumped off the freeway to grab something fast and get back on the road to catch my plane.  40 mins later I was just getting my food.  I called while waiting in line to see what the hold up was.  Oh sorry sir we are just slow tonight. 
40 min really..  I was so mad I could spit.
