The Mexican manager that tried to help me was so high or drunk it was ridiculous! I asked for a number to complain but the female co manager refused. Seven people got there food before me. The loaded manager got a bunch of free food and left. I have never been this disgusted with a fast food restaurant in 40 years!! I will chase this up whatever pole I need to. Don't go here. The worst service ever. And apparently the owners don't care. Trust me though, I will track someone down that does. I'm so appalled right now. To give them one star feels like I'm lying and they deserve it. And I just got home, they messed up my entire order and charged me too much. Ugh. I'm so freakin mad!!!

SLOWEST LOCATION EVER. Even with two cars in the drive through, you'll be in line for 10-15 minutes minimum. Just keep driving and go somewhere else or use the one on Stringtown. I'm typing this as I'm sitting at the window. Been here 20 minutes. Yeah, I'm not proud...but I've invested so much time, I can't give up now. You win this time, cheesy Gordita crunch.

I am normally a big fan of Taco Bell but I would steer clear of this paricular one. The last three times I ate here I couldnt finish all my food it tasted so bad. The service is lightning fast but maybe they should start taking a little more time in preparing the food.

I love Taco Bell in a pinch but I think the fast food Union is on strike because there's literally a line out the door and two people working: one at the counter and one in the kitchen. If I'd have known how slow this process would be I'd have put an order for dinner in, too.

This has got to be the busiest Taco Bell in the world.  The line at the drive thru never ends.  

I went inside to Order my meals.  Two big boxes and s 10 pack of tacos.  A few minutes later...Bam.  Complete order, delivered flawlessly.

Skip the drive thru and just go inside.  Got lots of sauce too!

Just on a whim after a meeting in downtown I stopped at this and Taco Bell right off the freeway was in the mood for a Crunchwrap so I got the Crunchwrap and a taco and while I was eating the taco I noticed the show tasted just a little bit out of date a little bit stale and I got that strange does Taco Bell is always so busy so when I bit into the Crunchwrap I was even more shocked to taste and extremely rancid stale tortilla shell but since I went through the drive-thru and went back on the freeway I couldn't turn around go back and exchange it and what would they exchange it was from the same pile of the taco shells I was very disappointed but the service and the efficiency was outstanding
There are closer Taco Bell's to me but I drive further to this one.  The food is always hot and fresh.  The staff is polite, quick, and they never get my order wrong.

This is by far the slowest fast food restaurant ever. It's taco Bell, so you expect the food to be average, but holy smokes the wait is terrible. I'll certainly never be back. Whoever manages this place should be ashamed. 40 mins in a drive through line with 5 cars? There's no excuses for that. Also, I get that it might not be the staffs fault, but apologizing for the wait would be appreciated....instead they seem to have a condecending attitude and just give off the vibe like it's the customers fault...looking at you Sophia.
Slowest Taco Bell on the planet. Always takes about 10-15 minutes. Other than that it's fine

Horrible food, they always get your order wrong and are unappologetic, the skinp on ingreadents.

blah blah blah

Tried them 4 times, all were bad bad.
Burritos are good! Kindly casher in drive thru. Nacho menus are nice, too. But, sometimes crunch wrap and chalupa little bit got a burn.

Honor your HOURS!!!! I come to this restaurant almost morning being it's the most Convenient place to stop. I understand you have to get your restaurant ready but this is a on going thing. I always arrive around 7:05 and they always say they're not ready. Today was the last straw and said I would just wait. The girl by the name of Ashley ( bottle cap eyeglasses ) rudely said "we're closed" and when I said you open at 7 she  "ok wait then". I drove to the window and she was being being rude and said call 1800- taco and shut the window. I spoke to the manager and again same excuse. Who runs a business like this?? Florida seriously by far has the worst customer service I've ever experienced! ATTITUDE and hiring people with no class or education is not a good look

My review used to be 2 stars but then I received this today with some equally skimpy potato soft tacos.
I've included photos so you can see why you should never go here.
P.S. the fries were mildly warm and not good anyways.


WILL NOT TAKE 2 orders at once after midnight because of store policy!?
I'm going to egg this Taco Bell.

We spent all day at Disney and we hadn't eaten for over 8 hours. When we left Disney we looked for the closest Taco Bell and found this one. I ordered a bean burrito for myself and as I took a bite it tasted rotten! It was nasty... so I watched others eat and I had nothing. How do you mess up a bean burrito?

Let me say this is the first Taco Bell I haven't liked. It is my favorite place to eat most of the time.

Came here on a Saturday night and waited over 45 minutes for our order. This place was so disorganized, they had every customer order delayed or incorrect. Horrible customer service, unwilling to provide refunds despite dozens of upset customers

I must be bored to review a taco bell. This one stood out to me though. Its a taco bell so it doesnt matter about the food. It always tastes the same. No need to review that. What needs to be reviewed is why no matter if it is drive thu or walk in, is how it takes no less then 15 minutes to get your food. I have been in there to order a single taco, literally one standard taco, and have waited 15 minutes. I have sat in the drive thru, and waited 20 minutes, after I ordered. The employees give off a strong scent of "i dont give a sh×t" which I dont blame them. Obviously management, if it even exists, provides no enthusiasm or motivation. This is not fast food, although the quality is. This is slow food. Wasting my time for a damn cheap taco food. 

If you have time to waste, go ahead. If not, dont risk it.

I have never left a negative review. I always let things go but my experience tonight was awful. I spent 50 minutes stuck in the drive thru and the line wasn't even that long. When I finally got to the window, they didn't say sorry for the wait. They just asked for my money. Then I waited another 5-10 minutes at the window. When I finally got my food, they just said here you go. No have a goodnight or anything. They never even asked for sauce. So much for fast food!

I don't know what the problem with this Taco Bell is...I've lived in Boulder for years and it's seriously the slowest Taco Bell ever, the wait can take up to 30 minutes sometimes. The staff is usually pretty nice and they usually get the food right at least. But this last time I went, I ordered two crunchwraps and arrived home only to find they had NO ground beef in them...seriously. We drove back and the manager kindly had the staff make new ones, however the kid toasting them carelessly tossed the bag onto the counter when he was finished making them, visibly annoyed by the situation. The new crunchwraps were sloppily made and only one side of them had beef on them but at that point we were over it... This place seriously needs to get it together. A lot of the time we have to drive across town to the other Taco Bell because this one always has so many issues...seems like they're terribly understaffed and poorly managed.
I come here a lot when I get off of work late at night. Drive thru is fast and they're always super friendly which is rare with fast food

This Taco Bell needs to do some serious rethinking on their staffing 1 they need to get more people because the drive through line is the slowest moving line in history. 2 there has never been a time where they actually got my order correct and gave me all the food I ordered. These employees just simply don't listen and then always ask for a good rating/survey for how they did. Do I expect a lot when I go to fast food no. But they are absolutely not fast, and they do not listen to your order or double check the food in the bag is all there.

RATS RATS RATS !!! I wouldnt recommened this location . The server refused to let us order separate orders at the driver thru. She had a horrible attitude and lacked good customer service.  She was quick to get us out of line even though there was no one in front or behind us . And as we were leaving I saw a rat run across the floor behind the front counter . GROSS ! I didn't even eat my food I was so disgusted

Ok I'm here to Try the $5 Naked Chicken Box
First off when I placed my order I made sure to tell the drive thru personal lady was to add extra beef to my Burrito Supreme and Make my Hard Taco a Soft Taco Supreme extra beef so both were only .50 cent to add extra beef per item.. Best $1.00 ever spent now to the food

The Burrito was massive soft filled with Beef yummy and the lettuce was cold and crisp add Fire Sauce I was happy...

Now to my Soft Taco Supreme it was also filled with Beef so big Beef was hanging all over from the top with my toppings yummy...

 
Last but not least The 6 pc Naked Chicken was nice and warm with a side of cheese sauce on that thang they were good but now I'm full so I will Re-Bake those later Gator.
Slowest fast food service I've ever had. Ordered 3 crunchy tacos and a crunch wrap supreme, got the food 45 minutes later. If you're in a rush, I recommend going to the McDonald's across the street.

Apparently all taco bells do not have anything but beef chicken and cheese in the Orlando area, as instructed by an employee. We were advised we couldn't go anywhere else and it would be the same scenario. Seems bizarre and not buying it. Makes sense why it has 2 stars on google... mind you we got charged meal price and they didn't give us a few meal due to the lack of ingredients.

This Taco Bell used to be the worst Taco Bell on this side of town but after the remodel and under new management as far as franchise it's great. The employees appear to actually like their job and it shows in the food and service. I live near the Obetz location and rather drive to this location just because it seems like that location is now garbage and needs to be tore down.

Probably one of the best Taco Bell locations I've ever been to. Food came out super quick and was the best quality I've ever seen. The staff was super friendly and working hard. I'm actually impressed with the quality of the food it looked just like the commercials

Where was the store manager today? No sodas at all! I simply wanted a lemonade. Their "burrito supreme" is not a supreme burrito. It's about the size of one of their dollar menu burritos. I paid $5 for that tiny thing?? Ridiculous. Del Taco has EPIC burritos, which are MMMUCH BIGGER and BETTER for the same price. A Chipotle burrito platter is also MUCH larger than this. 

I'm done.

I went here for breakfast a slow Saturday morning. I ordered using the kiosks. After not being acknowledged after waiting for 15 mins I approached the 2 gals working behind the counter. They treated me as if I was bothering them. After another 10 minutes they finally got off their behinds to give me my single breakfast burrito and coffee. Horrible service. Stay away. Fire the lazy workers.

My fiance and I love Taco Bell ( yes we know it's not the healthiest) we go to three that are around our locations, West Roxbury, Walpole, and Framingham. West Roxbury and Framingham stores suck, the quality of the food is lacking and the customer service is mediocre. Walpole has never failed us. The food is always consistent, the quality is great and the employees are the friendliest employees we have ever encountered. We will no longer be going to the other two stores because we do not want those stores to be disgrace the Taco Bell brand. Thank you for being great!
Try the vegetarian power bowl. I told my friends about it and they loved it, too. Around 430 calories. 37% fat, 52% carbs. ( Also comes with chicken or steak if you like) Saborito!!

Worst night service ever. Dining area closes at 12 (way to early), one person works the drive thru speaker, makes the food, and helps customers. Rest of the employees stand around on their phones. Ridiculous. If you can't handle being open late THEN DON'T BE OPEN LATE.

this place literally shouldn't even be considered a Taco Bell. The first time i came here, I was inappropriately hit on by the man taking my order inside and it made me VERY uncomfortable. Secondly, i just attempted to go through the drive thru in order to get a quick dinner after a 10 hour shift at work and waited 30+ minutes when there was FOUR cars infront of me and was told I couldn't use Apple Pay, along with a rude comment from the individual stating "well it isn't my fault"... a total joke. I am incredibly disappointed and will never be returning. Literally eat anywhere else. Please.

We drove through at around 1030 am and the staff was quick accurate and the food hot and delish. There was a good amount of napkins put in the bag too as well as hot sauce which is important because you don't always have those these days. We asked for extra cheese on the nachos and it was a good amount and worth the extra charge which is always not something I get right at other locations.

This was the first time my order was completely accurate! Bask in that because I also ordered the last apple empanada they had in the store. Apparently the executive decision was to take them off the menu which after the crushing news my meximelt is long gone it was a harsh blow. The food is consistent and for the most part a friendly staff whole unlike others that try to sneak off early I can count on them. So what if you asked for cheese instead of cheese sauce at least they are there.

Anyone who knows me wont believe this review.  I receive over $100 in Taco Bell gift cards for Christmas and my birthday each year.  I have loved and defended Taco Bell.  So much so that I was kicked off our local Oregon City Chit Chat for too much defense of Taco Bell.  So it is with heavy heart that I write this complaint of the Gladstone Taco Bell.  They use to be the best in service.  I was eating here several years ago when the regional manager awarded all the employees X boxes for their top rating.  What a difference.  This is now one of the slowest, with very little regard for what they serve up.  Talk about false and misleading advertising.  Here is a photo of the tostada they market, and here is what I get.  You don't even see any beans on one of them.  This is not the first time...this constantly.  After 6 years of coming here, I will not be coming back.  I prefer quality and true marketing.  This has become disgusting.

I don't know why anyone would ever look up a Taco Bell for reviews on Yelp, but just in case: this particular Taco Bell is the best I've ever been to. All the staff is competent, all the managers are friendly, and all my orders are correct. I guess that's pretty much all you can ask of a Taco Bell.

Usually have a pretty good experience at this location. Today I went and ordered a taco salad and a nachos supreme..I added jalepenos for .35 cents...I got a total of 3 jalapenos on the nachos and 4 on the salad...I know its not a lot of money but COME ON!!

So the fam came here and ate inside this time.  The wait was minimal. I ordered a Steak power bowl sans the rice and beans.  I try to eat Keto these days. It was pretty tasty! Steak, sour cream, guacamole, pico de Gallo, lettuce and cheese... I'd order it again. 

The boys ordered their usual Beefy 5 layered burrito.   No complaints there.
I am very impressed with the Quesalupa. Soft shell stuffed with cheese and overflowing with meat, lettuce and cheese.  Very good! Thank you for the great service.
Worst taco bell location I have ever been to.  Ordered 3 tacos and waited 30 minutes. Never again.  This place needs more employees.
25 minutes waiting inside for my order while the drive thru line was empty. Completely disorganized.

Service, food, quality? Taco Hell. It took 15 minutes to receive my order AFTER paying. They gave food to 2 other carloads AFTER me. The taco shell was old. The taco was dry. The worker as I was placing my order apologized twice, once for being interrupted and the second time not hearing. Needless to say, that preview should have told me something. Won't be back to that location.

Went to drive through it was really busy at midnight. Order stuff without meat but some of the order came with meat. I would recommend check your order before leaving. Taste good and also cheaper then other fast food places.
The service is horrible, by the time you get your food you don't even want it anymore

I don't frequent this location, I work in Grandview so if I want my Taco Bell fix,  I usually go to the 5th Ave location.  They're always friendly,  accurate orders and for the most part have fresh food. I just had to post this picture of the "mexican pizza" I received Tuesday at this location on Livingston. Booo. So sad.  And this is one of the pricier items on the menu. Maybe they were a day early for April Fools.  Ho hum. :-(

This Taco Bell has horrible service, rude staff, and is filthy. 
We stood and waited on our order for 15 minutes and when they didn't give us all of our order a staff member said "Oh she is just standing there" and walked away. 

The adult on staff rolled his eyes and finally I stated what I still needed for my family. And proceeded to wait a little while longer. 

I would never recommend anyone eating at this Taco Bell and will never eat here again.

Great experience! Fast drive thru line! And friendly service! We tried a different Taco Bell tonight that was closed before 1am which is crazy! We were happy to find this Taco Bell with great staff and  fast service! We will drive the extra mile here every time! Thank you!!

What do you expect from Taco Bell.  I ordered $25 worth of food and got $10 worth.  Then I come back and the manager tells me I didn't order that much food.  Typical shit hole fast food with piss poor management.  Good job making America great again Taco Bell!

OK, so I do not review many if any fast food restaurants, this being my first. However, I do check reviews prior to going. This site had a 2 star rating but honestly today's visit was every bit worth 4 stars if not more. I went in first to order some dollar menu items and Danielle, who never heard of Yelp when inquired after I ordered, was spot on with her service.  Food was ready within a few minutes and accurate. I decided to get another order using drive thru to see if I could find a chink in their armor but again, I was totally impressed with the service. I wrote review after eating the food at my nearby hotel and again I could not find any fault with food presentation/quality, in fact probably that best tostada I've ever seen / tasted.

Worst fast food service I've ever experienced!! Came there to pick up breakfast at 8:40 AM and could barely understand any of the English the lady was speaking, I could not fit my work truck through the drive-through and Lead carry-out attendant would not open the door to let me pay for the food kept telling me to walk around the entire restaurant and go to the drive-through window. This is absolutely absurd, I will not give any future business to this Taco Bell location and I am very disappointed in the unqualified workers of this restaurant.
This Taco Bell has some of the most real people in the world working there. I asked for hot sauce and I got the proper amount witch most taco bells can't say. Thank you for great customer service.
Nice staff and consistently good for taco bell. I highly recommend this location.

So I went to this location on Wednesday and they got my whole order wrong never gave me a receipt and when I called to let them know there was no answer for 3 days. How do you have a phone and don't answer it? Why did I spend my money and not get what I ordered. I guess they decide what to put in the bags. I wasn't going to write a review had they answered the phone but being that they are to busy giving people the wrong food so they can't answer I decided to rant my frustrations here. My suggestion is if you don't want a mystery bag you go somewhere else.
I was charged more than the price listed on the drive-thru sign.  When I brought this to the cashier's attention, she just shrugged and said the drive-thru sign was wrong.

You guys could do better how do you call this management I'm afraid of what could've been going on during the covid restrictions and their new manager they had come in "big boss chasity" doesn't understand the basic principles of hygiene just look at these pictures be careful with coming here don't think twice

Wow I think it's amazing how you going to a place they miss your order up pretty bad get shitty ass service and everything like that then you called and complained and they send you a coupon for 3 dollars really after you spend 10 on tacos they're going to give you 3 dollars

Could not believe the wait. We only stayed because we were feeding a cheer team and it was the closest to them. It took over 45 minutes for food and waiting in line. The even had to close down heir drive them to get through the night.

This is hands down not only the worst taco bell I've ever been to, but it's also the worst dining experience I've ever had in my life.  Waited over 40 minutes for food as workers moved at a glacial place. I almost celebrated a birthday waiting for some stankass food that tasted like dog excrement. I wanted to ask for a refund but I'm apparently a glutton for punishment.

What a horrible experience. Do not... I repeat DO NOT go to this Taco Hell under any circumstance.

Went through the drive through and was greeted by 2 very rude people. The manager at the time was Kaia, a 19 year old who needs to be educated and disciplined. 

This place hires entitled , rude children and they don't give a damn about customers. 

Avoid at all cost. I'll be contacting the franchise owner as well.

This isn't the most convenient Taco Bell to get into since it's located inside the Crossroads plaza but it is the closest to Disney. We stopped in here quickly to grab breakfast in the drive thru. There was no one else in line so we got through very quickly. Everything was hot and made fresh not to mention cheap! It's not my neighborhood Taco Bell but the service was pleasant and quick so if I'm over here for breakfast again I'll be sure to pop back in.

Longest wait ever. 30 minutes for about 10 cars. My  90 year old grandmother could do better. If the service here was any worse, I'd think that they weren't even open. If I had the cash, I'd buy this Taco Bell, fire the employees, and knock it down.

why would anyone review Taco Bell??! Well, if you like Taco Bell food, go to a different location. This one is poorly managed, very rude, and almost always mess up food prep. Not that they give you the wrong order, they'll give you messed up tacos, miss fillings, and the list goes on. 

Trust me, I gave them a chance, more than FIVE times!

Worst service ever. They sell all the items requested and won't switch any items out. If you sell the beef and I want beef instead of chicken why won't you just not put chicken and instead put beef strange.

The Taco Bell App started off amazing but has since failed me miserably. 
Literally 3 times in a row in the last 2 months I have gone in and they do not have my order.
3 times they have made me reorder and which I am charged again for the order that I just made but no they will not refund me in the store, I have to speak with customer service. They come up with an excuse that I have to been within distance of the store to make an App purchase. Are you serious! The amount of money and tech everystore would have to have to make the system work like that would be ridiculous. Odds are its just this store that is awful with the App. I am an avid fan of taco bell and have been for years and when they made the app I was very glad it worked well until now the store has been a sore on the entire organization.

11/6       Someone else took my order and after about 15 minutes we realized what had happened. The staff had to make my order again but were timely and friendly about it and did everything to make it right. I truly appreciate it!

Staff at this Taco Bell cannot be bothered to serve the counter. They're too busy handling drive-thru business to to bother with walk-ins. Even when I asked three times if anybody was serving the counter, nobody in the kitchen responded.

This was the worst experience ever. We went through the drive thru, got our order, decided to check it because the lady taking the order kept reading it back incorrectly. Sure enough, the order was completely wrong even after repeating it 3 times. Due to Covid, their lobby is closed so we went back through the drive thru, told the girl what happened, waited in line only to pull up to the window and she asked again what was wrong, then made us pull around to the side and wait. 
The girl who brought the replacement out was rude and extremely unpleasant and immediately went back inside. We decided to check the replacement and it was wrong AGAIN. This time we called, the manager instantly blamed the girl who typed in the order and said he made it how it was sent to him (seriously? I don't care who's fault it was) and he sent someone out to get our order. The guy who came out to get our order wasn't wearing a mask, pulled his shirt up over his mouth and had his stomach showing while asking us what we ordered. 
Our second replacement came out perfect and the lady who brought it to us (Diosha..sorry, I probably totally messed up the spelling) was so nice, apologetic and gave us a couple coupons for next time. This review is obviously a reflection of everyone except Diosha.

Normally I wouldn't judge too harshly on fast food service. I work customer service and I truly understand the stress to having a dinner rush and mistakes happening. Some friends and I ordered some food on the wall kiosks in this Taco Bell and began to wait for our food. The restaurant wasn't busy while we ordered but people came in right behind us. All of us were welcome to wait with no real worry since we were all fine with talking. However it soon became apparent that 20 minutes had passed since we ordered our food. People who arrived after us were receiving their food and begging their meals before our entire order was completed. Which again, mistakes happen and things get overlooked. What truly left a bitter taste in my mouth was the employees reaction to our situation. At first we were dismissed being told that we had to pay first before the order would go through their system as however when we showed physical proof of the review we received at the counter (we paid in cash and could only do so from the counter) we were still treated with indifference. At this point it took them another ten minutes to even begin the food that was ordered over a half hour prior and when I finally asked for a refund for our less than satisfactory service we were denied and simply given some free sides as compensation. 

Again I understand fully how difficult working in a busy fast food restaurants can be, and dealing with irate customers can be an ordeal after a long day at work, but the entire ordeal was handled poorly. What's done is done here however I hope the employees of this establishment take this as a learning experience because they seriously need to rework their work ethics.

Worst service ever. Bearded guy in drive through was so rude we left before finishing order and went to taco bell in Attleboro instead. 
If you hate your job that much please find another one. It may be "just taco bell" but I expect better. Customer service training needed!

I just came here after a very undesirable experience at the Bethany location and you guys were SO AWESOME!!  Dylan and Josh made me fresh rice chalupas and they were so kind and super fast!!  They even doubled checked to make sure all was right.  You guys absolutely rock and I appreciate your positive disposition and kindness.  Faith in late night Taco Bell restored   I don't visit Taco Bell often but when I do it will be this location.

Some days this location get my order correctly.

Most of the times they get my order wrong, the food is cold or soggy!

For some reason they never have MILD SAUCE.

ALWAYS OUT OF THE APPLE EMPANADAS!!
YES ALWAYS!!!!!!!!

MY soads is always FLAT


Oh how I love this Taco bell

NOT!!!
Robin who's a worker at this Taco Bell gave us the best customer!!! We live near by and have gone here multiple but today was the best service I've gotten. Thank you ROBIN!!!

This location seems to have gone downhill in the last few years. They used to offer reasonably-sized portions, but corporate or the franchise owner seems to have cracked-down on their portions because they're now consistently smaller than other locations of the same chain. 

If there was another location *anywhere* near-by, I'd be there in a hot second. Unfortunately, this is the only Taco Bell near my apartment. Recently, I've been going to Taco Time instead.
We stopped in for a bite on the way back from Universal Studios.  The employees were friendly. The restaurant was clean.  The food was good.  Three cheers for the tostada on the dollar menu!

The bathroom in the Taco Bell has poop all over the front of the toilet in the women's bathroom. If they can't even keep their bathrooms clean, what must their kitchen look like? I walked right out. So gross!

Taco Bell has free WiFi. And is in my neighborhood. My two goals this summer are to work remotely from the office and cook less. That makes this location ideal for me. Answer a few email and eat. In all fairness to the location - I came in after the lunch crowd. So the dining room seemed messier than usual and it was hard to tell who was in charge. Once you get pass the messiness, the staff was knowledgeable, friendly and accommodating. And my meal was $6 including the drink. Some days, it's really all I need. High volume store.
This location feels it is okay to close before their advertised times. Not good business. Worse customer service.

This is the worse... Taco Bell... I've ever been in. It's alwaaaaays packed even at 2am still packed and when it's packed it means your food is made sloppy af and on top of that every time I go through drive thru they always forget something and when you try to check your order before you drive they give you the worse look. I'm done with this location.
They took forever to make foood it should never take one hour and I asked sauces and got one sauce packet

This is the worst Taco Bell on the planet ! I work down the street and it is by far the slowest moving Taco Bell I have ever been to management should be ashamed... never a wait under 20 min I actually just walked into some say it's going to be at least 20 min NOT FAST FOOD DO NOT STOP FOR LUNCH BREAK you will probably get fired because no manager would believe Taco Bell is that slow

Dear tacobell.

This is The last time we order Food from there, They never Get our order right. Also What kind of tacobell is out of tacos, might as well just call yourself bell. 

Thanks for all the hot sauces tho, great to have 22 sauces with no food to put it on. 

Y'all should get your life together....

Sincerely, 

Two-hungry-will-order-from-mcdonalds-next-time-girls
The food takes forever to come out. Shouldn't advertise themselves as fast food. Terrible.

The drive thru is awful, and their customer service is just as bad! I avoid this location which is a shame because is close to my house. I normally make the drive to a different location further away. You have been warned.

Worst  taco bell EVER!!! WHO DOESN'T HAVE LETTUCE ON A SATURDAY NIGHT??? REALLY. I pulled up to the drive thru window then someone pulled up behind me. When I got to window I was told there was no lettuce. I was ordering a bowl. Therefore I did not order and I got stuck for 15 Min!!!!!! Slow employees! !

Very VERY vitriol/acidic/rancid/MEAN...... they might spit in your food.

Here is what happened....
I ordered a simple $10 value meal and they were out of the fritos but had the meat.... no prob.. so I just politely asked could they then substitute sour cream for the fritos instead..... and boy oh boy, did the order taker flip out on me.

Fine....., if thats the case..... no problem. I just said,..... "ok dont spit in my food or anything like that ok" and she just blew up on me stating she wouldnt serve me and anything like that. 

Fine.

I drove right on thru.

I was hoping to give this location a good rating seeing from past ratings.... never mind.

What a shitty restaurant. 30 minutes to make two  bean burritos. Employees not listening to the manager to make my food when I finally said something after 25 minutes. Manager needs to be fired if his employees wont listen or the employees have to go. What a shit show
5 layer burrito has 2 layers of tortilla, a layer of cheese and splash of beef. No beans. Someone hates their job.

If there was a 0 star I would select very rude people worst Taco Bell branch was kept on hold forever and could hear the stupid person that answered the phone saying I can't understand what the guy on the phone wants he is on hold then someone said leave him on hold.

Avoid this place! 3rd time I've had an issues at this location. They do not like filling large orders. Just went into the drive through with my 4 kids and got a nasty attitude from the order taker. Backed up and left.

I come here a couple times a week, but I'll probably be going to the Taco Bell on Hall since it's not much further for way better service. 
I've had two encounters with "Jake", he wasn't wearing a name tag so I'm not sure if he gave me the correct name. He was extremely rude and shouldn't even have a job there. I would post pictures with my receipt but the last two times I've gone (yesterday and just now) he has not given me one.

If I could give negative stars I would. First let me start by saying this location is notorious for always getting orders wrong but tonight was the last time we will ever eat at any Taco Bell again. I'm over it. 

Tonight, when my boyfriend arrived home with Taco Bell, we pulled everything out of the bag only to discover that they forgot our second Mexican pizza.   He immediately called and then drove the 15 minutes back there to get the other item. As he was on his way home for the second time I called him to tell him that I went to take a bite of my Mexican pizza and was surprised to find a bug clearly cooked on it. I even snapped a pic and sent it to him. I'm so glad I saw the bug before I took any bite. I didn't eat my meal at all. Unfortunately my boyfriend wasn't as lucky as he ate one of his Gordita crunches on the way back to pick up the forgotten Mexican pizza. Had I called him a couple of minutes sooner with my discovery he would not have ate his Gordita. 

So he came home grabbed the food and drove back for the THIRD time and went to return the food. Again, we retuned all of the meal minus a Gordita, that he wouldn't have ate if he knew about the bug earlier. So that's 4 of the 5 items returned. Basically the full meal. They wouldn't give the refund and actually argued with him about wanting the refund for the meal that we weren't going to eat. 

I get that it could have been a genuine accident. A bug in the food is gross, accident or not and I am not eating food with a bug in it. The fact that this location ALWAYS messes up every single order and now we get an order with a bug in it? It's just obvious they don't care about quality standards for their store, the food and they clearly also don't care about customer service and making mistakes right. We wasted money on disgusting food that we didn't eat, time and gas on the multiple trips only to not get treated right. It's not like we were trying to make a buck and get free food. We were returning the food and just wanted to eat else where with no bugs. It's not about the money so much as the principle or making a mistake right.

Reading other reviews online it sounds like this location has a serious problem with getting any order correct, food quality and customer service -especially on night shift.

I somehow keep giving this place chances every few months, thinking it will get better.  It doesn't.  It's awful.  I should've walked to Pollo Tropical instead of wasting 20-25 minutes to get a simple burrito and three cheesy roll ups.  I'm sure management doesn't care, but I can't be bothered giving this place any more chances.  My time is worth more than this.
Good. It's Taco Bell nothing fancy. Went through the drive through and the food was fresh and good. Staff was friendly. Would go back.
I know Taco Bell is Taco Bell, but service makes the place great! Cashier Danielle is super cheery and helpful! She makes me want to come back.

I like taco bell. There I said it. The love affair started back in college when all I could afford was the bean burrito. As an international student eating taco bell was an awesome experience.

This branch is nothing unique but you are there for fast food and chalupas. This taco bell is fast and decor is nice. The people here are very nice too. Hence the good review.
They can't even make a small chicken quesadilla... so sad people are really THAT LAZY.

I ordered the #2 and three soft tacos from the drive thru just to get five mins down the road and find out they sloppily threw together EVERYTHING! Tacos were so soggy that they actually wet up the whole bag the order came in almost falling out the bottom. My boyfriend's Champion gym pants ruined almost ruined my Nike joggers thank God they are black ‍
Love the Nacho Cheese Fries Supreme and the $5 Nacho Cheese Fries Cravings Box!  Senior citizens get a 10% discount.
Everything about this Taco Bell location deserves an A+.  The restaurant was clean inside and out.   I was greeted by an upbeat extra friendly cashier.  My food was prepared quickly and was accurate.
Slowest service ever! We had to wait an extra twenty minutes to get our food and the cashier was super rude!

This is by far the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to.  I lost track how many times I've come and their systems have crashed, how many times they've messed up my order, and how many times they have been low on their own inventory.  I have only come across one helpful and joyful employee while the rest have been terrible to say the least.

I love Taco Bell but this one is right outside my place and because of its performance, I will have to no longer be a patron.

Probably 2nd slowest Taco Bell in existence. Takes 1-2 cars order, then needs to wait until they have paid, received their food and on their way until they take the next cars order, way too slow. Waiting 20 minutes and only 2 cars were in front of me and they had small orders! Hire faster and smarter employees please.

WRONG ORDER AGAIN!  I'm so tired of ordering something and getting an ¢85 bean burrito.  What a con, pay for a deluxe menu item & get something of the cheap menu.  YOU OWE ME BIG FOR ALL YOUR SCREW UPS!!

Had to repeat my order several times for clerk to understand. Clerk messed up my order completely again and again. Thought it was all sorted out, received wrong order. Had to go back. Lengthy time getting correct order. Food was cold by the time it was received. Seriously bad customer service when I returned. Hopefully they'll figured it out eventually.

So I have no clue what y'all teach your line employees but this is ridiculous. second drive threw to severely mess up. I'm allergic to certain things so I ask for no beans on my nachos and no meat on it as well due to a spice problem... what happens. No beef on the taco supreme and beef on the nachos along with beans. I said it 4 times that I'm allergic. Once again. Money down the drain. Your employees don't listen at all.

Edit: hazel did not take my order. She was a sweetheart at the window.

I've been to many Taco Bells; i'm a roadie for a small band. This Taco Bell was the worst by far. The tables were greasy and sticky and trash on the ground. The employees were rude to me when I simply asked for a straw because the compartment was empty. I'm never coming back.
This is the best run Taco Bell I've ever experienced. The customer service is noteworthy and the place is spotless. This is a model store.

The drive thru at this Taco Bell is literally always a 30 minute or longer wait. Doesn't matter what day or time you come. There were 9 cars in front of me when I got here, 15 minutes later only 3 cars had gotten food. I just don't get it. How hard is it to fry some food, fill a drink, make a taco, etc? Go to any other Taco Bell, no issue, but here? Be prepared to spend more time waiting for food than you do in a real sit down restaurant.

This location rocks and is the best place to get free food, because they literally screw up your order every time!

Last time I was in there with my bf, we ordered 5 items and got 3 extra items for free because they did not make the order correctly the first time. 

The employees are awful, the store is always messy, but I keep coming back for the free food! Keep up the terrible work, guys!

Screwed up my Mountain Dew Baja Blast order twice. First time ,he gave me the drinks glass. As I was unaware that Baja blast is the freeze (similar to Watermelon freeze), I took the glass and filled that with Baja Blast soda. 
When I realized later, I asked order Watermelon freeze and this time he did give the freeze but alas.. It was all watery, no black seeds. 
Upon asking, answer was that that's how the freeze is usually. 

How lame the excuse was. Not going there again.

"Is this it?"
*dirty look followed by door slam*

I would give it one star but the food we did receive was not bad. Of course we were missing half the order bc we sat at the drive through waiting for this nasty woman to respond to us and she just looked at us when we asked if the entire order was there and shut the window on us. Gross. Figure out the customer service and everything else will fall in place.

As a kid I frequented this location and it was always great. Now, not so much. The last few times I was in the area and decided to abuse my body with fast food I stopped here and drove away sad. On the last visit a few weeks ago my sister and I waited in the drive thru line for at least 30 minutes. I have no idea what was taking so long as we were the third car in line but it was ridiculous. When we finally got our tacos and nachos they were all stale. Really upsetting seeing as we waited sooooo long to get this food before the long ride home. I'm thinking next time I'm on that road I'll hit McDonalds instead.

Surprisingly the inside is clean but got people in there asking for change in the side this damn store. I went through the drive-thru but I would low on gas and I was in a rush and they look like they kind of slow. But for the most part I love that $5 box with a Mountain Dew. Oh and one more thing that had customers in the side loud and cussing. But I will still go back

Saturday afternoon. Not particularly crowded. Waiting on 3 tacos took over 10 minutes. Many people waiting and vocally complaining about the slow service. Read yelp and see there is a pattern here. Unfortunate the franchise owner or corporate cannot or will not correct the situation.

Worst Taco Bell for service ever. Had 2 orders. One took 31 minutes from order until given to us. The other 37 minutes. By the time we got the second order our friends in the first order we're finishing up. The quality of the food was fine, fortunately. Otherwise it would've been a total disaster.

Last night I wasted 20+ minutes of my time waiting in line and over $20 on no meat but beans in my tacos because the man taking my order did not understand english in the slightest.  Usually this is a decent taco bell.  Not any more.

Seriously the WORST Taco Bell EVER! We've ordered several times and gone in. The orders have continuously been made incorrect! We ordered from DoorDash and had to go in to pick up the incorrect order and had to hear the employees say "It's just DoorDash!" They messed up the order AGAIN! This was after we had spoken to the manager Chris! Totally insane that it was made incorrectly more then once!!

I have actually been in line at the drive thru for 20 minutes and have just ordered .  The big issue is you cannot get out of line so you are stuck waiting .   The food was the same as every other Taco Bell but the service is so slow you could go to a full service restaurant and get your food faster.   Total time from getting in line and driving away with my food 30 minutes .
My steak quesadilla came with absolutely no steak in it also asked for extra beef in my crunch wrap But got barely half of a serving

Wow, fantastic team here. They handed my food to me before I even sat down. The food was super fresh. My only guess is that they were making it while I ordered. This place was a pleasant surprise and I would totally choose this one over others.

It's Taco Bell ....and if I have to tell you about the food, you likely live a sheltered life. I don't know why, but Taco Bell is good. So this post isn't about the food, because it's the same taste and fast food quality that you can get at any Taco Bell location across this great country of ours. BUT...this Taco Bell is extremely slow. Slooooooooooowwww. Ordered online and had a pick up eta of 8:02. Food was finally ready at 8:33. If you're in a hurry, default to drive through. And don't waste your time ordering ahead.

Slowest TACO BELL EVER! We were first in line through the drive thru and probably two people in the lobby. We had to wait 15 minutes to get 10 tacos. They said they just got slammed with people...what people?! No wonder there is always a long line..they're so slow.
Seriously, the longest drive thru wait ever. There has got to be a way to fix this. More training of staff?

If I could leave less stars I would. They messed up my entire order. I wanted to treat myself because I have had a long day today and I asked specifically for two things to not be on my order and they just didn't care. Both food items I ordered came with the items I asked for to be left off and the made one of the items so poorly that I only ate half and just threw the other part away. I will never ever be going to this location. It's people like the workers here that I just hate. I hate people who are lazy at their job. I work in the food industry too but I take pride it my work. So grow the fuck up and take pride in your job. YOU CHOSE TO WORK FOR TACO BELL. Don't act like your job is so hard to do or think you could be somewhere better.. because if you wanted to be somewhere better to work you would have already fucking moved on from a job meant for high school and college kids.

Picked up some taco bell last night about 8pm for my son and I. I am vegan so I ordered a crunchwrap supreme and subbed beans for the meat and fresco style which means no dairy and I specified no dairy. my son is vegitarian and ordered a bean burritto, a chunch wrap beans instead of meat and no sour cream and a taco beans instead of meat. we got home and my vegan wrap was full of cheese so I just could not eat any of the taco bell food. my son ate the crunch wrap and woke up this morning throwing up all over. he has food poisoning and is very very sick from this food!!!!!!

This is the second time I have been to this location an hour and a half past when they are supposed to be open and the first time thru the drive thru speaker they said they were closed I told the lady I had made a mobile order and wanted to know how to get a refund and she said "oh, don't worry about it I'll make your food". This time today after doing a mobile order no one was working the drive thru and I had to cancel my order. As I drive around the front of the store customers are denied entry with locked doors.  This location dosen't care about making money it seems.

I've driven by here many times without stopping. My original plan was to go Panera but saw the line and opted for Taco Bell.
When I walked in I noticed it was very clean. A gentleman around 60 was cleaning and came behind the counter to take my order.
I was impressed with this gentleman who had the ability to make conversation while I waited for my order.
The shredded chicken tacos were awesome and kept me full during my busy work day.

I am familiar with Taco Bell, so I had only low expectations when I agreed to take my family on the way home from delivering food to the grandparents. They erred on the customizations, most importantly a beef to chicken substitution. Tried to call, they didn't answer and their mailbox is full. I thought they'd pick.up the phone because the "cook" picked up the phone while we waited for him to complete our order. It looked unsanitary that he did so. So many locally owned restaurants  so back to home cooking and back to our focus on supporting small businesses.

Yeah, it's just Taco Bell, but everyone deserves a review.

I haven't been to this location in ages and have never eaten in there.  Got there a little after 11:00 and it was quick and easy.  The young man at the counter was very nice and rolled with the punches even when my friend was cracking jokes.  Our food came out very fast and everything was very clean.
Still slow still horrible . Everything about this Location sucks. The drive thru always moves super slow .

I go to my local taco bell pretty persistently and they do a pretty good job. Whenever i want mild sauce they put the perfect amount. I put it as 4 stars because they got rid of my favorite burrito (grilled cheese burrito). I hope for it to come back soon so i can go more than I do now. I also want to recommend coca cola products instead of Pepsi cola. Just my opinion! (keep baja blast plz)
The service is awful. Walk, because they messed up my order, the girl at the register is on the phone. Three other employees look at you and ignore you. You get one word snappy answers. No thanks.

Always the same story at this location, loads of lettuce and cheese with NO meat. I'm glad I can help pay for the new remodel by purchasing meatless tacos....this particular location outta be demolished, which in return would add more parking for Kroger!

Thy don't deserve even 1 for rating. The employees are very slow. They really need to know the what word "Fast Food" means.   Perhaps, they need to hire more competent and motivated people who can provide quality of customer service

There was a COCKROACH in my $5 box. 

I do not go to Taco Bell for quality food. I stopped by suing my lunch hour on a Saturday and they were PACKED. I waited in line, received my food pretty quickly. Once I let the lot, I was at the light and opened my box to check my food. At that moment a FREAKING COCKROACH crawled out and onto my passenger seat. 

I killed the bug and took it back along with the food and drink I ordered. The staff did what is within their scope, apologized and refunded my money. I've also emailed corporate about this and plan to contact the health department. 

I've had food from a few sketchy places but NEVER experienced something as disgusting and foul as this. 

Please, do not eat here.

I have been in the drive thru for 9 minutes and I've only moved up 3 cars. It's TACO BELL... What are they doing?! This is the second time I've been here & had to wait FOREVER for food in the drive thru. I feel like they owe me at least 3 free meals for all of the gas I've waisted here, except I won't be back again twice is enough.
HOW LONG DOES IT TAKE TO MAKE A TACO?!

If there is a slower Taco Bell in America I'd like to know where.  Regardless of the number of cars you usually wait 10 mins (even with only one 1 car in line).  My only wish is one day someone will complain loud enough we go from 10-15 mins down to 5-10 mins ‍
the slowest fast food ever. avoid at all costs. 1 hour waits in drive thru. not fast food, not 100% sure why it takes 30 min a car in their drive thru. needs better owners managment everything.

This is the WORST Taco Bell. I'm not even sure why it's still open. The service is horrible, I pulled up in the drive thru and I've literally been sitting here for 30 minutes all to get to the window and he tells me they don't have anything to eat except crunchy tacos. I don't even eat meat I was just gonna get cheese and jalapeño nachos . So I've been sitting here for no reason and I'm still sitting in line waiting just to pull out . Just close this Taco Bell down.

As far as Taco Bells go, this one I would have to rank this one at the bottom. Every time I come here the service is slow and it can be hard to even get any body to run the front register since I walk in and stand there for a few mins before any of the employees even sees me standing there. The dining area is usually dirty with food crumbs on all the tables and floor and because if that it makes it hard to find a place to sit. This location is also a place where homeless like to hang out. Ive seen many of them just sitting or even sleeping at the tables. If it wasnt for the convenient location Id go somewhere else.

This restaurant is so slow I don't bother going there anymore. Drive thru wait time is always greater than 10 mins, once I've waited 30 before just leaving without food. There's a KFC in both directions along the highway and a taco Bell 10 mins away. The drive there is shorter than the wait time at this store.
This place is always on point!!!! The staff does such a great job! They're super quick, the food is always fresh tasting, and they never forget anything. Best toco bell I've been to

It really sucks that it's good food in a pinch. But extremely unfortunate that my orders are literally NEVER DONE RIGHT. It's not just this specific location. I don't think people making the food read the screen for order specifics. And even then they still can't seem to get it right. I order the same thing most of the time. A shredded chicken burrito with extra avocado ranch sauce. Seems simple enough. And everytime they apparently think extra means none. I never get sauce on it. But tonight was the worst. I'm pretty sure they moved the quesarito recipe with a shredded chicken burrito recipe. Got no sauce and it was way to spicy and grilled? I'm so sick of having issues with something that seems extremely simple. Last time I called about my order being incorrect (extremely terrible). I picked up the food on the way out of town the closing manager literally laughed at me on the phone. And said there's nothing he can do about it now that I can't bring it back.  I'm hoping management and even ownership can fix these on going issues and I'm sure I'm not the only one.

This location closes earlier than their posted hours very frequently. Either that, or the workers inside won't take your order while you sit there at the menu. 

It's unfortunate because the previous staff working there were really cool and I always had pleasant interactions with them.

This Taco Bell location is the best one I have ever been to. The people who work there are happy to be there, even the manager. It is always clean, friendly and quick. 

I have been there many times as I live close, it is a refreshing change from KFc, Mcdonald's and subway. The only thing that ever happened to me was that when I went to order a fruitista one day that told me they did not have the correct cups for the slushy type beverage. It disappointed me because the paper & wax cup isn't lasting under the melting pressure of this usually frozen for hours drink. 

The second time I went to order a fruitista flavored POMOGRANTE STRAWBERRY, that was advertised on the drive through menu yet the customer service order taker was kind of rude when she told me you were no longer offering that kind anymore. She never offer me any other kind or explained why. It was strange.  I ended out just leaving without ordering anything due to this. 

Overall, I have to say great place, one bad experience with one person will not deture me from going. I hope they get there cup orders figured out soon as it is a new location so they are on a new curve as well.

It took 30 minutes for 3 plain tacos. I'll give them the benefit. They were maybe understaffed but watching them take about a minute to wrap the damn taco was making me mad. Hence why I'm writing this review

Paid extra to substitute beef with chicken. However, when I reached home and gave the item to family member, she bit into it and discovered it was beef. Had her very upset as beef is against her religion. 

When I called next day and was offered a coupon, and a refund. I did not care for this, but I asked for the system to be looked into and to ensure such things don't happen, as this is probably the third time they got my order wrong in the past year, and I don't visit here much. However, "manager" insists that she is trying to resolve the issue by offering my $3.80 back and coupons. No genuine apology or reassurance for future corrections. 

After requesting directly top speak to regional manager, and after some hesitation, gave me number of 508 339 6150. Called and left message, but no reply. 

I guess bottom line, beware they may screw up your order, so check it before you leave, if you can. And don't expect them to follow proper procedures as if they get orders wrong often, God only knows how many more "mistakes" they make behind the scenes.

You all know Taco Bell so I won't write a long review - I'll just praise them for offering a vegetarian menu , cheesey bean and rice burrito for 1$ can't be beat ( al fresco makes it vegan ) 
This location is nice , good service with a clean bathroom

My favorite Taco Bell in the area. I usually get the Power Bowl and typically feel like it is a rip off because they are extremely skimpy on the toppings, sometimes forget some, and the bowl is almost the same price as Chipotle. The last few times I have been getting the Shredded Chicken Burrito instead because of this. This location tends to make the Nacho Fries well when they are in-stock.

No point going inside to order, staff barely acknowledge walk ins nobody wears a name tag you have to order from kiosk self service which doesn't give you comment option to modify edit order items but you can edit it one by one with limited options. Sometimes staff forgets edited items from menu and give you default order from menu so you paid extra for chicken Crunchwrap but got a beef one.
Service is extremely slow. Waited in the drive through for 20 minutes with only a few cars ahead of me! Definitely not "fast" food

Dear Katie,

You have a wonderful staff. It's 3am in the morning and your sprinklers gave me an ice cold shower. I had a terrible time trying to order through the drive thru and kept having to close my window. Your staff was very patient with me but I dont think it's your intention to spray your customers with ice cold water every night. Your staff was very apologetic, so I hope something can be done. The sprinklers should water plants, not customers.

Thanks!

DO NOT COME HERE!!! I had an AWFUL experience here!! We went in to order line was extremely backed up (drive through full and inside packed...it was also 11:30 pm so I'm not sure why it was packed but it was) by the time we got our order it was 1:00 am and the order had been messed up several times. Obviously the management is terrible and the employees that I experienced had ZERO customer service. Overall I DO NOT recommend this location!!!
The staff is always nice, although everytime we order tacos we rarely get any cheese. The tacos would be alot better with more cheese

I came here for a quick bite with my husband since it was late at night and I really didn't feel like getting up to make something and I must say, never fire that Sean employee of yours! The service was impeccable and you could tell he truly cared about the customer's order which is rare nowadays especially when times are so tough. Luckily I have no complaints so please don't disappoint me in the future.
We ordered delivery via GrubHub and half the items were missing. I tried to call them, but they would not pick up. In the end, I had to talk to GrubHub to at least get a refund for the missing items.

The new renovations look amazing! It's Taco Bell! If you love their food, come here! I have come to this location at many different hours and never have I had bad service! Employees are always friendly with me.

This is the worst Taco Bell by far , DONT EAT HERE, Tykesha need to be reminded that without customers she won't  have a job.  Bad service , rude employees, the Haitian lady making the food never changed her gloves after she went to the back room a few times and came back out to make orders.  I wanted to walk back out the door but decided to get them the benefit and stay .  Never again !!!  Hand sanitizer dispenser empty , TP in the bathroom missing and it's only 10:30am. Coffee maker was not working and they screwed up my order! Crossed this restaurant off my list

No soap in any dispensers in the men's bathroom. Also want to add I waited 15 min for two burritos and this lady who was there before me was there waiting so long her and her daughter both asked a few times about their meal and got told to wait and they ended up just leaving without food or a refund
Absolutely ridiculous wait in the drive thru! I will never get stuck in the line again!
They are slow/inaccurate and never have good service through the drive through. I once waited 10 minutes for a single taco.
They have more people walking around then working.  Order delivery time is around 30 minutes

It's a taco bell so you don't expect the quality of food to be great. I go there cause my wife loves taco bell (I don't know why). If the service here was normal it would be 4 stars for me as a taco bell, but half the times I've been they might get something wrong (it's an adventure), a drink, some food item. It usually doesn't matter much to me because all the food at taco bell is the same quality to me (i.e. not good) so it's not like I'm ever craving something and missed out and as for drinks, we usually have drinks at home as they serve Pepsi products and it's not my first option. It's the closest one to me so I'll keep going when my wife wants taco bell. Perhaps in the future the service will get better.
Taco Bell is Taco Bell. Location is convenient and the nacho fries were well seasoned today- so happy they're back!

Tonight I went to T-Bell and when I got there, the line was pretty long and it went by pretty slow as well so that left me in a bad mood. However, when I got to the window, the woman was very kind and I got my order very quickly. This was surprising considering how long I waited but anyways, I headed home and ate my food. Let me just say that this was one the best T-Bell experiences I have had in a long time and I've had many of them. The food was fire and hit the spot, I feared that it wouldn't be warm but it was toasty and delicious when I ate it. Thanks for changing my mood tonight! Had to download yelp just to give this review because I was so pleased! Bless up

The first time i ate here i was sick as a dog the next day so I'm done. It was the only thing i ate that day. Yesterday my wife took my son there and he is sick now as well. Don't eat here and if you do I'd recommend steering clear of anything with meat

Not picky when it comes to my fast food or Taco Bell or even the customer service but went here last night and the two boy teenagers working there were so rude and purposefully messed with our order out of spite...it was unbelievable. First, we had a large order and they wouldn't split it, I'd understand if it was crazy busy but we were the only car in the drive through and just asked for it to be split in half. Then they gave us attitude for asking to split it. Then they messed with our order. They filled the entire bag half way with just sauce packets and left out half our food order. They still charged us for the whole order and didn't give us a receipt.

Slowest Taco Bell I have ever been to!  And they messed up our order.  Took 30 minutes just to get to drive thru window to order and then another 10 before they asked what I wanted.  Why might you ask did I stay in line?  I have no idea.  Maybe it was that I just left Disney and was used to waiting in lines all day.  Maybe I just wanted to see how long they would make someone wait.  It became a game and I was the loser.  I lost my time.  I lost my appetite.  And I lost my sanity once again on my day of leading my bratty kids around Disney.  Thanks Taco Bell.  But for anyone else reading this... do yourself a favor, and pass this TB.  Drive down the road to another one farther away from Disney.

I ordered a chicken chalupa with nacho cheese. Instead I got beef chalupa. It's good but wrong. And I waited in drive Thur for 20min at 3pm. Oh and the tacos were beyond sloppy note the receipt and grease.

Well I decided to try this place again. At least they got my order right this time but the service has gone so downhill in the last few years. The girl at the drive-thru window didn't even say one word to me. Gave me my food took my credit card handed it back and close the window. This happens all too often at this particular Taco Bell. If I was the owner or the manager I would get new staff. Horrible service.
Always friendly staff! View drive-through line sometimes as long but it does move quick, it appears the employees are doing their job efficiently! Have yet to have a bad order, keep it up Taco Bell!
In the area visiting for Christmas, this Taco Bell is really, really good unlike other locations that I have patronized. The food was fresh, service in the drive thru was efficient.

This Taco Bell is AMAZING. Rarely an item is forgotten, but when it is they make up for it big time. They forgot our Baja blast freeze and the manager called and apologized and replaced our entire order and gave us two Baja blast freezes to make up for it. They are definitely my favorite location so far!
fuck this taco bell. its actual bullshit. the staff flirted with me and the food was POORLY made. fuck this place.
this is the best taco bell i've been too in Atlanta! everytime i go they get my order right, fast service, and the food always tastes like it was just made. 10/10 recommend going to this location

We called ahead of time to see if they we're going to be open. When we got there a female stated "our system is down" All of the employees were in their cars smoking and hanging out in the parking lot.  I wonder if the system magically came back up when their smoke break was over.

I was very impressed with the service! The cashier and staff were friendly, chatty and quick. I went there around 11:00 and received my food only a few minutes after ordering. The burritos were delicious and the tacos were alright. Overall a really good experience!
Food was great and came out fast. We went through the drive-through after leaving universal and barely waited for our food and everything was right.
The people who work here are the rudest workers I have ever had to deal with in any line of customer service. Avoid this location at all costs, an embarrassment to Gahanna.

Straight up the best Taco Bell in Columbus and the only I ever go to. Even if there's a line, I know it's worth the wait. Everyone working is always the coolest too. Keep on crushing it and I appreciate you all

Usually fresh, but like damn how hard is it to make a supreme taco actually supreme? not a horrible establishment but it's irritating going 4 different times and paying for supreme tacos and they're not actually supreme...

This particular location has awful service! Super slow.  We wanted to avoid the drive thru because we've had a bad experience in the past, so we walked in. NO ONE acknowledged us for a full 5 minutes, so we walked out & got in the drive thru-chumps that we are!  Not a good decision!  Took about 15 minutes-not what I consider fast food.

Omg !  Worst mobile order experience I've had so far.  Took then over 15 minutes to make the mobile order, I watched and heard them talk about the mobile order, but then they never called my name.  I had to go to the counter and ask for my mobile order after I heard the manager tell someone to call out my name, yet they didn't....not sure what's going on, but don't come here if you're looking for a fast food experience.  It is a slow food Establishment.

Your inside service was so bad I left after paying for my order and went through the drive through. There are at least 8 high school kids that haven't gotten food and we're taking about being late to class because the wait was so long. The only reason you get 2 stars is Because of the kind older gentleman who handed me a cup while I was standing there for a drink. Lunchtime is not any time to be training anybody new if that was the reason. I got through the drive-through in three minutes. Bad just really bad today

Apparently it's closed now?!?? 
No warning but sign is gone and drive thru is blocked by a fence?!?

Can I give them zero Stars!
Waited in the drive up line which did not move for over 5-8 minutes backed out... when inside the store waited another five minutes to place my order! 
30 minutes for crappie tacos aka Mexican food.
you got to be f****** kidding me!
Never coming back!
This is the best tasting Taco Bell I've been too! Don't know why the reviews so bad. :(

Literally The Best Tacobell in the Beaverton area. I am a tacobell fiend, I eat it at least weekly and I wont apologize for that, its cheap, good & easy to make vegetarian. While this location was closed for renovations, I went to four other tacobell locations in the area trying to find good tacobell. Every single other location made errors on my orders, primarily adding meat to vegetarian items and the service was just bad. This location has never done that to me and they actually go above & beyond service wise! I usually place a mobile order for drive thru pickup and asked a few times in the past if they would seperate the vegetarian items & meat items (for the other members of my household) into seperate bags, they now do it without me even needing to ask anymore, I actually love these people.

would give 0 stars if i could. I was coming from Disney all excited craving some taco bell .. girl, my grandma works faster than them ... I also waited around 20 minutes to get my order taken, ended up having to go order on a kiosk, still took forever to give me my food.

Could not believe the wait. We only stayed because we were feeding a cheer team and it was the closest to them. It took over 45 minutes for food and waiting in line. The even had to close down heir drive them to get through the night.
Wish I could give 0 stars. Every single thing about my order was wrong. Ya got ears? Use em.

I rarely eat at Taco Bell. I know it's not authentic Mexican but some food is good but since I rarely eat at Taco Bell my favs get replaced often.
 Positives are clean place, food served hot. Negatives are no Dr. Pepper but many drink flavors that are not sold elsewhere which make it difficult for people with favorites they want. The menu looks big but most are usually the same food and toppings and offer little changes or options to add. Headquarters need to rethink it.
Employees are friendly and helpful.

After hours drive through is horrible!!!! Waited in line for over 40 mins!!! It's tacos and burritos....throw some meat, cheese and beans in it and wrap it up! Finally pulled up to the order window and I can hear the person laughing through the microphone.  Guess she thinks it's funny that people are sitting and waiting that long.  This will definitely earn a call/email to the CEO of Taco Bell.  Maybe then the franchise owner will wise up and check in on the night crew who are doing who knows what after hours!! Sure as hell isn't making food and waiting on customers.  Finally pulled up to the window for my order and the red head with countless tattoos just starts giggling (couldn't catch a name).  WTF?!?!!
This place is good if your on a budget and want something tasty and cheap. I usually get the chalupa and the bean burrito then i come on myself because that's what chalupas do to me.

Good as a taco bell can get! Craving Taco Bell since out of the States for a year. I ordered from the app ahead of time and chose to pick it up in the drive thru. I guess this is the only way to get a quesarito since they took it off the menu? Anyway, drove up to the drive thru and they delivered it out the window. Not a bad system, in my opinion. Will do it again if I am ever in the Taco Bell crave zone.

Just left there a bit ago. (About 45 min before closing time 4Am) Pulled up and there was a guy in front of me, waited about 5 min and didn't hear him ordering then I heard him said "hello" after a few more min at this point it's been like 12 mins since I arrived I don't even know how long he'd been there and two more people were behind me now. The guy finally drove off as did I and as I was pulling out another car drove in and went into the drive thru. I looked inside the store and it looked like no one was even there. This is not the first time this has happened it's actually close to damn near 7 times. Me and the guy in front of me both drove down the road to Mc. Donald's lol I'd say don't bother going there late nights.. they might as well close earlier. Sucks for a lot of people who go there though bc it's advertised as if it's open till 4 but the piece of shits working there leave early. I get it, it sucks but do your job at the very least

Drove through as required with the pandemic and ordered a chicken power bowl and drink. Got those items minus the sauce, fork or straw. I was going to walk in and get the missing items as it said take out, but only via walk up at the window. I called the store to tell them and was told I would have to get back in the long lunch line for those items. Not happy, but did so. I had a bag thrust at me with FIVE straws, an inch thick stack of napkins, and over three dozen sauce packets, but NO FORK. Because I was traveling I did not go through the line a third time and by the time I was able to get a fork from somewhere else, the food was pretty much inedible. The overly large amounts of the condiments I WAS given, was clearly a middle finger in my direction. As someone who worked at a Taco Bell as a teen, I know people make mistakes, but you then try harder to make it right; not figuratively flip them off with a huge bag of condiments that still was not right.
Is it me or just all fast foods are slow. And the line be wrapped around the building

They shoved a cold, unwrapped crunchwrap in the bag, sealed it and gave it to me.
I have a bag of mess.
They give it to you "sealed for your protection and you can't see what you got, and they can get away with this $%**!
I am not waiting another 30 minutes in line to return this bag of garbage.
Buyers beware.
For one it takes forever in the drive thru &2 they gave me the wrong food  I asked for burritos not tacos. I would not recommend

This place is well know for messing up orders but wow I think this will be our last time going to this location. They have messed up my order for the 3rd time in the last few weeks. I simply asked for "no cheese and sour cream" on my wife's tacos since she's lactose intolerant even specified "dairy free" twice into the mic and they still managed to fuck up our order. We received dry tacos with nothing but cheese/chicken inside (picture attached). Fucking seriously lol. This Taco Bell is the absolute worst and needs a complete management overhaul.

1 star considering I can't leave a review unless I leave atleast a single star. Took our order ahead of time before the speaker to "improve our times" yet the line took probably just as long as if they didn't, got up to the window asked for sauce was told it was in the bag already, it wasn't. Unfolded my burritos to each of them dry as hell no sauce, stuck to the paper as if they'd been sitting in a warmer all morning and just now served. Quesadilla wasn't even cut... cmoooon I just wanted a cheap tacobell meal and I couldn't even get that ughhh

I love this Taco Bell, have been going to this specific location for years! The only issue I've ever had with them was they forgot a straw once, but that's out of a crazy amount of orders.

I'm not sure why all these people are posting horrible reviews, but I've only had great experiences from this location. Currently eating an Uber eats order from there now.

Everything came hot, correct modifications, and with plenty of napkins.

Also- I provide ratings off an expectations based scale. I do not consider this a 5 star restaurant, but I do consider it a top notch Taco Bell.

I wish I could give zero stars. Just awful every time I have ever been to this location. I've never been here and waited less than 30 minutes. I won't be back, even though it's 2 minutes from my house. Get new management.

This particular location was awesome 4 or 5 years ago. Don't know if there was new management during this time, but for some reason the amount of protein they use now is pretty much half of what they used to. I ate what I got today because I was starving, but probably won't go here in the future. 
     On a positive note the staff is always friendly and really busts their asses through the drive thru. Sometimes almost too fast, because they frequently make small mistakes on tacos. I will eat almost anything, but my wife is very particular and won't even eat something if there is lettuce on it. Super disappointed. Gonna go to the Stoughton location the next time I crave tacos.

Just left this Taco Bell after picking up a 12 Taco Nacho Supreme pack. We got home and there was only 9 tacos. There were NO cars in the drive thru, two cars in the parking lot. What are they doing that they can't count to 12?
Served us well even during a pandemic. Patient with plenty of sauces/requests. Served us well when we needed them most. True American heroes.

Pulled through the drive thru 30 minutes before they closed, and they turned off their menu board. I pulled to the window and could visibly see employees inside hiding from me. Great customer service!!

I come through the Taco Bell a lot and every time I ask for sour cream there's always just a tiny bit in the very bottom of my burrito I asked the manager, Heather, kindly if 9 response to me was that they make burritos the way they make them and if I don't like it I can stop coming back to this Taco Bell or I can take my food away it's already made. She shut the window so I went inside and asked the rude managers name. The guy said "Heather" and she approached me and said "thank you leave now." I flipped her off and she said "fuck you too ". SERIOUSLY?   Its off Beaverton-Hillsdale Highway. Across the street from  Dollar Tree, next to a Key Bank.  I'm APPALLED. How Heather isn't a mother. I thought management was trained to deal with rude people and not to be very rude and unprofessional to people that are being kind.
