I've never reviewed a Taco Bell before but had the best service at the drive through and had to...Sean was so great and gave us really personable and friendly service, which is really rare during such a difficult time. We made a few changes to our order and he had no trouble adjusting it and confirming, which many drive throughs struggle with. The food was Taco Bell food so...you know. But the service was way above Taco Bell quality, I am so impressed and it made my night.

The time was neigh.

Just getting out of The Home Depot and it was time for whatever meal that is that toddlers eat between 2 and 4 PM after lunch but before dinner. The one that you'd try to skip and hold out for dinner if you knew it didn't mean your kid Jekylling out into a tiny a-hole like Gizmo in water. Fortunately there's a Taco Bell in the parking lot.

I know what you're thinking. I'd never give my 2 year old Taco Bell, but matters are pressing and exactly what could they do to a quesadilla? Don't answer that. This is a once every 6 month scenario. Don't judge me. Fine judge me, just know I've already judged you.

Roll up and wait for my turn at the speaker box and order one single quesadilla for us to split. Apparently there was a whole soccer team in the van in front of me. Kiddo's in the back seat still in full zen mode just content to be out of the house. I'm up in the front seat listening to the radio enjoying the personal space that an all legal 5 point physical restraint system offers to a parent and not having a literal finger in my eye every time I sit down while my child practices identifying body parts and stepping on my groin in order to reach.

I don't even know what happened. Time had obviously passed but I didn't feel like it was anything exceptional. There were two SUVs obviously ordering meals for the whole family in each, but I rolled up and they gave me the quesadilla for free because of the long wait. Pretty rad. My kid got his liquid cheese injection and I didn't even have to pay for it. We bypassed the whole tiny riot phase of the night.

I've been to this location dozens of times and the service has always been positive, but never enough so to justify a review. There you have it. You took the added initiative to look like you care, so here's your review! Crisis averted!
Always busy tip 5 bucks basket day to go and back n day they had 2:00am drive thru it's best and hope slot of times good comes out hot for customers one if my fav drive thru customers are good

I go inside to eat at this T.B. They have two dedicated food lines for making the food. One is for the drive-thru and the other line is for dine in. Had crappy food at the drive-thru once, but inside has always been okay. Much friendlier workers than the T.B. that's two miles north on 99 E.

Long lines. They hire nothing but ghetto ratchet people. When you pull up to the window all you see is employees yelling at each other and throwing temper tantrums like a bunch of babies. Avoid this Taco Bell at all cost.

Ate in (or tried to) for lunch today.  This Taco Bell was just recently remodeled, but cleanliness inside is obviously not a priority.  After ordering our food, my wife and I attempted to find a clean table.  Once we found one that was relatively clean, we sat down to eat, but were overwhelmed by a mildew smell that was either coming from the table or the floor.  After moving tables, it seems it was the floor that was the culprit.  It was so overwhelming that we decided to leave and take our food to go. 

Inside, the service was good, and the cashier was friendly.  I'm sure the drive thru would probably be fine, but I do appreciate fast food restaurants that at least make efforts to keep things clean in the dining area.

I ordered taco bell on a late monday afternoon through uber eats with the hopes of receiving my dietary restrictive taco bell order. i basically spent $20 for just tortilla. i am a vegan and requested extra potato's in my cheesy bean and rice burrito and got no extra potato. and for the spicy potato soft taco they added cheese when the request was for no cheese. the wait time was more than i expected and when i called taco bell to tell them that my order was wrong, the guy was very short with me and offered no refund. if you are vegan and enjoy potatoes i don't recommend coming to this taco bell.
Drive through only :-(( hey Taco Bell you think a lot of customers that come to Home Depot have lumber/pipe racks and/or trailers and can't fit through drive through??

Taco Bell simply is slop. Management whatever.  Terrible taste. Meager rations

How are they still in business

When I arrived to the restaurant the line was wrapped around the building but I had no problem patiently waiting in line for my order. Upon getting to the window I placed an order for two chicken quesadillas with a young lady over the speaker. Upon getting to the window I placed my card in Jamals hand and he gave me a total of $16. I asked him if that was for my order, the two quesadillas he paused. He then asked a young lady behind him if she had forgotten to ring up an order for two quesadillas, she stated no. He then stated that I need to get back in line and place my order again. At this time the line as still there wrapped around the building. I explained to him that with the line wrapped there was no way I would have cut in front of anyone. He proceeded to say he could not help me. When I asked to speak to a manager he stated I would have to call in the am. I asked for corporate # and he stated it was not available. 

I appreciate all the workers during this pandemic and never want to disrespect anyone but this was HORRIBLE customer service and I'm disgusted that someone who took my order didn't even put it into the system which led me to having to go to another restaurant

This is the worst T-Bell in Boulder by golly! My cheesy potato griller, which mind you is a nice mini burrito loaded with taters and cheese, at a very convenient price, was half the size it should have been with very uncooked potatoes, tasting as if they were fresh out the freezer :/  Then they gypped me on the nacho cheese sauce for my nacho fries, giving me less than half of the little cups worth, leaving me to eat most of my nacho fries without nacho sauce :( And finally my Cinnabon Delights were incredibly cold, more than they should have been despite me eatin em after those other pieces of waste. Warm sugary coated fried-dough balls, with that cool gooey filling might just be some of the most amazing things you will ever put in your mouth. My goodness, I could just about eat 30 of them if my stomach could go toe to toe with every single one of those delectable devils. T-Bell is where it's at when it comes to fantastic fast food, but oy vey my friend you should probably just avoid this particular one unless you don't care about your chalupas and gorrrrrrrrditas!
I absolutely love the staff and the food! Great service with fresh food. Much better then any Taco Bell in central Ohio

This location should be shut down. There are 4 other Taco Bell's in Boulder. Go to any others. Incompetent employees who mess up your order, make it poor quality, sexually harass you in the drive through, and steal your credit card! The drive Thur guy never gave me back my CC and I was too pissed off from being sexually harassed by him that I didn't notice until the next day...I called and told them to check their video cameras...I'm pretty sure he got fired but only to be replaced with other creepy rude guys...
They used to make fresh tacos, but lately my tacos are hard and doesn't feel fresh at all, also bad management service.  I have given them many chances but the food keeps tasting not fresh and hard.

Went here today right after 11am and got a few items to take home with the family. I opened the last burrito to eat and there were two bites taken out of the top already. This is insane... during COVID the highest safety measures should be in place. Either someone was eating and working and wrapped the wrong burrito, clearly incompetent or mad they work fast food and their life is going nowhere. Do not dine here. This surpasses dirty diners especially during an epidemic. If I could find out who it was they'd be in a world of hurt. Stay anonymous, degen.

This is a super busy location no matter what time you come drive thru and the inside is packed. So you just have to be patient with the service. Foods ok because its made in haste to serve everyone. But the best thing about this location has to be Ms. Danielle who is cheerful at any given time I have been here. She makes your day and I would order inside just so she can brighten your day.
Awful!! Just awful!!! Last time I went through the drive through I got such an attitude from the staff. The food was gross anyway, I don't think I'll be coming back

Cody provided superb service went there a few times.  Overall the food was fresh and the Mexican pizza shells were fresh, many times I've gone to a Taco Bell and the shell is stale over here the pizza shells were perfect.

I should has we listened to all the bad reviews!  We went to the drive through after leaving Disneyland and there were only a few cars ahead of us. little did we know,  we would still bee stuck waiting over 20 minutes. additionally,  the young lady taking orders and working cashier, Emelie, needs stone customer service training and was very rude.  for ordering meals for 4 people,  she was very stingy with the got sauce, like it was coming out of her paycheck every time she handed one out. lastly, their soda was flat and probably not well maintained.  DO NOT GO HERE.  THERE ARE OTHER OPTIONS OPEN LATE.  YOU'LL THANK ME AND SAVE YOURSELF A BAD EXPERIENCE
Went there Monday nite very good service and nice clean place to eat. The food there is really good

I love Taco Bell, but this location is awful. They filled my cup almost entirely with ice and barely any soda, they forgot two of my orders of nacho fries, and they gave me chips instead of cinnamon crisps. They really need to work on their fulfillment of drive through orders.

Isn't "fast food" supposed to be expedited quickly? You wouldn't know it here. 

Then my husband gets a sarcastic "Aw." from the girl behind the counter when he states he's waiting for our order. Poor thing. She clearly hates her life.

Do not go here. Constantly out of items and getting orders wrong. Tonight was the last straw when they gave me a crunchy taco when I ordered a cheesy gordita crunch. They charged me for the cheesy gordita crunch, too, which is nearly 3x the price of the item I received. I know it's fast food and I shouldn't expect much, but there is something about Taco Bell/KFCs in the area in general that is consistently bad because more often than not something goes wrong with my order. This location is so convenient to my school and I do enjoy me some Taco Bell,  but something's gotta change. I won't be returning.

Always come here after a bar round and the food is really good in comparison of what you pay!
The service is good and the workers are nice here.
Waited 30 minutes in the drive thru.  They have you trapped, so you can't leave. It truly was amazing.  Not even an apology. 30 MINUTES!!  No exaggeration at all

Lonnie is a cool guy. Took my order in the drive through and was nice enough that I wanted to leave a positive review in his name. I dunno, something about him made my 1am burrito less pitiful and more pleasant. 

Plus the food was super fast and tasty. I like this Taco Bell.
This Taco Bell is usually legit on it. If they're busy you have to check your shit though. They forgot one of our $1 potato tacos tonight and that sucks.
The evening drive through at this restaurant has the rudest employees I have ever encountered. They act as though you are bother to them.

Freaking taco bell man... I'm just saying don't advertise things that aren't actually available or on the menu.. TWICE!! OH YEAH and since "corporate controls the sign lighting like I was told by your first class employee" maybe turn the thing on during late night rush hour so your customers can actually see the menu..

Terrible service!  I've been here multiple times and the drive thru seems to always be slow.  Even when you get the chance to order there could be up to a minute to wait before someone asks for the order.  At least say I will be right with you to acknowledge the customers presence.

Once the food is ordered it takes several other minutes just to be served again.  By far the worst taco bell in the area.  As I'm sitting between the order station and pickup right now as I'm typing this.

UPDATE 5/13: There was only one car ahead of me in the drive thru but it took me twenty five minutes to get my food. I haven't had a problem like this since Dustin took over. Also, whoever made the meximelt made them wrong AGAIN. They're stuck to the wrapper. It's just a complete mess. I had to update my review and lower my star rating.

Taco Bell, on the whole, gets an average of three stars, because c'mon. It's not fine dining, but it's often a necessary evil. This particular location, however, has earned the nickname "Judgy Taco Bell" from my coworker and me. We tend to visit once every couple of weeks, and every time, we experience unusual levels of side-eye, incorrect orders, and/or weird offhand remarks about what we're getting. Just give me my burritos and hold the side of shade, please.

Dude. How the HELL do you run out of taco meat and beans at a taco bell...and then when I ask how long it will take the guy tells me 30 minutes like how dare I inconvenience or rush him..this place sucks.

It's edible, but it's not great. There's too many other fast food choices around here to put up with this mediocrity. There's even another Taco Bell within a mile! 

If I have to go to this Taco Bell, I have to remind myself to use the drive-thru. Why? The store is nasty-dirty! Yuck! And whatever you do...do not go into the bathroom (well, at least the men's room. I don't know about the lady's room :-))! 

I usually walk in to grab a quick bean burrito or a spicy chicken burrito and take off. It's not the worst Taco Bell I've ever seen, but it's close. If you decide to dine-in, bring some disinfectant. You're going to need it. 

Now, don't get me wrong. I've been a big Taco Bell supporter for years, but when I see a dirty one - people need to know about it. The food is definitely better than the environment in which it is consumed. But, one has to wonder about the kitchen. Is the food really that good? 

Buyer beware. There's a Wendy's, a Skyline Chili, a KFC, and an Arby's all within walking distance. I can only hope that the owner and managers clean up their act. Stoneridge deserves much better!

People .....This taco bell has very nice decoration inside and recently i was so happy that this place and the owner try very hard to keep customers happy and have fresh   food at the same time. 5 stars guys and keep up a good work.  )

The service here is much friendlier than other taco bell's i have been to, especially late at night. They always take forever to greet me at the window and bring me my food late at night, but at least it's always with a smile. I would just work on speed more than anything, they seem to be just strolling around late at night, not 100% focused on getting my meal out to me. But i get it. I've had taco bell's that are straight up rude late at night, but this one is not one of those.

At least the person who took my
Order was nice. Otherwise, there was lettuce and tomato in my cheese quesadilla--- yuk. And only 2 hot sauce packets. Come one.

I miss you, Taco Bell (or pile of rubble where Taco Bell was).  I can't wait until you're renovated.  Where else will I tipsily order cheap, shitty tacos late at night, mostly on weekends, but more often during the week than I care to admit?  Come back soon, friend.

Employees here are the best! We played a prank on our friend using the drive thru and the employees we asked to help us were totally down to clown with our dumb asses. good food, better ice cubes, best people!

Worst Taco Bell, no, worst customer service experience ever. The employees were hanging out outside with a line in the drive thru. When I finally got to order I had to repeat my order because they were not paying attention. I could hear them laughing in the background. Then when I got I food I asked for hot sauce. The employee gave me a weird look, I wasn't sure she heard me so I asked again, then with attitude she finally replies "I heard you the first time". Food was stale. DO NOT GO HERE. I disliked it so much I created a yelp account just to review this Taco Bell.

As far as Taco Bell's go...I've had better. Their food doesn't seem to stand out from all the other Taco Bells around. I used to live right down the street from this Taco Bell, so I used to frequent it quite a bit. I know, I know, aren't all Taco Bells the same? No, they're not. Just because it's a franchise, doesn't mean you'll get the same quality at each location. 

In their defense, I've had much worse at other Taco Bells nearby. I usually take advantage of the drive-thru, because I'm usually on the run. The dining room is nothing special. It's an older style Taco Bell which could use a slight facelift like most older stores. 

Is it clean? For the most part, yes. Is the service good? Good enough for me. Is it conveniently located? Yes. It's right off of Rt 161 on Sunbury Road, but it does not have an entrance that it directly connected to Sunbury Road anymore. They've widened Sunbury Road and blocked off the old entranceway so you have to drive past it to the next light north of 161. It's not that difficult, but it's definitely different.

All-in-all, I would eat here, but not if I had to. There's a McDonald's across the street.
Love this place! They are super fast and I seriously love Taco Bell! Also the Taco Bell breakfast is on point.

About once a year I come here, and I remember why it is only once a year.  I love Taco Bell as it is my $3  guilty pleasure but this one is awful.  Slow ...wait for it.... slow service makes this place unbearable.  It has not changed over the years.  Back in my college days, I came here more often than now and it was the same.  The workers either are always new or just hate their minimum wage job.  I would go the one on Cemetary (decent service) or West Broad (not sure of service) even though they are further way.

Maybe the Pizza Hut/Taco Bell is the cause for slowness.

It's Taco Bell. You pretty much know what you are getting here. I will say they have made my food correctly every time and the staff is always friendly.

I am glad they finally rebuilt this location.

To Taco Bell in general. Make bigger sauce packets PLEASE! Who uses just one? I use a ton of Fire Sauce.
Well o enjoyed the ppl that were working hard even tho there was just a few ppl they do the job

I recently went to this Taco Bell and it was decent...long line but they did a good job

They had this new taco called the Bacon Chicken Chalupa and it tasted great!

I ordered the XL Burrito combo from the Taco Bell app to save time (since there was a long line) 

The XL Burrito combo comes with a Doritos Loco Taco (of whichever flavor), a drink and the burrito for about $7 (which is average amount) but it was delicious. 

Now let's about the customer service/sales associate: no need for one since I used the Taco Bell app to purchase my food. There was one thing I would love to mention (the guy that gave me the order): He was EXCELLENT mannered and he was very nice! He kindly gave me the food in the bag and said "Have a great day sir" and I replied "Thank you sir."

Pulling up with only one car in the parking lot and the only visible employee locking doors I thought they were closed. So I decided to just drive through the drive through, howeve rthey were in fact open. Being the only guest I asked if I could order at the window.  They cashier said yes. He then said I had to drive around for their timers. As I was leaving I heard the other employees laughing. Once I pulled back up they were still laughing and making that offensive sound people make implying they think the person is retarded. I explained I didn't know the hours. The cashier walked out of sight said something to the other unseen employees and they merely laughed and continued making the sounds. Even still the food is really poorly made. I mean yes it's taco bell, but there is almost nothing in my burritos and it's not even folded closed right. I literally pulled over to download yelp to post this. I've come here twice since I recently moved.  First time food was terrible but they were busy so I passed over it. This time I will never come back to this store again, and with how rude and offensive the staff is I don't think anyone else should either.
I had Boss Nachos....It was hot and made right.....It is a great meal for under $7.00...The resturaunt was clean and service was friendly...I will be back.....

Not exactly sure what happened to his Taco Bell. It was pretty decent until maybe a year ago. Since then it's been a catastrophe of wrong orders, wrong prices charged, running out of key ingredients...like chicken or ground beef. Even rice once. Yea. And then there is revolving door of late night closure. You honestly never know when they are actually going to be open like their hours state or if they simply decided to close at 9 or 10pm for no listed reason. Just lights out.

This taco bell is usually very fast and very nice.

But today on this date I go through the drive thru and I'm waiting to order I finally get to order and for some reason I am stuck at the order place not moving I'm sitting there for like 15 mins. Finally I'm 2nd to the window about to pay and get my food.  Well the lady in front of me yells back at me and says "for some reason the lady at the drive thru window decides she wants to quit and walks off so we wait for about 25 mins.

One of my favorite fast food places.
Great variety. 
Great price.
Great option for vegetarians since you can substitute beans for meat.
Definitely one of the nicer T Bells but I almost always drive away with the order wrong. Make sure you check your food!
Never had any problems here. One time I had to wait a little long but nothing crazy. Food is always what I ordered and the employees are cool. Love the fiesta potatoes and Baja blast.
This people take forever to help you. Whoever is running the night shift needs to get written up if not fired.

Very decent Taco Bell, I never thought I would wind up writing out a yelp for T-Bell but I have eaten here a couple times and even being a Taco Bell snob and ordering specific things every time, they've never let me down or missed an order. 
Clean inside, nice staff, doesn't screw up, solid Taco Bell

Disappointed with this location. They were slow, my food fell apart, and there was a red-haired girl working checkout that had an attitude. I don't plan on returning, and from other reviewers feeling similar, I suggest we all don't come here.

So as I waited In line for 10mins for even a greeting (1st strike) then once I  ordered even thought the cashier was being over worked doing both drive through and walk ins ..as I observed with all the horseplay and lack of interest to get the customers In and out it should never take 15mins for a 2tacos (2nd strike) .  Ohh and by the way that order was wrong but that's ok..if that's how it's ran their. But for me it's unacceptable
  I'm here on vacation visiting family and just trying to get a quick bite...quick is not what happen!!  So as me and four other customers  wait . Young man walks up and see how I'm guess he's an employee but he walks up and says "I need a favor"  "Taco Time"and expectedly he gets his slurpy immediately..(3rd strike) as I'm in route to my hotel I take a bite of my Hard taco which has clearly been out  and stale I'm over eating at establishment. As I return and ask for a refund the shift manger disposition is rude and cares nothing about how  this establishment is ran or even perceived ..So in closing I WILL NEVER EAT AT THIS LOCATION !!!

This is one of the Best Taco Bells I've been to. Fast friendly service!!! Foods always fresh and hot. Dining rooms always clean and trash is never overflowing like you see in most restaurants. You can even see the work area and it's nice and clean. If not it will be they clean as they go here.
Try the breakfast menu. My favorites are the am crunchwrap with sausage and the flat bread sausage. I grab a coffee and hashbrown to go with my meal and i'm full. Price is very reasonable.
Sorry McDonalds but Taco Bells my favorite now.

Not sure what's up with the previous reviews. Maybe they've changed things around since then. My experience was that they were very clean, fast, efficient and more polite than any other Taco Bell I've been to.

Average Taco Bell. Great location very close to a lot of industrial parks. And close to 285. Food is your average Taco Bell fare. The place could use a good cleaning. I really like the lunch special #3 supreme gotdita yum.

Longest wait I have ever had in a drive through at a Taco Bell!  27 mins in the drive thru at 11pm!  The line was long...actually dozed off and was still in the same spot. Staff was very friendly though.  I am sure the line is due to the time and availability of open fast food at this time.
Instead of hitting the drive thru. Wifey an myself decided to go in an sit down an have lunch today glad that we did. Two thumbs up for the employees hospitality
It's one of the faster Taco Bells I've been to. The staff is always abnormally happy to be there. The Drive Thru gets long around lunchtime but it's still fast.

Would have been nice if they actually gave me my whole order. This place sucks. The staff are rude. I frequent Taco Bell restaurants on a regular basis and this one franchisee is an embarrassment to the chain. I suppose they earned at least the one star by remembering to unlock the door.

I'm only giving this 3 stars instead of 1 because after waiting nearly an eternity for food one night, a guy at the window (unsure if manager or not) was super friendly & personable. It helped ease my salty mood for having waited in the drive-though forever. Thing is, it's every time I go, not just that night.

Secondly, every single time I get something w tomatoes on it, they don't put them on. Every time my gf asks for no tomatoes, they put them on her's. Every. Single. Time. I think we're up to 5x now. We joke that we should switch it up to get what we want.

Minus a night of very bad cinnaballs, the food has been your average Taco Bell goodness.

Final closing thought: The fast food restaurants around here are all very sad. Not sure why everyone in the food industry here hates their lives.

I'm not a fast food fan at all, and I rarely eat fast food. Yesterday me and my friend were going back home and my friend wanted to eat something so he told me to pass him Taco Bell. I didn't order anything just my for my friend. While we got to the window and paid I was just curious about the cinnamon fried balls and I just asked the person in the window I believe his name is Thomas and without any noticed he brought me those sweets for me to try without charging me. 

I believe this is what called a loyal employee to any company.  It's not because of the free thing he gave me it's about the approaching and being good to the customers in a way that's convinced me to come back and do more business to this location.

I would say zero stars but that's not possible. This is the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to. We waited in line 41 mins with no way to get out of line the way the drive thru is built. Their were only five cars in front of us. The manager on duty should be fired.

Probably the most expensive place you can go to when it comes to fast food. $10 or more for ANY meal. But the quality is better and more consistent than any major fast food chain you can go to. So, you pay a premium. The drinks are bigger regardless of your size order. Who can say no to nacho cheese sauce though.

So Taco Bell is a Taco Bell, but this location has been very consistent with their service and food preparation with the orders that I have had.  Even with a longer drive thru line, I don't think I have ever waited more than 5 minutes to get my food.

Inside is kept clean and quick, friendly service.

Worst Taco Bell ever!!  In line for more than  40 mins!!!!!  Ridiculous!!!  Can't even leave line because I'm stuck in the middle.  In line next to Window and people inside have been in line forever too.  Seriously not fast food!  Car in front of me that is at the window just got a refill because he's been in line for so long.

I tried to eat here today for the "grand reopening".  I was the only person in the lobby and there were a couple cars in the drive through.  There was a manager with a mustache that was just kinda walking around.  There was a lady that said she would be right with me then got herself a drink then started talking to other employees.  After waiting about 3 minutes I just left.  I guess this is what is to be expected from taco Bell.

Every time I come here I am disappointed. I've tried to give them the benefit of the doubt but each time it's something different. The food is almost not edible it's usually burnt or not what I ordered. The customer service is awful as well.

Consistently the rudest people, the worst customer service, always gets the order wrong, and always a sprinkle of attitude even when you're the customer and trying to be nice!  This place is absolutely horrible.  Go to the Morse location, they have better employees.

As for fast food joint go, this TC has been consistent, fast and obv cheap. They had issues with their supply of essentials incl cheese but recently went through a massive renovation. Entire location got an upgrade sometime in September- looks super sleek and drive through driveway is leveled.

Don't eat meat so TC has the best options for me. I live in the value menu section lol. My one big tip: request to get your burritos grilled!

Just going to say that this is the worst Taco Bell I've ever been to, ever, like on planet earth.  They're always understaffed, and often out of basic items like "medium" Taco Bell hot sauce. If by chance they do get your order correct it will be soggy and disgusting. This place will make you want to "return to sender" your food items and throw a beverage in frustration.

Best I can give this place is a 2 star.  The last 4 times I have gone to order from thrm, they have either shorted me at least an item or made something not what I ordered.  The last time I went they actually handed me another person's order.  Reason I noticed before I drove away was that I ordered a pizza and there wasn't one in the order they handed me.

The food quality and taste always remains consistent.  Just wish management would instill better training to their employees.  I know they rotate faster than a merry-go-round, but other fast food location have thir affairs in order.

I'm only giving this 3 stars instead of 1 because after waiting nearly an eternity for food one night, a guy at the window (unsure if manager or not) was super friendly & personable. It helped ease my salty mood for having waited in the drive-though forever. Thing is, it's every time I go, not just that night.

Secondly, every single time I get something w tomatoes on it, they don't put them on. Every time my gf asks for no tomatoes, they put them on her's. Every. Single. Time. I think we're up to 5x now. We joke that we should switch it up to get what we want.

Minus a night of very bad cinnaballs, the food has been your average Taco Bell goodness.

Final closing thought: The fast food restaurants around here are all very sad. Not sure why everyone in the food industry here hates their lives.


Update many moons later:

This place continues to be the satan's asshole of the grandview area. Instead of a long wait (which I would've preferred compared to what happened this time around), the gf & I were met by a woman's voice in the drive thru. She got my order wrong on the screen probably 5x. I repeated myself probably 267x. It was so bad, I thought she was trolling me at first. Keep in mind I was annunciating & speaking loudly. She gave up after like the 6th repeat & some random dude came on & had no problem with me. When we got up to the window, the woman gave us our bag without saying a word the entire time. As she was handing me the receipt, my gf pulled out our food, all of which was leaking & smeared everywhere. But wait, this part is great. This girl actually, with a straight face, says to us, "on the back of the receipt is a survey, let me know how I did." *window closes* Hahaha what an absolute trashcan.

Clean place but the drive thru is a freaking wreck! Every time we get home we realize that either were missing food or the food given wasn't the correct one or that special instructions weren't follow on a certain platter. Service sucks!

Drive through lady literally always throws the bag of food at me, I have to catch it before it hits me in the face!

New experience today, same lady says to pull over that the fiesta potatoes will be ready in 3 minutes and she will bring it out to me. No parking spots available so I am awkwardly parked near the drive through window. 10 minutes pass and to my astonishment the lady is on her pink iPhone casually talking to somebody! So I went inside to make her job easier and she angrily tells me she said she'd be right out. 

The front counter lady gives me a bag with half of the items I ordered. Third times a charm after their third attempt all the correct food is in the bag.

It's a shame because Taco Bell is the only fast food I go for, and this being the only location, I've given up.  Better health decision (and peace of mind ever dealing with that drive thru again!)

If the franchise cares about their company on an individual store level, you guys need some serious work.

Judging by the previous comments it appears as though the company does not care about their sub par service. They really do make you feel like you're bothering them by being a customer.

*update there was spit on the two tacos that I asked them to make me that they forgot the first time. Time to talk to corporate!
Taco Amigo is far and away my favorite place to grab a quick lunch on 82nd drive!

To be honest, this is probably the worst restaurant in the area. 
First of all, the roadways to get into the parking areas are needlessly narrow, which is exacerbated by the road barriers that block how it was originally connected to Sunbury road. 
Second of all, the dining/waiting area feels like it was partway dismantled in a hurry a while ago in anticipation of renovations that never happened with mounting holes on a disused food tray holder and a ledge that looks as if it once had a decorative cactus planter on it. 
Third, the staff, while friendly enough, can often be a bit unprofessional. I once had the displeasure of a cashier mocking my admittedly bad handwriting. 
If things don't start improving, I may just start taking my family to Lo Mas Del Sol across the street, instead.

I actually legitimately love this Taco Bell. I go out of my way to avoid the Gladstone one that is closer to my home and go to this one. My order is always correct, the employees are (mostly) polite, and there's one employee in particular who apologized profusely for even the shortest of waits and often waives the cost of my beverage. I just went here for a drunk Taco Bell run (as a passenger!! :P) on a Friday night, and although there was a huge line, my order was still perfect. I've eaten a ton of Taco Bell in my life and this is definitely one of my favorite locations I've visited.

At a quarter past midnight I waited in a 20 minute long drive-thru line just to be told they weren't accepting credit cards at the moment, then I had to wait another 10 minutes until I could finally get out of the line!!! If I could give this zero stars I would. Horrible customer service.

Went in today and the person serving me (his name is shawn) did a poor job . Went with my girlfriend and she ordered a quesadilla while I ordered a combo deal for taco day . We got the quesadilla which was slightly burnt and I did not get my order because he wasn't paying attention. So I had to ask him again and he put it in the system and had to wait even longer . A total of 45mins to an hr . Slow service.... never coming back .
CHECK YOUR BAG!!! 9 times out of ten they screw my order up and my visits are few and far between.
Worst experience ever drive thru staff so rude. Made me feel like I was bothering them by being a customer. Won't make that mistake again.

1 star is too much for this place. I usually drive 3 miles PAST this one to the one in Tucker because this location is so bad.
-always dirty
-poor customer service by people who aren't skilled enough to scrub a toilet 
-always have some issue giving receipts 
-always a long wait even when they aren't busy 
FIRE THE RBTIRE STAFF OR SHUT THIS PLACE DOWN!
I went through the drive thru today, placed my order at 5:40. I was told to pull up... behind the car that had been sitting there.
My order:2 quesaritos and a chocked quesadilla. 

I wait over 20 minutes when a thug comes out with my food. I ask why it took over 20 minutes for such a simple order. He shrugs stupidly saying he just got here. I ask the managers name, he walks back inside.

I go back for my receipt, since it wasn't given to me by the manager.

The manager fakely says she is SO sorry,  she didn't realize I had waited so long. I ask for MY receipt,  and they hand me a receipt for someone else's cash order. 

PASS THIS PLACE UP! The franchise owner must not give a damn about their business or they would not employ rejects from the scum pile! I won't be back!
Super slow, and food was cold. Went around 9:00 (not too late) but was super unimpressed.

Cashier was fast and friendly. We asked the manager a question about our order and she came right out, with a smile, and assisted us quickly. I feel like they went above and beyond to make us feel like important, special customers.

Service took a very long time, We waited for a while before being helped, then sat at our table for awhile before the food was ready.. and the lighting was stressful. I prefer the old Taco Bell on 82nd.

Worst Taco Bell I have ever been to! I waited 45 minutes at the drive-thru, and it was a Tuesday night at 11:00. The manager was some A-hole from Joizee who was completely rude. What's more... They got my order completely wrong. When I informed Mr. Joizee about it, he actually argued with me. Never ever ever go to this hellhole no matter how desperate you are.

Sooo, on a whim, we decided to pick up a not so healthy quick dinner on our way home after purchasing a car. The kids saw the advertisement of Taco Bell's new caramel apple freeze.  Upon ordering, we were advised the machine was down. Why is it that every time we want a freeze, the machine is down? Anyways, we skipped the freeze and ordered a Crunchwrap supreme and chicken quesadilla.  Of course the kids devoured them.

Delicious food and nice people. The inside of the restaurant is clean. Order prep time is medium speed if you're eating in.

Yelp reviewers love to hate chain restaurants. It's a silly hipster "I'm not part of the establishment" culture on here. But let's be honest, if a Taco Bell is clean and makes a decent taco, you'll probably still eat there, despite your seathing prose-filled 1-star review.

I'm glad you "stick it to the man". Now grab your to-go bag of standard issue tacos and put your car in drive. There's a line waiting.
The kitchen staff was  the worst misbehaved group.very unprofessional this restaurant has gone down hill since the take over

This is literally the slowest Taco Bell I have ever visited. We're 20 minutes into this and still have 5 cars in front of us. There were only 7-8 when we pulled up. People are getting out of their cars and walking inside to complain. Horrible!

This fast food line makes me never want to spend my business at any Taco Bell ever again. Two meximelts is not worth waiting 20 minutes in line and upon reading other reviews this isn't the first time the line is like this. There were two cars ahead of us, 9PM at night, and I get to the window and my small order isn't ready. Bye bye Taco Bell
Found pubic hair inside my double decker taco. When I alarmed the manager she said , "SORRY"
This is the closest Taco Bell to my house and honestly it has always been super slow but I have just gotten use to it. OK tacos at good prices. ‍
My order has been incorrect the past three times. They need to hire better employees.

My review isn't on the food because it's Taco Bell. My review is on the slowest drive thru on the planet! There is always a line 8 cars deep and it could take up to 30 minutes to even get to the window. I don't understand.
Tried to close 30 minutes before actual closing time. Couldn't make a Crunchwrap supreme, went to McDonald's instead. Damn.
Plans is filthy   Rude service.  Always out of something. Drink station is nasty as is counter.  Beware

I came here on my way from the airport and being hungry a craving for taco bell came out. The service was quick and fast and barley had to wait to get my food.

The food was good and fresh and delicious but Taco Bell is not always like that everywhere you go and not always healthy for you but once In a while don't hurt.
The best Taco Bell I have ever been to. Very clean and the workers here are very nice and friendly...I love going here

This is the worst Taco Bell location for drive thru service. I have literally sat for 20 minutes and more through the drive-through every time I have come to this location. If you come after the 2 AM hour expect to wait at least 1/2 hour for service. This location is absolutely horrible with the service times for the drive through window at all times during the day I have never spent less than 15 minutes waiting for service here. This evening I brought my concerns to their attention at the drive-through window and the service attendant at the window literally shut the window on me. I said "oh ok, shut the window.." then she opens it and says "we're behind.." and shuts the window again.. don't come here, and if you do, please let them know how horribly slow their service/employees are! After the 10th time of this I felt it necessary to post this review.. wake up!

This is the absolute WORST Taco Bell I've ever been to. The past two times they got our order horribly wrong, even though we used the app and they knew AHEAD of time what to make. This time is the last straw. Found a LONG BLACK HAIR in my food. It was absolutely disgusting. Paid almost $6 and have a damn hair in it. The one in San Marcos, who has only students working there, gives better customer service and quality than this place does. The manager should be fired and the workers either need to be fired or trained better. It's obvious this isn't the only bad experience. Absolutely horrible.

As Taco Bells go, this is a good location. Midnight order, cashier was very friendly. Food came out great, pico was fresh, came with good amount of cheese. Drive thru menu is a bit far away from the speaker, think i needa Yelp a Lasik eye surgeon.
For some reason I am always excited to go through the drive through. Love the grilled stuffed burritos but this time it's an encharito

My husband and I stopped in for a light dinner.  We entered and found the place disgustingly filthy with absolutely no one bothering to sweep floors, wipe down tables, pick up garbage around the condiment table and the soda fountain machines had ice everywhere, including melting on the floor.  We stayed (which was stupid) and ate in.  There was no one in line, few people in the restaurant area, one employee on her cellphone with her child walking around the place.  The food was good, but the filth around us detracted us from the food.

Ever since the new manager Dustin took over service and food quality has greatly improved. The drive thru line moves fast, the food taste fresh and the employees are really friendly. The only complaint I have is the last two visits they have been out of Mountain Dew. Other than that I have nothing negative to say. If you have been purposely avoiding this location, I'd give them another try. I'm glad I did.

As Taco Bells go, this place is doing it right! Most locations try to skimp on the toppings, or serve you lukewarm food. This taco was fresh, hot, and bursting with meat and toppings. I wish this location were closer to home.

I only go to this location if I'm working during their business hours. They always forget items and screw my orders up. Once I was the only one who placed an order for the longest time and another woman came in and made this large order and she was done before me and out the door. Really like wtf man.

I normally don't write about chains since I'm sure everyone knows the quality of the food and the kind of service there is. HOWEVER, try the drive-thru in the late night. 2 out of 3 times, we've gotten this really funny guy that makes my night every time. He's super funny, speaks to us with different accents, tells us our total in pesos. This guy makes the most of the boring night and I really appreciate it!
Employees are too slow and doesn't even know how to take order. DO NOT GO TO THIS TACO BELL.

Hey, it's Taco Bell.

This location has recently gone under a face-lift of sorts and I gotta admit that for the 1 or 2 times a year I eat Taco Bell, it's a lot more pleasant to be in than an old ugly Taco Bell.  

Did you know they have salsa verde packets now? I didn't. I dug 'em. The guy at the counter was real nice even though we were a bit tipsy. 

We skipped all the way home with our $12 bag of gold. See you again next year, TB.

Absolutely the worst restaurant experience in the last 25 years and we eat out twice a day or more.  Food took 26 minutes to get and then the order was wrong and they were not even busy.  Took 5 minutes just to get them to acknowledge that I was standing in front of them asking for the rest of my order.
Worst place in the earth. We stood in line for about 5 minutes before the even realized we were standing in line. People saw us and didn't even say nothing at all. I will never come back here again!
Horrible service. Very rude employees that run the drive thru, especially the women. They need a lesson on good customer service (and I work in customer service myself). Would give them 0 stars.

Usually have a decent experience at this location. Don't have too complicated of an order, but it typically has a 50/50 chance of coming out right. The only plus side is that the employees are usually really nice and will apologize and correct your order. I just wish it was right the first go-around.

Typically the food always comes out tasting fresh too, and I've maybe only ever had one issue the multiple times I've been here. Overall, it's a pretty good experience, just be prepared to wait a while if there's a long line in the drive-thru.

I love tacobell anyways. And there are some good some bad and some gems. This tacobell is a gem. I'm on the lowcarb diet and thus order everything with no bun or wrap. They are the first tacobell to pretty up my "tacos" so they didnt look like sad slop. They were appetizing and the rest of my service was wonderful.

Yup. Back again, even though I know better, lol. Ordered the "$5" cravings box. Employee taking the order was pleasant. Whoever put the order together apparently was not. Clearly asked for no beans on the burrito supreme, it listed it on the screen and the receipt. Driving down the road we looked in the bag and saw no chips for the nachos. Since the building was closed at that point we could have driven back and waited in line with 3 cars for...15-20 minutes. No thanks. And when we got home I made it through 1/3 of the burrito supreme and then bit into a mouthful of beans. Spit it out and threw out the burrito. My dog wouldn't even touch it. And there was a nice skunk slinking up and down the hill next to the drive through screen/display.

Whoa! 
Super great customer service! 
I was blown away! 

Never have I experienced such an unexpected thing! I was greeted so pleasantly, served quickly and sent off with a smile! 

Will forever love & be drawn to this location for my awesome experience!

Horrible customer service! The drive-thru takes forever! It seriously never gets any better no matter what day/time. I've gone at 4pm, as well as 2am and they are just as horrible. Also, some of the workers there smell really really bad. It smells so bad that when they open the drive-thru window to give us our food, you could smell the lady's horrible body odor. It seemed like she hadn't showered in weeks! 

If you go, plan on being in line for at least 10 minutes, even if there is no one ahead of you. 

I've been to many other Taco Bell's, not embarrassed about that, but this one is the worst Taco Bell there is. I don't understand how workers can be so incompetent. I also don't understand how they can be so slow!!

I came there tonight in order to get some food after getting off work. I was told the computer system was down and it would take ten minutes to reboot. When I told the gentleman I would wait he seemed off out and tried to tell me how long it was going to be again. Then I said, "Can you take cash?" He replied "I don't know let me ask my manager."

Female voice gets on says she is on the phone with the help desk and it's going to take 30 mins. I asked her if she would take cash and she said the tolls won't open. 

1. All tills have manual keys.
2. Stop being lazy. You decided to not serve a customer because it would inconvenience you to do the math. 
3. I would just rather you say you don't wanna serve me, than lie to me. 

I'm only posting this for the owners benefit. You should know that your employees are not representing your brand correctly.

Went to this place over the weekend. They totally got my order wrong. Came back tonight Just a little after 8:00. The doors are locked. Drive-through is backed up like crazy. No way I'm going through and waiting. I pulled around and saw the same one guy working when I looked through the windows trying to dine in. This place is going downhill fast.
After a cross country flight, Taco Bell for the win! Nice and pleasant window attendant got our order in correct and fast. It's midnight too! Hit the spot before a long ride home.

Is it just me or have a lot of the fast food that used to taste great is going downhill? I feel as if the taco meat at Taco Bell has suddenly become watery, making it impossible to make it through your three taco meal before the third one is wet and seriously waaaayyy disgusting. I'm already eating pure trash I would prefer it to not be watery pure trash, thank you very much. 
Also why oh why are the taco shells stale the majority of the time now? What's going on here guys? Can you not figure out a way to keep the shells crispy and the meat non- watery..? In particular since I'm paying almost two bucks a piece for this. I literally can go to Chipotle, spend half the amount and get at least a passable facsimile of actual food fit for human consumption. 
I realize all of your employees ap partly hate their jobs but can't we figure something out guys? 
Bueller..? Bueller...? Bueller...............???

Food was fresh and pretty good but the drive-thru customer service was horrible and it took about five minutes to get our order together, ordered 3 nacho cheeses, only received 1, and didn't get 1 item of our order of 8 items. Will not be visiting this location again. Avoid at all costs, go to Sunbury Plaza Taco Bell near Harry Buffalo instead!!

Good food for the occasional junk fanatic. The people that work here are very fun, have great personalities, and are helpful. My order has been messed up probably 3/10 times so I have to go back to get it fixed. I do recommend the Starburst frozen drink SO GOOD.

Have to agree with most of the others, the "employees" simply do not care about the business, now that is to be expected in a fast food joint but you would figure there would be a manager or someone on duty who does care.  I have seen the ads on TV for Taco Bell's new breakfast, they finally got me interested enough to give it a try, or so I thought.  I didn't know the menu so I went inside, only person in there, no cars at the drive thru either.  I waited 10 minutes; 5 minutes AFTER the second of two "employees" saw me and then did their best to avoid eye contact so they didn't have to get off their lazy butts to help a customer.  I left without anyone acknowledging I was even there.  Obviously ongoing issue, if the employees care so little about a customer who can see them imagine what they do to the food when the customer cannot see them.  I would be very afraid to eat the food from this Taco Bell given the attitude of their staff.
I just got a bag of chip crumbs for my nachos. The drive-thru obviously, I'm sure they wouldn't have had the nerve to serve them in store. On second thought...
I thought this was a typical Taco Bell. Clean, fast and efficient. I didn't see any of the issues with some of the other reviews

This location is very busy and we found out why 
They are not stingy with the ingredients. Everything was fresh and the new grilled chicken quesadilla is pretty delicious
I'm definitely getting that again 
Unfortunately this location is a bit to far for me to come to a on a weekly bases. Oh well!
Great place to stop if you're traveling north or south on Interstate 95.
No stars. Had a late night meal and found what appeared to be a worm. They killed my love affair with Taco Bell.

The store has received a revamp/refresh on its model. I still do not believe I would come here even though it is the closest Taco Bell to my house. You can still see how dirty the kitchen area is, and the lobby/tables are more spacious but the quality of food remains the same. I can get better Taco bell by driving ten miles away and I'll probably continue to do so.

I've been to this Taco Bell a few times through the drive through. The customer serivce is pretty good from what I've experienced. Never gotten a wrong order. Not too much more to be said about a Taco Bell. hehe!

This is one of the worst Taco Bells I have ever been to.

1 - We ordered the #3 crunchy SUPREME taco combo and it didn't have any sour cream or the tomatoes. 

2 - Then the tacos were at the bottom of the bag, CRUSHED by 4 other burritos stacked on top of them.

3 - The tacos were crushed, greasy and the shell stuck to the paper. I had to eat them in a bowl. 

I would love to post pictures, but yelp doesn't allow them with reviews.
Terrible service, constantly screwing up orders. You're better off going to the Morse Rd. location.

Worst Taco Bell experience ever! Lunch rush and one person working the counter. Drive thru backed around the building and the workers are dancing and jacking around while Making the food. We waited 15 min for an easy order! Terrible service

Taco bell always hits the spot. This location was in top of it. Food was warm and good and the lady in the drive thru was the bomb. Everything came out right and it was a good night. Thanks taco bell!!
I ordered 9 tacos. First they gave me the wrong bag. Then they gave me six tacos and 3 were upside down. If you order anything, it's 50/50 they get it half right. Terrible.

I chose to go to the drive thru for my late night snack.  Surprisingly, the line was long even at 11pm and I had to repeat my order several times to the cashier before she got it correctly written on the order screen.  The food was usual Taco Bell flavor and quality- nothing noteworthy, but at least my order came out correct, which is rare for my visits to Taco Bell.

I wish I could give this place 0 stars. 

The staff (I know it's fast food) is horrible! They talk bad about the drive thru customers as the sit in customers can hear them. They also yell at each other (very loud). This visit was my 3rd and it will be my last. 

They have no - I mean NO customer service. And coming from the fast food industry it really makes me mad for the fact that they cant even smile. Nothing in that place is good except the fact that it's Taco Bell and you can't really f that up.

Probably the worst fast food place I have ever been when it comes to getting the order right. Every time I've been except the very last one, they have screwed up the order. Giving me the wrong type of meat in a burrito, the wrong order, not knowing what a grilled stuft burrito is that is on their own menu, and VERY long wait times has been my experiences in a nutshell.

This place needs to get their act together.
So I wanted something quick and easy to eat while driving n this is what I got!! Thanks Taco Bell for wasting my time n $$$.

This is not the best place to come to if you're on a schedule. My friend ordered before I did, but was served 10 minutes after I was. Otherwise, this location usually fills orders accurately and at the right temperature. If they could streamline their service times they'll be great.

The total reconstructive surgery this location received (because it's not a facelift when they completely demolish the original building) has made this the best looking Taco Bell I've ever been to. The service is a little better now too, actually. Maybe they hired new staff?

I'm rating this based on the service at this location because let's face it, fast food can only go so far. This one of the best Taco Bells I've ever been to. I usually only go after work around 9 pm or later at night, so it could be different another part of the day but the service, accuracy of orders, and timeliness are always spot on when I go. They are always friendly and I've never had a wrong order here.
Beats my record for longest fast food wait every time I visit. Seriously, why is this Taco Bell soooooo slow?

I come for quesalupa which is Great with chicken with queso in the shell it's worth but it does take time for food to come out, they should hire more people if they need more man power to get the food out. The cashier is polite but i feel bad for them because they are short staff.

Worst customer service ever. We just came from there and went through the drive-thru. The guy taking the order was rude and seemed aggravated. Everything looked correct on the screen so when we got home I was missing an item, a burrito that wasn't supposed to have onions had a onions loaded in it and my husbands burrito was falling apart in half. It's not even worth talking or going back to that establishment for more food or for them to fix their mistakes. Poor lack of customer service, poor work ethics, poor place to call themselves an establishment with those people who work there. Absolutely ridiculous.
They have old tasting food and I got little to no beef in my taco. Was horrible. The soda wasn't even worth drinking.

I like this Taco Bell. Quick drive thru, my order is alway correct which I love. It's clean and open really late. The food is nice and hot when I order and the service quality is great. For Taco Bell this place is pretty good compared to a lot of the other ones I've been to in the area this is my favorite one.

Stopped by for a late dinner,approximately mid night. They were out of 2 of the menu items our party wanted to order. Than when we got back to the hotel to eat, the order was wrong. On top of that, the ingredients they made the wrong menu items with were wrong also! Pretty bad!!
I really can't recommend this Taco Bell, I would say keep driving to someplace else.
Ate there Wednesday about noon. (2 crunchy Taco's with hot sauce) Was sick, vommitting, gas by 3pm and was still nauseous Thursday. Recovering now, but still shy of food.
The food was okay... taco little watery tho

I've been twice now, both drive through. The first time, I got home and they hadn't closed the lid on the cheese sauce from the nachos, had just thrown it in the bag, so half of it was on the inside of the bag. 

This visit, I got 2 cheesy gordita crunches and nachos and cheese. The cheese didn't spill this time, which is good, because they barely filled the thing halfway. One of my tacos had a minuscule amount of meat on it (see picture). I barely tasted it as I ate

They need to shape up their consistency on things
Don't do drive thru. Staff sucks had to go back through twice to get proper order. Do wendys instead.

It's a Taco Bell, obviously it's not going to be fine dining. This Taco Bell doesn't skimp on the portions and always greets me very joyfully and nicely. The other night, I had a particularly nice guy help me at the drivethru and made me smile. I've never had a fast food employee be so enthusiastic and nice. Definitely the best Taco Bell in the area.

I've only been at the drive-thru so I can't speak for the inside, but the drive-thru seems to be brand new and kept in good order. Bonus points for the overhang at the ordering speaker so you don't get wet when it's raining! As for the food, they have never messed up my order, which I think says a lot for a fast-food joint!
Don't order the taco salad.  The shell is fried in old oil.

I had my servant pick me up two beefy furito burritos with sour cream. Once he arrived home I began to eat them and I realized there was no sour cream. I paid 90 extra cents for the sour cream and there was none. Usually I wouldn't Yelp Taco Bell but they're always fucking up and I'm tired of it. If they didn't fuck up and actually gave me sour cream it'd be one little squirt on one end of the burrito. I WANT SOUR CREAM ALL OVER MY FUCKING BURRITO. this is ridiculous, they're always fucking something up and if they aren't it's poor quality food. Now for the good part, my mom ordered a 7 layer burrito and they gave us 8 layers, guess what the eighth layer was? It was piece of scotch tape about 3in long, fucking ridiculous. I wish you could give negative stars cause you would be getting the max. Next time you guys fuck up, all my food is going back and I won't be handing it to you, you'll get a face full of it.

The drive thru sucks! It is so incredibly slow it's not even worth it!!! I actually got behind a n SUV that placed their order then drive up to pay, 10 min later the guy orders something else while still waiting on his food. I was so pissed for having sat there so long I yelled at the poor kid working the drive thru. I ask myself every time I go there if they are butchering the cow in the back to get the beef for the tacos! That's how long you will sit in this drive thru!!!! So bring a good book next time you want to run for the border!!

Great people here and very friendly. Breakfast was poor and it took forever to make it.  The only reason I'm writing a review is because of the staff.  Typically I do not write reviews of fast food places unless they are particularly bad or good.  Normally the food all tastes the same.

However this staff was great.  And the breakfast is NOT great.

Taco Bell. I have such a love/hate relationship with this place.
This particular location is in desperate need of an update. The inside of the restaurant looks like something from the 90's. Ever seen Good Burger? The inside of this place reminds me of Mondo Burger from that movie. On top of that, it's dirty inside, and there are tables with chairs missing. 
The staff of this location is usually pretty nice and easy to get along with. I think there have only been one or two times that we have had an issue with staff.
The biggest issue is their drive thru. OMG WHY DOES THEIR DRIVE THRU TAKE FOREVER?!?! I just don't get it. I have been to other Taco Bells who have had long drive thru lines and have never waited nearly as long in the drive thru as I do here.
We also noticed that some of their food costs more than at other locations. I'm probably going to avoid this location from now on and start going to the one close to Easton. That Drive thru...
I ordered the Doritos locos meal and got all regular hard tacos..... Not ever worth the 1 star....

On Sept 10th, around 4:30 we went through the drive-thru. The girl taking the orders was slurring her words and couldn't get the order right. She had to clear the screen 3 different times, we tried ordering a fourth time and she still kept screwing it up. Finally we gave up and went elsewhere.
I don't know if the girl was having a stroke, or she was under the influence of something, but Management should ensure the people they put on the registers are lucid and able to preform their assigned duties.
How difficult is it to punch in 3 bean burritos, 1 black bean burrito, 2 apple empandas? Instead she kept puttiing 4 of one thing, 2 of something else, and then items we didn't even ask for. And she kept doing that.

we stopped here on the way back home, it took them more than 30 minutes. our tacos were poorly wrapped.. all of our food was falling out all over the place, they missed several items! definitely need new staff. IF I COULD GIVE THEM 0 STARS I WOULD.

Ordered the Chalupa. My first time having one. It was better than others expected. I always go for the crunch wrap supreme but my decision didn't steer me wrong. 
Con: a little less ice in drinks.

I went here late one night, like always. I was thrown off by the how their parking lot was set up and went in the wrong enterence for the drive-through...that was embarassing and dangerous. I had to turn around without getting hit before pulling around the corner to finally find the drive through window. I ordered 2 doritto tacos, a borrito, and a quesidilla and before I could order the drinks he told me to pull around. Jerk. Ok so I pulled up and got my stuff..he ended up charging me for 3 tacos but I didnt complain since theyre only $1 anyway and the husband was very hungry. 

The food was good, nothing wrong there. The 3 stars are manly for the way the lot & window are set up and because the guy messed up. I was very clear with my order, and he even read it back to me, but oh well, things happen. I was more upset that he was rude and didnt wait to figure out we were thirsty too. Why order dinner without drinks?? Tacos are salty...surely he knew that since he worked there. Whatever. No 4 stars from me today...sorry.
Some how the last 2 times coming to this location in drive thru they got the order wrong. I guess it's my fault for not checking my order when leaving drive thru.

This place used to be great for those late nights... My last experience wasn't so great. I can recall ordering a $5 box with a Spicy Triple Double Crunch Wrap w/ guacamole (which by the way implies 6 layers, but I won't get into that) a Supreme Spicy Doritos Locos Taco and a Supreme Soft Taco. I get home and they gave me a a regular Crunch Wrap and no guac and a Crunchy Taco that was stale and wasn't even supreme. I called them and they told me that they would replace my order next time I come through, I just have to "show them the receipt" and "ask for Nate." So, another day I go through to get my replacement order and I get to the pay window and ask for Nate and hand them the receipt. Meanwhile, I have a friend in the car with me and he made a separate order. The lady at the drive-thru was very rude. She proceeded to tell me that nobody named Nate works there and that the address on the receipt was to a different store (which was a lie, because I double checked the address on my phone.) and she gave me "my order." She also said, "we'll be nice this time. But this is the wrong store." I left confused and when my friend and I got home we opened our bags and the tacos and everything were just thrown in the bag, even his order! There was spit in his Nachos! None of the Tacos were wrapped and it wasn't even all there, no Crunch Wrap! I had to choose my battles and decided to just never go there again. I should probably call corporate and OSHA and shut that place down.

Below average. The last time I ate here, I felt like I was doing serious damage to my body. I felt like I was eating garbage- and I actually did go through a dumpster diving "freegan" phase where I scavenged food from dumpsters behind grocery stores and ate it. I felt better about doing that than I do about the bodily sensations which followed me consuming the goey blobs of excess cheese sauce dumped into tortillas that they try to pass off as burritos here. It was sour cream on top of too much low quality cheese. cheesus. Anyway, so I haven't patronaged this place since, but I rolled through the drive thru last week. To get my boyfriend that new taco which has chicken as a shell. Because he's really into food that has been advertised to him on TV commercials. And he liked it a lot. So they should get credit for successfully executing a brand-new and probably high demand item.

It's had its decent moments but on two separate occasions I walked there for lunch and nobody was at the counter and after five minutes of just standing there I gave up and left. Not sure why I let that happen more than once. Oh, there's also the time I got food poisoning and spent the night in the hospital. That was pretty great. Haven't been back in the year or so since that happened, so maybe since that time they've hired competent people. Guess I'm just not willing to risk it.
To be fair - I've only been here around breakfast. Not Taco Bells specialty. But it took us 30 minutes to place and receive our breakfast order. The only people in line.

I would give it a zero if i could. After numerous tries this place needs to just close. Multiple trips have proven the incompetence. Missing items, pay for an extra side of sour cream or cheese to find out the container is almost empty, cold food when it is supposed to be hot, hot salads, wilting lettuce, order steak get chicken, eat your food vomit the rest of the night. To top it off they really don't care. No more for me, its not a bad manager or employee, no one was just having an off day, it wasnt a truck was late so they ran out of supplies. Just go to the Morse road location down the road or the schrock road location.

Horrible. Always crave tacos and Mexican food. People who work their don't care about their jobs or customers. Had it last week and actually woke up with food poisoning. Crappy service by crappy people.

I was so surprised when I walked into this Taco Bell... I was greeted, and with a smile!

My experiences with Taco Bell is usually mediocre. It's a fast food joint so expect to be in and out. But this certain Taco Bell surprised me... the staff was actually really nice. ALL of the staff, including the girl who brought my food to the front for me. Not a fake nice, but a genuine niceness.

The food still is regular TB food. The beef is whatever. It's good when you are in need of quick food.  I'm still blown away at the friendliness of the staff.

I recently ordered the "Grilled Stuft Nacho Box" for $5.99.  It also came with a burrito supreme, taco, & a drink. I DID NOT LIKE THE GRILLED STUFT NACHO AT ALL!!  It had a funky taste.  I was expecting something like the Crunchwrap Supreme which I enjoy... this thing was nothing like that.  Just as well, because it's only available for a "limited time" .  The guy at the register didn't have much of a personality, but he did his job... but, what was really odd, the short woman that delivers your meal to the counter was very surly to everyone.  There was no reason for her to sling attitude to the customers, but she was definitely not in a good mood & was taking it out on the customers...  However, I go to Taco Bell for their food, not for their employees.  Have you tried their great green sauce "Verde Salsa"?!   It's Yummy!  There's also a limited Pizza Hut menu.

Personal freundlich, preislich gut .
Geschmacklich nicht meins aber aus dem Grund muss ich es nicht abwerten, da alles voll zu unsere Zufriedenheit war .

For the most part I have disliked Taco bell because living in NY the quality was always poor. But I own a place down in Winter park and we tried this place out one night after arriving on a late flight from NY. This Taco Bell Has changed the way I feel about them. I had the Cantina bowl and Cinna swirls and I must admit that I was surprised at how good it was. They are Open late and the drive thru was on point. No complaint so far! Try them out if you ever in the area.
Just cause, Its alright for fake mexican food. Its good for late night last minute food.
The longest fast food line that I've been in. Every time I go it takes a good 10-15 minutes to get through the drive thru.

I go here all the time & I know it's a risk. Sometimes they close earlier than their posted hours & sometimes they get your order wrong.
Tonight i ordered the $5 cravings deal& they didn't ask me if I wanted any sauce, did not greet me& did not provide me with cinnamon twists. I lost my receipt to take the survey that is provided, but I figured I would be satisfied enough with this review.

While it's important when mgt & corporate big wigs come in to scope the place out.... What's MORE IMPORTANT is actually paying attention & serving the customers that walk in the door. At 3:25 today walked in the door looking to spend some money on some Tacos, walked in the door, stood in from of the register to place an order, and acknowledged my presence or even took my order. Tooo busy showing the mgt that had come in the place. Quick formula: No Service = No Money = Bad Yelp Reviews = Less money = Job Loss & Store going under.

Longest line and VERY bad quality food even for fast food. Gave them two chances because of location and soft tacos were soggy with grease because they sit so long. Nasty. Driving the extra ten min for orange city or other taco bell for our cheat meals

We didn't want to deal with thinking about what was for dinner. We picked up Taco Bell on a Tuesday night around 7:00pm. I went the drive thru. The girl on the speaker and window was friendly. I ordered 6 items and only one of them was incorrect. I guess that is kind of a win. We got a ton of sauce so I wasn't too annoyed about it. The food was the average caliber for Taco Bell.
They have the Pizza Hut logo on the sign and also on the building, yet they've discontinued selling any Pizza Hut products.
Awesome restaurant at a great location. Close to the home where I grew up, so this Taco Bell will always have a sentimental value to me. They are continuing to put out great food, so I love them.

Earlier today we went through the drive thru and accidentally received a similar, but different order. We didn't realize this until we got home. When we called the restaurant, the manager asked how he could make it right. When we returned to redeem his offer, the next manager looked up his notes and quickly took care of us. It's great to see people take pride in their job and take care of their guests!

Horrible service, cashier appears completely out of it.

Waited well over 30 minutes for horribly prepared

" fast food " 

The place was full of customers waiting and complaining.

Employees argumentative with guests and the soda machines were empty!! How bad can one place get!!

STAY AWAY!!

I have no idea why this Taco Bell has such low reviews. I go here more regularly than I care to admit and they are always attentive and enthusiastic. Hands down the best drive thru customer service I've seen!

Beware of price hikes.  I love Taco Bell, but I will not support this franchise nor the sister store in Cocoa, due to the fact that the franchisee has higher prices than any other Taco Bell in the area.  For example the $5 box as advertised on TV is actually $5.49.  Plus every normal menu item is also .10 higher across the board.  Why???

Im giving this 4 stars ONLY because I like one of the new products, the smothered burrito.  I never thought Id give Taco Bell 4 stars, but in Atlanta most all Mexican places are terrible, I mean really BAD.  I spent over 30 years in border states and what they serve here is just plain garbage in most places.  This smothered burrito is accepted, so here that rates 4 stars!!!
Im so happy to finally see a burrito that is served with red sauce and melted cheese on top and still is tasty.  Still though it doesn't compare to what you can get in other states, but it is way above much else in town and this is just a taco bell. 

   You can get this same burrito at ANY taco bell now. The enchirido was eliminated and this was brought in after as a semi replacement. Its larger though, and more expensive of course. 

  One odd thing here was I was the only one in the restaurant. I didn't realize it was in a bag. The gal just sat it there quietly and let me stand around. I found that odd. I was at the next nearest taco bell today and the gal who makes them again I realized couldn't speak any English.  So maybe that was it, they can be quite shy. Many of the taco bells around here are a bit dysfunctional.  Still though I will go back for this burrito!  :)

This Taco Bell just opened this week. It's smaller then I expected it to be. It's nicely dedicated in simplistic modern furniture. The service was good and the food was hot and fast. As Taco Bells go this is a good one.

This is by far the worst Taco Bell in north Atlanta. It always closes early and by early I mean, 11:30 at night even though they are supposed to be open until 1am. This time was the last though. They always mess up my order at this one. If I order and pay for a taco supreme, half the time I get a regular taco. Tonight I was craving a bean burrito, so I went to Taco Bell near me. I needed more than just a bean burrito, so I ordered some cool ranch tacos. I get home and there are no napkins, no sauce, just the food. I eat the tacos, which are both in broken shells with a gallon of sour cream. It was like eating sour cream in a shell. I get to my burrito and it looks old! I go to my fridge for hotsauce. I always keep a supply for such situations. I open up the burrito and it is swimming in onions. My one request when I ordered was no onions!!! It was repeated back to me! I have 3 options, drive back, don't eat what I paid for and remain hungry or pick the onions out. I try to pick the onions out, but am left with almost no beans when I finish. From the moment I start picking out onions, the beans aren't even lukewarm. I finally eat it and still
Found an onion in the almost empty tortilla and it is as cold as if it had been in the fridge. This location should close down because they are horrible. Go to the one on north Druid hills if you want good and accurate food from Taco Bell!

We all love Taco Bell. 
As Brits we are used to burgers for fast food but the crispy tacos are amazing.  
Great service.  
Low prices.  
Delicious!

Not sure what is going on at this place. 15 mins to get food @ 2 pm on a Tuesday?  You have employees w/ serious attitudes that are trading food over the counter for candy bars from some guy with a cooler that filled himself up on ice @ the beverage station. He got his food in about 3 minutes! Very strange...not sure this is what the franchise owner is going for but hope they figure it out.

I wish I can put in no stars because that is what this place deserves. we pulled up to the drive-through and the lady asked us "what do we want". I ordered a Chalupa and that shit was so oily. Cinnabons were so hard on the outside like they were like cold then refried to get it it was just an awful experience
