You're better off getting your tacos from Wendy's across the street. They keep messing up and we keep trying with them. We finally gave up. Management doesn't even apologize or try to fix the problem

Oh Taco Bell. My car has graced your drive thru many a 2 AM's. 

When the bars close your drive thru line is insane. But drunk people play games like Chinese fire drill, blast ghetto music and dance in the parking lot. It is almost like an impromptu block party.

Your window servers are always friendly and always greet with a, "Hi! How are you?" and are very rarely sour.

I regret you in the mornings, but we will forever remain friends of the night.
Love Taco bell because it's fast and cheap! Where else can you get an entree, drink and side for less than $3!

This place is an absolute joke. I have never been to a location... Any location, gas station, fast food restaurant, rest stop, DMV... That cared less about the human beings that enter it's facility or pull up to the window. I have literally never had an order right at this location. I live close so I've tried a few times just to see, or cuz it's late. My orders aren't hard, and I know it's not because someone pulled out of the drive-through line or that they mixed up the orders. They also make you wait...like, pull up in front of the drive thru and wait cuz your bean burrito needs another 12 minutes to cook. They are sort of in the vein of correct, and then you open it and it's very very wrong. You'll be missing items, they will be out of something so they swap it for something completely different, i.e. instead of cinnamon twists, here's a taco. After 9 o'clock they are generally "out of things". Literally all sorts of things, Mountain Dew, beef, cheese, any desserts. The sad part is I tried to go to the connected KFC here once at a normal time like 6:30 PM and even that took about 45 minutes to give me the wrong order in another 15 minutes to get my money back cuz I had had it. Other patrons were laughing at how much of a joke this places and simultaneously vowed not to come back as well. Worth the drive to the other closest Taco Bell or anything else
Like my tip states, this Taco Bell will mess your order up 90% of the time!  That's a promise.

Im really tired of going to these fast food places and getting the wrong order.  I pretty sure fresco means, no cheese... and what did i get on my 3 fresco bean burritos???   Im just gonna stop complaining about this crap and cook at home.  Bye

This Taco Bell is great! SUPER FRIENDLY and FAST service. The staff is upbeat, motivated, and they really seemed to work as a team. Food was piping hot and the restaurant was very clean. It is out of my normal way, but I will definitely be back!
Service sucks they mess up your orders absolutely horrible costumer service not happy and coming from a mañana get that deals with ove 1000 customer a day need to step up there service

My son and I went here tonight for dinner.  Now I know that I'm a little old but not that old but the prices are very high.  But why are there prices more than the one on Washington here in Titusville I feel that it would be better for me to drive to the one on Washington than go to this one on Columbia.  The food really isn't all that either I guess that's why I really don't eat Mexican food that much.  To messy and to expensive especially at this Taco Bell.  That's the one on Columbia across the street from Walmart where you can see the homeless people holding there signs.  I guess that's why it makes sense to go to a high society Taco Bell .  To much money for me and really its not that good really

Samantha was so helpful! I called and spoke with her on the phone. Love the customer service here at Taco Bell I cant emphasis it enough!!! Everyone was very kind and sweet. I will be back! Delicious tacos and good people. Thank you so much Samantha!!

This location is very convenient to my house and work and I'm glad of that and also close to highway 285.
I gave the restaurant 3 stars because it still need a little clean up. But!! I can say they have improved tremendously on their customer service and quick service compared to back in the days "GOSH"!

Longest drive thru I've ever been in! Girl taking our order/money was so friendly. Food was fresh and hot. Drove right up and picked up food. Wish all Taco Bell's were like this! Don't eat fast food often but I'd come back here.

Eventhough it's an old Taco Bell, the service and staff are polite, however they have a huge hole in drive thru.. if you go there, make sure you stay close to the round yellow concrete barrier to your left, otherwise you will fall in that big a** hole. It bit me in the a** once but I know now how to enter drive thru without sinking. Lol

It's hit or miss with customer service, and tonight it was really great; girl at the drive-thru was really friendly. I went around 6:30, there was no line and received my order right after she handed back my credit card. 
For the reviewer complaining about the line after 11, there's ALWAYS a line that late! A lot of people from the Disney area go there after work.

At 6:45pm on a Thursday we decided to dine In at this Taco Bell. Speed of service was really slow. The crew was going as fast as they could... but looks like they were short staffed. Try hiring a few more people Taco Bell. Great Job team! Keep it up.
Service has improved ever since they rebuilt the place. I have had very nice interactions with the customer service although they do not get my order right most of the time! Read the screen!
Gary is incredible! Made me laugh in the middle of a super stressful day. Never thought a drive thru experience could be so awesome!

Maybe it's because I'm used to Taco Bell locations that are just horrible, but this location is really good. I've had breakfast here a few times as well as taken dinner to go and I have zero complaints about service or cleanliness. The staff has been very friendly each and every time; something that I could never say about the other locations I've been to. 

The food? Well we all know what Taco Bell is; if it's something you aren't a fan of then chances are you wont be reading about Taco Bell on Yelp.
Horrible service, very slow, the workers don't care and they suffer so repercussions for shotty work. The food is always stale as hell stale torrtilias and hard, dry beans in the burritos
Ran out of beef? How does that happen at 7pm? Also, since I had to order chicken, they charged me extra $3 Not right.
Horrible place they gave me slop after I heard the gentlemen in the kitchen yelling and complaining about customers. I received slop from this place

Today my Taco Bell experience was the best it has ever been. Michael is the best cashier I have ever had the pleasure of ordering from. He was enthusiastic, professional and makes me want to return to this location.

I really appreciate how this Taco Bell doesn't give a single care what you order. They will throw whatever is available into your bag and expect you to not notice. And the genius thing is, since you already waited so long for your food, you've already lost any fire you have inside of you to complain and get what you paid for. Also I don't think this Taco Bell knows what supreme tacos are. The multiple times I have ordered Locos Tacos supreme I have never once received that delicious sour cream on my taco. You really gotta hand it to this establishment that they put 0 effort into giving the customer a satisfactory experience. Also, I'll speak for my vegan friend. You cannot eat here if you have any dietary restrictions. They will not accommodate. I don't know, maybe their KFC side is better, I haven't tried it. I assume it's just as bad.

The people at this Taco Bell are amazing. I've never met an unfriendly or unhappy person while there. Thank you Taco Bell employees for always giving me my nacho supreme with a smile and positive attitude! You are appreciated!

Not sure who actually reads a review for Taco Bell but here's my experience: I drive past a different Taco Bell on my way home from my second job, and even though it's right on the way home it sucks so I avoid it. I drive out of my way to go to this location. I don't go to Taco Bell because I want to, but more because I just worked a long day and don't have any options at home. Drove in at 10:40 on a Monday night and was told it would be 15 minutes because they were doing a shift change. I used to work in food service for 10 plus years so I'm very understanding. However I wasn't even offered an apology , and was told to move to the parking lot and wait. Will not be back here again.
Slow. Messes up orders all the time. The worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. And that's saying something...
Ummm...  We were asked to back up to the yellow pole in the drive-thru to wait for our order....  This is the first time that we've been asked to do this. Don't be surprised if it happens to u too

Yuck. I don't know if it's just this Taco Bell or what but this place has gone downhill FAST! The quality is disgusting, not that TB was all that great to begin with, but now it's not even edible! I'm gonna pretend, from now on, that there is no Taco Bell in buda so I never make the mistake of going here again.
Worst boss nachos ever! Absolutely terrible music playing so loud inside made for a horrible dining experience, not to mention the rude staff. What happened to the Taco Bell I used to know?

This taco bell is CONSISTENTLY terrible and has been since at least 2010. Unfortunately it is the only taco bell around. The kfc side NEVER has chicken ready and when I try to order grilled they say it will be 18 minutes. The taco bell side is no better as they get my order wrong EVERY time. There has NEVER been a moment when I drove off pleased without having to go inside to correct my order.  On top of all of this, service is still ridiculously slow.

This particular instance I ordered a chicken nugget go-cup and got strips. I also asked for a grilled stuft burrito (among other items) and specifically asked for no avacado twice and got home to find plenty slathered on. The cashier also asked me what sauce twice and I told her "plenty of Fire please",which was pointless as I discovered 3 hots. I tried to call to speak with a manager but the number only goes to a fax. And at this point I doubt it would matter, for a restaurant to be this bad for this long I'm sure the manager is no good.  Just go to the Moes across the street.

Completely fed up.

Stay away! This place has 1 person working the drive thru and the counter. She takes the orders and dispatches the food to both. We were on a line inside for about 5 minutes behind other patrons with no one at the counter before we left empty handed. The girl was at the drive thru register and there was only one person at the kitchen. This is the TacoBell right by the airport.
So I ordered 2 combo meals and ask for "a bunch of mild sauce". For my 2 meals I get 4 packets of mild sauce. I'm convinced their employees work on Commission of snuffing packets of hot sauce.

This was one of the old, original design Taco Bells. The inside was dingy and the employees were usually rude. The food was your usual TBell fare. Recently I drove by and saw that it was closed. There was a sign that said it was closed due to sewer problems (ew). I drove by a few days later and the building was demolished. It's going to be rebuilt.

This is the worst Taco Bell in the city of Portland. 
Always slow. Always out of extra large cups. The beef is always very greasy.
Consistently one of the worst Taco Bell's I've ever been to. Sitting in the drive thru for 30+ minutes is absolutely unacceptable. Especially when I ordered via the app.

This Taco Bell as well as the Taco Bell on 161 have the slowest drive thru's I've ever experienced ever in my life. Ever. I asked for 6 soft tacos with no lettuce and cinnamon twists. What I got was 6 soft tacos, all with lettuce, one with a piece of potato in it and one with a piece of bacon in it. It wasn't worth it. But then again, it's Taco Bell, so what was I expecting? Does their corporate even care that they have shitty locations?

Everytime I go here there is an issue. If the order isn't wrong then the customer service is bad. I had my order taken by Bianca and not only was she rude with confidence but when I pulled up to get my order her and another guy who gave me my order continued to take about the customers behind me. Just extremely unprofessional. I know you work at taco bell but there must be standards to the point where you at least pretend to care about your job in front of the customer.

Well for a taco bell this one is okay I guess. I have never had any problems with my food but I do not suggest you eat it there. The floors and tables are always dirty. There has never been a time when I walked in (mostly after 6 on a weekday) and there was not a puddle of soda on the floor in front of the machine. I have never had my order messed up but I have seen others upset that their orders were not right and missing items.
Not so good but super fast services. Food was very dry and tasteless, save your money and go anywhere else.

Food is great, but the customer service unfortunately is lacking. The gentleman operating the drive thru had zero personality and honestly didn't seem to care if the order was taken properly. He was too busy when we got to the window talking  to other employees that we didn't get a "hello, how are you?" Or even a "thank you"...

About a year ago this location was exceptional. Nowadays, it's just a sub-standard fast food place. The last 2 times I have been here it has been dreadful. If it's not the quality of food, it's the speed of the service. I spent 12-13 min in the drive through. It wasn't even busy either. Not acceptable, but I've learned not to come here anymore. It's unfortunate because I love burritos.

Service was fast. Food was evenly distributed, warm, good and Mexican!
Awesome Taco Bell!

This Taco Bell rules!! Yes, I understand, it's Taco Bell but this one has always had the best service. They will give me as much sauce as I want. They will make drinks the way I like them, with less ice and more drink, when I request. I've never had my order messed up. And they're always nice! That's saying a lot about a fast food drive through.

I really enjoy this Taco Bell!! It is usually clean and I've only had to wait a few times when I go there.  The food is as to be expected.  The fruitistas are AMAZING and the machine is always working as far as I'm aware.  

I was originally going to give them three stars, but then remembered they have a bike rack, so they get an extra star. There are too many fast food places in this area without bike racks and it is really frustrating when you are biking!  In all honesty, I would probably give them five stars except that every time I have ordered their cinnamon twists they just taste old, like the oil in the fryer needs to be changed or something.  They just don't taste good. I'm guessing it's the oil because a brother-in-law of mine works at a Taco Bell (in Alaska) and they had this problem until they changed the oil, he said.  

The service has been good each time I have gone and the tables have been cleaned! It's a nice Taco Bell, over all! I enjoy it!

Omg!!! Just got some fast food from taco bell that I brought home and as I'm looking through my bag I noticed that they gave me among my condiments a peppermint and a moist towelette! Totally awesome and not expected from taco bell. All smiles over here

As far as I'm concerned, this is the absolute best Taco Bell on the face of this planet. They hook up you up super fat with the sauces. Are super kind and helpful when it comes to ordering (made suggestions for my lady's vegetarian Crunchwrap which she loved). Great attitude and I love when the cashier says "have a blast" upon handing me my super crispy cold Baja blast. The best. Hands down.

We eat here every now and then since it's the closest one to where we live. We ordered some of the new Grillers tonight. Two of them weren't the right ones so we took them back to exchange. The cashier told us they could remake them for us and never asked for the other ones back but we would of gave them back anyway when the fresh correct ones were ready. We waited 20 minutes and went back to the counter. They forgot about it and never started on remaking them. She offered us potato wedges in exchange so we took it. I don't want this to be a bad review cause it was 1 out of many times we've been there. By the way, they remodeled the dining area and it looks good except it mirrors the new McDonald's on Buford Hwy & McElroy Rd. There was a lady that kept complaining it was cold in there. I didn't realize it for a while but she was right. It was freezing in there. She asked to speak to a manager about turning the heat up but she didn't get any answers.

Slow as molasses...it took 5 minutes before anyone came to the counter at breakfast time. Breakfast choice s are pretty good but the coffee is bland.  The taco bell in huntington station NY, where I usually go, is so much more efficient. Skip this one

I've been going to this one for years, since I used to live up that way.  Then Sweetie worked not too far away, and now we still take our cars to Firestone and have other reasons to be up here sometimes.  

I don't remember any bad experiences.  I do remember stopping in after work when they started doing late night hours, and once coming on a time-change night when they had to work an extra hour- they were still friendly and fast.

This time, I needed a snack.  Parking is okay- the lot is rough, but I'm not sure it's actually theirs.  There's always a line at the drive-through.  I went inside, and it was clean and mostly empty.  Service was friendly, and fast.  I had a steak quesarito.  You know, Taco Bell is kind of a guilty pleasure; I do like it once in awhile.  There's not much to it.  Various combinations of meat, cheese, beans, tortillas... This was tender steak in cheesy sauce, in a tortilla.  Hot, mildly flavorful, and satisfying.  

Hey, it's cheap, fast, and filling.  Sometimes, that's what you need.  It's not health food.  It's not fine dining.

To be honest...I freakin' LOVE Taco Bell! It's one of my guilty pleasures. Not being able to decide what I wanted for lunch one day, I decided to go through the drive-thru here and get something real quick. The girl at the window was very sweet and acted like she really cared about her job and making my "drive-thru experience" a good one. 

I know it's Taco Bell we're talking about here....but I've been to some places where when you open up your taco or burrito, it looks like it had been stomped on a few times. Not THIS place! I got a few tacos and a couple of burritos....and don't ya know, they looked just like the pictures. Not only that, but the burritos were nicely wrapped (and didn't have sauce leaking out of the bottom). The tacos were crisp, had plenty of cheese on them and the lettuce was still chilled. Nom nom!!!! The shell wasn't cracked, soggy, or leaking oily meat....(which would've leaked out of my pores later). 

Everything was great and I'll definitely be back to this one!! 

Kudos!

James gave my family the best and friendliest service while in Florida. He made the experience great. He shook my hand and made my family feel welcome. He took our order, made the order, and offered a small sample of an orange slushie at our table then returned to taking orders. He is a customer service machine. Will return just to feel so welcome again. He is clearly a great asset to the business.

I shall not patronize you by saying "It's Taco Bell, what else do you expect?" because you clearly already know that. But as a paying customer you are allowed to expect your order to be timely, correct and made in a clean environment. 
While our orders have been correct or quickly corrected if something was accidently left out (always check), they can be a tad slow. My main concern is how messy the dinning and pop areas have gotten. Nothing makes me question sanitary conditions like trash and food strewn about.
Might just have to move to the Morse/Easton location.
Missing items ordered and horrible assembly of the food ordered. Better to come earlier in the day.

One star is being too generous... i wish i saw the reviews before coming here... i literally sat in the drive through line for over 20 minutes and that was JUST TO PLACE MY ORDER... not to mention having to wait another 10-15 mins for them to bring me my food... seems like no one here has any customer service skills whatsoever... one girl just stood at the window having a good time laughing with other employees instead of actually doing work and helping customers.  Then i finally get my food and all it is is lettuce and tomatoes literally no meat at all.   Wont be returning again until they hire new employees and figure out how to make the items they sell.

When this location first opened, the customer service was amazing. Now after a few months, the service has declined drastically. The girl taking our order took forever putting in our order and it was still wrong. It seemed as though they kept messing up peoples' orders because others were complaining as well. It doesn't seem like anyone cares here.
This location has the worse service, you can't even order food without being over charge and then yelled at for catching there mistake
Service was slow and we had mold on our Tortillas. Skip the fast (not) food and visit Chuy's or On the Border down the way for better quality and service.

I would like to echo the many other reviews here. This Taco Bell location consistently gets orders wrong. Sometimes multiple times. I understand mistakes happen, but it's to the point where I am actually surprised if they DO get my order right. Orders also take a long time to receive, and sometimes I wait at the counter for a couple minutes before anyone even tries to take my order. I think management should invest in better training for the staff and hold the store to the standards I'm sure are set in their franchise agreement.

You had two jobs and failed at both. One, charged me the wrong price and two to get my order correct. Charged $2 too much and asked why the extra charge...response "oh, that's what the register say." Well, not what the sign says...still no refund. Lastly, no lettuce or tomato on my tacos, as I'm allergic. Confirmed special order, receipt shows special request...guess what I found on tacos when I got home...lettuce and tomato. Tried to call them to let them know...no one picks up phone. I will now finally fill out that survey on the receipt. Terrible!

We were the last car of the night and the staff was by far the best customer service I have had at any fast food restaurant ever. After our experience I wonder what this location did to turn this it's guest service... Whatever it is, it worked!

Late night employees were incredibly rude via drive thru. Told us we couldn't order food over $20 and gave us attitude the entire time. Unacceptable, everyone has a bad night but this is a repeated problem.
Pretty much what you expect from a Taco Bell. I had soft tacos and they were good. I did order a Pepsi but they were out so I had to opt for a Dr. Pepper.

If I could give zero stars, I would. I ordered a tostada without tomatoes and got tomatoes, I ordered a bean and cheese burrito without onions and got onions and no cheese barely any beans, I ordered tacos with tomatoes and got no tomatoes. To top it off when I poured out the chips for my nachos all I got was pieces. I went through the drive thru so I was very upset when I got home and had to deal with this-never again.

Taco Bell is pretty good when I go normally. I don't really have to wait but it does get really annoying when you have to repeat your order because your server wasn't listening but...it's normally a quiet place to eat and enjoy your food.
Wow I just waited what seemed like an eternity for a couple tacos!  This is fast food?  Go to Chipotle across the road and you'll get your food faster and fresher.

Horrible customer service!  Came here the other day the line was unreal. I placed my order it felt like the line didn't move come to find out their short staffed. So after waiting on a ridiculous line I got to listen to the drive thru employee sing to me, act like an idiot and held my bags up to his chest like they were breasts!! Real mature!!!!!!! And my order was wrong!!!!!!!! WTF
It taste ok but my cholupa taste weird and it took a long time to get food. Having fun

Do not go here late night. Like, after the bars late-night.

It's not the drunk crowd that's the issue. They're there, sure. But it's the older post-college drunk crowd that's semi-embarrassed to be eating Taco Bell or just keeping to their group talking about the night. The issue is the workers and the lack of organization. I know that has to be a shitty thing, serving so many glassy-eyed stumblers, but you work at TACO BELL. The company you work for ADVERTISES "Fourth-Meal" aka drunk food. 

To be fair, no one was mean or rude. But everyone looked exhausted and annoyed - it was so unorganized, they were running out of everything and people were waiting over an hour for food. I wanted to leave, but my out of town friend apparently NEEDED her quesadilla. 

There's a "cop" on duty who was just kind of standing around.

If you're hungry at 2am go somewhere else. You'll be sober before you get a taco.

I know this is just a fast food restaurant but there are still expectations. I went in tonight and bought a bunch of food for a bunch of family members over at my house. I spent a lot of money there. When I came in at first there were already two people waiting to have their order taken, everyone was just walking by basically ignoring them while carrying on with their own personal conversations. None of us were told "I'll be with you in a moment" or anything along those lines, just blatantly ignored. After literally 5 minutes of waiting to have orders taken someone comes out of what I assume was the office and takes the people first in lines order. 

I was next, I ordered my food. The woman (manager) was a little gruff and short with me but nothing terrible. It was nothing compared to the personal conversations that were going on for the whole place to hear. Workers openly flirting with each other, being inappropriate, talking about hooking up with each other etc. if it was slow I could understand but the conversations they were openly having for all to hear while it was so busy was pretty unprofessional and trashy. Not one worker was kind either so that made it so much worse. They all seemed annoyed or bothered that they had to help us. Ive worked in this industry for a long time and I have never acted like that. Totally gross.

I usually give good reviews taking into account location and my expectation.  What should you  expect from a Taco Bell.  A lot more than this one.  I walked in with 2 customers in front of me and knew I would not have a problem with time because I was on my way to work.  All of a sudden the cashier yells out loud "I'm not taking orders because I did not count my drawer".  I am not sure if she was yelling at us, or at the fellow employees.  She then stormed off towards the back.  As a another employee comes out and shrugs his shoulders I asked if somebody would be taking orders because I have to get to work.  He answers back "I Don't Know"  I Was Like WT$.  As I wait I start thinking of my options which were plenty along in Kissimmee but I had my taste buds set for taco bell.  If she was not back in 5  minutes I would have to end my taco quest and go for a burger.  She did finally show back up within the allotted time. counted her drawer and proceeded to take orders.  She did apologize to each of us as she took our orders.  Ok... Now how hard is it to leave off something when asked.  I asked for no tomatoes on my taco.  Instead I got no lettuce and lot's of tomatoes. My burrito was dry and disgusting.  My taco bell grande was ok but the refried beans were like cement.  I could have had better -food at the 7-11.  Now for the cleanliness.  Oh brother.... they had at least 4 employees sauntering around like they had nothing to do.  Very poorly managed restaurant.  I now will have to use my Yelp app to help me find the next closest taco bell for that next taco craving.

I would give it 0 stars if possible. Waited on line forever, had a long order and apologized for it before ordering. Took over half an hour to get food and then there was a single taco missing from the order, not a big deal in itself. Went in to ask for the missing taco and the cook came out yelling, nasty about the "missing" taco as through we would make up a single missing taco. Only thing my mother ordered and we ordered for approximately 10 people. Felt like they were insinuating we were lying and trying to make a dollar on a free taco???? What the heck. Rude as hell and terrible with customer service. Never going back.

Holy moly, y'all. We live in the neighborhood and maybe hit TBell once a week. I can say, no bits, we have been to this Taco B SIX TIMES when they have 
3x had no night manager
1x had no beans
1x ran out of beef
1x no closers at all (tonight, 816pm)

What? The? Sweet? Hell?

I am a person and I ran out of patience. C'mon, dudes.

I just spent 20 minutes in line... Gave my order ... Paid and was told they're out of beans.  how does taco bell run out of their top ingredient? Get it together guys! I was given a refund but legit wasted 20 minutes and wasn't able to get food. Some of us have jobs to get back to. No food for me. Won't make that mistake again...

We frequented this location of Taco Bell when on a trip to Atlanta.

Product: Cheap, greasy pseudo-Mexican fare. Just the type of stuff when you're in a rush or have a hangover. The food was on par with other Taco Bells and your typical fast food restaurant. 2 stars

Service: They didn't screw up our order, which seems like a bonus with most fast food employees these days (I will not lament when these establishments go fully automated in the near future). We used the drive-through, and the wait was not long. 3 stars

Facilities: I can't really rate anything besides the outside, which seemed well-kept to me. The drive through order mic and speaker worked just fine. 3 stars

Overall: An average fast food joint. 3 stars

I went here just to satisfy my desire of the XXL steak nacho thing that I was dreaming about. Like most of my fantasies, this turned out to be a bit of a downer. It was almost $7 to load up on this platter of steak - well, it wasn't really steak - not sure what it was but I know steak and this wasn't steak. I'll go back when I'm hungry and drunk and can't find anything else open (I'm looking at you Publix).
Don't go by for breakfast, they may not be open. Don't bother calling because they won't answer the phone!

Went here with a friend while vacationing in Salem. We ordered a very large order with special instructions and everything was made perfectly! They forgot the hot and mild sauce but otherwise great service and preparation.

Taco Bell never disappoints and they always seem to get the orders right even at 3 o'clock in the morning. I haven't had the breakfast from here yet and even though we only come here once a year I know it's a place I can always count on that will actually have decent food for a decent price.
Love this Taco Bell . I had a complicated order but they got everything so perfectly! Customer service was spectacular! If only I could leave more than 5 stars I would (:

Everything bad you hear is true. Its complete butt. I love taco bell but never get any because of this location wich is closest to me, i got to wait so long wether im dining in or in the drive through. If you in a hurry don't come here. Its been a year since i came here and now i remember why i stopped

I really don't understand some of the negative reviews for this Taco Bell. Every time I have gone they have been fast, friendly, and order was correct! I can't always say the same for other area locations.
Still a cheap good choice BUT man there drive through sux! SUPER SHow long does it take to make a few tacos!! Ugh

Food was okay but they screwed up part of our order instead of giving us ranch for the taco salad they gave salsa dressing. We asked to confirm that it was ranch dressing and they said "yes" it was. when we got back to our hotel that was kind of far away we discovered that it was salsa dressing. when we called to ask what they could do they said if you come back we'll fix it. Service could have been better. Not sure if I want to go back there.

Disgusting. They served me a burrito that someone had clearly taken a bit out of before handing it out and when I called to complain the assistant manager I talked to told me to f*** off.

Do not eat here. If they think it's funny to serve food they've bitten off of, think of what else they might be doing to your food because it's 'funny'.

This place is a serious health hazard. Be careful.

I tried to go back for a refund, but that went nowhere as well, but at least I got it on video. Link to youtube for proof: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8MuFB1ufmHo

Horrible service. I order the steak power burrito all the time and the girl at the window told me tonight that you can't order the power burrito after 11. No where does it say that AND I have ordered the power burrito after 11 before. Then she refused to come to the window and talk to me face to face and wouldn't answer the phone. Ignorant workers!
Can always count on quick service and well prepared food.
Still a cheap good choice BUT man there drive through sux! SUPER SLOW!!! How long does it take to make a few tacos!! Ugh
Shawn was the best I've ever seen. He is so friendly and fast. I'll be back again and again.
Waited in the drive through for 20 minutes and then had rude employees not have a single care in the world. Got home and our food was gross, stale as shit and tasted like it sat all day long.
Took me 30 minutes to get a bean burrito. Employees were playing around in the back while at least 7 people waited for food.
Cmon man ....... I ordered a number 8 combo,, two chalupas waiting for ya boy..came home got two regular soft tacos... be better Taco Bell this was disappointing ... you can't flip it on me like this

Ordered $16 worth of food. Received $7 worth of food. Called the restaurant and asked for the manager. Hung up on me. Called again, asked for
Manger and told her the situation. She said there is no way to take my number down or get my
food that I ordered unless I drive back with a documented receipt. I NEVER received a receipt.  Told her the 5 items that they missed and she said, sorry I can't help you. I asked for her name and she hung up on me.  You guys are the laziest, most unprofessional fast food location that I have ever been to and owe me at least $100
of missing shit. How smart do you have to be to combine the correct order without messing up? If this is a franchise I would fire every human that works for that location, and try to get into a different business. Fuck you!

I waited 25 mintues for 2 chicken quesadillas. Then watched them had my food to the person who ordered after me. When I asked about my order they said, oh sorry about that we gave your food to someone else. Then I had to wait again for my food to be made.

Will not visit this Taco Bell again. On more than one occasion, our order was messed up (hubby and I are vegans) and our order consisted of cheese instead of the fresco that we have always asked for.  It doesn't matter to them that you have to drive all the way back to the store in the rain to tell them they messed up and not receive a sincere apology in return. I have worked in fast food before and this is not how good customer service is!

Closed restaurant down at midnight on a Friday saying their system was down. They are not supposed to close til 2am. Not pleased at all when it was close to our hotel room. I guess they didn't want to have to clean up again. Not good for service.

Taco Bell more like Boar Ragnarok

Being serious tho this place is straight trash and i think there meat is literal dog crap

Quality of food is really good but please explain why I bother using the app to skip the line is they don't make the food before I get there? It says as you order ready to pick up ASAP 2 to 5 mins but it takes them 15 minutes once I arrive to get it ready...truly pointless.
Also make my vegetarian Crunchwrap wrong with BEEF added to it and my potatoes soft taco with cheese after I ordered it with none. I've been in the service industry a long time and it's sad how bad customer service has gotten.

I don't usually have an issue with this location & my problem could have easily been solved over the phone but after calling this location 74 times I was unable to get ahold of anyone. I was given two wrong burritos with my order & was not given a receipt. I just want to make sure I wasn't over charged & get my correct order but I am unable to contact anyone here. If you use this location...DONT LEAVE THE WINDOW WITHOUT CHECKING & OPENING EVERY ITEM! Very disappointed with the lack of customer service. I should not have to drive all the way back to the restaurant & wait in line for issues like this to be resolved.

Waited in the drive thru and come to learn they are out of Mexican pizza shells, no fire sauce, no hot sauce, no mild sauce. How can one eat Taco Bell without sauce. Need to do better on ordering and keeping par level of supplies. I canceled my order and the location lost out on revenue.
I walk in and they tell me at least 28 minute wait, is this acceptable? I don't think so! What happened so fast food? The owner should know! No stars
Worst Taco Bell I've been too!!! My nachos were cold, cheese sauce was half full!!! Quesadillas were piper thin with not much in them! Very disappointed!!!

Ah, Taco Bell....this location seems to have some age on it and the area it is located in is very much a mixed use industrial park type of zoning. The staff is very professional, friendly and quick. Drive thru equally so...and they always ask if you want sauce...what more could you want? Except for that cute talking chihuahua to stage a come back.

Sucks used doordash got order wrong. Was 12 mins past the 29 min posted time. Supposed to be free. WAS NOT. AGAIN SUCKED.
And to quote an old commercial. WHERE'S THE BEEF

It says "Open until 3:00am" on Yelp, and their website, yet when I walk up to the establishment at 11:00pm, apparently they've already closed their lobby. I do not live here, I am traveling and currently do not have a car. Therefore the only way for me to get food from this "Open until 3am" restaurant was to drive my non-existent vehicle through their drive-thru in order to get food. 

Awesome!

The tacos were how they're supposed to be at every location. However, all the shells were cracked. Yet, the burritos were good! My main issue was how impatient they were while we were in the drive thru ordering our food. It took a minute extra for us to decide and we communicated saying we need a minute looking at the menu. They constantly asked what we wanted to order after no welcoming greeting. Then, they pushed and shoved the receipt and bag of food at us after touching the top of the bag. Not only that, but we were missing items like the cinnamon twist and I was looking forward to it because I've never tried them before. What a disappointment of a place. I'll never return here because of how rude they were and how bad the service was in general.

I wouldn't even give it a one star, it's worst than that! But I had to in order to post this review!! 
The worst worst worst. Worst service worst food. 
Always a 15-20 min wait to then not get a complete order. And then get the worst customer service from employees!!! Where's management and order!! 
Look at the time line on the reviews u can see something went wrong at one point and quick!! Always happens during evening and night shifts!!
Just left after going inside and waiting for someone to acknowledge me. They are too busy talking to notice the front.

Their service is terrible. They closed 10 minutes early and wouldn't let me in. I tried going through the drive thru and they wouldn't serve me. They just wanted to get out of work early and they were extremely rude the whole time. Don't go to this Taco Bell.

Incredibly friendly service.
The general manager JR made sure we had everything we need and even brought our son a new taco without lettuce when he saw him picking out the pieces.
The food was very good, too. 
Hot, fresh and it came out in no time.
I love that they have 4 hot sauces to choose from. :)
Ran out if food (Mexican pizza) this should always be restocked. Manager of the establishment should be retrained on how to do inventory and when to order.

They were not stingy with taco toppings but nacho fry bell grande let's just say did not look like the picture. Cinnamon twist old and hard. Toilet in girls bathroom is not in the ground, the bathroom looked like it hasn't been cleaned in a while along with the rest of the restaurant. Let's just say this place could use a good deep cleaning. Thank goodness this is not my towns Taco Bell because if it was I would be talking to a manager.

I go here on my breaks often every time I come I never have a good experience the lady is always rude when she talks to me and I ask for a lot of mild sauce and 9 times out of 10 she gives me 2 sauce. Today I get my taco looks like it was thrown into the bag and all the cheese is outside the taco and the meat is on one side. As I bite into it I get the pleasure of a black hair in my mouth.....I'm blonde so I know it didn't come from me.  Just disappointed.
Gave me the wrong food for a mobile order. I got a few things but they gave me a bean burrito instead. I just want my money back. The staff seemed very tired and agitated they should get more breaks.

Food is standard Taco Bell, but the service here is literally nonexistent. The first time I came here on a Saturday night I spent a good 5 minutes at the drive thru waiting to order until I just drove away. It was during regular drive thru operating hours and there was no indication that they were closed. 

For some reason I gave this location another chance tonight. This time I placed a mobile order and opted to go in to pick it up. I will say the restaurant interior, including the bathroom, exceeded my cleanliness expectations. 

However there was no one at the front register for 5 minutes or so after I came in. My order was supposedly going to be ready in 3-5 minutes. Eventually when another customer came in an employee appeared and asked if I was picking up a mobile order. She got my bag and said, "You just gotta to tell us." 

Well, who exactly am I supposed to tell when no one is there? And when the app says "we'll call your name" when your order is ready, as it has been the case at other locations? I didn't get a receipt either. 

Look, I don't go to Taco Bell, or any fast food place, expecting Michelin restaurant quality service. I do expect employees to actually be there though, and for a place to have some indication they're closed for whatever reason. I don't think that's asking much.

I love Taco Bell. LOVE Taco Bell. This particular one is... abysmal. We've gone and had them out of drinks several times. All drinks. And today we went at 3 pm and the front and side doors were locked. It was full of people. We knocked on the door. The employees ignored us completely. Numerous people walked up, tried to enter, and left. It was clearly open as the drive-thru was open and people inside were eating. Unreal at how terrible this location is.

What a horrible experience. We went through the drive through and they we were out of almost every drink. My husband said his chalupa had a weird taste to it and they forgot this cinnamon twist. The cherry Pepsi tasted nasty. Stay away from this Taco Bell!

I know. I know. It's fast food, but, come on! How hard is it to make nachos? Last time I checked,
Nachos have cheese. It's kind of a necessity for nachos. Um, I guess they missed the memo. There was MAYBE a tablespoon on my whole order. A tablespoon.
When you're pregnant and craving nacho cheese, that's not gonna cut it. In fact, even if you aren't, chances are, it's still not gonna cut it.
The nachos were a disgrace to the nacho name.  Boo on you, Taco Bell.
Excellent drive through service. Order taken quickly and accurately. No contact service. Food was good.

Commercials work! I end up at Taco Bell a half dozen times a year because commercials work. Nacho cheese for fries, fantastic... until later that night. If I stick with bean and cheese burritos I might have a fighting chance to have a steady stomach afterwards. I don't though and triple steak chalupa Gordita nacho box looks so good... until later. Will I keep going, yes. I will pay for it later though.
anyone who gives taco bell a review greater than 2 should be banned from yelp. this is a joke.

Jason behind the counter who took my order had a good sense of humor when I cracked a joke or two.
My order of an Enchirito and Mexican pizza came reasonably quick, fresh and steaming.
Both items tasted as good as it gets from a Taco Bell so I have no complaints.
The seating area was clean and pleasent.

Two female staff workers working the drive thru were exceptionally rude. We ordered combos and gave us only the food and closed the window in our face not giving us the drink,  and when we finally got their attention to give us the drinks they gave us the wrong drink. We had asked for a pink lemonade and they gave us a mango tea and when we tried to tell them they were rude and tried to correct us and said," YOU SAID MANGO TEA, not pink lemonade." How are you to correct the customer? And then she didn't even bother to correct the drink and then closed the window in our face once again and called her coworker to make a simple pink lemonade. 
Another time we went we ordered food on the app for pick up and when we got home we realized we were missing food.

I don't ever even bother leaving reviews but this kid that worked the drive thru annoyed me so much I had to. So as I'm paying for my food I ask " can I have hot sauce" he looked at me like I had 10 heads. Didn't say anything I'm like              " alright then"  he hands me my bag and walks away. It's okay I don't need a have a good day or anything.... but at least put my hot sauce in the bag all this to say he didn't feel like giving me
My hot sauce) Meanwhile he's talking to his buddy telling him " I don't take my break I'd rather get this money" but it seems like he's constantly on a break. Not to mention that whenever I go to Taco Bell they ask you if you want sauce before they even give you your food? So not only did he just not listen he didn't even wanna bother asking me.

Went to this Taco Bell on my way to work one day.  You really can't go wrong with Taco Bell.  For $2 and change you can get a meal. 

Ask about a Senior drink.  It is free.

One thing I did noticed about this location, is that it looks dated compared to some of their updated locations.

Keep up the good work Taco Ball.
Perfect and fresh tacos, plus they give lil cini mints! Customer service with a smile, thanks a bunch!

Oh Taco Bell -- I know it isn't the healthiest of foods , but this is where I come to break my diet or if I have a bad day. The service is always super awesome at this particular location and they even arrange their sauce packets in the containers. 

I am a bit upset that they don't do happier hour with food anymore -- a crunch wrap is always my go to :).

Don't know how to explain it besides it's Taco Bell. You've been in one, you been in them all. Same menu, but this place was clean. I do love the fact that we dined in, the manager came to us asking if our food and everything else was ok.

I'm more of a Taco Time fan,  but I drove through here for breakfast once and the guy working had such a great attitude it set the tone for a great day.  Every time I've been there it has the friendliest people working and today was no different.  The gentleman working was great and he shared that energy.  Sure,  it's Taco Bell, but the cheerful employees make the experience great.

The absolute worst service I have ever received. I cannot count the number of times the wait has been more than 30 minutes for 2 items. The employees are consistently rude on top of the horrific service. This place needs to be shut down.

I agree with the comment below, I've been to fast food and Taco Bell's all over the country this is by far the best one I have ever eaten at. Actually shocking how fresh and packed the tacos are.

Can't compare to any Taco Bell I've ever been to this one is that much better.

Terrible employees including managers were no help.
A small simple order was too much to handle for them all as it took over 15 mins. 
Some employees were cursing behind the counter and were verbal towards each other. One manager was very rude towards the other employees. 
This location needs to be completely retrained!
This was on Sunday 12/30 at 1:10pm.
The guy taking the orders on April 21 at 1:52pm is a complete tard. They should fire this guy. After 6 attempts he couldn't get our order right. Ridiculous.

Horrible i went in made an order then i waited for 20 minutes, they got my order wrong i waited again, i went home and my order was still wrong when calling store to ask if they can give my money back, manager tried to tell my mother was wrong then hung up on her,she tried to call bag and the store answered then hung up.

I'm lactose intolerant. Every time I go to this Taco Bell and order a bean burrito fresco style it ALWAYS has cheese on it.(this has happened the past 3 times) As someone who is lactose intolerant I end up not even eating it. A waste of money and time and extremely frustrating!
This Taco Bell is fine except if you go there past midnight, there "system will be down". It's happened twice to us which means they don't want to work.

Inexcusably slow service inside with plenty of staff that seemed to be focused on the lunch time drive through. 
There was two large orders in front of me inside but it took just short of ten minutes before they called my name with a quick and barely audible from where I sat, "sorry for the wait."
Food was cheap and the usual.
A complaint about ordering off the posted menu;
There is only one "double decker" taco listed and it says "Supreme." Yet when I ordered the "double decker taco" I got something less expensive without any supremeness. Why wasn't I asked for clarification?

I have never been to another taco bell that so consistently messes up my order. I once had to go back twice because they put beef in my Crunchwrap that I specified should be meat-free. Don't even bother giving them modifications because they will completely disregard them. The employees must have very little care for accuracy. Beside that, they are also extremely slow. Go to literally any other taco bell!

Better than the one I went to 2 days ago (Sanford, review posted). I got waited on. Employees visible and working. I ordered 2 items. Got to listen to one employee tell a man who seemed like a district manager, how much she hated living here. "It's not home to me" . "How long have you been here? "Oh, since 93 or so".
Bitch, just go home. We don't want you here.
So, I get my food; ask for a bag for one item. The dude that waited on me tried to snatch the tray he put my food on. I said "I'm sorry, can I use this to get to the table?" He actually replied .....ok, but don't steal the tray" .... I said "pardon me?" .... Dude repeated "don't steal the tray".
How fucked up. I'm a single mom who took her kid to school, have a few minutes to have a bite alone. No cats, dog, .... no one around and I can enjoy a bite to eat. 
Until I get a ride smart assed comment "don't steal the tray". WTF. 
I will never come back to this store. If my child asks for Taco Bell, we will drive well out of our way to go to another one. I am about to leave and am going to make sure the girl that hates Florida knows to tell that kid I didn't steal the tray.
Edit. The kids name is Hunter. I made sure the manager told him I was not stealing his tray. He was clear in the back and tried to cover his comments with "I wasn't accusing you of stealing the tray, I just didn't want you to walk off with it".  TO WHERE, A TABLE?? 
Oh I'm pissed. Hunter is getting a review through corporate.

We only have one Taco Bell near my childhood home back in Maui, but they always could be counted on for a solid fast food meal. I think this was probably the worst Taco Bell I've ever been to, in terms of overall quality control and presentation. It's a combination restaurant in partnership with KFC, which is probably a big part of the problem. Either the chicken is amazing, and the Taco Bell side is slipping through the cracks, or they both are going down the tubes. 

I went here with an Uber after work one day through the drive thru. The driver and I both thought that would be faster than going inside. Mind you, there was no one in the drive thru line in front of us, nor were there any customers even inside. It was completely dead. 

We still somehow managed to wait a good 15 minutes for everything after paying, and for what? Please, see my pictures. The quality was not there at all. I was not expecting gourmet, but I could've done better for sure. There was no care or concern put into my meal. The crunchwrap was barely sealed and falling apart with old grilled bits stuck to the bottom. You know, the kind where the grill isn't cleaned often, so you get all that old charcoal taste on it. On top of that, the taco salad shell was served completely broken and with toppings stuck to the top as it was mushed down too tightly when the cover was closed. 

I ordered some tacos on the side which were okay, but the other items were unacceptable. There are people who would love to have a job right now during this pandemic, and it just saddens me when I see people serve food with no care like that. I didn't rate them a one star, because I didn't get sick, but I know they can do better. I have no interest in coming back to this location, and I would've gotten a refund if I had driven myself there, but I felt bad as it was having had the Uber driver waiting for 15 minutes. I would avoid this location and seek out a solo Taco Bell if I were you (no other chains attached to it).

Terrible. Every single time. I love Taco Bell, but this specific location is always awful. Food is almost guaranteed to be cold. And if you order a burrito, it'll more than likely be 98% tortilla only. Fries are cold, soggy and poorly seasoned. Do yourself a favor, and drive down the road a few minutes to the Semoran location in Winter Park.
Food is terrible and there slower than snails here. Go get some real food wish these terrible chains would close down.
Good luck if they are open when you go. I went by there over 2weeks ago. I complained & haven't gotten an email or a phone call. Horrible customer service! Stay away from this location!

Please do everyone a big favor and close this location. I have been here three times and all three times have been a disaster. From incorrect orders to burnt food and today waiting over 15 minutes in the dining room and still no food being prepared. Workers are fighting with each other in the back and customers are sitting there waiting for food for a longer time period than would be acceptable at a legitimate restaurant let alone a fast food joint. I requested a refund as did the gentleman that was waiting who placed his order after me. Just close this location and stop the bleeding.

The food has sucked every time but decided to give the place one more shot tonight. Wish I had a bowl of cereal instead. My quesarito doesn't have much of anything on it lmao. Thanks for the 4 dollar tortilla.

Just sad Taco Bell.  We don't ask for much, just a simple quality product.  Serving a broken  taco, that was probably perfect until it was in the hands of this monster's hands. Sorry that your life is  miserable  but that doesn't grant you freedom to ruin my taco Asshole!
they messed up my order so bad and now they arent answering the phone id give zero stars if i could!!!!!!!!

Everytime i go to this taco bell they are always so sloppy... my quesadillas are always a mess the cheese isnt even melted and everything is cold. The attitude i get from the same girl that works there is unprofessional.. never smiles never says " hi how are you today what can i get for you?" you walk up to order and she doesn't even greet you.. i wish i got her name .. also they never give napkins EVER.. thats what they are suppose to do give you napkins.. it is un ACCEPTABLE! worse taco bell.. someone needs to do a serious MAKEOVER of this place and step up there game or they will lose ALOT of customers.. save yourself the disappointment and go to another taco bell.. theres one on Rte 1 or in salem on highland ave.
I know it's Taco Bell, but I was really taken by surprise today by how great the food looked and tasted and how nice the employs were.  Eesha took my order and was so sweet and helpful.
Employees closed the door as i was walking towards it and said i cant come in... it was only 1030... horrible employees... horrible service

This place had really gone down in the past few years. It was never great but now it's just unbearable. Everytime I drive by on my way home I see a line of cars almost reaching back to the road. Even when there are only a few cars, you're guaranteed a 15 minute wait for your food. I was really craving it tonight so I decided to try walking in to get it to go. Took 5 minutes before anyone came up to the register.

Avoid this place at all costs! Ordered some Mexican pizzas and they came undercooked and as a result got food poisoning! Try to find the next closest one if you have a hankering but this place is awful.

It is the slowest drive thru ever. The customer service is absolutely horrible. I went a couple days ago and there was only 2 cars in front of me, which eventually turned into 1 because the person in front of me left after waiting for so long, and it was a 15 minute wait.

Giving this place a 1 star simply because while I was waiting for my food the "female" (can't really give her credit considering she really had zero class at all) was talking about how she "shaves her privates" and was asking the other female in the drive thru with her if she shaves her. Like really? That makes me REALLY want to eat my food while I hear you talking about your "privates" Smfh.

In the past I've had some epically slow drive through waits at this location.  However, things have been really improving lately.  Consistently well prepared food, thoughtfully placed in the bag and the employees are consistently friendly.  I really like this Taco Bell location.

SLOW! took 20 minutes to get two soft tacos. I could see their order screen and there were only three orders ahead of me of a couple of items each. One person presumably on a break stood near the person supposed to be making orders and talked and texted on her phone.

I have gone to this location a few times now to get breakfast and every single time they have said that they aren't ready to take orders for a while...after they're already scheduled to be open. It's been the same guy working as well. It's getting rather annoying. If the guy can't manage to get to work on time then maybe he needs to work a different shift.

These people at this location are the WORST!!!!   They will not open at the time they are supposed to be open.  I waited at drive through for the longest then drove up just to be told were are about to open.  The guy in the back is grabbing chips and eating them while looking at me rudely.  WORST TACO BELL EVER!!!!
Screwed up entire order. From now on will need to open bag and look. Not a hard job to take an order.
This place has the slowest service I have ever experienced. I waited in line for 30 mins to get my food. Would not recommend.
I just saw the way a MANAGER treated a good customer who got extremely bad service on Youtube at this Taco Bell. I will never come to this location and I am filing a formal complaint with corporate.

I'm a Taco Bell customer, I ordered some food and while I was eating a cashier of the name of Sabrina, was staring at me and my while I was eating and made me extremely uncomfortable I stoped eating and left cause I felt disgusted, this message is for owner or manager, fire her  and your business will do better I swear to god...

I'm giving it a 1 star just because the food was good. 

I came in today, ordered takeout and paid with a card. I noticed the employee pressed "round up for this charity" button on the pin-pad and the total wasn't correct, then mentioned it and he said it would ask for my pin. I said, "since it's a credit card, it won't ask for that" and he assured me it will. It went through for the wrong amount, and I said I wanted the amount refunded. He's about to refuse to do it and his manager looks at him, throws a dollar out of his pocket. No apologies, no respect. 

Also, parking lot is a nightmare, nearly wrecked coming in due to the design.
It is 2:30 in the afternoon, maybe 3 orders ahead and 15 minutes later no food.  They look fully staffed.  Food comes out of a bag.

Are you ready to think outside the bun?  Yes, this is a four star review for a Taco Bell.  The food is a pretty consistent two to three stars, but the staff here were just super friendly.

The inside is pretty small, but it seemed clean and well maintained.  They do have a drive thru which seemed pretty busy though inside it was empty at lunch time.

I don't go to Taco Bell often, but I do sometimes get a craving for their crunchy taco.  It's a basic but solid fast food taco with seasoned beef, lettuce, and cheese in a crunchy shell.  It won't change your world, but it's not bad.   The staff here were just extremely and genuinely friendly.  Lots of smiles and positive attitudes which truly impressed me.  

Give this location a try when you are ready to think outside the bun and go south of the border!

I just had a 29 minute experience at the drive-thru.  29 minutes.
And if THAT had been my only problem, I'd give this place a glowing review.

I pulled into the drive-thru at 11:41 PM.  There was one car in front of me waiting to order, and one car at the pick-up window.
Around 11:48 PM, the car in front of me finally placed their order and moved up to the pickup window.  
I finally got my order placed at 11:56 PM.  (That whole time, I just sat there in silence - I was never once greeted, or told that they'd be right with me, or anything like that.)

My order:
2 Cheesy Potato Burritos (with Chicken instead of Beef)
1 Cheesy Potato Burrito (with Steak instead of Beef)
1 side of nachos with cheese
1 Large "Limeade Sparkler"

I pulled forward and waited behind the other car (the one who had finished placing their order 8 minutes before me).  Eventually it was my turn to pull up to the window.  The guy handed me my drink.  Unfortunately, it seemed that most of the drink was on the outside of the cup.  The indented lid was covered with liquid, all of which spilled on me when I took the drink into my car, and the outside of the cup was soaking wet and sticky.  Delightful.

About 5 minutes later, another employee came to the window and handed me two bags.  "Here's your order" (handed me one bag) "...and here's your steak burrito."  (handed me another bag.  Ok,, that was weird, but whatever.  I wanted to pull away, so I tried to condense the bags.  Of course, as I drove off, I noticed that there were only 2 total burritos in the bag.  I turned around in the parking lot and looped back around to go back to the drive-thru - only to discover that there were now SIX cars lined up.  There was NO way I was waiting in that line.  So I pulled up alongside the car that was currently at the window.  The guys in that car were nice enough to tell the guy at the window that I was back, looking for the rest of my order.  

Eventually, the girl who handed me my order came skipping (yes, skipping) out to my car to see what I needed.  She asked to see my order.  I handed her the bag.  I don't want to say she was rude about it, but let's say that she seemed "pretty sure of herself" that I had, indeed, received everything correctly.  I watch in PURE HORROR as she (with bare hands) took one of the burritos out of the bag, UNWRAPPED IT (yes, in the middle of the parking lot - and yes, with bare hands) and said "Here's the chicken one!"  She then waved the other burrito in my face and said "And here's the steak one!"  It took a great deal of effort and patience on my part to remind her that I had ordered 2 chicken burritos and 1 steak.  She then asked to see my receipt, because she was "sure that there was only 1 on the order".

She then skipped back into the restaurant, and I returned to the waiting game.  Eventually someone else brought out the new burrito and handed it to me.  Not once did anyone apologize to me.  

I left the drive-thru at 12:10, making that a 29 minute drive-thru experience.

BUT, here's the best part...not only did I get dinner.... I got dinner AND a show!  In that wonderful 29 minute "experience", I was blessed enough to be visited by mother nature's littlest creatures, as I counted no less than 10 various mice and rats scurrying throughout the parking lot, and climbing along the ledges of the building.  Mmmm, tasty and appetizing, right?  

And THAT isn't even the end of the story....
I got home, and promptly threw out the first chicken burrito (the one that Susie Skipsalot opened with her bare hands in the middle of their rat infested parking lot)...
But, against my better judgement, I ate the rest of my items.

The order of nachos with cheese i ordered?  There were 8 (eight) nacho chips in there.  EIGHT.  Well, that's 8 plus enough shards and crumbs to possibly make a 9th chip.  The cheese sauce with them was cold, and rock hard.  One of the chips broke when I tried to dip it in the cheese.

The steak burrito tasted "off"... which was really disconcerting, considering the wildlife I witnessed in their parking lot.

The chicken burrito, however, was what really gave this meal a nice "finish".  About halfway through the burrito, I bit into something that didn't belong...  INSIDE my burrito was one of those plastic-wrapped cinnamon candies (the ones that look like the red and white peppermint candies).  Yes, a plastic wrapped candy INSIDE MY CHICKEN BURRITO.

Also, I asked for mild sauce, and got "Fire". 


I went on the Taco Bell website to try to contact them, but their webform is limited to 500 characters, which isn't nearly enough for me.  I tweeted them, asking for an email address, and they responded with a 1-800 number.  I responded again, asking for an email address, and they responded again with the 1-800 number.  So I guess if they're not willing to contact me the way that's most convenient for me, I'll just say "screw it" and put my story on Yelp.

It sucks when you are craving something and you go and order food get home and the order is completely messed up even when is not rush hour! My order was stupid simple a number 11. 3 tacos supéreme and a chicken griller. I get home no sour cream strike one.Go to eat the third taco no meat lmao like literally no meat I had a lettuce taco incredible strike 2. The chicken griller had rice in it strike 3. really lol I think instead of a high school diploma they should require a college degree maybe they get half my order right... not the first time this happens

If I could give it a zero stars I would. Understaffed, the staff don't seem to know what they're doing and take 30 minutes to fill the most basic of orders (a cheese quesadilla). There doesn't seem to be any management around either.

I visit this location often due to being in the area. They are pretty quick in taking my order and getting my food out. The staff is usually very friendly and outgoing without feeling fake. It is appreciated. I recommend this location! Thanks!
Best Taco Bell! Both food quality and customer service! Super yum! Clean bathrooms too! Came on 1/5/17...

Update to my two star review prior...

This Taco Bell has really turned around. I've been a few more times since my run of bad experiences and it seems everything has changed. Newer staff, quicker and friendlier service, and most importantly not one mistake in orders in last three visits. 
I left one star off on the new updated review because I want to see if they can keep it up.

I understand I am in Taco Bell. However, it should not take 5 minutes for someone to come to the counter. I should have left at that time, but was quite hungry. So I waited and placed my order. It took another 20 minutes for them to make a quesorito and meximelt. The drive through was empty and two people in front of me. Our food all came out within seconds of each other. There is no reason to be this slow, and y'all want $15 and hour....

Apparetly they close an hour and a half early today. Sat at the drive through for 10 minutes with no one responding, when i seen people inside. Very bizarre since there was no one waiting for food. Drove all the way here for nothing.

This place charges more than other taco bells for almost every menu item, and they still are absolutely incapable of getting an order correct. I'm almost always very patient with these kinds of mistakes because it's fast food but their lack of any sort of quality is the most consistent thing about this location. This place may be conveniently located but they will overcharge you for worse product.

I ordered food through the drive thru today and the male manager was extremely rude. He was talking to me through the mic and other employees in the back and I kept asking him if he was talking to me or them cause I was confused. I ordered the chicken tenders and when I got home and opened the box, they were stale and hard. I went back to get my money back and I brought the receipt, Same guy argued with me when I was being polite, saying what's wrong with them and that there stale cause I came 30 minutes ago (it was 10 minutes later...). The best part is he threw them in the trash then picked them out of the trash with the same gloves he was touching customers food with he was ripping the chicken apart on the counter in front of me like he was trying to prove a point saying that they were fine. I told him I didn't want to argue and just wanted my money back on my card. He then tips the trash over and gives me a dirty look and walks away. Takes my card and starts playing and bending with it, tapping it against the wall being obnoxious. 10 minutes later I got my money back well I remained calm. No way to treat customers like this, also very unprofessional especially as a manager. Would never go here again.

Stopped here today 2/4/19 around 3pm. I was the only car in the drive through and my order STILL took over 5 minutes... I eventually put my car in park and was just looking at all the employees joking and laughing with eachother. only had two items...so I'm not sure what the hold up was. Then the guy in the window kept stopping me as I was pulling away to keep offering me things he'd forgotten to put in the bag, napkins, sauces etc....it was super awkward.
Very poor service here! The employee was very rude and messed up my order as well. Won't be coming back to this location again.

I'm not really a Taco Bell fan so this review isn't about the food. I just placed an order for something and was over charged. I spoke to a manager that literally shrugged and repeated the incorrect price. 

I will not visit this location again for sure.

First off, I always check reviews on a place before I go. I'm going to be honest: people are Ridiculous. It's Taco Bell, not Ruth  Chris steak house or Antonio's. Second, tho I take the reviews with a grain of salt. Especially with the fact it's common for staff to rotate in such an establishment. Meaning those not putting effort to work hard they quit or are let go and or they might be new and training, yada yada blah blah. Third, yes I did wait maybe 10 mins. But again taking in account there was a line of cars when I pulled in that I could see before i pulled in. That already makes it obvious there's going to be a wait. So I ordered my food, kept my order small. And here is a HUGE tip to the other reviewers and our right: before driving off I Opened the sealed bag and checked my order. The food was fresh and put together as it was supposed to be. If there was an issue I'd kindly wait till they came back to the window and respectfully ask they fix the order. It truly is that simple. Is it 5 star quality? No, though it's evident the staff are doing the best they can. It's just Taco Bell, and I feel some people can have a bit more compassion especially in the time we are in now with COVID and such. Thanks y'all, I love Taco Bell and not having to cook my own food sometimes. No I don't usually leave lengthy reviews but I felt for this place.  drop!

Went thru the drive thru to pick up my mobile order. I was told they didn't have my order and it's a 3rd parry app to call them. After going to the drive thru window and arguing with the drive thru rep, the manager and store manager they found my order under Ayron Santarelli. Not 1 time did they ask for my order number, my last name, or anything. The drive thru rep said my manager said not to talk to you about it. I asked for the first manager 3 times before the rep stomped off to get the manager. The manager wanted to argue so she got the store manager. The store manager just argues until one of the cooks said that is Aaron to ask him his spelling. I told them 3 times my spell and still was very rude. Than while waiting for my food you see every employee walk by the windows many times just to look at myself and my passenger. Then you hear the first drive thru rep say something rude to her coworker and he replies loud enough to hear him say yes he is fat. The first manager just looks over and said stay away from the window. The worst experience ever out of the 40+ orders here.

Food was fresh and delicious my first time trying a chalupa and I loved it. The soda area was messy but it's super busy at the moment I never have a complain when I come by to visit this Taco Bell. Keep in mind it's in a very touristy area so be prepared to wait your best bet is to use the mobile app and order your food it's awesome
Does not attend the line in store hardly at all. Took about 10-15 mins to order and they even left without giving me a cup for my drink.

This location is a solid Taco Bell. We went here this past Monday (7/13) while at the hospital very late and service was a bit slow (they seemed understaffed) but the food was delicious, hot and fresh and the order had no errors which is often a challenge with two picky eaters. The young lady working the drive thru was nice, helpful and apologized for the wait. This location was very clean and although it is almost a year old everything seems to be kept in pristine condition.

Stopped here tonight for dinner and tried to get two beefy frito burritos but they were out so I got two beefy nacho burritos and a cheese quesadilla with no sauce and had to wait 5 mins for some guy to come out dressed in shorts and a tank top and got a cheese quesadilla with sauce and two gross smushed burritos. What the f Taco Bell.
If your employees aren't willing to make the product, why do you advertise as open until 2:30 when you can really only order until 1:30ish

No contact food prep and bagging comes at a cost!  The girl folded over my bag extremely tight and then she pushed down on it before sealing it with a no contact sticker..  My tacos and Mexican Pizza were all smashed and I mean smashed!!!  She seamed nice enough but my order was so trashed that reflecting back, I can't help but to think that she did it on purpose.  Nice enough but was knocking a bunch of packaging off the prep-table as she worked and I sense that she has a really bad attitude.  Easily two-three dozen boxes and plastic containers ended up on the floor and so something had to have been up.  I'm from Colorado and haven't had Taco Bell since moving here a year ago and sense that it'll be a long time before I return again.
Terrible. Ordered three tacos without lettuce and the order rang up correctly on the screeen. All 3 had lettuce. Tacos were cold and 1 hard shell was in  pieces and all three were soggy.
Horrible service and they'll either mess up your order or completely forget to give you something. Make the extra drive to a new Taco Bell.
The reason I'm giving this Taco Bell 2 stars is not because of the food but simply because of the employees.

Love the rice burritos and mini chicken quesadillas great for a quick bite to eat when on the go I think of taco Bell as a healthier choice or option when doing fast-food service at this location could stand to be improved sometimes.  Depends on who's working needs to improve to friendly professional and getting the orders together appropriately to many times I have been given someone else's order or received a order that was incomplete

Service is VERY SLOW.  Store was moderately busy and it seemed the people working the line were more interested in complaining to the kid busting his butt at the counter.  Poor management and poor attitude!  20 minutes wait for a to go order?  UNACCEPTABLE!

Why the heck my friends and I decide to ever come here is beyond me. I only like the cinnamon twists and drinks, but I decided to get some nachos. Bad idea. The rude employee not only did not give me my change, he also gave me no receipt. He also told us to pull up and they'd bring the food out. 15 mins later, they bring us our incomplete order followed by then going back in to get the rest, and never coming back out. My friend immediately reported it to their corporate, which, likely is just as big of a joke. Seriously, you may be hungry, but you'll leave the same because you won't get your food anyhow... and apparently won't get your change, either. You guys are a pathetic excuse for "fast food"... but I should have figured as much when your hilarious excuse for a manager stood like a deer in headlights when we asked where our food was. What a joke.

A complete waste. Says the open at 8 and it's more like 9, waited to be served via drive thru and they never came to the speaker, causing me to be late for work. About 5 of us left the line after waiting 15-20 minutes

It's very rare that I visit this Taco Bell. I live in Buda, but will happily drive to the next location in Kyle just to get a decent order! This is NOT what comes on the spicy LOADED taco. The fact that I sat there to watch it get made and to receive such a mess like this with missing ingredients. OH and the prep in the kitchen was in such a rush, I ALMOST ate the end of a freaking jalepeno that was found in the damn taco. I'll think more than twice before visiting here again. Especially after 8pm when it's a complete mess. Don't even get me started on how the dining area looked.

2:30 on a Tuesday afternoon is the time to drop by for a lateish lunch. 
Jason was behind the counter to take my order of a Mexican pizza and combo burrito. He was in a great mood and very pleasant.
