I didn't have my change put away when they called my name and handed me a tray with my food. Amazing speed.
The combo burrito was a touch seasoned/spicy on the first bit. It tasted even better with mild sauce. I'm glad I grabbed a spork because towards the end, this burrito got messy when it busted out the bottom.
It had been some time since I'd had a Mexican pizza. It was okay, nothing wrong with it, maybe it had just been too long, and the memories had grown fonder and tastier. Anyway, I might not order this one again.

Overall, a good dining experience and I'd return.

Employees need ti pay attention to the food they handle to the customers went on my lunch break to order food trough the drive tru  the got my order correct on screen and the ticket  as well order a combo 1 which is 3 hard tacos but nooo guess what i got instead a beens n cheese burrito ..... really wasted my lunch break getting food from here and get my stuff wrong shame on those  employees that doesn't pay attention  to what they are taking

I used to go to this TB regularly but now I am done.  Whenever I order any sort of burrito, they cannot figure out how to spread the food out so that its mixed together.  I get a bite of sour cream, a bite of cheese whiz, a couple of bites of rice. One bite of meat and 3 bites of beans.  Yuck!

130 a.m. Only 2 workers that ignored 3 cars in front of us blasting their horns.  We knocked on the window to be greeted by a girl 2min later,opened the window n said WHAT? REALLY? Took 11 min to get our 6 tacos and cinnamon bites. No sauce.Super rude girls and attitude up the ass like we bothered them.Came home just now,the tacos were literally be wet like there was water put on them. Never again....I'll go to Gulf and bye a friggen' 2 day chicken sand first!!   Night managers,review your tapes! Fire these 2 morons because they are useless and rude a.f!!!!

I ordered two steak quesaritos and a chalupa combo with no sour cream and chipotle sauce instead. 
I ended up with two ground beef quesaritos, instead of steak. I still was charged extra for steak. The chalupa's still came with sour cream and no chipotle. Yet we were still charged for chipotle sauce. 
From personal experience, working in a restaurant is stressful but shouldn't be this far off from getting an order right. Management needs to take some initiative and talk to this location. 
This isn't the only bad rating as I can see.

I arrived at the restaurant at 2:45am when the lobby was open until 3am listed on the front door. An employee was standing in the parking lot stating that his manager instructed him to lock the doors while we reminded him that we arrived 10 minutes before it closed. We were then instructed to go through the drive through, which we complied with. While waiting in the drive through a truck's battery died in front of us which prevented us from driving through the drive through. I then got out of the car asking if we could go inside to order as it was still 2:54am at the time, 6 minutes before they are scheduled to close. The manger, standing outside at the time, proceeded to tell me that he will not let us inside and we must wait until the truck was fixed and moved before we could order our food. We then backed out and went to McDonald's down the street. If management from Taco Bell reads this message, I highly suggest you fire the manager that was on duty. He clearly shut down the restaurant before the proper time. The employee that told me his manager instructed him to lock it early appeared to be nervous and uncomfortable telling me that the manager instructed him to close early when we stated that he closed early. This is terrible customer service and extremely frustrating that we were legitimately told we would have to wait until a car was fixed and capable of moving to be order food. I hope this reaches the proper authority level to make a service better for this store.

Hands down, the worst Taco Bell in the area. 

They are out of hot sauce.
They are out of Baja blast.
Always out of something 

Plus, 15 minutes in the drive thru. No thanks

I went through and was harassed by an intoxicated individual behind me. As they harassed me I communicated that someone behind me claimed his wife was the drive and he didn't care- the individual taking my order reciprocated that the food would be hot and fresh.

The food was dead cold. I called and was hung up on. Further I was followed by the person and his wife (the one driving) as I stepped out of the pad ever side of my friends vehicle it was intervened by sherwood police. 

(Thank god) 

This has been the worst experience from any fast food restaurant in my experience and I am an industry member myself. 

Shame on the MGMT here.


F****g shame

Got a chicken burrito with a BITE MISSING tonight (see pic). Two weeks ago, I started counting our items bc this location is notorious for missing items. The guy leans out of the window and goes "you don't have to count it! It's all there!" It sure as shet was NOT all there. I complained on their corp site and didn't even get a "we heard you" email. This location has taken a hard downturn.
New and clean restaurant, great service , good value menu, chalupa is the best, clean bathroom fast service
This taco bell is the worst by far. Bathroom are out of service constantly. The staff is, rude and have zero clue what customers service is about. You want to have an bad experience, then come on in!

I want it to be known that I love taco bell. I know it's not authentic Mexican food. And I STILL LOVE IT! But this specific taco bell has the worst service I've seen. The past 8 times that I can remember, they have messed up SOMETHING in the order. It has gotten to the point where I sit at the window checking EVERYTHING before pulling away. Even when there are 6 cars in line behind me. Just recently, I brought this up at the window (nicely) and she said, "I'll double check and make sure everything is there". I checked the bag while waiting on our second one, and we were already missing something. I do not understand the disconnect here. Also, when ordering things such as nachos bell grande or the fries bell grande, the toppings are just scooped dropped on in one spot (especially the beans and cheese). So you can put in the work to distribute the toppings. I've worked in fast food service before. I think if they slowed down a hair to make things a bit more accurately (because no one is expecting perfect), they'd find customers much more satisfied. I'm willing to bet people wouldn't even notice the few second difference in waiting when they receive good service and their items they actually ordered.

I only ever eat there for breakfast which is delicious but they never have their breakfast menu displayed in the drive through. Ever! And it's not like I am there at 5am, I'm talking 730am. This is my only complaint

So it's not that I have high expectations for Taco Bell but most days I do enjoy it. Tonight was not one of those nights. I decided to get a crunch wrap minus the lettuce. In turn I received back a crunch wrap with no meat except a small small amount at the very bottom. I usually receive better food at this location but it seems someone had overlooked the quality of my quick service dinner.

I do recommend that you use the Taco Bell app when you order. It's really easy to use and you can add and remove ingredients. I find the employees work better from that as opposed to telling them through the intercom.

The absolute worst Taco Bell in Columbus by far. The place is a dirty dump and nobody knows what they're doing. 

I've had so many bad experiences here (and I've gone to a lot of TBs across Columbus, and often) I can't even count. The worst was probably when I was on my lunch and I came here because it was the closest thing, and after I placed my order I waited for 25 minutes only for them to realize they forgot about it.

The food never fails to be dry, and gross. The employees seem like they have no idea what the hell they're doing because whenever I go in there it just seems like a complete mess of confusion and uncertainty. 

Literally just save yourself the trouble and go to ANY OTHER TACO BELL IN COLUMBUS or the Chipotle across the street.

This was by far the worst experience I've had with Taco Bell to date. First off, my party of 3 were attempting to order a small amount of food while the lady on the speaker was rushing us consistently repeating and cutting us off saying "is that all" or "anything else". Following this event, we arrive to the window, no one was wearing a mask, and they refused to give us a third large soda that we have ordered. They forgot to add to the order, we had to remind them so many times, and when we are finally getting to eat so many items are missing. I will never return to this Taco Bell, and I will never have proper closure from this night.

One of the women working here WAS NOT NICE, like she probably shouldn't work there because she hates it or was having a horrible day. I know this isn't a 5 star restaurant and we shouldn't have much expectations, we just want our food and to sit down, but this girl working clearly looked like she literally hated every person that walked in before they said anything. We should at least expect to not be treated like the least wanted customers on the planet.

We order. My order is right, my moms order, completely random. Her burrito supreme, just a burrito with meat and lettuce, wtf. Her gordita came out as just a taco. She went to the counter and pretty nicely asked for them to be fixed (we're not rude to people who fix our food for obvious reasons) but the woman who hated everyone, ignored her, when she got attention the woman working didn't bother to listen she just took the food to the back and started doing something. We get my moms food back and the burrito supreme still, no sour cream. We ask for a side of sour cream finally and get that. My mom was pretty frustrated at this point, didnt finish her food and we just left. I mean honestly. I would hesitate ever coming here again after the experience we had. Who in the world can treat complete strangers like that when your job is customer service. I hope she is mentally ok. 

I hate leaving a 1 star review because of 1 visit but I think that this warranted the 1 star. Someone should have sent her home. Customer service is not that hard, fake a smile if you're having a bad day or at least, stop scowling and ignoring customers.

WORTH THE WAIT!!!
The line was long and slow, but dear God the food was amazing!!! My fiancé said and I quote "this is the first time I've been to Taco Bell and they've absolutely killed it". On top of that, the staff was very accommodating and professional!

I read some of these reviews talking about how long it took to get food. I just figured people were exaggerating but there was no exaggeration. That drive thru took forever. I'm actually still in it... Just made it to the first window

Wow is all I can say after this recent experience at Taco Bell in Stoneridge Plaza in Gahanna. There is a sign in the window that they are having open interviews. They NEED to do interviews for new and more people. We walked in, we were after one person who had already ordered. There were maybe two cars in the drive-thru. After we ordered at the kiosk at the entry to the store, we waited and waited and waited some more. There were about six orders inside after us and probably eight cars waiting in the drive-thru. And waited some more. The manager was very put off having to answer a question to help us after we ordered at the kiosk - Apparently the kiosk is the god of the place and the people can't be bothered with anything if you've used it. No one would even look toward the counter to see if anyone needed anything, and trying to get anyone's attention was actively ignored. The people who ordered well after us got their food before ours came up, and the kid who was calling the names on the orders was randomly picking a name to yell. Our food was announced for Jennifer - that is not remotely my husband's name. At least it wasn't as bad as the poor guys after us while we waited to get some mild sauce - the kid called out Paul, and Paul went up to the counter to get his food, but it was really Bill's food. The kid didn't even apologize, just said "oh, it's Bill" when Paul didn't recognize any of the food in the bags as his.  There was no Jennifer in the place to try to get our food, so I guess we can look on the bright side there.  We walked out, and my husband said, "Looks like we need to find a new Taco Bell location if we ever want it again."  Sure does.

Worse Taco Bell....I sat in drive through for 15 mins...only 2 cars ahead of me.  After I got my order, left one item off, even though I paid and waited patiently.  Extremely pissed.  Def not fast food...

I came back and expressed my anger.....they made me a completely new order...faster than when I sat at the drive through the first time.
Great and fast service. We got in and out quickly with a friendly goodbye! Food was good!

I hate to say it, but sometimes late at night  or early in the morning nothing beats the Bell. This particular location is fast  and the staff is friendly. I was not inebriated  but still had that  once a year craving for tacos. I  had a soft taco supreme and a chicken chalupa. Tasted great and the drive through staff was nice for the 30 seconds we interacted lol. It's faSt food and it's Taco Bell so you know what your gonna get. It's delicious and a guilty pleasure at the same time. I'd still go back aardvark I know I will. Good food at reasonable prices. Also if you didn't know, Taco Bell has some of the healthiest fast food out there. Google it, it's true.

Food was not bad. Their prices are
Higher almost across
The board, as least what I order. I was told they were a franchise and not a "corporate" store. Doesn't justify higher prices but explains why there was no line. No thanks, corporate store right down the street. No need to be back.

So I grew up in the taco era. Amongst allergies,  there's crap that is just adding an extra ingredient to start the next new line up. Im very sick,  very broke, had just left enough energy to mining my very own coins of the the back seat to afford these delicious tacos from the chalupa box. 1. No substitution for better meat,  and definitely you used old burrito tortillas to be my "double decker", and I didn't even get to eat it. Being malnourishred from not being able to, and to finally get home and eat a decent meal. 

How come you always get the order wrong? How in the earth can you run an establishment that doesn't fluently know food phrases?

So thanks Taco Bell,

It was my attempt to feed a family of four for not much money, 

No amount of fixing will give me the energy to catch up, or retrieve the correct order today. 


They were s**t taco bell. I wouldn't even feed my dog with it. Is there a way to fix this?

I read the other reviews here and I'm dumbfounded. I agree with the long waits but I don't agree with the quality of food. 
Besides always getting the order wrong, the food we receive doesn't even come close to what Taco Bell tastes or looks like. 
Actually, so many ingredients are missing and what is there is subpar-not to mention it's a sloppy barren tasteless mess whenever we open our food. 
I love love Taco Bell and this is the closest around-but this is not Taco Bell food.

Edit to add:  Looking at the not recommended reviews confirms I'm not just unlucky on my visits here.

Excellent customer service! I've only used the drive thru but it is fantastic!
The service was prompt, accurate, friendly, and most importantly the food was great!
This is by far the best fast food restaurant I have ever been to!
Wish I could give it more stars!

If I could give this Taco Bell 0 stars I would.
Husband and I dined there couple days ago and we were infuriated!
Tables all dirty and we asked to have them wiped off and nobody did for us. A family comes in with little children out of control that immediately jumped up on the high chairs and climbed the metal railing practically up to the ceiling right across  from the cash registers where they store the high chairs and the seating area sits behind. Then I notice one  of their daughters maybe age 12? is running  through the restaurant barefooted! Since when is barefeet allowed in any eating establishment? I brought this up to one of the girls who finally came out from behind the check stands to wipe down some tables and she just mumbled some words and walked away and nobody did anything about it! Finally the mother of these out of control jungle children noticed the bare feet and told her daughter to go outside!
Taco Bell should have done something about all of this if you ask me! I will never eat at this one again!

Slowest drive thru ever. Everybody leaves the line and goes to another fast food on the strip. Was there on Thursday night and waiting twenty one minutes in the drive thru. Food was for my sick boyfriend but if it was for me I'd be out of there in a heartbeat

Update to my two star review prior.Fast food to go takes forever...  Like I'm taking 10+ mins for "fast" food.

And the customer service keeps getting worse.

Skip this Taco Bell.
The lady who gave me my food was screaming at her coworkers and didnt say a word to me. Before i could ask for a reciept she shut the window and walked away. HORRIBLE Customer service.

I have to say I don't go out often but when I do it's late because I work 12 hour shifts. They were backed up and the manager bigger guy with a beard a cool guy hooked me up. He apologized many times and as I am not in a hurry he explained some things. If I do go to Bell it will be this one.

The staff is friendly but The food is always thrown together and sloppy as if someone was in the biggest rush of their lives to make it. The orders are often incorrect. The restaurant itself is generally pretty dirty, especially the men's bathroom looks like it's cleaned once a week.  Overflowing trash cans and food on the floor, drinks spilled all over the soda machine. Just not what you want to see in an establishment that serves food, whether it's a Taco Bell or a 5 star restaurant
Service was less then desirable... Very rude employees and they tried to charge me twice for my meal ... Not happy
Took over 20 mins to get a Crunchwrap and a taco. Terrible service.  Staff was not taking things seriously

Taco Bell?  Five stars?  What's going on!?!

This place used to be a combination Taco Bell / Pizza Hut.  The food is exactly what you expect from either.  Why the five stars?  Because I had a bad day and wanted some soothing bad-for-you food and had this conversation in the drive through:

Female Cashier: Can I take your order?
Me: *scanning menu* Ummmm........Is the Pizza Hut stuff gone now?
FC: Yes sir.  They got rid of all of that on Valentine's day.
Me: Dude, that sucks.
FC: Yeah. It's about on par with Valentine's day.  *thoughtful pause* I could really use a breadstick right now...

Instant five stars.

As you have probably noticed from the reviews, this restaurant is really hit or miss. It really depends on the time of day; if you come here during dinner service, you might want to drive to Orange City instead.

We made an online order on Friday, November 16. We arrived at 6:00PM and had our order finalized and in the system at about 6:10. Our niece came with us. She ordered hers at the counter. Her order was ready (although had items that were incorrect) at 6:06PM.  So around 6:36 PM and our food wasn't up yet, my wife asked the clerk what the hold up was, while I sat and watched our newborn. 

We ordered:  3 value items for myself, and a chalupa box, NOTHING custom or complicated/special order. It should have been a very easy and quick to prepare order.

We both have low blood sugar, so the wait was already starting to make me nauseous.  During our wait, we witnessed a very loud worker complaining and about half a dozen disgruntled customers complaining about the wait and their order being wrong.

At first the clerk tried to make the excuse that we had to notify them at checkout we had an online order. I noticed what was really going on, in order to catch up on orders they were pushing the orders off the screen to focus on orders they could make quickly, until our order was completely pushed off the screen.

Somewhere way after 7PM we finally got our food. At this point we could have went to Orange City and ordered food twice and eaten twice in the amount of time this order took to prepare.

I really don't see going back there again anytime real soon. It is a shame too, this location is just around the block from us.

So if you really want to throw the dice in both order accuracy and service, then I HIGHLY recommend this restaurant - heck misewell keep it exciting right?!?  But if you want consistent service and accuracy, I suggest you skip this store all together, at least until they do some housecleaning or re-training. I really hope the manager reads this review.

I don't make it a habit to complain, but this store was so bad it actually warranted me contacting corporate, which I try to never do.

EDIT:
Just a quick sidenote too, the drivethru is probably one of the worst ones I have EVER seen, thats why we park and order to go. Also they have a habit of closing early or just ignoring you at the drivethru when its late at night. Its so bad, I honestly stopped even trying to use their drivethru service.

Unfortunately the taco they sold me was a very bitter taco shell. It tasted so awful I had no idea what was wrong with the hard taco shell. Maybe a 5 year old taco? I'm afraid to buy another taco. I hope their not serving old taco shells. I don't know if anybody else ate it.  It was very inedible.
This location usually has good service but when I visited in the past I found that other locations in the area do a better job of making the food itself, specifically the Power Bowl.
They always close early...... it will say their open and workers will be there but you pull up and you get a automatic message

Complete joke. It took over 45 
min to get our food and there was barely anyone in line. It seemed as though the employees enjoyed making the customers wait. Avoid this taco bell at all costs.

If, when you approach, you see a line of cars - maybe 4 or more - in the drive-thru, I would suggest you consider eating elsewhere if you were planning on dining in. This Taco Bell does not seem to handle a crowd very well. On the day I stopped, there was a line of more than 4 cars in the drive-thru, and about a half-dozen people in front of me just to get to the counter to place my order. It took them 21 minutes to deliver the food I ordered. 

Another interesting tidbit - the bistro tables have 3 seats, but the tabletops only have room for 2 trays.
I sat in a 4 car drive thru line for 30 minutes. It was a painful reminder why I never go to Taco Bell.

In an area that is constantly busy they worked hard to get my my food on time while being polite . To anybody putting one star . It's Taco Bell . And it's cheap so cut it out . This is my favorite Taco Bell in Portland , I still have lots of sauces leftover . And the water is free!

Horrible service. If there is more than one car in the drive thru plan to spend 20 minutes at the minimum. Prices are higher than any other location I've been. They hardly put any of the ingredients in your order and that's  even if they manage to get your order correct. Do yourself a favor and drive the extra 2 miles in either  direction and visit a better location.

I only ever eat there for breakfast which is delicious but they never have their breakfast menu displayed in the drive through. Ever! And it's not like I am there at 5am, I'm talking 730am. This is my only complaint. Update- stopped in last week at 730am. Nobody answered at the drive thru speaker so I pulled up to the window and knocked. After a couple mins a man appeared inside and motioned for me to leave very rudely.

I've always been very pleased with the food and the service at this particular taco bell. I think it rises above the others around.
   Today I was in a bit of a hurry and just wanted a quick seven layer burrito but the drive to look like it was 6 or 7 deep so I parked and went inside. It took them three and a half minutes on a very busy Saturday at noon to get me out the door.
Absolutely the worst ever.  Can pay attention To an order and you get sick when you see the track marks on her arm

I don't have high expectations for this location but I can't imagine messing up an order when it's displayed on a damn screen during midday with no rush hour traffic. Tacos supreme with no sour cream....Crunchwrap wanted with no sour cream and tomatoes, came with sour cream and tomatoes. Just burn the place down and start over.

Probably one of the slowest Taco Bell's ever.... waited almost 25 minutes in the drive thru one day and there were only two cars ahead of me! Then today I figured I'd just go inside and get something quick hoping it would be faster since there were 3 cars already in line for the drive thru...  luckily only took about 10 minutes this time. However, when I left I realized they got my order wrong.... kinda sucks. Wish they could at least speed it up here!
Dude it's 1130pm on a Thursday and you're not open? What is going on here? Just shut down already.

This is the slowest Taco Bell in all the land. You could go across the street and have a meal at the sit down Mexican place in the time it takes to get thru the drive-thru. 

And it's a Taco Bell, so the food is definitely not worth waiting for. I have written this entire review on an iPhone in the drive thru line and am still nowhere near getting my food.

Why do I come here?  I can't figure it out.  Either I hate myself or I just really don't want to go home.

Hands down the fastest I have ever been served at any Taco Bell! There was a line of cars that moved quickly. As soon as I got to the menu I was able to order without delay. When I got to the window, the crew seemed to be working together efficiently. The guys were super nice and the order was even right! Definitely worth the few extra minutes drive to save overall time and a boost of service from the other ones around Columbus!
awful!!! took 20 minutes for food that tasted like mothballs. employees rude AF. how are they in business?!?!

I spent $110 on two separate online orders that I was forced to put through twice and they refused to give me my order or refund me. Fix this. There's no reason a PAYING CUSTOMER should have to go to social media to get $110 back from this garbage can.

This tacobell always, 100% of time, gets my order wrong. Whether it being forgetting something, or getting beef instead of chicken, something is always wrong. I've called and talked to someone about this place getting my order wrong and she was really snarky about it. This place would be okay if it weren't for the orders always being wrong.

WORST experience at a drive through... EVER. it took them 10 minutes just to be ready to take my order and 45 minutes to make it. i counted 5 staff members inside. when i got home, my order was only partially correct. don't waste your time going through their drive through-- you're better off going to a busy place during lunch rush.

This Taco Bell absolutely sucks. Cold food, bad service. Was just here about 30 minutes ago, and fast service is great don't get me wrong, but at 4 in the morning I don't want my food to the window before I even pay. I want everything hot and fresh like it's supposed to be. I called about my food and was told they can't do anything they are closed! Why close at 4am if you are open all night. It's a 24 hour place if I'm not mistaken.. I will never be coming back and will be calling corporate on this store!

The only thing that differentiates a Taco Bell these days is the service and staff. So much is premade or premixed that the only variability is the Leadership skills in hiring and keeping people. WOW was this slow. 7:30 on a Monday evening and we were trapped in a 30 minute wait for standard menu fare. If this is due to their new complex menu, then they should go back to basics.

I use to love coming to this Taco Bell as I've lived here in Lake Nona for many years now. It's so crazy to me that back when there were much much much fewer choices of fast food places to eat... This location was pretty great, but I'm beyond frustrated with them now as I can easily say without exaggeration 8 out of the last 10 times I've gone to this location, they have messed up my order! I go out of my way to repeat my order to them before approaching the window, then once again before handing over my debit card and yet still there's constant disappointment each time. They always say and confirm that they've got it right and then it's not. You can't go here and ask for anything to be removed or added to your order because they will simply ignore it and give it to you how they want to. Such a shame for a place that use to be great.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS! Waited in the drive through for 30 minutes. I was in town to see a movie and had an extra 45 mins. We were going to go to Qdoba or Chipotle but thought it would be cutting it too close. We were wrong. We could have received our food, sat down and ate it for the same amount of time we waited in the drive through. And to top it off, once we got up to the window, some douche was waiting there apathetic. He reads our order and hands me my drink saying "...be sure to check this..." I took a sip and the drink was wrong. He also asked twice what sauce i wanted. So then we had to inhale the food on the way to the theater. I see other people on here have had the same experience. Avoid!
Stopped by for lunch. Plenty of parking and the service is fast. I loved it felt so homey inside. Met two awesome vets and chatted with them for a bit. The music was awesome 60s.
Was sooooooo excited to get home and eat my quesadilla, chips and cheese, and cinnamon twists...but not only did I NOT get my cinnamon twists y'all seriously gave me a fucking tortilla. ‍

I wish I would've looked at the other better views before I even came here. This review is a reflection of service not of the food itself, not because I didn't try to eat. I went inside and ordered my food to go and then I sat down. After about five minutes I noticed there were a lot of people sitting around without food. I started talking with another patron who told me she's been waiting for 20 minutes and that there was still other people that were in front of her. Finally she lost her patience and requested a refund after talking with me for about 10 minutes. I noticed that the service wasn't getting any better, So I requested a refund as well. I ended up walking over to the McDonald's in the same parking lot and eating there instead. I love Taco Bell and this is the worst location I've ever been to.

This Taco Bell location is below the border horrible. Not only is reviewer Tom C. right about how horribly he was treated with his drive-thru expereince (been through that myself), mice and rats scurrying throughout the parking lot and climbing along the ledges of the building (seen those critters at this location myself), but the interior dining room is disgusting as well. Just about as disgusting as all the filth on the floor and countertops are the attitudes of the staff who treat you like complete dirt. They summoned the Danvers police against me for doing nothing more that trying to take a seat for a bite to eat. I didn't complain or make a fuss about anything. The supervisors at this Danvers taco bell just prefer not to tell you if there's something wrong with who you are. Just easier for them to treat you like complete scum.  AVOID THIS PLACE LIKE THE PLAGUE !!

I'm sorry it's your job to hand me some tacos. You make more of an hourly wage than I do and I'm a very helpful and giving person. Don't put a shit ton of sauce on top of a box with no bag and have an attitude about. I love the food but I'm in the service industry and I'm tired of this shit. If you don't like your job then smile while you're doing it and look for another gig.

I've been holding back on reviewing this location with the hopes that they'll change but that has not been the case. I go to this location the most since it's close to home. But every time I go on a weekend night my orders are always either messed up or over cooked. I just got three chicken burritos and I bit into all of them and the rice was over cooked on ALL of them and no sauce on any of them. I know I sounds weird with the sauce but that's what makes them good and not only that but the customer service is almost all the the time not good either. I don't recommend this location. Hopefully they'll do something about this but I doubt it.

I have made the mistake of stopping here many times when I was in a hurry for something fast. If I was Taco Bell I would revoke their franchise and close this location, quite simply the slowest and rudest staff I've seen in a long tine. 0/5 stars is what they earned.

This is the worst Taco Bell you can go to. I would give this place no stars if I could because it's honestly what it deserves. If you want cold food made incorrectly or your order to have missing items then go here. They can never get an order right. I gave this place many chances and each time the either forgot items or got the order wrong. My husband asked for no lettuce because he is allergic and every time it still had lettuce. He wrote a review on the Taco Bell website and they called him to redo his order for free. He was happy that they were trying to make up for their mistake. Well nope they still managed to mess that order up and make the same mistakes he complained about the first time. Most of the workers here have a bad attitude too. If you go at night you'll notice almost all the workers sit outside the taco bell doors and smoke until someone shows up. Very very unprofessional. Hopefully they'll get new workers and managers soon  I'm having to drive an extra ten minutes to another Taco Bell now that actually makes the orders correctly and has good customer service
Kudos to the late night team who puts up with our drunk shenanigans.

Worst service ever. Came here one day when I had a spare 10 minutes at work (I'm a driver) and figured fast food would be... Fast. Nope. Took at least 15 minutes to get my 2 chicken tacos and they turned out to be steak. I was the only customer there! Thought they were having an off day but I'm writing this review from the drive thru and the wait is horrendous. Not to mention the girl taking orders is a dummy. It's funny because it totally shows that the owner of this place gives zero f**ks.
Got my order wrong. No meat in the tacos that were supposed to be crunch wraps. No straw or napkins and a rude ass attitude at the window. Waste of my $8.

I'm very disappointed that I got food poisoning from this taco bell location on the 6th. I came in at 7:13pm and ordered the toasted cheddar chalupa box and I became wicked sick an hour after eating from there. And later in the night I ended up going to the hospital from being so sick from the food! I lost 15lbs from throwing up so much and lost lots of fluids and there was no ice and barely any of the soft drinks available and the staff made me feel like I was inconveniencing them asking for some ice which is ridiculous I felt like a bother and nobody should feel that way in any food place. In conclusion I am very unsatisfied with the whole situation. I love the franchise and this all has completely changed my mind on it all.

Probably the slowest Taco Bell in Columbus.   Few nights ago it was out the entrance to the parking lot. I pulled in sat for three minutes did not move and left.  Thought I would give this location a second chance since it was Sunday 11:10 and only 1 car was already at the drive thru.  I pulled up to the board to order and was told to "please have a look at the menu and I'll be right with you.  A minute later I ordered pulled up to window. The same car I saw from the road was still at the window. Waited 5 more minutes before it pulled away.  I pulled up and was not even greeted the window just closed and the person was fooling around with the POS system.  I'm writing the review as I'm in the drive thru   Once he greeted me with what I owed I got my order promptly. I used to go here all the time but will start going elsewhere.  The service has really declined in the last couple months.
Dirtiest Taco Bell I've ever been in. Will definitely never be back. Pics are just a taste of how bad it actually was.

Do not come here. Online order wouldn't show up, and even though I had the dollar amount and the order and address, the manager refused service. I asked her what I could do (figuring I could just go home and cancel the order off my card), and she had no idea and said it wasn't their fault. So I managed to eventually get part of the order. I hate having to be a jerk with people, but she isn't the one I am upset with (even though she was rude). It's the franchise owners who have undertrained and understaffed right at soft opening that should shoulder the blame. I called corporate and the number is 1-800-822-6235. Got it straightened out in 5 mins. They were on the ball. Keep the number handy, You'll need it.

This is a great Taco Bell. Its in the same parking lot as Goodwill and Gymnastics USA and there is a LOT of free parking.

I like their crunchy tacos with fire sauce. The lettuce and cheese on the tacos are always super fresh and they are very generous with the meat which also tastes fresh, as if it was just cooked.

If they were smart, they would spread the stuff on a burrito the length of the burrito so you get a bite of everything at once, not all guacamole, then all hard rice, then beans and a few pieces of steak.
They are always out of almost their entire menu and the employees are always rude. I went the other night and all they had were regular hard and soft tacos.

Absolute garbage. Do not go here. They don't deserve to be called a taco bell. They always get my order wrong. They take too long and there chalupas are always stale. Also they charge more than other taco bells.
I swear this place messes up your order on purpose.  I don't know how else they could keep doing this over and over.  This isn't rocket science.
Waited in line at the drive through for 20 minutes. They didn't give me my receipt and shorted my cinnamon twists. This location used to be good.

I'll keep this short:

Slooooooooow.

Going here is like hooking up with a bad ex. You know it's not going to be the best experience, but you just need something familiar. Unfortunately as you already expected, after 20 minutes you get what you wanted- but without any satisfaction about how you got it. And keep telling yourself: "never again, never again". But you know. You know you will be back.

It's hit or miss at this location, half the time I get what I ordered, half the time I don't even after confirming multiple times the specifics of the order ( e.g- ordering bean burrito getting a chicken burrito / asking for no sour cream but getting a mountain of sour cream ). 

They're generally pretty friendly and the service is usually pretty quick, unfortunately it's the only taco bell near by for us so it's our only option.  Dining room is clean and drive through never takes entirely too long.

No Taco Bueno!
Tuesday, 5:30 picked up their pack of tacos. (Regular) They pack them in a heavy cardboard box, right? Got them home and half were broken, like someone had intentionally crushed them as they put them in the box. Also, the extra thin shells are not what they used to be, so this contributed. 

What a mess! Not going back here! No Buenco!

Worse now than before. I just went through the drive through...they didn't have beef...
I ordered chicken as a replacement, I was handed a bag missing ALL sides I'd paid for and missing a burrito, plus the one thing they remembered to put in the bag had lettuce that id specifically asked to not have lettuce.
I had those items corrected, and then upon returning home I unwrapped a rice and been burrito that id asked for queso and light beans...to be 99% beans and almost ZERO cheese and NO queso...even though I was charged for it.
The cheesy roll ups I ordered had almost no cheese and the tortillas were hard and crusty...
Honestly, this is messed up.
I should NOT have spent money here

Any other night this location is awesome. Well, not this past Friday night!!! So this is honestly the only location closest to us besides Thornton road which I refuse to go to. Me and my fiancé comes through the drive thru at this location, place an order, pull up to the window and pay only to be asked to pull to the front of the store to wait on our food. Let me remind you, this is about 10:30-11:00 at night with maybe, MAYBE!! 5 cars in the parking lot. So we pull up to a parking space and sat there for literally 40 freakin' minutes for our food to come out and well, THE FOOD WAS COLD!!!!!!  In complete dismay, we took our food from the fella that was working drive thru, (might want to do a drug test hince the smell...) and sat there eating cold food. I'm completely disappointed about how the service of this location is going downhill. Hopefully service will be better next time we come through!!

Worst fast food place I've ever been in my life. Some bald dude who looked like squidward straight up forgot to give me any receipt when he totally messed up my order. We simply wanted our right order, but he decided to argue and accuse us of lying. Had to wait about 10-15 minutes for food as well. I work at Chick-fil-a and can't believe that this was tolerated by the managers. This Taco Bell, especially, is by far the absolute worst fast food location I've ever been to. Also I want that bald dude fired, he's literally nuts.

This Taco Bell runs out of hot sauce every time I go there! I will be driving to Kyle from now on! When I asked the drive through attendant why they never have hot sauce she just smiled! How does a Mexican quick service place run out of HOT SAUCE! The general manager should be relocated to a McDonalds!
This was a great taco bell! Breakfast was hot and served quickly. The person who took my order was very sweet and repeated the order to make sure it was correct. Very friendly service.

I ordered a steak questorito and it was straight tortilla after 4 bites. I went back to have it fixed and the manager who speaks Spanish. I said " hey can you fix it it's straight tortilla and I use to work at a Taco Bell and that's not how we made our burritos." The first thing he says is the meat portion is all the same. I don't care for the meat I'm just not a fan of just tortilla. I forgot to mention when I first pulled up to the window to fix my burrito he was standing rlly far from the window and gives me a huge attitude that he couldn't hear me. I told him you are far from the window I can't do anything if you are far from the window. Overall the service was awful. I regret coming here I would have just asked for a refund but I know it takes long.

My first visit and my last visit. Soft tacos, kinda grey lettuce, smear of meat, served with ice cold cheese. Since the whole meal was cold, I couldn't eat the second one. I'm not sure why anyone would eat at Taco Bell.

I wish I can give 0 stars. They knew they were out of medium and large drinks, but still charged me for them in the drivethru; then, during checkout, they made me pay first, then handed me food, and drinks last... they came in the 8 oz cup... They are a bunch of thieves who think they can do whatever the F they want... This is unacceptable for any place. 

TACO BELL... IF YOU KNOW THAT YOU ARE OUT OF CUPS, THEN DON"T UPSELL ME THE DRINK...

Dishonest TacoBell/KFC -- I have given fair warning...
Like the tenth time 30 plus wait time. at least this time at the register they said you sure it's at least 30 minute wait before we ordered. We obviously bailed and enough enough won't be back.

Just moved closer to this location unfortunately and i'm always scared to order anything at this location. They cannot make any special orders not to mention, i went the other day and was given somebody else's order. I ordered cool ranch taco supremes which are like 2 bucks each and a bean burrito and i ended up with 3 plain tacos and a steak burrito. I was disappointed as usual. maybe the day crew is better...

Ever since they got new staff the service is HORRIBLE!! 
Attention to customer are beyond poor! It seems to always be the females that give the worse customer service and today was my last straw! Came home to all my food smashed... which I would normally not make a big deal about but this is how my Mexican pizza looked like when I got home! So on top of the horrible attitude I got at the window I get smashed COLD shitty food!

Just went in with my son. He ordered buffalo nacho fries and when we got our order, no fries. When I tell the cashier, she gets an attitude and tells me I ordered nachos with cheese. This is tue, but my son ordered the fires and that was his only order. So she goes to the back and they make a comment insinuating they weren't ordered. Not my problem that the cashier didn't ring my sons order up right, but I know what he ordered, I told them three to get me my fries. Never got them. What a joke.

I'd like to know how 3 employees on staff can't handle 3 cars in the drive thru?! I waited in the drive thru for 20 minutes with 2 cars ahead of me. Once it was my turn to arrive to the window I had another 4-5 min wait..for what? One burrito, one nacho, and one fry? Y'all need to drug test y'all employees..only marijuana make people move that damn slow

If you want to wait in line (whether it's the drive thru or waiting inside) for 15+ minutes, get hair in your food, & ALWAYS & I mean ALLWWWAAYYS get your food with missing items that you paid for, only to call the store 5+ times & have them not answer, then this is the place to go! Service is terrible, food ALWAYS takes way too long to come out & the employees are extremely rude. Every time I come to this location, or any Taco Bell matter of fact, something is always wrong. I stopped going to Taco Bell for awhile because I was fed up & figured I'd go again tonight since my mother in law was in town & they forgot several items, took 17 minutes IN THE DRIVE THRU, & I got home to realize I'm missing 3 items. So fed up. Deff going to Wendy's next time.

I just watched the employees at Taco Bell make my dinner and numerous other people's dinner and I was impressed. There teamwork was great. I know my order was made right because I could see them fix it. And I'm sure it's going to taste great. I suggest that there be a little more smiling amongst the employees though. Thanks Taco Bell.

I ordered a vegetarian quesorito (which was half empty) and a vegetarian crunchwrap supreme (was definitely not vegetarian). The hot sauce packets were sticky and covered in dried food. Won't be heading back.

Just avoid this Taco Bell.

The food is great but the employees and even the managers are completely disrespectful and rude. Legitimately threatened me. Now I have to worry about my car being messed with at my place of work. At least I'll know its them. I wouldn't go here anymore. Just so terrible and unprofessional. The manager told me if I had a problem that I can "come through" like she wants to physically fight me. That's real nice. They need more education in their lifes and some lessons on treating others the way you would want to he treated! I'm 100% going to corporate and whoever else to get this place either shut down or have some of these employees that cause problems to be fired.
This place, moreso than other Taco Bell's always gives me the poops... not gunna lie. It's kinda messed up my nights.
Half of the staff didn't understand English and i didnt get my order right at least my soft tacos were fine

I was in this neighborhood and already in line and had placed my order before I read the reviews. Otherwise I probably would not have gone here. I kept my fingers crossed, paid and hoped for the best. 
I ordered a $5 box which came with a burrito supreme and I asked for mine with no beans. They got it right! Also, my cup of nacho cheese was full, unlike some of the previous reviews I read.   The other items were fine too. A drink came with the meal and I ordered unsweetened iced tea. It tasted odd. Couldn't quite put my finger on why. It wasn't great but also not terrible, just odd. Only order this if you are really really hungry. It was too much food and I ended up throwing part of the meal away. Just too much food! 
The woman who took the order was so nice and so pleasant! She should be doing some training on how to treat people at a drive thru window. I did sit in line for awhile, but there were 6 cars in front of me. I waited about 9 minutes.
Since everything about my visit was pretty good, I'm wondering (hoping) if a manager has been reading the reviews on this location and has been working on improving things. This location still doesn't look neat and clean so that part still needs some help. Hopefully many things about this location are on the way to great improvement!
order is wrong 50% of the time or an item is missing. the tables inside are always absolutely filthy.

Had a rude experience today. Came through the drive thru and got yelled at by the employee. She said "what you want"? Seriously that was irritating. She rushed me through the whole ordering process. When I got to the window to pay she snatched my card and asked me did I want sauce with a attitude. I said yes I would like Diablo. She was talking to someone in the back and ignored me completely by dangling my bag out the window. I grabbed it and drove off just to see that she didn't give my sauce. Not one. I asked for my food to have no ranch and it has ranch. I asked for Doritos taco and got regular. It's just so irritating when you don't get what you paid for and it was not a pleasant experience. I will never go back here again.
One of the nicest Taco Bells out there, might be the location but the service is awesome. Clean, fresh and fast. Great staff !!!!
This particular TB, on Narcoossee, is excellent on getting the order correct.  The food seems freshly prepared, the staff is friendly, and for a drive-thru it's as efficient as it gets.

At this point I wish I could post a review about then messing up my order but I can't... I never get to order! They are usually out of what I want or their system is down!! I just don't think the employees want to work after 10pm!!!!

This must be a new or remodeled Taco Bell. It was one of the cleanest I've ever been in. 

They had self serve ordering that was easy and fast to use. 

My taco supremes were what you expect from Taco Bell.

This is the second time I've gone to this location for nobody to serve us. We sat at the drive thru speaker for 10 minutes and no response from anyone. Nobody else in line and one car in the parking lot. Go down the street to the university Taco Bell.
I've ordered from here multiple times and they still can't get the order right! And it's cold and when I receive it.

The most terrible place to order food. Could not hear to order over loud rap music coming from inside restaurant.After order, there were several issues, and when calling the restaurant, we were ignored. When we attempted to approach the restraunt, the employees ignored my knocking on the door, and hid inside. Finally, we pulled back through the drive through, and got our order fixed. The manager refused to own up to the mistake, instead blaming a "new employee". Customer "service" at its worst.
Honestly, I love tbell, this is the best one ive been to. Everyone is always nice even if the line is packed. My food has been messed up once out of the hundreds of times Ive been here

This place gave me a very unorganized impression and really pissed me off, I paid for 3 Doritos locos SUPREME tacos and they only put cheese and lettuce, honestly I ate the first cause I was like ok whatever maybe is just this one but pisses me off cause I still got charged for supreme on the 3 pieces  
I called the store and talk to the manager and well at least She apologized and offered me to get another one but nah I hate having to come after I drove all the way back home to find this surprise.
The service I was always nice and fast. The food tastes great and hot/fresh. Been to a lot of Taco Bell's this one is definitely my favorite!

Screw this place. I used to love this Taco Bell so much. Would drive out of my way to get food from it. Until tonight when I got food and decided to tip the guy, which I'll do some times. Skinny tiny white boy with glasses and tattoos. He asked me if I wanted sauce and I replied, "as much as they'll let you give me." He walked away and gave my tip to some girl at the front counter that he clearly fancied and when he gave me my bag he was quick to shut the drive through window on me and didn't even say "have a nice day". I looked in my bag and there was ZERO sauce. Not a single packet of sauce. Not even an empty sauce packet. I'm not going back as long as that disrespectful child works there. Pay for your stupid tattoos on your own bill, kid. Maybe try community college. You'd fit right in.

This was the worst Taco Bell ever I am in the drive through I order boxes tacos drinks everything I come up to the drive through pay ask for sauces get home to see half of my food is missing I called called called no one answered that was the worst experience the next day I call no one picks up.

Holy hell, I gave this location another chance because it's so close to my house. What a mistake. I should have continued to stay away. They sealed my bag since the whole CoVid issue. Got home. 2 out of the 4 items missing. And 1 of the 2 that made it home was ok. The other was disgusting. I was worried the employees tampered with it or something. I tried calling the location from the phone number listed on Google, no answer. Complained on Taco Bell's website and requested a response, which I still haven't heard back from. I want it to be known that I love Taco Bell, usually. This location should be closed.

I wanna say whoever works at the drive thru with that red hair should get fired . Simply if you don't like your job then quit nobody feels bad for you at all . And exactly why you're working at a fast food place , I simply asked for more hot sauce packets and she onlu gave me one for three Tacos I sat there in my car honked my horn and she ignored me . This location should get shut down due to the lack of respect these employees have . So F this place never going back, I should just go back and buy 100 tacos . And throw it at them cause they'll end up giving me 1 packet of hot sauce . Seriously , Taco Bell you already taken so much shit away and hiring whoever . Shame on you guys

My favorite fast food place in the neighborhood!
This Taco Bell is holding me together through the fever dream that is 2020 and 2021. Online ordering is a breeze and makes ordering during COVID times easy. They always make my order correctly and are super friendly. I wish they hadn't cut the store's hours, but, eh, it's still tasty.

Worst experience ever. Received the wrong food, chips were stale, crunch wrap supreme was completely opened and falling all over the place. Didn't get the sauce or fork I specifically asked for and the employee was rude. So disappointed.
do not go to this taco bell. ive been in the drive through for over 40 minutes. im writing this while sitting at the windos. i wish i could give 0 stars!!

When you are attempting to give the restaurant the benefit of doubt but the employees are yelling at each other the entire store isn't cleaned it's time to leave. This store is taking applications store #034778 maybe they will get better as time moves on.

I've been working in the area for 11 years now. Over those 11 years this Taco Bell has gone further and further down hill but it was never very good to begin with. My order has rarely been correct and even rarer are the items made correctly. Also, I guess they don't believe in masks, because no one I saw, was wearing a mask what so ever. Makes me wonder if they are wearing gloves, or doing any other necessary sanitation measures. The front window has been busted out and boarded up for over 2 months now so obviously the operators are putting 0 to no money into the place. Today when I got cheesy Gordita crunch the wrapper was so stuck to the shell that I couldn't get it out without ripping it off,  causing it to not even resemble its former self. It's also one of the more pricey items on the menu, so you'd think they at least try to make it correctly. Not at this location! Today was the first time I had been back to this Taco Bell in almost a year because the quality is usually so bad. I guess some things never change. Won't be giving it another try though, that's for sure. Just go across the street to zaxbys or right around the corner for Wendy's. This location will leave you disappointed every. single. time. Taco Hell is a more appropriate name.

I'm not sure this is the correct location.   I'm currently sitting in the parking lot after eating lunch.  I walk in and a homeless man is sleeping on one of the benches INSIDE.  I asked if the potatoes were fresh.   Manager said yes they've been out 15 minutes.  I said that's not fresh.  So I ordered a nacho bell grande with no tomatoes, no sour cream plus EXTRA, EXTRA nacho cheese.   Nachos didn't have extra cheese.  Mind you about 10-15 minutes later woman employee walks over and wakes homeless man up and gives him food, then proceeds to take him outside offering him a cigarette.  A short while later I go sit in my company work vehicle.  The man is getting aggressive with me for $$$ & smokes!!!   Thanks taco bell employees who condone this behavior.   A short while later I go back inside and ask for a general manager number as also no phone number listed on receipt.  I get told I can't have it.  Excuse me!?!  I then ask for a local number and I'm asked why!?!  Excuse me!?!   I'm paying for my food and your GIVING a homeless person food who's inside the establishment I'm eating at and paying for.   WOW!!  Again I'm not sure this is the right location but I do have my receipt.  I'm at the one directly across from clackamas town center!!
If there's a more pathetic business in the world I'd be amazed. They are RARELY open. Seriously. 830AM will y the breakfast light on "please visit us during normal business hours".
I didn't know when you order taco with just lettuce, you only going to get shell with lettuce, no meat! This place has no customer service. The young kids run this slowest place in a world.

I was on drive- through  they took  40 min to take my order, when I  when to the  windows they were playing on the kitchen without said in anything to me, they took my order wrong and  I ask for a  manager and she did dont  did anything. They just playing around.

Happy to report customer service and food have improved. The bad reviews were correct, food was barely ever serviced warm and doesn't taste like good Taco Bell. The drive through service sucked too. This went on for a year. However I went twice in July and found everything had improved, no wait, food served hot, food tasted good, drive through employee bad good customer service.

I truly hate this location. They answer the drive thru as if you're bothering them. I ordered a Black Bean Crunch Wrap with no sour cream or tomatoes. Literally half of my crunchwrap was straight tortilla on tortilla, nothing else. Barely any black beans or other ingredients. I know I'm vegetarian but My God... I still enjoy food. The tortilla was EXTREMELY stale. I ended up ripping a lot off to avoid cutting my mouth. 

If I pull up at Taco Bell at 2am on a Saturday night I expect horrible food, however this was 4pm on a Wednesday. They KNEW they gave me this trash crunchwrap and didn't care. I've worked fast food and even on my worst days I at least tried to give the customer their money worth. This was such a waste. I'm genuinely pissed I wasted $3.99 on this considering I had to throw half of it away. Between this location and the one on Jimmy Carter I'm done with Taco Bell. Del Taco is further but they're customer service is much better. Get it together.

Staff not wearing mask while making food. Order taker wearing mask around mouth while rubbing her nose and saying she is nauseous. And then had attitude when requested money back. I understand times are rough with covid.  But no excuses for the attitudes. Also manager never told them to fix there mask, even though she had a mask on.

Fast food to go takes forever here.

I've been to this Taco Bell six or seven times now and though they MOSTLY get the order right, it takes forever and there isn't good service. They have been out of various items on occasion, short staffed it seems quite often, the lines are sometimes backed up, and the fast food order screen is broken to the point where you cannot see if your order is right or not. 

The food when you finally get it is... warm at best. The tacos must have been hot at some point, because they are melted to the wrapper often, meaning that the entire taco falls apart once it opened. It doesn't seem like the staff cares or communicates with each other. It is just tough to get anything here that you don't immediately feel like you're regretting your purchase right after the fact.

Update to my two star review prior...

Fast food to go takes forever... 

And the customer service keeps getting worse.

Downgrading my review today. We are on diets and were low of food intake so stopped by. Looking on our app we picked the soft taco at 190 calories.  
The beef was chewy and flavorless. I know it is a cliche but the beef tasted like cardboard.

We live near this Taco Bell location. I swear no matter what hour of day you come, there's a long line. Expect to wait 10-15 min minimum for this FAST FOOD "mexican". I'm not sure what takes them so long. The food comes out decent most of the time but the wait time isn't worth it. Usually the employees are nice so that's kind of a good thing. I've come late at night before and have never been told their credit card machines aren't working, or their lights are off, or some excuse to not serve me. I've experienced all those things at the Morse Rd. location more than once. That location is waaaaay worse.

I'm having my attorney file a lawsuit against Taco Bell for violating my Constitutional and religious freedoms by knowing or have known your employees mixed meat and cheese against my dietary laws, which are further compounded by the fact we are vegetarians. The meat you sell is one grade above pet food. 

You guys served us meat when we ordered vegetarian. Today I stood in line 10 minutes, never got service, nor anyone else, because your entire staff could not find a receipt for a customer who appeared he should have not been released on a day pass from a facility...you people SUCK!

Previously I wrote this: I have watched this Taco Bell being built and love that it is so close to where I work by PDX Airport. The service is fantastic, the food is great, bathrooms clean, and it's located in the new PDX Travel Center by the airport.
The burrito and the taco.....delicious but the service was horrible my mom that doesn't speak English the employees were inpatient and low key really rude

Came here to redeem 5 dollar chalupa box promo for free. I downloaded app today and registered, but app crashed when I was in line.  Offer said order online or drive through and a button to redeem offer.  I asked for manager ezra or something like that and said she knows the offer and problems and can't do it for me.  Guess I will never go back to taco hell
Stopped by a different Taco Bell to see if they had the newest taco in the menu and it's not here. However, still ordered their (3) taco & drink deal.

I tried ordering at the kiosk twice to eat in the dining room and had errors both times when trying to checkout my order. I then went to order at the counter, but no one was manning it. Someone came from the back and asked if I needed something, to which I said "yes". He told me he couldn't help me and the person who could was in the restroom. The person in the restroom returned three mins later and took my order. It took 24 minutes to receive my food and I was missing four items. I waited 15 more minutes to receive two beef chalupas and two cinnamon twists.

The staff had NO sense of urgency and the "manager" was unapologetic, almost mad at me for being upset and coming up with excuses for why the service was bad (understaffed, new job, etc). They told me the that could not process refunds because the only person that could do so was not at the restaurant and had to drive in from 20 mins away. There were three other groups waiting for food that somehow disappeared from the order processing system at the restaurant.

The situation got so bad that the "manager" threw his hands into the air, told an employee to lock the door and stop taking orders inside the restaurant, and then presumably went to his office. I did not see him again. This all happened at 7:30 pm, well before the dining room was to close.

The biggest issue I had was that this Taco Bell used to be efficient and hadn't messed up any of my orders in years. I liked the design of the interior and felt comfortable eating there. They have since redesigned the entire restaurant and it now is white, cold, and boring. The staff is all new and don't seem to care about their jobs or pleasing customers. To top off the whole experience, my credit card was still charged even though the kiosk order was unsuccessful and didn't show up on their system.

I may give the location another attempt at good service in  a few weeks, but overall this was the worst fast food experience I have ever had.

This Taco Bell is the closest one to me, which is why I go here so often.  Let me start with some advice.

I highly recommend that to enter the Taco Bell parking lot, you turn right at the street which, when heading north, is immediately before the Arby's.  Then take the first opportunity to turn left.  This puts you into the Arby's parking lot, but if you veer to the right you will be able to get into the Taco Bell parking lot - turn immediately to your left once on Taco Bell property to actually get into the ordering lane.  After you place your order, try to take the turn to the pick-up window slowly and carefully - they are about 10 feet short of the amount of space needed to let you get close to the window if you are at all sloppy.  After you pick up your food, proceed with tremendous caution, because people who tried to go into the Taco Bell parking lot through its only dedicated driveway will (potentially) be two seconds from running you down.

And that's really why I can't give this Taco Bell more than three stars.  It's a bit of a logistical nightmare.  The service is decent - probably 80th percentile for all central Ohio Taco Bells.  There are almost always clean tables and recently attended-to soda fountains inside; the syrup-to-carbonated-water balance is rarely off by much if anything.  It looks like the place has been renovated in the last two or three years.  They almost never goof up on my somewhat picky order.  I would say that on those grounds, ignoring the logistical issues, this is one of my favorite Taco Bell locations (I am familiar with Taco Bell locations in six or seven states and have eaten at least fifteen or so in Ohio.)  I just have to kind of gird my loins for battle before going here.

I guess it's been awhile since I've visited this particular Taco Bell. For some unknown reason they no longer take orders at the counter or your money they have to cram together electronic order boards.

Those require a card to pay and I wanted to pay cash.
No way was I going to trust the security at a Taco Bell with my credit card.

If there was a cash option it wasn't made obvious enough when I walked in.
I turned around and walked out.
This is a serious issue and I will never be back.

this location is so disappointing it's not even funny. They close so early. I've been told they ran out of beef before. I have no clue how a Taco Bell runs out of beef. There customer service is trash. They're not responsive at the drive thru until you say something. I don't expect much at all from a Taco Bell but like how can you hire such morons???

First off I love Taco Bell. It has been my go to fast food for many many years. You can also see that I never leave reviews but this place has forced me to. I just recently moved to Buda and I have been to this Taco Bell probably 5 times. This last order was the last straw. EVERY single order has been screwed up in some way. And the food has just been horrible. Taco supremes minus the supreme, stale nachos, fiesta potatoes with maybe 5 potatoes in a cup, chalupas rock hard and stale etc. I could understand an off night but this is just ridiculous. I will be joining the rest of the reviewers on here and going to Kyle from now on.

Went here to try the new Fiery Doritos Locos Tacos. They didn't place the taco in a shell sleeve so when I bit into it, the tortilla shell fell apart; basically shattered. 

I also ordered a cheesy gordita crunch. However, when I picked up my order it wasn't there, so I had to remind the employee "didn't I order a cheesy gordita crunch too?" She responded after checking, "oh. I guess so." And of course she quickly made that, without any attention to detail. And of course there was issues; the tortilla inside was even set properly and the filling was all over the place. 

Overall, a very disappointing experience. I enjoy Taco Bell overall but will be hesitant to revisit this specific location again.

Disgusted. I ordered a quesadilla the other day to go, and I wouldn't have ate the thing they handed to me if they paid me to eat it. It was burnt onto the plastic wrapper it was served in, and it stunk of burnt tortilla smell. The beef was practically nonexistent, which, come to think of It, it might have been better if it had not existed at all. It was disgusting to say the least. And the cheese was rubbery. My fingers were covered in oil after picking up the flat greasy quesdilla, peeling it from the wrapper in which it had melded itself to in the process. It was such a disappointment I couldn't bring myself to eat it. I understand fast food is fast food, I don't expect fine dining, but this was just ridiculous.  I wouldn't even feed my dog what they served me.

I work in f&b so I needed a quick snack. Thanks for not acknowledging a customer when you were clearly open for another hour. 

Lazy af employees.

Also.. check reviews from people who live/work nearby. We all think you're lazy and screw up orders... IF you even take them.

Worst place ever I Definitely do not recommend this place they always have our oldest wrong they're always in a rush to get you out service is bad 
They always get your drinks wrong and every time I get some hard tacos they're always Falling apart...I live in the neighborhood and they always tell me not to go there but is the closest Taco Bell not not recommend at all

Awful.  Food clearly sat out all day. The food was as warm as the puddle of ice cream resting at the foot of a young child who has fallen asleep at the pool with his cone, as fresh as JNCO jeans and as tasty (as much as Taco Bell can be) the 2005 McDonalds filet-o-fish that someone thought should be freeze dried and opened like a time capsule treat. Would recommend licking the pictures on the windows instead of eating the food.

I am always amazed at the quality of service I get at the drive through. Every time I go through the drive through, the person will say, "Hi, how you doing? Whenever you are ready." What ever happened to, "Thank you for choosing Taco Bell, may I take your order please?" The food is ok. My oldest son loves it. For a cheap meal, it is ok. If you are just looking to get in and out and pay no attention to the attitude you get in the drive through, then you are fine. (The Burger King in Kyle is not much better either.) I have sat at the drive through window for a few minutes waiting for the girl to stop paying around and take my order. Save your money, hit up one of the other places and drive past this place with the quickness.

Ever since the rebuild in 2013 this place has crashed and burned, worst Taco Bell in Columbus, possibly USA. Avoid at all costs, go to the one on High Street. Food is cold and looks as if made by a 4 year old, drive thru takes 10 years, and in house staff are rude, tables are disgusting, bathrooms reminiscent of Montezuma, and odds are they will ignore you while flirting/yelling at each other for thirty minutes. No responsibility, interest in customer satisfaction, or self improvement. I've given them several tries while they have trained new staff, one year in and they earned a big fat fail. Should have just left this one torn down.

This is probably the worst Taco Bell in Central Florida. Ordered on the app at 2:02, app said the food would be ready in 3-5 minutes. The bag of food was rudely given to us at 2:28, after waiting in front of the counter for 25 minutes. The cashier finally made his way to the register 15 minutes after we entered the restaurant with a customer waiting for 10 minutes without any acknowledgement. We had to ask 2 employees to give us our drinks and upon opening the tacos and burritos we were met with the smallest line of ground beef and a few shreds of lettuce. Worst of all, the app charged almost $2 more than the order total and the employee said he couldn't even find it in his register, and didn't care to offer an apology for the wait or hassle. After 20 minutes of waiting he said the food was being made right now, even though the restaurant had 2 cars in the drive thru and 3 customers besides us the entire 40 minutes we were there. Head to any other location besides this one for Taco Bell.

absolutely terrible experience. forgot half of our food, they could have ATLEAST checked our bag before handing it out the window. had to drive all the way home, to drive all the way back to fix our order.
Sat at the drive thru for 4 mins at about 9:30pm...I could see someone in the window, drove up in case it was a tech issue, and they laughed and turned away.

Why do I keep coming here instead of driving the extra 5 minutes to Kyle. Every time I go you are out of a MAJOR ingredient. Tonight it was beef. Last time it was beans.  Time before that damn near all the veggies. And tonight's quesadilla was just a tortilla folded in half. Barely any cheese and NO sauce. I just don't get it.

Honestly, I've eaten a lot of chalupas but this was the best I've ever had from Taco Bell. I feel like people should know that this location has improved significantly over the years. Everyone was following proper safety protocols and extremely polite, and they moved the line along efficiently.

This location could be so much better.
I entered the lobby to place a quick order.
Thank soon realized that this Taco Bell uses the ordering kiosks for the customer to lace their own order.
After placing my order and selecting the cash payment option I stood and waited and waited and waited...
The lady that arrived soon after I did received her order from an extremely rude employee and after a total of 20 minutes waiting to even be acknowledged by a Taco Bell worker I was told that they didn't have any other lobby to-go orders.

I left without food, Will NOT be back to this location until I see their ratings  improve. 

Thane on you, Taco Bell. Advancement and improvements should not sacrifice customer service.

Would give zero stars if possible...I called to ask a question and the employee answered with "hi" in a very monotone unenthusiastic voice and I had to ask who is this cause it sounded like it was a random person and all he says is "I'm Eddie..." so I'm like okkk and is this Taco Bell...and I get a "yeah." Please teach your employees how to properly answer a phone and sound like they don't hate their life!

Never been to this location and never will go back. Rude staff members. Called the restaurant asking if they will honor the free chalupa box for today as the app crashed and the man that answered the phone said "uh yeah but we are running low on stuff to put in it." So I was like alright let's try it so my sister and I drove all the way there and waited in the drive thru line for 15 min. When I got to the speaker I politely asked again and the same man says no sorry the app is down. Then a female rudely jumps into the conversation saying "no we're not doing that" and as I said I called prior and was told differently. Then she goes " well who did you talk to" and I said idk that man  who answered the phone by just saying hi and she starts getting angry etc. I would've ordered something different but I was so appalled at her rudeness that I said thanks and drove away. Not how you talk to customers.

Tryed the Nachos BellGrande for the first time.
The staff's focus at 11:30 on a Friday was on the drive through with at least 8 cars in waiting.
The chips in my nachos were fresh, the meat tasted a little more like beef than cardboard this time, beans were just okay and I have serious doubts there is any dairy at all in the yellow sauce they call cheese. Tomato bits seemed fresh.
They seemed to be under staffed for lunch today.
Not sure how others' experience was at this Taco Bell but personally this was the cleanest Taco Bell I've ever been to. Food came out fast and correct as well. Thank you!

One star is too much for this place.   Order came out wrong and I was yelled at and told it was my fault by the African American clerk.  Told them I wanted to talk to the manager and she got more rude and mad.  Manager did refund my money and try to give me my food for free which I did not take cause that's not the point.  The whole time I dealt with the manager the clerk continued to run her mouth.   Never again
While the food here was decent, the customer service was lacking as well as cleanliness. This is not by far the worst TB we have ever visited,  but there are others in the area we prefer.

How could it be that we have found another awesome Taco Bell. We stopped in for dinner at this well lit and very clean location. The crew was friendly and attentive. The food was made just the way they did back in the day. Tacos were filled to the top and the food presentation told us the employees were trained properly and cared. We will definitely return to this location!

I was given the wrong order. Overpaid for a bag of cheap tacos when I ordered chalupas. The young man at the window did not greet me and only handed me the bag without even saying thank you. I am very disappointed in the service. Check your order before leaving, especially in these current COVID times when good service seems to be lacking.

This Taco Bell is continuously horrible food and service wise. We have tried this location multiple times and it gets worse each time. We tried to be helpful and use the app so we could *hope* our order would be correct and we have been pulled forward to wait- no one even brought our food out and we had to go back through the drive thru and another time they pulled us and didn't bring us the right food or all of our food.
