The manager even brought the food to my car and said she checked it? 
I called back and they were pretty rude and acted like i was an inconvenience because I wanted to right food and all of the food we paid for. 

I was going to go inside and talk to them about my order because they have posted that the inside is now open for carry out only, but unfortunately they kept all of the doors locked so no one could actually go inside anyways. 

Needless to say I would strongly advise going to cemetery or broad street instead. Not worth the time or effort at this location.
Don't listen the stars. Great service, dare I say perfect service. Out of this world food! Thank you Taco Bell for bringing joy to joyless.

I found myself awake this morning at an unpleasantly early hour, mostly due to the fact that neither my cat nor telephone spammers (...it's more of a trapezoid really) understand the definitions of the terms "boundaries", "It's too early for this shit", or "I drank a lot of wine last night".

So since I was up before dawn on a Saturday, and I neither hunt, nor go mall walking in a tracksuit, I decided to treat myself (in the absolutely loosest interpretation of that idea) to a sampling of Taco bell's new breakfast menu. Luckily enough for me, there's a Taco bell directly across the street, well within walking distance.

Not that I walked there mind you, I was already about to eat Taco Bell for breakfast so I figured why not just go 2-0 for failure and drove the 100 feet.

The staff appeared busy, as if the concept of slapping eggs on a tortilla was somehow vastly different of a concept from slapping "beans" on a tortilla. I ordered a standard breakfast burrito; thinking that that would be utterly impossible to foul up, and a Steak A.M. Crunchwrap; thinking I hadn't had a stomach ache in at least a week so I was about due anyway. I opted not to get the coffee, because I have an abundance of terrible coffee at home, and frankly I have a Starbucks card.

The burrito was unremarkable at best. The eggs tasted real at least not like the soggy prison eggs you get in a high school cafeteria or Ikea, but it was bland. Fair warning, when I actually looked in the burrito as I was eating it, the sausage reminded me in size, shape, and color of rabbit pellets.

The first bite of the Steak A.M. Crunchwrap however, was another experience entirely, that thing was absolutely delicious. There was some type of tangy spicy sauce in there which blended perfectly with what was essentially a Denny's grandslam wedged tightly into a tortilla. Tempting fate, I once again dared to gaze into the depths of the now exposed Crunchwrap: the less that is said about that exposed alien brain the better. Lesson learned: don't look inside taco bell food, it's wrapped up for a reason.Despite its appearances, it was enjoyable down to the last bite.

Final Grade? 7/10, I would actually rate the Crunchwrap higher than a Mcgriddle but lower than the Steak Bagel Sandwich at McD's, nicely filling that bizarre craving for spicy food in the morning I get sometimes.

Wow am I really giving Taco Bell 5 stars!? Yep!! Don't fall out of your chair because even I'm surprised. But ordered from their app since my daughters quesorito is only available via the mobile ordering and not of you go there and order. Yes very odd! 

Placed the order and they actually begin making when you arrive. Very simple. I order and pay upfront. When I arrive, I go through drive through and let them know I'm picking up a mobile order. They tell you to pull around and by the time you get there it's ready. 

Order was correct and everything tasted great. Thanks Taco Bell for filling my daughters tummy with her fav yumminess!

So bought a burrito and a quesadilla on the drive thru on my way home from work and as I started to take a piece from my quesadilla i found a freaking locknut inside of it. Inside of the quesadilla! luckily it slipped before i bit into it and god knows how clean it was. Hiw do you not see this when you are making it???? I was already going home so I never turned back and probably will never return to this location

So why am I taking time to review a Taco Bell?  Aren't they all the same.  Yeah, well, that's the problem.  They aren't.  Let me explain.
 
One of the basic cornerstones of the fast food industry is that you can get a burger, burrito or fries at one location and know that it will taste like that at any other location in the country.  I get that, and for the most part approve.  But this particular location must have missed the memo, among a few other things.
 
First off, you never know exactly what you're going to get when you order here.  I have ordered 3 chili cheese burritos and in the same bag received, a long thin burrito, a short, fat burrito and a little tiny burrito-ette that looked like the baby brother of the first two.  You can get a mexican pizza with red tomato abundantly covering the cheese or... once, I got 2 green tomato-like cubes.  And that was it.  Is there no manual on how to make the food here?  It should be at least a little consistent, shouldn't it?
 
My bigger complaint is that the prices here are 30 to 80 cents higher here than any other local Taco Bell location.   On the same weekend when my daughter was going through a chicken burrito phase, we stopped here and the chicken burrito was $1.59.  It was a $1.29 at the Polaris location.  The next weekend, at the TB on Morse road near Best Buy, another $1.29.  It's not like this location is on the beach or has a view of Niagara Falls.  I understand that some franchisees may price a little differently, but 23% more for the same item that often times is much smaller than other locations offer?
 
We only eat fast food maybe 2 or 3 times a month max.  So this review is more like a review of the 8 times we have been there in 2 years.  Plus there is a sliding scale on fast food places being reviewed.  I mean, how can I give any fast food place a four stars when there are really good restaurants that have a four star rating.  Probably the maximum for a fast food place in my opinion is 3 stars.  This location should get about 1.5 stars.  In honor of my last mexican pizza here that was covered with red tomato, I'll round up to 2 stars.  Avoid this location until their prices and food preparation come up to par.
Literally the SLOWEST fast food restaurant in the history of fast food. The employees be taking their time.

The worst Taco Bell ever. They never get my order right after waiting in line for 45 minutes. Drives me crazy. I've given them so many chances ... every time, EVERY TIME THEY MESS SOMETHING UP. Seriously, fire the managers or get new staff.

After hundreds of trips to this location I'm wondering why I haven't written a review yet for my FAVORITE TBell! 

I probably drive thru this location once or twice (sometimes 3 times) a week. It is the ONLY location in the area I am happy with. I even moved further away and still drive the extra 10 minutes to go here! 

The staff taking orders are friendly, helpful and fast! Even with long lines, you won't have to wait too long to get your food. They have NEVER messed up even my most complicated orders and the food is always hot and tasty. The food you get is quality-- shells stuffed full and fresh quality ingredients every time! never stale shells or nasty lettuce like some other locations)

During the COVID19 outbreak, this location doesn't require ANY touch contact- they hold the card reader out the window so and let you insert it so they don't touch your card, and when they serve the food, they place it on a tray for you to grab so there is no human contact...Such a good idea! And of course they are wearing masks, while some other locations are not. Bravo! 

I can never get photos of my food because I always eat it too fast, but it is always assembled so well; looks like it could be used in a Taco Bell advertisement :)

This regular Taco Bell is one of the fanciest I've seen by far! They are outstanding! It's super clean and modern! Also they staff is very professional! One person in the drive thru gave them a hard time and they still remained professional and kind to the customers in the lobby! Also I came here for the Fries Nachos and they taste amazing!

COVID-19:
This place keeps the store sparkling clean and social distancing is in-forced as well as face mask.

Staff:
For being considered a fast food place the staff treats you like your in a proper restaurant, they are really caring and nice! They make sure everyone is happy!

Food: 
The return/new nachos fries are outstanding and definitely addicting! This place was outstanding with their food it was fast and tasty!

This staff in this place will definitely take care of you! One again I would definitely recommend trying the nachos fries because they are heave!

We love Taco Bell breakfast, after driving to 2 other locations that didn't serve breakfast, we arrived at this location. We ordered 2 bacon crunchwraps only to be told they didn't have any bacon. Ok give it to us without bacon. We then tried to order some breakfast burritos only to be told they only had enough eggs for 3 things. This was well before the time they stop serving breakfast at 11 am. So we went ahead with just the 2 baconless bacon crunchwraps and a sausage crunchwrap. Upon receiving these, they obviously didn't even have enough for 3 items as the amount of eggs on each was half of normal. Extremely disappointed with the service or lack there of at this location and will not be going back.

Every time I go to this Taco Bell they forget to put some of my items in the bag. I check every time... and what do you know, I'm always missing something. That happened this trip, but I'm also very disappointed in how much shredded chicken is in my mini shredded chicken quesadilla... for the whole wrap, it looks like there is one lousy scoop of chicken.
If I could 1 star I would. Period. Literally sat in line for 10 minutes... Ordered my food... Then they told me they couldn't serve me

worst taco bell i've ever been to. don't bother ordering what you want because you'll get someone else's order anyways. employees are always messing up orders or the quality of the food is terrible. for example, i ordered a quesarito and they gave me cinnamon twists. liiiiiiike how???  food's always cold too. just don't go there.

Yesterday I went to this Taco Bell Location and I bought 10 suprime tacos and 4 regular tacos. When I arrived to my house I was surprised because they just give me 11 tacos and all of them regulars, so today I went back to the store in the same shift and I talked  with Justin "The Manager" and I ask if I can get my money back, just the difference of course and his answer was very simple "NO I CAN'T, IF YOU WANT TO DO SOMETHING CALL MY BOSS JOHN" and he gave me his phone number, of course John is no answering his phone. BTW today l lost like 20 minutes waiting for Justin "The Manager" answer because he was talking by phone with John "The Boss"

Guys!!! If you want to eat real Mexican food go to a place I just knew last week, the name is "Chilito Green" they are in south Semoran just between Lee Vista and Hazeltine National Dr and they are the best tacos I ever had "JUST DELICIOUS AND SUPER CLEAN". 

The only reason I went to Taco Bell is because I live in Lake Nona area. Next time when my family and me feels like eat good Mexican food and awesome tacos for sure I will drive 15 more minutes and we will go to Chilito Green for sure.

Worst Taco Bell ever! Cold food, missing items from the order, even missing ingredients for the tacos! The drive-thru employees were extremely rude too.

I know you shouldn't expect much of anything from Taco Bell but this location needs some overhaul on the whole taco making operation. The staff needs retraining to say the least.

We ordered 4 black bean quesoritos, nachos bell grande with jalapeños, a chicken quesadilla and a couple of tacos last night on the taco bell app. And the food was made perfectly on time and cooked to absolute perfection!!! This is the best Taco Bell I've been to in OH!!!
This was terrible. Almost 30 minutes stuck in the drive thru line only to get home and the tacos were stale!!! Soooooo bad!!!

Worst experience ever. Every time I go here my order get messed up. But today was the worst ever. Waited 40 minutes for an order that was completely wrong. Told the person in the drive thru that the order on the screen was wrong then she starts adding things I did not order. I told here no sour cream no cheese on my crunch wrap because I am lactose in tolerant. She adds ranch to it and charged my $.40. Told here no dairy at all I have a dairy allergy she say ok order still wrong after waiting 40 minutes i get home and   I have cheese and cheese sauce and ranch on my crunch wrap that I just wasted money on that I can't eat or I will be sick. Not even worth going back to get my money back just a waist of time and money.

Establishment is open for limited seating in dinning room, drive thru. Opted for drive thru was hoping to try the new pumpkin spice taco with new sauce however this one doesn't offer it yet. Taco Bell just announced it yesterday so maybe later instead ordered burrito  & crunchy taco. The service was good.

This is the worst Taco Bell ever. I've gone twice in the past week and asked for "beefy nacho griller" and both times got a burrito filled with refried beans. If u go ALWAYS check cause they're stupid and will mess it up

Where do I begin?  At the start of the pandemic we were really impressed with how quickly this location pivoted to contactless service.  And the service was quick and pleasant.

Over the last two to three months service has gone downhill and almost all of our food orders have been wrong in some way.  Fast forward to this Sunday, we wanted to watch some football and thought we would try to use the coupon on the Uber app to keep us out of the crappy weather.

The problems begin when the Uber delivery driver takes a photo of the food and explains that the food was wrong but the Taco Bell wouldn't listen to him.  Two of our items were missing and all of the drinks were wrong, including we would find out when we tried them, substituting full sugar beverages instead of the requested diet ones.  Good thing none of us are diabetic.

So my wife calls, asks to speak with a manager and requests a solution.  Roy D (the only information he would provide) gets on the phone and says that we ordered it wrong.  My wife has the Uber order and the Taco Bell receipt that was taped to the bag in her hands and tells Roy that she's looking right at the order and receipt and they were both correct, exactly what we ordered and did not receive.  My wife asks to speak to his manager and Roy says that he is the general manager this Taco Bell location and he starts screaming at my wife that she ordered it wrong.  I can hear his voice from my wife's phone 20 feet away.

In sharing these types of experiences with others it seems like this is a growing trend.  When the pandemic first began, pick up food service seemed to pretty much step up and make things go as well as possible.  Now that we are 8 months in it seems like some fast food places have used "drive-through-only" to hide behind poor/ I don't a crap service.  They can screw up your order and when you get home or it's delivered and it's wrong, what can you do?  You can call the store and let Roy D scream at you.  Roy D knows that the doors to the Taco Bell are locked so you can't even enter the store and request that you receive what you paid for.  So congrats to "Troll" Roy D, you yelled at a female customer and hid behind your locked doors.  

We of course have escalated this to Taco Bell Corporate Office.  And we will be responding by not returning to Taco Bell so, ultimately we'll respond with our wallets.  I would encourage everyone to do the same for this Taco Bell location, otherwise I fear all of our pick up food options will have countless "Troll" Roy D's, hiding behind their locked doors and screwing up your food orders with impunity.

Ordered some food, total came to $16 gave us the drinks and lady at the window forgot the food, didn't notice when arrived at home the pizza box was not closed properly everything flew out and was all over everything inside the bag. Sauce from the the food leaked through the bottom of the bag. Overall the food quality is terrible and obviously done lazy.

Bought a "Grande Meal," which was supposed to have 10 "Fresco Bean Burritos."  The plan was to eat one a day.  On the third day, I discovered they had only given me 8 burritos, not 10.   Then I weighed the remaining burritos.  The Nutrition Information states that each Fresco Bean Burrito is supposed to weigh 213 grams.  My remaining burritos weighed between 165 and 199 grams, averaging only 80% of the specified 213 grams.  The long and the short of it is - at this Taco Bell, you do NOT get what you paid for. Go somewhere else ....
This is the worst Taco Bell in the world. As I sit in the parking lot for my food. I'm watching three employees smoke in the car next to me. This Taco Bell doesn't deserve anyone's business.
Always out of menu items. Always seem to get the orders wrong. Avoid this location! Third time was the charm to say never come back and find your cheap fake Mexican food elsewhere.

I dont often review Fast Food places unless they are exceptional either good or bad... 

This place sucked, I got to the window & the girl was like "What do you want"? I was like Umm, Who are you talking to?  Then I ordered and she was like "Ok", I was waiting for a total or a Thank You or please pull up.. NOTHING... 

I was just shocked and had my son not been sleeping in the back seat and me not feeling overly guilty because I was cheating on my diet I might have cussed her out! 

I get it you work in customer service, but that was YOUR choice not ours, Take your shitty attitude elsewhere...
Yea it's fast food, but how do you forget to put the right food in the bag??? They forgot to put several of my items in the bag and was very disappointed when i got home. Train your employees

Ordered the cool ranch and Doritos loco tacos and the shells were soggy as if they had been pre made and sat for a period of time.  Paid for what I asked for but didn't get what I paid for on my drive thru order.

Waited over 20 min for two items,that by the way tasted terrible.Way understaffed,also every worker here had long hair and didn't wear hair nets.The cashier hides in the back.I witnessed 3 people leave because they weren't waited on.Don't go here unless you want to be disappointed
9 PM on a Saturday and it's closed on the inside. Literally the most inconsistent place in the earth. I hope they never get business because it's literally a garbage place.

No matter what time we come here the drive through line is always super long and very slow. Granted you shouldn't expect too much from fast food, but still. Maybe consider later lobby hours to expedite the process? Made a great vegetarian frito burrito

Racist customer service! I told the cashier my name for my order and she said "give me a name our people can actually pronounce". I should have told the black lady my name was DeShawn. Order also took way longer than other taco bell locations.
Tried the new Cantina Bowl.  It was really good!  Like the cilantro sauce!

They don't do substitutions - if I don't want eggs meat or cheese on it why can't I substitute that for beans or rice, or a veggie - the cost is cheaper, instead they charge you money to substitute- ridiculous

Avoid it. Period. Don't go here. 

Extremely unfortunate that this is the only Taco Bell near campus. I have been to this location close to 2 dozen times, and can honestly say only on 2-3 of these occasions have I left slightly satisfied. 

The closing times posted online? Apparently these don't matter and the employees close at whatever time they feel like. On 3 separate trips I have taken the time to walk to my car parked off campus, drive to this location, only to have them be closed well before their posted time.

Also, don't expect them to keep their dining room open even close to an appropriate time. I walked a mile to get some grub, and found all doors locked at 9:30 pm. Having already committed to this endeavor, I decide to try and walk through the drive thru in a final attempt to eat. After 15 mins of waiting in an excessive line (caused by the painfully slow speed of the restaurant to make your food), I walk up to the box only to be completely ignored.

I wasn't informed I couldn't order, they didn't ask me to get out of line, they just sat there and ignored me. Are you ******* kidding me?

The day was saved when a car full of drunk patrons saw my struggle and invited me to get in and order with them. One of the more inebriated women in the back informed me it was her birthday, so decided to try and change my karma and purchase all of their food for them. 

After 2 hours and $35, I finally return to my residence, covered in a strangers vomit, eager to finally eat my assorted grillers and soft tacos. But of course, they messed up my order.

Sweet tea? They haven't changed it in 5 weeks currently, every time I order it at the window they give me a more and more watered down caramel colored liquid. I thought about saying something on multiple occasions but let's be pragmatic; what's the point.


My love for Taco Bell is the only thing that has kept me returning to this dreadful location. Perhaps I'm just a masochist, only explanation for why I would continue to subject myself to the atrocities of 2553 north high street. 
I do not plan on returning again. 
Ever.

Good riddance.

I don't go to Taco Bell very often but the two times I've gone in the past few months have been rough. Service is extremely slow. Spent at least 20 minutes in the drive through for two items and when I got them they were barely warm. Disappointing.
The slowest taco bell ever. 1 car in front of me in the drive thru. Took 22 minutes to get my food.

Must be 10 of use waiting for our orders I side, plus 12 cars in drive thru. Slow, not enough staff. Slow staff. Go order wrong but can't wait any longer. No body seems to give a hoot that we are all waiting. Nobody has egknoweldged us or helped ease the growing ugly crowd.

Worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. They got my order wrong 3 times in a row!!!! I literally showed my Taco to the manager and said I didn't order this at all and they proceeded to remake my entire order 2 times incorrectly after that. How hard is it to listen to your customers honestly? Also the drive through is a nightmare and will take you 3x as long as going inside. Save your time and just go somewhere else where the food is worth the wait and money sry tbell

This was a terrible experience. My husband and I wanted a quick and easy stop. We were the only customers in Taco Bell, ordered 5 things from the menu. They were from the $cravings and it took nearly 20 minutes for us to get our food. Let me remind you, we were the only ones, there were 5 Taco Bell workers standing around the cashier on their cellphones. Awful service and unprofessional. I have seen other fast food places where they have been packed but still get our food out at a reasonable time or offer some form of compensation. Never going to this one again.
This Taco Bell is horrible. They take FOREVER. Everytime I have been here I wait in line for at least 10 minutes, usually more!

I am always happy with the food.  Prepared well and tasty. The place is clean always.  The tables and floors all set for the day.  CLEAN.  The counter service is super and the folks are always happy to see a good cashier.  Known for years.

This Taco Bell is pretty out if date. It looks like it hasn't been remodeled since atleast the late 90's. The employees though are prompt and nice. Drive-thru is super slow though, but it is what it is. I think that's pretty consistant amongst all Taco Bell's.
Always long lines in drive tru. Inevitably something missing from order. Every time i stop, it's the same.

How hard is it to get an order correct.  3 attempts and still not correct. The reason I believe was I ordered vegan. The look I received was with disgust.  I was standing there while they discussing my order and conversation was not good. Really.

Seriously!
Worst drive-thru service ever. It took way too long to get a meal for one. Get your Ish together TB

This Taco Bell is absolutely horrible. Where is the damn management? Are you letting new hires close every night? They close several hours earlier than their set times, the line and service has been awful. And with how long I have to wait I can still never seem to get what I ordered. Save your time and find another Taco Bell to go to when you're not in the area. 2 out of 10 times I go I'm somewhat satisfied and and that's just me being nice. What ever happened to 3am Taco Bell service? These guys will close 2.5 hours earlier than they're supposed to. Not going to get any of me service anymore.

As much as I love Taco Bell, this location is horribly slow. We've tried parking and going inside but it takes just as long every time. They need more staff and/or better training for the staff they do have. I wait at least twice as long as this particular location in comparison to any other I've visited

It's Taco Bell - The food is Taco Bell. The food is a solid five by Taco Bell standards... And it's clean.

But! One star for speed. Drive thru or inside, night or day, line or no line, this is literally the slowest fast food restaurant I've ever been to... And I've lived in the south. So expect to wait at least 10 minutes after your order is placed. The staff is nice, though, and you're eating at Taco Bell... So how high are your standards, really?

Gotta say i dont really write these for fast food joints, but this Taco Bell went above and beyond my expactations! I forgot to tell them to add something specific and they made me a new one no questions asked. One of the emplyees even came up multiple times to make sure I was ok. Great staff!
They cut all the way through the quesadilla! Automatic five stars. Also gave more than one sauce packet per item. Best Taco Bell ever.
Best T bell around, maybe ever. Everything is perfectly prepared and stuffed to the gills. Look at all that meat in my picture. That's a ton of meat.

They take forever every time.. sitting in line right now for about 20 minutes.. There was only 2 cars in front of me... Then the food was packed so things were tipped over... was a really bad experience

This location is a disaster. Every time I have visited, be it drive through or inside the store, it has taken way too long to get my food. Today, I spent over half an hour in the drive-through line with only four cars ahead of me. The food is anything but fast, and often not accurate. When there are many other fast food options, and many tastier Mexican options nearby, it's hard to justify waiting so long for Taco Bell. Also, sometimes the lobby is randomly locked during business hours. I have no idea how this location is profitable.

I think it is very upsetting that they got rid of the country crunch wrap 
For the longest time while they had it i woke up knowing i was gonna be able to wake up and go get one untill they stopped that was one of the best things on there menu and i think its stupid they got rid of it 
That was one of the only things i would eat on the breakfast menu that i could stand it was amazing and it needs to come back 
ASAP!!!!!

I love Taco Bell.
A lot.
But not this one.

Shouldn't be that hard to make it right, but any special order takes especially long to order and make. Usually doesn't come right either.

But it's Taco Bell - and the only one around. It has to do.
Taco Bell, please come repair this one and open more.
They repeat the order back to you and they still screwed it up, twice. No sympathy from pattie the night-shift manager at all. Would recommend not going after 11pm.

Staff is usually great at  this location, but tonight was probably one of my worst experiences ever at this location. I had to repeat my order 7 times before the dude got it right, and then when I arrived to the window it take another 10 minutes before I get my food. I don't know if these are new hires but terrible!

I would understand if they were busy but it is literally 1:15 am Friday morning and all I could hear is all of the employees in the back chuckling and trying to figure which order belongs to each customer. As a person who buys food here I would atleast expect the people who work there take their job seriously.

Liz, the shift lead, went above and beyond to make sure my order came out great.  I said in the drive through window "I want taco bell, but ONLY if you can make it look like the picture!"  Can you make my a crunch wrap the matches the picture.  She must have mentally said "Challenge Accepted" because when I got my crunch wrap, all I could say was WOW, I'll be putting this on Yelp!

Unfortunately, being as tasty as it was, I failed to post a photo of said crunch wrap before being consumed.  Till Next time Taco Bell, till next time.

The food was good but I wish my burrito had more beans, nothing to complain about as it was still very good.
They treat each other like family which I adore in any establishment but minus one star because the family of workers laughing and playing delayed the cashier from taking our order as they finished laughing and talking. They were very kind however and I was asked how our food was. I'll be sure to go back when I'm in town.

This is the best Taco Bell you will ever go to. It's corporately owned and not a franchise. They always have new test market items and my food is always hot and my order is always correct. Plus the drive thru staff is super friendly.

Several years ago I stopped my 3 days a week Taco Bell habit.  I explained to my co-workers and family that the meat (beef) tasted different.  I didn't like the texture nor the flavor.   Well, now we all know why??  Yesterday, for the first time in months, I stopped in there in a hurry to order a bean burrito.  OMG. I waited in line 10 minutes to order and another 18 minutes to pick up my order.  They spent much of their time refunding folks their money.  It's called fast food for a reason - bring in some staff at lunch time. Tables and floor filthy.
I'm done with this location.  Out of beef tonight?  WTF.  25 min wait last time.  It's like a pizza joint out of cheese.  Honestly the worst Taco Bell in PDX/Metro.

On May 26, 2015, it was a beautiful day when I decided to order a Strawberry Starburst Freeze. I asked for a medium, but the cashier, who was a medium-sized chubby male, told me "We only have regular or large, DUDE." Not only was the disgustingly rude, but it was totally unnecessary. It is as if he could not put two and two together to get me the regular size or at least inform me kindly. This Taco Bell has terrible customer service and it ruined part of my day. I could not even go to the locked bathrooms without having to deal with his bullshit again, so I held it in. This is the opposite of what my experience should have been. This employee was incredibly impatient and hateful toward me. I'm never coming back to this location and I think you should do the same. This employee deserves no further employment and should be fired immediately for his ridiculous and unacceptable conduct.

I am still slightly bitter about Taco Bell getting rid of my beloved Baja Steak Chalupa, but I've recently discovered the Crispy Potato Taco and Gordita Crunch (add fiesta salsa).  Both of those items are pretty damn awesome, and they're cheaper than the Baja Steak Chalupa, so suck it, TBell!
Friendly staff especially for the area. Faster than nearby restaurants. Food is typical fast food you're getting what you pay for.

To make it short, check your orders every time. They were supposed to sub the beef for beans, as I don't eat meat, yet they failed miserably. Unfortunately for me, I didn't realize the error until I bit into a nasty clump of what they call beef. It's getting old having to call and go get my orders fixed.
This place took forever to go through the drive through then they forgot to put an item in the bag and we had to wait just as long inside to get it

Got rid of the crispy potato tacos. Drive thru takes forever. And the past 3 times I've gone there I've gone through the drive thru at 11:55pm when I know they do not close until midnight. I know they all want to leave and whatever, but I want my food. It's very very poor customer service skills. That is how you lose customers . Taco Bell should be open until 1am or later.
Yep, it's just a Taco Bell. But the great attitude of the staff, especially Marie, makes it a joy to eat here. Food comes quick and is hot.

I wish just once you could get my order right. I visited this location after a year since you always mess up my order and you once again proved why I must drive to the the other location on 164th they by the way never mess up my order. Maybe you should have their manager train your guys.

Almost always have had friendly staff help with my orders. Never have had to wait too long and they have maintained a consist staff. This location is right up the road from my house so I've had many stops here.

I give this location 5 stars because it's what a Taco Bell should be. My wife often orders tacos without cheese. At any other location she ends up fishing small bits of cheese out of her tacos. Not here. She was able to eat it right away while it was fresh and hot.
I'm a big Taco Bell fan.  Friendly staff, and quick service.  I like fresco style tacos.
Wow, this place was filthy. Garbage everywhere. Spilled food on the floor at register. Normally spotless.

25 minutes on the drive thru with no explanation...enough said. Don't let your love for late night 4th meals or quesoritos bring you here. Not to mention mine came with barely any cheese!!! That's ridiculous man, I was late to everything in life because of this place.

Having worked in the service industry for over half a decade, I understand that things can not be perfect all the time. This is the worst service I have ever gotten at a fast food establishment. I live a few miles away and have an open mind as far as giving places second chances. Tonight I went to this taco Bell, and for the 3rd time within a month my order was not even close to accurate. The first time we got our food and they forgot 3 of our items of 9. We called and they said to " come up some time this week and we will give you three tacos" didn't take a name, phone number or anything.... The second time we ordered nachos with no beans and sauce, they came with beans and sauce repeated it back to the order taker 3 times to confirm since they have messed up in the past...and our entire order was cold. Then we called and spoke with a manager again and they told us to come back up to fix it, so we did. And they messed up the order AGAIN. We then called the manager back and explained how poor it was and refunded our money. And now today, we go back and order a taco pack with soft and hard some without lettuce and the order wasn't even close to right, there was taco meat outside the tacos spread all over the shell... Then we call the manager and explained we don't want a refund or to bring the food back but we would like him to speak with the staff and work on getting this correct and share our 3rd poor experience... The manager offered no sympathy and said "is there anything else" and "what do you want me to do"... The WORST customer service I've ever heard. This place need to have management notified and new staff implemented.. it is fast food, not fine dining.

Taco Bell is always a fun guilty pleasure. Today I stopped at this location and was greeted and served by two of the warmest kindest ladies I have met at a fast food location. 

They seemed to enjoy their job and said hello to everyone that came in. Fast food is not usually focused on service but it was nice to have a different experience. Keep it up Hiawassee Taco Bell!

This is probably the worst Taco Bell on the planet earth. Everytime I decide to try it again it ALWAYS disappoints. The drive thru takes AT LEAST 20-45min on any day at any time. And the order is always wrong. I ordered a grande meal with 6 tacos and 6 bean burritos for a very specific occasion and I got 6 tacos and 6 soft tacos which I didn't notice till I got where I was going and it ruined the whole event. Wouldn't recommend this location. Save yourself and go to the mill plain location instead.

Is there really any high expectations for a TB? The employees and management all look like they are going through the motions. The very least amount of motions possible that are distracting them from their phone. 

Consider yourself lucky if you get everything you ordered. Expect a facial expression if you ask for a condiment at the drive thru. I do wonder if you said "Just one", would they be able to deviate from the usual handful. Never stop here if urgency is your priority.

Does it distress anyone else to see employees standing right by the door smoking. I must navigate they're nicotine cloud to encourage my appetite to eat here. The grind is when they come inside and put gloves on to handle the food without hand washing. I am that guy you may have heard, because I say it so loudly. "I CAN WAIT WHILE YOU WASH YOUR HANDS". That public shaming is what usually encourages a manager to give them the nod to go. Perhaps their hands are momentarily clean for you as well. I know what you are thinking... spit in my food. No the manager will usually complete my order while I watch from the counter, so I will just leave.

Have you ever dined inside? Even if the tables are cleared, the tables here are not cleaned. BTW you should always watch were you walk in there. Sweep and mopping may only get done at night.
There are better TB locations to patronize.

Horrendous service today.
We sat in the man taking our order was rude and clearly perpetually confused. Two women stood there grimacing at us while we order and still messed up the order. Totally unacceptable. Really disappointed,
Slowest Taco Bell in the history of Taco Bell! It looks us 15 minutes to get through the drive thru for our 3 tacos and drinks.

Dear Taco Bell,

How do you expect me to eat fiesta potatoes covered in sour cream and delicious cheese with hands? Can't you just ask your employees to include a fork? Unless you did. And they just forget. And you drive away hoping that you're about to eat some fiesta potatoes only to discover that your employees can't manage to do a simple step in a drive through service and include the fork on not even a busy afternoon. 

2 stars. 1 for crunch wrap supreme deliciousness (although they did think I'm ordering just an order of sour cream until I said crunch wrap surprise like 5 times)
1 for fiesta potatoes that I had to eat without a fork. Not proud of what I had to do there.

Getting my bean burrito - done fresco style of course!  
Sorry but this place is quick and an easy way to have a quick and healthy dinner for $1.00 too.

They had a sign up for .89 cent burritos, yes thats right POINT EIGHT NINE CENTS.  So each burrito should cost less than a penny according to their sign. 

When we asked to buy a few of these burritos they would not honor thier advertised price. They said they were going to fix the sign and that it was a mistake but we went back a week later and the same sign was up.

And guess what, they still didn't honor their advertisement.

I normally like taco bell as a good place to get some cheap fast food but I wouldn't go to this one.

What is it about this chain..we know its sooo bad for us but cant stay away. This location rocks. Clean, good people, and the food seems fresh for what it is. Two hard tacos, one bean burrito is my favorite ..and it comes up to less than $4...

Besides Subway, Taco Bell is my second favorite..but this location is the only one I trust! Clean clean clean
You'd think it wouldn't be hard to read a ticket that says "SUPREME" on it. And yet, here I am. With a non supreme taco.

Not recommended. Go to the taco bell just a mile down the road.

The food just tastes different than all the other taco bells I've been to. The meat is dry and they act like the cheese is being expensed from their own personal paychecks. Drive the extra mile and get the good stuff!

Let me tell you about an employee named Joseph. He is hands down the best reason about this Taco Bell. Always so friendly, and willing to help with whatever the situation is. I feel like family when I walk in and see him working. If you've ever had the pleasure of meeting him, you know that he is the bees knees!!

The food was standard. It's Taco Bell.

Wait time was what we expected. We didn't instantly have our goods but we didn't wait a century for them either.

Register girl was nice. Yay.

Clientele is stupid. Young, immature campus boys talk about the dumbest things and usually make unnecessary messes. They should be caged after a certain hour.
This place is great.  The staff is the problem.  If they paid above minimum wage, they might get decent help.

My favorite things to order at Taco Bell are:

- Soft tacos
- Chalupas (Supreme Beef)
- Gorditas (Supreme Beef, not Cheesy Crunch)

In 3rd grade, I was able to eat up to six soft tacos in one sitting.  I loaded each soft taco with two packets of Mild sauce.  These days, whether I'm eating a soft taco or chalupa, I like to add Fire sauce to every bite.  I love spicy food.

Sure, Taco Bell is at the bottom of the barrel when it comes to food and nutrition, but I still eat it from time to time.  I like the soft tacos because they're simple, inexpensive, and quick and easy to eat while on-the-go.

The chalupa and gordita have the same ingredients: ground beef, shredded lettuce, chopped tomatoes, shredded cheese, and sour cream.  I prefer the chalupa over the gordita because of it's golden, slightly crispy, and more greasy shell.  You can also "upgrade" chalupas and gorditas to include white meat chicken and carne asada steak.  Higher quality protein FTW.

This particular Taco Bell on Howell Mill has undergone some renovations over the years.  It's not as dirty and foul as it used to be and they removed most of the giant stickers they had covering the windows, which made me wonder why they even had windows in the first place.

Open late, until 5am on Fridays and Saturdays, and 4am all other days.

Let's face it. Going to Taco Bell in a city is sketch-tastic. 

But Taco Bell in Norwell is divine. It's clean, normal looking people are inside and the staff is usually some good natured high school kid who smiles and says thank-you. Fast food in the Burbs is where it's at.
 
I'm not going to bother reviewing the food. Everyone knows what Taco Bell tastes like. But if you decide to indulge, don't think outside the Burbs.

HORRIBLE SERVICE.

I went there to order their 5 layer beef burrito, and the manager REFUSED to honor their advertised prices [see posted picture].  I ended up pay 100 fold more for the item in question.  I have never had such a bad experience at a taco bell in my life.  

The manager told me that taco bell doesn't use "the same number system as everyone else" there. so dumb...

DO NOT EAT HERE.

I used to think this taco bell was the worst. It would always take forever in the drive thru to get orders. And even after all that wait the order would usually be wrong or cold. But as of late my last handful of visits have been very satisfactory. I would have to say its quite the turn around. Im not sure if its new management, new staff, or just the newly renovated store. Whatever it is, I'm not mad at it.

I can't believe I'm giving a Taco Bell 5 stars, but it deserves every one. I mean, it's Taco Bell, so we're not talking "real" food. :) But for a fast-food place, I was blown away. The place is SO clean and looks like it was newly renovated. Our food was brought out to our table! IN A TACO BELL. I about died. 

Like I said, I'm just as shocked as you are. But I'm glad it's in my neighborhood.

If I could give a 0 star rating I would. Custom service is shitty they never have enough products they always run out of everything. Then when they run out and you sit in the drive thru line for an hour waiting they then tell you instead of having it posted that they are out. It's funny because these workers want more money but they can't even do their job right. When I actually DO get the food I want it's usually always wrong EVERYTIME. Whoever owns this Taco Bell doesn't deserve to have a business of their own.

Yes, I've called it Toxic Hell just like the rest of us and bashed their lettuce tacos, but let's face it: DUH, IT'S TACO BELL!  We're not talking fine dining here.  Their burritos, as always, are cheap, greasy, fatty, heart-clogging goodness wrapped in a tortilla.  Their value menu actually has stuff you want to eat especially the awesome Crispy Potato Soft Taco (that southwestern sauce is to die for).  And as a big Pepsi fan it makes me happy to know as long as PepsiCo owns Yo Quero Taco Bell I'll be able to get a friggin' Pepsi and not have Coke shoved down my throat.
I love Taco Bell but this is the one I always call the nice taco bell, its always super clean and they dont skimp on fillings.

May 2018:
I went here and ordered online as I saw the line was long. As we wait for our food.. We realize there is confusion at the front, so we look and she's telling a man sorry this isn't yours and she tells me it's a part of our order. The man was bothered he thought he finally had his food and told them they need to call names and not just hand food out. So instead of replacing this meal that was handed to the wrong individual and he walked halfway across the restaurant with it, they decided to hand it to me instead of replacing it!
I let it go as the person who ordered it said not to worry about it. The order was wrong however..
On top of that we ordered six burritos and were missing two! I told them this and they never replaced them! When one of the orders were incorrect (the same order handed to the wrong man) when she approached them to let them know, she began yelling at her and telling her "It was her (my) fault for ordering it wrong, go tell her that!" Pointing at me..
I honestly have never met such rude disrespectful workers before, even the manager tried to yell and turn us away when we tried to complain. In the meantime a fight broke out  next door and someone had a gun so we just left because we didn't need that negativity or having our lives on the line at this.... Special place..
They need new management and new employees to say the least..


February 2018:
4 stars 
The food was good but I wish my burrito had more beans, nothing to complain about as it was still very good.
They treat each other like family which I adore in any establishment but minus one star because the family of workers laughing and playing delayed the cashier from taking our order as they finished laughing and talking. They were very kind however and I was asked how our food was. I'll be sure to go back when
Don't come here if you're expecting food within a reasonable amount of time. I've always waited at least 20 minutes in the drive through no matter the time of day. Terrible customer service.
Pretty slow line but available when I got to the window. It feels warm between my legs hence it is predictably delicious.

These employees show 0 interest in what they do or helping customers in a polite, respectable way. I asked a simple question; Why is your drive through closed? They replied, "because". I work within Easton. This Taco Bell is the closest one. I actually despise coming here, having to interact with these people. Something in upper management needs to be fixed. This store isn't giving a very good example of good customer service.
So thankful Taco Bell is open on Christmas eve evening!  We left Christmas eve service after a long day of flights from out of town.  Thanks for being available.  Merry Christmas!

My favorite fast food joint, but also the best place to cure my constipation. Stay away from the beefy stuff; the refried beans are much better. I recommend the taco pizza it is yummy. 

PS I am a cow. Mooooooooooooooooooooo
slowest taco bell ever. does not even deserve 1 star. the also never fail to get your order wrong. help this business!!!!!
I ordered the 5 dollars special it come with one soft taco and 1 crispy taco I loved it

This is a really good restaurant. It is clean. The staff are friendly and very nice - I have never been treated negatively by a staff worker there. The staff are always able to understand me and process my order quickly and efficiently. I have never had to wait more than five minutes in line while there.

The good: Excellent location, right on a bus line, quick service, friendly staff. Also, always clean.
The not quite as good: Sometimes can be crowded as it is on a college campus. Can also be loud (haven't had that happen often though).

Like the "Best Wendy's Ever" I reviewed last week, the Taco Bell on south campus is so unique that, while it may be "just another Taco Bell," its well worth a review. So let's get to it!

First of all: the food here is no better (and probably no worse) than any other Taco Bell. While I love me some Taco Bell, I know it's horrible food. It just barely resembles something vaguely Tex-Mex, but chances are that if you managed to navigate to Yelp.com, you probably already know how you feel about Taco Bell food, so I'll spare you the mediocre, bland details.

What makes this Taco Bell my favorite Taco Bell is quite simply all the character it has. It is very often during the school year absolutely swamped with business from all sorts of people- drunk students, nearby residents, motorcycle clubs, and a healthy attachment of police officers.

When it gets that busy, it takes a while to get your food. This would normally be intolerable at anything that claims to be fast food, but when it's jumping here, it's really jumping. You might witness just about any kind of personality and any kind of interpersonal exchange in the window between ordering and getting your food. 

I've watched couples go to the bathroom together for what I could only guess was either a terrible, frightening emergency or a case of hormones run wild. I've seen people walk in and try to take a tray of food they obviously never ordered. I even watched one customer pull out a bag of weed when he meant to pull out his cash to pay- the cashier admonished him to hide it quickly, since there was a cop in the store.

The way movie ticket prices are these days, this is some of the cheapest visual entertainment in town. I like to drop in, drop $5 on way too much disgusting food that I love dearly, and just sit and wait. 

Perfectly A-OK.

Nicest Taco Bell personnel compared to any that I've ever been to. Never had any issues with the food, or not getting what I asked for.  If you've decided to give up on life, are hung over, or feel like cleaning out your colon, this is the Taco Bell for you!

I feel like the service here got worse recently. The past two times I've been to this Taco Bell I had to wait at least 15 minutes for my food. The first time I went through the drive-thru, which extended throughout most of the parking lot. The second time, today, I went inside, thinking it would be faster. It wasn't. I waited 15-20 minutes inside, and even saw the guy who ordered before me ask for a refund. The workers are nice and they apologized for being under-staffed. Please hire one or two more people! The food is good but I don't want to wait 15-20 minutes for it!

Just waited over twenty minutes and still not even our nachos for our screaming toddler. Our answer when we asked about our order?! Three orders in front of ours. I demanded our refund and got the hell out. Terrible management. Couldn't even refund on our credit card so it took another 10 minutes while 20 other angry customers were waiting in their faces. Taking care of drive through orders instead of the people breathing down your neck? Byeeeee. Lost my business forever.

A gang of us stopped by here on the way to the beach for breakfast in a Saturday.  The woman taking orders in the drive thru was very perky and pleasant.  She was very patient as we tried to decide what we wanted because we were new to their breakfast menu.  We all ordered different crunchwraps and we're all very happy!  I got the California with guacamole and it was DELISH!!  This is a great location with really good service!

This taco bell is the worst. The food always seems like it has been sitting under a heat lamp all day. Dry crusty beans. Crunchy part of crunchwrap always slightly stale. Potatoes are always chewy and room temperature.The guy who served me in the late night drive thru seemed like he hated his life and was not pleasant to deal with. The scariest part is that the 2 times I ate at this Taco Bell in the past month my mouth was very swollen and painful the next day. What is happening in that kitchen?!?!? I have never had this problem with other taco bells. I go to the MLK one all the time and they are lovely and the food is always right.

Slowest drive-through service. Always a line backed up the couple times I've here and roughly 10 minutes between placing order and receiving. A crunchwrap and 2 crunchy tacos. No excuse. Then I asked for a handful of mild sauce, "10 or 12" specifically, and I get 2 mild and 1 fire. Never coming back.

This location has the worst service ever. They just stand there and look at you instead of greeting you. They bring my order out and left it on the counter without calling out to me or the order number for 5 minutes. Then I walked up and looked at it and asked if it was mine. The girl was confused and didn't know so she ran back to ask if it was my order or not. Terrible communication skills. They need to either train their employees or hire new ones if they're too lazy to do their job.

The staff here are extremely rude. We walked in and nobody said hi can I help you or even made eye contact.  We ordered 2 of the t3 meals [ taco Supremes ]. 
The guy taking our order repeated it back to us correctly.  
 We sat down to eat and discovered these were regular tacos with no sour cream or tomatoes. 
Husband went to the counter and politely explained the situation. 
They initially want to charge us for 2 more full meals. Then they were going to refund and charge for the correct meals. Husband left the.counter to come tell me what was going on and younger the cash from me. The lady then started to YELL you have to pay for this. 
Husband got the cash from me and went back to the.counter and a lady came from the back and said we will let you have the upgrade this time for free but next time be sure to enunciate what you want more clearly. 
Husband thanked her, we are. We went to leave and said thank you , have a nice day...but got no reply from any person working there... not even the guy who.was standing 2 feet away. 
I will not visit this particular taco bell again based on the poor customer service.

What can I say, it's a Taco Bell.  Cheap food that somehow tastes really good.  I guess if you put enough taco sauce on anything it'll taste good.

On this visit I had some of their $1 Crunch Wrap sliders.  Not bad.

Here's a tip...if you are a senior, 50+, ask for their "senior drink."  They'll hand you a cup for a cold beverage...FREE.
I never used to like the Bell.  But the new Fiesta menu and the pico is most excellent!

Very rude cashier, I have never been treated so poorly by anyone working in customer service. I would not recommend going to this taco bell. You get belittled and have to wait forever for your good. I have it a 1 star only because I had to.

Taco Bell not the best food for you but when you are hungry and need something quick this is the best place to stop. This location is on Tuskawilla located between a mom and pop's restaurant and a McDonalds.

I went to the drive thru this time but before that I came  to this location a  couple of  years ago and don't remember having a bad experience at all, as far as when I just came here recently and went thru the drive thru....   the order came out right and it was fast.

No complains here , fast and cheap food for a quick bite but  I do give it four stars just because it is not the healthiest and best thing to go inside your body but it hits the spot , bad side is  most of the time Taco Bell causes me a stomach ache.

No, It may not be a sin to enjoy Taco Bell, I certainly do, but 5 stars, seriously?

Its a Taco Bell. Its good for late-night to-go food, but that's really it. But if you want Cheap Mexican before 11pm, there are better places to go really close. Spend an extra couple bucks and go get a combo meal at La Parilla or something.
It's sad, but this place always disappoints. Food is terrible and service is slow. Consider going somewhere else, waiting in line here just isn't worth it.

It's another taco bell...not unlike any other. I really like their $2 meal deals! My favorite will aways be their dorrito taco and you cant beat the price!

this location gets really busy compared to the one a little north of it. The line here can get seriously long but when I'm in the area it works. Whatelse can I say...but yum

If you have a food sensitivity/allergy beware. 

We placed an order through the app so that way we would know for sure we ordered according to our dietary restrictions and they still managed to butcher the entire order. Unlucky me it was a crunchwrap so I couldn't see that the items I requested to be taken off were still there until I tasted them

We went back into the store to inform them and they didn't seem to care that much. I personally think giving a person food that they have an allergy to is a big deal so I'm surprised at the lack of response from the staff.

This is the worst Taco Bell I've ever been too. Worst customer service ever. I feel if somebody doesn't wanna be at work, DON'T COME TO WORK AND BE RUDE TO CUSTOMERS, it's not our fault you work at Taco Bell to begin with. Another thing, if you apparently "don't have" something that I ordered, take it off the damn menu. Period.
They were very nice after having a horrible experience at the newberg location. They gave me the baja blast and the service that newberg didnt to give me. Very nice staff.

I feel compelled to rate this Taco Bell on Morse Rd as I had the best experience of my life in a fast-food restaurant. The staff was very friendly and helpful. One of the staff members (didn't catch her name) even walked around to each table to ask how our food was! Never had that in a fast food joint.

Natasha M took my order and was patient, courteous and helpful as I didn't know the menu very well. She answered all my questions with a smile on her face. When I get back to Columbus, OH, I hope to stop in again and thank her and the Taco Bell team.

This place should be shut the hell down!  I literally have been coming to this Taco Bell for years and never had issues until about a year ago.  Did the people that have been working there for years quit or get fired because the past year this place takes over 20 minutes for the drive through.  Then on top of the drive through I asked please no tomatoes I'm allergic and these morons put TOMATOES in it.  I'll be calling the corporate office in the morning you better better be happy I don't call a lawyer like the panera bread issue that happened a while back.  But honestly I truly enjoy getting my food that was thrown in a paper bag rather than a plastic bag.   There maybe was a spoonful of meat a cup of tomatoes and barely any cheese.  $15 my ass you lazy assholes don't deserve shit!

When coming to any Taco Bell you have to remind yourself that it is a fast food restaurant.  My favorite things to order at Taco Bell are:

-Mexican Pizza
-Meximelt
-7-layer burritto
-Soft Taco
-I like the regular hard tacos more than all the 'doritos' tacos. 

I recently learned from Rohan S. that adding volcano sauce makes everything better!

Everything here is pretty much a combination/permutation of 10 different ingredients, so everything tastes pretty much the same.  Be sure to check out the nutrition information for all of their products on their website.

Don't forget the hot sauce!

I mean Taco Bell is Taco Bell obviously I was going because I like it but it's almost 9 am and nobody was there there were tons of cars in the driveway the front doors were locked basically just nobody opened the store

Your staff is not very friendly, or quick. There were only 2 people in the lobby, and 4 cars in drive thru and it took almost 20 minutes to get a pack of 12 soft tacos. Lobby was dirty girl came out and pushed 1 chair in but didnt sweep or anything.
Lousy service. 4 people casually working and no cashier. Waited 5 mins and just left as was ignored.

This is my Taco Bell. It's right down the street from my place. It's always done be right, honestly. Their food is as good as Taco Bell can be. The drive thru gets backed up from time to time, but that's honestly just because of its location. That can't be helped. I actually just went to get my free Doritos Locos Taco because of that World Series thing. I also got a cheesey bean and rice burrito, a beefy Fritos burrito, and a mini chicken quesadilla. Good stuff.

This Taco Bell always takes forever. They always only have two or three people working, so they're probably over swamped. It's a CAMPUS Taco Bell, higher up should know to staff better since it's always busy. The higher up are chumps, they must know they're missing out on revenue from having a inefficient location. Imagine how many more people would come here if they didn't have to wait 30 min. On top of that 50% of the time my order is wrong. But on the flip side there is a nice skinny white dude with glasses that's always pleasant, I give it two stars instead of one because of him. Not all hero's wear capes
My favorite. No ecoli like Chipotle. Unlimited soda. Am getting tired of the nachos. Recently remodeled. Employees are nice. Some of the customers flirt with cashiers and slow down service.
Usually I have a pretty strong stomach, but this stuff gave me the poops. I wasn't even able to finish the food before I had the  god damned USS Gibraltar screaming out of my ass.

Can be unsanitary with lots of trash in the dining area at times. My order has been given to the drive thru customers accidentally at least three times, making me have to rush to work when they finally remade my order. At least they make up for it with free cinnamon twists when they do that!
Closed at 11:40 on a Sat night? WTF. Your hours say you are open until 12:00. Grrrrr

Hoho!!! Lemmi tell youi-- soo I go Taco Belle, I aske fuhr 7 layerr burritoe, fresco beane burritoe ahnd a Nacho B'el Grrande. Instead, dei charge me for beif burritoe vit beannze! I say, no, dat no co-rect! So, dei give me dollar back. Then, when i look in my bagge, I half two bean burritoes and de 7 layer. Then I ohpen the 7 layer and see it was actually something vit beif inne eet, so I took bache. Dei apologize, give me 7 layer and free cinnamon tvists! So fohr about $6, I got tree burritos, nachos be'l grrande and cinnamon tvists. Oh, and I broughtte my own dreenk. So basically, I got a grrreatte deal, even for Taco Belle!

Charles is actually right, but here's the other thing...this Taco Bell is one of the best I've ever been to, food quality-wise, cleanliness-wise, service time-wise, etc.  While fast food in general isn't the best idea, sometimes you need food quick and cheap. 

For a vegetarian, most places don't have a lot of options. Taco Bell does, and you can substitute beans for meat at no cost on ANY item. You can apparently do vegan here, so say some pretty serious vegan friends, which is another plus for a fast food joint.  [I've just done some quick research, and that might be harder than it seems.]

Taco Bell was actually my first job ever. Worked there from sometime after I turned 15 until after I turned 18. That's a long time. I have seen many unsanitary and unpleasant things go on behind the scenes at a Taco Bell, my friends and I storing 40s in the walk-in and getting drunk while we made your burritos about the least grotesque of the bunch.

None of that has deterred me from returning! Taco Bell is king!!! Or queen, whichever.  I don't even like chihuahuas.

Yeah it's Taco Bell, actually this location is what CC and I affectionately call "Pizza Bell" because the have Pizza Hut personal pies and breadsticks. The people that work here are so nice, I don't know how they manage to be so happy with all of the campus traffic and it's related nonsense. You will wait in a long line if you show up for fourthmeal while the OSU kids are in town.  Well run location, four stars.
the manager kay is a drug addict, she got fired from speedway for stealing out the drawer to pay for her habit, so the deplorable conditions of the store shouldn't be a surprise to anyone.

My favorite Taco Bell! I have been going here for years literally and they have never ever disappointed me!  The food is always tasting perfect! I have gone to some taco bells were the food is not hot & tasted like it was sitting out! But not once at this one!

Had to wait 12 minutes after I parked for my pizza. They told me it would be 7 minutes when I ordered and I had 5 cars in front of me. I know 12 minutes isn't THAT long. What if your bank made you wait 12 minutes for an authorization when you use your bank card? I expect that a fast food restaurant would be able to produce its food, at lunch time, faster than that.

i love taco bell but this taco bell has really bad service and its very dirty. (stuff all over the floor and messes on tables) it takes them a long time to make my order even though its fast food. the taco bell back home was much better
Good location. Nice people. Clean. Always correct orders, and last but not least fast service. One of my ho to places.

This is the slowest fast food restaurant I've ever been to. It's not just a one time fault, it's every day no matter what time it is. Drive through and dining room service are both ridiculous. I've been in the drive through for over 20 minutes now and the line wasn't even that long. Usually the orders are wrong too but that's not as frustrating as the slowness

Taco Bell is Taco Bell, but this T Bell sucks! Not completely the employees fault because you can tell they need more staff, but they messed up on my order two times in a row. Staff does seem a little unprofessional too.  Baja blast freeze was straight water too.

This place is finally NOT like walking into a time warp and being transported back to 1995.  They've recently remodeled and modernized this establishment, and it's done a lot of good.   I wouldn't go so far as to say everything's "perfectly clean and pristine", but what's the place gonna do, it's a Taco Bell.   

The service is hit or miss, like every other Taco Bell.    The food is standard and obviously much better after a few libations, also like every other Bell.   But it is what it is.   And every once in a while, health and common sense be damned, there's nothing like a chicken quesadilla and a couple cheesy gordita crunches.
Waited for an hour in the drive thru and then she informs me that they're not doing anything except tacos and burritos because they're busy like wth

Last Sunday I went to Taco Bell with my roommate. Since I always eat Chinese food and American traditional food like steak, fried chicken and salad, I want to try something different, so I chose this Mexico fast-food restaurant. It has a one dollar cravings menu. This price surprises me. And I was totally full after eating the beefy fritos burrito I bought. It is both delicious and cheap.
It's taco bell... Nothing special EXCEPT their cheap and filling double deckers! The cherry limeaid Sparkler is the best out there! Mmm carbonation
Taco Bell is already pretty bad food but this place is slow. Go to another Taco Bell if you want shitty Mexican food

Waited for probably 10 minutes & my boyfriend had to complain before we even got to give them our order. Guy that took our order acted like we were interrupting what he was doing (aren't customers supposed to be first?), rushed us through ordering & then they got our order wrong. Have been in here for probably 20 minutes now & still don't have our food. Other customers are getting the same disrespect. They really need new employees at this location. Do. Not. Recommend.
The foods good but I drove all the way here from a few towns over and they say there open till 12 but it's 11:30 and there closed
Okay I admit it, I sometimes crave a Supreme Taco and a large Pepsi!  Forgive me culinary gods, I have sinned. But I get hungover sometimes, and this really hits the spot.

such awesome customer service! I'm not sure what her name is, but the older lady that is usually working the front counter is always SO sweet & nice. my boyfriend & I come here for lunch quite a bit and have never had a been experience. the woman always checks to make sure we're satisfied with our food. if it wasn't for her I don't think we would come here as much as we do.
Ordered a nachos bell grande and was told that they only serve breakfast until 1pm. Went down the road to the taco bell near New Albany and they served everything. What a garbage place.

Me and my friend are strict vegetarians and ordered 2 potato burritos with beans as a substitute, a crunch wrap supreme with beans instead of beef as well, and two bean burritos without onion.

Basically all of our food had meat in it, and we were too far away to go back. One of the bean burritos was just straight beef even though there was no beef to begin with..
I was pretty upset and had to throw it away. The drive thru guy seemed pissed and didn't give me hot sauce

Low prices with good service makes me a regular at this Taco Bell. Food is always high quality, and always served warm. The customer service is great with friendly and attentive drive thru staff. They always read you back your order to insure that no mistakes are made. Only downside is drive thru wait times are long (10-20) late at night, but not a big deal.

A quaint little mom and pop taco stand near the Swan Island industrial zone, the Bell is one of Portland's many food cart success stories.

They started in 2004 in a pod near US Bank tower and grew through word of mouth. The Bell is something of a tourist destination, like Voodoo Donuts or the Grotto. If Voodoo Donuts impregnated the Grotto you'd get the Bell.

Their specialty, the crunchy taco, is best appreciated if you enjoy an appetizer of smoked herbs about 90 minutes prior to dining. YMMV

Recently mom, or maybe it was pop, decided to cater to the waked and baked crowd who need a breakfast to keep them happy. You've had worse for breakfast.

This is authentic Mexican at its finest!

The cheesy bean and rice burrito minus the nacho cheese sauce is my staple. The service in my experience has always been friendly and quick. They do have a locked bathroom. The location is right next to Trimet Stations.
Your cinnamon twist are yummy! Your Chalupas are dynamite! Your nachos are scrumptious! your Quesadillas are the delicious! The tacos you make doesn't make my belly ache!
The new Nacho fries taste good but are under cooked.  So I had them cooked longer and they alot better.

Man I was major craving for some Taco Bell.. how sad is that huh? Well it's called being a student.. I was hungry and craving, and my friend said  there was one in the plaza I normally hangout to study at the Starbucks.. So I drove up, placed my order and was happy with the number 1 combo.. Grande Burrito! But you gotta tell them if you want chicken or beef, take the initiative , cause the workers won't. Overall the place was fast, clean, and of course for 4.99 what can you ask for right?

Ok, so I know what you are thinking: "who the h*ll checks into a taco bell?" the ONLY reason I did was to Talk about this particular locations service. after hitting the gym, I had this crazy craving for TC. Unfortunately, there was one on my way back to work. I haven't been in a TC in well over 7 years (specially after the whole 'mystery meat' fiasco) so I truly don't know what happen to my system that day. Anyways, I pull to the drive thru like a lost child, not knowing which way was up and the really nice lady at the intercom spent lie 5 minutes explaining the .99 cent menu and the combos available. I seriously have NEVER experienced this level of service at a fast food joint. I regret not taking her name because I would have written a letter to her manager.

Anyways, the moral of the story: don't eat at taco bell but do give credit to good customer service.

I can not stop raving this Taco Bell! Even though I only checked in once so far I've been there HUNDREDS OF TIMES!! It's amazing Taco Bell here and the people that work there are the nicest! Coming from a party girl that always had MID-NIGHT munchies I would come here around 2am with my friends and there's always a line around that time in the drive thru. But it goes by quick! There on top of their game during the rush too. The food is always good and Temp. is HOT. I've been coming here since I was 15 and all these years of fun I can honestly say THIS TACO BELL IS THE CURE to hangovers. Thank you!

The Taco Bell of the future! 

This place is absolutely standard Taco Bell food, nothing that stands out at all. However! The design is so over the top and crazy for a Taco Bell that you need to see it to believe it. Swishy curvy guide-rails for the line, punctured steel walls, and an awning that's made entirely out of poles spaced a foot apart are just the start. 

A must if you're in the north campus.
Antonio L is awesome!!! Great customer service. He was very thorough and patient with us as we ordered a lot of food lol. Thanks Antonio!
Usually it is a good experience. Sometimes they wrap things sloppily, rip you off on food amount or sauces. If there is a line for the drive thru expect to block traffic.

Impolite after I added an extra taco to my existing 6 tacos, told me that I would need to go back around. After asking if that was necessary for a single taco, he said usually you can't do that but his cooks were being generous. Thank you for being generous to me, the single taco must have really put you over the edge.
One of the busiest in the state I'd imagine with all the UCFers stopping by. So with that in mind, the service is very good and swift. Never mess up an order.
Probably the best Taco Bell I've ever ate at. The food is always great and tastes fresh, service is wonderful (cashier Tabitha is super sweet) and the restaurant is clean and nice.

Employees are never in a good mood. Always seem like they have something better to do.Last time,  my chicken burrito was missing the avocado ranch sauce and barely had any chicken. My kids cheesy roll-ups were barely warm and the cheese was still raw.
Went throw the drive throw meet a really sweet lady named Sue! I've never been in such a big line and have it move so fast and the food of course was perfect thank you Sue!

It's tacobell we all know what we're getting. It's tasty cheap fast food. I just wish they'd remember sauce at the drive through. For years I've been coming and at least %75 of the time they forget sauce. I either do without or I just pull around and go inside and grab a few handfuls myself to keep in a stockpile for the next time tje inevitably forget the sauce again.

You had one job: Get the order correct. It's not that difficult. You're not making a 5 star meal just a darn burrito, but somehow I still end up with a messed up order half the time I come here that I can't eat. I'm not wasting another dollar at this location.
Super slow service, but the people working there are nice. Taco Bell is Taco Bell. There is a time and a place for it, but only at those times and places. What else can I say?

Unfortunately this location can't seem to get orders right on multiple occasions. ALWAYS CHECK YOUR ORDER before you leave the parking lot.  Usually good at fixing issue,  but it gets old having to go back and being half way through your burrito to find things you didn't order and missing what you did order.
By far the best Taco Bell Location around. Stuff is always friendly, service is quick and orders always correct.

So i complained about the .89 cent sign to the manager and then called customer service, who then contacted the owned of the taco bell. Guess What? I got a free combo meal there. And surprise... I MIGHT NOT EVEN USE IT. 

To be honest, I don't even really like taco bell that much. I mean seriously, its like they have 4 different types of crust/wraps, and 3 meats, and like maybe 8 other vegetable/condiment toppings. I swear, all they do is reach into a bag and pull out one from each category, maybe 2 or 3 in the vege/condiment topping category and create a burrito or w.e from that. 

I mean yeah I get it, its cheap, but to be honest, do you really want to be eating that? I think the best deals are still the half pound cheesy beef and potato burrito. At 530 calories, and 2 to at least satisfy my hunger, its already pretty unhealthy. Oh and 230 g of fat in one burrito. HELLO heart attack. =D 

BUT its not a 1, because I have to admit, for cheap fast food thats open late, its hard to beat. And I am guilty of eating there a few times.
This Taco Bell was very rude the lady gave us are food and gave us a look like their was something wrong with us I am not going back their again
Horrible service , have fun waiting 30+ minutes in the drive through. Can't seem to ever get my order right. Do not come to this location. The taco bell on 164th is always fast and correct.

It's November 2nd time is 3:04am just left this Taco Bell and I'm very upset!!!! The fact that I pulled up and was the only car in drive-thru and had to wait 10mins for 6 tacos  that were absolutely the nastiest greasiest tacos ever!!!!! It was so much grease from them being to lazy to drain the meat that our damn tacos were sticking to the wrapper. I will be calling tomorrow!!!! This is absolutely ridiculous!...

I seriously wish I could give this location zero stars we are constantly having issues with this Taco Bell.

I don't often go to Taco Bell as I'm not really a fast food eater. But every time I go to this location (drive thru). The staff are are very friendly and aren't condescending like other fast food restaurants I went to. I believe I even had the owner hand me my food - really pleasant guy. I can see where his employees get their attitude from.

Just moved to the area, and I've visited this location three times in the past two weeks.  Each time, it was well over three hours before closing time and they "didn't have" any nacho fries, their current running promotion.  Not to mention the fellow at the window was rude and short with me every time. I usually love Taco Bell but this location needs to step it up MAJOR.
This location has the best late night I have ever met. (Crystal, Lamar and I don't know the other ladies name.) When you need a quick meal late at night, this is always a safe bet!
This has to be the slowest Taco Bell of all time. Waited 20 mins in the drive through at 10pm (2 cars in front of me). Clearly not staffed w people who can handle a night shift
Good god stay away from this location. The quality is below average
