In which I steal my roommate's luxury sedan in order to drive to Taco Bell at 3:30 am.

This review's lead in is shamelessly stolen from thisrecording.com which you should be reading anyway.

 There are a lot of problems with holiday parties.  If you're employed you are often obligated to go to your employer's party and pretend you are having fun.  If you are Jewish, like me, that problem is often exponential.  If you are also like me, and have massive commitment issues in every area of your life, you do not invite people to the holiday party that your roommate has been planning for weeks until the morning of the party.  As a result you are not surprised when 80% of your invited guests do not show up.  The people that do show up are treated to vinyl Talking Heads records (omg they rock!),  silent 1980's teen comedies that are playing on HBO2 (Private School), homemade guacamole (I used to work at Chipotle), and an otherwise raucously good time that is the result of 7 people talking about law school (please kill me I hate my life).  In my defense I like to think I make decent Old Fashioneds (Bulleit Rye 4 lyfe), provide fascinating conversation, and I think I already talked about the guacamole.  

But after everyone leaves what should I eat? (English teachers will often tell you not to start sentences, much less paragraphs, with And, But, or Or.  But they are wrong as fuck.  That's why they teach and don't ball out of control like me). And how should I get there?  My car is blocked in by my roommate's Infiniti in our apartment parking lot.  He is passed out on the couch.  It is 3 am.  His keys are lying there.  There is a Brooklyn Summer Ale in the refrigerator (another holiday party fact is that people like to bring expired beer).  I grab the Brooklyn, grab the keys, BOOM I'm driving an Infiniti despite the fact that I would probably blow a .60 if pulled over.  On the way Gotye with Kimbra is blasting on CD101 (or CD 102.5 whatever the fuck).  Great Thursday night.  I park behind a Dale Earnhardt Jr. fan in a red pickup truck at the Taco Bell Drive Thru.  2 hefty girls pop out of the truck and run behind the nearby fence giggling.  If I didn't know any better I would think they are urinating.  I hope there is toilet paper behind the fence.  A few minutes later they reappear looking much more relieved.  It is 4 am by the time I get home.  My roommate is still passed out on the couch.  I don't want to eat the Taco Bell in 
the living room because what if he wakes up and asks me how I got there?  

These cheesy bean and rice burritos were eaten in great shame.

Haha oh my god, how can people pick apart fast food?! And TACO BELL in NORWELL of anything! Honestly this is like, one of the cleanest Ive ever been to. I dont feel like Ill walk out with the plague after sitting in there. The people are chill, the drive-through experiences have been hilarious and sometimes they say some pretty funny stuff. 

The only thing that bums me out about Taco Bell - make more apple empenadas! Like...if you need me to I will buy the rest at the end of the night because I need them in my bod. There's never enough.

But 5 stars because everyones thinking too highly of a TACO BELL and this one rules .

Around 11pm, the drive-thru took 18 mins and everything I ordered was freezing cold. I also realized a couple miles down the road that I was given the wrong order, but I wasn't about to turn around and sit in line another 20 minutes for that.

This is the worst Taco bell location. Dirty, needs renovation. The restroom was not clean, it was a mess. Customer service was horrible. It seemed like the lady didnt even want to help me when I was ordering. I had ordered 3 boxes. It came all in one bag and was mixed. I was missing the cinnomon twist. I asked for the twist and for my food to be separated. The gentalman who called out my order was absolutely rude! Seemed like he didnt want to be there. There was one nice girl helping fix my order and he yells out i ran out of boxes and starts talking under his breath. She goes and gets boxes for me and completes my order. I will never come back to this location. They need to check on management.
Its not about quality when it comes to Taco Bell.  Its all about quantity and convenience.  You get what you pay for at 2am and I keep coming back.

Don't use the app. Twice now I've selected drive thru, been charged, and there's zero record of my order. They offered to take my order again while sitting at the window but paying again for what I already ordered? No thanks

5 stars for this location!

Super clean, quick and the customer service is excellent.

Plus, I love the fact that Taco Bell is introducing more vegetarian items on their menu. I' m loving those potatoes tacos.

Very affordable and our order was quick and not cold.  I ordered 3 mexi melts and a small drink.  I like it because you get free refills.  Parking is good plenty of parking.  Taco Bell was clean and tables wiped down.

Let's be honest, it's Taco Bell.   Their food's the typical fast food, shamelessly Americanized not even close to real mexican food.    I eat it anyway because it's sometimes amazing, sometimes exactly what I needed and a perfect fit into our culture.

My one and only problem with Taco Bell is THIS Taco Bell.   When I want Taco Bell, I usually end up at this location because it's close to work and home.   The food's always up to Taco Bell standards...but their service at the front counter ALWAYS leaves something to be desired.   I mean, why should I be standing there waiting for someone to take my order...even after the people on the food prep line look my way and seemingly ignore me?  I know someone can't stand at the front just waiting for the next order, but just what are they doing back there that requires me to wait up to five minutes before anyone even acknowledges me?
BEST taco bell ever. We drive over there just because its super nice and friendly. Always clean, helpfull. And if an order is messed up they fix it in an instant.

This Taco Bell is great. I always avoid TB because every single time I go to one, I wait forever and the order is always wrong...not this one! Been here a few times and my order was not only fast, but accurate as well. My nachos bell grande with steak seriously looked like it could be in a commercial!

I've dined in and used the drive-thru, both times a flawless experience. The inside is clean and bathrooms were as well, which is a major plus for any city fast food establishment. The employees I encountered during both trips were all extremely friendly and courteous. 

This location is definitely my new go-to for Taco Bell!

Usually the best. Went to get the chicken jalapeño honey biscuit breakfast and it said out of stock. I asked when it would be back. She basically said they won't be making anything with crispy chicken. I think they just don't want to. Had to park to wait for my meal because of eggs. 

Usually super on point. Just fyi.

Update:  Super long line at 10:30 Friday night. They forgot my cinnabons. I rushed without checking because they had been on point and the line was long. Inside was closed. I'm sitting in the huge line again. Yay. She said she tried to run out but didn't...I was at the locked front door, then in line. Didn't seem to care. My wife's food sat. I'm sure they have a crazy job.
5 stars for the lady working the drive thru at midnight. Haven't even tried the food yet but we left in such a good mood because of her awesome attitude. :) (receipt says her name is Lee P)

I was in a hurry; but decided to go inside this local Taco Bell near the corner of Goldenrod and Colonial. I saw they had the new cheese-stuffed "puffy taco," so I ordered two with beef. I also ordered a small frozen strawberry drink to go with it. The quesolupas were quite extraordinary (packaging and condiments.) However, the cheese baked-in just isn't necessary; and, didn't do much for the dish. Beside, they are quite pricey.

This one star goes to all Taco Bells.  I used to love Taco Bell, so why the one star?  Well, they got rid of the one thing I went there for: Baja Steak Chalupas.  They even got rid of Nacho Cheese Chalupas.  What the hell am I supposed to eat?  The basic as hell regular chalupa?  What's so special about that?  I do possess taste buds, you know.

Fiesta salsa + that pepper jack sauce was so deliciously amazing.  

I'll start going back if they bring them back, and hopefully they will, because I really miss them :(

RIP Baja Steak Chalupa, you were the best thing they had.

By far the slowest Taco Bell I've been to in my entire life. I had time to make a help account while waiting in a 5 car line. They also skimp you on sauce and aren't very polite. The one that closed on 8th was much better.
Dining room is great! Plenty of laptop plugins, comfortable chairs, clean and attractive. Could have done a better job wiping tables, cost a star.

This is THE WORST service I have EVER HAD! I'm a paying customer who arrives 3 HOURS before you close and you tell me I have to take off food because you're a lazy ass employee who doesn't want to work hard? It clearly says your open till 4 and you say there isn't enough meat to make my food? BULLSHIT. I can't feed my family because he doesn't want to "make" more food. Give me a break. Taco Bell you're full of shit. I love not being able to get food when I'm on vacation thanks for ruining my night Taco Bell!:)

Edit: got home and I'm missing two tacos and got dollar nachos instead of nacho supreme

My fiancé and I have been going to this Taco Bell location for a year and a half now and our last experience was truly our LAST. Upon ordering inside, we proceeded to wait for over 20 minutes, which was ridiculous considering there was only one other gentleman there who had ordered a single item after we had placed our order. While waiting for our not-even-close to fast food, four girls in their early twenties ran in, yelling and being overall disrespectful to the other patrons. 

We immediately realized that one of the girls was an employee when she leaned over the counter to the side of the register and started pulling cups out to hand to all of her friends, even trying to give them to my fiancé and the other man, who both refused. She loudly stated it was okay to take it because she works at this location. 

This entire time, the manager was right there watching, socializing with the girls and being completely unprofessional herself as other employees in the kitchen started coming out to socialize. This whole time we were waiting for our food. 

The employee and her friends all ordered food, which the manager did not charge to them, and they spent the entire time walking around while eating, standing in front of the drinks, glaring at the other patrons, and dropping racial slurs and calling each other offensive names. The manager witnessed this the entire time and encouraged it.

Our food was so sloppily made, my chicken quesadillas didn't even contain chicken and our food was burnt.  It was clear that they had half-made our food in order to socialize more.

Had it not been for the evident hostile and unsafe environment, including the fact that the manager was clearly supportive of this behavior, we would have complained or at least asked for the franchise owner's number so he could be informed that his employees were stealing from him and causing paying customers to feel unsafe.

If I could have given zero or even negative stars, I would have. Would not go back to this Taco Bell. When I called to let corporate know their employees were stealing from them, I was completely dismissed. I actually don't think I would ever support as a customer Taco Bell on principle of their complete lack of professionalism.

Taco shells were rancid last time we ordered to-go.  So this time we told them and they still served the rancid taco shells again.  About half the people in the restaurant were not paying customers.  Just people hanging out in the restaurant.  Not a nice environment for families.

I live in walking distance to this Taco Bell and go about every other week. They are rude. They are very slow and once you enter the drive thru, you are stuck. The food has been wrong about 50% of the time. Only go here if you are completely desperate for Taco Bell. 

P.s. The Wendy's next door is pretty quick and they have never messed up my order.

I needed some food super super late and was in the area. I was in shock as to how wonderfully nice the staff was. It was absolutely amazing! Great job folks seriously! If you can be that upbeat dealing with drive thru crazies in the middle of the night! Bravo - thanks for the late night grub :)

I love Taco Bell, and I'm not afraid to admit it. This particular location, however, is permanently off my list of restaurants to patronize. I have given them multiple chances to redeem themselves for their lengthy wait times, but I am finally giving up. I've been there on at least five occasions, and the speed for them to beat is 10 minutes (which, for them, is lightning quick). My longest wait time was 20+ minutes, and the others were closer to that. I've never been there when they've been super busy (if I recall correctly, the most people I've ever had in front of me was 4-5), and shudder to think how long I'd wait if they were. The worst part is, there are almost always employees standing around not helping out; it's extremely frustrating to see when you are hungry and want to hurry up and catch the next COTA bus, which they actually made me miss once on the aforementioned longest wait time. Also, the employees are less than friendly and enthusiastic, even by fast-food standards. If you're hungry for Taco Bell, you'd be better off driving a few minutes down the road to the next closest one; you'd probably still get your food faster. Alternately, there's a super-excellent Wendy's just a few doors down.
14 minutes for one taco. That's the time it takes me to go 5 miles to work. Pull it together guys

Today,  I went through the drive through. I should've checked my bag but left and when I got home realized my order was completely messed up. The GRILLED stuffed burrito was not grilled and was cold. I was missing items off my order but was charged. Ive ordered inside the restaurant before and the order took about 15  min, despite being one of 4 in the restaurant. Please get it together.

This might be the slowest Taco Bell I've ever been to. Really.

The good:
They got my order right. 
They gave me plenty of sauce.

The bad: 
The service wasn't great from a "business standard" standpoint. I went through the drive through, and they didn't greet me using a recognizable script. What usually happens when they don't use a scripted greeting (and what happened to me) is you are left wondering what they said and if you can order. 

The ugly:
I sat at the pick up/payment window for over 5 full minutes after paying without the staff saying a word to me and without being handed a single item from my order. I'm not sure if they had to harvest the beans for my burrito or kill the chicken to make the new chicken chips (which are fine but not remarkable), but it took them FOREVER. 

Bottom line: they'll get your order right, but don't go to this Taco Bell if you want your fast food to actually come out quickly.

Not sure why Taco Bell doesn't think people need a place to change their babies? 

Additionally: the slowest "fast food" I've been to.

The line is always really long. One time I waited AN ENTIRE HOUR. Another time there was a line, the place said it was open but when we drove through there was nobody at the intercom, or in the building except maintenance workers.

Went there around 12pm for lunch today. The front cashier woman literally had open herpes sores all over her lips. Management should have said she wouldn't be allowed to work with open sores like that. Scary hazard. Obviously left and didn't order. Never going back there again. They obviously don't care about being hygienic.

Let me preface by saying Taco bell is my most favorite fast food joint ever!
Now with that being said, its clear that my fatness visits many different locations and very frequently.  While i find the staff and restaurants fairly clean and friendly, the food portions are a JOKE!!!
I get the taco cantina bell bowl and this place literally is about 1/3 of the size of the other chains i go to.

Last week my orders were fine. Yesterday I ordered my order and they put no avocado ranch on my meal deal A which comes with it. If 3 pieces of chicken on my chipotle chicken loaded griller that also had no chipotle sauce. My shredded chicken mini quesadilla had no chicken on it. So they give me the same order today with only one bite that had avocado ranch on that burrito, the chipotle chickwn burrito had everything but was smalll as shit, and the mini quesadilla had no chicken. Fucking bs..... and funny thing is i saw my co worker walking out bc he was in the Drive-through and they put no beans on one of the burritos.
Absolutely horrible, always a 30 min plus wait and the food is always poorly thrown together

How do you run out of beef?!?!??? On a Sunday night!!!! Be better prepared. That is simply unprofessional and ludicrous. Get it together Taco Bell. Off to McDonalds I go. You've lost a loyal customer.

Got a Mexican pizza and two crunchy Taco Supremes here the evening of August 6th and had the runs the next morning. Have never had this reaction from these items in the past at this or any other Taco Bell.

I'm absolutely appalled !! Today February 23rd at 12:49 PM I walked into my house to give my daughter a Crunchwrap supreme and taco. I specifically said dairy allergy and they repeated my order back to me so I know they heard me. THERE WAS DAIRY IN BOTH!!!!!! I was livid!! I called and the manager couldn't of been more disrespectful, inconsiderate, unprofessional, and just flat out RUDE. Refused to give me a refund or remake my order and said she would look for me on the camera. CORPORATE WILL BE HEARING FROM ME!! Not acceptable!

Usually a long wait time, not usually a problem. Day shift is completely different than night shift. Rarely is my food made wrong during lunch hours and it's always hot and well portioned. At night it's 50/50 on if the order will be right and you usually have to wait 20+ minutes, which is why I have not gone at night in years until today. I waited 20 minutes, they were very busy but i expected this long of a wait. They did not give me my side of nacho cheese, I went back up to get it (took 5 minutes). Sit back down to see that my chicken quesadilla has sauce on it when I requested no sauce (and the receipt reflected this). I Bring the quesadilla back up, instead of having the kitchen remake it, the guy up front says they are really busy and he has to ring it in as it's own order, with a 100% off discount. Wait another 20 minutes only for it to be made wrong again. I ask for a refund for the quesadilla at this point, dt kid tells the manager who screams from the back that the order was "free" so why would they give a refund for the quesadilla. I explained to the kid the problem of it being a remake, manager never comes up front. She tells the kid open the draw to give me the money. It is a 5 minute scramble for them to find the keys because they don't remember who had them last. No apologies made. I understand the long wait times even though others complained, but if you are going to make people wait this long, at least make their food right. And if you don't, fix the problem ASAP instead of saying you're too busy and make them wait another 20 minutes for food that is still not correct. They took my receipt when I was showing I did in fact pay the first time for the quesadilla, so I could not do the survey, which I know is the only reviews they read / care about, but hopefully this helps people see they should go to this location during lunch only.

Went to the drive thru and ordered a T6 and a pink lemonade, 35 minutes passed and I still didn't receive my order!!! At the DRIVE THRU! Went on break and wanted to grab a quick bite, but ended up wasting my whole entire break in line waiting to receive my food! I ended up leaving with no food, time wasted, and upset. Very disappointing.

ARE YOU KIDDING ME!??? JUST GOT HOME AND THIS IS WHAT I FIND!??? Good job assholes. May not mean shit to you... take pride in your shitty job. I'm 32 and could run circles around you young kids. This is unacceptable and if I didn't have to load my kid back up in the car I would be right back there to get my food corrected. Fucking unbelievable!

I love you Taco Bell, my fast food craving.

This location has the updated interior (looks kind of like a Moe's on the inside and not like the late 70s or early 80s).

I kind of miss that familiar look but I will get used to it.  Overall, decently fast and friendly the few times I have been here.  (my home-base Taco Bell is at the glorious Ponce location)
Nice place to eat but make sure or order come with your right ingredients. Extremely slow kitchen. 4 chalupa 40 minutes to prepare.

It is with a sad heart that I write yet another bad review from Yelp land. I work midnights so often I stop here for food. It's Tuesday night at 12:50am. All of my food, ALL OF IT, it cold.  The tacos are larger than usual and look thrown together. Often times that I'm moving through here at 2am I feel as I'm drastically bothering the employees. Despite them constantly being out of things and constantly messing up my order I've always tossed it up as, all well, it's Taco Bell. I don't cat care anymore. It's a simple job, get it right.  I work in the service industry and my last few orders that've been put together have been beyond  embarrassment.

This is the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to.  Every time I have gone to this location, they screw my order up.  Either an item is forgotten or a special request (like no meat, or no onions) isnt followed, despite the fact that it was repeated back to me when I placed my order.

Slowest Taco Bell Ever. Unfortunately it's quicker for us to drive down Mill Plain to the Taco Bell, order, get our food and drive home than it is to get through this drive-thru and we live less than a mile from this location. The food is fine, but it takes at least 30min to get "fast food" here. Not sure what has changed, but it was not always this way.
The night crew was SUPER FRIENDLY!! I And gave me a tip that you can have a cheesy gordita crunch WITH DORRITOS TACO SHELL!!!!! I :)

Normally, taco bell is the ONE restaurant I can get in and out fast, decent food and cheap prices. However, at my most recent visit, I ordered for myself and my husband, and waited well over ten minutes in the drive through. I wouldn't be writing a bad review if this was my only problem. After checking out bag before we left the parking lot (a necessity with fast food these days), we discovered that one item was not listed on the receipt, and one item did not have my 'no sour cream' modification on the receipt. So, we went inside to exchange, and waited AGAIN well over ten minutes for our order. 
A little irritated, we went back to our car to quickly eat, and there was still sour cream on two items I ordered, and the *tiny* amount of nacho cheese on my nacho supreme should not have qualified as nachos.  

I don't have a problem with a wait time, but if Taco Bell, FAST food is taking over 20 minutes to complete an order of a mere five items, I expect it to at least be correct.

Straight up, Taco Bell is good because it's cheap, and doesn't taste bad(I mean, amazing to me, but decent to someone else)...this is the worst Taco Bell I have ever gone too....and I have gone here repeatedly. It's always bad. I mean the food taste like almost every Taco Bell there is. The portions however are terribly small. Like half the size of every other Taco Bell. SHAME, SHAME!

At 8pm on a Wednesday night, it took *20 minutes* to get food in the drive-through. (I got a text as I drove in, so I had a timestamp.)

There were maybe five cars ahead of us. Not sure why they're so slow.

This is the worst taco bell. They have very poor customer service, almost like the soup nazi from Sienfeld. I went through the drive through late at night and there was a poor girl on her bike in front of me that they refused to serve. I offered to buy it for her since I was in a car and they told me I wasn't allowed to order her food. Seriously, if I want to buy something for someone, I can't believe a business would keep me from doing so. Horrible, don't go here for your late night munchies.
This is the slowest Taco Bell I have even been too. I live close and would like to be a frequent customer but I cannot wait 20 minutes to get $4.99 worth of food. Please help.

Where to start! Jessica who is working tonight was completely rude and disrespectful. She should NOT work here if she wants to be rude and disrespectful. I wanted to order a number 4. What she did was put each item on individually which made the cost more. I am not sure if she was pocketing that extra money or not. Yeah it was only .40 difference, but still that is one type of employee I would not want working for my business. Also the taco I got had nothing but brown lettuce.

I don't really eat Taco Bell- my family does, so I can't comment on the food. However, this Taco Bell has got to be the slowest in the nation. I've sat in line for 45 minutes before. Currently waiting for 20 now. I could've had dinner at a sit down restaurant by now.  My son is lucky I love him so much!!

Monday night, the slowest night but somehow I waited 36 minutes at the drive thru.
Always fresh if you're looking for a restaurant not a "fast food" joint.
Employees seem like nothing matters.

Rude service at the drive thru. The shredded chicken burrito taste awful (like chicken gone bad, awful) and they are our of their signature drink Baja blast which is a customer favorite! Too bad there isn't another location closer. Funny how they are holding interviews for positions as I guess most of the good staff left and I would want to work here neither if was the last place on earth!

Supervisor the manager is horrible and when I called to tell her there was plastic in my food!!!! She responding with a sour, not genuin "sorry"!!! She was kind of annoyed as if she doesn't care!!!! This place is gross the food is nasty !!! Unless ur into plastic dibree in ur food!!!

After a night of drunken debauchery around PDX, my buddy and I wanted our "4th meal" since Taco Bell's are open 'til 4am. The plan was to get it on the way home and eat it at my place. Oh boy were we excited. Not because Taco Bell is so great--it actually isn't and I don't even like it--but because we were drunk and hungry! And we all know that everything tastes good when you're in this state. So, Taco Bell it was. 

After hopping off the freeway we make our way down the 99 to the Taco Bell. Guess what? They're closed?! Are you kidding me? Even though the lights were off we still drove through the drive-thru because we couldn't believe it! I've never seen a Taco Bell closed at 2:30am! Ever! Boo on you TB! 1-star only because yelp won't let me give you a negative 1-star =/

So we drove across the street and got McRib combos from the old faithful, McDonald's LOL

I mean, really, it's a Taco Bell. But you can't go wrong with plentiful sauce distribution, friendly staff and your very own on-duty cop. Viva la chalupa!! And my personal favorite of course, the veggie quesadilla, cheese burrito and soft taco sureme.

Ordered XL "Steak" burrito got ground beef 
Amazes me fast food is so hard to get right 
This is the third time my order has been wrong here .. Last time told them no guacamole of course was on the burrito. 
Reading the other Yelp reviews on this place looks like I'll be going elsewhere from now on ..

tried Taco Bell out. Read a few of the older reviews, and I'm a little surprised. 

We were served promptly. Worker over the intercom was pleasant. Had a slight conversational miscommunication at the window about sauce, mainly my fault, I didn't want sauce or anything but I didn't hear her question. 

Eating cheese quesadilla now. There's sauce inside of it, was a bit of a surprise, googled up the ingredients, it's a jalapeño sauce. Could have done without it. Add your own salsa at home for +3 , i.e. verde salsa from luckys that my mom gave me.

Spicy potato tacos had a cute look. "They were good. I was gonna say they could have been warmer but we did sit in the car for a second."

can't give it 5 stars cause it's Taco Bell but I would if I could boo xx 


And I recede.

This is hands-down the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to. It's the closest to my house and I keep trying to give it a shot... but I'm done. I just waited over 30 minutes for four tacos and two burritos. And when I got home? The order was wrong! Oh, but at least they gave me a coupon for a free taco.... Ridiculous. Don't go here. Ever.

I tried this location, very nice, clean and impressed to eat inside... will sure come/visit again. All staff people are good and listen your orders. they also listen you what you want inside or remove and add something else in your order. Nice wide parking.
Just small changes they have to do is when they speak your order sometime you cant listen well. so some loud or some system needed to inform your order is ready....!!!
They get 4 stars cause they normally get my order right.

I don't care about all the people complaining about how long it took to get their food, they've always gotten my order right it doesn't matter to me how long it takes it's open until 4 am what more could you possibly want
Hey, it's a Taco Bell. I love the place, but this one could be a little better. If you love burritos and tacos cheap, this is your place.

I swear Taco Bell is by far the biggest offender in the "screw up an order" category! It boggles my mind that they mess up my order 1 in 3 visits! (How can they survive if every customer has this average experience?!) Luckily, I like most of the menu so I don't starve...But that doesn't mean that I'm happy when I get screwed in the deal! You have a finite menu and had been in business for what? Almost 50 years? You should remember the menu. Food isn't cheap....If I have to pay $10 for lunch at a drive Thru.. Please , consider that I'm in my car.... And usually don't discover the error until I've reached my destination, unless it's something OBVIOUSLY "missing". Than to call and be told that I "can bring it back" and they'll fix it? Please use your head! Ask me if I can take a pic of it and either send it to you, or bring it in next visit...Something, just not...Bring it back! That's ridicules... We're driving thru...Probably because we're in a hurry, that's why we pay you guys so much for the convenience of not having to cook! Either BELIEVE that you're employees make errors, and I've got better things to do than try to scam a meal from Taco Bell, OR, find a better way to keep me from "stealing from you". (If I were going to try to scam a meal...It's gonna be at a really good restaurant!)
It's very aggravating to know you don't have to get better. If I wait it out..(maybe a few months) everything will flip and I'll be directing this to the new mgr and staff. It's not just this location or chain of restraunt s... It's just you THIS TIME!

Same as all of the taco bells. Some days I've been the food has been fresh, and in order, but other times, I've had sloppy burritos and other items on the menu. Open late on weekends, lines are sometimes long..

Absolutely terrible. This is my second time going to this Taco Bell. The first time, the drive thru took about 45 minutes. This time the drive thru took about 25 minutes, including waiting at the intercom with my window open in a thunderstorm for 5 minutes until they finally took my order. I got my food and returned home to find that over half the order was missing, and much of the food we did receive was incorrectly made (does Taco Bell even have a burrito with rice, beef, beans, and chicken? If so, I definitely didn't order it). I considered going back to complain and get the rest of my order, but I'm guessing it was take another hour or so of my time to get any kind of resolution, so I'm cutting my losses here.

I live less than a mile from this place and will never return.
Jason and I eat here about every 2 weeks. We love the food. The unlimited soda is great. They recently did an unnecessary remodeling

Similar to previous poster, I don't review fast food unless it's great or horrible. This one is horrible!
Went to drive thru on a rainy Wednesday before thanksgiving, admittedly not a great time to eat anywhere. Ordered one of their extra large chicken stuffed burritos, $4.79. At minimum, I was expecting something with chicken in it. I guess I was wrong.  Just a small burrito, stuffed with beans, rice, and some bad smelling sour cream.  Thankfully I ordered a crunchy taco as well, I needed it because I was still hungry. $10 for a fast food meal, would have been better off going to chipotle!
Another small annoyance was asking specifically at the drive-through window if napkins were included in the bag.  The attendant said absolutely, they are in there. Drove away happy to eat in the car, then realized there were no napkins.  

Not the first time I've had a bad experience at this specific location. I'm generally a fan of Taco Bell, but I would avoid this place if at all possible.  hopefully the franchise manager reads these reviews.

I like Taco Bell breakfast. I'm going to start this off by saying that there is nothing wrong with their food. What I have a problem with is when they decide not to show up or not to put their earpiece on. Today I went to Taco Bell at 7:30 and there was no one inside working. They are supposed to open at 7 and I guess I should have been surprised, but I was not very surprised because this is not the first time something like this happens here. I have been to this location several times for breakfast and on multiple occasions either no one has their earpiece on to take orders in the drive thru or they open way later than 7am. This Taco Bell really needs to work on getting its morning routine down or find other people that can be there on time and  have their earpiece on and be ready to work.

I realized I was only reviewing places I liked recently so I did a hard target search to find one I did not like.

I do not like Mexican food in general but Taco Bell is the lowest rung on my least favorite ladder. Every time I smell that smell it makes me sick. Every time my roommates bring some home I want to shoot myself. I imagine if Hell existed this would be the only restaurant there.

There is just nothing good about this place. The lowest quality meat and ingredients, never clean, and no one even pretends to bother to wear gloves or hairnets.

I guess if you like cheap terrible food this is the place to go but I would rather go to McDonald's or Wendy's any day.

Taco Bell Tigard is sooo awful! Simple Job can't even get the order right! Ugh! Just listen to what people order and get it right. Very simple! Making people drive back to exchange their food doesn't make it all better. For God's sake, stop acting all smart a** about it. Remember you work in service industry and customer is always right. We are not being unreasonable. Just get the beans and rice only burrito correct so my kid don't choke on the spicy sauce we didn't ask for at first bite!
When I call, the person who picked up sounded high and smells like weed around the parking lot. It's legal to smoke but it's still illegal to work high. Get a grip people!
It's my mistake. No more Taco Bell ... This is crap!
Love this Taco Bell. We come here all the time and the staff is so nice. Not sure why the reviews are so bad

This is literally the worst taco bell in town. Full stop. I never write reviews and I had deleted the yelp app but I logged back in just to say how much I hate this taco bell. They crossed me for the last time. Listen, I know taco bell is crap. So believe me when I say this taco bell is pure garbage. If I could leave zero stars I would.

Here's the thing, this isn't about anything but the food. They simply can't make it. I've been to other taco bells I know what I'm ordering and what it's supposed to look and taste like. You can't ring me up for the things I asked for and then just make random combinations of tortillas and whatever you feel like.

I hope this taco bell closes forever. F-

For whatever reason, this location is super slow. And I mean SLOW. Like it took 25 minutes from the time I ordered with only a few cars in front of me. The cashier said they were waiting on fresh chalupa shells, but when I got the food, the chalupa was cold. Go figure. The order was also wrong, but I wasn't going to go back around and wait for god knows how long to get it corrected, as the lobby was closed at 1am. Save yourself the trouble and go to the Taco Bell in Camas or the one at Mill plain & Chaklov.

Not the best, not the worst.  The homeless guy that was inside having a taco and avoiding the rain was very nice and not creepy at all.  The kids hanging out were minimally obnoxious, and left without making a mess.  The bad?  The girl at the counter.  We weren't ready to order right away so she walked back over to the drive-thru window and proceeded to text for the next 5 minutes.
Great Food! Right amount of cheese and content. Good service to.

I, like many who visited Taco Bell lately, was here to try their new Doritos hard tacos. The Cool Ranch flavor recently dropped in addition to the Nacho Cheese and before this visit I have yet to try either one of these joints. One of my coworkers planted the taco seed in my head earlier in the day and once lunch time came around, we went.

This particular Taco Bell is located on Howell Mill near the Wal-Mart supercenter so you know traffic is killer, especially around lunch time. Understandably service isn't going to be spectacular. One because I went during lunch time. Two...well because it's a sub-$5 meal at Taco Bell. The wait time was lengthy, but the lady working the register was extraordinarily friendly. I could feel she was genuinely kind, not because she had to be. I've been to many places where employees sounded nice but their body language said otherwise. Wish I could recall her name. Shouts out to you ma'am! One of my coworkers received the wrong order, 2 Cool Ranch tacos instead of one of each Dorito variety. The staff happily corrected the mistake and let him keep the erroneous taco. Another shout out goes to my coworker for letting me eat the extra taco. Appreciate it chief!

Food is what you should expect at any Taco Bell. Not going to sugar coat it and try to critique ground beef and what it should taste like. You should already know. If you don't, you've lived a deprived life. I will say that if you were wondering which of the two Doritos tacos are better. Cool Ranch over Nacho Cheese. The Nacho Cheese flavor gets masks by the flavors of the taco's contents so I couldn't really taste the difference between it and a regular taco. Cool Ranch gives it a unique kick and sets the taco off right. 

I won't be back to Taco Bell anytime soon. Not because there is anything wrong with this location, but because i'll probably die if I frequent here too often. But don't let me discourage you from it.

(Norwell, MA Location - 48 Washington St) I gave the 1 star because I love Taco Bell. That said, I JUST returned from there. I went through the drive through, ordered my food and hurried home to enjoy my meal. Once home, I opened my bag to find that my order was wrong. WAY wrong. I ordered 2 Double Decker Tacos, 1 Beefy Nacho Burrito (New item!) 1 1/2 lb. Beef Combo Burrito, 1 Large Baja Blast and I donated $1. Total of $10.79. Here's what I received: 1 Large Baja Blast, 4 soft shell tacos and 1 hard shell taco. ARE YOU SERIOUS!? That's less than $5 worth of food! There is no way they screwed up that badly and didn't know. My receipt is correct, and they remembered to charge me almost $11... LIVID!!

Third time in a row that they have completely messed up my order and I get home without items. I don't know who the manager is at this location, but I'm guessing they only work there because they get some kind of federal recognition for employing complete retards. I have eaten at Taco Bell restaurants all over the country and I can say without a doubt, this is the worst one in the entire country. Love Taco Bell's food, but I absolutely will never return to this location. It's pathetic.

I realized I hadn't eaten all day and had to grab whatever was close by before an appointment, I went to this Taco Bell. Because of the area it's in I was a little unsure if I should but, I was too hungry and out of time for another choice. I went through the drive through and the lady that helped me, Amber T, was awesome. She was very friendly and had great customer service! She helped me turn something on the menu into something they don't sell anymore. She did a good job of appropriately up selling, was speedy, and just so friendly. The customer service alone from this experience gives it a five stars. The food was also good, her suggestion of how to turn that item into something they don't have anymore was perfect.

I have been here twice.  The food was ok, but both times they were understaffed and had a 10+ minute wait with only 1-2 customers ahead of me.  There is another location down the street on Mill Plain that is much more efficient.

I am a pretty regular customer I've been going here for a few years now, the staff is great HOWEVER, they have messed up my orders quite a few times now! I have been a vegetarian for 12 years now, so I physically can not stomach meat! I hate wasting food so otherwise I'd just suck it up and eat it! But I don't understand what is so hard to understand about NO MEAT. I looked the cashier right in the eyes and said it about 3 times! I checked the receipt and she put it in as bacon. If vegetarian is not an option for a breakfast quesadilla then say so?? I'm a little annoyed, but I am still nice enough to give 4 stars because I LOVE Taco Bell, mainly for their vegetarian options!! I also know that working in the food industry SUCKS, and maybe they had a few online orders but the store didn't appear to be busy, it'd be one thing if it was crazy in there I could understand. I'm also still giving 4 stars because they usually hook it up when they make a mistake. Just please pay attention!

It's a regular Taco Bell. When I went in it was deserted since it was an off-time.

But as I waited for my food, some guy came in and was clearly so thankful to the staff for having found his lost cell phone or something.

So I guess the staff is kind and thoughtful.

I just went here for the first time. I go to a A LOT of taco bells. I mean A LOT and this taco bell is the best one I have ever been to. I mean, the interior is outdated (90s style) but it's clean. The staff is so kind. They're also fast at making food and accurate. I always get skimped out with ingredients at other taco bells but not this one. I got plenty of cheese, beans, beef etc. I have a very confusing order and they got it right. I went at 11:00 on a Wednesday. My cashier's name was Savannah U. and she was Awesome. Another employee was awesome as well but I didn't get her name. She was a young pretty black girl. I will probably drive past other taco bells just to go to this one instead. Great experience!
Amazing. Always gets our order right and the place is usually pretty clean. They strangely require you to have a code to use the bathroom, but whatever. Great Taco Bell!

Convince my location right off 205 but the drive thru/parking lot sucks. When you use the drive thru be careful turning left!!

Food is acceptable. They usually get at least one thing wrong though. Every time. 

I've mentioned a bad experience/missing food and I usually get some compensation. 

They have new staff all the time.

Monday night, the slowest night but somehow I waited 36 minutes at the drive thru.
Always fresh if you're looking for a restaurant not a "fast food"
Employees seem like nothing matters
 Month later accidentally went to Taco Bell, 30 minutes haven't ordered extremely slow
If this is a Mexican restaurant shouldn't the people in there be actually working or is it just a bunch of kids?

Location had a long drive thru ions so I decided to go inside thinking the wait time was shorter. Was I wrong! Waited 10 mins only to be told they weren't able to complete my order due to not having the meat. I asked for my money back and left!

Horrible Costumer Service!! 
Ordered food and paid for extra sour cream and got it with Not even the normal amount that's suppose to be in there, got it with no sour cream. Also ordered Extra Grilled and got my food Cold!! Also paid to get my food redone!!!!! Never been to a Taco Bell as bad as this one!
Fair quality of food considering low prices. Staff can definitely put some effort to keep it clean. Especially during busy hours.

This is the second time in a week that I've been here. Last week they shorted me a taco. I emailed them and never heard back. This time I asked the cashier if he would give me a free one to compensate for the last mistake. He said, "I don't know how to do that" and I asked if he could get me someone who did know. He was so rude and clearly hates his job. Also, I waited for 15 minutes.

The cashier was AWFUL! She grabs my drink cup after we pay and purposely drops it away from me on the counter. Ok I let it go. My 2yr old spills her drink on the floor so I go stand at the counter where they hand out food and let her finish with a customer. She gets done, doesn't acknowledge me at all and leaves to go pick up trays. A guy comes up to order so she walks back, takes his order, won't look at me and leaves the damn counter again to go rearrange the sauce packets. I walk over to her. 
"Hi, I'm sorry but my daughter spilled her drink. Do you have a towel and I'll clean it up?"
"Nope. We don't have towels here."
"Uh ok. So what would you like me to use to clean it up?"
"These napkins I guess."
"Wow. You are so incredibly helpful." And the whole time she won't even look at me. This girl was really going out of her way to be rude.

I love Taco Bell.  I have been to this location a couple of times and have yet to have a bad experience.  This is a franchise owned location, which means that the prices are a little higher, but I can always find my favorites on the value menu.  It is always good for a meal for a couple of bucks.

The only reason I'm docking a star is because it's Taco Bell and it's gross fast food and the quality is never going to be good enough to give it 5 stars. Sorry T-Bell.

However, I was really impressed with this particular store. First of all, it was cleaner than any fast-food restaurant I have ever been in. I've worked in fast food and as I stared back into the kitchen, I was in total shock.

I have particular food restrictions and as I was placing my order (throwing in my needs and restrictions), I could tell the poor girl behind the counter was a little overwhelmed and probably somewhat new. The manager came over and helped place my order (in a way that didn't make the counter staff seem incompetent which is a great quality in a manager) and they made sure my food was made in a way that I could eat it. 

Overall, great fast-food experience.

Thinking about doing a 10 day fast and my body is wanting to load up on all the junk food I can.

Thank you Taco Bell for having a speedy drive thru.

Thank you Taco Bell for having tacos where all the filling doesn't fall out soon as I bite into it.

Thank you Taco Bell for all you do with your late nite drive thru.

Thank you Taco Bell for being a junk food/fast food gawd!

A true five! And you wouldn't think it by seeing the place, but after years of coming here they have yet to get my order wrong even a single time. Not once. On top of that, the service and friendly faces truly stand out. The WiFi has always been working when I needed it, and it's super chill. Here's hoping they're an app location soon!

We stopped in for lunch and, naturally, had a great meal (because TBell is awesome!).

Decor: It's a Taco Bell... But it was very clean and inviting with not a dirty table or piece of garbage in sight. In fact, the staff is very on point about cleaning (both inside the dining room and outside the building).
Bathroom: Very clean, inviting, and well lit.

Staff: The cashier was friendly and our food was prepared very quickly. It was also very hot and fresh. Additionally, as I said above, the staff is focused on cleanliness. Good staff!

Food: It's Taco Bell, so it's delicious! Everything was rather well made and tasted as it should; no complaints.

Value. It's Taco Bell, fantastic bang for your buck!

I will ALWAYS return to Taco Bell and this location is a solid choice.

Fresh, local, sustainable ingredients. Hard to beat a place with such a commitment to the area and the sourcing of local, grass fed beef. The Doritos Locos taco is a must try if you are looking for authentic Mexican food with an American twist. Definitely would recommend to anyone visiting the area.

I work near this location so i literally go to this taco bell about 3 times a week for lunch. I always order the same thing. For whatever reason, this taco bell always had trouble ringing in my order when paid with a card. I always try multiple cards but for whatever reason they do not even register them. So they get a manager and he or she handles it. I felt bad so i would always pay in cash lately to avoid having to bother the manager. I work in customer service also so i always go above and beyond to treat csrs with the respect we deserve. Well today i did not have cash. I apologized and explained she will probably need a manager since this location has trouble with my card. She scoffed and said "no we dont do that" i was stunned at what she said and how she said it. I explained my situation to her explained how fot whatever reason this location has trouble with the cards. She proceeded to laugh at me and vigorously swipe my card. She laughed again and said "yeah, its not just us". I was so taken back i reached for my card and asked if a manager could come over. I took my card back as she said "no you can go to the bank and come back". I told her absolutely not and drove away. I understand how frustrating problem customers are so i was extremely surprised and upset to be spoken to that way.

I love Taco Bell, but this was the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to. I waited in like for at least 15 minutes, I wasn't too worried about the wait but once I got my food I was very disappointed. I ordered a steak quesarito and none of the cheese was melted and it wasn't even hot. I also ordered an extra side of nacho cheese and when I opened it it was less than half full. I hardly ever write bad reviews but I was really disappointed.
The line cane sometimes be long but they are usually get through it quite fast and are very friendly and professional.

Average food. Average customer service. Usually a long wait time because for some reason they cannot work on more than one order at a time. Always have to check the bag because they usually forget to give you something that you ordered

The customer service at this Taco Bell is awful. I love Taco Bell so I can't complain about the food but I've gotten the wrong order 4 times in the past 6 months and it's extremely frustrating. The employees are not all friendly, though it's clear some try. Others make it obvious they don't want to be there and seem to take it out on the customers. I have had good experiences because it's Taco Bell-- but they could work on customer service and employee friendliness

My granddaughter works or worked at Taco Bell at 11620 SE Mill Plain Blvd, Vancouver WA. The managers retaliated against her for reporting racist remarks made by her co-worker. She was told during her evening shift shouldn't you be out looting, rioting or protesting doing whatever your people do. The RGM Brian Rotschy turned it all around and slammed her for speaking up for herself. Now they refuse to put her back on the schedule.
My number one pet peeve is when I order a crunch taco supreme and they give me a regular taco!  I always order the supreme.  I hate Taco Bell so much this year!!

The employees there clearly do not care about their jobs. The staff looked like they were squeezed in the back office watching / looking at something and not really paying any attention to anything else. It took a good 5 minutes for someone to come up to the counter.

The manager asked me "'sup" when I returned my order because it was wrong. They managed to get one drink completely wrong and not include one of the food items. The manager said, "oh, that's all?" It was as if he was surprised they managed to get the food in the general ballpark of being close to my order. I got no "sorry" or anything for screwing up the order. He just put the stuff on the counter and said "there you go."

Ordered nacho fries and a bean burrito with fire sauce through the drive through. Ate a fry driving home to realize THEY WERE FROZEN SOLID. So, get home and heat them up... Even though my receipt says fire sauce, there's none in the bag. 

Don't go here. They do a horrible job.

3 PM sunday afternoon. Four cars in front of me. 20 minutes I get my food. I check it before pulling away, it feels cold. I opened a taco and stuck my finger in it. Not even warm, cold. They took it back, I waited five more minutes and they hand me the same bag bur clearly more wrinkled and abused. Same with the individual wrappers of the items I ordered. They just microwaved them. This location is so often a disappointment I had to write this. So, twenty-five minutes total for food that was made, left to sit and go cold, then nuked. Don't go here. Slow and cold is this Taco Bell's M.O.

My roommate was picking up our online order and told at the speaker to drive through to the window. At the window my roommate paid for and picked up someone else's order. He had to come inside and get a refund for the mistake and have our order made again. The manager then asked him to look up the receipt and made other customers wait while he tried to find it. Turns out our original and our remade order both were given to someone else. So after the third time our order was made, we ate it at home only to realize that I had cheese and sour cream on my food. I called the manager asking for a refund, explaining that we had to have our food had been made three times and that I'm allergic to dairy the manager said that the only way we could get out money back is to bring the food back even after our terrible customer service experience.  I would think it would be important to be sensitive to food allergies at food establishments and not be rude to customer when we were not at fault or unreasonable. Don't go to this Taco Bell ever.

The same cashier almost always gets my order wrong! She has a terrible attitude and displays a lack of interest in her duties. I highly recommend an evaluation of the employees who hold customer facing positions. This is a recurring problem and not just limited to one instance. I love the food and am a frequent customer, but I am also very dissatisfied with my experiences.

I would give this location a zero star but that is not an option. One worker was actually scrubbing the floors but the rest were goofing off. It took 7 minutes to just get out food. Which was 7 items. The food tasted good but the service was unacceptable. This location needs a real manager not the child they have employed now. Skip this location and go to the one in Whitehall. They are amazing there.

This taco bell is the Only one in the area or else your going to deland or sanford . I will say the girls taking orders are always nice but the speed of the line and the food quality sucks.  You should plan on waiting 20-30 minutes in line regardless of time of day. We have to check the bag every time cause something is always missing or just the wrong food.  You just dread going to this taco bell cause it's always something

I believe that I was the victim of food tampering at this location. There is no way this was done by accident. What else did they do to my food. Hoping I do not get sick. I will never eat Taco Bell again.
Wtffffffffffffffff I spent nearly 30 minutes in the drive thru and I'm stuck because there is no escape route. Food is cold. This is a terrible location.

I ordered my food with no cheese. They made it with cheese so they remade it. When I got home there was still some cheese on it and since I'm allergic to cheese I had to throw away the meal. The real problem is the nasty work stations

Where is the service? I walked in the door and the employee behind the counter looks at me and walks  back into the kitchen. I then order my food on kiosk and select "dine in".  The same guy, calls my name and puts a bag of food on the counter and walks away.  He had not given me my large cup for my drink.  I stood at the counter and when he appeared again, he looked at me but walked right by without acknowledgement. I ask if I could have the cup for my drink, he starts to hand me a medium and I ask for the large cup. He handed me the large cup and never said a word.  Most of the tables were dirty as well. At least the food was good. I realize this is fast food, but a customer shouldn't be ignored. Tip- put cups by the kiosk. That way a customer only has to wait for the food to be made. Overall disappointed!

They have the best staff! Always happy even at 3 am lol . Food is always good and if they forget something they chase after your car ‍ Chick-fil-A service but at taco Bell. Best Taco Bell I've been too and they always are pleasant even if they do get busy it's worth the wait

Although the store opens at 8 am, the employees were not ready to serve meals.  I was told by the drive through personnel that their food would not be ready for another 15 mins. So if you plan on coming here for breakfast be prepared to wait.

It seems insane to write any sort of review for a Taco Bell, which as we all know is a questionable life choice to begin with. Taco Bell in itself is usually a drunk decision, and this Taco Bell in particular I typically avoid even WHEN drunk which says a lot about an already low bar. It takes SO long to get through this line that I have literally seen trucks hop the curb and go through the grass because that's the only escape route.. there's now a fence, which means they've chosen to fix THAT problem I imagine instead of the staff moving at a glacial pace. Logical. I made the desperate and terrible decision to go through here being incredibly hungover last weekend, there were only 2 cars in line so figured it had to be reasonable. I ordered only 2 simple things knowing that they also have a habit of completely messing up your order. I went with a bean burrito and a beef chalupa supreme. It took THIRTY SEVEN MINUTES to get to the window. 2 cars ahead of me!! I'm fairly certain I could go through the entire hiring process and new hire training process in the time it takes them to make a taco. By the time I got to the front window, it took another 10 minutes to hand me my order and run my card. I quickly glance in the bag and see wrappers for a bean burrito and a chalupa and trust it. That was the next mistake. The "bean burrito" was literally just a tortilla with cheese, and I do not mean a quesadilla I mean they forgot the beans. The "beef chalupa" was a chicken Gordita. Of all of the terrible decisions made at Taco Bell, choosing to ever go to this location takes the bad decision cake.
This is my go to place when I need a meal after the gym.  Food is always good, service is great and prices are fair.  I will be back.

Allison is nice. The other employees need to be better trained or fired. They don't seem to be able to follow instructions. They often mess up my order. Today they messed it up twice, but I didn't want to deal with it a third time, so I just accepted the second messed up order.

I got 2 orders of number 3 which is basically a bag of six tacos and I had to say something because they were perfect. They were filled with meat and not overloaded with lettuce and they were like the authentic Mexican tacos you get out in Texas, they were so good. Thank you!

We went to this TAco Bell at like 2am and they were so patient with all 7 orders that we placed. we had some pretty perticular orders totally. Shantia was our server as well as teh night manager and she made sure every order was fullfilled. It was a great fourth meal after all!

Only because I had to give a star. I ordered without knowing their staff was 6 people short the manager showed up over an hour late to her own shift... the drive thru was wrapped around the building. And I wait an hour with a 3 yr old screaming because she is so hungry! 
You all need to get your stuff together.

Been coming to this location for many years. The food is always good. My only complaint is for the past 6-7 months or so they must have gotten a new drive thru staff because it use to be really fast and now you can wait 15-20 minutes or more at any given time to get through from ordering to getting up to the window to pay and receive your food. If they can fix this issue, I'd give a higher star rating.

Surprised that this location is as clean and neat as it is for a campus fast food spot. I'll take it. Quick service and a self service kiosk if you would rather avoid talking to people. 

Also, beer? And rum? And vodka? Where am I? If you want some cheep booze with your cheap taco, you've come to the right place.

Takes to long and they have no idea how to make tacos. When you come in to place an order they are slower than a snail. They must run out of beef, for you need a microscope to see the fillings. People waiting for food were waiting for about 30 minutes. I am leaving it at this since it would take hours and well I 
Update the have improved and I found out that they have new management and crew members.  Let's wait and see?

I'm so tired of not getting everything I order.  Today was no exception, hubs had to go back to get the chicken enchilada burrito that was supposed to be the main item in his Grande Burrito Box.  Granted, we live close, but they didn't even offer him anything extra for his inconvenience.  I'm DONE with this TB.  This is not the first time (I should have stopped ordering from here loooong ago) but for me, it will be the last.  Oh, AND they also left lettuce on my Chalupa when I said to remove it.  Done, Done, Done

Ordered some things through Taco Bell tonight and they didn't fulfill the whole order correctly. Asked for and paid for an upgrade to supreme for my cheesy Gordita crunch and got a regular one instead. Rest of the order was fine

I can't believe the service we have received the last four times we have went to this location. The staff are always too busy talking to each other (you seem like a inconvenience when you go there, not to mention they are loud and very unprofessional), not listening clearly to orders, you have to repeat yourself five times. Still don't know how to complete a order and put the CORRECT ITEMS in the bag and when they do they look like my attached photo...frustrating.
OMG so your fryer breaks and instead of asking me what other item I might want just pick one!!  YOU SUCK!

Seriously the worst Taco Bell I've ever had to deal with. When using the drive thru it takes 20 minutes. When I order ahead using the app they don't start making it until I get there. The staff needs more training or a complete overhaul.
Avoid this location. Poorly run and the chips and Mexican pizza had a severely bitter taste so we had to throw it out. Bad choice for tonight's dinner. Won't make that mistake again!

Cashier girl had a bad attitude when we told her she forgot our coffee. She said she "had to make them" and we waited for like 2 minutes. So I guess we got 2 minute coffee. It basically tasted it like watered down coffee creamer. I poured it out and refilled it with soda. It was that bad.
I'd write a negative review if I could. Service always is RUDE- food is always cold and half filled- and they always screw up my order. So disappointing.

Okay I know the drive-thru line is extremely slow but... if you go inside to order your food, you will not only be greeted with great customer service but you will also get your food faster! I have never had an issue going into this Taco Bell to grab my delicious crunch wrap supreme They have never made my order wrong either! You can use Apple Pay inside, which makes it easy to order fold even if you forget you wallet.

Overall, I love this Taco Bell and I will always come to this location when in search of a crunch wrap supreme or bean and cheese burrito I will be back after spring break!
Food was OK but what's the deal with no artificial sweeteners?!?

We always get the best service at this location, consistently. There are very personable and caring team members.  I especially like breakfast there, and am so glad they finally updated the interiors.  It feels much cleaner and more comfortable now.  I highly recommend this location and appreciate the senior free drink / coffee for my mom.  I only wish there was also a location nearer to iDrive.

I ordered the taco salad without the rice,  they fucked it up. I told then to exchange it. The chicken was bland. No taste to the salad at all. The most horrible salad ever. Should of choose taco cabana,  they taste better and so are the prices. 
Did I mentioned the mango tea has no mango taste. Never again.
Consistently disappointing. Yet again I had to pull up to the window before an employee recognized me. I'm sure my order was enhanced with spit. I should have gone to Javiers on Lombard.

absolutely DISGUSTING. there was a dead fly inside of my f'ing crunch wrap. this is unacceptable and honestly makes me debate if i ever want to voluntarily eat taco bell again. THIS IS NOT HOW I WANT TO START MY MORING. EEE in my crunch wrap is absolutely f'ing NASTYY. you're better off going up the street to KFC where they have the new mac n cheese. i'm F'ing pissed DONT go to NORWELL TACO BELL. you will not be satisfied. BS

I'm normally not the type to write a review, but after over 10+ horrible visits I decided to write this. Every single time I've came here (after 10:00pm) I've had to wait a minimum of 20+ minutes in the drive thru just to get food. The staff are extremely unfriendly anytime something's wrong with the order, which 9 times out of 10, something's wrong. The owner of this Taco Bell needs to figure his shit out when it comes to him hiring good employees/having enough employees so people aren't waiting over 20 minutes just to get food.

It's Taco Bell. It really doesn't need a review. 

This location is not on my list of normally visited TB locations.  They did a solid job of not messing up my order. The drive thru was moving quickly, but I didn't use it. 

The girl at the front counter was really awesome.  She wasn't the typical zombie at the cash register... she was suggesting items, asking me questions about the food I liked at TB, all very positive stuff.  Her great attitude (TB boss people - front counter on Saturday 10/24 around 4pm) was one of the best I've seen in all the years Taco Bell has been my favorite fast food restaurant.

I'm a TB fan. This has been TENTATIVELY added to my approved location list. I really have one. Don't hate.
I've always had excellent service here. The service has always been friendly, prompt, and respectful. I have never been treated with disrespect and have always been given good food. Thanks.
Absolutely the nastiest fat food restaurant I have ever Ben to. Staff was slow and uncaring.

These people suck. Even though the website says they're open till 5 or 6am the workers there shut it down whenever they feel like: 2, 3 , 4 am and they're there to tell you over the intercom that they shut down or their server is down or whatever excuse they use . I work in the service industry and probably tip these lazy assholes way too much to no avail. Guess their owners and mgmt don't give a fuck. Last time I'll be going there...

Been to this location about 4 times. Every time they have made our order in a timely fashion and more importantly; it's always been correct. Food is your atypical Taco Bell faire. 

Taco Bell has improved their menu and while the cost has gone up a bit the quality has improved by leaps and bounds.   

The staff here is pleasant and try to get your order done as fast as possible. Nice dine in that is pretty clean. Downside is trying to get out onto Route 53 especially if you're trying to make a left turn hoping that next vehicle will be the one nice enough to let you go.

This place should close and stay closed!  I ordered a chicken quesadilla and two hardshell tacos today 01/31/2020 12:36 PM... terrible!  The quesadilla would have had more chicken in it had they used a hard-boiled egg! The hard shell tacos were skimpy on the beef as well.  The trash in the parking lot and around the building was disgusting... not up to the standards you would expect!  I will not go back!

Sooo,,I haven't written a bad review during this entire pandemic. However,,The way my issue was not handled and how it was dealt with warrants one. I went through the drive thru and ordered two $1 Double Stacked Tacos and added Pico since it doesn't have tomatoes on it at all. They charged me $.80 for pico but neglected to put it on my tacos. I called the store and asked for the manager to which a girl replied "I am!" Cringe. I explained what had happened and she gave me a horrible attitude and sounded out of it.. She told me I had to come back for my refund. My total was $3.00. First of all,,I'm at home,,second of all it's pouring rain and third of all it would cost me $3.00 to drive back there. When I asked for the number of the distract manager, she handed the phone off to Lynette who said she was the manager. Lynette was better to deal with but still did not resolve my problem. They had a very laissez faire attitude which comes across like they do not care! And trust me they don't!! The soft shell was also folded halfway down my taco and all pics are included. Now,,this isn't the first time I have encountered a problem here and every time I write it in a survey but nothing gets done so here we are. The last time I was there,,the screen read Diablo sauce but they didn't give it to me. It was Crystal working that night too. The time before that I asked for the Cheesy Gordita Crunch sauce on the side and they just left it off completely and never gave it to me at all. I realize this is fast food but I also know when enough is enough. It's still my money and I'm not getting what I order and then I'm treated with an attitude and asked to drive back for a $3.00 refund. The bottom line is.. I prefer to eat healthy and pay for it anyhow and will never return to this location ever! I suggest you don't waste your time or money. It's not worth it.
Employees are very friendly. The restaurant has a very clean comfortable atmosphere with music as you eat. The chalupa box is always so tasty accented with cinnamon twists.

Well, we tried Taco Bell's delivery service through GrubHub.  The tacos were lukewarm, wet and greasy.  They fell apart in our hands. The burritos were fine, since everything is wrapped up in a thick flour tortilla. There were little crumbly cinnamon things that had very little taste, and a small package of tortilla chips with cheese sauce.  We ordered everything online through GrubHub, we were supposed to get $10 off on our first  order, but THAT never happened...had to go to the chat feature, and the guy promised he'd fix it.  We shall see. 

I notice a lot of restaurants are doing the delivery service thing, but Taco Bell?  Nope.  No way we'll do that any more.
Ordered through the Taco Bell app to pick up inside, got the alert that it was ready. Went inside to grab it and had to wait about an hour for my order.

Update: did you know that Taco Bell has BREAKFAST??!!!!!!!!!!

I mean, I knew, but never really took the time to stop in. Always thought of "The Bell" as more of a quick lunch or dinner or when you only have about $5 to your name.

Well, their breakfast does not disappoint.

This particular location was very quiet and lonely on a Saturday morning...but I like that...My daughter and I were able to have a nice breakfast and just chit chat.

I ordered 4 items from the $1 menu: grilled breakfast burrito. They have 3 kinds: bacon, sausage and potato. They are ALL very good with some hot sauce on them (my preference). I also got a hash brown... note, this could have been a little more crispy, but was still good. I also got a coffee. Overall... good, cheap "desayuno" for me!

My daughter ordered a breakfast crunch wrap combo. It comes with either hashbrowns or two Cinnabon minis ,and your choice of either a medium drink or hot coffee or iced coffee. Also a good price for this meal.

Looks like the "King" and the "Clown" have got competition from the non-existent "Chihuahua"...Yo quiero TACO BELL!

Fast food joints are well known for their bad service and incorrect orders. This Taco Bell is no exception. This is exactly why I never eat fast food. Unfortunately I was about to die of starvation so I hit the drive through around 130am. 
The cashier refused to substitute guacamole in place of the cheese and sour cream. I cannot eat dairy. Other locations have done this for me. I suppose they are all different. The employ on this particular occasion was very rude to me! I will not be coming here again.

During the day, this TB is pretty quick and the food is on par with other locations. The employees are fine and the orders are usually correct. Not the best location, not the worst.

During late hours (especially weekends), this location is horrible. It takes an average of 3-5 mins per car and I've literally been stuck in line behind 7-8 cars for over half an hour. One time there were about 10 cars in front and I waited 45 mins, on multiple occasions it took 30 mins from when I ordered my food to when I received it. You're also stuck in the drive-thru before even ordering due to the layout of the drive-thru. I've never been given an explanation for why takes so long, and usually they don't even apologize or acknowledge it. The night shift seems really incapable of handling the busy hours. After waiting 30+ mins on several occasions (6-7?) I don't get into the drive-thru line if there are more than 5-6 cars in line, which is usually only late night.

This location is also out of random stuff a lot. One time it was cheese, another beef, another time taco shells, another the griller wasn't working. Never had that come up with other locations.
Crossest TacoBell I have been too! They need fly strips or to clean the garbages more often because they were swarming the lobby area!

I waited nearly 15-20 minutes for my food.. and the hard taco in my chalupa box only had one side. I give them 2 stars because the manager was really trying his best to keep everything together. Other than that, my experience wasn't the best (to say the least).
Great place. Let me and all my friends walk thru the drive through and gave us awesome service
Just drove out here seeing that they're open until 11 but they've been closed for at least half an hour. It's 10:35 why is it so hard to just do your job until closing?

Absolutely do not go to this location. It has to be the SLOWEST food service on the freaking planet. I had five minutes to grab lunch and I thought taco bell would be a safe and fast bet. I got in line at the drive through was was stuck there for over TWENTY FIVE MINUTES. I couldn't leave or back out or anything. You are held captive! And to top that off, they brought me out the wrong food. I just left without my food (or my money) because at this point I was 20 minutes late to getting back to work. I will never come here again.

Slow drive through and people inside. Food is usually good though which justified the two stars. They have shut down the inside tonight and the line is almost wrapped around the store and back out into the street.

I've constantly been coning to this Taco Bell primarily for them having the best employee working the front register. Cindy has always and consistently been giving the best customer service one could ever wish for. The politeness and professionalism is remarkable and is always way above and beyond my expectations.

Somehow I had never been to this one before.  I needed something quick after running errands, and knew it was somewhere around here- map location is incorrect, it is farther west, in front of Best Buy, so I lost some time searching. 

Drive-through and delivery only right now, can't even go inside at all.  Decent drive-through service, helpful when I wasn't sure what the name of the things I wanted was.  Limited menu (but that still means a lot of items, maybe 2/3 of their normal menu, plus there are things they can make that aren't on the menu board.)  I wanted an enchirito, no dice.  I wanted the "beefy nacho burrito" and they had a beefy crunch griller.  They said it was the size of a regular burrito, but it's smaller, maybe half the size.  Still good: tortilla, beef, chips, cheese.  I also got my standard 7-layer burrito.  Also good.  I got a Baja Blast freeze, cheap at happy hour.  Cold and refreshing, and hopefully caffeinated.

It's Taco Bell.  It's edible, it's cheap, it's fast.  Sometimes that's what you need.

Good, but tell these fucks not to cut the Mexican pizzas. Also the prices are too damn high, like the rent in this country. That being said, it's a fucking taco bell, you know what you're in for-dank food, danker poos.

It's Taco Bell, so...yeah. But the customer service at this location seems to be a notch better than others. Even when it's drunk:30 and everyone in the car won't shutup and decide already, they're still speedy and understanding.

Bad customer service at this location.

The guy taking the order seemed very defensive.

I don't give a Fu*k what issues he has going on.

I'm never coming back to this Taco Bell location.

By far the worst TB I've ever been to. They were not busy, but nobody wanted to take my order so I had to use the kiosk and do it myself. I then waited 10 minutes for my food. There was nobody else in line and the drive thru was not busy.  While I was waiting, I watched the girl working the drive thru come out to the front counter to swipe credit cards. She had her cell phone out and could have EASILY been taking pics of credit card numbers. I got lucky that nobody would take my order so I could use apple pay at the kiosk. Once I finally got my food, I went to get napkins and there weren't any. The trash was so full that people had been throwing it in the sauce buckets.  I opened my first taco....it had been busted up, so instead of making a new one they slapped the broken taco into a second shell! There was trash all over the floor in the dining room and the tables had clearly not been wiped down all day.
I have an extremely low bar for what I expect from Taco Bell but this location is appalling. Never again.
Been waiting over 30 min for 2 beefy 5s and a soft taco and the 2 cars ahead barely oreder. And its rediculous. I let it slode but after the 10th time. Last resort taco bell
