I always get The Mexican Pizza add extra Beef 3 or maybe 2 Soft Tacos with Fire Sauce or a good ole Chilli Cheese Burrito.  The location is kinda hectic due to the fact its fight on Howell Mill Rd and with the recent developments this area stay crowded.
Awful service. Just sat in taco bell line ordered one thing for over 30 mins with 5 people behind me stuck. What are y'all doing in there taking
Late night shift staff, you're marvelous! They stuff my tacos up just like the Taco Bell advertisements.

Came in to just get Cinnamon Twists and there's no cinnamon on them.

This has got to be the most collectively retarded group of people to work here to mess this up. 

Lobby was dirty and the lobby was humid and hot on top of that.

I ordered food i was loud and clear and i got a wrong order and food. Like you expect getting paid 15 or 13 dollars an hour to do fast food why cant you make me my food. So unprofessional and they didn't refund me. I don't complain but why the hell u make it so difficult

It's late night. I'm waiting in line for 20 minutes, and as I get up to the window they tell us they're closed and won't serve us. Had to reverse out. Worst customer service I've experienced in years. Will never return to this location again.

Unlike so many of the low ratings reviews, I have never had a bad experience at this Taco Bell location, and I love their tacos and burritos. We usually go there on Sunday's around 1 PM (don't stalk me!) and sometimes for dinner, so I don't know what it's really like during the week or late at night, and I have never used their drive-thru (there...disclaimer out of the way).

Taco Bell is a great bang for the buck, making it one of the least expensive places to get some good Mexican food; but if you want GREAT Mexican food there are many better places.

Wow the reviews are spot on. Slowest service I've ever had at a Taco Bell! No apologies, or reasoning from the attendant. Ordered 6 items and they give us 5 sauces, shut the window as soon as we got our food. I had to honk to get their attention to get more sauce.  Very irritated with the service here! Never again.

Female that served me looked like a meth addict, hands were dirty, face covered in sores, nervous, shaking. Who on earth though she was a good fit for front shop work but I guess that's preferable to her making my taco's. Won't be back.

0/5 stars, the worst Taco Bell I have ever been at..
ABSOLUTELY THE WORST.
First of all, there prices are outrageous since they are franchised, so that's not already a reason to not go. They got my food order in wrong and the food that was actually right did not taste good.

To make matters worse, they wouldn't accept my employee discount for being partnered with Taco Bell, and told me to call a manger later that day.

I called later that day and the manger I talked to accused me of lying saying "our store closes at 11pm and you're saying you came at 11:30pm, I already can tell this story is false" as I am telling the truth reading the receipt that's in front of me.

The manger was a total bitch on the phone and told me she would refused to give me my discount that works at every other Taco Bell and refused to do anything about my food that was incorrect.

I WILL NEVER VISIT THIS TACO BELL EVER AGAIN, 100% the worst customer service ever.

Don't use the online ordering option. I was surprised at all the customizing you can make on your order like removing ingredients and adding ingredients. 
You can also just pick it up at the drive-thru by giving them your name. Easy enough.
Well they don't bother customizing your order. They just give you whatever comes standard on their items. 
I went back to just get my money back but they couldn't refund due to it being an online order. So I waited for them to correct the order.
The online option is a great idea and would boost business if implemented right, but when the employees really don't care it will never work.
Such nice and friendly folks!! Definitely one of the best Taco Bell's in atl ! We went late night and it was quickly and easy to get in and out of.

Angry! I'm angry! I ordered two beefy Frito burritos for delivery through grubhub and I got NEITHER of them. When I requested a refund for the delivery (since I did not receive the food) I was denied! I will be taking my business elsewhere from now on.

I had the extreme pleasure of getting an order at 8:45 p.m..  I saw an extremely long drive through so I decided to get my take out and walk inside.  there was one customer ahead of me and I noticed two employees sitting in a booth talking to two young ladies who were not in uniform.  excruciatingly long weight for our food when I looked over and saw the foursome and my spidey senses started tingling.  Something was a miss.  after waiting 15 minutes for my food I realize what the problem was, there were puppies in the building.  No not service animals puppies.   management get your act together or look for new jobs. This is unacceptable!

Definitely the slowest service I've ever had. I don't blame the employee, maybe he was new or something, but I've literally never waited this long at a fast food place in my life. No one even said anything at the drive through order screen until we spoke up.

Worst experience ever.  I will be calling the regional manager to talk about what happened.  I paid for my food with cash and my change was supposed to be $5.08.  the cashier handed me $5 back and moved on to the next customer.  When I asked for my change, she said they were out of change and her manager was coming to refill the cashier but it would be a while.  All of this was said with a nasty tone and lot of attitude.  If she knew she was out of change, why wouldn't she tell me that before I paid with cash and simply ask if it would be convenient for me to pay with a credit card?  How can you shortchange a paying customer and not even mention it?  Did she think I wouldn't notice?  When I asked her all this, she just continued to use a nasty tone and didn't try to rectify the situation at all.  We had ordered our food to eat there and a simple solution would have been to offer to bring us the change after her manager refilled the register.  The whole situation was so bizarre.. I felt like maybe I was on candid camera.  Horrible experience.
Dropped in for tacos. Place was really clean. Manager was nice. Ataff was quick on getting my order to me

Some people say:  "Don't go to Taco Bell.  It's not authentic Mexican food."

And I say:  "Well no shit.  I know damned well it's not authentic Mexican food."

I go there because it's cheap and they serve food way past midnight when I'm wanting something to eat in a hurry.  Yeah, it's not the greatest food on earth but these folks deliver on what they promise and for that I'm giving them 4 stars.  Now someone pass me some of that hot sauce and let me get down to business on these tacos.
Waited 45 minutes for my food. People were getting there food first who ordered after me. Very disrespectful employees didn't know how to handle upset customers.

I had time for a quick bite and went to taco bell...mistake. i ordered a power bowl and as im on my way to the next stop i see she didnt give me a fork...how am i supposed to eat a power bowl with no fork?! Thank's Luzmaria for putting me behind schedual because i had to go home for a fucking fork. She also fucked up my order last time. Do BETTER.

If you think even bad Taco Bell is still pretty good then fine go. But if you want your order to be the way that you ordered it then don't. I can guarantee it will be wrong. It also takes about 20 minutes per order so you would THINK they're taking extra time to make it just right but no. The workers are so gd slow it hurts and they literally couldn't care less what your food tastes like
Nothing "fast food" about a 23 minute wait from start to finish for drive through. Unacceptable and ridiculous

Yes, I'm reviewing (another) taco bell. It do be like that sometimes. 
So this is the new-ish taco bell cantina, where you can get alcoholic bevs. I did not partake in that, and do be aware there is no drive-thru here. But service is fast and friendly, the place is very clean, and the actual execution of food was on point and we had no errors. Their ordering kiosks were out of whack but not a biggie.  Disclaimer-we went around Thanksgiving weekend time so I'm assuming it would be more busy and potentially packed with students at other times.

This is the worst taco bell of all time! Went in tonight. Other than a semi-long drive thru line,  it wasn't too awfully busy.  Ordered my food at 5:52pm. While watching several people who ordered before me still waiting,  and the workers standing around lolly gagging and socializing... realize it's now 6:25...  Still no food,  and even more people waiting.  Finally got fed up and asked for a refund.  The manager REFUSED tti refund me and said our order was next. Watched 3 more people get their food,  and finally got an order that was wrong! Several people upset,  asking for refunds and getting pissed. The manager was ridiculously lazy and passive,  the tables were dirty,  and the staff just stood around watching alllllllll these people get mad.  What the heck happened to taco bell.??
this taco bell still sucks. the new paint job can't cover up the horrible employees. this place needs a bulldozer.
Plain and simple if you want your order correct and want to get what you actually ordered then don't waste your time coming here. 100% guaranteed it will be wrong and you'll wait 15 minutes for it.

Slowest Taco Bell ever. Avoid. Go to the further one it'll be quicker. I've been waiting so long in the drive thru line (27 minutes now) that I've decided to contemplate every life decision up to this point that lead me here. They only need to serve three cars right now. It's not like they're understaffed. There are two people working the food counter and one person ringing out. Food was wrong and they had to remake. Tasted fine the second time.
The employees that work here work very hard and that needs to be recognized. They're always very kind and have fast, attentive service. Best Taco Bell in Portland, in my opinion.

It feels weird to review a Taco Bell, but I feel like this one needs it. Not because it's so good, but it's SOOO much better then is used to be. 

Before, ordering from this Taco Bell was like throwing a dart at a dartboard while blindfolded. They would get your order correct about a tenth of the time. (I still came because it's right by work, all of Taco Bells food is made from like 5 ingredients anyway, and I'm weak and cheap).

But now this place is a normal Taco Bell. Like, it's kinda Ok now, and that's amazing.

Honestly I don't understand why we did not get service here (after an hour). The manager was very specifically racist sending out her employees to tell us to go away because of the music we were listening to.. An abuse of her power in my opinion and a telling representation of the administration here. It's truly disgusting her employees and customers have to put up with that type of treatment in this day and age.

The order took absolutely forever, I ordered on the self order machine and it didn't go through, after waiting for my food about 30 minutes later I had to go forward and state my order hasn't come yet, they also gave me my order all wrong
I wish I could write a review without picking a star. I give them a zero! I can't believe it took literally 45 mins for drive thru FUCKING RIDICULOUS!!!! It's supposed to be fast food.

If I could give this place 0 I would! The mother fu**** at the window was walking in to clock in and held the door open for my kids and i. My kids don't talk to strangers, hell, they HARDLY talk to family so they didn't say thanks. However, I walk in and say "thanks dog". Tell me why the punka** has the NERVE to go "YOURE WELCOME!! All five of you. Ain't even saying thanks. Psssh of course not." Then mumbles "fuckin white people.." I turned and said "um excuse me??? I did say thanks." He goes "well, then all 4 of you little kids." So I told him not to talk to my kids. I ordered my food TOGO since this jerkoff decided to make my kids feel ashamed of themselves and not want to dine in today. So I go and put my kids into the car after getting my food. I didn't bother to check till I got home, I should've..., missed one of my kids' bean burritos. ANYWAYS, I went back in and told him to not talk to my kids in ANY WAY SHAPE OR FORM like that ever again because he's not their dad and his a** doesn't need to talk to kids like that ESPECIALLY at work of all places!!!!! Completely disrespectful. I guess that's not surprising seeing as he was MAYBE 18 y/o... if the mf doesn't lose his job after today that is such a disgrace to ALL Taco Bell's ever...

I've always been told to never judge a book by its cover, but when I was driving through Old National, I decided to stop at Taco Bell expecting horrible service given the area it's in, but the employee who I believe was the manager went above and beyond with my order. She was so kind and patient and just made my experience so much better. More fast food places need people like her. I can't count how many times I've been to a fast food place and the employees are smacking gum, rolling their eyes, and generally giving off the vibe of "I really don't want to be here". 

I hope she sees this review. She's amazing. I wish I would've gotten her name.

The order was not correct. They called and couldn't substitute anything for an item they couldn't make sure to not having it. The employee was argumentative on the phone and the order arrived cold despite it being 1/2 mile away. There really was no compelling reason to get food here with so many other options. Avoid.

I eat here, seriously, all the time. Breakfast, lunch, & dinner. Ill suffer greatly when I'm older, not looking forward to it. Sometimes this place screws up the order, but its rare! Your in& out quickly, thru the drive-thru, inside not so much. Never had an explosion from my body afterwards, all is calm.
Just don't  come anytime after 10pm or late hours. Lazy  , "computers are down" bunch lies for people who Don't want to work. Just close at ten and save money(.)
The quality of service is poor. I ordered a shredded chicken nacho and it was all beans and cheese. The frito cheese burrito came with only bean and cheese as well. There is no quality assurance.

Takes to long and they have no idea how to make tacos. When you come in to place an order they are slower than a snail. They must run out of beef, for you need a microscope to see the fillings. People waiting for food were waiting for about 30 minutes. I am leaving it at this since it would take hours and well I am done.
Probably the best Taco Bell I've ever been to. The woman at the drive through was SO nice. Incredibly friendly. AND our order was right the first time. Which IMO was a blessed miracle.

customer service needs improvement. We walked in and no one greeted us or said anything. they all just stared until we began to say what we'd like to order.
Also typically when I come to Taco Bell I always get your Mountain Dew Baja blast. I was forced to settle for the sweet tea because literally every soda in the machine taste bland like there was no sugar. we tried each one. At least the food was good.
Absolutely the nastiest fast food restaurant I have ever Ben to. Staff was slow and uncaring

In the drive through at this taco Bell? Go to ticketmaster.com. Buy a one way ticket to Disneyland. Ride all of the rides, especially space mountain. Decide to fly back to Washington state and go back to your spot in line because YOU WILL STILL BE WAITING.

The customer service is horrible, the kitchen looks like it's having a melt down knowing customers can see them. The cashier doesn't give a shit about her job and doesn't even know the menu. The lobby is messy. They are understaffed for sure. This job isn't hard I had it when i was a junior in HS. It so simple yet these people are failing at it miserably.

This Taco Bell has got to be the worst one in town. Whenever I stop by this location it is shocking how slow the service is. 

This time on top of the usual slow service the manager came from the back with my food wearing gloves then took my card and charged me and then went back to the kitchen wearing the same gloves she rang me up with. The one other employee I saw was ringing up orders wearing gloves. 

Pretty gross.

I occasionally swing by the drive-thru here before work in the morning for a XXL Steak Grilled Stuft Burrito, one of my faves.  The service is always courteous and prompt every time I drop by around 10am.  No complaints here.

Btw, has anyone noticed they FINALLY removed the annoying curb when you're leaving the drive-thru?   I've been bothered by it when I used to come here a decade ago, lol

Terrible.

Not only the worst Taco Bell I've ever been to, the worst fast food restaurant I've ever been to. Don't do it.

All young people who are laughing and joking instead of getting our order correct. Had to come back to pick up 5 items they didn't give to us. Since we had to drive all the way back, my boyfriend told them he wanted the whole order re-made. The line is wrapped around the place and they are just goofing around inside.

It is what it is.

Always check your items before leaving. Something is usually missing or they didn't customize it the way we had ordered it. Oh and the short woman manager is always yelling at everyone working on any given visit.
This is not my preferred location but I haven't had a problem here. Nacho fries were yummy.
Slowest driving service ever!!!!!  No one inside cars in line and not moving.  Cars are parked as the wait is so long.

Okay, I don't review fast food places that much, but I am giving KUDOS to the drive thru service at this particular Taco Bell.

I am very specific on how I need my order, hold the cheese, no sauce, add lettuce. Yes, I am picky with my order, but they should be able to accommodate... and they did.

The drive thru attendant was awesome, made sure my order was correct even with it on the screen. Very friendly and helpful, just how they should be.

That's why this location gets 4 stars.

Oh cmon....
- 3 Grilled Chicken Dorito Taco Supremes - all refried beans instead of chicken?
- Mexican Pizza - handed to me sideways
- 12 pack Cinabon Delights was 11

It's like a purposely ruined order.

Really, if your sign says you open at 7:00 you should be open and if your not let the customer know when they pull up to the drive through using your mic so they don't sit there waiting for you to address them.

Another Sunday morning and you just never know whether this Taco Bell is going to be open at 7:45 AM or not. I guess it just depends whether they feel like showing up at work or not. Getting tired of this place. Will simply start to choose another place to drive through for an early breakfast.
I like their steak quesoritos, but other than that it's not great. Free refills for soda drinks and cinnabons are pretty good.

I love Taco Bell for a quick late night food run, but this is the slowest Taco Bell that has ever existed - seriously. We have waited multiple times in the drive thru in a line of 5 or less cars for over 30 minutes. So slow and they are often out of things such as Baja Blast. Still gave it a 2 though because the food is always average Taco Bell quality, nothing wrong with it.

This happens more often than it should. I am waiting in the drive thru because the restaurant is closed. The problem is employee shortage. The management needs to get this resolved. Not a fan of 20 minute drive thru times.
This taco bell is slow, never makes my order right and never seems to kick out more than 1 item every 5 minutes. I will drive all the way to the t bell in northern lights just to get through faster.

Only because I had to give a star. I ordered without knowing their staff was 6 people short the manager showed up over an hour late to her own shift... the drive thru was wrapped around the building. And I wait an hour with a 3 yr old screaming because she is so hungry! 
You all need to get your stuff together

So I'm not really inclined to rate a Taco Bell on food. Taco Bell food is Taco Bell food. I wouldn't necessarily call it "good," but it is sufficient and cheap. That being said, I can say that different locations vary in terms of service and such, and this particular location is on the high end of ones I've been to. It's spacious inside, and the service is typically pretty quick, even when the line is long.

Service was incredibly slow for a Taco Bell. Like a full-service restaurant would've been faster than getting the three items we ordered. And the cashier was had a really bad attitude towards all of the guests. I mean I don't expect much from a Taco Bell but the one on east Colonial is the WORST.

Employee was rude and I started to follow my first mind and just leave. The lights were off in the parking lot and it was dirty...the signs were there. I placed my order and asked the young lady to repeat and she said she had it...needless to say I get all the way home to find I have no chicken items in my bag, only beef
I attempted to call the number on the receipt to speak to a manager but the number on the receipt is incorrect and rings a fax machine. I go online and find another number listed...I called it and it rang over 30 Times twice and no answer.  Wow! #runfromtheborder!
Literally the slowest Taco Bell on God's green earth. Don't try to dine in unless you have 3 hours to wait for your cheesy gordita crunch.

Standard Taco Bell, this one is obvious and easy to find since it's right off 50. I can't tell you much about the food at Taco Bell since I only ever go for the dessert. If you haven't already GET THE CINNABON DELIGHTS!!!! They are the best things on this planet. Little fried sugary donuts filled with icing. If they ever get rid of them, I will sue for emotional damages. How are they so good and so cheap, I feel sorry for the people that don't know they exist. We. Must. Spread. The. Word.
Worst Taco Bell you can go to period. Foods messy lettuce tastes like it's been out for 3 days this place should be closed down!

Definitely not my favorite Taco Bell. Waited at the window for 5 minutes when no one was even in line. Working hard or hardly workin. I'll go with hardly workin... and to top it off they got our order wrong when we got 3 items.
I have eaten at nearly every Taco Bell and this one is my favorite.

Truly curious if there is a slower Taco Bell drive thru in the United States of America. It's truly absurd.

However, the food is usually solid when it comes out after you've sat stuck in the drive-thru for over half and hour, thus the 2-star instead of 1. Get it together in there, guys..

0/5 stars .
Ordered a veggie wrap and when I got home I noticed it has meat inside of it. 
Get people's order RIGHT

Walks in....crickets....nobody greets me 10 mins later ..just a minute I'll be with you..another 10..uhh you know we have a kiosk right?! Orders...order comes its WRONG! Waits for the rest of my order...my chicken burrito is tossed onto the counter like trash

Today at 12:44 I ordered my food and there were 4 to 5 people ahead of me so I understand waiting but when I saw what was going on behind the counter I started to pay attention and what I saw was the lady making my tacos put the tacos on the slider she put meat in the taco and then left the counter which when she returned she came back with a bag of lettuce and cheese.  She proceeded to fill the lettuce, two cheese containers and still my tacos are sitting there not done and then she went to get my cheese fries and yes this seems normal but I timed it and it took ten minutes from loading my tacos with meat too starting to put them in wrappers.  The total time of my order took 21 minutes.  When I asked for the manager she came to me and I told her it took this long and she said they were slammed with 5 people sheaf of me.  I told her my tacos were on the slider for 10 minutes and she said NO.  She then told me to have a nice day but when I asked for her name she said mark.  So mark if you work at Taco Bell this lady dropped your name.  When I asked for the stare number she refused to tell me but after asking a few times she said it was on my receipt.  I was told by my wife that she thinks the managers name is Michelle.  Poor service.

When I first came in it was ok, the lady who took my order were very  sweet.  But when I come in for my re order, a nice man helped me and was more than happy to have my order fixed.  While I wait in the lobby, I hear the lady who's doing my remake, making snide comments in the background about how she put chicken in, and that If I wanted more, I needed to pay for it.  When I take 3 solid bites and don't find any meat in it, there's something wrong.  Even my remake was crappy. Over filled with cheese. And hardly any meat or rice.  Very sloppy on her end and probably a bit resentful.  I did let the young man know that she made me uncomfortable.  He was very apologetic and Understanding.  I feel bad if I stressed him out with my complaint when it wasn't his fault :/ would have given 1 star, but the other two made up for it :)

I prefer this Taco Bell to every other Taco Bell around. They have the best customer service. They may not be the fastest, most Taco Bell's aren't because they make the food as you order. But they seem to care about the people. At least the new people. I was touched when I pulled out my box and saw a beautiful note on it. Thank you for making an awesome memory!
The. Worst. Drive thru. 30min wait before even getting to order, when I got to the speaker it was even longer before I drove off.

I've been in the drive thru for 15 minutes. All I ordered was a 5 dollar box. I'm so irritated and disappointed with the wait and if you want fast and correct service then I suggest not to go to this one. The wait was so disappointing, I've seen them do better .

I have been going to this location since it opened which was at least 20 years ago and can honestly say that at this point the restaurant has degraded so much I will chose another location.

As I entered the parking lot I could see that it was in desperate need of serious attention, trash and debris littered the entire lot.  The unenthused employee took my order and being I was the only person in line I was kind of shocked it took a total of :15 minutes from the time I entered until the time I walked out to get just one nacho box.  First time it had no pico de gallo, second time no meat, I opened the box a third time and it was the original incorrect order that I sent back the first time!  I asked to speak to a manager to make sure that my order was correct and he was as unenthused as the person who took my order, no emotion, just monotone and not an ounce of care whatsoever.  

They didn't have sporks out so I had to ask for one, and a bag since they didn't give me one.  But while I was waiting for my food the "manager" if that's what you want to call him took my bag and threw it away so I had to ask for one again.  Just an overall bad experience.  They can do so much better if they tried and obviously the drive is not there.

Taco Bell gets more expensive with smaller portions containing less flavor. To add insult to injury the latest remodel here looks and feels like crap. Beige, white and black make the place look even more grim than it already is. Steel chairs and wooden benches feel like something from a prison. Whomever was chosen to remodel this place should be beaten severely. I expect that the next remodel will be a centrally located single steel trough for everyone to dine from.
 As far as the food, TB needs to either get cheaper or provide better quality food. Plenty of better Mexican fast food joints around for the money. Service is better here than most TB's but has been slacking lately. Only other beef is the crappy urban jazz playing, not conducive for a stress-free lunch whatsoever, plus hard to hear what the counter person is mumbling when you go to order.

If I could give ZERO stars, I would! I used the app on my phone and paid before I went in. I had an order number as well as an email saying my food was ready. I walk in and stand there for about 3 min before I finally asked the girl at the register how to get my order. She had no idea what I was talking about. She then proceeded to walk back and forth looking as lost as can be. I asked her if there was a manager she could ask. He then came around the corner telling me that my order was not on his screen and there was nothing he could do for me. I showed him my order email confirmation and his response was, " I understand its on your phone. But its not on my screen so there is nothing I can do." He then says the only thing I can do is to cancel my order and order there at the counter. I asked him how to cancel it. His response was, "I have no idea how the app works. My manager tells people to cancel and re-order." 

I'm sorry! You are in customer service and the response I get is, there is nothin I can do for you? I will be filing a complaint with the district manager. Thanks for nothing!

Even before the remodel the service, speed and accuracy of the site was questionable. Now that they have reopened we decided to try again.  Got our mobile order placed and hit the drive through. Took 4 minutes for ten ro even acknowledge us (2 cars in front of us didn't seem to have that issue). Then I told the kid I had a mobile order. He said oh ok. And then another 5 minutes of dead air he said ok I can take your order. Told him again we're had a mobile order and he said ok pull forward. 5 more minutes at the window and then he ask us to pull to the front as they were having a problem. 
Canceled our order and went elsewhere for dinner. Definitely DO NOT recommend this location. Dine at your own risk.

I've been in the drive through for 25 minutes and there was only 5 cars ahead of me- night of August 1, 2019

Update: figured out why it took so long. When we pulled up all 3 employees at the window were dancing around and taking videos of each other. Our cashier was Eugene S according the my receipt. The drive through line has a curb on each side so you can't get out of the line otherwise I would have never waited so long. How embarrassing for this company to have employees represent your brand this way.
We had an excellent experience here.  Order was properly made with some customizations, the food was good and well portioned, and plenty of each condiment was supplied.

I've gone to this Taco Bell location four times so far. The first two experiences ranged between subpar and poor. However, the last couple of visits have exceeded my expectations. I'm not sure what has caused the increase in quality, but I greatly appreciate it. The meal I got today was both prompt and correctly made.

Hands down gotta say this Taco Bell experience was the best experience I've ever had at a Taco Bell. Food was hot, the order was made correctly not missing anything. But most importantly the manager work was a delightful person who truly enjoys their job and has curated a team of humble hard workers! The overall staff and food received here should be an example to what other Taco Bell's could be. I will definitely come out of my way to go to this location!! Peace. Love. & Tacos.
I've been in the drive thru for 20 minutes. Do the franchisees owners not look at reviews. Absolutely the slowest fast food in the NW

Literally the slowest drive thru in the universe.  I know you will say, there's no way this dude has been to every drive thru in the universe.  However, I am confident in making this generalization based on the 27 minutes I have spent in the drive thru this evening and I'm still three cars back.  Why'd you stay, you will ask?  I was blocked in.  That's why.  Save yourself.  Don't visit.

I just had the most wonderful experience at Taco Bell of all places. Savannah was so positive and uplifting. She taught us some Taco Bell slang and even hooked it up with a Baja blast! It was prime. Thanks dude!

I like the food,most of the employees are very nice. The only things I have to say that would be negative is they do very often get the prices wrong and put it in for something more or less expensive than it actually is and recently there is a new girl there who gets my order wrong every time and I've had friends tell me the same exact thing. Otherwise decent fast food and accommodating to vegetarians.

If there was an option to leave zero stars, I would.  My husband was there a short time ago and stood at the counter for a good 5+ minutes and not one employee came to the counter to take his order or even acknowledge he was there.  The drive thru worker looked at him a couple of times, but never spoke.....just looked at him.  We will never be back and will be contacting corporate on Monday morning.

Ordered a Steak Burrito (beef) to go just now. WTF? No steak!!! There is a reason why I ordered a steak and not a regular burrito. If I wanted a regular burrito, I would have ordered a regular burrito.
Taco Bell service is unmatched. Went through the drive thru and they forgot quesadilla. Went inside and got two free Baja blasts. thanks queen .

Tonight was the worst experience yet, watched an unorganized crew attempting to make orders.  25 minutes waiting for a walk-in order.  They would stop in the middle of orders to work on something else than finally finish and order 10 minutes from start to finish, then serving it to a customer.  One employee was busy stacking individual sauce packets into containers in the restaurant.  When asked for the managers name, they acted as if was classified information.  Since the remodel, service has sharply fallen off.  No one seemed motivated to give good customer service.  The need to remember we are the customer.  Given the level of service, I doubt I will ever spend another dime there again!  They need to clean up their act!

Firstly, my friends and I come to this location often and never have a problem with our order(s). Our order was complete mess. We ordered two orders of the triple layer nachos, it seemed like they only put the sauce - barely any cheese or beans if any also the chips were stale. My friend ordered a spicy potato soft taco with extra sauce, she even paid the extra $.50, but it seemed like the regular amount. My other friend ordered a Baja Blast and it seemed like the soda was running out. Also, once we got home, we realized that we were missing a taco so we had to go back and the man who helped me was really rude when I told him about their mistake, it wasn't even busy enough for them to make that kind of mistake. They also seemed annoyed that I had to come in and talk to them about the mishap. My friends noticed that all the employees were most likely talking about me as I walked out of the store. The girl, Kaylee H., who took our order, cashed us out, and handed us our food was rude through the whole process. She did not even greet us when we got to the window. 

I personally work in fast food so I understand what it means to give the customer their whole satisfaction and to have them want to come again, but at my work, every employee make sure multiple times that everything is in the bag even when our store is in a rush and have a lot of orders to give out, but even when there are barely any orders, it should not be hard to give out the correct orders. And what I am surprised is that they didn't even offer anything else like an extra food item for their mistake like other food establishments do usually. Honestly one of the worst customer service and fast food services that I have experienced.

Avoid this Taco Bell . LITERALLY there hasn't been a time my food was made correctly . Either an item is missing all together or completely messed up. Food is never fresh and wait times are the worst . Workers here never care anyway

I've been coming here and it's always clean and tidy, but today is just unacceptable 
Filthy tables are so sticky trash all over the floor


SAD
Taco Bell service is unmatched. Went through the drive thru and they forgot quesadilla. Went inside and got two free Baja blasts. thanks queen.

Standard Taco Bell, this one is obvious and easy to find since it's right off 50. I can't tell you much about the food at Taco Bell since I only ever go for the dessert. If you haven't already GET THE CINNABON DELIGHTS!!!! They are the best things on this planet. Little fried sugary donuts filled with icing. If they ever get rid of them, I will sue for emotional damages. How are they so good and so cheap, I feel sorry for the people that don't know they exist. We. Must. Spread. The. Word.

This is the Taco Bell I chose to go over the one on Kirkman road (closer to my house). There is definitely better food than the one from Kirkman road 100% of the times ( tested the theory plenty of times). More often than not, the employees at the drive thru are courteous ( as much as you can expect from drive thru employees at a fast food chain). My fiesta potatoes are made flawlessly every time ( no double frying taste there)! Go to this Taco Bell for a decent experience!

Went through the drive-thru today and ordered 3 tacos.  The window attendant asked me if I wanted any sauce and I answered yes.  Upon getting my order and arriving home, I noticed the bag was a bit heavier than I'd expect for 3 tacos, and counted 19 sauce packets.  I had asked for some diablo sauce but the packets were fairly evenly split between the diablo and mild sauces.

19 sauce packets?  Really?  What a waste.  Always a sign of poor management, to say nothing of non-caring staff.

I really like tacos. The food here is the exact same quality you would expect at any other taco Bell. The staff is hit or miss friendly. The food is served fast. This location is seriously in need of a renovation. The sides of the tables have mold embedded into the plastic. How this passes inspection is beyond me. I recommend taking your order to-go.

Now let's start off with saying that I am no stranger to Taco Bell. I live for the Bell. I follow them on Instagram. Big fan. Needless to say, I live más.

Having said that, I was very disappointed by my experience with this location. Let me paint you a picture. I'm up late playing Madden 07 with some friends. After a few hours of sleep, I get woken up to a phone call around 730am. A friend of mine needs me to take them to the emergency room. She sliced herself while chopping up some lettuce for a salad, and before you ask, I don't know why she was preparing a salad that early. Anyways, I'm a decent friend so I oblige. We leave the hospital around 11 and I'm cravin some TBell, knowing in my heart that breakfast time has expired. There's one in close proximity, and I feel my level of stoke on the rise. Like more stoked than when Ben Affleck and Matt Damon won the Oscar for Good Will Hunting. 

We get to the drive through and it's beautiful. A nice good looking TBell, the kind you would take a date to if you want to impress them. We order. I get my usual which includes, among other things, some Triple Layer Nachos and a couple of Double Decker Tacos with no lettuce. We've already had one lettuce incident today. I don't need another on my conscience. I exchange pleasantries with some employees and briefly mention my upcoming candle business. 

Now I'm driving home in my Smart Car after dropping my friend off at her place. She's doing okay by the way. And I'm driving and I can smell the Taco Bell and I just cannot wait any longer to eat! I'm so excited to eat, like on par excitement with Cuba Gooding JR winning the Oscar for Jerry Maguire.

So I unwrap my taco and there it is; a beautiful taco drowned in lettuce. I am devastated. 

The nachos are dope though. Two stars.

This location is a joke.  The employees are lazy and stupid.  The drive through girl tried to convince me they don't sell gorditas because she didn't feel like figuring out how to ring them up.   That was on the same order where my wife successfully ordered a Gordita crunch, but yeah you don't sell gorditas.  Flipping moron.   

This is the level of service you can expect from pretty much all of the area's Taco Bell locations.   This franchise is second only to Burger King for worst places to eat in Columbus area.

Only three people in line. Order took over 20 minutes to get to us. While our order was being taken, staff was distracted by a group of "friends" who came in shouting and swearing, she was not paying attention to our order. Restaurant was dirty, sauces were leaking in the containers, no syrup in a couple of the fountain selections.  Profanity and offensive language run amok and it was only 8pm. Never again!

I am not a big fan of Taco Bell so fair warning....
I go through the drive through once and a while. I decided to go inside at this location to watch my food being made.
I was not happy to see the clerk ring me in and turn around and make my food and other food with the same gloves on...
I left the restaurant and so did the customer behind me. He saw the same thing. We both shook our heads.
I hope you have a strong stomach if you eat here. The staff are the bottom of the barrel.
Good luck...

Definitely the worst Taco Bell ever! Everything we ordered was about 1/3 the size they normally are. LAME! I feel like such an idiot for spending over $17 dollars here. The two syringes in the drive through were a nice touch.

I work downtown so when have a TB craving I either go to this location or the German Village location. Today I came here and I'm not sure what has happened - the service was super slow, the floor and tables were filthy, the pop station was sticky and disgusting and there were no sauces or utensils in the bins! The entire experience was absolutely horrible! I'll be going to the one in German Village from now on!!!

Jordan is awesome, fast, friendly knows what he's doing. Definitely a great keeper! Order machine can be confusing for those who are not familiar with, but he stepped out and helped, and trying not to leave customers figuring on their own. Great service will drop by again. He also explained  my question very clearly about why Baja blast is popular.

The service was terrible they always talk back when I take the food because it's cold and thrown together these employees have no respect for preparing hot food. Or even basic human respect to selected customers I live in the area and will not tolerate this crap I'm not going anywhere and will keep telling them if the food is or I will write a letter to the corporate office. regardless of there big mouth's
This Taco Bell has the best service late at night. The lady...and sometimes guy on the mic are so super nice. Just thanks :-)

It's past the lunch rush.  Stop by for some cheap eats.  Guy at register is friendly and efficient.  Line at drive in.  ONE guy in the back filling orders.  Omg!  Waited 20 minutes for a combo meal.  Reminded me really fast why Taco Bell isn't a go to option for me!

They said they were closed an hour before they were supposed to be closed according to google. They are supposed to close at 3am but it was 2am when we got to the front of the line after waiting 20 min and they said they were closed to everyone behind me. Horrible place to go after 12am cause they lie!

This Taco Bell sucks. After ordering had to wait 15 inexplicable minutes to get my taco and then they called my name and walked away leaving the food on the counter missing the cup for the drink I ordered.  Then had to literally flag someone down since everyone was ignoring customers. No smiles no thank you. It must suck to work here even more than it doesvtovdine here.

This Taco Bell location is probably the best fast food option in the OSU area of High Street. The restaurant is brand new, with plenty of comfortable seating. The staff was friendly and I've never waited more than a few minutes for my order. Tables are plentiful and the soda machines are clean. 

Of course, this is a Taco Bell so one has to come with somewhat tempered expectations, but the basics - crunchwraps and tacos - are dirt cheap and as good as you'd expect for a place like Taco Bell.

Do not go into the dining room, unless you have absolutely no time constraints. I have waited over 20 minuted for food. Today I waited 10 minutes for my ONE food item, aand there was only 1 person ahead of me who also ordered ONE food item, and this was at 2:40 pm. They always put the drive thru orders first, so today I watched them get 3 cars through the drive thru before starting the order of the person in front of me. It might be ok if the staff was polite and apologetic, but they are rude and often outright disrespectful to customers.

I've never had a bad experience here, which makes me sad reading all the bad reviews. I usually come here before noon every once in a while, and I'm always greeted by the nicest lady! I wish I knew her name. She is so sweet! She always puts a smile on my face. I love talking with her, and would definitely recommend coming here just to visit with her.

Wow unbelievable! Walked into the restaurant waited for an unbelievable amount of time, then somebody came up and told me they were closed. I asked why was the door unlocked? He said he didn't know. I also know that their dining room is open till 11 p.m. but he couldn't explain to me why they closed at 10 today. I walked away very upset I will never return to this Taco Bell!
Went through the drive-through specifically asked to mark the burritos so we don't have to open up each one to find out who gets who's why is this so hard

I had to return some food since they fried my burrito and as I was sitting at the drive-thru window I noticed a rat at their drive-thru I'm horribly disgusted the rat was moving and injured. I think somebody needs to come out and expect this Taco Bell
This place is gross! Dirty tables, bathroom super nasty. They gave me my order with hairs in it, I almost threw up. This place needs to be supervised.

I work HVAC a hot job.I came here at lunch starving and only had a hundred dollar bill on me soaked in sweat at 1pm ordered over 25$ worth of food and was told at 12:30 in the afternoon they would not be able to give me change and I could not order then the manager checked all the cash in other registers where I saw many 20 dollar bills and was told she had no change so this place will not accept large bills bet will check them repeatedly to see if they are counterfeit but will not accept them.

Good for a quick meal. I like this Taco Bell because even though they cater to a large college crowd, they're quick, clean and efficient. I've never had to wait more than five minutes for my food. The staff is always friendly. The only downside is that it can be loud sometimes, but that's to be expected. 4/5.

Lauren W. was my cashier when I ordered a few things for myself and my friends as a going away party. My card did have the funds but was not working. I told Lauren just to take off the rest of the food and order just one thing. I believe her, the sweet female line cook, and female manager (wish I got their names) felt moved in their heart to help me out. They let me have the rest of my order even though I could not pay for it. It's people like this who have compassion for others in need that keep my faith in humanity. It may have just been a quesadilla and nachos but you really made my afternoon that day... I hope that you see this review. I hope to see you next time I come through hungry in that Atlanta traffic. For this kind gesture, I will be back. -- Thank you ladies!!!!
This taco bell skimps on toppings most of the times. My taco bell here tastes like an empty tortilla, very sad

I ask to be forgiven on this day, for I have done the most unforgivable act as a yelper and eaten at Taco Bell. 
It wasn't my idea, my coworkers wanted to come here and their infectious pleads for tacos made with hard shells in colors that don't exist in nature eventually won over. The worst part is... I kinda liked it. Particularly the spicy Dorito shell that was a bright glowing red color, almost blinded me to death.

The odds of me coming back anytime soon are not high just because I don't consider taco bell real mexican and there are a lot of good places in Orlando to get a real taco fix but.... I didn't hate the Dorito taco, and the service was actually good.

So about 200 years ago there was a pumpkin farmer in the area named Jedmund Kathspire. An honest to god, hardworking, good natured man. He would teach local children how to carve pumpkins and roast seeds, they would drink cider and laugh. Then the rumors arose: Jedmund and his family were accused of practicing black magic and indoctrinating the local children into their "coven". An angry mob descended onto the Kathspire's home and viciously beat Jedmund, his wife and three children (ages 13, 6 and 3) before tearing them apart with pitchforks and burning their house down (with their defiled corpses in it). This site is now 2553 North High street. The Hudson/High Taco Bell. The actual gates of Hell. There's an unsettling ambience around the whole place...like some unseen force is just looming over...something ancient, evil and pissed off. Must be why the employees are so rude. My order is literally always wrong, I'd say the people here just don't care if I weren't certain they were possessed by some malevolent force. I see the maleficent deeds have not gone unnoticed by others (constantly being out of Baja Blast...a lobby that closes at 9:30 pm on a Saturday night...egregious errors in service...intrusive thoughts of a crying man in a dark cloak...the sudden urge to devour oneself etc.) Avoid this location at all costs.

I have never been treated so poorly.  I go here ALL the time probably spend upwards of 100 a month.   Over two drinks Deja S. felt the need to make it VERY well known to all the surrounding employees how I was wrong,  I didn't say freezes..... so on so on.   Then after I said I didn't want the 2 drinks already poured that were wrong and I didn't have room for them,  she shoved them towards me and said throw them away. Where in my car? I then called to speak to a manager and Amy then felt the need to rush me off the phone and brush me off rudely.   It honestly felt racially driven,  real shame!
Every time I go here they mess up my simplest orders!! What is it with Taco Bell hiring the most incompetent employees??

Ordered #2 Supreme Soft tacos & Kickstart for my drink. 
Tacos were cold and my soft shells were HARD. Also my drink just tasted like heavy syrup. So disappointed.

Worst TB in town. Freeze machine always down. Orders correct half the time. And longest drive thru wait ever. 

Avoid.

Ok first off we go through the drive thru and you didn't even give us the right food, Sara had the shittiest attitude ever, really had a problem with giving us sauce after asking lmao. So we go inside and she was even rude fixing the order. Lmao bye

The manager that is on right now at 5:30 PM an older man I watched him with gloves on put his hands down his pants before handing a young lady her meal. He tried to be sneaky about it but I saw him do it. He was very rude as well when I canceled my order. I've been coming to this location sense I was a child and I am 29. How did someone so disgusting, unsanitary and unprofessional get put in a position of leader ship in this place?

I just wanted to give a big shout out to this location on customer service. This location always has super
friendly and nice drive thru staff. It is really refreshing. 
Tonight the service was so impressive in that category. 
I asked for a large cup of ice (happy to pay for) for a raging headache. The young lady at the window was so sweet when  she asked if I wanted a straw I told her the ice was for my head and neck. She gave me a perfect plastic bag for it. She didn't know it but, I am all packed to move and needed that bag for the ice. It just lifted me up. Take good care of your amazing staff $$$ 
Thank you!

Used the Taco Bell app and purchased a Nachos BellGrande which was a horrible experience. Not sure what's happened to Taco Bell lately but this nacho was half the size or what a bell grande used to be, chips were cold and some chips were stale. As for the 6 hot sauce packages I added to order in photo - no, they failed to put them in my bag too. I sure hope owner of this particular location looks into this.

Pretty average service and the food is alright by Taco Bell standards . The only real critique I have is when it comes to the drive thru service. Almost every time I go they forget something in my order. Unfortunately, Ive had to make a habit of checking my order whenever I go there because of how often this happens. As for the service when you're eating inside the restaurant, nothing really noteworthy. On the upside, this specific Taco Bell adds more cheese to the mini quesadillas than any other taco bell I've been to. Also, they gave me some free rice once so that was pretty cool. ‍
Online ordering and drive thru are easy to use and great! Thanks. Love the chicken power bowl.

I would like to start with saying I never expect Taco Bell to be fine dining. Taco Bell is the place that when grabbing dinner for my family of 4, I order a few extra things. I can count on something to be wrong or left out of the order all together. I'm ok with that, the food is cheap, no biggie.

I placed an order through the app, thinking that if I can input the order myself, maybe it would be more accurate. Anyway, order was placed, confirmation of order and payment was received. I got to the location and they had no record of the order. No one knew how to look up an order number to find it. They then said we had ordered via Grub Hub and the delivery driver must have picked it up. Nope, not a Grub Hub order. The night manager wouldn't give us the ordered food or refund the money. She kept saying if she gave us the food, we would just call the 800 number and get a refund. So we left with no food and no refund.

I have called the 800 number multiple times, it is not working. It just keeps saying to try again later and drops the call. I called the location and asked if there was another number to call and they hung up on me. 

No one at this location can do anything to make it right and corporate isn't answering. Fun stuff.
Went through drive thru. Soda had little ice and was flat. Pay attention employees. Will not be back.

I am a regular guest at this Taco Bell and for some reason every time I come either the credit card machine isn't working or they have all the lights off like they are closed. Online it says you guys don't close until 3am so why is it at 1am all the lights in the building and the Taco Bell sign off? Like if business is close. And then on top of that they get my order wrong every time. I am very upset being that I come here all the time and enjoy the food here and know some of the staff

I came to this location on Saturday November 30th around 12 am. I ordered a 7 layer burrito, a beefy 5 layer burrito and a cheese quesadilla. When I arrived home, which is less than 2 mins away, I discover that both burritos are luke warm and my quesadilla is not even cut. I usually don't write reviews because I usually never encounter a complete lack of care for food like this. But this one really took the ticket. I realize this is fast food and the quality isn't 5 star. But at the very least, I expect warm food and the food to be served in somewhat neat manner.

I've gone to this Taco Bell twice and bad terrible service. They ignore you if you go in the store. I had to yell "helllo?" Several time and asked for ny drink true twice. I am going to go to the district manager with this. This is ridiculous

4 stars is impressive  for taco bell only reason why i gove it this high is cause there cutomer service is amazing! No matter how u put it taco bell is taco bell but this is hands down the service i have ever received  there. Congrats!

Worst place to go. Wanted Food & their Dine In is Closed at 8:00 Pm. Virus or No Virus, my $ is still good & the so called Manger tells my husband, that he "has too" wait for all the Cars 1 St, before he can get Food . Remind you, the Dine In Rules say,  Open from Opening to 10 Pm.
Easily America's best Taco Bell! They're so nice and really fast!! Every time I come through they greet me and always thank me for my business.

Gracious Service 
Each visit to "Taco Bell,"  I am met with kindness. Thank you all so much =) 

I want to give a shout out; 
Holla to the new "Toasted Cheddar Chalupa!"Seriously hoping it will stay on the menu. I've ordered this with "Black Beans"  and love it!

This location was...not good. Not that most Taco Bells are amazing, it's just that this was particularly bad. Me and my friends stopped here after a night out. Not particularly late, it was probably 12:30. The girl taking our order was just so dismissive and almost ignored us half the time and kept asking us to repeat ourselves. I'd get it if we were drunk and annoying, but the sober one of us was the one that placed the order and we just got fed up. After the ordeal of ordering, paying, and leaving, what was in the bag wasn't even remotely similar to what we ordered. Would not recommend.

This location has gone downhill in the last 6 mos or so.  I really should give them 1 star but I just can't do that.  The drive thru takes forever even when they are not that busy.

Tonight was the final straw.  33mins in line from start to finish.  The poor kid working the window didn't really offer up am excuse and spent the time looking over at the kitchen probably staring daggers at them to hurry up.  You would have thought maybe the lobby area was busy?   Nope, 4 people.

New  management?? Who knows.

I have visited this place often and after 2 am,  they only accept cash. They claim that the system is down, but you go to the one on 117th, they take cards always.

I suspect that either the owner is trying to cheat the IRS, or the employees want to not work for an hour or so. Frankly, I'd rather hit the other location.

This Taco Bell is the closet to my house so this is where I go for my late night TB craving. The food is usual good and service on point, but the drive thru is a nightmare. The cars coming out, exit the same way as the cars getting in line. You HAVE to leave space for the exiting cars, but unfortunately not all people do. I've had a few close calls trying to exit due to the exit being partially blocked. The last time I visited we left room for the cars to exit before we could turn in. While waiting, a car pulled up behind us and tried to cut us off, which would've completely blocked the exiting cars. We pulled forward, not letting him in and thankfully the car at the speaker pulled forward at the same time so we didn't block traffic. When we left cars were blocking the exit but we were able to squeeze through. 

TB really needs to look into renovating the drive thru.

For a Taco Bell, pretty great. Staff is nice, I've never had a  mistake on an order. Some people on here are really hating after one bad experience. Cmon y'all lighten up.  

Thanks you guys, your hard work and mellow attitude is appreciated.

Was a long time customer but no more for me. First they did away with the double decker taco and now the Mexican pizza. Those were the main 2 items that would bring me in twice a week. Now I simply have no reason to go back. So long Taco Bell, it's been real

100% of the time this TB will mess up your order! And they know it. Almost as if they're doing it on purpose to save $. Last time I went in to get a correction the guy in the back admitted that he only made 1 of the two items. He knew what I was missing before I walked in! Ridiculous!!!
Did not give me my full order. Paid $14 dollars for a bunch of tacos and i ordered a grillled stuffed burrito.

I went here early morning, New year's day. Ordered 24 dollars worth of food. The dude working the window gave me one large bag and I asked him if that was everything. He checked with his co-workers and told me that it was.

When we got home, we found that they had missed four items. A few hours later, I experienced severe intestinal cramping and satanic diarrhea.

I called later and asked for a refund for the items I paid for and did not receive, they said yes. I came by and was denied a refund because I didn't have a receipt. They did offer to replace the food items, but I wasn't in the mood to have diarrhea again.

All I wanted was a refund, the total of which would have been around five dollars. Didn't even want compensation for the fecal geyser they created.

These stupid fucking idiots fucked my order and I called and talk to a manager and she took my number and name down and told me to come in and get my food and when I did they question me as if I'm trying to steal food and told me. I said who the fuck wanna steal 10 dollars worth of tacos. I pulled out out 100 and said I don't need to steal or ask for a free meal. It was your stores fuck up lol I swear stupid people blows my mind

there is a what looked like a bigger bald man. he was the best worker i have seen at taco bell in my life time. genuinely made me a my girlfriends night and needs to get a raise. sorry for not knowing your name buddy but well deserved and great customer service.

The customer service is terrible, but honestly what do you expect from a fast food restaurant chain . Placed an order on their app and it was mysteriously canceled, without a proper explanation from the MOD . Also, please terminate Justin (cashier) ASAP . His attitude and customer service is disgusting
I walked in and asked to go to the bathroom and was sexually harassed by a worker commenting on my butt and body. I was the only person in there and I felt so unsafe.

If I could give zero stars..... they get orders wrong EVERYTIME. Ordered a doritos loco taco that literally was thrown together. Will go out of my way to not go to this Taco Bell. It's across the street from my house.

It's terrible, but even the bad is decent when it's late night on a Tuesday, right?

Wrong. The drive-thru took 20 solid minutes to fulfill five orders of cars in front of me, and from a clear line of sight to the service window, not o e of the late-night patrons (latrons?) did the bulk food run.

Further proof? When I finally got to the window, the employees were laughing and joking with each other making me and every customer before me a distant afterthought. 

Plus, they forgot one of my tacos. One combo meal and I didn't get a taco. Gah. 

Look, I don't have sky-high expectations of the south shore's only option at midnight midweek, but criminy, get my order right and completed in a reasonable time. Sad, really.
Madison gives fantastic customer service in the drive thru! 10 stars for her! Food is fresh and she is very helpful. Thank you Madison!

I've already written this review I'm not exactly sure what has happened to it but it was a an awful experience the wife and I sat down to a dirty table because really what choice did we have all the tables were dirty so we went we cleaned the table ourselves and waited would seem to be a pretty long time to get our food when we got our food I pretty much already lost my appetite due to The Man Behind Me mentioning to the young lady at the register about how disgusting it was for their group be a dirty diaper in the doorway which apparently my wife and I had completely overlooked I'm glad I didn't have the mental image as well but when I got my food there was the image LOL the wife went to the restroom and said they were absolutely disgusting 01 funny fact when the woman at the register went to collect the diaper the men had to remind her to put on some gloves LOL

My friend had ordered a crunch wrap with beans, no beef. Shes highly allergic to beef. Got all the way home and it had beef in it. She called to complain, the employee had her read off her ticket (which was an odd request. It should have been, okay come in and we'll remake it for you) then the employee claimed she saw the ticket and it had beans. Then she cursed at my friend and threatened to call the cops on her if she showed up with it? My friend called the cops to meet her there and multiple employees came out dancing, pointing and laughing and acting like deranged children. This behavior is unacceptable, and corporate needs to handle this asap.

WHYYYYYYYY?! This is the slowest Taco Bell on the planet. I can understand at 2 am when drunk kids all want Taco Bell but I'm here on a Thursday at 7:30 and there's only 3 cars in line. I sat in the drive through for 10 minutes before finally placing my order, another 10 at the window waiting to get my order. As I'm sitting next to the window to the dining room I see 3 employees just sitting around hanging out and 1 customer at a table eating. The guy at the window was super nice, but he must be the only one working since it's taking 20 min for my super small and simple order? Seriously, hire some more people and fix this location.

Update: just found a tiny sliver of sharp metal in my quesadilla. Wtf

I have been a long term customer of this particular Taco Bell 13305 SW Pacific Highway Tigard, Oregon. I was pretty jazzed when I discovered this location was planning a tear down  and rebuild. This location was exceptionally slow and customer service was the worst, so consequently, I was hoping the new building would bring about a welcomed change for the staff and the customer.

My first experience at the new and improved building was last night 5-12-19 at approximately 8:00 pm 

After waiting in the driveway line for 18 minutes, I arrived at the order kiosk. The person taking orders apologized for the delay and said that they had been swamped. There were only two (2) cars ahead of me so I don't know if two cars constitutes being "swamped" but anyhow I order 4 items and asked for a substitute on my chicken burrito, no rice and add beans. I finished my order and picked up my food at the window. Upon arriving home, I discovered on my receipt that I was charged .60 cents for the substitute. I wished I had been told about the charge prior to getting my order and I probably would have made a different choice. Beans are NOT avocados!!! Laughing

Anyhow I slept on my frustration and called the location. And spoke to the Manager "Maria" about what had happened. She was uninterested in meeting the needs or expectations for a customer and blamed the delay on the fact that "we did $700 in sales between 7 & 8 pm" "you should expect a delay when we have that much business and we were short staffed, people on break etc. Not this customers problem, hire more staff!!!

When asked about the up-charge for beans, I was told " that's your problem, the screen at the drive up window shows the charges". I explained that after waiting nearly 20 minutes at a Taco Bell drive through, I just wanted to get my dinner and go home. Maria was inpatient with me, could have cared less and told me "call Weber Bells". Which is the corporate offices. 

I think I have a whole internet to leave derogatory reviews on. Perhaps the corporate office will contact me with an apology?????

It's amazing how terrible the service is. They don't even put your food on trays even when you want to eat there and they frequently run out of hot sauce. Loud customers constantly barge in and it just seems like it's one giant bitch fest between the employee, customers, and manager. I'm only giving this 2 stars because it's taco bell and the food is pretty decent.
Will not go back . Messed up on my order and gave me a half Eatin protein bowl . Horrible service.
Me and my brotha Jonny last night got the nacho party pack. This mug HITS. Phewwwwww, I was like damn momma. Dis jonspiece could feed 3 grown men easy, NO KWESTION. Ps love you Taco Bell

Worst Taco Bell in ga not exaggerating, somebody please shut them down ......from being rude to getting order wrong to cheating you on the meat

Always something when I go there , never going back again

Worst Taco Bell experience ever. Where is the 0 star option? I walked up to the restaurant only to find that they were "severely understaffed" and therefore closed for everything but drive thru. I came up to the drive thru window and saw a guy ordering without a car. After he was done ordering, they said they couldn't let me through reasoning he was already there. Garbage service, garbage hoodrat business. Please stay away!

This taco Bell is chock full of idiots. I ordered a nacho Bell grande no meat, substitute beans, Xtra cheese, Xtra sour cream. Double checked with order taker that there's no meat. I have kidney disease and HAVE TO SEVERELY LIMIT MY MEAT. What did I get? Nacho Bell grande LOADED with MEAT..

Absolutely the WORST Taco Bell I have ever been to!!!! The food is always shit & tastes weeks old and I can't count on two hands how many times I drove all the way there just to hear "oh the drive through just went down" yeah my ass. The workers are good for nothing stupid kids that don't know how to make a taco. DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME. TRUST ME!!!!!

Waited 40 for food.  Called and complaint manager asked "Uh so why you complaining" 
Kept talking to her and I dont think I ever spoken to a stupid dude manager in my whole 25 years of living lol

Out of the many Taco Bell's I've gone to within the United States the is by far the worst one. Every time I go the customers are very pushy and as well as not intelligent enough to get an order right to save their lives. Ordered two beefy five layers, got two bean and cheese burritos... Again.

We waited for over an hour to order through the drive through. The people working came out to yell at us for dancing in the drive through. We called to ensure that this location would accept visitors without a car which they said they would. They threatened to call the cops because we would not stop dancing. They specifically did not threaten the entire group of white people behind our group of mixed racial group. It sucks that they refused to serve our mixed race group of humans for tacos for "dancing". Turns out racism is alive at Taco Bell

They forgot my sauce which is kinda weird because every time I go through the drive thru they always make sure to ASK if I want any sauce but when I order online and get it delivered THEY DONT GIVE ME SAUCE. Like what the *bell rings*.
Your value menu should not have items priced a $1.29... that is absurd. A mile and a half down the road the same burrito is $1.00

WORST PLACE EVER!! Give you a quesadilla with nothing inside they barley use the ingredients properly got a cheesy Gordita crunch and they barley put anything in their just topped with cheese like wtf your cooking skills are the worst food is made by idiots

The customer service here is trash. They apparently closed and had a line of 10 cars lined outside and wouldn't tell anyone they closed. We pulled up to the window and the guy is standing there with a headset on like he didn't see me. You have a costumer service job. It takes nothing to communicate that you're closed instead of ignoring your customers.

This Taco Bell is conveniently located right in the publix plaza off of hiawassee road. It was recently renovated and has kiosks for ordering. The quality of the food was just mediocre at best. The chalupas felt greasy and may have been fried for too long or in oil that was too cold. Overall a meh type experience.

Crystal or possibly Krystal? Hooked us up with a ton of SAUCE (she came thru drippin ) some crisp ass water, and even threw in a dank Baja blast. We got 12 tacos, 2 spicy tostadas, and a Crunchwrap supreme; it was terrible but also so good cuz we were all pretty drunk and high. You see it all started back in 2011 when Bram introduced me to Mitch through yugioh and wanted us to all hang out and duel together. After initial hesitance, I allowed mitch and others to join our yugioh team and we proceeded to have the greatest summer of our lives - smoking, dueling, losing our virginities, shooting hoops - and that began a friendship that would last a lifetime. Fast forward to 2018 - were now small business owners, managers, supervisors making bank and settling down in some dope ass relationships. We gathered for a Christmas party to reminisce on some old memories while playing nostalgic games. Of course, we had to include drinking and smoking (also some new members: Mitch's brothers, my college friends, and girlfriends) and that lead us to the intoxicated decision to get TB! Thank you C/Krystal for helping make a legendary night

During Covid19....this restaurant has their lobby closed,  no restrooms for essential delivery drivers and you are required to wait in their drive thru line to pick up an order. Way unorganized! And NO MASKS on employees.

By far the worst experience I have ever had at Taco Bell. First off, they forgot half our order. Next, on our Nacho Fries orders, the cups were barely half full. Next, the items were barely wrapped up, causing all the toppings to spill out into the bag causing a sloppy mess. Lastly, the food was cold.... pretty ridiculous. Definitely won't ever go there again.
Maybe consider offering Doordash delivery up until the actual time of close like every other restaurant in town. Always some type of disappoint with this location.

The brilliancy of Taco Bell awaits you if you are looking at this review. You may call me a Taco Bell enthusiast. I have been to many taco bells and this Taco Bell has yet to mess up an order! Go threw the drive threw if you need your quick fix! They won't disappoint. 


Drive up, get your fix, and enjoy the art of Taco Bell!!

Received my order burnt with broken cover...even the car smelled like burned food!
The manager refused to take it back due to COVID.

We were just ready to place a final Taco Bell order to include multiple mexican pizzas to celebrate the end to a grand product.  But of course it's already off the menu.  $50 per week order going to another restaurant that continues to listen to its customers!
Check your bag before you leave, they NEVER EVER get my order correct. It's not even difficult, no crunchy tacos, soft tacos only and they usually forget something too.

Third time in a row that they have completely messed up my order and I get home without items. I don't know who the manager is at this location, but I'm guessing they only work there because they get some kind of federal recognition for employing complete retards. I have eaten at Taco Bell restaurants all over the country and I can say without a doubt, this is the worst one in the entire country. Love Taco Bell's food, but I absolutely will never return to this location.

....they still suck. I ordered the vegetarian black bean crunchwrap and got a regular crunchwrap with beef...I didn't realize it until 3 bites in. And they didn't add the sour cream I paid extra for in my cheesy bean and rice. Gave em 1 more try but no they are terrible.

World's slowest service. There were literally two cars ahead of me and and it took nearly 15 minutes. All I did was order two tacos. On top of that, my taco shell was stale. Now I know to get McDonald's next time.

went to drive thru around 230 in the morning and the service was extremely horrible..sometimes is the way people speak to you that can set somebody off. they told me they don't have a product but they can make me the burrito if I order it online..and they can not make it if I ask through the drive thru..but the manager was very condescending and rude..should be fired for the way she treats people ..

Today was free chalupa box day with the App. Downloaded the app did everything I was supposed to but it was not giving me a code. Handed my phone to the manager she could not get it to work either. There was obviously an issue with the app. She refused to give me my free chalupa box. Looks like they need to work on some customer service skills ! Left with having to pay for my son's dinner will not be back to this location unless they make this right.

I placed 2 orders using 2 different apps and both orders were made wrong. I drove to Taco Bell, even though I had placed both orders as delivery because the manager didn't believe they made an error. When I arrived, the manager said it was the apps I used, the pickup driver ordered my food wrong and the second order was made correctly. The manager asked to see the tacos in question. She looked at all 4 tacos and said they are right when they weren't. Never ever go to this taco bell. I have been giving them chance after chance for 18 years. Bye Winter Springs Taco Hell!

This was the worst experience I have had at any restaurant in many years if ever.  What was most shocking was the utter disregard for providing any reasonably prompt service. Laughing playing and not even sorry for 45 minutes in drive through with 20 of that at the window just watching and waiting.   the manager must be on vacation, the owner definitely is getting the raw end of the deal.   we will never return, there is an arby's and other restaurants if we are hungry.

Many of the reviews say that the service is slow are from months or years ago at the time of this review, so to update they seem to be doing better. Service isn't quicker or slower than any other place

They do seem to be very pestering at the drive thru however. Nice people, but you can't think or breathe for a second before they've asked you twice what you want.

Ordered two frito burritos with no beans because they are soon leaving the menu, no Fritos at all what so ever and the refried beans made it close to inedible. Super sad :( feel bad for the teens in the drive through, they appeared as if they had absolutely no idea what was going on.

From 5:40 - 6:15 i waited to order.  I normally would not be waiting this long for fast food but how the drive thru line is structured I had no choice because I was blocked in.  Never ended up getting food here because as soon as I had space to escape the line I did. I know this is fast food but there isn't an excuse for waiting that long in line.
Their late night crew is pretty badass. The 16 year old kid was very professional, they also load your food up and don't skim on anything, and it tasted pretty bomb!

the worst taco bell i've been to. the line was long which we were prepared for, but they forgot 4/7 things we ordered and the line was too long to even wait in to get the rest of our order. super annoying especially when we wait in a long line for 20+ mins and it's supposed to be fast food. i am a patient waiter but waiting in line AGAIN for over half of our order is a bit excessive:

Why does it take 20 to 30 minutes to go through the drive-thru at taco Bell to get any kind of product? I live in Hilliard Ohio and I have been waiting for 15 minutes I have not reachee the order window!  This is insane but it takes almost 30 minutes from taco Bell

Had the weirdest drive through experience, Luzmaria didn't know what she was doing and needs more training. All I ordered was 2 black bean and rice burritos. She replied "we don't have that". I think someone told her they do  and she put in my order. Each burrito usually costs me 1 dollar each and this time she  charged me 1.79 + .50 for black beans and +.50 cents for rice...when I got my bag there was one burrito. When I asked to pay for a second burrito she tried to charge me 3.79...wtf.
