I even showed her what she just charged me on the receipt and she still said 3.79 so i said never mind and she yelled "now she doesn't want the burrito!"  Wont be returning.

I waited 25 in the drive thru today for 2 tacos, it is crazy, they need to fix this or hire new management, it's fast food not a diner. Not only did it take forever but the girl at the drive thru was so rude.

Thanks again Taco Bell. What a brilliant idea to seal the to-go bags for our protection. In order to make it all works, your employees need to make sure that all FOUR items I ordered get put into the bag before I drive off unable to check. I then get home with THREE of my FOUR items in the bag. That's another $1.99 plus tax that Taco Bell owes me. 

Not to mention their new grilled cheese burrito with the cheese grilled on top gets stuck to the wrapper. As you try to pull the burrito off the wrapper the tortilla gets stuck to the cheese and you end up with rice, meat, and cheese in a wrapper.

The Manger for the night was just really rude and disrespectful, and she was also cleaning the counter with a dirty rag, we could see black stuff on it and that's not very sanitizing and we also saw her drop it on the ground. And she didn't even change her gloves after it dropped. Disgusting

It's sad to see a restaurant who's always been fast serviced and customer friendly take such a dump. Blame it on the new crew, maybe the rush hour but I've been coming here for ages , when my wife said no lettuce they go and put it on anyways ! Lots of history here. Rowdy customers , slow employees , hope the food is fresh and not a sloppy mess, drive through was a nightmare, guess we will find out when we get home .

I'm basing this review under the assumption that everyone knows Taco Bell is a fast food chain.  With that said, it's not the best taco or burrito I've had, but it's good. I've always been a fan of theirs. The store is clean, the staff are professional, friendly, happy, accommodating, and hard working.  You can tell staff like their jobs and each other.  They also love dogs. The staff all make a fuss over my baby boy and talk to him through the drive through.  They're open late, it's fast, and cheap. I go here because the quality and service is consistent.  They always get my order right, too.

I just love this Taco Bell location. Today Frederick J took my drive thru order. And my drive thru experience was the best. How do you go from ordering food too tripping with the cashier like you guys are good friends? This was my experience today. So! I want to thank Frederick J for good hospitality and making sure my food was prepared right.
Service is always horrible, half the time rude. The food is bad even for a taco bell. AVOID

Went last night before closing. Missed SEVERAL items that we paid for. Called early this morning and was told to call back to speak with a manger at noon. I've been unable to reach anyone. The phones are not working. We spent $30 and didn't even get half our order.
I want my money back.

This Taco Bell was fast in the drive thru so I'll give it that. But my crunch wrap supreme was soggy and cold. And something tasted a little foul, or rotten. I threw it out and went to jack in the box!
Awesome! The food is so great I cannot believe it! Try the tacos!

Ya, this is a Taco Bell but it is one of the better ones I've been to. They don't simply give you a number but also your name then call it out when meal is up. Try using an obscure name or of a past President, it will make people look. 

The staff is always polite and the service is fast. Food is always served hot. Best of all the restaurant is always extremely clean. I've stopped here a few times after hanging with friends in Vancouver. Nice that is always open late. 

I'll admit it is a Taco Bell and basic Americana-Mexicana fast food but it is always a safe bet when you don't know the area. For the quality of Taco Bell food it is actually pretty good. Believe it or not, I have had some bad Taco Bell food before. Not all stores are created equal and this one happens to better than the rest.

I moved to this side of town, so this is my go-to taco bell. Friendly service and so far they havent screwed up my order, which is a bonus. I have to say, im impressed with the new quesolupa, both the breakfast and the regular one. I will suffer greatly in my late late years from eating here too much probably with clogged arteries and a triple by-pass

Just drove through tonight and was thinking about their consistency in good service.  I ordered Taco Supremes, but asked if they wouldn't mind wrapping them like burritos, so I wouldn't make a mess, eating and driving.  The attendant told me he needed to ask, then shortly returned to say they would do it for me.  He was very patient as I struggled through the rest of what I wanted and really made it a good experience.  

Over the years, I've often made runs to this location when I had a beef craving and, although the lines can run kind of long, it's always been worth the drive.  The Meximelt is still my favorite item on the menu, but I do enjoy the large variety.  I miss the Steak/Chicken bowl they used to have and wish they'd bring that back, but there's plenty left to take care of me.

Just be careful drinking one of those Freeze drinks. I drank too much, too fast and thought my heart was gonna stop!!!!  It took me several minutes before my core was restored to its natural temperature.  Forget brain freeze, my entire digestive system pretty much shut down.  Oh well, I guess I'm not a kid anymore, but what a way to go.  If you find me dead, with a smile on my face and lime-green lipstick (looking like the Joker's victims in the 1988 Batman movie), you know what I was drinking...

I wrote TB several months ago, that this location is the worst TB I have ever been to in 45 years of going to TB.  I assumed, after filling out their survey before, that someone would get the message, so I decided to try again.  I like TB tacos better than Del Taco, but I am going back to DT after today.  So, I went today and when they handed me the bag, I could tell by the lightness, it didn't' have much meat or cheese.  I opened it while at the window and confirmed how little filling there was in the tacos.  I yelled for the window person and honked three times and he finally happen to walk by and see me.  I complained and the manager stuck his head out, apologized, and the tacos were remade.  I left and when got home, they were still light on ingredients.  Same as the last time I went there, a few months ago, but this time there was about 1/2 teaspoon of cheese and even less meat.  The lettuce was stale and tasted unwashed and the tortillas were stale.  This continues to be the worst ever and even if you ask them to redo the order, it is still bad and nothing like your pictures or commercials.

Very rude to our kids and was talking in Spanish and the lady behind us wouldn't tell us what the manager was saying but told us we might want to go eat somewhere else because what he was saying wasn't nice. I'm sorry but you live in America so speak our language and just because I don't speak Spanish doesn't mean it's ok for you to cuss us out.
Standard after the bar grinds. Nothing special about this location, but nothing bad either, except that they run out of stuff a lot.

Been coming to this location for decades now but never had this bad of service. We didn't get our food until 30 minutes after we ordered. My son ended up with the wrong item and it took another 15 minutes to get it fixed. I'm usually pretty forgiving when it comes to this stuff because I expect it when going to a fast food joint but this has been a ridiculous experience.

Why would people be ashamed of reviewing a Taco Bell? Are you ashamed of Heaven? Do you not like complimenting nice people? Do you think awesome food perfected in test kitchens for decades is not worthy of your high standards? I will (and am) shout it from the rooftops that Taco Bell is fast-food Nirvana. Now with breakfast? Are you kidding me? The A.M. Crunchwrap is so good it's Biblical. Not only is the combination of sausage, egg, and hashbrowns perfectly coordinated with the ever-so-slightly spicy Taco Bell cheese, but it's neat as well in it's own snug and crumb-free edible packet. It is undoubtedly the perfect road food breakfast for neat freaks like me. My kids and I are eagerly awaiting the Waffle Taco. If I have one without them they may stab me.

Worst Taco Bell ever. This place doesn't deserve even one star. Giving a "0" for this place. Was waiting to place the order. They looked at me and ignored and continued to chat. After a long time they came to take the order. After that again was waiting for along time. They were loudly laughing and chatting. One girl was constantly on the phone chatting. Since it was getting late I asked the girl why it's getting late? She got angry and raised her voice & said it is getting ready. When the food was done that girl brought the food and literally threw it on the counter. Will never ever go to this place. Save your dignity. I wonder why they keep such people for work.

From a food standpoint, it's fast food. It's hard to screw that up too badly (although it does happen).

Really, reviews of fast food places are more towards the service (which can change from week to week) and cleanliness of the establishment.

I will stop in here when gaming at Karliquin's just down the street. Most of the time, the service is very poor. It seems to take several minutes to process a few tacos or put a couple of pieces of chicken in a box, even when I'm the only guy at the counter.

In the summer, there does seem to be a few extra flies imported specifically for the increased ambiance. What would a fast food place be without flies?

In general, the food is acceptable. When I want a couple of tacos and a burrito or a few pieces of chicken strips, the meal is fine. Having to wait several minutes for such food defeats the whole idea of "fast" food.
Great Tbell! Amazing drunk food. Got the order right, quick and easy.  Would definitely recommend to those in need of "Mexican" food in the area. Would definitely go again.
Nice staff and fresh, made-to-order food.  What more can you ask for?  It's a typical Taco Bell and it appears to be clean.  Gotta love Taco Bell!  Nice people.

Wow can't imagine there so many people complaining about this Taco Bell. I am from nyc and know a thing about fast food honestly this was the best Taco Bell I've been to. The employee at the drive thri was the nicest and the quickest I've ever experienced. She had my order ready in literally 2mins. 

I came here multiple times and each time I had no complains love this place

I have been to a plenty of drive- thru restaurants, even managed a few but what I experienced last night was THE WORST! I stopped by after reading the billboard outside the restaurant for the rolled ckn tacos. When I pulled up to the speaker the tacos were advertised in two more slots on the menu board. I ordered for my son then I ordered the Rolled ckn tacos the cashier informed me they stopped selling them a week prior,wait what? Then why was the POP still up in 3 different places? I was confused because I work in the food industry and when something is no longer being sold you remove the advertisements at least I thought. So I asked why there were still signs. This is when I hear a female voice chim in and say "we don't have it so so stop fucking asking for it" you pressed the wrong button honey on me and that headset! Why was I wrong for ordering an advertised item? I pulled around to speak to whoever was in charge and I got shift lead Micheal. I asked him wasn't it policy to wear a headset to monitor drive-thru he stated he had not been wearing one and was unaware of what his employee just said to me. After I notified him he gave me a weak ass oh I'm sorry. I figured it was not as serious to me as it was to him or the employees laughing in the background and asked for the number of his bosses boss because I'm sure if I was getting this treatment from him and the staff nobody who worked in the building would see an issue with an employee speaking to customers that way, he brings me the GM's name and number for the store  I asked for a corporate # he stated it was a franchise, go figure. So I asked for area director/supervisors # and he came back with it. Clearly trying to save this girls job because when I told him I wanted his bosses boss # that what I should have gotten to begin with.my visits here are always less than perfect but my kid likes it so I go. Being spoken to like that with my child in the car is completely unacceptable you guys are giving Taco Bell a bad look.

God I love trashy burritos.  And tacos.

I recently went to TB for the first time since I was in high school.  See I don't really stray from the usual TB menu; I order the same items that I ordered when I was 8 years old.  However they have apparently upgraded the menu dramatically - bacon club chalupas, encharitos, etc, I was astonished.  I ordered it all.  With extra fire sauce.

On my way out a large herd of humans traipsed in, one that fiercely resembled the abominable Beth Ditto (lead singer of The Gossip, and Portland resident) - so I did what anyone who values their life would do - I instinctively shit my pants in an effort to throw her off my scent.  

SHE LOOKED HUNGRY!  AND ANGRY!  :(

Anyway 2 hours later I remembered why I stopped going to TB.  I'll spare you the details.
Got out of my car and saw a huge rat running from the AutoZone next door to taco bell and disappeared. I did an about face and left. Stay away.

THIS particular Taco Bell seems to be on the sketchy side.  Be it the 1990's decor, semi-cleaned tables or the feeling you could be shot at any moment...something just makes you feel a little uneasy.

But all those minor details aside, I absolutely adore Taco Bell!  The oozing goodness is heaven; be it a yummy chicken Quesdilla or a sassy Bean Burrito.  I just can't get enough!  I would totally bathe in this stuff if they would let me.

Ok, maybe that's a little much.  But Taco Bell is something we all grew up on and it would be hard to live without!
Ordered a chicken quesadilla box and 2 cheesy gordita crunches. Apparently cheesy gordita crunch reads as "regular taco" on the screen because that's what I got instead.
Went here the other day & got 5 tacos. Every one of the tacos had a little pinch of cheese. The prices went up & they're skimping on the amount of cheese? That isn't right.
The staff at this location are always so friendly and always get my order correct.  This is definitely one of my favorites locations!!

Consistently have to wait +30 mins in the drive through even when the inside is closed and only a car or two in line. Absolute worst location.


Oh and the food was cold right out the window.

So, I ventured out to Taco Bell to try their new Dorito taco. If if you don't like Doritos or tacos, you have to admit, the idea seems pretty brilliant. (By the way, if you don't like Doritos or tacos, then this is definitely not they type of place you should look for a meal at).  The potential to try something like a Dorito taco is what makes life worth living.

Anyway, the Dorito taco was an overall disappointment.  The flavor of the meat and other ingredients (even without taco sauce) totally over powered the subtle flavoe of the taco shell.  Basically, it was like eating a regular taco but I got orange powder on my hands.  Needless to say, I was quite bummed.

My overall evaluation from someone who has eaten too much Taco Bell his lifetime - this place just isn't that great.  Sure, if you are craving really cheap tacos, then this is the place to go.  And I like their quesadillas (highly underrated).  But I'd much rather go to Chipotle and spend a tiny bit more and get much better mexican-ish food.

I've been to many Taco Bell's, and this one is by far the worst. I am on vacation here in Orlando from California. I needed a snack after Disney World at 11 o'clock at night and this was the only place open that wasn't nearly packed. 

I ordered 2 Gordita crunches and a bean and cheese burrito to go. I got my food super fast. When I got back to my hotel, I was in pure disappointment. I got my Gordita crunch, but with no crunch! It was missing the taco shell. They just gave me a soft taco. Then my burrito was horrendous. It really seemed like they made a joke out of it. It was covered in just some sort of nacho cheese and they barely put any beans in it. Usually the bean and cheese burritos come with lots of beans. So disgusting. It was obvious the "cooks" are just there for the pay check. 

Don't come here if you want your order terribly wrong!
Love how clean this place is. Every time I come in the food prep area is spotless; this lets me know the food I get will be clean.

Our experience with this Taco Bell in their first few months was fine. This month, it has gone to hell. The last few times we got our orders with missing ingredients. The food is messy in the wrapping paper. One time our wait was 40 minutes (for a drive through). Today it was 20 minutes. I get that the staff is new, but whoever runs this place shouldn't have all the new people in training working the same shift.
mmmm/ yo quiero taco bell
This is the third time visiting and it's the same story. I'm #5 in the drive thru and currently at 20 minutes. It's so slow! The employees are nice which helps.

I wouldn't even give it a start. They already take long to take your order. You'd think they would be like. Sorry for the wait. I still even ask how he is doing and the rude ass employee didn't even reply just rushed me. Then I asked what drinks they had cause I couldn't see them on the menu. Asshole just said Pepsi products. When I got rude with him that's when he was like oh. Dude. Don't like your job. Quit. Don't be rude to people who making it possible for you to have a check. Place sucks.

Generally I avoid writing negative reviews but this place is a joke. For background, I worked at a mall Taco Bell for 2 1/2 years as a teenager. We were busy as hell all the time, especially during the holidays. Even then we never had a turn around time of more than 10 minutes and when we had orders heading up towards the 10 minute mark we addressed it with training and later firing if the employee couldn't carry their wait. This place clearly needs to revisit their approach on how to run a fast food franchise. 

Obviously, I understand that the place is new and is staffed with mainly trainees. At some point however, the excuse becomes just that- an excuse. It's been several weeks since this place opened and so far we've had four bad experiences:

- I waited in line for 15 minutes before someone came outside to tell me and the others in line that the refrigerator broke and they had to close. Fine, beyond your control. I get that totally. Why did it take 15 minutes to notify waiting customers?

- My wife and I waiting for 45 minutes in the drive through, stuck between two cars and unable to leave, waiting for our massive order of 3 whole items. 

- Received our food in a reasonable time. Unfortunately there was no beef or sour cream on my wife's burrito and the side of guacamole we ordered was missing as well. 

- Just today we waited for 20 minutes for two items with one other person ahead of us. My chicken quesarito had the wrong chicken on it and my cheesy gordita crunch didn't have any baja sauce or shredded cheddar cheese. It's not hard: gordita shell with three cheese. Put in steamer until it beeps so the cheese is melted. Place hard taco with beef inside on top of melted cheese. Fold gordita around hard taco. Baja sauce on the beef. Lettuce. Cheddar cheese. Wrap. Put in bag. Walk away feeling competent enough to make a taco.

In summary, how hard is it to make a taco? Answer- it's not. Source: I've done it.

--side note: staff is very friendly. Management needs to step their training game up. 

Tl;dr: avoid this place unless you enjoy long waits and incorrect orders.

My friend and I pulled into the drive thru and waited around two minutes for anyone to come to the intercom. Finally got someone to take our order and the person was very curt. After finishing our order, we wait in the line for over twenty(!!!) minutes, finally get to the window and still no acknowledgement that we are there. Finally the person cracks the window and we ask if we can speak to her manager, she then slams the window and storms away. The manger comes and doesn't apologize for us having to wait, we tell him we had been sitting there for fifteen minutes (that's what we thought at the time) and he tells us that it was closer to 23 minutes (okay...?!). He said they were short-staffed (which I understand completely, but this is Taco Bell, not a sit down restaurant). We say there's no reason it should take as long as it did, so he all but threw our bags at us, with no apology to the inconvenience or the attitude of his employee. Then we say we have drinks, which are then handed to us. No straws or napkins either... Ask for straws but don't get anything else. Window is slammed in our face and the attendant storms away. Absolutely ridiculous service, regardless of being "under-staffed" or not. Probably won't come back to that location anymore. Management and other employees need to get their stuff together and get better attitudes when dealing with people.

**Credit where credits due: went after the original review and there was a manager directing employees on what to do. Everyone was wearing proper uniforms and looked organized. The wait was just a bit longer than what it should be but has improved by far. The food was properly made and nothing was missing. Keep it up!

--side note: staff is very friendly. Management needs to step their training game up. 

Tl;dr: avoid this place unless you enjoy long waits and incorrect orders.
This place is so much better than the TB on Murray.  The food tastes fresh and actually has flavor.  For fast food this place is pretty darn good.
They provided fast & friendly service! I was in a hurry to get a quick meal home to my family and it was perfect! A happy family makes a happy mom. Thanks TB
My least favorite place to eat at no matter what. It's like everyone there is miserable. Some of the workers there are trashy and rude. The foods not worth it. Thumbs down taco Bell. Thumbs down.

This place definitely needs some love, especially for their workers who stay early in the morning to feed hungry/tipsy college kids ie. me. Props to the drive thru cashier who took my car's order and succeeded in taking our 5 orders with only a sigh. The food is quick, as should be with any fast food joint, despite 3 other cars being in front of us. Maybe I was overly excited, maybe it was because it has been a while, but this taco bell was the first i've had in YEARS. No trips to the bathroom, no tummy aches, and yummyy doritos tacos. A SOLID 4 FOR YOU TACO BELL.

I'm not one to Yelp for the fear of retribution but I have to say something. Yeah, I know it's taco bell, so you get what you pay for. However, I paid for many things I did not receive. Not only that, but the service given was so poor! I had to repeat simple requests multiple times and STILL didn't get what I ordered. As a customer service representative I'm really disappointed. The employees were very nice but didn't seem to care about my order... I will not be returning to this location.

If I could give this 0 stars I would.. 
I mean, I love me some taco hell... fast, cheap, consistent. 
This taco taco bell is the absolute WORST!! 
So fucking slow. We've been there 3 times, 
First time: Mexican pizza was the worst. Nothing else was made how it is usually made. 
Second/third time: waited in drive thru line for over 10 minutes! 
Also, the employees there are extremely rude. 
We will never be returning to this location, which sucks bc it's right by our place.
This Taco Bell/KFC was horrible, they are not very busy and we are having to wait on our food. They are nor getting in a hurry for No one. Worsted Taco Bell/KFC in Boulder

Taco Bell is my guilty pleasure when it comes to fast food. The food is so addicting and you can always substitute the meat for beans. :) I have several friends who are vegetarians who love them so Taco Bell. 

Usually most Taco Bells you have good service but this one was alright. It took a very long time to get our food. They seemed really short staffed that day. The girl who took our order seemed extremely bored and just over the job. There were several messy tables and the drink area was a mess. It wasn't until a large group came in, did she walk around to clean the tables. 

Otherwise the food was the usual but the service lacked.

So disappointed! First the chips and cheese nachos were completely spilled everywhere in the bag. The worst part was the cheese cups were. 1/4 full. No joke.  25% full. Next the crunchwrap was mostly shell. No filling at all. I usual stop at the Johnson Creek location, and will definitely not be stopping here at Powell again. The worst T bell in quite awhile.

This Taco Bell has to be the worst one I've eaten at because they've screwed up both orders we've gotten within 3 days. I asked for a vegetarian salad and they put chicken in it. And my sister ordered a chicken burrito that had beef in it.

This place is probably one of the most inefficient places around. They always seem to have a ton of employees yet the food takes FOREVER both inside and through the drive thru. On top of that, more often than not, the order is missing something, is made very sloppy, or is cold/stale.  I also witnessed an employee take out the trash with rubber gloves on and then use the same gloves to try to serve food. When the another customer called him out on it, he seemed to think it was absurd that he wouldn't want that food.

You have to know what you're going for.  I am not comparing this against other local places - just against other Taco Bells.

This is one of my grab and go / satisfy the grumble belly places.  

The problem is when you order a bean burrito fresco and they skimp on the fresco.  I know it will never look like the photo on the ordering board, but please - more than a tablespoon of tomatoes please.

Been there a ton recently, and 8/10 times I immediately regret choosing this location. It doesn't matter what time it is or how many cars are in the line, be prepared to sit for a solid 5-10 minutes JUST TO ORDER and then another 5-10 to get your food **and that's on their good days**

One horror story from this location: it's 12am, I'm out on my weekly cruise and start feeling hungry, being in the area, I pull into the TB. I see the line of cars, stacked about 8 deep. As soon as I pull in, another car pulls in behind me. FML. Now I'm trapped. It took half an hour for me to move the equivalent of 4 car lengths, barely making it to the ordering box, having to hang out of the window just to order. It then took another 20 minutes for me to even reach the window, where it took another 10 for my food to come out. While I sat there, I observed the employees just having a grand ol time, not at all caring that they've wasted an hour of people's lives. I ordered 3 loaded grillers...I know those are prepped before hand. There's no way any of the items people in front of me ordered should've taken that long to be prepared.

Management needs to step their damn game up.

Ok location, used to come here late nights when I lived in the area and service used to be pretty good. Kind of slow service today though for mid afternoon. Perhaps it was less than ideal staffing situation, will try it again sometime. The food was good, grillers are $1 between 4-5 PM.
Cool Ranch Dorrito Taco... it was Ok. Tasted just like any Taco Bell taco in my opinion. The location is Ok, half the tables were clean. Pretty much what you would expect.

Omg, walked in and two young ladies at the front where just talking another comes up calls front end. Tries to get our order when the correct girl comes up. Oooooookay. Order given . Go look for tables. Floor is stcky full of old dried up soda. Condiment stand is filthy. Soda dispenser filthy. Cup covers are on the counter in the front not to sanitary! Tables are disgusting! Girl comes around I think she is going to clean up ,nope. She ia looking for trays. I frequent drive thru mostly but I know one thing Ill NEVER sit in hete again!!!!!!!!!!

Awful customer service! Both the drive thru and walk in extremly slow. I have had numerous bad experiences there, they burned my burrito and gave me cold and hard refried potatoes. I asked for my burrito fresco (no dairy), and they put cheese in it. Additionally, I walked in one time, and was ignored for 5 minutes straight. Taco Bell better really do something about the workers at this location, is is absolutely despicable. I will never eat at this Taco Bell again.
A little dissapointed ordered a taco meal and one of my tacos had no meat at all, it was all lettuce n cheese.

Pretty bad when the kitchen is blasting music with all the swear words- S, F, N... had my 7 year old kid with me.

I mean, I actually liked the music, but it didn't really seem appropriate to the situation. Or for my kid.
Pulled into the drive thru at 7:01 and was told they won't be open for 10 minutes. If you don't open until 7:11, you shouldn't state you open at 7. Poor. No customer service. They don't care.

Save your money and go to another Taco Bell. This was my 3rd attempt with this establishment and the workers are always rude and when you confront them about being rude, they apologize and give a sorry excuse of how 'we just need to rush so you don't stay on the order screen too long.' Wait wtf is that suppose to mean? What kind of customer service is that? The food is either cold or hard or just both. I'm pretty sure my refried beans aren't suppose to look like play dough and my Gordita shell isn't suppose to look black. Shut this place down already!
I've never had a wait longer than maybe 3 mins here? Always fast service. Perfect for when you're having junk food cravings at midnight.

Run!!! This is the WORST Taco Bell I have been to in my life!!!!! If I could put no stars here I would! The people in the drive-through are the rudist people that I have ever run into. They could care less whether you wait or get your food. I asked for hot sauce and it was like I was asking for a million dollars. I asked for 6 hot sauces and she gave me one!!! I asked for more and she gave me one at a time with a nasty look. I will never go back to this place and I would highly recommend that you choose another place to grab something quick! Worst Taco Bell in the country!!!!!!

Homie at the register needs to snap out of it or he gonna lose his shitty job... why would anyone have him work the register??? He literally seems like the worst person to work that thing.. he just  slow at it, he couldnt even have one of the EIGHT other buddies to get my damn drink that they forgot to give me at the drive thru while he took an old man an 3 other girls orders
How can it take 20 minutes for 3 cars to get food?  This is the slowest Taco Bell ever.
Service is always good and food quality is what you pay for.  Shit, unless you have bad sense of food taste ADAM GRUDZIEN

As a vegetarian who occasionally has to grab some fast food cheaply and quickly...I must say that Taco Bell is often my easiest option.  Out of the other locations in the general area, this particular location is consistently good.  I haven't had to return any food or put up with any hassles like I've had to do at the Northlake location.  The place has a really high cleanliness score from the county (mid 90's I believe) and the staff seems capable and friendly.  For a Taco Bell, this location is the best I have ever experienced.

This is sub par Taco Bell I have yet to get an accurate order and they move SO SLOW. I go through the drive through to get my food and get home quick not to wait upwards of 15 minutes for my food. Beyond this it's your standard taco bell but don't go inside its filthy.

It seems the they only have one employee working.  Taking orders making food and checking you out.   Slowest fast food ever.  
Time to find a new place to eat.
Not only did I have to wait 45 minutes for my food when there is two cars in front of me. But they get my order wrong and they are so rude! Go to another location this one sucks!
Worst service ever literally only ordered 3 bean burritos and it was not busy , took them 10 minuets to get our food

I never thought I'd review a Taco Bell on Yelp, but I just had the best interaction with a drive-thru cashier I have ever had at a drive-thru!

It has probably been years since I last ate at a TBell and I am not sure what brought me to this one other than proximity and starvation. But, since I had not been to a TBell in forever, this kind young soul on the other side of the speaker took the time and had the patience to answer all my questions about the $5 box and made sure that none of my items had lettuce. 

He was also so light-hearted and when my drink that I requested w/no ice came in a cup w/ice, he kindly remade it! 

So, while the food was still not great, I can't complain because you get what you pay for (though, seriously for someone on a TIGHT budget, all the food you get in the $5 box is INSANE!), but after a long, hard day of OT on the wknd, it was refreshing to be greeted w/a laugh and a smile, especially by such a young guy. 

So, kudos, TBell young gentleman! You made me my inner-struggle about consuming TBell, less fraught w/angst...thank you for being exceptional!

I'll keep it real with you, I had taco bell for breakfast..with a mountain dew. Because that's how I roll. 

I come here a few times a week. Did you know the fresco taco only have 130 calories? Plus they're only 99 cents, I eat them relentlessly. When I go through the drive through I am normally out before I have finished listening too even one song. Yes that implies my food was pre-made and waiting patiently for me under a head lamp but for 99cents I could care less. 

Between the moderately low caloric intake for a taco, light speed gratification, and low prices Taco Bell has become my BFF.

Every time I go here my order is wrong, just left there like 20 mins ago with a 2 chalupa combo and got all hard shell tacos and Luke warm,I should have checked my bad, but damn I didn't think I should have to. Would have called to tell them they messed up but didn't see any good, the franchise should check on this place because it's ultra trash

The convenience of their "authentic" tacos is something. Sure its fair on the wallet and you get your food quick, but remember no one goes to Taco Bell for actual Mexican food. Just another fast food option. The people were cool though.

Seems kind of silly to write a review for Taco Bell, but this location is always a bit disappointing. If you don't wait in the drive thru for 20+ minutes, then you wait inside for the same amount of time. This last time, I got my food and the salad (yes I get the salad at Taco Bell) has black beans in it and the beans were crunchy and way over cooked. My Crunchwrap had a gaping hole where the lettuce and other insides was about to fall out so I asked for a new one (I've never seen my Crunchwrap that unwrapped before...). The cook seemed annoyed but the cashier was nice about it. I wish I took back my salad too, but I didn't want to be that girl (or get my food spit in).

Normally this location always puts tomatoes on my "no tomato" order, but surprisingly they didn't this time!
I also went during dinner hour so it was busy. 

All in all, I'd go to Los Gorditos across the street or even the one down the street next time.

One of the reasons I occasionally visit Taco Bell, is because they have vegetarian options, and they also have Diet Pepsi, which l like better than Diet Coke, Which l won't get into why at this point, but l never used to eat at Taco Bell, and then l discovered their cheese quesadilla and pintos & cheese...however, it seems that I need to just give up my expedited Mexican efforts, because l can NEVER place an order that is EVER correctly fulfilled.  Either l get a quesadilla with uncooked, raw cheese, or a cheese quesadilla that should have light sauce, but ends up with sauce for days...OR l ask for a cheese quesadilla and end up with chopped up chicken that l can't even pick off and eat around, as a vegetarian...not that l even want to compromise my diet that way, but I've just gotten tired of spending money to throw food away, after looking through the bag and finding out that my order is wrong and/or inedible.  I wish Taco Bell could get it together!  Anyway...what should I really expect from this caliber of restaurant?  Ugh.

Came here to kill time while we waited for our movies. When we came in there was an employee clean the tables but once we walked in he took our orders. I believe his name was Shawn. Shawn was very helpful when my husband asked about the naked chicken.  He recommend it or at least try it. Which we did and I have to say it was good but a tad spicy.

Oh no.... You gave me everything I ordered but guess what it's cold very cold as in a refrigerator befor you.gave it to me cold. Yes I ordered a hot item an xxl chicken burrito, ugg disappointed... I'll give you one more chance then I'm moving on...
Employees would rather be on the cell phone than to wait on customers. Never again. Will call district manager
If you have a small order it will literally take longer to receive it that it takes to eat. Expect 10-15 minutes on a good day.

Waited twelve minutes in line, for the order, two cars ahead, to get her two 10-taco bulk boxes. All the while, the cashier is joking and laughing with her, the entire time.
(There's no extra lane to escape if you're in line. You're literally trapped.)

After I pull up, for my Fresco burrito supreme and ice water, the closest to an apology for the inconvenience I received was verbatim: "Hi. Sauce? No? Kay, here ya go. Have a nice day."

They still couldn't even make the burrito Fresco style, and instead gave me a normal one, along with making me late for work.
This Taco Bell is a freaking nightmare.
I get closing your line and wanting to go home. I've worked food. But when I come 20 til close and you tell me you're closed, that sucks.

Impressed with the speed and accuracy of this location. I usually wait at least 15 minutes in the drive they at any other Taco Bell. Nice staff, I'm actually shocked, too bad I don't live in the area because the one near my house is super slow.
Great costumer service! Clean restaurant the new fries are deli and the regular crunchy tacos are always delicious. The cashier William H was awesome great costumer service!

I am a frequent visitor to this Taco Bell since I only live a short drive away. I use the drive-thru for most of my trips and I have nothing but good things to say about this place

Service is fast (I mean REALLY fast) and very friendly. They are always upbeat and ask you how your day is going and what kind of sauces you like. Food always tastes fresh and delicious. 

If you eat-in, there is a very spacious parking lot that they share with the auto shop next door so you will always find a spot to park.

closest taco bell to my house and I cant tell you how many times ive been here. pretty good taco bell, never have to wait too long. to all the people complaining about every little thing: ITS TACO BELL. its a fast food restaurant and youre paying next to NOTHING for this food. get over it.
overall, its a decent taco bell, ive been to a lot worse.

Are you kidding me? I have been sitting in the drive thru for over 20 minutes. At least 5 sitting at the speaker waiting for someone to acknowledge me. What a joke. Get up to the window and they haven't even started my food.  Who manages this place?

I have now been stuck in the drive-through for over 30 minutes three times at this location. And there's no way to get out of line if, say, you're on your lunch and the computer goes down. If there's someone in front of you and someone behind you you just have to wait for them to get the problem fixed.

I know it's just Taco Bell so it's pretty sad to complain, but ever since the 'remodel' it's been pretty bad. Multiple times I've been in the drive thru for 30 minutes waiting on food. Almost every time the order is messed up. Also last couple times I've gotten a crunch wrap there was literally two little chunks of meat in there and that's it. I'll definitely drive a couple miles further to the other one from now on.

they're supposed to open at 7am, today they waited until 7:10 (with multiple cars in line) to finally tell us they weren't taking orders because there were boxes in the way (???). thanks to the 10 minute delay I was both late for work and will be going without breakfast and lunch today (usually order 2 items)

if you're going to offer breakfast, you need to be reliable. people have jobs to get to :-/

won't be going back, can't afford to risk missing meals like this again

My boyfriend had ordered me three burritos and cheese tacos and I found a strand of hair on one and a piece of fuzz on another one. He then tries to call them twice to get a refund nobody answered. Waste of money this place.

Late-night post outing drive thru. We ordered SOOOO much food for a car-load of partied-out girls for only $20! We got our complicated order fast and of course checked it... to find we were missing a Mexican pizza. No problem, whizzed around the drive thru again weeeee and got it from the window. Plus an empanada! Ravaged our items at our apartment together soon after-- it was just what we needed to finish a night out. We'll be back soon for another "midnight" snack.
This is the best Taco Bell ever! Just the right amount of hot sauce! They never mess up the order and are 100% accuracy and quality! Love it!

The prices are unbeatable. Plenty of research has gone into making craveable products. Taco Bell wins in the taste-for-price category. We're not talking top notch quality ingredients but considering what you get for the price, nobody could match that shopping and preparing food for themselves. A good excuse to not make your own food. I have not had a problem with an order being confused, then again I only get walk in and not drive through service. Which brings me to the downside and that is walk in service should be 24 hours too, they don't need to keep the tables open, just the counter.

I have worked customer service, including food, for most of my life.  I always loved this taco bell.  Usually the order was right, if there was a problem, they had my back.  Until Will.  Will argued with me about my order being wrong, about food service being different than customer service and hung up on me.  Upon attempting to follow up and talk to his manager , I called on a later date to ask who the open manager would be, only to be asked twice who I was and then told I couldn't have that information.  I did schedule to sit down with Chris.  However, a family emergency took me out of town.  And honestly, its too little too late at this point.  
Oh, and insult to injury? If our order would have been right from the beginning, we would have spent 12 bucks less.  Yeah, when we went in to get replacement food for what was messed up, Will proceeded to charge my fiance for some of the items that should have been free.  He also took our original receipt and did a reprint of the new reciept so that we couldn't fill out the survey.  Luckily, I took a photo of the original, but my guess is, when I go to do it, it will have already been done, probably by Will.

Ever time I get take out from this location and I request no sour cream and no sauce, there is sour cream and sauce.  They absolutely never get our order correct.  If we order 6 tacos, we get home and there are 3 tacos.  There was sauce on my beef fajita soft taco tonight, of course, and it made the entire thing so slimy that none of the 4 people in our group would eat it.

We have even started going in to order because they cannot get it right and that does not make a difference.  They still cannot get it right.

This is probably one of the nicer taco bells I have been to.  It is usually preety clean, the servers are nice, my food comes out fast and they have baja mountain dew.  I can't comment on drive thru since I never use it, but if I need a taco bell fix I come to this one.
This Taco Bell is no more. Closed from what I see. No TB signs on the building.
Horrible food. Someone though fast food couldn't be worst!?, think again. Horrible customer service and the food is always wrong.

SInce my last review 2 years ago the service here has definitely turned around. The drive thru is where I normally pick up food from when I visit and the speed of service is fantastic and the customer service is great. My food is always fresh and delicious. 

Today's visit not only was the drive thru employee very welcoming but one of the other employee that was expediting jumped in and asissted by making sure if I wanted any sauce for my order and then handing it out while the other employee answered the drive thru. 

This is why I keep coming back... Well, this and the tacos.

Happy Dining!!
Extremely slow. 15 min for drive thru. I would of left 5 mins in but was trapped by curbing.

Disappointed... I knew that the cantina burrito had more stuff in it and is the second time in this store that they gave me nothing but lettuce and stake... And the customer service was very poor cashier on drive thru was on the phone all the time

Man, worst Taco Bell I've been to and I've lived all over the country. First I asked for the burrito that has onions- they said burrito supreme so I asked for 2, one beef and one chicken. Neither had onions or sour cream, and they were both chicken! It was torcher trying to order to begin with, but I was ok with that because maybe she was new, should have known smh. It is also the only Taco Bell that doesn't give military discount. Smh

I arrived at 2:11 am the close at 3am instead of taking my order they wanna close down early I'm sooooooo pissed like should've  ent to school n u wouldn't have to work at a place u don't want to till 3 Am tf

This is absolutely the worst Taco Bell I have ever had the displeasure of visiting. It actually might be the worst food place I have ever been to. I'm pretty sure that to work here you have to fail an iq test as a preemployment condition. Every time I have gone in here they have been incredibly slow and seem like they just can't be bothered. Last night my fiancé went in to pick up some nacho sauce (odd request I know but it really is just the best) so after standing at the counter for around 5 minutes watching the guy who was working throw a tantrum about having to remake a sauce side because he messed it up in the first place someone finally came to the counter. The girl was rude and after looking at the computer for all of 5 seconds tells him they are out of nacho cheese... after he just watched someone make a side. He had just worked 9 hours straight and was exhausted so he came home defeated and told me what happened. At this point I have had enough with their horrendous customer service and refusal to not be assholes that I went back down there. Waited 10 minutes before the rudest man I have ever met stomps up to the counter grumbles three words and guess what they have plenty of cheese! Yeah I get that it's just freaking cheese but to just blatantly lie because you can't be bothered to do your job is just ridiculous. I will absolutely not be going back to this location, I would rather drive the extra 5 minutes to the one by Home Depot where they seem to employ intelligent life forms. Oh and the guy completely shorted me on my change
So slow and never get our order correct. I was so excited for a Taco Bell close by but now I refuse to go here,. I'll drive down to the hwy99 one or LO if I really want it.
Second time I went there and food literally thrown in bag without wrappers. Under cooked food. Employees laughing about it. Awful
Slowest Taco Bell ever...the food was normal TB.  But at 10:40 on a Saturday night, I shouldn't be in the drive thru for literally 23 minutes.
About what you'd expect from a Taco Bell. Sub par food that looks even worse than it feels.
Stood at the front for 4 minutes without anyone helping me, what kind of fast food establishment is this

I should know that any decision that starts with "Hey, let's go to Taco Bell" is going to be a bad one.
Storytime!

9:30 (ish) on a Tuesday night, we stop here after an event, and all seems well at the drive-thru upon arrival (no long lines, lights are on, etc.), so we pulled up, ordered from the talking screen and then pulled around behind the car at the window.

Then we sat.

And we sat.

And after ten minutes, I turned off my engine.

And we sat some more.

And as time dragged on and on, one, two, three... six more cars piled up behind us. Unfortunately, this drive-thru offered no escape- there was a curb immediately next to the cars, then bollards and then a grassy hill... so we were doomed to wait either until food was delivered or the car in front of us gave up and left, allowing us an escape route. 

The car in front of us did nothing of the sort.

FINALLY, twenty minutes later, the window opens and the glorious brown bag of junk food was delivered to the customers ahead of us.

I started the car, pulled up to the window, and was greeted with "That'll be $7.20, cash only, our card ain't workin'." And no apologies.

Well no wonder it took so long the first time, the guys in front of me probably had to run across the street to the ATM before they could pay for their meal. UGH.

Never again, Taco Bell. Never again. (We'll see how long this rings true, though)

The bf and I very rarely eat out, including fast food so before we went to the grocery store on an empty stomach we decided to treat ourselves to some tasty taco bell. I ALWAYS get the chicken taquitos, he ALWAYS gets the cheesy bean and rice burrito. They apparently don't make either of those anymore... I about had heart failure. Then the guy told me "well we have the stuff to make it, I'll just ring a few items up, and hey it'll even be cheaper." We got a few other things and surprisingly they got EVERY item right, which is unheard of at any taco bell. I appreciated them making an effort to make our grumbling tummies happy.

This location is the absolute worst. Me and my family tried picking up food after a long day of work and the girl taking our order was not focused, was joking around, and was talking to other people while trying to take our order. She asked us to repeat things numerous times. It was so bad that I told her to just forget it because I was concerned about my food preparation. Waste of time, don't go here!

Love the Bell, but they really dropped the ball today. Came through on a Friday evening to kick off a great weekend and was met with disappointment. They had a huge sign advertising a new Strawberry Popping Candy Freeze. I thought I would give it a try, it was Friday after all! They told me they were out of that. I was bummed. Maybe they should take down the giant sign by the drive thru if they didn't want to crush people's hopes like that. I figured I would settle for a classic, the good old Baja Blast. I get to the window to pay and she destroys my taste buds again by telling me they are also out of Baja Blast! So sad. The crunch wrap was excellent as usual but the drink options really were lacking.

I eat burritos from this restaurant. I've never been inside although it looks nice from the outside. The drive thru menu is backlit. The bean burrito came wrapped in crinkly paper. The tortillas are tough. They sell Pepsi products here.

I just visited a Taco Bell in Vancouver Wa and it has the worst management. Everything is dirty, garbage cans are full, bathroom is a mess! They were out if napkins and really low on sauces. The door handle to the restaurant was broken and no note was on the door entrance, anyone can cut themselves! Terrible, just shocking terrible! I'm surprised that it even some how is open!
Expectations were low but I was high. The the DriveThru is open till 3am for a late night treat. Taco Bell, not the best restaurant to hangout with but he's always around.

The WORST Taco Bell I have EVER been too. Every time I've been there they take forever. This last time it took just over 25 minutes in the drive thru. Then the staff was extremely rude. AND they gave me the wrong items!

Why the hell am i reviewing a Taco Bell? Because this location is THAT on point. 

I order some mixed up stuff and i can honestly say i only remember 1 thing wrong in hundreds of trips. This TB inspires that "i don't even need to check this bag" type of confidence. 

On top of that the entire staff is polite, prompt, and thorough. Whoever is managing this location deserves to become a national trainer for TB, but i hope they don't because i want my TB to remain top notch!
Fast service and descent food. Service is pretty good here as well. Went through the drive thru and it was very fast

came about 2 am and had someone greet us immediately after we pulled into the drive thru. Jacob was very friendly and gave us speedy service for me and my boyfriends late night cravings! very impressed and satisfied

This is weirdly the best Taco Bell. I live three blocks away, so I kinda end up here a lot, at all different hours of the day, and no matter what everything is always hot, fresh, crispy and crunchy and everything else it's supposed to be. I mean, yeah it's fast food, but I've been to a lot of Taco Bells and I am always disappointed whenever I go to any but this one. No clue why. Might be good management, or they're just not lazy or something, but I just don't even bother with any other Taco Bell anymore. Admittedly yeah, they've forgotten an Empanada here and there, but they always fix the problem right away, make it right, you know. If you're craving Taco Bell at 2 AM, just make the right choice and go to this one. The other ones are disappointing.

Arrived at the drive through at 8:50 PM on a Saturday night (tonight). Waited about 2 mins before anyone greeted me and they told me they would be right with me.  3 more cars drove up behind me and waited. The order taker never came back on, and all 3 cars behind me turned around and left. After 15 minutes of waiting, I finally said "Hello", and the order taker proceeded to act like nothing was wrong. He kept adding cinnamon twists to my order which I was not asking for, and it took him 3 tries and several questions for him to get my order right.

I drove up to the window and the order taker didn't open the window for a few mins, and by this time I was upset and asked for the Manager. Manager "Alex" came to the window and I told him what happened with waiting for 15 mins and them losing 3 other customers behind me. He made a lame excuse about "oh yeah, we just figured that out", and I proceeded to tell him how bad the service was. There was no apology, no offer to refund me for my meal, and he just walked away. I waited an additional 15 minutes for my food and the order taker handed it through the window. I asked where my drink was, and he acted like I didn't order one.....I said I ordered a COMBO which comes with the drink. He gave me my drink and I asked for my receipt. He went and got the Manager "Alex" who proceeded to refuse to give me a receipt for my purchase. He stated that "sometimes it just doesn't come out of the machine". After demanding for him to reprint it, He said it was "gone".

In addition to the HORRIFIC service that I received here, there was no offer for a refund for me to go elsewhere, there was barely an apology, there was no offer of hot sauce or napkins, there were two items in the bag that I didn't order, the taco shells were broken, and all of the food was cold. Crossing this place off my list of places that I will EVER visit again.....in fact, since most of the other Taco Bells can't get the food or service right either, I will just not visit this chain ever again.

Seriously, fix this poor lost new location!! I feel so sorry for this locations staff, they need leadership and better staffing, they are not getting the support they need to give a reliable experience to customers.  I keep going there cause i am rooting them on, but its a bit painful. Its like they have no one who ever worked in a fast food place before, you would think they should

went last night to this location only after having worked all day and got out of school late to even cook something  at home, so i figured Hey why not taco bell. First i waited 20 mins in a drive thru line... than i placed my order and repeated it numerous times and they still messed it up.. i asked for xtra jalapeno on my quesadillas got charged but NO jalapeno sauce at ALL on my food, that's the only reason i eat at taco bell is for that AMAZING SAUCE.. i also asked for NO lettuce on my taco and they put lettuce.. are you kidding me??? the drive thru lady looked at little slow, didn't even greet me when i pulled up simply put her hand out the window for my card, The F*ck?? REAL CLASSY ladyy and you want 15an hr?? if they make that much im BOYCOTTING them.. Dont mess with me when im hungry.

Shredded Chicken Mini Quesadilla...apparently it doesn't actually contain chicken, but don't worry, they'll double up on the mystery cheese/spittle sauce and the lovely woman with the sweet neck tat will shoot you death stares if you ask for taco sauce.
The one day in the year I crave manufactured food and they're closed.  Really, Taco Bell observes Easter?
So so slow The employees move in slow motion terrible service  no brew teas the napkin dispenser at soda machine empty tacos shells stale
Tried to go through at 3am. Google said open until 4 am. Cashier told us they were closed after we waited in line for 25 minutes. So disappointing!

I had the best experience in the drive thru! I waited a while, it was 9 pm and busy but when the guy came on the speaker to take my order it was the friendliest sing song voice I had ever heard! He was kind and enthusiastic and very polite. When I got to the window, I realized it was an older gentleman (I say older because you usually see younger adults and teens working the drive thru). I did not get his name, I wish I had. He greeted me at the window with"Hello, friend" and was just as great in person as he was on the speaker. He was a absolutely fabulous and made my whole night with his wonderful attitude. You don't see that great of an attitude much anymore and this guy definitely deserves some kudos!

My very first time at a Taco Bell - I was on a deadline and had to grab something, quick, at 1 AM because I forgot to eat and had a headache, and, well,  why not? Bean burrito with guacamole, was..not bad at all - although very...processed - bean and cheese paste, but it was all right. Of course, it doesn't compare to my cooking, or really anyone's cooking for that matter - and I'm sure its super-unhealthy, but a-ok.
Professional, Fast service, pretty good for a Taco Bell franchise
New great and improved exterior! However, I simply requested a cheese quesadilla and instead it was filled with (barely any cheese) and a lot of sauce substance that was hot. Didn't like it.
Worst Taco Bell in the area! Made me wait over 20 minutes for a Chicken Taco, never coming back!

This is a junky location...   That said, if lauren serves you, you will be a happy camper.  Five stars for lauren.  Crappy facility drops you three 
stars.

The last star lost is because my big box meal came in a bag.  I wanted my big box meal to come in a big box, maybe in a bag too.

My daughter applied for her first job at 49th and Powell. She made it through both interviews and the manager offered her the position and gave her the hours she would be working. the next 2 days were very difficult for her, as she had to convince her teachers and school to allow her to change her class schedules. She even pleaded with a fellow classmate to change classes with her. She even bought a new outfit because she was so excited about her new opportunity. They called her under an hour before her orientation and told her i'm sorry we can't hire any one right now! She was on her way there, who does that?!
I am so angry with them! This is unacceptable. Can you imagine how she felt after telling her whole family and all of her friends.
Their claim was that they will call her first. I am very disheartened too.
-Daryl
Very modern and cozy location.  Background classical music is an interesting choice,  considering it's a Taco Bell. I suppose it keeps rowdy kids from hanging out too long, or something.

Avoid this location outside of normal dining hours. I always get someone who is "still learning" how to do things when visiting outside of normal rush hours like lunch and dinner. Last time my tacos were wrapped in all the wrong wrappers, forcing us to open each one so we could figure out which taco and burrito was which. Another occasion I ordered several chicken burritos that were served with rice and chicken only, NO SAUCE OR CHEESE! I was really bummed when I got home and found that my burritos were missing the sauces that make them so darn tasty, grrrrr, On another occasion I went through the drive through with a car full of people. We carefully ordered in a clear voice, order was repeated back to us perfectly. When we got to the window the employee seemed confused. The car in line in front of us was pulling into a parking space due to their order being incorrect, thank goodness they double checked before they got home. We were then asked to repeat our entire order, at which point we realized this was not a place we wanted to eat (if they can't remember an order, can they remember to sanitize things, wash hands, etc?). To be fair, on busy days during normal lunch or dinner hours I have had great service and tasty food. But the crappy experiences during late night and evening visits has really turned me off from this location. Better to hit up the Taco Cabana down at Mopac and Parmer instead. Also, avoid the nearby Taco Bell on N Lamar at night unless you carry a concealed hand gun. No, I'm not exaggerating, gang bangers and low lifes often start fights in the parking lot for some dumb reason. It's worth noting that this location is usually clean and has an extra wide door to make wheelchair access easier. Staff has never been rude to me, but some members are inexperienced in food preparation it would seem.
I come here all the time.  Late at night mostly.  They never take long, haven't screwed up my order and everything tastes good

Fassssst Fooooood Revieewwwww

Taco Bell in Everett has some issues. Issues include mostly the interior and exterior need a major renovation. The outside is very run down, signage is old looking and dirty. The food sometimes is a toss up. However that's my experience with most fast food. All depends on the staff behind the line. As well as how busy they are. It qseems like you get better quality food here during high traffic times and I can only assume that's because the staff is forced to prepare product on a more constant basis. 

There are two reasons I patronize this location. 1.) it's very close to where I live so it's uber convenient. 2.) the staff at the drive thru.

I have never felt like the person at the drive thru was anything but cool, helpful and happy. Which is how it should be. Always receiving a smile, a how is your day going, what kinds of sauce would you like and have a wonderful day. Kudos to the drive thru folks.

DO NOT GO HERE! The happy hour drinks are a scam! The machine is broken 75% of the time! No joke! They lure people in to a looooong drive thru line with the promise of a delicious 1$ freeze and then, once one is trapped in line, they inform you the machine is broken. Total waste of time. Tacos are everywhere. Go someplace else. This place sucks.
I was actually dumb enough to come back to the same Taco Bell if I could get a freeze because it's a sunny day. But of course it's broken. I am not sure how it is legal to continually run an ad for something that is broken every single time.

My girlfriend and I went to this location last night and I never knew that Taco Bell could be this good. It tasted fresh! Also, the portions were actually good and so I felt like, for once, Taco Bell wasn't selling cheap food but in tiny portion sizes so you end up spending more than you expect. Last, other Taco Bell's I've been to have served food that was thrown together haphazadly with all the beans or cheese in one place but not another ect. But here it was put together like you would expect at a nicer restaurant. The only negative is that the place was slammed on a Sat night. But despite working their butts off, the staff was still very nice and dealt with a minor adjustment to the order with friendliness.
Where does Taco Bell purchase the vomit they put in their burritos from?  Is it horse vomit? Pig vomit? Or is it dog vomit?

Go to this location from time to time. It's usually a hit and miss type of deal. The lettuce and tomatoes are always old looking so I usually don't order my tacos with them. The Apple empanadas are amazing though. The service is good and relatively fast.

It's Taco Bell. It really doesn't need a review. 

This location is not on my list of normally visited TB locations.  We had dropped off some friends nearby and I was hurting for a 4th Meal.  The wife was starving, too.  So we went.

They messed up one of our 5 items.  We ordered No Lettuce.  They made it with lettuce, but the tomatoes were missing.  I'm not sure who would mistake the two, but they did.

This place is insanely cheap with the paste* on sauces.  It was like they personally were being charged by the packet.  We ordered 5 items.  We received 4 sauces.  BOO!

In the big picture, it wasn't awful.  Two minor things.  I'm a TB fan. This has been added to my only in a Taco Bell Emergency location list. I really have one. Don't hate.

The old lady that works with the young chick after hours *nearly half the time I go here at 2am* totally screws up my order!
I ordered 2 bean and cheese burritos Fresca style and they made me one with beef and the other with the tomatoes..but it still had the cheese!! ??
Another time they gave me a burrito Supreme instead, and the other was made properly. WTF? 
Back through the drive through drunk and hungry with the DD driver to get it fixed is to be expected on Powell. 
I know to always do the "opening of the tortillas" before taking off to the casa.
How are you gonna rate taco bell poorly? It's fast good, not a five star joint! Anyway,  I love tbell.

Not sure I expected confusion when ordering on line, plus paying! I received a confirmation number, I provided that to the gift at the front counter but she insisted on the mobile number. Was that my mobile/cell phone number? Unsure, luckily the line cook said " is this for Paul"?, so mystery solved.

Workers here are so depressed I feel like I'm causing them physical pain when I order. I imagine it's not exactly great to work here so I don't blame them, I just feel like their frowns make me feel worse for buying crappy food.

If you want a contact high from the drive thru attendant, have the main part of your box meal missing and be up all night with diarrhea then this is the place for you. 
Don't bother dieting, this place will keep you thin.

It's taco bell. The only reason this place gets 4 stars is because it's the best taco bell out side of the taco bell border town on the rich side of San Antonio.  If your going to eat food that is made out of good knows what this is the best one to go to in town

I have never in my life seen a fast food restaurant closed at normal business hours like this Taco Bell. Now that I think about it.. I don't know of one fast food place that has ever been closed without good reason. This place, it's all the time. I can think of probably 5 different times I've driven up to the drive through inthe last few years and had them say "Sorry we're not open". Keep in mind this is during completely normal business hours. Saturday at 6pm for example like today. Other times were mid-day during the week. One time was at 7pm on a Sunday evening. Simply... PATHETIC. Clearly completely mismanaged location.
Wow! The shift leader Austin was such a helpful young man! Extremely nice and quick to take care of me and my picky friend. Thank you for making us smile today! Keep up the good work.

This outlet is next to my home so I always prefer takeout but last week don't know why I visited this place and had a terrible experience. The restaurant smell awful, I have ordered supreme nachos with tacos. 
No doubt, tacos were as usual crisp and delicious but nachos tasted bad. 
What I like about this joint ? Well.. nothing !!
Super friendly staff, the employees greeted me when I walked in, Antonia, my cashier, told me please let me know if you need anything.  Restaurant was very clean

So this taco bell replaced the taco bell closer to halsey on 82nd and I have to say almost everytime I go here there is something wrong with my order! whether it just they put lettuce on something I dont want lettuce put hot sauce on my 4 year olds quesadilla or just completely for get something I started to come to expect for something to be wrong :(

How does that saying go ... I know taco bell isn't real Mexican food, but I'm broke and I like tacos? 

Pretty much what you get. The restaurant is dirty, sticky tables and food on the floor. Messy drink stations. Just ew. I'll take my taco to go.

I was on my way home and I stopped here.  The dude gave me the wrong drink...seriously, I had one of the big Mountain Dews and he gave me a small ice tea or something.  Then I asked for a few of each kind of sauce and he gave me only mild and verde.  They didn't give me a receipt so I can't even submit the survey thing.  Sucks.

I am a regular at the Taco Bell and really enjoy their breakfasts but this morning was not as good as normal and maybe later I will update this review but for now I have to give it just a 2 star. 

We went through the drive-thru on our way to the grocery store.  I was hoping for some bacon items this morning but sadly they were out of bacon and so I ordered the Country Crunch wrap for my Mom and myself.  Well within a few bites we were both sadly disappointed. There is supposed to be country gravy throughout the wrap and I believe both of us had maybe a teaspoons worth at one end of each of our wraps. Sadly disappointing.

Slowest service ever. Finally pulled up to drive thru window and employees and sighing and having a great time while they are 8 cars deep in a drive thru line. Waited at the window for 7 minutes before they told me they are out of potatoes. I asked for my money back (because yes, the ran my debit card, then another several minutes went by before they informed me they were out of what I wanted.) and complained about the line being to long. Employees should probably focus on customer service and less on telling each other to "shut up" while the window is open. I would assume if they did focus on customers, in the 20 minutes it took for me to place my order, wait behind several cars, and pay, they would figure out they are out of something.

Looks like TB Corp heard the comments by previous reviewers. Yay!

The service we received was AWESOME! This is the BEST TB location so far! 

I have been eating at TB since a kid and no place comes close to the quality of service I received here. A staff member (a young guy) delivered the food at our table, the cashier (Cristina) waited patiently for a long time for my order. she even came to us to check if everything was good and if she could be of any assistance. Wow! never heard this outside of top sit-down restaurants.

Later Cristina was cleaning the store and came and asked if she could take our trash as the path to the trash bins was wet. Finally when we were leaving she thanked us for coming. What a service at a fast food restaurant! where our bill was about $8. Just AMAZING!

Oh BTW, this placed made the black bean burrito the best. Most places where I had the BBBs the BBs were less cooked but this place had them in the right softness. 

THUMBS UP to the staff at this location and thanks to the previous reviewers for writing comments to make the corp listen ;)

This is the closest Taco Bell to my house, and as a vegetarian fast food lover I'll inevitably continue visiting.

In a word, the best way to describe this location is: inconsistent. During the day, my experiences with this Taco Bell have been about as good as any other. The problem is that during the day, there are plenty of food options more appealing than Taco Bell, so my visits are usually at night.

The night crew is generally pretty bad, but it seems to really depend who is working / managing for the night. My last experience was the most hilariously bad, and of course folks tend to leave reviews based on exceptionally good / bad experiences:

1. Pulled up to the drive through intercom, repeated my order three or four times, was read back my order incorrectly on a couple of occasions, genuinely thought I was being trolled for a second there.

2. Pulled up to the window and clarified my order again for the fourth (or fifth) time, was told to pull around to the parking lot because they were cooking fresh potatoes (yay!). Asked for a few packets of fire sauce.

3. Waited three or four minutes, which is par for the course when ordering potato items after ~11pm, and which I honestly prefer because the alternative is getting potatoes which are either inedibly lukewarm or burnt to a crisp.

4. Got my food, went home, and did my best to enjoy my usual late night Taco Bell experience: 100% lukewarm spicy potato soft tacos, and bean paste which tasted like it was cooked an hour too long. Opened the bag and discovered I was given ~25 packets of hot sauce, which I promptly threw away because we already have about ~60 packets in our dedicated Excess Taco Bell Sauce Drawer because I'm incorrectly given hot sauce about half the time, which no one at our house eats.

My only problems with this location have occurred at night, and the issues are usually with food quality -- not with service. It's almost as if they turn off their fryers to save energy (resulting in almost inedibly lukewarm food), or food is cooked for much longer than it should be, resulting in a burnt taste / incinerated potatoes, etc.. To be fair, I don't think they've ever gotten my order wrong, and the service is usually pretty decent.

In the end, this is a Taco Bell -- so you can't expect much. I do wish the night crew could get it together so I didn't feel like I'm playing roulette whenever I'm in the mood for late night Taco Bell~

Up all night binge drinking? Taco Bell
Kids don't eat meat loaf? Taco Bell 
Late night sex for hours(or minutes)? Taco Bell
These are but a few excuses to punish your body with tacos and burritos containing  "meat paste". The price is right, but I wouldn't eat here on a regular basis. Only as needed. Taco Bell is every ones guilty pleasure.

15 minutes in the drive-through and I'm not even at the speaker yet there were only two people in front of me.  I'm stuck there right now not moving!!!!  Glad I won't be able to eat my lunch on my lunch half-hour because my entire lunch will be spent in the drive-through ! 25 min and almost to the window. One more car to go and THEN I'll get food. In total it took 34 minutes in this drive thru and that it totally unacceptable for FAST food.

I've been in the drive thru for 10 minutes now. At 8 minutes of sitting at the menu he finally took my order!! I asked him helllo and he said I needed to wait longer no, im so sorry we are super busy or backed up or anything just I'll be right with you! At 8 minutes of waiting this should not be the response I hear. I have now been waiting in additional 5 minutes and NO cars have moved in the drive thru!! I really wish there was a way to get out of this drive thru and leave! I am super aggravated that we are not moving anywhere! What is taking so long? Why couldn't he give me an explanation as to why we are still here ?? I will NEVER be back here again!! This is absolutely ridiculous

Update:: 20 minutes later finally got my food. And her excuse was we are having serious issues! And also I just got here was yelled at me . Wow!! What amazing customer service skills you are teaching!

Worst service EVER and unapologetically so. To the hiring manager: DO BETTER and take your time to find consistently polite and hardworking employees. I would go to this location mainly because its closest to my home but I would rather go out of my way for better service than to be continually disappointed by this location.

1. They ran out of chicken 
2. Waited almost 15 minutes for our order
3. Our sprite was more like sparkling water. 
4. Couldn't even eat the grillers, there was more sour cream than anything. 
5. Didn't get one of the orders right at all 
6. The crew members should do more cooking than gossiping and asking if we can hear through the drive through menu.

I thought I was going to have a delicious time at the Taco Bell as I drove back from the DFM. The drive through line was short, the server was polite and double checked my order, and I got my food on time.

Now when I got home, I discovered something frighting. Two out of four of my damn burritos had meat and cheese. I have carefully stated that I don't want any of that, yet, in my damn supreme burrito, there was some damn beef and some cheese. The wonderful nature of my diet allowed me to gag then vomit all over my table upon realizing this terrible fact. Thankfully, they did not f up the other two burritos, which made a great feeling as they were regurgitated out of my stomach.

Thank you, taco bell, for such a great adventure tonight. You have lost a customer.

Went by Friday at 8:26 and 'dining room' was closed.  Sign on door said 'dine in' is open til 9.  Tapped on door and girl just shrugged her shoulders. My van doesn't fit in drive through. 
Burrito loco up the street is better, just costs a bit more

im a huge fan of taco bell. i used to go there at least four times a week. don't judge me; its yummy!!
but let me get this straight.... you don't have dr. pepper (okay. i get it. its more of a southern thing. w/e) but you don't have water?! who the $%@# doesn't have water?
straight stupid. girl at the drive thru gave me a nasty attitude. wicked passive aggressive. pfft. whatever. im sure there was spit in my food.
better that than e coli, samonella, or hep.

If you go to this Taco Bell and Lodia H. Is taking orders beware. She insists on ringing things up her way which will case you to get things you didn't want. Asked for soft tacos with sour cream added and she insisted on ringing up as supreme and minus tomatoes. What happened I got tacos made completely wrong thanks to her. Tried to pay and she refused to take my cash and had to pay with a credit card. Now will have to watch that. Claiming not enough change for my $50. So beware going to this Taco Bell.

I know this is only a Taco Bell that I am rating, but it should and can still be a decent place to eat. The whole experience was bad. 
Long wait for someone to take our order when we were only ones in restaurant.
The person taking our order mumbled and spoke a form of english.
