He then asked for a name to be called when order was ready. When order was ready they called our number?
The place was a dirty mess. It looked as though it hadn't had a good cleaning in quite sometime. 
It looks as though no one that works there could care less about their job or the restaurant. This place needs a good manager and quick.

Wow!  OK.  Were the Taco Bell Gods listening to me?  
As you can see in my previous review, service was the issue.
We just had the best experience with Johnathan!  I actually commended him when we got to the window for his AWESOME service skills.
I told him I am regularly disappointed by the apathetic service but that he had made my day!  I actually called the manager later to rave about this employee.  Lets hope they do the right thing and use him as a training tool.  He is a diamond in a sea of glass.  :)  (He actually said, "When I am here, everyone gets great service")
They struggle to get a simple order right. Then have horrible service when you ask them to correct it. This has happened 7 out of 10 visits. Do not go here.

This is probably the best Taco Bell I have ever been to. Ordering was fast and easy and the employees were super nice. The food was delicious and actually made how we wanted it. I love the cheese roll ups and this location actually put CHEESE in the tortilla!! Usually it's like tortilla with hardly any cheese which isn't cool because if I wanted to eat a shell I'd go by a pack of them at the store lol. Anyhow, crew was friendly, the place was clean, and ordering was fast and easy! 5 hands down

Well as far a Taco Bell's go this is average.  Not bad as the one I ate at in St. Paul, MN (worst) but not as good as the one I where I used to live near in Dallas (best).  Service can be slow when it gets busy on the weekends.  Otherwise fast and friendly.
The quality is usually good (for what it is), and the employees are very friendly... but it always takes FOREVER and it's not clear why.

Only gets a star because you literally have to put one this Taco Bell is a fucking joke depending on what managers working I drive a truck.  Ive stop there multiple times and I've ordered at the drive-through standing there because my truck is too big but this one Mexican manager just shakes her head it won't open the door even literally fucking shit restaurant
Facility was clean.  Service with a smile and even accommodated special requests, at Taco Bell!

Doritos Taco.  Get the nacho cheese.  Get a root beer.

You are welcome.

Ample parking, nice service and CLEAN.

In the words of the Terminator, I'll be back!

Omg!!!!!! Who  what!!! Yeah I had a horrible night serving but omg! Got totally stuck in line for thirty minutes before the ppl behind me backed out and I could escape. Thanks for making my night worse!

I wrote a review from the receipt I was given but never heard back from management or anyone. 
Obviously they don't care but I won't be returning to this location ever again. 

The drive-thru guy FORGOT one item in my order and when I went to the window I told him the price didn't add up, it should have been more expensive. He forgot my Mexican pizza so I told him politely I still needed it. I work service industry so forgetting stuff happens a lot. He yelled to the kitchen staff that I messed up and wanted to add on a Mexican pizza. I overheard one man in the back get aggravated and say "gosh I HATE it when people do this shit!" I almost just asked for a refund but didn't want to hold back the people behind me and the inside was closed already. The order tasted awful! Like ice cold fish. I haven't eaten Taco Bell anywhere since then. That young man taking orders needs to be fired for being so disrespectful. And as for the man that was cooking...I have no words and I have no clue what he did to my food but it's ruined Taco Bell for me forever.

I have eaten at this taco bell several times now. never again. the staff is friendly. However, as a previous review said, the drive through tales up to 20 minutes or more even with fewer than 3 cars in line.
 The food is often not heated through and sloppy. If you are passing through or have only 30 minutes for lunch I recommend you find somewhere else to eat.

Yeah, I'm writing a review for a Taco Bell. And what? Everyone deserves a lil' shine when they're doing things right. 

When I'm feeling cheap, or just want some inexpensive ready-to-eat food in bulk, this is my go to place. There is not much to rave about on the food side- it's Taco Bell, so I'm assuming it's pretty much consistent mediocrity across the board. The customer service however, is pretty dang awesome. Yeah, I said awesome. The drive thru people have gotten it together and it has been a long while (knocks on wood) since they've forgotten or substituted anything. On top of that, they're super friendly and they convey it but don't fake it up or overdo it. On the few occasions where we chill and sit inside, they really do more than you would expect, ie, walk around when it's slow and offer refills to customers. What? Who does that? I decline, because than I feel even lazier than I already do for eating there, but you can tell it really takes everyone by surprise...in a good way of course. 

Basically, sweet place to pick up cheapo grub if you dislike mean or neutral fast food service. And ftr, it's not 'Mexican.' This ain't Wyoming, people.

Before I ramble on about how awful my experience was, I must say that the store manager Mood is very professional and sincere. I called the morning after my visit and spoke to him and he did a very good job with listening to my complaint and assured me that it would be handled. 

Now for the complaint... My husband and I went late to grab some food after a movie. I was ordering through the intercom at the drive through and close to the end of my order the girl started mimicking me and talking in a high pitched voice. ( i do have a higher voice) I was stunned. My husband yelled at her through the intercom and we drove around to talk to her manager. A bunch of kids came to the window and defended her and we repeated we wanted to talk to the manager. 

I could her the same girl in the back laughing and saying," I am not gonna get fired." Finally they called her saying Kathy ... they want to talk to you. IT TURNS OUT THE SAME GIRL MAKING FUN OF ME IS THE MANAGER!!!!!! 

I really was stunned, imagine if the manager behaves this way... sending a real good example to the employees. 

I mean really.... I am a grown woman and haven't been made fun of since grade school. They really have children running this place over night. We left because I refused to pay for food that they would probably spit in anyways.

Once again though when I called the next morning Mood was shocked as well and was very helpful. I really applaud him for his costumer service.

I just took the longest route to Taco Bell. I had been trying for two days to get around to one of my typical repeat performances of of a restaurant. This time it was Taco Bell's stuffed nacho I was trying to snack on. Taking into account that I have a history of being obnoxious at this restaurant, I was beginning to wonder if it was worth it. It was.

You know, i stopped eating fast food a few years ago, but when my TB cravings overtook me I was politely greeted by a SUPER FRIENDLY voice from the drive through window. I don't know when they became so friendly at TB, but i love it! Seldom do i eat here, but i have and it is always clean. It's cheap, it's easy, you know what you are gonna get.
I used to be a Grilled Stuffed Beef Burrito kinda guy; now i'm a Cheesy Beefy burrito guy (it is only a buck!!)

1 Beef taco = 5 hour visit to the emergency room! My son ordered a ground "beef" taco from this location and ended up with food poisoning. The taco was the only food he had all evening, so there was no doubt that the taco caused it (and fortunately for the rest of the fam, we chose a better establishment to eat dinner). He was sick within hours and eventually had to go to the ER from severe dehydration. Avoid at all costs! I'll never eat at this or any other Taco Bell again.
We normally go drive through. Most of the time, their service is super fast. Cashiers are normally pretty friendly. I like this taco bell.

I went to the new Bethany Taco Bell today for lunch and was pleasantly surprised.  The food was good.  I had a cantina steak quesadilla that I shared with my husband.  The steak quesadilla came with chips, salsa, and sour cream.  Not a bad deal for $4.99.  I also had a soda and the soda machine had enough choices for me.  The atmosphere was like other Taco Bells.  The young man behind the counter was very helpful and friendly and the restaurant was very clean. When someone left a table a crew member came over and wiped it clean for the next incoming guest.   I will definitely return when I want a good inexpensive meal.

They charged me for a senior drink!  The Taco Bell locations everywhere else have never charged me for a senior drink!  I also ordered a big burrito and it only had half the ingredients in it.  Not going back to this location!
This particular Taco Bell is the worst I've ever eaten in they continue to mess up my order I will never go to another talking about long as I live.

This is the first time I've actually been unhappy going to this Taco Bell.

I know it's not healthy but sometimes it's easier to go get fast good and with prior experience they have already done well with the orders and went very quickly.

Today the drive thru was a lot longer than usual and the messed up my order twice.

I got my order and I was missing two items so I parked my car and went inside to get the missing items and I told the gentleman and provided the receipt to show that I was just here and I was missing two items.  It took them awhile to figure out what I was telling them then they passed me off to another employee and they couldn't remember the items I was missing so I had to remind them again.

After that I finally got my taco and burrito. I went ahead and left and got to my job to eat and when I open up my food the original order was wrong again! I had ordered some chili cheese burritos and on the receipt it says chili cheese burritos I ended up getting bean burritos......

So this whole experience was pretty terrible I would say but I have never had this issue ever before here.  Hopefully next time if I come to this one again the order will be correct.

SLOWEST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER. Evvery time i come i wait in drive thru for ATLEAST 10 minutes. Its ridiculous i could be the only one in the drive thru and still have to wait 5 minutes at the service window .

I would like to tell you that I enjoyed my Chicken Soft Taco, but I can't, because it was a Beef Burrito. But we had ordered 4 Chicken Soft Tacos between the two of us, so a trade was inevitable. Unfortunately, the remaining three were a Chicken Burritos and two Chalupas... Whatever the hell those are. The real excitement came when I discovered that it was the NINTH time in a row that I had paid for guacamole, without actually getting any guacamole. I don't think they even have guacamole. I think it's a bait and switch item on the menu. You order guacamole, but they substitute it with a cup of white lead based paint that they like to call "sour cream," or maybe an extra one ply napkin. I'm giving two stars because we went back and they clearly felt bad, and replaced our items and threw in a free bag of styrofoam rolled in cinnamon and sugar for us to snack on after our binge and purge. Oh, I finally got my guacamole.

Went the other day after craving a burrito & they were out of Chicken, How are you out of Chicken? Like seriously??!!  

I happened to go to one the night before with GF's in Hudson, Ma & they were out of lettuce, is this normal? 

Other than that its Taco Bell you only go when you are broke...

This is by far the best taco bell in vancouver, the food not only is fast but fresh. You can tell that these works care about the job they have. The only thing I dont like is they are not open early in the morning for regular menu items anymore.....
Always fast. Customer service at this location is great sometimes and other times its ok never really had bad service here. Value for your money is awesome.

No kind of professionalism or respect for customer guarantees.  If you tell people your open till 4am be open till 4am or change your hours of operation to "when ever we feel like leaving.".  I arrived at 3:50am to find the entire establishment deserted.  No employees to be seen or even cars in the parking lot. So there's no telling when they actually closed. I haven't eaten Taco Bell in a long time and now they have solidified my return as never. One more reason on a long list of many.

This particular location is run terribly. The line is always short, but the wait is always long. I went through the drive thru last week and ordered dinner and an apple empanada. After getting to the window, I was informed that they were about to "drop" the empanada, and that it would be a five minute wait. They just wanted to make sure that I would be willing to wait before dropping it. Mind you, I had already been sitting in line for several minutes since ordering, so why wouldn't they just have dropped the empanada while I sat in line, as then it would have been ready once I got to the window (or shortly thereafter). But whatever, maybe it was a bad night for them, so I pulled off and waited. Fast forward a couple weeks (tonight), and I went back, this time to order three empanadas. Per usual, the line was short, and the wait was long. I was the third car in line. Nonetheless, after ordering my three empanadas, I sat in line for 10-15 minutes before reaching the window. Upon getting to the window, the cashier says, "So here's the deal, it's going to take 6 minutes to make the empanadas."  I couldn't help myself this time. I went off on him. Not him personally, but the location he works at. It's ridiculous. Why would they let me sit in line for 10-15 minutes without dropping the empanadas???  I ordered them. Of course I want them!!! It makes no sense. 

This location is very much mismanaged. I don't understand it.

Today I came in and dealt with eddie who was amazing and courteous.   He had a smile on his face the whole time thru my order and even after.  It was so nice to deal with someone who seeemed genuinely happy about there job!
Doesn't even deserve 1 star! Drive thru smells like rotten food. Waited in line for 20 minutes for two tacos ! Shut this dump down now!

I literally live less than one minute away from this Taco Bell but I prefer going to the one on Murray. Three out of the four times that I have been at this Taco Bell there is a long wait when I'm the only one waiting & there is always something wrong with my order. I will be missing something that I ordered and paid for or they just forgot about me. I was even asked to wait one second. 10 minutes later they will ask if I've been helped. There is no communication between the staff. 

I know this Taco Bell has potential because their staff is nice but their work ethic needs some improvement.
This Taco Bell says it's open till 3am but in reality they close at 2:55am so I drove 10 minutes for some tacos and didn't even get them and I was extremely disappointed

Nice- Gotta love that dead seagull that has been laying there behind the store- between Pearle Vision Center and Taco Bell for two weeks now! I especially enjoy how somebody moved it from the median strip to placing it on top of the bush for all to see as they enter or exit the parking lot. DISGUSTING!!! You should be ashamed of yourselves- YOU AND PEARLE VISION CENTER for not taking the initiative to remove the carcass!!

By far the nicest Taco Bell I've ever seen.
Floors, tables, everything completely spec and span, condiments neat and orderly, staff friendly and professional very impressive.
Sometimes my cheese levels run low and I have to make a run for the border.  I'm not proud of this, but I'm only human.
Whatever one may think about the food, Deandre at the counter is just great.  He's the best, most proactive, helpful fast food worker I've ever seen.  Thanks!

I hope there's a extra bathroom in the back for the male employees. Why? because there's no soap in the restroom. On top of that I noticed dried blood splattered around the sink area smh . That is just nasty & unsanitary.
I have almost completely eliminated fast food from our diets.... My daughter loves this place. So if she perfoms well at her softball games I reward her with Taco bell.

They should bulldoze this Taco Bell along with everything else on South Hamilton Rd.  If I had the type of attitude these employees have I would probably decide it's time to better my life and stop working at Taco Bell.

The service every night is insanely slow. Really bothers me because it's consistently taken over 10 to 20 minutes to get an item in the drive thru. Employees are nice but getting my food is a pain almost every time. The worst part is that it takes so long but there's usually only about 2-5 cars but even just now there were 3 cars and it took about 15 minutes.
We"re traveling through town. Come up to the window. And they are closed at 1125 when its suppose to be open till 12

Worst fast food place I've been to. We have come probably 3 times or so and each time we have spent at least 30 minutes in the drive thru each time. Barely get an apology. Should be getting a some free meals because of the horrible service. Someone really needs to look into how this location is being managed because we definitely won't come back after the third time. It's fast food... how can it take 30 minutes to get 4 cars through the drive thru?????
Very friendly staff. Food was fresh and in a timely manner. The girl at the drive through was very nice, the manager was too. Great location! Will return to this location

This is the worst taco bell I've ever been to. It's close to my house so we've given it several chances. 

EVERY time at the drive through, there is an unusually long wait (and not because of being busy). Just a few cars sitting and waiting. 

And 9/10 times there is something missing from the order. 

It's like  this place is staffed only by teenagers with no supervision. 

Yes, it's a taco bell. I don't expect much. But they could at least check the order before sending it out.

THEY ARE UNSANITARY ! THEY ADD DAIRY TO EVERYTHING !!!!!!I 'EVEN guacamole!! I went through the drive through and they forgot to take out the ranch and forgot to put lettuce . I am vegan so this is disgusting . I tried to call and busy signal , both last night and today . What a total disgusting scam . Waste of  7$ because I couldn't even eat the damn burrito and they didn't answer so I could get a replacement . 
They also add milk to the guacamole !! How disgusting . People have milk allergies

It was late and I had a few in me.  TB seemed like a good idea at the time.

Of course, it was absolutely disgusting.  I would rather starve to death than eat here again.
Average Taco Bell with nothing outstanding. Good, fast service and food taste like it should. Store needs cleaning outside.

It's Taco Bell.  So the 5 rating keeps that in mind.  The rating in this case is based on the people as the food is the same as any TB.  The service here over the past couple of years has been stellar.  The staff are courteous and the food is correct.  This  hasn't always been the case and isn't the case for many Tv's, but the service at this one has been great for this repeat customer.

I am not a huge fan of giving 5's to fast food but the crew tonight is what put this place over the top. We decided to give this location a try and boy are we happy that we did! Food was prepared quick and on point and for once you could actually get a meal and be full! They crew was having fun and doing work something every manager would love!! Great job guys!!!

Poor customer service and food preparation. I got the $5 box, If you look at my pictures of the ranch taco they put the sour cream on the outside of the taco. Then gave me the regular taco with spicy meat and the burrito supreme look like it got thrown at the wall before putting it in the bag. Then gave me a bag with beans smeared on the side of the bag? 
I say this to any employee that is unhappy with their job "quit if you don't like your job!". Find something that you love doing so that your job is a bit easier and don't make others dissatisfied with the company...

It took me 30 minutes after ordering to get a burrito. It's the only drive thru in the immediate area and people were going in reverse in the drive thru. So, I went inside. Nope, terrible idea. 30 minutes later I got mediocre food.

You get what you pay for-Taco bell is cheap and fast, and you get the food quality you pay for.  Nothing but excellent customer service, prompt service, and they get your order right the first time.  The store is clean, and the employees actually smile and acknowledge you.  The food was hot and made correctly-never had a problem with this location.
its ok nothing fancy but i do love their crunchy tacos. hate the bean burritos.

One of the few Places open late in the area. Pulled up at 2:28 (32 min before close) lights were already off and they had the worst attitude about us ordering as if they were already closed. Wouldn't recommend this location. Very obvious that the late night employees don't care about customer service.
Worst Taco Bell of all time. Waited almost 25 minutes for food and then when we got the order, they got it wrong. Don't waste your time coming here!

It's Taco Bell, so you know what you're getting.  Crappy fast food but sometimes it's just what you are looking for.  The drive-thru is always fast and efficient, but they almost always leave an item out of your order.  I am now in the habit of pulling into a parking spot, checking my bags, then going back through to get the missing item.  The other negative I have noticed lately is that they are getting real skimpy on the hot sauce.  They ask what you would like, but only toss a few packets in.  The hot sauce is the best part of the food.

My husband and I went here one day for a short lunch. When we walked in the staff took forever before even acknowledging then started shouting at a girl to come get us. When we were finally getting our orders taken the girl ignored us completely to talk a group of boys behind us. I ordered from the long john sliver side and my husband got his meal from taco bell. Everything we ordered tasted like it has been left out and old. Everything was really dry and did not taste good at all. The only thing that seem normal was a couple of their dollar tacos.

I used to be a huge Taco Bell fan and I have eaten at many Taco Bells.  This is the worst one I have been in.  The restaurant has a grimy feel to it and they serve customers out of order.  The line means nothing.  Don't bother going inside if you are going to this location.  You will be disgusted.
I wondered why there was always a line and tonight figured it out. This is one of the slowest drive thru locations I've been to. Food was ok, not bad tasting but just Luke warm.

THEY ARE UNSANITARY ! THEY ADD DAIRY TO EVERYTHING !!!!!!I 'EVEN GUACAMOLE !! I went through the drive through and they forgot to take out the ranch and forgot to put lettuce . I am vegan so this is disgusting . I tried to call and busy signal , both last night and today . What a total disgusting scam . Waste of  7$ because I couldn't even eat the damn burrito and they didn't answer so I could get a replacement . 
They also add milk to the guacamole !! How disgusting . People have milk allergies

this was classic taco bell.  If one went to the restroom, there was standing water in the hallway.  Not sure where it came from or if they clean it up periodically but they had put out a slippery sign so they weren't too concerned about it.  The men's restroom also had water over the drain plug and appeared to be coming up so not sure if the same source.  I thought it gross and strange so told the staff.  She asked me what I meant so I showed her.  She said it is always that way but would mop it up.  Makes me wonder about the sanitation.

Buzzards circling overhead the Drippin' Taco Bell. Need I say more?

Actually there is a few more items I have to comment on. This location is always out of something. Like "Sir, our guacamole is still frozen would you like some free cinnamon twists?" Not if you gonna put them on my burrito...

How about trying to eat a taco salad with a spork? You order the most expensive item on the menu; and they don't have real utensils. They did offer me a plastic knife once; I guess I was supposed to stab the lettuce. The photo in this case says it all.
They charge $1.00 for an empty water cup. I will not patronize Taco Bell in the future

"We're really understaffed. So don't make a big order."
Hahaha. I was going to spend money here. But don't worry! I won't!

The staff in this taco bell is almost always overwhelmed - even if they aren't busy - which is confounding since it's a chain fast food store.  I know that staff and turnover are issues in these types of restaurants, but so many of the staff have terrible attitudes.

Not to mention... once you're in this drivethru, you're STUCK!  Hope there isn't an emergency or something.... there are concrete curbs on each side and you're 'in the shoot' as soon as you order.  Good luck!  (I'd go to the one on 256 or Main St. if i were you!)

I gave this Taco Bell because it is as good as it gets for Taco Bell. 

I always go through the drive thru of this location and they are always friendly, fast, and accurate consistently. I would not keep coming back if they were not. I have tried other Taco Bells and have stopped going for years due to bad experiences but this location has been consistent for the entire year I have lived in this area. I am almost AMAZED by how well this location does compared to every other Taco Bell I have been to. 

GREAT JOB TACO BELL ON CEDAR HILLS!

You know, I don't really have very high expectations for Taco Bell. I really don't. But the impressively poor service at this location just really motivates me to mention it here. Customer service is clearly the last thing on the mind of every person who works here. They just do not care about you, or your food, or anything, it seems. 

While, because it's the closest one to me, I probably won't stop going here for my (exceedingly rare) Taco Bell experience, I just want people to know not to expect anything resembling service. Sad, really.

I had never been to this location until today. I have to say it was nice. Went through the drive-thru the gentlemen over the speaker was very nice and polite. The food was fresh and I got everything I ordered.

DO NOT GO HERE! The happy hour drinks are a scam! The machine is broken 75% of the time! No joke! They lure people in to a looooong drive thru line with the promise of a delicious 1$ freeze and then, once one is trapped in line, they inform you the machine is broken. Total waste of time. Tacos are everywhere. Go someplace else. This place sucks.

When you have been out all night and need a quick bite to eat to recharge this is where to be. Taco Bell is not known for having great authentic Mexican food, and that's ok. My review is I have only had people forget to add items that are requested, service is always fun when I go to the drive-thru.  Decent quick food for a low price, so you cant go wrong.

This Taco Bell doubles as a KFC - maybe they should stick to tacos.

The menu said $5.89

I paid $8.81  for:

1 single soggy orginal recipe breast
1 warm cole slaw
1 tepid mash & gravy
1 soda
1 *delicious* biscuit (that much was good) 

NO SPORK or any other utensils
NO RECEIPT to EXPLAIN the excess charges for the classic combo-

I can get an entire 8-piece fried chicken dinner across the street at the King Soopers deli, guys; you're going to have to do better than that. I won't be back to this location again.

I've been to this location twice, the first time everyone was polite and very friendly. It was a good experience. The second one, not so much. I would rate this place zero stars if I could. I saw a definite health violation. The guy making our burritos stopped midway, with gloves on, checked his phone with the gloves, put it back, and kept touching our food! I'm not a big fan of eating out, and this is why. I threw my burrito in the trash I was so disgusted. Phones are very dirty, we take them everywhere! It took only a moment to wrap the burritos, he could have checked his phone after. I will not be eating at Taco Bell ever again. This was my first time back in months, and will be my last.

I don't normally review fast food restaurants.. but I have to say that this Taco Bell has satisfied some major cravings in recent times for me. 

I've had huge hankerings for chalupas and Mexican pizzas lately. If you haven't had either before, I suggest you try one. (To be honest there aren't a whole lot of other items on their menu that I like to eat).

A chalupa is like a taco except it's made with fried flatbread. You can get a chalupa with chicken or with ground beef. I usually get the chicken one, which is a $1 more, but I think it's worth it at $3.xx. The Mexican pizza is $3.xx as well and is kind of like a tostada with beans, ground beef, melted cheese, tomatoes. Back in the day they used to be topped with green onions but that ended after an E. coli outbreak or something. Darn. 

I haven't been here late at night, only during the day and around 9 am. Service was good and fast, and the health score rating at this location is in the 90's.

The way they present everything on the tv is not the way they give you the food you order. Disgusting! I will never buy from them again. I know I won't make a difference but just sharing my experience. Never again!

Writing this while in the drive through line. I'm not sure if there aren't any employees working or what, but there were only 5 cars in line.  only three ahead of me and I have waited over 25 min in line. I've come here a few times and it's been bad every time but this has been the worst by far. Probably not going to come back for a while and hopefully they get more people working. 

I ended up waiting another 15 .They said they were training new employees and offered me a free drink for the wait. Nice of them and I understand but 40 minutes is insane for a taco Bell where I ordered three normal things. That's bad for a sit down restaurant. And there were only two people inside when I left.
Took 45 min to get through the drive through.  didn't think that was possible for a "FAST FOOD" Restaurant. It makes the DMV look better.

It feels a little bit silly to be reviewing a Taco Bell here, because, well, it's a Taco Bell and the food here is just as good as any other Taco Bell - but the thing that makes this a bad fast food restaurant is the atrocious wait time any time you order from the drive through. 

I've visited this Taco Bell about 4 times and every time I've had to wait ~20+ minutes in line. Doesn't matter what time you visit - during peak hours or at a random time in the afternoon - the service is ridiculously slow.

The manager of this place needs to take a serious look at their processes and find out why this 'fast' food restaurant is taking as long or longer to get food out as a sit down restaurant.

The staff at the Everett Taco Bell is extremely friendly every time I go there.  The girl who was at the drive thru today (2/28 around 230/3pm) saw that I had been crying and genuinely asked if I was okay. It meant a lot for a stranger to show that she cared enough to ask.  I would have been gone 5 seconds later so she could have just ignored me but she didn't. Thank you!

The food is great. 
However, this is the third time I have gotten the Fiesta potatoes with no fork. Had to throw them out again :(
Also it would be much appreciated if they would make sure to fill up the cup of nacho cheese as well as not just stuff the napkins in the bag but put in a folded stack.
Why don't you have both windows in the drive through open? One to take you money and the other to give you your order. This is NOT fast food. I've been waiting here for 20 minutes.

This is the closest Taco Bell to my house. I come here often. Mainly for breakfast because sausage AM crunchwraps are my guilty pleasure. Lately, I haven't been able to indulge because they are either not open during breakfast hours OR they tell me they've "run out of breakfast" and it's still well within the time span when breakfast is served. Take this morning for example. Since last week, I got the "we ran out" excuse, I decided to go almost immediately after it opened. I mean.... you shouldn't have run out if you just opened, right? I pull up to the drive thru. Nothing. So I circle the building. I then realize my car is the only car there. It's at least 7:15-7:20 soooooo someone should be there, right? I ended up just leaving. The only reason I still gave three stars is that every other time I've been outside of breakfast, it has been no problem. Hopefully, they'll get the morning routine down soon.

So lunch was aight.  It was cheap & quick & satisfying enough in the taste department, but what really sets this TB apart is the amazing conversations I was privy today on my lunch.

The first was a conversation about love & teh ladies between two middle aged D&D wizards.  Favorite quote: 'Its not about how she looks- its about how she looks AT you'...effin hilarious.

The second transpired between a random customer & the counter girl.

RC:  oh, hey cool, you guys don't have to do that up-sell thing anymore huh?

CG: huh?  I'm not sure what you mean.

RC:  you know, it used to be that the minute I walked in the door you would've asked if I was interested in shoving a Crunch Wrap Supreme up my butt & I would've said that I hadn't planned on it, but since you asked, sure what the hell.

CG:  (through stifled giggles) nope, I'm not really interested in up-selling or shoving food in you, I've only worked here for 5 weeks, but I do think that the new Big Taste Taco is pretty awesome.  

RC:  I'll take 3 thanks:)

Totally made my day.

Here's the thing about Taco Bell and with most fast food chains, most folks should know what to expect. Feening for a quick meal fix? Taco Bell works. Drunk out of your mind and looking for ways to curb your intoxication by eating a Mexican pizza? Done. Fantasies of obesity and diabetes for one night? Taco Bell is the place to be. In my case, it's whenever nearby Muchas Gracias (http://www.yelp.com/biz/muchas-gracias-portland-7) decides to suddenly close early, this is the next best thing.

Since I moved to NYC years ago, these sorts of Taco Bells are a bit of a rarity. it's bad that when even fast food is made poorly in one of the greatest cities of the world. It's even worse when a mediocre version of the "norm" is considered solid by abnormally fast food deprived palates.

This Taco Bell location is no exception and while it's far from the perfect tacos that weird critical folks will judge quickly, it's just fast food. If you keep that in mind, this place is as predictable as they come for the crappy food fix that everyone craves once in awhile.

Cheesy beefy burrito for a dollar? Check. Double stuffed tacos? Gross. Mexican pizza? Done and done.

So, I had a bad experience the first time I went to this Taco Bell, but I've worked in the restaurant business most of my life so I decided to give them another shot. I live 20 minutes away and realized the didn't put my quesadilla in the bag! So I paid $10 for two tacos and a medium drink. This is after I sat inside for 15 minutes waiting for the order and listening to the cashier visit with a KFC employee who wasn't even ordering any food! I have never written a review on yelp or anything before and I'm 39! I just felt like I've been to so many Taco Bell's, like the one in Denton Texas that are outstanding in terms of food and service that I had to tell someone about this location.

I know its taco bell so im not expecting anything fancy ,but this is not 1st time,such rude people working there, and when i order 3 items ,i get 2,
This location is extra bad with not giving you the whole order,i always forget not to go here ,but i tend to not remember that on the weekend.

10AM on a Sunday and the front door is locked. I see someone in there probably taking orders for the drive thru but no acknowledgement to us at the door with our two kids. This isn't the first time I've had this kind of experience with a Taco Bell being "closed" during business hours, but we have just moved to this area and this is not the best first impression for this location. We will be choosing one of the many places nearby to spend our money.

Why is every taco bell on the planet incapable of good service.  Or even just getting my damn order right!? And since the lobby was coded I had to sit I  the SLOWWWW drive thru again. 30 minutes to get my order abs get it right.   And not even a sorry or our bad. Will not return to this location again.

This must be a franchise store and not run by the company. My order came in a plain brown paper bag, not a Taco Bell bag. The Food did not taste like any of the other Taco Bells and the quesadilla had very little cheese in it. The burrito I got was small but more expensive than other stores too. It seems the owners are trying to be cheap about their business: smaller portions, larger prices and bad taste.

The service is terrible and the preparation is worst. The food is horrible. They don't know the difference between steak and marinaded beef.  DON'T GO. Go to a different location.  I even walked in and talked to the mgr. there. She could care less.
This is the best, and I really suggest that you go here!  The burritos are wrapped very well and have a perfect balance of ingredients inside.

Well, it's Taco Bell and I had a craving for Doritos Tacos. I went drive thru, ordered 3 tacos supreme and a medium Coke. Sat in my car and munched on my lunch.

1 taco fell apart. I hate that. You bite down and one side just crumbles, and falls apart. Spills meat everywhere. Whatever, I was careful and it didn't spill in my car. I rule.

Anyways, the tacos were pretty good. Filled me up for sure. The Doritos leave your fingers very cheesy. Like you've eaten a whole bag, but just had 1 taco.

My only big complaint is that the drive thru only gave me 1 napkin. I need at least 2 with these messy tacos.

I'll get soft shell next time.

Idk what happened over the pst year but this tacobell went from being the shit, to just being plain old shit. Everytime i come here i wait atleast 10 minutes for my food without fail. I litterally go to mcdonalds first so i have food to eat while i wait for my food. Not only this but they close early all the time, and they shut off drive thru with people in it. Like how the fuck u gonna deny me food when i been waiting 10 minutes in line to place my order you guys can fuck right the fuck off.

Taco Bell is a guilty pleasure. I've been eating their food for over twenty years. And yet, regularly, I get home to find out that I've been shorted items from my order. This happens so consistently that we secretly felt that it must be a corporately sanctioned practice. 

I have a household of eight people I'm feeding so my orders are probably larger and more complicated than most. But really, how hard is it to get all the food I order into the bag? Apparently it's quite difficult since about a third of the time something is missing.

Ultimate fail. Stopped by this Taco Bell to grab a taco and a burrito only for them to tell me that they will be out of taco meat for the next 25 minutes. Are you kidding me? First off the manager should be ashamed or embarrassed of themselves. That's like going to Taco Bell and then saying they are out of taco meat! " oh wait a minute, that is what happened!" Shaking my head, I can't believe this!

This Taco Bell location is one I frequent due purely to it's location (and my love for Taco Bell in general). But I have got to stop. This location is disappointing 99% of the time. It just is. You can always count on anything crunchy being broken or stale. Crunchwrap supremes are always folded incorrectly so they fall open the instant you take a bite. Go there if you want, just know what you're getting into. Don't expect excellence.
Always quick and easy, never fails. Great staff (Lamar in particular) is AWESOME -- makes my day every time I come!

Fast and more than friendly (offered to remake the fiesta potatoes for me because I didn't know they had sour cream).

Nope, it's by no means authentic or quality, but you know what you're getting and they're friendly.  For a fast food place, that'll make me a fan.
Employees are AMAZING! Thank you for hiring truly great people.

I get that it's Taco Bell, but WOW. Waited 30 minutes for $15 worth of food, and they forget the nacho supreme. I nicely went to the counter, waited another 3 minutes before anyone acknowledged me, and when I showed the girl that they forgot it she tells the manager(I assume manager, taller guy with a different colored shirt) and he literally throws it together and tossed it on the counter in front of me.  Didn't apologize or anything.

My husband and I stopped here last night. There was no line at the drive-thru, and so we were in and out very quickly. When ordering, the cashier was really helpful in suggesting a cheaper meal option that had the same components as what we had ordered individually, saving us about $1.50. They were really friendly and our order was accurate.

We normally go to the Taco Bell further down 99W in Tigard, but that location is constantly messing up and forgetting items. We will be making the trip to this Taco Bell when we are craving that Fourthmeal in the future!

Extremely slow location everytime I come here. I often end up having to wait over 20 mins. Food often comes out cold or wrong order. Guy at the drive through was super sarcastic and rude saying "my day is going great thanks for asking!" When I got to the window. Would not recommend this location.

I usually don't review fast food places.. mainly because my interaction is "fast" and pretty uneventful. But when you get exceptional service, which is hard to come by nowadays, you take the time to review and recognize people who went above and beyond. I was greeted by a really upbeat lady. Wish I could have gotten her name, but she was blonde, tall, and maybe the manager?. When I got my order, this other associate checked up on us to see if we were doing okay. How is it that I get better service at a taco bell than 60% of sit down restaurants I have been to? You guys rock! keep up the good work!

I got helped really quickly which is always a plus but what really blew me away was the state of their bathroom.  I actually ate at the burger king across the street but the toilet seat in the men's room was covered in shit, so I came here.  Not only was their toilet seat not covered in shit, the bathroom was actually very clean.  I'm really impressed.
So im here in the drive in and they're suppose to be open. Some dude comes out and yells "YO WE'RE CLOSED!". Thats how you do that right lol

For a taco bell, the service was very friendly and quick, and the girl at the counter even wished me a good day when I was leaving.  The bathroom was amazingly clean and a person was cleaning something the entire time I was there.  I would gladly come back to this Taco Bell even though I know what it does to my insides.  The manager takes good care of this place.

Terrible customer service on the managers part. 
I ordered double steak and jalapeño cream sauce on a burrito last week and last night and got home to fine that it was not only beef but barely any and no jalapeño sauce. I checked the receipt and it said I paid for steak 2x. 
This happened to my gf on another occasion too. We went inside to order and check and still it wasn't right. When brought to the managers attention, we only struck a chord and he manager got defensive, saying she made it and she did it right. She said if we come back in an hour we can get a refund or get the item corrected, she refused to do it then and we refused to come back in another hour.
Ordered a crunch wrap. Took a while. When I finally got it I headed home. When I opened it up the crunchwrap had no meat. How can one be so incompetent...wtf
Worst taco bell I've ever been to in my entire life. We sat in drive thru for 40min!!! Only to find out they had no need, then to get the food and it was cold. Sad service.

I ran through the drive thru when I was beyond thirsty. I was not hungry or  anything but it was super hot outside and I was so beyond thirsty. I tried to pay but nope, he would not accept money and told me to have a great day...WOW...

I rarely eat at Taco Bell considering, as we all know, their food is not natural and all, even i fit tastes good, but on occasions, I do. This time it was for my nieces, I was babysitting them last week, they are 11 and 9 and they love Taco Bell food
So I brought them here,  we tried a drive through, we had to repeat our order, few times, because either the sound system was not working properly or there was too much traffic noise out,  the service was really slow though, there were only four people, that I saw, working with the orders, and we waited almost 20 minutes to get our food...and it was nothing complicated, just the a very simple order, then when I asked for some sauces, they gave us only 4 tiny packets of sauce, I think it was a little extreme, since we had about 16 items altogether, so I did not appreciate that.
One of my niece complained that her wrap was black, because it was burnt, and she could only eat a third of it,  my tacos were soggy instead, and the children also noticed that there was barely any food in their wraps.Too bad.Taco bell's food is very simple, it does not take much to prepare it and it can taste really good if it is served in the right way, so I think that these problems could have been easily avoided if the service had been better and the people working inside, more focused. The person  at the window was not friendly either, I am not sure I will be back at this location

We're regulars here and we are mostly happy with our food. I really just wish the cashiers would stop putting their fingers our cups when they hand them to us. It's super gross because I know they have been handling money. Whenever I ask them for a clean cup they roll their eyes at me like it's some unreasonable request.
Horrible! Only 3 cars in the drive and 2 for the diner and I've sat here for 20 mins trying to get my food

My beefy melt burrito consisted of tortilla, sour cream, and bits of beef. Where's the cheese and beef go??? I know it's only 99 cents, but GEEZE!. at least include everything that it promises... or make it looks similar to the picture. SO disappointing.

Not rating the food, but the restaurant and experience itself. This Taco Bell was very clean. The service was fast and I got my food in about 5 minutes. The food came out correctly and they put the right amount of ingredients in their items. It was pretty cold inside, but overall this establishment did a good job overall.
I got so sick from this place. I will never come back to this location. LAVE SUS MANOS dummies !
25 minute wait time in drive through. Second time we've been here each time they been understaffed. Wont be back.
Worst Taco Bell I've been too. The girl was rude and the tacos were literally 1/4th full on top of that soggy.
I tried the California breakfast crunch wrap. It was a taco with a cold soggy hash brown in it. Maybe another flavor would have been better. The coffee was surprisingly good though.

Bought the holiday gift certificate and cashier argued that the promotion they just started was a old promotion. I got ahold of another store in London that said the promotion was still good. I will not visit this store again as they made me feel unwelcome.FALSE INFORMATION on the managers part. This is a Christmas promotion that started a month ago..

It is a Taco Bell. There is nothing I can tell you that you do not already know. However, if you are near this Taco Bell you might like to go because it is a newer one so it looks great. However, the food is still Taco Bell food. 

I recommend traveling north about ten blocks for far better Mexican themed fast food.

The employees at this location are 100% incompetent, every time, all the time. 

Divisive way to start a review, I know, but it's well deserved.

My fiancée and I are not picky when it comes to Taco Bell. Seriously, who is picky when it comes to a fast food joint. Our only request? Bean burritos without onions. 

The last three times we've ordered at this specific location? They've screwed it up each and every time. Onions, onions, and more onions. In addition, tonight, the chicken quesadilla we ordered was folded in half and stuffed into the bottom of the bag under all of our other items. Seriously, this isn't brain surgery, people. 

I'd call the number listed on my receipt to complain... But I find emailing CEOs and executives far more effective at correcting the problem. 

I can't wait until Greg Creed, CEO of Taco Bell's parent company, along with all senior executive leaders, check their emails tomorrow...

PS: the Taco Bell off of 26 and Murray never mess up orders. Go there, because this Taco Bell is Toxic Hell.

don't normally write reviews but his taco bell sucks. they always mess up orders. get the wrong chicken. and they are afraid to put any lettuce on their tacos. i know its very expense and i always ask for extra lettuce  they they think i am asking for a salad and no I just want normal lettuce not two sprigs. my soft taco is more like a taquito than a taco. further more when they made my mexican pizza looks like they threw the ingredients from accross the room in a blob in the middle. this place sucks. HARD

(Obvious Note(TM): I am reviewing THIS location, not the food of Taco Bell or the chain itself. ) The secret is out. Don't tell anybody, but this Taco Bell is... kind of incredible! They play classical music. The staff is friendly. Every time I've been in here, it's as spotless as a Taco Bell can get. Incredible people, special requests were politely accepted (I like my bean burrito a certain way, see?) and as pleasant as a Taco Bell is ever going to get. So, if you find yourself in a position where this is what you're after, THIS Taco Bell is the place to go.

I love this Taco Bell!  I live super close and as a college student it is fast and easy to pick up some yummy snacks when necessary.  I have never had even one incorrect order or sloppy food. I really appreciate how attentive and polite they are to me everytime I come through the drive thru. My only request is that someone help them fix the Freeze machine because I miss my Baja Blast and it seems to be broken.  Thanks guys!!!

Gotta love a trip to Taco Bell! I don't think I've ever reviewed a Taco Bell restaurant before but I really wanted to call out an excellent case of customer service that you don't see often; Stacy went above and beyond while we were here. You can tell she really cares about her job and the people that she helps. Food was great as well and this location was very clean.

This is one of the Taco Bell's that I almost never have an issue with.  They actually take great care in providing a good customer service and have rarely if ever made an order wrong with me.c  I go there all the time at lunchtime just because it is cheap and sometime I crave a good volcano burrito.  I wish I could give fast food 5 stars but it is fast food and will only ever get 4 stars max.  But as far as as good as one can get, this is a good restaurant.

I have been to many Taco Bells in my life and this is by far the worst. Not only were the tacos shells clearly old/stale, they forgot my chicken quesadilla. I understand it's Taco Bell but damn, get it together.

Let's get down to it.

Taco Bell, oh how I love you. You make me feel so good inside. With your spicy beany goodness, that I love so much. I love you soft and I love you hard. I love you full of cheese cuz I like cheese. The FIYAH SAUCE is so good. I like to put it in the tacos so that they taste so yummy. And I love how when I talk about it makes me feel so good. I should go get some but I won't. I'll TOOT and my girlfriend will kick me out of the house. Yes, the house. I'll go to the couch, but she'll start screaming she can smell it under the door. I tell her to roll up some towels, homeland security style to keep it out but she don't care.

Three visits, three bad experiences, done and done. I only started coming here because they were the nearest location using the app. The third (and final) time I went, the Mexican pizza they made me tasted like they had dipped it in cinnamon. Avoid at all costs.
Pretty consistent for a Taco Bell. Chalupas tend to be frozen and they ALWAYS forget my quesadilla (we are on 4 forgotten and counting..)

I never get tired of Taco Bell! A bad taco at Taco Bell (which I've never had) is better than a good taco anywhere else. My only complaint is I wish they would come down in price to their worth of 99 cents.

I don't know why I lowered my standards but I decided to try the waffle taco for breakfast for the sake of curiousity. It was really gross. The waffle was stale and eggs were not seasoned and were dry and flaky. 
I can say the steak and chicken at taco bell is edible at best, but since I saw first hand the ground beef stigma is not unfounded. 
The box that houses the bags of ground beef says "edible by humans" with NO grade to the beef. I am glad I only worked for them for a short stint 15 years ago.
Go to bean burritos made okay. Nothing special going on there. Glad they didn't put cheese.

This Taco Bell is always solid. I can't think of any bad experiences here. The tacos are fresh, the meat is hot, and they don't skimp on the toppings. Granted, I only ever order the Taco Supreme, so if they can't get that right...

The Manager was just a major d-bag. I asked to fix my order but all she did was yell at me and tell me if I don't like something to leave the place and go to another Taco Bell. I was very disappointed because I never had a problem with any of their employees besides their manager. She needs to learn some customer service skills or they need to hire a new manager.

Friendly service. Answered all questions. Hot food. Fast! Great location. The menu is great. A lot of new items since I was last here. Don't know why this place has so many average reviews. Don't be discouraged to eat here.

Yes, I do realize I'm reviewing a Taco Bell. You know what? I don't care. When it's 1 am and I can drive less than 2 minutes and have a 7-layer burrito with fire sauce and a caramel apple empanada, it's all good. This is perhaps the one and only fast food place I frequent, and I don't foresee that changing any time soon..

Its Taco Bell.

Its close, fast, easy, and awful for you... just like any other Taco Bell.

This location is crap. They always mess up our order. Once again they charged us for items that we did not receive and when going trough the drive-through. So, I had not noticed until getting home. I am really getting tired of Taco Bell robing my family. I defiantly will not be going back to this location.

You know what you're getting and they do it well. Clean, modern interior and food seems to be consistently fresh. I'm not rating this on a fancy restaurant scale, I'm rating it on a fast food scale, and they do just fine.

Oh my I hate to rag on my fave Taco Bell on the planet.  Been eating here periodically for many years and its always been the cleanest and best fast food restaurant.  The last couple of times they slapped my orders together so quickly and without concern that there was almost nothing inside the shells.  I had to leave the drive-thru window and go back inside to return the food it was so unacceptable.  They refunded my money and apologized.  I told them the last couple of times it had been unsatisfactory and I wasn't happy at all.  The last time I went, I got a taco with 2 shells stuck together and I could have fit the amount of filling into about 2 spoonfuls.  90% shell (times 2) and then 8% lettuce, 1% meat, 1% cheese.  This has become typical at this location for the past year or so.

The drive thru staff at this location are INCREDIBLE. So nice, and they try to organize your order to get you the best deal?! WHAT. Also I have never had them forget an item in my order which has been an issue at other locations. We always used to do the "Taco Bell check" to make sure all the items were there. Not anymore!

This is my favorite Taco Bell. I have been coming here for years, and just love the service! You're never rushed, and there's a genuine care for the customer at this location. My food has always tasted good, and they're quick to get from one customer to the next. Highly recommended!

Dis shit fire yo! This taco bell got some real mexis workin there so u kno your food is gonna be on point. Skip those bullshit taco bells on 114 with white ppl. The employees here might fuck up your order but whatever u end up with u can count on it being the real deal hollyfield.

This is a pretty average Taco Bell, though I really feel like the employees that are currently working here are very well trained and are friendly enough that you feel like you'd definitely like to come back (Though who are we kidding, you're starving at 2 a.m. and nothing else is open. You're coming back). The drive thru seems to be much busier than the lobby, but I think that's increasingly true of all fast food places.

I can't give Taco Bell 5 stars, I just cannot.  (I never eat meat at ANY Taco Bell.)  But, I'm giving this location 4 stars!  I've eaten at a lot of Taco Bells in my lifetime.  This one is the best, hands-down.  I've never been disappointed in the food.  What floors me is that the employees are always friendly and upbeat.  And, I know why!  I was eating inside one day when the manager or assistant manager was doing some training.  He was telling them to always ask the customers how they are and be mannerly and friendly.... and they are!  I was very impressed with the manager who was training them.  He said more, but I cannot remember -- but he did a great job.  This Taco Bell is always very clean too.

Walked in and there was no one at the counter. That's fine, kitchens get busy. I get it. My wife and I waited a good five minutes (I actually paid attention to my watch) and still no one at the counter. I asked loudly if someone was able to take our order.  Out came a lady with attitude who told me they were busy and that they would be able to make my food as soon as they were caught up..

I know Taco Bell isn't fine dining , but other locations in the area don't seem to have the issue this one does.  Poor service after three visits is why I'm finally writing a review.

this taco bell can get it. it is straight fire sauce. chelsea is a dope ass human. i really can't complain when the closest taco bell before this was one was built was miles away. it's convenient, the food is delicious and you're getting your drunchies fix. what more could you ask for? 10/10 would sit in this drive thru for 30 mins.

It's been a long time since I've been to a Taco Bell. Stopped here because of lines at other places. 

The cashier, Andre, was very polite and cheerful. Nice greeting. I asked for breakfast suggestions and he said their Hash Brown Built-in was their favorite right now. 

I order it and I can see why. I know it's not the healthiest way to start the day but this is good with hot sauce. Perfect if eaten while driving. 

I'll be back for breakfast. Especially when I'm on the road.

It was about 9:30 and I was getting hungry from not eating all day (healthy right!). So after grabbing some stuff from Target, I stopped by here to get my dinner. There were two cars in the queue as I pulled up. I was told to wait and they'll get to me. I waited for about a minute and a half to get my burritos. Shortly after I was given three poorly made bean burritos. The hot sauce I requested was not there, and on top of that my water was nothing but ice. The burritos actually tasted quite good, but the lack of care in my order and the wait annoyed me a bit. Nevertheless, you'll deal with such things when you need a taco bell fix.

I decided to come to this location because they're open later than the others around me and I hate going somewhere right before they close. Yelp says this location closes at 1:30a, the website says 2a. 

Regardless it was 12:15a when I arrived. The drive thru was closed, the inside was closed, everything was dark and NO ONE was there. The screen where you order was just black and turned off obviously. 

So I'm not sure if the listed hours are just incorrect (I don't think so bc I've come here late before, and recently) or if something happened. The car behind me was confused also. 

I ended up going to the one at Braker near Burnet, right before closing, anyway.

The staff in the daytime has always been nice and friendly. 

We went here last night pretty late and when we got our order from the drive thru we were missing some items. We informed the person working the window and they went to solve the problem after throwing our change at my friend. 

A different girl came over with the missing food and very rudely said "thanks for snatching." My friend and I were both confused and unsure why she would even say that. Overall the night staff seems far less professional and I don't think I'll be stopping by at night again any time soon. 

Super disappointed by this behavior and I wish I would have gotten the employees' names.

I haven't eaten at a Taco Bell in quite some time.  They had added a few new items, I was bored, so I gave them a shot.

Cantina burrito: swing and a miss.

Cool Ranch Taco: same thing.  I don't know why I even tried it, I don't like Cool Ranch Dorritos either.  Duh.

Don't go there on Saturday. Your order will not be made correct, then when you try to have it corrected they argue with you. I order a Nicholas supreme and they gave me chips cheese and meat. I took it back and the girl with big earrings wanted to argue and tell me they only have 3 types of nachos. My reply " I know that, and have known that before you were born. Give me my money back!"

I'd say this deserves a 3.5 star rating here but I didn't want to give it 3 stars. I love having Taco Bell every now and then. I've actually never dined in at this location. I always order from the drive thru and or app. Its your typical fast food joint. I've had successful orders from their app on my iPhone, super easy and convenient. Baja Blast is the best. The employees at the drive thru are usually nice. Its super cheap BUT it can be hit or miss here.
Fast service and good food. Never a mistake in my orders. Always good staff to make my order fast. Clean place too. Nicely done new interior.

I've never had a problem with this Taco Bell day or night. I'm always in and out of the line within 5 minutes (especially compared to other late night Taco Bells). The food quality is typical of a Taco Bell. You get what you paid for. It's definitively a cheap eats option.

If I could give this place zero stars, I would. My husband came inside to order, waited about 5 mins, had backs turned to him and absolutely no acknowledgment from the staff when he tried to get their attention while they chatted away amongst themselves behind the counter. He ended up leaving because he had to wait so long.

It's Taco Bell. It really doesn't need a review. 

This location is not on my list of normally visited TB locations.  I was stuck down here doing an errand at lunch.  I dislike this part of town and this location is never, ever going to be visited by me again.

I was running late getting back to the office, needed food, and had little time.  The food quality was awful.  The drink tasted like soap and I threw it out.  The quesadilla was burned.  The girl at the window was sarcastic and annoying.  Complete Taco Fail!  BAD BAD BAD.

I'm a TB fan. This has been permanently scratched and never allowed to be added to my approved location list. I really have one. Don't hate.

WORST TACO BELL IN HISTORY. Decided to come here to get a gordita crunch and some nacho chips for her. We get home, and they gave us the completely wrong order. The gentleman at the window (seemed that he was pretty new) almost forgot to give us back our cars and didn't give us a receipt. I  called, and they said yea come by and get a refund. Drove back,and the 'manager' refused to give us back our money and said they could only remake it. Sooooo y'all inconvenience me by making me come back, and can't refund an order when y'all f up orders by the pound?! Daily?!! 
 Not to mention, they've messed up our order multiple times in the past forgetting items, not getting the order correct, the usual. Just a waste, idk why we haven't stopped going here sooner.

This Taco Bells meets the basic fast food standards.  The feed you at a cheap price. They usually get my order correct and the service is usually slow.  The key issue may be that I have never seen the same employee twice in multiple visits.  The counter person never seems to have a clue.  They will try to figure it out with a another (sometimes two) new employee, and eventually get it right.  At least they are consistent, and in the end I get my bag of fast food.
This is the worst poor excuse for a Taco Bell ever the food the hard taco shells are stale the food over all is disgusting its a shame how Taco Bell allowed this one location to tarnish there name
Won't be coming back here ever.  Waited 30 min for my food.  10 min for them to make and then they had to remake it because they realized they gave my order to another patron.
It seems that the staff  doesn't want to be there.  Had to ask for my drink and what kind of sauce I needed.    It was 12:30 so lunch time was still going on and they could care less.

I love Taco Bell but the service here sucks! I ordered a $6 chalupa box and everything on the order was correct but when I opened my food there was absolutely no meat in the taco and it took them 15 minutes to get me my food when nobody else was in there getting food. Not to mention the lady screaming at them in the drive thru for messing her food up. I wouldn't come back to this Taco Bell

I was starving stop by there to get a taco with just lettuce and cheese! No over exaggeration. Smallest amount of beef, tons of lettuces and cheese great, just great. Lucky I threw away my receipt I would have left the review on the official company site. If I had two more hands I would give this place four thumbs down

This Taco Bell is so unprofessional and absolutely has no costumer service!!! They always Always get your order wrong and they don't even care! I have seen people walk out for waiting for someone to acknowledge them. Don't go here!!

This is honestly the worst fast food restaurant I have ever been to. Ran out of eggs for breakfast this morning. Already paid for my food. No compensation or free food offered except to wait the 15 minutes in the parking lot for new eggs to be made. 
Perpetually understaffed with no understanding of how to run a Taco Bell. This franchise owner is a total disgrace. I chalked up the initial shortcomings to it being a new location but it has now been almost 6 months since opening.

Been to this location quite a few times over the last few years. Always get friendly service and food received as ordered. 
I can only review the drive-thru as I have never been inside. They're service is as quick as any Taco Bell goes. I don't recall ever having to wait a ridiculous amount of time for my food.
I like the convenience of this location as it is close to the shopping area of Jantzen Beach, in addition to the Chevron gas station and Wells Fargo Bank.

I really do not like leaving negative reviews, but this place is in need of help. Seemingly constantly understaffed, there seems to always be a long wait and long drive through line. The employees who are there do seem to be trying, but they are overwhelmed. After waiting in the drive thru line for 20 minutes for a bean taco and a slushy for my kid, I received only the taco and was told I could pull into the parking lot and wait another 10-15 minutes for the slushy because they were too understaffed to make it then. I said I had to leave (cars were honking behind me) and I was not offered a refund for the slushy I had already paid for. I know the struggles small town businesses face, but this one desperately needs attention and fixing asap.

Worst fast food restaurant I've ever been to. Been there three times and have had the same problem every time. No sour cream or tomatoes in a crunchwrap is not a difficult request when there are only 4 other ingredients in the thing. I get that they are all new to the job, that's why I've gone back two times, but a 20 minute wait when we're the only people there and no one is at the drive thru.

Went through the drive thru Monday evening, I ordered a few things off the menu.. everything was correct on the screen (I was also asked if it was) pull up pay received my food moments after and went home. Out of the four items I ordered I only received one correct order. I rarely go to TB but when I get a craving I hesitate because this is the second time now (last time it was different TB) they've gotten my order wrong. Nobody is going to enjoy eating something they didn't order or have to make themselves. Please work hard on checking your orders before serving them to paying customers please and thank you.

Never had any issues with food orders from this location; drive threw or dine in. Staff is friendly and quick to fill your order. They do not skimp on sauce packets either which is nice when you get home and want more then 1 packet per item like some other locations, they also don't throw handfuls in either that get wasted. Always have napkins in bags too which many fast food places leave out now a days.
This is the slowest Taco Bell I have ever experienced. I could and should have gone to a sit down Mexican restaurant and had better food in the same amount of time.

Overall have been happy . Certainly with the food. We have had some adventures with the service. Once they accidentally gave our order to a drive in customer and once they were so shorthanded with cook staff that they had a dozen customers waiting for their orders, including us.

Never again will I visit this location or any Taco Bell after last night. I've been puking and peeing out of my butt all day today. Thanks for the disgusting food that's probably been left out since lunch time. I will never visit a Taco Bell again

Do not come here if you want food.  They close down their fryer early, let you make your order, then refuse to make your food.  I am sitting here (arrived 18 minutes before closing) stuck behind another car and I don't even get any food.  Seriously???
I go there late night after bars. They always get the order right and it's prepared well for a Taco Bell. The people who work there are friendly, too. It seems to be pretty well run.

Two orders wrong. Two separate days. I tried one more time.

Went there at 2am. The sign was lit. I waited ten minutes for someone to respond at the order menu, till I drove around to the front.

An older African American woman passed the takeout window, and didn't even glance my way, after I called out.

They're either not open till 3:30am, or blatantly ignore customers.

I and my girlfriend work in the service industry and so I don't like to complain but there is absolutely nothing in my crunch wrap supreme, not even the shell. Ordered a Xxl steak and they jipped us on the steak, put ground beef instead. Although we live a mile within this tacobell, we will not be returning. Will just drive to the one by Brodie and slaughter instead.
Another long wait... 40 minutes for a bean burrito and a crunchy taco!!! Seriously!!!

If I could leave this place a zero, I would. Worst customer service ever. Especially when the hair that was in my food exceeded the length of the burrito I ordered. I know it's Taco Bell and young fast food workers, but don't mess with people's food....

I will never be back!

WORST. TACO. BELL. EVER.

If I could give this particular Taco Bell location ZERO stars, I would. We've been here maybe ten times, and every single time it ends up making us say, "NEVER going back there again!" Yet we did, over and over. Hoping that things would change, but no more, I say! 

The service is slow and rude. DO NOT try to go INSIDE to order. Take the drive thru or sit in the lobby until you grow old and grey, die of starvation, or just give up and leave, whichever comes first. Seriously though, they will take your order, and then they will forget about you in the lobby forever. 

Taking the drive thru is a little bit better. There are always tons of people in line, but at least this route will get you some food. The problem is that it probably won't be the food that you ordered. It's best to check your bag before you drive away from the window, because if you don't you are faced with a dilemma: Enter the Lobby of Eternal Waiting, or get back in the drive thru line from hell... Dun dun duuuuun!

Well, good luck to you, if you decide to face this horrible place, but I'd rather drive to a different Taco Bell to get my crappy "mexican" food fix.

These assholes tried overcharging by adding chicken  to a taco instead of substituting chicken for beef. Which is a 4 dollar different for doing this for 6 tacos. I told them exactly what buttons to push since I previously worked at taco bell 8 years ago. They tried telling me that they have worked there for 10 years and that it's impossible to do it and has never been an option (funny part is that they did it 2 nights previously). Well they ended up telling me they will give it to me this time, but next time I have to talk to a manager. Well they didn't charge me extra at all. Which I was expecting to pay 4 dollars for substituting. So with that, it made me suspicious. After 25 minutes of waiting for $40 of food, I decide to check to see if the order was right and when I open the taco there is literally 1 piece of chicken broken into 2 in there in every taco. So I told the girl to come over and look at it and I asked her wtf is the problem with the two and she was stunned I noticed and said it was a taco. I then asked her why the hell there was only 2 half pieces of chicken and she said that it's an average portion size. I said she was full of crap because I worked at taco bell and know what a portion size is. This she actually had the nerve to say "well you got what you paid for and you didn't pay for the chicken" and I was like you gotta be f'in kidding me, you did this in retaliation to me telling you that you're wrong and there's a substitute chicken button. So I demanded a refund and then called their general manager. If I could give them 0 stars I would. It took 25 mins to make our food,  they were assholes, and tried to ruin a $40 meal. Oh and forgot to mention, when I called bs on them, one of the people behind them told them in Spanish to say that they gave me the wrong meal so I should shut up. Solo porque soy gringo, no significa no puedo entender español cabrones

I had a simple order a cheesy bean and rice burrito and triple layer nachos add lettuce and tomatoes (which I was charged for the add on)... no receipt was given to me for proof of my purchase. Drive away and take a bit of my burrito (luckily I didn't get all the way home to Sandy Springs and notice) the order was wrong. I don't know what kind of burrito they gave me, but it had meat in it I don't eat which is the reason I order nothing with meat on it. No tomatoes on my nachos that I paid for idc if it's $30 or .$30 it's the principle. I got back inside after driving off and there's a guy that's in the lobby cleaning I guess he looks at me and I tell him my order is wrong. This guy proceeded to GO OUTSIDE TO SPEAK TO WHOEVER WAS IN THE CAR WAITING ON HIM  instead of helping me. The other 4 people behind the register neither one of them asked what was wrong as I stood there at the counter with a bag clearly showing my order was incorrect. One of the employees making the food proceed to tell the manager I guess "ask her what's wrong." The service here overall was horrible. And don't count on getting in and out which you should get at a fast food place the wait time in the drive through was horrible as well I went at 10:30pm

Place wasn't that busy but the dinning room is a mess.  Also took about 15 minutes to get my food which was only two meals.  Food was as expected and girl working the cash register was really nice and professional.
Extremely rude to customers and calling them liers. Slamming windows and slamming down the food they make, breaking taco salads bowls. Attitude attitude

AMAZING customer service. Came back to return my order cause things were missing, so I just asked for my food to be remade, and I'd return the first order. I did not have a receipt but I had the same card I had used to pay. There seemed to be two woman managers that were so sweet and remade meal with no hesitation and even said I could keep my first order of food as an extra perk and offered me a free drink, which I decline but was very thankful. Also, I have been going here for a while and this is the FIRST time I've had a problem.

It's Taco Bell. It really doesn't need a review. 

This location does a solid job of not messing up your order. The drive thru is quick. The window people are pretty nice... with the exception of this one girl who can't put her cell phone down to save her soul. I'm positive she sent 4 or 5 texts just while I was waiting at the window.  HELLO MY FOOD IS READY. 

I'm a TB fan. This is on my approved location list. I really have one. Don't hate.

Spicy chicken cooler ranch loco doritos tacos. What a mouthful. The food is heavily processed, over seasoned, fatty, and full of preservatives. But I like it. #DontjudgemeMonkey. I tend to go for Happier Hour, alcohol free is hardly happier, but I'll let it slide. I like to keep my digestive system on it's toes by visiting this establishment often. The breakfast commercials are funny and the waffle tacos are laughable as well. Yeck!

I tend to stick to items that taste better with generous hot sauce. Loaded Grillers. I do like the steak burritos, the steak has real steak qualities. Try the steak cantina burrito. Al Fresco is possibly the worst excuse for a healthy option. I don't even understand it. 

Nonetheless I will return.

This review is for the service of the management staff. 
I had lunch the other day on my break and went back to the office, realizing that they had forgotten my Beef Meximelt. I called the manager on duty to let her know what happened and she took my info to allow me to redeem the missing order on my next visit and an extra item for the trouble. 
I came back this week to get my missing order and purchased more items and the manager paid for my whole meal when I was about to pay for the extra item. I thought that was a nice gesture and service when he did not have to do that. I will definitely be back for more.
