my 14 year old begged me to go there to get him a 7-layer burrito. I really did not like the overly bright fluorescent lights in the place, it gave me the creeps. Too institutional in feel. What's worse the tables and floors were dirty and the bright lights made it all the more obvious that the restaurant wasn't clean.

I never thought I would bring myself to review a Taco Bell, a fast-food chain--but I received outstanding service from Daniele! My toddler took what felt like 5 years to decide on his order--she was patient and super sweet to us both; even suggested changing the order to get a better deal on the prices; hey before you judge a penny is a penny! The drive-thru is quick--though I've had a few blah moments with the window attendant's, not the 'greeting committee.' The food is ...uh..well it is Taco Bell not a 5-star chef prepared accommodation, I'm sure we'll be back for the late-night convenience that is T.Bell. Thanks Daniele for the quality service!

I went through the drive through and they forgot to take out the ranch and forgot to put lettuce . I am vegan so this is disgusting . I tried to call and busy signal , both last night and today . What a total disgusting scam . Waste of  7$ because I couldn't even eat the damn burrito and they didn't answer so I could get a replacement .
Considering this is fast food, the food is excellent, the grounds are very clean and the service is far beyond the other fast food restaurants. Highly recommend.

This is one of those places that doesn't really need a complete review, because we all know Taco Bell. I have already completely eliminated fast food from my diet. 

But here is a tip if you're tired of paying for $3+ for a taco and burrito? Next time go to Chuck's Produce & Street Market (2302 NE 117th St or 13215 SE Mill Plain Blvd). Chuck's Deli and Taco Bar has more to offer with better pricing!

Terrible.  I don't eat fast food often but this place is very close to my home
Twice I've come home to discover my order was wrong.  Some kid made the wrong item and just unfolded it to resemble the quesidilla I ordered.  I actually called after the second visit.  No way to credit my order.  I don't believe that.  The manager is a bs artist;  he gives no fucks and the teenage workers put it on him.

In the game of Taco Bell, this location is the equivalent of Michael Jordan, Tiger Woods, Bach, Beethoven, First Recon and Delta Force.  With them one should not mess unless you want to be elegantly humiliated and destroyed.  They do not lose--cost me $50.00 in our last match.

The Taco Bell game is based on the fact that the drive thru window employees at Taco Bell are trained to ask you if you want anything else during pauses in the customer's order.

The object of the game is to, through special ordering techniques, get the person to stray from their training and say, "Will that complete your order."  
A winning combination is:

Employee:  Will that complete your order?  

Player: Yes.

Winning Strategies include: The Mexican Pizza Gambit and the Medium Diet- Cola Defense

One losing tactic, which I learned in my last match, is the 15 Mexi-Melt front load.

There are a couple ways to lose.  If they keep anything else-ing you as trained, you eventually have to give up.  That is the most humiliating way to lose.  If this happens you have to pay $20.00 to the cashier to cover the next customer's order.

You can also lose by "balking."  This occurs when you use a non-front loading defense and they ask if your order is complete before you get enough food ordered.  If you continue to order after they ask you if the order is complete, you lose by balk.  There is no penalty for this.

Let me start out by saying I love taco bell and have been to many locations throughout the U.S.A and have never had a bad experience till now. Most of my food was made wrong or I didn't get it at all. The service was a little slow but my food problems were handled with grace and a pleasant attitude. The manager was present and had mentioned that everyone was still learning, no hard feelings but probably won't come back again.

This location needs to step up its game for sure! Taco Bell is just addicting to eat regardless if it all taste the same after a while. Its my guilty pleasure. I can eat it everyday for the rest of my life but this location is either a hit or miss. 

If you have the ability to go through the drive through when its not busy, I recommend doing so. The drive through line can get extremely long and it takes a bit of time to get through it. The time it takes to get your food just takes forever and at times my items have been cold. My biggest complaint would be my food is usually 50/50 made wrong or is just not what I would assume be the Taco Bell standard. Any time I order a burrito, its usually wrong and my tacos are never filled with anything. The amount of meat is the usual but there usually is not much lettuce or cheese on it! Fill my taco up! Make it look like the commercials! If its going to take a while for me to get my food, it better be because your making my food perfect and look commercial approval. 

Other than that, the staff themselves have always been nice. That part of the service is great. Even walking in to get my order, everyone has been attentive and willing to fix my order if it needs to be. The store has been clean and never felt like I was in a filthy resturant. 

Speed of the getting my food and fill up my tacos!

Thought I might treat myself with Taco Bell tonight. Oh SOOOOO wrong!!!
I ordered and stepped aside. The guy who took my order moved to the prep line. Watched him start helping and touching food with his gloved hands. The same hands that just took my money and handed my change to me. YUCK! I said something to the order taker that I didn't want him touching my food if he is taking money too. He started to tell me he would change his gloves, but a second person on the prep line started to argue with me and said he was fine and not touching food. I told her that I stood there and watched him touch a couple of things. She still wanted to argue. A third person stepped from drivethru (had to be manager or supervisor) and told her to stop arguing. Then apologized to me, but I just couldn't bring myself to eat the food now, got a refund.

I am beyond angry at this place so I came to Taco Bell on my lunch they got my order completely wrong which is not the end of the world so I go thru the drive thru and the boy tells me to hold on and than asks to help me like four times lol wtf so finally I tell him what's up and he doesn't understand and than tells me to hold on again! So I back up and go inside instead! I'm waiting in line inside and the kid is just talking shit about me and how I backed out of the driveway! Etc rude service I got my money back and left never ever ever will I eat there again!
Great service! And helped me to decide if the grande was too grande...by explaining it was half a pound of food. TG they did, was hungry... And now very full. Anyways, they're very friendly

Yup, 5 STARS!  My husband and I often frequent this East Broad Taco Bell after late nights out with friends. I expect mediocre service from a fast food restaurant at 1:30 in the morning, but at this Taco Bell you can we always get fast, very friendly service, and of course, hot yummy food. I always leave with a smile and a feeling that the employee went above and beyond my expectations!!

Terrific location for getting your crunchy taco on.  I'm not too proud to review a Taco Bell, and this one is in a good location--right in front of the Target store.  Clean inside, great food and speedy service.
I really like Taco Bell, but not all locations are created equal. This is definitely one of the better ones. Friendly, clean-cut staff, and my order came out perfect!

I rarely do fast food but taco bell is our favorite, visiting this one is ordered about $14  worth of food one of which consisted of a drink, I get my food and even a straw but no drink, then suddenly the window shuts on me, I wait about 2 minutes for a manager to open the window and ask what else I needed after I reply I would like my drink he questions me about 4 times if I actually received my drink while sticking his head out of the window to view the interior of my suv to ensure I didn't get my drink already.  Please I pulled up in a 80k suv do you think I'm trying to scam you for less then a buck of soda. TACO BELL you need to make this right or higher actual management in your franchises

Really great fast food place! Workers are really nice and food is perfectly fine. There's an employee named Omar who's really nice and keeps a positive attitude when taking orders. This is one of the best restaurants I've seen!

Rating still stays at 1 star for this location, but props to Yum's corporate office on courtesy, extremely apologetic, and fast follow up of the complaint I filed. The gift card due to inconvenience was nice, as well.
Going cage free eggs first - way to go Taco Bell.  Delish bean burrito and love that they can make some of their items vegetarian. Food is always fresh and service is very fast.

First off, the slow service at supposedly "fast" food is a Boulder County-wide issue. In a town where drivers at a light turning green slowly let off the brake on the inhale and begin to accelerate on the exhale, the chi is flowing for everyone but me, who would just like to make the light, thanks. But have you ever waited at a drive thru window so long that it got awkward? Me and the cashier, just sitting there, looking around, checking our shoes, waiting for something to happen. After a couple minutes I got my 3 crunchy tacos and was on my way. Despite the wait, the cashier was really nice - he had good chi.
It looks like there have been some upgrades since the last review. Place was as clean as any other quality Taco Bell. Food was good and the cashier was very nice.

This was my first time for this location, It was not very clean due to 
 chips all over the tables and floor. Part of the counter staff was rude and not very helpful but others were very pleasant. My food on the other hand was hot, fresh and tasty.
30 minutes to get two soft tacos! It is filled with homeless people too. I don't have a problem with homeless people but I do have a problem waiting that long for fast food!

Since they have re-opened, I have been quite happy... they are open very late which is great for a night owl such as myself.
They are the more pleasant fast food employees to deal with in this area.

This place could be on fire and they still wouldn't know what's going on. Drive thru 7 cars deep, my order got skipped, 2 or three people have come back with problems with their food! What in the world is going on here? I even saw some people that knew the coworkers get food before everyone else!! I've always had good experiences here but tonight is horrible!!
They just came back to me telling me they lost my receipt and need me to tell them what I ordered.... Ughhh
This taco bell is horrible. Very slow service and the food is bad. The kids that work there are not friendly.

This is my main Taco Bell. The staff here are always really nice, and although they mess up my order sometimes... they are always quick to fix it, and give me a free item or upgrade with it. The food is always hot and quick. The dine-in area is really nice since the remodel.

For a fast food joint or a cheap taco craving, it hits the spot.
And come on... It's Taco Bell. What do you expect?

First off it's dark outside with NO lights on, I couldn't see the board. Second I know it's a fast food place but I've been to enough fast foods to notice fake happy but everyone in there was giving me rude looks and the drive thru KID was RIDICULOUS. Not a care in the world and literally TOSSED my food and drink at me, my drink was incorrect and I didn't get my taco sauce I'm sorry but who eats a taco without sauce ?! He only said my total and when I was going to ask for sauce he gave me a look that said go away. I was already in a bad mood just by hearing his voice on speaker with his I don't care attitude so I simply left. With the 2 stars for this Taco Bell get new employees or shut down.
I love the place. Seniors get free sodas

I've been slowly shitting out what seems to be my small intestine. I've been quaritined, because the doctors thought I had ebola. Till I told them I ate Taco Bell from this location. They looked at me with some great admiration, since they say that every person that has gone to that Taco Bell to eat have come to the ER only for them to die such a excruciating pain in their asshole. For the moment I'm fairing well. Will I ever eat there again? HELL YEAH, and so should you. Enjoy it while you can, you got a life to live. Might as well shit out your internal organs at a time.

Slow service, totally messed up the order,had to throw in trash. The employees are very rude and act like they don't care.    Wait in line 15 minutes at the drive thru for 4 soft tacos and they can't get that right.

I would like to thank the generous people who work at this upstanding institution for the extra fire sauce they always give us. This Taco Bell is, without a doubt, my favorite place to eat between the hours of 10 and midnight. I would also like to thank the people who work at t bell headquarters for creating the chicken quesadilla.

This is based off of the sauce to food items ratio alone. Not sure what kind of hellish recession is going on but, we just received 4 total sauce packets for 8 items. This is the 4th time we've been here in about 2 months (not at all embarrassed at those stats) and every time, we've been big time sauce shafted.
Taco Bell taste so good when you first eat it!! Love this place because of their quick and polite service thanks for being awesome Taco Bell

STEER CLEAR of this location. Seriously. If it's between starving, and eating at this location-- just go hungry. They are painfully slow. I ordered through the app and despite being assured my order was being prepared multiple times, I find out that my order wasn't received after waiting FORTY MINUTES! Almost an hour to get a couple average tacos is unacceptable. That being said--I completely understand that mistakes happen. However, my biggest disappointment was how rude the staff was when they finally realized their error. Not a single person ever apologized, and all I got was a couple eyerolls as the kitchen staff begrudgingly threw some meat in a shell, and tossed the bag on the counter without saying a word to me. 

This isn't the first poor experience I've had here either. Just trust me, no amount of hunger is worth eating here.

I've been to this Taco Bell a handful of times since it's close to where I live plus it's the only thing open in the middle of the night when I'm hungry, and I have to say it's just your average fast food place.

The staff here is friendly whenever they want to be, however, for the most part they're really just there for a paycheck. My order is made wrong about 90% of the time so I have to go back and re-order it again. For the most part the place is somewhat clean and okay to eat at. But nothing to fancy.

Like I said I only eat here in the middle of the night when I'm craving something or when I'm out with friends and they want to stop here. Definitely not my first place to eat nor is it my favorite place to eat, but I'm thankful I can eat vegan here.

If you MUST go to a Taco Bell maybe try another one.

If I could give no stars I would got a taco salad which is usually  pretty alright and the taco shell had mild type stuff on it I will never eat here again blahhhhh they better hope the city of austin is easy than I am

C'mon, why does Taco Bell have 4 stars?  Eat here of you want gut DESTRUCTION.

Low quality ingredients and the furthest thing from Mexican food.  One star!
Thank you, this certain TB, for putting faith back into my Fourth Meal.

Let me spell out my experience:
T-terrible service 
R-ridiculous wait times
A-asinine employees 
S-stupid business practices 
H-hell ain't big enough for this flaming pile of dog crap called Taco Bell

My office is a few hundred feet from this Taco Bell. I wish it didnt consistently take forever to get food. I wish that the staff here was not consistently rude. I wish it wasnt so dirty in the store. I wish they didnt run out of common items. Sad face because i really want to give them money for some delicious tacos, but after a dozen or so visits, of cosistent crap, ill just do without.

I love Taco Bell but so many locations close before their stated closing time. I arrived 12 min before closing on a Friday night and saw two cars parked and yet was ignored. I hate that because I drove out of my way to pass by Taco Bell and it's the only fast food restaurant I frequent, and driving to the other one would have been faster if I had known this one would close early

I loved this place. I went here to clear up a late night craving and the employee who served me was surprisingly cheerful and friendly. Honestly, I left this Taco Bell with a smile, that cashier was one of the nicest people I've met. The food was delicious, the actual restaurant was clean and well kept. The whole area had a nice flow.
We used the drive-thru late at night. The staff was friendly and paid attention to every detail. The food was hot and delicious.

This is the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to. Our last visit they managed to mess up our order. We were told to call corporate to get things taken care of. We spoke to corporate that then sent us a coupon for 2 free items. Today we went to redeem our coupon where we were refused because they said it wasn't real. The GM Blanca made that decision. When I called to speak to a manager Cassidy or something similar answered the phone and said she had never seen the coupon before that's why they wouldn't accept it. I asked for the Gm's name. She said Blanca and then when I asked what her last name was she told me "she's the only Blanca here". How unprofessional. I asked for the corporate number where she proceeded to tell me that they were short staffed so I needed to go on my phone and get it myself and hung up on me. Well Cassidy from Taco Bell I will do you one better I will let everyone know that your Taco BELL is the most mismanaged Taco Bell, most unprofessional Taco Bell and the most ignorant to what customer service means. Corporate will receive yet another complaint. I expect to be contacted by the owner of this franchise because I will not tolerate being treated as an inconvenience to a food establishment.  If I could give no stars I would! Pathetic customer service!

Simple order: 1 chicken quesadilla. Received an uncooked (not undercooked, uncooked) cheese quesadilla. Just unmelted "cheese," taco bell magic sauce, and a sad and soggy tortilla. Waited 10 minutes in the drive through at 8pm on a Tuesday night. I've eaten at a lot of Taco Bells (I'm not proud) some good and some bad, but these guys seem like they aren't even trying. I would have called to complain but they didn't give me a receipt. Long story short, if you're in Boulder and craving some TB, think about your body. If you still decide you want some Taco Bell I recommend you find the ones on 28th or Baseline.

This location always seems super slammed day or night. So, just a warning... Make a lot of extra time if you plan to go through the drive-thru. The service and the food don't really stand out compared to any other location... Typical chain.
2 nights in a row, 20+ minute wait, wrong order. If they didnt have bushes next to the drivethru, I would have drove over the curb and gone somewhere else.  Never seen 4th in line take 20 plus mins

Late night eats, and the staff was friendly and fast. The gentleman working the drive-thru asked me to fill out a positive review that is offered on my receipt and I did.  So I'll one up him and give a 5 star review for the location on Yelp.

The food is really good and Taco Bell always has new specials. I definitely recommend this location for late night.
What can I say I've never seen such a slower bunch of workers I've seen snails move faster..... Ordered a cravings box 4 fucking items and it takes 25 minutes...... Hustle

I made my order at the drive-thru, no problem. I pay for my food and am then notified they are out of things for half my order. I asked for a refund for the items not available and they kept pushing me to order something else. I ask for the manager and get my refund with some hesitation. Being that I do not eat in the car, I get home (10min drive) and my XXL grilled stuffed buritto is cold and is about as stuffed as a quesodilla. There was barely ANYTHING stuffed inside the tortilla. It's 2:00 in the morning, I just got off work after a grueling, stressful day and I do not want to go back and have them remake my order. I do not recommend this Taco Bell unless you enjoy poor service and dismal quality food.

If I could give negative stars I would. This place is a waste of time and money. Everyone's order was wrong, there were no straws or napkins and the service is crap. Never again will I go to the closer Taco Bell. Next time I will just drive down to Barnes where they aren't rude and actually care to do their job correctly!

This Taco Bell is about double the size of a normal Taco Bell, rockin' that early 90's decor.  The service was somewhat slower than I would expect from a Taco Bell, considering they had two assembly lines running at 8pm on a Saturday.  

I ordered the Doritos Loco Tacos combo and a chicken soft taco.  The Loco tacos were lighter than normal on the meat; though the chicken was what was expected.  The lettuce (which they filled mostly with) wasn't fresh, with some of it gone brown. The amount of cheese was average.  Removing some of the lettuce (because of color), the taste was that as expected.  Trash bins were messy around them.  Overall, I have experienced better.

My husband and I just ordered dinner. The ground beef is RANCID. I'm sick and thank god my child didn't eat it. Smells like body odor, and tastes almost sour. We will be reporting to the health department.
Yelp doesn't know about the location at 7853 E. Colonial, 407 277 7453

Let's talk about Taco Bell.  It used to be reserved only for road trips and late night meals, but recently I have developed a love for Taco Bell anytime, anywhere.  The cheesy, meaty goodness of the crunch wrap supreme however uncrunchy it proves to be brightens my day in any situation.  Let's move on to the Dorito taco.  Why has no one thought of this sooner? Ridiculously good.  The chicken quesadilla also never ceases to amaze me with it's cheesy perfection and zesty baja sauce, clearly straight from the gods.  My final note is the props I give to TB for continuing to entice my soda pallet with handcrafted flavors like blue and red mixed with mountain dew.  Keep it up TB, if only you were locally owned you would have had that fifth star.

Chill staff, chill service. One of the cashiers is almost cute enough for me to come eat here more often, but Im not about to eat Taco Bell every day just for the off chance that I might happen to make small talkcfor thirty seconds with the cashier as she asksmy order. Especially since she probably works part time so I might eat like three days of Taco Bell before even getting my first chance to chat with her, and then when Ido so what? Id have to go like three more times to develop enough rapport to actually get anywhere.

Who reads a review on yelp for Taco Bell anyway? Toke some reefer, then get in a debate with your buddies about which local Taco Bell has the best service?

I go here at least 3 times a week just to get a drink and cinna twist today was a disappointment in the twist :( however I called and the general manager was great! Fixed it even gave me the name of the gentleman that is normally in the window TJ he is awesome! Very friendly and very funny. He makes my day just a little brighter. Thanks for the quick fix to my sugar needs :)
I've been here couple times. The bathroom is so dirty here and there's no papers for the seat.

Let me preface this by saying that I have a deep love of Taco Bell. 

That said, this is the worst Taco Bell I've ever, ever, ever been to.  They mess up the food every single time and the wait for counter service has been upwards of a half an hour... for FAST FOOD.

And if you sit too close to the bathroom it really smells.

The people who work there seem very nice but it's just not worth it.  Make the trip to the Taco Bell by the Fred Meyer on 82nd and Johnson Creek and even if you have to dive three times as far for it, you'll probably get your food faster and better.

Great food, fast drive thru, manager was very nice when I brought an issue to her attention. I was in the drive thru and asked the person at the window for 10 fire sauces. He seemed so inconvenienced by it, so what does he do? Puts 38 of the wrong sauce in my bag. Yes. 38. For 3 items. He knew what he was doing. Thanks a lot, Deandre. If it weren't for you, this would be a 5 star review.

This location is still on their bullshit. It doesn't take 1.5 hours to wrap up some preheated meats in a tortilla. And then on top of that only send you half your order. And is this how you're making tacos now, no meat, all lettuce and a pinch of cheese? This was supposed to be a Supreme. All 3 came like this. Wtf is you all's problem?
Absolutely rude, came in at 9pm on a Monday. Not busy in the slightest and it took them 5 mins to even acknowledge me. I've worked food service, it's not that hard. Wouldn't come back.

I arrived and drive thru was full so I came inside. It took over 30 minutes for my order and no manager in sight. I am a manager for applebees and we get well done steaks out in 15 minutes. Never contacted by corporate. Will absolutely NEVER visit this location ever again in life!!

Went through the drive thru and had the worst customer service ever. She was snotty and rude and argued when I asked about the black beans. Which apparently they do not have, even though it's on half their menu. Anyways Taco Bell, get some damn black beans! Also teach your employees to be respectful. I then called to speak to a manager and she was also very rude. Answers the phone just saying Taco Bell. I told her that whoever is working window is being rude and she also argued with me.
Meat proportions are great. Very busy place especially for the location. Friendly staff and courteous. Bathroom is moderately clean but no waste on the ground so that's a plus for me
Not much to say here.. I visited on a Sunday afternoon through the drive through, and received excellent service and above average food (as compared to a standard Taco Bell location).

I pulled in at about 11pm tonight and was hungry. Got as basic an order of the Chalupa $5 box and the cashier is telling "JESUS CHRIST!!" when I pull up to the window. I think, that's strange, but whatever. Then as I'm about to pull away, the line cook tells at me "FUCK YOUUUU!!" with the double birds. I didn't even do anything. Were you guys mad because you had to get off your behind? Don't recommend coming here, even if it's late and you're hungry.

I've seen some improvement since posting my last review. There are actually times when the drive through is not too bad. Of course, during lunchtime, dinnertime and weekends, it can get pretty slowed down. Just know ahead of time that this location is a hit or miss. 50/50.

Nancy who was the cashier and also manager talked fast and rushed me thru the drive thru. Told the young guy at the window and he seemed it didn't care he said it is what it is. very horrible horrible customer service at this location and they always seem to get the order wrong.
This is my 3rd time visiting this location. Always tasty food and very friendly service. Dining room was clean and well stocked.

I'm not sure why this location is getting bad reviews. I've been coming here occasionally for the last 10 plus years and have never had any issues. 
I've only used the drive-thru around lunch time and have never had to wait too long to get my food. My orders have always been correct and the employees friendly enough.
Sometimes I'm in a time crunch and need a quick meal...this is a great place to get it!

So we came in at 9:45 pm and I guess it was close to closing time would you believe that these people locked the doors with customers inside to my understanding all doors are to remain unlock during business hours ,that is a direct violation of the city fire code.

It appeared that they were more worried about getting out on time instead of worrying about customer safety, what if something would have happen and no one could get the door unlocked in timely fashion? whoever the manager on duty was needs to go back to training..Needless to say this speaks volumes of this store operations.. First and last time giving them any money.
Food tasted really good. They were really nice and fast. The cleanest Taco Bell I had ever seen.

90% chance your delivery will be messed up, if you order regular Mt. Dew I hope you like Baja blast, these idiots don't know the difference.  As always I blame it on the owner/mgmt...how sad is it when you're unworthy of a TB franchise???

OMG. I love this place. The service and good food are incredible.
I never regret Tarco  Revere

This is the worst Taco Bell in Austin!! 

 plus I asked for hot sauce and got fire then bean and cheese burrito with no onion and they gave me onion. It's cool tho I get it, it was a difficult order.
This place is a joke the service takes unbelievably long and  also forgets are food order.

Wanted the Chalupa box for $5. wanted to replace the twists with 2 pack cinnamon delights (both have a value of $1). Said they would take off the twists and add the 2 delights for $1 up charge. No thanks, great job manager on duty. Never again
I love Taco Bell! Can't go wrong with this place, 5 stars all day. Service was great and the food was perfect. Great look for the new location too

All three fresco tacos came with less than half filled with meat. Our cruchwraps were broken and folded into the bag like a taco cause all the inside ingredients to go everywhere. So damn disappointing. The lady at the window was CLEARLY intoxicated. No pride or care in your work.
Always had good experience. People and food consistently good and fast.  Nice location and parking.  Burrito Supreme my fav!

For the second time, my husband has received a burned crunch wrap. I guess I don't understand how you can clearly see it and still expect someone to just be fine with it and eat it like that? I called and complained and the lady told me I can come in another time and get a replacement one. I asked if she needed any of my info. She told me no she would "write it down" ok how does that help when they're going to just tell me no LOL. 
People want $15 an hour and can't even take the time to serve food correctly.

This location was very clean including the restrooms. Employees were friendly and professional. The order was correct and they had a large variety of beverages. The sauce/ condiment station was well kept and stocked. The food was hot and tasty. Thanks again!

It's Taco Bell, enough said. You know what to expect. But there are just too few people working in the store. It took roughly the same amount of time it would take to order a sit down meal tonight. Very disappointed Taco Bell. This is not the first time you've been understaffed.
Fantastic Taco Bell!!!  Christopher (cashier) was wonderful! Very fast and polite. The food came out before i could even turn the corner. Very happy!

Taco Bell is my fast food guilty pleasure.  That said, only go inside to eat.  PERIOD.  If you go through the drive-thru, they will 100% screw something up or serve you something old, stale and cold with hopes that you don't call and complain once you get home.  Something stupid has happened to us everytime we've used the drive-thru at this location.  It sucks because we drive out of our way to eat here because the William Cannon location is the poorest excuse for a Taco Bell in Texas.
I was on Saturday, April 20 at 11 pm and the service was the worst. We Wait one hour in the Drivethru. They must change the employees.

Taco Bell is a super fun place if you're feeling daring and want to play a fun new version of Russian roulette and are you gonna get explosive diarrhea or not. I should have learned by now that Taco Bell flu IS REAL, and when my friends say "I'm craving a crunch wrap supreme" I could just not go. But sadly my mom once asked me "if your friends jump off a bridge will you jump too?" and apparently the answer is yes because I ALWAYS tag along to get the Taco Bell and spend the rest of the night writhing in pain thinking I would know better by now.

I ordered a custom item and they got the no cheese part right but gave me a completely different taco not even the same meat that I ordered.  How does that happen?  They gave a me a hybrid chalupa w ground beef when I ordered a grilled steak soft taco.  Not even the right sauce.  Frustrating!

Taco Bell has been my favorite since I was a kid, and though they took out some of the crucial seasonings a few decades ago, their enchiritos and crunchy tacos are still above board. Always friendly and efficient service here also. Glad they are a staple in Beaverton.

Das erste Mal bei Taco Bell gewesen.
Wenn man neu ist, ist auch das Menü vollkommen überladen und ich hatte keine Ahnung, was ich nehmen sollte. Nacho Fries waren wieder da, also habe ich die im Menü versucht.
Die Speisen schmecken gut. Das Preis-Leistungs-Verhältnis ist noch besser. Trotzdem konnte ich mich nicht so richtig mit Taco Bell anfreunden.
Ein weiteres Mal komme ich auf jeden Fall noch.

Order: Everything normal, just one item without cheese.

What I got: Everything with ONLY meat and cheese.

Too bad they didn't give a receipt and their menu screen was out of order, because I couldn't even verify they heard the order correctly.

They make it really hard for me to believe in raising the minimum wage. Really hard.

Somehow they found a way to ruin Taco Bell. It tasted worse than hot pockets.

Don't go to this Taco Bell.
They suck! Bathroom is gross. Did not accommodate for anything I wanted, food came out 20 mins later and most of their employees just stand around!

Horrible quality, and higher priced just because it's sw Portland. As if that matters anymore because the area has gotten to be no better that se felony flats with all the drug addicted low life's. Tried the cheddar chalupa box here, that isn't $5's over here compared to anywhere else in Portland.. And it was greasy and burnt. I pulled more lettuce heart out of one taco than I've ever seen. This place is definitely one to avoid. I'd rather drive across the river to the Eastport plaza location next to Walmart than eat anything from this location again.. I had the same thing from se foster/Powell two days ago and it was good. The quality of food and service from this location has been poor since the day it opened. I wish I could give less than one star! 25 minutes in the drive through EVERY SINGLE TIME I go here. The order is never right. No reason for this lengthy of time. I drive 15 mins away to go to a different store to avoid it. Don't waste your time or patience

The best taco bell ever check them out!!!!!   I Always get the best service here the food is Always fresh and the staff is Always very happy!!!! And shout out to Lamar the best taco bell employee ever keep up the good work brother !!!!

This is the WORST location. I haven't had a good experience since they opened. Today was by far the worst. Only one car I front of me and I waited over 10 minutes for my food. If I could zero stars I would. Been 25 mins since I ordered food and I am still waiting on 2 combos

We were staying across the street from this Taco Bell and decided to stop in for a quick dinner at 8:00 on a Wednesday night. It was nothing but quick. We ordered at a mobile kiosk at 8:00 and waited and waited. We waited over an hour for our food in a never-ending line of customers. The staff was nice enough but they were obviously overwhelmed. 

Let me reiterate. We waited over an hour. For Taco Bell. Save yourself some time and eat somewhere else. I've never had an experience like this. Completely baffling.

Poor excuse for a fast food restaurant. It's Easter Sunday and I placed an order through Taco Bell's own website. It was about 9:30am and the website said they open at 10am today. Went to pick up my food that already has a pending charge in my bank account. I sit at the speaker for five mins or so, then pull up to the window, only to see a sign that says they will not open until NOON. Way to update your operating hours.

I call TB customer service and get a rude customer service associate by the name of Sarahi? (maybe, after numerous times of telling her I could barely hear her I still couldn't hear her).

She was nonchalant about the situation, blaming the lack of updated info on COVID when we all know restaurants cut the hours of line workers while management still works and gets paid....THERE IS NO EXCUSE FOR THIS AND THAT IGNORANT WOMAN DIDN'T WVEN APOLOGIZE.

Now, I need to watch my bank account to make sure the pending transaction falls off. 

I can't cancel the order, can't get my food, can't get any empathy or compassion. I will NEVER patronize YUM Brands as long as I live.

Yeah. a review on Taco Bell.... but get this.
 I order food, no drink. 
The voice says 'Would you like a drink?'
I say, 'No thanks' 
The voice says 'Can we get you a water?'    (pauuuuse, this is odd)
'No thank you'
I roll around to the window. Guy takes my money and says "Can I get you a water while you wait?"     
(uh, water to wait at Taco Bell?)
I say 'No, but thanks'
He turns around hands the bag out the window, thanks me with a big smile and I drive off confused and bewildered. I remember when drive-ups would get miffed when you asked for water snarking back 'you'll need to pay for the CUP!'

This is a new level of service right here. 
I agree with other reviews re friendly service, this place always has great people. No one seems to hate their job or YOU. 

p.s. those cinnamon balls of fried creamcheesey goodness? Yeah four of those have to be equal to eating a whole Blooming Onion!

Horrible. I ordered online and it did not notify me that the usual Taco Bell on fourth plain was completely closed, drive through didn't work or anything (which would've been nice to know) so I went to this one to see if they could get my order for me seeing as I already paid. I was furious and had to pay AGAIN for the same meal I bought previous.
I just bought a casadia and it's super cold, even cheeses are NOT MELT!! Don't give people bad food, just for to be fast!!

This is the worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. We waited almost 30 minutes to get our food. We should've taken the multiple people ahead is having to go back and get their orders corrected. When we finally got our order, we had missing items and food that wasn't how we ordered them. I can see if they were super busy, but it wasn't busy enough to excuse these errors. As I'm writing this review, there are two more people going up to get their orders fixed. Needless to say, this will be the last time we visit this establishment.

Horrible!!!!!!!!!!
Never enough employees..you have to order your food on the kiosk because theres no one at the cash register to take your order..then..after you order at the kiosk you cant get your drink until someone comes up front..by that time people are coming in and getting in line before you...so horrible and unorganized..my food took so long to come out. Horrible..Im never going back.

Really a low-level TB. EVERY time something is wrong, no napkins, no spork, no sauce. Stuff that makes my short lunch break more of a chore than a break. Today's failure was super-flat soda with maybe a tablespoon of ice. Just gross. The crew is always nice enough, but when they constantly mess up, it's just a drag. Won't be back.

Stopped here for a spontaneous meal of five regular crunchy tacos. The place was crowded, though clean and tidy, when I entered, but both electronic and inter-personal transactions were completed easily and quickly. Seven customers were ahead of me, yet my order was ready in five minutes. No complaints here, at least for this visit.

Your employees were smoking weed in the parking lot..... classy 

Check cameras 8:56pm 11/3/17

Like most people, I've been to many different Taco Bell's across different states and cities. You been to one, then you been to them all. But I was disappointed in this particular location because after leaving my hotel late night for a nacho bell grande craving, I had to wait behind about 7-10 cars in the drive-thru, only to be disappointed because half of my nachos were stale. The drive thru employee was pretty rude and not friendly. I won't use the "he's young" excuse because good customer service skills should translate no matter how young or old you are. It was very busy and he looked a bit stressed so I'll let him slide. They also forgot to give me hot sauce and a fork/spoon. It was especially frustrating because I wasnt staying at home but rather in a hotel so I had no options and had to just deal with it. 
Gotta do better folks!

I always feel just a little bit sleezy eating at Taco Bell, but I had a craving for those Doritos Tacos.  I mostly don't regret my decision.  

Can't really expect too much, and this location is serviceable.
Took us almost 15min from the order window to the pick up window. They didn't have anyone in their dining room. So what was the hold up!? Longest Taco Bell I have ever been to.

Good Mexican food is hard to come by, and I'd been meaning to try this cozy little adobe restaurant on the corner for years, but never got around to it. Their slogan "make a run for the border" was catchy, and their neon sign lit up the dark sky like a welcoming beacon, so one evening when it was late and I was hungry, I finally stopped in. Boy, am I glad I did! 

The menu here is chock full of a variety of choices that promised an authentic south of the border dining experience. The selection was so vast, in fact, I was feeling overwhelmed, and asked my waiter for a recommendation. We could not bridge the language barrier, however, because it sounded like he said "whatever you feel like, ash roll." I'll have to brush up on my Spanish for my next visit. After much deliberation, I settled on a Doritos Locos taco with  ground beef, and a pair of steak Chalupas. The taco was delicious, the tortilla satisfyingly crunchy, with a unique blend of orange-tinted spices and herbs that tasted vaguely familiar, though I couldn't quite place the flavor. The ground beef - I'm pretty sure it was USDA Prime Choice - was browned with a nice char, and seasoned to perfection. My taco came with julienned strips of iceberg lettuce, fresh diced juicy red tomatoes, a dollop of sour cream, and shredded, aged cheddar. The homemade salsa was served in a convenient little packet in which you tear off a corner and squeeze onto your food. This is both fun, and allows for excellent portion control. Not a drop of the fiery hot sauce went to waste. Like the taco itself, the flavors sang to me! At that point I was afraid the rest of my meal might pale in comparison, but there was no need to worry. The chalupas were every bit as divine. The chalupa shell managed to pull off the feat of being both crispy and chewy at once, testament to the chef's cooking prowess and knowledge of fine Mexican cuisine. It came with thick strips of marinated premium-quality steak - if I had to guess, I'd say it was Kobe beef - grilled to medium-rare perfection. The accompanying vegetables were every bit as fresh and tasty as those that were served with my taco. I washed down my meal with a golden, carbonated beverage that I believe is native to the Jalisco region of Mexico. Locals refer to it as "dew from the mountains," though I cannot recall its actual name. (Ask your server next time, but remember to brush up on your Espanol first)! The dessert specials looked enticing, especially the twisted Mexican doughnut (similar to a cruller) dusted in a sweet sugar and cinnamon blend and served piping hot, but I was too full to contemplate ordering anything else. Which simply gives me the perfect excuse to return here for another wonderful meal!

They say it is the little hole-in-the-wall restaurants that surprise and impress the most, and my experience at Taco Bell proves this to be true. I'm only disappointed that it took me so long to discover this hidden gem! I highly recommend it to anybody craving an exotic, wonderfully prepared multi-course Mexican meal. It's muy bueno!

This place is a joke. Went out tonight and ended up waiting for 40 mins in line for them to tell us when we got to the drive thru that they were close. BTW it was before 3am and we have been waiting forever. Even though Taco Bell is a shitty food environment, we were drunk and needed something to eat. Thanks for the shitty service not a shocker . Shitty service goes with your shitty food.
Really love this Taco Bell. The staff is very friendly and they never mess up our order. I can only name a few fast food restaurants in the area that actually do a good job and this is one of them.

This place is like no other!!

I am pretty sure that Taco Bell requires their employees to be to read. However, it seems as though they choose not to. 

We had an order for 5 people for dinner. The first thing that upset me was the man taking the orders. I thought I was being nice and helping by explaining that it was long order. He said "then come inside". I explained that I was disabled and that's why I was in tye drive thru to begin with. His response "yeah ok!" Said in a tone of yeah I don't believe you. After I ordered and paid it got worse. To start off, they forgot 3 cinnatwist. I was able to point that out before pulling away from the drive-thru window. That saved me time and gas and pain and aggregation of going back up there, or so I though. (Ended up going back anyway)Then when I got home, I passed out the food. 

Part of the order was 2 steak soft tacos with NO sauce. (They come with this advacado ranch sauce that I hate!) They both had that nasty sauce everywhere. I took them along with the bean burrito I ordered for myself back up there.  It took me about 3 mins til I was able to explain what happened. It took 16.48 minutes to the food replaced. Its a good thing I asked for a fresh burrito too. It would have been ice cold. There were no orders in the front at this time after I ordered. There were a lot of orders in the drive thru. They cleared that board before fixing my food. I did watch so that they couldn't do anything bad to it. (Spit in it or worse, never had it happen but have heard friends stories)

While I was waiting, 2 managers walked passed me. One went in the office and was chatting with another employee. The two of them had just come in from smoking together in the parking lot. Guess they weren't quite done with that conversation. No one asked if I had been helped. No one asked if I needed anything. No one gave a shit why I was standing there. 

This was the WORST customer service at a Taco Bell that I have EVER had in my life. I have worked customer service my entire life! I started out in tge drive thru at McDonald's when I was 16 yrs old. I'm now 50! 

There were many other days that we had issues too, this just pushed me over the edge! I will go out of my way to go to the Taco Bell on 75th st instead!
I have ate lunch here 3 times in the past 3 weeks. Food is always warm and their cooks are super friendly. Location is renovated and clean. One of the best Taco Bell's I have been to.

The quality of the food coming out of this location seems to vary almost by the minute.  There have been a few separate times where I have ate here 2 days in a row on the same shift. The shells ranged from greasy to stale. Also this location seems to have a real problem with special orders. I am allergic to guacamole so I always request my items without is it comes standard. 8 out of 10 times I have had guacamole on my order. Another example is a drive thru order I recently placed. I order a Mexican pizza no refried beans. When I got home I had refried beans on the pizza. Trying to call the store got me no where so I drive back and went inside and explained the problem. They remade my pizza and this time it got handed to me as no ground beef. I feel the staff needs to have some lessons in communication skills.

Got a sweet tea and left it in my car when i got home, so the next day i get in my car to head to work and decide to take the lid off and look at the drink and there was a big blob of spit floating at the top. I was so disgusted.

Honestly just done with this place. Have been buying Taco Bell here for a very long time just because it's the nearest location on the way home and I'm constantly reminded of how terrible the service here is. Even after the remodel, I constantly  see new employees but the fact that my order is filled wrong every single time with very simple changes just drives me up the wall. For example when I want a 5 layer with NO BEANS and extra nacho cheese, I get a NO CHEESE with EXTRA beans. And the receipt says otherwise.. 

This had happened at least 20 times since I've been coming here. Same story with my wife's and friends orders. They just constantly get the orders wrong. Big no no.

Employees of this location, WATCH ORDERS CLOSELY OR you'll continue to lose customers!
Literally the worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. I would never recommend anybody to this location.

Go to the revere location for far superior service, I came here to get dinner one night and I kid you not the dude working the register would go outside to his friends vehicle and get in to hang out like every 10 mins, I could not believe it, young high school kid, punk, whole order was incorrect
Waited 20+ minutes for two food items while people argued in the parking lot. After all that my order wasn't even correct. This place sucks.

Worst Taco Bell. The last time I was there, they said "long wait"... then the Manager just leaves. Employee has to refund like 20 people. No food for any of us. Then I give them one more chance, a week later, the restaurant part is locked and drive thru line is way too long. Nope.

The employees seem friendlier in the AM thru dinner rush. Since I moved over to this part of town, this is my go-to. Make sure you double check your food before leaving the parking lot, they shorted me a taco supreme. Other taco bell locations repeat the order, per contents in bags that they hand you.

This taco bell should be closed down, how are u gonna take peoples money and not give them everything they paid for. Ordered a #2 and 2 casadillas and a fritos burrito and they gave me 1 taco for my number 2 and 3 casadillas. Horrible service I wont be going here again nor recommend anyone go there. Tried calling and goes straight to voicemail. This place is garbage

I don't do a lot of fast food, but I have been st this location more than once, often late at night after being out and about.

Taco Bell is cheap and fast fast food. It's not real Mexican, but it is Taco Bell and this iconic brand has become a part of the American landscape. I guess my most often order is the Doritos Locos Taco, a guilty indulgence to someone who prides himself as a foodie and a fan of great Mexican cuisine.

Would I recommend here, hey, Taco Bell is Taco Bell, I don't think you need my recommendation, you either love it or you love it when you have a few drinks in you. Either way, you will end up here.

So disappointed..came here and they were out of beef. So I ordered a Mexican pizza with chicken she said it wouldn't be a problem. After I left I realized they forgot my drink. When I got home the Mexican pizza looked terrible there was no sauce or tomatoes on it and the chicken wasn't in it..it was dumped on the top just on one side. I wasn't expecting much but seriously?? Awful!!! Never coming back.

I've had a few less than satisfying experiences at this location, but tonight topped the cake. While waiting 15 minutes to order, being the car behind the person ordering, I thought that maybe they didn't know what they wanted and where taking their time. That being frustrating alone, when I pulled up I quickly figured out that wasn't the case. I waited an additional 5 minutes before I could even order, and got a less than pleasant manager rudely taking my order. Finally got to the window, nobody in front of me as around the corner, and it takes forever to get my food. When I noticed my burrito was missing and told the girl at the window, she told her loud mouth manager in the back who processed to YELL from the back,"you better check that order." I could see everyone inside look over at me, which was highly embarrassing. Once she realized she misread my order, I got my burrito and left. Upon arriving home, I noticed literally everything was wrong. Everything that was asked to be left off was put on there, and everything was stuck to the top of the container. WORST experience at any Taco Bell I've ever been to.

OK- So it's Taco Bell....  What am I really expecting here?  The lack of stars are not for mediocre food.  It's Taco Bell for heaven's sakes.  I come here BECAUSE of the mediocre food.  The lack of stars is for the lack of EVERYTHING ELSE.
I searched high and low.  I could not find the customer service anywhere.  Maybe it was hidden in the bag with my caramel apple empanadas??  NOPE!!  Because those were mysteriously lacking as well.  Forget them once again did we?  YES!
They will offer you 6 handfuls of saucy packs but forget 1/2 the damn food you ordered to put those cute little saucy packs to work!
I suggest a re-vamp on the service training.  Umm- Give me a second to see the damned menu please!  Attitude + Take-Out Window makes me want to literally Drive Thru the side of the damned building.  The caveat here is that not ALL Taco Bell's have the same lack of everything.  A little further away, kinda on the Chelsea/Everett line, across from a quaint KFC and delish Chinese place is a Taco Bell worth a little more than this one.
Do yourself a favor.....
If you are thinking outside the box, head to Taco Bell in Everett!
Worst service EVER...placed my order then had to wait 20-30 minutes to get to the window. If you're going to be open you need to get it together!!! Would be 0 stars if that were an option.

I'm not one to even post reviews on here but I just thought I would say, I just had some of the best Taco Bell ever. I use to work for the company at a store in another state. The food we provided was good but this location was awesome. He was really warm when I was eating it and very tasty and up to Taco Bell food standards. Great location!!!

Stopped by late night after a long day. Just wanted a quick bite. Flew in from NYC for the week. Went through the drive thru Janilia S was soooo nice. Although it was only drive thru. She was sweet and explained why certain items were no longer available. And was still patient after a billion last min changes in the order (my gf smh). That usually doesn't happen in NYC. Give her a raise!

This Review is going to be shorter than my usual style. This Tacobell location is spot on in terms of consistent quality and order speed, but has one glaring weakness that is starting to strain HEAVILY on my desire to eat with them. And that's Sour Cream.

Whoever owns that store must be the Sour Cream man. He's likely got super powers to put sour cream on every taco and burrito within 30 miles. He instills this same cultish behaviour into every single employee he hires and forces them to chant the Sour Cream motto (In Cream we Trust) before allowing them to clock in.

I fucking hate sour cream.

Why do they put sour cream on EVERYTHING even though every time I tell them NO sour cream! It's on my receipt! You read it back to me! Why in the FUCK is there sour cream?!

My husband and I have resorted to stressing no sour cream on these items, but it doesn't help.
Really?!?!! Never enough meat on anything honestly. And I KNOW it is not corporate standard because this location is the only one I have had this reoccurring issue at!

One star cause no stars is not an option. Been stopping here on and off for several years. This location has never been the cleanest, and service is typically slow. About 2 weeks ago i stopped in the mens bathroom was filthy. The sinks were literally black. Toilet paper was all over the floor. The softdrink overflow tray was about full to the point of running over, and looked like scum. But everybody has a bad dsy stopped in again few days later it was a little cleaner. Typical wait for someone to take my order. Was then informed we can't take cash. So i left and will not be back!

I went through the drive through and they gave me the wrong order. I asked for hot and mild sauce and he said it was in the bag.. I kind of knew it wasn't because I hadn't asked for sauce yet but I took his word for it because I could tell he was annoyed by me asking and then I got home to see there was no sauce at all and they gave me rice burritos when I ordered beefy five layers. I just ended up throwing it away ):

I can't say I've ever been to a worse Taco Bell in my life.
Scratch that, I can't say I've ever gone to a worse Fast Food Restaurant in my life.

Taking in the quality of the place, you don't expect much. That was until the day they RAN OUT OF GROUND BEEF. Can you name anything on the typical order from this place that doesn't include ground beef?
Another time I had walked into the store, stood at the counter for two minutes, then they  told me they were closed and I would need to do drive through, apparently they forgot to lock the store up in time. The question was, why couldn't they just honor my order there instead of making me go back in my car and wait in the drive thru line? I've never seen slower service. Fast (keyword Fast) food people, I could always cross the street to Taco Time and maybe I would but Taco Bell keeps the market on unusually late hours for this kind of greasebucket feeding frenzy. It'll kill me to say that I may once again come back here out of sheer desperation for that late night chalupa but I will not enjoy it.

My family and I were staying at a hotel across the street and wanted a late night snack after having some drinks with friends. They were not extremely busy but had several customers making their orders and or waiting for orders. The wait was not long at all and the order came out very fast as well. The service received was great and the food was very satisfying.

Whenever Taco Bell comes out with something new, I have to try it.  So my wife suggested she stop on the way home to pick up the new Naked Chicken Chalupa.  The chalupa is composed of a deep fried chicken patty that has been shaped into a taco shell.  It is filled with cheese, lettuce, tomato and avocado-ranch dressing.  It's tasty enough on its own; but, by force of habit, I added the Fire Sauce.  At $3 each, it's a bit pricey for Taco Bell; and, you definitely need 2 to fill up.  I'm still not sure whether we'd order them again; but, am sure glad I got to try one today!

I went to this location today for lunch.  I ordered nachos and a shredded chicken burrito and a drink.  the woman on the speaker asked me what kind of meat I wanted on my nachos.  I let her know, beef.  when I got to the window the guy there tried to verify what I was getting.  so I told him.  he says, so you got an order of chips and cheese and a shredded chicken burrito?  I told him no, then repeated myself.  he then says oh so cheese and chips with a soda?  I told him nope.  he I let him know again I ordered nachos with beef and a shredded chicken burrito with a soda, he replies again so then chips and cheese and a shredded chicken burrito.   I told him that is not right.  I got a nacho with beef then added a drink and shredded chicken burrito.  he then repeated it back wrong once more.  I told him no.  that is not what I said and not what I ordered.  he wanted me to repeat it again.  I asked for him to get a pen and paper since he cannot remember or let me talk to another person. 

after some time we finally figured out that what I wanted was called a nacho supreme + shredded chicken and a drink.  he hands me my food but does not ask for my card to pay with.   he said, oh don't worry about it I paid for it for you cuz of the issues.  I told him that was nice but I would like my receipt so I can take the survey.   he refused to give me one saying that since he waived it there was no receipt.  I then told him to charge me for what I ordered and tried to give him my card.  he said no there is nothing to charge you for now.  I tried to order more food then so he could charge my card and he said I would need to go get back in to the drive through line if I wanted to order more since there are other people trying to order food.  

I can say I was not going to go wait in line.  so I am leaving my survey here.

this taco bell has easy access off the highway even room for truck drivers to use the drive-thru,... always friendly and fast service,... the bathroom and dining areas are always clean and the food is 100% taco bell yum yum,...

I never review places 1 star, especially fast food as I never expect the best service but I was absolutely appalled at the service. Don't go here if you don't eat meat. I've been a long time Taco Bell fan and love coming here since it's cheap, yummy, and very vegetarian/vegan friendly. However today I tried to order a beefy frito burrito and replaced the beef with beans and they WOULD NOT do it without charging me extra. Absolutely ridiculous. It left a bad taste in my mouth about the whole company.
The staff at this location is great, Connor was very welcoming and nice and the food is better than any location I've been to :-)

Yo, ok he's the deal. Just went to this Taco Bell and the late night crew totally killed it (in the best way!)
I usually don't go to this location because of missing items or messed up orders in the past but it was AMAZING this trip. 

The dude at the window and his coworkers were super sweet and polite, got the orders out quick with three cars in line and everything tasted awesome. 

Also window man, your dog sounds awesome. We had ours with us at the drive up and he agreed, best Tacobell we've ever had.

I really like this Taco Bell. I don't eat a lot of fast foods, but I love Taco Bell. I always order vegetarian and I have never had an issue with this place getting my order right. It is fast, easy and convenient as I hit it a couple times a week on my way home from work. The employees are professional, and I usually have my meal within under 5 minutes.

Look, I get that it's Taco Bell, but the cashier had his pants down below his ass. The food was pretty good, but I got an item incorrect. The staff was quick to replace the item, so that's all good.

Also, there was just randomly a guy with like a full office setup, a full days worth of fast food wrappers, a dog, and a big ass knife on his belt. Like... What??

PROS: This is the best Taco Bell I've been to in Austin. The staff are usually happy, courteous, and friendly. They all seem to enjoy working here. They've all been helpful, too.  My order is usually correct. The store and staff are clean. I live nearby so this is the one I frequent.  **CONS:  tonight they were out of taco salad shells and guacamole.  I ordered a burrito which they forgot to bag. They didn't answer the phone. I drove back, waited in line and had to reorder. I asked for an upgrade item for the inconvenience.  I didn't get it.  Not cool... especially when doing Game of Thrones night emotional eating.

This place is fast food at fine dining speeds.

You may have noticed the other reviews saying this place is slow. You might be thinking, maybe it took someone ten minutes to get their food. Maybe they were just a little busy. It's a Taco Bell. How bad can it be?

I like Taco Bell. I won't go back to this one. It's on my banned restaurants list. I called it quits the last time I was here and it took me an hour to get my food. Literally. A literal hour. For a few burritos and tacos. And that's an hour from the time I ordered. The drive thru has always been bad here, but I figured if I placed my order online and walked in, I could get around that. Nope!

From the hour I had to observe the whole process, I think I figured out why. Everyone here seems very nice. But only a few people are working at any one time. And they're not very quick. Everything is made slowly one item at a time.

They also don't make the food in order. Uber Eats orders? Front of the line. They'll work drive thru in after that. Eat in orders last. If they're slammed by Uber Eats? No food for you. You're going to have to annoy them at the counter to even get them to start on your food. Even if you're into the drive thru, prepare to sit for a long while.

And just to be clear, my hour wait was my breaking point. But this place is always _slow_. Half hour, at least, most of the time for drive thru.

I don't know what they need to do to fix this place. But I've literally tried to track down where I could send feedback to Taco Bell corporate about this place which is definitely not something I thought would ever be something I would actually spend time doing.

We usually do drive thru and never have issues but tonight we decided to eat in. Katrina was our cashier and amazing at her job. She offered whatever help needed to make our order better, we talked about the taco Bell catina and she told us a bit about their menu and drinks. She was very knowledgeable about the company in general. My boyfriend and I watched her interact with the other customers after us and she was so happy, helpful and fun. I asked her name before she left because I wanted to write this review and let her and you at taco Bell know that she is definitely an asset to your company and an amazing employee.  Great Customer service and being genuine will always have customers coming back.

This Taco Bell used to be their flagship store. I don't know what happened there. Maybe it's Sunspots. An eclipse of the Sun, Or the earth has shifted on it's axis. Perhaps, it's the first day for the person making the food. First, they were out of the new double crunch taco. I asked the girl, what's up. She told me they ran out.. Of what, I don't know. Taco meat? taco shells? Of is it they don't want you to order on their dollar menu? 
This place smells like franchise. And, whoever took it over, is a penny pinching scrooge. I got something else, and for my partner, she wanted  a grilled seven layer burrito. Hold the cheese. extra pico. Is that difficult?  What we got was little more than a bean burrito. No rice, not grilled, it had no discernible, sour cream, or anything else. It was sparce almost thin as a pancake.
So, I went back into the store and I asked them, showing them this and asked them, what 'this' was? I showed it to the cook and the manager. I thought it was an honest mistake. i felt perhaps they'd do the right thing by making me another one for her, since she didn't get her seven layer. They assured me that it was a seven layer burrito. .I guess, the customer isn't right anymore. Believe me when I say,
 it wasn't a seven layer buritto. 
More like a sparcely filled bean buritto. 
 Was this a bad joke. Were we being pranked? It felt like it. But, no  grinning host came out to have us point into their camera.  I went back outside and talked it over with my partner, and decided since she was hungry, I'd go back in and order for her,                                                 another seven layer buritto. Again no rice. no tomatoes. It had lettuce, a pinch of pico and beans, and a  small dollup of guacamole. it again, was dollar menu thin and virtually tasteless. All it was was some beans, lettuce. a drizzle of pico, and guac. few onion bits. All my gal could taste was some beans and lettuce. It was a thousand miles from being a seven layer burrito. We thought we'd try this location one more time. but, again, it was disappointing and the tall manager should train his line cooks better, or be in some other line of work, because he certainly isn't in the customer service business.

Stopped here for a quick dinner on the way home from work. It was late and had to grab the kids a burrito and a taco, not the healthiest, I know. Got home and the adults food was in the bag but the kids wasn't. This being one of the few times I didn't check before driving off, I was greatly disappointed. The icing on the cake was that I called the number for 20 minutes and no one answered. I called a sister store down the street just to see if it was a line issue but they answered promptly. They advised me to call again. Someone finally answered and when I started my complaint, they hung up on me. It's not about the money, but the customer service. I will be calling corporate tomorrow.

Taco Bell is my go to fast food but this location messes up your order so often. My last three orders (spread over the last two months) have missed drinks or cinnamon twists or sides that I have ordered. I always feel bad to stand there inside and count everything in front of them but I guess I'll start doing that.
This taco bell location specializes in making orders incorrectly.  If you want your food made just the way you don't like it, I'd recommended swinging by.

I never eat Taco Bell, but was feeling cocky.  Wife and kids offered to go and I went back to my old trusty go to...Chalupa Supreme.  Buuuuut you failed to put it in the bag with the rest of the order.

I feel silly knocking on Taco Bell but for real....

This place is TERRIBBLE!! I went there at 1:30am after a long shift at work looking to get a quick meal. When I first pull up to the drive through I ask the lady there to give me a second to look over the menu and she said 'I guess' and sighed heavily. Then I placed my oder and pulled around to the window and was greeted by a very rude lady- didn't even try to be nice. I ordered the Variety Taco Party Pack or whatever it is called and when I got home I found out that I actually just got  a bunch of regual tacos. Then after further investigation over half of my tacos were smashed and broken. This is absolutely the worst service I have ever received, enough for me to write a review. I WOULD NEVER RECOMMEND GOING HERE, McDonalds is better than this, at least  the people at McD are nice.

This location is one of the worst. I am constantly waiting forever, the staff always have attitudes and the food is cold and stale. I've had several times where I'm in drive thru and getting my food and I'm being given attitude for no reason. I used to work fast food so I try and be extra polite to customer service workers and every time I come to this location, I'm the one being given eye rolls and tone when I'm trying to order. Tonight, for example, I pulled up to the drive thru, no one in line. I waited and maybe heard a distant whisper of "hello". After sitting there for a few minutes and asking if anyone was there a few times, I grew upset. I used a slightly annoyed tone and received one back. While ordering, she continued with her snarky and impatient tone. When I finally pulled up to the window, she greeted me with the same attitude and even yelled something out to the kitchen staff with the same tone. She didn't return for a good 7-10 minutes. She didn't tell us how long it would be, check in on us, nothing. Not a word after handing my payment back. When she handed me my food, nothing had changed. Not only do I receive horrible service like this every time I go but when I got home, less than 5 minutes later, my food was cold and stale. I know a few people who run into these problems with this location as well. Mill plain and highway 99 are my go to's for Taco Bell. It's almost worth the extra 20 total minutes of travel time to get decent service.

I mean, I've given many chances to this place, but this is the cherry on top, parents need to be aware, this is the second time I've had a bone such as this in my damn burrito, there's no excuse for that.

Oh my god. So my boyfriend went to this location and came home with a black bean crunchwrap supreme for me. Not only was there almost no beans in it, it was basically like 90% tortilla and lettuce, but he asked for guacamole with it. He got charged for it only for them to not put any guacamole in it. Honestly, what is wrong with this location? I've never been to a fast food place that was this bad.

Had me repeat my order 2x and they still got it wrong. Couldn't eat what I got so I ended up tossing it. I usually don't waste time writing a review but I have a fever and haven't been out in 3 days. This is all I've been craving and it's my 3rd time at Taco Bell and all 3x my order has been wrong. So it safe to say that I will not be dining at this location again.
2 stars on a bad day, plus 3 stars on a good day, equals 5 stars every day. They also got that blue Mountain Dew Baja Blast so you can drink that while you fill up your guts, baby!

This location ruined my order. I drove all the way to Vancouver to find out they gave me a Diet Pepsi . When I called and told them they made a error they said I was lieing and I had to wait to Monday and hung up in my face I had to wait to talk to manager. He was s bigot and from my first to my last interaction was nothing but bad news. And a complaint has been filed

5-stars for a great breakfast.  I had the Breakfast Crunchwrap, with just the sandwich.  My wife had the combo with a Hash Brown Patty, Bacon & Scrambled Egg Burrito, and Regular Coffee.  Omeica C was friendly and personable, service was quick, everything was cooked to order and tasted great.  Great Breakfast!

I came here just to review this taco bell because I've been here 5 times. This, every single time, has been the slowest drive thru line I have ever been in in any state, in any city, in any country, in my life. Each time it seems longer than the time before. I've been in this taco bell line for 25 minutes before and still wasn't at the window. Once, okay, it happens, two, a fluke, but FIVE TIMES....are there not any other taco bells within driving distance, or are they just that slow? I give it 2 stars because at least my order is usually right. This time, I watched an entire episode on Hulu on my phone and still had time to type this review. Still sitting in line, as per usual. I think this will be my last visit to this establishment. Nobody has enough time on their hands, especially when they're choosing a place partly based on it being FAST. FAST. FOOD. I've ordered from big chain restaurants and had chefs finish my order and in the bag waiting for me in less time than it takes to get my food here. Something's gotta change, manager of taco bell on Powell Blvd. Jeez!!! This is absolutely ridiculous!

It's is now 12:30 am, we swung by and the little girl at this place said they weren't serving food! This place closes at 3 am.... wow!!! Smh if you hate your job so much just quit find your happiness!

Ugh. Taco Bell come on. It is EVEN easier than ever before to work in fast food with a printer that prints out EXACTLY what someone orders. To not get it right, time and time again should mean that a better quality staff needs to be hired. This is a consistent issue at this store and conveniently no one ever answers the phone at their customer service. If you don't mind having to go back, and dealing with constant issues, then by all means go to this store. Otherwise, don't waste your time.
I love you guys but why do you ask if I want sauce if you aren't gonna give me sauce?? 2 drive thru visits in a row now you ask me and i say "yes, hot sauce please." and I don't get any. :P
Ordered a Crunchwrap, grilled cheese burrito, and a nacho crunch double stack... all had little to no meat in there... sad... this has been happening to 90% of my orders...

I'm literally sitting here eating and I hear this guy come in because they forgot something of his order and they were giving him a hard time about something. Then my dad was talking about how he didn't really care for his nachos because the beans were burnt and then half way through realized the chicken he ordered wasn't on there. The next thing you know this little girl is going up to the cashier and saying "there's something crunchy in my burrito I think there's onions" and then the lady who didn't even make it straight up told the girl "no honey I didn't put onions in your burrito" and so the mom had to go up and tell them they did. So now there's one guy, my dad and a little girl complaining about their food to these people meanwhile the cooks are basically telling them/us tuff luck plus the first guy still waiting on his food. So my dad asked for the manger and she had some stupid excuse about how she was busy... which being a manager myself is no way ok to tell a customer specially when there are groups of people up front that have problems with their order. My dad dropped it and walked way and turned around just in time to see her disrespect us with her body language.Then shortly after that, a guy came up and tried to tell my dad off saying he works here and he needs to stop before he calls the cops! Anyway. There was soo much poor quality about this experience in such a short amount of time. Come on guys it's Taco Bell, can't be that hard! To top it off after everything was settled that same little girl went up, peaks over the counter and says "excuse me theres onions on my burrito"  even though this was a bad experience my dad, sister and I are cracking up over the whole situation. Gotta love good ol' Taco Bell, And little girls with guts!!

I don't know why my husband insists on eating at this Taco Bell when we travel along interstate 70. There is never any customers here and service is slower than a sloth on ambien. Now they have installed screens to order on rather than actually talking to a cashier. Our order took forever to be finished and then two more trips to the counter to get it corrected.

This place ALWAYS closes earlier than they are supposed to, several hours earlier at times. I'm tempted to report them because who knows what else they aren't doing that could end up causing food poisoning etc. DO NOT GO HERE!

The worst service. Every time I come here I sit in the drive thru for way too long. This is not fast food. They always have new people working and nobody knows what they are doing and they dont understand that it's fast food or something. It's the closest food to my work so sometimes I have no choice but to come here but I regret it every time after sitting in the drive thru for so long. It shouldn't be this difficult

Talk about bad service. Pull up order taker doesn't say anything till I said  "Hello?" Then he said "Well, what do you want?"  I replied "How about courteous service?" He then repeated his first sentence. I'll save money by not going back.
Awful. Small portions and employees very apathetic. Wish we would have gone to a different Taco Bell.

Asked a cashier if she can clean a dirty table off she got defensive and another worker named Brandi asked me what the issue was and took care of it! Brandi has superior customer service! We need more people like her in this world!
