Thirty mins for 3 tacos! What a joke this place is. Service was the worst I have ever seen. 9 people and only two really working. The rest standing around looking lost. And they want $15 an hour. No way!!!

Just gotta say that Rick (I hope I caught his name right) is the most accommodating, helpful, and friendly employee I've ever had at any Taco Bell location. Not only did he make my food quick and efficient, he also came out to make sure my complex order was correct BEFORE making it. I have had numerous orders, both large, small, simple, and complex be messed up consistently, but not here. Always great for a quick meal. Rick needs a raise.

Terrible parking is the first thing. Employees are nice but not trained and very unaware. On this visit ground beef was so watery it soaked through any type of soft shell or hard taco shells. Disappointing. Will not visit this location again plenty other locations within a mile.

I have never seen any Taco Bell ever so inefficient in my whole life. Being a fairly regular customer at this joint, I was terribly offended when I was treated like a trash bag. Seriously Katy Perry was right when she said "do you ever feel like a plastic bag" was basically the same way I felt in this Taco Bell. Acting as if the customer was not there really was the breaking point for me. They were talking in the back room like I was not present. I have been also through the drive through which also takes such a long time. Taco Bell overall is a great fast food joint however this specific restaurant is not worth your time. Save your respect and go to another Taco Bell.

This is the second time I have been through and order meals for a few people and it's not that the order was wrong, but they have charged me for my order and didn't fill the order. Tried to go to Taco Bell's website but they must have low standards cause you can't send them a message. I was already regretting the dinner choice, but getting screwed over after waiting 20 minutes in the drive through is BS. I'll be sure to find their nearest competition and gladly give them my business. How hard is it to do your job???? Also, big shout out to the corporate side of the business, I'd also hide if I had a failure rate that high.

Im currently sitting in the Taco Bell drive through where I have now been for thirty minutes because this location decided to put a sign that don't take cards once you pull up to order. There are cars in front of me. Cars behind me. I'm physically stuck in this line all because the employees didn't think to put a sign at the ENTRANCE of the drive through. The car in front is currently honking at the window to get the attention of the employee because I assume their order is wrong. So attentive. The best part? When I pulled up to the window the employee asked me to pay for food I didn't order because I couldn't order???? I don't expect five star dining from a drive through, but I did expect common sense and a quick trip. The entire point was to be quick so I could get back home to my sick husband.
Terrible attention to ordering kept giving me beef crunch wrap supreme when I kept coming back and ordered chicken. If they weren't open late I'd never come back
They had no ice. Bathroom was dirty. Service was sub par. Wouldn't recommend coming here. Expectations are low for Taco Bell but this one is way worse
Great experience, manager was a super friendly older gentlemen. Made sure everyone was happy with their meals. Clean fast exactly how TB should be. Thanks

All I keep thinking to myself is why would I possibly write a review for a fast food joint such as Taco Bell, especially since my last review was for a 5 star luxury hotel. 
Boy folks I have downgraded, nonetheless this review is very necessary. 
After working really long 15 hour days i'm starving and just need something in my belly. 
Taco Bell is the only "fast" food I will eat. I put fast in quotation marks because this location is far from fast. Expect to wait a minimum of 15 minutes. 
The last time I went was by far the worst. 
There was only one car in front of me but he seemed to be having an issue and was yelling at the lady as he was ordering. So it took about ten minutes to even get my order taken. Waited another ten for the food. 
It was a teenage girl working who clearly thought she was way to good for the job and her attitude was showing all around. 
She handed me the bag, but I asked her if there was any sauce in the bag. 
She said no, you didn't ask for any sauce (of course with a snarky attitude). 
Okay, anyone who ever goes to any Taco Bell can back me up on this one. They always ask you what kind of sauce you want when they have your order in their hand. 
As I drove away the car line increased to over ten cars, all I was thinking was good luck you will be there a while. 
Got home with my tbell, opened my potato taco to put some sauce and there was 4 tiny scraps of potatoes. What the heck! And I had two more potato tacos the same way. If you are out of potatoes just tell me and I will order something else, don't give me the bottom of the barrel garbage. 
This is a very convenient location right on Barbur that is on my drive home but if I'm ever working late and need some food, I'm definitely passing on this location. 
Snarky teenagers, long waits, and half filled tacos are not my thing. 
Thanks but no thanks!
The girls during the day are rude and always rushing me, but the guys late at night are super nice!

I wouldn't usually review a place like Taco Bell, (fast food places I mean), but I felt I had to. First off the bad, only thing is the music playing. It's like R&B old school soul. Not my first choice of music, (guessing by the area, I'm guessing not many customers first choice). Other than that, nothing else bad. Now the good, around 7 customers came in after me, (I ate here), and all were served as fast as I was. That's great. I mean, it is fast food after all. Lamar Lopez worked the register and is a great guy. Awesome attitude, very attentive, just an all around great guy. Food tasted freshly made, (not usual for a fast food place). All in all, a great Taco Bell location.
Every time I eat at this place I get so sick I am put in the hospital and miss a week of work the last time i I was here I went septic a couple days later.

Horrible food!!! You risk getting food poisoning or cold, stale 2 day old food. Avoid unless you want to be pooping for 2 days. Doesn't do any good to complain to management unless you want to make another trip and spend 30-45 minutes arguing. Reporting Health/Food Inspectors of Austin. I've only been twice and that's plenty for me. 
Check your order before leaving. Always cold food and wrong order.

These guys couldn't even get 1 crunchy taco right! 10 minutes while I stared at my made single taco sitting on the counter waiting to be handed to me. The guy finally hands it to me and it had sour cream on it. That's what you get when you employ a bunch of high school drop outs...
Worst/slowest service I've ever seen. I work in food service industry and this is not acceptable. 24 minutes wait with 2 people in front of me. Drive through lady needs to get better at multitasking.

i absolutely LOVE each and every one of the workers there. they are all insanely sweet and patient- even when the drive through line is down the street and theyre busting out orders. literally wish i was that patient.. they all deserve raises

This location is insanely slow. Everytime my fiancé and I come here we always talk about how something must be wrong. Idk if it's bad management, lazy staff, slow equipment or what but the line literally wraps around the building EVERY time I pass here. It's FAST FOOD! Why is Taco Bell taking this long? We usually just get a simple taco and even when we're at the window we're waiting for atleast 10 min. (Not the 35 min wait before getting to the window) There's never been a time I waited less then 35 min in the drive through sometimes longer. The thing is, there's so many workers inside.. it's just so SLOW!!

I am extremely repulsed by the way that the crew members of this Taco Bell represent their company. We understand that this particular TB is always busy, usually because they are short staffed, and pulling into the drive thru after a 10 hour shift at our respected jobs, my boyfriend and I were willing to wait.  My first issue is the girl that took our order completely walked away from the window when we pulled up, not only did we have to wait over 10 minutes for our food, we saw 3 girls dancing around in the window, not sure what they were trying to do to distract the one guy in the kitchen. But when we got home just a 3 minute drive away, everything was cold. The ground beef was definitely not up to temp when it was made into soft tacos. The Mexican pizza had spilled all its ingredients in the box, to the point where nothing was actually on the pizza its self. The chicken chalupas had pico de Gallo on them, which I asked for plain tomatoes. And the loaded potato griller was so flat it resembled a panini, not a small burrito. Why should I come to Taco Bell and spend my hard earned money after a long day when your associates can't even take directions clearly. You have completely lost faithful customers because of the nonsense of your employees.

I would give it 0 stars but it's not an option. This is the WORST Taco Bell we have ever been to. Today, my son and his friends waited for 25 minutes to get their food and they didn't even get the accurate order. 
The service here always takes an astronomical amount of time. We came once 35 minutes before closing and they had locked the door and walked away after they made eye contact.

This is a typical Taco Bell the service is ok and the speed of the order is not to bad.  Sometimes there isn't someone to take your order and you can wait a little while to get it in, but 70% of the time it's usually pretty good.

i love this place. i feel happy and welcomed into this place. i want to be this place. you can be wearing anything and wont get judged. i love everything about this place. go to this place. its amazing. 


y wasnt i invited to the taco bell resort. thats a secret ill never tell. i know you love me. xoxo gossip girl.

I feel bad writing this but I have to give a PSA: don't come here if you expect it to be fast. I sometimes want a snack while i'm waiting for my bus transfer. Don't do it if you want to avoid anxiety. 

I just waited more than fifteen minutes for a bean and cheese burrito. Almost missed my bus, and they didn't get my order right. It has rice and the wrong kind of cheese (nacho, no thanks). 

I wished I could have walked through the drive through since they so clearly prioritized drive through orders far and above the people in the restaurant. I understand that to an extent, but they must have made five hefty to go orders before they started my SIMPLE AS CAN BE one. 

The people are really nice and friendly and they offered me a drink or dessert to apologize for the wait, but I'm trying to run after and not be **completely*** unhealthy so I didn't even take it. 

The point of fast food restaurants is that they're fast and reliable. This one needs improvement, because they didn't satisfy any of the reasons I went there in the first place. Again, staff is super nice and understanding. They just need either more employees or more strategy from above.

Amazing service from the minute I walked In.. which is very rare in a fast food restaurant. There was a customer (a grumpy old man) that had an issue on his last visit, the manager who was already helping in the food line, overheard the issue and immediately jump to the front and catered to this man. This man was a royal pain in the ass, however the way this manager handled it was absolutely amazing. Her attitude, her demeanor and her aiming to please was witnessed by the whole dining room.  As hard of a time that he gave her, she did nothing but Please Please Please this man. Just to witness the way she took care of him, I had to give this restaurant, this manager, an awesome review.. I will definitely be back for the return of the awesome customer service. Yajaira you belong around people!!!

Worst taco bell of all time.  Been in the drive thru line for 20 minutes without moving. I can't even leave because there are cars in front of me and behind me.  I'm literally imprisoned at taco bell.

This happened last time and I though it was a fluke, why did I do this again?

Destiny at the Revere Ma location is a total gem. Pleasant, friendly and professional..The drive thru totally messed up my order so I decided to go inside to get it fix and thats when I met Destiny she apologized and quickly took charge and didn't make me wait behind all other orders she totally deserves acknowledgment and a raise...

This is the ONLY TB I've visited that is ALWAYS OUT OF SOMETHING. 

Recently it's  been boxes for combos, fire sauce, Dr. Pepper, or something else.

Today? G2.

How the hell can this ONE restaurant ALWAYS BE SHORT OF SOMETHING?!?!

I know they have changed managers, but apparently that means nothing at all.

If you want a 5 star dining experience then go somewhere else, okay. It's Taco Bell. I don't get why so many people complain about fast food because you're not paying for a lavish experience so don't expect one. That being said Taco Bell is my guilty pleasure and the people at this location are generally very friendly. Sometimes when the drive through is packed they mess up an order but if you check it before driving off and tell them they're usually very polite and they quickly fix it. As far as the inside goes the soda fountain area could be a bit cleaner but it's certainly not going to stop me from indulging my craving for Baja Blast.

I only have a 1/2 hour for my lunch break. I drove to Taco Bell's drive through on Powell blvd in Portland to grab a quick bite. I waited in the drive through for over 15 mins behind 3 cars. Two drivers in line behind me went in the store to see what the issues was. One was angry and said " This is bullshit!". He stormed the store abandoning his running vehicle in line. When I did get my burrito it was cold! Gross. I couldn't eat it. Waste of time and money.

taco bell, sadly, is one of the very few fast food joints where someone who doesn't eat meat can get a decent (yeah, yeah, i know...) meal.  i have tried this particular TB (hmmm...) a number of times and nearly every time, i am so very sorry i gave them any of my money.  and it has nothing to do with the general taco bell fare.  i know what it is and i know not to set the bar too high.  but even by that low bar, this TB disappoints time and time again.  no flavor, no napkins, cold food, creepy employees (some, not all...).  i think this location must lead them to believe that most customers are just going to hop on the freeway, never to be seen or heard from again.  and maybe they are right.  but some of us actually live in the area.  personally, i am d.o.n.e. with this particular taco bell.  i will sit in the long line at the bell on 117th and 65th and tell myself over and over, 'it beats eating from the one near the mall'.
SLOWEST FAST FOOD JOINT EVER. Step up your game management. I've never been to a Taco Bell so slow on a regular basis.

It's clearly marked that breakfast ends at 11am. I showed up at 10:50am and was told that breakfast had ended. We have a few problems here and there with our orders (mostly wrong/missing toppings). But this is absurd. Guess you don't want our money now.
I like Taco Bell and i like it a lot lol. This location the food is always hot and out fast. Just good ol fashioned Taco Bell lol

DO NOT GO HERE!

Never ever been to this slow of a taco bell, let alone a fast food chain in my life. I can speak for the 10+ other cars in line that waited over 25 minutes to get their order. Whoever is managing this chain should be VERY ASHAMED! Please sell your interest in this location to someone who will properly run this fast food restaurant! 

You are a disgrace to boulder and the high standards it has.

I had to drive off because it took so long. I have not been to a worse Taco Bell. Min wait is at least 10 min drive threw. Doesn't matter what time of day. I have never had a good experience here. I go other places and say woe your fast. I want to be able to count on tbell for food source but if it takes to long I can't put my trust into yum products. So from a hungry customer who has to work a 12 hour over night shift with out food please resolve this issue.

Our Uber driver Bradley drove us through this Taco Bell at 11:30pm, where we met Dalton, the Taco Bell cashier. By the note in my phone, "5 star dalton Taco Bell nice," I believe I promised Dalton a 5-star review. Which he deserves. He hooked us up with some awesome cinnamon balls. Dalton is cool.
fast, delicious and cheap! i loved the girl in the cashier, she was really nice! i ordered the crunch wrap supreme and it was super easy to make it vegetarian by just asking her

YOU ARE NOT IMPORTANT. Remember that while you consider ordering from this dump.

My supervisor, tech and I went to get lunch. "We're unloading the truck right now, so we're closed" We were like "Excuse us, but the driver should be unloading" They didn't say anything more.

So the next place is JIB and the service is a knockout. The crew at taco bell either wants the place to close, or get fired. Wouldn't make me cry!@

Taco Bell always does great when I'm around, never had any problems at this location despite seeing other reviews, today I was served by Jose and co, really great front counter customer service, I've been in customer service for over 5 years + and really appreciate the kind service provided, keep up the great work !!!!

Great service, and love me some chalupas! Drive thru was fast and courteous. Couldn't ask for more especially when a craving hits. Will def be going back. As far as people getting the shits after eating at TB, ever think maybe you're the problem?

I realize no one's coming on Yelp for a Taco Bell review but in case you're the kind of person that checks out Yelp's Taco Bell reviews... this one's for you. 

Everyone in here is so nice... surprisingly nice, but they need to hire about 12 more people to work at any given time. The wait is atrocious, I could order, eat across the street, come back, and still be waiting for my food. When I drive though I turn the car off and push - I'll be in that line 15-20 minutes. They need to drop the "fast" and just call it "food."

But the people are so nice.
This place is a joke... half our order was missing and the one thing that was correct looked like this....

I walked into the Taco Bell and the girl working at the front gave me the nicest smile and said "hi what can I gets started for you?" I was so pleased with her manners and attitude I asked for her what her name was and she replied Mellian. If you ever come to this Taco Bell ask for Mellian to take your order, but I must say their nacho fries need some work and they needed to be served with more cheese. Besides that is was great.

Slow asss service hectic af for no reason lots of screaming yelling. Come here to test your patience. Well atleast they warn you their food will take 15-20 minutes... and then they will make you wait even more after that
At this location. They don't take credit cards. They stop taking credit cards for the last few months now. It's an inconvenience especially when you're in the drive-through.

In quite possibly the worst craving for a spicy taco I ever had, I ventured in to this location and was shocked.

This place takes "taco hell" to the next level, and is quite possibly the worst location of the franchise in Columbus. Not only did service inside take way too long (8 minutes?) but the interior of this place is the filthiest, out of date, "scared to touch the countertops" fast food joint I've ever been to. Sticky floors, dirt spots on the walls and floors... Three items in their soda fountain were out (including baja blast, one of the other reasons I go to TB).

In a significant showing of bravery I managed to eat my meal at home. I am alive the morning after to tell the tale, but I definitely will not be going back to this place.

Ironically, there is a mexican food cart parked outside the valero on hamilton road all the time, I think I might have better luck there.

Late night T Bell craving? Don't waste your time. I waited 20 min in the drive through at around 11pm on a Saturday night behind three other cars without moving an inch. An absolute waste of time-- even with the low expectations that come along with going to Taco Bell.

Unfriendly drive thru bad customer service the girl didn't say hi how are you didn't say thank you just threw the package at my face and closed the windows 
I know it's cold but not a reason to be rude

Pretty good. For a Taco Bell, anyway. One time the fillings for a taco were on the outside of the taco, but that was  just one time. Fast, convient, and cheap. Just ignore the depressed workers and you should be happy with your authentic Mexican eating.

I know. It's Taco Bell. This, however, is the worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. They are never sufficiently staffed and the vast majority of the staff are severely under trained. 9 times out of 10 I do not get the items I order or they are prepared incorrectly OR under cooked. I would return and get my money back but it's not worth driving . The people are nice but they just are not good at their jobs but I blame very poor management. Dear Management - pull your head out and train your people better.

We're all living in 2020, while Darius B and the rest of the taco bell crew are serving like it's 3020!

Remember that this place is taco bell and not a five star restaurant, so when you come here, you're going to get taco bell food, but with that said, this location is great!

Whenever we decide to come here we are always greeted with a smile, great customer service and great food every time! We have no complaints, and hope Darius B and his crew stays safe during this time!
Went at 8 when they say they close at 9. One worker was laughing because the doors were locked???? Y'all deserve no stars with the way y'all act.

The line always wrapped around the building. My friend was visiting from out of town. Not like I didn't warned her about the overprocessed meat that Taste weird ( maybe from grinding it too fined) to me I call it dog food. Her food were old tasting and stale. That is why I refused to eat here or anywhere that is open late whether I'm sober or high Af! They will  serve you days old meat late nights and especially on weekends. 

The workers can keep the food, I wondered if the workers were taking shit loads oof the food that was suppose to be sold to customers instead my friend received some nasty soggy flat bread crunchy shit, her soft tortilla was around the crust, the grand taco probably had like 1 tbsp of ground beef from end to end. 

If you want rreal Mexican please attempt to look for one.
NEVER gets my food right and always has something not working or they are out. Really sucks cuz I live 3 minutes away from

I waited two hours for an order that was never fucking delivered. after the hour mark, the driver said he'd be here in five minutes and I patiently waited and waited until it said my order was delivered but guess what? it never showed up. this is the second time i've had a prolonged delivery at this location. it needs to be shut down

Employee named lizabeth, didn't place steak in my chalupa tacos, then had to correct this person more than once about my whole order. I received one nacho fry instead Of three. Never coming here again, this employee is incompetent of her job.
NEVER gets my food right and always has something not working or they are out. Really sucks cuz I live 3 minutes away from them :(

You know the food so this is about the location!

Taco Bell has 400 things on their menu. And if you have to try and find stuff on the big board above the cashiers, forget it! Fortunately this location has 2 ordering kiosks. So now I can take my 5 minutes to scroll through everything and mix and match  to my hearts content. Love it! Plus ApplePay! 

Otherwise the location is clean. People are friendly. No issues at all. It's a good Taco Bell.

I came to this particular Taco Bell during the dinner rush. I decided to go inside because the drive thru was packed and my order was complicated because I'm a vegan. Though the restuarant was extremely busy, the manger on duty took great care of the patrons and employees so as to make everyone feel important. My order was filled flawlessly and trust me, it was complicated. The only negative strike I have for this location is that the Manger is a Patriots fan in the heart of Browns and Bengals country. The service was so great that I was able to over look that one flaw. Go Browns!

Waited FIFTY (50!!) minutes in drive thru. Once I pulled up to the window I watched the cook undercook my quesadilla, there's a timer on the machines, it's like 20 seconds and she couldnt wait. The cashier was rude and kept her back towards me the entire time. RUDE. GROSS. Do better!!!

Rough day, turned into long night, and we needed to eat very late.

This place was pleasant, the customer service was great! And the food was good/order correct.

Do appreciate this place for what it is, and you can't beat the prices!

Was slow and they messed up a whole bunch of orders. I felt stressed for the employees as they seem to lack training and communication. Lots of costumers were angry. A big no return for me. But the food was good once we finally ate.

Excellent establishment. Not too many good places to eat out at around here. This Taco Bell is fantastic. The food was hot and delicious. The service was fast and friendly. The best part of the experience was our server Katrina. She was very personable. Katrina is an asset to the restaurant.

This place is amazing - if you can stand the snooty clientele. I've tried to get in here several times during their much sought after lunch specials and it's really hard to get a table. They don't take reservations, so don't bother calling ahead. When me and my party finally did get a table, we were thrilled to see that they had the famous Mountain Dew, 'Baha Blast' on tap. A rare treat. 

The staff is friendly and courteous, but maybe a little snooty which I guess I can understand since their clientele usually consists of Boulder's top elite professionals, politicians and diplomats. Don't worry about them messing up your order. They've figured out an ingenious system of calling your name when your food is ready. I guess you don't become one of Boulder's standout dining experiences without a little innovation. 

I usually get the T6 (when I can get a table) and it's always delightful. I love the array of homemade sauces they provide, though 'Hot' is phenomenal. 

Now, if you go here, get ready for a little 'sticker shock' - they don't provide the best service and best food in town on the cheap. My entree was around $6 if you can believe that. But it's worth it. Good luck getting in!

What a joke!!!! But I'm not laughing. The staff here is very unprofessional the manager Marissa handled the situation very unprofessionally I will never be back here at this taco Bell I didn't get what I ordered the order didn't come out right and nobody seemed to be confident enough to handle a minor situation I don't know how these people have a job here at taco Bell boo for taco Bell if I could leave zero Stars I would
Half the order wasn't in the bag. Half the quesadilla was just straight missing. Brutal.
Rude employees and act like assholes for taking your order guy working at 3:30 A.M. is rude

High turnover.  I dont like these combo restaurants.  It seems that it makes too much confusion. The last 3 visits I say no beans on my supreme and theres nasty gross disgusting beans.  What if I was allergic to them?! 
Due to also being a KFC I feel attention isnt paid well enough. Too much happening.

This place is great if you only want to receive half the order that you paid for. Better triple check that bag because chances are you'll be missing an item. And when you call to ask for a refund they can't help so good luck!

I fell on very wet floor as I entered this place!
The only thing the manager said to me was"do you want an ambulance"?........ Immediately the sales clerk ran to her and said" I have the sign out".....fuc_king floor was like a mini river! Anyway, after laying on the floor for a few minutes, I was able to get up and collect my senses. Thank God no broken bones...some bruises on my knee and elbow. The Fu-kers never offered an apology and charged me for my food!
Manager to my info and said someone would get in touch with me. I called them twice....still waiting on a reply. They Suck! Also ruined my pants......WTF TACO HELL???????
Such terrible customer service. Dude at register just stayed silent pressing buttons didn't even ask me any questions. I've been waiting almost 20 minutes for two $1 menu items

Just don't. 

Drive to another location. 

Bad service
Bad attitudes
Bad business
Bad wait times

I'm not sure I can recall the last time I even had a taco here since there are so many better options around and I'd gotten sick of their overall flavor profile (except for their nacho sauce and the nacho fries, ohh baby), but I recently discovered the power menu bowl and have been wondering where these have been all my life. The chicken version is my bowl of choice and it's always fresh and loaded with plenty of everything. It's so tasty and filling!

The staff here has pretty much always been friendly and I can't remember the last time I've gotten an incorrect order, if ever. My only complaint for this location is that you can end up waiting a super long time if you go inside to order and eat. I waited almost an hour after ordering one evening while orders absolutely flew out the drive-thru window, and if I weren't so stubborn I would have asked for a refund like several others did. Hopefully they have improved this in the last year but I don't want to test it.

I was in a hurry; but decided to stop inside this local Taco Bell near Waterford Lakes. I saw they had the new cheese-stuffed Chalupa so I ordered two with beef. I also ordered a small frozen Starburst drink to go with it. The proffered items were quite extraordinary, in terms of packaging and condiments. However, the cheese baked-in just isn't necessary; and, didn't do much for the dish. Beside, they are quite pricey.

Food was as expected.  BE FOREWARNED!! The green button on the credit charge machine is not an  OK to pay!  It is .96 cents to the Taco Bell Foundation! What a scam!  In grocery stores they ask you if you want to donate.

Ok I have tried this location several times since my last review and there is just no going back here. The food is so much smaller than other Taco Bell's. It is made sloppy. Be careful because they ask you things like " would you like extra beef?" And even if you say no they may charge you for it anyhow. So watch the menu board as you order. 
From the outside it looks like a brand new shiny Taco Bell!  This Taco Bell just does not care about the consumer. I have also gotten stale shells several times. Nope I'm not going back. Buyer beware!

I disagree with Yelpers who say, "well this isn't Victoria and Alberts" so they give it 1-star.  The stars aren't indicative of the facility, cuisine, or level of service.  Taco Bell should be compared to other fast-food outlets and to other Taco Bells; and, this one gets it right, every time!

I forget what was going on; but, I know we were pressed for time; and, my wife was on her way home; and, stopped at Taco Bell, to pick up a $5 box for me; a Taco Salad for her; and, some tacos for our daughter.

Everything was hot and tasty; my hard-shell tacos were full, full, full; and, tasted great.  My wife was thoughtful enough to get me a few of the Fire Sauce packets, which really kick it up!

Drive-thru service was fast and efficient, quality and quantity for the price was better than other outlets. We really appreciate this location.

All the tables were dirty. We stood around for five minutes and no one came to take our order, so We decided to ordered via the console. When someone FINALLY saw we were there they couldn't see what we had ordered to know what drinks to get us.  They were almost out of all the sauces and napkins in the bins. So we had to wait for someone to notice us to get more napkins and sauce packets. Very dirty and poor customer service.

The worlds slowest taco. If you pull up and there is more then one car in line, drive away because it will be at least a 20 minute wait. Sometimes when we go, the line is wrapped around the building. Things I do not understand? Why have one window for storage and one functional window if the line is so Slow? The only redeeming factor? The employees are very nice and helpful

Update: they are awful they forgot 4 of our tacos...4!!! Also we asked for Fire sauce, they gave us all but fire sauce.

Whenever Taco Bell comes out with something new, I have to try it.  So I sent my wife out for the new $5 Double Chalupa Fill-up Box.  The chalupa is huge, packed full of taco meat, cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, etc. 
 It is accompanied by a classic Crispy Taco and the Sopapillas. 
 
Everything is tasty enough on its own; but, my wife was thoughtful enough to get me a few of the Fire Sauce packets, which I added to the taco and chalupa.  My wife had her Taco Salad, which is her favorite.

I was very glad to try this one out; but, it was difficult to eat... it is NOT a one-hand item, so watch out if you are eating this in the car!

It's 11:53 and I just left the drive thru and there's a guy with a pony tail and glasses that works the night shift for drive thru and he greeted me and my friends with awesome service. He's a very cool worker thank you for the great customer service !!

Around 11:15am on October 31st I visited this location at 7710 SW Barbur Blvd. I ordered a beef chalupa with no sour cream, soft taco and small Sierra Mist. Upon arriving home i noticed my chalupa had chicken on it not beef. I also noticed my receipt was not given to me. I returned to the restaurant and went back through the drive thru. I told them what happened and ask for my receipt and a refund. I was told they had already remade my chalupa and I asked for my receipt and when I got home I noticed the bag had 2 chalupas not 1 and they both had sour cream AND the receipt was for an order that was not mine. I called the store and asked for the franchise owners information. I was laughed at so I hung up and did a google search and found the information. I called multiple times and nobody answered so I filed a formal complaint with corporate.

Missing customer service! 
They were more concerned about helping those in the drive thru, than helping those who came in. Kenny, the guy working the drive thru actually yelled at us to use the kiosk after we had stood at the counter for some time. Miss the days where someone says hello and welcome!! 
Food was hot and was everything you would expect from TB.
Boycott this location! The management is fucked up and treat their employees like dog shit.

If negative stars was an option I would put -5!!!! I went through the drive through and ordered 2 Mexican pizzas that's it and it took them about 5 minutes to make it so I was hoping they would be fresh. I get home they only had cheese beef and tomato in it ( usually it has sour cream on the middle) and they cut them like a 2 year old we're working there two of the pieces were about 75% of the size. Them I get to eating because I'm not gonna go back just for that, one of them we're fine just wish it had sour cream but the other quite literally made me sick (the tortilla  had a strange taste and was dark brown on the bottom) I stopped eating it and no joke in an hour i was in the bathroom non stop for the next two days with constant stomach pain!!!! I WILL NEVER GO BACK AGAIN!!! This wasn't may first visit but it's my last.
This place does not know how to make a quesadilla! How difficult is it to put cheese and sauce in a wrap?

Besides normal dirtiness, staff was okay with someone bringing in a full bio-hazard trash bag, and placing it on seats. Hopefully guests or staff don't get any diseases. This location also has a hard time opening at posted hours.

I have been boxed in in the drive through line for twenty minutes. I would have left but it hasn't budged. I would have no problem with waiting if the employees weren't hanging out in the lobby where everyone can see them through the glass. Horrible location.

I go to this location often only because it is right by my house but it's never consistent. Don't think I have ever ordered something that they either didn't make right or forgot to put in my bag. Especially now that I started doing mobile ordering. It gives the option for customizations and I don't know why I even bother because I honestly feel like they don't even look at that. I have tried even calling the store to see about getting my order corrected so I can head back to pick it up and I swear they leave the phone off the hook.

I know there is better authentic food in the area, but as an irish guy when I get a craving for taco bell it just needs to be satisfied. meat from a caulking gun, stale chips, 4 days worth of salt, whatever random flavor of mountain dew is. a five buck box of heaven  only a few time a year tho, its like a holiday or shall I say fiesta

We went to taco bell at a reasonable time. Ordered about $35 of food and we were told to wait around the corner for our food. After a few minutes a worker came out with our order and gave us what she said was all of our food. She looked like this was the biggest inconvenience of her life. We got home and realized she had literally only given us half of our food. We called to have our order cancelled or to be reimbursed for our missing food. This seemed to be a bigger inconvenience to them even though they messed up, gave us attitude, and offered no solution for their mess up except for us to drive all the way back to get our food. Awful service

Worst service ever for anywhere stay away from this horrible store  waoted over 5 minutes with no drive thru customers and no customers at all in the store to only have a short dumb employee finally notice me soni told her i onlt waited to let her lnow how bad a job they are doing and she told me to leave the only customer in the store or drive thru waits forever to be told we dont want your business ya all these illegal immigrants are really improving america :-(

Um yeah it makes my stomach hurt sometimes but I return because its delicious. And I'm in shape but limit myself on this awful yet delicious food. The lady gave me a million FIRE sauces which I have a really bad habit of eating by itself so I ate it all . ALL!! Meaning like 20! Nom nomz!
This place sucks ! Don't ever come here ! The order is f***ed !!! It's not correct and there bathroom is dirty! They never have Baja blast and the service sucks!!

Supposedly always short staffed and cannot take orders for certain amounts of time..... but when you pull around people be smoking weed in the dining room.... and multiple people talking in the background.....has happened on multiple occasions and they even forget my food. Wont be coming back to this store again.

Not much to say- service was good, food tasted like Taco Bell, and the building wasn't too messy. 
Most tables looked like they hadn't been cleaned off for a little while though

This is the best Taco Bell in ATL! Actually, who knows... because it's the closest to my apartment. It's honestly great. I order everything vegetarian and they never hesitate to make it AND FAST... you want tacos? Replace the meat with beans and you're living your best life. I even changed up the nacho fries on them and they do it with a great attitude. They've never messed up my order and the fine young people that work here always have a smile on their face. I'll be back and my loyalty to this TB is forever.

My usual location is currently closed for renovations, so I went to the next closest location: Here. I placed a mobile order for two "Power Menu Bowls- Veggie". After arriving home with the food and taking my evening meds before sitting down to eat, I discovered that both of the VEGGIE bowls had steak in them. I am pescatarian. I attempted to call the location, however, the only phone number listed for them is *perpetually* busy, I tried for 30+ minutes. I can no longer drive to the location as I have taken my evening meds and cannot drive on them. I start prep for a colonoscopy & endoscopy tomorrow, I just wanted some food I like before having to fast for 48 hours. Dissapointing.
Girl named Taylor who works here was so unprofessional. Don't come to this location, terrible service.

"Surprisingly Nicely Prepared and Presented"
The other day, my wife and I went out to lunch at the Taco Bell on Alafaya Trail, in Waterford Lakes. The location primarily caters to drive-through traffic, which sometimes makes dining-in a bit frustrating. There was only one person working both registers -- the drive through and the counter -- but, Alan S did a commendable job handling patrons both inside and out. 

For lunch, my wife ordered the crunch wrap combo meal, which came with a soft taco and a drink. I opted for the beef "Boss" nachos. The nachos can be ordered with either ground beef, grilled chicken, or grilled steak. It was the steak that was advertised; but, the premium price dissuaded me. However, Alan S suggested the combo meal; and, for only $1 more, it included a large drink.

Surprisingly, the nachos were nicely prepared and nicely presented. And, they come with both sour cream, and a tasty guacamole sauce on top. There were lots of crispy, light, and tasty chips, sufficient meat, refried beans; and, fresh salsa.

The meal itself is quite large; but, I managed to finish almost all of it.

Waiting in the drive thru line for 30 minutes to finally get to the window and have them say their computers weren't working- which is fine but it would've been nice for someone tell us right before we go to the window. Very unpleasant. 
Also I've heard there are illegal drugs being sold out of this Taco Bell location. @ HR/management
They purposely postpone my order making me wait for over an hour l and then decided to cancel it instead of for filling it.

For the last 2 weeks, the orders take 30-40 minutes to come out. This is ridiculous for a fast food joint. I understand for a day here an there when a worker might now show up or something. But for 2 weeks in a row and counting? Staff needs to be more respectful to customers as well.

So I ordered the number 6 the meal with the 2 chalupas and 1 taco and the chalupas come with chicken so instead of the chicken I wanted the substitute the chicken for beef but of course they made my order wrong and didn't do the substitute so I was left with these chicken chalupas and had to eat it since it's very late and I have thing to do in the morning also the wait is extremely long and I didn't order much just a chalupa meal and from what it seems the staff in the back are not really doing there job they are doing random stuff instead of actually doing there job which is why I think this place is so slow DO NOT COME HERE unless you want to wait in a long line just to get the wrong order

Worst experience ever, went through drive through and he wouldn't take our order and was listening to our conversation and then refused to give us our order when our friends paid for it. Will never be coming back to this location ever again. Extremely disappointed. Very disrespectful service. Having to work on the weekend isn't our fault bud.
We have been setting in line for 30 mins now and have watched two different employees take a 15 min smoke break.! They are so dang slow and the food was dry as can be. What's new I guess lol

On a Friday night you would think this location would be booming but no it's all dark lights off like it's closed once pulling up we see ppl standing in the door way smoking and just hanging out getting to the speaker the guy was rude and seemed like he was rushing us to order so we decided to just not order and go else where better safe then sorry. Wouldn't recommend this location to anyone.
It's Taco Bell, ya know? Lower your standards and it will taste great!

Oh hell no we came here and the worker Mia spit in our food and we seen it then she got an attitude when we said we want our money back she said no I didn't do shit to your food so we asked for her manager and she didn't get her till 20 min later when we said we would tell the boss and then the manager was so rude she said I don't care what happened you don't get refunds. I will never come here again it is so disgusting how disrespectful they were to us(.)

Really aggravated with this location. Not only was the girl at the window NOT wearing a face mask literally at all (despite the very clear sign on the window directly next to her), but they also really messed up our order.  We received only half of the food we paid for, and the food that we DID get was cold, stale, and missing ingredients. Horrible service!!!!!
I was pretty Mad to find my rolled chicken tacos were cold and partially heated all 4 of them completely ruined the experience for me

Since this is a newer location, it's mainly staffed with trainees right now, but they're still friendly & doing their best to keep things moving along (I usually go through the drive through). 

I don't usually expect much when going to a fast food place- I've worked in kitchens long enough to know how it goes- but I was pleasantly surprised by this new location :) I definitely like it better than the Tigard one farther down Barbur (even though the driveway/parking lot here was kind of hard to find at first). 

Bonus- I always substitute beans for the meat, & so far I haven't had any mix ups at this location!

How high are the people working at this location?! They made my Cheesy Gordita Crunch WITHOUT the gordita, forgot to give me my drinks, forgot what I ordered to drink, made one drink incorrectly and gave me the wrong size for the other one. And the syrup for the Baja Blast was out so it tasted like lesser than La Croix. So annoyed.

I've had a lot of bad experiences at Taco Bells, multiple at this location, but this one takes the cake. I placed a mobile order, and I couldn't order one of the standard items because apparently they took pintos n cheese off the menu. I placed the order for everything else, because I knew that filling pintos n cheese is fast, and I went to the restaurant. I stood in the restaurant for almost 10 minutes with nobody coming to the front. I eventually yelled to the back, and only then did they even start making my mobile order that I'd placed more than 15 minutes prior. They were so busy making my mobile order that I didn't have a chance to order anything else, and by this time I needed to order drinks as well because I didn't have time to stop anywhere else for drinks. So now we are going to be late and we have no drinks to wash down our food, and I am so upset.

Trump's Tariffs have hit this South of the Boarder Location HARD

My favorite "fast food" is Taco Bell. I love going south of the boarder for their creative usage of a minimal lists of main ingredients and the end resulting flavor combinations; it normally is a great return of my investment. However, this location on East Broad Street in Columbus Ohio must have been hit HARD by trade tariffs. 

I normally order low cost items with most of them from the dollar menu. Most locations provide some "weight" to the end product. not this place!!! The manager stated she "carefully proportions" out the ingredients. The result, a mostly flour tortilla with a smothering of some of those main ingredients I mentioned. Thank goodness they did not portion out the packets of hot sauces, I needed something to moisten the tortilla with, otherwise I would have felt like I was trying to cross the dessert in search of something damp. 

The service was good, the cashier seemed a little confused, but got my order correct. The facility just went through a remodel and is clean and open. My order made it to the counter very quickly. So, at least "su casa" was in order.  

One plus that keeps this location from getting a lower rating is they do honor military service with a discount. If any of you read my reviews, you know this is something I almost always ask the management/ waitstaff.

Half of our order was wrong or missing. The cinnamon twists were somehow bitter and after further examination the paper bag they came in smelled like cat pee. Something was rancid. Worst  Taco Bell experience I've ever had.

Don't try to modify anything on the menu. They don't listen. It will come out how they want it to. It is the worst Taco Bell I've ever been too. I came here one hour before they closed and they said they only had beef and beans. How does a fast food place only have 2 items? Every time I come here I'm unhappy. I'm not coming here anymore.

Yikes. After reading the other reviewers' experiences, I was hoping to be a unicorn and that mine would be different. Unfortunately, the taco supreme I ordered was served to me with a broken taco shell. It looks like they tried to fix it by putting it in a new taco shell, but that one cracked too because of being overloaded. The taco was good; although there was much more diced tomatoes and shredded lettuce than seasoned beef.

The manager of this location is quite stingy with taco sauces because they don't place them out so customers can get them - you have to ask the employees to hand you some. I asked for a lot of fire sauce packets and was handed four packets. 

The entrance to this is a bit tricky because you have to turn on SW Troy St to pull into the Taco Bell's driveway. There is only one entrance so if you miss the turn at SW Troy St, then you'll have to U-turn back to try again.

This is a TERRIBLE Taco Bell. I wouldn't even give it 1 star but it's required. Every time and I mean EVERY time I go through the drive through at night there is ALWAYS a long wait/ line. I am currently sitting in line and have been in like for 10 minutes and I'm not even at the window yet. Terrible service. I never even write reviews but management or someone needs to fix this poorly serviced Taco Bell.

This Taco Bell location is one of the best fast food restaurants I've ever been to. The place is kept crisply clean. The condiment station is spotless and fully stocked. The staff communicates seamlessly behind the counter, and the customer interaction is always fantastic. That store manager should be the model that Taco Bell trains to. Well done Whitehall Taco Bell!

The only reason I'm giving a star is because I have to give it a star to post.
This location is ALWAYS out of something. I don't get it. How can you constantly run out of thing at a fast food place. Either they're out of hot sauce, out of taco shells, out of beans, or their system is down. One time they were out of ground beef. Taco Bell out of ground beef, are you kidding me. They need to teach the managers had to order, mayor fact they need to re-train the whole staff at this place.

Arrived at 10:16 Am through the drive through. Lights on and all, menu lit up. But no one at the windows. As we drove through the drive through we finally see two employees in the dinning area on their phones just sitting there. The hours say open at 10 am daily. We sat there for five minutes trying to get serviced, no one even greeted us or acknowledged us. We drove up to the window there was nobody around then we drove up to the window to potentially see if there's anybody in the restaurant, there are workers and people inside the restaurant but they were just ignoring the drive-through. I have never experienced service like that, completely ignored, I would never recommend this place to anybody. It is a beautiful brand new Taco Bell, modern design (2020), but the service was 1994.

Literally asked for a handful of sauce and couldn't even get the simplest job done if they can't do that right I could just imagine how their work environment is like and yet they had the audacity to give me a paper to leave them a good review. Well no thanks to (Lola & Gianni) for not getting a simple task done

This Taco Bell is absolutely terrible. I went there at about 7:30 pm and it was  about me and 3 different customers and I ordered on the kiosk. And now I'm just waiting to pay cash at the register. There is about 4 workers and all in the kitchen. And I'm still waiting. At this point it's 8:15 and I start hearing this old guy working there saying I'm so done with my job and cursing all over. Finaly I get my order done, but by the time I left, it was 8:45. I waited an hour and 15 min for what, a chalupa box. And they still managed to mess up my order. I asked no sour cream and right when I got my order I saw sour cream. At this point I don't wanna wait any longer. Let me just not, the only good worker their is this Asain lady. Her 4 stars everyone else 1.
This place told me as I approached the main door that they were closed! As I showed them their TB sign, the TB associate told me, I don't care, we are closed! WOW!

Pretty annoyed. Bf stopped by on his way home from work tonight to pick us up some dinner. They were closed for some reason(this was ~10:30pm when they should still be open). Had chairs blocking the drive through, even though the open sign was still on. Had a locked dining room even though it's still business hours. Three employees were inside, ignoring us and the three other cars that were trying to get food. They could have at least posted a sign on the door, or answered their phone. Not sure what's going on, but they clearly didn't care tonight

I went there tonight at around 730pm.  I went by drive thru.   The person who took my order was impatient and short.  My order was incorrect.  That person was rude and I understand it's a hard job, then don't  have the job if you don't want It.
Service has gotten sooooo slow lately. Every time I come it takes forever. What is going on?! I shouldn't be in the drive thru for 20 minutes

The fast food industry isn't known for having the best service, but this place is just bad. I waited 15 minutes in the drive thru for my food (only 1 car ahead of me which left quickly, so for most of that 15 minutes I was just awkwardly sitting next to the window). When I paid for my food, the girl who took my money barely looked at me. She was talking with the other workers inside. I just sat and waited for 15 minutes while people inside were chatting and laughing. No one told me it was going to be a minute or they were sorry for the wait. Then, a different girl came to the window and told me a different total I owed. I told her I already paid. She shut the window without saying anything to me. Finally, the first girl opens the window and gives me my food. No apology for the wait or anything. There was melted cheese on the outside of the bag. And then when I got home, I realized they gave me a burrito instead of the nachos I ordered. My bad for not looking when they gave it to me, but at that point I just wanted to leave. I'm definitely not coming back to this Taco Bell...

So I want to start off saying, that I've always loved Taco Bell. But anytime I go I'm just super disappointed with their cheesy potato burrito. The potatoes are super crunchy as if they have been sitting under a heat lamp for 8 hours straight. Meaning they taste old and super crunchy. So hard that I could barely even bite through it. I have thought about writing a review for the past year hoping maybe something would change, but yet it still hasn't. It doesn't even matter which Taco Bell I go to, it's the same. So here I am, writing this hoping that it will get to the owners and they can make the appropriate changes.

Sometimes you just need a "run for the border" and when I do this is the location I choose.  Drive through usually fairly fast and accurate. 
My favorite is the Nacho Cheese Dorito Taco Supreme and the Cinnabon Delights.

I was happy with my experience here.

Came during the COVID-19 scare and the drive-thru did not take much time. They got my order right and the food was tasty and worth the value.

People that answered the drive thru were very rude and seemed to be in a hurry even though we were the only car there.., got my order wrong and food was super stale and hard to chew I literally spit it out.. Unfortunately including the nacho fries were old and tasted like it had been sitting for days which was the only reason I came!!!

Worst customer service I have ever received. I have absolutely nothing good to say about this place. I usually wouldn't even waste my time reviewing a fast food restaurant but this was just TERRIBLE! Never again....

I love me some Taco Bell, over a dozen of times in the last YEAR! Covid or not, I order with Uber eats and go there and my order is always wrong when I'm home. Uber eats actually doesn't refund me after the 2nd time it happened because when I say they didn't give me my entire order or messed it up it's some how on me. Soo Tonight I worked all day and my son wanted a taco snack ;) I need to go grocery shopping so just decided Taco Bell for the win (1/2 me didn't want to because they always mess up,  but 1/2 of me thinks they will get their shit together. They seem to never do.) I ordered 2 crunchy tacos and - supreme combo - my Supreme, was not supreme at all there was no sour cream in either of them and my burrito supreme had a huge hole in it in the middle. The crunchy taco order only had one. It's frustrating Lol every time I order from this location it happens.  I paid for the extra I paid for the delivery and there's nothing I can do, I tried to leave an Uber eats  review but ultimately it's Taco Bell on 11717  ne 65th st Vancouver Wa fault, they are both reading the order or doing their jobs properly. I'm frustrated and I know nothing will change but I hope that they see this and try harder. Next time I will not order from here. I highly recommend you to choose a different Taco Bell location. Poor worth ethic ultimately

As far as Taco Bell goes, this was the best experience I've had in a long time. 

We were greeted promptly. Our order was correctly made for the first time in a what's probably been 10 visits. The person working in the drive-thru was friendly, understood our order easily, and was kind when we got to the window. 

The food was the hottest I've ever gotten from a Taco Bell! Burrito was large, perfectly crispy potatoes in the taco, with everything made correctly. The service was fast also! 

Hope they start getting some better reviews with better experiences for others!
Beautiful establishment. Very nice workers. On top of everything. Food came quick. Delicious.

My friend and I stopped at Taco Bell we ordered 6 items and while ordering our food the person working drive through wasn't listening well then when we got to the window we had to wait almost 20 mins. When we finally got our food the nacho fries were COLD and the rest of the order was barely warm. This isn't the only time I've had issues with this location. It's ether the staff is rude, they screw up a simple order or the food is cold or ALL THE ABOVE.

Don't ever eat at this Taco Bell came here because I heard they were discontinuing the pizza ordered a # Mexican Pizza meal and a bean burrito add beef & extra sauce.  The kitchen was extremely dirty food and condiments all over the floor, then when I received my meal there was barely any ingredients on the pice one slice had nothing on it except cheese and sauce on top the shells they were on tasted burnt and were darker then normal.  Then I looked at my bean burrito and it was very sloppily put together stuff running out the ends, and was covered with sauce on the outside.  I just can't believe an owner would allow this.
Yesss yesss. I was craving Taco Bell and I got Taco Bell in the middle of nowhere. Upholding Taco Bell standard around the world
If you want to be a line forever.  This is your place.  They take forever to make a fast food menu.  Simple menu long wait.  Get it together Taco Bell.

Went inside thinking we could sit for a bite before going shopping.  Nope.  No dining inside and not listed anywhere on the doors, windows or website.  Had to take it home so we skipped the shopping, went directly home - the tacos were ice cold - not cold - ice cold.  The chrunchy taco was soggy from sitting around.  The burrito was warmish.   Used to be a place I would choose for a light lunch.  Will never go back.  It wasn't just "not good", it was inferior.  Other brand and family restaurants open at least 50% so I think this is a management decision.

5-stars for a great lunch.  My wife and I came in for the Toasted Cheddar Chalupa.  I had the box, which came with 2 hard tacos and a soft drink; and, my wife got two of the Steak versions.  

This new chalupa is meant to satisfy your cheese desires and it delivers big!  This is Taco Bell's "biggest food innovation of the year" and we loved it.

Maria D was new; and, she needed help ringing up the order; but, the restaurant was not very busy, so we patiently waited as she worked everything out.  

Later, the place got slammed inside and in the drive-through; and, it was amazing to watch the team come together to meet the needs of the patrons.  The manager was on the front-line, leading her team and pitching in to help.

Definitely the worst taco bell I have been to. The food was cold, portions were comically small, and I received the wrong order. Employees provided some of the worst customer service I have received. Will NOT be coming back.

What can anybody say about Taco Bell that has not already been said.  Find dining it is not.  Decent food, on the run(no pun intended).  Taco Bell is always good about their tacos, Chalupa's, Doritos.  And they always have some sort of a good promotion going on. For example there five dollar box.

And for those of us that have gray hair, they offer a senior drink specials, which translates into free.

Always good food, when you're in a hurry. And we are always eager to please.

Don't be afraid to ever try Taco Bell.

As I mentioned in the survey, you can't train personality.  I really like the manager here, his personality fills the restaurant; but, our cashier was a mush-mouth, mumbler, who barely looked up from her cash register to answer our questions.  The most engaging statement was, "is that what you want?"  Sigh...

On this visit, my wife had a Steak Power Meal, which apparently replaced their bowls; and, I had the Crunchwrap Combo with hard-shell taco and a frozen Skittles Strawberry.  

Everything was hot and tasty; my hard-shell tacos were not quite as full, full as prior visits; but, still tasted great.  The Diablo Sauce really kicks things up on the flavor scale.

Service was fast and efficient, with the manager keeping the kitchen humming.  Food quality and quantity for the price was very good.  I was just very disappointed with the front-line staff... speak up, show interest, make recommendations when asked, it's not too much to ask.

This Taco Bell used to be decent, now they mess up constantly, don't care, even when they go to fix your order it's still messed up. I'm not one to complain and I usually just let stuff slide but this location has been on a downhill slide for about 6 months. Other issues are extremely high wait times for no apparent reason, again multiple occurrences. I would advise against going to this location.

This is one of those times where I wish I could rate different aspects of the establishment with different grades, but since I can't, here's why this place only got two stars from me:

Food:  5-Stars
Service by employees: 5-Stars
Manager:  0-Stars

YES, THE MANAGER IS THE SOLE REASON WHY I GRADED THIS PLACE SO HARSHLY!

Make no mistake, this is a place staffed with decent, hard-working people, doing their best to make delicious food for many demanding customers, but the manager (...bespectacled white woman with short hair named Terry) needs to go.  

Seriously. She is a horrible, HORRIBLE person.... and she needs to be FIRED.

Long story short:  An irate, irrational woman barged into the place while I was dining in.  She very loudly and dramatically accused an employee of walking away from her when she beeped for service.  She even stopped to berate her in Spanish.

Terry the "manager" came over to hear out the customer, which is her job, so that's fine.

What is absolutely UNACCEPTABLE is what this manager did next.  

Terry, without even ATTEMPTING to hear the employee's side of the story, proceeded to berate and humiliate the employee right there on-the-spot; an employee who I'd be willing to wager barely makes a salary south of $9/hour.

Full disclosure, I didn't see what happened on the employee's end, but I've BEEN a manager to employees before and the rules of engagement are fairly simple:

1 - Listen to the customer and diffuse the situation as best as possible.

2 - Once the customer is gone, pull the employee aside privately and get his/her side of the story.

3 - If there was a legitimate mistake made by the employee, proceed accordingly.

What you DON'T do is publicly shame an employee.  No, NEVER!  Under NO CIRCUMSTANCES do you EVER humiliate an employee, yelling things like "what the hell?" for all customers to witness.  It is degrading and, quite frankly, it's employee HARASSMENT.

Terry needs to find a new line of work. She's clearly not cut out for this line of work and she has NO BUSINESS managing other employees.

What a horrible excuse for a human being she is.  These people work HARD for borderline slave wages.  The LEAST you could do is hear THEIR side of the story and treat them with a modicum of respect.

The first time this happened I let it slide but after 3-4 times it's just silly. How you gonna ask if I want any hot sauce at the window and later open up a back with Literally zero hot sauce. If you're gonna ask a question, maybe listen to the answer?

It's a Taco Bell.  The food is exactly the same as you'll get at all other Taco Bell locations.  What's unexpected is that the establishment is very clean, and the staff here is very friendly, prompt, and professional.  As far as Taco Bell goes, this is a good location.

I specifically asked for fresh fries, I received cold and unseasoned nacho fries. I also ordered a crunch wrap, which had barely anything in it, customer service was garbage. I've never been to a more poorly organized, and unsatisfactory Taco Bell location. Desperately in need of new employees who know how to do their job correctly. Will never visit this Taco Bell again, I strongly recommend you stay away from this location and go somewhere else. I would give negative stars if I could. Honest review.

Employees ignored us and refused to take our order . Excuse being that they have a kiosk to order on even tho we told them a couple times we were paying in cash . A bunch of ignorant workers that don't even speak English. Never coming back to this location

Up until about three weeks ago the service was great, and the food orders were correct. Something has changed though. I've gone there twice in the past two weeks and my order has been screwed up twice in a row.

I live Fairly close to this Taco Bell and go to it quit often. The line is usually always out to the road, often can expect at least a 10 to 15 minute wait. However the staff is always chirpy. They have never once had a bad mood while Ive gone in. I like to get the green sauce (which is discontinued unless you ask for it from the line) and they have never charged me extra for it. I didn't even know it cost extra til I went to another Taco Bell and they charged me 50 cents. So I thought that was pretty neat. I went there tonight for dinner and got my usual which is the $5 chalupa box. They gave me the fastest burrito and it was made perfect so it wasn't falling apart. When I asked for the green sauce the young lady at drive thru goes "oh you know about the sauce!!" Yessss I love my sauce! Lol

Thank you Taco Bell (Everett location) for making me happy ever since I can remember. You never disappoint and always come through with the delicious food. Lately I see you guys have been very busy more so with the Uber and door dash orders , I just want to say you guys are doing a great job. Especially to the young man who's always up front taking the orders , he's so calm and kind even when there's a bunch of people waiting / ordering. Great job !

They said i lied aboit my order when i showed them my reciept and both bags. Giving me things i didnt even order. They then decided to kick my boyfriend out calling him a liar and mocking him then continuing to laugh with the next customer.
I prefer this Taco Bell over any others in boulder because the employees are WAY NICER. Also it's a fast food place so they meet my expectations of a good fast food place.

NEVER again; will I eat from here. I ordered 8 tacos...waited 22 minutes, what I got was 6 tacos and they were made WRONG. One of them when I unwrapped it, looked like it was run over by a truck. I didn't mention it because I was afraid they'd claim it was nachos and charge me more. Like I said...NEVER will I ever again. 

Do yourself a favor, order online from the BASELINE taco bell and go the extra distance/trouble to drive there and pick it up. Much better quality at Baseline.

I love Taco Bell and have usually frequented this particular one. However tonight's experience altered my desire to return to this particular one. The manager here for the PM shift is incredible rude. Whole demeanor detracts from what should have been a simple casual dining experience. 

I get when you're about to close the lobby soon, you'd want folks to leave. Great, I get it. But seriously don't come at your customers in a rude way. "Lobby is officially closed. Leave out this door when done" with a snotty demeanor. Come on... 

Then to add insult to injury, my wife orders cinnamon twists and extra pico, does this happen? I think not. Rather we got an extra side of rudeness from the manager and the attitude floating around the back. 

I truly felt bad for the guy who fell asleep in the lobby. He was just trying to chill after what could have been, and visually obviously was, a stressful day. Does the manager wake him at first? No, just talks smack about it like it's the end of the world. After ranting for a while she goes on to aggressively shake him awake and tell him to eat and get out. How rude! I've taken the liberty of attaching a photo of the poor sod before getting violently shaken awake. At least it appears he was shaken, not stirred. My heart breaks over his lost peaceful slumber. 

I get it's the end of the night, but goodness, find a better way to treat your customers and act professional.

I been going to this place for must of one year and always is excellent, the food spectacular and the peoples are very helpful when you going to take a order and  today (05-10-19) at 11:30 pm my wife and me was in the drive thru and a new lady was very simple, don't even say hi, she give us the order so wrong, no beverages, three of ours tacos with just cheese and lettuce, we have a burrito too with just a little bit of cheese and full of beans... I feel so disappointed and Im gonna think about going to this place again.

Taco Bell is.. Taco Bell. Did we order a lot of tacos? Yes, 12 to be exact. Did we finish them all? No. Ps - we got 2 quesadillas on top of that but everything that we didn't finish made for good leftovers just hours after first consumption. Was it a sketchy place at 930pm? Yes. Was I scared? Sorta. Will I be back? Yes.

I can't give their imitation of a steak burrito.... it is not made of ground beef, a mixture of sour cream/rice/cheese. VERY DISAPPOINTING! There is a very clear description between ground beef and steak. Washington Taco Bells get your act together. It suppose to be sour cream optional, real slices of steak, cheese, rice, and beans. I ordered a steak burrito. Instead I received a steak quesarito. Pay close attention to your customers request and go over the order. 15640 NE Fourth Plain Rd, Vancouver, WA.

my Gordita crunch literally had less than a tablespoon of meat in it. And most all of that is in one small corner and there's NO meat in the middle. If I wasn't still hungry I'd find it absolutely hilarious but unfortunately my order was also missing an entire taco and ALL the sauces I ordered, so I'm definitely left hungry. I wasn't able to eat half of my order! This is absurd.

I just got back from getting some food from Taco Bell. First off the line is very long and that's understandable. First they got my order all wrong . Then when I had them give me the rite food I had my sheesey potato's missing so I'm already upset that they can't get an order rite . Then I get home hoping to bite into a nice Taco supreme. When I opened it up this is what I was sold . I'm disgusted

We waited 27 minutes in the drive through for 3 items! There were only two cars infront of us the whole time! I don't know how it is acceptable for the service to be this poor. When we finally got to the window, the employee Brianna didn't even say sorry for the wait. And then we had to wait even longer at the window because they didn't even start making our food yet! Stay away from this Taco Bell if you value your time. This was the worst Taco Bell experience I have ever had.

This locations drive through is always really slow, (I'm actually sitting in the line right now right now and have been for probably 10 mins and haven't gotten to order yet) I'm no Karen so I don't cause a fuss, I understand the foodservice industry.  if you're in a rush maybe try a different location or order inside. (Just finally ordered!) the employees here are cool always kind and personable! One time I forgot to order a drink and I asked at the window If I could add the drink and she just gave it to me no charge that was pretty cool shoutout to that lady. And another time I came through the drive thru smelling like dank and the dude made a funny comment that made me laugh so also shoutout to that guy.  The foods always good at this locations, I've found at some locations their beans are dry af but they're always hot and fresh here.

Billion dollar company that always gets the order wrong and will never look into it because the big wigs already making enough money and nobody cares. 
Why am I on a rant? 

Ordered online because of the free delivery promotion got a whole bunch of tacos and not one pack of the sauce that should be like a crime or something. 
Also order was messed up an missing a Taco

As we all know, Taco Bell is Taco Bell. We all know it, we all love it (for the most part) I don't need to tell you about their menu or their prices. The reason I took the time to write this is because I am always impressed with the level of service at this location. EVERY time I go there (maybe once a month or so) the staff is so friendly and my order is always correct. I feel like at a fast food place you don't expect much but this Taco Bell always exceeds my expectations. Thank you!

The Saga continues.  How is it that an establishment is run poorly. The last two times they have forgotten half my order. Tonight for example they forgot 4 tacos, 4!!! Okay so maybe the person stuffing the bag forgot, but I had the seal of approval (that it was double checked). I don't get it.

Id leave a zero star if I could. I drive out of my way to go to the location off of william cannon because every time I try to give this one a chance they are either out of something I want, their system is down, or their fryer isn't working. Seems to me your night staff is just lazy and coming up with new ways to get out of work. I'd suggest some surprise visits or learn how to place a truck order and get your equipment fixed.

Employees ignored us and refused to take our order . Excuse being that they have a kiosk to order on even tho we told them a couple times we were paying in cash . A bunch of ignorant workers that don't even speak English. Never coming back to this location

I wish I could give a -5.  Just left their location 30 minutes ago.  The drive thru personnel was horrible and severely lacks customer service skills.  She "super rushes" then screws the orders up. She was extremely rude.  Taco Bell tends to put the worst people on the drive thru window.  I suggest you drug test your employees.  The food was prepared horribly too.  Must be a meat shortage because the tacos and other things only had a spot of meat.  I will NEVER go back to that location.  The staff at this location is going to cause loss of business.

I have repeatedly given this review one star with the statement reflecting I would give it a -5 but somehow it keeps showing up as three stars.

Honestly as many times as I've come here to this location, this has to be the slowest drive thru EVER. Most Taco Bell's are really quick with their service but this is a record. I'm actually writing this review while I've been waiting in line for more then 10 minutes now.... please get a better system or hire more staff.

I ordered through the Taco Bell app in hopes to save them some time on making my order. I walk inside and someone just raises a finger at me to signal that it'll be a moment. In total, it took 10 minutes for me to be served two tacos. Employees seemed rude and service was very slow. I wasn't even going to leave a review but I was sitting here in the lobby waiting so long I figured, hey why not?

The worlds slowest taco. If you pull up and there is more then one car in line, drive away because it will be at least a 20 minute wait. Sometimes when we go, the line is wrapped around the building. Things I do not understand? Why have one window for storage and one functional window if the line is so Slow? The only redeeming factor? The employees are very nice and helpful.

Yes. I'm giving a fast food restaurant 5-stars because I feel this location deserves it. Long story short, Taco Bell wasn't my first choice for a quick little "hold me over until dinner" snack, but I'm so glad I pulled in. The drive-thru line was pretty busy, so I went inside (mask on) and ordered via their touch-screen kiosk. (Sanitizer is located at the kiosk for a before and after sanitization.) I ordered the Pineapple Freeze and a simple taco. The employees were polite, attentive, and Covid compliant. My pineapple freeze was an absolute treat, and the taco was just what I needed. The inside was also SPOTLESS. Very impressed with this location. Other fast food establishments would do well to take some pointers.

I ordered my food over the app and customized it a lot and I sometimes get nervous on that cause someone always figures away to mess it up but they did great! It had no dairy or meat and they added all the stuff I asked.
