(Other locations I've been to would gob sour cream and were too lazy to fix it) It takes about 5-10 minutes according to the app and I was about less than 5 minutes away so i had to wait; I also wanted to pick it up in the drive-thru cause I had my dog with me but sadly was told to come inside or wait in the parking lot and they'd bring it too me but the drive-thru is set up as an exit so you can't just loop around...if you're fast enough just jump over lol but that's the only reason why I took a star away cause they made me go inside instead. The two ladies working there was awesome and funny! They were the only two people working there **

The food is very good; the restaurant is relatively clean; it would be nice if they had someone dedicated to working the counter and the sodas from the fountain are usually awful. I've filled out many Tell-the-Bell surveys but Taco Bell still has the worst sodas in Portland. Bring your own drinks.

I really love taco bell but this particular location left me a little baffled. Our order was taken quickly and the young lady that took our order was very friendly, however, when we pulled up to pay she had her mouth full of food. Then after we paid she kept speaking to another employee from the kitchen, half in English and half in Spanish. She was going off about someone that had been there earlier I assumed but then she kept looking at me.  The cashier kept saying  no, but I wasn't sure what she said back to her. However the girl from the kitchen kept insisting and when the cashier finally handed me my order the other girl made a weird face and gave a fake thank you, like she knew me and I had done something wrong. I was almost afraid to eat my taco salad after that. 

I wish I would have called her out on her negative attitude and inappropriate behavior, but I know not to stop at this location in the future if this is what I should expect for customer service.

Happy dining!

Whenever Taco Bell comes out with something new, I have to try it.  So I sent my wife out for the new $5 Crispy Chicken Quesadilla Box.  The quesadilla is composed of deep-fried chicken nuggets, cheese; and, is served sandwiched between two halves of a pan-fried flour burrito shell.  

It is tasty enough on its own; but, my wife was thoughtful enough to get me a few of the Fire Sauce packets.  The box also included a Crispy Taco and a Doritos Taco.  Both were packed full of meat, cheese, lettuce, and tomato.  The one with the Doritos shell was tasty enough that no Fire Sauce was needed.  The other one was a bit plain and benefitted from the sauce.Very glad to try this one out!

First of all, half the employees here are clueless. I don't think they were trained properly. We were ordering with an employee at the register and half way through the order another employee came out of the woman's bathroom and proceeded to have a very personal conversation with the guy taking our order. Literally in the middle of us placing an order. We stopped talking and just watched them talk. The guy told the girl you call tell me later and looked at us and apologized and looked shocked himself that she was so clueless and rude. It was the weirdest thing. I took two stars off for that. Another 2 stars for the eating area looking so dissaray. And finally I did let them keep a star for getting our order right. Which they topically don't. That was the only reason why we even went inside, so we could check our order to make sure it was right. I am not impressed with this location. If there's another Taco Bell close by, go that route instead.

This Taco Bell isn't super close but we thought we'd try it. They almost forgot our drinks, they had no hot sauce and when we got home we found out they left out our quesadilla from the order. Not impressed at all.

Worst Taco Bell ever! Rude employees nothing is run properly at all. They had us sit in the drive through line basically trapped even if I wanted to pull off I couldn't. They kept taking orders from people but didn't even have the actual food in stock.. made us wait the whole time just to get to the window 35 min after initially ordering just to be told they didn't have what we ordered at the moment. Never bothered to walk to the cars to tell people what's going on just made them sit till they pulled up to say anything.

I waited in the drive thru for about 15 minutes for my black bean crunch wrap with chipotle sauce and jalapeños only to drive away biting into a regular ground metal meat crunch wrap. I u-turn it back, go inside with my receipt that has exactly the right item on it, with the two modifications and tell them my order was wrong - the boy at the counter was nice and had his coworker make me the black bean Crunchwrap. I said to the boy can you make sure they put the chipotle sauce and the jalapeños (like I originally ordered and was charged for) - he then goes over to his coworker making the sandwich looks up to me and says jalapeño slices? In which I replied yes -- I ate through half of the overly filled with lettuce crunch wrap to find not one jalapeño and no chipotle sauce. Super frustrating! But what was worse was when I called to let them know, the loud manager William not only asked me if I was sure they messed up twice but also referred to me as 'mama'. I wasted 45 minutes trying to get the right lunch in which I was unsuccessful and also felt disrespected by your 'manager'.

This location has a bad reputation in the area & is well known for being constantly making errors on customers orders. 

Tonight is the first time in a long time that they didn't make an error on our food. We came in about 10 minutes to closing the inside. 

The male cashier, Vol was at the least thrilled to be there. You could tell he hated his job, but at least he has one. He did more there in the 30 minutes we were there than any other worker did. 

There is another couple inside with us who had ordered well before us; but they did from both Taco Bell and KFC. Big mistake. 

My husband and I both ordered Taco Bell and got our food within 5 minutes. We got our food before before the couple before us did. In fact the other couple didn't get their order until 5 minutes after we got ours and they only received HALF of their order. His wife's chicken tenders were still "cooking." It's now 20 minutes later and she still doesn't have her chicken tenders - she got frustrated and started eating her husbands extra taco. Staff doesn't seem to care, in fact 3 went home the minute the clock was 10:00.. 

In my opinion, no employees should've left until the restaurant until she got her food. 

As Vol started to clean and do closing duties, he asked both us and the other couple if we were drinking tea b/c he was going to start closing duties with the machines. He then told us that if we needed a refill to ask at the counter to get it from drive thru. 

When we left that drive thru had at least eight cars deep & two on the side waiting for their food. Cmon how difficult is it to make tacos/chicken and give it to your guests?!

On Sunday's, I wake up late (hung over of course) and somehow drive my a$$ to TB. Honestly, it brings life back to the monotony of the week ahead.  The only issue I have is they sometimes mess up my order, take too long to take my order or leave out hot sauce. Keep up the 4th meal dream and live mas!

Worst ever! I went in to use the restroom before purchasing something and was told I had to buy something before using it! They have a type in keypad so you can't use the restroom! Who does that?! Pay to pee?! Ridiculous would give a zero if I could
I wanted a cheery limeade! Super Yummy!! That's all I got b/c once you're over 25 anything from here will probably have you in the bathroom way longer than one should be...LOL!
Not open the hours they are posted to be. The drive through was closed way before 2 am so don't expect to get any late night options from them. Go to the one on Braker or Taco Cabaña.
Taco Bell is my guilty pleasure. Countertops and soda foundation area could be a little cleaner, but the food never disappoints. Staff is friendly.

So I've been to this Taco Bell several times and I get a correct order about 1 out 3 times. The receipt is correct but when I get home, it's not what I ordered.  For example, I order a beef burrito supreme without beans.  I get a bean burrito 1 out of 3 times.  The crunchwrap supreme has practically nothing on it. I will not be going back to this Taco Bell.

Went to this location and ordered chicken nachos. Took my order home and there was absolutely no chicken whatsoever on my order and hardly any beans at all. Seems like it would be very hard to forget to put chicken on an order of chicken nachos.

This is the worst experience that I've ever had in general with any food industry. On 10/13 I came through the drive through around 2-3 am after an evening of celebrating my 22nd birthday. Taco Bell has great options for modifying their menu due to diet restrictions and food allergies. I've been vegan for over a year and prior to that, vegetarian for over three years. So with Taco Bell's modifications that can be made, it was still one of the few places where I can go to veganize certain menu items. I ordered the triple layer nachos fresco style and a Mexican pizza fresco style as well with refried beans as a beef substitute. I'm always VERY clear with my order, specifying that when I order fresco style I mean no nacho cheese, dairy, etc and that I need beans substituted for beef. I've been working in the restaurant industry for four years and when I take my tables orders I make sure that proper communication is made, especially when dealing with diet restrictions. I ordered my food and headed to a friends to eat my meal. My nachos came as usual and after devouring those, I started to eat my Mexican pizza. A few bites into the pizza I realized that something wasn't right and that it tasted.... Different. I had my friend try a bite (who has no dietary restrictions) and he told me that it tasted like it had meat mixed in. I opened up the shell and after dissecting the pizza (see attached photos) to my horror I realized that mixed into the beans were random spoonfuls of BEEF. This had to have been done intentionally. Taco Bell's beans do not contain lard, they are PETA certified. It's safe to say that I got very sick after the few bites that I did manage consume. I've spent a good portion of my birthday in bed due to stomach problems. Diet restrictions, food allergies, and menu modifications SHOULD be taken seriously. They are not a joke. Just because someone CHOOSES not to consume something doesn't mean that it's acceptable to sneak that item into the meal because someone thinks it's "funny." I am disgusted with the way that I was treated at this Taco Bell. If you have any type of food allergy, diet restriction, or simply need to modify a menu item for your needs- Do NOT come here.
Not a good experience at all. The gordita crunch was supposed to be no lettuce and had maybe a tablespoon of beef. The chalupa shell was overcooked and hard. Meh.

Honestly this was a funny experience me and other costumers were laughing. So I order my food and here a list we've made of what this Taco Bell was out of,
-guacamole 
-chicken
-ice
-mild sauce
-large cups
-boxes
-napkins
And the napkin part was really funny a man asked for napkins and she just tossed a a paper towels at him and the napkins were almost gone too. While I was here I kept hearing that the Burger King across the street was out of burgers!! Sadly this wasn't the only problem it took us 30 minutes to get 6 tacos now I haven't worked at a fast food restaurant but I think 30 minutes for plain 6 tacos shouldn't take that long.
Great service! Food came out fast and hot. Never know what to expect with Taco Bell, but this location is a winner!

This taco is super bad the older Hispanic lady has the worst customer service and always gets my order wrong. I been going to the Taco Bell on sunset 100% better than the Bethany Taco Bell. I got a beefy supreme burrito,And there was no beef in it just sour cream and chesse that's it and I also requested more beef haha. They are more expensive than other Taco Bell's and let me say again the portions are super tiny you jut get a flour tortillas with extra sour cream. I wish they would get there stuff together and I have called Taco Bell head quarters about there inconsentantsey as a franchise.
I love you guys but why do you ask if I want sauce if you aren't gonna give me sauce?? 2 drive thru visits in a row now you ask me and i say "yes, hot sauce please." and I don't get any

The morning/ afternoon crew is terrible. Terrible customer service, they never get orders correct. Being extremely allergic to sour cream, I make that aware yet I am still served with sour cream. Waste of money and I can't even enjoy my lunch.

I have not had Taco Bell in a while and I must say that their customer service level has definitely been kicked up a notch. From the young man who took my order at the drive thru that sounded very pleasant and engaging. All the way up to the young lady named Leishlanis who collected my payment. She was super outgoing and friendly which is kind of rare to see at a drive thru around 9pm. It was also very nice of her to acknowledge my daughter in the backseat and was waiving to her and laughing with her as I waited for my order. 

I ordered some regular Dorito Locos Tacos and an order of cinnamon twist. The tacos weren't as crunchy as I'd hope, but it wasn't bad. And Cinnamon Twists are always a good choice. I'll be back but preferably earlier in the day.

Okay I've been to this Taco Bell a few times. The staff is always goofing off and the line is around the store.  After waiting 25 minutes and inching 2 cars ahead, we cancelled our order and went to Revere. They had us in and our in 5 minutes - I have no idea what's going on in Everett but I gave up.

You guys I swear are the worst Taco Bell on earth, I wanted pico there is no pico I paid extra for , I don't even know why I go here anymore. This Taco Bell must be broke tortilla with cheese sauce , when I also ordered extra beef and it was 10am

Your business hours say you are open daily inside until 10pm. It is 9:40pm. Your doors are locked. The drive-thru has 9 cars in it moving at a snails pace. 

Looks like poor staff management and poor customer service and not adhering to your posted hours. 

No thanks. 

I'll go elsewhere.

Very disappointed with my meal. Only gave us Mile sauce when we asked for Hot and Fire. The tacos we ordered were soggy, the lettuce was soggy, and came with no cheese. The meat tasted foul. I feel sick after eating two tacos I didn't finish my meal. This is the worst location I've ever been to and never had these problems at other Taco Bell's around town.

At the last minute, decided to stop at the Taco Bell for lunch yesterday with a co-worker.  I prefer my usual location in Lake Buena Vista to this one.  Service was just ok.  The girl at the register was obviously very new.  I also tried one of their new burritos (minus the rice).  Without the rice, they didn't add any of extra beef to replace it at all.  So it was a very anemic burrito and frankly was kind of gross.  Oh well.  What was I expecting?

This is literally the absolute worst Taco Bell I have ever been to. They consistently forget stuff, mess up orders, half a$$ everything. I usually just double check everything but I just got home and this is seriously a Crunchwrap supreme? Are you kidding me?
The best taco bell in the area!! I come all the way from Decatur to eat here because the taco bells in my area are horrible. The service here is great and the food is always accurate.

The food was fresh, tasty, and reasonably priced. The employees kept the premises sparkling clean; they cleaned tables immediately after customers exited the restaurant following a meal.  My experience at this Taco Bell was very favorable.

Asked for the number 11 combo. Order screen said it was the supreme option, and I asked that it be switched to the regular tacos (I cannot have sour cream). The drive thru operator said "I heard what you said" in an extremely rude voice. When I received my order, I had gotten the supreme taco. Dude gave me so much attitude, and still got it wrong? Explains why he's working the night shift, as he clearly doesn't have the mental capacity required to take orders during the day.
They shorted the quantity of nacho fries and half filled all of the cheese sauce containers. Low rent dreck Taco Bell!

You get what you expect. The food is good and the service is friendly. I've been here a few times and they are consistent. I don't like the newer plastic cups but they may be more recyclable than the old ones. Their parking lot is small and hard to get out of if there is a line at the drive thru.

Was craving a #7 all day at work and as soon as i came out of work I rushed over here. Then i was completely devastated when I was not only told that their grill and fryer was down but that I was told with some snickering. As I was driving by i seen that the store was being run by a bunch of teens. NOT coming here again.

This used to be my go to fast food spot in dripping. I can understand places being short handed, which I assume was the case tonight as I sat in line for 25 plus minutes. Nothing was said about the wait during ordering. Instead a sluggish voice, noticeably unhappy about whatever the situation was, greeted me. No excuse or apology was given at the window. Instead I got to watch a girl, obviously sick or allergy ridden blow snot into a tissue. WTF. The person at the window didn't seem to care so now I consider this location to be a toilet. If I can help it, I'll never go back.

I sat in line for 15 minutes to order order my food and then get told I can't use my husband's debit card because we don't have the same last name highly upsetting I would like to know when this policy change was because I've use that card there all the time and then to be stuck in line and not even be able to order my food is ridiculous
Ran through the drive for a decent lunch in a hurry. A big improvement over my lunch out elsewhere yesterday...thank you taco bell!

Employees kids running around everywhere then to see 7 kids drinking the thing I wanted in a water cup but was told they were out of it. That's just bad customer service.  Ways I would improve the place
1 don't allow outside food or drinks. 
2 don't allow employees to let there kids run around
3 train employees
4 train employees
5 it's not a playground so don't let un accompany children hang out we are in Texas there is a law against it
6 tell the manager to stop butt scratching and start wiping down dirty table
I ordered from grubhub and they forgot my supreme chalupa. I also tried calling them but no one picked up. You should never order from here.

Everyone was so kind especially this girl named jordan she was kind,sweet and generally an amazing girl she helped me with everything I needed an was patient with me and with a big order for the family
Laziest people work here went to get food after work and got there five mins before close and they refused to help me
Worst Taco Bell in Atlanta bar none. Poor service, poor product, poor quality. Rarely get an order right, pending they're actually open to take it.
It's 2:45am on a Friday night and we've been in line for 45 minutes. This better be the best damn soft tacos that has ever entered my mouth. YEET
Took FOREVER to make my food! I've never had it take this line. Been waiting for over 20 minutes. This is TACO BELL...
Drive through service is *extremely* slow, and makes the trip not worth the wait. Don't even bother with this location! Not worth it.
They got mine as well as my friends order wrong after I repeated the first one multiple times. The food was hot but not what we ordered and it was frustrating.

While I applaud any franchise that makes an active effort to employ intellectually disadvantaged people, there really is 0 reason for them to get my order wrong not once, not twice, but three times all in the same visit and after showing them the recipt each time. It was 3 items (2 chkn grillers, 1 beef) and yet the orders I actually received were

1) chicken griller, 1 bean burrito, one soft taco. 

After showing them the receipt and giving them the taco and burrito back, I wait for my two other grillers. Remember, I showed them the recipt and had a verbal exchange specifying them

Order 2 comes out as the same taco, bean burrito, and a gordita. I again send them back

Order 3 eventually comes out and it included two chicken grillers (remember, one was supposed to be beef). At this time though I'm so annoyed by wasting a half hour that I just take it. To their credit, they were polite, but these employees are wasting a ton of food and people's time. Needs better management
The worst place ever. I had to wait 20 minutes to get my food which happened to be old and cold. Not worth the time or money spent here.

This is the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to and I will never go back! Horrible management. Both times I have been here I have had bad experiences. Take my advice and stay away from this Taco Bell to avoid a headache and rude customer service.

Enhanced safety measures??? This is the second time I've been through this location and the employees do not give a FUCK about covid safety. The window literally says "Masks are required inside due to local regulations. Committed to keeping safe."  BULLSHIT. Please see photos for both UNMASKED EMPLOYEES.  Ridiculous.

I have never left a one star review in my life... but this is getting ridiculous. I'm used to Taco Bell messing up my vegetarian orders but this location is something else. I ordered a Crunchwrap with beans instead of beef and it had BOTH I didn't even notice at first because the beans disguised it. Still hungry and wanting Taco Bell I ordered a bean burrito, an item that had no meat. THEY GAVE ME A BEEF BURRIOT!!! Wtf!! I accidentally ate meat twice tonight. my stomach hurts. Bleh.

Hi there, I moved to this area about a year ago and so being in our 20s, this taco Bell is kind of our hotspot. Nearly every single time that I have ordered either diamond, or drive-through my order has been incorrect, no sauce, and overcharge, missing items, items that we paid extra for alterations like guacamole were paid for but we were given the regular burrito... 

One time, I waited in the lobby for my order for 30 minutes when they had no drive-through line. They just forgot that we were there waiting for our food. The last straw was that we had a door Dash order last night and our entire order was incorrect, we paid $48 and all items were incorrect as well as the items were missing. Like seriously??? 

DONT GO HERE.

Excellent food and service!  This location has to be one of the best in Georgia!  I travel between NC, SC, GA and FL and I have to say Georgia has the best Taco Bell's!  This particular is so far my favorite! Keep up the great work!
Really?  25 min on drive thru? What is going on? If I wasn't trapped in the drive thru line I'd bail on this line. No $1 nacho fries are worth this!

Does anybody really read Taco Bell reviews before they choose one? I don't.

Anywho...here's my two cents since you asked.

I love my local Taco Bell at the corner of abandoned hotel and aging Publix. Nestled in a strip mall of Hooka Lounges, empty store fronts that used to sell discount golf-equipment, and an always-busy suburban Middle-Eastern discotheque, this T-Bell serves up fresh and tasty "Fourth Meals" to locals, tourists, and drunken club-goers alike. 

I've been visiting the drive-thru for nearly twenty years, and have always been met by a consistently friendly voice. Sure sometimes they can't understand my accent or I can't understand theirs...but once I round the corner, there it is: a tasty bag full of half-a-dozen different combinations of beans, cheese, and onions. 

Sure, sometimes when I ask for beef in my enchirito, I get a hybrid slurry of chicken paste product, but it's always delivered with friendliness and sincerity. 

And they always say nice things about my car. It's a Porsche. I'm willing to fire the money canons for a sweet ride, but I'll be damned if I have to pay more than $1 for a taco.

Absolutely awful location. We ordered two nacho boxes and it looks like they ran out of chips, and we barely got a handful of chips and a crap ton of over cooked meat. When I tried calling they disconnected the phone. Horrible place and horrible management.

Update: I've attempted giving this location multiple tries and it's always awful no matter what. I've gone twice around 1am, and they aren't serving any grilled items? If you're open until 2, why would you turn off your grill at 1?  The employees are generally rude and don't seem to care. I've lost all hope and I'll be going out of my way to a different location from now on.

We order online every time and they seem to always leave items out this time it was 6 items. this is unacceptable to forget to put it in the bag. It's like they don't give a damn since you can't go inside and order. Now we have to go all the way back to Taco Bell's attitude while the other items we have get cold. We also requested a bean burrito no onions guess what we got onions. Sure did go back to get a a attitude from the employees. And they still forgot to put the cinnamon sticks smfh. Always saying you order online who gives a damn. You shouldn't have online if you can't handle it.

Food is as good as Taco Bell gets. Friendly and good service. 
But it does bother me that I have gone there twice recently and no one I cld see was wearing gloves or a mask. It's as if Taco Bell is not worried about COVID. Guess I shld not go back if that bothers me until all this mess is over.

I live right next to a different Taco Bell, but drive three miles out of my way to come to this Taco Bell.  The food is always fresh and the manager is very helpful and friendly.  They really like using the Air Conditioner, so you may want to bring a light jacket if you are cold nature and want to eat inside.  If you don't usually like Taco Bell, I suggest you try this one out before you give up on them.

I came here because Taco Bell has been blasting the airwaves about a free Doritos Locos Taco on Tuesday as part of helping out in these times.  As usual, it's at "participating locations only".  I bet you can't guess, but this location isn't participating.  I asked and they said very firmly 'No'.  I don't know why Taco Bell spends so much on commercials just to have their franchises not participate.  This is just another reason I don't like franchises/contractors and I wish company's would just take over their own business.  You don't get a consistent product or message.  I definitely will not be going to here or any other Taco Bell during this crisis since I cannot trust them.

Don't even bother going past 10pm, past five times I have it's been "sorry but we actually can't take orders right now as our "system is down". Like yeah but the thing is it's actually not, y'all are just insanely lazy and don't want to work at a place that's notorious for having late night customers. If you don't like it that's too bad, go get another job and let someone else do it correctly. Simple as that.

Came through the drive and was told they didn't have beef, ice, beans. So I had to either choose chicken or steak, they then proceeded to try and charge me because they didn't have beef . These fast food restaurants just get more low grade and consistently obnoxious. Trying to tell me it wasn't her fault they didn't have beef, which is fine, but don't try and charge me because y'all don't have it . Weirdos.

It's Taco Bell. But coming out of a movie theater at midnight what's my options? 

It's fast, teenage, fake food that tastes fine. I mean it's fine I like a couple things on the menu and who doesn't crave junk food now and then?

We got a crunch wrap supreme, a chicken burrito, and a snake bite fries. 
My crunch wrap was closed correctly and tasted as should. The fries we're not my thing but I enjoyed stealing the jalapeno off of them. They were surprisingly fresh and had a little heat to them. 

I can't bring myself to give Taco Bell 5 star cause it's not real food but it fills a spot. This place seemed fast and competent in the drive thru. And the crunch wrap supreme was actually sealed and grilled a pleasant surprise.
If you order delivery from this location it is GUARANTEED they will get your order wrong. This is based on years of ordering delivery from this specific Taco Bell location, like some sisyphean fool.

Im sick and tired of this location messing up my orders. It's happen far too many times, whether it's from the drive through or Uber eats, do not order from this location. They miss order notes way too many times for it to be acceptable. I've received tacos that do not have and meat on them what's so every, I'm not paying for lettuce and chesse on a tortilla, I do not recommend buying anything from this location, you're better off eating dirt

Usually the Taco Bell's I go to the customer service isn't great and the food is thrown together. Here, every time I've gone so far the customer service has been much much better than other Taco Bell's, and better than any other fast food place I know. They're kind and the food is actually put together very nicely. They wear masks and social distance. Keep up the good stuff!!!

We waited in line after concert had already done mobile order to get to speaker to be told sorry can helps us they are out of everything. So she said would refund us. Total was $10.37 and we got back $10.26???? What the heck. I called and she said ink and hung up so I called back she said she would give back. Said we are already down the highway by time turn around they will be gone but my point is that is thieving no matter the amount.

This is a newer location and my first visit here.  I don't normally eat fast food... But every once in awhile when I'm in a hurry, or it's late night I'm known to hit a drive-through.  

So since my yelp friend Paul reminded me it was taco Tuesday and I'd not had dinner yet I decided to pull in.  The parking lot was empty and the drive-through had two cars in front of me.

I ordered and things moved along pretty quickly and I was at the drive-through window. The cashier was very friendly and asked me how my day had been.  I paid and got my Taco Supremes promptly. Everything was great until I opened the bag. 

I hate having taco shells broken. I purposely order them without lettuce so they are not so filled up that they break.  I ordered three and three out of three were broken even though they were only filled up halfway.

This made a good visit bad.... don't mess with my tacos. People don't like their taco shells broken if they did they would order a tostada instead. Get it?

No complaints about the food or speed, but this place consistently "forgets" to add items when I order from their drive-thru. For example, today I ordered two Mexican pizzas, and got ONE pizza, double-boxed.  Shady.  Check your order thoroughly and ask for a receipt each time!  :0(

Trash food always old they close the store early even though they claim to stay open till 3am staff at night bad attitudes manager no better... cinnamon twist have a weird baking soda or something off taste

I would give no stars to this place. Every time we order its wrong . It's like they do the opposite of what we ask ! It's beyond ridiculous. I used to work at Taco Bell myself so I have an idea of what's going on in there. Never coming back to this location . WORST TACO BELL EVER.

Ordered on Uber eats, got 2 chalupa boxes, a soft taco, a burrito, 2 nachos and cheese. There were no drinks that came with the boxes along with cinnamon twists that were supossed to come with it. No soft taco. No sauce. And all of the other food was dry, no meat & sloppy. Taco Bell has gotten so bad, and this will be the last time getting it. Yuck.

Nasty location. Went through the drive through and saw an employee come out of the kitchen, eat something off the counter by the front registers, and go back to the kitchen and keep cooking, contaminated gloves and all. Mentioned it to a manager and she didn't care at all. Good way to spread germs when we already have a virus outbreak!
The last two times I've been here the food has been pathetic. Stale hard shells and hard soft shells. They need to hire the Wendy's were's the beef lady! 27.00 for almost no meat! Keep driving!
Good flavor and polite most of the time but Nachos are too often served with crumbs instead of chips. REMEMBER TO ASK FOR CHIPS NOT  CRUMBS

I decided to stop at this Taco Bell. Around 5:50-6pm. heard there was a new burrito. When my boyfriend and I pulled up to the speaker a nice girl greeted us. We were trying to figure out what to get. We took like 30 seconds looking at the menu real fast when a guy asks us with an attitude "do you need help looking at the menu?" Through the speaker. I felt rushed when he said that. There wasn't even no line, no cars at all.  Then we heard laughing in the background. We still decided to order. The chicken chipotle burrito isn't even a burrito. It's tiny. It's in a flour taco tortilla. They COULDVE tried being nicer.
literally the best Taco Bell in the world. They are always so nice and I have never had any issues I would like to hug all of the workers there! chefs kiss!!!!!!!!

You guys are the absolute worst when it comes to inclusivity. Every single time I order cheesy bean and rice burritos (from the VEGETARIAN menu) they have meat in them. This is so unfair because I will be in the mood to eat and I can't because of the IGNORANCE this establishment radiates when it comes to dietary restrictions. Will never ever eat here again. Do not recommend to anyone who follows a vegetarian lifestyle. Respectfully, you guys are fucking dumbasses :)

Our entire order at this location was screwed up, but the receipt is correct. The quesadilla was cold and the cheese wasn't even melted. We were given a beef chalupa in place of a 7 layer burrito, spicy potato tacos instead of potato grillers (also cold). This is the worst experience we've ever had a restaurant that frequently screws up orders.

The employees spoke to my grandma aggressively.
When my grandmother asked for a senior discount at the window instead of at the call thing. The employee gave her major attitude. But who I assume is manager used a more aggressive tone. I'm usually not sensitive about these things,but they were jerks.
Legit said "we aren't take orders" when the store didn't close for a couple hours. How is that even possible? The ownership should lose this restaurant.

I have been happy with my experience here. I think a customer should not have to ask for a straw if you are giving them a drink with a lid.

Came during the COVID-19 scare and the drive-thru did not take much time. They got my order right and the food was tasty and worth the value.

Mexican Pizza was half beans and half beef. Wish they did a better job making the pizza. The chalupa and burritos were good. Basic taco was not worth it. 

May return.
crunch wrap was crunchy as hell. loved every bite. best crunch wrap i've had from a taco bell.

If I could give 0 stars, I would. I was waiting for a half hour for my food and they served 3 or 4 people that came in after me. I complained to them about it and the manager basically told me to f*ck off. Absolute waste of time.

Worst drive-thru I've ever experienced.  After making the "U" to almost order, I am past the point of turning around, despite the cars I see behind me pulling out and leaving because of how slow this place is.  As a business, please do yourself a favor and steal a page from Chick-fil-A's drive through training manual and get your program together.

This location is actually a joke. We ordered 3 crunch wrap supremes, 2 cheesy Gordita crunches, a dollar taco, and twists. They forgot a Crunchwrap and the taco. The kid at the window was a joke and needs to check the orders before handing them out because he handing us a drink we didn't order. After waiting 18 minutes we were expecting all of our food and some structure but I guess that's asking too much. Go to the Super Deluxe across the street, they have bomb chicken nuggets and they won't fuck up your order.

"Front of house" has three main tasks - take the order accurately, handling the money accurately, and give the customers their order, accurately.

I ordered and paid via the mobile app - doing 2/3 of their job. All that's left is to put the right food in the bag and give to the right person. Apparently they are not up to the task. I

One of the best taco bells I've been to. I rate these places against other fast food places and others of the same type. Taco bell is clearly not the same as fine dining, so I include this disclaimer.

Anyhow, clean bathrooms, clean store, awesome A/C fast service, decent speed drive through, order was accurate and the lady at the register was nice and the drive thru attendant was quick and professional.

I've been in some bad fast food places, but this isn't usually one of them.

I have a passion for Taco Belle. I'll admit it - I love the food. So much is prepared ahead of time in an industrial manner that it almost NEVER varies. What varies is the service.

I have been burned WAY too many times at this location. Yeah, you know the pain: when you order something and find out they blew the order miles away. They have a great screen at the order and I really ensured they had it right. But when the items weren't there that my kids ordered when they were digging in, that burned my tamale.

Make sure you check your food BEFORE driving away, they don't. Learn from my miss on this.

Every time I come here at night my order is wrong. I'm tired of wasting money at this location because I don't get everything I ordered. Management needs to start doing a better job at making sure workers realize what needs to go out the window.

For clarity the staff of this Taco Bell are amazing, have positive attitudes and deserve wonderful things in life. Every time I pass through they put me in a great mood. The owners of this company can burn in hell and I hope their hardworking and lovely employees get everything they can from this trash company and get out. Powell Taco Bell employees, you are angels and you make my day!

This is by far the worst taco bell on the face of the planet. I'd say 9/10 times, my or any of my acquaintances orders are wrong. I'd say half the time half of their menu is "out of stock". I've came to taco bell an hour and a half before close and have them tell me that they are "closed" because "Managment" was having issues, numerous times. Taco bell by no means is the peak of fast food chains- but good god this location sucks. Either corporate needs go revamp this place, fire everyone inside and rehire- or just close it. Its just sad- even for taco bell's standards. Go to any other food place other than this location- you'll be sorely disappointed.
Ceclina served us and she was super friendly. It's nice to see cause ya know COVID. 10/10 recommend

Worst costumer service I have ever had. Wanted to add an item on at the window to be told by the manager no because of the car behind me. I would've gladly come back around to get it but to be told no without any other option was absolutely rude. Considering I worked in fast food for six years and part of the management team, I would've never done that to a paying guest .

I will admit, I love me some KFC. Taco Bell is also up there on my list of late-night fast food cravings, but the popcorn chicken combo usually wins out. 

I moved to Quincy in February and this establishment happens to be the closest fast food restaurant to my apartment. Since February, I have paid this drive thru a few visits and was shocked at how horrible the service was. Not only is this the worst KFC/Taco Bell I have ever been to, this was the worst fast food restaurant I have ever purchased food from.

The Drive-Thru: No matter what day of the week or time you go to this place, the service is unbelievably slow, incompetant and inconsistent. Last night, I enterred this drive thru at 9:45PM and did not pull away from the window until 10PM. I was offered no explanation as to why the line was delayed or an apology of any kind. Also, after I placed my order and pulled up to the pick-up window, I was told that there was no more Pepsi. When I asked the girl to calculate my order without the soda, my request was met with attitude. She also snapped that she didn't have any change in the register, so I had to dig through my wallet to find coins so that she could give me bills back. I know this is a single example of the poor service, but all of my visits have been equally as frustrating. No forks given when I ordered mac and cheese with a meal? No wedges available? Even worse, no CHICKEN available? More than once I have had to sit and stare through the glass window after giving them my money for over 5 minutes before getting anyone's attention - no explanation for delay offered- turns out that they were frying more chicken, while there is a line behind me, and didn't think to let me know so I could pull over and let the other orders through. The drive-thru is so slow, in fact, that on Friday and Saturday nights the line is so long that it ends up in the street, causing additional traffic at an already congested intersection.

The store itself: disgusting. The floors are always sticky and there is constantly trash on the tables and floor because the employees do not clean up anything. The condiments and papergoods like soda covers, straws and napkins ALWAYS need to be refilled. Don't even get me started on the bathrooms. 

Bottom-line: Avoid this KFC/Taco Bell at all costs. 

1 star because I like the food, but the poor service and unsanitary conditions seriously need to be addressed. This place leaves me wondering when the last time a district manager paid a visit.

I figured live walking distance should get good service wrong, food was slapped together with no care also if you have a sign up in the window that says open at 7am then you don't open until 730am maybe the sign needs to be removed.

This Taco Bell is totally different from other locations I've been to this one is really big and looks like it's newly remodeled.The staff is really friendly they always care and the food comes out fresh and quickly.I love the Quesarito's yummy

Horrible!!! Whole restaurant smelled of sewer from bathroom! Swear I could taste it in the food it smelled so strong! I WILL NEVER EAT HERE AGAIN! I must admit the staff was friendly as I witnessed a Hispanic man non English speaking having trouble ordering as there was a language barrier yet the cashier was very patient and did not give any attitude as she politely asked the manager for some assistance . The manager seemed rude as he blurted I CANT UNDERSTAND YOU I DONT KNOW WHAT U WANT in a raised voice as if the man was deaf ... regardless I will never return due to the health issue of sewer.
They skipped my order. I wittnesed three other orders messed up or skipped. Worst service ever.

As far as taco bells go... this one gets it mostly right!

Guy who rung me up at the counter was friendly enough to be one of the memorable parts on my trip. Staff seemed like they're pretty friendly overall (which is rare where I'm from).

My fresco bean burritos were perfect, not as messily put together as some other ones I've had (by taco bell standards, of course).

Like all taco bells, a great place to score a late night "lunch" if you're vegetarian or vegan.
Worst "service" ever. Not sure how they manage to stay in business. It's really not worth going there. Lots of better options in the area.
Staff offered tip on deal and was friendly. Beans were overdone on burritos, visited durring prime lunch time.

These guys always get my order right, it never takes too much time, they are generally pleasant enough. Ignore the naysayers, this is a Taco Bell and you are going to get Taco Bell food late at night and fill your belly. Put some hot sauce on it and keep living.

This place sucks they over filled my drink split it all over the place in the drive threw and just handed it to me they take forever when you have not a lot of food and then not only did all that happen but I get my food and it's wrong had to go back and get the right food and they still don't want to make it and take the longest time to make one thing I would just stay far away from here the food is not that great anyway but my wife likes some things I think its  awful

Consistently slow service. Can never figure out what the heck is going on at this location. Last time was the last straw. Waited at the counter for a solid 2-3 minutes for a cashier at 5pm on a weekday (wish the counter was furnished with a taco "bell".. The 3 other people waiting to place their order tolerated my dad joke). People walking around in the back made eye contact but didn't seem to care much. Order took much longer than you would expect. The kicker was the sign (ON A NAPKIN) on the napkin dispenser that said they were out of napkins..
Worst drive thru ever I've never had to wait 15 min in a drive thru and that's just to order my food. They are so slow it's awful.
This location is just bad. Every time (3-4 times) I have come here, they take forever and it never fails that they forget something I ordered/paid for. No more.

I come here for convenience and a love/hate for fast food. It's the same food as every Taco Bell but it is by far from fast food service. Every single time is a problem with service. Staff is incredibly slow. It's at least a 30 min wait just to place an order. They are also very unpleasant. They don't care that they are wasting anyone's time.

Crisis averted. My trusty steez at House of Pipes informed me that this Taco Bell is going through a remodel. 

Noooooooo!....It's closed! Drove by yesterday and there's a fence up and "colsed" is spraypainted all over it. 

This Taco Bell was amazing! Great service, they actually put cheese on the tacos, actually put cinnamon on the twists, wetnap and a mint in the bag and they effe'd up my order a total of zero times. I usually think Taco Bell sucks and they all screw up orders on the regular. Not this one. Whoever ran that thing did a great job finding great people. 

Please tell me it's a remodel!

Thanks taco bell for being terrible, you literally gave me 3 hot sauces for 15$ worth of food split for 3 people. we can now all have 1 sauce. next time I come to taco bell im gonna ask for the box of sauces... how much money do you loose from sauce.. seriously

Worst Taco Bell food I have ever had, and I come from the land of Taco Bells, Texas.  The tacos/gorditas/etc. are always cold and soggy.  I think they pre-make them and keep them under a weak heating lamp because the letttuce is always withered and melted into the cold hard cheese goup that was once hot.  There is hardly any meat in them too.

I've been here about 5 times over a course of 4 years because this is the only place in the South Shore that tastes remotely like Tex Mex food. I always hope that they have gotten their act together when I go, but it's always a huge dissapointment.  

The Taco Bell in Walpole is awesome though! It's just a Taco Bell, not a hybrid Taco Bell/KFC, and it is an "old school" Taco Bell. I will drive 30 minutes away just to go there.

We went there on Wednesday afternoon. The place was very busy, thought of ordering a drive thru but it was totally packed. My husband went in and placed order. There were 4 people waiting for food. All orders came at a time with no clue which bag has what inside. It took 10 minutes to sort the orders, still none of the bag has a complete order. Everyone ended up with "we don't want any food, just make a refund". The cashier cannot do a simple math while returning cash. Half hour is wasted and have to go and eat somewhere else. Avoid this place specially when it is busy.
The service in this place sucks, and workers have attitudes and sometimes fighting with each others. I also got my order wrong here more then once.
Says its open till 4am but closes the grille down at 3am.  Which means only tacos and nothing else.  Total BS
Fast food.i personally like taco bell  beacause it has very dealishos tacos and lunch and dinners.

The longest wait EVER . Came here a few months ago and waited nearly an hour in the drive thru. Thought things would have improved. Nope. Sitting in the drive thru now for 30 mins...have moved an inch.
Extreme friendly, very fast and constantly accurate. What more could a person ask for in a drive through. This is my anytime craving go to place.

Food was satisfactory and the place is cleaner then a lot of other Taco Bell's I have been at. Staff was for the most part pleasant. Knocked a star of due to customer service I was reading my order to the lady and she didn't acknowledge so I said hello to see if she was listening or needed a minute I was returned with hold on sir I'm not ready for you. Other then that decent junk food place

Everything is shiny and new! This place has been re-done and it looks great. They added more space to park and there is outdoor seating. The inside has a nice open layout with lots of different spots to take a seat. Tall tables, short tables, some against the wall, and a little bit of a funky new age block seats. The music is always chill in here. I think you can cruz through till around 3am and then they close. 
Service is always friendly and fast. You get what you expect. Ingredients are always correct. mmmmmm tacos....
Says it closes at 4am but shuts the grille down at 3am which means you can't order anything but tacos.  Such BS

On fast food scale, it gets the job done and inexpensively.  They do seem to forget things at the drive-thru though, so check your bag before you hit the hills.  I have come home twice to find that a burrito is missing, thus creating an unhappy kid.  To that, I must say I have called right away both times and been assured to let them know next time to be given the item for free. Both times I was not hassled and given the missing item.

They never have any new items.  They still don't have many older items either.

If you go inside, your wait is at least 5 times longer than if you go to the drive through.  And the inside is tiny, you'll be lucky to get a seat.  Along with the people working here, very charming...

I really love Taco Bell, but this place is fucking terrible.

I had such high hopes for this combo when I moved into the Wollaston neighborhood, but I honestly think they need to focus their efforts on one brand only because they clearly can't handle two!

I have tried both the KFC and Taco Bell side and the KFC side was far more fresh and appeared to be the more popular choice of other customers. However, the service at this place was atrocious, tonight I spent 25 minutes inside waiting for my order (which was missing items). When I brought it to their attention I was given attitude and other customers were forced to wait for my issue to be resolved. At the time, there was one employee out front and 6 in the back to serve the drive through I suppose (they were really just hanging out and chatting)... Regardless I will be avoiding this place so that my opinions of these restaurants are not marred forever! Avoid if at all possible, the Friendly's next door is much more worth your money.

A final thought...the menu board is a cluster of confusion, don't go there with something in mind, because it probably isn't on the menu and the employees probably won't know if they have it either.

I mean I'm not entirely sure how to write a huge grand review about a Taco Bell. All I have to say is when me and my friends are high out of our minds, this place really is a stoners paradise. The food is cheap, they are fast, and did I say this is a stoners paradise? Seriously when your high there is no one better!

By far the worst Taco Bell in the area. I sat in the drive thru for 30 minutes and when I was finally able to pull up to order I was told the computers were down. The workers there are always unprofessional and unfocused, a bunch of high schoolers who are always on their phones/ playing around. I understand that the food may take a few minutes to prepare however I am never impressed by the service I receive while I am waiting. Lately I've been going out of my way to go to the Taco Bell off of Hill Road because they are always extremely efficient and professional compared to this location.

ABYSMAL SERVICE!
My bf and I just left this location ( Howard & Wells Branch, about 3:40 pm on 03/16/2018)), because NOBODY SHOWED ANY INTEREST IN TAKING OUR ORDERS.
There was nobody behind the counter, but were two people busy in the kitchen area. At least one of them looked at us several times, then looked away without saying anything. I didn't expect them to drop everything and come running out to serve us, but I DO expect a smile and  a "I'll be with you in a minute"!
But the two guys there chose not even to acknowledge us, so we left after a few minutes.

Forget not getting an order of two items correctly this place can't even get 1 order of 1 item correctly... ONE!!! -_____- never going back here again  

I ordered the cheesy nachos through the drive through and the person told me to drive up so I did and waited for 10 mins till I turned off the car and continued to wait then a guy just happen to pass by opened the window and was like did u order something O.O OMFG are u serious? he went to go check and came out with my food after another 10 mins cause he didn't know what happened

BTW no one customers happened to be in front of me, behind me or in the store.....all you had to do was put cheese on chips omg how long can that possibly take ....

The staff here is trying their best. However management and ownership needs to hire more people, for one and for two they need not to put their new hires on register the first day. lots of mistakes while I was waiting 30 minutes from my food. LOTS.

For a Taco Bell, I have had quite a few exceptional experiences with the drive thru at this location. The customer service is unbelievable. Each time I have been to this location has been in the late evening on a weekday or weekend, so it could possibly be just that specific shift. I have never had any problems with my orders either. I do not go often but I am continuously surprised that for the past two years, this level of service has remained the same. 
My sister was with me on my most recent trip a few weeks ago, she is an assistant store manager at a large grocery chain and has been working in that business for 11 years. She said that she would hire the male employee (who helped us) on the spot from what she witnessed while in the drive thru.

Keep it up! Taco bell is my favorite fast food, and through the many years of being a customer I have never had such great service as I do with this location!

Food OK. Came in for a $5 box meal and they charged me $5.49 even though they had the $5 sign in the window and I just saw the $5 Box commercial! Said there was nothing they could do about it. That is False Advertising! and I'm never going back.
Fuck you I'm drunk and you should be open. Cunts. Wendy's is open, you cocksuckers. Fourthmeal my ass.

This is definitely one of the nicer, older-style Taco Bells in the area. I have eaten more at this Taco Bell than almost any other. Why? It's good food and it's conveniently located just east of the Tuttle Mall right off of 270 in the northwest part of town. 

It's not the most advantageous location for a fast food franchise, because you'll pass approximately 20 other restaurants before you get to this one (that's if you're coming from 270 of course). This never distracted me from getting to the best fast food burrito in America though and apparently it hasn't stopped too many others either. 

This place has been around forever. I'm pretty sure that it precedes even the Tuttle Mall. It may be a dinosaur among a bevy of younger competitors, but this Taco Bell could probably survive a nuclear strike. Now you know where to go when the big one hits! You're welcome :-) Save me a seat!
You're open til 2am and we have no food at 215am?! Yes we placed our order before the 2am cut off. Please staff properly!
Taste great when your super high. Feels like you have a brick in your stomach the next morning. But I still go 3 days a week.

Fire the entire staff and start over. This place is trash, closed when they're supposed to be open, incorrect orders and always ALWAYS a ridiculous wait time..inside or in drive thru. I'm currently in the drive thru and we haven't moved in 15 minutes and there's still 2 cars in front of me that need to order
Why I am I even paying at this point?
I wouldn't even give them one star if the app didn't make me

So... It's Taco Bell food; do with that what you will...

This review is about service... To be exact, fan-freaking-tastic service, 100% of the time, over a span of about 1 year, from different people almost every visit.

I come here when I need food fast and I know what I want.  I always go in to order (never drive-through) and the service has been amazing.  Everyone is friendly and generally has the appearance of happiness.  They're patient when I need them to be.  They offer alternatives when the national website menu doesn't match their offerings.  Seriously, some of the best fast food customer service ever.

I go once every month or two, so this is all based on about 8 to 10 visits.

We love Taco Bell, we have been fans for a long time. Especially my son he loves cheesy potatoes  burrito. Today we decided to stop by this location since their remodel and it's close to ours house. We ordered from drive thru, got home opened up the food kind of surprised of the quality of the food. I ordered my son cheesy potato grilled instead of his favorite because they don't make cheesy burrito now.  My combo is $6.49 come with 2 items and drink. I had a couple bites of crunchy wrap any I was thinking to myself why it's so thin with little filling inside.  I didn't say anything until my son started complaining about his food. He showed me that in the middle of his burrito is kind a thin had very little stuff. Double disappointed. Seems like the price is going up, but the quality is lacking. I guess I will definitely go back to the location in Tigard by 99 HWY. Too bad I didn't have the picture of my crunchy wrap to show.

First off, let me start by saying I love Taco Bell!!! They have options for non meat eaters!! And that is more than most fast food places can say. This particular location consistently disappoints. My order is never correct at this location, also they are so inconsistent with the ingredients in the food! Some days I get a bean burrito with sour cream? Some days I get one without it? It's never consistent. I get that maybe they have new staff periodically. But at the end of the day, if I'm paying for something I expect it to be right. I do want to mention that I didn't post this review in haste, I have lived near and patronized this location for about 8 months. I also want to mention that I have on multiple occasions informed management of how my orders have been, they always offer to replace my order but I just want them to train better.
Seriously the best service at Taco Bell that I have ever received. Food came out quickly and actually looked like the menu items. Staff was super friendly.

I don't care what people say about fast food or Taco Bell. This location is always quick and it gets my order done right. What more do you ask for? 

It's a solid fast food joint
They'll screw up your order once in awhile, but they try hard and as late night drunk food goes, they're pretty good.

Pretty terrible service.  We tried this place a few times, and they totally suck.  We won't be back, and I'm glad their corporate office sent us some free coupons that we used at another location!

Recently, they used stale chicken to make the chicken flat bread (disgusting!).  They didn't wrap the tacos correctly, so when you tried to open it, it fell opened and everything came out in your lap (messy!).  I would highly recommend NOT coming here and going to another location!  It wouldn't surprise me if other consumer's are having similar experience.  I would avoid at all costs (unless they can actually learn their Taco Bell cooking rules correctly!)
They always get my order right even when it's a large order. The employees are helpful and courteous. And the food is pretty good.
DONT GO HERE EVER. Customer service is horrible. THEY RUN OUT OF CHICKEN ALL THE TIME. I wish I can give this place no stars.

Charged $1.70 for a bag of chips and salsa that other Taco Bells charge .50 cents.

Check your receipts because she said, 'We are a franchised location and can charge more.' That really did happen...

The bowl and service was as good as any other Taco Bell otherwise , so nothing much there.
I'm not going to judge anyone for eating at a Taco Bell. If you're reading this you know what you're doing. Just know that this is one of the best-run fast food places I've ever seen.

If there was an option to give no stars I would. I have given this place more than enough chances since it is conveniently located down the street from my house. The customer service is always terrible and my food is always wrong. My most recent transaction with these people was today.. I ordered 2 of the new chalupa boxes...got home and had two crunchy tacos and one of the dollar burritos in both boxes. Not only was it NOT what I ordered the tacos were so old that when I picked one up to eat it the bottoms fell right out and were complete mush. Disgusting. The wait is always more than 25 minutes..place shouldn't even be open as far as I'm concerned. Get it together.

I am a Taco Bell fan. As drive-thru fast food junk goes, they are my second fav (Wendy's is first).

But this location is awful.
They don't do breakfast. They don't carry diablo sauce (even when other locations start offering it again).
On multiple occasions, I've been told that they don't have an item that's on the menu....not that they're out of it, but that they don't carry it.

And the busier they are, the more dreadfully slow they are, and the more likely they are to make a mistake.
I've worked in fast food, so I understand that it takes longer when its busy. But if you take forever to get someone's order, at least get it right.
It's all about the Beefy 5 Layer Burrito.  Just when you think their ingredients cannot be combined another way, Taco Bell tells you that NO YOU IN FACT ARE WRONG.

I hate this location. I don't know why I even bother going back. Every 6 months to year I give it another shot and I swear its worse every time. It takes about 20 from the time you order to the time you get your food. I always go in so I can double check my order. 9 times out of 10 something is missing. The staff is usually always rude and don't know what they are doing. The manager is usually just lingering in the back looking at people instead of actually doing anything.  Last night will probably be my last visit at this location.

This is quite possibly the worst taco bell on the face  of the earth. They NEVER have any of the new limited edition items advertised. Terrible service, and it's combined with a Long John Silver that is equally garbage. Literally this taco bell turned me from an atheist to a devout man of christ just so i can pray each and everyday that this taco bell gets wiped off the face of the fucking earth. Fuck this taco bell.

Terrible place. I refuse to go here when my friends want Taco Bell. I will drive miles out of my way to avoid it.

The staff is terrible. A clerk once fought with me over my order that she got wrong, insisting that I was wrong and that she "doesn't want to argue with me". It is insanely slow to the point where cars will be pouring into the city street because the drive-thru is so backed up.

The eat-in area is a joke. There are maybe three tables which are always in use. If you do, however, have the misfortune to find a table free, they are all awkward to sit at due to the strange elevation they have them set at.

There is nothing redeeming about this place.

Almost everytime I have come here, they screw up my order.  I mean all the time to where I avoid this Taco Bell.  That's why they get a 2 star.  The customer service is either great or bad.  They need to get better cooks and train them to pay attention.

Worst tacos I've ever got at any Taco Bell. I've been to Taco Bell in other states as well and all over orlando it is usually my go to quick dinner or lunch. This is bad enough I'm toying with sending these photos to the corporate email. The woman in the drive thru was also slightly rude.

Harumph.  This is one of those place I'm positive I reviewed before, maybe a couple years ago.  I remember writing about it- the service sucked. 

Well, maybe the place has been reincarnated, and that's why my review is gone.  Because from the moment I walked through the door I thought I was in a different location.  Service was great, start to finish.  Speed, attitude, you name it- it was together.  The place has been remodelled, and there are even new menu items, so it was a very different experience.

I got a "chickstar" which is a crunchwrap with crunchy chicken.  Being me, I ordered the chipotle one, but didn't expect much heat.  Oh, it was there though.  Not a lot, but way more than I've ever had at Taco Bell.  I also had some nachos, and they were pretty typical.  The new Mountain Dew citrus flavor was not to my taste- tasted diety.

I stopped in on a whim, because I was right across the street and in a hurry.  I used to avoid this location.  Not anymore.

Stopped in for a quick bite on my way home from work as I didn't want to cook. These places are so easy to order food from, and you get such a good value for what you pay for.  It's really good food that hits the spot.
 My order:
Triple Double Crunchwrap Box for $5! The box includes one triple double crunch wrap, one Doritos Locos taco, a crunchy taco, and a Drink. This is a really good deal and it's very filling.  I started with the crunchy taco, then moved on to the Doritos Locos Taco, then for the finale the Triple Double Crunchwrap.  I saved the best one for last.  Wow that was perfect!!
Great Taco Bell. Got two crunchy tacos at the drive through. Person working was great and I got two mints and a wet nap in the bag.
The worst Taco Bell I've ever been to seriously just drive a little farther and go to another Taco Bell cause this one is ass
Nia was the best she took her time explained what was in the food made recommendations I brought a pie only because she said it was good! !!!!
When I order something, I want you to actually put it in the bag.  Secondly... MILD should not be confused with FIRE.  Bring back the Cantina Taco!  You bastards.

Fast and efficient, but the people are usually pretty unfriendly. On almost every visit, they rush you through and seem upset that they have to serve you. Plus there always seems to be some weirdo hanging around outside. And no, I'm not a jerk. When I say 'weirdo" that isn't because I'm some snooty guy; it's because they truly are weirdoes. I just went there a little after midnight tonight, and there was a lady walking back and forth in front of the doors holding a cat. The inside is closed this late, but she kept knocking on the doors and pacing back and forth, and she would walk up to the cars in the drive thru and just stare at them. And on another time, a guy kept approaching the cars asking for money to get food. I offered to buy him some food, but he declined and moved on to the next car. I guess he was planning on buying food other than Taco Bell? Finally, a side door opened and an employee came out and asked him to leave, but they ended up just getting into a verbal confrontation and eventually the employee went back inside, leaving the dude to go back to badgering the drivers. All in all, this location could use an attitude adjustment and should really crack down on the people bothering their customers in the drive thru.

They keep arbitrarily changing the hours that their lobby is open. I showed up at 9:55 to find them locking the door. The crassly told me to go through the drive thru instead. But I have a bike mounted on my truck, so I won't fit. They need to keep their lobby open later.
3 our of the last 3 drive through trips have taken 10 minutes or more. Twice soda was diluted.

I have gone to this taco bell my entire life (North PDX Native here) and tonight I waited 40 minutes for 2 bean burritos and was still ASKED TO PAY FOR MY MEAL. My food cost less than $3 total. I don't have the option to turn my car around mid way through the drive thru so why not at least pay for my meal to make up for the insane wait time and the inability to bail out?

Hella rude, yall. Get your crap together. :/

Literally, this is my favorite Taco Bell. They knocked down the old one and put in a re designed building. Yadda yadda.. Let's get to the important part, my crunchwraps.. I get them no meat no nacho cheese add beans ok. Not every Taco Bell employee understands this but at this location they do. Orders are always right.

Aight... I've never been inside, and I haven't eaten anything from here in some time. Nope, the reason I make the run to the border here is for... yep... the Big Ole Pepsi.

I pretty much always get great service in the window here, but it's probably because I'm not ordering $30 worth of food one taco at a time. When I need the sweet sweet elixir of relief, these guys got what I need.

Conveniently located, plenty of parking, and the drive thru is spacious.  Service was quick in the drive thru, even though the line was long. Girl at the window was nice. Not complaints with the customer service.  
The food however, very disappointing.  I order the shredded chicken burrito for $2.59 and the triple melt burrito for $1. The shredded chicken wss a joke, I opened it to put sauce inside and it was literally 3 shreds of chicken(that looked like hard cheese), the avocado sauce (very sour), and cheese(basically all cheese). In reality I had a cheese rollup. 
The triple melt one was really mushy and not horrible taste wise, but wouldn't get it again.  Funny enough, the $1 burrito had more in it than the chicken one. 
And lastly I got the cinnamon bite things, always good. 
Waste of money, could've made a better burrito from scraps out of their dumpster.

Took 12 minutes to get this order?!? Like come on Taco Bell.. I get that the drive- through is important but having 9 cars go through the drive through is not ok.. I could have walked across the street and had chipotle make my food and walked back before y'all had my simple order done.. I'm cool
Nothing "fast" about this Taco Bell - more times than not I have waited for 20 minutes or longer with only 3 cars in front of me and no one inside -
Thought this was supposed to be fast food??? Sat in the drive thru for 20 minutes until I decided to just leave.

I love Taco Bell however, the service at this location is very poor. Not entirely the employee's fault because I"m assuming whoever is in charge decides not to staff appropriately. There is always a line and the drive-thru line is always unbelievably long. Also, the parking lot can be difficult to get out of because of the drive-thru line interrupting traffic.
They are nice here and always does a great job on the late night.  Cured the munches. Also very fresh

I know....why haven't I reviewed Taco Bell yet? Makes no sense cuz it's only the greatest thing since sliced bread! Go ahead and choose ANYTHING on the menu and tell me it's not delicious! And it's the only place I can get baja blast which is the best Mountain Dew ever created......by humans. As long as you got a good 45 minutes to waste on the toilet when your done eating than Taco Bell is always a good choice.
Nasty restaurant... Poor service the employee in the lobby looked at me 3 times before finally asking what I needed when they messed up my order...
Ice cold food that should have been served hot!  A squirt of this sauce on this spot and a squirt of another sauce over yonder.  Do these "workers" deserve to to be paid a "livible" wage?

I would give this place zero stars if I could. As a Taco Bell regular I have to rate this as the worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. I would recommend driving the extra 10 minutes to the next closest one.

So what! I LOVE fine dining, but I ALSO LOVE TACO BELL!!! 
Meximelts and Volcano hard shell tacos ROCK on a Friday night, around 1am after a night out dancing with the girls :D
This Taco Bell is great! Super friendly service. They forgot a Churro and, because of their mistake, gave me another churro and some rice! Very clean and busy restaurant.

This is a great Taco Bell. It's clean, modern, and quick. Also, the customer service is good, not great--there seems to be quite a bit of turnover at this location, which is to be expected. It does the job! I'll drive an extra mile to get here instead of the one on 82nd in Clackamas.

This is my second visit to this Taco Bell. I gave it another shot after the problems the first time. It's close to Universal Studios and everyone is craving a taco. My first visit and now my second(I write this as I sit in drive thru) SUCK. 
The drive thru is by far the worst ever. Slowest ever. Speed is not this places style. 
Going to Del Taco next time around.

This place never fails to impress, lol. There is always something going on. Either they've closed early with no reason, they are out of ingredients x, y, and z, or the employees are just rude and inept (nearly always).  

Tonight, my friend and I decided to play roulette again and both order double chalupa boxes. Before ordering we were notified that they were only accepting cash tonight. Ok. We have cash. 

Got up to the window with one car ahead of us. One person took our money. Then we proceeded to wait. And wait. And wait. Inside the employees thought it to be good idea to start counting the drawers in front of us. Not sure if that stopped them from making the food or not. Ten minutes later another person handed us our boxes. "You got two chalupa boxes?" Uh. Yea. "Here. Have a good one". No sauce that we had asked for earlier. 

It then took another six minutes of hand waving and gesticulating before one of the people that was counting the drawers who had stuck her gloves hand in her mouth while counting one of the drawers to slowly walk over to the window. 20 seconds later she opens it and says nothing. Just stares. Uh, can we get some mild sauce (I just season at home, my friend refuses)? She stares some more. Then proceeds to hand us about 24 packets with a sick grin. Stares again. "You have a good night, now". Ok, then.
Slowest drive through ever! Only 1 car and I'm sitting here writing the review while waiting at the window for the last 10 min... it's peak dinner time why is this so slow?!

a minute ago

Drive is through workers are irresponsible & racist. I order something very simple a Pepsi the girl proceeded to give me a mountain dew knowing damn well I said pepsi twice. I ask very calmly miss I wanted a pepsi, she then proceeds to tell me they are out of pepsi. You think she would've said something when I placed the order right? As I am driving off a male worker inside yells out " Aye we don't got those empanadas for your ass" I am a hispanic male and instantly understood that backwards ass racist comment. I live right down the street and will never come back to this store.

Happened Tuesday July 17th , Drive through at 10.32pm

I walked into the restaurant during my dinner break, and was completely let down. The ladies room had 2 stalls--1 that was a handicap stall, and the other that was so tiny, I thought I was going to get stuck in it (I'm 8 months pregnant and someone was having a heck of a time finishing their business in the other more roomy stall). But that didn't kill my experience. I waded through a sea of high-top tables & chairs to stand in line for 10 min (behind 2 people) and ordered my food at 6:57pm. I went to fill my drink, and found that the Sweet Tea was almost empty, but since I usually use 1/2 sweet & 1/2 unsweet, it was just enough to fill my cup (I then emptied the container when I left--with no concern shown by the staff for brewing more.) Come 7:15pm, I still did not have my order, so I went to the counter and when asked by the manager, heard the girls on the line say my order still wasn't ready even though, they weren't that busy. I watched them slow-poke around, and they eventually finished my order another 3-4 min later. The manager did nothing to help them and said nothing to me, although the lady at the counter apologized for the wait. I then sat in the dining room with the ambient music blaring at a level much higher than a typical fast food place, and ate the stale gordita crunch, and sloppy burrito supreme that came in my box. This is by far one of the worst fast food experiences I've had in a long time--that's if you can classify this restaurant as "fast" food, which I wouldn't. I think a visit from someone higher on the chain is definitely in order to fix this store. The layout is terrible, the food is sub-standard even for Taco Bell, and the service is the slowest I've seen in years for "fast" food. Bypass this location and get better food and service somewhere else.

This was the worst.   I work 3rd shift and needed something to eat.  Bean burrito made my stomach turn just looking at it.  Being a night worker, I would frequent this location.  Now, I would rather starve.

My husband and I flew in late to Orlando this evening and drove to this Taco Bell for dinner. We waited in the drive through for 15 minutes when one of the workers came out and put wet floor signs in front of our car, cutting us off from the line being served, and just said "no!" Several cars before ours were also turned away. We thought maybe it was closed and we were just too late, however it's actually supposed to be open until 3am. Not sure what's going on with the management and staff here, but I certainly won't be coming here again. We ended up going to Wendy's down the street and had fabulous service there.

Listening to employees fight over helping customers. Pretty disappointing with the manager watching. And then to have a homeless man ask me for money in front of the staff and nothing said or done. Very very disappointing. Employees should wear name tags so they can be addressed by upper management for there behavior

I ordered the new naked chicken chips. It was very disappointing to get home and see that I was given a little under a table spoon of the nacho sauce.  Other than that the food I received that day was good.

Haha!!  Getting a good laugh out of all the reviews on this place.  Haven't been here in over a year (maybe 2 years).  I stopped going because they were rude to me at the drive thru.  I didn't learn my lesson the first time.  It actually happened 3 times in about a year.  I probably only went 3 times in a year, so I was 3 for 3.  They also run out of chicken.  Gotta love this place!  I would love to know who the owner of this franchise is.
