UPDATE:i guess my yelping bout service helps a little! they have better workers. and they even have a number posted for you to call if you had a bad experience hanging by the drive thru. but since my last review about how bad this place was, i should say they improved a lot, they havent screwed up my orders and they give me all the hot sauce and ketchup i ask for!

and as for the food theyre still good enough to satisfy your late night cravings but of course can be better but what do you expect for 99cents!? i still enjoy munching on cheesy nachos and as for tacos i learned that if you are more specific and witha side of bitchy you'll get what you like =P

I just arrived at 1:23. Nine people in front of me in line......This location is famous for their very long waits. Great good though. 

Overall, GREAT Taco Bell. The waits have been getting shorter. Very nice staff. Very helpful. I will go back tomorrow.

I stopped by and they order wasn't done correctly and no one else was in line. So i called. Matt the manager said well sorry about that. Thats it? He said thats all he is required to do. Customer service at its finest!

Shit-hole.

They refuse to speak English to you, and they're very rude.

One drive-thru manager referred to a fellow employee as 'n***a' very loudly and repeatedly. There were kids in there, man!
you know what it is, delicious and makes you so happy :) just don't go too often because heart disease.

I'll give two stars - one for friendly service and another for the food meeting expectations at a Colonel Sanchez (Taco Bell/ KFC Combo).  

Inside the restaurant, the place is kind of filthy.  Today the ice machine was broken.  And for the first time in a dozen or so visits they messed up my order (they forgot the cookie with the $5 fill-up meal).  Listen - I don't have high expectations when I come to this place, but they need to clean up their act.  There are myriad fast food options in Quincy, some of which are open 24/7.  Don't be too humble - you're not that good.  

As for as new menu items, I like the new $1 menu. I've tried the Frito Burrito and the shredded chicken quesadilla.  Good stuff.

Avoid this place like the plague......because chances are the plague has been here.  Crappy food (sad when you can't even live up to the Taco Bell stereotype of food), service is non existant (No hablo?), location sucks, etc, etc, etc.

Pro's: 
-Will clear out your digestive system and allow you to decorate in the inside of your toilet.
-Nothing else.

Con's:
-Food is usually served lukewarm and not fully prepared.
-If you are lucky ONE person in the whole establishment will speak english.
-Bathrooms look like someone urinated in the sink, on the toilet and all over the place.  That urine covers up the grime on the floor.
-Want your food specially made?  Try it!  "I want a cheesy gordita crunch, chicken...no beef."  What do I get?  Beef..............fuckers.
-Beef is the equivilent of cat food.
-For the price, you would expect something decent.
-The food here makes McDonalds look like 5-star resturant!
I LOVE IT!  The cheesy nachos and Supreme Beef Chalupa with a FREE. senior drink for less than $4 can't beat that. YUM!!

This location always surprises me. The staff have always been incredibly nice. They are a little on the slow side.  I'd give more starts but its taco bell.  I'd write more, but its taco bell, how much can you really say?

Look. I can take a lot of guff from a fast food restaurant. The workers are underpaid and probably wish they weren't working for a company that doesn't value them. But when you're vegetarian and don't want meat, not even a little bit, in your burrito, and they mess up the order twice in a row? That's when I'd say I've had about enough. I live about a five minute walk from this Taco Bell and the next closest Taco Bell is a 20 min drive. I hate the prospect of driving 20 minutes when I'm craving Taco Bell instead of walking 5 minutes, but it's worth it if they at least get your food right and don't deny that anything is wrong. I brought back the one that had a little bit of beef, explained what happened, and then they added a little bit of shredded chicken. It's like they were making somebody else's order and then midway through tried to take out the meat and add in black beans for my order. That's got to be a health violation.

I've never had a problem with this taco bell before but today i got the cinnamon twists and they tasted like extremely strong paint. It was so strong that we could smell the paint scent and it burned our mouths. I've ordered the cinnamon twists at taco bell before and they have never tasted like this.

Obviously, it's Taco Bell.

But, DUDE, just about the nicest lady ever at the drive through just now!  

She was pleasant, articulate, and fast.  She had a huge smile on and my order was all correct.

Get it girl!  You need a raise I'm sure.

*ell naw..to the naw..naw..EVERYBODY say..*ell to naw..naw..to the naw..naw..naaaaw! THIS is why I can't do fast foods..I just can't with them..just can't do it. Messed up my order. Didn't have anymore Baja blast...food was like bleh..NO quiero taco bell hombre! So disappointed but I got over it! Another one bites the dust! On to the next!
Out of bacon, out of sugar, front register not working. About 5 employees working at an empty store. Poorly managed dont come here.

I have a soft spot in my heart for Taco Bell. Perhaps it's because it was the first "real" food my mother fed me or perhaps because it was my first employer. Alas, this location is terrible. As a self-proclaimed Taco Bell connoisseur I can say, without a doubt, this is the worst location I've been to. There are three expectations for me for fast food: Correct order, speed, and quality/portion. They failed all three of these expectations the three times I've visited this location, butchering my order with tortoise-like-speed.
Manager literally came from behind us shouting that we are closed. We noticed the time on cell phone it was 9:58 pm. She jumped in front of us and locked the door . Really rude .

This is my go to Taco Bell! I think they've messed my order up or forgotten an item two times but that's not 1 star worthy. Other than that, these guys are on point!

Maybe it's because I always go late night on my way home from wherever, and there's one or no one inline. Which is why I come here in the first place. Fourth meal! 

Like in said before, they've rarely fouled up my order. Customer service is friendly and the speaker here is clear and understandable. The menu is brightly lit and organized in an appealing manner. 

The food quality is fast food. ITS TACO BELL PEOPLE! 

I know you're so bad for me but you taste ohhhhh so good Toxic Hell!
Five stars just for the service. Jewel (cashier) was probably the nicest person I've ever met. Well done.
I came here on a Saturday night at 1 am and they were closed. The sign on the window says they stay open till 3 am Friday and Saturday. So THATS annoying!!

Always always always sloooowww at the drive thru, never fails. All taco bells are slow, but for some reason this one is ridiculously slow and you can't leave if you're waiting to place your order and there's a car behind you, you're basically trapped because the drive thru is only wide enough for one car. Plan on being in line for 25 minutes if there's 2+ cars when you get there

Sometimes you've just got to have some taco Bell and mountain dew.  Sometimes you even go there knowing you'll be in line 30 min . That's what happened tonight.  After baking Christmas cookies all day, I just didn't want to cook dinner. So we drove up here and now we sit and sit and sit.  At least Prairie Home Companion is on NPR. 

The. Wait. Is. Unbearable. Every. Single. Time.
Ordered 6 chalupas supremes and 6 Doritos tacos supremes and they only put meat inside no sour cream no lettuce no tomatoes I guess they think people like to pay extra for nothing.

Literally the slowest fast food I have ever orderd. For a lunch hour, it was relatively slow. My receipt says I ordered at 1217, and my food was called at 1231 - and my order was wrong. This fixed it quickly (with only minor attitude "Did you tell [the guy I ordered from] that you wanted it that way?"). 

To be fair, the food was made to good quality - but I'll be going elsewhere if I need a quick lunch.

I got a dorito locos taco from here yesterday for the first time and it was delicious! I usually get cheesy gordita crunch, chalupa supreme or chicken quesideas with sour cream! *mouth watering* mmmmm......

The service at this Quincy location is okay. Would be better if they smiled more! :D
I ordered a crunch wrap supreme and they gave me an octagon shaped tortilla with just beans....  No crunch... No meat... Just beans, thanks T-Bell. Real let down haha

How do I even begin. The WORST TACO BELL IVE EVER HAD. First the cashier had no idea what was going on.... I had to call the manager to just make sure the order was correct. So you would think at that point it would be okay, but you would be wrong. Almost every item was wrong. Two items were completely missing. Then the food wasnt even edible. It was so bad and so many things were wrong with it that we just throw out the food and went somewhere else to eat. I was the only customer in the store so they weren't even busy.I WOULD PAY THEM TO EXPLAIN TO ME HOW YOU CAN SCREW UP TACO BELL THAT BAD. I am writing this review to save someone else from this unfortunate & inexplicable experience.

Run for the border?  Run next door!


I always hesitate to write a review for a fast food chain.  What's the point really.  However, this location is just nowhere I will go again, which is a shame since it's so close to me and should be a great go-to in a pinch.

Food was okay, nothing special, but was decent and they got my order correct which I do appreciate. the few times when I have been inside the place is very clean including the bathrooms, very important at a fast food location.

 However. the drive through window employee taking my order really put me in a bad mood.  Rather than greet me and ask to take my order when ready, I was greeted with a sarcastic "Thank you for not choosing McDonalds" can I take your order.  Unbelievable really.  You never ever put down your competition like that, especially not directly to a customer, and especially when that competitor is 25 feet from Taco Bell and I could have easily gone there.

Just completely silly behavior at this location.  I'm not sure if it was something the company tried out since they're in heavy competition, or if it was just a sarcastic employee.  I would not have even written a review here about it, but after writing to the company about it and receiving no response, I'm choosing to do so.

You have lost this customer, and I sincerely do not appreciate being treated that way.  Grow up and get it together.  In today's market you just cannot act this way and not have there be any repercussions.  You can do much better.

I ordered 2 Doritos Locos Tacos and they both tasted like shit. I know they tasted like shit because I have eaten my own shit before. This shit was special, it looked like liquid meat. Pretty cool. Don't eat here unless you like turd tacos. 1 STAR.

What they said. Management is poor 
I'm wondering when the franchisees will start paying attention.

I LOVE THE BELL! I don't care what anyone says. Tacos, Tacos Tacos for me!

Ok now that I got that out of my system I am a fan of Taco Bell. Always have been. It's quick, inexpensive and tasty. Perfect fast food. They are always coming out with new "Mexican" fare. I love the Doritos tacos.

I'm a sucker for things that are cheap and open all night long (like your mo.... nevermind). 

A fresco taco--a hard corn tortilla shell, beans, lettuce and pico de gallo-- has around 100 calories, 5 grams of protein and 0 cholesterol. 

Know what this means? Taco Bell is awesome, delicious, AND nutritious. (Don't argue.)

Is it weird that I'm reviewing a Taco Bell? Maybe, maybe not. I was surprised by all of the negative reviews and had to write a positive one since I've always had positive experiences here! 

My orders have always been correct here. I only get drive thru and there's nothing worse than being too lazy to check your own order before you leave, only to get home and something isn't right (I'm looking at you, Taco Bell location down the street in Winter Garden)! 

A big shoutout to Sam (I think that's his name) at the drive thru window working the late night shift! He is the most polite fast food employee I've ever encountered! He's a nice kid and works hard.
The service at this Taco Bell is about as bad as it gets. You're better off just skipping your meal entirely and going to bed hungry.
I Love Taco Bell, but this one is not the best. Food always seems to be rushed and sloppy. Go to another location.
I asked for fire sauce and they gave me a peppermint. I'm just a little disappointed.

Terrible customer service!  Most of them don't know how to run the register, only the manager is polite- the others act as if they aren't getting paid and forced to be there.  I've worked in customer service for many years and these employees could use some major classes, even a starter class on how to act in a job where you are facing the public.  Most the time the order is wrong, because they are too busy talking to other people or doing something else non-work related to pay attention to what is being ordered.
We've given this location several chances, as it is conveniently down the street from our work- but it is always the same... At any given time there are more people standing around waiting for their food, than actually eating, an average order takes about 15-20min and 2/10 times your order will be correct.

With regard to the Taco Bell on Oltorf (78704), this place has perennially terrible service.  Yesterday, I purchased 2 Grande Scramblers and another meal, of which the gentleman forgot the second Scramber (drive-thru).

Today, I asked them to replace it with the order I made today, and said "you can decide if you want to or not".  Instead, I was greeted by the manager who began arguing with me, telling me that we got it...he asked me 3 times for a receipt.  I sped off after I gave him the money (without food) because I could tell he was more interested in escalating the argument than just deciding whether he wanted to replace the meal or not. 

This place is just terrible, all up the chain.  Too bad, cause the scrambler is great.

This Taco Bell has been out of something every time we have been. I can understand one or two times but this has happened every single time we come. At least the workers are polite about it...that's the only reason this review is 2 stars instead of 1.

This Taco Bell is great. I have been here a lot since it has opened. I always get good service here. The employees are usually very friendly. The food is delicious also. The building also looks very nice since it is brand new.

The people here have been surprisingly friendly and professional the few times I've visited. 

Pretty straightforward when it comes to fast food. Order fast, get your food fast. Where joints Ike these stand out is getting the order correct. They've never left anything out. 

After about 10:30 they can't serve cantina stuff (my favorite) and apparently the neighbors like the Carmel apple empanadas, cause they run out all the time. 

I eat here too often.

Updates: The online app does give you an order number, however if you close the application or rotate your phone the receipt disappears  along with your order number. 

Ever since I wrote the original review, they are now calling names.

I ordered through the app again, I had a friend with me and he forgot to order a drink. He waited in line and ordered a soda, the employee asked if that was all? My friend said, well we ordered through the app and I forgot to order the soda - she thanked him for ordering through the application because it makes it easier for them - and gave him a small soda cup. 

The food was as good as fast-food can be, this is a rating of a taco-bell as compared to other taco-bells.
Waited in line way too long for a chalupa and crunch wrap. About 30 minutes with no more than three cars ahead. How can making a taco take so long?

I love this Taco Bell location! Nice and quiet. The service is excellent. Every time I visit everyone working is super friendly and cool. The food always tastes fresh! This is probably the only Taco Bell in Orlando I even want to visit! It's THAT nice :)
I love taco bell. They have the best tacos. The pepsi are great too. I love the service i get here they are fast and courteous.

Seriously... I am a Taco Bell enthusiast. This is the SLOWEST Taco Bell I have ever been to. Literally writing this review while I have my car in park. Been here waiting for twenty minutes while there is no one in line. I was going to order a pizza but thought it was "too slow". Wasted drive and didn't save any time.
This place is average depending what they put in their meats

Great place to eat, its always constantly clean, and the staff act well mannered.
It gets full during lunch time on weekdays, or when the Premium Outlets Mall next door is full of people
This location is great during the day, but at night I do not suggest going!! Unless you want to wait 30 minutes in line.

The place is filthy.

They run out of chicken.

The line was out the door the the employees just stood in the back yelling at each other instead of helping customers.

I eat frequently at Taco Bells but I would caution you to avoid this one.  It is the absolute slowest, dirtiest Bell that I have ever been to.  15 minutes for a burrito (with no large orders in front of me), and that was during the "Speed Zone" time!  The manager was in his office (with the door open) surfing on his phone.
If you want food from here in the morning don't go here . We drove thru the drive thru @5 and no one answered , lights were on but no answer .

First, they only gave me half my food at the drive through. I had to get their attention after they had shut the window to tell them that I had another item. Next, I ordered 4 rolled chicken Tacos but they only gave me 2. Finally, I ordered Doritos Locos Cheesy Gordita Cruches but I received regular Doritos Locos tacos. That was three strikes in one order! I will NOT be back again.

Not a bad location.  Easy to get in and out, handy for the mall and highway.  I stop in when I need a quick fix, and Sweetie doesn't have to know... 

I mean, it's Taco Bell.  It's not great, but it's filling and cheap.  It's not Mexican, really, or even Tex-Mex.  But it's fast food, and has more flavor than some.

This one is clean, and the service is friendly.  If I don't have time for real Mexican, this at least reminds me of what it's like...

I ordered a Nacho Fry box (Gordita, Doritos taco and nacho fry) Nacho Fry Supreme (with NO tomato's- I'm allergic), crunchy taco and 2 large Baja blast.  I only get the two tacos and what I assumed to be nacho fry supreme.  Go back in for the Gordita and nacho fry- the manager yelled to the back that I was here for them, indicating they knew I didn't get them, waited a few minutes then was reapproached asking what was forgotten and had to wait AGAIN while they actually made the food.  (What we're they doing the first time?!?) The employees appeared to be annoyed that they had to "remake" my food with repeated non sympathetic sorrys.  I get home and instead of a Nacho Fry Supreme and I have a Mexican pizza WITH tomato's, instead of a crunchy taco and Doritos taco I have a 2 crunchy taco supremes (with sour cream and tomato's!) The ONLY things that were correct were the two things I had to go back in for- which my husband ate.  I did not eat because of the tomato's on food that I didn't even order! VERY, VERY bad experience for me and assumning others since I obviously got someone else's order.  
Also, drive thru takes 30-45 min.  Bring a book. AND always test your soda before you leave- it regularly taste AWFUL!

For the first time when ordering food, I went online to view the menu. In the process I discovered the Taco Bell app. 

I decided to give it a shot. 

The process seemed easily enough as I placed a rather large order including drinks, multiple tacos, different types of burritos, chips and guacamole.

After imputing all the food I wanted to order, letting the app know which store I wanted to use and paying through a secure website,
I received a confirmation of my order and an email confirmation, with a message to press the designated button on the app when I got close to the store. 

Within the order I was asked if I wanted to get my order within the store or in the drive-thru. I chose the drive-thru.

I got in the car and headed for the store. 

As I pulled into the parking lot, I hesitated a bit, not knowing how much time was needed from the time I pushed the app button to when I could get my food. 

After pushing the button, I drive up to the speaker, told them I had placed an online order and gave them the order number. 

On the other end, I was asked to verify my name and drove through to the pick-up window.

Surprisingly, they read off my total order which was completely correct. I offered my credit card to pay for my meal and was told that I didn't have to do that because it had already been paid. 

The lady in the window must have been a manager because it seemed she was training the young man with her. 

I was very pleased when the lady told me that my order of 12 Tacos Supreme would actually less online next time if I ordered them as a 12 pack. The price would be $18.99 as compared to the individual price of 12 Crunchy Supreme Tacos for $20.28, a difference of $1.29. I realize it's not that much of a difference, but it's still $1.29, isn't it?

When I got the food home the food was still hot, crunchy and delicious. 

The 7-layer burrito was wrapped in a soft tortilla and filled to overflowing with luscious guacamole. The Tacos Supreme include tomatoes, sour cream and a crunchy outer taco shell. 

This is not so much a review of the app, but a way to get good, delicious Taco Bell food faster.

Late night drunk food? Check.
Hangover cure? Check. 
Patient employees? Check.
Correct orders? Check.

So, I didn't think I would be writing a review on Taco Bell, but this one is special to my heart. It has saved my life on multiple occasions. It is conveniently located right on broadway. Beware! If you are driving drunk (which you shouldn't be), you will most likely not make it through the drive through. It is the curviest drive through I've been to.

Honestly, what's worse than coming home after a night of drinking only to discover that you got a fish taco instead of the quesadilla you ordered? Nothing.

This is why this Taco Bell is solid. Consistency is key.
Sit in line for over 25 minutes waiting to place our order.  Was finally able to get out of line and leave.  Please hire more people, so you can provide better service.

Only usually hit this place up on my cheat days, which is about once every two weeks, the biggest compliment I can give is their customer service, they have really stepped it up a few notches, every employee I have dealt with at this location for the past year has been outgoing and pleasant to deal with. The food is pretty decent, I mean it is Taco Bell, I usually go after their cantina wrap which is decent.

Ever since the Taco Bell in Tualatin has been remodeled and opened the staff, service, and food has been terrible. We keep giving them a chance and every time it's awful. They never get your order right, they take absolutely forever to get you your food because they are all busy talking with each other laughing and grab-assing. When you correct them about your order they give you attitude and talk back, the customer service is terrible. It doesn't matter if there is ten people working and two customers, a full house or nobody there it takes too long for a simple order. We will literally drive to Lake Oswego from now on and make sure that all of our friends and family do to. Absolutely terrible.

Terrible service! I entered the drive through 6 minutes before they closed, I get it, they probably had everything cleaned, and were looking to get out of there, but I waited for two full minutes, still no answer, and proceeded to drive to the drive through window and banged upon it. Finally, some clown walked up to the window, looked at me, and walked away. I ended up eating an overpriced burger at Kelly's, simply because they were the only place still open that time of the morning. I drive to Danvers now, (30 minute round trip opposed to 15 minute) just because the service is better, and the people are friendlier. On a positive note; Saugus messed up my order last year, and when I drove around to go inside, the manager (I didn't catch her name, but she was African American), was very professional, polite and apologetic, and offered me a free beverage. The man who worked mornings when they started offering breakfast was  very polite as well.

The food here is at least average for a Taco Bell and the prices are better than the one on Interstate, but I routinely have to wait for 20+ minutes in a line of only a few cars to get my food. This is especially evident at night. Suggestion: trek over to to Javier's tacos, about a 10 minute drive away, for your late night Mexican cravings. They're much better and faster and they're open 24 hours.

Typical Taco Bell. 

for some reason this is my daughters favorite TB and insists on it every time. 

They are usually pretty fast with the order and get it right.

Only thing is it would be nice when you order in the drive thru that the speaker is not turned up to 11. Sometimes you can order with your window up its so loud.

I won't go here again.  First of all, had trouble ordering.  She couldn't understand me and I couldn't understand her, not a good way to start.  I ordered an enchirito, not a good idea.  Let me start... first of all, she slung the bag at me through the window.  The lid wasn't on the container and it spilled in the bag.  The reason it spilled, is that they didn't know how to make an enchirito.  It was open faced with the meat and sauce on the outside, no wonder that it spilled.  I won't go back.  Next time I want Taco Bell, I'll drive to Norwell.

Super clean restaurant. I like to see a franchisee taking such pride in their location. The entire building inside and out was well taken care of and the staff was doing a great job of keeping it clean. They were sweeping every 5 minutes and the parking lot too. 

The food is consistent and everything I ordered came exactly as I expected. Living in the Virgin Islands I don't get Taco Bell but twice a year so it is a tough choice when you have that menu staring at you. So many choices. 

Baja blast is such a great choice for the drink. 

I got a burrito supreme and a taco supreme which with the diablo sauce was a perfect combination.  

Toyota must be close by as I saw 10 or so employees come in and out in the short time I was there. 

Please come back to St Thomas Taco Bell!  We miss you.
Every time I come here they get my order right, but the tacos are always broken, they frequently forget napkins and sometimes hot sauce... and it always takes awhile to get through the drive through

This is one of the best Taco Bells around.  The staff are very friendly, the manager is approachable, and the service in the drive thru is quite speedy.  I can't - and don't- ask much more than that from a fast food joint.  Bravo, Reynoldsburg Taco Bell!
As far as food goes. It's just a taco bell. We know what it is. Service is excellent. John G at the takeout window is awesome. Top notch service and class.

I really don't agree with the bad reviews.  The food is not superior quality, but it is good value for the price.  The portions may be small, but atleast the lettuce and tomatoes are fresh.  The meat may be frozen and not all of it is actual meat, but that brings us back to the price.  You can't beat the prices at this place.  There are a lot places out there that charge more money and have worse quality of food., whether mexican food or otherwise.  If you want absolutely best food, the best thing to do is try reputable places that have higher prices.  If you compare price versus quality for this place, I would honestly give it 3.5 stars, but I rounded up to four because the people are usually nice here.  But I can definately understand where the people are coming from who made bad reviews, I just don't personally think this place is that bad.  It is sort of guilty pleasure of mine.
That was the best crunch wrap supreme I've ever had! Super fresh and extra big! Staff was friendly and quick.  YUM
Standard Taco Bell fare but the bathroom was gross: the floor didn't look clean and there was some kind of rag or shirt underneath the sink!
Taco Bell is more expensive than a traditional Mexican eatery.  ¡No f'n bueno!  More importantly, the entire restaurant smells like a musty jock strap that was washed with farty refried beans.

I have never had a bad experience at this location.  I work nearby and often stop here for lunch.  The staff is always super friendly and never rushes me or gets an attitude if I take a while to figure out what I want. It's taco bell so I'm not expecting a gourmet meal,  but the food is always hot and tastes fresh.  For fast food, you can't go wrong at this location.

Terrible costumer service! Start working and stop having bad attitudes. New manager & new staff is needed. They always run out of food and try to close early. Scary to eat there! Might as well tear it down.

This location used to be really fast and reliable. This is the second time in a row that has taken FOREVER

The person in front of me was at the ordering screen for at at least ten minutes. I assumed she was just ordering $60 worth of food. But when I finally got to the screen there was a single combo on the screen. The guy then asked me to wait a moment. I then sat there in silent for 7 minutes (I timed it) before he came back to take my order. I placed my order in about 30 seconds and when I pulled forward all the other cars were already out. Then I sat at the window for nearly 10 minutes before I got my food. It looked like the guy was the only person in the restaurant, so maybe they need more staff

Tonight wasn't nearly as bad but I've spent more than 15 minutes in this drive thru and am still waiting for my food

Fresh food and friendly staff! 
Sometimes it can be a little slow but I totally get it, busy location and few workers scheduled? 
Props to the workers who try their best and stay professional.

Love the food but have never been even slightly satisfied with the service from this specific Taco Bell. In fact the other night when I pulled in i saw an employee flip us off most likely just because it was midnight but they continued by giving us lots of attitude as I always generally receive through the drive through there. However today I walked in for my free Doritos locos tacos since they were having a promotion, and I saw the person in line before me receive theirs. So after standing their for about 45 seconds someone asked me what I'd like to order and I told them I'd like the free taco and he told me the promo had been over to which I replied oh whoops I thought it ended at 6 to which he replied yes it did. I then pulled out my phone to show him it was 6:00 still. He looked at me with a blank stare so I laughed as if he were joking then he asked if I wanted anything so I walked out with no further words. I was there at 5:59 waiting to order and the place was empty other than the person in front of me. I've always loved Taco Bell and it is a pity now I will never be going to that location again due to the fact that they must have chose their staff looking to find the most miserable customer service known to mankind. I genuinely felt that everyone there was in a deep depression in their lives.

Lobby always closed ! Waiting an half an hour to get your food. Huh. Thought it was called fast food for a reason. But, ig not. They sure do take their sweet time. And they want a raise, that's funny. You better earn it. Make customers happy.

I ordered through their new online app; they never called my name - i found out later that my order was on the counter getting cold. I am not going to assume an order is mine. They were calling out the receipt numbers - but the app does not give receipt numbers - they asked everyone in line their names but still they only called out receipt numbers. 

They were out of hot sauce in the lobby, a gentleman asked for some and they put a boat load on the counter and left it their - I went ahead and filled the lobby container for them. 

Understaffed and this place needs a culture change - champs cheers aren't working.

I come here a lot because Taco Bell is my jam.

Service can be really, really slow when they're busy.  They need a bigger building, or Taco Bell needs to open up more locations in the area.  There's clearly a demand.  If you go onto Google Maps and see where the Taco Bells are, this is the only Taco Bell for like hundreds and hundreds of thousands of people.  All of Quincy, all of Milton, most of Dorchester, South Boston, Weymouth, etc.

The inside is still small.  If you come here after school is out or after work, this place can get real fucking busy.

If you're coming here and it's busy, I HIGHLY recommend parking on the street or down a side street.  Drive through and parking can be a complete clusterfuck because the drive through and parking both use one single lane.  You can be stuck in that parking lot for literally a half an hour. 

They don't have any of the cool Taco Bell drinks.  That's the problem when it's a KFC/Taco Bell combination place.  However, they always get the new food on time now.  It's great being able to hear about a new Taco Bell item and I can actually go here and get it instead of never or weeks later.

They definitely revamped their staff.  Now instead of unhappy, angry young kids.  There are actual adults working here who know that people come here for cheap, fast, indulgences and don't have time for lazy, disinterested employees.  No one wants to be in a fast food joint for longer than they have to, but we do it because that's where shitty capitalism takes us.  Their staff has significantly improved from below 0 stars to a respectable if I must say above respectable level.

They still fuck up orders once and a while, because that's part of the requirements you must agree to when you get a license to open a restaurant from the city, but they've gotten significantly better.  This is a solid Taco Bell now.

Gratnted this is fast, unhealthy food......but This has to be the worst taco bell experience ever.  The first time we came we waited 15 minutes in line and still 5 cars behind where you put in your order. Couldn't wait anymore so we left. (6pm on a Tuesday)

Decided to try it a 2nd time .. waited 13 mins just to order. Then another 8 mins to get the food once at the window. 

While we were PARKED in line, watched at least 3 cars back up and leave.... when they handed us the food it was already cold. Hard tacos soggy by the time we got home, and we only live a block away.

In the Bay Area, it takes an average of 3 minutes to order and get your HOT food.

The food was good. Typical Taco Bell. The employees were nice. The food took 15 minutes.  They were busy, not packed. The place was filthy. We had to wet napkins and clean a table. The napkins and condiments were almost empty. I only gave it two stars because the food was good. I would leave 0 stars for the state of the restaurant.

This Taco Bell location is in the SoDo district of Orange Avenue. North of Michigan Avenue, it is in the Super Target plaza. On my visits here, the service has been quick and friendly, the food is served hot and in a timely manner, and the dining area and bathrooms are always clean.
I stopped in here for lunch this past Wednesday. Always busy during lunchtime. I ordered the Combo Number 3, which is three tacos (either hard or soft shell) and a large drink for $5.39. I also ordered a Mexican Pizza for $3.39. I always have to order one of those. Love those things. Especially covered in hot sauce! Anyway, with tax, the order came to $9.36.
As I mentioned, service is always friendly. And the employee working the counter, Shenikwa, is worth mentioning. She was friendly and greeted each customer with a smile, as well as the other employees whose names I did not get. All employees were courteous and made sure that the service was fast, all condiments were available and well stocked, and that the dining area was clean.
Let's face it. It is more of a fast food restaurant than it is a Mexican restaurant. But if you are tired of hamburgers, chicken sandwiches, and hoagies for lunch, this is a good change of place.
The only problem I have with this Taco Bell is that you have to deal with the traffic in the SoDo plaza and parking lot in order to get to the restaurant. During lunch hour, traffic can be heavy. And with the intersection of the parking lot being confusing as it is, it can cause some problems. Anyone who has driven around the Orange Avenue-Michigan Avenue intersection knows about the experience I am writing about.
But for a reasonably priced meal, it is worth checking out. Especially for one of those Mexican Pizzas!

Messed up order 3 times
The workers probably have a hearing problem
Maybe you should get a hearing test before working

I think a point needs to be made that my lazy personality actually bothered to download this app just for this review.  This isn't me trolling nor bashing poor workers on a bad day.  Let me begin by painting the scene - we were the only ones in the Taco Bell.  This happened mid day - not at night when potentially there could have been episodes of narcolepsy.  We were polite (southern hospitality ya'll) and considerate.

So now that you can imagine any other retaliatory scenario in the works is out of the picture - let me begin this review.  Part 1: Cheesy potato burrito. The thing is a burrito, not a bowl, not a fiesta potato, it's a burrito. So guess which enigma I came across when I opened the beautiful brown bag of goodness? It was a burrito without a tortilla - how that is possible? I don't know.
Part 2: Mexican pizza.  The dish is simple and elegant - I can't even describe to you how this could be messed up.  The wrong cheese, no sauce, and just beans and crunchy flat tortilla.  This was more puzzling that the enigma codes cracked during world war 2.  But then there is part 3.
Part 3:  Crunch wrap supreme.  I think the only way you can get worse is when the thing is simply missing - guess what? It wasn't there...that brown bag of goodness...not in it
So if anyone ever reads this masterpiece, please know I am hoping that they were having a bad day. A part of me just hopes ...sheer prayer...that this doesn't happen to you.

This is the slowest Taco Bell in the universe. Over the past 5 years I have stopped by once per year. Whether it's on the middle of the day or night or morning, they are slower than molasses in winter. The customer service is fine, price is fine, and so on.

But seriously, if there are more than two people in line in front of you, expect to take 30 minutes or more to get your food. Yikes. 

This is my final attempt with this Taco Bell. Going forward, I'll drive out of my way to the Taco Bell on MLK.
You should really update the hours if you will be closed due to construction. Just drove a half hour to this location after checking to make sure it was open just to find it to be under construction!

Not open on time or even relatively near on time. Supposed to open at 7 a worker arrived at 710 while another was just standing there inside lights off drive through closed. Lazy and incompetent workers.

The manager at this place sucks, she's rude, yells at her employees in front of customers and is overall just terrible at her job. I've waited for 35 minuets for my food here before and she was the cause, have gone several times an hour or so before they close and they say they've closed early and are not serving anymore just so they can leave earlier it's crazy they still in business

I just spent 25 minutes in the drive thru and when I got home my order was severely inaccurate chicken tacos instead of steak...and 2 items weren't even accounted for...the time was so bad I don't care to go back....im very displeased.

Hey TB employees- if you're gonna talk crap about or make fun of one the customers, make sure they can't hear you. Or maybe just don't be mean at all... People who work at Taco Bell's shouldn't throw stones lol

Workers were extremely rude when they did not abide by the hours. We pulled up to the window where the manager opened, and told us they were closed "on their clock". Then continued by shutting the window on our request for food.
You don't get what you pay for, that's for sure.  Lovely way to cheat on product use levels.

So we went here kinda as a joke cause we were starving and it literally had two 5 star reviews.... uhhhh... yeah, but surprisingly, it was pretty legit.

Extremely clean, new Taco Bell design and one of the friendliest staff's I have recently come across in fast food.

Big Ups

I wasn't going to write a review but I had a question for Jason A about your experience? 
How big is your vagina? What the hell are you expecting from a fast food chain? Tacobell pays minimum wage, sounds like an employee was trying to make a little joke, and your are a certified douche bag, and idiot for even considering this might be a ploy from the management at Tacobell because of competition. Goto Mcdonalds next time pretty boy. I go to Tacobell for quick food, and me being a veteran at this location I can say the food and employees here are just what you might expect at a Tacobell. If your food wasn't bad and that is your only real complaint about the service then your just a little girl for taking your time to post this bull. I hate you.

I come in there and they ask me to eat food and do a survey? It was unpleasant to be approached that way. 
Won't be returning due to the fact I might be side swiped again.

Used to love this location, now it just sucks. The past few times my meals have either had missing ingredients or were cold. Came tonight, and of course I get home and the cheesy Gordita taco in my craving deal has literally no cheese. This is the only reason why I get this meal. So annoying. In the box, I ordered a soft taco instead of the hard taco, and ofcourse I got a hard taco. Disappointed.

I love Taco Bell every now and then. This particular one screws up my order every time and is always really, really slow. The guys on the line seem way too baked to function ...even for Taco Bell, which may make it mandatory for employees to smoke up before work.

Our order was wrong.... They shorted us food that we paid for.  We only ordered four items.  When we pulled up to the window the young man working stuck his hand out and without any sort of greeting just said "money".  I get that this isn't five star dining or Cha Cha Cha two blocks down or even a decent McDonalds.  BUT a hand out the window with no eye contact that just says money and the lack of ability to correctly place four items in a bag?!?  No thanks.... drive the extra 10 minutes to Interstate.

I went into this location just to get a gift card. SO I can not comment on anything else expect that. I guess that is good because I would never consider eating there. There was only one person taking orders on a Saturday afternoon at 12:30. Really.. the place was packed and when I say packed it was five deep in line. The drive thru was at least six cars deep. The soda fountain that you are supposed to help your self with was broken. The only person they had taking orders had to stop taking orders and refill drinks for people in the restaurant from the drive thru fountain. When she finally got to me which was about 15 minutes after I got in line, I asked for a gift card and she had to leave the register and the store counter to go to the back and look for some. Eventually she return and said they were out come back tomorrow or I could go to Walmart they should have some. Clearly I didn't go back on Sunday.
Great experience 7/5/14 at 11pm. The assistant manager CJ was incredibly helpful and friendly! The food was good, hot, and complete too. Keep up the good work guys, I'll be back!
Got my food..cold..had things I didn't ask for and one thing I did ask for I didn't get...not going back...Del Taco all the way!!!

This is the best Taco Bell I've ever been too.  The lobby is extremely clean & well maintained, the food is delicious (tastes better than other Taco Bell locations), and the service is great!  The lobby is also open until 12 AM, which is pretty neat if you enjoy dining inside fast food restaurants.  I'm really sad this Taco Bell isn't closer to my house, but then again, maybe that's a good thing...

Taco Bell is Taco Bell so how much can I tell you.  Since this one is 30 seconds from my house, I've been here enough to feel compelled to review it.  

Their drive through speed was once great but has taken a huge dive in the last few months.  However, they almost always have ultra friendly people working the window which is refreshing compared to other fast food places.
4 stars because this is the better of Taco Bell's in Columbus. It's close to work, they're never out of ingredients and the staff is pleasant. Sometimes you just gotta have some TB in your life.

I don't know what fillers they are using in their Taco meat, but it's awful!  It's worse than the worse meat because you just don't know what is in it.  I've noticed this for years, but it's getting worse.  Kind of like a paste. Spend 2 extra buck and go to Chiptole where meat is meat.
Super slow service. Was so tired waiting for my knowledge of a grande. It felt like I waited all night long. All I wanted was some tacos and they never came.
This was our second visit back through there as there as they completely ruined the food from our first visit.  They did make it right and all is well again.

When I am galavanting in the Quincy region, and have a hankering for a waffle filled with sausage and egg, I slip quietly into Taco Bell of Quincy, Massachusetts. Their fine waffle breakfast sandwiches fill me with joy. Shally, the head cashier, serves me with a smile, even when I sheepishly order a third waffle taco. She makes the shame almost tolerable. Thanks Taco Bell, for all you do. Can you open an hour earlier? Thanks

It's small and gets packed quick so be ready. It takes some time for your food to come out, but there is plenty of seating. We haven't eaten here in a long time and wanted to try the breakfast menu. It's exactly what I thought it would be, breakfast for a one handed pro. We ordered 1 of each of the breakfast items to test all. The Cinnabon bites are deliciousness wrapped in a ball of carb-ness. 

We have to drive here from Dorchester but its usually worth it. taco bell is reserved for weekends in my house but with it being summer we might have to add 1 weekday for breakfast when we're on the go.

I want to start out by saying, no one loves Taco Bell more than me. Taco Bell is the greatest, I love Taco Bell and everyone knows that I love Taco Bell. But this location is EXTREMELY below par. All my items were missing ingredients. I got a sausage grande scrambler and it only had cold eggs and sausage. I KNOW there are more ingredients. This is not my first rodeo. It was as flat as a pancake. I've actually seen pancakes that were thicker. Then, they had a guy pressure washing the drive thru at 930 in the morning. He was coming within a foot of our vehicle which was spraying dirty water and/or chemicals on our car. Definitely not thrilled with this location.

i have been to this taco bell over 30 times since its opening. restaurant growing pains never bother me constant customer service was there at all times this visit i wanted to try the rolled chicken with the dipping sauces guacamole was better than expected also that spicy ranch was great also, beef burrito supreme was perfect with some diablo sauce very spicy and my personal favorite fresco soft taco check it out they are operating on all cylinders good food, also checked out the drive thru its all in all a great experience try it out

Why a five star you say? In high school, my friends and I were going here almost daily for lunch...sometimes dinner also. The customer service was superb for a fast food chain. 

In the last few years they have revamped their store and it is much easier on the eyes.

When I want Taco Bell, I come here!

Clean interior, good service, typical Taco Bell food. My primary problem with this location is that on some items, they charge slightly more than other Taco Bells in the area. For example, the $5 cravings deal box (currently the nacho fries box and the double cheesy gordita crunch box) that costs $5.00 at other Taco Bells (like the one nearby at Bethel & Sawmill) costs $5.29 here. If you're in the area (i.e. at the Tuttle Mall), this location makes sense. But if you live anywhere else in Columbus, you can probably save a little bit by going to a different Taco Bell.

I do enjoy a little Taco Bell every so often But... This time. It took well over a minute to be acknowledged at the counter. When I placed my order and received my receipt it said "To Go". I was never asked if I wanted to "dine in" I'm guessing no one wanted to wash the trays since I didn't see anyone with them in the dining room. So I sat at a fairly clean table that I found and ate out of my bag. 

During my seeming long wait for my order. I heard the staff complaining about working too much and wanting to go home.... Then! I watched the team member that took my order go back on the prep line with a new pair of gloves start working with food. Then, take a finger load of food off the line and eat with the gloves on, then go back to touching more food without changing the gloves. At that point I pretty much lost my apatite, in fear of what else could be wrong with the food. 

Floors were dirty throughout, Tables dirty, soda fountain a mess... I have eaten here before on many occasions but after today's experience I may have to think twice before coming again.

My way to work every day and this place has the worst order takers in the world. I said last time i came my salad had no sc on it. This time put sc on it but forget to put the chicken on it. Come on people , so next day i go back and complain to manager, no sorries no freee stuff, no more................................
Talk about customer service! Ashley gave the best customer service imaginable! I hope she gets a promotion, like yesterday

Beware of price hikes.  I went to this store last night (11/13/17) and was a little surprised by the increase in pricing.  I love Taco Bell, but I will not support this franchise nor the sister store in Titusville, due to the fact that the franchisee has higher prices than any other Taco Bell in the area.  For example the $5 box as advertised on TV is actually $5.49.  Plus every normal menu item is also .10 higher across the board.  Why??? 

The employees are always friendly, but my order is always wrong.

They seem to have changed the quality of their food. I ordered a beef chalupa and, I am not over exaggerating when I say this, they literally only put a tablespoon of beef in it. I posted a couple of pics to share. They used to be my favorite taco bell but sadly no more.

I'm surprised by all the negative reviews for this Taco Bell.  Yes, it's fast food and it will likely leave your system in 12 hours or less.  But the food is consistent and I've never had any real complaints.  Sure, the service isn't top-notch, but name me one fast food joint with employees who actually give a damn.

Let's talk about the service here.  The service is "What do you want", "what else", and "here"...  The employees here are horrible, every single one of them..  No greetings.  No manners.  No "thanks, have a nice day".  They do this all without a beat, every time i come here it's like that.

Even though the service is terrible, the food here isn't bad.  I actually like the food here.  Cheesy gordita crunch, my favorite on the menu.  Potato wedges from the KFC menu is also a favorite.  Make sure when you order your food in the drive thru, double check all the items in the bag.  Almost half of the time they will forget something or give you the wrong item.

The food is typical Taco Bell fare but the customer service here is outstanding! I really feel like the people who work at this location are genuinely happy and enjoy their jobs. My friend and I met here with my two kids and her four. We ate inside when it was a bit slow and the workers came out and cleared out places, asked how we were and kept the whole place looking very clean.

G-L-A-M-O-R-O-U-S

Fergie acts as if Taco Bell is the dumps.

But you know what?! I STILL GO TO TACO BELL. SHIT'S MAD FLOSSY.

First off, classical music in a Taco Bell, WHAAAAAAAAAAT?! Dining here was a real treat this evening. As I bit into my usual Double Decker taco, Beethoven floated me away to another magical world... I felt as if I were peacefully dining at an upscale establishment, even as the dirty hipster guy two tables away was making a drug deal (prolly weed, mang) with some other dirty hipster dude. (And speaking of which, why do hipsters always have crappy weed?)

Cashier 66 Steven Hearn presented us with excellent service, even taking the time out of his day to ACTUALLY BRING MY FOOD TO ME and...bussing it away at the end of my meal! Holy shit! Was I supposed to tip you man? He made me feel bad...kind of...because when he asked if I wanted to donate a dollar to their Taco Bell fund for high-risk high school students, I just shot him down.* Man, Steve gave me the saddest look ever. Damn. He even cared about the kids...

1 star knocked out because they didn't give me enough beans for my Double Decker. THAT'S THE WHOLE POINT MAN! THE BEANS! But Steve, my man, I know it wasn't your fault. You should be running the damn place.

*Note: I work at a non-profit that works with high-risk high school students. And I barely have enough money for myself, damnit! But enough cash money to get some fine dining material at Taco Bell. MMM YEAH!
Taco bell is meh.  Not a fan of the breakfast. I.leave with a tummy ache every time! Not good!

This is what a 5-star Taco Bell looks like! Hot food, order filled accurately. What more do you need? My wife orders tacos fresco style because she doesn't eat cheese. Most Taco Bells manage to get pieces of cheese in it anyway. Not this location. Her tacos were cheese free. That may sound trivial to you, but it means a lot to us.
Gave me a stomach ache when i ate here last. I used to love eating here when i was a student because it was value for money and i was poor then
I got sick as a dog last time I ate at this Taco Bell. I will never eat there again. It also took forever to get my food. I thought Taco Bell was supposed to be fast food not this Taco Bell.

Driving along, I just wanted something quick that I could take with me and so I popped into the Taco Bell drive through. It was quick and efficient, my burritos were stuffed and wrapped properly. It was better than A-OK but "I'm a fan" seems unusual for TB.

Closed until Nov. or Dec. 2014 for remodeling.

Good food, friendly service, great price, and with classical music.  Two small notices posted by the drive-in window, out of view inside the new chain link fence announce closing after "August 12th for remodeling ... [that] should take three to four months".

I hope it'll reopen soon as the nearest Taco Bells are miles away (and of course the others don't play classical music).

His name is Steven.  He was clearly on drugs.  I will never go back to this Taco Bell.  I feel that a restaurant must provide a standard of safety to its customers and this small standard was violated.  This is a clear sign of poor management.  Taco Bell should be held to a higher standard by taking clear and corrective action until then stay away for health reasons.
They have a good selection for vegetarians, it's cheap, and tasty! They're even open late. How can you go wrong?

If this Taco Bell location was a band, its name would be Dinner Drivethru Deathmarch. Have been here many times but tonight was the worst yet.  This is truly where the notion of 'fast food' went to curl up and die.

Ordered 2 soft tacos around 10:15 pm. Waited for 10 minutes in line, and had enough so I had to BACK up out of the line. There is only one way in, and one way out. Service is horrible. It's called fast food FYI. Once I reached the other side of the highway, the same person was still in line, and the time was 10:42... absolutely horrible. Never will I go back to this location again

I was here 23 min after they were open and they simply just said "sorry we got in late an don't have any food ready" no oh let us get set up or nothing. Just posting so perhaps the owners are aware of the quality of employees they posses.

This location is hit or miss. Sometimes it is great and sometimes not. I have gone when doors were locked too early. Service is usually slow. 

It is clear the issue is management.

That said the food is generally fine. They routinely run out of sauce and doritos. It's close to me so I will likely go again. Just set your expectations and you will be fine.
Place is horrible. Closing employees doesn't care about how the presentation of the food is. I ordered the Steak Nacho box and it's just thrown in the box. Never again will I visit this location.
Found a hair in my nacho box never coming back again. That is so rude and disgusting. Who the fuck does that with food

Although the staff here are really friendly, they seriously need to work on getting orders correct.  As a disclaimer, I did come here around 2 am (sometimes you just need late night Taco Bell!), though I think that it's important to always get orders right at all times of the day. 

I ordered 3 chalupas, a nacho bellgrande, a quesarito, a crunchy taco, a cheesy potato burrito, and one cheesy core burrito. After ordering my food in the drive thru, I realized that the bag they gave me wouldn't fit my nachos. They forgot them. Meh. I drove back to the drive thru and waited to get my nachos. After coming home, I realized that they completely forgot my quesarito and my crunch taco. Also, the two burritos I bought weren't even the ones that I wanted. I literally had no idea what they were.

TLDR: I ordered 8 items in total. I received 4 of them. 2 of the items weren't even in the bag and the other 2 were incorrect. I know it's Taco Bell, but still. This is unacceptable.

I was just at this location and apparently, now they open an hour later than they used to. I rolled up to the drive thru at 7:24 and waited 5 minutes for some woman to rudely come on the intercom system and say that they don't open the drive thru until 730. Not great business and whoever that woman was should be fired. It's not like they have their hours listed on the menu board so to come at me with the attitude she had was unnecessary. It's a shame, because I would have loved to provide my business.

It seems I'm not the only one who has gotten food poisoning from this location. The times I have gone here has been because it is close to my house. The service has always been horrible, but I continued to go due to liking the food. After my food poisoning, I will not be going back again.

Don't ever use a credit card here. A while back the workers  didn't hand me back my credit card and then wrote down the number and purchased over $800 online. I reported it to the police and after investigation they found that they had done it to multiple people. Worst part was I went back to see if the lady who took my card was working there and she was, after I reported her to the police and Taco Bell headquarters.

I really hate to admit this but... I love Taco Bell. Always have, and likely always will.

Been to probably 30 different Taco Bells in my life all over the country, and his one ranks at the bottom.

The place is dirty, the staff is incompetent (even for Taco Bell standards), and they are very, V ...E... R ...Y slow.

The food is regular Taco Bell fare after you finally receive it, but the atmosphere is so clammy, crowded and odd I just can't suggest this particular Bell to anybody.

If you have a craving for a #8 w/ soft tacos, a bean burrito and a Pepsi, drive 25 minutes south to the TB in Norwell, MA on RT. 53.

Several solid review for this TB so I have it a shot and it was up to snuff! Clean, new store design and they grilled the Crunchwrap Supreme all the way shut...which when they don't is a huge pet peeve!

One of the better TB's I've been to. 4 stars on the "fast food scale."

It's getting worse. In the past month or two they've hired a couple new workers who want to make sure you understand they don't give a shit about you and that they're headed for better things. There's one dark haired girl with tattoos who will spend 20 seconds on her phone before she hands you your food, not even looking at you in the process. Society will benefit greatly when automation replaces the need for workers like these. The food has gone down in quality since these workers started, which is saying a lot. Also, wait times have increased a lot in the past couple of months. Robots should be making these burritos... they would get it right every time, cost the business owner less and result in faster/more reliable food delivery. Does anyone really want unhappy people in a hot kitchen making their food? Bring on the robots, Automation Age... I'm ready.

Taco Bell es una cadena de cómida fusión mexicana americana que se destaca por sus tacos pero también tiene otras opciones como burritos, sándwiches y ensaladas. Los precios son bajos y por 5 usd comen dos personas. La gaseosa es libre y se puede llenar el vaso las veces que se quiera, pero también es posible evitarlas y servirse agua. Hay salsas picantes para agregar con distinto grado de picor. Los nachos con queso no son ricos pero algunos de los tacos del plato que comi (una degustacion de 3 tacos) estaban ricos con relleno de carne, queso, salsa y lechuga. Buena opción para los amantes del fast food que busquen una opción económica. El local es amplio, la atención muy amable y cuenta con un estacionamiento cercano y espacioso.
I usually get sick when I eat a taco bell.  The food is sub par to say the least.  often cold, mushy, and rarely am I satisfied.

This Taco Bell location is always busy, the food is good, Personally I feel the drive through employees should be more professional, She should greet the customers in a proper manner,  Not rude and sassy!!!

This restaurant is so poorly managed it's pathetic. Probably three out of five times when I come through for breakfast at about 7:15 AM the restaurant is closed and for whatever reason, unable to take orders. I don't know this until after I've placed my mobile order, paid, and then arrive to the store only to be told they won't be open for awhile. So then they have to issue a cash refund. I've heard excuse after excuse, but the bottom line is management is in capable of managing. I've also gotten talked back to from an employee when I (politely) asked for salt. His response to me was "I don't know why but sure!" I don't understand why he felt the need to make that comment but it was inappropriate. Regardless - it's about a 50/50 chance that this store will be open within their posted business hours, they close early quite often too.

I don't normally post on these sites but my experience here was beyond terrible, and I think others deserve to know. The service was horrible and the employee incredibly rude.  The employee actually tried verbally picking a fight with our group while we were ordering.  I enjoy Taco Bell, but will officially go out of my way to give anyone business besides this particular franchise

I'm usually someone who thinks yelp gives businesses a bad rap, but honestly I feel like this one is deserving. There hasn't been one time where I left this Taco Bell with my complete order. Literally every single time, and I'm counting at least 8 visits this year so far. They're never even nice (and I'm writing this with no expectation of nice service at a Taco Bell). I've worked in the food business, and I know it gets stressful, but most of the time there's barely anybody even in the store or in line, so there's honestly no excuse for the service. I can also say this is the only Taco Bell in the area (mostly meaning interstate and west burnside locations) where this even happens. Somethings gotta change, man.

Rudest staff ever! After years I have not eaten at Taco Bell... this reminded me of why I should've kept avoiding Taco Bell. The guy at the register greeted us while he was on his phone and messed up our order. When we talked to him about our messed up order his manager showed up and still charged us double for the missing item. She was also very rude and as we ate our food she was cursing and talking about the situation that happened. I'll try my best to avoid this restaurant

If I could give a negative star I would! The customer service here is LOUSY! The people working here ALWAYS mess up on orders like if you paid for a $5 burrito somehow you get a 1 dollar taco? and if they somehow managed to get the right order the food isn't made correctly like a chicken burrito WITHOUT CHICKEN!!!?? all i ordered was two things hoping at least these people couldn't mess that up well they DID! and its not just once or twice but at least 20 times... why did it take that long for me to stop going there well i just kept on hoping cause i thought some people couldn't be that incompetent and i really love taco bell ... well not this much

I would consider mysel a Taco Bell afficianado.  My friends even give me gift cards for Christmas and Birthdays.  Today is the FIRST TIME I EVER WALKED OUT OF A TACO BELL in total disgust.  Not only were theu upcharging on every item I typically order at other Taco Bells, but when I asked for a chunky chicken butrito ,instead of the shredded chicken (reminds me of tuna salad - yech), they wanted to upcharge me a couple of bucks.  No other Taco Bell has ever charged me for the change.  What a ripoff....and to top it off the clerk was very snipey and not very friendly.  I will not be back.
No complaints. Food was quick. Order was right. Food was good. Restaurant was clean and looked good. Next time I want Taco Bell, I'll go here.

I regret caving into my hunger and stepping into this degenerate establishment. It took 5 minutes to get our order taken with no line, other than the 500 pound cholo leaning on the counter demanding a free taco. The wait for the food was 21 minutes and 3 seconds. 3 seconds too long if you ask me. During the wait one of the employees was filling the role of office prankster and wouldn't stop playing with the "good service bell." How ironic. The food I received was over cooked. I do not really expect much from Taco Bell, but the 20 minute wait, over cooked food, and 500 lb cholo was a sure recipe for disaster.

Worst staff selection ever. Horrible customer service. Literally does not repeat your order back to you does not tell you the total they literally just have you order what you want and hand you a receipt with no communication whatsoever.

I went to the drive thru  last night an got four nacho cheese grillers extra meat. So the guy at the window  say the cook misread  the screen  didn't  see the extra meat so I put four sides of beef on the side.  I  said Ok that's not  my fault  they made it over and it was the worst  taco bell I could  of ever had. Spk with the manager  today and she wasn't  the friendless person I ever meet. Not  sure wen I'll be make because  not one time she even offered  to comp me something  for the bad food they gave me last night ... customer  service  poor

You know I understand it's the night shift but If it takes a half hour to get some food then you need a new night shift. Whoever owns this place should be ashamed. I bet if it was lunch it would take this long

Best fastfood establishment I've ever been in. They play classical music inside, the staff is super friendly/hardworking, and you get your food fast. Not only that, it's always really clean, and the tacos actually look like they're supposed too! always fresh ingredients, and never skimpy on portions. This TB goes above and beyond the call of fast food expectations.
Reliable in being unreliable.  Late night service is nonexistent, don't no why the owner bothers. Super inconvenient. Been this way for over a year.

Wth with this location?! Been here twice and it's taken 10 mins a shot. For two bean burritos and box. Totally got my $5 box all wrong.  The beans were tepid at best. I think it must be new owners or managers or both. Very disorganized and not familiar with the menu items. Not going to this location anymore.

Pros: I've been to this location a few times, and they have always been great. I tried the breakfast burrito for the first time and I was not disappointed. The line for this place gets so long and it must be due to the service and quality.

Cons: The drive thru food could have been warmer.

All in all keep up the good work, it's appreciated.
Way too SLOW!!  It's a shame because they used to be great!!
I come here every once in a blue moon and usually have a good experience. Today had the strawberry starburst freeze and it is delicious!!

Not all Taco Bells are created equal. With that said...

The good things about this Taco Bell:
-It's clean (which can't be said about many other Taco Bells)
-The staff are friendly and competent (also can't be said about many other Taco Bells)

The bad:
-They don't accept the Taco Bell coupons that you find in the Columbus Entertainment Book.

Overall, not a bad place to satisfy your urge for junk food.

This place is so bad! The service sucks I mean I know you work at Taco Bell but take a little bit of pride in what you do! I have had a somewhat embarrassing retail job also, but tried my best! Every time we get cinna twists they are either rock hard or have no cinna on them! Food is just eh, I know it's just Taco Bell but it isn't that good. The lady in front of me wanted a bucket of chicken. They didn't have all the pieces so asked if it would be okay if they could charge her extra for a bad bucket. The wait is always super long.  

Drive to a closer one this one sucks!

I went to this location last night for dinner around 6pm. I was craving the Doritos tacos after watching one of my favorite Facebook entertainer Chris Crocker's videotape previous day. The parking lot was kind of small but knowing people are more about the drive-thru these days, I don't think that's a problem. The drive-thru line was packed! The side door was locked, so I and another customer had to walk around to the front door. I didn't mind the 5 second walk but I do wonder why the side door was lock. For safety reasons? Maybe they lock the side doors once the sun goes down? Who knows. The lady that was my cashier was awesome! She was super friendly and great. She was making jokes and knew how to smile. She was great --honestly. I asked her about one of the drinks they sell (Mountain Dew Sangrita) and she immediately offered me a sample. Who knew you could sample at a fast food restaurant? The interior was clean too. I didn't notice any dirty messes or I cleaned tables. When it was my turn to order, I ordered my three Doritos tacos which came out in less than 5 minutes (expected because it's a fast food shop). The tacos were okay, the shells were a little soggy but maybe that's because of the lettuce inside. Out of all three I recommend the "cooler ranch Doritos" taco. If you like something spicy and hot, you will love their newest Doritos taco "fiery Doritos". For this visit to Taco Bell to be my first in two years, I give it a 4 stars. The cashier was very accommodating and made me feel welcomed. She didn't treat me like someone who just came in to get food, if that makes sense. And I noticed she treated the other guests just the same like me. That definitely helped to make whole Taco Bell experience great. :)

I'm vegetarian so I ask for my beef to be replaced by black beans every time. I'd say about 50% of the time they mess up the order and include beef anyway. The good news is, if you open your food and check before leaving they'll make it again, and it's usually right that time.
Super friendly staff made my meal that much more enjoyable. Came here for breakfast and the positive attitude and great service made my day already!

This place is a joke! Been here a handful of times and 100% of the time they screw up my order and I end up driving back to get it corrected. From this point in I will not be going there and I will recommend my friends and family not to go there either. I get it's fast food, also a franchise, but that shouldn't mean sacrificing service cuz "you feel" you don't get paid enough to care. How about getting an education..? Thanks.
Don't go if you're in a hurry. Every drive through trip takes at least half an hour. Service is alright once you get there, but it takes forever to actually get there.

The WORST Taco Bell in the universe. The bathroom was filthy. Blood on the seats and overflowing trash cans. Every table was dirty in the dining room. Asked to have them cleaned.  After they were cleaned, you still had to go behind her to dry the table and seats because they were soaked. There was no sweet tea in the container. One of the two ice machines didn't have ice. The soda nozzles were missing and sprayed you when you used them. At least 7 flavors were missing syrup; the Pepsi looked light-skinned and tasted horrible. The Dorito Los Taco shell was beyond the sell by date. Clearly they need new management but I won't be back to see the improvements.
Took over 25 minutes to prepare a mobile order for a menu item. Staff was extremely rude and nonchalant. No apology was given for the delay. Would not recommend and will probably not be returning.

I've lived in this neighborhood since 2005 and until recently, had not visited. Ever since discovering the excellent tacos at King Burrito, Rose City Tacos, and Tienda Santa Cruz, I just didn't see much point in going to a TB. But, on a whim a few days ago I suddenly had a real nostalgia wave crash over me, and decided it was time to end my unofficial boycott.

And what do you know, I found out that I actually quite like this Taco Bell. It's under construction right now so the dining "experience" inside isn't exactly magnificent, but the food is better than I remembered it. And the people working were efficient and friendly. I didn't go through the drive through, rather I went inside. It does seem like the drive through does get pretty busy at times. I'd probably avoid going during those hours.

What an awful experience. I ordered a beef burrito supreme and a steak quesadilla as well as a Mountain Dew Baja blast freeze none of my order was correct or well-done and even after I voiced concern that the drink wasn't the right consistency the employee still gave it to me there was no steak inside of my burrito and sparse steak in my overcooked quesadilla needless to say this was my worst experience at this Taco Bell it's going to take some sort of miracle and maybe an email back from Taco Bell corporate before I consider going back to this restaurant

Taco Bell has been my cheat meal every Sunday for the last 6 years. The food is cheap, yet so good. However, this location has never gotten my order right. I don't order anything that deviates from the normal menu, but they can never simply give me what I order. They continuously "forget" things regardless of the fact that what I actually ask for matches what is on the drive thru screen. I really hope they can get it together because I'm really tired of paying for food I'm not receiving.

Literally no one in the store and they took the longest to get our order done. Didn't say hello, I literally had to walk up for them to notice me and take my order when I was the only one there. Once my food arrived, it hasn't been two seconds yet but the girl starts yelling my name constantly and laughed cuz my name was funny for some reason. I don't really get what's so funny but honestly the most ratchet, slowest service.

Is everyone stoned here? Super weirded out by the staff. They all look like they don't want to be here + they move soooooo slow. I left without my taco assuming they are just as lazy with food prep and sanitation. No thanks!

I like the prices, sometimes though the customer service is horrible.  Use to be bad food, but seems to have gotten better.  Few workers there in drive thru can't speak or understand English well.  One or two workers there, just don't give a f--k. I like to eat Taco Bell over other fast food, the price, and selection.  That's why I give it four stars, hit or miss sme times.

Typical of fast food establishments.  Still, sometimes you have to satisfy your cravings.  Will you get Grilled or Original Recipe?  Tacos or Quesadillas?  Coke or Iced T?  This place is great source for messy, fulfilling, smile-inducing carbs.  It also has the distinction of serving both KFC & Taco Bell.  Currently going through some renovation so hopefully a facelift will do this place some good.
I hate myself for eating here. Clean the god-damn tables.
Really disappointed in this particular Taco Bell, they always get my order wrong! I asked for the steak, but got beef are you that busy!? You guys need to get it right!

Person at the drive-thru seemed almost annoyed that I was there.  Had to wait a long time, as they were very slow.  Was not asked about any sauces, did not get any sauces.  No straw for my drink.  Very little meat on my taco.  Don't waste your time here!!

Worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. Spent 40 minutes in the drive through with only 2 cars in front of me and they messed up my order which was only 4 items. Avoid at all costs & find a decent Taco Bell somewhere else. 0 stars.
The service is super friendly and the food is consistently good.  The restaurant is always clean with a nice environment.  So thankful to have one of my favorite fast food places so close by.
I got food poisoning from you twice and found nasty thick hair in my burrito, you should probably check your food before you serve it!!!

This branch is terrible. Floors are sticky as are tables and chairs. We ordered bean burritos which came with about 2 tablespoons of beans and the barest hint of cheese. They were almost nothing but wrap. One we ordered with lettuce and tomato. It had the most minuscule amounts you can imagine. You pay extra for 5 thin strings of lettuce and 6 tiny tomato bits. Bits of heaven knows what was in with the fries we ordered.

This is why Chipotle is winning over Taco Bell.

The only positive is that the staff is relatively polite.

We won't be eating here again. It's a shame because we live Taco Bell.
What the heck .....every time I go here it's 20 minutes at least to go through drive thru!! My fault that I keep going back ....i don't blame the employees but management needs to fix this .....
