today i was very unhappy with my experience. Not only was the bathroom not stocked with paper towels, but they had no mild sauce as well.their drink is too syruppy as well.

Surprisingly, it has to be one of the best fast food places in the area

There are 3 fast food places on the intersection of billingsley and sawmill, a McDonald's, Wendy's and of course Taco Bell, I have been to all 3

McDonald's and Wendy's both seem to have issues (just read my review for McDonalds) though I have yet to have any issues at Taco Bell
Literally my fave taco bell. The cashier is so nice and never judges how hungover i am

Normally go inside at this location as i learned to ALWAYS check the food before leaving. Stupid me was in a hurry and went throught the drive thru. Got my bag and made it to my destination. Looked in my bag and my nachos are missing. Opened first chalupa and it was pretty much meatless. The chalupa bread was very cold and stiff. Well that teaches me to go through the drive thru again. Very disapointed, it was not a complicated order nor was it lunch rush.
The service is lack luster. Since the remodel, my order has been incomplete or wrong items given to me about 3 out 5 visits.

I love Taco Bell
I am passionate about Taco Bell
This is why this location gets two stars instead of one - simply because Taco Bell is beautiful and wonderful and tastes good.

But that's all this location has going for it. I come here weekly... I've been here MANY times and they have gotten my order correct once or twice. I've gone back to get it fixed and it's still been messed up. 

I understand shit happening sometimes and that orders won't be perfect..... But every single time? Come on man get it together.

This place is the only Taco Bell for several miles, or I wouldn't ever come here. Every single time, it takes over 30 minutes for me to get just a few items. And I look at the cars in front of me and they aren't getting more than three or four things either. It should take that long. It's ridiculous.

I'm currently trapped in the drive thru, I've been here 15 minutes already and haven't moved forward 1 single car.... If I wasn't boxed in I would leave.... I am instantly filled with regret for coming here.
Yeah, it's a Taco Bell, but it's a pretty good Taco Bell. The quality of food is pretty consistent and usually pretty good. Service can be hit or miss, but never anything too terrible.

First i got there and the cashier was very rude, then i went inside to the restrooms, they were horribly not cleaned well, there was poop next to the toilet, the food was almost frozen if you want cold food then this is got to be the first choice for you because honestly it was very cold, i asked for 3 quesadillas and 2 doritos locos tacos and she didnt gave me the 2 doritos locos so i had to go back and ask for them again so not recommended

I lived in NE my whole life and always went to this Taco Bell especially when the plaid pantry one and the one on Sandy closed. I moved to SW now but still would come to this one for late night fixes because the Taco Bells out here suck like the beans will be jacked up and the soda mix messed up and bad meat. Please reopen!

Yes I know its taco bell...and it's fast food....but It's my guilty pleasure!

I only ever eat tacos, mexican pizza and chips and cheese.....

I never have to double check my order because it's always right! Probably now that I said that I've probably have jinxed myself...hahaha

It's be remodeled and I love the drive-thru...they have maximized the parking lot to fit in the SODO complex.

The staff is friendly and efficient!

Just closed on me mid service because it hit 1Am. Pulled up to the window at 1:01 am and the girl at the register was counting the money shaking her head saying "were closed why are you sitting there" didnt look me in the face just looked away. Clear customer service doesn't matter at this taco bell.

sadly this is the closest taco bell to me or I'd never go to it. no matter what time of day or night it is, you wait forever. I totally get that in the evening it would be slower due to the fact it's busy, but that does not give employees and managers the right to be rude to customers. Numerous times I've been given attitude because they are busy, even when I'm patiently waiting and trying to be nice. Sarcasm is a huge thing with the evening employees. I've waited 20 mins at times to get someone to take my order and when I get to the sign to order i get an attitude like I shouldn't be there.
I have personally eaten at this Taco Bell on multiple occasions, and, to the best of my knowledge, have never become violently ill as a result.  I'd say that's good enough for three stars.
We got the grande meal, and it was really good! We were pleased w/ the service and the value for the money. We'll get a meal from here again.
Dear taco bell, thank you for giving me food at 3am. Thank you for giving me the mud butt. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. You are my favorite trash food.

I've been to this location several times. More often then not they mess up the order & tons of times I've had missing items. It's ridiculous. GET IT TOGETHER. 

There's ALWAYS a long wait in drive thru & you still wait a while going in. (I went in once). That day there was a huge line (even 2-3cars your going to wait forever).. so I was not about to wait over half an hour with 3 small kids in the car. Thinking it would be faster going in (big mistake), I took the kids out & we went for it. I waited for over 30 mins for my order. There wasn't more then 2 people ahead of me. I was about to leave several times. Finally got our food, went home & there was a mistake in the order, as per usual. 

Point is- if you want FAST FOOD, your not gonna get here.

I had the weirdest experience here today. Food was fine...no complaints. They had the music cranked up reeeeeaaaallllyyy loud and it was music I've never heard before, with super suggestive lyrics.....so bad I choked on my taco. It was really awkward and uncomfortable to be sitting there alone with these embarrassingly sexual songs blasting away in the dining room. Going to stick to drive thru from now on.

Bathroom was clean. Inside was clean.  Drive thru. Worked

Food was decent. Good stop on a very busy road. Staff seemed helpful also.

I know this probably disqualifies me from yelping but Taco Bell is my favorite restaurant on god's green earth. It's cheap, delicious and diverse. The problem with taco bell is that they are inconsistent on a store by store basis. Some are great and some arn't. I've been to many, so please believe me when I say This is the best Taco Bell I've even been to. 
Drive thru: fast
Employees: great (everyone friendly, and I mean 'sit down restaurant' friendly
Store: convent and clean

So fellow yelpers, please stop reviewing taco bell if you can't appreciate the beautiful mush that is taco bell. And for those who salivate for that mush, this is the place to get mushed up.

We have gone here a couple of times and every time we do they are friendly and they give us our tacos or quesadillas in under 2-3 mins. This is a very upscale Taco Bell as the area around is very affluent. 

I highly recommend.

Only fast food place I have ever been where the Manager argues with the customer over an $.89 taco that was made wrong.

Enough said.

Taco Bell Tualatin is very slow, and they get orders wrong constantly. They once made me a burrito with a small piece of paper in it. Still, I used to be willing to put up with them sometimes because I like that they offer the option to make most items vegetarian. But things hit a new low when they stole my money.

On New Years Day, the app said the restaurant was open - so I placed an order and my gift card was charged. When I arrived at the restaurant, there was a sign that said "Dining room closed - drive thru open." So I proceeded to the drive thru only to find that it was actually closed as well. I was unable to pick up the order, and my card was not refunded.

When I tried to get this resolved, first they ignored me altogether, then they tried to lie about the restaurant being closed, and then they tried to blame me. They did finally resolve the problem, but it took two days' worth of hassle.
Back when it took a while to prepare the meal, You should hit the Alp.

Heck yes. My roommate and I appreciate drive through taco bell when were blazin' in the Volvo station wagon. I didn't even dream you could live across the street from. It actually makes me want to move. She gets the steak chalupa supreme I usually get a crunchy taco recently replaced by volcano tacos which kick butt.

this place is the worst taco bell in the city rude a$$ employees ghetto dont care about customers snatches money acts like they cant hear ur order threw the drive thru cant speak clear english not understandable dirty place to go eat no respect for people would never recomend here cold chicken this should be shut dont with all these bad reviews should become a popeyes or some other chicken place! this place is so un organized and slow the workers are just there for a baloney check never for good services! the meat is always funie tasten! is this a place of business or a zoo full of rude animals that dont give a crap??? its too bad the one in cambridge is gone id rather go to brockton, or walpole, which are out of the area any day before coming to this raggady one! whoever is running this place needs to rehire new caring employees  or consider maken some kind of changes in the building or need to retire early! by far the wackiest place to waste ur tyme and gas and money to go stop and eat at! hopefully one day good rid-dens :d!!!!!

Normally I don't do reviews for fast food places, as they're typically just a mediocre experience with nothing to stand out either way, but I love this Taco Bell.  My boyfriend and I used to come here very regularly, before we went on a diet, and one employee, Denise, has always been extremely friendly, polite, and overall just very sweet.  She recognizes us when we stop by still, though obviously not as frequently, and it's great to feel welcome and remembered when it's a corporate fast food chain that sees hundreds of people each day.  The only thing keeping this from five stars is that we have had a few times when they forgot a chalupa or two we've ordered, and that sucked, but we've learned to check our bags before leaving now, and haven't had issues since!

This is the best Taco Bell!  Left part of my ordered accidentally, called to see if I could come back and get it.  They said yes, and made fresh food!

Thank you!

This Taco Bell is so understaffed it's not even funny. I came here yesterday inside and there were 6 people waiting for food and nobody working the register.. So after 10 mins i left. Came back today and took 20 minutes to go through the driver and they got my order wrong.

This is probably the worst Taco Bell I've been too. There constantly out of something or there drive thru lane is the slowest. I'm definitely going to be driving the extra mile to the next Taco Bell on 82nd too avoid this location. Last night was the last straw, I ordered a steak quesadilla, and 2 5 layer burritos. The cashier explained to me they were out of nacho sauce, this location is always running out of things. I don't understand how this location is so poorly run. I finally told her to give me a discount for my food because she also said that she needed to close down the store due to shortages. Haha what the hell is wrong with this location, please find better leadership, and stop hiring punk kids with zero customer service experience.

Have had bad expereinces, this was the WORST. Let's boil this down, hot chalupa shells are awesome. 8-10 times I order at any Taco Bell I get a luke warm chalupa shell  which totally ruins the chalupa. This time it was not warm but COLD. I get home and I got a Dr Pepper instead of Diet Pepsi... and to top things off, I got a rancid apple empanada. Only thing right about the meal was the taco. WHAT THE HELL, Taco Bell?? Rancid???? The rancid aftertaste still persists.
I've tried to go there a quarter past 7 a few times as I'm in a hurry to get to work and they have never been "ready" to cook food. Then order mess ups, which is not that big of a deal .

Still waiting for my two tacos . I sent my 11 year old boy in and after 15 min went to check and was told they would be right up that they take care of the drive threw customers first because that was %80 of their business. So he basically politely said we care more about the drive through customers and you can wait

This place always messes up our order. A missed burrito, taco etc. so we dine in so we can deal
with any missed items. Tonight was a huge joke (on us!)  not only did we wait for 25 minutes for our food but the beans were burnt and dried out.  I looked up to see if I can find a person to talk to but the person in charge didn't look like I would be able to speak to him. He was very busy running and bumping employees behind the line. He kept yelling he was sorry for the wait and he is under staffed. This is highly unprofessional!  No matter what customers shouldn't be burdened by the business's drama. Once again my family and I spent 30 dollars on food and I'm hungry because my food is always messed up.  
DONT WASTE YOUR TIME HERE!

late night run to taco bell for a burrito turns into a shouting match with ciara an employee for taco bell what type of business allows cursing at customers and i couldn't get my money back i was told i had to come back in the morning to speak with a supervisor very unprofessional even if it is fast food and this just happened so i'm still pretty upset what a waste of money

Last three times I've been there, there has been major issues with service. Last time, I waited in the drive thru behind just 2 cars and they did not move for 10 minutes, I left. Time before that, the drive thru was backed up and the dining room was mysteriously closed. This was NOT after hours. And the time before that, we went in and ordered and waited an extraordinarily long time before our very simple order came out. Dinning room was not packed by any means, but the people who were there were all waiting for quite some time.

They have the regular menu, they seem to be fast, and my experience with them has been good, I go there on my scooter, and they are generally very nice and helpful, if have anything negative, it is that they don't have the doors for people with disabilities, so I do have a harder time getting in and out!

This Taco Bell is exceptional! The cleanest I've seen with excellent customer service. Tammy was working the cash register today and was not your typical cashier at a fast food restaurant, she was upbeat, polite and friendly with everyone that came in the door. The food looked exactly as it does in the commercials!

Well this is yet another cookie cutter location of tex mex food. It is cheap and tastes better than most other fast food stops. Are there better places? Sure. Are there cheaper places? Sure. Are there better tasting to me places that are cheaper and within 5 miles or so of my place? If so I don't know them yet

I'm digging this location of Taco Bell  
My Doritos nacho tacos are crispy and don't have that gross soggy thing going on that has been happening at various Taco Bell locations. Not sure what's up with that but it wasn't going on here. The staff were smiling and nice as well

Went to Endicott ST. location and will not be returning.The help was lazy and I was told they had no idea about the 4 tacos for $5 special.We went through the drive thru and paid $21 for tacos with no filling.We got soggy taco shells with some lettuce and some with no meat filling-others with less than 1 teaspoon of meat.This was on a Saturday night at 6 pm and please don't visit this location.Bad impression after First time visiting a Taco Bell in the Northeast.Never again.

You see those 2 photos has show you What happens the mess up 
- soft taco supreme add onion and the put smaller beef the bottom and no add tomato topping.
- FORGOT bring 2 cinnamon twists 
- Nacho Fries HAS BEEN FROZEN

The was wrong item and 2 miss cinnamon  twist and I come back the door was locked and I called but no answer it. And the don't care about  it.

I will be despite ASAP

I have never written a bad review or a review in general, but save your money and TIME and go to a different fast food place. Not only does it take 30+ minutes to get your food, but it's poorly made. It's like this every time I've ever tried to come to this Taco Bell and I'm done wasting my time.

Fast friendly service! This hits the spot when it's time for a quick meal. You probably know the food is simple and not high-end, but I love TB, and this is a great one. Only 3 stars just because it's fast-food-quality.

How is it that one location can be spot on, every time, while another just two miles south can never get an order right?!? 

This Taco Bell has gotten our specialty orders right every time we have gone there, and always is friendly. They are our traditional Saturday breakfast since we are always going somewhere early. Lunches, dinner, have always been fast & accurate. The one on Sawmill at Bethel Rd, only two miles south, has never once gotten our order right the first time, and usually not even the second time when they are trying to fix it. I will not spend any money at the circus called Taco Bell on sawmill & bethel. 

Sawmill & Billingsley Rd has been, and will continue to be our "home restaurant" location even after fighting the traffic! It's worth it when they nail the order, and are so friendly.

I wrote a positive review, and later deleted it. I wrote a negative review, and later deleted it. Now, I'm back with a middle-of-the-road review. :)

The good:
-Tasty food at reasonable prices.
-They will customize almost any item to make it vegetarian.

The bad:
-They get orders wrong too often.
-Service is a bit on the slow side by fast food standards.

I LOVE Taco Bell. No really. Love it.  I will defend TB's deliciousness until I die.  That being said: this is a great location and happens to be close to my apartment so I'm here pretty often. 

I am always amazed by the customer service at the location.  The person taking orders is always exceptionally polite and pleasant.  I'm usually blown away at how polite they are. Then when I actually get my food and drink this person is just as happy and nice. 

Now to the food. Just as delicious as any other TB.  It's fast food - you know what you're getting.    I usually get a decent amount of sauce but sometimes I only get one per item I ordered.  COME ON! I want my mouth to burn and my forehead to sweat. I need AT LEAST three sauces per item I ordered. Other than this, top notch TB.

They say you learn something new everyday, and today I learned that you can burn a crunch wrap supreme. Now I don't expect much from taco bell, who does? But today the low standards I do have where lowered again like some demented limbo stick. Bad service, burnt food, long wait, no reason to go back

Just came through the drive through and the man was remarkably rude. He was horribly offended we asked for separate tabs and made his feelings very clear to us. Super uncomfortable. In addition, he said the beef quesadilla was marked so I took a fat bite and it was my friends chicken quesadilla. To make matters worse they were mini so that was about half of it. Lies and discomfort

Was starving after a doctor's appointment at SODO and had to get back to work so jumped in the drive thru here.  The woman on the speaker was so friendly and helpful and happily answered my silly questions about whether I could get light sour cream and if she thought I could finish 3 tacos in the combo!  I love people who take the time to take care of my needs-even the the drive-thru-NO, wait-ESPECIALLY in the drive-thru!! 

I pulled up to the pickup window where another friendly lady delivered my order and asked what sauces I'd like.  The service here is really good and the people are really customer-oriented.  

The tacos were just fair-but they were fresh and hot and filled me up!

I think this is the slowest "FAST FOOD" restaurant ever. If I had time to sit down for 30 minutes I would have gone to an actual sit down restaurant. Currently sitting in drive through as I write this for over half an hour. Stuck in line and can't get out. Ridiculous!!!!!! Unacceptable!!!!! I started counting cars at McDonald's for fun already to see how many they let go while I'm sitting here stuck. I've already counted 23 cars and I haven't even moved yet. Wow this is insane. Stay away from this Taco Bell. Definitely not "fast food"

I have had it with this place!  My kids love Taco Bell and now I am forced to go to the one in Hilliard that is much farther away from home because this place has ripped me off for the very last time.  I stopped by Monday evening and they didn't give me two sides of rice in my drive thru order.  My husband stopped by tonight and they didn't give us two orders of nachos in our drive thru order.  Without fail there is always at least one item missing...  Done with it!  Called to complain and they hung up on us!  Done.  If you must go through drive thru, please check your bag before you pull away!!  I give it ZERO stars but I had to select at least one star to get this review posted!!  Anyone want to work on class action suit against this place for how many times you've paid for food you didn't receive!!!!!

This is the third time I have frequented this Taco Bell and had to wait in line for more then 20 minutes in the drive-thru. Normally, I catch this Taco Bell on my way home from work always around dinner time--the food is normally pretty good for Taco Bell. However, it appears they make a habit out of long wait times so I won't be coming back

So, normally I prefer this location.
But not after last night.
It was about 8pm. We drove over, got in the drive thru lane, just like we have done for quite a while.
We pull up to the order box.
It is running the normal ads for various menu items.
It takes a little while - no one is asking for our order.
Then a voice comes on - says he is the manager, and due to being short handed, he is not taking drive thru orders.
Frustrated by the fact that all the lighting was on and ads were running, but okay, we drive around to the lobby door. It is now 8:15pm.
I get out, walk up to the door, pull the handle... and it is locked.
Now all the lights are on inside. But the doors are all locked.
I was very frustrated.  
At least have the common courtesy of turning off the exterior signage that is the draw to people wanting to order.  Maybe even put up a sign on the door saying "we are sorry. We don't want your money tonite. We don't need it to use for salaries of new hire staff." or something.

I give this location 5 stars for their lunch time crew, I can't speak for the other hours of the day. I work downtown and grab lunch here once or twice a week. The service is ALWAYS great and they always get my order correct. My biggest reason for giving this location 5 stars is that the food is always fresh and hot. You can go to some locations and get a bean burrito and tell that the beans have been sitting for awhile because they are dry and cold, but not here. The beans are always fresh and have the perfect consistency. They make a perfect cheesy gordita crunch too. I've never had a bad meal here. Major props to the manager and crew that run the store at lunch time. Y'all deserve the recognition. Hope your higher ups see this!!

Habe dieses Restaurant öfters besucht allerdings immer durch den Drive Thru. Sehr freundliche Begrüssung und nettes Personal. Essen war ebenfalls frisch  und einigermassen flott. Ist ein stark frequentierter Taco Bell aber gerne wieder.

When we're in a pinch, we occasionally stop by the 'hood Taco Bell.  My wife, who has never had problems with her gluten allergy* here, swears by the Crunchy Taco Supreme, which is their seasoned beef, sour cream, lettuce, diced tomato, and cheese, wrapped in a tortilla.  I, however, prefer the Gordita Supreme, which has seasoned beef, sour cream, lettuce, diced tomato, and cheese, wrapped in a "flatbread".  When we're feeling adventurous, we'll get the Chalupa Supreme.  This one consists of a clever mix of seasoned beef, sour cream, lettuce, diced tomato, and cheese, wrapped in a chalupa shell.

I somehow like this restaurant more because it's old school.  It's been open forever, without renovations.  It reminds me of the "Mexico" section of an old theme park.  Some of the newer locations could serve any food, with their antiseptic corporate looks.  There is NO mistaking that this place serves tacos.

You know what you are getting.  I've not found this place takes any less or more care than any other location of the Bell.  When we've both worked late, and realize it's 8pm, and dinner hasn't been started, we can decide to make "a run..." and be eating 9 minutes later.

Once you warned us that you were out of "potato chunks".  I didn't even know you had 'potato chunks".

Once you were out of sour cream.

SOUR CREAM!

ORLY????!?!  Sometimes I wish I had a sour cream gun installed at my house.  

But it is my local Bell... And, as the Duke of this location, I have to defend its honor.

PS  Green sauce is the bomb.

* Note:  The website shows the Crunchy Taco Supreme to contain gluten....

The establishment smelled like they haven't changed the mop head in a while. I asked for a mini quesadilla and when I opened it, it looked like they smushed it and threw it in whatever they used to heat it up and it smelled like the cheese was old. Took one bite and it tasted biter and now one day later I've been vomiting and pooping non stop. Thanks Taco Bell.
One of the best taco bell's in the area.  The staff are clear, concise, and will fix your order if you accidentally spoke it wrong.  Very good service, and consistent.
Slowest service ever. Placed drive thru order and waiting 16 minutes and still one car back. Really?

The staple of every nutritious meal, Taco Bell!

Not much to say about this place, it is a Taco Bell.  I like Taco Bell, so by defaults I like this place.  This is a regular stop for m when I need a fast lunch.  Never had any issues, so it keeps a title of a standard Taco Bell.

In short, this is Taco Bell that is likely very similar to the Taco Bell in your local neighborhood.

LOL. I can't believe I'm even reviewing this fucking dump.

Bottom line, you get what you pay for.

Half-assed, crappy, and not made to order.

Tell them you want extra cheese and they'll make sure you get none.

Hahaha.

I swore off ever going back to Taco Bell after my last experience two years ago but necessity made me return. The food was well prepared and it was loaded, unlike my last experience. The tacos and burritos had plenty of filling and chesse and were quite good by Taco Bell standards.  The service and delivery was a little slow but I will definitely return to this location.

I have been holding off putting a review about this location for a while, thinking it was a one / two time thing. The management needs to order supplies better. I have gone around 1130 at night and they are out of beans, rice, and chicken. This morning I went to get breakfast at 1050am (breakfast is served until 11). They we're out of breakfast... I think this location need to change its marketing to WHILE SUPPLIES LAST!!!
It's Taco Bell food is ok when not home and need something fast. Only downside is really slow service at night. Like 15-20 minute wait.

The worst freaking Taco Bell I've been to in my life. My entire order was wrong, they didn't have boxes for the 5$ box I ordered and they didn't even have receipt paper??? I even paid extra for some upgrades on tacos just to receive a regular ole taco like I didn't just pay extra for it. Avoid this Taco Bell, don't waste your time. Uglies

I freaking love Taco Bell. I live right down the street from this place so I come here quite often. The food is usually good but the people who work here are some of the most unpleasant and lazy people I have ever encountered. You wait in line while watching other people being ignored only to be ignored when you get to the counter. Almost every time I get to the front of the line, the teller will literally just wander away for like five minutes without saying a word to me. The employees almost always look sullen and are incredibly rude. There is one delightful teller named Tiffany who I have observed yelling at people who don't speak English very well.  (There is a large Asian population in Quincy). She may be the only person I've ever seen who can inject ill will and condescending malice in the phrase "Can I help you?" I will continue to come here because it's in walking distance but don't go out of your way to come here unless you like a fast food employee treating you like you're a complete idiot and a nuisance.

Food and service are normally par for the course here .. so, you had to wait in line a little longer one time vs the other, or the didn't give you sauce or napkins this time vs. the last - typical, right? Fine... But time after time of their lights being on, open sign on, and you pull up to the drive thru and no one says anything - silence. Shut the light off! Stop wasting people's time cause you all want to sit in there playing on your cell phones (Slapnuts!).
Always busy! Need to work on keeping it spotless! Honestly I think the food is delicious just wish it was faster to receive your food!

It saddens me to see this Taco Bell go down hill.  At one time, this was an amazing place.
As a former employee of this location, it's hard to see what's happened.  I worked there for over 3 years.  My former regulars come to me to complain about the store.  Some don't even go there anymore.  Sad, just sad

Bad service!
Mar a lot of mistakes with orders and the place was practically empty, when I opened my wrap there was no meat inside, they gave me another one with meat but this time no lettuce and tomatoes!
They were doing mistakes with ever order they got for the few customers there!

I went to this Taco Bell at 10:40 pm and the field in the drive through said they were closed.  Yelp says they are open until midnight and Google says they are open until 11.  You are a bunch of lazy ashes closing early and I think you have a bad attitude. I wish I could say what I really think of you.
Horrible, horrible, horrible!!  Rude staff, under cooked food, and waste of money.  Taco Bell please train this franchise, because they need to up their standards and manners.

Nothing special but if you are expecting something special from a Taco Bell then you need to check your expectations. The food is always hot and tastes as I would expect compared to other Taco Bell experiences. Very risky place to live next to after a night out drinking.

I can only not give this a five star because it is fast food but other than it would be. I've gone to this place when the line was wrapped around the building and the employees kept it together, did an above exceptional job and my order is ALWAYS right.

I'd give it negative stars if I could. Worst Taco Bell in the city. Orders are ALWAYS wrong, staff doesn't seem to give a crap when they get your order wrong. Drive thru is always slow and backed up. I drive out of my way now to another Taco Bell so I know I get what I order and pay for.
Its a Taco Bell. The place is very clean, rarely busy and they staff was pleasant.

I absolutely hate this Taco Bell. I live in the neighborhood and I won't be back anytime soon! The customer service is terrible and there is trash from this restaurant all over the neighborhood. 

They are a terrible neighbor!

I ordered (drive thru) a simple number 8 which is just 3 soft tacos and 1they were ice cold 2 soaking wet and 3 incorrect. The person taking orders was constantly on her phone and it was overall not a good experience.

Been forever since I ate taco Bell.  The food pretty much all standard from one location to others to me.  There seem to be some $1 breakfast burrito with egg and meat inside.   That's crazy.   They got some awesome drinks.  Big on mountain dews brand.  Give it a shot if you never been to a taco Bell before.  This location in particular would be a good choice.   Got some friendly staffs. Most case, food came out quite quickly.  Place seem clean and good space to sit in.

I was driving down route one today, hating my life because I hate route one, and I was thinking about eating.   When lo! and behold!  I see in the distance a shining beacon of wonderfulness!  Taco Bell (choir of angels chime in here)!  I pull in, get out of the car, walk inside, and get a little freaked out.  There was no one here.  I mean NO ONE.  It's always a little unnerving when it comes to a fast food chain and there is no one there at lunch time.  But I get my food anyways, and while I was waiting, I looked around expecting to see the same trash on the floor and tables that you always see.  But..there was no trash!  I'm not saying you could eat off the floors or anything, but it was remarkably clean!  I get my food, and go out to the car to notice that there is no trash in the parking lot either!  "Well," I think to myself "the extra Baja sauce on my crispy potato soft taco will be the judge, you always order extra and don't always GET extra".  But guess what?  I did get extra Baja sauce.  I really don't understand those haters out there.  Taco bell has never made me sick, and I really like the taste of the food. But...what I didn't realize when I went to get out of the parking lot...there's a reason I hate route one!  I sat there for 10 minutes trying to get out into traffic going 60 mph.
Those nacho fries are a hit!!  They have some type of zesty seasoning on them and go perfectly with the cheese.  Brilliant.  Will go back soon to try them in a burrito or loaded nachos.
Company store mated with a Long John Silvers.   This keeps the prices in line vs the franchise operations.  One of the more friendly TB staffs I've run across in my travels.

This place is a HOT MESS!!

Place was dirty, service was slow, soda was flat. 

At least the food is what you'd expect from Taco Bell.

This Taco Bell shouldn't even be open. Why they are still in business is beyond me. We live right around the corner for this location in which is very convenient. Although, they are close I'd rather drive across town to find better service. Today we were in the drive thru and we're ordering in which we had specific instructions due to a dairy allergy. Which we complicated simply because they have Fresca tacos already on the menu. We ordered a few Fresca tacos and for all of you that don't know what that is, it is a taco without cheese. We get to the window and the tacos are smothered in cheese. We go inside and wait about 10 minutes before someone comes to the front and ask them to be changed. We get them changed and the crunchy taco shells are soggy and broken, not even consider a taco at this point. Not only did I have to get my tacos remade but then my tacos are broken and soggy. It's not a preference it's a requirement that my food doesn't have dairy in it. It's a health deficiency not a complicated request that you get to choose whether or not to modify it. I will not go to this Taco Bell anymore. The overall quality of the food is not worth the money. They clearly don't take pride in their food or customer service. P.S. THIS IS THE 3RD TIME. Never again.
Walked in to grab a quick taco or three.  It took 17 minutes and the place was empty.  The kid at the register was picking his nose.  Ill never go back here.

It's actually a KFC-Tacobell 2-in-one. Their hard and softshell tacos are comparable to snacks, rather than dishes. The hard shells become soggy if not eaten immediately (within 15 minutes). You will notice there's the layer of warm beef on the bottom, then a distinct layer of cold lettuce and cheese on the top. To top it off, they have a large supply of sauce packets.
This place is disgusting.  The soda dispenser and the condiment section were dirty. The food didn't even taste like Taco Bell.  It's tasted stale and old. Never again. Blahhh

Make sure, if you order cinnamon twist to check your bag at the drive through. They 'forgot' to give them to me 3 times now. I didn't check the last 2 times, as I had someone else go pick it up for me. But, come on guys, how hard is it to put cinnamon twists inside the bag?

Once again the food is filling but not mind blowing. What was mind blowing was fast food being made and given to customers in 20 to 30 minutes. The lobby was filled with customers waiting on their food. Some had to take it to go due to The long lined and one customer seemed ready to go home without their food.

If you have never eaten at a taco bell it serves basically tex mex style food.
None of the offerings are likely to ever be served in a latin home or dining establishment.

But they have taste. And occasionally a star like the caramel apple empanadas or the smothered burritos.

The guy that was working the drive through was very rude. He took a very long time between items on the order when there was NO ONE in line 3 hours before they closed. Two gorditas, okay, 2 minutes later, no lettuce, okay, 2 minutes later, sounding aggravated , anything else??. His underwear were hanging out of his pants. Plenty of people need a job, if he doesn't want to do his I'm sure someone else would. The car behind us left without finishing their order it was so bad.
The dirtiest Taco Bell that I have ever been to. Trash on floor. Food and trash on tables. People in my group ordered - very slow service.

I Normally Have A Great Experience At This Taco Bell Because Of Liz On Shift But Yesterday Adrienne Was Very Disrespectful To Customers And Employees She Need To Be Fired ASAP! I Won't Be Back There Until She Is Gone , By The Way I Eat Tacos Three Times A Week So I Will Check To See If She's There Is So Taco Bell Will Not Get My Family's Money !

Parts of our order were missing. Steak burrito was a joke for the amount of "steak" that was on it. Long wait in the dining room for orders. Kitchen staff simply cannot keep up with the volume of clients at this location. When we tried to call to complain, no one answered the phone. Still waiting on the compensation 5 weeks later that was promised to us after we took the on receipt survey.

Sometimes they can be a little on the slow side getting food out but I try to blame the person in front of me and think maybe they just ordered half the menu. Most of the time they get my orders right but sometimes not. Sometimes the food is great and sometimes not. It all just depends on who's cooking that day I guess, which is my reason for three stars. No reason to really complain but nothing to write home about either. I've never expected much from Taco Bell so hey, whatever. It feeds me when I'm hungry and really close to my house, what more can I ask for?

I've never stepped a foot inside of this taco bell, now maybe that's why I haven't received such bad customer service as my fellow yelpers have. The only time I come to this taco bell is late at night when I'm too lazy to get out of the car.

It's taco bell...I don't expect the food to be 5 stars but it's good for what it is. Never had upset stomach the next day or dealt with rude employees; I just tell them what I want and go on about my business.

It's not the best place and not the worst. It's just good for what it is.

This is the worst KFC/Taco Bell combo that I've ever personally seen.  I can't say much about the KFC side of things, as I'm already 100% anti, but I love Taco Bell.  This place should have its signage removed by the Taco Bell corporate office.  Its really that bad.

One night, my friends and I decided to give into the late night fast food taco craving.  I was volunteered to make the trek over and bring back some Taco Bell goodness for everybody.  I ordered up a bunch of the spicy chicken burritos, and some soft tacos.  When I brought it back, most of it went uneaten.  They hadn't cooked the rice in the burritos!!  Every bite threatened to break your teeth.

I've since been back there every 6 months or so, hoping that maybe someone from corporate would show them how to properly make their food.  They haven't.  Everything you get here is cold, undercooked, and just plain old lazy.  Go to Wendy's around the corner instead if you're looking to satisfy that bad for you fast food craving.
Orders are always accurate, and the staff is friendly enough, but this location is super super SLOW! Good luck getting through the drive-thru on a half hour lunch.

For a Taco Bell, it gets 5 stars. 
They never mess up my orders & they are always super friendly.

This rating is purely based on service and my experiences at this establishment.  Personally I love both KFC and Taco Bell, but the employees at this location are horrible.  Slow service, will mix up your order 90% of the time, you'll catch an employee texting on their sidekick 3/4 times you're their.  It can get really busy here, and one time one of the employees wouldn't return from their sidekicking break to help out the busy line.  The floor is usually sticky because nobody mops up the spills.  Overall, a disgrace to the name of both companies.

Just like any other Taco Bell. Always a good place for authentic white people Mexican food. Taco Bell is usually a solid choice, but there's always the consequence of pissing out of your ass for the next 24 hours. 4.213/5, would sacrifice the innocence of my beautiful brown eye for a box of tacos again

This is a newer Taco Bell in the SODO complex. and this place is nice, clean and the staff is very friendly. I always get the Doritos Locos Tacos......Cant wait for the new Doritos Flavor tacos to come out! Anyways, food seems to be fresh every time we visit and have never had a problem at this location with exception of one thing...too much sugar in the sweet tea, i have to do 1/2 and 1/2 tea to tone it down a little. otherwise no complaints at this location.

How can you be this consistently terrible!?? Seriously? I've lived in tualatin for 2 years now and I've started to drive to Wilsonville if I'm craving Taco Bell because I know (even with the drive time) it will be faster!!! I've timed it! I've NEVER had a drive through time less than 25 minutes! Not joking! If you want Taco Bell you are guaranteed to wait a half hour!!! Just don't put yourself in the drive thru purgatory. Go somewhere else. Someone REALLY needs to shut this place down!
They leave their trash all over the neighborhood! In no way are they green.

Waited 25minutes in the drive-thru (according to the screen inside the window). And they still missed an item. When I went in to correct it, there were 2 people simply standing at the front registers, chatting, with NO ONE sitting inside eating. 
Hire some real workers.

Don't give one stars often, but the service at this Taco Bell is stunningly terrible.  Blows me away every time.  Remember when Taco Bell used to have those timers (which is still installed at this location) and if it too long to get your food it was free?  It was always be free here.  Always.  Expect 30 mins minimum.
Service is slow, at times I feel like there's only 1 person working. Post-club hours is a shit show. They're pretty accurate with your order.. just painfully slow.

I've been living in a nearby apartment complex for almost a year and really loved my living situation, but have always felt like the area was lacking something.  I recall telling my roommate, "If only there was a Taco Bell closer in our area, my life would be complete." Lo and behold, not one month after I said that, construction began on the glorious Taco Bell restaurant that you find today. 

I passed by everyday on my commute to school in the mornings and could see the progress of construction almost every step of the way. It was like witnessing the miracle of child birth - after patiently waiting 9 months slowly watching it grow, it was finally ready for delivery - but instead of a messy, sticky newborn in my arms and the self-questioning of whether or not it was truly mine, this Taco Bell is indeed a blessing and I know I will love it unconditionally. 

Thank you Taco Bell!

PS. Other comments about how friendly the staff treat you are all true. I've never been to a more welcoming and friendly Taco Bell. Keep it up, guys!

I love taco bell but it actually hurt my soul to watch 3 people who ordered more than I did to get all there orders before mine without any sort of explanation and when I asked for a refund then they started saying itll knly be 2 minutes it had already been 12.

I've stopped here twice and both times have been terrible.  The first time I walked out because they were so slow.  This time I started to but decided to wait it out.  To be fair they are slow but it was made worse by the guy in front of me trying to invent things that weren't on the menu.  The dinning room was ok not the cleanest but not bad either.  Took awhile for the food to be ready but the food was good.

Despite the countless negative reviews I still went against my better judgement and went here because I was starving, needed something quick, and it's Taco Bell not a five star restaurant. But the minute they took my money I see why people weren't too pleased with their experience. The staff just wasn't professional at all and it was complete chaos in there. I ordered food for me and my boyfriend and when I get home, NOTHING I ordered was in the bag. I got a completely different order even though I asked the last lady behind the counter was this really my order because I felt like based off the reviews, the order came too quick. She was so confident but there was a language barrier so I couldn't understand when she repeated the order back to me. What was the purpose of printing ticket numbers if you don't call out the tickets number when the order is ready. But the positive side of all of this is whoever ordered this food really spent some money and almost purchased ever item on the menu so I guess we actually came up in the end :) that's the ONLY reason I gave it 2 stars. Avoid this place if you can! This is more of an incentive to eat healthy and cut out all the garbage.

I want to give this place NO stars...

This place is absolutely the WORST Taco Bell/KFC establishment I have ever been to. I will actually drive out of my way to avoid it, despite the fact it's probably less then 5 mins from my house. I am not quite sure how the place is still in business. It's AWFUL!!!
Consistently for getting items in drive-through orders, the line always takes forever. Always double check your bag after you order

Can't give zero stars. Wouldn't know how the food is. Went inside and stood there; could hear someone moving around in the back, but the only live person I saw was the Pepsi guy delivering syrup. No one came to take the order.

Stopped here to pick up a quick, late dinner here at my daughter and son-in-law's request. Inwardly I groaned but it's what they asked for. They just had twins a few months ago, in addition to their just turned 2 year old. I would have gone somewhere 'nicer' to pick up food for them but again, it was what they wanted. I dreaded the idea of going to Taco Bell. Anyway, even though we ordered at the drive thru at around 10 on a Friday night, the service was cheerful, prompt, and accurate!The parking lot was clean and the drive thru line moved quickly. The new parents' order was correct and freshly made. Glad they were happy!
This place is a Dump, Everything here is scary.....RUN!!!!!!!!!!

The absolute SLOWEST fast food I've ever experienced. 10+ minutes to get food in the drive through every single time. Management needs to retrain employees to be efficient and quick. Food quality is what you'd expect.

It's never been great but the last two times I've been there it's been bad. Last time was subpar and tonight was just gross. I feel sick. 
Tonight and last time they didn't grill my mini grilled chicken quesadilla, cheese wasn't melted. Kind of a big deal. I got a chicken burrito earlier, it was "off," tasted different. I swallowed the bite instead of spitting it out and have nausea.  
Best wishes.

Not only has this location not improved since my last review, it is now way worse! The odds of getting decent service are a coin toss, if even worse than 50/50. Several times in a month span has the wait time been atrocious, with the service even surlier than usual. Then, the other night I went to use the app and it wouldn't work with this location. Not sure if it was just an error or if they just decided to shut off online orders, but it was irritating since online orders come with a free small Pepsi Sugar Free. I've just given up on this location and will either go to the Interstate Ave location or go locally to Rose City Taqueria.

Slowest ... fast food ... ever. But if you have 20 - 30 minutes to wait for your food, they at least get the order right most of the time. The employees are pretty zombie-like. But honestly I would be too if I worked there. And I'd much rather deal with a vacant employee than a rude one.

My wife and I stopped after a basketball game for a take home snack.
It was Saturday at 4:30pm- the sign on the drive thru said "Temporarily Closed"-lights on inside????

So Taco Bell is hit or miss.  Currently in on the Keto diet and opted for their steak power bowl no rice no beans, extra cheese.  It wasn't too bad- just nothing to die for.  The drive thru wasn't that busy and I waited a normal time at the window.  I just wish the drive thru servers would be a little more excited about life... a little more pep in their step.  I'm all about customer service and today just didn't cut it.  Other than that- i scarfed my good down after drenching it in hot sauce. It is 2:30 after all...

I ordered a Mexican Pizza and I got a meatless pizza. I came back to ask for a new one, only to get AGAIN a meatless Mexican Pizza. At this point I had waited 15 min. I asked for a refund for which they asked me to wait... 30 minutes later, I asked for my refund and was asked to continue waiting. I left without my pizza and my money!
Every since they remodeled this location, the service there has been excellent. They always get my order right, the food is hot, and they are nice. This is my go to Taco Bell!
Their hours are a lie. Every time I try to go there at 1:45am, they are always closed. If they want to close early, then just put that in the hours so people don't waste their time.

Worst Taco Bell by far. Currently in line waiting and it has been 20 minutes in the drive through! Everyone is losing patience beeping and yelling. I could've gone to a restaurant instead. No excuse given or anything. No excuse honestly would've justified it either. It's a drive through.

This Taco Bell location is by far the worst one I've ever been to! I was given the wrong order, the food was cold and when I called to complain to the manager, he hung up on me. I called him back several times and each time he picked up the phone and hung up again. So much for customer service. Taco Bell should be ashamed to have this location in operation and seriously need to reevaluate the management there as well! DO NOT VISIT THIS PARTICULAR LOCATION!!! THEY DONT KNOW HOW TO TREAT CUSTOMERS!!!

I lived close to this Taco Bell for two years and I'm amazed on the lack of service, cleanliness and lack of order accuracy. I have called their customer service to complain a few times and not a single time have they taken the time to return a call. 

What even pathetic is that they charge you a $2 fee when ordering on line for delivery and their prices go up. I don't understand why they charge a fee when they don't spend any additional services and at the same time they seldom get a order correct.

I'm literally writing this as I sit in line at there drive through. I've been sitting here 25min after my order was placed and there is still 2 cars in front of me. The lady couldn't understand a word I said (in English) because I'm American. And completely botched my order. The lady behind me have up and left, if I wasn't wicked hungry I think my journey would have ended sooner. Spent literally 40 minutes in the drive though just to get 3 soft shell (beef and cheese only) tacos. So incapable at doing their job it's crazy. This is the last time in coming here past 7pm because the night shift is apparently full of non English speaking or understanding idiots.... And my tacos were awful. How do you mess up only meat and cheese... Did I mention I waited so long in the line after my order that the lady asked me "what do chu got?" So I had to repeat my order again 40 minutes later

Place is ALWAYS out of ingredients, and always has 12 cars wrapped around the building with 5 people waiting dor food and 5 people in line to orser. Went in on dinner rush at 7pm and they had 3 people working. Usually a waste of time every time I go, but this will be the last time.
I go there all the time!!!  Taco Bell  is this the wait you treat your customers. Please teach your staff how to prepare the food! Sloppy food!!! Talk to manager rushing me off the phone.
Food came slow and with a hair in it. Staff stared at me weird sometimes and I wasn't even dressed that strangely. 4/10 at least my quesarito was good.

One star because I just ate three tacos from the drive though and now I smell like a taco.

Another star because I got twice as much fire sauce as I needed.

Another star because I couldn't understand a word that was said over the speaker but I still got tacos.

Minus a star because I wanted the fiery red shells. I think mine were orange. How many colors do they have?

Add another star because I don't want people to see too many two star reviews from me and think I'm a pr*ck. Yeah, I act like one online, and I smell like a taco, but at least I have a heart. Right?
Poorly ran even for a taco Bell. They jacked up my order and the food was under cooked. How do you make a quesadilla soggy? Also, no ice in the drink station.
This place I had rated at 4 stars, but today I went there at 2pm and was shocked at home w disgusting the men's bathroom was. What made it ironic was the employees must wash sign on the door.
Vegan option #1 the california breakfast crunch wrap minus dairy and bacon. Includes hash browns pico de gallo gaucamole. Yummy
horrible service, take an hour long to get my food , fire the lazy people & get realy people that want to work
The drive thru was absolutely insane past 10PM. There were probably 7 cars in line and it wasn't moving at all. Several cars including us eventually gave up.

Food was good as usual, but the wait for it to be ready was abnormally long, and considering the fact that I only order 2 chicken chaloopas and a Mexican pizza AND that there were like 3 other people there was even more ridiculous. Not to mention the lady on the cashier messed my order up adding a Doritos locos tacos as well as my friends order. I recommend going to another Taco Bell.

Who writes a review of Taco Bell, right?
Well, I do!
I believe that all restaurants deserve to know when they're doing well and.....when they're not.
Negative reviews give Managers a chance to improve.
So, it's Sunday.
I'm a little hungover and Chic-fil-A is closed.
I head on over to the closest Taco Bell for an inexpensive dose of mystery meat, loaded with cheese and wrapped in a warm flour tortilla.
That is NOT what I got.
I was the only guest at the place and the server still got my order wrong.
No big deal....I corrected it before I left.
My problem is with the food.
When I say that the food at Taco Bell is bad, that's really saying a LOT!
My Cheesy Roll-Up had zero cheese and the tortilla was stale.
My Crunchy Beef Taco also came in a stale shell.
My Pepsi was actually a Diet Pepsi. (perhaps this was a hint)
If the Gods are willing, hopefully I will at least get a good poop out of this experience.

I was very hungry all day I got home after a long day at work. Placed and order from the yelp app. I said it was gonna take from 15 to 30 mins at first. I ended up waiting for more than an hour and then just got a text with my order getting canceled. was exhausted have to wake up at 4:30 am and was up only waiting on the "grub hub" delivery, all for nothing when I should have had just go get the food myself

Long line at drive thru at lunch on Thursday. I went inside. Oops - big mistake! At least 7 guys in front of me. All construction workers needing to order. All dining in. I overheard the cashier telling one of them it would be 10 minutes for the food. really?! And she didn't tell anyone else. Another big group of 6 had just placed their orders so  there were lots of orders ahead of me.  

They had one prep line open for both dining in, take out and drive thru. IT took at least 12 minutes. For Taco Bell. For fast food. ugh. I stopped looking at the time. And all of the orders were combo meals. Nothing special. With that kind of wait (for a fast food place) they should have offered a free drink or dessert.

Really sad to say one of the worst experience we had at a Taco Bell location! We went on Sunday and after waiting to be assisted they told us they had no chicken, no steak and something else we dont remember.  We went today (Saturday)  and  service was awful, (again) we had to repeat our order more than 3 times so she could understand how we wanted our food and she still got the order wrong! When we told her that we were missing items in our order,  with an attitude her response was that we didn't order anything additional!! No apologies, not even a "but i can ad it to your order now" no nothing! When we arrived home food was also cold and uncooked.  We understand that now days with everything that is going on we need to support all restaurants and shops however this is a "give and take" situation.... good service =more happy customers coming back to your location, as simple as that.

Don't go to the drive-thru. Employees literally just have conversations with each other. I only got a fry and two soft tacos supremes and had to wait 35+ minutes. I eat taco bell maybe 2-5 times a month and this behavior is consistent...

Half-full cheese sauce on the reg. Pathetic. Always put ice in my "no ice, please" drinks and last time my drink was flat. Not sure I've ever had a flat drink at fast food before, so the innovation in scamminess is impressive.
waited almost 50 minutes for our food and didn't even get all of the order such fuckheads

This place is awful, been here a few times and the customer service is bad seems like kids work here there constantly goofing off laughing while we ordered and had to repeat myself since he wasn't paying attention. The lights outside have been flickering for months and nobody has fixed them.
Probably the worst Taco Bell in Columbus.  Employees are rude and I can't figure out why there is routinely a 10-15 minute wait for tacos.

I walked in to this newly opened Taco Bell excited and full of anticipation for a great taco experience. As I walked in the aromas of ground beef hot sauces and melted cheese overpowered my mind. I couldn't think straight. I was salivating at thought of my cheesy Gordita crunch. My body yearned for the tasty Mexican treat. Unfortunately this feeling of bliss caused me to overlook the facial expressions of several unhappy customers still waiting for their tacos. As I placed my order with ease and couldn't be more unaware of what was yet to come. I was blinded by my hunger. This is when my nightmare started. Unfortunately my high hopes were quickly dashed by the worst taco experience I have ever had.  45 minutes later and I still didn't have my cheesy Gordita crunch. During this time Me and my fellow customers grew restless. several fights almost broke out and I feared for the safety of the tacos makers as well as my own. One man shouted with a crazy look in his eye " hey buddy where's my expletive taco I'm Fin hungry! " I was scared, hungry and even considered getting Wendy's 4 for 4 with the spicy nuggets. However I persisted and received my Gordita crunch taco close to an hour after ordering it. Will say the taco was warm and crunchy however which is why I gave it two stars. De nada

Something is wrong in the makeup of this location. There is definitely a dire need for a fast food joint in this area, but if I roll up at 3:47pm on a Friday afternoon and am told it's going to be 30 minutes to get two tacos I can make in a minute and 20 seconds, this place needs a serious overhaul. In 40 years, I have never been to a Taco Bell where the wait time is that long. Create more workstations to meet the demand, hire more employees, or both, but do something to accommodate either your high demand or slow work output. Because again, this place is a necessity. Just get your sheet together.

Went to this location a few weeks ago. When I arrived at the drive thru the person on the other end sounded like they were high as a kite. I ordered about 3 different times and brushed it off as I thought maybe they weren't hearing me correctly, etc. When I arrived at the window the guy who took my order swung the drive thru window open and hung half of his body out of it, laughing and giggling hysterically, totally disregarding me being there. He then asked me (a 4th time!) what my order was and continued to hang out of the drive thru window laughing and mumbling to himself. I knew he was stoned as hell but this was beyond the Kush, this man was absolutely obliterated. After 10 minutes of him tripping out at the window and mumbling to himself he turned around, grabbed a random bag off the shelf and handed it to me. I pulled off as I was extremely uncomfortable and when I got home the order was completely wrong and it looked like something that was prepared 5 hours prior, cold as if it were in the fridge for hours on end. I will never go to this location ever again, that's a promise.

Everyone who goes there knows it sucks and everyone who works there knows it sucks, so there is a fascinating sense of camaraderie between everyone involved. It's like becoming friends with other people stuck on an elevator for 45 minutes, which is about how long it usually gets my food regardless of whether I order it online or in person. I'd suggest that the drive-thru be your main ingress point, as it usually only takes about 30 minutes.

I like going here Katlyn s always is there to help me she is a amazing person she always has a smile on her face and very kind I enjoy her hard work she should become the next shift leader keep up the good work Katlyn

I know this is a nationwide problem and discontinued issue, but the only things I've ever ordered since I was a little girl were a 7 layer burrito and cheesy fiesta potatoes. Without looking at the menu I ordered these items out of habit, to be told they were both discontinued, that's fine I understand. So instead I asked for a 5 layer burrito with a side of fire sauce. When I got to work, the burrito I received was only meat and cheese & mild sauce. Honestly, this has nothing to do with the staff but with Taco Bell as whole. The world is disappointed. BRING BACK 7 LAYER BURRITO & CHEESY FIESTA POTATOES.

Honestly this location could probably be a challenge to run, yet when I stopped my food was literally the best Taco Bell I've ever had... seriously.  That seems silly but everything was hot, the burritos were full and the staff was really nice.  Yo really couldn't ask for more in a fast food place.

Found a bug in my taco and reported it to a manager named Christina she simply looked at my taco and I showed her the bug and she said she doesn't know. What do you mean you don't know? That's all you're going to say to a customer who just spent money here? Not an apology nothing just I don't know. Poor customer service seemed like she didn't believe me. I only had videos of it so I could only screenshot from my video but you can see it's leg on the side.

Must admit that I don't expect much when I go to TacoBell, but they really adjusted my reality downward.  First of all- I got the wrong things and paid a premium because I asked for extra sour creme and there was NONE on the item.  Grrrr -Ok I get it, you hate your job, but please don't take it out on the customers that are paying money.  The girl at the window was so obviously unhappy and rude that it was really ridiculous.  Doubt I'll ever go back here.

Probably the worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. I ordered my food at the drive thru. The guy rang it up wrong, not a big deal. When I told him it was wrong and said what it should be he proceeded to argue with me the entire time and keep telling me I didn't say that the first time, instead of just fixing the incorrect order. Refused to give me a receipt as well, which I'm assuming is so that his name wasn't on there in order to complain about his behavior.

DO NOT EAT HERE
Took forever getting our food. We finally get our food and 10 minutes later we are asked to leave because the lobby is closing.

I hate to post on yelp but I'll tell you right now that I've been coming to this location for two years and I've seen constant terrible service since I've moved here. I can't believe a business can actually stay floating with the horrible customer service and disgusting attitudes from the staff. I wish I could get what I ordered but I guess that's too much to ask for. This store should be shut down. This has been happening for the past two years. Yeah I keep coming back, but only because I like Taco Bell. This one store is a disgrace.
Taco Tuesday fans beware...My co-worker ATTEMPTED to grab lunch there yesterday and the line was really long.  You may want to wait a ferw weeks to get your Bell on!

Words cannot describe. Stay away!!
Hate that I even have to give a star. Staff is just awful and unapproachable zombie like waste of space. Not sure how long you would have to stand at the counter before someone would even acknowledge your existence just to ask a simple question. The manager and regional manager should be ashamed of themselves. Just close it down and open up a Dell Taco or even better a Chipotle. Guess I'm just dreaming now... lol

This place never gets my food right. I had to go back around for my extra condiments that they charged me for because they forgot it and when I got home all of my food was wrong. So tired of this place.

Need to give credit for the value meals here for $5. Works out to two meals for me.

It's the same old, same old, but it hits the spot and it's open late.

Some of the crew have been exceptionally friendly.

Sometimes I give it a pass if the line at the drive through is too long.

Bill

I went to this Taco Bell 3 days ago and made an online order. When I got home and started eating my burrito a found mold on it, you can imagine how mad I was as my kids were eating from there as well. I send an Email to corporate and until a this day nobody has even acknowledge the situation.
Uber eats is the worst fckng delivery service. I ordered this at 9 pm and still wasn't here until midnight. This is ridiculous

This is right next to the outlet mall. Tons of tourist and usually that is a disaster in waiting...but this Taco Bell is well staffed and the workers and extremely efficient, making this one of the better Taco Bell in the area. The food is typical TB and I do love fire sauce. Other places on I drive will drive up the price because it is in a tourist area, but this place keep price the same and it's a great find after some good shopping.

Hispanic or white chick with brown hair in a bun working the drive thru was extremely rude for no reason tonight. Asked how she was doing on the speaker and she said "bad what do you want?", then proceeded to tell me "don't make a large order cus I won't take the order" even tho it was just me in the drive thru?.. and then finally yelled and cussed at me when I was trying to leave the drive thru. If this is how you guys run y'all's business then  I'll take my business elsewhere. I know not to expect much from Taco Bell in general but a little respect goes along way.

I want to start by saying that the staff is doing an amazing job given the circumstances they're working with. They were all friendly, polite, and helpful to the extent that they could be. Surprisingly not as bad as one would expect given that the atmosphere is one of slight chaos and clear signs of overwhelmed staff. My order was correct and I waited about 15 mins. I used the kiosk and did not stand in the order line.

This being said, this location is not ready to deal with the volume of business being in downtown Crossing brings. They are still hiring and are clearly under staffed. The place is always packed which means a line out the door both times I have been. They have a kiosk were you can order, they should have 2, but 1 has been down practically since they opened. Today the soda machine was down, no ice, warm beverages and some beverages were just carbonated water not the soda indicated. A repairman standing on the counter, hovering over staff, food, and customers.

I know the opening was pushed back, but seems like they should have pushed it back further. They are not ready. I honestly feel bad for the staff.

this disrespectful worker made us pull through the drive through to order one item we wanted to add on. there was no other cars in the whole entire parking lot, and when we first asked if we could order another item she said we didn't have to pull through but then gave us our food and made us go through AGAIN. not to mention the attitude on this cashier. I have never been so disrespected in my whole entire life. And there was no lettuce

I stopped here for a late dinner once and there was only myself and one other car in line at the drive-thru.  It took FOREVER for them to get my order....and then took forever for the people to deliver my order. This is Taco Bell for goodness sake....it's not rocket science! There are plenty of other TB locations in the area that I'll go to other than this one. Not sure if it's the management here.....or just the quality of employees they hire (or LACK of quality should I say). 

Like I always say, minimum wage for maximum losers! Taco Bell-----FAIL!

Great service every time. 

After 20 years this place is still here, and still making decent fast food.

Pre covod review: I had the opposite experience of my friend Nancy H below -- I ordered on the mobile app (T Mobile Tuesdays gives you free burritos once a week) and it was ready right when I ordered. I did have to awkwardly 'excuse me' my way up to the front, but I was there at 1:03 and my burrito was sitting there for my 1:00 order.

TACO BELL ON OAK ST IN MILWAUKIE 

The kid at the window has EXTEME eczema and was scratching at his skin the whole time we were waiting for our food. I understand he can not help the fact that he has eczema, but it made me lose my appetite knowing he was scratching at himself and then handing our food. He wasn't wearing gloves and his skin looked like it was starting bleed. I feel bad even saying anything but this has happened twice now. Maybe he could wear some gloves? It just seems very unsanitary.
The service was great! The only thing is that they forgot my Diablo sauce but not a big deal I had 2 packages in the car lol. I  like how they are well organized. The manager is doing a good job

OBVIOUSLY UNDERSTAFFED! 
Literally waited JUST under 20 minutes in the drive thru line, and didn't move an inch forward. Called to see what was up (did someone die?), and Justin answered chipper as can be, stating everything was fine. I've worked in the restaurant industry for years- this was bad. Two cars ahead of me pulled out after I called, & I finally got the hint, and left. "Fast food" my bum. Terrible. Someone should hire some competent staff, or make sure who is on staff is trained. Thanks for nothing.

After two Road detours in downtown Orlando, I had to stop here and pick up some lunch on the way to work.  

I really like it when a plan comes into place.  I ordered my two burritos, and a drink.  By the time I got to the window to pay for my meal, they were ready and waiting for me.

Nourishment aside, this is called customer service.  This Taco Bell will definitely be a return visit.

Wasted my lunch break waiting for someone to take my order. Thought this was quickest way to find something to eat in the very limited time we are given by our employers. I literally sat in car waited for 8 mins. Before someone told me that they didnt have anything i wanted. I mean thats fine but when you respond to me in a rude manner after making me wait mins is worth bring up. STOP CALLING YOURSELVES FAST FOOD

We have tried a number of Taco Bell locations. Over time, the quality of the product,  the service, and new attempts to appeal to an in increasingly savvy consumer (on line ordering) has declined.   We will curtail the frequency of ordering and give them a try again in a while. Disappointing.

Atrocious. Abyssmal. Absolutely shit. We walked in curious of the forty other people in the restaurant. No one was eating. What we didn't realize was that they were ALL waiting on orders. Unfortunately, my friend misplaced the receipt, so we had to wait. And wait we did. It took a full hour for four tacos! The place was a dump. The food was poorly made. The service was subpar. I will drive ten miles the other way for Taco Bell instead.

We made the mistake of coming to the drive thru at midnight on Saturday night. We were in line for well over 40 min. I've been doing TB drive through for 25 years or more. This is the longest I've ever had to wait. Avoid this Taco Bell at all costs.

This is the worst service I have ever gotten. We came in and a young black girl gave us the dirtiest look and at first I just thought it was her face but then she continued to catch an attitude. She then took forever and the excuse was that the screen was so backed up it couldn't take anymore orders?? What kind of an excuse is that. We then ordered a side of cheese and didn't get it until 30 minutes after and all the food was cold, the soft tacos were hard and their inside and drive thru was backed up. All small orders took forever. My aunt ordered 5 $5 boxes and the girl got upset when we went back to retrieve the 5th box we never received. She then tried to argue with us saying she never paid for it even though she read the order back to us and refused to give us the receipt after we asked just so she can prove that she didn't but when we went to show her the bank transaction online it showed that we got charged for five and the manager came and argued along with us to lie about the pricing even though we calculated with tax and everything. The black girl was in the back still arguing with us and all we wanted was the $5 box. She then got an attitude and stormed off flying the doors open to go talk to the people in the drive though. Someone ordered one taco and they still hadn't received it 20 minutes later. The girl came back in and had an attitude rolling her eyes again and throwing cups into the holder. People from the drive thru came back and wanted refunds and she continued to get an attitude with everyone coming in to receive a refund even though it was her fault that these "back ups" occurred. I have worked at Taco Bell before and with 4 people working at the pace of which people were coming in, everyone received their orders within 5-10 minute no matter how big. These people had 7 working at half the pace and people were waiting 30 minutes plus. After we had left, getting into the car, the girl stepped out and took a cigarette break, shoved her way through us and was glaring at us. At this point we were pissed so we told the in coming family coming in to not even bother coming in and she got upset after they walked away back to their car and WALKED INSIDE WITH HER CIGARETTE to tell her manager what we had just done. This is the worst service you will ever receive and the food was disgusting.

I just waited 20 minutes in the drive through with only 2 cars in front of me. When i got to the window the person took my money, shut the window, roughly handed me the bag of food and Never Once spoke to me or even made eye contact. I know it's fast food and it's a hard job (believe me, i did my time) but this is just so next level BAD.

So the last time I posted an updated review was two years ago. I just want to reiterate how awful this place is. I haven't eaten Taco Bell in almost a year (May will be my official one year without Taco Bell.) The sole reason being because of how terrible the quality of food is at this restaurant. I constantly think of Bernice and wonder what she's up to now. Maybe she's not as impatient as she used to be.. or maybe she changed her outlook on life and donated her coat to the garbage and will never buy animal-skinned clothing again. But either way, if you can avoid this specific restaurant, please do it.

If you like Taco Bell (which I do), don't come to this establishment. Myself and several others had our orders taken, then waited for food for more than an hour. We ended up taking a refund and leaving, as there was no guarantee from the staff that we wouldn't wait another hour. The hold up? Who knows. They weren't short on food or staff, and the kind lady at the counter said their computers were operational.

Taco Bell often needs to work on its cleanliness. It is difficult to enjoy your food when you're worried about what that puddle is in the floor of what the sticky stuff is on the table. The temperature was also a little too cold to be comfortable. The food was good, exactly what you expect from Taco Bell. My friend got the new $1 grand burrito: loaded taco for the first time. He's a big fan. He really enjoyed the red tortilla strips in the burrito along with the beef & cheese. Taco Bell is a great value for the food you get.

Waited in drive thru line for 10 minutes then told to wait before ordering.  Took order and screen was correct.  Sorry though you not only gave us a taco salad which we did t order you missed three other items we did pay for.  Now have to turn around and sit in line for another 10-15 minutes because lobby not open.  Poor!

Fast, efficient, friendly and ....  great tacos and nachos!   

Drive thru lines can be long.   Their parking lot area can also make it quite a tight space when navigating.   Other patrons traffic behaviors or impatience would seem to make the place an accident waiting to happen.   Look out for the other drivers.

I am not a fan of drive thru's because something always seems to go wrong.   This location has their act together here.   Good teamwork.   Very few problems with drive thru errors.    Even though busy, their line goes quickly.  They are great with minimizing contact during this challenging pandemic times.   I'd definitely go back when I have craving for tacos, fast.

Fast food is supposed to be fast. Waited 5 or more minutes for them to figure out their cash drawer, then waited another 10+ minutes for 3 regular tacos and 2 rolled shocked tacos. Right as I'm finished eating, a guy comes in returning an order from the drive thru. He's yelling and really mad. He said he told them 5 times he's vegetarian and can't have meat and not to put any meat in his order. He said he had to "spit that nasty stuff out".
