Now, I think it's great that a vegetarian accidentally got meat in his mouth, doesn't that even sound awesome when you read it? I'm giving an extra star for this alone. But these employees are the worst.

Honestly worst possibly service anyone could get. Managers are highly disrespectful with all do respect it would be much better off without those kinds of people working there. Talking crap in Spanish right in front of your face not knowing you speak Spanish because they got my order wrong ...

Where's the beef?? Went and ordered a few different items only to find more sour cream and lettuce than anything, especially beef. After reaching out a few days later and speaking to a manager by the name of Tyeisha, there was nothing but frustration and an attitude from her end. I told her I no longer had the receipt but did take timestamped photos on the day of so (since I was pressed for time and could not say something that visit) she could see the lack of any meat in any of the items. She asked "So...what do you want me to do? You should have come back the next day. Do you want a refund or do you want us to remake it or what?" I took her up on the offer to remake part of the order and had told her I could show her timestamped photos for evidence if it could help with quality control. She told me to ask for her name when going through the drive-thru.

Upon arrival we did as followed and asked the person at the window if the manager whom I had spoken with wanted to see the photos for quality control moving forward. The associate called her name looking over at her and then relayed, "No, she doesn't want to". I asked if she didn't really care and the associate said, "No". 

The higher disappointment was the fact that the manager didn't even care to improve the quality of the food when given the opportunity and treated the experience as a guest just wanting free food.

I ordered nachos at this location and when I opened it there was mold on a couple chips so I took it back and the manager told me its not mold then ate the chip. I called corporate and they had a different store employee from this location call me after hours on his personal phone to call me a liar and tell me there is no way the food could possibly have mold on it because he orders the food personally and "reads the books"... They deny it is mold or there could be any problem. He said it looks like fryer grease splashed onto the chips, when I said "well what gets cooked in the fryer" he said "EVERYTHING"......

If you are planning on going to this Taco Bell - do yourself a favor and find another one.  Went here at 7pm, waited 15 minutes and no one came to the counter or even said they would be with those of waiting.  Finally another customer told us we might as well leave because she had been waiting 30 minutes for an order.  This Taco Bell will be the last place I will go to ever and I will make sure to let everyone to avoid it.  Maybe a new manager is needed, the people working there need education on customer service!!!

Definitely the worst taco bell I've been to in my entire 23 years of life constantly out of something or the grill is down the freeze machine is broken and I've even been told several times they didn't have enough people to be open but have enough people to tell me that through the drove thru please just shut this place down it's terrible I in every aspect I can't name one thing good about it

Services was literally trash they were very rude to me and threw my food in the bag sloppy. I made a donation and one of the employees (white kid) said i can't get my free taco. If i could give this store a negative 1000 i would.
Got 30 minutes to wait in the drive through?? This particular location SUCKS! And they give free food to their friends. Shady place

Taco Bell needs to accurately complete orders. It appears that when you tell Taco Bell your order is to go their quality control goes out the window. I attached a picture of my receipt and one of the three burritos opened with no sour cream. All three were missing the additional ordered ingredient. I was however charged for my sour cream.

Well, I finally had to make a run for the border.

Every now and then, you just get that hankering for Taco Bell.  Not Mexican food, Taco Bell.  In particular the crunchwrap supreme was calling my name.  

Upon entering, I must say that this is one of the cleanliest Taco Bell locations I have ever patronized.  Bonus star.

Also, It was only about one minute between order time and my food being done.  I can honestly say that has NEVER happened to me at any other Taco Bell location.  Another bonus star.

Aside from that, it's what I wanted.  I happened to be in the mood for something that takes nacho cheese, taco meat (and I use the term loosely), tomatoes, lettuce and sour cream and then wraps it in a flour tortilla with a tostada shell inside to make it crunchy and then grill it so it stays put together while I'm eating it.

I also get the baja blast mt. dew every time i go to a Taco Bell, simply because I can't get it anywhere else and it's about the only mt. dew flavor I kind of enjoy.  I stole extra packets of fire sauce as well, not because it's hot--it's really not, I just like the flavor in my pie hole.   Damn you Taco Bell!
Taco Bell was sooooo much better in California, I used to eat it all the time. But now I just cry cause the Taco Bell in Portland just isn't the same (sigh) hopefully one day things will change.‍

Order was wrong people weren't friendly at all, seemed way too hasty to get order done and you out of there. Food was ok but seemed like it was dropped. Didn't ask what drink I wanted with the combo, just gave me cola. This was from the drive thru.

This is the most unorganised Taco Bell I've ever been to. Every time I've gone I've waited over 30 minutes, two of which I've left without food after waiting almost an hour (even when there's only 4 other customers in the place). If you try to ask the workers where your order is they either give you attitude or ignore you all together. I've given this location multiple chances to make up for how awful their service was on my previous visit, and each time I've been let down.

Hate this Taco Bell.. I'm disappointed every time I come here. Today my chicken burrito was 90% rice. If I wanted a rice burrito I could've just made that crap at home..
I wish just once they would staff this location with some people who actually CARE about their job.

Lesson finally learned. Never coming to this location again. #CancelTacobell

See picture. This disgusting little abomination is not even in the same category as the spicy tostada that I had ordered. This thing has a undercooked flimsy Quesadilla, shredded chicken and chipotle three cheese, and frankly tasted like leftovers. A tostada features refried beans, red sauce, creamy chipotle sauce, shredded lettuce, shredded cheddar cheese, and tomatoes on a crunchy tostada shell. Spicy Tostada doesn't even sound like shredded chicken mini quesadilla. Avoid this location in my opinion.

The way these children (adults cannot be inside playing like this) let you wait in the drive through is just insane. Literally don't say ANYTHING then wait until you pull to the window to say, "we can't take orders at the window" .. like who lil cousins? It's sad man and then you can VISIBLY SEE the issue ‍

Went there at night and the worker told me I had a 3 item limit and couldn't order more than 3 things. When i ordered a 5$ box, she said that's all i could order. Got out of line and took my business elsewhere. Terrible experience. Do not go here and choose other fast food places next door.

If I could give it less then one star I would. There's nothing to say other than this restaurant needs to be closed and restructured. I have have literally seen health code violations, an unclean lobby and watched the cashier hand a coworker a joint! A joint, really so unprofessional.

I finally get to eat Taco Bell in Boston! This place is way better than that poser Qdoba. The prices aren't as cheap as I remember, but to be fair, last time I had Taco Bell was like 10 years ago back when you could order 10 tacos for 10 dollars. Technically, Burger King has a 10 dollar deal for 10 tacos, but their shells are weird and they don't have the signature sauce. I just wish BU had a Taco Bell. At least, now I can finally taste Baja Blast again and remember my days in California.

WOW! I was hesitant to come here because of the negative reviews when it opened, but boy am I glad I tried it for myself. Not only is it very clean, the lines moves quickly and you can watch your food being made. The woman at the register was extremely friendly, and was accommodating to my friends request to make as close to a double decker taco and she offered a better deal combo for what he wanted as well (which was cheaper). I mentioned the negative reviews and she explained that things have changed since it has opened, with better employees and guest service, which I agree with. 
Now getting to the food, it was delicious!!! The cheese was cool, lettuce crisp, and there was plenty of meat! I enjoyed my stay thoroughly and will return again! :)

If I could give zero stars, I would. I ordered almost $30 worth of food and only got maybe $10 of it and what I did get, was wrong... the order was even correct on the screen. When I called, three times, it just rang and rang and rang. I have no idea how they're still in business and I will not be going back to this location. I'll go out of my way and go to the one off Kirkman

Never getting this again until I forget how terrible I feel right now. Ordered 2 cheesy Gorditas like always and they were extra dry. If I didn't have my tasty baja blast I wouldn't have made it and neither would the 2nd star. The taco meat looked a week old, grey with orange blotches, which in my opinion is pretty f*cking disgusting. Not even an hour after consuming it my stomach felt as if I gulped down some toxic waste and I have had diarrhea 5 times in the last 3 hours and almost sh*t myself. Not to mention my stomach making deflating sounds. Taco Bell pfft more like Taco Hell 

-Lydia Johnson out

Ordered 3 crispy tacos and friend ordered a couple items. No lie it took 45 minutes to get our order! Guy was yelling out names of customers to see who was still waiting. At least 3 of the orders the people had left after paying not wanting to wait any longer. Unbelievable!

We waited I believe around 30 minutes in the drive-thru the other day around 8-9PM which is beyond crazy. We thought about just leaving but we already waited so long that we decided not too. Food was OK. Also, watched a gentleman try to enter the interior dining area and the door was locked- which I personally thought the dining area being closed before 9 was very odd. I definitely think they could improve their speed at this location.

Don't go here)It's disgusting and dirty I went here because I never had it and I threw up and got food poisoning I had to go to the hospital and I had cramps in my stomach for 3 days.DON'T GO HERE AT ALL
They were so cheap... this box costed 5.99 and there is around 9 pieces of fries and the whole point of the box is the nacho fries.

Worst Taco Bell ever. Trash experience. Bad service. Waited 45 minutes for an online order. Order was wrong three times. Spent $25 for slow cold food. Poor quality customer service poor quality food. If I could give zero stars I would. 10/10 recommend not going here
Slowest fast food service seen anywhere and they have problems all the time, mostly with their attitudes. Save your money.

I don't usually bother writing reviews of fast food places.  I mean, it's fast food, right? But it's during the coronavirus and what else is there to do?  Plus, this was such a disappointment.  We have been getting delivery on Saturday nights and this past Saturday, we decided to go for inexpensive.   We had also been talking about how we used to love Taco Bell.  I was always a huge fan of the bean burritos, they were piping hot, with red sauce, cheese and chopped onions.  I also really loved the bean tostadas.  This time, wow, so terrible.  The bean burrito was like some mashed, lukewarm beans in a tortila. No cheese, no onions, nada.  The bean tostada looked the same, but had no flavor.  We also got the nachos, which were a tiny amount of nachos and cold, but at least had a little flavor.  We won't be ordering from this Taco Bell ever again.

It seems every time I go through the drive thru at this location, they are friendly, fast, and the food is hot. Every time I go inside, however, not so much. I've seen the teenage cashier ineffectually sweep the floor while a customer is waiting at the counter 5 feet away for several minutes. I've received a completely incorrect order from a cashier who wouldn't make eye contact or speak to me. And it always takes 8-10 minutes for me to get my two cheesy gordita crunches when I go inside. 
This time I went because I read they were giving away a free taco to every customer this afternoon. I felt awkward saying "I want the free taco", so i ordered my cheesy gordita crunch and figured they would put the free taco in automatically. I was standing to the side waiting for my food and a staff member put a bag on the counter and said what sounded like "Brenda" (my name's Tricia). No one came to claim the bag. A few minutes later the cashier walked up, looked in the bag and yelled back to the kitchen "whose food is this?" I dont know if they answered her but the cashier then walked away. After this, as I still waited, I decided I better tell the cashier about the free taco. She asked me what my order was again and I told her a cheesy gordita crunch she said "That's not free but I can ring you up for a free regular taco". Okay I wasn't asking if my CGC was free but whatever. So now I'm waiting for two orders to come up. Someone finally brings a bag up and calls my name. It's the CGC by itself. So I keep waiting for the taco. The staffperson looks in the other bag that's been sitting there and yells back to the kitchen "whose is this?" The kitchen staff says Tricia, thinking she's talking about bag number two (the CGC). I told her that it had been sitting there since before I ordered my taco so it's not mine. But I honestly think she was confused by what was happening and said I should take the taco. Her tone made me think she thought she was giving me a bonus. Like she was giving me food that I didn't order. To be fair: it was what I ordered, but it was sitting there before I ordered it. Meanwhile, another customer was busy complaining bc she said her family had been there for 45 minutes and hadn't recieved their order.
 I just wanted to outline some of the confusion that seems to take place at this spot. I've witnessed similar incidents take place every time I go inside this location. If you decide to patronize this one, go to the drive thru if possible. If not, for the love of god, save yourself from an aneurism and don't come if you're hangry or impatient.
The food's alway's good though!

Mobile Order Review! Don't do it! All the counter orders will push your order back to eternity.

I wanted that free bean burrito from taco bell if you order from the mobile app since my tummy was rumbling. I set an order for a 6PM pickup. The app auto tells you that your order is ready at the set time even if it isn't. So the app and the store have no communication on that end.

I got my order at 6:20 after I asked the pickup counter what the lodown was only to wait in line for the counter and find out my mobile order was continuously pushed back by the counter orders so they were never going to get to it. I saw the lady scroll through all her orders at the taco making counter, *click*, *click*, *click*, *click*, *click*, *click*, *click*, "Oh it's her mobile order, MOBILE ORDER". 

They quickly made it and shipped me off with my goodie in hand. Taco Bell makes a dope bean burrito to satiate the hunger but if you're ordering via mobile app you have to go to the counter anyways...

Terrible place. I refuse to go here when my friends want Taco Bell. I will drive miles out of my way to avoid it.

The staff is terrible. A clerk once fought with me over my order that she got wrong, insisting that I was wrong and that she "doesn't want to argue with me". It is insanely slow to the point where cars will be pouring into the city street because the drive-thru is so backed up.

The eat-in area is a joke. There are maybe three tables,which are always in use. If you do, however, have the misforutnthey are all awkward to sit at due to the strange elevation they have them set at.

There is nothing redeeming about this place.

They ALWAYS ALWAYS ALWAYS mess up my order. No matter how slow I tell them. They even verify it with me when I pay at the window and still mess it up. I will not visit this location again. Sucks cause it's the closest to my work.

There are two things I expect when I go for a late night T-Bell run: (1) that delicious Tex mex flavor we've grown to love and (2) nice, sweet service from their drive through professionals. 

Let me give you a breakdown of my *supreme* experience at the broadway location tonight.

A) rolled up in a hurry for food. There was a bit of a line but the staff member on intercom greeted me in a friendly laid back way that made me instantly think "ok this is going to be good" "they seem busy but well prepared and confident"

B) oops. Forgot to order a CHICKEN chalupa for my dad (waiting at home and basically allergic to beef). The window guy switched it for me easy peasy. My dad was really happy. I thank you for that 

C) the window guy and his comrade on the grill seemed to have a great, natural chemistry. Almost like a teen movie or something. They appeared to have a great time making these delicious items and dealing with the customers. You never really see happy employees almost anywhere. But. Tonight I did.

Thanks to this location and keep up the great work. The bean and rice $1 burrito is basically keeping me afloat through all of this.

I don't know what has happened to this Taco Bell but it has gone down hill fast. The drive thru line is always horrible no matter what time of day. My Husband just sat for 55 minutes in the drive thru and couldn't even back out. We are done coming to this Taco Bell

Avoid at all costs -- understaffed, abysmal layout, unreasonably long wait times.

Preface: A shout out to the staff who are trying to make this place function. You're all facing an impossible challenge.

The kitchen is clearly too small for the demand of orders coming in. It's staffed by three people: two people working on orders from customers at the restaurant and other working only on online orders. The person making my online order kept getting pulled off the line, so my 12:15 pick order was ready at 12:45. 

The restaurant is quite narrow and the layout is poorly designed. Notably, the pick up counter is directly in front of the soda machine -- which was then encircled by sea of folks impatiently waiting for their orders. Nightmarish.

It gets a second star because the food was terrific, portions were generous, and staff is trying to make the best of this situation.
Worst Taco Bell I've ever been too. Extremely slow service. Waited 20 minutes for threetacos on a slow Sunday afternoon. So much for fast food.

This must be the worst Taco Bell in Portland.  Saying this because I have been to many.  I was trapped in the drive thru today for over 30 minutes.  Could not back out because of cars behind me.  The service was soooo sloooow.  The Customer Service was HORRIBLE.  Once I got to the speaker to order- It took them aprox. 2 minutes before they even said anything.  I had to keep saying "Hello, Hello". And once he got on the line, no apologies for the long wait or anything. Once I got to the pick-up window,I asked for  the Manager- The person I was speaking to stated she was the Manager- Her name was Samantha. She too, did not offer any apologies.  I asked what took so long and she told me first of all I did not wait as long as I told her I did.  She wanted to argue with me instead.  She did mentioned they were only working with a crew of 3.  I informed that I was sorry about that, but that is not my fault. And as a customer, I should be respected a little better than that. If they were only working with 3- Maybe they should have closed drive thru all together.  There is no reason someone should wait in drive thru for over 30min in the hot sun.  On top of that the 2 freezes that I ordered were melted by the time I got them.  I asked for a refund and she told me she had  already charged my card and she could not refund me.  On top of that, she told me I was holding up her drive thru.  I be damn!! So, now I'm the reason the drive thru is so slow.  I asked for corporate's phone # and she told me to go online to get it.  I felt this was really rude of her. The people  in the restaurant started looking towards drive-thru because of the commotion we was creating. I had to get loud because she kept cutting me off when I talked.  All she had to due, was first apologize for the delay, and refund my money.  No- she did none of that- so here I am. I will be contacting the Manager/Owner Alex next.  Thanks to the other person working - who was nice enough to provide the owners name. At least someone had a bit sense- Sure was not the shift Manager- She sure needs a good lesson in Customer Service!!!!  Avoid this Taco Bell unless you have nothing else to due but sit in drive thru to pass the time away.....    :-(
Whaaaaaaat the fuck. It says they close in 45 but they are already closed. That rightfully makes me upset. I'm hungry and i was looking to here for food. No one else is open...so ..just sayin

Garbage customer service for the overnight crew. Wrote them an email about my situation and still haven't heard back from anyone about the matter. Two very rude employees at night times who don't have any upbeat attitude to show towards anyone to start off with, and when something goes wrong..."the monotone window guy, starts telling me off and spouting things about calling each other liars (hadn't even thought about the word and he uses it...) why did expect anything different from a trash company...

50 years old and worst taco bell experience of my life! Dirtier restroom than a hole in the wall truckstop you can envision....took 22 minutes from the time I paid until we got all our food. The guy I spoke to on x2 occasions named Victor was rude and just didn't care. When I asked for his name he refused. Picture is attached. The heavy set guy.
Just ordered from here , our tacos had no meat just packed with lettuce and sour cream, if I wanted a salad I wouldn't be going to Taco Bell for one just saying.

Normally I don't have a problem with Taco Bell. It's just your standard taco and burrito chain restaurant. However every time I come here, my order is always messed up. I usually get the quesadilla with extra jalapeño sauce on it. And what do I get?! No sauce whatsoever on it, with all my meat and cheese in the two middle pieces, and nothing but tortillas on the sides. I can't tell you how annoyed I get. So I had to start getting extra on the side, which they make me pay for it. 
Not only is the food orders incorrect, but the people they have working there! Well I say people, but I really mean person! The day manager there is incompetent, extremely rude and hurries you through your order. I don't know about you, but that to me is the definition of bad customer service!!
Im a fan of Taco Bell but for some reason this locations drive through time is always slow. I've never waited less than 20 minutes in the drive through. Cant say for sure about inside.

I really wish I could give this location zero stars. They got my order wrong in the drive-thru, luckily I stopped in the parking lot to check it. I go inside and was really friendly about it, just wanted the right food. Employee gives me major attitude about it and she says "you don't have to argue with me about it" when I was only calmly explaining what the issue was, and hadn't even been able to explain it all. She takes the wrong items, and a few minutes later she brings the right ones to the counter, and tells me I should have checked the board after I ordered when I was asked too. First off, the board was right, secondly I wasn't asked to check it. I should have known better and not even had gone to TB, and will never go again. Still can't believe how poorly I was treated...

I like going here Katlyn s always is there to help me she is a amazing person she always has a smile on her face and very kind I enjoy her hard work she should become the next shift leader keep up the good work Katlyn S very awesome worker

Took them 4 times to finally get my order right. I also asked for extra sauce and when i got home they gave 0 But the food was good the lettuce was crispy not soggy like some other taco bell's. They also gave a extra taco lol

I would give this place no stars just due to the manager Loretta Sanders. She always has an attitude with her staff and treats them disrespectfully. I was personally offended when a young man asked her for help who worked there because his drawer wouldn't close she said "why the fock cant you close it, its not hard" and he said, " i tried to do it the way you said I thought Im sorry" she just huffed, rolled her eyes and went over to help and then continued to go on and complain. When these two girls walked up, loretta told them to just use the machine to order themselves and they told her it was broken, she looked over and looked back and ignored them, sent a young lady cashier over to help. Loretta kept giving us glares because we were eating in for awhile and maybe she doesnt like babies in her restaurant? Our baby was quiet, we just went ahead and left, didnt feel welcomed the whole time we were there by here but we decided to hopefully let it roll off our backs. We also want to say that the young lady with the nose peircing that helped us and those girls should be promoted and given a raise as should the young man who was working that night with her....but Loretta...just fire her...she also complained when SHE messed up our order saying we made it too hard....beef soft taco...no cheese?????

Good lord. 
I was in a hurry on maybe a Wednesday or Thursday morning. 
The sign on their door says that they're open at 7:00am. It was literally 8:55am and there was no one in the store. 
I thought maybe they were closed for construction or some interior work or whatever, but there was no sign. 
So I drove across the way to park because I was getting a call from a coworker and I don't like to drive while I'm using my phone. 
As I'm on the phone, I see maybe 2 or 3 cars pull up and leave without any food. 
Then about 5 minutes later at about 9:05, I see people walking around in the building. 
So I whip around the drive through line again, go straight up to the drive through window and bang on it pretty hard. 
Some apathetic street rat (she looked all of about  20 years old) opened the window and simply said "Excuse me, can I help you?" in the most condescending tone I've ever heard. 
I very sternly retorted "Ma'am, I WISH you could help me. The sign on the door says you're open at 7:00am."
She just stared  at me blankly and said "Ok."
I said "what do you mean 'ok'? You were supposed to be here 2 hours ago. Is there some kind of half day at the office, or what's going on?"
She said "No, it's just the time we get here."
"Oh, so you're not really open at 7:00, so you change your sign to 9:00 then." 
"Ok." 
What the ever loving f%^*?! No apology no attempt to satisfy a customer, nothing. Brain dead. 

"So why does the sign say 7:00am when you're here at 9:00?!"

"Because that's what time we got here."

"Holy shit, may I see a manager please."

"I'm the manager."

"Of course you are. What's your name?"

"Dienna". 

"Thank you".

Then I called corporate and they told me they didn't own that location. So I asked "well do you know who owns it or who to call?!"

"No, sorry." 

Taco Bell - I love your food, but you have got to get a grip on this location. They're making you look very, very bad. I've never encountered such unprofessional nonsense at a fast food place. It's not as if it's a rough job. 2 hours after opening time they show up and don't care and don't even apologize. What the actual f%^*in  F%^*?!

If it is possible to not provide customer service...this is the place.  The millennial at the drive-thru was so self-involved on her cellphone that she didn't notice me at the counter for 10 minutes.  Then when her peer told her she laughed.  I think as a baby boomer I will just use my money to pay for another millennial on Favor to wait for this millennial to serve them and they can bring me my food.  I don't have the patience for them and they seem to have patience for each other!!
They're really fast, but they charged me for the sour cream i ordered, told me the correct # of items, but it wasn't the correct #, missing two sour creams.

I was already disappointed because they took the loaded grillers off the menu and those were perfect for me. As a back up I went with the chicken quesadilla and I made sure with the guy multiple times that the creamy jalapeño sauce still came on the quesadilla even if I ordered it not on a meal. He told me yes and yet my entire quesadilla is dry and I'm highly dissatisfied

I've come here twice. The first time was quick and easy.

The second time, today, I came again. Expecting the Fritos burrito, I was sad to find they were out -- that's okay. Stuff happens. So I ordered different than I'd have preferred.

It was a bit tricky, I admit. Which is why I felt bad having to go return it after they didn't make my food fresco. I asked that they please don't add sauce to it (because that's what the website does when you fill it out, it removes all dairy).

I walk back to my car. Open up one and it's missing the guacamole I paid for -- sure, I'll leave them alone, it was probably a mistake. Open up my other one and it's got the sauce on it.

I just want to eat my lunch. I'm incredibly lactose intolerant (diagnosed). I don't want to call out of work for a day and feel like crap for the next three over something so silly.

Please be careful to check your food if you have severe allergies or dietary restrictions.

I drive thru here when running late to my job at St. Ed's and always get the same super friendly and competent sweet lady -- she's fast, sharp, sweet. Yes it's a fast food drive through but come on -- NOT BAD for a $4 lunch!!!

Wish I could give a review. Can't because they closed before they said they would. That was a fun surprise for us and the Uber who drove us there. What a travesty. Adjust your hours or close down your business.

This place is beyond terrible. It took over 25 minutes to get my order through the drive thru, YES 25 MINUTES! The place is very dirty and the staff is extremely slow!  They also forgot something that I ordered and it just seems like nobody cares and they are more interested in dancing than getting your order in a timely manner. AVOID this place!
In the mood for stale taco shells and room temperature fried potatoes? Look no further!

Order form this Taco Bell frequently over the years. Food is consistently better prepared than other Taco Bell in area. Staff is always very friendly and my orders have never had any issues. 
Keep up the good work!

This is how every Taco Bell should be! The customer service is great, as well as the quickness of the orders come out.

Best Taco Bell in Florida, by far!

Its a hit or miss when i go here during the day they're usually on point but at night they dont give a flying shit you'll have a online order and ask for specific things and they do the complete opposite i always have to turn around and go back to the window and get it re made the funny thing is they messed it up again my online order is literally on the screen whats so hard about reading simple directions on a sceen and doing it never going to this location again

We have watched the quality of worker go Down here quickly and now we are missing a taco each for each of our meals and this is what my beef, cheese with small specks of tortilla strips looks like - it was hard and hurt my teeth and I looked down and saw all tortilla and red pieces so I took a picture of its minimal and sad self and then opened it and wow .. this is a joke .. if smiling nice people are discriminated here at this location and this is what they dish out - we don't want to go back. We own my partners childhood home on Mount Scott and he has watched this Taco Bell change over the years and now with the new remodel we thought we would try it again and see if we are missing anything - well this is the 3rd time something is missing or old and hard and we felt really laughed at or not treated well . Taco Bell please let Mount Scott have a Taco Bell , we deserve it too once in a while .

Update we went back - same evening-  and AmaZing assistant manager Antoine ( if we are spelling that or saying that right he said it so quickly ) said that our next meal was 'on him' and he fixed it by giving us our two tacos and a remade beef and cheese burrito with those little red things in it thank you Taco Bell!!!

Always the slowest Taco Bell. Do not go inside or you will wait a long time for your food. I used the little kiosk to order my food. Waited 15 minutes. I asked to speak to a manager about how I "tell the bell" about my experience (because I didn't get a receipt which normally has all the info on the back). The manager refused to give me her name because I was going to leave a bad review. I asked for my money back. She wouldn't do that either because it was a kiosk order. WTF?! She told me I'm gonna have to contact my bank to get my money back. The nameless manager then walked away from me leaving me helpless and without even an apology. I said "excuse me I'd like your general managers name" probably 10 times at the top of my lungs before the girl making tacos walked over and told me. I would drive farther to another taco

A little sketchy in the wee hours of the night, and they are so skimpy on the number of hot sauce packets you can get, and for full disclosure I'm reviewing this TB in comparison to NYC TB which is such a disaster for a much higher price - but otherwise I had a solid Taco Bell experience here. The food was definitely above standard, but there was no line, and I went around 10:30 pm and didn't mobile order. Got the tostada (which had a high volume of toppings!), the Crunchwrap (which was made perfectly, the bean burrito (which was made perfectly fresco style with the right amount of sauce) and the nachos, which I have no complaints about. And their bathroom was clean. Would definitely come back!

The girl the window was pissed off before I even ordered, I asked her for a lot of hot sauce and she gave me fewer packets then items that I had bought. Her voice said "f' you" already, with every word, but the packets of sauce were a definite "f' you." Then the tacos weren't wrapped well and their innards fell out in the bag... I don't know if that was intentional, but three of 5 tacos were mostly shell before they were out of the bag. But that POS at the window... she's gotta get out of customer service; she just radiates hatred and animosity... Damn!

Fast food establishment....not here...SLOOOOOOWWWW. Terrible service. The tables are seldom clean. But it's always busy, so I guess the neighborhood doesn't mind the short comings that I experience here? Just goes to show you that there's a butt for every seat!

Thank you to Christie P. For taking our party of 29 gracefully and with ease!!! We came in and her and her team got all our orders correct and had great attitudes!! She was very professional and had such positive energy !!! I thought she was manager with the way she carried herself! Also her team deserves merit! : Raphael Famous, Le'ann B. , Amber , Juan, Dontrell, Brittany and Josh! Thank you guys!! We really appreciated your service !!

Best cinnamon twists I have ever had. So good. Best Taco Bell near Downtown Orlando. Lady working the drive thru was very nice and patient as well as very knowledgeable of their products. Will return to this location.

There is rushing an order to satisfy the customers appetite, and there is just rushing an order which I experienced this evening. I'm all about second chances, and even after my last experience at the Oltorf TB, when adjusting my order at the window by requesting "NO ONIONS" on our burritos, I was shocked when the attendant said they were already made. I gave a shocked face, to give a second to think about that one for second. "Do I force the customer to buy something he doesn't want?" A second past, as did I to the Golden Arches. C'mon TB Oltorf, please get it together.
Always horribly slow. Wait about 15 minutes every single time, even if there are only 3 cars in line.

I was in the neighborhood taking my mom to doctors appointments. We decided to go through the drive thru between appointments. I haven't been to this location in ages. I could see where turning into this drive thru could be challenging for some. The turn is quite tight. 

My mom and I ordered a few different items, supreme tacos, burrito supreme, taco salad, and a Mountain Dew. 

As we were waiting for the car in front of us, I see them had the driver a Baja Blast Mountain Dew. The driver handed it back. I literally said to my mom, I bet that's mine. And it's not a regular Mountain Dew. Sure enough. We get to the window, they tried to hand it to me. I said, no, I had a regular one. They took it back and gave us our food. They waited for us to leave. I'm like, ummmm....my drink? They looked at me confused and finally, reluctantly made me a regular one. 

Because of this, I totally forgot to ask for sauces and didn't realize until we got to the house. My thought was that they should have asked me if I wanted some. My mom said, oh, they never ask you at that location. I felt a bit spoiled considering the ones in my neighborhood always do. 

Our tacos were already soggy by the time we got there and fell apart. And my burrito supreme was sad. I had just had a really good one recently in Four Corners and craved another one. I don't know what the difference was because it's basically all the same ingredients, but I wouldn't get one again at this location.

Do you like having your order messed up every time? Then this is the place for you. 
Where's the 0 stars option?
Do NOT enter the drive through!  Slowest Taco Bell in history. I will never stop here again.
Unacceptably slow service. Not uncommon to spend 30-40 minutes in the drive through. It's literally faster to drive to the Taco Bell on MLK and Lombard. I won't be back.

I don't normally review fast food places, but I have to agree with every other review here. Every time I've been here it's been incredibly slow no matter the level of business. There's no sense of urgency at all by the staff. I came inside to order today because the drive thru was always very slow and I naively thought that going inside might be quicker. Staff was unprofessional, gossipy, and moving SO SLOWLY while making the food. I literally counted to ten while watching one guy wrapping up a taco. People were complaining about wrong food or the long wait and there were staff members on break at one of the tables laughing at the people complaining. Snapped this photo of one guy with his pants practically down around his knees. Then the food was wrong and incomplete. I don't understand it. Go to any other Taco Bell location instead. Avoid this one at all cost.

I am going to try and keep this from becoming a rant... bear with me. In case it does, here this: take out is fine, eating in not so much.

The food was fine, pretty much what I'd come to expect from Taco Bell (with one, fortunately good, exception). 

Cheesy Fiesta Potatoes were nice and hot! They'd spend no time sitting under a lamp. Chalupa Supreme with steak was fine too, everything in balance, from under a lamp as expected. What was a pleasant surprise was the steak. While they didn't overdo it, they hadn't at all skimped, and it actually had some flavor. My only minor critique is that it was wrapped a. It funny (off center) making it hard to hold without everything falling to the table.

I had no problems with service speed as it only took  a couple minutes; and I got what I ordered. 

Service politeness though could use some attitude adjustment. Person taking my order gave the distinct impression that she had better places to be (which is forgiven, I know that feeling). The person I assume was the shift leader though, her attitude was more acrimonious for lack of a better word. 

The location was tiny! Which ordinarily is fine, but there are a few caveats. There are no trays, which combined the the tables in need of some washing, everything that falls out on the table should be considered a sacrifice to the food gods. 

Also, if you're wondering how you can have Taco Bell and KFC under one room... both are owned by Yum! Brands (also owns Pizza Hut and WingStreet)
By far the worst taco Bell around. Still terribly slow. Staff is not managed well and not trained for efficiency. Not only slow, but consistently slow every time. Even when not busy.

I gotta give y'all credit for making the fattest Crunchwrap of my dreams come true tonight. 

You put your heart and soul into it and it shows.

Place isn't clean, people are lazy and rude . You'll be waiting in line for over 45 min with out having to even back out because of the way the drive threw is made. They didn't give me what I ordered witch I paid 20$ over called me a liar and decided to close early !!!! And told me to come back the next day I use to work at a Taco Bell ain't no way we would let people wait in line that long ! 7 minutes tops and food is out threw drive threw . Who ever is managing this locations needs to be fired and upgraded to new trained staff . I wouldn't be surprised is majority of these employees were smoking weed while on shift .

Ordered through drive through. Asked for 2 cinnamon twists and received one. Asked for mild sauce. Got none. Called to let them know they left off things on our order. "Sorry about that" was all said.

I go to this location a lot and usually Everytime i ask for extra meat I usually get it. I got charged for extra meat and I swear I got less than usual in my crunch wrap. My regular tacos were stale somehow and usually they are fresh. Not a great experience today.

This is by far the worst Taco Bell on planet earth.  I grew up in Quincy and have been disappointed by this location for almost 10 years now.  Terrible service and terrible food.  

The KFC is 50/50 but the Taco Bell is down right dangerous.  This place should be put out of business.  I don't understand why it's so bad.  It's not hard to make.

Slowest service in the history of the world. Here now. Been here for twenty minutes. Seen one bag of food go out. Four guys working. One standing at register not doing anything. One guy standing next to him doing nothing. Two others chatting while they slowly process the same order for the last several minutes. Boggles the mind.

This place is a shitshow! If you're looking for a quick bite with a lot of sass and no sense of customer service or quality "bush league" for a stoners appetite with watered down my dew, this is your place. You spend your dollar and get a pain in the ass, with the hopes that you'll eat your millennial shit pie and move along.
Taco Bell is the best restaurant of all time and if anyone says otherwise they r clearly high on meth!
Went there at 1 am. They had just taken someone's order but they left me to wait. When they came back they said they were closed - even though their hours are until 3 am.
TACOTASTROPHE..... I went to pick up this beautiful looking taco, and to my surprise the WHOLE bottom of the taco fell through. ARE YOU KIDDING ME TACO BELL?!?! I'm severely disappointed.

HANDS DOWN THE WORST TACO BELL IN ALL OF PORTLAND MAYBE IN THE U.S.!! I understand that it's Taco Bell and you can't expect certain things but going through the drive through tonight was possibly the most excruciating experience I've ever had at a fast food restaurant. We order our food same as always at the intercom and the whole time we are ordering the person continuously interrupts rudely saying "is that it?" "What else?", whoever was taking our order needs to be retrained on how to talk to people or have human interactions or just shouldn't even be put at the speaker. Anyway, the car in front of us is in the middle of getting their food and it is visibly clear that the order he received was wrong and about 10 minutes later he didn't receive his food and just drove off. We roll up to the window and the person in the window says the amount to an entirely different order and we say that's not our order, he asks what we ordered and we repeat our order, he repeats it back and it is wrong, we repeat it again, he repeats it back and again IT IS WRONG, WE REPEAT A THIRD TIME, HE REPEATS IT BACK AND IT IS WRONG(the whole time we are speaking to him he is rude, interruptive, impatient, and doesn't even seem to care what we are saying) so he storms off and someone else comes to the window asking for our order, we repeat it again AS CLEARLY AND LOUDLY AS POSSIBLE, they still don't comprehend what we are saying, and it's not like they don't speak or understand English because we can audibly hear them talking to each other in English, we ask to speak to a manager and the person says there is no manager at this time of night. We tell the person this is the worst Taco Bell and we decide not to eat there and drive 15 minutes up the road to another Taco Bell, which honestly everyone who drives to this Taco Bell should do, DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY, YOUR TIME, or any other form of attention to this Taco Bell. I wish I could give this place 0 stars or negative stars cause this was just plain awful. I've been to this Taco Bell before and they mess up every time granted I should have realized that rolling up to this Taco Bell but I was feeling optimistic so showed up there and I can say with complete confidence I will never choose this Taco Bell again and neither should anyone wanting Taco Bell, you will be disappointed beyond belief.

Went through the drive through which is always out the street, took about 20 minutes to get my crunch wrap supreme!! The inside is small for a combined joint of KFC and Taco Bell. Theres only 3 tables inside and can't hold more than about 12 people. Some of the staff are rude it just depends on which days you go i guess. Sometimes they burn my crunch wraps and the tacos fall apart!! I still really enjoy there food, but they need better service. (especially since covid)

Food and service was standard, like any of their other fast food chains. Cashier had mask on but was not covering their mouth/nose the entire time. However, he was wearing gloves and gave us the bag taped shut. Love their steak chalupas with lots of fire sauce

Never come to this Taco Bell past 3pm unless you wanna be in line forever! Once the day gets later they get slower with their service and the line gets way too backed up and they take their sweet time getting your order ready for you. Their customer service isn't that great and they get sloppy with their burritos past 5pm:(

Let me give you the rundown. I have been to this place several times, so I know what goes down.

If you are going to order inside, make sure to be there in the morning time. If you try to order inside in the evening/night time , you're pretty much screwed. The workers usually walk around everywhere but the registers to wait on people at night. I have watched this happen for the last couple times I have been there. A man in front of me (he was third in line by the way) waited for about seven minutes, and he then said out loud to the workers, "You DO realize that there are people in line, right?" and then there were two workers who went to the registers. Cool beans.

So then, I finally got to order my food. While the one guy scanned my card, and was waiting for my receipt, he was texting someone while on the job. I repeat. Texting. He handed me my receipt, and then waited another glorious 10 minutes for my food.

So, in review.
1. If you want to eat Taco Bell/KFC at this restaurant, and are ordering in, do it in the day time.
2. At night time, use the drive thru.
3. Don't go here.

Worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. We go there often, new to the area. EVERY single time we go something is wrong, never any sauce in the bag even if you ask 2 or 3 times. Still no sauce, I finally got tired of having my order wrong EVERY time, my family's tacos, the burritos, always wrong. I called, complained. The manager sent me a coupon for a free combo. So I go back today to get my free combo and guess what MY ORDER IS WRONG. After I repeated it not once but twice. I pull off and realize there's no f**king sauce either! How hard is it seriously?? I was the only person in the line! I walk inside and ask for sauce after standing there while everyone's laughing and having conversations and I'm just being stared at for 5-7 minutes. Same girl who was in the drive thru comes up asks me what I need, um??? the sauce I asked for 3 times! Gets a bag of sauce and tosses it at me. This is ridiculous! I've worked in fast food! This Taco Bell is the closest thing to our house but I'm done with this shithole and I'll never go back! If you hate your job so much find a new one! Damn!

Worst experience EVER!! A co-worker and I decided to grab nachos on our lunch break. We work overnight, so this is around 2am.  We pull up and ask of we can place two separate orders. The guy SIGHS LOUDLY and reluctantly says yes. My friend orders first. She asks for a Nacho Bell Grande, no beef, add shredded chicken. No problem paying extra. We don't have the menu memorized, and we don't frequent this place often. She then asks him if the nachos come in a combo. He replies, "Well yeah but you didn't ask for that!" I'm initially shocked. How rude! I tell her, "wow, he's pretty rude." He hears this and begins yelling at us through the loudspeaker, asking us if we have a problem! My friend says no, we just want to order. He proceeds to try to intimidate us and argue with us. We decide not to order and ask for a manager. He tells us he is the manager and his name is "Jim." I doubt that. We pull around to the window, he refuses to acknowledge us or even apologize for his foolishness. I will Never go there again, and I will be calling corporate.
I just called to say they got my order back and who ever is the manager of the shift right now was super rude . Very disappointed

Horrible customer service when I made the order who ever was taking the didn't even let me know that the didn't have the syrup for the drink I order and when I was about to say do you mind if I order other she just hand me the drink and closed the window, discourteous and I think a that she may not like us as Hispanic same as her but still you gotta treat every single customer good without defining them just by the race.

IS NOT ACTUALLY OPEN PAST 11PM. Went here at 11:15pm, it was not open. Paid an extra $5 just to have the Lyft add an extra route because I didn't want to be the drunk jerk who requests a TBell stop. We pull up and this place is completely closed. Lights off all outside but employees hanging out inside. Such a disappointment considering we were about to rage on the menu.
The Taco Bell is the worse bad ever worker said, "I don't work for postmates its not our job to handle it for you"  so the Taco Bell must be shut down immediately!

Less than average Taco Bell. I wanted to give it a 2 1/2 but that isn't an option. The location doesn't seem very clean, the service is lackluster and less to be desired. The food is below average as well here for a Taco Bell. If you're looking for a taco or something along the lines of Taco Bell items... go down the road to Chipotle for an all around better experience and food.

Oh, Taco Bell. I get nostalgic when I come here. It reminds me of late nights, a youthful metabolism, and extreme hangovers. This particular Taco Bell is very conveniently located in the Sodo Plaza. The building is new and the parking lot looked very clean. We went through the drive thru. It was kind of hard to get into the drive thru line, but the drive thru attendant was very nice and patiently listened to us debate the relative merits of Captain Crunch donuts vs cinnamon twists. Spoiler alert: my husband got both. I got a diet Pepsi (Happy hour from 2-5!), but I have to admit that I was very jealous watching him eat the artificially colored and flavored calorie bomb. 

Overall, this is a solid Taco Bell location.

I rather drink bleach than  go to this Taco Bell location they always messed up my order and one time the meat was not fully cooked it was still a little raw.. not too long ago I went to the drive thru I had a somewhat big order and I don't live that far from it maybe 8 mins to get home but all the food was  literally cold .

The sign on the door says that it opens at 7am. I arrived here at 7:55am and both doors were locked. I could see workers inside serving people through the drive through. My work truck is too big for the drive through so I have no choice but to order inside. 
This isn't the first time this has happened. All I want is for you to put up a sign stating that you will not be open at your usual time or something like that. That will save people some time.

There is no dollar menu. They also skimp on the toppings. I got a chicken quesadilla too and they used the wrong type of chicken. Bought multiple things and they didn't label them. Also one of the new people wasn't wearing gloves. Disappointed I won't go again though. They also forgot some of the sauces on my burritos.

Terrible design trying to supplement a self serve kiosk for actual employees. Kiosk has never worked and only creates longer wait times & confusion amongst patrons. Who thought ordering fast food needed to be this time consuming & complicated?

First and last time going here.  Was one of the of only 4 customers in there.  Didn't get my receipt, missing 2 of my items, one of the items was missing their "meat".  Its not rocket science, its Taco Bell.  No reason to return.  I'd advise others to not even try.

How do you run out of nachos and mild sauce?! That's like McDonald's running out of fries! When we finally did get our food, it was barely warm. Glad we didn't get it to go because it would've been ice cold by the time we got it home. Highly disappointed!!! I know what I'm getting food wise. Not expecting anything fancy, just hot and available.
Had a mobile order for this location but the app had it in Clackamas.  They were quick to help to get it corrected.  Thank you!

Awful! Just awful, I pay for extra sauce and they never put it on the quesadilla. They always end up doing the opposite and putting no sauce.

I always request no beans. I go home open my meal and there's always beans on the food and I can't eat it. 

It's so not fair I get charged for extra shit and don't get it, or I request for no beans specially and when i go to check at the drive thru window I always feel uncomfortable and rushed. 

I just wanna say fuck you to all you shitty fast food workers out there. I work hard all day and I look forward to a good meal when I get home. It's so wrong this happens 90% of the time at every restaurant. People just suck. 


***Check out this burnt quesadilla with no jalapeño sauce on it. And I payed for extra.

Mouse is an exceptional young lady! It was totally our first time nervously rolling up to Taco Bell! Mouse did an excellent job at providing an accurate description of all the menu items. She from the classic Doritos locos tacos to the new freezers, she even gave us her own personal recommendations as she saw fit for our situation.  

Never have I ever experienced such positive,speedy,and quality service at any other restaurant chain in all of the US! 

Mouse is an intelligent, friendly, and professional human being. As a minority female myself, it's amazing, to see such positive attitude and strength in a work environment during these trivial times. 

Masks were worn, food was fast, customized drinks and sauces were whipped up! And wham bam we had a great meal for the fam!

This location is one of the worst. Came in & ordered 4 items. It looked like there were enough workers to handle the drive-thru plus the counter; however, we waited over 20 minutes for our order. Looking back into the kitchen area I saw a male worker with his pants so low his underwear was showing, when he bent over I saw his ass crack. He then proceeded to pull up his pants with his gloved hand & continue to prepare food. We were offered a drink for our wait, but by that time I was ready to ask for our money back. The place could use a good cleaning as well. Very disgusted.

The machine I had to learn to order was annoying I am old fashion and I want to ask questions. The food was good other than the eggs I had removed from the potatoes in the scrambled. I was impressed by the cleanliness and organization. All of the items were well stocked and neatly organized.

Update, they MUST be under new management. Been twice recently and order was correct, employee was nice, AND food came out incredibly fast and accurate. It's like a 180 degree difference I am glad to say. Time will tell I suppose. Another update, I have been multiple times now and they are CONSISTANTLY GOOD!! Even ordered grubhub and my order was spot on and super fast. They have finally fixed this Taco Bell. 
yay!

In comparison to OTHER Taco Bell's, this is on the bad end. Slow not-so-friendly service, food is sloppy and very inconsistent, often are missing ingredients. Wish ownership would help at least get them on par with other locations.

There was a mess of people as soon as you walk in, the soda area was all messy, the wait for food was long to the point where some people just got up and left, there was a bad smell emanating in the dining area, and some of the staff were unhygienic. I noticed some touching and scratching their face and didn't change their gloves. One of the staff members stepped out the the food prep area and began closing and locking the doors and went back to handle and prep food with the same gloves he had used to lock the doors . Safe to say I will not be coming back to this Taco Bell again.

8 out of 10 times my experiences with this Taco Bell are good; my order is correct, it's cheap and the service is above the "I'm checked out mentally and emotionally" attitude you see with fast food establishments. However, the other two times are some of the most soul sucking wait times I have ever experienced with a drive thru. 

Twice in the past two months, my wife and I came to the Bell starving, expecting fast and efficient service (hence fast food). What we got was wait times that rival the DMV. One time was forty minutes. Forty minutes! I got my license renewed in less time than that. I could have gone home, prepared a simple meal, ate it and returned. But no, we had a car behind us and they don't have an escape lane, so we were stuck. 

Finally, we get our food with no apology or acknowledgement, and filled out the survey that they have on the back of the receipts. Not happy. And the odds are not worth it for subpar pseudo Mexican food.

Is it possible to rate zero stars? I've been sitting in this drive thru line for almost an hour now and still three cars away from the window. This is officially the longest I've ever been stuck in line for "fast food." I'm going to need gas soon. It's taking all my strength to not fill this review with curse words right now. Never go here. Avoid at all costs.

This place has horrendous service. The speaker at the drive-through was very static he and even worse the workers could not speak English. My crunch wrap supreme was not made to my liking as it was not fully grow pressed and it looked disgusting. It was cold and I found a hair in it! I will never go here again!

So they have a new self serve kiosk, if you use it MAKE SURE TO GET A RECEIPT, we ordered one crunch wrap meal and one chalupa cravings box and a chicken quesadilla at 7:55 on the kiosk and selected no receipt, and we know this place is slow constant 15min wait minimum. Waited until about 8:20, one cashier was taking orders, other people who ordered a head of us were upset and some others received wrong orders and lashed out at the other associates, i saw a gentlemen who ordered on kiosk get his order an leave. Never heard the order name get called out i was sitting about 8ft away in a silent lobby. I went up to the counter just to see how long the wait was going to be, one of the line members said "for who?" In a panicked manner, i said the name it was under "Hanora" which is pretty obvious one to call out,and he just shouted back "you mean the wrong guy took that, well what do you want me about it?gonna have to go track down the guy who took it. Do you have the receipt?" We explained, "No, we just used the kiosk and had selected no receipt." Same line member in a huff "well i dont know what we can do then?!" Cashier came over and both of them retook our order and got it wrong bit were adamant that it was right even though we showed the price difference between it and what we got charge on our card. At this point i just said "ok, that will be fine." They said they would get right on it." Waited another 35 minutes for our food. Would of been 3 star but then we got undeserved attitude from the line member and no real apology for any of it.

Not clean at all. Appears to be more filthy then a third world country. Everyone even customers speak Spanish except one person that took my order. I almost walked out but didn't. Wish I did now. I waited while 5 other customers before got their food. I get my order no have a nice day no nothing she just said my name and threw it on the counter. No napkins or sauce fork nothing. I ordered the Mexican pizza combo to go. Pictures below. I assume it's Mexican pizza sauce on the outside and inside of the carry out bag? You guys look and make your own mind up. What this bag and food looks like it what the inside of this establishments walls and floors looked like. I personally didn't see them drop my food on the ground but it sure the heck looks like it. I had to give one star to write this. I take that star back. Good luck and may God have mercy on you if you  eat here.

Despite the Portland city ordinance that was passed in May, this Taco Bell refuses to serve pedestrians on bikes after they close their doors. Even if you pay through the app online. Not everyone has a car, hence the ord
Currently sitting in line for the drive through at 10:30pm. I've been here already for a half an hour and I'm only half way through... come on. What are they even doing back there?

Will check back this location, I cant put my finger though on why the food turnaround times so high.

The wait can be very long, upward to 30 minutes last time was there!  I went there one more time thinking that there arent that many people...nope instead they said they couldnt take orders until in 20 minutes saying "computers are down".  I just walked out.

Never, ever, ever again.  What an absolute mess. After trying to place a large order at the kiosk they cut power to it right as I was paying.  They told me the order "didn't go through".  The manager wouldn't talk to me because they were busy.  No one would help me and I left just thinking that was the last time I would step foot in there.  The next thing I know, there is a charge for the entire order I didn't receive on my credit card.  I went back there and again no one could help me and told me to contact my credit card company.  I'm still waiting on the outcome from that.

I was excited about Taco Bell opening at this location. It is a welcome addition to food options. Sadly how it is run is very disappointing. 

In the location itself you will find slow service and rude service. If you try to order delivery, they do not have the correct open hours set on Grubhub, so it will always show as being closed even at 4pm during the week. When you try to call the store, the phone is always off the hook. 

The employees do not care about your business. I wonder if the owner cares themselves since this has been open for three months without improvement.

This is hands down the worst Taco Bell in the US. This place should be shut down for ever! The quality of the food is not even good for the pigs. They can't expect me to go back there ever. I ask all who have some common sense and do care what we put in our body to please stay away from this hell hole. And it's not cheap anymore we pay a good dollar for the crap they try to serve us. 
Sunday July 7th. They the microphone only works when the staff likes it, then they tell us that they ran out of tortillas, and because they understand what embarrassment is, they try not be to clear when they take the order, but what really bothered me the most is they made us wait for more than usual and in the end served us a soggy bag that contained what looked like yesterday's taco inside. It looked like puke !! Lastly the whole staff is just plain fucking rude. Never ever!! This place is the Latrine of a restaurant. Alfredo
It's a taco bell, enough said. . . .
This is the slowest Taco Bell I have ever been too. Totally disorganized and not that busy. No clue how it takes 15 minutes to get a no 1 combo.

Horrible service! There were like 6 other walk in customer waiting for their order for over 20mins! Seems like they were serving all the drive thru first even when they ordered after. That ain't no damn fast food. After I complained, they gave me a free cinnamon twist but then this rude worker tossed my food on the counter. I had to tell her not to throw my food. Girl didn't even apologize. Never again!
I was in a rush and I placed a mobile order and came for a pick up, they forgot my drink AND sauces, I had to drive back and ask for it again

The guy taking my order was a complete jerk. I tried to order a bean & cheese burrito w/ xtra cheese (order this about monthly for years). Him: "so just beans and cheese". Me: "normal + xtra cheese". Him: "we don't have a normal bean & cheese burrito". Me: "since when?" Him: (silence). Me: "I want a bean & cheese burrito with the normal red sauce & onions but w/ xtra cheese". Him (very sarcastically): "You just have to tell us what you want on it hon. We just have a bean burrito, not a bean & cheese burrito". He called me "hon" on top of being a royal jerk. I gave him some expletives, then drive off. I'll never go back there again. I know the company doesn't care, but to anyone considering this location, especially a female, just know you may also be subjected to a side of misogynistic sarcasm by an idiot that felt the need to go on a condescending diatribe rather than just ring in an obvious order.

I never leave bad reviews. Literally ever. Only positive ones. But this Taco Bell is a complete joke. It doesn't matter the time or day I go. They are always closed. No warning signs. No nothing. But their lights are drive thru open sign are always on. I honestly think they just all get together and milk the clock and do nothing. I'm surprised corporate doesn't see it in their sales with how much money they do not make at that location. I would shut it down if I owned it. Always closed anyway. The one off tussing is way better and always open during business hours.

If I could rate lower I would. Not sure what the deal is but it just seems like this place used to be at least ok a few years ago for a fast food drive through. Just waited over 40 minutes in the drive through. And there weren't many customers there other than those stuck in the drive through. And the last few times have been closer to 30 and they forgot things on my order. I don't know if they just need to fire everyone who works there and start with a new team or do the neighborhood a favor and tear it down and put something worth while in. Disappointed to see.
We just went through the drive through at 9:15pm and there are rats all over the parking lot and drive through lane, hope there's not a problem inside the restaurant...

I love all Taco Bell and I get off work really late around 2-3am and this is my spot to go. Today I went and they said they were closed?!!! It was about 3:20am and online they said they close at 4am! I have been here multiple times at this hour and have gotten my food. So don't know if it's new hours but I am really unhappy. :(
hated it. taco was horrible and burrito was so bad. i suggest do not i mean do not go here at all!

Went through drive-thru last night at 7pm.  5 cars in front of me.  Only 3 cars in the parking lot. . No one at the order intercom.  I figure it must be dead and that is why it is taking so long.  People must be giving orders at the window.  I get to the main window, I kid you not, 52 MINUTES LATER! Because of the way the drive-thru is designed, you can't go around or get out of line.  At the window, the lady says, "That will be $3.79." I didn't order anything!  I tell her they need to let people know if it's going to be an hour wait.  She responded, "Well there are a lot of people, I'm sorry" in a snide voice.  Are you kidding me!  A total of 8 customers is "a lot of people?!". Never again.

this 10/10 5/5 stars restaurant wooed me into the Mexican culture . taco bell is in my top 5 favorite restaurante (restaurant in Spanish haha) of all time. the crunch of the taco shell really floats my boat. the crisp juicy taste of the mountain dew baja blast gets me every time. it a big thirst quencher. i would consider myself a taco bell regular and the staff‍‍is superb and beyond compare to any other restaurant in the world.  i don't think i would be the same person i am today if it wasn't for taco bell . it changed my life in ways i can't imagine. My go to is a beef 5 layer burrito (with no sour cream of course ) Another amazing cuisine selection is the diritos locos tacos (my favorite is cool ranch btw ) i hope this review changed your life like taco bell changed mine. Thank you for reading.
Worst Taco Bell ever! I specifically said no Cheese in any Item! Yet they did it twice & refuse to give my money back! I walked out in anger. Terrible establishment!

Taco Bell stole my money. I ordered online to pick up breakfast at 9:15am, 15 minutes after opening, and the door was locked. After 10 minutes someone finally came to the door and told me "we don't have any food" and "this place is a mess in here". I asked when I can get my food and she said "You can't. You should figure out how to get a refund" and then she closed the door in my face. About 40 minutes later I get a text that my food is ready so I went back down. The door was locked and they just shooed me away from the door without opening it. I don't know who the franchise owner is, but they are doing a terrible job. I emailed Taco Bell. I better get my money back.

THE WORST! I went through the drive thru and while I was ordering I had to keep repeating myself and when the person repeated my order which I made sure it was correct and it was, she told me to drive up. when I got to the register to pay for my food they messed up all my order! whatever I wasn't going to make it a big deal but I brought it to their attention in the nicest way possible and I was willing to pay extra for what I wanted to add on. The guy had the audacity to tell me that They were missing some things from my order cause I didn't order it....?? Like does that make any sense?! I know what I said and I know for sure what I ordered AND she repeated the order back to me. Anyways, I asked if he can make it and I'll just pay extra and he says " you have to go back in line and order". I was so pissed like it wasn't like they were super busy but even if they were is that how you treat ur customers?!? Miscommunication happens so I completely understand but he was so rude about it honestly no need for that! You need to check ur workers cause clearly they need more tips on how to provide good customer service.

This place is a joke. They call it fast-food for a reason but clearly these people are unaware. First of all. I waited 10 minutes inline because the cashier decided to have a little meet-up with her teenage friends that stopped in to say hello. She took her time and when it came time to ring them up, she didn't even charge them for their drinks because they told her "we don't have money". Meanwhile she's doing this all in front of her manager. The manager was walking around screaming at her staff as well as continuing to talk across the restaurant to them in the eating area which was very disrespectful to people trying to hear their orders / enjoy their time eating. The service was so incredibly slow. There were 5 people in the food prep line but they all seemed to be taking their times and not focusing at all. Don't even use the mobile order kiosk. I saw people put an order in before me and they still didn't get their food by the time I got mine. It seems like that isn't even efficient and only one works at the moment. The layout is obnoxious there's no room to wait for your order / in line since the food prep station is awkwardly in front of the store. I won't be going back. Not to mention my tacos were soggy and not that warm when I got them. But I guess that's crappy customer service for ya.

I've never eaten Taco Bell before so I decided that today is the day. Delivered through Uber Eats. I pretty much just ordered a few items of value menu because I figured it was a good place to start. Did I think it was going to be real Mexican food? No, not at all so I wasn't too disappointed with the taste. Here's my thoughts...

Shredded Chicken Burrito- I've had better but I've also had worse. Not a ton of flavor and pretty skimpy with the chicken. I'd suggest adding extra. Definitely the smallest burrito I ever had but a good value for the price. Might buy again someday.

Doritos Taco Locos- Hated this and it went into the trash can after two bites. The worst hard shell Taco I've ever tried. The entire bottom stuck to the paper and stayed there when I removed the taco. Didn't taste like Doritos to me. Would never order this again.

Shredded Chicken Quesadilla Melt- Probably my favorite of the food items. A small but good Quesadilla that was nicely done. Would definitely get again. 

Seasoned Rice- I've had better from a package. Seriously. It was undercooked, a lot of hard pieces of rice in there. Had no flavor even after I added two packets of their mild sauce. A big pass for me. 

Chips and Cheese- Good, no complaints. Too bad these are being taken off the menu soon because I would have gotten them again. 

Cinnabites- I was actually kind of disappointed by these. Everyone had hyped them up so much I was expecting my mind to be blown. It wasn't. They were good but not hype worthy. Probably will order again.

This place is just a disaster from start to finish. Staff who are rude and slow that consistently screw up orders. The place is hardly ever clean. They never have napkins and you have to ask for a fork. And they always run out of chicken and have you wait forever til the next batch is finally cooked.
Remodeled the outside but now it's basically just a more visually pleasing place to go and get your order messed up
Says open until 4- I'm watching teens instead not answering the phone or acting like the drive thru is open- it's an ghoul before they close.
Longest wait I've ever experienced in a fast food line. They have serious issues with management and work force. Unbearable!!!!

The worst place next to hell !!!!! You will be waiting 30 mins for food !!! They have new employees every week !!!  The inside stinks !!! The drink machine is always out !!! Like eat anywhere other than here. The workers look like they all just got out of prison !!!

Always the slowest Taco Bell. Do not go inside or you will wait a long time for your food. I used the little kiosk to order my food. Waited 15 minutes. I asked to speak to a manager about how I "tell the bell" about my experience (because I didn't get a receipt which normally has all the info on the back). The manager refused to give me her name because I was going to leave a bad review. I asked for my money back. She wouldn't do that either because it was a kiosk order. WTF?! She told me I'm gonna have to contact my bank to get my money back. The nameless manager then walked away from me leaving me helpless and without even an apology. I said "excuse me I'd like your general managers name" probably 10 times at the top of my lungs before the girl making tacos walked over and told me. I would drive farther to another Taco Bell.

So I just got the best slushy of my life I ordered altogether way too much food from this Taco Bell location both of the people working inside were super polite and pleasant and I couldn't be more happy with my Taco Bell experience yes I am leaving a review for the Taco Bell in Cocoa Florida awesome superb job guys can't wait to see you again - Wyatt

I literally never ever post poor reviews and especially about the beloved tbell, but I get off work around 10-11pm most nights and pull up to the drive thru and I just end up sitting there for 5-10mins before finally driving away. I can see workers inside and their cars in the parking lot. Tonight they are said to close at 2am online, my boyfriend just ran out to grab us some and they're closed already? It's only midnight...
This blows bc the second closest tbell is like 10-15 minutes away... ):
Please somehow fix this!! You guys would get so much more business if you operated during your stated hours online. This location use to be THRIVING. Idk what happened :/

This location is near my office so I went by for lunch today. Why? Nacho fries. I don't know what it is but I just love them. Customer Service at this location was ok. Not rude but not super friendly either. The drive thru lane is on the scary side. Very narrow and a sharp turn that seems to border on dangerous. In addition to the nacho fries I also ordered the Doritos locos combination. Everything was fine. Nothing bad, nothing especially great either. I had to wait around 5 minutes for the car in front of me but I don't know if it's because of what they ordered or the location. Overall it was a decent experience.

Worst Taco Bell, went in the drive thru and only had 2 meal order. The person that was taking the order was terrible, she obviously didn't want to work. First order the chalupa box and the second order is the 2 chicken chalupa meal I asked her to change the chicken to beef I'm pregnant and I can't eat chicken well I repeated my order 3 times and she tells me that on the screen it shows chicken but we are gonna change it to beef. So I pulled up and my first mistake was not actually checking the chalupas got home and it was all chicken. I live about 30 mins away from this Taco Bell which is the closest one to my house. I called the place 5 times no answer. Literally never again. I don't recommend unless you want them just to take your money and have them give you whatever they want to give you.
