While I LOVE Taco Bell, like I go out of my way to find one AND I'm a native Bostonian so I KNOW the Downtown Crossing "vibe", this place was a mess. Not cleanliness wise, because the restaurant was very clean, but management a employee wise. The manger was yelling at everybody including the Uber Eats guy, sent two people home, and the registers (both live and self service) were down. It was only laughable because I was one of the last few to get my order in before the manger closed the registers and started turning people away, it was only 6:45pm and the restaurant is open until 12. PLEASE don't take my Taco Bell away, but y'all also need a more efficient manager and a team that doesn't stand around confused because they aren't being managed. Lastly while I do not think it's fair that women have to smile or be nice to come across as pleasant, THIS manager was actually just mean and not professional at all. Granted not a 5 star restaurant, I get it, it's Taco Bell, but geez.

This is hands-down one of the worst fast food locations I've ever experienced. We have been going there for years since it's close to where we live, but never again.

The drive thru line is the kind where you are literally trapped from ordering to exit. This wouldn't be a big deal except several times we've had weirdos walk up to our car and act crazy, OR the 10+ times we've went to order and they tell us either 1) their ordering system is down so we are stuck in line behind people that placed their order, or 2) they close earlier than their advertised hours. They close early All. The. Time. Multiple times we have arrived 15 minutes before closing and they tell us it's too late to take our order so we get stuck in line half an hour for nothing.

The food is always cold. Always. I have never had anything beyond lukewarm from this location.

Tonight was the last straw. Once again their ordering system was down and had to wait in line for nothing. But hey, we got to watch one of the employees with a headset smoking at the drive thru exit!

It's fast food so normally I wouldn't bother, but holy hell this place is a special kind of terrible.

Went to this locations drive thru around 9pm on a friday.  It was a woman taking the order, she gave me a total without asking me if that's all so I said I want to add cinnamon twists and she said I had to go around again if I wanted to place another order. I told her no I don't want another order, I want it on the same order. She said ok whatever with an attitude. I pulled up to the window and she still had an attitude. So I asked her, why are you being so rude when I'm being nice, she said if you have a problem with my attitude you can call the GM on Monday. Well anyways I got my food, got home and idk if they were running out of food or what because my "power bowl" was mostly lettuce. I am not exaggerating when I say there was maybe 2 tablespoons of beans and 3 of rice in this bowl. Then my crunch wrap was just a smear of black beans. Worst service and food.

All the employees were yelling and swearing at each other in anger while the women at the register was yelling at customers and swore at me when I responded to the wrong name called by accident. You guys might want to check in on this location because this place is off the rails. Won't be back here. Trust me.. It's a Taco Bell, there is no reason to try to act superior to customers when you are working the register.. so relax.

The female cashier needs to talk louder when talking to the guest placing a order and not be so rude when we can't hear her because she is barely opening her mouth. The food was hot, served fast and was given a good portion. This is one of best Taco Bell in Columbus as far as the food.

I've been here a few times during Covid Times while dogsitting nearby. The drive through line is always long at dinner time (I'm not sure if the dining room is open or not) but the person taking the order is always pleasant. I can hear the smile in the voice.

Sometimes the card reader is presented to me and other times the person will take the card from me and run it through. Always, always, the food is placed into a plastic tray for me to retrieve. Drinks are handed to me.

I haven't had any issues with this location in the past few months.

Absolute dirt employees, my orders been wrong the last 3 times I went. Bs management and bs hiring. Really, I don't need an after school  program spitting in my food and fucking up Everytime I go in; there's mcDs and  Arby's around the corner who don't hire assholes like here

This is one of the better Taco Bells around the area that I stay in. The few times I've been inside, it has been cleaned and they have done some updating so it looks nice. The staff has been very kind and attentive to any needs or mistakes in food. I tend to go through the drive through a bit more and yes there are lines at times. If your going between the hours of 1130-130, you might see a line. Its call an lunch rush and the same for dinner. You expect it. Regardless of it being a fast food restaurant, they do get slammed at times. Get over it! 

Other than that, my food has always been made to how I need it. I like extra red sauce on my bean burritos and this is one of the only Taco Bells that actually do it! Never had any problems with my food or major mistakes that have upset me. It seems as if they might have had new management, so the service level has increase in general.

I visited my neighborhood Taco Bell today in the midst of the COVID-19 pandemic & was pleased with their updated social distancing policies, swiftness & accuracy in preparing my vegan order, & the overall cleanliness of the store. While this location is usually open from 7 a.m. until 2 a.m., they're currently operating their drive-thru from 8 a.m. until 12 a.m. with the lobby open for takeout only from 10 a.m. until 5 p.m. I was the only person inside at the time of my order, & was able to order & pay completely via an automated screen quite a bit away from the employees & their kitchen. They have also placed tape down to indicate proper distances between customers when there are multiple people inside. As someone who doesn't drive & is looking to avoid continuously paying delivery fees, I appreciate having the lobby takeout option, as well as the option to order & checkout without any verbal interaction taking place. As an additional bonus, this location has yet to include meat or dairy in any of my vegan orders & I've visited, albeit occasionally, since 2013. Today, I had my two fresco bean burritos & one fresco seven layer burrito (for a grand total of $6.27) & was on my way home in roughly five minutes--which is exactly the scenario I'm hoping for when I'm in the mood for fast food. I'll visit again soon!

As someone who used to work at Taco Bell and was proud of the product and service I provided this location could use some staff retraining. Staff demeanor was that of emotionless, unhappy robots. It's quite sad, it was apparent there was no communication or a firm leadership. The food was sub par. I ordered a number 4 which comprised of a quesarito meal. And a Crunchwrap on the side. By the looks of the photo, my Crunchwrap had very very very little meat. The taco shell was broken. The wrapping of the product was done lazily, there were visible stains on the wrapper from the product falling out. You don't have to like your job, but if you chose to work at a job and continue working at a job at least pretend to give a dam for what the job stands for and what you stand for also. Just some advice.

We ordered 4 crunchy tacos and that is all we got in the bag. They shorted us on our change but we was already down the road a ways. They gave us no napkins. Did not ask if we wanted hot sauce. The taco shells were all cracked. Upon eating we found rotted lettuce in the tacos and very little meat. NEVER GO THERE!

I don't expect much from Taco Bell, but I believe this location is actually passing off garbage as food. About once per year I make a poor decision to grab food from this dump, and I always immediately regret it. Last night was no exception. Burrito was ICE Cold, and it tasted tinny, like an ingredient had turned. Threw everything away after one bite. Still scratching my head at how a burrito could be that cold. It's like they took the sour cream out of the freezer and added it to the burrito. Either the staff there doesn't know how to make food correctly, or they just don't care. Either way, it's crap.

The employees at this new Taco Bell are extremely friendly and very good at their jobs. The food is adequate, typical Taco Bell fare. The management often puts a little surprise in my bag since they see me so often on lunch! Also, they make a great steak quesarito.

If I could give this Taco Bell zero stars, I would. Tonight we waited an hour in line (there were only about 8 cars in front of us) and the pineapple whip freeze machine was not working??? And then they didn't give me the correct food--I ordered a beef quesadilla and they gave me a bean burrito. Thanks for wasting an hour of my night.

I ordered extra chicken and cheese with my Chipotle Chicken Melts. It wasn't as much as I was expecting, based off previous experiences. That being said the quality was great. The chicken was moist and the cheese was melted well.

Absolutely Horrible Service!!! 
No matter how many times I ask for NO ONIONS!!!! 
Even having them read it back to me and it saying plain as day on my receipt No Onions they get me everytime. 
It's annoying to get home after waiting 20 mins for them to even fill the order to find out it's wrong. Like here's my money give me what I specifically asked not for. Lol
Dumbest Taco Bell I  Austin. Where do they find these people???
Gone there multiple times and they always forget one item I order...but I sure get charged for it. Make sure you check your bag before you take off, lost over $10 so far.

It's interesting to note that all of the Taco Bell's are moving to touchscreen self-service ordering. I quite appreciate this since it ensures that my order is entered properly. Still - for a fast food establishment - the food wasn't prepared particularly quickly (surprising since it wasn't terribly busy) and there was confusion about what actually went into our bag. 

That being said - the tacos were all made properly and had the familiar Taco Bell taste. We know it's really all about the hot sauce.

This is probably the worst Taco Bell I have ever encountered. Each experience has been paired with an unnecessarily long wait, incorrect or misplaced orders as well as rude and unhelpful staff members. After waiting 45 minutes for one taco I was gifted a "free taco of your choice." A few weeks later I went in to redeem my coupon and was told I am unable to use it on anything but a hard taco. No where is that written on the coupon nor was the miscommunication properly taken care of. The cashier answered my inquiry with a "nice try" and an overall rude demeanor. Safe to say as much as I enjoy Taco Bell I will not be returning to this location but I hope the homeless person I gifted my free taco to enjoys it!

They were some bitches.  Open but they didn't give us taocs. The old chick was extremely rude... they couldn't accept any payments after we ordered. Told us to pull up and turned us away. We just wanted 10 soft tacos.. we drove 14 minutes to the next Taco Bell

this is by far the worst taco bell, and in fact worst restaurant i've ever had the displeasure of ordering from. just about every single time i've ordered from here i either don't get my order, or it's made wrong. recently, my order was made wrong so i asked if i could get new one. no sweat. after waiting 30 minutes, i asked again if they were making them. the server acted surprised that my re order existed, and gave me my order eventually. i checked the order when he gave it to me, and guess what. the same mistake, again. i set down the food and left. on my way out someone stopped me and told me they were writing a corporate complaint and took my information to add to it. obviously nothing has been done about this and this is still possibly the worst taco bell in existence. do NOT come here. go to a different taco bell at least, even if it's a half hour away i guarantee you you will get your food faster.

I ordered everything vegan (fresco style, subbed meat with beans). They even asked if I wanted black or their regular beans. 

They got my whole order correct. They didn't even skimp on the Crunchwrap. They were super fast with my order as well.

I usually get Taco Bell when traveling and many have a hard time with my order and still put cheese on it or forget to sub beans. This location did everything right.

Ghetto people working late night. Rude as ever. Cussing me out over $2.50. Maybe if you did your job right the first time and gave it to me I wouldn't have had to interrupt your group cigarette break.

Dirty tables,chairs. No customers. Ordered supreme crunch wrap,no chicken. $3.98 for mostly lettuce on a pita? Never again. Employees just staying around talking. Came to the counter to show my food,and to ask about chicken,no one cared. Never again.

I would give this location a negative star if i could. I ate here in 2006 and got such bad food poisoning from this restaurant i ended up hospitalized. I haven't had any taco bell since having food at this location.
Idk what these are supposed to be but these are not the mini quesadillas we used to get. It's bread and cheese!!!! Wtf?!

This is hands down the worst Taco Bell in the US. This place should be shut down for ever! The quality of the food is not even good for the pigs. They can't expect me to go back there ever. I ask all who have some common sense and do care what we put in our body to please stay away from this hell hole. And it's not cheap anymore we pay a good dollar for the crap they try to serve us. 
Sunday July 7th. They the microphone only works when the staff likes it, then they tell us that they ran out of tortillas, and because they understand what embarrassment is, they try not be to clear when they take the order, but what really bothered me the most is they made us wait for more than usual and in the end served us a soggy bag that contained what looked like yesterday's taco inside. It looked like puke !! Lastly the whole staff is just plain fucking rude. Never ever!! This place is the Latrine of a restaurant. Alfredo

This Taco Bell opened just under a month ago and it would seem they're still in their growing pains phase. I've gone exactly once a week for three weeks and every time I went, there were problems.

For starters, the design of the area for what goes where is just a disaster. Granted, they probably don't have a lot of room to work with, so I'm trying not to criticize this too much, but the prep area is enormous and is right smack dab in the middle of the "restaurant," which forces waiting customers to bottleneck themselves to the left if they're waiting in line. 

Not a huge deal, but they also put a self-serve screen kiosk in the middle of the action as well, so you have clusters of people waiting for their food, clusters of people waiting to use the self-service kiosk, and a jumbled line of people waiting in the main line to order... and we're ALL in each other's way.

And because they're still a fairly new presence in this part of Boston, it's packed with customers.  So, imagine how awesome it was this past Monday (October 7, 2019) when their A/C wasn't working, the place is packed (again) and their soda machine isn't working, leaving customers to get either a bottle of water, a Diet Pepsi, or a slushie. 

I went with the Diet Pepsi, which they gave to me in a can... and there was a small lump of frozen slush at the bottom of my can of Diet Pepsi, leaving ME to believe perhaps they accidentally re-routed all the cold from the A/C to whatever fridge is keeping these cans cold.  Again, not a huge deal in and of itself, but when you consider the size of the cups they give you when you order a numbered value meal, one can of Diet Pepsi would fill about HALF of one of those cups, so when I went to get a second can later in my meal, the cashier charged me like $2.75 for it when she should have just given it to me free of charge.

After all, it's not MY fault your soda machine broke down less than a month in... and when I got THAT can, about half of THAT was filled with frozen slush.  That was my most recent visit. The visit before that, the self-serve kiosk was out of order and they were severely understaffed so they were getting slammed. The woman who I'm guessing was the manager was helping the other two folks get the food ready, but one of the customers in front of me started complaining about the wait. The manager wasn't rude to her, but it was pretty clear she just did NOT give a crap that they were crawling through food orders. 

Lastly, of the three times I've gone there, they've managed to screw up my order twice. The first time, they forgot the crunchy taco that accompanies the quesadilla meal and the second time, they put sour cream in my 5-layer beef burrito after I very politely and clearly asked the cashier to please omit the sour cream. 

They're very close to where I work so I won't give up on them yet, and I know they're all still very new, but good grief, they really gotta get their sh*t together. Maybe get a handful of stellar Taco Bell employees from other locations to temporarily commute to their 76 Summer Street location to get the newbs shaped up and flying right as a sort of hands-on training process?

This taco bell actually sucks. I'm sitting in it right now waiting on food and I have been for 45 minutes. If I hadn't paid, then I would've left. The workers are lazy and are standing around joking when there's 20+ people waiting on food. I wish they had the managers name posted so I could call and report these employees. Also, they have a machine spilling water and other fluids all over the food prep area

Says they open at 7am for dine in. Get there doors locked an employee pops out from the back and looks at me a turns around walks away so I left an went to McDonald's instead. I don't know why it's so hard to open on time. But hey they need 15 a hour.
Shorted on order, getting dark asked if this was everything. Got a snippy yes six items. Couldn't tell in car. Got home and only 5 items, most expensive missing

Terrible management. I went for lunch yesterday. The lines were insane. The manager was on the register. There were 2 other women working. They were standing by the front door. One tried to jump on the second register and the manager sent her back to stand around. The need someone who has actually managed a fast food place before. 

I got my food after about 20 minutes. It was fine.

I can understand why this Taco Bell only has a one and a half star . it's not even deserving of star! I had to give it one so I could write and submit this review.We only ordered six crunchy tacos, a beef burrito supreme without sour cream and a steak burrito. We got six semi crunchy tacos. The bottoms on all but one of them were cracked on the bottom. Even though our slip said we ordered a burrito supreme without sour cream, whatever we received had sour cream, something that resembled cheese whiz and Fritos. I ended up with a Quesarito St. whatever that is. We usually go to this a Taco Bell at least once or twice a month. We have been forgiving up until now. We will not be back.
Great Service,friendly and always smiling. Boss Lady Suzanna was great at taking care of guests. Thanks for the delicious food. Stop here any chance I get

Oh man I don't even know where to start lol,

I guess if you guys would actually stay open until 11 your crappy food would be worth it. Unfortunately you're the closest T bell in the area and SEVEN times strong you have been closed by 10 or even 9:30. One time I actually was in line at 10:45 ( 15 min before closing) and the guy said by the time my food would be ready it would be eleven so he couldn't take my order? I along with 10 people behind me knowing T bell closes at 11 we're not stoked. I don't know what kind of joke of an establishment this owner is running but keep your chain open for the hours listed... it's not that hard. I'll save the poor food quality for another day.
Closing time says 11 but doors locked at 1030. People inside shoo'd me away. I get it but at least update open and closing times
8/24/19 drive-through: "OK, uh, we're closed due to a shortage of staff." Man.

I wanted to try the grilled cheese burrito because I heard that it was good. 
I was out shopping and this was the closest Taco Bell when it came to mind so I pulled in the drive-through.
I ordered the grilled cheese burrito & taco supreme.   I noticed the line item price for the burrito on the drive thru screen was different than what the menu showed in the drive-through by $.30.   So when I got to the drive-through window I let the girl know that it was supposed to be $2.99 instead of $3.39 for the grilled cheese burrito. 
She left and brought some guy back with her and he asked me what the issue was and I told him. He proceeded to tell me that he had just clocked out but he will go check the menu board.   Well apparently he didn't mean he was going to go check it immediately and he disappeared. The girl proceeded to charge me the $3.39 for the grilled cheese burrito instead of taking the $.30 off of my total. He disappeared.  
By this time I was so put out, had waited and there was a line behind me ....I just figured I would let them know how disappointed I was and just pay it.  
It's a big problem if a manager does not believe a patron about a $.30 error and not want to make it right. As if I would lie about $.30.   Sad... And I will not be back.
However I do want to let you know that the grilled cheese burrito was surprisingly on the spicy side and more tortilla than anything.  There was not an overwhelming amount of cheese... I guess I was expecting more cheese like a grilled cheese sandwich.

This place is the absolute worst business in the world. 40+ minutes in the drive through with 4 or fewer cars each time. Shame on me for thinking it could change or was just a random one off occurrence. This is truly a pathetic establishment.

complete waste of time. came here apl the way from the next city over.  Hours are wrong on yelp! If you cant be bothered to update your hours on yelp take your business off the listing! You dont deserve the business yelp is sending you! These selfish businesses make me sick!

One of the slower taco bells. Only one in drive thru. Ordered about 6 items. Waited 10 minutes. By the time I left there were 5 cars behind me. Food was alright just really slow. Not "fast" food by any means. The new quesaditos are ok. Get the steak one if you are wanting to try one.
This place is a cluster$uck of dumbf$ckery. Who makes Supreme tacos without sour cream? Three peoples orders, all different crap, all screwed up! Looking at the reviews!

Do not go here. I have gotten drive thru (trapped) and would have driven over the median to get out if I had a suv. It took over 40 minutes to get food. The person at the window dropped my card on the ground, and was like "that's the fifth time I've done that tonight." 

It seems like the staff is going in the freezer and getting drunk or high or something. There were over five of them there, there is no reason why it would take this long for food to come out. Every order was small including mine, as the lobby was closed. 

Decided to try it again and got grub hub  last night and the order was completely wrong. Grub hub comped the meal. 

Two out of two visits and both had issues. Hopefully corporate comes and takes over your franchise for mis management.

Taco bell winter garden 34787

Taco bell winter garden 3478
Mary ann Campbell ocoee Florida 34865
There food is so good however there web site says 7am until 2am I pulled up to the drive thru at 1:15am and they said they were closed however online the website says 2am.

Wow this was the fastest service I ever had. Food was as expected especially mexican pizza is my favorite. Other taco bell messed up my order. I was really hopping they don't be the same. The staffs were co- operative. Place was clean and neat. Taco fries were not fresh it was very cold and less in quantity.

Normally this is the go to Taco Bell location here in town. I live literally behind a Taco Bell and I'll still drive 15+ mins up the road to this location. It's cleaner, service is better and normally very smooth ordering and receiving products. 

Tonight is not one of those days... we're sitting here and we've had an issue with our order something was missing. My husband stood in line for over 5 minutes to get it fixed. As he was standing there two other people had came up because their order was wrong. One persons was made incorrectly and the other had something missing. 

Maybe tonight is just an off night for them because it is normally the dead opposite of service for them. They have 2 people on break & about 8 people in the kitchen area working. 

Food wise... I always get the #7 Quesadilla + hard Taco and I always pair it up with cinnamon twists. They're either hit or miss with the quality of cinnamon twists and how full the quesadillas are. My son frequently gets #7 or #8, 3 Tacos. The newest thing they have out now are the Nacho Fries.. my husband describes them as crunchy and moist inside... my son describes them as fries covered in Mexican spices with a nacho cheese dipping sauce. 

They have a Pepsi machine that has 15 drink options. My family favorite part of coming here is reading the sauce packages sayings. It's so corny but we love it.

Quick service was about the only thing this TB has going for it. Order was incorrect, and no utensils were provided for either cantina bowl. BF says due to Covid, his hands are dirty, and he refuses to use his toes. I ducked into two fast food places for a fork/spoon before stopping at Bowl&Berry (where btw, the gal was wonderful and helpful, and yes, I'll be back sometime!). With as many food options as are available in this area, I won't be stopping at this Taco Bell again.
I downloaded the Yelp app just to write about this Taco Bell.  Of all Taco Bell's, I genuinely fear for my guts

This Taco Bell refused my service when I used their drive through while walking from the nearby hotel. Unfortunately, I was traveling via Uber for business and didn't have a car at the time which I told them. First time this has every happened and I've been through several drive throughs before without a vehicle and received service. If they thought their own safety was at risk, they shouldn't have because I went ahead and stood back several feet. Anyways, I won't be eating at a Taco Bell again because of the rude gesture and expression from the workers inside. If it's a policy they need to reconsider it's use because the logic behind it falls apart quickly considering a would be criminal can easily commit crime with a car. How does having car stop a armed robbery? Most likely the car would be stolen or they could just cover up the plates. How does the policy match the non-existence of protection when ordering in side? They don't have glass in between workers and customers. A number of other logical holes exist as well. So they should just get ride of the customer alienating policy because it does little to protect a would be criminal. If it's not their policy, fire the works inside and offer an apology ( with three free meals I might add).

The food from any Taco Bell location is pretty much the same as at any other. . .it's OK enough since all you want is something fast and cheap anyway.  I distinguish locations from each other mainly by how "pleasant" the seating area is and how accessible it is while I'm driving.  Looking at it that way, this Taco Bell is good because, although it's located on busy SE 82nd Avenue, it's on a corner that has a traffic light with left turn lanes and signals.  This gives it great "accessibility" the way I see it.  It's a very easy stop for something fast and cheap to eat.  The food is always OK and the employees there have always been nice.

After a long day my family and I went to the downtown location for a quick dinner. It was Sunday about 630pm. 
The 2 Cashiers one had long braids gave great service. She made sure to re read my order to make sure it was correct. Upon receiving my order I noticed it was incorrect. No bigge right everyone makes mistakes. So after nicely explaining the issue.... (I am assuming the manager / a Heavy set lady with a strip shit) comes to  address my issue. Immediately she seems upset because my order is incorrect! Then insist that I didn't order it...showed her my receipt and in fact I was missing items. She quickly remakes them while telling staff "get the orders right or clock out" . 
Cool I sit down to open what was just redone...to find out it  was done incorrect once again! This time by now I address the issue  with a not so nice tone. The manager then ask for the mistake tacos back cool I grab it and bring it back. Not only was is snatched out my hand the new taco was thrown on the counter by the same manager! I was highly disappointed in the service I received! I will not be returning. I feel bad for the staff that have to put up with that manager. And this is coming from someone who has been on both side of the counters!

Refused to let us order because we were making a personal order, and not a favor/doordash order. ..I mean what?! Isn't that discrimination? Yes. Yes it is. Go to taco C instead, this place is trash. Corporate needs to examine this location

This location is quickly going downhill. It's sad too, because it USED to be the best in St. Cloud. 

We ordered 25 minutes ago and we're still waiting for them to call our name. 

There is 1 person doing the dine in food, 2 in drive thru and 1 person taking orders. 

Icing on the cake is this location has no soft tortillas available. 

Station to get drinks, lids and straws is dirty. 

Not impressed and won't be back anytime soon.

Just heard they have no root beer, Pepsi or Mountain Dew && their running out of lemonade.

First off, when ordering the lady was very rude and impatient with us, we waited 20 minutes in the drive through.... only to get home and see we got the complete wrong order. 

When we got back to the Taco Bell two of the employees were smoking outside... one was working the window and  the only other one we could see was FaceTiming her friend while making herself a coffee. I had to say excuse me 5+ time and lean all the way over the counter before I could get her attention.... we got no apology and then the employee proceeded to eat the last couple Cinnabon's instead of giving them to a customer who had requested them.

Turns out the entire time we had been waiting in line, gone home, and come back... the man who's order we had been given had been waiting inside the restaurant waiting the entire time.... 

Extremely disappointed and I had very low expectations to start out with. 

Currently I'm still waiting and watching an employee lick a Cinnabon from behind the counter

UPDATE: after 10 more minutes they came back out and asked what food we wanted and then proceeded to make food for an employeee and we never got ours..... we asked for our money back after the 45 minutes we had waited....

All I can say, is if I was the owner, I'd be pissed.

I've visited this Taco Bell location several times recently as Taco Bell is one of the most vegan-friendly fast food options there is & this one happens to be near my home as well as my work. I've ordered the fresco (no dairy) bean burrito as well as the fresco crunchwrap supreme (with beans instead of beef) & had no issues with incorrect orders or consistency in terms of the taste & size of my meals. While it's far from my favorite Mexican food option in Portland, I do appreciate their commitment to providing vegan options, the portions vs. the price, & the convenience. The service has been efficient, friendly, & swift. I'll visit often.

So I understand this is taco bell so I don't expect much.  I ordered a number 1 which says taco supreme and shows 3 pictures of 3 supreme tacos.  Well it turns out you have to specify that you want the supreme and not regular.  
I called in and was told that I had to specify and kept calling me babe.  Seriously. I was not looking to get anything for free.  Dont make me feel like an idiot for not knowing I had to specify.  I told her I would not be back an, her reply was "okay babe".  Just wow

Taco Bell Tip of the Day: Don't order at the self service kiosk or through the mobile app. You will never get your order.

I went during lunch with some folks that went straight to the self service kiosk while I waited in the long line for counter service. I got my food, left, ate, and even had time to gossip around before they returned with their food. 

Mild, Fire, Diablo - go for the Diablo if you actually want level 1 spicy. The crunch wrap supreme is pretty sad but fills you up. The doritos los tacos aren't that great. The baja blast soda though is really good. I'd want to try the breakfast crunchwrap because hashbrown, eggs, and bacon wrapped in a tortilla? Done deal. 

The cup covers are right underneath the soda machine FYI. This place has opened for two weeks? so far and it smells...unique already. Live mas!

I don't know how they are running this place, but the orders take FOREVER. This is NOT a fast food place; it is fast food quality food, but delivered at the pace of a sit down restaurant. I ate here months ago and thought I'd try again today. But at least the food was hot and tasted good. They didn't give enough guacamole and cheese dip (containers were only half-full). But seriously I have no idea why this place is so slow and make so many  mistakes in orders.

Rude customer service . Got ignored by all workers til finally this emo chick comes up doesn't say anything and just stands there lookin like I shouldn't even be there just a bunch of rude ass kids working and fuckin off which  I can get to an extent being young and working with friends but damn don't come up to me and stare at me like your gonna steal my soul all I wanted was a taco.

It's unbelievable that being a frequent client here. The young chubby white lady with black hair and black eyes is called to take my order. She goes in front of the cashier leaving me on line . Walks away and me alone in front of the counter. No gesture to take my order. I said "Hello" she just keeps on moving walking among tables but no reaction or response. THank you Lindsay for such a fantastic service. To Lake Mary Blvd, maybe I'll be luckier there.

This Taco Bell is actually the best restaurant!! We have one that is very close to our house, but the food served there , doesn't taste the same. Food here is really good, always , and so is their customer service!

I would give this Taco Bell negative stars if I could. I have lived in multiple cities around the country and never have I experienced a worst Taco Bell. Moved to the neighborhood several months ago. 4 out of 4 times we have gone our order has been completely wrong and honestly inedible. I didn't know it was possibly to mess up food this badly. I will never be returning after tonight. We had to drive through twice because they forgot items on our order and then got home to find it was all completely wrong. I'm out money and now have to figure out what to do for dinner

If it was possible to give this location negative stars I'd give them double digits.  If it's not waiting in the drive through for 25+ mins to get up to order and have them close on you, it's them tripping up on an ingredient you explicitly asked to be left out and hearing workers joke about spitting in your food, if you can, go to tuttle or 23.

I can't believe I'm writing a Yelp review and I'm ashamed to be writing one about my dearly beloved. I love Taco Bell, but please, don't insult hot garbage by comparing  this store to it. 

Initially I stopped visiting this location after being trapped in the drive-thru for over an hour and a half...it was midweek and there were only two cars  ahead of me. If I had either the suspension or insurance to jump the lawn I'd have cut my losses and dried my tears in a McChicken. I did finally get my food but my order was wrong, fine,
whatever, k. 

 More visits than I would care to admit later... I ordered delivery and it took just shy of three hours. I tried to cancel and was told no!

Why? How? Why can't this Taco Bell not suck so bad. I want TB more than I would care to admit but DAMN It takes so long and nothing is ever right. Please just be better

Still in line after 45, on a Wednesday.... we've been in line 45 min with 3 cars still ahead of us... and no way to turn out of the ordering line. Since when does fast food take you over 45 min?

Also, when we got home, 90 percent of our order was wrong.....

I thought the point of fast food is its fast...
Be ready to spend 30+ min in the drive through. 
I thought maybe they were short staffed but when I got to the window there were plenty of employees.. they were just to busy entertaining them selves..

I was out late. Headed to my neighborhood and wanted some food. But I just got shitty service.  Yelp says this place closes at 330 am. Sign in the window says it closes at 230 am. That's fine. I arrived at 220 am. Got into the drive through and no response. Drive around the restaurant and saw and employee inside. Drive back around to the drive through with no response. Knocked on the drive through window... said employee points at sign saying they are closed. Before the the hours indicated.  So I called and stated the facts of the building and employee tells me " we close early. That is how is goes." 

NO ! Your hours are stated on placards on your building. I was there before close with no service. That is not "how it goes " I would love to spend my money at your restaurant. But you have some lazy night shift ass holes working for you. I had a simple order ...I am a man of simple means... obviously, because I am trying to eat your food. I work in retail and have stayed open just a bit later for last minute customers . Why can't you fast food flunkies do the same?!  And that's. it even the case. I was there 10 minutes before your stated closing time. What's the f'ing deal!? Calling the store in the morning. And whoever was closing the night of march 1st 2017 / morning of march 2nd 2017 should be reprimanded for negligence in his duty as a service industry professional.

I've tried all the Taco Bells in the immediate region and this one is the best. The one of Riverside near Pleasant Valley is mediocre. The location on Lamar by Barton is OK. But this Oltorf location has got it right. I always order chicken quesadillas because of the sauce they put in (I have the recipe for their sauce but never make it but occasionally have intense cravings for it). Then I order random entrees from their drive-in menu.

I did not eat at Taco Bell for a long time. But those new Verde green sauce packets are delicious. I actually have some at my desk for ALL the meals.

The price is kinda high for fast food. I often order tacos for later or tacos for friends whereas McD's I usually shamefully order my overcaloried serving. Taco Cabana is far superior if they are nearby, but this local TB is great.

Me and the kids love Taco Bell. Been to many of them all over Mass.  This is by far the worst.  Service is slow and they seem to always forget something when I order through the drive thru. 
I continue to punish myself by going here instead of taking the extra 10 mins to go to the Saugus location.  That will change!!

High school meets fast food...

The woman in charge (a woman with dyed red hair) was running around like a bad substitute teacher trying to control an unruly classroom. She was yelling across the restaurant and barking out orders. And then she gave up and started treating them all like friends. No wonder no one was respecting her. 

The staff were behaving like children. Especially the woman who was ringing us up (a taller thin woman). First she had a 15 minute conversation with a group of high school girls. Then after finally wrapping up her personal conversation, I kid you not... at two points during my attempt to order she left to check the front of the store to see if her friends were there. 

Also apparently a fight amongst workers broke out last week.

DO NOT GO HERE IF YOU WANT FOOD WITHIN THE HOUR. Honestly just go to a real sit down restaurant. 

I hope they can turn their act around soon because as of right now this branch is going to fail.

I can't begin to tell you what poor customer service this so-called "manager/general manager/will not tell you her name at the drive-through window person has. Several cars were lined up and most were leaving. I decided to pull up to the drive-through speaker and ask for my order. She said we are closed because our computers are down for 15 minutes. I said "OK I'll be right here." She told me to "MoveOn." I told her no and I asked her for the corporate number. She said "800 get out of my line." I said and what is your name she said Stephanie. I wrote it down I asked HIM for HER TITLE.  She sent out her goon,she sent out too move me.  Nope even the pictures and the selfies did not work. After 15 minutes they still were not open and in addition to that she decided she was going to not open the drive-through for me or allow me into the restaurant. This is all to say good customer service is not within the store and I would refuse to eat there anymore although I live .9 miles away it's not worth my time and energy. Although the food has always been good  i'm consistent. Good customer service plus good prices plus good food will get my money. Poor  customer service will not get you a good bite to eat at this place if the woman there is in charge. EVER!

I know. I know..
Taco What... Ick. No. It's another one of my dirty food secrets! So everything is of course my own fault but c'mon. How is your service so slow? I get it. "Kids". I think it's more bad management than anything else. I witnessed a manager going outside constantly to tell Drive Through Customers about current delays. Why? That's at least one Crew Member not helping during a Rush Of Customers.

Not My Circus. Not My Monkeys. 

I've been here a few times and i've seen slow service on a couple occasions. I get it. Not my circus. I will get my order in the order it was received. It's just a bunch of kids working the line. And More Importantly.... It's Taco Bell.
Prepare to wait at least 20 minutes for your order at off-peak hours. I went at 7:50, about 10 people waiting for their orders. It's unfortunate.

THIS IS THE WORST TACO BELL I HAVE EVER BEEN TO. First time: I went through the drive through and they were SOOO slow! Food wasn't cooked right, Crunchwrap was falling apart, etc. Thought it was a fluke. Second time: WE WAITED IN THE DRIVE THROUGH FOR 30 MINUTES! I will never come here again.
Just left this Taco Bell, because they are closed. Literally says open until 11. Am I crazy?

So I normally go to this location a lot, I love the convince of Taco Bell. However when I find a Cigarette Butt in my chalupa that's a little messed up.

It's such a shame when this kind of stuff happens, but hey at least I lost a couple pounds when I threw up after almost taking a cigarette butt into my stomach.

Gross

this location is in desperate need of new employees and management.  doesn't matter if you uber, order online or go threw the drive thru they are incapable of getting an order correct.  the order i placed today was missing 6 items plus all the sauce packets.
They always tell you to do their surveys online as if they're giving out quality food.. they didn't even try to put the cheese & beans in the middle just on one side of the "nachos"

Saw on the neighborhood page that they had made some changes so we went through the drive thru recently after swearing we never would go there again.

Neighborhood page was right - fast, friendly service and for the first time ever - we actually received what we ordered.

Good times.

Drive through and take out open, store and lot very clean on the outside and in the Drive-through. Safe handling I served, money taken at window with a large box, money and food given back in the same manner.

Order was taken, when we got home it was perfect and still hot.

Looking forward to going back after this Covid mess

Wow went through drive thru and I though it was a Halloween haunted house full of zombies. These girls at this location are so dead. They look like they hate there job and hate you for ordering. We ordered 4 meals and received 3 hot sauces. Ordered 2 Large drinks and received half full sodas. This is just a joke. Fire managers and employees

It's probably the best Taco Bell I've been too. Great customer service. Easy to get in and out of the parking lot. Typical Taco Bell food! Sometimes there is quite a line but it definitely moves at a decent pace.
This Taco Bell deserves no stars but that's not an option :/ there's no reason in the world that a Taco Bell drive thru should ever take 30 minutes on a REGULAR basis.

This is the second time I've been held hostage in this drive through. Going on 20 minutes and 3 cars ahead of me. At least if the food is slow at a restaurant, I can get up and leave. But I am claustrophobic and stuck in between cars. Not worth the Crunchwrap supreme.

When I entered this place it was messy . They have signs outside saying that they are hiring. It is obvious that they need to hire. The place was so messy like bruh what the heck . They need to hire anyone that comes through their doors so they can clean the flippen place. Food was good tho.

So I am writing this review three years later from my first review of this place. Not only has the performance decreased since the last review, but I am currently writing this review while I wait for my order. I ordered and have waited ten minutes before redownloading the Yelp app and writing about this place.

The leader, Mercedes, is telling her coworkers to make the darn food and the customers here are livid. A woman in a fur coat is yelling at Mercedes for waiting twenty minutes (I ordered five minutes before this lady.) She just told her daughter that she should have went to McDonalds as planned. 

The wait here is obviously long if you order inside. There are only three workers and they are dedicated to the drive thru. I'm trying to make a showing of Logan at 10:40, and I've been here half an hour.

I finally got my food and I am now stuck in my car due to the drive thru lineup. Don't EVER go inside. Other than that, the food is great. And screw you fur coat lady.

Met my mom here for a quick lunch before going to a doctor appointment. This was one of the dirtiest Taco Bell restaurants I've ever bee in. We were greeted by a woman standing at the register picking her teeth with her finger nail. I was immediately turned off but thought, at least she's not actually working with the food. I paid and went over and got our self served drinks and then sat down and waited for my name to be called. A few minutes later, they called my name and I went to pick up our order. 
Mom got a soft taco. She took her first bite and then spit something out in her hand. I asked when was wrong & she said there was ice in the lettuce. I asked her if she wanted me to take it back up and have them remake it but she said no. She took another bite which was ok, then another and it had more ice. There was ice in about every other bite. ICE! Not what you want in your taco! 
I told the teeth picker lady when we left, and she apologized but I didn't see her move to tell anyone. So I assume either she didn't care or they already knew. Either way was bad. 
Gonna be quite awhile til e give this Taco Bell a visit again. Will need to give them time for the employees to turn over.

Service was extremely slow and the soda machine was out... Machine was giving watery not so tasty soda... Turns out it was like that for 2 days. Got soda from drive through machine and still watered... Not sure if I will eat there again.

Second Tuesday night in a row they close the dining room before 6?!??
Hire more people or close the doors!  False advertising on dining room hours! 
Went to chipotle and food was better and faster!
Taco Bell franchise should seriously come review this location.  Giving you a bad name!!  Horrible service and nobody gives a shit?!?!  Really?!!!

Aliyah provided the best customer service I've ever experienced at any Taco Bell. She provided a joyful greeting and asked me how my day was going. She is a real ambassador of this brand. I've been to this location many times in the past and everyone else that I've encountered is just plain rude. Keep up the good work Aaliyah, show them how it's done girl!!!

They completely left an item off my order. This is the second they screwed up my order. On top of that most of them are unfriendly.
Last time, the girl taking my order rudely asked "are you ready yet", there was no one behind me and barely anyone in the parking lot, so i don't understand the rush. Didn't add an item to my order after I asked twice. Had a complete attitude during our interactions.
This time a different girl was acting somewhat friendly, but forgot to bag my burrito I ordered. Seems like this stuff is a habit for them though.

We ordered a diet mtn dew with our order and they tried giving us a diet Baja blast after we had already paid. We don't like Baja blast so we declined the drink because it wasn't what we asked for and we were not given a refund for the drink. Trash.

I literally never ever post poor reviews and especially about the beloved tbell, but I get off work around 10-11pm most nights and pull up to the drive thru and I just end up sitting there for 5-10mins before finally driving away. I can see workers inside and their cars in the parking lot. Tonight they are said to close at 2am online, my boyfriend just ran out to grab us some and they're closed already? It's only midnight...
This blows bc the second closest tbell is like 10-15 minutes away... ):
Please somehow fix this!! You guys would get so much more business if you operated during your stated hours online. This location use to be THRIVING. Idk what happened...

*update*
My bf just went there to get us dinner at 9pm!!!! on a Wednesday and he ordered a Baja blast freeze and the worker over the microphone to my boyfriend was like, "OH MY GOD FINE". Like, dude don't be mad you're closing down the store extra early and probably wanted to shut down the freeze machine.
Cold. Are you serious? Frozen cinnabon delights? The health department should pay this place a visit. Sketch and you should run far away. Cant believe this is in Portland.

I honestly don't use Yelp. Just logged in after years of not using it to say that this is the worst Taco Bell in existence. 25+ minutes to get through the drive through on a Thursday, at a non-busy afternoon time. Like, by the time I got my order it was cold. I feel bad for the folks who work here, but honestly go next door or to Chipotle if you're in the area and craving fast food. 0/10.

I came here last week at about 10 PM I ordered a Loaded potato griller. I get home and bite into it and can't even chew it because the potatoes are so old and hard. I came back tonight let them know in the drive thru what happened and asked for fresh potatoes. And was assured I'd get them. I choose another loaded potato griller and a spicy potato soft taco. I get home and it's exactly the same old Ass potatoes you can't even chew after being assured my potatoes would be fresh.

Okay, it's a Taco Bell and it's not the one with alcohol so my expectations aren't super high. Deciding between 3 or 4 stars. When I come to this location it's usually pretty fast, but I came during dinner hours and waited 20 minutes in line in the drive thru. The way it's designed, you can't really leave once you're in line so I stuck it out. Staff is always friendly. Got some surprise meat in one of my shredded chicken burritos this time but it was still fine. The nacho fries were good but not worth paying more than $1.

LOL. I love taco bell. Diane took my order and she really made my morning. Also, the sausage breakfast crunch wrap is something I could probably eat every other day. You get the egg, sausage, hashbrown all in one bite!! How can you not want that?!

What a train wreck-totally understand that this place is new, but over 20 minutes to get a quesadilla and taco is insane. Food was okay once I got it, but the service and layout of this store doesn't work well. Too many other places in Downtown Crossing area to get lunch to even think about going back here again.

Could give them zer0 if possible. Horrible service, non informative about an issue with online ordering. After them taking almost $23 out of my account I pull up to a line all the way down to stop and shop and when I get to the window they tell me they have no recollection of my online order. There is no number to call. And would not refund me.

I understand that in these times, things are difficult.However, placing a take out order, should NOT be one.
Last night I placed an order via the mobile app, got message saying it was ready, got there, only to find that they hadn't even made it yet. So after waiting in line, I had to wait additional time for the food to be ready.
Got home, only to find out the order was incorrect.
I ordered the new Grilled Cheese Burrito, with no sour cream, however it clearly wasn't the new burrito, because it didn't have the melted cheese on the top, didn't have the red chips inside and it HAD sour cream!
There has to be better follow through, when it comes to food orders at fast food places.
What happened to "Quality Control" ? Managers, and Supervisors MUST do their jobs, Customer Satisfaction used to mean something.

This Taco Bell consistently has the best service and freshest and most generous food of any Taco Bell I have been too. I have been visiting this Taco Bell for about 15 years. I've been to many many other Taco Bell's, and I've never written review before, but I have to say they're really doing good work here. The customer service is consistently good and polite. I don't know how they get such good people to work here consistently. I wish I could meet the manager and thank him or her sometime. Well done!
Lied to,attitude, yelled at,and to top it off wrong food excuses for why they were that way the only kind person was thrown under the bus for being new. Do not go there

So, I ordered food through door dash cause my wife was craving some tacos. So we spent $20, a bit excessive but I don't argue with a pregnant lady. Food showed up wrong right off the bat. We ordered soft tacos with beans, and we got taco meat....cool. We got the nachos and guess what...it looked like they gave us crumbs and meat. Cool. Bit into the taco and it tasted off, turns out we found a couple of bugs. Not sure what it was but they're definitely something that doesn't belong in a taco. I called the restaurant and surprise surprise, they hung up on me three times. Fourth time around the assistant manager picked up, and of course she said she checked the quality of her meat and that it was impossible. Cool. Not like I used to work in the food industry before or anything. Ran a restaurant and food service 101, apologize the hell out to the customer because you don't want the health inspector to do a full random audit on you. Guess she didn't cared. So I called my friend in the Health Department and she'll follow up with the inspector in the region.

Overall okay, but I have to say, this was not my favorite T. Bell experience ever. 

What better way to cap off my day at Disney than with Taco Bell, right? When I pulled in I immediately got excited because it was what looked to be a Catina version of Taco Bell which is newer, nicer, and just all around more fun. When I got inside it kind of reminded me of any other Taco Bell with a fresh coat of paint. I did feel a sort of emptiness inside of the building. I think it's because they have the ordering monitors and such a large space between that and the actual tables it just kind of feels too open.

I think people work here? I only ever saw one person- there was never anyone at the actual register. A person gave me my food so they all must be hiding in the back? The beauty of online ordering, right? 

One thing I noticed is they had diet Baja blast which I didn't know was a thing.

My food didn't take all that long as mentioned in other reviews. And it tasted true to Taco Bell form. Nothing out of place there. I took my meal to-go because I had no interest in staying here.

There was zero atmosphere but always serving five star food. Overall still a solid three stars.
In a time of infectious diseases, viruses and bacteria Taco Bell didn't seem too worried... food was good I guess...

I've had only kind, swift, & accurate service at this Taco Bell location. I've always appreciated Taco Bell's vegan options, & am glad to once again have this location nearby for inexpensive vegan-friendly options. I usually order fresco bean burritos, meat & dairy-free crunchwraps, &/or dairy-free seven-layer burritos. I've never waited more than ten minutes. Please, be kind to the workers.

Just got Taco Bell/KFC this is for both. I order a couple of tacos and a Gordita and a bucket of chicken and some sides. I ask her the lady at the front counter for a gordita, she kept saying burrito I had to repeat myself at least 3 times. I said gordita and she said burrito I ended up getting all small sizes, like you would order a kids menu. I wanted and needed food for both me and my boyfriend and there was not even another food for me. It cost about $20.00 and I was like where is all the food at? The lady did not understand english as it was not her first language. I wanted the "family" size enough for left overs, the gordita was soggy and a sad excuse for a gordita, I am not pleased they do not listen to you and give you wrong things/sizes here. Be prepared to repeat yourself here and still not get what you want awful.

So I entered the drive thru at 10:09pm. It's now 10:49pm and I just placed my order. Unfortunately this drive thru has a wall to your right and a ditch to your left so once you're in, you're in. The employees here are usually pretty nice but seriously, niceness cannot make up for this ungodly wait. Maybe it's opposite day because this is not fast food. I'll update this review when I get my food.... don't hold your breath.

Edit: exited drive thru with food at 11:04pm.

Come here pretty often & have great service every time. Orders right every time (even special orders) & always very friendly staff. I can't understand the lower rating of this location... I give it a solid 5 stars.
Had a good experience here today while in the area. Drive through was quick and food tasted fresh! Love that there's vegetarian options. Also we both ate for $6.14 which is nice on a budget.
Dude was just pissing in the drive thru and then ran up to his car at the window while someone blew hella smoke in their drive thru window so they were too high to take my order. Shame.
Always the bare minimum for tbell. Usually sit in line for about 30 min. This place sucks

Went to get breakfast for a group of friends as I was ordering the gentleman made rude comments about the amount of food I was ordering. After he read back my ordered he said "wow that's a big breakfast"  I explained it was for a group and his response was "whatever". I was waiting to pay I could over hear him talking about a customer calling her fat and cussing about her because she asked him to correct her order.

I've been to this taco bell so many times, and usually love it like a normal taco bell. But dude, I ordered 4 chalupas that the shells were all CRAZY STALE.  Super, super gross. Don't know if that's this taco bells fault, or if taco bell has new shells for the chalupas. But super gross. I'm put off from taco bell for a while now. 

One positive thing-- their baja blast is never out of syrup, so it's never watered-down.

This taco bell actually sucks. I'm sitting in it right now waiting on food and I have been for 45 minutes. If I hadn't paid, then I would've left. The workers are lazy and are standing around joking when there's 20+ people waiting on food. I wish they had the managers name posted so I could call and report these employees. Also, they have a machine spilling water and other fluids all over the food prep area.

"Not my choice :-("  

Apparently, that was the tip I left when we came here.  It's Taco Bell.  If you don't know what you're getting when you come here, then that's unfortunate.

Update: I am updating, now; to say that I fully appreciate the follow through with management to see this issue through. While I never wanted any physical products to remedy this, upper managements have continued to show the willingness and kindness to have this addressed. I've been advised that this behavior is out of character - and I'm willing to accept that knowledge nugget. No one is a perfect human all of the time. I also appreciate the idea that If their manager is going through something, they are willing to check in and offer help to them. And, Upgrading to three stars due to the follow through I've seen and appreciate. Also, redacting names to allow privacy to those who may be seeking help. .

Please stop letting abusive humans in positions of power. I'm talking about {manager}. His fragile and toxic ego. His inability to admit to a stupid (very minor and stupid) mistake. Instead, {manager} will showcase his ego by getting upset and talking over you. {manager} has learned the art of gaslighting and projecting, like a true narcissist. We talked very extensively about my order and even verified it was all there at the window. 
And those poor employees who can't even tell a customer who {manager} answers to, like I should rightfully know? What a shitty work environment. Ew. 
It's very clear - {manager} is not cut out for this gig. And, I hope he can learn how to stop putting customers AND employees in severely uncomfortable and unfair situations. 
 {manager}- Please take a class in communication and customer service. Right now, your just a fragile little human and it shows very bright. sad face.

food sub par 9 people working yet bathroom is disgusting with pubes on the seat, garbage all over the floor dining room is a wreck. employee on break with his apron on which is disgusting staff ain't really all that friendly and seems to play grab ass all too much and maybe the loud mouth GM should teach homeboy how to mop

I mean the service is pretty slow the parking lot legit has about 6 cars waiting for food... mind you I order just a chulupa and been here for 10 minsif they told me at the window I would have just went somewhere else-disappointed

Yo. Real talk. 
This Taco Bell is on a whole.
Other.
Level.

Im giving it 2 starts because the drive-thru is the opposite of fast food.

Got there at 9:30pm and the outside lights were off and so was the menu board.
Thought maybe they were closing because everything was dark and things were going SUPER SLOW. 

The lady that took our order was super friendly and made sure our order was correct.

By the time we got to the pick up window is was 10pm. 30 minutes!

At least they turned on the outside lights by the time we got our food. ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ 

4/10. Wouldn't recommend.

This has got to be one of the best Taco Bell stores out there. Always pleasant staff, fast on the food prep, and the store is always clean. It does get crowded at lunch and it doesn't have the largest parking lot. I've never had an issue with this location. Would recommend it anytime.

This Taco Bell makes me so angry!!! They close early every single night!!!!! I don't get out of work until 2:30 and they are suppose to be open until 3 but they never stay open. I even had a person inside ignore me at the drive threw and I am beyond pissed off. Shitty people they all need fired and replaced period.

I've been here dozens of times as I live very close. I don't have high expectations from fast food, and expect to have my order wrong at times and such. 

Well, the last two times I've been, the food that I ordered was not lukewarm, but stale. It had been sitting for so long the food had become stale. How do you serve this... multiple times? I don't leave negative reviews a lot, and I EXPECT bad service, but this is absurd.

WORST taco Bell location, ever! I've made so many calls, emails and left so many reviews but obviously they don't care because they're the only location within a 10-mile radius.  But the problem isn't in the quality of the food, it's the service.

In the past 3 visits, I've dealt with the same dumb girl on the intercom who chooses not to listen, gives you an attitude and never once has smiled in her life.  She doesn't acknowledge your order so you have to tell into the speaker "are you still there?" She acts annoyed you even exist and makes you feel like you're bothering her. Everytime I encounter this sad human, I have to ask her to repeat my order, which she sighs heavily and I fear she'll spit in my food.

Finally when it's time to pull around, when I'm finally graced with her presence, she doesn't even say hi or smile at me, just shoves her hand through my window demanding money.  After 3 minutes of walking around back there, credit machine beeping that my card was approved, she finally comes back, grabs the card and shoves it in my face. She turns to leave again but I ask for fire sauce, which causes an eye roll and another famous sigh.

Another 2.5 minutes goes by and she takes my bag and shoves it through the window saying nothing. No thank you no have a nice day, nothing.  I tell her she forgot my drink and she says "you didn't have a drink." In what is the rudest time possible. I tell her I did and show her my receipt. So back she goes again for another 2.5 minutes. 

Unfortunately, the way this location is set up, after the window, the drive through ends to the street and you have to pull out and leave, there's no spots or room to pull over and check your order.

And unfortunately, the past three times I've gone here, they've forgotten an item. Today it was my chicken chalupa, last time my grilled stuffed burrito and the time before? My nachos. These are not cheap items, I'm not a rich person. What I am, is upset, unsatisfied and have decided as of today, I am done going to this taco Bell and will of course, tell everyone I know to do the same.

Listen, disregard all of the jabronis commenting on this location. They just opened recently and they're doing a fine job. I had one of the best steak quesadillas I've ever had. Everyone else is petulant, ungrateful little children. As far as I'm concerned, there could be no Taco Bell downtown so think about that next time before you decide to complain. I love you Taco Bell thank you, keep up the great work and ignore these rich financial districts losers who apparently can't wait 30 mins for Taco Bell when their dumb asses decide to come DURING LUNCH HOUR expecting it to be easy. Good day.

We have tried this Taco Bell many times. Every time we will have to wait at least 20 to 30 minutes and they consistently get the order wrong. Bummer, we live close by and would go more if it was more consistent.

The man taking the orders at 8:20 was rude, and short after we asked for one second to see what we wanted. Then when we got to the window his nails were dirty and he was impolite. The receipt says his names is James S.

This Taco Bell has one of the fastest and most efficient drive-thrus that I have ever experienced. They are doing an amazing job during the pandemic. I have been impressed on multiple occasions and I do try to compliment them for their great service.
The service is incredibly slow. It's not unusual to wait 20 minutes at the drive through.
Barely put any beans or lettuce on my tostada ?? Like I came there with the munchies and Taco Bell really let me down .

I wish I was the morning manager here. They're never ready to open, literally like 90% of the time they're open much later than the listed time. MORE THAN OFTEN you're given a lame duck reason they aren't open.. today was the fryer was on... they've have had COVID here and not posted or told customers, they just stopped doing morning openings for two weeks. Then they come back and still can't seem to get a staff that can arrive to work on time and open for business. Seriously this manager must be Jesus because I truly don't know how else they continue to keep their job with terrible reviews and the INABILITY TO RUN THIS STORE. CORPORATE PLEASE STEP IN AND RETRAIN THIS MANAGER, if not just close the store. If you can't commit to your poster opening time and can't make menu items (not due to lack of food), close. Please. The sad thing is some employees do care, just not the manager.

Been going here off and on for a while. Lately it's been chaos. 3 out of the last 4 times I've been here, they were not taking debit/credit. Not only that. The intercom is always broken and they skimp hard on the sauce. Go to a different location or try a different food chain.

Twice after 2am I have been here and twice now the staff refused to serve any customers. They claim the register goes into perpetual reboot mode until 7am. I don't believe them. Any owner of a franchise that is unable to make even ten cents, after a certain time of day, would move heaven and earth to reopen for business. 
Had to drive way out of the way (to Canal Winchester) to satisfy my craving.  I won't be back to this particular Bell.

Ordered crunchy taco supreme (no lettuce).

I'm guessing these tacos are mostly lettuce?
I understand giving Lynn youth an opportunity to be great but get some better adult management because this location is not it whatsoever.

This is seriously the worst taco bell around the kids are rude they never get the order right ...terrible customer service..also if u order something and they dont have it they will still let u pay for it and give you something Els! Isnt that great!!!  Assholes

Always gotten great service and not very long wait times. I've seen some comments complaining about how "unhappy" the workers are. I doubt you would be too happy working long hours for minimum wage at a Taco Bell, dealing with rude people all day. My only complaint is their times are always wrong. Currently they are closed completely. They're also not usually open to 3 or 4am like yelp says so I'd say don't go too late!
Came to this location because the ones near my house were closed. The workers here were rude and were not wearing their masks properly.

Consistently disappointed with this particular Taco Bell. I have gotten many incorrect orders and the associates have a hostile attitude toward customers. I keep thinking I'll give them another chance but i always regret it. 

Today was my final straw- showed up for breakfast at 10:55am. Granted, cutting it close to the 11am cut off, but the customer in front of me ordered two breakfast burritos and it was fine. I order the breakfast Crunchwrap at 10:57am and she rudely blurted out "WE ain't doin breakfast no more!" Confused, I asked why, and she just said sorry. I left with no order and will not return
This is the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to. I drove 10 minutes to this location only to find out "they only were doing uber eats orders". Is this a joke? New management is needed here
Incredibly rude. I mobile ordered, and I never got my nacho box and received a sweet tea instead of my mountain dew baja blast. They need to straighten up and double check before handing things out

Very disappointed with Taco Bell/KFC drive-thru! Their service is incredibly slow and the employees are very rude. It took 8 minutes to order my meal because every so often the employee would say "hold on one second"...then waited 13 minutes in line because there was hold up ahead. We finally reached the window and paid for our order. They forgot our drinks, which resulted to us waiting even longer.

We ordered a $5 fill up, which included 2 pieces of chicken, biscuit, cookie and a side (we chose potato wedges). Inside, there was only one chicken wing, biscuit, three over fried potato wedges and no cookie!

always i like  taco  bell  and now days  you cant  come  in to  eat lunch  
the  whole  place is  locked  up  you have to walk around the  to the drive in window  and not safe  less you want to be  almost hit by a car and i wont be going back any  soon and  them lost  my business
Great!!!! We we're all super hungry so we just ordered some and WOW oh WOW it's great for family's. The Kids absolutely love Taco Bell can't go wrong with Taco Bell. I highly recommend

Is this human food or dog food?
Is it a taco or a piece of cardboard?
Is that shredded cheese or plastic?

The thing is, I can't tell the difference. I know this is objectionably garbage, but why do I love it so much?

Can I leave negative stares? -5. This restaurant got my order completely wrong and would not fix it because it was an online order. I was charged for a party pack of 12 soft beef taco supreme and 1 beef chalupa supreme. I got 12 regular beef tacos and 1 chicken taco and no chalupa at all. When you pay money and get screwed it's called prostitution.  Hard pass. Nope right out of the parking lot and go somewhere that they can actually read an order correctly. Do not recommend. Run away from this one.

If you want to work at this Taco Bell, there are 3 requirements:
1) You must not be able to speak or understand English very well
2) You should never, ever get orders correct
3)You should not be able to properly count money

...oh, and you get a bonus if you promise to use old, hard tortillas on drive through orders.

Folks, I do like to make the occasional run to the border, but I would rather drive to Walpole, than drive the mile to the Quincy location.

Taco Bell peeps- you should seriously give this franchise owner an atomic wedgie.

We have been to this particular Taco Bell three different times.  Each visit they have given us the wrong order in the drive through.  Not only do they get the order wrong the food is always cold.  Pretty much done with the Taco Bell In St. Cloud, fl.

Not impressed with this TB. They are 0/2 since I started stopping here. First time they screwed up my order, got beans instead of beef and a ton of onions which was not edible for me. Second time which was today no hot sauce, food is bland without. They asked and I said yes please, mild. Bag was sealed so I didn't notice till I got back to work. Really disappointing both times, but not worth my time to go back. I'll find other spots to eat locally like Roxys.

I've been here quite a few times but have stopped going after a white rubber glove was found in my drink. The shift manager confirmed it was the type of glove they use. One employee was put on leave for 2 weeks, but I never was told whether the glove was intentional or an accident. I don't trust going here anymore. Contacted taco bell about it and all they did was send a coupon for 2 free items. No attempt made to reaffirm to me that this will never happen again or that measures have been taken.

The staff here is absolutely outrageous! It's like romper room in there, The staff is yelling and laughing in the back, watching videos on their phones and swearing! Unbelievable, there must be Zero management here. I swear these employees are out if control. My order was wrong and so was the people behind me, it was not even busy. I will NEVER come back to eat inside there again! I wish I could erase what I heard, one of the employees called a drive thru customer ignorant. The "F" word was said at least 5-6 times very loudly! Plus it was dirty! Real classy Taco Bell!!!!! Taco Bell....OFF THE LIST! I read the other reviews as well and they said the same things I said, I guess nothing was ever addressed. Rude is the only word that comes to mind. Do NOT Bother going there unless you want to feel like you were in the halls of a high school with classless punks.

If I could give 1 star I would. Worst Taco Bell I have ever been to. Forget half our order. Food was disgusting. Had to go back inside to get what they missed and the guy at the counter was so rude to us about what they forget. When they gave us what they missed in our order the food was falling apart it wasn't even eatable. Never going here again.

The only reason im giving this location one star is because 1/2 star wasnt an option and no stars would probably be overlooked as a missed rating.

At 1pm today i went to taco bell on Groveport road in Obetz. Asked for a kexican pizza and was told in the most ghetto way "want aint gots no mexican pizzas" i was ok so whatndo you have for me to choose from. She said no pizzas no potatos, no pink lemonaid.

Soni switched my order and got nacho bell grande with extra extra cheese. Got regular cheese. .80 cents wasted. Got to window and after getting my food, asked why are you out of the stuff your menu says are options? Did truck not come yet? She said yes waiting on truck. I looked in back and found no receipt as i planned on complaining and expressing my continous disappointment with this location.  i?had to ask for a receipt to be told it was in the back. I looked a second time and said nope not in bag. By now im really getting impatient with this girl with finger nail polished nail. Trying to serve an attitude. She looked at the receipts on the printer and said printer was out of paper. Oh how convenient. no optionnto get a receipt reprinted, as I know management can do. I simply said ill take care of this and she looked at me as if i was retarded.  I tried calling the phone number yelp , google and yellow pages had listed 614-491-6005 and it was a fax.

Everytime I go to this pitful taco bell there is always something. I wish i had the geneal manager or franchisee owners phone number. If anyone has this information please post. Something must change with this place. 

Thoroughly disgusted and completely fed up customer!

My husband went thru drive thru this morning, ordering 8 breakfast burritos for his crew. He was told he needed to call ahead...reallly?? Our business will go to other establishments on his route. Guess it's not fast food after all!!

Update 7/25: Still painfully slow drive-thru. Clearly management does not care or this wouldn't be an issue. Been coming to this location for a year now and they haven't figured it out. There's absolutely no reason why I should be sitting in drive-through for a solid 10 minutes. The line doesn't even begin to move quickly after one car leaves with a tall order, everybody in the line could order a small Pepsi and it would still be this bad, I don't understand it.

When this Taco Bell location gets it right... they do a phenomenal job. On those off nights, when they're bored, not listening or otherwise distracted, they fail across the board. For the most part, the staff is quite nice and hospitable, being in a touristy area (just off of International Drive). Get the Cinnabon Delights for a yummy nightcap.

I was so excited when this place went in. But I have two main problems. The first isn't really their fault; the place is insane to get in and out of.
