The location on Central Florida Pkwy (and in its traffic) makes it frustrating to get in or out of their lot. The second is that while their food turnaround is super quick (a plus) they don't always cook the items long enough. For instance I've yet to get a quesadilla from there that had any brown or crisp on it at all.
Almost 40 minutes to get our food. Service is EXTREMELY slow, "fast food" is just a label.

I go to this Taco Bell because it's close to home and is usually open late. However, their service is terrible.  I use the drive through and I end up waiting 10 min or more just order and it is backed up with no end in sight.  I get better food and better service at a chick fil a or a mcdonalds, this is slow and it's not gourmet food!! The staff are always nice but hire more people, having to wait a total of 30 minutes because I couldn't get out of the line due to the planter next to me, is ridiculous.  Drive thrus are for quick service, if I wanted to wait I could go to a sit down.  Worst time service I've ever experienced. Hire more people if you need to but I don't think I'll be coming here anymore.
Great service. Quick. Xavier did an amazing job. He spoke clearly. He was polite. An all around great ambassador for TB. Well done mate. 5 star employee. Promote now!

I rang the bell for JANET! everyone else was doing their own thing , the guy interrupted and didn't know what he was talking abt. Janet had a great attitude even for drunk people at midnight and took care of our order in a timely fashion. Excellent customer service. Get it girl. From, the gay trio on July 3rd evening.

Be aware when visiting this Franchise that they do not use corporate prices. Every item is much more expensive and they don't have any of the specials. If you're looking for value prices then do not goto this establishment.

I think the problem here is Management. They hire the wrong people. I came in the morning for breakfast and they forgot two of my orders, and the funny thing is that I was the only car in the drive through. The last time that happened was last year when I ordered from here, and than two weeks before. They either charge me wrong, give me the wrong order, or make me wait fifteen minutes or so. The management has to get fired, and hire a new management team.

Although they did corrected my order, which did take another fifteen minutes or so and made me late to work. I give them two stars.


Not recommended.

This place deserves a ZERO star! We were feeling hungry after the BB game last night 7/3 this taco bell was close to our hotel so what the heck we gave it a shot!  MUCHO MISTAKE! Food was cold I had a chicken bacon chulupa really it was literally 2 pieces of chicken in my taco it was full of sour cream... and taste like CRAP!!  Hubby's meal wasn't any better! Pass right on by this taco bell... not worth a damn cent!
Ordered 4 items to go. Got home and none of them were correct. Oy. Felt like I burned through $12 of food that didn't hit the spot

I don't think this location can stay open as-is.

The facility is in poor shape. Dirty, for one. Many of the chairs are patched with duct tape.

Next, with all the traffic circles and freeway ramps, it's like a puzzle to even get in and out of this place.

Finally, the employees seemed bothered and annoyed by customers. The food was not assembled well (by normal taco bell standards).

I'd recommend not going to this location.

Please teach ALL your employees what Fresco style means.  Part of what it means is no Baja Sauce and no cheese.  I'm tired of getting home from the late night drive-thru to find it was made wrong.  I hate throwing food out and my money away. This happens close to 1/5 times.  20% of the time is too high to be throwing improperly made food away.  The cheese I can check quickly, even though I shouldn't have to.  The Baja Sauce usually isn't easily detectable in a car at night until after biting into it, at which point I want to barf.  If you could train your employees what Fresco style meant it would be great.  Don't assume they know because I guarantee you...they do not.  Thank you.

I am so tired of this particular Taco Bell I'm done with them. They consistently screw up our orders, and this evening they made me wait longer than usual, while the manager and two of the staff are goofing around while one young lady seems to be doing all the work. 
I get home to find I didn't get a chicken burrito I paid for. I called the phone number on the receipt and it rang until someone picked up the phone and hung it up.
There's another Taco Bell about 2 miles west of this one, that will be getting my business and Taco Bell corporate is getting a complaint

This is by far the best Taco Bell in the South Austin area... They are accurate through and friendly. Love Spicy (Green Chile) Burritos and they are the only ones that make them great and with onions... A+

Our cashier/server Alyssa gave us the best experience! Food came out correct and quick! She was so nice and sweet and always smiled and had the most friendly service I've ever had! I will definitely be back here when I come back to orlando Florida .

I have been to this location over ten times because it's close by, but every time I go they get my order wrong. 50% of the time the food is good, other 50% it's sloppy or just tastes bad. One night as  I was sitting in the drive thru one of the employees (large African American girl) had just finished her shift and was outside and asked me to knock on the window do she could pass a carton of cigs through to her co worker. Another time I was in the drive thru another employee walked right up to the window Infront of my face, knocked and asked the employee inside to hand her her jacket from the back. So unprofessional in this location.
Web site says 6:30 open I drove 3 miles out of my way to find out they don't open until 7:00 soooooo disappointed.
Food was smashed into pieces and tacos were missing ingredients. Terrible quality control.
Slowest Taco Bell in the Portland Metro area. Why can't they just hire 1 or 2 more employees for the evening shift?

It is cheap.

While the food is of questionable quality, the same thing can be said for all of the fast food restaurants on Main Street in Apopka.

This Taco Bell has pretty good customer service, though, and it has recently gone through a remodel.

At one time you could go to Taco Bell and get solid food.  Not the best, but good solid meals anytime.  Now they have time of day with disgusting and limited menus.  And they don't tell you when the limited menus are in effect until you try to order.  I made the mistake of trying to order a taco.  From Taco Bell!  Crazy!  Next I'll try ordering a burger from Burger King.

6/26/2018:  Melissa os working her *** off behind the counter.  TOTAL HUSTLE.  I love to see a hard worker.  She deserves a HUGE raise.  Owner, take notice, this message comes from someone who recognizes hard work and appreciates it.  

Taco Bell tasty as usual

Taco Bell is a magical place to go be happy.  At least it is to me.  But, this Taco Bell location in particular is at the top of the game.  It is so clean and organized.  The sauce packets are perfectly stacked and the tables are always clean.  In addition (and this is almost weird for a Taco Bell), the staff is incredibly courteous.  They are quick and not the typical disinterested fast food worker.

I love this place

Perhaps the slowest fast food in existence. Communicating with the order taker for my 3 items almost stretched my patience to the limit. And, yes, I do articulate in grammatically correct English. I'm glad my order didn't have anything wrong with it because I definitely would not have wanted to work out any difficulties with this Taco Bell based upon the other reviews. I know now that this is a location to avoid at all costs.

Worst Taco Bell by far in Oregon. It doesn't matter how many times you tell them What you want in your food. It always come up as the "chefs choice" and he's horrible. I will never return to here again and I hope they get there act together. It's like they have a bunch of idiots working there and they are just throwing things to wall and hoping it sticks. It's just sad...

The service was terribly slow and I definitely got food poisoning from here. The food I got seemed incredibly old and I spent the rest of my night for 6 hrs puking and pooping. It was a terrible experience and ill never be able to eat taco bell again. I was never a big fan but this put the final nail in the coffin for sure
The staff here is incompetent. I always have to wait a significant amount of time to even place my order, especially when there's no one else in the store.

It's too bad that a metropolis as large as Boston would banish its Taco Bells, home of Fourth Meal, the almost-beef taco, and many an impromptu case of the munchies, to its periphery.  (The other is available in the Cambridgeside Galleria; the Boston University Taco Bell Express closed several years ago).  Perhaps to pay the community back for it's oversight, Yum! seems to have tacked on a perfectly good Long John's - home of the best mass-produced fast food french fry in the business - to this location.

What's not to like about this TB/LJS?  It's clean, well-lit, Wi-Fi'd, and features the new "Cantina Bell" menu which seems to have taken a chunk out of Chipotle's stock price recently.  Actually reasonable!

A down side is the location - on eastbound VFW Parkway, getting to LJS often requires an overshoot U-turn on VFW; forget about getting there by foot or by bike!  Finally, getting back onto VFW sometimes requires a pedal-to-the-metal drag race to speed back into traffic.

But who's complaining?  12-pack taco boxes don't eat themselves!

I dont eat out too often, too poor to even do it. lol but this was a better place around my area. The staff was great, it was actually really clean inside, and they get your orders right. Not much else you could ask for from a fast food place.

Worse Taco Bell ever.  If you like waiting 25-30 minutes for your order that's rarely correct, then this is your place.  I'm not sure why I've come back a few times, probably because they're the only TB nearby but it's always the same.  Usually one or two insanely slow cooks while everyone else stands around talking about their plans for the weekend and complaining about how they're excited for their next break. (Since they're working so hard.).  Come on Taco Bell, step it up.

Taco Bell is continually redefining "fast food" in the 21st century. Apparently this Taco Bell isn't adequately staffed for 3 cars in the fast food lane at 11pm at night. I spent 20 minutes waiting for orders to be taken (3 cars mind you) before we could pull up to see a menu. I went through half of Michael Jackson's "Off the Wall" in the process.

Isn't this the fast food chain that created a 4th Meal? How is it that they aren't prepared? They can't handle 3 drunks waiting for a mix of tortillas, cheese, and mystery meat at 11pm? 

Totally over Taco Bell. No one wants to wait in a fast food lane that takes 30 minutes to get shitty food. The intrigue is over along with your Doritos tacos.

I am updating my review because the entire location was torn down, rebuilt and it appears the entire staff has been fired in favor of a new crew. It hasn't opened yet but thankfully the earth has been cleansed of the worst Taco Bell in the world.
Poor service, bell was broken and not very nautical in nature. Also, the staff was not very charming as mentioned in a previous review.

I loveeee taco bell BUTTT this one is a joke.  Slowest service ever.  On average you will wait 5-10 minutes for the most basic of orders and when you do get your food, if it is even what you ordered, it is a mess.  Finger wholes in the tortilla from sloppy wrapping.  Broken shells on taco. Drink not full (drive through)  At night you could easily wait 20 plus minutes!!!  CLEARLY A PROBLEM WITH THIS LOCATION!!!!
Free wi-fi doesn't work; it connects but won't load site to agree to terms of use. #21stcenturyfail
Definatly the BEST Taco Bell I have ever had (only used the drive through) the service is always awesome and the food is yummy and quick, what more can u ask for?

I went about a month ago at night, and they were accepting cash only. Therefore, I didn't even get to order. I did get to wait in the drive thru line for an hour for them to tell me that though. This isn't the first time they've done cash only, but some nights they do accept card payments. A sign at the beginning of the line stating which forms of payment they're accepting that night would be nice.

I used to frequent this location with some accuracy, but they were usually accommodating about it. In the past couple of months...the person at the drive through has been unfriendly but tolerable until a few days ago. The woman attempting to take my order was rude, kept cutting me off while trying to order, and actually yelled at me.

Other reviews have shitty grammar and spelling. 

Their sentiments are true. Service is slow, unreliable and all around bad. 

Preparation of menu items is poor. 

Staff is poor. 

Wait time for the drive thru is the worst of any Taco Bell I've ever been to. 

I wish the mafia would firebomb this place.

As Taco Bell goes, this one is okay. The drive through is open late, earning it a bonus star. Dining in is hit or miss.  If you ask for light lettuce on your taco they seem to think it means you want extra tomatoes,  if they manage to actually give you light lettuce, I don't understand why.

You need to update the whole building. 
How are you going to have tea urns without drip trays ? That's dirty.

The Chalupa box is life though. Daily Happy Hour Freezes from 2-5 pm. That's wonderful ! Keep having great deals. The food is usually quick & Sanchez is cool. Easy & affordable to all demographics. I appreciate the franchise. Maybe it's just not a good one to work for.

Nevertheless, I love inexpensive tacos  & it's essentially the closest food from the house.

Great experience from a bunch of young kids working at the Taco Bell in West Roxbury. Three different kids help me at this Taco Bell all had a smile and look like they were having fun while serving me. The Parents, owner and manager should be proud. There just not enough kids raised with the hardworking and great courtesy shown to there customers anymore!

Wtf. I seriously hate you guys. 

After waiting in the drive through line for twenty minutes, I received the wrong order. Tried to go inside, was met at the door by all 6 employees, including the "manager" none of which would open the door to even speak to me, let alone replace my order. Was motioned back into the twenty minute drive through line. Waited, received order, still wrong. An hour of my life that I'll never get back. Awesome.

Slowest Taco Bell ever. Doesn't matter what time you come, it always takes at least 15+ minutes. Also, they don't listen, so after waiting 15+ minutes for your food 95% of the time it is terribly terribly wrong. I ordered a bean and cheese burrito... And somehow ended up with a chipotle ranch and nacho cheese burrito.... By far the grossest thing ever... Went back again, and again bean and cheese was somehow translated to rice, spicy ranch and nacho cheese....

This taco bell is the slowest Taco Bell. Two employees where standing outside. And the drive three line was pretty much on the highway. I've been sitting here for food for about 30 minutes. I would give zero stars.

Terrible service on Sunday 19 November at 6pm. Lady at drive thru was rude and short with us. She gave us only half our order. Asked for Taco Supremes, they are regular. Sauces missing. Not going back. Plenty of other places on Roswell Rd.

Have you been living under a rock? Less than 30% beef. I haven't eaten Toxic Hell in a long time & I never will again. I rank the food somewhere above KFC & slightly below eating a cat lump out of the litter box.
PS. Where I grew up, it was common knowledge that the employees spit & did other less than desirable things in the various meats & sauces.

So...why are there 2 people in line that haven't even been greeted when there are 3 employees sitting at the table behind us talking about missing court dates? Apparently only one of them was on the clock but a simple, "we will be right with you" would have been better. This is why people get treated differently, it's because some people act differently.
Delicious.  Great late night food anytime, everytime.  They have yet to disappoint me.
It could be better, but beefy five layer burritos do get the job done.

Bad service it almost took them half hour in the drive thru,  there wasn that many cars neither, i couldnt evem eat since i was on my lunch break its always teenagers working no to blme them its just poor managment.
Sucks that there is only mcdonalds and taco bell close by.

My first night going here they ran out of ground beef. My second time going here because they ran out of ground beef they piled on a lot of lettuce and very little meat I will not eat from Taco Bell in M AN OR Texas anymore

I really enjoy the service I receive here. We only go for Long John Silver's and, because it is the only one around, I wish they would serve LJS after 9pm. The LJS menu offerings are a bit too limited for me to give this place 5 stars. For example, the popcorn shrimp is only offered as a side and not a meal...bring back the meal!

3rd weekend in a row where I go late , it's not busy and I pay for the items I want and don't get them. the worst part is over paying for steak and getting beef. Never again , done with this horrible service and chain.

I can't bring myself to give this restaurant more than one star despite it really being a location which offers occasional excellence.  

The short of it is, if you're going in the evening you better pray to whatever god you worship that Armani is on shift.  That guy runs a tight ship, is always friendly, always fast, and always accurate.  You really could not want anything more from the experience when that guy is running the shift.

On the other hand, there's another guy who runs evenings who is such a giant turd, I'm compelled to give this location a single star because yes, this guy is really that terrible.  He's high pretty much any time you go, the line will be wrapped around the building and even if there are only 2 or 3 people in front of you, you should expect literally a 20-minute minimum wait time( note that's a minimum, as in it ranges much longer) You'll also be lucky if the order is right.

Take a look through the drive thru window sometime and you'd see why his shift runs so slow.  He makes his staff do all the work while he shamelessly stands in eyesight of the patrons peering through his bloodshot eyes at his phone, texting and doing anything but helping expedite the orders.  The one job he gives himself is filling the drinks, and he doesn't even do that well.  He hates waiting on the foam to go down, so he tops it out and slaps a lid on it, handing you a beverage that's easily 4-6 ounces less than you paid for.

I really can't say enough bad about that guy, he is actually the worst fast food worker I've ever dealt with.  When he's on shift we go over to Wendy's or if my wife is just having to have Taco Bell, I'll drive down to the Polaris location instead, despite living right next door to this one.  The wait, the frustration, and the disappointment is too much.  I can get to Polaris and back by the time I would have gotten through his line.  I also occasionally get grill items tasting like cleaning solution from him, so that's another issue.

Again, if Armani is on shift, have at it, otherwise avoid this location like the plague.  The potential of how awful your visit can be is heavily outweighed by how good it might be.  Save yourself, go literally anywhere else.

Probably one of the best experiences I've had at a Taco Bell. The guy at the drive thru window was very nice and although I didn't get his name, he definitely deserves some sort of promotion! As a server, I like seeing other people get rewarded for good customer service.

I  don't know how this place got a 2 star rating it clearly deserves 1 star.
I went to this restaurant 3 different times and it was the same situation every time. Stale food-dirty floors-slow service.
I don't know who is running this joint but it clearly needs new management.
What I seen was a bunch of teens running around with no leadership. I also believe I contacted slight traces of food poisoning from this very same place. Eat here with your own discretion. As for me I will never eat at this one again I'll cook my own food first. I don't know what happened to the taco bell chain, this one does not represent the brand very well.

Saw some pretty weird stuff at this one. Right as I pull up there were 2 young girls leaving and this was at 1020 at night. So I tried going in and a guy in a wheelchair with no taco bell shirt told me they were closed so I decided to go through the drive thru instead. After I order I waited for about 30 minutes in the drive thru and while I'm waiting I see some guy leave with his huge dog and then I see other people inside not wearing the taco bell uniform so once it was my turn I just left. Way too many red flags for me to get my food here. I don't recommend this place at all. I mean I know it's taco bell but still I don't want dog hair in my food or who knows what else the people are doing in there. Shady.

Gone to this location at twice and both times they forgot half our order. 
The more expensive parts of our order at that...
I do not believe my luck is this bad to have it happen twice so close together, so someone needs to get it together in there.
If you really need fast food, don't go here. They take forever.  Occasionally they will give you a wrong order as well. Hope they turn it around.
This location is consistent with other locations.  The menu is standard and the service is quick and cordial.
great late night food choice :)  they got my whole veggie order correct :D

I had a really pleasant Taco Bell experience here!!

The woman on the drive-through mic had us cracking up during our interaction. We asked her how she was, and she said, "I am AWESOME!" and we said, "That's AWESOME!" and she happily replied, "Isn't it?!". It's nice to have a drive-through experience that wasn't sullen, apathetic, or plain lazy. She really seemed happy to be there.

Plus, our tacos were absolutely STUFFED. I swear, my crispy potato taco (NOMNOM) had twice as much stuffing as it was supposed to.

I will DEFINITELY be back to this Taco Bell! :)

excellent customer service; especially thanks to Tamika, possibly the most outgoing and friendly person I've encountered in years.
btw... I'm reviewing this 'all things equal'... and comparing it to other TACO BELLS... not to Ten Tables or Espalier! 
You like taco bell?... then this one is your BEST bet!

I'll keep this on point: I just stopped for four Doritos Locos Fiery tacos. I was starving. 

The line was slow. My tacos smelled and tasted like they had freezer burn. I won't do this Taco Bell again for a long, long time.

I just tried to get some food from here but their doors are locked and they parked a car in the drive thru to keep people from ordering. There was no one inside even though they are supposed to be open until 3am. There was also no sign on the door indicating whether or not they were experiencing an issue.
TERRIBLE! My young son got horrendous food poisoning from this location a month ago. Do not eat here!
It literally smelled like someone took a fresh dump next to the fountain drinks. lol!

I hope you have at least ten minutes to spare if you opt to use the drive-thru. I also hope you don't care about taco sauce, because they rarely will give you more than one per taco, and you may not even get one for your burrito, should you ask.

That said, the people who work here are generally polite, it's just very slow and they skimp on the taco sauce, which is pretty annoying.

Just waited to order our food for 10 minutes in the drive thru after being told "be right with you". We even gave up one time and went back to the drive thru and received no greeting whatsoever. Finally gave up and went to the trusty Steak n' Shake. Terrible, just terrible.

Charming staff, good quality food for Taco Bell. They take your order fast and rarely make mistakes.  The radio lady always puts a smile on my face.

Only bad thing is that they can make you wait awhile in the drive through- priority goes to customers at the counter.  There's a little clock inside that measures each car's window wait time and I've seen it hit 12 minutes while I idled.  This happens regardless of whether anyone is in line.  So either go inside, or be prepared to give yourself an extra quarter hour to eat.

Slowest. Taco Bell. Ever. The few times we've been here, it's been 20+ minutes in the drive thru for no apparent reason. Plus, the orders were never exactly right. Taco Bell will always be near and dear to my heart, but I'd rather drive an extra 15 minutes to Chamblee than wait in this line again!! Get it together, Sandy Springs Taco Bell crew!
Nicest staff I've ever encountered at a Taco Bell , I definitely will bypass the Taco Bell on delk road to come to this one

Best Taco Bell. The tortillas are crispy, not soggy.  The staff is friendly and competent. They seem to do all the little things right (including hiring), which makes it as high-quality as a Taco Bell can get.

I love taco bell but this location is something else...I have yet to come here and get the proper service. Maybe it is just my luck...but after the 4th time and the order is not correct it gets frustrating. I don't even feel like going into detail with this one. The lack of word count should suffice as to how I feel about this location.

Ah, Taco Bell. Your run of the mill late-night hotspot for all of your cheesy faux-Mexican needs. Why would I spend the time reviewing a Taco Bell?

Because the service is freaking amazing at this location. Seriously - these are some of the most genuine, hardworking fast food workers I've ever seen. 

I come here quite frequently for work. I often bring clients through the drive-thru to grab a bite. Sometimes my clients aren't quite sure what they want, and order without exchanging niceties such as "please" and "thank you." On many occasions there are some unique requests made, and my clients may get upset. 

But this Taco Bell has accommodated them *every single time* with the upmost professionalism and grace. They've dealt with some situations who would make lots of people (including myself) impatient without any fuss or attitude that I'd get from other fast food restaurants. Orders are always accurate, and the service is always friendly and apologetic even when there isn't a reason to be sorry.

I just want to send a thumbs up and thank you to the staff here for all of your hard work and excellence in customer service. Y'all rock out hard.

Went there this past Sunday.  Parking lot was empty and was the only car in the drive through.  Placed our order and then pulled up and waited about 3 minutes for someone to come to the window and take the payment.  Then waited another 12 minutes and didn't see anyone in there.  Meanwhile 2 cars behind me in the drive through took off.  Finally honked the horn and told them I wanted a refund.  They said only 2 people showed up to work and they were short staffed.  If they don't have enough people to run the place then they need to close down instead of wasting customer's time!

I have never had an issue with a Taco Bell like the issue I had with this one. Not only did it take too long for them to take my order it then took them too long to make it...and then they gave me a burnt quesadilla. The woman handed it to me and said "I hope you enjoy that. It's a bit over done." Overdone and burnt are two very different things! Save yourself the trouble and go somewhere else.

By this point you can consider me a Taco Bell connoisseur. I order just about the same thing every time, so it's pretty easy to judge a good Taco Bell from a poor one.

Have to say that, while not exactly a generous serving, the food here was easily the freshest I've tasted at a T-Bell in the Central Florida area. Just really good. The service was better than what you expect at a fast food restaurant, the girl even gave me a free bag of chips when I asked if I could have a few more since half of the one I was given was crumbs.

I'll definitely be back to this location if I'm in the area. 4 stars.

I don't even understand how this Taco Bell is surviving, but I will not even waste my time or my money at this location. On several occasions I have had to pull off after ordering because the drive thru service is the slowest you can possible find. If there were an award to give for slowest service it is most definitely an award this location should get. After sitting in the drive through for over 15 min...I finally get my food...I drive off and pull my food out and it's cold. I end up going back to get a refund and I go inside and there are 2 customers in the dining room and a family of 3 trying to decide what to order. The young man behind the counter was very friendly and apologetic. He tells the manager I wanted a refund...I was offered my refund or they can make my food all over again...I'll pass...I'll take my refund. He then tells me the manager will be over to do my refund...a few minutes go by then the manager calls the young man back over to her and then he comes back to say he'll do my refund. Not once did the manager come over to apologize for the service or the food that I recieved. Whoever runs this establishment needs to work on retraining management and I'm sure at this point work on customer satisfaction and retaining customers. I'll spend my money at the surrounding eateries. There is a new taco place in the Publix plaza...they will be my new taco place...and as far as late night...steak and shake is right across the street...they are open 24hrs and you won't have to waste valuable time on getting your food in a timely manner...Taco Bell get it together!

This place has made me hate all Taco Bells. Everytime I go, my food is cold by the time I get home, which is literally a block away, and the order is always wrong somehow. How hard is it to not put sour cream on a freakin taco. They could use some new management and then maybe I'll consider trying again.

Food is fine. When they remember to put what you order and the condiments you ask for in the bag. I go here often and more than 1/2 the time I get the wrong sauce, no sauce, no napkins, or food left out of the order. This is all drive-thru. If you go check you stuff before you pull off!!! You have been warned!!!

One of the best taco bells in columbus.  Friendly people, orders are generally correct, and the products taste well and are prepared properly.

Only downside is they are a bit slower than other TBells
Delicious I like Taco Bell. The staff is okay... they ran out of napkins but food comes quick overall decent location open real late.
All I ordered was a couple tacos and it took AGES! For an exhausted pregnant women trying to grab a quick bite on her way home from the airport it was exactly the opposite of what I was hoping for.
This is a normal Taco Bell. That's all that needs to be said. If you value your waistline, only go here seldom.
Slowest Taco Bell north of the border. Please hire some faster people. I could have made it at home in better time
All i have to say is the cheapest version of Mexican style food! Yo quierro Taco Bell!

I didn't even know people would write reviews for fast food chains.  But I frequent this place on average once per month, about.  Pretty much every time they are friendly and fast, they seem to actually care and that is hard to find anywhere in the fast food biz.  I appreciate that!

VEGETARIANS BEWARE!
This Taco Bell is horrible!! Ordered an am crunchwrap and I specified over and over about how there can be absolutely no meat in it, the ordered said yes of course but when I get home to eat the crunchwrap I break it open and find bacon bits everywhere! Do not, I repeat DO NOT TRUST this Taco Bell.

Taco Bell, I am disappoint. 

Two bean burritos minus the cheese was a huge fail. The burritos had a diameter of a golf ball. The beans tasted old and the tortilla seemed to be aged as well. 

The speed of service was good, but when they skip on making a proper burrito, you know why.

Never again am I going here to satisfy my Taco Bell craving.

Maybe I came on a bad night, but I was pretty disappointed with the wait time at this Taco Bell.  I understand that it was a weekend night which is Taco Bell's peak time.  However, I noticed that the issue seemed to be the time it took to get food instead of the volume of customers.  It would take about 5 minutes for each customer to get their food.  Annnd, when you're behind 6 or 7 cars when you pull up, you get the picture.  When I finally got my order, items were missing.  After spending ~40 minutes in line, I was frustrated that my order wasn't even correct.

I'd be willing to give them a pass if they were at least getting orders out quickly, but they did not seem to have an effective system in place that night.  I will probably give them another shot because of the convenience and my love for their burritos.  However, this experience still left a bad impression.  Big crowds on weekends is no surprise, so there really is no excuse.

Let me tell you, I'm a Taco Bell ride or die but it should NOT consistently take 20+ minutes to get through the drive through. I've worked in the food service industry and I know it does not take that long to wrap some damn beans in a tortilla... currently sitting in the drive through (minute 26) and the employees are just sitting around and there's at least 7 cars behind me

This Taco Bell is absolutely terrible. I don't consider myself to be high maintenance when it comes to my TB order, but apparently to this location, I'm asking far too much. Every single time I come here, I order the same two things. A cool ranch supreme taco, and a bean burrito with extra red sauce, extra onions, add sour cream, add nacho cheese. Every time I visit, one or both parts of my enigma of an order, are wrong. Today my broken taco had no sour scream, and my sour cream and nacho cheese, that I pay an extra $1.05 extra for, might I add, weren't even on my bean burrito. This type of thing happens every.single.time I visit this location. I fill out the online surveys every time my order is a mess, and nothing has ever changed at this location in that last 3 years, since I started going here. So this was it for me. I won't be returning to this Taco Bell until I hear that it's got it's crap together, or ever.
This has got to be the longest I have ever waited in a drive thru.  So far 15 minutes.. can't really get out of line..

The food is the same as you get at any Taco Bell.  

But the service here is freakishly good.

The staff is friendly and courteous and they act like they actually care whether you're happy or not.

The manager here really deserves to be complimented because he clearly has a knack for hiring great people and keeping them happy.

Where to start......

The lady was laughing and giggling while we were trying to order and was rude and obnoxious. We got to the first window and she acted like we were on crack when we asked for an extra Pepsi. She had attitude and the service was painfully slow. She forgot a burrito, didn't give us napkins and did not give us our guacamole! 

Go to the McDonald's instead, they are friendly and the service is scary quick.

Your typical Taco Bell I guess, I don't eat there often, but there are usually some kids hanging around their cars in the front of the place, and the guy who took my order told me at the drive-thru that he wanted to get high after work - seriously. Why do people tell me these things?
Taco Bell will always be Taco Bell in terms of their food quality.  However, today I received great customer service from Kenny R in the drive through.  She was very friendly and patient with us.

I was the only person in line inside. After waiting for five minutes and not even receiving acknowledgement from any of  the three employees that saw me standing, I left. As a circled the building to exit, there were also no cars in the drive through. I guess they just didn't want my business? Couldn't even be bothered to lie and say "We'll be with you in a minute".

Only other comment I can make was that I have been here once before. I used the drive through around 10:00pm on a Friday night. There were three cars in front of me. The first car took about 10 minutes to get their order. After waiting a few minutes I shut my car down. Again, about 10 minutes for the next car. Only one more car in front of me. I moved up and shut down. Same thing. My turn, pull up to window shut down car. Yet again, about 10 minutes. Overall wait in drive through was about 45-50 minutes with three cars in front of me.

I will never return here. Shame as they are just a few minutes around the corner from my house.

PDQ restaurant across the street has great service, quality food, quick service, and a clean restaurant. If you get tired of waiting over here a Taco Hell, hop across the road!
This Taco Bell location is always very clean and 100% accurate with their orders love the new items they always put out as well. My dog loves the chicken grillers!

Don't do it. I check in on this Taco Bell about once a year and it's getting to the point where it's just gross. Orders take 20 - 30 minutes to arrive at the counter and there is never a clean table. The beans were so dry they may as well have been powdered. And heck, don't expect to ever get an order right here. It's sad. They just can't handle the basics.

Ok, so I only seldom eat fast food and I don't think Yelp! reviews for fast food restaurants are necessary, but this Taco Bell impressed me so much that I had to write one!

I stopped in the drive-thru yesterday because I needed a quick post-workout meal. First off, the gentleman who took my order was as sweet as a peach. His voice was so calming and soothing -- not like your typical "let me just rush to get your order and get you out of here" voice.

I ordered two chalupas sub beans for meat, no cheese, no sour cream. He got my order perfectly. Sometimes I would have to repeat the beans for meat thing because people are sometimes like, "What? No meat?"

Same young gentleman who took my order also gave me a generous amount of hot sauce packets and napkins. YES! I dislike when places are stingy with condiments and napkins. Like yo, I like sauce and I'm a messy eater. + they're both cheap items. My receipt was in the bag just like I wanted it to be and my order was on point.

Once again, I rarely eat Taco Bell or fast food for that matter, but if I do again, I will definitely be stopping by this specific TB location!

Worst service I have ever had. Sat in the drive thru line for 30 mins. At one point I was about to leave, but couldn't because there was a car in front of me and behind me with no way to get free. Went to order food, they either didn't have it or did not make it after a certain time. The crew member was unfriendly and did not make an attempt to at least empathize. After a 14hr shift, I just wanted food and to go home.
It's Taco Bell so you know what you're going to get. They actually stay open and stick to their posted hours. Accurate with your order and quick service. No complaints here!

Worst Taco Bell ever! I never complain on Yelp. This location closes 30 min early every day and leaves the open sign on. They tell  you to complain to corporate if you ask why the sign is on and they're closed. I work in the service industry and totally understand last call but this is ridiculous. Horrible service. Go to the one on Central Florida parkway, they stick to their set hours.

If you go inside and order it only takes 30 minutes verse the drive-thru which takes an hour! There's clearly no real management here it shouldn't take so long to get fast food. The only reason I go back is because the drive thru person is usually pretty nice.

Always been a fan of Taco Bell breakfast, and this is the newest addition to the Manor fast food chains..being new, of course it has that fresh construction smell and the service was good..wife gets the bacon Chalupa and I went with the steak grande burrito with a hash browns on the side..and a side of cinna  bits, everything was fresh and hot..and they have Diablo sauce..most Bells do not carry it..smoky, nose running spicy and great on any item on the menu..it's nice and close to the house and I'm sure we will be back. I do hope they maintain the standards they have set after grand opening wears off.

The service here is unacceptable. 10+ minutes for a simple order at the counter to eat in the restaurant is not good, especially during the lunch rush. The 3 people ahead of me, their orders were wrong, and I saw 2 people who ordered after me get their food prior to mine, and even their orders were incorrect.  I spoke to a coworker when I got back to the office and he said that his orders have always been wrong at this location.
Everytime I go to this Taco Bell my order comes out wrong. Also, the drive thru staff is rude. I will not go to this location anymore.

Great service & the food was way above another Taco Bell that we had on the other side of town. Wish we had known about this Taco Bell sooner. The staff who work at this Taco Bell are happy to be there and have a Manager who appreciate her employees. This is very impressive to me. Great job!

why do I keep coming back
Just cheap enough to save a dime.
Two words: crispy burrito
Where's the next Taco Time?

Unbelievable. Horrible location. Drive thru is fast but food is barely thrown together, sometimes not even made correctly or missing all together. I would be willing to wait an extra 30 seconds to see some love put into my food. Staff has gotten better but still never attentive. Today I ordered a side of rice and it was about 1/3 full. In the past my tiny rice container is at least full... THIS LOCATION LACKS GOOD MANAGEMENT. PERIOD. MANAGER SHOULD BE REPLACED. I'll do it for you guys if the pay is right. If other Taco Bell locations can present themselves better, create a better experience and make food the proper way instead of shorting the customer than this location is capable of doing the same thing! Needs to be fixed... where are the owners? They would be mortified!

Overrated, just like all other late night junk food places in Boulder. This one is just like any other Taco Bell, just that there's a lot more drunk college students in line at night. If you go there during the day there's almost no one there, go there at night...and people are lined up like a bunch of 13 year old girls lined up for a Hannah Montana concert.

If you go at 3am on thursday-saturday be prepared to wait at least 30 minutes.

The slowest drivethru I have ever had to sit in. It's 9:23pm currently and I placed my order at 9:10 and I e moved one car closer to the window. This isn't a solo occurrence either....almost every time I visit it's like this. I'm just glad I don't go often. Hire some more employees or something.

Open later than most of the other places in the area, so once it gets a bit later be prepared to wait in a long line.. The food is like any other Taco Bell but I don't think they've ever gotten my order right on the first try. A few times I've been given someone else's food. Double check and triple check before you drive away!

Good food, accurate orders, friendly staff.
I've been to this Taco Bell during lunch rush twice recently; drove thru the first time... quick, friendly and good food. Went inside the second time because the drive thru line was long. There was a line inside too and although they should've had another person running a register, the person who helped me was very nice and apologized for the wait. The food came out good and the order was correct.

I know it's ridiculous that I'm reviewing a Taco Bell. But this one deserves it. First off, I like Taco Bell. I'm dubious of their beef, so I generally avoid that.  And for everything else, I think you get a good bang for your buck.

This one location is especially good though. The employees actually appear to care about their job. This shouldn't be so novel, but at a fast food place it is. When I asked for something without beef, the girl happily asked if I wanted beans instead (and their beans are good.  Not just good for fast food. Actually good.) 

The food comes out faster than most other TB's and it's far and away the cleanest fast food establishment I've ever stepped into. And borders on OCD-ness with the taco sauce packages neatly stacked. 

Plus, if you want fries with your cheesy bean and rice burrito, you can get them because it doubles as a Long John Silver's (which I've actually never tried.) 

And just as an added bonus, there's the "Captain's Bell" which you're encouraged to ring if you liked your service. So go there and do it.

Lunch today there was amazing! This group of employees out did themselves by being polite and making the best meal I ever had at a Taco Bell. I ordered the beef tostadas and a hard shell beef . My tostadas was very tasteful and loaded with tomatoes! The taco was crunchy and filled to the brim! Even my ice tea tasted good! And the price was very reasonable!

I live right next to this taco bell and have been going here since i was very young. These tacos have been a simple pleasure growing up. I came back yesterday during a busy time for them because the drive thru was backed up so i walked inside to order. After ordering i sat and waited...for at least 15 minutes, i was watching the only white kid making my food...i was falling asleep watching the speed of his hands slowly reaching the ground beef. Unbelievable how they hire people incapable of working at a decent pace. The mexican manager guy (im assuming) is extremely friendly though because when he hands out the food he always has a happy expression even when its clearly busy. I will keep coming back due to the convenience of location but they really need to work on effecient management

TL:DR not very fast for being fast food

Taco Bell is a guilty pleasure of mine. I truly wish there were a closer location so I never had to return to this one. There hasn't been a single time where I was given my whole complete order in the drive through. I make sure to check my bag every time now, and always wind up turning around and going back. Poor, rude service too! Today was a new level of disgust, though. Got home to find a very visible, long dark hair lounging in my nachos. Enough is enough with this terribly managed location.
Staff have a combined IQ  of -8. Drive thru is always a 30+ minute wait after 9pm. My left big toe could make a better burrito. Go to the Taco Bell a little farther west by Fred Meyer gas station.

This is the only Taco Bell in Boulder where you can order online, that's a plus if you have a lot of customizations. If you want to try something awesome, I recommend getting the Naked Chalupa - add pico de gallo - and jalapenos...this is the BEST fast food I've ever eaten. no joke ( take a look at my review of the Arapahoe TB; YUK )  The Staff at Baseline is remarkably friendly too. They get an A+ from me
This is a swanky Taco Bell and clean inside. Julie has awesome customer service skills. The food is fresh and tasty. This location is hiring.
These people are so rude. Never coming here again. The Asian lady got an attitude because I requested NO BEANS! She lucky I was not in the mood and hungry.

Taco Bell isn't known for its fast drive thru. But this location has to be the worst. I think they must have difficulties being fully staffed. One time the person taking the orders was also the person preparing the food, so it took 20 minutes to get my order. We just tried to order for our teen and they said the grill is down so they weren't serving. Why not shut down? It's rare that the service inside or out is even close to that of other fast food restaurants. My son really needs another go to fast food place!

Often times we go into fast food restaurants with a preconceived thought that the service will be mediocre.  This wasn't the case at this location.  Upon entering the store I could tell the staff had taken care to make sure the store looked splendid.  Floors were spotless, decorations had been modified slightly for the Christmas season (which was nice), and the staff appeared to genuinely enjoy having people in the store.  Best yet, the food was consistent, timely and delicious.  Way to go!

Hope you only like tacos, because this store was stocked out of ingredients to make any other item on their menu. It's unfortunate when you can't order even a 3rd or 4th option. Plus had to wait about twenty minutes to go from the speaker box to the window. 

Hey, management: carrying razor thin inventory levels, it does you nothing but lose sales, and also give the evening shift labor - I highly recommend going to the other Taco Bell ten minutes down the road. At least you won't waste your time sitting in line to get something you really didn't want.
Friend begged for it. So we went. 3x. Each time, they left off one item. Drive-thru is friendly and courteous.
dirtiest place ive ever seen a roach was on the wall when i walked in and i just turned around and left.

I can generally expect quick and friendly service when I come here. I've only had my order messed up once (and I come here more often than I'd like to admit!), and it was just a minor mistake; Doritos shell vs regular. My only complaint is that the drive thru tends to take a long time, but then again, the order is always fresh and correct, so I don't mind waiting. Overall, there are gives and takes, but I enjoy coming to this location.

I can't say much about the food quality because I never got my food!  

I tried to get breakfast here on the way to work.  First of all, they don't start serving breakfast til 9 AM!  That's pretty late for on-the-way-to-work fast breakfast.  But I got there at 8:55 and decided to wait til they opened.  

At 9:03 they still weren't open so I honked.  Nothing.  Drove up to the window.  "Manny" explained that they weren't ready.  I said, "It's after 9, right?" and Manny said, "It's only 3 minutes."  He obviously was on "manana" time and didn't care how long I sat there or what time they actually started working.  

He didn't ask for my order or anything.  He kept repeating "We're getting ready.  It's only 3 minutes." Never asked for my order because they "weren't ready" at 9:05.  So I said I would just call the customer service number because this was poor service and he said, "Fine, call the number" and waved his hands and shut the window.  SO SO RUDE!  

After contemplating this I decided to go elsewhere (not really having a choice then as I would FULLY expect "Manny" to spit in my food if they ever made any.)  But I was annoyed so I went in to speak to the manager.  Guess who is the "ASST Manager"?  Yep, Rude Manny.  He kept saying, "What?  It's only 3 minutes!"  (Which by then was no longer true).  No apologies, no service.  He waved his badge at me, "I'm Manny, see?  Go call the number."

So I did.  And I will never go back to that Taco Bell.

And yes, their petty over-the-top fence barrier to prevent access to Einstein bagels from their parking lot is ridiculous.

This particular Taco Bell is the BEST of all Taco Bells I have ever eaten at. The restaurant is clean, well maintained, and it smells good. The staff have been very helpful to my 2 year old child and me, helping us with a high chair, bringing out our order to us, and even making funny faces at him when he gets fussy.

I enjoy the #1 which is a burrito supreme and a taco supreme (crunchy), then I add a pack or two of the "fire" sauce to add some spice.

the world's greatest Taco Bell. that's all there is to it. excellent customer service, zero wait time, and best part is their hours... at 2:30am when everything else is closed, Taco Bell on Cumberland is open to save the day...

Awful service! Went through around 11... didn't leave till after 11:30  had no idea it could even be possible for a taco drive thru to take so long! Very disappointing. After getting our drinks that had ice after we asked for no ice we got our food. Eager to go back and eat we looked in the bag and got no straws for our drinks and none of the mild sauce we asked for. Just wanted to relax and have a taco... not sit in a drive thru all night to receive a less than satisfactory meal. Just disappointing
Slow. Slow. slow. Food is as good as any other TB, but the service is bad. The people that work there are nice, but they are severely understaffed. They need to hire more people.

The people that work here are really stupid. I know that can be used too often on this cite but it is true here. They never get your order right. One night I went into the store because the drive thru was not moving and they had one employee working... one. The dining room never has clean tables. You can tell they do not clean the soda machine because there are flys and nats all around it. How you can present a restaurant in this condition is laughable. They just rebuilt the store to make it look nicer and the management is going to trash it with terrible employees. This taco bell has employees that make walking and talking seem so difficult that you wish that someone would just let them rest. Paying welfare to these people is better than letting them make my tacos.

I had to try that Doritos Locos taco creation. It was not nearly as good as I'd hoped. :(

This location provided quick, friendly service at lunchtime. I thought the cashier asked if I'd like to "add cinnamon twists for a dollar?" so I said yes. But what he REALLY said was "cinnamon twists 4 for a dollar," so I got four bags of those delicious, lightly greasy desserts.

And to top it all off, in the parking lot there was some entertainment in the form of one car stopping, backing up and pushing the smaller car behind it back a few feet. I guess they were mad at each other?? Unfortunately I missed the entire episode but what I was was a good show.
Why do I keep giving this location a chance?!!?! Stuck in the drive thru every time. Worst Taco Bell ever. 122nd and halsey location way better
Worst ever. I never expect super star service.  However treatment, quality, and at least people who pretend to care is not to much to ask for.  I'll let my pics explain
Nothing special service is ok and honestly not sure why anyone comes to this place i would say no go go to taco time

ALWAYS check your food before driving off from the Drive Thru.  My order isn't that difficult and they get it wrong about 25% of the time.  I always order a Crunchy Taco without meat, Cheesy Fiesta Potatoes and a Volcano Taco minus the meat.  Does that sound very difficult to punch in?  Other than that, it is a Taco Bell so the service is quick.

Best Taco Bell on this side of town.  I'm very happy with the cheap prices but good food.  Fed my whole family for under 10 bucks.  Excellent Service from Friendly cashier.  Would highly recommend a better sign because this taco bell is surrounded by trees and hard to see from the South bound lanes.

The Gentleman who served me and my family congratulated us on our baby. The food was great, but the human being serving the window warmed my heart... at little old Taco Bell. This is the one you should choose.
This is why people hate taco bell some one call corporate office and kill the manager here clearly poorly managed a3rd grader could do a better job. I feel like I should go get tested for parasite
Our cashier, Michelle B, was very kind and gave us compliments! Best customer service at a Taco Bell! Give that girl a raise! #MichelleB2020

Was gonna feel bad leaving a negative review, but based on the other reviews, I see I'm part of the majority here. Here's the deal... drive thru was wrapped around the building, we were pretty hungry, so we decided to go in. NOPE. Wrong choice. Don't do it. Just leave. We were waiting for 30 MINUTES for 5 damn soft tacos. Idk if they went all the way to Mexico for this shit or what... but I won't be back. 2/10 DO NOT recommend... only reason not giving a 1/10 because my tacos were hawt at least.

This food is cheap and gives the best nachos in the world for 89 cents.

Will go again.
Service was prompt, most of the food was good, but the mold spores on one of the tacos is unforgivable.

Long John's: red-headed stepchild

Stopped by for the usual Taco Bell pilgrimage and was pleased by the reliably good burritos and tacos.

Also got a fish plank (because I could) and was horrified to bite into a leathery chewy seafood abomination - must have spent hours under the heat lamp. Sent it back, only to get yet another lamp-abused slab. 

"Do you want us to fry you a new one?"
"YES."

Redemption. Bothered me though that it took three rounds to get it right. Where's the pride?

This Taco Bell is great! I've been going here every couple weeks for the past two years, and the service is fantastic. They've only made a mistake on my order once, which is pretty great since I heavily customize my orders. The restaurant is always clean, and is never too crowded during lunch. This is one of my favorite places to get lunch.

I seriously don't know why I keep trying with you guys you never give me exactly what I asked for order for. 

Is it something like you guys transpose information so should I said if I if I really don't want onion should I be asking for extra onions so I don't get onions???

It must be true when they say ignorance is bliss. Yet again this store never fails to take forever or mess up an order... NEVER FAILS. Any day. Any shift. I ordered 2 T6 chalupa specials Saturday around 4:15pm drive thru. The staff was very nice but I wonder if it's  just to throw me off of their incompetence.  I ordered the combo specials identically because I know this store would have issues. My order was repeated correctly and I had to wait more than expected, although not the typical 10 minute wait average previously. No cars in front of me and she mentioned  they were making them fresh. Shouldn't that always be the case, served fresh?

There wasn't any special requests but I still received the order incorrectly.  I quit going there because I usually got the KFC chicken and that stopped when Bojangles opened... for which I give that store the highest praises for accuracy, never out of chicken, fresh product, and fast service. Something very welcomed over the KFC side of this store.

All I can say is my rare Taco Bell weakness moments will not be spent at this location. The food was good, just wrong.  Otherwise I would have scored them a 1.

Painfully slow. I sat in my car at the drive-through window for twenty minutes after I paid. The whole drive-through experience took about 35 minutes. So close to just driving away. They told me, "We lost your order."

What is bizarre to me is that all you people leave a review for taco bell.  IT'S TACO BELL FOR CRYING OUT LOUD.  what do you expect?  Is anyone really surprised when they are disappointed?  We all feel shamed when we eat any fast food slop. Only reasons to ever eat fast food is you are in a rush or drunk.
This is a terrible Taco Bell they couldn't get my order right I ordered a number six with chicken that's a chalupa  combo how ever I ended up with a steal quesadilla with steak a protein I don't eat.

Stopped here after work yesterday night.  
Drive-thru was pretty clear, and all I thought was..

SWEET! 

I didn't want to wait too long considering my grueling long work day and my growling stomach. 
I got up to the speaker and the employee was very welcoming.  His tone actually seemed like he was happy to take my order- we all know this is rare nowadays! He was in no way rushing me and helped me out a bit by explaining what was in a certain menu item. Bonus points! Thank you for your patience! Not sure what your name was but you had brown shaggy hair and glasses. Props to your great customer service. 
My food was nice and hot. Got 7 items and only spent a little over 8 bucks.  That's my kind of deal!

I'll be back to this Taco Bell next time to fulfill my cravings! Y'all are great!
Fucking morons can understand how to charge for "supreme" and then not deliver. Get home to find that ALL 3 ITEMS I ordered were supposed to be supreme and NONE OF THEM WERE. Morons.

Spent 35 mins in drive thru with only four cars in front of me, I didn't think that was physically possible but they made it happen somehow, I will be driving further out of my way next time I go to a taco Bell, definitely never going back there. At least the order was made correctly.

I LOVE me some Taco Bell.  I don't expect good service, I just hope the bread isn't stale.  The location in West Roxbury on Rt. 1 is hands down the BEST fast foot restaurant I have ever been to. I go there often and am rarely disappointed.  Whoever is in charge take pride in his or her work and it carries down through the employees. The place is clean, the staff is friendly, and the food is fresh.  I even had a manager of some kind come around to the tables to check if I needed anything.  I'm usually grouchy but that blew me away. A+
Worst Taco Bell location we've been to. The food is okay, but the tacos are never stuffed full. They always make you pull up to wait for your order which is super weird.

Every time I go here the workers always seem like there on something, my order is always wrong, there extremely slow I feel like I'm at a restaurant with the wait verses at a fast food window. Always an unpleasant experience when I go here doesn't even deserve a star.

It's fast food but seriously, there is no effort put in and barely any manners at this place. I only go here when desperate and regret it every time. I almost put two stars but then I remember I paid $8 for a horribly put together "Mexican pizza" and two surpreme tacos which is insane. I wouldn't be annoyed if it were horribly put together and $4-5. I don't know why I spend money here, well I do but it's a mistake every time. I doubt anyone eats here actually depending on enjoying the food anyway. Oh well.

You ever download that Live Mas app that Taco Bell has?  Well, you should, dudes and dudettes. 

I have come here more than 10x to pick up my food, AFTER i ordered exactly what I wanted through that Live Mas app. I am telling you now, you need to order your food off that app from now on. Why you ask? Let me count the ways - 
1) you get to order EXACTLY what you want, how you want it, even with all the add-ons (extra sauce, no onions, extra cheese, etc) without any discrepancies or cracking megaphone ordering from the drive-thru microphone.
2) as soon as you roll up to this location (after you ordered from your app), go through the drive-thru (or inside) and let them know your name (the app even gives you a silly name which you can use and it still identifies your order as yours). Your food will either be ready for you and/or the employees will put the final sauces, napkins, etc in your bag.
3) Walk out/Drive out and head home to enjoy your food. 

Ordering through the app the first time I had my suspicions that my order would be incorrect, lacking, etc however the app really eliminated any discrepancies and allowed me to expand my order and tailor my food to my liking. You can pay over the app which I highly recommend because Taco Bell will sometimes add coupons and discounts to your order(s) on the occasional basis. I got $2 off my $12 order and I was a happy lady when I checked out on the app and paid for my meal. 

Do it. You won't regret it.

Lets get to the point.  This food is horrible. The only reason I eat at this place is because it tastes good after gay porn. The service is so slow it gave me time to bone the waiter. I finally got my food, and I think it had sperm in it.

The costumer Service in this place is HORRIBLE!!!!!!! The drive thru line and wait is always long and SLOW!! Inside and outside! I will definitely will not visit this store again! I've gave it 5 different chances and it honestly gets worst every time. Someone take care of this issue As soon As Possible!

TERRIBLE SERVICE. We waited over 20 minutes to order food. The guy taking the order was completely rude. He had a mustache, beard, feminine, white & completely rude & would not respond to us on the drive through. He told us to fuck off. I was with my nephews and grandparents. I HIGHLY recommend to not go to this Taco Bell. They have NO customer service.

I go to this taco bell quite frequently because it is close to where I live but I would go to it if it was farther away. The staff is the best. They never mind that I customize my order even when it is busy. In the rare chance that they do make a mistake, they always happily make me a new item from scratch.

I ordered $21.34 worth of food via the online system around 12:15 A.M. on 11/01/2016 for pick-up at the 6560 Roswell Road Taco Bell location. This location does not close until 1:00 A.M.. I arrived around 12:30 A.M. to pick up my order and was made to go through the drive-thru 3 times! After the third roundabout at 12:40 A.M., my Uber driver and I were told by both employees that they didn't have supplies to fulfill my order because they were closing. Not only was I sent away without my order, this location wasted $7.34 of my Uber fair. This is unacceptable.

I went to this Taco Bell after leaving exhausted, hungry, and broke from one of the theme parks. I was a little nervous to go because of previously bad services from other Taco Bell restaurants. First of all, let me just say that this was one of the fastest drive thru services I've had in a Taco Bell. Another thing was that I got the order wrong BUT they fixed the problem really quick and gave me an extra item. I ordered the shredded chicken mini quesadilla and they prepared pretty much how they should be like....with melted cheese and toasted tortilla. It may not be the perfect Taco Bell but it had a pretty great service! (This happened like at 10:30pm btw)

Attempt 1: came here around 8pm to try the nacho fries only to find out they're out of the nacho cheese -__- and it'll be at least a 30 min wait. Since this was on the day the nacho fires became available, I'll give them a pass. I decided to come back and try again the next day.

Attempt 2: came here during lunch to try again. The fries came out relatively quick. It was a bit soggy. The inside tasted like mashed potatoes. The nacho cheese was a good match for the fries, but nothing to die for. I give the fries four stars since they were only $1. I do give Taco Bell props for good marketing and hyping up new menu items. It actually someone who normally wouldn't eat Taco Bell to go out and try it.

I love Taco Bell, the $5 cravings deal is one of my favorite deals out there, I don't like ranch or sour cream but I never eat the burrito so The only special thing I ask for is no ranch, that being said this Taco Bell's staff in Clermont sucks! Not only do they have slow service in general but the next closest Taco Bell is in winter garden so it's almost always busy. The last two nights they have messed my order up, it's a cravings box it's really not that difficult, the only special thing I ask is no Baja ranch, so of coarse the last two nights they still put it on, and they forgot the nachos the first night. Since I don't eat the burrito, they still put sauce on the gordita, and they forgot the nachos, the only thing I could eat was the hard taco. Last night I was still craving that gordita that they made wrong the first night, not only did it seem to take a half hour but while sitting at the window you can see that 4/5 of the guests on there drive through screen are in the red time wise, and after all that wait, sauce on it again! At least they didn't forget the nachos that time...

Look I know this was a lot of bitching and complaining for a $5 box of food but in the long run I still paid money for specific food that I did not get so I am not happy.

Next time you want to head to this Taco Bell you may want to think twice about that decision. Went hear and the food we received was unacceptable. I will not be going back here again. I will post two pictures of the Tacos we received. Just find a different Place to go. Not worth the poor service you will get.

Yo Quiero Service!

I swear, I have no bias against Taco Bell. I have a bias against bad service.

This place is more dirty than  the Taco Bell in Saugus.  I think the floors have the same dirt on there for over 5 years.  One noticeable difference is that multiple people here speak english and the food is actually prepared warm.

My beef with this place?  You order something, you get the exact opposite.

My order:

2 Nacho Cheese Chicken Chalupa's
Cheesy Fiesta Potatoes
2 Cheesy Gordita Crunches

What I get:

1 Baja Beef Chalupa
Cheesy Fiesta Potatoes
1 Cheesy Gordita Crunch

This is the on going theme with this Taco Bell.  If you order at the drive through, pull into a spot in the parking lot and throughly check your order.  If you order inside the resturant......throughly check your order.  If you come to use the bathroom......throughly check your order!

My recommendation is that this place is good if you want to clean your colon or empty out a few pounds from your intestines.  Save your money and hit up another fast-food resturant.

I had the best experience I have ever had at this Taco Bell. Damian is very professional and I can tell he is a good guy. I honestly prefer Burger King over Taco Bell but I will consistently go to the Bell because Of Damian. The only reason why I have a 5 star was because of him, Taco Bell should give him a raise he's probably the hardest working  employee they have
Don't go to this location unless you want to sit in the drive through for a half hour. This is the slowest Taco Bell ever. They need more staff or something.

Great staff here and very well kept location. I have gone here a few times using their mobile app and each time has been seamless. The manager has come out each time and asked about my order and everything has been promptly made. Looks like everyone takes pride in this place and it shows, very clean and great service / food. Cinnabon and Captain Crunch bites for life.

Pretty Standard for TB. We go pretty often, especially if we are getting home late (after drinking). My only issues have been not getting my order correct twice and them running out of chalupas twice. Hopefully two times is the charm, and these things won't happen again. But hey...it's Taco Bell...

Staff is always friendly at this location, and typically pretty prompt/swift in getting you your order.

Don't order online if you want the food you actually ordered, and don't use the drive-thru if you want fast service. Otherwise, the quality of the food is fine, and I've never had a bad interaction with the staff. The inside is generally clean - can't speak for the restrooms though as I've never used them - and they keep their sauces and things pretty well stocked.

Between random closing hours and messing up your order 50 percent of the time, it's crazy that this location is even allowed to remain open. Getting our order wrong is one thing, but the last visit I was overcharged and told the only way it could be dealt with was to drive back to the location that night (I know, my fault for not checking the bag, but why should that be my responsibility when this happens so often?). I assume this store just does whatever they feel like and assumes everyone is a drunk student who doesn't care about their terrible service. I guess the better option is to just go home and ask throw whatever you have in the house into a tortilla because it will be more accurate than whatever you tried to order from this location. Seriously terrible.
2 stars just because it's Taco Bell, but this is the worst taco bell in the world. it closes way too early for being in a college town and has the rudest and most impatient employees. disappointed

I love the Yelp community.  By reading other reviews Ive been able to learn a lot about my surroundings, and I've met some wonderful people along the way.  Yelpers have somehow managed to circumvent the mean-spirted and vapid state that has permeated so many social media sites.  That being said, I think that we reviewers are sometimes hasty to post a review based on what I view as fairly minor issues.  Judge the business, not the incident, especially if the incident was more than likely a one-off occurance in an otherwise good experience.

Which brings me to, of all places, Taco Bell, at the corner of Bethel and Sawmill.  Yes, I eat at Taco Bell, and what's more, I enjoy it!  I do love fine dining, but I am anything but an affected foodie... I like what I like.  There are some itches that only a Taco Bell can scratch! :)  So one day I find myself in their drive-thru, waiting in line for my seven layer burrito and fiesta potatoes, and as I get to the window I am greeted by a man in his mid-20s in the most welcoming way you could imagine.  It wasn't a scripted blurb spoken by a painted smile, hoping to talk me into super-sizing my order or some other such promotion.  He literally seemed happy to see me and have my business, all $3.18 of it.  I smiled back, somewhat oddly, completed my transaction, and after a hearty farewell and a wave from Mr. Smiley, I was on my way.  I chalked him up as most certainly the business owner, and it was probably his first few months in that title.  That theory was called into question the following week when I returned to that location and placed another order.  This time it was a woman, probably in her early 30s, giving me a greeting that was just as natural and yet as exuberant as Mr. Smiley's.  A co-owner?  Perhaps, but now they had my attention.  Over the next few visits, I had similar encounters, which left me scratching my head.  Either this store was putting something in their employees' water or they were just getting really really lucky with hiring friendly staff.  Was this one of those unanswerable questions?

Finally I just decided to accept this little fast food oasis as a reminder that regardless of what we are consuming, be it tacos or a hotel room or overpriced cable TV, great customer service makes ANY consumer experience better.  Do I need that level of customer service to buy a burrito?  Of course not, but I'll take it.

All taco bells suck, especially this one. Its called fast food, so that means be fast. Ive waited so long in the drive thru and inside longer then people should have to. Something is always forgotten when i order. Its like no one cares and it really shows. Taco Bells in general need a lot of improvement because they are going down hill

I literally think that this Taco Bell sucks, yet, it is truth. They provided me with yahoo and gmail...y'all I loved it. I thoroughly enjoyed my time here. They gave me alcohol and weed. Whatttttttttttt. I believe in God, do you? I loved GOD. You don't want GOD. What's wrong with you?! For your GLORY. I will do anything. JACQUELINE RIVEASZ. BREAK EVERY CHAIN. Daresia CARTER.

Yo to the what had seemed like the manager who had the purple hair and mans who was taking the orders they're the real MVP 100  and had that fire customer service. Give these men a raise or MFN scholarship!

The worst taco bell I've ever been to, I hope they shell out some cash and get themselves a decent manager to straighten this place up. It's just embarrassing for them at this point. I keep thinking that no place can be this bad, this must be some sort of long running 'punked' bit and Ashton Kutcher will pop out any day now.
This taco bell has a limit of 2 packs of sauce per item.  Stay away.
Worst Taco Bell slow service and rude customer service glad chipotle is open so no more bs food

Sat in the drive through for 10 minutes before even ordering. Someone behind me otherwise I would've just backed up and driven away. Are the 5 people in front of me ordering catering orders for 500 people?! Drive through is supposed to be fast, not a friggin sit down restaurant amount of time. This is ridiculous. Get it together
This visit got 4 stars because I was only there 5 minutes and my order was complete and accurate with friendly and quick service.

Taco Bell is my favorite fast food restaurant, always hits the spot! I am also a sucker for every new promotional food item TB comes out with. This location gets super packed during lunch time because it's a TB/KFC, so plan accordingly. They have never not gotten my order wrong; I wish they would keep the sauces outside so I don't have to keep asking while dining in.

The food is pretty much the same.  Once in a while, I feel the urge to try some and I had a bunch of errands and got to the point where I needed to do something in this area.

The employees were pretty cool at this location and it was just what I expected.

I'm at this Taco Bell about once a week, and while they occasionally spectacularly fail at my order, more often than not it comes out fresh, hot, and exactly how I ordered it. And when we're talking Taco Bell, excellent more often than not is flying colors.

Taco Bell is like having sex with a friend's sister; it seems like a great idea at the time and it sort of is fun while it's happening, but then afterwards you feel like your stomach's been turned inside out, you wonder why you did what you did, and you can't leave your bed because you're in so much pain from the sex, I mean the tacos. What seems like an innocent package on the outside is explosive diarrhea waiting for you, looming for you, about to strike at any moment after you indulge. You think it's gonna be okay this time, you tell yourself. I'm desperate. I need this. I want this chalupa and you convince yourself you'll feel ok. then you get home and it hits you all at once. the nausea, the regret, the vomiting, the shits, and you curse the Taco Bell gods for another six months until your hungover ass decides it's a good idea again.
Worst Taco Bell ever was in drive thru for 30 minutes and there was just employees sitting around on their phones. Super slow. Wouldn't recommend
Eh. They have the cheapest prices of any Taco Bell.

Wish we could give negative stars. Went to get a meal in drive thru. It's fairly late, so not busy, worker was rude taking order. Then, after waiting to get to the window, she takes my money without so much as a thank you. She then proceeds to laugh and joke with co-worker. Then closes window. Then starts cutting up boxes. 18 minutes later, yes not a typo, eighteen minutes, she comes to window with the food. She laughs, says "sorry we are experiencing a heavy volume". No one was inside. So, heavy volume is 1 customer at a time at drive thru. Just to make sure this is clear, I ordered 1 meal and two tacos. 18 minutes. So, I go online to take the survey. Wow, Taco Bell, you need to work on customer service. Fill out survey. The survey responses prompt the survey to send me to additional comment box because I said I was dissatisfied. No sorry written. When survey is over, states to talk to someone about experience call 1-800-taco-bell. I call. Get recording, sorry we are closed try later.  Really, couldn't take a message to call back? Sorry excuse for employees and company.
