Wow! Probably the nicest Taco Bell I've ever visited! Very clean, food was as good as expected, service was fast.
So understaffed they barricade the entrances. Slow service? No service. I am continually disappointed by the wait time at this location.

Tonight, the service was worse than usual. We waited almost 5 minutes before we were even greeted much less had our order taken. No one said hi or I'll be with you in a minute. When an associate finally did appear at the register he said nothing. No greeting or I'm sorry about the wait. He didn't say anything. We ordered and after 30 minutes our food still was not ready. We finally decided to ask for a refund and there was not an apology for this disastrous encounter. We will never come back to this Taco Bell location. The management, as well as the associates working there, 
should be ashamed of the lack of customer service.

I go here all the time but that's solely because I love Taco Bell's food and this taco bell is the closest to where I live by 15+ minutes. Plus, the reliable bowel movement 30 minutes later always frees me from having to do it later when I have better things to do.

That being said, this Taco Bell seems more akin to a prison cafeteria where the prisoners are forced to prepare the food. Their eight hour sentence must be hell based on the look in all the inmates eyes. Every employee here seriously looks one burrito away from shooting up the place and whenever I go inside it's like I'm an uninvited guest everyone wishes would just shut up and go away. 

Whatever, as long as you continue to put crack in your taco's I'll be back to get my fix.
This is the worst taco bell in the area. The drive thru is always backed up and takes forEVER! Never even an apology from the staff. Get yourselves together.

I think this is the best Taco Bell I've ever been to. This is a Taco Bell that cares and wants to be the best. The night manager, I don't know her name, but is always so polite! The drive-thru service no matter what the time is quite good. And for the price, you honestly can't really beat that anywhere.

I love Taco Bell. I think it's great for the price, open late, and not a cheeseburger in calories. However... THIS Taco Bell needs the owner to get on here and read the shit people are posting. I will no longer ever return to this particular location. Here are three desperate incidences and I am dumb for returning after the first. 

Incident 1.) We spent approximately 30 minutes waiting in line to reach the speaker (we were socializing, so didn't realize how much time had actually passed until afterwards), and by the time we ordered at the speaker, waited yet another 10 minutes to inch up to the window. When we finally felt as though we had been waiting in a doctors office and it was finally our turn(!) we reached the window to find the cashier throwing. Let me repeat that. THROWING her speaker headset at the window screaming "I'm done with this shit!" I didn't know if my food was going to be safe and sanitary so we decided best to go across the street to steak and shake and of course, watch the police arrive. 

Incident 2.) I ordered a sweet tea with my meal. The last time I had a soda was in 2006. Clearly it's been years (as this incident was in 2014), and the cashier hands me a sprite. Politely I say, "oh, I'm sorry, I ordered a sweet tea". This very rude girl has the audacity to tell me I ordered a sprite. No ma'am. Get the wax out of your ears and stop with your ghetto yelling in the back and pay attention. I do not drink soda. Pretty sure I would know this out of the two of us, right? But after hearing her argue with me, I took the sprite and threw the liquid from the drink on the ground on the way home. No need to waste a perfectly good cup holder. 

Incident 3.) Tonight I go through, after my birthday celebration to order food on my way home. There's nothing like LYSOL covered tacos in the morning! But why wait? Taco Bell serves you until 2 am. Nothing like cleaning supplies to make you feel like they're doing a good job keeping down those germs! They should team up with orbit for that clean sparkly mouth! ;-) Are you kidding me?!?! To top it off the Cinnabon treats were so cold it felt like an ice cube. No. 

This is ridiculous and you should be shut down. You have absolutely no idea how to run a business and obviously keep good employees happy. One time. I repeat, ONE time I had a great experience with a cashier and he has long since been gone. Can't imagine why.  Get it together.

Food was fresh, tasty and correct, service was quick and courteous, and I left satisfied. So either I just happened to visit at the right time or they've really stepped up their game since the previous reviewers visited. As far as Taco Bells go, I'd say this one is up there. One thing I cannot however rate is interior cleanliness as I only went through the drive-thru.

Yes, I know this place is Taco Bell and that it is cheap, fast food. But the service of this particular Taco Bell is OUTSTANDING every time I go. I am greeted each time I walk in the door. The workers are always friendly and helpful. They are quick and attentive. I have never had a problem with an order either. Keep it up!

Boycott this place!!!!!!!!!!     They have put up a fence to prevent you from parking for 5-10 minutes in their lot to head up to Einstein's/Starbucks.   Yes, it's their right and their parking but they have a huge lot and I've never seen anyone looking for parking because of pesky Starbucks customers.  And yes,  it's the landlord of Starbucks/Einstein's fault for not having enough parking up there at Baseline & Broadway but c'mon!  Give the rest of us a break Taco Bell Grinches - quit being so petty.

Be careful. Always ask for receipt. They didn't give me one when they charged my card, so I asked for it. As I asked for it, she seems hesitant to give me the receipt. They charged me for add ons that I didn't ask for.  When I told them my order was wrong and I didn't request the add ons, she rolled her eyes to coworker.  Something fishy is going on at that Taco Bell.

Yeah, I know, it's just Taco Bell.

But this is the BEST Taco Bell.

I've been eating Taco Bell for about 20 years now, with hundreds of visits across 5 or 6 states. This location has been my favorite for the last 7 years. The service has ALWAYS been fast, friendly, and correct every single time for as long as I can remember. Most other Taco Bell locations have pissed me off after my first or second visit. This location has never done me wrong.

I would give it 5 stars, but it is Taco Bell after all. The food is cheap, but poor quality, and it gives gas like nothing else. Best appreciated super late after a long night of drinking. But be careful, Cobb County Police Department knows this, and camps out on Cobb Parkway. Don't ever drink and drive.

I believe this particular location is open till 4 or 5 AM every night of the week.

I really wish it could be a zero star review. There might as will be closed sign because it seems like nobody is working very slow service we were in line for an hour and a half we couldn't even get out the line because it was so backed up. The lady at the cashier didn't even know what we ordered. Looks like management needs to step up and get everything in order. When I asked for a manager they said they didn't have a manager. When I try to pay with card they said it was cash only and they didn't have any receipt paper to give me.

I have been here during breakfast, lunch and dinner hours. Buying from the drive through is like Russian Roulette, maybe you get your order, maybe you don't, so I try to go inside so I can see the servers. Going inside means you will wait between 15 - 20 minutes for your order regardless of how many people inside, in the drive through or when you came in. There is a timer for how long people wait in the drive through I guess that contributes to the mistakes and the lack of attention to folks on the dining room. Wouldn't recommend going here if you're looking for something fast.

Sadly, this place has warranted enough lately to drop my review down to this level. The staff here is great, and every time I've gone here they have been very pleasant. The only issue is the past two times now they have missed multiple items from our order. My workplace normally uses the mobile app to preorder and pickup. As of now we've counted 5 total missing items over two orders resulting in a little over $11 lost. I really enjoy the staff here and that's what makes this so disappointing, and given the orders are work oriented we do not have the time to return to correct it. Fool me once, shame on you, fool me twice, shame on me, I suppose. The establishment is still well kept, I guess just be wary and check your order before you leave, I am hesitant to even return here due to the common theme.

I've been to a fair amount of Taco Bell's in my days & they were 1,000,000 times better than my visit here. This Taco Bell is the definition of suicidal hell. The drive through lines are longer than Charlie Sean's. If I had to choose between going to this Taco Bell or eating tar... im sure you know what my answer is. I honestly hope a mob of hobos start a peeing-circle around this Taco Bell, and it becomes the most famous peeing-circle spot in all of hobo community and the hobos create a class system where only the wealthiest of hobos can sleep within a 1 mile radius to the Taco Bell and any other hobos must work hard in order to make it to the most famous peeing-circle in the state. FUCK THIS TACO BELL AND THE BIG BERTHA THAT WORKS THERE!
Slowest drive thru ever.. I have been in line for over 15 mins with only two cars ahead of me!
TB... Crap veggies. Taste like chemicals.
This Taco Bell has had people wait in the drive thru for 15-30 minutes. And no, I'm not over exaggerating. Poor customer service, that's why I have stopped coming here.
Longest.....drive thru....ever.......30 mins+. We're near Disney, you would think after a brief time it would be obvious night rushes are going to happen. Save your time, go elsewhere.
The same as all the rest. Good, fast food at a great value. Always my go to place if I can not decide where or what to eat.

This is probably the worst Taco Bell I've visited! Customer service is horrible, drive thru associate texting on her phone and taking orders, not sure what recipes this location is using (in my Trump voice- Its bad, really sadddd), long wait - no customers (sad), barely gives you any meat (wrong)....I can go on and on but you get my point. You should probably skip this location and ONLY stop here if you're about to die from starvation or thirst. And if you do, you might be worse off after you vomit due to the food not agreeing with your stomach. Just kidding, it might stay down. 1st time visiting (eh) 2nd time (eh, uh, oh, noooo) 3rd time (all my fault, I should've known better)!

Went thru drive thru.  Food was fast and fresh but the friendliness of the drive thru attendant was horrible.  No acknowledgement, no thank you.  just stood there with drink and waited for us to take it.  Overfilled the drink and left a mess in the truck.  Just handed us the food.  Asked her if that was it and she just looked at me and nodded.  ugh....

I want to give zero stars absolutely one of the worst I have been to. Order was wrong like way wrong on top of that my food looked like my 7 year old made it and wrapt it they have 8 people working and none of them take pride in what they are doing save yourself and avoid this place.
I am under the impression that they have a staff of toddlers manning the kitchen as it consistently takes over 25 minutes to get through the drive through.
Drive thru is empty 4 people in dining room and terribly slow service been 10 minutes since we ordered where's the fast in fast food anymore? Troutdale one is worse

They mess up my order instructions all the time. Also they don't put enough ingredients in their food. It seems they don't change oil often and that causes stale and sticky taco shell. Never go to this location
Rushed all the way over here to find out the employees wanted to close early either that or update your damn hours

Hey if you want to get food poisoning here and have them serve you beef when you are allergic to beef and order chicken...definitely go here.  The management doesn't care, you'll probably end up sick but hey .... Nbdw this owner should be embarrassed by his team.
Slowest taco bell ive ever been too! They need more workers or corporate needs to get involved because it is beyond unacceptable. It takes roughly 45 min in the drive through!

If I had to choose only one restaurant to eat at - I'd choose Taco Bell.  This particular Bell has quick, efficient service.  I've been there many, many times and have yet to have an incomplete order.  And to top it all off, they know the proper way to make a Mexi-melt (not too much meat, a healthy balance of cheese, and just the right amount of pico).  A recent remodel makes this Bell good for dine-in as well.
Convenient fast place to hit up before going to Emos. They got my order out pretty fast on a Friday night and all the food tasted good.

I go here for ONE item; Nacho Doritos taco & they ALWAYS have STALE shells. I have YET to have a fresh Nacho Taco. C'mon Taco Bell step your game up at this location!!!!What a disappointment every time. Drive thru is always a problem. Huge lines and moves wicked slow.

I have gone here 4-5 times a week after school for about a month. Almost always kept very clean, and service is above average for taco bell. Great place to go for a snack by yourself, or meet with friends. Only complaint is occasionally they take a little while to get you your order, and some workers do not have as good service as others. Also if you have $1.08, i highly recommend the beefy Fritos burrito. Hope this helped

I ate here last night.  To be clear, the 5 stars shouldn't be compared to a 5-star rating at a fancy restaurant.  I'm rating it compared to other quick-service places.

That said, the service was very fast.  The food was fresh and delicious.  The people were nice.  $8 for a taco, burrito, sides of sour cream and pico de gallo, one piece of fish, and a medium soft drink.  How can you beat that?!?!

Awful.  Not sure why I keep coming back outside of the convenience on the way home. Every time the drive through has been snail pace slow. Easily a 5-10 minute wait if you are the only car in line. 15+ if there are people ahead of you. Soooo slow (opened a Yelp account and writing this review as I sit in line)
The slowest one i have been too yet... And they are not busy. Of it was packed I can understand, but there are four people here waiting for food. No line.

Wow really? Got into a heated agurment last night with the store manager, after he refused to take my call. All because they forgot a few to put some stuff in my bag. I was called a liar and that it was my fault  that i didnt check the bag before i left. That was after he told me that he was someone double check each order before it goes out. So I finally get my food and leave. Then he follows me out to my car with his minions yelling at me that i better not come back. Wow

Drive thru at 10 pm, excellent service! I ordered a enchirito, burrito supreme and a taco supreme. Enchirito is not on the menu, but its one of the old school items they used to have on the regular. It just doesnt taste the same as it does in Cali. What I'm used to is a cheese enchilada type of dish (if you will)....
This enchirito had meat, onions and a chunky type of salsa,with gobs of cheese (no complaints on the blanket of cheese on top of the sauce) instead of a smooth chili flavored sauce. They got our order right on the first try. Everything was fresh!

Management needs to reevaluate the entire stoner staff! They're forgetful, rude and I won't be going back! It's not that hard to remember someone's order and requests! Plus smart-ass comments are said when your order is given!? I'd fire the late night staff and rehire dedicated people that aren't stoners!!! F Rating! Failed!!! Find another Taco Bell!

Food on par for any ol' Taco Bell but the wait in the drive through line is THE WORST!  I've been here many, many times (it's one of those things where I tell myself "it won't be that long again.." and I'm always wrong) and the wait time never gets faster.  It's NOT fast food.  

I've had more than enough time to write this review while sitting in the line...

The food here is usually decent , they get the order right, but there isn't much more positive to say than that. Even speaking clearly they seem to hear the incorrect thing, which always results in having to correct them at least a few times until they have it right.  It seems that going through the drive thru and going inside usually take the same amount of time to get you your food ( FOREVER). The wait has just been getting longer and longer too. Fast food is suppose to be fast isn't it?

Well, if I am going to get Taco Bell, this is the location near my house.  I don't do it often, but occasionally I have a craving for a quick and crappy crunchy taco and this is the place.

The problem is, they never hear you properly through the drive-thru speaker.  The often repeat my order to me wrong, over and over.  They usually get it by the 3rd try, and the girl at the window is always nice and friendly.

The food is exactly what you pay for - and exactly what one would expect.  It's Taco Bell.

They keep changing up the menu and trying new things and I applaud them for that.  But truly, I'll keep ordering Crunchy Taco Supremes.
Be warned. This is possibly the slowest Taco Bell in Orlando. You cannot go here and expect to be in and out. You will wait a hella long time for your chalupa.

Honestly it's hit or miss when u come here. The first couple of times were pretty great, last 3 times I've been here however I've been disappointed.  Btw.. Rn there's a $5 steak nacho special going on. I wouldn't recommend it. It's just a bunch of nachos (when I ordered, the nachos tasted dated), very little steak and a drink. Honestly, I think u should wait for steak, the steak shouldn't be waiting for u.
Upside, the front end has been very polite and courteous every time I've been to this location, both in store and drive thru. But you mostly come for the food, right?
I love taco Bell breakfast ,lunch,and dinner. Definitely bears the fast food chains around

Ordered two chicken grilled stuffd burritos in the drive thru. Seemed easy enough. I asked for some packets of the fire sauce at the window. The girl took a second to glare and threw three packets into the bag. Three. Only three. Seriously. Whatever, I wasn't going to confront her on her disdain of handing out condiments. Life is too short. I left and went to work. At the office I started to eat only to find whoever made my chicken burritos seemed to overlook the small step of adding chicken in the assembly. Plenty of sour cream, beans, and rice but not one shred of chicken. My coworker laughed until he sliced open and dissected his burrito to find, again, and obvious absence of chicken in what should have been a chicken burrito.
Just met darian a very polite and considerate person. Extremely professional I'm shocked that Taco Bell has such awesome employees.

Worst customer service I've ever experienced! Waited for 33 minutes then finally asked for my money back.  They said they were short handed yet didn't tell anyone until people started to complain. Short handed yet one of them could be seen in the back on his phone and the others were swearing so loud everyone could hear.  When I complained and said I wanted my money back the young punk in back said that they didn't want my business anyway and don't come back.  Believe me I won't!
Just ordered 8 soft taco SUPREMES with beans and no meat at the drive through.  Got home and had no tomato and no sour cream on any of them.  This sucks!

I don't get why so many people are hating on this place, I have been here on multiple occasions, and each one of them has not been nearly as terrible as some people on here are describing. 

Keep in mind, this is TACO BELL, it is not an expensive Mexican restaurant, the food here is most likely not going to be the best thing you ever ate.

That said, of my many many visits here, my order was prepared in a timely manner, no mess ups on the order itself, but many times when I wanted the order "for here" they gave it to me "to go" but this was quickly fixed every time. 

A few times when I ordered the Cheesy Fiesta Potatoes - they came out just slightly warm, when i told them they were told, they told me they could make new ones, but it would take a few minutes, I said I was okay with that, and they made me new ones, without any complaints from the people there.

The meat sits under lamps or in heaters of some kind, if it vegetables, then it feels very crisp and refreshing. Again, this is fast food, protein is not going to be cooked to order.

Although, if they seasoned the food there even a little bit more, I would be a much happier customer. Then again, there are plenty of sauces, sat and pepper available for seasoning the food.

The only other thing that comes to mind that is food related is that the bean paste is not to great, but that is just me since I like my beans whole. 

As for the location, it is pretty clean, it may not sparkle, but it is not dirty by any means.
Every time I come to this Taco Bell I wait in line for a minimum of 20 minutes if not more. And half the time I am missing part of my order.

Worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. Wait times are always out of control. I've sat in their drive thru for over 45 minutes on multiple occasions at various times of day. Only on one occasion did the staff apologize for the wait, ever other occasion they have behaved as if the long wait times should be expected. It's fast food, not a sit down restaurant.
For a fast food joint, I don't think service has been more impeccable! It's better than 99% of places I've been to.
It's the Bell, what would you like me to say. I drive thru, I get Pepsi. They are nice. I am happy!

Every time I go through the drive thru, I'm stuck for no less than 20 min waiting. It took me 15 minutes to even be able to give my order this time. The drive thru makes it so you can't get out once you have a car behind you, so I'm always stuck. Not worth it.
This place is awful. They are so slow and I actually waited in the drive through line for literally 30 minutes

Ok so this is Taco Bell. Hmmm. Food is all the same. But what I like about this location is the employees. They, (and when I say they, I mean he. The drive thru attendant. Older guy. Man why don't I remember his name?!!!!) he's awesome!!!! He offers u different sauces to make ur late night crave something truly special. And sad to say, he remembers me. Yes I crave the bell late. This is my fav Taco Bell location thanks to (mr can't remember his name older guy)
This Taco Bell is always slow on getting out your food and I swear it is never right. We avoid this Taco Bell at all cost!

Ordered my food at 9:49pm, left at 10:40pm. There was only one person before me waiting for their meal. Apparently, he had been waiting for his food for about 20 minutes. Guy at the register said: "sorry, we are a little understaffed," as he puts on his jacket and proceed to clock out. 

Okay, I work in the food industry too and I totally get its stressful when the shift is running low on staff so I prepared myself to wait and be thoughtful of the workers. 

Minutes go by and all these other customers who ordered after me gets their meal. Looked at the time and the time I've ordered, its been 25-30 minutes

I'm completely pissed off now, go to the counter and starts cussing every worker behind the counter. The one worker told me they had gave my order to someone else! My response? "OH, THATS F-ING GREAT." This man clearly sees me looking into his soul as he call out all these other names and not once, not once did he check up on my food. It wouldnt have escalated as it did but it did.

The dude goes back to the kitchen and I'm watching them. I'm cussing at them and I let them know: "give me a f-ing refund or give me my f-ing food!" 

Kid you not, they heard refund and started working faster. Never, NEVER will I go in there again. If it wasnt for my sister who wanted this crap I wouldnt have went here! You SUCK.

Second visit by my family, second order messed up. Ordered steak gorditas, got ground beef instead. Completely bored college girl who obviously didn't want to be there taking the order. Shame on us for going again to this sorry excuse of a location of a once great chain...

Someone needs to bring in new management...

After hitting up Publix for subs, we had one kid that just had to have Taco Bell.  I think I'll be trading him in for a new model after this experience.  

Food here is standard Taco Bell fare, but omg the wait.  It's infuriating waiting 20 minutes for the 3 cars ahead of you to get their "fast" food.  Are they grinding the corn for the tortillas.  Seriously, what could possibly take so long to make 3 tacos!

Another fast food joint populated by indifferent, surly idiots. I won't bother recounting my 'tale of woe', such as it is. 
Listen, maybe your job sucks. I get it. But it's not my fault. You don't have to take it out in me. 
Just give me what I asked for, I'll pay, say 'thank you', and be on my way.

This is the worst fast food place I have ever been to. Very slow service everytime and I have had multiple wrong orders. I ordered a Chicken Chapula Supreme and it was given to me with the shell wrapped but the contents just dumped inside the bag. Worst customer service ever. I tell everyone who mentions Taco bell NOT to come to this location because it's trash.

I'm unsure how exactly this Taco Bell is still in business ? Slowest Taco Bell ever and everything I ever get here is made so sloppy it's almost inedible unless I get a fork or spoon but that's just not how I'd like to eat my burrito. Almost every time I ask for no onions, I get onions .. It's just a sloppy Taco Bell and apparently other people think so as well. There's another location down the street from this location that's much better and much faster.

I consider myself a bit of a Taco Bell connoisseur, that being said this one is right up there with the best of them. When it comes to Taco Bell there's not a ton to expect, just your basic needs like good food, fast service, and workers that aren't  rude. At this location I'm happy to say that I got all three.

GO TO MOES

i swear i will never return. the staff is horrible and they act like they dont want to work or help anyone. extremely disappointed im the lack of customer service. went the the drive thru and waited TEN minutes and NO ONE ANSWERED THE DRIVE THRU! i thought maybe the sensor didn't go off so i went forward and stopped at the window. not to mention while waiting people were HONKING AT ME thinking that im the the reason why its taking so long. so i get to the window and wait another ten minutes. the workers inside just kept staring! then walking away dealing with god knows what. so after the drive through was about 10 people long and they still haven't answered the window i drove off. 

GO TO MOES
Boyfriend & kids love this place & it's a block from our house. While it's not really my cup of tea, never had any complaints from them. Consistent service & the fam is happy, so it's a win.

Only two people working on Saturday night. Sat here waiting for 15 minutes at drive up. Can't imagine the food will be right . Get it together Taco Bell. 

Update- everyone came to window and apologized, then gave me full refund with food. 
All good, nice people and I'll be back. Thank you.
SO SLOW, and HORRIBLE SERVICE! I almost feel bad because the workers are so miserable, but they make the customers miserable too! Took me 20 minutes to get tacos....

Best Taco Bell on the planet. Always fast, hot, and correct! I'm waiting in line right now actually... The speaker is broken tonight and the drive thru is taking forever but the 50+ visits I've made here over the last 4 years are more than enough to allow me to overlook tonight's oddity. 

... As a side note, there are two Taco Bells closer to my work/house and I go out of my way to come to this one. It IS that much better.

88% beef. Even the varsity has better food. 

Steak and shake is across the street and has real food.
Rude and messed up my simple order. Felt personally victimized. The one on oltorf is way nicer.
I've been here many times since moving to Manor 4 months ago. About as consistent as other Taco Bells. Haven't had to wait long for food.

waited half hour [+] for our food that is generous we order a double beef taco burrito, 2 nacho dorito tacos, and a chicken quesadilla and only 1 order ahead of us with NO ONE in drive through not a single person came through during this time on a busy road!!!! never coming here again

This Taco Bell is the worst one I have ever been to. It is by my work so I've been there ever so often hoping it will get better but if anything it gets worse! It's not only very dirty, but they have clogged drain lines and smells really bad. They take no pride in this location. It is the only Taco Bell that has not been remodeled. I would avoid going to this location because they don't seem to know what they are doing.

*****Disclaimer: this may be a lengthy review :)

You see...I have a love-hate relationship with this taco bell.

I visit this location frequently because I work literally down the street and there aren't exactly a hand full of restaurants around so most of the time I'm able to grab my lunch and continue on with my day. But the last 2 or 3 times I've visited I left HIGHLY pissed. 

Let me start by saying this.....my lunch break is 30 minutes. Enough time to drive around the corner and get a number 7 right?? First off when you finally make it to the speaker they tell you to hold for hmmm..maybe 4 or 5 minutes - but hey that's cool right? Cause we got about 20 mins or so for lunch. 

So the order is finally put in and we drive to the window pay for our meal and everything is smooth sailing. We still got a little time for break. So...5 minutes go by but you're on the phone so time flies and you haven't given much notice. 

Okay we got around 15 minutes or so but it's cool cause we still have a little bit of time. 

5 more minutes go by and now you're getting kinda annoyed. We haven't seen anyone since we paid. No one bothered to say, "hey this may take a little while can you pull up?' Not one word.

A few more minutes go by and now you're pissed. You already paid so you can't leave the line. There are cars lining up behind you and there's STILL no one to be seen. And now you're down to 2 minutes before your break it up.

So now your lunch is up! 30 minutes exactly. You're furious because you basically wasted you're whole damn lunch waiting...oh and let's not forget the only thing you ordered was 2 mini chicken quesadilla and a mountain dew and now they are cutting into YOUR time and YOUR money.

A minute later they just throw you your food and forget to put in the mild sauce you requested.....


I say all this to say...I get it. It's taco bell for christ's sake, I don't expect to get any 5 star treatment but dammit are you really going to waste my ENTIRE lunch break waiting on 2 little ass quesadillas?????? And not even have the courtesy to let me know it may take some time so I can go elsewhere and spend my money. 

I am so through with this location. Like I said this has happened several times and this is just not okay. I give an additional star because the food has always been good it's just the customer service that needs some cleaning up.
The worst Taco Bell on the face of the planet. Literally. The. Worst. Never right, never fast. Please do Tucker a favor and get a better crew.
They are stingy, Rude , and follow some kind of Taco Bell regulation about sauces! Never come through drive through! Horrible experience! It's the worst!

This place has a snazzy interior for a Taco Bell. I am used to the old crummy ones where you really have to be careful as to where you sit, seeing as you might sit in what is left of someone else's beefy melt. 

Also, I am a huge fan of their Verde salsa. Usually I am one to grab all Fire packets but the Verde is so good, you must try it

This Taco Bell used to be so fast all the time but for the past few months it has been incredibly slow even when there's only 1-2 cars ahead of me.  If I see more than 3 cars I don't even bother because I know I'll be waiting 15-20 min, no joke.  I'm in a wheelchair so it's a lot easier for me to do the drive thru.  Please fix this!!!

5*, qualified with "this is a Taco Bell." They're always fast & friendly, the food is what I expect from a Taco Bell, mistakes are rare.

Getting food here is hell at lunchtime, but that's par for the area.
The worst Taco Bell I've been to the five layer burrito was five layer burrito no meat more bread no beans more bread the empanada was cold will never go back

Be prepared for your order to be wrong. The service was terrible in the drive thru and the window. My chalupa was stale and filled with both chicken and beef (I asked for beef). My Doritos taco was soggy. My drink was mostly ice. This is not the first time I've gotten bad service and food.

I will never go to this Taco Bell again.
They started charging extra to substitute beans for the meat as of 12/27/2013. I'm sure they will lose customers over this decision, as they have lost this vegetarian customer. 
The staff frequently messes up simple orders.

This is by far the best Taco bell in the Orlando area! The food is always hot and fresh! Now for the real reason i am reviewing today... BREAKFAST!!!!!! OMG it is so good! I have gotten the sausage burrito and the cinnamon bites the past two days and all I can say is YUMMINESS!!!

Slowest Taco Bell ever. Doesn't matter what time you come, it always takes at least 15+ minutes. Also, they don't listen, so after waiting 15+ minutes for your food 95% of the time it is terribly terribly wrong. I ordered a bean and cheese burrito... And somehow ended up with a chipotle ranch and nacho cheese burrito.... By far the grossest thing ever

Went through the drive through. The line was kinda long so I waited a while. When I got up to speaker the girl seemed like she rushing to take my order and kinda rude too. When I pulled up to the window I see this creepy employee just grab some food from the kitchen and pop it in his mouth... Super gross. And wtf I order three items and I get three separate bags... hello, just put it in one. Didn't get any napkins either. Probably won't be back to this one.
Awful customer service. Was very rude and slammed the door on us so we couldn't ask for the correct order. Messed up every taco was incorrect. Paid for extra sauce and wasn't on any of the food.
Slowest drive thru ever. 20 minutes. No one inside. Must be only one person doing everything.

Stay away from here unless you rather spend a significant chunk of your life in the drivethru. I could have went into market basket next door and made my self tacos at home by now..... So now I'm trapped in the drive thru at 9:15pm because my hubby wanted taco bell. well F u taco bell in Salem. Every car in front of me had literally a 15 second order. PLEASE TELL ME WHAT IS GOING ON IN THERE.
Ages later when it was my turn, I came to realize they are probably getting all the orders wrong because you cannot hear what the guy is saying over the speaker and his only solution was to bang the headset. Even worse you can see if he's getting your order correct because the screen does not show your order, just so surfer.

This is the fourth time since I moved back to TX back in Feb 2018 that Taco Bell in Manor messed up my order. COMPLETELY! How hard is it to omit lettuce from one box and tomatoes & sour cream from another. It's just sad.

My son would say 'Best ever!!'

Great prices for yummy food 

Now with 'Diablo' sauce. Love it!!
This is the best taco bell in the nation.  And I say that after they got rid of the pilot touch sceen ordering and turned me down a million times after I walked through the drive up while wasted.
Weird I didn't know making a taco took 20+ minutes..... horrible location.. rude employees too. Yould think they would be a little nicer since I just spent 30 minutes in the drive thru ..

Absolute TERRIBLE service. Line was extremely long, we waited forever. They ended up getting our order wrong and leaving out multiple items that we had paid for! Since it was 11 at night the inside was closed. The drive thru line was super long and after already waiting in it we knocked on the window t see if they could just give us the items that were missing. They refused and said we had to wait in the line again to get our food!! We went around and asked the car at the window if they could get us the food for us, the manager REFUSED to give it to us!!!!! Even though we had a receipt and everything! Literally took our money and didnt give us our food! Even though I know it's not a huge de, it's the principle. I can't even explain how terrible of service this was and I would love everyone to knows I will definitely be sending an email to Taco Bell as well as tweeting. I sincerely hope they get it and understand how bad this location is. East Riverside Drive Austin TX 78741.

I Ordered tonight through the mobile app. I got a spicy tostada fresco style and a grilled 7 layer burrito fresco style. They got the tostada right but it only came with four bits of diced tomatoes actually on the tostada and  there were about ten bits on the cardboard box along with some lettuce strewn off to the side. There were four things wrong with the burrito. 1. it's wasn't grilled 2. there was no pico de Gallo 3. there was no lettuce 4. guacamole was added for some reason. Will not be going back.

Ok so usually I go here and the people who work there usually are busy so they aren't in the happiest mood but I understand so it's fine but the guy who was taking my order today was awesome he actually seemed like he was happy and he actually smiled haha ...his name is davontae, he was awesome so I just had to give 5 stars

If only I could give a zero star review, waiting over 30 mins for my food in Drive-thru and it was not ready. I immediately asked to cancel my order. No manager came out to speak to me and all I was told was how understaffed they were and there was nothing to be done to compensate for the situation. ABSOLUTELY RIDICULOUS. Never have had worse service in my life. 
Mind you the young lady working the drive thru was very rude.

Why do I do this to myself?
Every so often I think ok lets go for some crappy fast food and I haven't had Taco Bell in years and never in Columbus so lets go for it.
The one star is really only since I have to and I did like their 2 new sauces the verde and the fire roasted.
(they might not be new but that shows just how long I haven't eaten there)
I had the grilled stuffed which took them about 15 minutes to make and was pretty soggy, mushy and otherwise flavorless had I not drowned it in sauces 
( I refuse to call that salsa, as there is no actual tomato, onion...nothing really good in those packets)
some regular tacos, which are never really great, they just always throw those in your meals so you feel like your getting a good deal.
And last a cheesy gordita crunch which I had remembered being my favorite.
Meh...not so much anymore.
Don't judge, yes that is also a Big Mac on the picture, I thought if you are going to do all the wrong things today have a Big Mac along with it, truthfully I should have stayed at McDonalds, this Taco Bell has the slowest service, pretty run down and not the greatest food.
Needless to say I was disgusted the rest of the day and back to my regular eating habits for good!

The staff at this Taco Bell is really chill. They're fast and friendly and always seem to be in a good mood, even if it's late at night.

The Long John Silver's closes at 9pm, though. If you want some of that side, you'll need to get out earlier.

This Taco Bell is pretty clean but as far as taco bells go it's not one of my favorites.

If you go through the drive thru make sure they give you all of your food before you drive away, they've consistently forgot 1 taco every time I have gone through or been in another car going through. 
Also their burritos are so much thinner than almost any Taco Bell I have ever been to- I understand it's cheap fast food but at least give me my dollars worth of fake beans!
Other than that they are pretty nice and will correct their mistakes on your order

I'm a huge fan of Taco Bell, but I'm really surprised about the three 4-star reviews for this location in particular.  Although I had been to this one several times before, I had only gone through the drive-thru.

Recently, my friend and I decided to dine in on a Saturday afternoon.  It wasn't busy, so our food came out quick.  I wasn't super hungry, so all I ordered was two crunchy tacos.

There were maybe two or three other tables of customers when we walked around to look for a table.  The first table we sat at was super wobbly, and when my friend turned around to check the table behind him, he saw that there were two seats but no table where one should have been.  Can you say "ghetto"?  In addition, many of the tables were dirty, and there was trash scattered around on the floor.  Ick.

We found and sat at one of the cleaner tables, and I finally started to eat my first taco when I realized that the shell was cold and kind of stale.  The beef inside the taco was warm, but I really did not enjoy the taco shell.  Fortunately, my second taco's shell was crunchy and good.

Overall, this Taco Bell gets 2 stars because although their food is usually just like any other Taco Bell, the inside of the restaurant looks really old, beaten up, and unkept.  It really turned me off from wanting to eat inside again.  I'm sure I'll be back to this location because I love Taco Bell, but I will stick to the drive-thru from now on.

[Review 084 of 366]

I ordered the new cantina double steak quesadilla and when I opened up the box the quesadilla was stuck to the paper! It was cut into only 3 pieces and only one piece had steak in it, it was poorly made. I've had much better at home in NY. Also the nachoes that come with it were for some reason unsalted and weren't very tasty more stale actually! Though the staff was very very nice!

It was somewhat clean inside which is a plus, but they were out of certain sodas and when I asked if they could change out the syrup to have a fresh soda, the manager gave me a dirty look and said it's out come back tomorrow with an I don't effing care face. Lol who would go to Taco Bell two days in a row? I ordered a crunch wrap and it was okay, just sort of sloppily thrown together. Staff was not friendly except for the lady that took my order. She was fantastic and the only redeeming mark for this place to get the second star. I don't know if it's just that I'm not used to such unfriendly people or if Ohio is full of whacks, but this is the norm for most places I've been in this state. (P.S. I shouldn't have had Taco Bell anyway.)

Grab a couple of tacos or maybe a burrito with all the stuff and go back to your life occasionally this is a junk food I want and crave. It is going taste the same every time and sometimes knowing what to expect is a good thing.

Will the Taco God be pleased with this choice probably not but it works in a pinch.

Mother nature please have mercy on me for my stupidity and lack of self  control !

Okay, it's a Taco Bell. I get it. It's not Mexican. It's not Epicurean fare. It is however under five bucks and really, really yummy. This Taco Bell however differentiates itself from the rest by having some great employees, taking it from three to four stars. Muy bueno!

Would never go back!!!!!!!  Went through the drive through with the kids a few months ago.  The man at the window when we got our food looked high (mind you it was only around 8 o'clock), and was trying to pick me up in front of my kids, then got mad when I asked for a manager which I never spoke to.  Paid for the food, then threw it away as soon as we got home.  We still eat Taco Bell, just not at this one anymore.

Would give this place 0 stars if I could. Been waiting in the drive through line for the past 40 minutes and still haven't gotten food.. This place is the polar opposite of "fast" food. The staff must be filled with some seriously incapable people since I've never had this problem with the McDonalds right next door. There's a lady in the line behind us screaming at the person through the microphone and crying because she too has been trapped in this god forsaken drive through line for 40 minutes. I say trapped because once you're in the line you're blocked in and can't leave. We tried to call the store to see what could possibly be causing the hold up and the phone must be off the hook. Seriously all we ordered was 2 hard shell tacos.. Just got to the window and the guy could not be moving slower. If anyone reading this is even thinking about going here DO NOT DO IT. If a manger or anyone else is reading this its 12:45 pm on July 1st, 2016 and you should fire everyone currently working here... To top off the horrible experience our order didn't even come out right. Very disappointing, infuriating, and completely unnecessary.

A lot of the workers where not doing the best they could. A lady was taking an order to a person who only spoke a different language. After about 7 minutes of her trying to figure out what she wanted the lady called over a person names Carlos who spoke the language that the lady infront of us spoke. After about another 6 minutes of them taking her order they finally got to me and my sister. She ordered firat and then i did. My order was fine. I got everything i ordered. But my sister didn't get the freeze she ordered. They tried to give her a regular cup to get something from the soda fountain. O had told them "No! She ordered a freeze. A baha blast mt dew Freeze!!" After ger looking at the both of us like we where crazy she gave it to my sister. I would like to say that my 4 stars go to carlos who was working there. He knew what he was doing and was very good with the costumers. Out of the 4 people who helped us he was by far the best. Not the best taco bell experience i have ever had..

Got to this Taco Bell because I was not waited on at the nearby Pollo Tropical.  When I got here, I did have to wait until someone came up to the front counter.  There were many employees so I felt like someone should have been there as soon as I came to the counter.  Anyway, once I placed my order, the food was ready quickly and it was very tasty.  I got a free senior drink there also.

Great staff here and very well kept location. I have gone here a few times using their mobile app and each time has been seamless. The manager has come out each time and asked about my order and everything has been promptly made. Looks like everyone takes pride in this place and it shows, very clean and great service / food. Cinnabon and Captain Crunch bites for life.
What can I say....it is a Taco Bell.  Just dont get there 10 minutes till closing because they will ignore you and the doors will be locked.

NEGATIVE stars!!! 11/16/15 7:59am park and go to front door. The door is locked. Double checked my watch, and double checked the hours posted DINING ROOM OPEN AT 7AM. Ok??? Fine I'll just go thru the drive thru. Sat there almost 2 minutes with no answer. They do open at 7am right? That's what the sign said. Drive around to the window, see 2 people working inside. One lady looks at me, then turns away and ignores me. Well fu€k u too b!tch! I'll NOT be visiting this location again!!!

I usually like to go to this Taco Bell late at night. I'll get a burrito from the drive-thru, then sit in my car in the Walmart parking lot and eat...while sobbing uncontrollably, wondering where I went wrong in life...and why they only gave me one Fire sauce packet.

A few months ago, I decided to eat in the dining room (which closes at 10pm, I believe). It was your typical remodeled Taco Bell: lots of purple around, overhead hanging lamps, a combination of low chairs/booths and high chairs/high tables, pIctures of Lorena Garcia everywhere...you know, regular Taco Bell.

A woman in front of me was with her daughter, and it looked like they both just got out of work, since they were both wearing Macy's name tags on their shirts. Mother and daughter working at the same store? That's weird. Anyway, the mother ordered something that I've never even heard of before: Cheese Roll-ups. [http://www.tacobell.com/food/menuitem/Cheese-Roll-Up] I was so intrigued by her order, that I decided to order one with my meal. It's basically a tortilla with cheese, rolled up. And it tasted like...a tortilla with cheese, rolled up. Who the hell would come to Taco Bell to get this? You could go to the Walmart 100 feet away, and get a pack of tortillas and a pack of cheese for less than you paid for two Cheese Roll-ups. Whatever. As I sat down, realizing what a waste of money that Cheese Roll-up was, I saw a woman sitting by herself. it looked like she finished eating, and was just doing the "gonna sit here and keep refilling my drink, because refills are free, beotch"-routine. We've all done that before. But something was different. This woman was talking out loud, and was very passionate when she spoke. She was talking about Nationwide Insurance, and how their hiring practices were shady, and how she knew many people that lost their jobs. It seemed like she was arguing with someone regarding benefits packages, and unlawful termination. It was a pretty intense conversation...so intense that I was live-tweeting it. When there was a brief lull in the conversation, I got up to refill my drink, beotch. I walked past her, expecting to see her holding a phone to her head, or wearing a bluetooth headset.

She had neither a phone nor a bluetooth headset.

This woman was having this intense conversation, which sounded completely legitimate and not crazy at all, with herself. Out loud. For everyone to hear. This was really strange. Stranger than the mother-daughter-we-both-work-at-Macy's-Cheese-Roll-up-outing. As I sat down to drink my Mountain Dew Baja Blast--available only at Taco Bell--I noticed the woman glance at me, and whisper something to her invisible companion. I felt really uncomfortable and decided to leave.

I like this Taco Bell location. Drive-thru is fast, and they'll give you a lot of sauce packets if you say "Can I have a bunch of all of them?" when they ask you what kind you'd like. It's in close proximity to Walmart, which is open 24 hours, so you can go in and wash your hands when you finish eating in your car. But the real excitement comes from eating in the dining room after 9pm. You don't know who will be in there, and what you'll be able to live-tweet.

Third in line at the drive-thru. 25 minutes so far... I've never been impressed with the speed inside or outside of this particular location, but it's hard to drive through when I spend a half hour in line.

Follow-up: Still in line... 35 minutes now. The two cars in front of me have their orders messed up. The first person literally go out of the car and walked back up to the window. Then receipts and bags changed hands until they figured it out. This is incredible. I can't wait to see what I get!

They wowed me with service today! I noticed the health score was at 100% which makes me happy for any fast food spot! The staff was extremely personable and friendly. Fast order! Keep up the good work guys!

I ordered my food and asked for for sauces Hot and mild. I drove away to find they gave me none. I went back through and kindly asked for sauces. The manager arrogantly pointed to the window saying you have to ask for them. The cashier told her I did. The manager basically threw them at me and did not apologize.

Came here for a quick lunch and low expectation fast fast lunch which was great. My taco shell was crispy not soggy. The meat quality was excellent and my order came out almost instant. The prices are really reasonable here too. I shall return real soon.

Look, it's Taco Bell, it's cheap delicious tacos what do you expect? BUT this particular location is ON POINT - my order is always right the first time (which is like unheard of at Taco Bell) and the staff is super friendly. We literally drive out of the way a little to avoid going to other Taco Bell's because this place rocks.

The past three times I've come here in the past twice months the food has been great. The place is always clean and the staff is pretty friendly. This is exactly what I expect from fast food. Best place in riverside.

Food was typical of TB, staff was overwhelmingly communicative and helpful. I ordered something requiring a longer than expected cooking time and the young gentleman at the counter made a point of apologizing for the delay and assured me it was going to be fresh. 

Kudos to this location! I wish I remembered that gentleman's name so I could give him props specifically.
I came in to the drive thru and ordered some tacos. I ordered hard tacos and they were all poorly made I'm very disappointed

Worst Taco Bell in Oregon. Employees "sent" out my order and was waiting for nothing. They had to remake it and still got it wrong. Had to ask for the rest of my food again, ordered chicken quesadilla and got just cheese. I waited 40 minutes in total from the time I ordered and time I left. For fast food! Employees are slower than sloths... no motivation or speed at all. Please save your time and do not go here.

This Taco Bell is so pointless. 
I went in to order and I stood at the register 15 minutes and although the employees walked around and saw me
Clearly - they continued to act as though they hadn't seen me. 
It was only the drive thru employee who acknowledged me - yet he had someone at his window. Which I could understand. 
But not one other employee helped me at all.
I ended up leaving and going else where.
What a waste -
This is the worst Taco Bell in the work online says it closes at 3 am but it's 1:30 and they won't take my order even tho there's clearly people inside

If I could give no stars at all it would be better!!! One girl was taking my order through drive thru and then some ghetto female took over being overly rude and ghetto!!! No kind of customer service!!!! We ended up just leaving ! I don't recommend this location to anyone!

Came in with my kids and there was only one person in front of us already waiting for his food.  After placing the order had to wait 20 mins for them to make the order.  Got the order wrong after finding that we were missing some items from our order.  Placed a new order and had to excitedly 19 mins to get this new order.  While waiting a girl from Grub Hub came in watched her wait 20 mins for her order.  My daughter used the bathroom and was completely filthy with pee all over the toilet seat and boogers on the sink.  No sense of urgency at this place for customers.

Really slow and the customer service is horrible. 
Perhaps consider on training your employees better.

Hopefully some good news to report, it seems that they may have had a management change. I visited this location on June 4th via the drive-thru, and it was running very well. Someone took my order promptly, and the food came out pretty quickly as well, overall an experience of how it *should* be done, and uncharacteristic of their usual insanely long wait times. 

I noticed they had some new materials (different cups, different bags, etc) so I'm partial to think they took a close look at this place and addressed some problems. 

I will likely update back to 5 stars once I go back and confirm that they have turned their ship around. Hopefully yesterday's very positive experience was not a one-off fluke.

I second Aaron on this one....best TB in the WORLD!!!  So many 4 a.m. trips for the Grande 10 pack...half bean burritos and half soft tacos....mmmm...sooo good....as well as Burrito Supremes and Chalupas....
I might love me the Rover's and Canlis of the world, but I can appreciate a good Enchirito once in awhile...
FYI: I think the Bell needs to bring back the cinnamon chips of my childhood!!

This Taco Bell is 100% the worst Taco Bell I ever been too.  I lived in Salem my whole life, and they always hire the rudest people.  Like yesterday I asked the lady at the window to add one more thing, not like my food was done.  There was only one car behind me, and just for a dollar.  She gave me a attitude and was like "umm no, you have to go around!"   And then when she seen me not argue back, she started talking more.  She was like "it's not fair for the people behind you."   Excuse me, I'm still a customer, your still serving me.  I just let it go. She gave us the food *3 mins later* and while we're just making sure everything is in the bag she started giving us a ugly look in drive through, basically telling us to move.  Then I just proceeded to drive, she looked at the kid in my back seat and goes "Boooooo!" Through the window.  Like she looked like those ghetto girls that hate their life in movies. Soo rude and unprofessional.  Like I always regret going to this place, but sometimes I think it will get better.  The cheese was barley melted in our quesadilla, management is obvy awful.  It's 2019, having edible food isn't all that's gonna keep you guys in business.  They are know around town for this
Horrible service, waited in the drivethru for 25min and i couldn't even drive off because the damn curb is so high

Dude if I could give this location zero stars I would. I recently moved to nearby this location and I went for the first time about 2 weeks ago. Since then I've been back twice, I'll tell you about those experiences. 
1. Go in and there's no line, but no one at the register for at least 3-4 minutes. Finally a dude walks up, he looks upset and right before I order the guy yells "we're out of ground beef, but can do steak and chicken". Next thing he looks at this older couple next to me and is all nice when he offers to replace their beef with steak or chicken. So then he comes back to me and I told him what I want and he asked steak or chicken and then tells me crazy price. I questioned it and he says "there is an up charge for the steak". So I'm all like "nah, you just gave it to those people and beef clearly isn't option." This dude looks at me and says "it's not my fault that we don't have beef, I can't control that." Y'all, I looked this dude in his eye sockets and said "it's not your fault that y'all didn't cook enough beef?"  I was over it, so I just left and I called the 800 number and they sent me 2 $5 coupons. Now onto visit 2. 

2. So I have 1 of my $5 coupons in hand and I drive over and order from the drive thru. I get up there and homeboy tells me "we don't accept these."  I'm immediately shocked and explain to him why I have this thing and he was cool and went ahead and took it. But then he tells me that they ran out of the Cinnabon dessert that I just ordered and then I got home and my quesadilla was way over cooked. Whatever, it was mostly free, so it's cool. Now onto visit 3. 

3. Just now I go up there and I walk in this time. For starters the dude behind the register looks like a homeless guy they pulled off the street this morning. No uniform shirt, no name tag, shirt all dirty and wrinkled and he just looked sketchy. So I'm ordering and he just looks so angry to be alive and working at Taco Bell. When I'm done I hand him this coupon and he snaps "we don't accept these, you can't use this" and he tried to throw it away. We go back and forth, I explain how I got it and he tells me something about headquarters won't take them. They sent me the thing, why would they not accept it? So he gets someone else and she condescendingly asks how I got it as if I'm printing these in my basement so I can save $5. She finally says "we'll accept it this time, but we're not supposed to" as if she's doing me a favor. 
Then the guy commences to tell me that I have to get some box, that I can't use it for what I ordered. Yet again, the coupon doesn't say anything about that. So I take the coupon back and I say "you guys suck" as I walk away and the guy says "f**k you, go to hell." Classy right?
So I've called their 800 number again, but highly doubtful I'm going back here. Wtf Taco Bell?

Went one night ordered two $5 dollar box w the burrito, taco etc. Recieved everything I ordered, but once I had gotten home & started eating pulled out a hair out of the chalupa while taking a bite, its bit the first time this has happened. I feel like they should be more hateful bc its v disturbing & it takes away from wanting to go there again.

I never leave reviews on fast food restaurants but I called ahead of time to find out their hours and Regis, who answered the phone, helped me find their location. He was incredibly professional and made me and my family feel comfortable about their quality of freshness that we stopped by even though it was late.  Regis met me at the window and greeted me as he did on the phone.  I was extremely impressed by him and his demeanor in which he approached his job.  I realize that this review is focused towards the one person I encountered in my visit  but the food surpassed my expectations.  I honestly believe this location employs people that care about there job and what they put in to it which is rare to see.

There are a few things you need to take into account before visiting a Taco Bell.  One, and probably the most important, is that it's Taco Bell.  This fact alone should set expectations in a very reasonable and realistic fashion.  You are not expecting fine dining, great service or a plush atmosphere.  You're expecting cheap, tasty tacos to be served to you expediently.  And those were pretty much my only expectations.  

So, I had planned to go to Chick-fil-a but because of the odd setup with the median, I missed the turn in.  Being in a hurry and not terribly picky I came across Taco Bell next, and so Taco Bell it was.  If you really want to get specific it's technically a Taco Bell/Long John Silvers.  

Upon entering, it became obvious that things simply weren't moving at the pace that you'd expect from a fast food establishment.  There were multiple people waiting for orders and nobody at the register.  I waited several moments and someone finally showed up to take my order.  I went with the 3 crunchy tacos combo meal.  That's it.  I sat down and proceeded to wait.  It took 17 minutes from the time I ordered (I checked the time stamp on my receipt) for me to get 3 crunchy tacos.  Not acceptable.  Everything tasted fine but I should have been in and out in 17 minutes.  I'm not sure what the issue was.  It wasn't unduly busy.  It doesn't really matter.  I thought my expectations were low enough.  Apparently not.

The woman doing drive through tonight at 11: 45 was the best. Not one issue. Perfect example of a good employee who is polite and efficient. She handlers a while line of cars perfectly and for that I thank her for my burritos.
Typical late night line at a Taco Bell. Biggest complaint was after I repeated my order twice, still when I got home. It was wrong.

The employee that was serving me was completely clueless and ignored me when I asked for more sauce, and asked three other parties what they wanted to order. She was resting while I was waiting for my things. Overall I'm frustrated and shocked because usually I don't have problems with this Taco Bell.
Good and busy. The place is clean, restrooms decent. Food is fast. If you want a quick bite this is it. I opt for the powerbowl no meat.
Horrible customer service!!! The lady was very rude at the drive thru. how are you going to be a Taco Bell with no tortillas and then be rude as hell.

If you like the worst stalky hard chunks of lettuce being the primary ingredient and little to no cheese even if you pay for extra for it in your Taco Bell then this is the location for you!!!
It almost seems like the place is solely there to push out the most undesirable garbage stalk ends of lettuce. All the employees seem to be trained to make everything 80% lettuce stalks and 2% cheese... probably just a scam to make numbers look good for the manager.
Even if you ask for light lettuce and extra cheese, despite the fact they will charge an extra .45 cents per item they will come out the same.

I have been here a few times, the service isn't the best and they can NEVER get an order right... i just went through the drive through and handed the guy at the window $10 while my order was under $8, he handed me change but no bills which isn't a big deal, people forget. When i told him about it, it was like i I convinced him. I also realized that they were missing a burrito and i ordered the nacho fries well i got actual nachos. I also ordered water and went to ho inside to get it, the doors were locked (it was before 8pm) so i went through the drive through and the same guy looked like he didn't care...

Was excited because there are not any other Taco Bell's in the area & I ever so often need my taco-fix. I am incredibly disturbed with my visit a few weeks ago. During this time, while waiting for my taco... I witnessed 2 people get their orders messed up, the manager yelling at his employees, and a worker coming out to the floor yelling at whoever complained (when his order was completely wrong). It was almost a comedy act. After exactly 16 minutes, I finally received my meal. Nice and cold.

They're pretty on top of their game, the food was fresh and neatly prepared while service was fast and friendly. 
Not just friendly by 1:00am standards either, they put Chic-fil-a to shame.

The slowest Taco Bell ever!!! The employees have no drive no care.  It always takes me 25-30 minutes in drive thru. The inside is even longer!!!! I still go there despite the torturous wait because I like the food. Poor management!!!!! They need to improve.

This is the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to, and I have been to a lot of Taco Bells. I love Taco Bell usually. It is the quality that is really lacking. If you buy a crunch wrap at this Taco Bell, it will be half the size of what it should be, but you are still paying the same price. I live in Manor, so I have been to this Taco Bell several times, hoping it will somehow get better. It hasn't though. Everything is miniature, and I always feel gross after eating there. Someone needs to look into the obvious issues taking place at this location.

With this Taco Bell it's either a hit or miss. Either they do a great job or they can't get my order right or don't remember something. The biggest thing is they can't remember to ever give me a straw. Isn't that supposed to be the easiest thing? I've also been there when they've been out of chicken. What kind of Taco Bell runs out of chicken?

Absolutely terrible! Working a job nearby and we decided to stop here. Mistake.... No one I repeat no one greeting customers. 5 or more people waiting in line to order and the drive through lady looks at us and says "use the kiosks that's what they are there for." So we oblige and kiosks are not working to accept credit card. We wait another 10 minutes a girl throws her gloves off huffs and walks over to the register. While speaking with a customer and getting his order her terminal malfunctions so she says well F$&k . You can see the manager sitting at the desk in the back. The girl at the counter has no business ringing up customers. Terrible

This Taco Bell is the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to. I order a side of fiesta potatoes and it took the employees 20 minutes to make it. This is outrageous. It shouldn't have tooken them that long. The food was good and the employees were very nice but the restrooms were dirty and needed to be clean. The employees would say your name when your food was ready but the say it too quietly.  So to summarize the review I would not recommend coming here if you are in a hurry or need to use the restroom.
In the drive through line for 25 minutes to only get the wrong order. Not the mostly friendly Taco Bell at times.
This place is top notch. Always greeted with positivity, and orders are always correct. 10/10.

Every time I go here it's always a new person at the window. I don't know where they are getting them from but I'm pretty sure it's the willy wonka chocolate factory. The workers be happy as hell. But I'm good with that. 

Food is hot, serviced quick, and always with a smile.

Poor customer service. Understaffed. Rude. Only the manager (Kimberly) and one employee working, and in her own words "it's like this every night". Apparently, this excuses the lack of concern/customer service.
All i can say is that the food here at this Taco Bell is horrible! Please train your employees properly.
I can't believe I am writing a review for a fast food joint but this place has the BEST service. they are so nice!

Went here the other night with my grandmother and brother. Waited in line at the drive thru for atleast 20 minutes before ordering. The guy over the speaker just kept apologizing and apologizing saying "I'll be right with you".... a woman a few cars behind me walked up to the window see what was going on.. turns out he was the only guy working. One staff on a Tuesday night having to work both the front and drive thru??? Makes no sense. Ordered our food and waited another 10-15 minutes for it to come. The guy in the truck in front of me drove over the curb he was so aggravated and didn't want to wait any longer. I almost did the same. While I understand he was the only guy working, why couldn't he just close for the night instead of trying to do it all himself?!? I could only imagine what it would've been like if it was a Friday or Saturday night and he was the only guy on. He was a bit of a weirdo too.

I go there for late night food. They purposely turn off all the lights so no one thinks they are open. It's bad for business. Plus the late night staff is rude usually. You can tell they don't wanna be there.

Alright so I gave this location another try tonight and I have to say someone is listening to these reviews as the service was better than ever as Aunton A was in the window delivering great service and was super friendly........Great Job!!!

Time will tell if this was a one time experience or someone has really changed the employees attitude towards the customers.
Burnadette (if that's her name)was Incredibly rude. Very hard to talk to. Every time I have been to this location of Taco Bell the staff have been so rude. They really need to do more staff training.

Come here if you're trying to be in a drive thru line for 25 minutes on a Tuesday night at 8 pm. I'm not sure if they let people go early or get rid of all their stuff early but it never fails. Please staff correctly.
Lame. Ordered two bean and cheese burritos with no onions and got extra onions. All the south Austin Taco Bell's suck so badly!!!
This is the absolute slowest Taco bell I've ever been in. Waiting 15 minutes and counting for some tacos and a crunch wrap is unacceptable. Fast food my ass....

I went inside for a take out order - the store overall looks dirty, cleaning water clearly is not changed out, everything has smudges and grim on it. Staff could care less if you are standing there and even their appearance is nasty, cloths are messy and they clearly are not interested in their customers but more about having conversations amongst themselves. I waited 15 minutes for my food and left without it as I had to be at a meeting.
Love the larger than life employee ad - they clearly need new staff and cleaning products.
I suggest you avoid the Clermont store at all cost.......never again.

This is the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to. Always dirty inside. Most of the tables caked with cheese and god knows what. They take forever to prepare your order. Don't even get in the drive thru line if you are on a lunch break or want to eat within the next 20 minutes. They also usually leave some ingredients out of the burritos. I think each cook might have their own version of what goes in them. Fast food chain franchises are only successful when they are consistent. This one falls far from the bar. Never going back.

Do I REALLY need to review Taco Bell?  I don't think so but I am anyway.  You got a problem with that?  No?  Good.  Don't judge me.  Every now and again I get to jonesing for some Nachos that are drenched in 'cheese' sauce and covered with 'beef'.  Typically I feel really gross and needing to cleanse my body and soul.  The 4 times I typically eat fast food at least half is here.  It keeps getting worse and worse but I just can't help myself.
naw, still slow and terrible. literally have gotten sick 4 out of 4 times on recent visits. done.
My food tasted horrible and spoiled. The taco shell had this awful chemical taste to it.

Told me my sauce was in the bag but it wasn't and my chicken chalupa was missing but other than this friendly drive-thru lady and it was my fault for not checking before I pulled off. Good size portion on my nacho bell grande.

Typical shithole Taco Bell. New workers every week, pay $4 and wait for 30 minutes for a half full burrito.

Worst chain imaginable somehow.

Filthy place. There was no ice In ice machine I had to ask the staff to fill the ice for me. They gave me a wrong order and had to wait for like 10 mins to cook my order I mean is this a fast food restaurant ..? There was barely people around at that time. I don't think I ever want to come back here again.

There are times in the past when this was a decent Taco Bell for me to get a quick to go meal on the way to a literary event I go to sometime once a month.. I went there recently and the food was ok as it usually is.. But the cashier, although not exactly unfriendly, did not have good customer service skills.. It also totally was not good news to hear that this location no longer offers any senior discount.. Just to drop something like that which they had offered for many years is nasty... Also two of the employees were standing against the wall behind the register talking about which tables were dirty.. And there were several.. But they continued to stand there with their hands in their pockets and making no efforts to clean the tables. It was not a pleasant Taco Bell experience at all.. I probably won't get food here again.

5 star reviews are not given lightly by me but this is a fast food restaurant so standards are lowered a bit. Visited the drive thru last night (4th meal) and was first greeted with a very nice "welcome to Taco Bell..."  This was very refreshing since just a few minutes prior I was being 'slowly neglected' at the McDonalds a mile down the street. The person was exceptionally friendly. I placed my six item order, got the total (asked to verify order on screen) then drove around. The gal that took my money was equally as courteous (at 10:30 PM) and had my order ready before I could put my change up. From start to finish, my experience lasted probably 3 minutes. Excellent work by their kitchen staff. 

Granted the food IS Taco Bell, so it wasn't exceptionally delicious but based on other like stores, it was good. 

This isn't my first visit here and they've always been great. Highly recommended for fourth meal!!!

If coming to grab "4th meal" you will be disappointed with how long you will wait. Both in the drive through and inside. 

I went a few days ago and waited from 10:35pm - 11:20 for a Crunchwrap supreme, cheesy Gordita crunch and a Doritos locos taco. 

I complained to the staff and manager about the wait because this was the 5th time I'd had to wait over 20 minutes for my food at this location. They told me to come back tomorrow from 1:00pm to 5:00pm to get free food... I told them I'm not complaining to get anything I'm just pissed because the whole reason anyone comes to Taco Bell is because it's meant to take 5 min to get your food and get out. It's called "Fast Food" because it's meant to be faster than Chili's. They said it was because the changing of the shift at 10-11. But here's my thing and I'm done... why would you not overlap your employees schedules or adjust times if you know you get all of the traffic right during that time since SeaWorld and Disney let out during that time?! I told them they need to address it if they want my business. They got pissed at me and passive aggressively tossed my food on the counter. 

Great stuff Taco Bell. I didn't expect much but you went ahead and disappointed me still! 

I'll be driving to the Crossroads location from now until i4 demolishes it.

Great warm, food. Great customer service. Quick drive through service. 
We went to Wendy's first and they were disgusting, awful customer service (cashier burped in our face) while taking payment, and our food was thrown out the window along with gross food. Wendy's could learn a lot from Taco Bell a few stores over. Good job Taco Bell!

I always go to this Taco Bell when I by Seaworld. The staff is really nice and always make me feel like I'm at home. The store is always clean and efficient. Plenty of vegetarian options, just substitute meat for beans!
Don't really like this taco Bell. They are always slow as hell with getting your food together. Stingy as hell with the sauces. 3 packs of sauce for 6 tacos.. come on man..

Good food, good value and friendly workers. The only negative I have about this Taco Bell is that the drive thru during lunch hours is very slow. Every time you would go through the drive through, it would take at least 10 minutes from the time you placed the order and pick it up at the window.
The order was right on the receipt. When we checked our food everything thing was wrong. When we went back  they gave us a new order. This time half the order was wrong. Such horrible service.

This place has been a disappointment the last two times I have tried to go. A few weeks ago we went to grab A late night dinner around 1230 ( they are open til 1) when I got to order the guy told me he was closing early because he had to catch the bus home... very frustrating. The last night we went again around 11pm and ordered our food. When we got to the window to pay the employee informed me that it was cash only. AFTER I HAD ALREADY ORDERED. I explained that I did not have any cash and he told me that he was sorry I could not pay with my card or have my food. Very unfair considering that I was not u formed until after I had ordered.l and still wasn't able to get my food. We will not be back.

Don't go here!  the place is filthy...  Someone spilled a drink and let the staff know. 20 minutes later no sign was placed and the cup and entire drink was still on the floor.   Wait for food was way too long for taco bell.  And then the girl tells me they are out of chips (on a prev visit, out of ice.)  As I am leaving I see someone eating the nachos I wanted to order.  Then...  the cashier comes up and asks us to complete a survey on how her service was.  Brave....

My experience at Cumberland Taco Bell wasn't a good one.

While waiting for my order, I went to the men's restroom.  One of the employees from the kitchen was in one of the stalls and didn't have the decency to shut and lock the door.
