When I walked in there, there he was, pants down, casually dropping the kids off at the pool.  He didn't seem startled in the slightest that his business was out in the open for others to see.  Good for him, but I don't care to see that ish. That image has now been scarred into my brain.

No quiero esta Taco Bell.
Awsome awsome awsome service to night owls go here also polite for late workers who just want go home very polite thank you

I don't even want to put a single star. The service is absolutely horrendous, the staff to management is run by animals who bark at you. We literally left the drive through line and got quesadillas at the nearby wawa... and let me tell you the wawas quesadillas are way better quality. Disgusting food and people at this Taco Bell, will never return.

Wanted to give 5 stars, but I cannot in good conscious as it is 'fast food,' after all (5 stars should go to some place with top-notch wait-service, an Exec and Sous Chef, etc, etc).
Otherwise, everything is always tasty.   Place is clean and well lit.   Good, good people!  The new menus items like the Dorito Tacos, or Nachos Burritos are wonderfully addictive.   I eat there waaaaaaay too often and have never paid the 'Porcelain Toll' and the orders have been nearly perfect (only one lil' slip-up in nearly 7 years).
Best off, for 10-15 dollars, you can feed a small army.

As an experienced Taco Bell customer(sorry mom), I will say this is a pretty solid location. Friendly staff. Not perfect, but it seems most Taco Bell's suffer from staffing problems from time to time. Managers, if you're reading this, understaffing is WORSE for you than overstaffing on weekend nights. The recent wait times have been pretty ridiculously.

I will give a shoutout to the REAL MVP of this location, and that person is Pete. Me and my roommate only know him through our shared patronage over the past couple of months, so I can honestly say he's amazing at his job. Great service and knows what he's doing. 10/10 would buy him a beer for being a generally rad person.

Terrible service on Sunday 19 November at 6pm 2017 and Wednesday 15 August at 6:45pm 2018

Nov: Lady at drive thru was rude and short with us. She gave us only half our order. Asked for Taco Supremes, they are regular. Sauces missing. Not going back. Plenty of other places on Roswell Rd. Lady at register didn't even say you're welcome or any greetings at all. What happened to the other nice people that used to work there? They left because of her?

Then today I ordered 4 crunchy taco supremes and had to wait in the drive thru for 10 mins. Then they got the order wrong. No wonder they have 2 stars. Corporate get this store together!

Located near Seaward, this Taco Bell is open late and has a very quick and efficient drive through. A bit to quick sadly, as others have mentioned grilled items are often not grilled to perfection.

Maybe it is just Florida, but this Taco Bell, even more so for being in a tourist trap, is very well priced. Surprisingly if you look at the menu, you can find some fairly healthy items to order but it does take a bit of menu navigation.

All in all though if you are near Seaworld, this is not a horrible Taco Bell to visit.

Watch out for the unwritten price list.  I placed my order of an item with the price clearly listed on the menu only to be charged 15% more at the register.  The manager only shrugged and refused to honor the listed price.

The woman at the register has been friendly over my many visits, but she works for an a$$hole.

On 4-27-2019 I waited 10-minutes to get served at the counter while the drive through was working full speed. after asking for assistance twice and being given the "not my problem" salute. I became more vocal. The lady at the window came over and waited on me. After being told I could go through the drive through and after two customers behind me had departed. I only hope they did not get in the drive through line. This Taco Bell Location is mis-managed and the staff has no instinctive to provide counter service.

No forks were available. I had to ask for one. 

As I was eating my meal they they locked the doors after placing a closed sign on the two door. I was trapped along with another gentleman in the store wit no way to exit without assistance. This is a violation of all fire codes and the Life Safety Code. This is just wrong!!!

Zero Stars!  Aside from them always fucking up your order. It has to be one of the slowest service in fast food history. If you go inside thinking it will be faster, you're going to be sadly mistaken. 

If you're desperate enough to wait in the drive-thru line, I hope you have half an hour to kill and a full tank of gas, cause you're gonna be there for-fucking-ever! 

Side note* When the fuck did these fast food places think they are 5 star restaurants able to charge close to or sometimes over $10 for the garbage they pass off as food? 
Fuck off with these $9 meals. Nothing on the menu should be more than $2 and if you get ANY meal it shouldn't be more than $5
During this day a employee helped a choking child :) and the food was amazing the sweet tea was exalent it was so good we had to refill it 4 times

Always busy, this Taco Bell is my favorite. Good, friendly customer service and they're always hustling. No slackers here. 
Aaaaand, the foods consistently good.
Oh I forgot to mention the guy with a girl sitting in the middle of the place. Maybe around late 20's. He had his hand down his pants and was playing with himself.

Great Service

This restaurant often gets a bad rap, but my experiences here have always been good.  Someone I know told me they once called the police after being in the drive thru for over 30 minutes (there is no way out once you get in) because they genuinely thought something must have happened to the staff inside.  Most recently however I took my 7 year old niece there when she requested Taco Bell after having a rough day.  After we had ordered, and we were waiting for the food, she related the story of how she was bitten by a dog earlier in the day.  As there were no customers behind us, the cashier listened intently, and then offered her a "freezie" or whatever it is called.  In the grand scheme of things, this was a small gesture, but it meant the world to my niece; she told everyone she came in contact with over the next day or two about this experience.  On other occasions, I have noticed that the staff goes above in their customer interactions, but this time it was so sweet that I felt it definitely warranted online recognition.  Thank you for keeping a little bit of the small-town feel in an area that is quickly becoming primarily industrial.

Hi my name is Victoria Hernandez and I place my order at 10:55 p.m. and I have the receipt with my order they gave me the wrong order I was nice to take the wait that yall had..i came back 11:15p.m .there was long line so im waiting again some come out there car in front of me saying tace bell was not take oders for 30 min.so im waiting for 30 in front. Tacobell .i have pictures of everything.. and don't Taco Bell don't close until 1 p.m. it doesn't make sense why this Taco Bell is closed for 30 minutes either I need my refunds back or something free I am waiting in the front of Taco Bell why this food that they gave me is getting cold and I need my food that I ordered I am really f****** pissed right about now. And I called when I got home and looked in the bag and this is what I got nothing nobody still answers is 1207 and nobody's answering the phone.i be back in morning this shit maybe food too.. it don't make no sense what kind of employees don't do their job right and what kind of manager that working that night answer the doors all the windows
Rio Norman was an amazing worker and very polite helping me with my order.  I'm coming back alone because of Rios. Use knee service at Taco Bell

This Taco Bell is the worst I've ever been to the didn't melt the Mexican melts the quesadilla was not cooked well, I ordered a crunch wrap with no lettuce and got lettuce and they forgot a burrito and the best part was that there was a hair in my wife's pintos and cheese # boycott

Never ever going here again.........

Complete disregard for customers with the smart ass attitude from chicky chick Natalie taking orders tonight.

Order was wrong and they don't answer the phone on the receipt when you call to ask where the correct order is.... sketchy business practice when u can't get them on the phone.

Someone needs to correct the service here or close it.
I placed an online pickup order and jut waited in line for 40+ minutes. Worst service I've ever had in my entire life. Anyone running this store should be fired.
I'm sorry but I shouldn't be receiving a crunch wrap like this... Step up your game Taco Bell, what the hell happened to your staff??
Great Place, Tacos are good. I recommend the T6. Soft Tacos are better then hard in my opinion. Sometimes closes. They gossip about you in Spanish. Cmon

All I wanted was a $5 craving and a steak quesarito and this lady comes in BLEEDING EVERYWHERE. The Management NEEDED CUSTOMER ADVICE to put on gloves and sanitize the place properly. I had ordered food before this incident happened and my friend was given his full order AND A REFUND. I am trained in SAFETY AND SECURITY and staff was barehanded spreading blood everywhere. My friend got a refund and his food and I was given nothing. This is a SERIOUS VIOLATION OF HEALTH STANDARDS. The manager on staff would not provide anything despite GROSS VIOLATIONS OF HEALTH STANDARDS. This is a step beyond f$&3:d up

This location is my neighborhood Taco Bell. It's conveniently located at the Cofer shopping plaza alongside Kroger and Walmart. (Be warned of the traffic during peak shopping hours) The staff appears to be different every time but I've never had an issue with my food other than the occasional long wait. Customer service isn't among the top of my list when it comes to fast food because I have my go-to's such as the chalupa. A chalupa is essentially a fried taco shell and it's their "modernized" approach to Mexican cuisine. Overall, TB isn't your hole in the wall cantina but it'll pass whenever you're craving a quick fix for some tacos. P.S. don't forget to get the hot sauce packets/inside out fortune cookies!
Terrible Taco Bell, cashier can't do simple math and unwilling to substitute more rice for when removing sour cream, cheese and lettuce....did rice become a precious commodity at some point?
Slowest service in the history of food service. Outdated. Employees are slow as hell. Never seen anything like it. Was in line for 45 minutes no exaggeration to get tacos at 10pm

This place SUCKS!!!!!!!! That may be an understatement. The dumb people ran out of beef and then charged me extra for other options (chicken and steak). After mentioning this the manager told me that she can't control that. By the way I went here earlier in the day and the whole computer system was down and they didn't have their shit together even though the drive through computer was working just fine. Fuck this Taco Bell and their leadership. I would love for the franchise owner to contact me and I will instruct him or her on proper business practice.

I placed an order for 2 chalupas and a quesadilla. after waiting way too long a person comes over and says: I need to rebate your order, the deep fried is not turning on and we can't make the chalupa.. she asked for my card, I give it to her and try to order something else. She was like I have a line, meaning no you can't order something else... Bad customer service, not even and offer to pull foward and I bring your food... After all my wait I had to go to BK

This Taco Bell is one of  The worst I have ever been to. 1st the person taking the order was very short and didn't seem to pay attention to was we were saying we wanted. Although very nice and well spoken when she wanted to be. 2nd We had 2 separate orders which the employee said it was fine and told us the price for each one as probably she is supposed to do. We pulled forward and paid for both of the orders. 3rd is we were given 1/2 of the 1st order and just the $5.00 box for the 2nd order. We didn't receive the $5.00 box for the 1st order nor did we get the drink for the 2nd order. We only realized the drink missing on the 2nd order so we sat in the drive threw for about 2 to 3 minutes while being ignored. When she finally did came back to the window we could tell she was very annoyed by us s still being at the window as she asked what we need and before we could say anything she blurted out. "oh yeah the drink." I asked before driving away is that everything. and she replied "yes". We got home and no $5.00 box for 1st order and no receipt for both orders. my girlfriend and our friend b ok th got there food but I did not  So we tried to call and number attached to this taco bell given by Google and on the Taco Bell Website. It wasn't answered even though I called many many times and went to what sounded like a fax line. We called the next day and a woman answered the phone we asked to speak to manager and we were replied with they are bizzy and i can help you and wanted to know what we wanted, so we told her, she replied with do you have the Receipt. And again like I said earlier we were not give bbn a receipt that night.  She said no she can't do it without receipt and offered a $1.00 burrito  to compensate for the $5.00 loss we took.  She we started no not good enough!  I just want the food I played for.  So we asked to speak to the manager again!  And again she said no, she said manager was not available and she wouldn't even take our names or phone number to have them call back and then she hung up on us. I called back probably 3 more times no answer. Then called TacoBell Corporate  and filed a complaint. which still hasn't been resolved or even contacted back and said we are sorry and you can come get the food you paid for at the least. This is a very poor way to show that Taco Bell wants to keep customers happy. This is a very good chance for a training opportunity  for there employees. I hope that now this will be resolved it isn't about the money more as bout the principle. Now I guess I will wait still. But won't hold my breath.

Waited over an hour for my order to get delivered, called them about it and they hung up!!! Worst customer service ever. I called them again and did not answer at all until 10 minutes later! Bad luck the day before my last final exam. Currently still waiting for my food to come...

Look, I don't need to describe Taco Bell's menu to you. You know what you're getting. And food wise, this place is just as good as the next Taco Bell. However, the wait time there is unacceptable! 

Doesn't matter if you drive thru, or go inside hoping to beat the line of cars. You're guaranteed to wait 20-30 minutes every time. Even though I only live a few minutes away from here and LOVE me some Taco Bell, this location has seriously made me turn away from it because I end up grumpy after so much waiting time with no improvement in sight. The staff for the most part doesn't really seem overly concerned either. Maybe they're just burned out at this point from being chronically understaffed, who knows.
I don't know what her name was, but when I asked for a sh*t ton of fire sauce, she gave me A SH*T TON of fire sauce. You don't see this often. Great job Taco Bell staff, I'll be back.

I went through the drive thru Today and They took forever to take my order. When I got to the window I asked for extra hot sauce packets.. I checked the bag,, he gave me two packets.. for 3 items.. SERIOUSLY?? He acted like he couldn't spare any. I asked for more and he only gave me 1 more. Said he ran out... 

I used to work there I KNOW they have boxes of those packets underneath the counter. He was just being a jerk. And more surprisingly I'm pretty sure he was the MANAGER.

when I got home I discovered that the grillers tasted different. They must've used a different sauce or the beans out too long. Cuz it just did not taste good.

The lettuce on the one taco I got was nasty looking. The kind that doesn't stand up on its own. Like its been out WAY TOO LONG. lettuce isn't suppose to be soggy!

Slow, slow, slow! Went to the drive thru on a Sat nite. Two cars ahead of me, they had already placed their order. Took 3 tries for the guy to take/hear my order. Bad intercom system. Only order 1 thing, crunchwrap supreme, no beef, no tomato. Then proceeded to wait behind those 2 other cars for at least 5-7 min. No action at the car waiting at the window, no food coming out. Called the store from my cell phone, spoke with manager, he didn't seem too concerned stating that they were very busy and trying to catch up. Finally got to window at the 8-9 min mark, got my order, no apologies for the wait. Drove forward, only to have my daughter check the bag, wrong order. Got 4 crunchwrap sliders with beef and tomato! Parked went inside with receipt. Inside, not busy! One guy waiting to place order, no one there to take it. I asked him if any had taken his order yet, he said no, he had been waiting 4-5 min. He gave up and left. Had a guy come in after me, and guess what, he had just been through the drive thru and also got the wrong order. Too bad i didn't get his and he got mine, we could have switched and gotten the hell out of there! While we were waiting for someone to come out to the register, my daughter saw the girl behind the counter out back picking out food and eating as she was just wandering around! When she got done eating a bit, she finally came up to the counter to wait on us. Told her we got wrong order, she didn't say much but "oh", then went out back. The guy behind me that got wrong order as well, decided it wasn't worth the wait and left. When the guy behind the counter finally gave us the correct order, he looked half asleep or stoned, i couldn't tell. Stay away, stay far away!

As an experienced Taco Bell customer(sorry mom), I will say this is a pretty solid location. Friendly staff. Not perfect, but it seems most Taco Bell's suffer from staffing problems from time to time. Managers, if you're reading this, understaffing is WORSE for you than overstaffing on weekend nights. I will give a shoutout to the REAL MVP of this location, and that person is Pete. Me and my roommate only know him through our shared patronage over the past couple of months, so I can honestly say he's amazing at his job. Great service and knows what he's doing. 10/10 would buy him a beer for being a generally rad person.

It's honestly the SLOWEST drive thru I've EVER gone through. I'm not saying this with just having been here once. I have been here COUNTLESS times and today is definitely my last here. Every single time I come here, I am blown away beyond comprehension with how the service can be so dog shit. I'm LITERALLY WRITING THIS REVIEW WHILE WAITING IN LINE. THERE ARE FOUR CARS STILL IN FRONT OF ME, AND I HAVE BEEN HERE FOR 20 MINUTES. Four others just pulled up behind me and someone just left. Im on my way to Panda Express.
UPDATE: After driving 5 minutes to go to Panda Express, ordering my food and driving back (another 10 minutes), I ended up at a red light with the SAME PERSON who was in front of me in the drive thru. Honestly, I understand if you are understaffed (if that's even the case), but the employees show no concern to the wait time and it's a long wait EVERY TIME. Definitely not coming back to this location.

I've always had such a great experience at this place. It was 3am and I tried going to taco Cabana. It's supposedly a 24hr place but it wasn't open  however taco Bell (which was supposed to be closed) continued to take our order

Made an online order and waited about half an hour at the pickup until I asked what the status of my order was. On the app, it said that the order was received and that the food would be prepared soon. After I had mentioned that I had been waiting for a while, the manager (or at least who I assumed was the manager) came up and insisted that I had "not fully checked in" and needed to check in at the register for my order to be processed. I have gone to this same Taco Bell before and had made many online orders and not once had to check in at the register, as that would defeat the purpose of ordering online. I asked if he even knew how I was to fully check in and he said he did not. He was extremely rude and made it clear it was my fault for not fully checking in, even though neither of us knew what that meant and the app notified me my order was received and that I should wait at the pickup counter. Sure, I got my food and the order was correct, but service was horrible and proper management is nonexistent. To add to this, on my way out someone went up to the register and asked for their money back. Not sure why, but further shows the status of this place. Not coming back here again unless management changes.

Worst service I have ever received. I have gone multiple times (during business hours) and have been refused service in the drive thru. If you say you are open at a certain time then employees should be taking orders not ignoring them!
Take away food Cold on being given it. My husband ordered a Chicken Chalupa and I asked for the same. He got Chicken, I got beef. Won't go again to this one!

I just tried to go through the drive through and they said they could not take my order for 10-12 minutes because they got a grub hub order. I asked why they couldn't take the order of a customer physically at their store and they just said they could take it in 10-12 minutes. The fact that they are prioritizing the order of someone that is not even at the store is ridiculous. I have grubhub, Uber eats, and door dash at my restaurant and we always prioritize the customers at our store before we make the order of someone from the app.

Worst TB ever.  Tried to drive through for late night munchies tonight, and was told at the speaker that they were out of...EVERYTHING.  Seriously, it was almost comical that EVERY SINGLE THING we asked for, we were told they were out of the ingredients.  No beef, chicken, potatoes, nacho cheese, French fries, CUPS... The list goes on.

Perhaps it was just a single worker who is collecting a check and not giving a shit.  Maybe it was a terrible GM who didn't order the basic ingredients to their entire menu.  Maybe it was a freezer went out, causing mass spoilage.  Regardless, it doesn't make sense to be open if you can't sell anything.  What a shitty business.
The guy at the drive thru had the worst attitude, he should not be in customer service. We just left.

This particular location is very clean and friendly. 
Each and everyone of the employees make sure that your order is correct and is out in a reasonable timing! While i was dining in, i had an employee continuously check on me, even tho its a fast food restaurant. I sat near the window and watched them tackle a very long drive thru line in about 8 minutes... very impressive!

Look, it's a Taco Bell. You know whether you like it or not and you know the service to expect. But let me tell ya if you're choosing between the two Taco Bells on William Cannon, go to this one. The other one SUUUCCKKKSSS. The employees here are chill and nice and don't make me feel bad for enjoying Taco Bell on occasion
The service sucks. They say can I help you then start having a social conversation with another like individual. I walked out and will spend my money elsewhere!

I enjoyed visiting Taco Bell for breakfast they have a lot of good choices however I would love it if chicken was added to the breakfast menu or Turkey sausage was added to the breakfast menu I got an egg and cheese breakfast quesadilla ... however I was charged for bacon and I didn't get bacon so that's disappointing if I could have the option of adding Turkey sausage even turkey bacon our chicken that will be wonderful just a suggestion.

We went through drive to pick up some on-the-go food before heading out to meet friends. The wait for our order was about 5 minutes at the window with approximately 5 cars behind us (give or take). Mind you we did not add anything additional at the window. They had our correct. The cashier at the window was nice and had a welcoming attitude. We saw someone that was dealing in food prep go up to the cashier with gloves on to help someone (he tapped on the cashiers screen at the indoor register) and return back to the food prep area with the SAME gloves on! 

Uhhhhh HOLD on... "isn't he supposed to change our gloves?" I said out loud. I believe they heard me make a comment as that same guy was looking at me right after I made that comment. Dead on. I will not eat at this location ever again.

They messed up my order (not the first time) at a drive through.  When I discovered it an brought it back, the manager wanted to only refund items piecemeal.  Very classy.  Check your order at the drive though.

Love me some Taco Bell!  Nom nom nom!  This particular location is fast, friendly and clean.  The three things you look for in your fast food dining experiences!

Want to really feel like a fatty?  Head on over to the ice cream shop in the same shopping plaza for an extra treat!  Be warned though, at the end you'll feel a little bloated from all the edible goodness.  Just take the stairs!

the worst experience in fast food, not for the food but for the staff, whenever I come here I have to wait 30 minutes, do not come here, it's the worst to wait so much, the owner should hire more staff and a little more agile.

They are the worst Taco Bell in the city. I ordered four items. Two were wrong and one was totally burnt. It took about 15 minutes for my food to come out! If I would have known it wouldn't be worth it I would not have sat in the car that long!! Just take the extra time and drive to the one at 270!! This place is a mess

I have no shame in ordering Taco Bell... most of the time. It's cheap, quick, and just what the alcohol ordered. 

Even late at night the staff is friendly and handles the most ridiculous orders with ease. I don't think we've ever gotten our order messed up. 

The remodel is nice (way better than the dump it used to be when it was combined TB/Pizza Hut) but it does not disguise the fact that you're eating at the 'Bell, not that it's really an issue.

I'm highly disappointed in the service with the night crew. Around 1am I came with some friends. Ordered the 5$ Chicken Chlupa box. It took well over 10 minutes. The food wasn't even warm, the Doritos locos taco was stale-ish. Never got the cinnamon twist that come with it either, nor came in the box. The whole order was half assed. I will not be coming back here if the service is going to be that awful. Poor customer service and food.

Taco Bell is the same pretty much everywhere you go, but there is always something a bit different.  The bathrooms here are clean, the people working there are friendly, & there is always a place to sit.  Unfortunately, the last 2 times I went there, they messed up our order.  So just make certain that you double check your receipt & what you receive.
Slowest Taco Bell ever...   we did drive through with no one in front of us, but still took forever

Ahhhh taco bell...great place to go after the bars or when you want to relieve stress and pig out.

Taco bell may be so unhealthy but it is soo good!  This place has a drive thru so you're in and out and already half done with your meal before you pull out onto VFW parkway.  The staff here is ultra friendly which is a shocker and if you want some fried clams, Long John's is there as well. (I strongly do not recommend to order anything from that menu)

I love ordering from the cheapo menu such as the 1/2 pound burrito and the cheesy fiesta potatoes.  Yeah, the lettuce is limpy, the shredded cheese can be sometimes dried out and the meat is probably a grade D, but it's 7 minutes in heaven!

So here's to you: 1 gallon mt. dew gulp, 3 crunchy taco meal taker!

STILL the worst place when it comes to customer service!! I am APPALLED at their customer service skills.. my husband and I went last night after work and we gave them a 20$ bill..the total was 13 something which meant we got 7 somethin back. All I got back was 2 dollars and 2 cents. I quickly questioned it and said "where is the rest of my change"? I noticed the girl who took our order and Money standing around talking to the kids and yes they were kids, at the next window just as fast as I questioned it and then they say "pull up to the curb we have to count the drawer" it took 35 minutes for them to do so and the manager for the evening came out with a HORRIBLE attitude accusing us of being wrong when the receipt in our hand said what we were saying so the receipt backed us up.. she said "well here's 5 dollars out of my pocket" I took it from her and said " that's not the point the point is that your employees are STEALING money from customers and it's not right I want MY original 5 dollars that's on her body, in her pockets" the manager proceeded to say "she doesn't have it the drawer is even" I said "yeah I know, cuz she's been pocketing money all damn day so of course it will be even"..this is not the first time this has happened and it's not the first time they got our order wrong. nothing has ever done to make the situation right especially when it comes to stealing money. If you choose to eat here I would watch the money very closely and demand they give you the right change right then and there..I would even venture to say call the cops if you run into the situation I did last night. The manger who allowed this to happen AND the person who was doing it needs to be fired ON THE SPOT! If this happens again to us the cops WILL be called and people WILL be searched!
Terrible service, food is not cooked enough, cold raw and disgusting, don't eat here this location should be closed!!!

I don't get it how do you not know what order you put in the bag . Then ask the customer is that the correct order ? Then one employee opened one of the tacos to confirm it was correct ! He has the nerve to put it back in the bag after he  held it up to his face and breathed on it . Who does this .. I had to tell him please get me another one please . He did but was obviously annoyed. Yeah don't think I will be going back horrible service ..
People that work there are really friendly and the food is never that bad it's just always at least a 15 minute wait whether it's drive-through or dine in

One of the worst Taco Bells in the area. Consistently slow, gets orders wrong, out of stock, no semblance of effort with customer service. I've also seen it close much earlier than their listed hours. Like, I've driven 10 mins to the next closest one just to avoid this one. 

And this comes from someone who enjoys the brand very much. There are good ones around town that put this one to shame.
Crazy slow service, like a 45 min drive through wait and only "if" you get your food it's not always what you ordered...I hope corporate can fix this???

Why did I not follow the other Yelp reviews. #fail on my part, but my kids were hungry, traffic was horrible, and this was the only place with a drive through.  

The reviews said to expect your order to be wrong.  Wow!  They just knew.  I ordered two bean and cheese burritos-as is, and one bean and cheese burrito with NO onions!  Guess what?!?!  They all had onions, a LOT of onions. 

Second, the beans were in liquid form.  Not like soft beans (like other TBs). The stuff was running out of the poorly wrapped tortilas.  After 2-3 bites, the mess went in the garbage. 

Whats even worse was that both of my kids had horrible stomach aches that night as did I.  I would stay FAR from this location.

The staff was friendly though.

Me and my friend. Left our house and walked to Taco Bell because we were very hungry and it said it was open til 1:00. But when I got there. At 11:30 the kid working there closed the restaurant and the drive thru early because he wanted to hang out with his friends. They came and picked him up, right as he was telling the people in the drive thru, that the last order was taken. I am very very upset all I wanted was a Baja blast and this Taco Bell, the only one I could get to. Closed early because someone wanted to hang out with their friends. we were waiting on some friends to pick us up at the drive thru, and we had to tell them that it was closed. Everyone that was told it was closed thought it was open till 1:00 and were very disappointed. All I wanted was a baja blast. And because of irresponsibility. I did not get that

Great customer service. I really wish I knew the girls name because she was very nice and provided great service. I got the Mexican pizza and swapped out the meat for some beans. Same with my tacos. I never knew you could do that with the tacos so I was really happy she offered that to me because now I know! Make sure you got some hot nacho cheese on the side and throw it on your tacos and pizza! Sooo good.

Worst Tacobell I've ever been to. I have worked in the area for about 3 years now and can not recall a time where my order was correct. Literally every single time there is either something missing or incorrectly made. I worked at a TacoBell in high school and find it very frustrating this is the service provided. Despite my previous commitments to staying away, I come back every couple months or so to see if things have been corrected, but with this being my 4th consecutive fudged up order, all hope is lost. Tacobell will forever have a place in my heart, but this my formal resignation from this location.

The food quality and service have taken a downward turn over the past year. At the drive thru, the food came out so poorly packaged that crunchy tacos were crushed and one was completely opened with contents spilled all over the other food, making those paper wrappers tear and the food inside became wet and cold. Very unappetizing.
Food is okay, but they get my order wrong 50% of the time. When I can they come back between now and 8 am and they will Give you the correct order..., that's annoying . No sorry ever.

Giselle was fantastic at her job at the front cash register. Their whole team tonight (its 7/5 around 9pm) had amazing customer service and you need to employ more people like the team today. Even under lots of stress, multiple clients, the cash register even failing, Giselle stayed calm cool and collective and the team was getting the orders out in a timely manner. Thank you again, please keep up your good work but don't over work yourselves.

I absolutely love this Taco Bell. The restaurant itself is two to three times larger than the average Taco Bell, so nice and lots of room. It has to be one of the cleanest TB I have been to, there is the average tracked in dirt occasionally, but they are so good about cleaning everything nicely. I have no complaints here. The food is typical Taco Bell food, so just expect that. TB corporate could produce better food.

Customer service here has improved a lot they always get my order correct and repeat it back to me. The girls are really nice who work here. The lobby needs a remodel badly. Drive thru times can use a little work.

Late night drive thru review ONLY!!!

WHOEVER the owner of this location is SERIOUSLY NEEDS to pay a visit or do SOMETHING and HIRE PPL! There aren't many late night options for food, and sometimes when you really want something, EVEN AS GOURMET (sarcastic) as Taco bell, you'll wait for it. But by golly, I told my kiddos they owe me $100 bucks for making me wait thirty minutes in a TACO bleeping Bell drive thru. That's right, the worker would help two cars then omg the next order wasn't taken for at least 7-10 minutes later. There was ALWAYS  a line of 5+ cars. So, in my opinion, if you want late night food and think of coming here, maybe find another option. I won't EVER come back to this location for a late night anything. I kindly asked the guy at the window if HE was the only one and he said its hard to get employees there. Can't get mad at the person who IS there, but fuh-REAL, never again.

I'm a huge fan of Taco Bell, though this particular location is insanely slow, as others have commented. 

They don't do anything wrong in terms of delivering an accurate order (at least in my experience), but both inside and via the drive thru, orders can take 20-30 minutes EACH, on average. 

Yesterday, the "window timer" in the drive through hit 24 minutes before we got our food. I pulled over to the side and parked, and my girlfriend and I both finished our food before the car behind us got their food, it takes that long. 

There is definitely something weird going on with their order times, it far exceeds anything I've seen anywhere else, Taco Bell or otherwise. 

It's aggravating because there arent many Taco Bells in the Boston area, so you're left with waiting, or just going without. And I think all Taco Bell fans dont want to see another location closed, just fix the speed. 

No comment on Long John Silvers aspect of this place, never ordered off that menu.

I don't usually write reviews here being that I'm in the service industry myself and I know how harmful one person's experience can effect a business but I've had the unfortunate experience of trying to get some TB after my shifts ranging from 11pm to 1 am and something is ALWAYS out. Couldn't order anything yesterday 8/2/2019 due to ground beef being out. Today I get there several hours earlier (11pm) and place my order. Feeling a bit more confident and okay with my choice to give the staff a 2nd chance. However I get to the window and I'm told once again they ran out of beef and can't complete my order. Gave me the option for chicken on my nachos and had to make sure I wasn't charged extra for it.(Was reminded that they don't usually allow the upgrade without the extra charge but seeing as I had already been rung up he would be okay with it this time!) I don't know what is going on but it sounds like this place needs a management overhaul!! Late night shift leader said not enough product was dropped for his shift by the previous shift lead. Considering this has happened several times for me ( I know it's nuts that I keep going back, it's the closest drive thru besides McDonald's and their product upsets my stomach every time) I'm going to completely stop going thru drive thru's and just plan accordingly to eat after my shift. Absolutely horrible product. Items I ordered tonight were cold. I've witnessed several staff members outside. Couldn't help but think if your out of a major staple to your menu first: why do you need 3+ staff members on the clock and why are you open? Learned my lesson and hopefully this helps someone who may not want to sit 30 minutes in their drive thru only to be disappointed.

Do not get the watermelon freeze. We ordered two, a chalupa and some Cinnabon delights. The chalupa was fine but the Cinnabon's were cold and gross. The watermelon freeze tasted like straight up medicine. I do not recommend it. The bag with the chalupa and Cinnabon's was also a mess because the chalupa has spilled everywhere.

This Taco Bell is terrible clearly every one that works here Give no shits about there job at all they take forever and mess up even if you get a soft taco without lettuce but when you look at your taco there's gonna be lettuce on it lmao there not friendly at all and this Taco Bell will not be getting any more of my money the cheese on my chili cheese burrito wasn't even melted I'm throwing it away is getting hot food to much to ask for ?

The experience was at 10/10/18 @12:17pm
Staff was attentive and nice.
One thing that I wished they did was to label or mark the items on the wrapper so that it is identifiable. This was a carry out order and there were about 3 burritos ordered. One of the burritos was the Cheesy Bean and Rice burrito to accommodate a vegetarian.
Got home and could not identify the Cheesy Bean burrito from the Beef burrito. When we did have everyone break their burritos, discovered that there was no Cheesy Bean, despite the order that was put in, as noted on the receipt. #sigh
this is my go to Taco Bell.. what can you say it's Taco Bell, this place is a bit cleaner than most and I've never had a mess up of my order over the last couple of years..

Sunday 8:30. Before we ordered. Guy came in from drive through. Whole order wrong, and something cold (?) or raw or something.  We should have left then.  In the time we were there....OUT of Mexican pizza, Chilupa anything, 
Flat corn tortilla anything, Tea,  strawberry frosty,  and there were several times they call folks up to the counter because they were out of something. 
We got our order and there was 1/2 the amount of meat as normal in our supreme tacos.   Save yourself the trouble go West a mile to the one on Brodie --- never has anything ever gotten close to this mess.

Worst Taco Bell in history! I faithfully come to this poor establishment almost everyday and my order is always incorrect. I practice a vegetarian diet so I decided to stop by and purchase a $5Chalupa cravings box. I pulled up to the the drive through window and the woman on the intercom did not take my order down correctly because for some reason I was missing a whole box, no chalupa, no burrito, or no cinnamon twists. I had spent 20 minutes in the drive thru. I go inside and I tell them they had forgotten my other items. The manager told me that I would have to wait an additional 15 minutes for my other items. I said it was okay. Time passes on. I still don't have my items and my food has gotten cold. Manager comes back with my missing items and I noticed that my food
had gotten cold. I asked him politely if he could redo my meal since it had gotten cold and he said "no because there is too much people here" I reply "but as a manager it's your duty to try and correct your error" then he proceeds to tell me that he was not going to remake my food. So I asked for a refund and he said no because I was being rude. I told him I wanted to speak with his supervisor and he said "you're looking at him" I said "so Taco Bell is just going to rob me for my money and deny my service?" Then he proceeds to threaten to fight me infront of ten other customers. Long story short PLEASE avoid this poor excuse of a Taco Bell. Fire the manager and retrain the whole staff
These guys were so happy and friendly in the drive through.  Not to mention my order was fast and correct (even with a few special requests.)
In a city like Austin, why go to Taco Bell? I did because I was broke. This Taco Bell sucks. Staff are morons. Place was filthy. Bathrooms were nasty.

Ordered food inside at 8:24 ... got my food at 8:44. It was a simple order... a quesadilla box. Why 20 minutes, especially if it's not busy. I see people standing around doing nothing behind the counter and a lobby full of people just waiting for their food..
Waited 10 min in the drive thru, they are super slow!  The food was mediocre at best and the Taco shells taste old plus the food wasn't that warm.

Waited for order to be taken for about 4 minutes . Finally someone comes to take the order . Asks me how I'm doing . How do you think? 
Asked for a Baja blast . They are out of that of course .
The line of people who have already ordered hasn't moved in the 10 minutes I've been here ....
Got a Crunchwrap supreme with no meat in it. Absolutely ridiculous. Also, we both ordered no tomatoes and sure enough both got tomatoes. Never coming back to this particular location.
F'n trash they up-charged me on nachos and cheese and still gave me the bullshiit I didn't ask for..

Went to the drive through at 145am (I know it's late but we knew the drive through is open til 2) and NO ONE came to us or spoke to us. Literally sat there for the ENTIRE 15 minutes waiting for the employees (who were clearly in the building) to at least let us know they are closing early or SOMETHING. This was so rude and absolutely awful customer service. Sucks because this is the closest taco Bell to me and we loved them for late night snacks. Not anymore...

I went through the drive thru. GREAT customer service!! And wanna talk about fast food?!? I got my order so quick it was crazy! The manager was at the window and asked what sauce I would like after saying one and changing my mind after he already handed it to me he didn't mind one bit reaching for more! He was extremely nice!! I'm not from around here and in the fear of getting lost I stuck near my hotel to eat. Great customer service!
Wow...never saw a place as slow as this.  20 minutes for a bean burrito.  Not sure what the problem was...plenty of people in the back.

One of the worst Taco Bell's in the US. 30 mins in the drive thru on 11/19. Pulled up to window to pay, 3 credit cards didn't work. Had to pay cash because they said my cards were declined even though I used one just 15 mins before. Went back on 11/21, same thing. Two cards declined even though we used both not more than 20 mins ago. And they won't accept it's their machine screwing up and NOT our credit cards.

If I could give less than one star I would. Ordered two meals, one large drink one medium. Got two mediums because they were out of larges and the supervisor was extremely rude. Only got a half full container of nacho bell grande and ordered extra cheese which was not included. This was a big mistake.

The drive through will have you waiting in line for at least an hour before you can even place your order. And then you'd think going inside would be a little better but it's not. The staff do not look like they care and it's sad because I live near by and would love to have a decent Taco Bell near me
Didn't give me my cinnamon twists. Absolute morons. Caleb was very rude on the phone, acting like a disabled person which I found incredibly inappropriate. Would not recommend
I waited 5 min for new potatoes to cook and they give me 3 potatoes for the spicy potatoes tacos, smh

This place is just horrible. I order a bean burrito ONLY but it turned out that it had something more than just beans. It seemed like they either used the same spoon for beef and beans or else they realized it was suppose to be beans and just added beans to the beef. I am vegetarian and that isn't cool. I went back and manager was nice but it seemed like other staff members didn't care.  Not recommended.
Fixed an error in my order. Great food! Great service.
Nice friendly people, but the service (especially the drive thru) is extremely slow when there are more than 5 vehicles or so. My past 3 drive thru visits I have waited 20+ min!! Ridiculous...

Went through drive thru with two separate orders. From the beginning the lady taking the order was rude. Then we get to pay. One of the nacho fries bell grande  is wrong. The other had barely any mean/cheese on it. And she's in the background saying you only get some odd scoops of meat. Just being rude about the way she said it. Then when we asked for napkins. She says you need a better attitude. To pay for food and get treated like that is absolutely ridiculous and uncalled for.

Buckle your seatbelt kids, because this is going to be a wild ride. 

This is my go-to Taco Bell. Literally a minute drive from my house. It's never out of my way, and my toddler loves him a cheese roll up. This staff is operating on a level I didn't even know possible, like I actually have had in depth conversations with my friends about this Taco Bell and it's staff on numerous occasions. It is nothing less than perplexing. Why am I writing a review for a Taco Bell? Who knows. No one needs a review for Taco Bell, you know what it is, you know what you're paying for. But here we both are. 

First off, I swear the hiring criteria here is: you must either be legitimately the nicest person on planet earth or you have to be on quaaludes 24/7 and have minimal grasp on how to function as an adult. It's about a 50/50 mix. I get tons of compliments on my hair and nails. One guy will recognize my car and tell me to come up to the window when I get to the speaker. I usually only order a Mountain Dew (why is Taco Bell Mountain Dew vastly superior to all other Mountain Dews?), he usually gives it to me for free. The nice employees will say hi to my kids and just generally live up to the "nicest person on planet earth" label. 

But man, if you're rolling up at midnight or later you are in for a treat. And by treat I mean ineptitude so astounding that it can't be anything but absurdly hysterical. I'm not being sarcastic, I genuinely love these late night adventures. I could probably write a blog about the ridiculous things I've had grown adults do and say at this location. 

One night, I have a conversation that follows:
"One large Mountain Dew and one quesadilla."
"Wait, a quesadilla? Like with cheese?"
"Yes, just the cheese quesadilla."
"So one cheese quesadilla."
"Yup, one cheese quesadilla and one large Mountain Dew."
"A Mountain Dew?"
"Yes."
"... what size?"
"A large."
"So a large Mountain Dew?"
"Yes, and the cheese quesadilla."

That's not an exaggeration, I pulled into the parking lot after to text my friend the interaction that had just happened. And, I was given a medium Mountain Dew and a chicken quesadilla. 

Another night, it was around 1am. I have a clear view of the store once I pull onto Worthington Galena. Theres no one else at Taco Bell. No one had recently left before. No one was behind me. It was just me and had been for a while. I order a drink, those chicken nacho chips they had at the time, and a cheese roll up. Dude seems flustered taking my order but nothing I felt the need to write down immediately after, I pull up, hand him a $20, get my food and remind him I had a drink. He gives me the wrong one and has to make another. I pull out of the drive thru and realize my order is two quesadillas, two soft tacos, and a bean burrito. There was no one else around for him to accidentally mix up our orders. When I came back he admitted he must have heard me wrong. Please take a moment to compare the order I placed to what I got. What in the actual heck. I had paid for this big order too so he ends up pulling $15 out of his pocket and hands it to me. 

I have numerous other late night incidents like these but I feel like the aforementioned visits paint a clear visit at the levels of nonsense that can happen hear. Any fast food chain would be a 3 star due to lackluster food quality and mediocre service but the sheer absurdity of this place earns an additional star. Thanks for the lols Taco Bell quaalude users, you've made my nights infinitely more amusing over the last two years.

Edit: not even 24 hours after this post I stop by for a, you guessed it, large Mountain Dew. The man is barely audible over the speaker. The total was $2.14. I hand him a 5 and 14 cents. He hands me a Baja blast, I tell him I just wanted the regular Mountain Dew. He hands me another drink, and $2.75 in change. He walks away from the window. Okay then. I drive away, my drink is a diet Mountain Dew. Don't you go changin on me, Worthington Park Centre Taco Bell.

Been to this location twice already, and it's leaps and bounds better than the Northcrest/Chamblee-Tucker spot. Although, the service is a little inconsistent. The first time I went here the service was excellent - friendly and accurate with good food. The second time I came thru, a different cashier didn't understand what I meant when I said I wanted Splenda or another sugar free sweetener for my unsweetened iced tea. There was seemingly a bit of a language barrier and she said they didn't have anything like that, which I find hard to believe. Ran out maybe, but I know they normally carry it. In any case, you could do a lot worse than a $3.66 lunch, which was my total the first time. I recommend coming during the early 11 o'clock hour as the drive thru picks up around noon and later.

We came here at 9 PM on Taco Tuesday AND Cinco De Mayo. The service was phenomenal. We even got some extras thrown in for waiting longer than normal (wasn't even that long considering how busy it was!). I am so impressed with this visit and this will be our Taco Bell of choice from now on !!

Two stars because once I do get the food it is usually hot and fresh, but I wish I could rate the food separate from the service. I don't understand why it takes more than 10 minutes to get through the drive-through when it's full. Going inside is even worse. You're better off going across the street to McDonald's or Wendy's. It's not just one day or another, it is consistently awful around 11 AM.

If you want fast food and are used to Taco Bell speedy delivery, you are at the wrong place. It's been 25 minutes since ordering my food  and I am still waiting. When I asked the stats, I was told it would be another 5 or 10 minutes. 

It's not the people that work here that's the issue. The workers are very nice, pleasant and are doing the best they can. From what I can observe, it is the training and speed of production that needs help.
unless you are dunk, broke, or like shooting flames from your rear why would you ever stop in a taco bell ever.... the fact that everything is shot out of a caulking gun should be the clue to leave.

They forgot a item I ordered and it took me half an hour to get to the drive through windows when I looked through the items they forgot something I tried called the restaurant and I tried knocking on the door and no answer they are the worse customer service ever

I came here around 12:30AM May 8th and what happened was just ridiculous. I pull up and the person working the speaker answers in the most dead voice I've ever heard. He blatantly asks me "Whatchu want?" And as I begin to speak I hear laughing, yelling, and screaming as if there was a fight going on. I struggle to make my order and I can clearly hear 5+ people inside yelling "bro it's only 5 cents more!" And is followed by around 30 seconds of laughing and giggling through the headset and I couldn't even hear my own thoughts.I know for a fact I will never return to this location, especially during Covid. I could clearly  hear that no one inside had a mask on and I will never let anyone I know eat here with a clear conscience. Honestly I understand that these workers are having to pull long hours and that it is difficult for them atm. But this was 100% unprofessional and unacceptable. The workers inside sounded like children at a birthday party, and I wouldn't ever trust them to make my food during this pandemic or ever. There is no way I could put what happened into words and explain to all of you how risky this place is. I pulled out when I had had enough and couldn't even finish half of my order. Please everyone stay safe and stay clear of this location.

It's been almost 2 years since I've been willing to darken their door or even think about giving them any of my money. That was a very short and fleeting thought! The five dollar nationally advertised Cravings box comes in at $5.63 and patronizing explanation that it's a franchise and their prices may vary. That's fine, my choices will vary. I'll drive to an a half miles out of my way through traffic to go to another one, that wants my money.

I didn't even get my order finished before I decided I'm not even gonna play this game. I will never spend any of my money at this location.


Update on the review, 12:50 Closed up tighter than a frogs butt hole when according to their posted hours they're open till 4 AM. So once again this location screwed the pooch. I won't be trying again. There's 13 miles north of me I'll go there. I'll drive out of my way to go to another location before I ever give them any money again.

Worst "Restaurant" experience I have had. I pulled into the parking lot and had planned to go through the drive thru. Unfortunately, a truck making a delivery had parked in the middle of the parking lot and blocked the way. When I saw that the door for the main entrance was open I just walked in. It was 10:50pm on a Sunday evening and several people that looked like customers were inside the lobby area. After waiting at the counter for short bit, an employee barked at me asking what I was doing inside. I explained that I try to order food. He barked at me to get out of the lobby and use the drive through(in a manner in which no customer should be talked to). I tried to explain that a truck was blocking the way to the drive thru which lead to that Taco Bell employee blowing up and using explicit language. I asked for the manager in which he responded that he was the manager. I asked for his name but he refused to give it to me. Another crew member was standing by and said that his name was "Carlos"(which he thought was hilarious). When I asked the "manager" again for his name he cursed me, grabbed a phone and called the police(a first in my life).

No customer ever should go through this for some fast food. Totally unqualified staff and the owner should do him/herself a favor and fire every single one of them

Me and my friends decided to go to Taco Bell since we've never had it before.  I look at the menu dazed and confused, so many options.  All so enticing.  I ended up getting 3 things.  My friends also got 3 things each.  Came out to like 17 bucks or something. "HOLY CRAP WHAT A DEAL" Linda shouts. We get the food, we park the car facing the empty Taco Bell to appreciate it in its full glory.  Before removing the food out of the bag, we turn on That's Why They Call It The Blues by Elton John. Now we're ready to take our first bites, I shed a tear. Tory screams "it's so cheap, so filling, and it's a one way ticket to flavor town!". Wiping the tear from my face I agreed. We gobbled down the tacos and melts, you name it.  By the time we get to the crunch wrap supreme we are begging to not be so full. We put the trash in the bag and went home.  Linda was taking the trash out the car, and I said "NO LEAVE IT" I wanted my car to remind me of this great experience the next time I entered.  The bag is still there 6 days later. If you've never been, come! If you've been, come soon! 5 stars. Pairs well with pizza too

Best Taco Bell in the area!
Great decorations during the holidays. Great people, great service. Live Mas

Trash. They will ALWAYS leave out your cinnamon twists and sauce if you don't double check and go back to the store for them. They close early all the time despite their online hours. The food looks like it was left under a warmer all day.

This is seriously the best Taco Bell I have ever been to. As a vegan; I often have complicated orders with substituting meat for beans and removing the cheese. They've never messed up. They always have the most amazing proportions of everything. The person taking orders is always so thorough and with the program. I've been to many Taco Bell's in my life and this is honestly my favorite. I come here at least once a week. Thank you Riverside Taco Bell team
this place is so heckin' bueno - nuff said! this review is currently too short - here let me take the time to type some more before trying to post this review. okay, this should be enough. wowza dawg
Waiting a long time to order then to get to the window only to screw up my order. Can't believe they can't get a order right.

Every. Single. Time. I have ordered here. Over The past THREE YEARS. This location has done NOTHING but disappoint. My order has been wrong every. Single. Time. All i ask is NOOOOO sour cream. None. My only ask. On any app that i order off of (because they don't serve half of the menu that i order any more) ITS FUCKING WRONG. EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. Even BEFORE the menu revision, it was wrong.  When i go through the drive through, it's wrong. EVERY. SINGLE. TIME. Fuck this location. Don't come here. I promise I'm saving you some time in your life if you're reading this.
Horrible service takes forever and an old establishment. Hate when franchisees don't give a crap about their investment.

This Taco Bell location is the absolute best fast food restaurant, of all the fast food restaurants (even Chick-fil-a) that I have ever been to! It doesn't matter if it's 1pm or 1am, the customer service is always excellent. The staff is extremely polite and friendly and I have never had an order that was incorrect. Also, the food is really fresh at this Taco Bell. I don't eat a lot of fast food, but I trust this location and if I need a late night snack, it's only a five minute drive. I really can't say enough great things about this particular TBell, but whatever you guys are doing, keep it up!

Anytime after 10 PM. They're saying we close only this location at Riverside every day their hours change !! what time do you close exactly ?? When I go there is always worker inside and they keep tilling me we close 
One day at 10pm one time at 11pm one  day at 
12 am and online  say at 2am I will suggest you find you someone wants to work. Thank u

It gets three stars because it's exactly what it is, average. I'm more successful than you anyways, so you're going to read this review and have a fucking opinion on it nonetheless, go here if you want something that reflects your life, mediocrity.

I'm not sure what it is about this shopping plaza on Bethel Road, but for some reason it seems like they have some of the worst fast food places around them. The Wendy's has been great when I've stopped there, the Jimmy John's and Subway were fine, but I've had some of the worst experiences when getting fast food in Columbus at the Burger King, McDonald's, and of course Taco Bell located in this shopping plaza.

The first time I went, it was a Monday night about 10:00 a few years ago, and normally that's not really a busy time, but the drive thru line was already really backed up when I pulled in, and I decided to wait because I didn't want to drive all the way to Kenny Road one thinking that they would catch up and speed things up. I was wrong about that as it took forever not only to finally put in my order but also in waiting for them to prepare it.

So after that I've avoided them, but with everything going on right now, I stopped in really quickly at Walmart to pick up an order, and then just decided that I'd go through Taco Bell drive thru really quickly figuring that it wouldn't be that bad after two years and to give them another chance. 

I understand that things aren't optimal right now for them to say the least, so I wasn't concerned about time at all. It's just that the food was cold and tasted awful, and I really wish I had drove to the Kenny Road location because so far I've never had any problems there.
Fix your drive through or open you lobby for take out. I broke my bumper coming out of your drive through and now have to buy an expensive replacement due to your drive through

This is the best Taco Bell I've ever had the pleasure to patronize. Lines can get long during weekend nights but the staff holds their composure. I've never had an incorrect order, even with customized options.


They're the best.
The drive-through it's always been very quick and easy. The staff of always been very helpful. I just wish the music wasn't so loud.

My friends and I were craving taco bell after a night out and we looked this one up and it said it closed at 3. we drive 30 minutes to get there at 2:45 and when we got to the window the guy said they closed 2 hours early because we were there first customer in 2 hours. i worked at a fast food restaurant for a year and we would never even think about closing early even if we hadn't had customers in awhile. so if you're thinking about going here late at night, don't. they'll probably be closed. very disappointed.

I went for 2 six packs of the naked chicken chips. I waited for 20 minutes..... and then I go home to find out they're burnt to a crisp. They thought the extra chicken roll ups they threw in would make up for their lateness and obvious lack of attentiveness. It did not. I am not writing this review after one bad visit... I have gave this location multiple chances because it is so close to my house, 4 times to be exact. I will never be back. They call this fast food!?.... hello Wendy's!

I'd give it a 0 if I could. THE WORST Taco Bell I've ever gone to. Been here many of times because it's the closest. Not once have I had a good experience. Every time takes 10-25 minutes. It's NEVER made right. Got home with my food and it didn't have any sauce or onion on it. I CLEARLY asked for it 3 times. Went all the way back they re made it for me after I waited for 8 minutes with no one even in line. Pulled forward and checked and THEY STILL HAD NO SAUCE OR ONION. Went back around waited for 16 minutes! To get what I asked for and I was very polite. Rude worker said yes no I'm not re making those for you. I said I understand that can I get a side of the sauce and onions then so I can just put it on the ones made wrong he yelled I saw him I'm not re making it. Worst customer service ever. Food is always wrong. Really going to start driving to the one that's far just because it's fast and always right.

As stated in the previous review, this Taco Bell has gone through a remodel.  What was once a questionable place to eat in, is now a much less questionable place to eat in.  Tables were clean when we were inside, and the customer service is good.  The drive-thru is where this Taco Bell shines, as every time I come through they are very quick, and get the order right.  Something so simple, and yet so many drive-thru restaurants fail at.  

I give props to the cashier, who helped me figure out a way to order nachos with just meat on them (no cheese, son is allergic), and make it come out to 99 cents, instead of just charging me the cost of a more expensive menu item and just taking things off of it.

DO NOT EAT HERE! I ordered through Uber eats and they served me expired food. The chicken smelt rotten like it got left out of the refrigerator for days before getting cooked. I also ordered a chicken and cheese melt and there was barely any cheese...

OK, John and Alex who work here at Taco Bell are totally awesome. Why? Well I drove up into a line of 10 cars waiting and with about 15 cars behind me and both of them spoke to me cheerful and with an upbeat attitude. I think them for working on a Sunday evening to provide us with food and they were extremely happy and helpful with my order. Whoever owns this Taco BellFrom a person who's owned a company before you are very lucky to have employees of this caliber. If I were a billionaire I would give them each $1000 in cash because that would be a fun thing to do at least to me it would. Keep up the good work Mr. & or Mrs. Taco Bell owner.

Taco Bell, for me, is a combination of guilty pleasure and pure convenience.  If I'm in a hurry, fast food is the only option.  If I don't want a burger, well, in most places that means Taco Bell.  And I'll admit, I like a few of the items, and like trying out their latest combination of tortillas, beans, and cheese.

This time, I miscalculated and didn't have time for a real meal.  There were several places in the area I wanted to try, but I only had 15 minutes.  So, Thai Mango was out, Panini Opa was out, and anything farther afield was absolutely impossible.

Easy access off Sawmill, and from the mall lot.  Clean, bright, and pretty empty at 2pm or so.  Friendly service.  Like, a couple of notches above standard fast food service, so I was pleasantly surprised.

I had a seven-layer burrito, one of my standards.  Light, maybe semi-healthy, tasty (after adding hot sauce.)  Then I had to try their "naked chalupa."  Not even sure what it was, I went ahead and ordered.  It's like KFC's Double Down: a chicken breast molded into taco shape, deep fried.  It actually held up really well as a vessel for the other ingredients, tasted good, and didn't seem greasy or nasty (though I'm sure it is both.)  It actually worked, logistically and in terms of balanced flavors.  Wow.

I hadn't read the reviews first or I might have shied away, but I had a good experience in terms of food and service.  It ain't fancy, or even really good food, but it's fast, cheap, convenient, and filling.  And sometimes, that's what you have to go with.
this place is trash. it took 40 minutes to get a quesadilla. never come here ever. One guy was working really hard but no one else was working at all.
It's rly good I like their beans a lot their lava sauce was dank but they don't have it anymore. Mexicab pizza is my favorite item!!!

I'm rating this as a Taco Bell - I'm not giving their food 3 stars. ;) I don't ever wind up here because I suggested it ...

Of Taco Bell locations that I've been to, the employees here are quick but accurate and nice. The place is decently clean, however the general look of the interior is just kind of depressing. I'm enjoying some of the upgraded interiors of restaurants nearby - something this Taco Bell could use. 

I had the Nachos Bell Grande, a churro and a small Pepsi. The Pepsi was good, the nachos reminded me of why I don't eat here (it's just not my thing - even smothered in hot sauce) and even as a sugar monster, I didn't even eat half of my churro.

If Taco Bell is your thing, this isn't a terrible location - but you may want to take it to go. The lighting, hard chairs and overall look of the location are clearly still designed to get you in and get you out as fast as they can.

Worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. I've given it a second chance, a third and even a fourth, but the poor customer service, long wait times and terrible food remains consistent. One night I ordered 3 beef and cheese tacos through the drive through and got home to find that while they did give me 3 tacos, the only ingredient in them was LETTUCE! No meat. No cheese. Absolutely ridiculous.

Walked in after a long day of boofing graphite with the bois and was obviously ready to stuff my body full of processed Tex-Mex. After seeing the Hollywood Reporter review on the window, I ordered the Nacho Fries. Post me standing in the overly chilled dinning room, the fated "nacho fries" arrived. These fries were neither nachos nor fries, they were soggy pieces of potato with warmish cheese sauce resembling the poop I took last night after eating 17 Gordita Crunchs the day before. This experience makes me feel like what I imagine a little kid getting an ice cream cone and then it dropping on the ground feels like. It did change the way I looked at fries, I will admit that. One star. (Zero if possible)

Haven't been in 20 years, and there's a reason why. Placed  l an online order. Waiting for 30 minutes in the drive-through. These people are fricking morons. I have no idea why they're in business. If you look at my other the reviews I do not speak of this in this way

It's brand new and popping! Too bad they didn't finish the roof deck in time for the summer before coronavirus. I'd recommend coming earlier in the day if you want seats or Baja blast because it runs out fast. Getting anything that's supposed to be crunchy to go is risky because the hard shell tacos get soggy. C'mon it's taco bell with alcohol. It's the bomb. Maybe it would be better if they had Corona beers instead of Modelo.
Gavin at this location is amazing and helpful.  We love taco Tuesday. Give him a raise

This Taco Bell is horrible.  I know it's Taco Bell and you shouldn't expect much in terms of customer service, or food quality, but this place just sets the bar at an all time low.  I work nearby, and to be fair, the drive thru is normally pretty good for a quick bite during the work week.  We decided to eat inside tonight and it was a bad idea.  First, the interior is completely run down.  I believe the ac must be broken Bc it was very hot inside. Now, for the food, we ordered three burritos and a nachos bel grande.  You'd have thought they had to go to the grocery store to pick up some more tortilla or something.  25 minutes later, we got our food, but it was not what we ordered.  We were missing a burrito and nachos, and another burrito was wrong.  So 25% of our order was correct.  Then the manager decided to argue with us about how we were wrong.  Don't go here, find somewhere else to spend your money.

Absolutely one of the worst fast food restaurants! This particular restaurant never fails to disappoint. I work less than a mile from it and go only when I want cheap food. It's not fast by any means and forget about service! Today, I walked out for the 3rd time in 6 weeks. This time I stood at  the counter for 10 minutes with no one there to take the order; 3 times someon came by and said they'd be right with me then went back to the prep area! I finally went to Moe's right around the corner- spent more money, but was immediately waited on and the food is actually better! I'm done with this TB! They should  get rid of the management or demote them cause they do not know how to run a DD restaurant!
My wife I always have a great experience at this Taco Bell.  Crystal, the manager, came out said hi and made sure we were enjoying our meal.   We love Taco Bell on VFW Parkway!!!

We really like this Taco Bell.  It seems though the staff have changed.  A week ago my wife specifically asked for to sauce which we never got.  Recently I went to place my order in the drive thru with no one around.  And the girl says please wait a moment and it was ten minutes and when I drove up they didn't seem to be working hard.
We really have enjoyed this Taco Bell mostly in the past.

So i just went to Taco bell with my brother and my grandparents. I couldn't help not writing about it. So we get there and my brother orders and I ask him if he'd share a quesadilla, he orders it and i say that I'd like it to have half cheese after my brother ordered and onion one. Once we sit down our food comes (really quickly ,upside) and I take a first bite into the quesadilla. I taste the onion so I think i got the wrong side of it. When i looked inside each part it is all onion. I ask the person at the counter if she could change it but she says we'd have to pay for a new one again!! (if you get the order wrong aren't you supposed to give the right order free???). Another time I buy pintos and cheese (beans with melted cheese on top and hot sauce) and it looks like they took the cheese straight from the bag and slapped it on the hot beans. It was not melted at all. And I got the same thing again sometime later and it had a piece of chicken in it, I'm a vegetarian by the way!!! Overall I think Taco bell is pretty bad and I would not suggest going there at all.

This is the absolute worst Taco Bell I have ever been to. Taco Bell is my favorite fast food chain that I ate at least once a week in college. After moving here over a year ago I have given this place 3 chances, regretting it more and more each time. The food is never prepared correctly, the staff is rude and unhelpful, and the drive thru line takes at least 20 minutes no matter how many people are in line. Something needs to be done ASAP

I went there a few days ago and they put the guac in the very bottom of my burrito somehow?? Like the last bite was all guac. Who would want that? I would have been less mad if they forgot it completely. Tonight I decided to get the guac on the side and I get a cold VERY dry burrito with small bits of cheese when I asked for no cheese. I'm so disgusted.
I paid for 6 Taco supreme and 2 crunchy tacos and I only found 3 taco supreme and 3 crunchy tacos. This is highway robbery.

Fast food, very slow

I havent been to Taco Bell in years but was craving tacos as i past by.  


After several moments, it was fiNally my turn at the register.  I was greeted by Jacob, a very sweet young man..  he took my order then disappeared as i waited quite a while to get my food.

Originally, i planned on getting three crunchy taco supremes but i noticed the stacked tacos whIch were onky $1.00 each. (Crunchy taco supremes $1.89 each). So i got two supremes and decidedd to try the stacked.  

All in all it took me close to 20 minutes  to get my  fast food

The crunchy taco supremes were totally broken and the stacked was almost totally dEvoid of the cheese whiCh was supposed to be seepinG between the two layers.  All very  disappointing

Just like other reviews, this Taco Bell has always had problems. Located in center of Rockwood, this Taco Bell has gone through a lot. I have been here and waited in drive thru line for 20+ minutes, multiple times. One time while waiting, I noticed half of the crew walk out and they closed the dining room. I learned (the hard way) to kind of avoid this Taco Bell unless it's just a few small items for myself (fingers crossed) I do gotta say that the drive thru gal has become much nicer and seems to actually help and talk you through your order. My food is correct majority of the time. I learned if they forgot something to just bite me tongue and move on cause it's not worth my time to go back in. .

It's been almost 2 years since I've been willing to darken their door or even think about giving them any of my money. That was a very short and fleeting thought! The five dollar nationally advertised Cravings box comes in at $5.63 and patronizing explanation that it's a franchise and their prices may vary. That's fine, my choices will vary. I'll drive to an a half miles out of my way through traffic to go to another one, that wants my money.

I didn't even get my order finished before I decided I'm not even gonna play this game. I will never spend any of my money at this location.

We waited in line for 30 minutes in the drivethru when it was a pretty slow night. There were only 3 cars in front of us. We just bypassed our order after that wait and didn't even pick up our food. Not worth it to pay for the food after waiting for 30+ minutes. They should've offered everyone some kind of discount or voucher because that was ridiculous. I won't be returning to that location.

The sink hole at the end of the drive through is so wild I can't even get taco Bell cuz the lobby is closed and they is no option to buy and have someone bring it out to you. If I want taco Bell I have to ruin my bumper going through this 4x4 course. I just wanted some tacos, I didn't sign up for a rally track. I mean I drive a car not a lifted monster truck. I can't imagine it would be to expensive to fix this issue and show your customers you care. Nothing bad to say about the employees, great people but that drive through or should I say mountain range is insane. I just want taco Bell but I guess I'll have to start getting taco trucks cuz at least I can navigate the terrain to get to them. 

P.s. all your drive throughs are wack in my area. your losing business and not only mine, anyone without a lifted truck or that isn't willing to ruin a bumper can't eat here anymore

The Mexican Pizza I ordered is only halfway topped. They also got our 3 soft taco order wrong and gave us hard tacos, and didn't ask if we wanted any sauce. I understand it's busy at 1130pm, and maybe we just shouldn't be expecting much, but this is still disappointing.

I've been here a couple of times and it's consistently slow. The staff is eager to help but thinking it is out of their control. Tonight I used the app thinking maybe it would be better. Nope!

It's now 9:05 and no sign of an order I placed at 7:51 for an 8:30 pick up. Why have an app or "ready when you arrive" if it's not going to happen. Seems to drive bad ratings. This will be my last visit to Taco Bell. I ordered through the app for ease and customization but seems to be fruitless.
