My guess is that the crowd here over rides the lack of concern over expectations. When I asked to cancel and refund "we can't because it's a mobile order."  Easy next steps, never mobile order. 

I will compliment the staff who talked to me, young and trying. They were friendly albeit unable to fulfill my order on time. Yum Brands needs to evaluate their expectations for customers. Clearly a fail tonight.

My daughter loves plain meat tacos with no lettuce and no cheese.  Simple.  This drive through messes that up about 3/4ths if the time.  The people there don't seem very enthusiastic, never been rude to me. But it just seems disorganized and that scares me because neglect in certain areas usually means neglect in many other larger areas.  Kinda scary when it comes to fast food right???  Just don't get a good vibe here.  You should avoid this one.

It's a guilty pleasure, eating at Taco Bell. I rarely have an issue with my orders. This location is one of the better ones that I have been with. The employees are usually kind and patient. They also tend to be friendly which at a Taco Bell is a delight. I always check my food when I go to fast food restaurants before I drive off. Though, I still check when I go to this location, they have yet to miss an item and they always offer sauce. The offering of sauce may seem like a small thing but its important. I can just order cheese and chips and they still will offer sauce.

They also will add extra cheese to burritos if you ask with no extra charge. I did not even realize I could do this until I heard someone in front of me do it. My food is always fresh and hot. If there are issues, they don't get testy when you let them know. They fix it and keep moving. They can get busy but they move pretty quickly. If you like Taco Bell, this is one to visit.

There was an unfortunate stocking issue that affected our order and Eric and everyone on the night shift did everything possible to make it right and went above and beyond! We greatly appreciated their efforts and it made our meal even better!!

I've been to this location about 10 times and every time I wait for at least 30 minutes for my food. Call me stubborn but I've tried to give this location a chance. But rather I'm gifted with long wait times, broken credit card machines, and general incompetence by management. If you come to this location you will wait. No matter what.

This location opened up very recently and we have been there twice since. Our first visit was a late night one. I was very surprised that there was no line! Everything came out as we ordered it and it was a good experience. I went for a second time yesterday at dinner time. Again, no line! I had a couple modifications and they were all accommodated. On the tacos, the toppings were all fresh and cold (cheese, tomato, sour cream) and the meat was warm. Pretty spot on! The only downside was the chips on the nachos seemed a bit stale. All in all, the food is pretty good here so far. Customer service was good, staff was friendly on both visits. The downside to this location is getting out of it. Of course this depends on the day and time that you go but it can be a real pain. So beware the small parking lot and the time it might take you to get out.

Just 
Don't 
Bother 
Coming
Here 

The staff is rude and SLOW!!!!!!!
Always gets the order wrong and the attitude my God props to them for having that much attitude working at a taco Bell my God

I haven't had Taco Bell in a while so I decided I better feed my crave as they say. I put in an online order and went on down to pick it up. The... what do we call spoiled little girls that think they are too good to talk to customers? We will call her Evilyn. Well Evilyn I guess greeted me by saying "what's your order" to which I replied, I have a mobile order for (insert name). Before I finished my sentence she said to pull forward, not please just pull forward. I then was given a drink that was the wrong size but I didn't want her to rip out my soul with her 6 inch hot pink nails so I remained silent. She handed me a bag and said it's all in there. So I just believed her, or did I?  I parked and found that Evilyn had made yet another mistake 3 missing tacos out of an order of 3 tacos and one nacho bell grande (please don't judge lol). So I went through the drive through and was created with "what's your order" to which I replied "I had the mobile order..." I was cut off again. "Pull forward" I heard from the box so I did. Evilyn said there are no mobile orders so I told her that there were some missing items. She walked away and a nicer person handed us a bag. Odd that without telling Evilyn she knew what was missing and had one of her victims... I mean co-workers bring it to me. I got my food but I nearly lost my life. Let's all pray for her co-workers.

I have only ever used the drive thru. Use the website or app to place your order, that'll ensure your customizations are sent to the food line correctly, cutting out the drive thru operator who will mishear or misenter your order.

3 of 4 times, they'll ask you to pull forward past the camera. This is so their times look better, since your car will drive out making it look like they completed your order in 30 seconds. Your food will have to travel out thru the seating area, out the door, across the road to the parking area you're sent to, instead of the 3 feet out of the window. That is if they bring it to your car first; today the guy took the order to the car behind me who was also told to pull forward. The manager of this location (reportedly) encourages this behavior. Super weird experience, food gets cold, boss gets a nice bonus I guess.

The food is hit or miss, sometimes I'll get high quality, but at least half of the orders are low quality. The new chicken chalupa I ordered 2 weeks ago was nice and crispy, today it was soggy with only a few crispy flakes.

I aLways love a good Taco Bell.  This one clean and the order was fast. They were quite busy  as well. I just had a supreme taco. The boy had taco salad with steak, chicken cheese quesadilla , and a burrito.  Hit the spot. Yum

Drive through line is terrible. Like seriously god awful long of a wait every time. No matter if it's three cars or 10 - it takes FOREVER. Order is usually wrong. Few employees are nice, the rest look like they hate life at Taco Bell

Tonight, we pulled to the drive thru and were informed that they were waiting 30 minutes before taking any orders... no line, no other people, no explanation.. just waiting. We (obviously) go into this with very low expectations and it is hard to disappoint, but somehow it always does. Best case scenario, corporate starts all over and wipes the slate clean. What a waste.
Been here twice. Once after work, around 4:30pm or so, and tonight at 8:45pm. Both times they said they were closed. No reason given. Didn't apologize or anything. Just said "We're closed".
It good but there some thing wrong with the bean burritos becus  my sister ate some and got sick and now I got a stomach ache because I just ate one

I just moved to Columbus and while moving we stopped at this Taco Bell location. They were super friendly, fast, and (not sure if it's ok to say but...) they gave a couple free tacos as well! It was so unexpected and very much appreciated. Even without that kind gesture, I still would have gave a great review because I had no issues with the visit or the food!
Far and away the worst Taco Bell location in Columbus. Simply put, the workers just don't want to work.

My standards for cleanliness isn't very high for
Taco Bell. Typically, they're not the cleanest fast food chain. 

But the restroom at this particular Taco Bell is terrible. The employees seem to use it for their cigarette breaks because it always smells like cigarettes in there. I'm also not sure when they last cleaned it. Might be weeks ago.

They also seem to be chronically understaffed since the person taking orders for the drive thru also takes orders for the dine in customers. This naturally leads to longer than usual wait times.

There appears to be a major failure in leadership at this location. Not sure if it's the management or the owner.

Regardless, I'd recommend the Taco Bell at Henderson & Kenny or the one near Tuttle Crossing until this particular location gets their act together.

Tried their drive through and honestly one of the sweetest drive through experiences I've had. Clear to understand and got my order right the first time. Also it's located right next to 75 if you want to get a snack before you head home in the horrendous weekday traffic! :) This will hold you.

The guy working the drive threw was drunk and tweakin on meth 100% he couldn't talk straight. Was all over the place. And he gave me the wrong food. Spent 16 dollars for 2 tacos and 2 soft tacos. Like boy I wanted 2 Gordita crunch's and a loaded griller. He needed to stop talking to the shadow people and get my order right!?! Terrible! Trash! Garbage! Never going to Taco Bell again. Boulder please get rid of this place. And too the drive threw ole tweaker man. Get your shit right or else you'll be suckin something under highway 36 for that meth with no job!

This place deserves a four or even five star rating for what it is. Went there on the fourth and the employees were great and had my food out instantly. Quality wise, it was supreme for Taco Bell. I had the power burrito and it was pretty good. Same with the Baja blast icee. The places was spotless. If you understand what you're getting into going into a Taco Bell, I think this is a great establishment.

This location has messed up out order every time we've tried to stop here. They have missed food deletions because of allergies, and burn grilled stuffed burritos almost every time. 

We have stopped here for breakfast repeatedly and have been equally disappointed. However, this past Sat took the cake! The "store manager" Nick, insulted us for not knowing the exactly what a new item was called. He belittled us for calling an item the wrong name, then would not serve us because we told him we had already told him we wanted a combo while he interrupted us. 

If the store manager is that much of a jerk to customers, we will not spend ANY of our money there again! That is unfortunate, as our order range from $17-$28 depending on the day. 

Avoid this place until they get a real manager, and a crew who cares what they are sending out!

$6 for breakfast crunch wrap and the naked chicken chips. Don't get the naked chicken chips. I always get suckered into buying new novelty food. It's like bad triangle chicken nuggets with plastic cheese sauce. 

The food was as expected and the cashier was friendly. 

The experience was fine until a homeless person sat next to me and starting cussing at the air. He smelled like smoke. The bathroom was kind of bad as well but that was before the homeless guy walked through.

Would I come here again?
Nope. I refuse to go out of my way for any fast food. It kind of ruins the point of fast food.

Out of meat and out of beans. At 10:00 p.m. on a Wednesday night. I can't make this stuff up.
And we all got trapped in the drive thru when we decided we didn't want rice for dinner.
I wish I could add more to this review but I have nothing more to add other than I lost 10 minutes out of my life. Ridiculous.

This Taco Bell just opened up on Comm Ave and so it's super busy and popular! The wait times weren't bad at all because the employees were very efficient. The customer service was great, they were friendly and attentive. I got my order in just a couple minutes after ordering despite it being a Friday evening. 

Never really wanted to drive out to Cambridge for Taco Bell but now that there's one right in Comm Ave, it makes it a lot easier to satisfy my taco cravings! Also, excited to try their alcoholic beverages. They are taking COVID-19 precautions seriously, with plexiglass when you order and employees are also all wearing masks. The restaurant is spacious and so you don't have to worry too much about being close to people. Definitely coming back, so happy that there's a Taco Bell in the area now!
I got hemorrhoids from eating here but still pretty good.

Honestly, I have been eating at this Taco Bell for almost 30 years, and this was the worst experience I have ever had... and I have had some pretty bad meals here.  My food was not cooked.  I know everything just needs to be heated up but all of my taco shells were stale, chalupas were stale, gorditas... stale.  I was starving and I didn't eat it.  It felt like it was off the floor.  Shame on you.  I don't even want the 12$ back.  I'll never come back... after 30 years.     That's some loyalty you just can't win back.  Good luck.

I struggle to find a positive here. I guess the value.
You would think consistency, but not the case. It's assembly line menu, yet you can order 4 tacos, and one is missing cheese, and another has only a few pieces of lettuce. Do corporate people ever order here? Do they get the same food we do? I want to eat at the TB where they take those display photos. Employee attitudes are unmotivated, and consumed with the notification that just popped up on their phone. The management is just barely a step above this. Probably beaten down by staff performance and unhappy customers.
It's TB. Expectations are low.

Went through drive thru last night at this location, William Cannon/1st. When I was paying, I saw a young male employee without a mask on, sitting on what appeared to be a food prep table. Ended up throwing my food away. Please talk to this guy. I don't want him to lose his job or anything, but that's not cool.

This may be the slowest worst run restaurant I've ever seen it may take you upwards of 30 to 40 minutes to get through the drive-through and they do not understand how to open the lobby like every other restaurant has managed to do despite Covid all around poor performance

Let me just say I love Taco Bell and the last couple of times I have been to Taco Bell (not this location) the customer service has been awful! I literally was about to just say to hell with one of my favorite fast food places! Let me just start off by saying Deshaundra was phenomenal, not what I was expecting from a Taco Bell. The food came out quick and it was everything I love about Taco Bell. The only down fall is that this place is so far away from my house and the Taco Bell by me is just horrifying.

I'm only making a review about Taco Bell bc I feel bad for the staff. Sat for 20 mins which is fine, I wanted my T Bell lol but then when I got to the order thing nobody said anything for like 5 mins. So I said hello? & the dude was like "it'll b a 10-15 min wait to order." I asked why? & he was very clearly stressed out & upset, he said there were only 2 people on staff.... ok this is on a Saturday.... very close to downtown .... late at night. Like it's going to b busy?!? I feel like the management should have closed for the night, those two people cannot possibly handle all of the people & it really just made me feel bad. Also after being told this you are literally blocked into the drive thru so have to wait for like 4-5 cars to leave first..... which clearly took FOREVER. I feel disgusted ANY manager would make these people continue to work with this low of staff & feel obligated to say something. ‍

So yea a taco bell is a taco bell, but this is why I give this place 5 stars...

In my last 5 trips this is what I have gotten:

1) Very clean lobby - probably the top 10th percentile.
2) Managers that have brains.
3) Employees that say "sir" and "thank you".
4) Food that doesn't look like it was made by a 8 year old.
5) If they mess something up they are the first to apologize - you don't have to say anything.

Overall big kudos to the management here.  I don't know who owns this shop, but it's nice to know that if you hire good management you have a great store.  

If I ever feel the need for taco bell I will drive the extra distance to come here over any other place.

Part of me wants to give this Taco Bell a great score and insist that everything bad anyone has said about it is wrong. The problem is they aren't wrong. No one should ever eat Taco Bell, its basically poison wrapped up in a tortilla. 

I still eat Taco Bell sometimes and this is my favorite location. My favorite poison here is the Caramel Apple Empanada. The thing is that 9 out of 10 times I order the Empanada they are sold out or unable to make them for some reason. Its very frustrating but when you do get one its amazing! 

The crunchy tacos are good in a trailer park sort of way. I've been known to go into a few Crunchy Taco frenzies that I am sure have taken years away from life. 

I know you probably wont listen to me but the best advice I can give you is to not ever eat Taco Bell and especially dont drink Baja Blast Mt. Dew, I heard a rumor that drinking it will make your poo glow in the dark under black lights but I"m not brave enough to test the theory.

I've been to this location over a dozen times in the past 2 months. The order screen hasn't worked for more than 3 months. The restaurant always seems to be understaffed and less than capable of running a business. On my last visit 2 weeks ago I waited over 15 minutes in the drive through and my order was wrong. My quesadilla was overcooked and was not cut. The nachos looked like they were made by a child and the gentleman that took my credit card for payment was wearing rubber gloves and was working on the food line. He did not change gloves between the car in front of me and me which tells me he was handling money and touching food without hesitation. I typically don't complain but enough is enough. This restaurant is filthy when I've gone inside and the service/food quality is always sub par. On the visit tonight I was told to look at the menu while they were catching up. There was only once car ahead of me. I was also told the they were out of beef and that it would be a 30 minute wait for it to be done. Therefore I ordered the #7 combo with a chicken quesadilla and a chicken soft taco. I also ordered a steak quesarito and a Mountain Dew Baja blast to drink. After waiting 5+ minutes for the vehicle ahead of to receive their order I approached he window. I waited 3+ minutes to be greeted by the employee. I could see from the window that the drink they filled was dark and not Baja blast. When they finally came to the window they asked if I would like sauce, after I requested fire sauce I asked if the drink that was poured was Baja blast. The woman answered no and that they were out of Baja blast. She then proceeded to pour Baja blast into a cup and drank it herself to see if it was carbonated. She mentioned that the drink they poured for me was Pepsi and that the Baja blast hadn't been working? She then gave me a half filled cup of Baja blast. When I finally received my food I checked to make sure that everything was there as I typically do. I opened the soft taco expecting chicken, I added the fire sauce and took a bite. I was highly surprised to A. Find beef in the soft taco and B. Discover that the beef was ice cold and uncooked. The entire soft taco was frozen and inedible. I'm assuming they rushed the beef to the line even though it wasn't cooked despite the fact I requested chicken. The quesadilla was also overcooked once again with minimal chicken and once again not cut into quarters. The queasarito was warm at best and with minimal meat. Again I reiterate I typically never complain but after multiple bad experiences at this location I feel it should be made known. The order screen not working, inattentive employees, incorrect orders, overcooked/undercooked food, filthy restrooms at my in lobby visits and long wait times at the drive through something needs to be done. I don't expect 5 star service at Taco Bell at 11 pm however I do expect the screen to be functioning, correct orders, the food to be  cooked properly and all menu items to be available. Not to mention the foul odor of sewage while sitting in the drive through. I'm going to be placing this review on Yelp because I wouldn't want someone else having the same poor experience that I've had the past several months. Shame on me for continuing to frequent this location and expecting different results. I also plan on sharing my experiences with the Ohio Health Department due to uncleanly restrooms, employees handling food and money and the undercooked food.

Decided to give mobile ordering a try for this location. Found that half of my order was missing from the bag when I got home. Rookie mistake: Didn't check the bag before driving off. When I realized items missing, I called the location to request that the amount from the missing items be credited back to my gift card. The associate, who simply answered the phone with a dry "hello" upon answering, placed me on hold and disconnected the line. I called back a few times with no answer until the 5th time. Someone named "Brandon" answered the line with a sound of annoyance (I'm guessing he was briefed on my issue) and was quite rude. As I told him, I was a bit far from the location and could not return to the location.I was advised to come whenever it was convenient. It's not what you say, it's how it's said. I requested the number for corporate and was advised they did not have the number. I did contact corporate to share the experience as well and look forward to speaking with someone else. Training and good customer service can go a long way!

Good service is hard to find in the fast food industry these days especially late night drive thru runs. I went in around 10pm and was greeted by the most pleasant young man! He conversated with me and my husband and had us laughing and engaged the whole time, got my order out very quick and kept the drive thru experience short and sweet. This kid deserves a raise!!!!! All in all this is probably the best service I've had hands down in a very long time!

I am not sure how long Taco Bell expects you to stand at the counter before they take your order but it was waaaay to long.  Then Im told to use the ipad to place my order. Why dont I just jump back there and cook it too.
Terrible customer service when the service industry is hurting for work.

Jumping the border is probably easier than getting service at this place!  Nothing against a $.99 burrito, but after 15 minutes I've had enough time to reconsider my poor nutrition decision.

I watched as 1 cashier took her break.  Another went to the bathroom.  All while the manager walked around in the kitchen and paid no attention to the 3 people waiting in line to order.  Meanwhile I was fortunate enough to order - even after standing there for 2 minutes while the cashier added change to the register and couldn't even offer a courteous "just a moment".  

For a moment I thought I was being "punked" because the service was so ridiculously horrible.  Part of me wished I was the manager of the place - only because he was blatantly high as a kite! 

Final verdict: If you're in a rush or value service, pass on the chalupa!

I've been to many Taco Bell's in the states but congratulations to this one on being THE WORST TACO BELL IVE EVER BEEN TO. Everything was wrong. Everything. First the forgot my chips and cheese (the one thing you'd think they couldn't mess up) 
Second, the taco shells were soo empty it was embarrassing. You know how del tacos tacos are usually pretty empty? Well these tacos made even them embarrassed. 
Then my husbands quesadilla had sauce when he asked for none. 
And last, our bean burritos were at least a day old. Tortillas falling apart, beans much too over cooked and just old. 
How this place has 3 stars is beyond me.
Been here a few times. Service has always been alright and same with the food. It's Taco Bell what more is there to say?

This is my favorite Taco Bell. Customer service is always amazing and food is ALWAYS FRESH!! 
I also love the kiosk inside this location.

I have lived in Boulder for 25 years and I visited this store plenty of times.
So I arrive at their store by bus and I was told only drive thru and only with a car. So I was out of luck. Really lame.

I don't see how somethings so simple can be made so hard to accomplish.  Horribly slow service,  remember no dining in, not even food thoroughly cooked, eat at your own risk,  this place NEEDS NEW MANAGEMENT ASAP!
It's Taco Bell. I don't expect much but a 20 minute wait the few times I've come here are ridiculous.

Soooo, I usually love this place. I'm not sure if they were under staff or what but it took so long. They forgot some stuff for my order so I had to get back in line and wait behind 10+ cars again. I just really wish they would double check the bag before passing it along.
Every time I visit this location the staff is super friendly and service is fast. They also don't skimp meat like other Taco Bell's and everything is always very fresh.

I had ordered a black bean Crunchwrap Supreme due to being vegetarian when I bit into the order I come to my surprise I find a ground beef Crunchwrap Supreme my receipt said black bean I called the store spoke with the manager they said to come up and get replacement food I arrived at the location after just being out and sure enough they are out of black beans in simply just tried to replace them with ground beef because apparently ground beef is now a vegetarian option according to this tacobell it's been a long time coming but this location officially needs to shut down they are the worst Taco Bell in central Columbus

Slowest tacobell around, seriously dont go here if you're in a hurry. You'll look at 5 or 6 minutes a car, and I mean... that's alot with 5 or 6 cars!! Think it took 25 minutes to go through the standard line...

Its taco bell, even a perfect day the food is... well, tacobell... but... my ratings are based on the location/branch rather than the food, if you are reading taco bell Yelp for food quality... you're going to be sad

Unsanitary! The place had garbage all over the tables and floors. The trash bin was overflowing with garbage and all the workers were in the back laughing and conversing loudly without a care in the world.

If you want to go to the trashiest, lowest quality Taco Bell in Austin, this is it. What kind of stupid asswipes allow your food to come out looking like this, and expect you to be ok with it? Screw this location, I hope it goes out of business.

Worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. I called ahead and asked if they were drive through only, they said yes and let us wait for 20 minutes in their drive through line only to tell us they're no longer accepting drive through offers. WITH 10+ PEOPLE BEHIND US IN LINE. This is ridiculous. Worst service ever. I'm so disappointed.

I wish I didn't go to the Taco Bell on riverside late at night. I order 5 Doritos loco tacos instead of the beef I got chicken. Our tostada had a taco shell broken in half. The chipotle loaded griller had two pieces of chicken, and that's not even a joke. I know they did it on purpose because they didn't bother asking to check the tacos.

Very slow service. Line was long in drive through, so I went inside. Still slow. Might've been worth ordering from grubhub. 10 min per drive thru car. No better inside. I understand that they make everything but I don't think I've ever waited this long. It's been 17 min already. still waiting.......final time to get food. 21 minutes.

if zero stars were option you'd be getting it. what kind of bullshit is this? i ordered two bean burritos and they gave me literally a taco with beans added wrapped in a burrito tortilla. bean burritos dont come with meat.

Would give 0 stars if I could! Went through the drive through last night and was told that they were "closed". I could see a couple employees smoking pot with their friends in the parking lot and thought about pushing the issue but didn't want bodily secretions in my food. I went to the Wendy's across the parking lot instead and don't you know I drive by after getting my food and Taco Bell is now open for business again! I get it, working fast food sucks but seriously you're going to shut the business down momentarily to get high! Everywhere employee reeks of pot when I go in there and I'm pretty sure the manager is a dealer. So if you need some drugs head to this Taco Bell but if you're just looking for food, don't bother, you're lucky if you can get service here!

Worse drive thru packaging ever. I ordered 3 taco supremes & a drink. Two crunchy, one soft taco. When I get home mouth watering, to my dismay. The soft taco is barely wrapped and has spilled unto the other tacos in the bag. Now I'm gathering the ingredients to put the taco back together. This was my first visit to this location as I just moved into the area. Not a great start at all. Tsk tsk Taco Bell
Idiots. Worst attempt at service in the continental us. It's the exact people you'd expect working here. Zero pride

This Taco bell is very irritating to eat inside their is a lady in there who can't understand English and seems to mess up the order is a lot so it's very frustrating to get something to eat. I hope they can get a new cashier or something to help the inside experience. Also they seem to scamp you on the meat!

Five stars without question! Upon making my order, I received three cups, however, my woman didn't know these were water cups! 
So, I headed back to the man at the register, and said, Sir? I think I owe you some money; Because my girl put soda in those cups. Anyway, the moral to this story is... It's okay to be honest! and being honest resulted in a handshake backed with a smile! I wasn't charged. Again, thank you!
This new place is great!!! Upscale Taco Bell!!!! The staff are so friendly and professional. Wonderful food and wonderful drinks. Love it.

I was riding with my friend Brian on the way to a friend's kiki this weekend, and he stopped here for food. I use the term "kiki" since Brian informed me of its use in the Scissor Sisters song (NOT it's origin, as one queen on my Facebook corrected me), and I now think it is a super cute way to say "party". We'll see how long that trend lasts.

I first ate at a Taco Bell during the late 90's, around the time they were using a borderline-racist talking chihuahua as part of their advertising campaign. However, I haven't eaten at a Taco Bell since 2004, which remains true to this day. The last time I was in a drive-thru line at Taco Bell, the cute guy I was involved with at the time was upset they had jacked the price of tacos up from $0.99 to $1.09. He refused to pay the extra dime, and he left angry, and without his tacos. It was beyond embarrassing for me, even as a passenger in the car. Since then, I've been extremely uncomfortable anywhere near a Taco Bell, due to that mortifying memory of a certain cute-but-chinchy guy. Still, I sort of miss him; now he's just somebody that I used to know. Oh yeah. I just went Gotye on you. 

I almost, ALMOST ordered the Doritos Locos Tacos, just for the sheer novelty of them. And because Catherine T. commented on my check in with simply the words: "Doritos Locos Tacos". But when Brian said they were messy, I changed my mind. I wanted to look nice for the kiki...not bloated, and blanketed in Doritos dust.  

Brian ordered a chicken quesadilla. The truck ahead of us ordered God knows what, but apparently they racked up the bill to $25. I suspect that probably purchased one of everything off the menu. At first I thought Brian had been eavesdropping on their order when he told me the amount, until I noticed the large, red, digital sign that displays your order total by the window. If I had any respect for privacy, I'd be a little mad at them blaring your order total to the cars behind you. Then again, I bare my soul in reviews for Riverside Dr. Taco Bells, so I probably have very little room to talk about privacy.     

The guy at the window was friendly, and a surprisingly good multitasker from what I could tell. It was a busy Friday night. 

It was a relatively smooth experience, except for the irritating delay of the pickup truck in front of us, who tacked on even more crap to their order as soon as they got to the window. Next time, maybe they should just bring a U-HAUL and cart away bulk tubs of "meat" and "cheese", and save everyone the hassle of waiting behind them in line at a drive-thru.   

Brian ate his quesadilla in the car, while I silently thanked God for protecting me during my somewhat coerced visit to Taco Bell. 

Thankfully, it wasn't nearly as traumatic as I expected. I'm just a little shook up, still. 

But I'll survive.    

3 Stars, I suppose.

Quick, accurate & friendly

Stopped by the drive thru for lunch today.  The order taker was friendly and upbeat.  The same person gave my food to me at the window.

Order:
2 bean burritos
2 crunchy tacos
Mild sauce

When I got home the order was complete and made correctly.  There were napkins and a good amount of taco sauce.

Taco Bell food is not amazing but it sure hits the spot.

Waited an hour in the drive thru. Would have been longer but cars gave up before me. Probably would have if they didn't. Thanks for you sacrifice. When I got to the window  they were very sweet but don't expect a quick drop by.

Absolutely the worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. I promise I'm not being dramatic. I ordered online and waited over 30 mins in the drive through. The people on the drive through literally won't answer you and when they finally do, they tell you that you need to come inside because it's going to take too long in the drive thru. When I came inside and told them I had a mobile order, they told me that they had too many orders in front of mine and that it would eventually show up on the screen to be made. The boy at the register kept telling me my order was being made, and then finally a manager came out and asked me why I was waiting so long. I told her my name and that I had an online order, and she said the boy at the register had never initiated my order, so it hadn't even started to be cooked yet. I then waited another 30 minutes. These people were SO unprofessional. One of the young girls working was walking around the lobby and said "God I hate this job." I finally got my food and left. They had already cleaned up the lobby and took out the trash around me and locked most of the doors. At only 10PM on a Friday. This location really needs to be shut down until they can be equipped with enough staff and staff who are trained.

My husband and son wanted Tacos and I was being lazy and didn't want to cook so we went to TACO BELL. I guess you get what you pay for.

there was more shell then anything in the Tacos, very disappointing.

The Burritos are far better then the tacos they should consider calling them self BURRITO BELL
Come here during the day. Because this taco bell is ALWAYS out of grilled chicken at night: if it's not grilled chicken, it's definitely something else they're out of. what y'all got going on?

This taco is awful! Ordered 2 mini quesadillas, a cheese roll up, and a chicken roll up meal. Ordered at 9:29...finally got the food right at 10pm. Every single person in the restaurant was waiting 30+ minutes for their meal. While waiting... the manager screamed that someone needs to go clean the bathroom because a patron vomited all over the women's restroom. Every employee lined up to go see the puke in the bathroom. Finally got our food and the cheese wasnt even melted. Disgusting. Do not ever go here.

Adriana. 
I arrived around 9:45 (reasonable) and pulled up to where you order. Very quickly and already full of attitude I was "notified" that since they were out of ground beef i would have to pay MORE for chicken or steak. So i nonchalantly said that its funny I have to pay when youre out of something which is pretty laughable?? She proceeded to tell me since she "notified me" (multiple times) that it's completely justified, in a very rude manner. Im pretty lighthearted so I may have not minded the extra dollar?? for a steak taco, but she was doing too much with the bad energy I was pretty taken aback. So I told her to fix the attitude and backed out. And shes a manager?! Seems too abrasive and tone deaf to me, maybe she was stressed. Either way shes gotta work on that. Big fail in your #1 priority of customer service. Try LinkedIn for a manager position. 
Adriana

This Taco Bell location was surprisingly great. Fast food restaurants can always be a little iffy, but I'm so glad this one exceed my expectations.

My food was HOT - which I'm not used to from Taco Bell, which means it was fresh. My taco supreme was full! I'm not used to that either. You usually get like a few teaspoons of every ingredient but these were stuffed. That's how I like my tacos. I feel bad for the other reviewers who didn't have good experiences and was skeptical about coming here, but it was closest to my hotel. 

I was highly satisfied. Quick service, friendly employees, hot food, great food. Thank  you!

always something happening here. i pulled up to order to go and the person manning the window informs me there is a 25 min wait. I ask what happened and he says "we're under staffed" it's 9pm on the weekend and this location is open till 12. on top of that the drive they doesn't have an exit so i was stuck in line.

All the usual stuff you would normally expect in a taco bell except now theres  margs and beer on tap. We ordered just on time before a hoarde of BU kids filled up the place. There was only two usable tables to dine in the restaurant. 

The loud fans, face masks and screen made it hard to hear the staff when ordering or receiving the meal. Which was understandable. 

I ordered a crunchwrap supreme combo with the alcoholic margarita, which totaled to roughly $11. They give you three liquors to choose from: rum, vodka or tequila. I wasnt expecting much to begin with but all the alcohol sunk to the bottom and didnt mix properly. 

The drinks were reasonably priced $4-6 for beers and $6 for the margs.  With Cheap modello and Sam Adams on tap, I will definitely go back.

No idea why yelp says this location is closed today- it's open and serving amazing breakfast !!! I can't believe I paid so little for such a well made and filling Mexico breakfast !!! They take a bit longer than typical Taco Bell's with your order but that's because they make it fresh right then. Portions were good, quality of the food was there and place is very spacious and clean. WiFi also good.

Rania Moore has made our Taco Bell experience 5 star!! 
I have never in my life been offered a free drink for a long wait. Completely patient and pleasant! I couldn't not recommend this location enough l

Ramp to get ya up !! Auto door ! What a welcoming experience! Very bright very clean! Friendly staff! Right on public transit roll in !! Can't get any easier !! I'm sure got accessible restroom !!not worth the food!!

Here's a first: you arrive at Taco Bell to find they are "out of beans and meat." What can you get? "Rice." No apology for the inconvenience, just the most expensive rice you will be charged for in the US

I went here on their opening weekend and they had a crazy line out the door.  They do not have any indoor seating. It is strictly take out and you can order inside or through the app. What makes this Taco Bell unique is that they do serve alcohol which includes frozen margaritas (1 shot or 2 shots of alcohol) or a very limited selection of beer. It's not the best, but hey it's cheap. The service was quick and they didn't mess up my order. However, I noticed that the prices here are more expensive than other taco bells. For example, the typical $5 dinner box costs $6.59 here.
Nice employees, but check your order before you leave. They've messed up our orders, the last 3-4 times we've been. Switching soft and hard tacos, and they always forget our cinnamon twists.

I've been to this place dozens of times over the past year and I've gotta say, they never disappoint. Their staff is polite and professional. I've been to literally every Taco Bell within 25 miles and this one is the best.
Other Taco Bells give you food, this place gives you heaven in a bag. I swear they're the most delicious and well-crafted meals I've ever had at any Taco Bell in my life and that's coming from someone who goes to Taco Bell on average over a hundred times a year.
What I like is that they don't rush when it comes to making your food, which pays off A LOT when it comes to quality. The meat is tender and fresh and it tastes like a lot of effort was put into making each item on the menu.

This is at least from my experience, and I usually go at around 1pm and order the Steak Quesarito, the Crunchwrap Supreme with grilled chicken, $1 menu shredded chicken quesadilla, and Cinnabon Delights.
Those are all really great at this location.
I highly recommend a visit here! Or two! Or twelve.

Yes, I must say, on a recent trip to this Taco Bell I had a really nice experience and have to give credit where credit is due - - specifically for the polite, patient, and accommodating customer service I received one recent Thursday night at the Drive Thru from a new employee named Jessica.  

It's late, I kinda got the itch for something Mexican, quick, n cheap.  Yeah, I know what you're thinkin' - - but Mamacita wasn't around and that's not what I was referring to.  I'm talking about making a run for the border and maybe trying that new Loco Taco or the new Beefy Crunchy Burrito.  

I've been to this location more times than I should, and I've generally had good experiences all around.  At times the service can be inconsistent, and sometimes not that friendly, but the food's solid and consistent and I go in with no expectations on customer service.  At the drive thru a lady starts talking through the muffled speaker and asks for my order.  She is polite and patient as I put in my order for that BCB.  Then she throws in a loop and asks me "would you like to donate $1 towards my college education?".  I was like "WTF?".  She repeats it and I still can't make it out (due to the muffled speaker) so I tell her I think I'll pass and head up to the window.  Still, the curiosity is getting to me - - I thought she said "my education".....turns out, she did.  

At the Drive Thru window out pops a nice young girl with a big eyes and a pretty smile and greets me w/ a friendly "hello!" - she's quite chipper this late at night and she's very polite and courteous, her name is Jessica.  I said she sounded different than the lady on the microphone, her response was that wasn't her, it's her boss Diana R. (does "R" stand for "Ross"?) and she was in training.  I asked about the $1 donation script - - was that for reals?  "Yes!", said Diana Ross, "it's to help me graduate college w/ my degree, and it's never too late to get your degree!".  Donna's right - - it's never too late to invest in yourself.

 I ask Jessica for elaborate but now there's a queue of cars waiting behind me. Instead of getting stressed out or trying to push my order out asap she patiently explains the details - - the $1 goes into a fund that is used to support those who are going to college.  I ask how it's going - she said it's "so-so", and if I'd like it to go to Diana Ross then I just need to sign my name on this form and put her down.  Sounds like a good investment to me, I'll pitch in.  

Had Jessica not been so nice and patient and courteous during that transaction, I would have likely not donated anything or even asked about it.  Just think if we had more people like Jessica and Diana Ross - who were kind, patient, courteous, and professional - it would be a much better place.  Great job!

Without a doubt the most garbage Taco Bell in all of Austin. I live close, so I find myself there a lot. Failure on all fronts. Terrible customer service, and they can barely ever get the order right. Just drove there and paid for an order, got home and realized they gave me someone else's tiny order. Now my options are be hungry, or drive up and show them how to do their job. Trash establishment, ran by trash mo mo managers. Be better. It's not hard. Simps, all of you.

This is the worst Taco Bell ever!, they take too long to give you your order, I ordered 5 tacos like 20 minutes ago and I'm not the only one waiting here, they honestly have to get their shi*t together‍

Got explosive diorama in the bathroom. So sorry to the 75 year old man with the black moostach and Arthur itis that had to clean it up... please take these five stars as payment: 

Also, the doritoes loko was just ok to be honest

Poor Attitude. Management needs to take a look a proper training of staff. Was told they were no longer offering 7 layer burrito and I should just get a burrito without meat ,"was same thing". 7 layer has tomatoes, avocado, sour cream, rice beans, lettuce,beans and cheese. Since I had to wait in line anyway, couldn't back up I ordered the $3.59 bean burrito. Only ingredients on it were very soupy refried beans and a small amount of cheese, may 3 tiny pieces of lettuce. Was not given a receipt, so I could call it in. Thought maybe management might read this

If I could give this location no stars I would. Drive through cashier very rude. They give cinnamon twists with out and cinnamon sugar on them and when you ask for them to be correct they laugh and act like its a joke.

SeaWorld Taco Bell is the best one in the metroplex! We always have complicated orders (Crunchwrap Supreme, sub beef for beans, 86 sour cream, 86 cheese sauce) and they never mess up at this location. I appreciate attention to detail. 

We've dined in a couple times and tables have been unclean, but not a big deal. The main reason I keep coming back here is because they're so consistently on top of their orders and even at any time of day. Weekdays, weekends, day or night. Good job whoever is training/hiring at this location. 
They always give a handful of sauce, too. 

My favorite fast food joint! ;)

Went thru drive thru last night and was met with a employee that was rude and I felt rushed. The drive thru wasn't busy and they don't close until 2:00. This took place around mid-night. If there was an escape lane, I would've used it! The other Taco Bell's in the area closed at 1:00, so I chose to stay. The guy had a beard and tats. I know this is Austin...that's half the people here! The store manager knows who he is.

Do not use the mobile app to order food from this location!!! They completely messed up my order twice, even after I corrected them the first time. I only ordered the $5 Dinner Box, but for some reason they couldn't understand that and ended up giving me the wrong food and overcharging my credit card. They also didn't provide a box or any utensils or hot sauce. I will not ever come back here.
The customer service is horrible and the manager is extremely rude! Will never come here again!
Just got out of the hospital. Came in 8 minutes past 11 and wouldn't serve me breakfast.

First, it's a Saturday night at 11:45pm and they are sayin tit will take 45 min to receive my order due to them replenishing the food line. That has nothing to do with customers. Organize your team and store. For someone who was very hungry and loves Taco Bell. If I could give a minus  star I would.

No one is going to pay you $15 to mess up orders at a snail's pace.  Plain and simple employees are less motivated that a person going to the electric chair. The drive through requires a full tank of gas.  most people were standing around waiting impatiently for their orders. There 8 people waiting to place orders but they were so slow no one even went to the counter to get them
Is this location even open? I came here at 8pm on a thursday as it shows it is open but all the lights are off. Also tried ordering online the week before but order failed.
Christian is the shining star of this Taco Bell. And even tho I waited a hella long time for my Crunchwrap, this place is getting five stars regardless because it's Taco Bell and I love Taco Bell.
This place needs new management. I know it's Taco Bell so my expectations are already set to factor that in but the slow pace that this place moves is actually shocking
not only should you fire everyone who works here. you should burn the building to the ground and start completely from scratch. suck my bean paste.

food is usually good if you get your full order, but employees are really quick to get annoyed. had the worst  experience here before but i don't think overall the place is too bad, but their employees are pretty terrible. while i was in the drive through, the car up in front of me was not on the pressure plate and the dude was just sitting there, either shitting his pants, drugged out, or contemplating his next move. we waited for about 15, with varying levels of effort to get his attention and tell him to move over. an employee eventually came out to scream at him, nice. either way, it caused a backup and the employees became very short very quickly, and once the dude left (got his order eventually) employees treated my group and the people i was with as though we were the ones that caused the backup because we had a larger order. (sorry we wanted to give you more business- wont happen again (probably will tho because food is good and i am desperate)) but we weren't rushing them, they were rushing us and really made us feel bad for ordering food? talked to us like it was an inconvenience to their day, and thats relatively how you're always treated. at one point they even told us to stop ordering and pull forward and when we pulled up the cashier looked pissed at us, half ass yelled at us, and gave us the wrong order entirely and literally didn't give a single shit. Would've gone back if I didn't think I'd get punched, order was so fucked up. Also, the speakers are absolutely terrible so they never know what you're saying and you never know what they're saying. Order wasn't even that big, they were just incapable of listening through the speaker and communication was really bad. And if they talk fast you're fucked, cause in my experience they don't slow down for you, and get annoyed when you ask them to repeat it. If you're socially anxious, this is eternal prison. Sucks that it was mostly the employees that ruined it though, we weren't being impatient, didn't mind waiting- as it wasn't their fault. But the employees do not extend that recognition to you. I think if we were older we would've been treated with more respect, but we also shouldn't be treated like trash just cause we probably won't flip out about it. Food is alright tho, if bitches aren't gonna ruin your day, go for it. that is, assuming they feel nice enough that day to give you what you actually ordered.

Ordered a $5 chalupa box and a $5 steak nacho box. Called to have them replaced because if I wanted to go eat tortilla chips and shells I would go to Fred meyers and get them cheaper. They said bring in the receipt. So we did, they competed both meals and only gave us one. We then asked for the other box and they said they are now only doing one box even though the receipt for the comped meal said 2 boxes. Waisted my time, waisted my money, waisted my gas. The guy who was redoing the order also had a fat attitude. If you don't want to redo something do it right the first time. But you guys deserve $13/hr? I don't think so.

We ordered from here twice and both times they got our order wrong. First time we ordered 6 tacos only beef and there was rice, beans, and nacho cheese in it. The second time they put lettuce in our party size box and we ordered only beef.

First I had to wait in the drive through for 20 minutes, which was fine since they were busy but after a long time and finally getting home I found my food to be servilely messed up, not to mention whatever they did give me looks absolutely horrible and I can't even tell what it is. Would not recommend this Taco Bell location, I'm just so confused on how it got so messed up, it just wasn't even close to what I asked for, they're lucky I ate such a big lunch at the C4C and I'm not super hungry or I'd be pissed.

This is quite possibly the worst taco bell you could ever go to. There have been countless times that they have been out of items and you havent been able to get what you want, or you have to wait 30-40 minutes just to get your food... but tonight was quite possibly the worst experience we have ever had with TACO Bell. We ordered online since we had a decent sized order, and got nitifed that the fold was ready.. when we went to pick it up, they informed us that they were out of chips and a few other things and could offer us a certain type of burrito instead.. since we didn't want that, we asked for a refund.. they said they were unable to refund there, and that we can cancel it on the app.. when we got back home we went to cancel our order, only to find out that we are not able to cancel once an order has been marked ready for pickup.. we called the restaurant and when explaining our issue, were rudely talked to be a girl who stated that there is absolutely nothing they can do and then said we would have to figure it out as they are not allowed to give refunds.  Hopefully the manager figures something out because not being able to get a refund on over 25 dollars of food is ridiculous. They may also need some training on how to handle and talk to customers as they are degrading on the phone. This Taco Bell is out of control, and has lost my family as customers. And I will be sure to let all my friends and coworkers know to avoid this specific taco bell at all costs.

Okay. I have given this location three chances. They have goiter our order terribly wrong all three times. They simply do not care and the staff is not being managed properly. They have no quality control. I had to give this location 1 star for review purposes but they deserve no stars. For the money we pay for fast food and they want to earn more money? What a joke. Management and ownership should be ashamed.

Horrible management and prep line. Don't know how to read order properly. Young man up front, Shaun, was very polite and took our order correctly, but when it was made wrong by the cooks, I took the order up to get fixed and Shaun got yelled at for "putting it in wrong" by management. Unfair to this young man!

I normally don't eat fast food anymore and this place is an example of why. The staff are rude and very loud. While you wait you can watch them play around and practically scream back and forth at one another.
Oh I forgot to mention the guy with a girl sitting in the middle of the place. Maybe around late 20's. He had his hand down his pants and was playing with himself.

I'm big mad at Taco Bell. They retired all my favorites. No more Mexican pizzas. No more cheesy fiesta potatoes. The service was good. The food I ordered tasted fine. I guess my palate has changed since I was a drunk patron after midnight. They need to add something to their menu to make me return. At the moment; I will not be returning. I can actually get cheaper tacos and higher quality tacos on a taco Tuesday by other businesses.

I just wanna say that I don't ever eat fast food because I'm a chef but everytime I go to this location there is always something wrong went the other day a pulled up only to here the cashier say we are only doing no more then 5 items lol who ever the owner is I just wanna say they are such cheap bastard for not hiring workers every time that I've gone they are never fully staff just got a cashier and a cook 2 people to probably serve a 100 customers through there 7-10 shift please shut this place down because it is so embarrassing that your staff won't make a taco party pac because it's more then 5 items get it together and I hope the manger or owner reads this YOU SUCK sell this place already or take a dam management course lol

Tonight my son asked for Taco Bell so I decided sure. Mistakes. First, I ordered two 4 packs of the rolled chicken tacos. I pull up and pay. I was given a bag with half the rolled tacos and half of the right dipping sauce. But I didn't know about the sauce until I got home. I asked for my drinks and the other half of our food. The guy laughed and said yeah we only gave you half of it. 

You just watched me grab a bag knowing only half of what I paid was in it and you just smiled? What's wrong with you?

Thank you, Taco Bell, for contributing to the overall downfall of my health.  For real, why are you so damn tasty?

Okay, the same general wonderfulness that you'll find South of the Border.... and a would-be 4 star... but  their credit card machine has been down for like 2 weeks now... come on Bell!  Get that shiznit fixed... you're in a mall food court for jesus sake!

And, now, I'd like to end with inappropriate Taco Bell references.

Don't forget, when you go South of the Border... eat tacos and think outside the buns.

fin.
Three trips through the drive-thru later, the order was finally made correctly. No acknowledgment of error or apology for the inconvenience.

Stopped here to use the bathroom and get a snack... I think the bathroom had just been "cleaned." There was a mop and bucket outside the door and a "Caution: Wet Floor" sign. Basically the bathroom looked like an employee had filled up the bucket and poured it out on the floor and toilet a few times and then did a cursory swab, but the end result was that every inch of the bathroom was wet. Ew. I ran. I did not get a snack. Checkers is two places down the road.

This place is bad. 23 minutes for a soft taco and burrito. I was the only person in the store. 15 minutes after I got there someone else came in. There were 5 people working. I have no idea why it is this ridiculously slow, it will be faster to pass by this one and drive to another Taco Bell. This is the worst one ever!
There's always a problem with my food every time called corporate many times and never heard a call back. The stuff are rude.

I've always loved Taco Bell but unfortunately my local one (Braker and Research) always and I mean ALWAYS messes up my order.

Today was one of the worst. 

My order:
Cheese Quesadilla no sauce
Nacho Bell Grande no sour cream
Large Pepsi
Mild sauce

What I got:
Chicken Quesadilla
Nachos with no beef!?!
Medium Pepsi
Fire Sauce

0/4 that's a new low!!

The employees are nice but I think I'll have to stop going here.

Every time I go here they get it wrong... I keep thinking they will get it right and it's the closest thing to my house but this is ridiculous, third time I've gone there and I get home with food for me and other people and literally they got two out of the five items right...over it...
I have been sitting in the drive thru for over 30 minutes and only four cars have been served. If I weren't trapped, I would have left long ago.

I love this Taco Bell. They always get my picky orders correct and everything is always hot (probably because I order so much stuff without certain ingredients so they're probably not able to give me the pre made stuff) but either way, love this Taco Bell. Think I'm gonna run up there now actually.

Great fast service tonight from staff on a Friday night...again it Taco Bell so relax on bashing the place...plenty of other options in areas...if you want fine dinning Mexican YELP another place...good value, fast service ..will be back

Does not offer the Triple Double Crunchwrap... even though it's advertised on their drive thru menu. 2 stars for being the only restaurant besides McDonalds that open for late nights in this area. Was only offering the single crunch wrap only. -_-

I may be intoxicated as I write this, but that should show how sincere I am in my review. The drive thru operator was so kind and accommodating. He didn't make us feel at all rushed or an inconvenience; will definitely be back for future drunk purchases.
I found a receipt from my visit a few weeks ago with her name on it & it's Gloria M. She's like the 'Soup Nazis' on Seinfeld, except even meaner!

absolutely the worst drive through experience I have ever received. Waited in line for almost 30 minutes BEFORE ordering. Nothing against the people working, but management get this under control. Still waiting for food.... 50 minutes later...

Service was ok.  It was what should be expected for Fast Food or to be considered Fast Food.  I ate inside this time while doing some math homework.  Bah, hate math!  Either way, the place was surprisingly clean as I appreciated that for sure.  My only real complaint was the size of the burrito.  Have you ever noticed that every Taco Bell has different size burrito's for the same burrito?  It's odd, but yeah it was somewhat small and was somewhat disappointed, but as long as the food tastes good as well as the customer service was decent, I will always give a place a decent or at least average review.
I usually order the power bowl and eat here knowing exactly what to expect and I didn't get diarrhea. Good times!

Taco Bell is really nice place to get good and fast meal. At least for me and my friends. What i notice that this is very clean and organized place. The staff is extra friendly and they act like you are their best customer or part of their family. seems like they really happy if you like their food and if u satisfied. And it's make you feel special. 
The food come out really fast.
All stuff wear gloves and they change them when start work on other order. I know that how it suppose to be but be honest, not a lot of places does it. And it's very important for my friends because they eat only kosher food. so when we order taco without meat just with vegetables they always ask if we would love some extra beans and i just love them.
So this is really good place to go. I didn't give them one more star because i notice that sometimes their cheese are not as fresh as it suppose to be. I told in beginning that my reviews are honest.

Terrible terrible, I have given this location chance after chance because it is so convenient to my house. Every time I come here I get the wrong order or pay for items I don't even receive, I assume they are having a bad day or maybe really slammed but I can't continue to come up for excuses. Get a training crew in here and train the staff, the fact that the majority of the staff forgets orders should be zero tolerance for the company. Slow down double check the order and deliver.

I've been to Mexico.  I've eaten authentic Mexican food.  I'm not quite sure if Taco Bell ever stepped foot in the country before though.

Never-the-less, bravo.  Just do yourself a favor Taco Bell, perhaps visit the country one time, because as hard as I looked while over the border, I did not find one instance of Dorito taco shells.
The worst drive thru. I waited at least a half hour after I placed my order to get my food. Slow. This is the last time I'm ever going to that Taco Bell

0 stars. I went through drive through when it wasn't even busy, then noticed I got a random order after I got home. When I went back, no discounts or anything which I don't expect but it's always a nice gesture for an inconvenience as such, got a stank look from the lady who gave me my food, then when I went home, there was chicken in my cheese quesadilla:( I don't even want to go back and get my correct order so now I'm just hungry.

Last time I was here, I ordered a freeze that they didn't put he lid on right so it went ALL over my newly clean car. So much sticky ness.

I recommend any other location than this one.
The staff here today was so full of energy and very nice . I was very impressed and I travel a lot

This is my favorite Taco Bell to go to late at night when I've had one too many drinks and just HAVE to have a taco before I die.

Taco Bell, I'd be lost without you and your soft tacos, mild sauce, and bean burritos with no onions.

I'm always happy when I'm not making dinner... or cleaning up after dinner. So perhaps I set the bar too low but I know that I can count on this Taco Bell! I've gone through the drive thru repeatedly with no issues. They have always gotten my order right and are friendly. 
I've used the bathroom - it's always clean. 
I've dined in.... what do you know? it looks like a Taco Bell. A clean one at that. I've never had a cause for concern. Which is awesome.

Seriously the worst Taco Bell ever. I understand that Taco Bell isn't high quality food, but this location consistently brings it to a new low. Every time I've been there the food is cold or barely warm, the cheese on the gordita crunch is never melted, and they frequently forget to put all of the Taco ingredients on the tacos. Even my Cinnabon delights were cold! Like straight out of the fridge kind of cold. It's got to be a problem with their equipment because I refuse to believe that every employee there intentionally doesn't fully cook any of the food. I give up on you Kyle Taco Bell, thanks a lot.
So Taco Bell comes to Kyle. And as can be expected it is much like any other Taco Bell. I will say it is cleaner than most I have eaten at.

This taco Bell is decent. It gets you your food correctly in a mostly timely manner. The location is a bit hidden so you may want to use your GPS but it's near bowlmor. 

The food tastes just like other taco bells and I've never had an issue receiving the correct order. 

I'm not sure why people gave such low reviews.. I mean, it's taco Bell. What do you really expect? 

Also, if you want the #1 and aren't dying for the supreme taco with tomatoes, sour cream.. just get the cravings deal. You get a smaller drink size but save $2 and get another item in your meal. Seriously, $7 for a burrito, taco and drink is outrageous. I always just order whatever box promo they have. Easiest since the food doesn't really taste all that different from each other. 

Oh and the naked chalupa chicken taco - overrated. I tried it during this trip and the chicken is super thin like the chicken fries you get at BK. It's not really worth it. Just get the ground beef like their normal tacos.

You just gotta get some T-Bell every now and then, am I right? They seem to be disappearing (thanks for taking the one out of Warren Towers @ BU, NOT!), so I love the fact that I can grab some when I go shopping at CSG. I LOVE the chalupas and cinnamon twists, you can't get anything like those items anywhere else. Also, they have Brisk Raspberry iced tea here, which is definitely one of my favs.
Slowest taco bell in existence. It's called fast food for a reason...  But upside, it's quite clean and new. Besides that... Good lord lets pick up the pace!
Always hit this location for a quick and easy dinner thats usually spontaneous. Line moves well and food is always good. Staff is polite as well.
I hadn't eaten at Taco Bell in years and was pleasantly surprised when I went the other night.  The location is all shiny and new so that was cool.  Everything else was just as I remembered.

NO STARS IF I COULD....How does a Taco Bell run out of ground beef and then decide they would charge you extra for chicken when that's the only choice you have?! Poor management leads to poor decisions which leads to poor product which leads to poor employees which leads to poor performance which leads to poor satisfaction so if that's your aim management....you have succeeded!

I went to this Taco Bell lots of times and try  to give them a chance many times, but  
After all the wrong orders and missing orders I will rate this Taco Bell with one star.. Really bad

I ordered 3 if the same very simple thing. 3 bean and cheese burritos. 2 of them fine, just bean and cheese. Ya know the only thing that is in it. Who puts lettuce in only 1 of the 3 burritos. You aint got the brightest working there.
Walked in looked like a PIÑATA EXPLODED !!! Tables dirty no one acknowledged that we were standing there ..Drive thru was backed up ...stood for about 5 minutes and walked out ...

Thoroughly pissed off! I ordered in the drive-thru around 12:30ish. I ordered the #6 which is the chalupa supreme meal, & I ordered an extra 2 tacos. 

The chalupa shells were so hard that they were crunchy (they are supposed to be soft), there was only a teaspoonful of meat on each chalupa, the lettuce was brown, & sour cream was scarce. The tacos were basically just brown lettuce & cheese with barely any meat in them. On top of ALL that the meal was beyond cold. 

They should be ashamed of theirselves for serving this food. I understand I went to the drive-thru 30 minutes before they closed. But that's no excuse for bad food. If your store closed at 1am...you should be serving quality until 1am. No excuses. 

I will be calling the this location tomorrow to demand a refund. Just Terrible.
Showed up quarter past their open time and they weren't open. I wasted gas driving here for no reason. Disappointed. Get your hours straight.

This was not my best Taco Bell experience. The cashier taking my order told me I couldn't get an item from the menu cause she couldn't find it on the register. Second, my two friends orders were completely wrong. One asked for 3 tacos and only received 1. The other asked for a cheese and chicken quesadilla and got a bean and cheese quesadilla. I will not be returning to this location!

Service was sufficient for a fast food restaurant; "Bellee" did give me a couple of wet naps when I spilled some lemonade filling my daughter's sippy cup.  They did get the "no ice" order in my Diet Pepsi.

But the idioso girl who took my order had no idea what I was talking about when I asked her if they still had the Pina-Colada Frutista slushy drink.  

Like that they have the drive through garbage before you get to the take out window so you can clean out your cup holders.

Food was consistent as always and the 3 for $2 deals are a bargain.

This is the place I go for when I just want Americana Fast Food Mexican Food. I actually base other Mexican places against Taco Bell. This is my baseline for cheap basic Mexican style food. A taco with fire and bean burrito then I'm golden. If I need a late night fix and don't want to drive to TV highway and 185th or Forest Grove for real Mexican food this is where I head. For the price it can't be beaten. Being close to home doesn't hurt.

If you are going to come here your best bet is to go inside and order. If you go to the drive-thru you will sit in line and wait 5 minutes at a minimum per car just to order and then the same to pick up your food. Even ordering just a drink takes about 3 min to get your drink. If I wanted to take my time to eat I wouldn't go to fast food restaurant. I don't think they understand that here.

Went through drive thru, got home found out they gave me the wrong order. Just paid way too much for 2 soft taco and a regular taco. Sadly, this is not the first time it's happened to me. 

FYI: double check your order before leaving the window.

Terrible service, after waiting in line for much longer than average, my entire order was wrong. Meanwhile a few staff members were just hanging out rather than working. And these people want to be paid $15 an hour? Please learn how to get a basic order right, you don't even deserve minimum wage.

I love Taco Bell, and this location has some great people. I give it 4 stars cause there is one constant problem, they always miss something. When I catch it and point it out they never hesitate to make it and give it to me on the house. But the employees are awesome and always make me feel welcome!

Patrick P was amazing. So kind and conversational. The food was also the best Taco Bell I have ever had. Hot and perfectly prepared. Good location and very clean for a Taco Bell. Will be back to this location even though it's out of my way
Big shout out to Victor who was at the drive through window. Super friendly, great service. Made our day!! Thanks for the fire sauce!!

Gloria has to be the nicest person I have ever encountered in the whole state of GEORGIA! So sweet I will make the hike to this taco bell just to see her. keep up the good work Gloria and may God bless you and your family!

It's a Taco Bell!

Nothing super special about this location but its proximity and convenience. I think I satisfied my quarterly fast food craving here. 

About every three months I need some cheap Mexican good and this perfectly hits the spot. I new the fake cheese to close the deal every time. 

Ill be back. In three months.
I ordered three taco supreme, an hr later I was having food poison symptoms. I was hurting for a good 20 hours. The food was good, but I would have to rate the cleanliness of the food to be horrible.
Food was decent and was clea but slowest Taco Bell ever been to and staff isn't very friendly. All and all shitty experience.

I'm giving this a glowing review purely because of the incredibly nice and sincere people who work here, who deserve better than to work at a lousy underpaying fast food job. You can stand to pay your workers higher, Taco Bell corporate.
This has a new look...but it the same as old.....a lot of homeless causing and fighting..begging inside restraut .....food is taco bell....so its OK...only go if u need too

This is one of the only Taco Bells around metro Boston and I love me some Taco Bell. I don't eat meat and Taco Bell will substitute beans for any meat product so I can eat pretty much anything on the menu. Definitely not somewhere I go daily. The food is heavy on the caloric and sodium side but every once in a while its a nice treat.

I ordered a steak cantina bowl from this location. As me and my son was sharing my bowl, halfway through it I felt like I was chewing gum. Something wasn't right, so I pulled the hard chewy piece out of my mouth and I saw it was a big chunk of plastic. I checked my receipt to see if I ordered a side of plastic and it wasn't the case. Turns out it's the package for nacho cheese hence the nacho cheese still in the plastic. The cantina bowl does not come with Nacho cheese. I or my son could have choked or even worse ended up in the hospital.

Soooo Slow.  Only 1 cashier at lunch, so the line extended to the door.  After waiting 8 minutes to place my order, I waited 18 minutes to get my food.  No, I am not exaggerating it really took that long.  There were 4 customers that asked for refunds, due to the wait.  The worst part is that nobody ever appologized.  The manager giving the refunds only made excuses that they were short staffed.  This is the second time in the past month that this has happened.

I rarely write a review on fast food chains but this location of Taco Bell sure deserves one. First of all it's very clean and fast, I was in and out( walked in) in the matter of a minute or two. The staff was very warming and welcoming . The tacos were not your regular " throw in sloppy joe look", that most of Taco Bell serves. It was nicely wrapped with a warm tortilla with an each ingredient placed carefully inside. Not messy crap, just nice little tacos. Loved it.
Devon and Elise are great they made my night pulled up to a soda fight but it's cool they are funny

Second time I been to this Taco Bell and the cashier at the driver thru always seems to have an attitude. And it would be nice to cook the rice all the way through, got a couple burritos and the rice was so hard. I do not recommend this location.

Been going there since I move back to Austin I've gotten to know all the nite crew there always smiling laughing very friendly they go out of there way to make my meal just the way I like it thank you nite crew y'all are the best keep up the great service ...
A really friendly Taco Bell. It was really fast and the people were so nice. I must admit I would go back to them

The staff here is so friendly! The wait "inside" can be a little long but the drive thru is always speedy. They always apologize for any inconvenience and will fix our order if there is a mistake. 

I LOVE this place!

I really love Taco Bell.  And the recent onslaught of commercials gave me a craving so I had to make a run for the border.  But my experience at this Taco Bell was definitely sub-par.  

First, I ordered one crunchy beef taco fresco style and one chicken soft taco fresco style.  Neither came fresco style.  So sad, I really like the salsa.  

Second, I asked for a cup of water and the woman taking my order informed me that the water was broken, so they couldn't honor my request.  That's not even possible.  If your soda fountain works, your water works.  When I asked the manager the same question, she gave me the same answer.  I'm pretty sure this is just a ruse to get customers to buy $1.75 bottles of water, and it does not make me happy.  

I'll be taking my Taco Bell business to another franchise next time.

If you want Taco Bell late at night or any time for that matter don't go here. Doubled checked to see when the drive thru closed and it said it was open till 4 a.m. At 2:52 a.m. I pulled into the drive thru and sat there for 5 minutes said hello a couple of times and no one responded back at all. Instead they turned off the lights and the menu board lights with out any word so I went to McDonald's instead and gave them my money. I guess this Taco Bell doesn't want to make money.... oh well.
Got my driver thru order wrong once again. Ordered and paid for 2 Beefy Mini Quesadillas and 1 Chicken Quesadilla. When I got home, one of the Mini Quesadillas was missing

worst taco bell ever! 
never again! 
horrible service
cold food
bad bad bad

My last visit to this place--9-16-2015--led me to think it is unsafe to eat from because me and a relative had ordered the ghost pepper grillers and extra ghost pepper sauce but got habanero grillers and extra habanero sauce instead; and one griller had a sharp plastic object. I reported the finding of the object and the wrong sauce given to taco bell corporation online and I got silence from the area coach micah melvin when I said I should be recompensed for traveling back to this restaurant. I got silence for 6 months since reporting the found sharp object, now bill retz of taco bell only wants to give my refund and the cost of one meal on a gift card.  taco bell has seriod trouble since it does not hire knowledgeable employees to know the difference between the habanero and the ghost pepper sauces, and either the restaurant employees or the meat plant is responsible for that hard object found in one of the three grillers.  I also shared a picture of what was found to Taco bell but it doubts my story. Overall, at this taco bell and other locations, in terms of the food, something foreign may be found in it, including drinks, meat serving is trivial, the freshness of vegetables like the lettuce and tomatoes may be brown, wilted and limp and the wait time is moderate, rarely fast. Employees maybe ignorant of specials or promotions. ATTENTION: People INSPECT and CHEW whatever you order and/or drink from here and any restaurant.

I usually stop here on the way back to San Antonio to grab some caffeine to stay awake on the road (as its one of the few places actually open after midnight). The restaurant looks relatively new and/or extremely well up-kept. The staff is courteous and orders come out accurately, so what else could you want?!
These guys hook it up with every purchase, my burritos are always filled to the brim with mouth-watering "meat," truly a privilege to be able to shop here.
I was going to Taco Bell for something quick to eat. I like pretty much like  everything here especially their Dorito nacho cheese tacos. But my one complaint would be that they use very lil meat!!
