The drive through was horribly slow on a  Sunday evening. When I reached the window I noticed an animated male employee handling the food. My 5 year old woke up in the middle of the night vomiting and had diarrhea this morning(Food poisoning symptoms.) Lucky for them, the health department doesn't work on weekends. My recommendation is to fire everyone here and start with people that actually want to work here. Remember, it's not the people you fire that give you the most problems, it's the ones you don't.

I am looking at the hours that they are open now (Photo attached). "Stores closed" is what I was just told about an hour before closing. They have forgotten food multiple times before but this is a new for this below average store. Total bs. Come here and risk, cold food, attitude, lies, and most likely getting screwed.

Good service, friendly staff. Part of dining area we were sitting needed to be swept and tables needed to be wiped off. Staff seemed to be sweeping but behind cash register.  Kitchen didn't seem well kept either, had puddle on the floor and light bulb was flashing. Disappointed with food even in the context of Taco Bell. Nachos had some cheese that wasn't melted. Burrito looked to be on a the small side. Taste was bland and stomach felt weird after.

This Taco Bell is an adequate one and one that I have been going to for roughly 7 years.  The service is usually persistently friendly and of good company.  They aren't the fastest Taco Bell and drive thru does great at lunch but pretty slow and sloppy at night.  The other big issue they never give napkins or sauces in drive thru unless you remember to ask.

Inside they are of good size and it is nice that they keep it all open all the time so seating is never an issue.  Their fountain drink machine finally received an update, so the sodas are not flat as they use to be but my big complaint inside is it isn't the cleanest nor do they have their condiment station in order.  It is rare for them to have all the sauces out and even sometimes napkins.  The food though is always the best part, the taste, prep and tortillas are usually done better overall than other Taco Bells that I have visited which is the reason I don't mind returning year after year.
Very pleased-wanted breakfast tacos for the office on short notice, called in my order and it was just about ready when I arrived 20 min later.  Very nice crew.
good fast pretty decent food don't really eat there meat only there chicken because i personally believe there beef is not any good but one of the best taco bells in the area

I frequent this location for lunch. Even during a rush, the service is efficient, my order has always been correct, the employees are kind, and you know what-- they give me wet napkins and cinnamon candies with my order. This far exceeds my expectations of a Taco Bell! 

This location is clearly trying to compensate for the losers who spend their time writing scathing reviews of chain restaurants on Yelp. 

Thanks, guys! Keep up the good work.

This is like a High End Taco Bell.
Staff is great, food is great and the place is very clean.

I've been here twice now, and I will return!

It's a Taco Bell. You know what you're getting. It's not healthy, but it's fast, tasty, and cheap.

I've been to this Taco Bell several times. It's always been very fast, even when it's super busy, and I've never had any complaints about what I get.

Tip: Taco Bell's nacho fries box is good!
This is my favorite TACO BELL. EVERYTIME I come here my food is always fresh and ready fast. I always stop by on my way to Austin!! NEVERRRR DISAPPOINTING!!

I know that this is a very common occurrence in fast food drive thrus, however after I went through the drive thru and went back to my house, I realized they forgot my taco. I drove back up there about 15 minutes later and the guy standing there didn't seem to care about this little mishap. I claimed that I was through the Drive thru without a taco and he said "oh" and he walked to his manager for my taco. Most fast food places are super convenient and the workers on shift will usually apologize and  even give you an extra order of cinnamon twists. I have to say that the food is great but this was a very inconvenient trip.

Probably the worst experience I have had at taco bell ever. My family and I went to the drive thru to order some lunch the day before easter. We asked for a minute to get our kids orders ready and the lady (valentine g) was very rude. She continued to say she couldn't hear my husband and told us to pull up the the first window, where james took the rest of our order. We pulled up to the second window and were asked if we wanted sauce. At this time I realized I ordered the food for my children and forgot about myself. We asked to add a taco and she was visibly more angry. She took the credit card from my husband and yelled into the cooks that she needed another taco. Then proceeded to throw bag after bag of food in our car window at my husband. When she gave him the drinks she put his card on top of one of the drinks and rudely just said "card" like we are supposed to know she wasn't going to just hand it to us and put it on top of our drink instead. After we received the last taco we ordered we started to leave the parking lot when I realized my children did not get their drinks. We went back and rather than dealing with her in the drive thru I decided to go inside and talk to the manager about the drinks and the customer service his staff was giving at the drive thru. He seemed complete unfazed by what I had to say. While getting the drinks for my children he had to remind his staff to get back to work and take orders at the drive thru. Also valentine decided to hide behind the kitchen equipment while her other coworkers came around the corner trying to see who was talking to their manager about their customer service. All the manager had to say at that point was have a good day and sorry for the inconvenience. None of it was sincere, it was like he didn't even care that his staff could be so rude and unprofessional. I understand this is fast food but if you don't like your job then maybe you shouldn't work in fast food or customer service. Then when we got home we realized the drinks were just carbination and our tacos were half wrapped and falling apart all over the bag. This was a waste of money and time.

Although I never have high expectations for Taco Bell as they usually get my order wrong one way or another, I return to them as they are 1) cheap and 2) fast.  During my most recent visit, I ordered a chicken quesadilla.  It was lukewarm and the cheese wasn't even melted.  *sigh* Again, I don't have high expectations for Taco Bell, but they do need to rise the bar even if a little.  Keep trying, Taco Bell.
Thanks for my food, it was made perfect, just the way I like it. All greasy and messy.. Again thanks, I tossed It out the window :(
Took forever. Watched burritos sit on counter for 3 minutes before wrapped. Never coming back.

I frequent this location often, but never have I had the lady taking my order be so rude. Not friendly at all. She even told a young girl (maybe 10 or 11 years old) to get her napkins from the dispenser on the wall behind her, instead of moving her ass while she was refilling the hot sauce packets!! Not, to mention, it took 20 minutes to get my order!
Incompetence at its best. Be prepared to get stuck in the drive thru for 20 minutes plus. You will be dealing with unintelligent people
Horrible customer service late night, and very slow we literally waited 40 minutes. They should have at least 1 extra person working!

I don't know where to begin. Absolutely no customer service. A drive thru speaker where we can't even hear what they are saying. Then we place an order and get no receipt because the receipt machine is broken. We get our COLD food and noticed that we were missing two tacos. BE LUCKY WE DIDNT ASK TO REPLACE OUR COLD FOOD. We come back and was asked to repeat our order. Instead of saying " I'm sorry my mistake ", we get cussed out about what we ordered and that we didn't say so. Then have two pay $2.87 for the tacos that we paid for already. When we asked for the receipt, this is when we found out the machine was broken. How would the customer even know what we are being charged for without it. This lady comes back to the window with the nastiness attitude ever and told us that she actually gave us two extra tacos (which she didn't) and asked if we were 'good'. And then ordered a woman with braids to close the window on us. Had to throw the extra tacos that we paid for again away because I thought someone spit in it. So unprofessional.
Took my wife to Taco Bell for a quick lunch break, and it's about what I expected "fast food"

Ate beef because of wrong marker on the package. Disgusting :(.. I am pure vegetarian and I can't explain how disgusted I feel due to your small mistake. Please have your staff be cognizant about such things and their impact.

First P-Terry and now you guys. Bad week for me.
Literally toke 10 minutes to just get ONE large soda, all I needed was a cup but it took 10 minutes.

Ordered a plain chicken taco , they gave me chicken and cheese melted on taco.  I also order 2 cinnamon twists and they did not put in my bag . Seems like every time I go here , something is screwed up with my order

When you're in a pinch... Who doesn't love some Taco Bell late at night when you're desperate for a taco or just some food to keep you from bouncing off of the walls. Or to keep you bouncing on the walls... However you roll, I try not to judge. This one had a fairly ridiculous line late at night as some of them do so make sure you're not hitting it at bar 30 or you might be screwed into waiting a ridiculous amount of time.

Okay, I'll admit it. Taco Bell (also affectionately referred to as Toxic Hell) is a guilty pleasure of mine... and not always when I've been drinking, surprisingly. I was a little more than devastated to see that this location had closed upon a recent craving. I even Tweeted about its demise. So, imagine how excited I was to discover that they'd only been closed for remodeling. Hooray!

I've never actually been inside, but my drive thru experiences have been great. The employees are usually pretty friendly, I was in my work clothes the last time and I was asked if I was going to work or on my way home. I always order the same thing with a slight modification and I've never been given any flack for getting a soft taco in lieu of the crispy. Well, it's Taco Bell, so I really don't know what to say about the food... except that its really tasty when you're hungover, depressed, stressed out, overwhelmed, or just hungry. Yeah, pretty much any time.

My affinity for Taco Bell probably stems from a couple childhood experiences, and I'm totally okay with that.
This Taco Bell is a huge let down.  The food is never consistent. Two days in a row they've forgotten my hot sauce.  I've learned my lesson and won't be back to this location!
Creepy dude panhandling threatened me before I could get out of my car. No way management couldn't be aware of situation. WTF?

I'll admit it, I like Taco Bell.  I've never had a problem at this location. They are always friendly and the service is always fast.  Free WiFi and TV, its great to go on your lunch break when you don't have a lot of time or money.   
Thank you Taco Bell.

Part 1: Prelude


The Order:

After seeking recommendations from the experts, I was told the DORITOS® CHEESY GORDITA CRUNCH was among the pinnacle of Taco Bell offerings. 
 With this information in hand, I proceeded to order, but was initially thrown off by the "combo" system, offering an aggregated approach to taco procurement. Perhaps in a moment of panic, my order (A number ten (10) combo) was slightly obscured, and rather than successfully getting the aforementioned Doritos® version of the Gordita Crunch, I was instead placing an order for a plain Cheesy Gordita with two FIERY DORITOS® LOCOS TACOS accompanying it, along with a large (20 fl oz) beverage. 

Impressions:

After getting over the initial confusion and perhaps disappointment of the received order, I decided to make the best of a bad situation and begin the ritual application of Taco Bell hot sauce. As a purveyor of all spicy foods, I of course defaulted for the spiciest available variety of sauce, which is named Diablo, as to elicit images of Satan himself. When I imagine a top-tier sauce, I picture something that could double as a chemical warfare agent outlawed by the 1977 Geneva Protocol, a sauce that would send pain through every exposed membrane of the body, a concoction so powerful the human tongue would recoil as if bit by the most venomous of snakes (The Inland Taipan, incase you were curious). I assume purely for purposes of liability, this is not the case, and while the diablo sauce delivered a pleasant level of spice, it was by no means the masochistic experience I had wished for 

I started with the Fiery Locos Tacos, and upon examining the first one, found them to be well balanced, but delicate. The shell, a vibrant red, was flavored with a spicy chili-esque powder, giving hints of lime, and filled with ground beef, lettuce, and shredded cheddar cheese in successive layers. My first bite was met with a sense of relief, the taco was crispy, the ingredients were hot, and the lettuce was even, dare I say, fresh(?).  I administered a few Diablo sauce packets which complemented the seasoned shell quite well, and within minutes had consumed both of my hard-shell tacos. 

I moved on to then what was to be the crown jewel of the meal, the Cheesy Gordita Crunch Wrap.Like an Arkansas wedding, this smashing together of two closely-related entities produced a surprising mutant offspring, but in this case, it was met with salivation and enjoyment. The Cheesy Gordita Crunch concept is nothing new, but captivated my interest for its complex taste built upon a fairly straightforward platform. 

At this point I realized the key to Taco Bell's success lies within a simple psychological principle. Throughout the meal I felt a sense of nostalgia, as familiar tastes and textures of elementary school lunchroom food wafted through the air. It has been theorized that smell (and therefore, taste) have perhaps the strongest connection to memory than any other sense the human body possesses (Willander, J., & Larsson, M., 2006). It is perhaps this aspect of the human condition, our existential need for truth and reverence through the lens of our childhood experiences, which is reenacted but only for a moment, by the ground beef and Dorito flavored taco shells before is. The pressures, expectations, and formalities of the adult world temporarily disappear, as it is quite impossible with any semblance of maturity to eat a red-dyed taco out of a paperboard holder and feel serious about the whole ordeal. For $1.79 (plus applicable state and/or local meal tax) you too can relive your glory years, when the hardest decision of the day was which side of the playground smelled the worst. 

The Gorditas biggest strength turned out to also be its largest weakness. While the taco shell and soft taco outer layer provided excellent texture and axial rigidity, this massive outer layer absorbed much of the inner flavor, like a protective sheath of cheesy tortilla, and provided a seemingly bland overall flavor compared to the Fiery Tacos which I had consumed prior. Had I ordered correctly, I would have been treated to a Fiery taco within the Cheesy Gordita Crunch Wrap, and this may have remedied this whole blandness situation. 

At this point I felt two things: The first being that even after my triple-taco spread, I was still hungry, and the second, that I had an editorial obligation to provide a review consistent with a wide spectrum of menu offerings, and to get below the surface to really discover what Taco Bell is all about. I boldly returned to the counter and placed an order for a Crunchy Cheesy Core Burrito, which promised a cheddar filled center, the internal crunchiness of seasoned chips, and a soft steamed burrito exterior. In what seemed like only seconds I was handed a bag containing my final challenge, a foil-back paper wrapper holding the creation, initially surprised by its weight and size in my hands. 

To Be Continued...

The only two taco bell locations in the entire Boston area are here and NEU's main student center.

NEU's taco bell is good but they only have limited options to choose from and they don't serve chalupas. It is unacceprable and it is a disgrace to all mankind.

Now, on the other hand, this place has a full menu INCLUDING CHALUPAS AND BAJA BLAST.

If you live in Boston and you want to get your taco bell fix, come over to this chain and get your money's worth.

Anything after hours is the worst time to come here 
I've came 3x and every time I had barely any meat let alone anything in tacos burritos or whatever I ordered. 

It seems as if they aren't making enough food at all of being lazy period. 
It's a disappointed to be waiting for a few minutes for your food (5-7) min wait by the way.  To receive barely any food 
Def not coming back to this Taco Bell.

We stopped by here one late afternoon for a quick snack. The male cashier looked young and inexperienced. That didn't matter. What mattered, however, was pretty much how the following events unfolded.
The cashier charged us extra, and we didn't notice it until the receipt was already printed out.
He brought it to the attention of his manager -- a Hispanic woman who looked like in her late 40s. She came out from the back of the kitchen and approached the counter with no smile on her face or even just a "Hi". The cashier explained to her the issue, and I did as well. She insisted the charge was correct. I told her it's not and pointed it out to her. It finally hit her that I was correct. But the attitude she showed was quite disturbing, like it's such a burden to make the necessary changes by punching a few buttons. Although it was just a two dollar extra charge, it wasn't about that. It was about integrity and customer service.

Later, I had to go back to the counter to ask for something in relation to our order.
She didn't even want to make eye contact with me. How rude! 

I didn't get her name. Apparently, she took her name tag off. This incident took place on 4/13/2015 around 5PM.
Don't get me wrong, I do like Taco Bell. It's just that the experience we had that time was very unsatisfactory.

No stars is what I'd give it if I could. Expected to pull in at 6:45 and get breakfast. Sat at order screen for five minutes then pulled up to the order window and knocked and honked. No answer. Pulled around and saw a massive woman with an uncanny resemblance to the aunt Jamima woman from Tom & Jerry waddle out of a car with a uniform on. We called out while in the drive through lane again "is it not open at 6:30, as the sign says?" And she mumbled some ghetto sounding nonsense I almost couldn't make out, but was akin to "dey need thirty minutes ta gets ready". Of course, this is the place that served me all the meximelts fused to paper and inedible so perhaps I'm the idiot for going back there. 

The Taco Bell ten minutes down the road was open and served us. What's so hard about this?

This place is clean inside, the customer service was great and the tacos were filling. One of the best Taco Bell experience I've had in a while.

I definitely recommend coming here if you're craving Taco Bell or an affordable snack. I got 3 regular tacos and I was full after.

I'm a huge fan of the Bell and have been to them all over Orlando. This one has definitely been the best and most consistent. I eat a vegan diet and they're really good with accommodating it. The drive thru is always fast and everything comes out correct. They're also very friendly every time!
Lousy, slow service. Nobody cares about the customers. Go home if don't want do the job. Make room for other people that want to work.

What can i really say, it's a Taco Bell.

All i know is i have going here WAAAAYY too often since the Doritos tacos came out! I get the Doritos Taco Supreme with beans instead of beef...it tastes like trailer trash 7 layer dip in the best possible way!!!

This location has consistently had better quality and friendlier service than ANY of the others in this area (as compared to the one on Murray near Home Depot, which is THE WORST location i've been to in my life). The drive through attendees are always VERY talkative and friendly and they have never gotten one of our orders wrong.

I'm not a typical fast foodie however, when the craving comes along, a crunch wrap is in order. Tonight's chicken crunch wrap supreme had VERY little sour cream and the hard shell was stale. Also, once at the window I waited 8minutes to receive my crunch wrap. Now if it hadn't been 9:45 at night, I'd be more understanding. The guest service was kind and up to standards, as the drive through lady apologize for the wait. Simply disappointed in my ever strong craving for my chicken crunch wrap supreme.

The reviews others posted say enough. 
If your wondering how someone can stay in line for 30 minutes and get a warm drink with melted ice and tacos that need to be put back in the microwave, I'll tell you. PISS POOR MANAGEMENT. 

The workers are not to blame. The girl at the window isn't to blame her boos can't hire or keep people to staff the place properly. 

If corporate offices wonder why the taco truck selling tacos for 2$ are so busy it's because customers will risk a taco from a truck that doesn't have an endless supply of running water and no bathroom in site. That's how much people hate your place. 

No matter how many try's and befits of the doubt I give this place it just keeps falling on its face. 

This is a sad excuse of a fast food business. 

I live less then 1 miles from this place yet I avoid it like the plague. The place is that bad. I rather drive 3 miles and get don Pedro's from some girl who can barley take my order in English yet never messes it up. 

Taco Bell take notes from these taco trucks. You will soon be closing stores like this one because  you  can't keep up with them. I cherish the day this place has a for lease sign on the doors.

At dinner time most of the tables are taken, so  my family of 4 is sitting at a table that is below our knees. We have to bend over to keep from food dropping in our lap. Who approved these to be installed?

So I visited Taco Bell again despite my previous nightmare. The service in the day time is completely different from what I received at night. The day crew is much more pleasant and are much faster!

I noticed the Happy Hour from 1pm to 5pm for the $1 Freeze's. Regular price they are around $3. In this summer heat, a freeze is highly recommended. They currently have three different flavors: Baja Blast, Strawberry Skittles, and Watermelon. 

Baja Blast Freeze: The Baja Blast is my favorite! Tastes like the regular Baja Blast except frozen.

Strawberry Skittles Freeze: This one took a while to get used to. At first, it seemed too sweet for me, but soon my tastebuds adjusted and it became enjoyable. 

Watermelon Freeze: This Freeze tasted just like watermelon. The only thing I wasn't a fan of were the candy seeds. The Freeze is already sweet enough. The candies seeds take it over the top. I actually started to spit them out like real seeds.

Overall, these drinks are good. I recommend getting them during the happy hour time of 1pm-5pm!

I bet your wondering, "What is this guy doing writing a review on a fast food place?"
Here's your answer. I had a rather strange encounter when coming to this Taco Bell. My grandfather and ordered our food and everything was going fine until 2 guys walked in. They knew the cook, so they were talking to him. Never in my life have I seen a Taco Bell employee cuss right in front of a 12 year old sitting with his grandfather eating his food. These 3 guys were cussing up a storm and they weren't being quiet about it. 

Other than that, the food was great and we only had to wait around 3 minutes.

Writing this review on the service since everywhere you go the food at Taco Bell is the same. Very friendly drink-thru guy and workers who made us a few extra cinnamon balls and gave me a free drink from a mistake they made for a diff order.

Probably the most expensive Taco Bell in the 97236 area code, probably beyond, too. When they had the XXL chaulpa box for $5 everywhere else, it was $6 here. I think they raised their prices again at the start of the year. Right now their 2 Chalupa meals are $9.39. I've never seen a taco bell have a meal over $9 before! I know min. wage is having stupid increases ever July 1st so its just gonna push food prices back to the consumers (thanks dumb government) but it seems like this Taco Bell raises priced when min wage goes up and at the start of every year...I don't frequent it enough to tell for certain, but like I said earlier, $9.39 for Chalupa meal, if someone can find that for more in South East Portland let me know.
Great Taco Bell! Friendly service and always efficient. I had my best experience at a fast food place here. Keep up the good work

I live 2 minutes from this location and usually the staff is pretty nice and I've only had to return twice in 2 years for missing items which were quickly replaced with no issue. Then BAM...I go through the drive through this past Friday afternoon....the guy taking orders was sooooooooooooooooooooooo RUDE. I mean beyond rude, no Hi, How are you? Can I take your order? Can I help you? Nothing....not a thing. Then this punk wants to give me an attitude because I place an order. HONEY I'M TWICE YOUR AGE, I'VE WORKED AT TACO BELL, I MANAGED MCDONALD'S FOR YEARS. DON'T TRY IT WITH ME. Customer service is one thing I can't ignore. Not only was he rude, I got my money basically thrown at me and the window slammed in my face. Not to mention the item he left out. I didn't even mention that when I went inside to complain to his manager. The lady behind the counter inside is absolutely wonderful. Very polite and she is a great addition to the team. This kid needs to go. Customer survive isn't his thing. I was so angry I really almost yelled at him. But I take my family there and refuse to act like a fool because of his actions.

22 minutes in the drive thru. I ordered one item no problem. After 6 attempts at saying "stuffed nacho" they kept asking if I wanted nachos. I kept telling them stuffed naco....like on your menu. 6 attempts and they couldn't figure it out. When I got my order for a single cheese quesadilla (I had to give up on the stuffed nacho) they tried to charge me $11.60.  I asked for a receipt (so I could give Corp feeback about the experience). I pulled forward, checked the bag and there was no receipt. 
Seriously....22 minutes in a drive thru? Is this because they can't freaking hear (6 ATTEMPTS to order off their menu were met with confusion and them keep trying to confirm an item I didn't order) or is this because they are under staffed? Either way....I'll go eat my garbage food somewhere else.
MY lemonade was WARM. power aid tastes like old kool aid and the service was very SLOOOW
Do I even need to explain. Cheesy gordita crunch might be the best invention since the telephone

Let me start off by saying I love some Taco Bell, but my experience at this particular one was ehhh. I was in the drive through for almost 30+ mins. When we finally got to the window she repeated the order back to me. I said "correct". Hands us the food and I drove off. Before I left the parking lot I checked the bag and it was a completely different order. I parked, went inside and told them they messed my order up, come to find out they didn't even make my order so I had to continue to wait. And when I finally got the right order, it didn't have tomatoes that I added to my burritos and the tortilla chips for the nachos tasted like boiled ass. Horrible experience. Two thumbs all the way down.

I stopped by today to get some food with a coworker, since we were in a hurry we decided to stop by this location. Let me start by saying the customer service is really bad. I work a customer service job too and I understand sometimes we are having a bad day, but as soon as I pulled up the guy sounded like he just did not want to talk to me. He yelled when I asked him to repeat what he had said since the intercom was cutting in and out (it was broken of course). I was nice to him and told him that I did not need a drink when he asked he then proceeded to yell at me and tell me "then you just want regular tacos why ask for this order if you don't want a drink!!" I really wanted to drive off the location at that moment but I had already wasted time and if I didn't get this I wouldn't have lunch for the day so I put up with his attitude and him cutting me off most of the time. As soon as we pulled up to the window he just gave me a mean look and took my card, I asked if I could have guac on the side and boy did it look like I had just asked him something extremely difficult. We waited there for a while and finally got our food, I asked my friend to check the bag because I had a pretty good feeling our food wasn't going to be right. And of course, I didn't get the correct order and neither did my friend. I got regular tacos instead of supreme and she had a chicken quesadilla instead of steak. With no guac. I would 100% recommend another location besides this one, overall the whole staff just looks like the hate working there.
I wanted some Taco Bell after work and they said sorry we're out of beef like how do you run out of beef....why you still open if you don't got beef...get your shit straight
In the past there were good, crunchy tacos but tonight it was stale and the woman at the drive through was rude.
Every time I come here they don't serve me food but they serve my white friends TACO BELL IS RACIST!!!

My food was good but the air conditioning was on only 40 outside.
I was frozen by the time I completed my meal

i asked for a butternut reduction when ordering a chalupa.   

they obviously got the order right.

mmmmm

I came here last evening in search of something cheap to eat. But you know what they say, you get what you pay for. I mean it's your everyday Taco Bell. Nothing more, nothing less. My loaded potato griller was yummy though.

This Taco bell is usually a decent one, never had a problem. but last night was bad. the staff were incredibly rude and the food took almost 10 minutes to make, then when we got it and were eating it, was stale and badly made. Not pleased at all. BEWARE the blonde girl in the drive threw.

I love me some Taco Bell.  Whenever my son gets to pick dinner most times he picks Taco Bell.

Even though my wife and son incorrectly order their bean burritos with no onions and without red sauce and I get them they were God designed them to be eaten, Taco Bell always gets both orders correct.

Throw in some cheesy roll ups (which let's be honest is just a tortilla with some melted cheese with a fancy name to trick kids in to getting it) some soft tacos and you can feed a fmily of 3 for around $10.  Victory!

This Taco Bell always seems to crush its health department scores as well. #winning

The food served at this Taco Bell is the worse that I've had. Waited over 30 minutes in the drive thru line and came home to super cold food and broken up chalupas. I ordered a double chalupa box and the chalupa and tacos were broken up. I also ordered 2 meximelts that were $1.99 each of which they gave me soft tacos instead. Also ordered the power steak burrito and shredded chicken burrito which were both terribly cold. Will not be going to this location anymore.
It's a Taco Bell so it's my guilty pleasure, but the woman who took our order and gave us our food was so nice and happy that it made us laugh as we drove off. It was on Monday around 1:30/2ish.

Hate it admit I like Taco Bell. Something about the Americanized Mexican flavor. it is like White Castles, a few times a year i just gotta have it. Now if they would only put some cheese on the food! Real cheese, not the stuff from a can. The pictures and the actual food you get and in no way the same! False advertising at a minimum! 
Service is good. Friendly. They say "Thanks!" 

So many fast food places never say thanks anymore...

On 3.22.16 13:02 I visited the Taco Bell in Kyle Texas. I was greeted on the loudspeaker at the drive thru menu with a pleasant voice asking me how I was doing today. Not only did I almost passed out because someone was being nice to me through a drive-through window service, but he  even gave me time to browse the menu before rushing me to order. He definitely was a perfect gentleman and was giving excellent customer service.  When I reached the window  was greeted again by Jeremiah J., and things just kept getting better.  I am very please with the customer service I received. My order was correct. My food was correctly prepared  and hot. I even had napkins and a straw in my bag. Jeremiah thank you for the good customer service you provided me.

Perfectly nice Taco Bell. The Quesalupa was flavorless and stupid.

My meal was provided to me before I walked the 20 feet to the soda machine, but it was around lunchtime so I guess they have them ready to go.

They were "out of large-cup lids" so I could have an extra large soda for no charge. Or a medium. I chose extra large ...

The dining area is immaculate and with some high tables that might be fun for groups. But there's lots of signs outside about loitering.

Has really gone downhill over the past several months. Used to be my go-to for a quick and easy delicious meal. Now it's been consistently getting worse. The cinnamon twists are always bad.... some weird chemical taste. Probably bad oil or shortening. The fountain drinks are always watered down..... doesn't matter what you get. Customer service seems to be good, but the quality of food is just piss poor. I keep coming back thinking it will change but hasn't yet.

They never get my order right unless it's under 3 items and their freezee machine is broken most of the time.  Drive thru wait time is ridiculous no matter how many cars are in front of me, and the parking lot is in very bad shape.

If I could, it would be 0 stars. I ordered 4 crunchy gorditas and 2 nacho fries. I mean it is the national promotion right? Get home and I have 4 gorditas,not crunchy, and 2 Ice cold nacho fries. I live 10 minutes away. So I call the manager, I'm told"if you want us to make it right you need to come back"! I'm sorry, I went there to begin with and you couldn't make it right the first time . Waste my gas? Hell no. Then just say my name next time you come in. Next time? Not happening. How about you ask for my email or my address and send me a voucher or refund? How about you try"customer service"instead of making me unfuck your mistake. How about that.?

I have yet to be here once where I didn't have to pull forward and wait at least 5 mins for my food.  I went for breakfast and there's no breakfast menu up.  The food was thrown together and nothing like it was from the previous Taco Bell I tried the breakfast at that got it right.    

I guess I know why I never see anyone else here in the mornings now

The night manager, Amy, is dynamite!
Great food, great employees, great service!
Can be a bit slow at night, but always a great place for your midnight munchies!

I know that it's mostly silly to write a review for a fast food place, particularly one that I've never been physically into (as is the case here), but I've a) been at this store's drive-through many times, b) have enjoyed the food I've ordered from here, c) have not done many reviews lately and d) feel like writing, so e) based on a-d, here's a review.

The food I've received here has always been hot, accurate and delicious, and I've never had a problem with the service (it's always been very friendly), so I feel comfortable giving this store in particular 4 stars. I've had issues at other locations, but never at this one. I also enjoy coming here as much as is acceptable since the store has Mountain Dew's Baja Blast, which may be the best soft drink of all-time. I think all Taco Bell stores have it, but this one is the closest one to me and its availability here are the main reasons that I've been here as much as I have.

This store likely won't stand out too much, especially to seasoned Taco Bell veterans who have been to far more locations than have I, but this one does a good job and has what I want. No problems here, and I'm not expecting any in the future.

Taco Bell is Taco Bell is Taco Bell...right, well in this case maybe not. Where is the rest of the menu you guys I mean they do not even have tostada's and why do they not have fire sauce anymore??? Now in fairness I should not be expecting Mexican food that is only 4.00 to be great but at least have a full menu I mean come on guys get with the times here. With it being the only Taco Bell around though it is ok and will satisfy your cravings for the Bell.
Food was as expected for fast food. The manager "Tori" seems like she wants to shoot herself. Never seen someone so miserable but I mean can you blame her? She works in fast food.

It's Taco Bell. It really doesn't need a review. 

This location does a solid job of not messing up your order. The drive thru is quick. The window people are pretty nice and helpful.

I'm a TB fan. This is on my approved location list. I really have one. Don't hate.
This Taco Bell has chili cheese burritos. ARE YOU HEARING ME ORLANDO?! Closest place is lake city, fl - 2.5 hours away. You're welcome, America.

Pretty disappointed.  I stopped by for a snack 4 hours before close and all the lights were off.  When I called to ask how late they were open I was told "we are short staffed and running low on food, so we closed early".  Taco Bell is known for being open late.  It's just bad business and the franchise owner should be embarrassed.

Taco Bell 032943 has a courteous and efficient staff which provide excellent customer service.  The menu is as described and food is always delicious.  Our family's orders are always accurate.  The restaurant and drive thru lines move quickly.  Taco Bell 032943 never locks its doors during opening hours unlike another Taco Bell location.
Good service but priced really high for taco. I bought the Chalupa combo for 8.29 usually six and some change at other locations. Franchisee should be ashamed. Won't be back.
Would be nice if y'all were ever open. I agree withthe  lower star reviews because we are having to drive an extra 22 miles round trip for late night snacks. Step it up.

Worst taco bell I've ever been to. Wish I could give negative stars. They consistently get my order incorrect and sometimes experience waits of over 30 minutes for my food after its ordered. I don't have any idea what they are doing back there ,but let's get serious. Making tacos on a line isn't that hard.
I wanted some Taco Bell after work and they said sorry we're out of beef like how do you run out of beef....why you still open if you don't got beef...get your shit straight

With an extensive menu and complex flavor, Taco Bell of Cambirdgeside goes beyond your typical free sample encrusted mall fare. Service here is above average and everyone seems very friendly! 

ONLY DOWNSIDE=NO BREAKFAST- really that's it
If a customer comes up to the counter don't ignore them. At least say we will be right with you. After five minutes standing I walked out and went to Chick Fil A next door.

Conveniently located.  Ample parking.  Courteous & efficient staff.  Lines move quickly.  Accurate orders arrive timely.  Food always delicious.  Drinks refreshing.  Portions satisfying.  Prices affordable for families & groups.  My family & I highly recommend this Taco Bell.  We'll definitely return to dine in or take out.  Thank you, Taco Bell!

It's Taco Bell. It's fast food. It's great if you find a store that cares about that bag of pseudo-Mexican delights vended.

This is one of those places.

Crunchy tacos w/ too much hot sauce = yum.

I went back for a second round a couple of weeks later. They must have magical ingredient matching fairies at HQ. How bout that Quesarito? Just when you thought it impossible to mix and match 7 ingredients a different way.

As far as Taco Bell's go, this is one of the better ones I've found. The food and customer service got remarkably better around a year ago and I now find it above average for a fast food locale. I come here frequently and primarily use the drive through.
do not go here!!!!! horrible even for the worst taco bell!!!!!!!! yelp removed my initial review so here is the tame version....... stay away for health, time and sanity!!!!! enjoy!
I had very very very VERY bad diharea, I would recommend this place to a constipated person

WARNING: If you easily puke do not read this! Every time I go to this location they always forget something AND I will always say a S#!+ ton of mild sauce but always come out with 1 or 2. If they don't forget something they make it wrong. Also I had a friend who worked here and she said that some of the employees SPIT IN THE FOOD if someone returns an item that was made wrong (Which happens often.) When I have tried returning the food for a refund one time, the Hispanic woman at drive through started yelling at me because she knew the order was right... even though it wasn't. Do not ever go to this location. There is only one person here who is actually a great employee. I've only seen him work really late but he is an amazing guy, his arms are hairy and have a few bald spots on them but all of Taco Bell needs to learn from that guy.
Every time I go here it takes forever! If you go through the drive thru plan on sitting there for at least 20 minutes

Dont come here on friday or saturday nights. They got the D-class line up of young workers probably bitter AF that theyre not at some shitty apartment turning up. They got hostile when I went back and got a refund for a meal that had missing or hardly any ingredients. You may have a hard time understanding immigrants over the intercom but Ill take their food over this shit anyday.

This Taco Bell has awful, rude employees and can't get any thing right. How hard is it to understand big box!!! And especially after you point to the picture on the board! This is the second time I have been there and they just can't get it right. The person in charge was anything but compassionate about making it right. I can truly see why Taco Bell should just close its doors.

I hate to admit how much my husband and I like taco bell And how much we like this location. We've never had a problem with "beggers" and we enjoy how friendly the staff are. It's hard to come by great customer service in fast food. The manager Luis is super nice!

Literally loved this experience, whoever was working drive through at 11:02pm on Wednesday June 13th DESERVES a raise and great hours- he literally asked us twice about sauce, got personal about our night and my dogs and his working experience here- I'd recruit him to my store as an employee if I could, I used to always come to this Taco Bell as a kid though and I've never had a bad experience, I can't wait til the renovations are done- I want to see this place sparkle, shine and become the most successful one! I don't even mind going 20 minutes out of my way for it anymore, definitely have a loyal customer here

Taco bell is my bad day food. Being as I'm having a bad day and come here, I might be bias. But a taco bell is a taco bell, the food is pretty much the same and you get what you pay for. I order the same stuff every time, sometimes my food looks particularly smooshed or small, or even gross. 

We've mostly done drive thru and it's a pain in the ass sometimes because their ordering system is right at the bend in the road and you car CAN touch the sensor before your window gets close enough to order. We've had it where our car triggered the system and the gal on the other side was confused and wondering why we weren't saying anything. Because we were actually behind that lightpole you put right in front of the ordering system...

Usually gets our orders right but we've had to go in or drive through again a few times. That's another pain because it's a really busy taco bell at night at waiting 30+ minutes for the nacho chips they didn't put in the bag the first time is really frustrating.

It's a Taco Bell in a mall, so expectations should be managed. I tried the Dorito taco thing, which tasted like a taco that someone had put some Doritos in. Not too bad. There was some kind of deep fried cereal confection, which I had to taste, because you can't pass on something that horrifying. It was, as expected, overly saccharine and pretty gross, but I'm guessing the pre-teen and younger set loves it.

As it's in a mall, there's a food court, and there were plenty of free tables, most of which were clean enough. I doubt I'll come back, given that this was my first visit to a Taco Bell in at least fifteen years, but if TB is your jam, this one is fine.
Without question the finest Mexican fare in the area.

My dearest Taco Bell Corporate,

I have neglected you lately but not dispassionately. I have only been thinking inside the bun lately; too much Americana on the mind at a time when isolationism seems more pleasant than the alternative. And fourthmeal? As forgotten as the naivete of our youth. What I can say is that it is always an experience when our post-divorce paths cross in the distant badlands, the nexus of drinking about you and not being able to find any other eateries open as late that enthuse me even a little bit, like a gas station burrito, I would always return to you over that option.

At the juncture of our latest fond encounter I was taken aback. This was the first time, across the wide and disparate lands, that the guy taking the order through the squawk box asked me if I wanted to donate to charity. At no other Taco Bell has this happened. I did not know if this is a new Taco Bell thing; or just that one. I find it mildly humorous that like many people, I was in the drive thru late in the evening because it was cheap, as in I did not have a lot of money but I could still eat like the King of the Peasants awash in my wealth of cheaply priced tacos. That demographic of your drive thrus, especially in the late evening, I would not think is going to be among the big contributors to that enterprise. Shaking down an investment banker or oil & gas person, that is a different story. They are assholes, excepting Warren Hellman, but they have the money to fix all the root causes of feigned evil and evil-in-fact. But your typical Taco Bell customer? No. We're not seeking authentic Mexican cuisine; we are broke and need cheap tacos. So I will be interested to see if this was an isolated incident; or if this is a new chain thing you are rolling out across the board, like fourthmeal or think outside the bun. 

P.S. Bring back the chihuahua so I can pet him.

I am only reviewing this place because I was impressed with their service for once.  I have always considered Taco Bell my favorite fast food place but with horrible service.  I stopped in here the other day and was impressed with the service.  The lady hooked me up with a side of Guacamole when i was trying to decide if it was good enough to get.  She let me take some home and try it.  I am glad it was free because I probably would not order it here but they have improved it from a few years back. 

Also when my burrito was accidentally dropped on the ground, they did not try to hide it.  They tossed it away without even looking to see if I saw them drop it.  They made me a new one and were quick about it.  Good service with normal Taco Bell makes this one of my favorite Taco Bells.  It is a guilty pleasure for me especially in need of cheap (under $4), quick meals.

Dude like really.  What is wrong with this place. No one should wait more than maybe 5 mins for drive thru. You have a full staff and food is taking forever. Was waiting in the drive thru line at least 15mins. They need to get a clue! I wish I couldn't even give 1 star.

I LOVE Taco Bell..however, I have never been so rudely treated in my life at a fast food place. These places are a convenience for the consumer, thats why its called fast food. The Manager (a crotchety old man) was working the drive through. Upon ordering, I ordered a #1. He asked if there was anything else and I replied with a yes and tried to carry on with my order. After everything I ordered, he said,"do you want anything else?", not can I get you anything else. I did have one more item that I wanted to order and I did. I ordered a Burrito Supreme. Well, the number one has a Burrito Supreme and he rudely said, "another one?", like I was some sort of pig or something. His demeanor was awful. This is the manager we are talking about here. This man need not be in customer service, he should be in an office or on the assembly line (firing). When I asked for a few more hot sauce packets, he practically threw them at me. But wait..it gets better. After all that, we pulled out of the drive thru, not checking the bag and ended up missing an item...seriously??? So. I pulled back thru the drive thru, was met at the first window this time by a wonderfully nice man that not only had what was missing from our order ready, but at his own doing, threw in 2 empanadas for us. Very kind. We graciously asked him for a few more packets of hot sauce, my fiance drinks the stuff, and he so willingly asked what we wanted and accommodated.
I will NEVER go back to that Taco Bell, not that there aren't 50 of them in Austin, but that particular one needs a new manager. I don't know how they keep employees if he treats customers like that..how does he treat his employees?!?!

My message to him...just because you are having a bad day, doesn't mean that your customers have to suffer the repurcussions of your unhappiness. You chose your job and you get to wake up every day and decide if its going to be a good day or a bad day. Note to self, pal..if its going to be a bad day..STAY HOME. We don't deserve to be treated that way.

absolutely the worst location i have been to, and on a consistent basis. I have given it many chances, but never again. drive through employees either neglect the drive through, or are nonexistent. i usually visit the the drive thru late night, and employees are always drunk/ smoking in the kitchen and it is obvious! i could smell it and even see the smoke cloud coming out of the drive thru window! On top of this i receive wrong orders, or get charged for food i do not receive. On multiple occasions i have just had to drive off because i was never greeted after at least 15 minutes, and cars in front of and behind me have done the same. on other occasions there was no one even visible in the restaurant, even after a very long period of time. advice to owners: find some new employees! last time this happened was saturday night 8/16/15. I will never visit again

Just literally tried to go to this tacobell. Says it's open to 3:30am. Heard a guy get on the mic and then didn't do anything sat for a bit and waited but no one responded so I left. This used to be my usual spot to get Taco Bell but no longer after tonight. I will bet that the Taco Bell on 122nd and glisan will do you better or even the one right off i205 and stark. Any where else but this place.

Such nice staff and fairly quick both the drive through and inside. Food tasted like Taco Bell should, and it was fairly clean inside. After talking with one of the staff they even whipped up a Crunchwrap Surpreme with a Doritos Locos shell instead of the normal taco one, its was awesome!

The lady that took my order was very nice. She even warned me that my rolled chicken tacos just came out of the fryer and were very hot. 
Tacos were okay. What do you expect from Taco Bell

When I came to this location the person taking our order (DTO) was super friendly and nice. He set us up from the beginning in having a good experience. When we got to the window, the DTR, person taking payments, was also very friendly. I'm not sure if it was the same person but there were two different people by the window. Either way, they were super friendly, they were happy and gave off good energy. Our food order was done correctly! It came out in a reasonable time frame and they took care of our needs without showing any negative emotion. For that, I was surprised and I wouldn't mind coming back here when I'm hungry for some tacos!

I have finally found the perfect Saturday brunch spot in Cambridge! It's Taco Bell, in the Cambridgeside Galleria!

Tucked into the cutest corner of the mall food court, this Taco Bell really reigns supreme.

Let's start with the service. My cashier was helpful and attentive, fast and efficient, a true master of the art of cashiering. Food prep was just as on point. My food arrived quickly, made perfectly, and it was truly delicious. And the woman who called out my number and handed off my food was just as great as the rest of the staff.

Next, ambiance. The food court itself has a bit too much neon for my own taste, but I'm sure others will enjoy the charm. I chose to eat in the outdoor seating, perfect for a beautiful summer day as it was today. The seats had a great picnic table feel, and the fountain was gorgeous. All in all, well worth the trip.

So your friend needs a hot recommendation for the coolest brunch spot in Cambridge? It's Taco Bell!

Worst drive through experience aver. Waited 33 minutes in the drive through to get to the window with only a few cars in front of me 12/2/16 1:00 pm. Get to the window girl gives me the wrong total and have to go back and give her more money. Waited another 4 minutes to get food while girl was standing there doing nothing dancing around and talking to another girl. Hard tacos were all cracked in half and other food was cold. Poor management at this location for sure.

This Taco Bell is awful. One of their employees put a disgusting rock-like substance in both my husband and I food. I returned the food and showed it to the manager. The rude manager said, "there is no such object here". I'm now filing a complaint with the corporate office.

I seem to only eat taco bell after getting off of work at 11pm, i go through drive thru of couse and impressively......whoever runs the drive thru here is FRIENDLY! I'm all grouchy after getting off of work and its so nice to hear a friendly person! Food is as usual, you get what you pay for and can never go wrong with the cheap nachos.

This location has some residence street beggars. Every time we come here they are inside hitting people for money.  I don't know if this is another way they are making money or the district managers  is not aware of the problem. We really have to be tire of other restaurants to come here. Just got.my food and got the wrong food. Manager sits there and check price to charge me more . I just said to the manager just get me the right food i order please.  he said is going to be more let me check. I had a recipt in my hand and he did nto even notice. I don't care if is more just like to get my food. He got an attitude for 10 cents. Hahahaha. and i order the only thing i like here a wrap. i can say i will try to stay away from this location and recomend everybody not to come here at all is not worth it. plus the tables are always dirty.

Taco Bell 032943 always provides our family with excellent customer service, accurate orders, perfectly cooked food and satisfying portions of food.  Our carry out orders are complete no missing food.  Most importantly, Taco Bell 032943 never closes its doors during opening business hours.  Another Taco Bell location sometimes provided service only to drive through customers while closing its doors during opening business hours.

I gave this man at the drive through probably the most complicated order of the day he took his time to try and understand what i was trying to do he was patient n got the shit done right , i myself would of be an asshole if i was in his shoes lol fuck all that shit but he was cool but the food was nasty as shit but good customer service on his part hands down.

++Chalupa chicken. Delicious. Basically a fried pita-like bread with its bread softness still maintained with the innards of a taco. 

++Dorito tacos with squeezed hot sauce wedged in between? The bomb! Very crispy shell; it will crumble but the meat inside combined with the veggie fillings compliment together well. 

My first visit at a Taco Bell chain ever, and I was very surprisingly not dissapointed. Mexican food and I have had a rocky relationship-sourcream, beans, and excessive cheese I hate so I am always ambivalent heading to any Mexican place for dinner. 

The boyfriend has been trying to convince me about the goodness of Mexican food and dissprove my taste aversion. I would say this was a success since everything was in moderation. "Wow, taco bell is really good." *He smiles with a wide grin*

Just your typical Taco Bell in case you were in the Cambridgeside Galleria food court and were craving Mexican food. Their staff is everything but Mexican but they will satisfy your craving, especially if its for crunchy tacos as they are one of the very few places to carry such a product...

It was recently revamped and it looks much nicer and cleaner.

As usual it's very affordable and quick.
Always open and almost always great drive thru service. Very polity and accurate with the orders.
This is the slowest moving taco bell I have ever seen. If it's to busy for you to handle at the same time everyday, you should probably schedule more people at that time.

DO NOT COME HERE AT NIGHT!

Avoid this Taco Bell at all costs. Unfortunately, it's one of the only fast food places open late on my street or in my area. I've never experienced such horrible service in my life. We were in drive-thru for at least 35 minutes. Ordering didn't seem too bad, but waiting to pay and receive food took an eternity. The entire time, they were getting orders wrong. I saw so many people who were in line, come back to complain about a wrong order. Maybe a reason why there were so many signs about interviews and "Apply Now". They need all the help they can get.

The Service: When we finally got to the window to pay, the cashier was nice to us, but would consistently joke around and fuss with the food prep staff in the back. The staff had a full profane argument with the window open about how they were "f*cking up orders". It got to a point when I thought they may throw hands. We then had to wait an additional 15 minutes at the window just to get our food. The entire time, we heard the crew arguing. 

The Food: I didn't even order anything worth the wait. My fiancée was the one who was primarily hungry. I simply ordered something just for laughs & giggles. I ordered 2 Beefy Mini Quesadillas ($1.19 each). These things were BUSSIN! So good. I ate both in a matter of minutes. If you're at any other Taco Bell, I recommend if you want something cheap. But don't order here. At least not at night.

Overall, I think you get the point. DO NOT COME HERE. Especially not at night. Since they have so many advertisements about Job Fairs and "Accepting Applications", I'm sure things will turn around eventually. As for now, I'm avoiding.

I went inside instead of waiting in line in the drive through. There are 3 people here besides me. After waiting 20 minutes for my order and watching the employees ignore a lady's request for sauce three times while screwing around with their fellow employees. I am an avid taco bell goer and opening my bag and having my tacos covering the rest of my food was more than disappointing. 

Get it together.

Stick with a crunchy or soft taco when ordering here. Thats about the only thing that can get right. Trying to order something with more ingredients seems to be difficult for them. Got my order completely wrong and they get mad at you as if you ordered wrong. Smh. It will be a while before i come back.

This is my guilty pleasure.  I love this place.  A review is probably redundant for most of us but one way this place does stand out is its service which, for a quick service joint, is surprisingly courteous.
Sooooooo Sloooooowwwwwww! Unfortunately, this is the closest one to my house.

I love Taco Bell and this is the closest location to my house so I will keep going here but it is rare they get our orders right. More often than right it is wrong or missing something. People are extremely friendly though. Just check your bag before you leave.

Ok, so we were in a hurry and figured, fuck it, we would go to Taco Bell.  Taco Bell is a place where even though we write bad reviews, we still end up going there.  In any event, we ordered some food thru the drive thru and it was seriously taking 5-8 min per order which is odd for a fast food joint.  We get up to the window and ask the lady how long it is going to be for the order.  They hadn't even made it, and when she told me another 5-7 min, I asked for the credit card back and drove off.  It seems that she was messing around with one of the cooks and someone was distracting someone, as their process was severely slowed down by this.  The food is good, but the service at this particular Taco Bell is below Sub par.  Seriously I am done with this place.  
     My wife called up Taco Bell and the manager there remembered the order and offered at any time to get it for free.  Talk about add insult to injury.  Do they not even consider that the amount the food cost was not their fall from grace?  Seriously, its like they think that offering something for free will make things better.  How about take some fucking responsibility for your service and provide me with what you are gonna do to make sure it get's better.  Give me a fucking game plan or something.  Not some god damned coupon for free food.  What the fuck do we look like?  In either event, as you can tell by what I wrote, we declined that offer.

Only ever come here after midnight and there's always a line because there are no options other than Taco Bell and McDonalds but the staff is always much more pleasant than the average fast food experience and the food is standard for Taco Bell.

I usually dont write reviews but I'm going to today.  you give me a diet soda I ask for another one and you still give me a diet soda after I told you I wanted regular. Then I call to say somrthing and you start speaking in damn Spanish and leave the phone off the hook? You should get in trouble for that. YOUR JOB ISN'T THAT FUCKING HARD IS IT? BECAUSE I USED TO WORK FAST FOOD AND I NEVER TREATED SOMEONE LIKE THAT. I'll let everyone i know know about this experience. What kind of peopke do you guys hire? Obviously idiots. Your getting no stars from me.

I really enjoy Taco Bell's Fresco Tacos since I have a dairy allergy. However, things are getting a bit messy. I spend more time picking out bits of white and orange cheese than I actually spend eating my tacos. It's starting to feel like it isn't worth the effort. A vegetarian's food would never be treated so disrespectfully. Have a heart for those of us with dairy allergies! Place the fresco tomato/onion/cilantro mix away from the cheese...good grief...:(

Best Taco Bell I've ever been to. Everyone is always super friendly. Food is always hot and fresh when you get it. This has been my 3rd visit and my experience hasn't changed. Almost Disney level of customer service.

This place looks great. But  yeah it is substandard. I was harassed by the very same cashier who had rung up my order. I was using the restroom after dining and right before  leaving. She got angry that I wanted to make sure to take care of my businesses.  I don't think I am coming back here any time soon. Having a restroom for your own paying customers is a mandatory health and safety requirement. This is not something which this respective fast food worker gets to decide. Does not work like that. Not at all.

Did I just admit to liking Taco Bell? Did I visit a clean location with friendly employees who filled my order correctly?   Nah, I must be sleep-posting on Yelp.

And sleep would explain how that cheesy potato burrito thing could become my fast food vice.

A Review of Taco Bell Chains. By Dimitri D.

Taco Bell is cheap and disgusting. First of all, every single Taco Bell I ever been to (which has been very few) has given me cold food that looks and tastes like dog shit wrapped up in paper. Small note: The bathrooms are DISGUSTING!!! They smell, there's grime and filth growing in the spaces in between the bricks, the paper towel dispensers are usually broken, and there's always someone's shit left in the toilet. I will never as long as I live go to another Taco Bell in my life!!!!!

I drove all the way to this place at 1AM because it said it was open until 1:30AM only to arrive at 1:10AM and receive no service. Nobody even came to the window to talk to me, they just looked at me, talked amongst themselves and ignored me. This is not cool. Don't say you close at 1:30AM and then refuse to acknowledge people before this time. Extremely uncool.

I've been here multiple times and each time the service is very lacking in all aspects. It honestly seems like everyone, including the manager is brand new on the job. Customer service does not exist and I don't think anyone in the building knows how to smile. Worst Taco Bell I've ever been to.
Rude employees, mediocre food!!!!! I hate thick, unmelted cheese over "COLD" meat!!!!!This particular restaurant doesn't deserve a long detailed review!!!!!! That's all I have to say!!!!

Absolutely, positively, the worst service I have ever seen and I have come here several times to see if there is any change. From lousy customer service, to drive thru people trying to "make a deal" for leftover chicken at closing, no please or thank you or have a nice day, NOTHING ever done about it. Once pulled up and watched car in front of me get serviced at 10:55pm and they closed on me at 10:58! I asked why and the answer was, "well it's 11:00 in here!" Don't waste your time
The manager was very nice and he replaced my entire order when the box split open and tacos went flying everywhere.

Good breafast but I couldn't believe it when I asked for some sauce packets and they told me they were out. Not a single one!  Then I wanted some napkins-out of napkins!
It is a tasty, cheap breakfast though.

Came during "happy hour" where they have dollar medium drinks, wanted water and they had to charge me a full dollar for a medium cup, seriously? I mean I get a like 20 cent charge for the cup but full price for a water? That's ridiculous.

Noticed that Taco Bell was serving breakfast now, so decided to head over and try it out. I tried the A.M. Crunchwrap - Sausage and the Breakfast Burrito - Sausage.

I first tried the Breakfast Burrito - Sausage, I didn't get any sauces because I wanted to see how it was alone. After the first bite it was only eggs, a couple of bites in then I finally got to the sausage. Overall, it was plain, nothing to special to talk about. 

I tried the A.M. Crunchwrap - Sausage. First bite was amazing, honestly, they put this sauce in the crunchwrap that just brings everything together. The hash brown was crispy, the sausage had a little spice to it and the sauce, I just can't talk enough about the sauce.  This will not the last time I have this.

Not bad for one of those Taco bell, not good enough for me to come back. I hate it when you leave and drive away just to open the bag with food to find they made a mistake with the order. Not the first time, hopefully the last time.

So bad I walked out without completing an order.

First, I was told to wait to place my order (nobody else there, just me and the one person behind me in line). 

Then they tried to charge me $10.80 for a chalupa combo with chicken. I routinely get this combo elsewhere for $8. 

If I wanted to spend $11 on mexican, I'd go get Carne asada or Pollo Ranchero from my favorite local joint, get good, hospitable service, and enough food to take for lunch the next day. Oh, and I'd get free chips and salsa.

Fuck you very much, Taco Hell.

If I could give a 0 I will just came to this taco bell  and the guys that   got our order gave us attitude  because I ask him  that my fries where cold and he got mad  and   shove the bag   on my hand  if you are not happy with your work you should not  interact  with costumers  if it so much problem   ... If im getting food even if it cost a dollar  you should  get the best  service  and they dont do that in this  taco bell

Food and service were very good. My reason for 2 stars and not higher is the TV.  I'm not a fan of news being shown when you are out trying to relax and CNN is the absolute worse.  I'd prefer almost anything else. People get enough news, how about something more enjoyable.
Drive thru is too slow. It took me about 17 minutes to get 1 burrito.  Incompetent staff.
Never put enough nacho cheese in their burritos. Especially the breakfast burritos. Tried at different spot they're much better.

Not the worst of fast foods. Of course I wouldn't eat this all the time but the food was pretty good. Full of flavor and very soft burritos. But the place wasn't the cleanest. I do recommend using the drive through even if it takes a little longer. The quesarito was delicious and something worth trying. Usually the service does take a little bit of time understanding customers though so try to keep your order simple so there's no confusion. Try Taco Bell. It's not bad.

My wife was hungry from Sandy ride and this was OUR NEXT STOP,  THE OTHER DIMENSION.......... 
              I Ordered a $5 Craving deal I ask for no flat bread on the Gordita. And I was charged $.40 cents for less effort and more ingredients saved for them for no flatbread and cheese.

I swear I thought I saw Rod Serling standing by the register and THE 'IT" clowns in the burrito-taco assembly line. 

I didn't take the tray of left overs  to the trash can, they might charge me for doing it.
  
What a long strange trip it's been......KEEP THIS PORTLAND TACO BELL BIZZARE!
Awesome serve, lighting fast. Loved it. Aryal did a terrific job. Food was hot and smoking fast!

Instead of being petty because of a first world problem, I'll actually review the restaurant and the food.  The food has always been correct and hot, and tasted like Taco Bell should taste.   It's a welcome addition to the area, and definitely the best Taco bell around here.   The drive through is usually a little slow, but better than most.
who runs out of potatoes before seven pm? this fucking tacobell. no warning or anything. and then we had to sit in the drive thru because the people in front of us ordered a feast.
Best Taco Bell ever, I love the sexy cashier guy at the front, he was so nice and so nice, I love the way he swept those floors
Horrible service. Always a 15-20 min wait in the drive thru. Cold food. Uncooked rice. Obviously needs a management overhaul.
Slowest most understaffed mgr has got to get a clue. 1 hr in the drive thru is ludicrous!!!

I arrived @ Taco Bell 3:50am on 2/20/14 . I was placing my order when the women started to yell @ me. All because I had to tell her my order 3 times... she didn't care to get it right the 1st two times or maybe because she was too busy on her cell phone to care, which is what she was doing when I drove up to the window. She proceeded to tell me to just shut up and drive to the window. In Spanish she called me "perra estúpida" which is stupid bitch in Spanish! Unbeknownst to her, her headset came on and those words came out blaring through the order box. I drove up to the window & waited to pay and get her name to report her, but she never came to the window. I watched the older lady that had been cooking my food grab the sauces and napkins & put them in a bag but the nasty women went over and said something to her, then went back talking on her cell phone scowling @ me. After about 5mins I knocked on the window and they just ignored me. The next thing, they turned off the open sign lights!. By this time it is 4am, closing time. And I never received my order, I watched it just sitting there doomed for the trash I suppose. I left so angry @ the gall of this women. I looked around to make sure that there were cameras so when I contact the franchise owner there will be proof of this behavior I'm describing inside and how long I sat there. I'm a 20yr resident and business owner in this town & never have I received this sort of treatment from any company/business or persons working there. It should be known that this sort of behavior is common place @ this location with this women, as this is the 5th time I've had an issue with rudeness from her which in the past I've just ignored. This behavior was so over the top & blatantly disrespectful I had to write this review.

Taco Bell generally gets a bum rap, but I don't understand what people's expectations are when they judge TB so harshly.  I was a little annoyed that they didn't have a combo meal available for the new item they are promoting, the fajita melts, stay away from those btw.

The new 79 cent Cheesy Roll-Ups RULE!

The thing that sets this location apart is that they have greeters during lunch, this would be annoying, but they seem to be so genuinely nice that it is okay if they ask you how you are doing and how the food is 2 or 3 times.
The Manager Al.. Replaced & corrected a mistake w no question. His service along w Aramari the cashier was A1!

Obviously it's fast food-but sometimes they are more than a little slow.  Orders are often wrong, so check before you leave. Service is faster through the drive thru than with walk-in business.  They occasionally make up rules involving coupons or discounts so be wary and always announce your coupon when ordering.

Pretty standard as far as Taco Bell goes. I always wondered why the lines here at the drive thru are as long as they are. Unless I screwed up, the inside is just a Pizza Hut and the drive thru is a Taco Bell.

Everything else was standard and worked well, but I think it's an odd set up.

The wait at the drive thru was 15 mins. When I made it to the speaker it was 7 minutes before I was acknowledged., with simply thank you for the wait. I get to the window and they want to charge me for the wrong food. But hey at least I was told thank you.
It's a Taco Bell.   They make the food as well as the next instance of the chain.  This one just happens to be near work so I tried it.

I went through the drive through, I was the 5th car, it took 30 minutes, two VERY unprofessional window girls! The worst service ever, the food sloppy and pretty much all beans and no meat or cheese in sight, ordered a freeze drink, I get to the window they hand Mr a sods cause freeze isn't working, I asked for a refund, that was another Fiasco

I have never posted a bad review as I like to give mercy to most restaurants, but last night was terrible to say the least. First off I ordered a Doritos Locos Taco Supreme with other food items only to find out they never even gave me the Doritos Locos Taco. The rest of the food was horrendous taste wise. I've been to Taco Bell numerous amount of times and I know when their food is good and bad. This was bad enough for me to take out of my time to write this review (which I never do). I'm kinda glad they didn't put the missing Taco in the bag as it would of probably tasted like everything else I bought. The food tastes like it had been sitting out for three days and was cold enough to make the equator freeze. I honestly felt like I got robbed. I would never ever recommend this place!

Once in awhile I enjoy Taco Bell. I come here because it is the only location near me. I usually order the fresco soft chicken taco or the regular fresco taco. They are really good. I have tried the Doritos Taco and it is really good. That is what I usually order for food and it has always been tasty and the order has been correct every time I have come here. The one thing that I really like is the lady at the register who is very friendly and kind. She is one of the nicest customer service people that I have encountered. She is really sweet.
I brought my nephew here. The staff were very friendly and eager to please. Good customer service goes a long way.
This is by far my favorite taco bell. Friendliest staff around. Great customer service skills and the staff is highly efficient. I was in and out of five thru in less than 10 min.

The drive thru is awesome, always double checking my order and being friendly. Decided to dine in since the new interior upgrade... a bunch of bratty teenagers apparently on break, sitting and being rude and obnoxious, right in front at the counter. Didnt seem like anyone besides the one cashier was working and it took 15 minutes to just take my order... if you want to dine in, just get take out in the drive thru and go inside to eat it...

This Taco Bell honestly sucks. They seem to always get our orders wrong and the food is often poorly done. I went through the drive-thru and ordered a gordita. Instead I got a crunchy taco, in a chalupa wrapping paper.  Sometimes, when they do get the orders correct, the food is alright.

Avoid like the plague! Way too long in the drive thru. Almost ten minutes from order to pick up with one car in front of me. Ordered a grilled and nachos bel grande. Burrito was unevenly made so half of it was just tortilla. Nachos were made up of all broken chips except like two. Just NO.

They're so skimpy with the meat/filling at this location. I got a Crunchwrap with barely any filling especially the meat. And cheesy potato griller with burnt potatoes and also very low on filling. I didn't pay $$ to eat half empty tortillas.

I guess as a drive through emergency stop it works well but otherwise no. The staff can't seem to get anything right for anyone ordering. The seating was crowded and the bathroom was extremely small. 

They completely screwed up our order and seemed to have done the same with everyone else's. 

Thankfully this is a chain and there are many many other locations.

Not impressed at all- the past few years I can say that Taco Bell has been "getting it together" however his location fell short; the building is dirty and dated. The order taker at the drive thru messed up the order at the window I expressed that my order was wrong and she looked at me like I kidnapped her first born.

The order was "corrected" however it was thrown into a bag with grease everywhere- and was not edible.

I will not return to this location.

The drive thru cashier started flirting with my boyfriend and looked at me and said "honey why are you mad? You know when females are mad they don't fuck you right. Of course you can find a man who can." Who the hell says that to customers? Never going here again, he should be fired.
Freaking cannot fulfill an order.  Get home late night only to see bag was missing 3 burritos.   And fast food wants higher wages yet can't read or count???

Service was slow and the cashier walked away from the register. The lady from the drive threw with was picking her noise had to take my order. I asked lots of sauce and only got four. The tacos tasted pretty good tho!! So two stars from me!!
