For late night eats in Gresham where I live this is one of only a few options in my current price range.  The people who work the late night drive thru window are always nice to me, speak 100% english, and always greet me with a smile.  I give this place 3 stars because lets face it.  Taco Bell makes you run to the toilet after five minutes, but when you want some late night grub check out the $5 box or the mexican pizza.

I was told it would take 10 minutes for 5 cheese roll ups!!!  REALLY!  Completely unacceptable!  He said there was an order for 6 tacos, so we would need to wait 10-15 minutes for 5 cheese roll ups!!!

The food is typical Taco Bell, but the wait time especially in the Drive Thru is atrocious. I've never waited less than 10 minutes, and at times is an easy 20-30 minutes. Taco Bell at its best is not worth waiting that long for.

For a taco bell I always go to this one, mostly because of it's proximity but also because they rarely ever mess up my order (no sour cream, add this add that etc.) However it is just a taco bell so I can't bring myself to rate it higher than 3 stars.

How many times do you have to give an order? I had to repeat myself four times and when I ask her to repeat my order back to me she asked me a 5th time what did I order. Either, get it right or go find you a new job.

Witnessed the manager violently throw nachos at an employee for "messing up the order" They exploded everywhere including on the employee and the floor. Please check your cameras. Cashier Devan was awesome. He had outstanding customer service throughout  this whole incident and was well composed.
This is hands down the nicest Taco Bell I've ever been to! Great service and very clean. Also, the food was prepared well and wasn't sloppy and messy when I got it! 10/10 would recommend.

Every time I come, it's a 15+ min wait in drive through. 80% of time sauce or an item is forgotten and tonight they forgot an item again. Decided parking and walking in would be best. Of course lobby is closed so knocked assuming employee in lobby would ask what I wanted. Nope, ignores me and said "closed" several times. They didn't give me a receipt so had to shove a receipt in window from another establishment to get attention. Guy finally communicated with drive though and realized I was missing part of my order and let me in. Manager's compensation was a pie and a "sorry" and left before I could respond. Definitely writing to higher ups about poor management performance.
taco bell rox...all i have to say on bout that. i eat sooo much of it and it tasted good lol i like the bean's

Taco  Bell  is supposed to be Vegan friendly but no one told this location that. They messed up my burrito so many times I had to ask for my money back. Never will I go back here again. Yes I'm a lil salty but why can't they just listen

I rarely review fast food because c'mon. It's Taco Bell, we all know what we're getting. But this restaurant gave me by far the WORST, most inedible burrito that I've ever had the disgrace of putting in my mouth. 

I ordered a cheesy bean and rice burrito. When I grabbed it out of the bag my hand got wet. That was confusing, but as I pulled it all the way out I saw that half of the wrapper was soggy with a orange-ish liquid inside of it. I was pretty grossed out by that point, but unwrapped it to see wth was happening with my burrito. After unwrapping it, it seemed there was something leaking from one end. Not sure what it was, I ripped that half of the burrito off and threw it away. 

Why did I continue? I don't know. I was starving, hadn't eaten for almost 12 hours, and was 2 flights away from home. Desperate. 

So I bit into the other half of the burrito. And I was accosted by the crunchiest, most inedible rice I've ever had to chew. It was disgusting. So the rest of the burrito went into the trash as well. 

Please don't go here. Learn from my mistakes, child you're better than this.
Thier beefy 5 layers are made perfect, but its the beautiful girl that takes my order friday evenings that makes it worth it, she will keep me coming back

On such a warm evening I would have liked Taco Bell to turn their air conditioning up a bit as it was quite warm in the restaurant. At 10pm we were the only diners and from what I could see the drive thru wasn't busy either, so I was surprised that the restaurant wasn't cleaner and the food was so slow arriving. 
Spicy potato soft taco was indeed spicy with plenty of warm potato, the lettuce was fresh with no browning but the shredded cheese was a little in the hard dry side. 
Peculiar taste to the crunch wrap supreme which is usually my favorite thing on the Taco Bell menu. After a few bites I didn't want any more as it was so unpleasant. 
My husband also had a strange flavor in his taco and left that too.

The service was terrible as well as the manager it was dirty in the back they was playing and joking around we waited we waited close to 35 to  40 minutes for order my order number was 30417 6 the cashier was Ashley B ...sad thing about it all when we ask for the manager to ask her what was taking so long her response was we gotta make everything you gotta wait just like everybody else I hope Taco Bell please attention to Yelp

This is a great franchise location. The staff was easy to work with and provided ample condiments with a welcoming smile. The food was hot and fresh, and this seems to be consistent service since we've been back numerous times. I would recommend this location  for a quick drive thru bite.

On multiple occasions I have tired to go through the drive thru and the prices have been wrong.  I was told that "I know what the price says out there but it is wrong". If that's is not the price change it. I understand just missing it once. But I literally went back the next day and it was still wrong. If you have one price and tell me it's another it is unacceptable.

We went with a giant order for multiple people. Tony waited on us. He was FANTASTIC! He had a positive attitude, was cheerful, and thoughtful! He even thought to put names on all the bags! We were not the easiest order but Tony was the bomb! He needs a raise!
I love Taco Bell. Five stars automatically. Only one problem is that at this location the prices are a little bit higher but that's OK my food is always yummy and correct.

This "fast food" joint is far from fast. This is our 3rd time here and every time it took us 30+ minutes to receive our carry out order. I know it's our fault for giving this establishment more than one try, but we gave it another shot and we're disappoint like the times before. 
It's not overly crowded, but seems the problems are in the lack of urgency in the employees.
Will not come back again.
I don't think this is a trustworthy location.  I trust my taste buds enough to know when something is odd.  Second burrito tasted exactly like blood.

Came at 8:30 and was treated amazingly by the employee Barbra. She was very attentive and respectful. She is the single best Taco Bell employee I have ever encountered. Made me feel at home!!! Food was up to par too!!
Orders are always wrong, chips are stale, and the food is made like no one cares. Taco Bell on Parmer Ln is MUCH better.

Taco Bell has to be hands down one of the best fast food chains out right now! I loves me some Taco Bell, they are one of the most creative, economical and most tasting of the fast food chains. 

I love this location cause it's so close to home for me and no matter what time I come here the service is fast, friendly and efficient. Me and my friend have come here at 1 in the morning after our drink fest to come eat some good food and never been let down and no it's not the liquor that makes it better lol! 

Between the steak soft tacos, the Doritos tacos which blew my mind because I love Doritos. The burritos, the steak quesadillas and my goodness the shredded chicken smothered burrito hands down the best thing Taco Bell has ever done until.... this new damn new naked chicken Chalupa. Who would of thought Taco Bell would come out with a taco shell made of delicious chicken breast smh. I can go on and on what's good here and not a lot of people would agree with me but idc who would disagree with me I love this place.

Extremely unhappy with the service. They were not busy, no other cars in line. And they forgot our drink and when I open my chalupa it looks like someone chewed it up and spit it back out onto the wrapper. Seriously?! Won't return
Ill just keept this short and simple. If Burgerville is open across the street, go there instead. Worse fast food experience, with long lines. Save yourself the pain late at night.

My husband loves Taco Bell, so I agreed to eat here. Big MISTAKE!! The food was ordinary food from Taco Bell. He got the cinnamon twists and they tasted like the oil it was cooked in. Everything was cooked in the same oil! Nasty! We will never go back.

Got pickup tonight and food was typical Taco Bell food-no problem there. Problem was that out of the 3 employees that I could see only 1 was wearing a mask over their mouth and nose. The other 2 had the mask hanging around their chin. Obviously required to wear masks but management is not enforcing so it's not happening.
Had to walk out, the register couldn't get it right with the customer ahead of me and after 10 minutes waiting to place my order I walked out.
Place was clean, food was fast and good.  Also the guy working behind the counter was very friendly and seemed like he liked his job!

This review isn't necessarily for this location, but applies to T.B. in general.

20 minutes. That's right, 10 min less than a half hour is how long it took for the one (1) Doritos Locos taco to rocket thru my lower intestine in a fury of liquid hell.  I didn't expect much...but my sense of sheer morbid curiousity led me to take a ride with this abomination.  I was going to grab one at work while on lunch break, but the little voice in my head told me to wait til I was in the comfort of my own home.  Im glad I listened.  This unholy concoction of MSG and unidentified meat managed to turn 79 cents into a gastrointestinal misadventure in less time than it takes to watch an episode of Its Always Sunny in Philly.  Thank God for whoever invented the shower massage because that's what it took to clear my ass of the splatter. Loco indeed.

If youre craving dirty, counterfeit Mexican food....go to Del Taco.  Its nearly as cheap, but actually delicious and you wont crap in your pants.

P.S.  I rated the noise level as 'very loud' since I was screaming for my very life as I sh!t my entire skeleton.

Don't get me wrong. I love Taco Bell. The food here is really good. However, this location has problems. The lines tend to be pretty long, but that's to be expected because it's in a mall. But the employees are really unsatisfactory, being rude and unhelpful. For example, I'm trying to cut back on sugar, so I said I wanted water in the cups because I saw that it was an option on the machine. So the dude tells me they don't have it, and offers two bottles of water. I settled for that, but the guy proceeded to mess around with my order. He took everything from the meals and made them separate, which cost me more money. The water was expensive enough. I still go here because the location is convenient, but it's unpleasant.
Kurzer Besuch am Drive Thru am Abend für einen kurzen Snack. Service war freundlich und flott. Essen war in Ordnung.
Ordered fresco tacos. What I received were tacos with frozen salsa/vegetables on top- FROZEN! There was also a very tiny beat of meat in the tacos. Won't be back.
I love this one Taco Bell it is always clean and the staff are very friendly. Also the food is very fresh. And they serve the meals fast.

Placed a mobile order for pick up at the counter.  When I arrived the chairs were on the table, so I called and was told I had to go through the drive through to pick up my mobile order.  Drive thru has really long line.  It was pointless to mobile order.  Place order around 10:40 PM and arrived around 10:52 PM

I was screwed by a bunch of lazy teenagers running the place at night, with no adult present. After a long night of work, all I wanted were Chalupas, so I ordered a Chalupa combo and was charged $9 for it.  I got home and realized these little punks were too lazy to make Chalupas and just gave me soft tortillas, and the crunchy taco looks pathetic. And they give me a receipt? No. Also, they asked me if anyone was behind me through the drive-thru speaker, which makes me think they, then, closed the store 15 minutes early. I have sent in two complaints on the corporate website over the last two months with no response from corporate or anyone at the store. Clearly they could care less about their customers. I want my money back, because I paid a lot more for Chalupas and got ripped off. This place sucks. I hope they close. I will never go back to Taco Bell again after this experience...but more so, because I have been ignored. You don't deserve customers. You should be ashamed of yourselves.

This taco bell is a joke, the lobby is trashed, all around not cared for. Took 10 minutes for someone to come to the counter to even take my order! People if you dont like your job find another. This place is deplorable, just like every other food place in northern lights

Wasn't impressed, the workers weren't very friendly... drive thru was moderately quick, only waited a few minutes but I threw away my entire lunch (two tacos & a potato griller) because the sour cream tasted disgusting, it basically bit me back.... there also wasn't any bacon in the griller... Womp womp
They are completely closed not sure if it went out of business but the signs are all gone and it is stripped on the inside

Been going to this Taco Bell for at least 30 years.  Not much to say really. A really hit n miss on service and quality. As a former employee, back in the 80's , long time ago the service was awesome, we made good food.  Today the melt max was bland and nachos was usual.  Will go back just because well it's Taco Bell.

I mean, it's Taco Bell, so the food is...well Taco Bell, but the service is great. For awhile my wife and I came here pretty regularly, and the staff got to the point where they asked how everything was going, they knew our orders, and always took great care of us when we came through.

Going to miss the manager that was transferred to another location. She is the only reason I never posted a bad review because she took care of things - she knew my name when the mobile order came and always assured it was right because I was a regular customer. But she is transitioning out and I feel I should let everyone know the level of care and service here now. Our orders almost always get messed up, either because of ordering through the app or just a lack of caring because of the employees. From employees freaking out when they see our order, to missing items, to missing ingredients, to the new managers on duty literally not caring about the customer. We have started going to the Taco Bell on 441 and have been happy so far and don't mind driving a little further in order to get things right and have our dinner!
This Taco Bell is always closed due to some sort of "maintenance" or "malfunction". The hours are also not up to date. Don't waste your time making the trip here and just go to a different Taco Bell.

Wow. Wildly disappointed with my experience at this Taco Bell. I placed my order online and waited patiently for the food to be prepared, they were quite busy. 45 MINUETS LATER and after placing my order again online, I asked the woman working there where my order was. Miraculously, she pulled out more order of now-cold-tacos and Mountain Dew. TF TACO BELL. They never called my name, leading me to believe that either someone took my order or it was never processed, thus I threw away 25 good dollars. My tacos were cold and not impressive. Overall a mind numbing extremely disappointing experience. Taco Bell, you lost a loyal customer today.

If I could give this place less than 1 star I would. I cannot believe the wait time. It's not even busy here. The staff doesn't care how long you have to wait. I had to wait over 8 minutes at the register just to order food and no one was in front of me! I have been waiting for my food for over 15 minutes so far and it's still not ready. If you want to suffer then come to this location.

Coming off a heartbreaking defeat by our cross-town rivals, my friends and I sought the only restaurant that would be able to soothe the pains of loss. We arrive to see that the fine establishment was still open, but not for long. Some of our friends were still arriving when an employee (who shall remain nameless) named Debbie made it very clear to us that no one else was to consume the "Mexican Delight" that night and locked the doors. We thought nothing of it and continued ordering... but the worst was yet to come. When my friend opened the locked door to let our other friend in to use the restroom, Deborah released her inner Kraken and made my friend repent for the sins he had committed not 15 seconds prior. After that situation cooled down we got our delectable Quesaritos and went on our way. Taco Bell that night recieved 4 out of 5 stars and Debbie lost $14 in a screwed up transaction when my friend ordered. Good job Debbie!

Worst Taco Bell EVER!  I live nearby so I've come here a total of 5 times. Every single time I come here I regret it.  They are always having problems: missing ingredients, machines down, short staffed, prioritizing drive though over in-site customers. Long wait times. What ever you do NEVER use a delivery service to deliver your food. We've tried 2 different food delivery services and our orders were wrong both times. Save yourself the trouble, go elsewhere.

This Taco Bell never lets me down. I went today and had he usual good experience. Drive thru at 1 was full but it flowed well enough. No one crazy special ordered or picked up for a team, so it moved along. I got my usual junk food splurge and it all came out as they were trained to do: nachos supreme, crunchy taco, and five layer burrito with a Sierra Mist. 

They say you are getting old when everything seems more expensive than before. Well, I'm getting seriously old because I remember I could have ordered all that for less than a Lincoln.

Waited in drive thru for 45 mins for my order. Screwed up order completely and was missing 4 tacos.

I think they hired the kids that got fired from BK down the street. Unbelievably slow and rude.

Terrible Drive-thru service. The attendant asked me three times whether or not I wanted any sauce. Obviously he didn't care to pay enough attention for something as simple as sauce. To top it off it took forever for my order to be completed. He could tell from my face that I wanted to know why my order was taking so long but he didn't come to the window and let know what was going on. During the time I was waiting at the drive thru I could see the attendant and another employee goofing off by tossing a dirty rag back and forth. Disgusting!
When my order finally came I asked why it had taken so long. He said they hadn't had any of the item I ordered prepared so they had to cook a new batch. If I had known it was going to take 10 minutes from the get-go I would have ordered something else. Basically it just comes down to terribly trained lazy employes.

I am always satisfied after leaving taco bell! Great food for a great price. Can't go wrong with tbell. After all, it has been voted healthiest fast food place! 

My go to is the mexican pizza. I recommend this to all my friends and get them hooked! You can change it up by adding jalapeño sauce or pico de gallo for a twist. I usually pair this with a soft taco and a baja blast. 

I've tried pretty much the whole menu and everything is good. I load everything up with extra sauce. I even take some sauce packets home sometimes and add it to my homemade mexican food!

You can sub beans instead of beef for everything if you are vegetarian. 

Service could be a little friendlier but it is a fast food place so I don't expect much more. One of the better serviced locations I have experienced. Be prepared that the food court can get quite busy during lunch and dinner and it can be hard to find a seat.

I never write reviews. EVER. But this calls for a review. Went through the drive through Friday night after being out for a bit. Ordered 6 ($1) nacho tacos, 3 chicken tacos, 2 drinks. The incompetent young man tried to charge me $19+!!!!!!!! I reminded him that there were 6 $1 tacos in this order. He He disappeared for a bit. Corrected the price. Handed me a bag. Which contained ONLY the 6 $1 tacos. WE didn't get any drinks (which I have to admit I completely forgot about since I was so perplexed that I was getting extremely rip offed), or any chicken tacos. This is not the first time they have screwed up. But it will be their last screwing up my order. Hello Taco Cabana!!

I had the worst experience at this Taco Bell. Wasn't even a super busy time and it took over 45 minutes to get the three items of food I ordered, and they got my order wrong. They focused on the drive through people's orders instead of the people on the inside ordering.. I wish I could get a refund for the three items I ordered. It's supposed to be fast food, not making your customers wait the same amount of time they would at a sit down restaurant to get fries, a taco, and a burrito. Do not recommend anyone going to this Taco Bell if you want actual fast food service. If I had been offered a refund, maybe I would reconsider coming back..

My friends and I went to this location at 2:15 AM; their closing time is listed as 3:30 AM (on yelp). The employees completely disregarded him and said that they 'were on their break'. Maybe the hours just need to be updated, but the employees were completely ill-mannered towards him.

Lunch on a Saturday: Forget it!!  Staff was overwhelmed... management did an abysmal job of making sure enough people showed up happy and ready to work. The drive-through wasn't moving and the inside of the store wasn't either.  For a fast food restaurant, this wasn't fast --not even a little bit. I seriously worry about this store. If it was a ship at sea, I'd ask the owner how he/she feels about keelhauling.

Well I'm not even sure where to begin. I had a pretty decent size order as it was for 4 adults and 1 child. I went through the drive thru because it was getting late and I wanted it to be quick. I told the man who first spoke to me that I had a large order. A woman got on the speaker and told me to get inside. First I waited at least 10 mins in the small drive thru waiting to get out of the drive thru to go in and order. Plus I've never had any problems like that before. Then I went in and placed my order. The cashier had mild guest service skills. I paid and took my drink to the station to fill it. The soda I wanted was flat so I tried a different one and again flat. I told the manager about it. SHE DID NOTHING ABOUT IT. As I was waiting on my food I could hear multiple cuss words and bad language used by the staff cooking. The lobby WAS DISGUSTING. My food finally came out in which he called "Big Order". I've never felt so disrespected at a taco bell ever. I took my food to a table nearby to check it. Big shocker it was wrong. Another customer wanted to speak to the manager in which he got told "she's busy, she get to you when she can". I've had enough at this point. Took my food home hoping to enjoy something I was really craving. No the food was TERRIBLE. Most of it was cold and the shells were so hard that they were falling apart. I will never go here again!!!!!! Literally the worst taco bell I've ever been too and I'll never go back.

Good service. They put up with a lot of yuppie crap that slows the line. I go there twice a week, and am almost always trapped behind a Lincoln Navigator or Toyota Sienna with 15 item orders and multiple substitutions. I rub my forehead as they bark out "on that one, no tomato"... or "maybe just a little tiny bit of sauce on my burrito... like, a REAL TINY bit". YUCK. Die in a fire. Despite having to deal with these a-holes, the employees are always cheery and do their best to move the line as quickly as possible. A+ for the store, overall. I usually get my nachos without tiny broken chips... and my tacos are always well-loaded and well-wrapped. Tortillas are always hot. Good job, Arboretum. A+

I have only ever frequented this location via drive through. It is a pretty standard Taco Bell. Ingredients seem fresh, shredded lettuce and sour cream are always cold, the staff is friendly, etc. I only come here like once a year, but I gotta say, it's not bad at all. I give it 3 stars based on Yelps ratings: "A-OK".

In the vicinity: Wendy's
                         The Mad Italian
                          Arby's
                          Dry Cleaning
                          Shell and Chevron Gas Stations
                          300 Bowling Alley
                           I-285
                      
                         
  Pepsi Products are sold here.

This Taco Bell is a JOKE. Constantly a 20+ minute wait in drive thru and a lot of times more. WHY?? No other Taco Bell is like this I've ever been to. It's rare the order is EVER correct. Flat Soda, no nacho cheese, no napkins, no sauce. Constantly items missing from orders and then give attitudes when mentioned about food I paid for. Disrespectful rude employees slamming the window because I interrupted social time. Everyone knows a place ran like this starts from the top and goes down. Get it together!!

Late night cravings!

Located right in the heart of the Highland neighborhood sits this Taco Bell. It has been here for as long as I have lived in Gresham!

This Taco Bell is right off the corner of 181st and Powell. There is plenty of parking in the little lot where it is situated. 

While the food isn't anything to write home about, it's good and fast Mexican inspired food. The price is reasonable for what you get. 

I usually opt for a Gordita, Chalupa, soft Taco or nachos. Their Mexican pizza is also tasty and loaded with beef and beans. The staff here is similar to what you'd find in other fast food joints.

The interior of the restaurant is clean and well maintained. There are plenty of seats if you are opting in to eat in. I usually order to go or go through the drive thru.

While the quality of food here isn't great, I like the fast friendly service. I usually come here for a quick bite or snack. Just don;t expect it to be gourmet quality food.
20 mins for food in the drive thru is unacceptable but it's the norm here. Go to 122nd and glisan.

Literally the worst fast food experience I've ever had. On the 3 occasions I've been here, I've waited almost 10 minutes twice, and dealt with the rudest cashier ever. And my food was wrong once, and the girl giving me my change, didn't. I gave her exact change and apparently counting coins threw her off. She said she needed 20 more cents, I gave her the benefits of the doubt and handed her a quarter, she gave me nothing back. Wow... do managers exist here? Check on your staff. They're awful.

My favorite Taco Bell in the area nice service and customer service I had a wrong order today(never happened before) the manager corrected it very professionally And offered me a pop to go with it so thoughtful. If you need a quick bite and  you happen to be in the area stop by here you won't be disappointed.

Probably the worst experience at Taco Bell I've ever had! I ordered my food and got home and they forgot half of my order, so I brought it all back down and asked them for the food and if they can remake all of the food since it is now cold. As they were making the food I heard and saw the guy that took my order the first time at the drive-thru say "I'm not going to remake that just toss it in the microwave or the hot box" and a few of them kept saying they were going to do that.. then they just tossed me my food on the counter and didn't say anything. I will probably never be back to this location. They have never gotten my order right...

Got two frito burritos and a soda at the drive through, order was accurately completed and the guy at the window was friendly. Got through the line at 11:30 am on a Saturday in less than 5 minutes. Great service and decent fast food! Who can complain at lunch for two for less than $4.00?
Honestly the people here do whatever they want, the order is always wrong, the staff is disgusting, and they legit don't know how to make the food. Save the time and go to another location.

Honestly.... just dont go to this location. Messy, slow, forgetful :/// 
Food was nasty more importantly

Absolutely incompetent staffing and ridiculous waits at night, then you'll get the wrong order.

Have the only fast food place open late. Schedule skeleton crew. Large volume of people show up late at night. Giant lines.

Management: *shocked Pikachu face *

It's your busy period every single time. Just put on a full staff - half your traffic sees the line and drives away - you're basically throwing away money. How bad at your job can you BE?

Oh, and after waiting 20-30 minutes, you'll get the wrong order.

I am not quite sure why it takes an hour to get your food here every time, but this may be the most inefficient TB there is in the entire state of Oregon. Enter the drive thru here at your own risk and with a full tank of gas...

When you are getting Taco Bell you can't expect much. When people in the 90s got tacos it was around 50 cents a taco and now it's over $1 for the same taco with no difference. When I go I ask for no ice because it's already cold and it's over 2/3 ice which leaves you with very little soda. I ask for no lettuce on my soft tacos and 2 out of 3 times they put lettuce on it. Is it that hard not to put lettuce on a taco!? Now every time we go we take an extra minute to look through to make sure it's correct because if it's not we give it back and they make it right. They have almost fully lost all our business.

Always had great service here.   Managers and employees are super nice.  Sure, orders get messed up a few times here and there,  buy hey mistakes happen.   I really like the new redesign of the interior.

Usually not a fan of drive through late at night. Tonight the service was not only quick but the man running the window went above and beyond for service. Great customer service. Repeated order. Asked about sauces, types, quantity and suggested something. Thoroughly impressed. Thanks! Hope he sees this. Keep it up. It's rare nowadays.
Never go to this taco bell during a lunch break.. Tack on another 15 min than how long they usually take. Smh

Got here at 1:26 AM and they told us we couldn't order cause they were closing due to not having any product left. This isn't the first time this has happened. This location doesn't close till 2 AM. Very disappointing for us Hilliard residents looking for a late night bite. Maybe stock up ahead of time ?

This Taco Bell just can't get it together I've given them multiple chances and today was the last time. I ordered 4 tacos only got 2. I ordered a chicken burrito with regular chicken instead of the shredded and when I looked inside it was shredded and they put not sour cream on my nacho supreme like wtf you can't make a simple order ? So I go back in and let them know I get my new burrito and there's no creamy avocado sauce like damit how many times do I have to go back in !! GET IT TOGETHER PEOPLE you work at Taco Bell it's a simple f***** job!  Another thing make sure you have all the damn items in the bag ! I worked at Taco Bell for 2 years and never once did we ever not make sure the right items were in the bag it's literally the most important thing ! You guys suck and I wasted 22$ on garbage my tacos looked flat! Absolutely no meat barley any cheese or lettuce disgusting and completely disappointed! 

Just drive up to Taco Bell on Imbrie and Cornell it will be worth it.!

I visit this Taco Bell frequently after work. Most nights it takes 20-40 minutes for the drive thru. Often times you are told the system is down. This location has just become so unreliable which is a shame because it used to be great. Just seems like every time I visit now it's an extremely long wait or you are turned away since nothing is working.
Well I guess we know why there's one star. Slowest pick up line on the planet. Do you think the person working the window has her friends come by to talk?

Yes, it's Taco Bell but where else can I fill my belly for $5.20? 
Believe it or not I've actually found differences between Taco Bell locations. Be it the taste of the re-fried beans or in the case of today, the consistency tortillas the locations seem to vary for whatever reason. 
Right now my go to Taco Bell choices begin with a couple of Cheesy Bean and Rice Burrito. Liquid cheese is a gift from above and to incorporate into a bean burrito with rice, pure genius. 
Throw in a soft taco and Diet Mtn Dew (sure, it's the perfect time to be concerned about calories) and I'm full.
My personal gripe with Taco Bell is the cashier handing me my receipt and asking me to login into their web-site and rate me experience for the chance to win $500.00..... I've done this a bunch and I haven't won squat.
Window says close is 5am, but apparently that means 4:30 according to the old dude that was working... Sad face. :(   #faultyadvertisingalongwithlazyemployees

The food was typical and most of the employees were typical.  Edible and half ass.  Sweet tea was junk even though it was 'freshly made'.

The soda fountain though...  I hardly get soda but I always hear complaints from my guy about how it's water, it's sour, it's old, it's crap, everywhere we go.  I decided that since the tea was junk I'd give the spiked Mountain Dew a try.  DING DING DING!  It was awesome!  Which actually really sucks because I haven't had it again at the same level of awesome.  My local Taco Bell waters it down to nothing and the canned version is really stevia~y.  

And one of the employees, a young girl, was awesome.  We clicked on Totoro.  She's coo.

The place was pretty clean in the dining area and the view was awesome.  The bathrooms needed some work.  Women's was out of mostly everything and when I stepped into the men's room for some soap, it reeked and was dirty.

This is my go to place when I don't know what I want for lunch or just need a quick bite. Today I was worried because the car line was looooonnnngggg! No need to worry because I was in and out in no time!

What was great was the person who took  my order was upbeat and friendly and even laughed when I tried to take blame when I mumbled my order. Once I got to the window she was friendly and smiling. There were no mistakes with my order. All the food was yummy.

Why not the 5th star. Okay, maybe it's me, but....
don't talk bad about other customers. One day it may be me. She made a negative comment. I know the other person didn't hear but it just made me feel bad for that person.

What do I order when I am there? CHALUPAS. Oh, yum! The combo comes with 2 plus an extra taco. I think what makes it so good is the sour cream. Yum! It came out to about $6.50 or so (no tax in PDX).

Stop by when you're nearby.
Rats in the driveway. I don't think I need to say more. Saw 4 in my 3 min of waiting to order. Pretty grossed out and never coming to this location, again!

Nothing fast about this fast food joint. Stopped in just for cheese fries.. 15 minutes later.. zzzzzz.. two people have already got refunds.. wow.. unorganized would be putting it politely. Poorly managed..

Every time I come to Galleria I make sure I get my box at Taco Bell. Today very disappointed. My Grande burrito. Was Extra small burrito it was tortilla and nothing else inside. I asked for the manager and they didn't have one. A girl from the kitchen came out to assist me but she was very rude. Instead of offering me a new one like I told her she offered me the money back. She said that's how the burrito is but it's not true I had here before and it's always fine. Maybe I have to come weekends when the manager is in and the food is perfect. Anyways here's another picture of my girlfriend food. You can tell it's only lettuce.

Warning - their closing time does not match what's on their website or yelp.

Drive here and you risk wasting a lot of gas.

We flew into town after 10 and we know we only had a few places to go. My daughter asked for Taco Bell. It was 11:16 and we asked for a soft taco with black bean. They said they stop selling black beans at 11 pm. We asked for the fiesta potatoes. They told us they had no potatoes, because they were cleaning their oil. I know for a fact they have more than one frier machine. Who would clean both off them while open. This toco Bell needs learn tone prepared at all times. Just go to McDonalds like we did. They were prepared.
They are always out of everything .. Tortilla chips sour cream. And only 3 options of drink... I mean someone needs to fire their ordering manager bc this is a constant problem.

Come to this location cause it's close to home after work. When I stop by between 1030pm-12 i can usually get through pretty fast with the right order usually about 3 cars in line always. Came by around 930 the other night it had lots of new people working obviously still in trani and got my order taken properly but given the wrong items and meat on a vegetarian item sucks.. sometimes have great service others are lacking.

9-19-19
Ordered tonight and am so frustrated with the service. The person that took our order was great but the kitchen workers messed up a lot. First they didn't add the nachos ordered, then never added the jalapeños to a burrito that was ordered and in addition it was a complete mess not even wrapped all the way with beans and cheese falling out of both ends, the other two burritos were barely like warm and not hot at all!! We took the order to go and didn't realize until we got home that there were so many errors

What can you expect from a ghetto fast food restaurant? Ghetto service. 
Everyone is too high and violently angry to properly take any order. I've never (NEVER) had an order right. I go there a lot. Don't customize an order. They can't ever ever ever ever EVER ever do it right. Not ever. Not ever ever ever ever

The worst Taco Bell bell ever. A few weeks ago they were closed for like 3 days because "they were hiring new management". They are always out of hash browns every morning. The drive through takes years. What are they doing in there???  I've called and they always say they are short staffed. Lol. Hey management. Here is a crazy idea. How about you hire people who are competent....

I've been a long time Taco Bell fan, this location in particular, and although I love it, I will sadly not be returning. I'm a vegetarian who specifically requests a bean substitute and been given beef on SEVERAL occasions. It's happened quite a few times this year alone! Sometimes I don't check my meal right then and there like I should and wouldn't realize it until I got home. I used to live a few minutes away, would go back and they would correct my order. My whole thing is, that should not be happening in the first place! Yesterday, the line was drawn. I just got off of work after a long day and the guy took my order/gave me my food said not a word to be at the window and seemed to not be in the mood. I moved a little further out a few months ago and didn't check my order before leaving. Came home, got comfortable and was ready to eat my food and lo and behold, it was beef so I threw it away. I gave two star because although their food is GREATLY MADE, the errors unfortunately outweigh the food. I hope this location is able to fix this error because it's simply not ok.

Worst service ever. I went into the drive thru one Friday evening, and I kid you not it took about 15 minutes before I got to the order window, another 10 minutes at the order window, 20 minutes at the first window and 15 minutes at the second window. When I received my food there was no napkins, no cutlery nothing! Don't waste your time here.

If u want to wait 56 minutes for food, go here. 
I'm not even joking, me along with the whole restaurant waited hour+ for food. Everyone started asking for a manager. One lady was so upset she was getting loud and we were in agreement with her. The manager comes out and says the previous morning shift didn't set him up right. Hard to believe. To be honest it's like that every time I go and I end up leaving.

visit this taco bell and everything was sold out and I bought a party pack and a chalupa the chicken 
chalupa only had vegetable and the tacos not good this is the last visit.

Took me 40 minutes to go through the drive-thru    I arrived on a Sunday at 9:50pm & got out at 10:30pm.  30 minutes to make it 5 cars to order then 10 minutes to get my food.  Managers need to know what's going on because this is uncalled for for a fast food restaurant.

if I could give more stars from my experience today, I would. I don't expect much anymore when going through drive thru's-- they're always usually a major let down. but today I received EVERYTHING that I asked for AND it was hot. I had a 10 minute drive home and was so happy to still eat a hot meal. the girl at the window was super polite as well. thank you for your awesome service during this COVID19 crisis.

I wish no stars was an option. I ordered nacho fries and they couldn't AT LEAST fill the little cup halfway with cheese. 

My burrito was COLD. 

We ask for hot sauce. He asked, fire? We said no, hot. Then proceeds to dump fire sauce in our bag. 


We waited 45 minutes minimum in the drive thru line. 

Terrible service.

It's a guilty pleasure. Especially when I'm in a hurry. 

But don't be in a hurry at this location. It's okay at the drive through. I think those orders have first preference. 

I usually have a bike on top or am in a big van, so I have to go inside. And it's always slow. I'm not sure why I think it may be different "this time."

All of my experiences at this particular location have been horrible. The burritos are sloppily made, barely any meat, just full of rice. The cheesy fiesta potato bowls are always hard and taste old, as if they were sitting out for hours. I would give zero stars if possible.

**STAY AWAY FROM HERE!**

If you value your health and well-being please do not eat at this Taco Bell! Last night around 11pm I purchased dinner for myself, my partner and our roomate. Everything that I got seemed fine enough, not great, but not bad either. However, while my roomate was eating his Doritos Taco he nearly bit into a VERY LARGE black beetle. It looked like it hadn't been dead for very long and was missing some legs (which I assume are lodged somewhere in the unfinished taco. Or worse, he may have consumed them already..ugh) As I type this review all three of us who ate the food at this location have nausea, our roomate also has a stomach ache as well. How on earth did an employee not notice a bug this large inside their food during prep? I mean, seriously?? Did this thing crawl it's way in at some point??

Please people, BE VERY CAUTIOUS OF THIS TACO BELL

This has got to be the filthiest fast food place I have ever been in. Food scattered all over the kitchen area floor. All of it clearly visible to all the customers. Beside the fact they had no cups for coffee.

Well I didn't exactly expect much when I came here. I'm on a diet but I came from the Kroger across the street and I was super hungry so I stopped in. I've only had Taco Bell once and it was OK so I thought why not. I came through and ordered a soft taco and an order of nacho fries. The nacho fries were hot. The soft taco meat was weird, I know they boil in the bag but maybe it was over boiled? I don't know if that's a thing.

 There was a little line so I waited for about 5 to 6 minutes. I only ordered three dollars with the food but it's cool. Overall the nacho fries were OK despite the fact that they were super seasoned and kind of salty but the taco was just gross. The texture of the meet was weird and it was just lobby. I want to the drive-through so I can't comment on the inside, but overall I guess it was OK.

So many times I have been to this Taco Bell before 2 AM and they are closed. Their hours say that they're open until 4 AM and sometimes they are but other times they are not even though they're supposed to be. Very frustrating and a waste of time when I go to get my late night hunger fix. Very disappointed however McDonald's around the corner is open 24 hours thank God!

In all honesty I wouldn't even give them one star, but it doesn't have the choice, this taco bell is complete shit, the worker half ass their food, I ordered a quesadilla took it home and looked in the bag, and it was wrapped up in tin foil, and my quesadilla was approximately 4 inches, not the average size. it looked like left overs from somebodies lunch that their two year old kid made them, but then didn't eat it because you might get sick. The way that they are handing out their food does not come up to food code regulation therefore should not be given to customers, period. the manager need to do their job and fire the workers that don't do their job and hands out shitty contaminated food.

Do they just not know how to multitask? I would suggest playing one of those food games on your phone to learn how to get multiple things started at once. And sitting in line for 30 minutes now and there is only five cars ahead of me. Getting this review now as I am waiting at the window still waiting for my food watching three of the employees staring at a monitor trying to figure out what's going on

So no one expects much from Taco Bell or any other fast food restaurant but if you pay for food, you expect to receive the food you pay for. Let alone order 14 items and receive 8. So for future customers.. take the time to check your food in front of fast food window so they can fix it, regardless of how irritated they may look.

Drive thru on braker has a knucklehead taking orders and we have been in the drive thru for 29 mins - avoid if customer service and your time is important.   food was ok - but after that wait, who cares - not a happy customer

I literally just left this establishment. As I ordered my food, I saw a lady walking with a broom in her hands, as soon as my order loads onto the screen, the same lady(holding the broom) went to make my food. She did not change out her gloves. I addressed her and the situation. I approached the situation calm and civil. I had asked if she changed her gloves before making my food because I saw her holding the broom. She said no and looked offended that I even had to ask. She got so bothered that an elder lady that worked there had to tell her to calm down. I don't understand, if I was on the other side, would she have liked for me to make her food when my hands were in possession of a dirty broom!?!? Really people....this is the food industry....why the attitude? Anger? You definitely won't see me here anymore!!

Visited yesterday 3/25/19
Great customer service front end and management 
Foods were delicious! Hot!
Store was clean 
Atmosphere quiet and peaceful 
I enjoyed my food and the service 
Will go there again

So I'm very picky when it comes to Taco Bell and this Taco Bell never disappoints! They always get my order right and the food always tastes delicious! I'm so glad that this location is near me! The staff is also friendly which can be hard to find at fast food places.
I am so very super upset!  I came to this Taco Bell with my mom and we both wanted cups of water with our order and we wanted to sit in the lobby
2-3 people we trying to take my order at the same time and they were talking shit in the background and took 5 mins to take my order which I only had 4 items.
Ordered online for 1:15pm pickup didn't receive my order until 1:35 pm what's the point of having online of you not going to not prioritize the orders. Never again!

EVERY TIME I order food at this location  my orde is wrong.  I had won a gift card which is why I gave them a  chance again and was more disappointed this time than every other time.  Don't bother ordering a supreme anything, you won't get it.  You will also leave the drive through missing items. There are better fast food places close by to frequent.  Do yourself a favor and don't go to this location. Pathetic.

Excellent experience going here. I went between nine and 10 to get my wife something to eat and was very pleasantly surprised by the friendliness of the staff and the speed in which my order was completed. I wish I would've got the person's name who is running the drive-through but they did awesome.
This place has to be trying to go out of business. Don't go to this location, having a perfect experience there is harder than winning the lottery.

Pretty decent Taco Bell. I believe it just got updated in the last few years. Located off of San Rafael st, Their drive thru and parking lot is weird as it's in a shopping center - next to a Winco and other stores. The drive thru is narrow and kind of tight for the larger cars. Staff is decent. I received hot food and everything was correct. I usually stop here for a quick bite and never been disappointed- four stars is for the drive thru wait time as it can become super busy / crowded during lunch rush.

Came here for lunch with a chorus group, so they were pretty busy. The lady who yelled out my order was extremely rude because there were two orders of the same thing and I got confused and she was very dismissive, loud, rude and sassy. Not good service at all. Also, I modified my Crunchwrap and they didn't do anything I asked for.

Not only was the staff snippy and rude to us, but It also took 20 minutes for two burritos. There were only four cars ahead of us! Not to mention my food was cold! I'm not sure why I would continue coming to a fast food restaurant, when it appears they have no sense of urgency. Furthermore, why this level ineptitude is allowed by a multimillion dollar corporation. Thanks for the immensely underwhelming experience.

Just got my Taco Bell Nachos Party Pack that I ordered with NO BEANS home, and...IT HAS BEANS ON IT!! After waiting 20 minutes to order my food and get it, after verifying TWICE that I did NOT want ANY BEANS, I get home to find  beans on my food. Whether someone is eliminating a food because they don't like it or because they have FOOD ALLERGIES, I want what I paid for...Nachos Party Pack withOUT ANY BEANS, refried or otherwise!!  This Taco Bell gets an F minus minus minus. Thanks for ruining dinner!

Never any meat in my order of tocos always just lettuce cheese dry nasty please please make it better 
Let our true Mexican brothers and sisters work there bet you it will be great then and tasty delicious food much better
I've been here 3 or 4 times since moving here. Always had a great staff in the drive thru.

I am normally not  one to complain when it comes to fast food but I went to this Taco Bell, mid day and ordered 4 tacos & a cinnamon twist. The cinnamon twist was never included in the bag although I was charged for it & one of the tacos wasn't even wrapped and made a mess on me. My first job when I was younger was Taco Bell, so I can honestly say, it is not that hard
Abysmal service, all the previous reviews are correct. Management is rude and incompetent. Avoid this location at all costs.

Taco Bell. The ultimate late-night munchie. I love Taco Bell. I can't say that I go very often but when I do it's a treat. Everything is always very tasty and the Fire Sauce is the best thing ever. I got my Mexican pizza with no meat and a bean burrito with sour cream. This is been my staple along with the taco salad for many years. One thing I love about Taco Bell is unlike other fast food places this one is very vegetarian friendly. And yes there was a big line of cars and there was a wait but that's basically what I come to expect so I can't really complain. It's cheap it's tasty. And it's a new location right on the corner of Osceola Parkway and Landstar.

A bunch of idiots work here. They don't understand how fast food works and what the purpose of a mobile order is. Waited 25 minutes after placing a mobile order only to find out my food was sitting on the counter waiting for it to be brought to me the entire time. THIS TACO BELL SHOULD BE CLOSED FOR GOOD AND HAVE EVERYONE FIRED!

I thought about giving this Taco Bell 4 stars before we finished our lunch but decided on 3 stars. The last four times we have gone through the drive through, our food has been smashed, missing items, and the special items without onions were not labeled so eating the food is an  allergic guessing game. The times that I called to tell them we were missing items, they said just tell us when you come back through that you are owed items. We did. The person at the drive through said that without a managers name and written information, they would not do that. The person started to get really upset and we just gave up. Today, we walked in and ordered. There wasn't anyone at the counter so we ordered from the order computer. The good thing about that was we could specify no onions. They took Apple/google pay. Our no onions burritos were in a SEPARATE bag! That made us so happy. When we got home and went through the bags, we were only missing one item. That's better than last time. The food was hot. So, previous visits would have earned them a 1, since I don't appreciate people accusing us of lying about missing items and that all the food was mixed up in the bags, but they have redeemed themselves. We know which items were onion free and were only missing one item this time.
food is usually good until they forget something. anyways, customer service at the drive thru is shit.

They had an unlit landscaping and a long line. I jumped out to get inside before they closed to use the restroom and get my food. The FOH (front of house) workers were literally so rude to me that they told me to go somewhere else and that they wouldn't serve us. Literally you can find high schoolers with more work ethics than that. I'm a server and I know the service industry. Tonight's staff does not deserve to be part of the service industry. Fire them, or I'll never be back.
The ABSOLUTE WORST! Never again will I visit this location. They don't listen, no matter how many times you repeat yourself. They eat right there at the counter.

Sat in the drive thur for over 30 mins todays then when I finally pull up to the monitor to place my order I had to say hello 2-3 times to get a response and the cashier at the window I could see her through the drive-through and she was basically in the back doing something long story short you can go to Chick-fil-A across the street which has twice the line and get your food in 5 to 7 minutes.

I got shorted two beef supreme gorditas while in drive through. I ordered online for pick up in drive through and expected they would get the order correct. Guess not. It's one thing to be shorted one item but two is ridiculous.
They say 1 Am (close) , but really it's like 12 I ain't sorry I work late and get off late that's your job WORK YOUR DAM HOURS !!

This is my second time eating here with disappointment.   Ordered 2 bean and cheese burritos and that was it.  They decided it needed rice.  I hate rice.  No even a little bit sorry.  You either enjoy rice or you don't.   I do not.  I am just lit.

Very bad service make you wait in line 5 minutes to order and those who are working are just laughing, I do not know if it's funny to have a client in front of you or because you simply can not do your job

The food is never not prepared correctly , which is one of the only things this location has going for them. The time it takes those workers to make one order is absolutely horrible. Don't get me wrong , they're nice people , but some of them care more about talking to each other and if you mention that you haven't gotten your food yet-and it's been over 20 minutes- and you only ordered for two people , you're going to get some nasty stares and horrible attitude from the cooks.
Hasn't messed up on my order and i come in all the time. Im a busy student so i need food fast and right the first time. Never have a problem.

182 & Powell is closed for remodeling.
When I called the Powell Taco Bell 185th & Stark Taco Bell answered.

Thank you Taco Bell for keeping me regular. I do not need to take fiber supplements when I go on a late night food binge when Muchas Gracias is already closed. 

It's like a Russian Roulette with you but I do appreciate the fake cheese and sour cream that you always put on your Quesoritos. Some may give me the "push" that I needed. Some nights, you fail. 

And thanks to your Baja Mountain Dew, it kept me until 4am for some lightning storm the other night. 

Other than that, you should try training your employees how to say "thank you", "welcome" and try not to sound like  a stoner. I know you're at work, tired, miserable and just want to be at the couch. I feel your pain. But I feel my stomach grumbling more. 

Be nice and pleasant.

Terrible restaurant,lets talk about how there customers sucks, bad attitude i dont know how many times my food was wrong missing things or tasted nasty they honestly dont care about there customers at all the employee. I keep giving them the benefit of the doubt when i do end up coming here but i always end up getting the same bad customer service when i go never again coming back to this taco bell. I highly recommend nobody come here AT ALL
If I could give 0 stars would. I payed for a STEAK chalupa, and they gave me beef. Charged me for a steak. How can this company even still have customers. They need new management.

I absolutely love Taco Bell but this location is freaking terrible, idk who they hire here but I work for a property management company. So when we order for everyone it's a big order and every time we order from here it is never right the orders are always wrong!!! 

When we order we always spend a lot of money and I always push for Taco Bell but I will not be doing that anymore, well maybe not for this location anymore cause the online ordering they freaking suck, I may try another Taco Bell or not them at all cause of my experience which is sad. 

It just sucks when you order something and spend the money and you don't get what your craving cause they don't know what they doing for some reason, so disappointed in Taco Bell and the online ordering.

You'd think as the cost of fast food have raised over there years that there quality of the food would also get better but they skimp on the amount of chicken they put into the tacos I get the chalupas and there's never enough chicken in them it's disappointing really would it hurt to add a little more meat?
Terrible service. Every time I have been there the food is cold!! I believe they don't fully cook any of food. French fries taste so bad....

It took a long time to get our food. Everyone in the restaurant was waiting and mad. There was a man sitting by the the door telling everyone if you plan on waiting more then 45 mins you should go somewhere else. Very very dirty in the lobby and not stocked. Instead of the front counter guy cleaning and stalking he was standing there. Customers were mad and yelling at the manager
Had to drive here twice because they messed up the order the first time.  They messed it up worse the second time.  You can't fix stupid.

I wish I could give this 0 stars. Jiselle the shift lead is extremely rude and incompetent. I ordered a chalupa meal and asked them to change the chicken to beef and I leave and open the bag and they put refried beans instead of ground beef. I go back around and explain what happened and she was rude as if it was my fault. I get handed my bag of food with an attitude , I check it again when I drove off and now they put chicken. I went back around waited in line for a 3rd time and at this point I don't even want it. I told her what happened she rudely answers well a chalupa meal is chicken and I said yes ma'am that's why I asked the first time for ground beef instead of chicken and second time when I came around I explained they put refried beans instead of GROUND BEEF. Young man at the window says yes she did say that and I just asked for a refund. She was so upset about the refund then says cash or card and as I'm saying card she said I need the card and shes rolling her eyes and breathing heavy the whole time so I told her to save her attitude when I'm not the incompetent one who can't get an order right after 2 tries and she's acting like me as the customer was making it wrong. I asked her name to report her to corporate for her nasty attitude and she says I wish you would and says her name was jiselle. Poor management & I would never return to this location!
Staff is very friendly. Usually very fast and efficient. Overall consistently one of the best Taco Bell's

Horrible! I hardly ever eat here, maybe a couple of times a year and when I do, it takes them FOREVER to prepare a couple of tacos. It's ridiculous. And to top it off, the kids running the place are super disrespectful. Their reason for slowness is being understaffed. Management seriously needs to get things under control. There no reason why any should wait for "fast food" for 30+ mins...

Went through drive-through waited in line for 25 min and received the wrong order.  I tried calling but of course the phone is buzzy so I l sure they have it off of the hook.  There were 4 people standing the window.  The manager was playing with a screw driver and no one offered an apology for the long wait. Unacceptable!!

My wife and I have tried to go multiple times at various hours of the day and each time we go they are out of everything.  Before you can even order they start by saying "we are out of . . .".  The first time we went they were out of mild sauce hot sauce Baja blast and various tacos.  The next time they couldn't serve anything deep fried.  This last time all they had was only steak options, they literally said as soon as we got to the order menu "we only take cash right now and we only have steak left" only steak?!! Like what is this establishment?!! Get your s@#t together your location sucks!! A word to anyone else wanting a taco from a Taco Bell go to one that isn't out of tacos.

I've had a myriad of problems with this Taco Bell that should be mentioned. 

1) I've had a couple of occurrences where the price I have been charged has not matched the price on their menu board, and they were not supportive when I asked them to use the menu board price. I take that as not giving a crap, plus scummy as they should honor their advertised price. 

2) I have had issues with them getting orders right in the past on drive-thru. Online they've done alright for what it's worth. Even though the rating is low, this is close to my house, and since Hilliard rolls up the carpets around 10 PM, sometimes you gotta do what you gotta do because of a lack of options. 

The food's Taco Bell. No better, no worse. Take that for what you will. But, if there's another one close, you might be apt to get a better experience at a different locale (Tuttle or Hilliard-Rome Rd.)

3 times I've been here since moving into the area. 3 times I've ordered a number 2 with a soft taco and no ice in my drink. 3 times I've gotten a crunchy taco with ice. They're 0 for 3 on getting my order right.
Crap food and service! Save your money! This location is consistently bad.  They just don't seem to care.  They take their customers for granted.

This is the absolute slowest Taco Bell I have ever been to. 35 minutes in the drive through is very normal for this place. And the best part of all, is that they get your order wrong quit frequently. In all honesty, you could get take out from Red Robin or Applebee's 2x faster than going through the drive through at this place. I don't usually leave reviews but I feel like this needs to be a public service announcement, avoid this place at all cost. I now drive a few miles out of my way to go to the Taco Bell on Cornelius Pass and Evergreen.

I mean it's Taco Bell... but this one doesn't even live up to the low expectations I have for this type of place.

1: No acknowledgement for 5 mins after walking in (only customer I , lady looked right at us several times)

2) Trash EVERYWHERE... the floors are covered with food and wrappers. The workers just step on it like it's normal.

3) watched them burn several peoples food, look at it, ignore it, and serve it.

My partner was hungry enough to still order from here... I was not.

I visited this Taco Bell at around midnight and when I went to the drive through, no one responded. I went to the window and honked and waited about 15 minutes before leaving. They close at 1 and the lights were on and there was a car in the parking lot, so there must have been someone there so I'm not sure why they wouldn't be able to take my order almost an hour before closing.

I enjoyed my food at this restaurant. It's located in Northern Lights so it's really convenient and easy to get in and out of. Theres a good amount of parking. Right next to a Huntington Bank. There's a busy intersection but not too much noisy - it's reasonably quiet inside. I like the set up. Easy to get your own drinks and sauces.

 I came through at 11 AM and ordered lunch. The location was clean and the manager was friendly. The Restroom was clean as well. Food was hot and I was in and out fairly quickly.

Taco Bell is literally my favorite place ON THE PLANET. 

Like, how can I describe to you the sonnet of flavors Taco Bell presents to you in a tortilla? The flour tortilla, or as I like to call it, the "angel wing of tengo hambre" is supple and chewy but has edge, like a crepe that has seen some ish.
What lies at the deepest point of a taco from Taco Bell is a unification of mild beef, shredded light cheese, sour cream and shredded lettuce for an unmatched crunch found nowhere else. Nowhere I've been. And I've been, well, nowhere.

I can't describe the specialty items because my friend, that would take the rest of my life - but rest assured, for this restaurant I would dedicate my life's work to such a symphonic masterpiece of culinary art. 

Your wallet thanks you. The people of America thank you.

I fully realize this is Taco Bell. I don't go here and expect a 5-star dining experience. That being said, this has to be one of the worst Taco Bell restaurants out there. Slow service inside and drive thru and it seems like something is always missing or messed up. Today was the last straw that prompted me to write a review. 

Used the drive thru, which wasn't busy, and we ordered 4 cheesy Gordita crunches and 2 soft taco supremes. When we got home to eat, my 2 soft tacos had been placed in the bottom of the bag, with the much heavier Gorditas on top of them. They were both flattened and swishing out of their wrappers. It might be hard to tell from the photo, but wow. It was bad. 

None of the cheesy Gordita crunches were crunchy. At. All. Soggy soggy soggy.

The food was good for a Taco Bell except for the cinnamon twists. They tasted like cardboard. The lady at the window was very polite, except the cook. We had ordered a freeze but they never gave it to us so we had to wait. After waiting, the lady, who looked like the cook, (not the window person) came over and started yelling at us. She said there was a timer and when we tried to tell her we were missing our drink, she continued to say "there's a timer" (still yelling) and forced the window closed and left. Since she obviously wasn't going to come back, we just left. Note: there were no cars behind us and she didn't even bother to ask why were we're still there. If you don't want to deal with rude cook and disgusting cinnamon cardboard, go someplace else.

This TB didn't let me down in flavor but it did let me down in service. 

I get it. It's midnight and you don't want to be working but it's midnight and it's the perfect time for some TB so at the most just be polite! 

Drive through took way too long and the guy working did not seem happy. Did get lots of sauce though! That Diablo absolutely lives up the hype.

I'm shocked that I've gone to this location multiple times (and at various hours of lateness) and they're always on top of their game and super friendly. I guess I've been lucking out compared to the other reviews. But the remodel is done now so maybe things will get better.

Came at about 2:35pm. Food was hot and staff was so friendly. I only waited about 2 minutes for my order.  Staff made jokes and was funny and happy. I enjoy coming to this location. The GM was there and Greeted me. She was efficient and I feel like she made the experience that much better.

I ordered two soft tacos and a side. Food was tasty and the location was clean. The GM was cleaning the lobby when I came in but it was already good looking. I've had sub-par experiences at other places but this one always comes through for me. 

Tacos were stuffed as normal and no skipping on the potions as some places. It also plays music here which I enjoy.

Place is absolute trash just spent 21 dollars there and not only was everything cold! But my chicken rolled tacos were freezing, ordered a 12 pack of tacos they were all out together like crap taco toppings not even on the tacos ordered 2 mini quesadilla and I only got one and it was absolutely burnt! And then tried to call and talk to manager and the phone is off the hook! So unhappy! Pissed. Worst Taco Bell I have ever been to! And the person running the drive thru was just sitting on her phone texting!

Can I give -5 Stars? As if the 20 minute drive thru wait wasn't the worst. Literally TWENTY MINUTES in a drive thru I couldn't get out of.

I wanted a Taco salad, well, they didn't have any more shells.
I wanted the new nacho fries. They didn't have that either!

So I kept it safe and ordered Tacos, they can't mess that up, right?
Ofcourse they did, I waited another 5 minutes after I paid and the tacos were cold and old. Threw them out!
The girl at the window handing me the food seemed like she had an attitude with ME?? Really?

Ofcourse they made sure to "forget" my RECEIPT with the usual survey.
That's why I had to dust off my old Yelp account. 
To warn people about this mismanaged, time wasting location. 

There's other locations that I've NEVER had any problems with.
This was completely UNACCEPTABLE.
Food poisoning ! Terrible terrible. If I were you I wouldn't go to this Taco Bell after 8pm. I can never eat a Taco Bell crunchy taco again.. it's ruined forever..

Went there today for lunch before heading back home to Houston. Went with a co-worker and it turned out he ordered the same thing I did. Ten minutes later they called out his order and I was curious on why his order was called before mine even though we ordered the same thing. Two more orders were called out so I asked a staff member about my order. He looked it up on his monitor and said that it would be right out. Well, four more orders were called and I was still waiting. My co-worker already finished his meal. I asked for a manager because I've already waited 20 minutes and wanted a refund. The same guy that told me that my order was coming right up, approached the register to give me a refund. He avoided eye contact as he went through process and even when he handed me the money. I didn't even receive an apology or explanation for what had happened. Lunch ruined.
Super slow service. Appears they do not have enough help. 15 minute wait in drive through. Don't expect fast service ever at this location.

If I could leave negative stars I would. This is hands down the worst Taco Bell. The staff is always rude and super slow. Just went to get a few tacos and it takes them forever every time and there was no line or anything. I get Jeramy who seems to think he can talk to costumers anyway he wants should never be allowed to work in the public. He's rude combative and just plain disrespectful. I'd rather eat road kill than come here ever again!!!

The day shift people have always been nice.  The manager that works nights is extremely rude, on multiple occasions.   She didn't give us the second half of our order and didn't say anything to us and walked away from the window and kitchen, get home realize half of our food is missing and she blamed it on us driving away.  Another time went they the drive thru and she refused to let us have two orders for one car, and we're stuck in the drive they so just had to do an order all together.  Never polite at the window.  I came here pretty often but this manager just makes me not want to come here.  BUT the day shift is great! Just don't go at nights

Horrible. I don't expect much but, when you get my order completely wrong, I have to turn around, and wait another 15 minutes for something that takes 1 minute is ridiculous. An apology wasn't even offered...

Why can't this Taco Bell get it together? Last time  I went - we waited in the drive-thru for almost 20 minutes. My food was comped, which is nice. But, every time I go here there's an issue. I don't get Mexican Pizzas here anymore because the last one I got was horrible. The oil that the tortillas are cooked in hadn't been changed and it was so gross, I threw it away. This time, Cheese Quesadilla was ice cold, burnt and had sauce when I asked for none. The quesadilla is obviously old and was probably just lying somewhere. YUCK!!!

I am so very super upset!  I came to this Taco Bell with my mom and we both wanted cups of water with our order and we wanted to sit in the lobby. However, our cashier informed us they were out of "water cups" and told us we could buy bottles of water for $1.89 instead of offering us a different sized cup for water. I immediately declined because I didn't want to pay nearly $2 for one bottle of water.  We told her we were going to take the food to go instead, since we couldn't get any water. 

As we waited for our food, I saw a stack of cups on the counter near the register. I walked up to the counter and politely asked "are these the water cups?" A female wearing a drive thru headset replied in a quick, loud and harshful tone "NO!!" I thought to myself "what was the attitude for?" ...but I said nothing as I walked away, even though I was really thirsty. I actually thought about grabbing 2 of those cups to get my mom and me some water, but I didn't. 

The lady with the headset quickly recalls our order out loud, drops our food bag onto the counter and yells "thank you very much!" AS SHE IS WALKING AWAY FROM THE COUNTER!! She recalled our order so quickly that it all sounded like one long sentence and my mom and I didn't understand her at all. I actually had to yell to catch her "what was that last order??" She came back and repeated it a little slower but still walked away in the same fashion. I'm irate at this point, but chose to stay calm because of my mom. There was a third female standing behind the counter when the one with the headset did this. I kindly asked her for mild sauce. She gave me a blank stare, but one of the other customers pointed me in the direction to get my own sauce. I'm really mad I had to get decent customer service FROM A CUSTOMER!!!! 

We got to my house to eat (because there is plenty of drinking water there) and I found not only was there a mere spoonful of beef in my "Crunchwrap Supreme", but the large tortilla chip in the center that was supposed to give it a good crunch was completely soggy! I couldn't even eat it! My mom said her chalupas had no meat either! 

BOTTOM LINE: Not only will I not ever step foot in this Taco Bell again because of the horrible treatment and subpar food we received, but I encourage others to do the same.

Come to this location cause it's close to home after work. When I stop by between 1030pm-12 i can usually get through pretty fast with the right order usually about 3 cars in line always. Came by around 930 the other night it had lots of new people working obviously still in training and got my order taken properly but given the wrong items and meat on a vegetarian item sucks.. sometimes have great service others are lacking.

I work right next to this location and although I do not eat there hardly at all, I constantly see employees walk out of this Taco Bell, and going to their car to smoke cigarettes in the same apron they wear in the kitchen.. unsanitary and disgusting.

One star because of association with Grubhub. They never delivered my order but managed to take my money. Used Door Dash for a place next door and received my order in 15 minutes.  Like my Taco Bell but you now have ticked off customers.  Rethink your business partners.
Fix your online hours. This is filler text because Yelp sucks and is a poorly designed product.

Ok, normally I like Taco Bell but this one is one of the worst. be prepared to sit in the Drive-Thru for 15 to 20 minutes waiting just to get to the window and when you get there you can bet it will be some young lady with bad attitude as I just got,  and please check your order before driving away cuz I got home ......no caramel apple empanada and I refused to go all the way back to get that.  also I asked for no tomato on the nachos.... I got tomatoes.  

and this was not just a one-time random occurrence.  this is the second time we've been to that Taco Bell drive-thru and waited. you might as well just turn your car off.  Again check your order before driving away.

Open at 7 like the sign says . Almost 8 and still not open. I believe they need a responsible manager to run this business. Maybe the owner should get involved this isn't the first problem I've encountered

It seems to be a gamble on if you will have a bag of great food or if it will be a huge squishy yucky mess. Today, it was great. They marked each item so we knew what was under the wrapper. We order on the app and pay through that. It earns you points and is fast and safe. They hand out the sealed bag in a clear bin so there is little chance for spreading anything. I really appreciate them labeling the burrito supreme so there are no shocking surprises for the one that doesn't like sour cream.

RUN AWAY! Today as my first experience back at Taco Bell in years and I was optimistic. I ordered a chicken soft taco supreme only to get a normal one with 4 pieces of chicken thrown on top. I also ordered two chicken quesadillas with sour cream on the side and got them with the sour cream on them. The final straw was finding a PUBIC HAIR in my side of sour cream. I'm so disgusted I can't even stand it.

Huge thank you to you guys! Me and my crew are lineman here for Hurricane Dorian and they were closed when we came here but they opened up the door for us and allowed us in to eat. Support those that support you! Thank you !!
The workers are super nice. Very positive. Music inside was great positive music as well. Food was good and fresh. I really enjoyed this location over many and many I have gone to.

I don't think the employees there really care about the customer. She gave no forks or napkins with my order. I ordered a smothered burrito - unbelievable, what am I supposed to my food with, my hands?

Went there to go through the drive thru. Got there at about 5:30, got my food at 6:20.
