Almost an hour of waiting for 3 tacos....... and I used to work fast food so I understand there is a wait front time to time, but not a hour. And then when I finally got my food I was given the wrong sized drink. I'm not sure if it's the management or not but this location is always extremely slow....

I have eaten at this location many times.  (probably 40-50 times over the years.)  The last 10 visits have been horrible.  Wrong items or toppings and almost always, missing items that are on the receipt which I paid for.  Terrible attention to detail time and time again.  I would strongly recommend to eat at a different store.  Any restaurant!  Just not at the Bithlo Taco Bell.  It will save you time and an unpleasant experience.  The owners or owners group must be incompetent clowns for the consistent level of mistakes simply filling an order.  I mean you have a piece of paper and a computer monitor which details what each item is.  I understand mistakes happen, but systems should be established and maintained to eliminate and fix consistent errors  I would either extensively retrain the managers or fire them.  You are a national chain for Gosh sakes!!

Consumer Beware- go to Chick-fil-A instead.  There is a reason they destroy Taco Bell and Yum group on customer service rankings every year.

Let ME tell you if anyone anywhere went off on ME I'll jump down THEIR throats 100 times worst they'll be running to mommy. DO NOT EVER take CRAP OFF employees anywhere. PUT THEM IN THEIR PLACE. U PAY THEIR WAGEs rather it's CRAPPY or good pay. DAMN KID's NOW a DAY'z.

There's not much to evaluate when it comes to a standard fast-food place, but going to this taco bell I felt compelled to give them some good feedback when I felt that their rating (2 stars) did not match my experience. 

I went in a random afternoon time, which probably affected it, but the cashier was really nice and friendly and made an effort to get to know me. The lobby was pretty clean and it wasn't too busy. Everyone smiled and seemed happy to be there.

I tried the new quesalupa and a chicken quesidilla. Both tasted awesome and consistent with what I expected and I got my food quickly. I still like the regular chalupa better than the quesalupe but I did try it. 

No complaints!

This Taco Bell never lets me down. I went today and had he usual good experience. Drive thru at 1 was full but it flowed well enough. No one crazy special ordered or picked up for a team, so it moved along. I got my usual junk food splurge and it all came out as they were trained to do: nachos supreme, crunchy taco, and five layer burrito with a Sierra Mist. 

They say you are getting old when everything seems more expensive than before. Well, I'm getting seriously old because I remember I could have ordered all that for less than a Lincoln! Well, it was still a decent deal.
There's a Taco Bell near Fred Meyer on Cornelius pass. Just go there. The customer service alone should be enough.
I had a metal skrew in my breakfast burrito. It was not pleasant when I bit down on it. Hopefully it was not intentional by the cooks.

I go to this Taco Bell about twice a week because it's some what convenient. About 90% of the time there's something wrong with my order it's either the wrong order or it's cold in the middle or sometimes they don't even call out your number and toss it to the side from the door. This time I asked why was my order wrong and the lady at the counter said rudely "it's not my fault you can't read the board" and asked the guy behind her to make me what I ordered which was a "cheesy Gordita crunch" I watched them all roll their eyes and slap everything together. While they was doing it they all started speaking Spanish. Saying "I don't know how to order" and "hurry up so we can get him outta her" by the way I'm Hispanic myself so I understood everything they was saying I was just covered up because of the cold weather so they must of thought I was something other than Hispanic. I've been eating at Taco Bell for year but this is by far the worst Taco Bell I've ever been to in my life, I know it's in a mall but come on. They gave me my order cold again and I was just done no need to argue. This Taco Bell workers need to be retrained on everything from the food to the customer service aspect. I've seen multiple times them messing up orders and not caring and giving attitudes. Please fix this problem before you lose good customers

Been stuck in this drive thru for an hour now. Lady behind us is honking and getting feisty. Don't know what they are smoking on their breaks here but it must be good. 

Update: order was wrong. Manager is obviously flustered but she's also trying to tell us it's our fault. Always an adventure coming here.

Man I love TACO BELL FOOD but this is SLOW THESE PEOPLE DO NOT LIKE DO THEY WORK .. Now almost 15 minutes later with no line in store or drive thru they still don't have my food done and on top of that they just lost my order crazy I guess during shift change no work can be done
If you have 30 minutes to wait for drunk food. This is the Taco Bell to come to. Took 20 minutes to order and another 10 for the actual food.

Omg. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE!!  Went thru the drive thru. Guy was horrible. Rude. Wouldn't listen. Horrible. Ordered 2 burritos bean only - no cheese no onion. He even asked if we had a special order and we said yes. STILL WRONG!  Asked for a receipt. He "lost" it. How can you lose a receipt ?  It's right there on the machine!  Got home not only were the burritos wrong but missing a whole meal too!  Oh yeah - tried to call the store - right to a message saying TOO BUSY CALL BACK LATER!

This doesn't deserve five stars - nothing in Cambridgeside Galleria really deserves five stars.  However, it's still Taco Bell and it's still delicious.  Five stars to the franchise for single handedly "McDonaldizing" Mexican Food.  By "McDonaldizing" I mean taking some type of food and making it into its own brand (which tastes nothing like the typical cuisine). For example -  McDonald's doesn't really taste like a typical cheeseburger, but moreso it just tastes like... "McDonald's".  That said, if I feel like real mexican food, I'll head to Border Cafe, or Chipotle in the least... but there is just SOMETHING that makes you want to crave Taco Bell like no other.  The Cheesy Gordita Crunch (which may actually be discontinued) is really the kind of thing you can order when you have no idea what you want - it covers all the bases.  Partner your meal with a Mountain Dew and your body is SET for carbs/fat/sugar/etc. for the rest of the month.  

Hey, every once in a while you need it man.

A year and a half later...Taco Bell and this location have decided they don't care about their customers and never responded to my multiple attempts at customer feedback. I never wanted anything for free, I don't need your attention or your apologies...I do, however, deserve my money back for chalupas that were never given to me. To not even respond to negative feedback is an atrocious business move by both the managers of this location and corporate. Keep letting children run your place into the ground. Clearly you don't give AF. Don't spend money here.

its 12:00 and they closed. id like my gas and time back
oh yea... and i was a minute past 12 and they wouldnt even serve me. pathetic franchise management.

NO STARS ARE DESERVED: Possible legal/workplace disciplinary action up to termination+anger management education. 
First off, let me apologize for the late review. I should have been able to post it much closer to the actual date of experience. If ANY TB employees read these reviews, PLEASE check the previous week's schedule, 04.06.20. Whoever was scheduled to work the closing shift (through 2 am) displayed such WILDLY inappropriate behavior towards myself and my husband I had to write this review, & may take it up the chain of command until I can go no farther. She raised her voice at us, cursed at us from the very first words she spoke & continued to use profane language towards us multiple times, for the duration of our interaction.  
Let me explain our part in this; I drive for Postmates. Most of the time I like working late at night bc the roads are mostly my own, so less stressful navigating to unknown areas. My husband rides along to assist navigation, provide morale support & back-up security should the need arise. We received a notification to pick up a new delivery at Taco Bell on 122nd, PDX, OR. When we arrived it was 1:55 am. There looked to be a transient male pedestrian at the drive up menu where orders are placed. We waited. And waited. And waited. at 2:15 am my husband decided to walk up to the drive through window and see what was holding things up and why we had not even been acknowledged. As if waiting for that exact, perfect moment to attack, the female inside lashed out at my husband verbally and when he began to walk back to the vehicle she became louder & more offensive and literally began to come through the window towards us. The whole upper half of her body was hanging out the drive-up window!!!! As she was screaming at us & calling us liars!!!!!.  
I WILL FIND OUT YOUR NAME & I WILL BE PURSUING THIS ISSUE.
TB MGNT; I'll be calling you shortly.

Out of a dozen or so fast food restaurants ive hit up on the way to or from (my "essential") work this week - This is the ONLY one ive found with employees actually wearing gloves and taking precautions to treat this corona virus situation seriously. The only downside is that with those precautions, their hours have changed so i can no longer stop by on my way into work. Thank you for actually caring.
I came to get some food through the drive thru, Marcus took my order and made me smile and laugh with him. Such an awesome personality and upbeat nature about him! Let there feeling good and happy!

I'm not a huge fan of Taco Bell, partially because I used to work there when I was younger.  I stopped by the location in Chamblee off of 285.  I wanted to purchase the shredded chicken quesadilla melt on their value menu as a simple snack.  

Unfortunately, I found out that Taco Bell has announced that they are discontinuing all of their shredded chicken menu items on November 5.  This location is ahead of the curve by showing "out of stock" stickers covering the names of all of the shredded chicken items on their drive-thru menu board.

As someone who has always enjoyed their shredded chicken menu items, this will probably impact my desire to return anytime soon.  Nevertheless, I decided to get the traditional chicken quesadilla instead.  While it's not as good or as inexpensive as the shredded chicken melt, it was served warm with lots of chicken and cheese.

my food is wrong every time and a sloppy mess. i just expect it at this point and when i take it in the shift leader has the worst attitude. what ever  manager there on june 1, at 4:20pm has the worst attitude ever.  just a waste of time. the food being put together her attitude. the service is trash. the tacos are never filled


Update girl at driver window tonight at June 4 12;30am again still hates her job I guess. Gives the worst attitude when u ask her to correct something 


CHECK YOUR BAG BEFORE YOU PULL OFF

This has to be the WORST location of all Taco Bell's in the nation. Every time I stop there, the order is wrong and the food is cold. When I eat Taco Bell, I expect massive diarrhea. What I don't expect is the incompetent workers who get my order wrong and serve me cold food. You are better off driving to a different Taco Bell if you have the option, or just eat at the Wendy's next door. Hell, you might as well ask your local homeless bum to shit in a bag and cook it over a fire because that will be better than the cold dogshit the workers at this location serve you.

Woman at the drive through window had her mask pulled down while she was pouring our sodas. When I said,"You're not wearing your mask!" She pulled it up and rolled her eyes. Then, she immediately pulled it down and glared while she handed us our food. I would have asked for my money back and driven away but my cousin was starved and said to forget about it. Taco Bell drive through lady, you are disgusting and I will never be back there.

Ok. Late night. I see. But I did a mobile order. Specific details. 3 chalupa boxes. 1 with nachos /dip instead of cinna twist. No beans on burrito add guacamole.  I get cinna twist and a burrito with rice and ALL beans. I'm allergic to beans! Number 2 chicken burrito. I get beef with rice. Huh? Number 3. Regular. Just add rice. How it get sour cream on the taco. This is place sucks. I'm mad. Tempted to take that bean burrito back and leave it on the counter but I'm not. Just wont eat there again. Zero stars! Wasted my money.
Best Taco Bell in Apopka . I never usually have a mistake in my order . Just one time , but we're all humans . Never rude , so far . Lol
They were very helpful whoever worked at 1:06 am on Sunday January 11th, she is the most helpful Taco Bell employee I've ever felt with. Should give her a raise.

It's extremely sad when you go through the drive thru and they aren't busy at all and all I ordered was a 7-layer and bean burrito and a burrito supreme and they can't even get my order right. I got a bean and rice burrito and a 5 layer burrito and burrito surpreme. Very very pittiful you can't do your job right.

Great location. Staff is always very friendly. They do their best to move the line as quickly as possible. There are usually longer/slower lines when going at night or after the theme parks have closed. Disney Cast Member discount for any purchase of $5 or more.

The food was correct and good. However the from the time I pulled up to the speaker to the time I got my food. Those people are soo rude! Like if you don't like yo job get a new one don't be treating people like garbage..

Very unhappy with the level of service at this Taco Bell. After a 10 hour day at work, all I wanted to do was grab dinner to take home to my family. So when I got home to discover they had left out part of my order and I had to go back to get it I was not happy. When I got there and went inside, i had to wait another 5 minutes to get helped because there was NO ONE at the counter. Once I got my order, I asked what else they were going to do to make up for the mistake and they just stared at me like providing customer service was a foreign concept to them. The girl I assume was the acting manager then asked if I wanted her to call the store manager because she didn't know what they were allowed to do. After speaking with the manager she told me that they couldn't refund me or anything because we got the food. I said "so there's really nothing else you can do to make this right?" And she FINALLY said "I could give you a coupon for a free taco". Seriously? If you have "apology coupons" for free tacos, why wouldn't you START with that?? Like "Hey, sorry about that. Please accept these coupons for free tacos for the inconvenience while we fix your order" It's called CUSTOMER SERVICE people! 
At least the crunch wraps were good.

placed an online order and prepaid. when i get home i have missung items. i called to ask for the missing items to be refunded as i dont want to drive back in pouring rain. the employee who answered made no apology but simply i will have to contact the GM tomorrow they couldnt do that. an apology and at least asking for contact info for the gm to contact me would have been nice. i did get nachos that were stale and the lid was not on and fell all over the bag. Don't think i will be back here. pretty gross and now i need to track down a gm for their mistake.

Aahhhh ... Taco Bell.

Ok, if you're expecting gourmet food, this is definitely not the place to come to.  Taco Bells are known for coming up with inexpensive fast quasi-Mexican food.  I had a work colleague who was born and raised in Mexico City.  He never moved from there, but he visited the US a few times.  When I visited Mexico for a work assignment, Carlos decided to take me to one of the best taco restaurants in Mexico.  While we were waiting for our food to be served, I asked him what his favorite American fast food restaurant was, and he answered,"I love Taco Bell food, because they call it Mexican, but you can't get that food in Mexico."  His reply caused my Coca Cola that I was drinking to burst out through my nostrils for the first time ever.  He had me laughing so hard, but he was also serious about loving the food too!

To be honest, I like Taco Bell's basic three crunchy tacos meal that comes with a drink (iced tea for me).  It brings back good memories of being  in my late teens and just being able to afford to eat at Taco Bell.  lol.  And the tacos still taste the same!  Crunchy hard corn tortillas, with the indescript meat that is easily recognizable by its unique very slightly spicy flavor, crisp shredded lettuce and shredded orange colored cheese tossed on top of the rest of the ingredients like they were trying to hide something (most likely the indescript  meat).  Life was so much simpler then.

So, fast forward to today.  I used the Taco Bell phone app to order the meal, and told the voice coming from the drive thru speaker that I was there to pick up my mobile app order.  Even though there were four cars ahead of me, it took probably 5 minutes for me to get to the window, which I felt was great!  The three crunchy tacos meal is still the same as it always has been, flavor wise.  Fast ordering, fast line for fast food.  The only thing that I could complain about was that I had ordered unsweetened iced tea but was given sweet iced tea.  It was ok with me, though, because this sweet tea was not sickening sweet.

I don't know whether or not sitting indoors is an option.  I know that if it is an option, there are a lot of parking spaces available.  Employees were efficient today!

If I could give half a star rating I wouldn't but since a star is the least it'll do. Very rude staff, doesn't give receipts and missing items from orders. Like how can you have a system that tracks orders and you can't go into it to see what I ordered, make it make sense. If you're reading this review SAVE YOUR MONEY!!!!!
This place looks like a crack house. I'm scared to go there because people are just hanging outside looking like they are about to rob me.
Still making people pull around to the parking lot because they are too slow. I thought corporate was supported to put a stop to this.

Like any tacobell this place is better during the day time and not at night. I've Been here several times and they've forgotten a few items over the time and have made some item poorly. That being said they are consistent with giving you lots of sauce which is awesome!!
Worst Taco Bell you could go to. I do it out of convenience and my order is always wrong. Just spent $25 there and nothing was right, several things missing. Get it together

Uber eats driver here.15 minutes k. The drive thru they can't seem to get it together . Edit it was 20 minutes and I left without saying thank you.i was very upset that they were high and moving slow and didn't knit the order.

My boyfriend and I came to this location for food we ordered the following:
2 crunch-wraps (1 without tomatoes)
3 tacos
2 chicken quesadilla 
2 burritos with no onions

When we got our order we started with the Crunchwrap one of them was supposed to not have tomato in it but both of them did in addition the burritos had onions on them which we asked them not to add onions. The associate managing the window was also rude and sounded disinterested in what she was doing. Her customer service was not acceptable and was rude and aggressive.
Very very unsatisfactory service.  I won't be visiting this place ever again.  Avoid at all cost.

It is Taco Bell so you should not expect much but this place is pretty bad.

The line was extremely long and slow. The contact-less drive-thru is a nice touch.

I ordered the Chalupa Box and triple layer nachos. Nachos were fine. Chalupa had almost no meat. burrito was mostly sour cream. Taco and cinnamon twists were good.
not a good taco bell. writing more cuz yelp won't let me post blah blah blah lol yeet

They do have an app where you can order and pay so it makes the pick up go much quicker. Although, it does not work if there is no signal so you have to order from the drive through. They do take Apple Pay though so no credit card is needed. We had to pull forward while we waited on our food. For waiting on our food, it didn't seem like it was hot. So we had lukewarm food but it was still decent.

Just had the worst food I've ever gotten from any Taco Bell.  Clearly no shits were given while making it.  Really sucks because we were looking forward to it.  I thought about taking pictures, but really don't think anyone there would care.  Lame.  Don't get your hopes up.

I travel around the Atlanta area a lot and when I find one I like I tend to frequent that location.  Like the one in Swanee - I paid for double meat - and they actually gave me DOUBLE MEAT!  The reason I'm excited, is because some dont put ANY meat in them no matter how much you pay - like the one at 5201 Memorial Drive, Stone Mountain GA - the WORST offender of them all in my opinion.  EVERY SINGLE TIME I've gone there, even if I pay for double meat, there's non to be found!  Exaggeration? Go see for yourself.  Once I got into an argument with the manager and he acted like he has these conversations every day... somehow I believe he does.  Avoid this location if you don't like being ripped off.  The one star is for this location - I call them skimpy bell - avoid skimpy bell.

This was the best tacobell experience i have had in months! I was first surprised I received napkins and hot sauce. I then bit into my food which was hot but the tortillas were not burnt, i was again pleasantly surprised! The employees were all so friendly! even though it was during the rush of 9 cars in the drive thru i was still out of it within two minutes. After eating my food, I couldn't wait to tell the employees how great this experience was, I looked for the receipt and couldn't find it.  I went back to order more food just to get the receipt. Second time around they were just as kind and my food was cooked to perfection. I go to taco bell multiple times a week and this is by far the best taco bell i can remember. Thank you all so much for not only doing your job accurately but with a smile. You turned my day around. YOU ROCK!

I came in to order, because the drive-through line was very long. There was one person working the counter and making all the food. Although he had a disability, he was amazing and did a great job. However, no one helped him out at all! I even asked the manager and he said he really didn't bother with me because that's not where he gets most of his business. There were at least eight people there working and only one person took orders and made the order at the same time. Even when I've gone in the drive-through before, it's taking at least 20 minutes for me to get through the drive-through. This place is seriously mismanaged.
Me and my driver came her for lunch. The place is clean and not busy. Some pretty ladies work here. Food ok.

my boyfriend and I were craving taco bell and this definitely hit the spot! they even made our nacho fries extra crispy. this time my favorite was the baja blast & the doritos locos taco. thank you taco bell

0 stars. I've been in the drive through for over 30 minutes. The person in front of me had to say "hello I know you hear me" into the mic for them to acknowledge her. There are still 7 cars behind me.... no drive through should take this long. I just got off work and I was starving and I will probably be dead by the time I get to the drive through window for my food

I thought about giving this Taco Bell 4 stars before we finished our lunch but decided on 3 stars. The last four times we have gone through the drive through, our food has been smashed, missing items, and the special items without onions were not labeled so eating thee food is an  allergic guessing game. The times that I called to tell them we were missing items, they said just tell us when you come back through that you are owed items. We did. The person at the drive through said that without a managers name and written information, they would not do that. The person started to get really upset and we just gave up. Today, we walked in and ordered. There wasn't anyone at the counter so we ordered from the order computer. The good thing about that was we could specify no onions. They took Apple/google pay. Our no onions burritos were in a SEPARATE bag! That made us so happy. When we got home and went through the bags, we were only missing one item. That's better than last time. The food was hot. So, previous visits would have earned them a 1, since I don't appreciate people accusing us of lying about missing items and that all the food was mixed up in the bags, but they have redeemed themselves. We know which items were onion free and were only missing one item this time. 


I am updating the review because this visit is back to the normal Taco Bell experience. Food was not labeled. It was loud in there and the food was not that good. I didn't finish either of my items.
One of the better Taco Bell's I have been too. They are have the same ingredients but the customer service at this one is above par. Always friendly.

I would rate it no stars if I could. Went threw the drive threw. Asked for no sour cream in the burrito, well got sour cream and ask for them to remake it, they refused. Got a large drink, they put pretty much just ice in it, asked if I could remake my own drink, they said I had to pay for a new one. 
Great customer service Taco Bell, Not! No wonder this location is poorly rated.

Worst Taco Bell I've been too! I ordered a bean chalupa and when I was about to eat it the beans were warm and the whole chalupa was frozen af! Lazy employees need to be fired! Wouldn't be surprised if it closed down soon. Something is wrong with my order every damn time! Never coming back again.
Fast food...they should change this to slow food! Slowest Taco Bell ever! Takes 10 minutes+ any time I hit the drive thru.
Yeaaah, this is the most lit Taco Bell. Drive through has been good all of the times of day I happen to come through. Quick service and they're usually polite unless it's busy.
Food was cold. Customer service was horrible. Won't be back!!! We wanted to place two separate orders, and was told we would have to drive around twice for two orders!!! Wtf?

I never thought I'd be on Yelp reviewing a damn Taco Bell, but here I am. The main reason I'm writing a review is to keep people AWAY from this location. 

First, the drive thru is SLOW. The reason it's slow is their customer service. The employees at this location simply don't care. Usually Taco Bell employees are timed on how long they take to serve each customer. They don't seem to follow those guidelines at this location. Multiple times I've received the wrong order. Multiple times I've received bad customer service. More than once I've spent my entire 30 minutes break sitting in the drive thru. Once I heard the employees talking amongst themselves. They must have used 5 curse words while I was sitting at the window. I don't care about cursing, but I work in customer service. Extremely unprofessional.

The second and most important reason you shouldn't go to this location...they've made me sick TWICE. I work near this Taco Bell and my coworkers told me not to go here. They've all been sick at least once, some of them twice from this place. The first time I didn't follow their advice and ended up on the toilet all night. I thought it was a coincidence. Tonight I went for the first time in months. TMI, but I have horrible diarrhea and vomiting now. This is FOOD POISONING. I've had food poisoning twice in my life and it has been from this place. I noticed they cut corners when it comes to customer service. It makes you wonder how many corners they cut when it comes to cleanliness and proper food handling.

Tomorrow when I feel better, I will be reporting this place. Something isn't right for me to be sick twice from eating here. 

So there you have it. You've been warned.

Looked at the reviews before coming here and pretty much found it to be spot on average. Nothing special or bad just average. Good Staff at the counters however the wait was long for the quality delivered.
Got here for some breakfast on the way to cedar point.  Yummy food, ate inside, speedy service.

It's an ok place for cheap eats. Ok I'll ad more info since yelp said my previous review was too short. Good location  ok food. Good prices. Nice to be located near a Target and steak and shake.  Good location cheap eats
Slowest service I've ever dealt with in fast food. In town for work and came twice in the same week, unbelievably slow both times..drive thru and inside

Came in for lunch with my whole family.  The guy at the counter was exceptionally accommodating and efficient, which was very appreciated since we had a rowdy toddler with us.  I would have given 5 stars, but the bathrooms were kind of gross.

Taco Bell.

I actually had to "add" this Taco Bell to Yelp...the one that is paired up with KFC in Billerica, MA.

So I am "extremely" privileged to bring this to the Yelp-Billerica Radar.  *rolls eyes

So Taco Bell...we all know what it is.  It is cheap eats...for food that vaguely reminds you of Mexican cuisine.

Amirite?

I'd say there are two items worth getting at Taco Bell.

Tacos...or the Meximelt.

Hard or Soft, the Tacos are cheap eats.  The Meximelt could be considered a rolled up cheese quesadilla with that special mexican meat-like concoction in it.  Drown either of these in Hot Sauce...the Fiery sauce isn't fiery at all unless you have pale white skin and think Ketchup is spicy.

Don't ask more questions than you need.

For $5 you can fill your belly with a good amount of food...and then ponder on why you ate there while you're sittin' on your favorite toilet of choice.

Did I say that out loud?
The lady at the drive through was on those new wireless Apple earbuds and speaking in Spanish and I could understand everything..... and it was not pleasant at all. Not cool.
I did not get sick. That's about the best i can say for this insipid inauthentic chain restaurant.

Good food great service
...nice people!! I go every day @ 9 am...very clean good experience nicely priced budget food!!
I have been in the drive through line for a half hour now and I am still two cars from the pick-up window. If I wanted to wait this long, I would have gone to a proper restaurant.

They're pretty quick on getting your order out, and I've never had a problem. 

HOWEVER, trying to find and get to the place is an adventure in of itself. It's across the street from the mall, hidden behind O'Charleys. Like almost literally hidden, you get behind the building and BAM turn into it quick. Its on a corner of the main parking lot driveway and the parking thru lane, so there will be traffic and it will suck, so be warned. But the food is good and fresh, so no worries on that part.

My food was okay. The hard shell taco was better than the chicken quesadilla. Mainly because the quesadilla was messy and a bit too spicy for my taste. We got the order rather quickly which was good. My complaint is the bathroom floor in the ladies bathroom was filthy and there was no toilet paper!!!
Nice people. Greeted me when I came in with a bit of courtesy. Fast! My food was ready before I filled my water. I just can't give TB 4 or 5 ever. It's barely food.

Horrible customer service, bland food, newly remodeled. This all proves you cannot polish a turd. They need management to step in and properly oversee service and food quality. If this is corporate controlled they could benefit by a few surprise visits. Understaffed yet clean. Maybe it's because no one comes into the lobby of this establishment.

Worst Taco Bell ever. I used to work at Taco Bell and this is a poor excuse for a Taco Bell. I was supposed to get supreme tacos but received regular tacos instead. No big deal right? Well it wouldn't have been if the tacos had not been soaking wet. Literally, they had water inside the tacos. I couldn't even eat them. They also forgot multiple items on the order. It was just ridiculous. This was also not a one time thing. Every time I go to this location they forget at least one item every time.

Just wanted to update my review. In ten months this place hasn't changed I have been there a good dozen times since my initial review and they get at least one thing wrong every time. It is just amazing.

Unbelievably slow. Always a wait. Staff takes forever for simple order. If you're vegetarian, don't bother. They don't understand...I asked to sub beans to my order and they ADDED beans on top of the meat after I said "no meat"

This used to be a good location; what happened?  Horrible customer service! They were rude to both me and my girlfriend, seemed pretty bothered that we'd disrupted their day, and there's a pretty pungent / sour smell inside.   It's a fast food restaurant, so I'm not expecting to be wowed, but hey common courtesy isn't too much to ask for.
I ordered it one night after work and got home which is not far at all from the Taco Bell and everything was cold . did the survey and never heard back from anyone.

Extremely long wait times. Staff seems unorganized and confused about almost everything. The soda machine was out of a drink someone else was looking to have. I would avoid this Taco Bell location at all costs. The drive thru line was ridiculously long so I figured I would come in. Worst choice I've ever made. The dining room is so dirty I'll probably eat in my car, if I ever get my food. The man at the register was more concerned with his phone than taking orders or providing customer service. I won't be coming back in the future, I would literally go to any other location than come back to this Taco Bell.

I'm not sure how to review a taco bell. Especially since I only came to try the nacho cheese fries...

I had to get the nacho fries after the web of fries trailer (watch it if you haven't!). They weren't had. I wasn't expecting something good tbh and they actually were. Best fries I've had? Not by a long shot. But for 1 dollar (yes 1 dollar) you get a container of fries and some hot gooey nacho cheese. Well worth it!
I can't give a great review. My crunch wrap supreme was far from supreme. It didn't have enough of that cheese stuff. It was falling apart. However it still tasted good!!
The workers constantly close early... And not like 15 min early... Like over an hour early. Love Taco Bell normally but I hate this location's customer service, it's appalling.

Love this Taco Bell but it is freezing in there in the winter, inside needs updating to make the dining experience better especially since it is the Polaris area and there is a lot of competition, needs to be redesigned so when the doors open you don't feel like you are eating outside. Quality and service is great.

Waited in the drive through line for 20 plus minutes with only two cars in front of me. They then gave me a cold burrito with meat on after I specifically asked for no meat because I am a vegetarian....
It is what it is.  Taco Bell is fast and cheap!

One of the few places that offer a value menu with delicious items. This is my favorite place when the budget gets tight. I can get a cheap meal that I actually enjoy eating. Yes, it is just a chain operation but quality has been consistently good on every visit so I give it a thumbs up.

Let's be honest, there's no point to reviewing Taco Bell, especially one on the edge of the projects, but I realized I have no one-star reviews on Yelp, and I need to even out my distribution, so this very Taco Bell wins the award of worst place to eat I can think of off the top of my head.

It should actually win an award.  Where else can you be exposed to contaminated food, buy drugs, and get shivved, all while poisoning your body for ninety-nine cents? It's like a genetically-engineered super mecca of crap.  Nice, always wanted to end a review with a poop joke.

The absolutely worst experience I've ever had in a drive through. It's crazy to compare employees at places like chick fill a that are ALWAYS considerate, then look at this MANAGER who obviously hates every aspect of her job. She said her name was Jackie, who knows but she was the manager on duty this Monday June 20th at 9 pm. She laughed when we asked to speak to the manager after she was so rude and said "i am the manager, and you can't get me fired, I just make tacos,". We never said anything about her getting fired, we just didn't appreciate the attitude when we were trying to order. And then the food was HORRIBLE. see attached picture if the most pathetic taco ever.
Horrible service .... people are so rude! ... they take way to long for one order....... I been in line for 20 mint just for 1 order of nachos.

I looked at the reviews on here out of curiosity before I visited this location. I went in with the mindset that it would be a bad experience. Well, what I experienced was exactly the opposite. I had stellar customer service and I was really impressed. The food was delicious too. I would recommend this location. I don't remember ever receiving this kind of customer service from Taco Bell ever!

The food was good, but the dining area was extremely dirty. Every single table had food remnants on them. I asked for someone to clean the table I wanted to sit at and the employee looked confused and said, "Is the table dirty?".

I have noticed that this restaurant has improved over large amounts of time but was a little worst now taco Bell is doing a spectacular job also the food is amazing and I do not regret eating here every time. I recommend this Taco Bell to anyone who prefers Taco Bell to be at it's finest.

Ridiculous is the only word I can come up with to describe what's going on here 08/29/2017 9:30 pm! If I didn't know better I'd say there was one person working here.... it's chaos behind The counter it seems no one really knows who's doing what?!? A conservative estimate would be 25 minutes from the time I walked in the doors to the time I was walking out of the doors with two burritos. Two customers in front of me simply requested their money be refunded and walked out with nothing

Poor customer service, they forget things you order and offer nothing but a sorry.  Cashier Amber has a bad attitude and I won't be coming back to this establishment. Not worth the TIME when all you will get is dissapointment. If ZERO stars was an option I'd have rated it as such.

The people who worked 07/26/18 at around 11:20 pm were super rude. They took a while getting the food out to the drive thru which I'm usually okay with. But when I got home the food was not made well, we got beefed five layers one without sour cream one without meat entirely. The cashier or whatever punk kid with his hat backwards was rude. Disappointed since I like to eat here a lot, I love t Bell and they really were terrible.

I know that most people only go through Taco Bell when they're drunk...but by the grace of God, we were actually sober and desiring Taco Bell. We pull up to the drive thru window, inform the man that we have two separate orders, and proceed with our first order. For some reason he puts us down for something that we never ordered, argues with us about what we ordered, and then swears at us because he's frustrated. I would expect this if I was hammered drunk going through the drive thru, but I'm clearly not. Screw this guy and this Taco Bell. One star only because I can't give zero.

There's not enough employee s working there they need more people the service is super slow there's only one employee doing the food and only one person at the register and the same person at the register is the one emptying the trash which is not sanitary at all  and the table top stay dirty for too long no one is there to clean them up

Your standard Taco Bell, but the woman who rang us up was ridiculously friendly and nice, I was not expecting that at any fast food place. I'm a sucker for the steak gorditas. Will be back again soon!

It's taco bell. There's really not much more to say.

It's always been fast when I've been in the drive-through. Great for late night food that you'll regret by morning.
Staff is very friendly! Drive-thru is quicker than going inside to order food. The inside is pretty clean.

Clean, new, fresh, friendly. What's not to like?  Yeah, putting in a Yelp review on a Taco Bell may seem a tad cheesy to some, but I wanted to point out that (Like the Wendy's nearby), these kind folk close LATE, 1am I think, and for those of us who work odd hours (And, in my case, that's REALLY odd hours), places like this can, in all honesty, really lift my spirits.  Thanks, Taco Bell, for staying open late, having a new, classy looking store near a road I'm on often (Think of this as "east Sand Lake"), and takes credit cards!!!!

This Taco Bell is as good (or bad, depending on how you feel about them) as any other.  It's newish, so it's always nice and clean and I would ALMOST go as far as saying that it's an oasis of sorts on this part of 82nd Avenue.

My only complaint (and the very one that prompted me to write this review) is that the music played on the PA here FUCKING ROTS.  I don't know what aural cesspool they dredged it from, but it's every auto-tuned, over-produced top-40 teenybopper cliche you've ever heard combined into one soul-crushing onslaught of lame, generic disco/techno beats and despicable sub-mongoloid lyrics.  I like Taco Bell food well enough, and the "atmosphere" at this particular location is alright, but the infantile, sub-standard music has got to go! 

I know, it's fucking Taco Bell, and musical diarrhea is appropriate, but GOD DAMN IT this is Portland and my unrealistically optimistic ass wants to believe that even shitty fast-food chain restaurants can do better than this.  If you can't give me some music that's WORTH A FUCK while I shovel corporate nachos into my mouth then FUCK YOU, GIVE ME SILENCE!!!
Just went through the drive thru. Mexican Pizza not cut, ask for hot sauce got fire sauce, ordered pintos and cheese...no spoon. Not recommend
These guys suck. The late nite crew is incompetent and rude. I hate having to eat here.

Been to this location twice and had delicious food. We went through the drive-thru during late evening hours. Both times we went, there was longer waiting times in comparison to other stores during similar operating hours. They also made a slight error when executing one of the orders replacing the crunchy taco in the big box meal with another burrito. However the service was friendly and the food was very yummy. The chalupa was generously piled with toppings on a puffy and warm shell.

I gave them one star at this location due to the under filled tacos.(pic included) When I took the food back to the counter, the manager looked at it and said, "Whats the problem"? lol. He then said that I must have ordered it with no lettuce! You can see some lettuce and I definitely did not say that. Another customer had the exact same issue.

you'd think weed was legal here..given how frequently the employees bork your orders, one would think they MUST be high outta their damn minds. having eaten taco bell both in california, seattle, and denver though, that's probably just offensive to ganja users who still manage to actually do their jobs properly.

waited in line for my food about 15 minutes with about 5 cars in front of me before driving off for a few minutes then realizing i'd received someone else's order. when i came back and knocked on the door, the girl (i think) gave me a repulsed look as if i was irredeemably rude before promptly turning and walking away and ignoring me.

ok. the reason i knocked on the door was because other drunk patrons had shown up and now there were TEN cars in line. so i waited about 20-30 !@#$ing minutes just to get the order i'd placed to begin with. lo and behold, they were out of 1 of the 3 items i ordered.

they correctly gave me 2 of the 3 items i'd ordered and didn't even bother asking for the initial wrong order that they gave me back. unfortunately i was allergic to literally all of it so it's not like i walked away with extra free items because they were going in to the trash.

i had time stamps from my phone indicating i literally spent just about an hour getting some shitty food that i really shouldn't even have been eating to begin with. the employee at the window knew he fucked up, and was pretty chill. initially i was apoplectic but it took so damn long to get back to the ordering window 2nd time 'round due to the queue that i already cooled off by then too and wasn't rude.

as humans, we all blunder. working at 2 am for a shit wage serving drunk dipshits like myself (imagine the typical taco bell consumer at that time), you're going to be unmotivated, presumably. so i don't fault the employees or hold any grudges against them, but this understanding still doesn't rectify or alleviate my shitty 1 hour taco bell experience. boooo
When in the mood for Mexican food, and the name "Taco" in taco bell is proof enough to make you think its authentic-- then "Taco Bell" is the place to be.

I couldn't believe that I waited behind ONE car for 15 minutes and then when I made it to the window they didn't even know what my order was even though there were no other cars. Then I finally received my food and when I made it home to eat THERE WAS BARELY ANY MEAT. I had shell lettuce and cheese. It literally looked like someone sprinkled meat in the center and that's it. I was so mad.
Was closed at 10:30 pm when they were supposed to close at 11. Before that, they got my order wrong 3 times. Same window girl every time, hyper aggressive. I know it's Taco Bell but come on.
I just went to the Taco Bell in Lakeway and I swear I was in the Twilite Zone !  Some weird people work there !  Everyting was good .  Just a buch of weirdos .

TERRIBLE SERVICE. The to-go speaker/microphone was broken--causing customers to order and pay and be served at same to-go window. Staff goofing around with one another, unaware of the line of cars piling up. Seriously--we've never waited so long for fast food. Go anywhere but here.
Closes like an hours early everyday. Can't figure out if lazy employees or if the just need to update there hours

Taco Bell is Taco Bell, generally.

But this location has always been consistent in getting my order right, quickly going through the line of customers (if there is any) and always remembering to give me the hot sauce I request.

Parking has never been an issue, I've never had an issues with either ordering inside or going through the drive-through and I have never had an issue pre-ordering via the mobile app.

I have been In the drive thru for more than 45 minutes 06/17/18. The person taking the order was cursing on the speaker using vulgar language. I am never coming back to this location again. Worst experience ever.
Was closed 5 minutes earlier than it said in the sign and they still didn't let me in. Didn't get to eat dinner because of it. Smh
Loaded potato griller and nachos are awesome. Honestly you can buy a bunch of things without breaking the bank. Drive thru is pretty fast and legit.
Service is always average. Lobby and drive thru are both dirty. Drive thru usually is busy and the employees usually forget an item or two. Typical of an older taco bell location.

Late night dinner pick up. Got the Doritos taco. Taco was stale as ever like it was left out for a while then my chicken Quis was just nasty as well. If I weren't so tired I would have went back for my money
Went in 20 minutes ago ordered the new chalupa box and I didn't even get that got something else
Nom! Nom! Nom!  After a long session of pumping iron - I like to down a dozen tacos!  Yum!

It's no secret that I love fast food and the fact that I'm currently the Duke of this Taco Bell leads me to believe I might need to start taking some sort of cholesterol medication. Sure, I could just start eating better, but what's the fun in that?

I don't care what they say about their beef. It's good and I love that's it so greasy it practically melts out of the chalupa shell. Oh, and the cheesy fiesta potatoes... fried potatoes, processed cheese wiz, and a big gob of sour cream. Gimme, gimme, gimme some of that!

This place gets a bad reputation because of the sketchy apartments across the street. The drive-thru is quick and the parking lot is really bright, so even though I only come here at night it's not really that big of a deal. Just keep your doors locked and leave a little room between you and the car in front of you in case of the unlikely event of an emergency.

#Yelp365 - 51/365

Great food service... wait on second thought the drive the line slowed down. I jumped the gun. This is crap. Wait on second thought it is actually picking up again... great friendly service. I'm loving it. Wait... the food might be taking a while but i might just be analyzing time wrong. Not sure if i fully believe in time right now. Oh wait here he is with the finished product. Alright final answer eh... not bad, pretty friendly staff associate.
Giod value for the money, line can get very long though.  So take a look before you drive up or could spend 20 mins easy

I returned  to Taco Bell  today at 2pm to pick up an order that they screwed up last time I was there when I used drive through. When I got ho me my order was not what I ordered so I called and talked  to a manager SHE said please  come back and I will make your order right. I told her I was under a tight time frame. She said ok i will hang your ticket up so we can remember what you ordered 
For your inconvenience I will throw in some cinnamon donuts. My name is xXxX. I forgot her name 
So today this young (unfriendly)man came form the back ask me how he could help. He said we through those tickets away after a week
So he said I'll honor it this time but not in the future. Of course he didn't give me the cinnamon donuts I was promised 
This man needs to return to customer service 101 class asap.
I was not told I Must return in a week to get my original order 
  By the way we didn't eat the order I got by mistake 
Bob

It's fast food, so you can't expect much. The food is standard fare, but I always wait what feels like 20 minutes (and once clocked, at 18 minutes) for my food in the late night drive thru. Even if there's only one other car.

FORGETS MY NACHOS EVERY TIME. 

I moved here in July, I have been to this location 4 times now, 4 out of 4 times I have ordered and paid for nachos but failed to receive them. 

I am in my 20's, I come to your drive through late at night, unfortunately for me, I rarely think to check my order before driving home. I should not have to do that every time I want a burrito and nachos. 

Double check your orders before sending them out.

The literal worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. Countless times I've been either left waiting at the order screen - which doesn't exist because someone ripped it out - for upwards of 10 minutes, or unable to order at all due to the store closing in the middle of the day because of "equipment malfunctions". On the rare occasions I've actually gotten my food, it was incorrect no matter how many times I sent it back, stale, improperly portioned, and overall disgusting. Seriously, don't bother.

Every time I try to go to this particular location they always have some type of mishap, and that's just when they're open.  Half the time I try to go there they're closed. This evening I tried to go there and they tell me they have no hot water they can't serve anybody. I work in the restaurant business, I get it, things happen.  Considering the amount of things that happen with this particular Taco Bell, and there inconsistent hours, they should just close for good or hire new management.
Got a crumpled up days old receipt in my bag. There was a crumpled up straw wrapper in my tostada box. Never again!

Like previous people have said, it's the slowest fast food place I've ever been to. I've waited multiple times well over 20 mins in the drive through. It feels like they literally have one person working the whole store. I'm writing this as I'm sitting in line because I have a ton of time. This will be my last time coming to this Taco Bell. 

UPDATE
I'm going to assume that "Lynn" works at this Taco Bell lol. Decided to give it a try 6 months later. Still horrible service. It was 11pm, two cars outside and one car in the drive thru. They asked me to hold on before I ordered and I sat there for 15 mins waiting. I finally just backed up and left. I have no idea how this place is still open or how they make any money.

I have always gotten sick after eating at every taco bell location I have been to.  Also when I used to work at a mall I could tell when the district manager was in because that was the only day they wore gloves.
I come here all time service is pretty good the foods always how I want it I never have any extra problems

I will say Westerville needed Taco Bell back in town.  The food is really good but I must say this is the slowest location I have ever been to.  Takes approximately 10 minutes to get your food every time and this is supposed to be fast food.  If it was my choice, I would not come here but my boys like it.  They need to step up their game.

What on earth takes this long to make a taco??? This is the second time I've been to this location both times super long wait. Even if they have no staff what the heck, I'm watching them just standing there! Two times was it for me, not coming back...ever!

If you know me closely, you know that I'm a taco bell fanatic. I love love love the nacho supremes, chicken gorditas, chicken burrito supremes and my absolute favorite part of Taco Bell is the fact that I know I can always come here to get a Pepsi, which is a big deal to me, with me being a Pepsi-lover in a coke-crazed town (ok - thats sounds bad ...coca-cola crazed town, my bad). Cops must like this place too, because every time I visit, I swear there's like 1 or 2 cop cars in the parking lot. Maybe they love Taco Bell as much as I do? Or maybe its the rather questionable activity that takes place in the area when the sun goes down? Hmmmm.....I'm taking off a star because of that but regardless, me loves me some Taco Bell :)
The place is so much better now that it has been redone. A great late night snack place.

Worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. The young girl on the speaker was SO rude and cut me off before I even finished my order. When we finally got the food, we were 1 taco short, and everything else was so soggy and falling apart. We didn't even get a receipt, otherwise I would have spoken to the manager to complain about this girl by name because she was so terrible. I'd rather drive the extra miles to Saugus just to avoid giving this place any more business. She sucked. Ruined my night.

I just witnessed one of the darkest aspects of humanity at this location.   An elderly Hispanic man was attempting to order food.  The all African American staff at this location were ridiculing him and making fun of him to his face.   The cashier said "this idiot don't even know English", directly to the customers face.  They proceeded to laugh and insult the elderly man.   If you want to end racism try ending these employees careers at Taco Bell.

As someone who has an autoimmune disease that limits what I can eat, Taco Bell is actually one of the few fast food restaurants I can go to. I went through the drive-through with my boyfriend at around 11:30 PM. Now, we knew that they were about to close, but the restaurant was not closed therefore they should still have the food that you would like to eat right? Well I was able to get my soft tacos with no problem, however my boyfriend wanted to order nachos and she stated that they did not have any cheese. He then asked for something else with steak, but they were out of that as well. It is so frustrating to us when we go somewhere and they are out of the food or don't want to melt the cheese so that they can make our food. The lady speaking to us was very sarcastic and rude, as we were trying to figure out what we could order that they actually had. At one point she even stated and I quote "we don't have whatever you want, we are about to close." So rude. Never going back to this location
8:30pm- been in the drive thru for over 20 mins now. it normally is slow here but holy Chet wtf. save yourself some time and go to the one on west parmer. sometimes they run out of beef

I do not typically review fast food restaurants, but I wanted to in this case to recognize an awesome employee.  My coworker and I visited Taco Bell during a busy lunch rush. It is a couple of days after Irma hit, many businesses do not have power, so as you can imagine Taco Bell was even more packed than usual.  

All of the employees were working really hard to expedite orders as quickly as possible. One stood out and that was Catricia who was working the counter. She greeted every single guest with enthusiasm, kindness, and serious positive vibes!  She never seemed stressed or frustrated despite the long line of people she had to take care of.  She made my day!  

On days I choose to hit a fast food place during the work day, I will try to hit this place in hopes of seeing her smiling face!
Best fast food joint I've ever been to. Staff is always extremely friendly, and nice,  and the food is spot on. Come here if you want to know how taco bell is meant to taste
Good god, they can't get a drive-thru order correct....ever. Prepare to be ripped off because the food you paid for will not be in your bag.

So, I don't each much Mexican period, and have only stopped into this Taco Bell a few times over the 4 years I have lived in the area. I will relay two recent stories. 

First, stopped in and grabbed some dinner. I ordered a couple taco supremes. I get home and realize that they are not taco supremes, they are regular tacos. Hmph. So I call the store and they tell me to come back and they will give me my correct order. Annoying, but I did end up with four tacos for the price of two. 

More recently, I went for their free Doritos Locos Taco promotion for the 2016 NBA Finals. The parking lot was packed! I am guessing alot of people were looking for the same thing. I enter and the cashier looks like she has an attitude and does NOT want to be there at all. She basically speaks almost no words. I make my order. She doesn't ask which flavor I want. Maybe that is part of the promotion? You don't get a choice? She just grabs a taco and hands it over. I thought to myself...hey, it's free so I'm not gonna complain. I got the Nacho Cheese version. I hate Nacho Cheese Doritos. But it was actually pretty good. Doesn't really taste like the Doritos thank goodness. 

Overall, I think the food is good for Taco Bell. They just have issues with the staff.

I will note...the curb cut for this restaurant is weird from Ponce de Leon. It's like you're going to Zaxby's.

The service was ok and I only ordered a bean burrito, but I can say for as busy as drive thru was (3 cars ahead of me) I was in and out within 3 minutes and to note what Beth H. said, my bean burrito was real cheesy and that is really nice!

This is the worst Taco Bell. We were so excited when this location opened so close to our house, yet because of their horrendous service (i.e. No service) we go to other locations, much further away. Today, I couldn't even purchase gift cards from this location. I was told that their manager is the only one with access...and he/she is not here...at lunch time. This is the same manager that asked for prospective employees to come in on a specific day, only to be on vacation. So sad. At least there's another one down the street.
It's Taco Bell.... Although, it should be noted the double decker taco is pretty genius!!! And the box combo value is pretty hard to beat!

I give 5 stars as this place deserves a better rating. Nice and kind employees. Their food is always consistent. Their drink machine is maintained really well. Nice and refreshing drinks as well as good selections. Considering it's shady location, they do really maintain the place really well in my opinion. Good job you guys.

It's cheap it's fast and it's reasonably tasty.  OK - yeah... it's not really real mexican food, but sometimes it will do in a pinch - especially late night when there's not much else open. 

This is pretty much the only big chain "fast-food" I will eat. Then again, I keep it really simple and order a couple bean burritos (with green sauce - which makes all the difference in the world) and maybe a soft taco. They really can't screw that up - discounting the one time they put like an entire handful of onions on my burrito.

This location on Airport is pretty typical. I've only been thru the drive thru. I have no idea why they have the crazy 2 window system (pay at the first and get food at the second. The same employee seems to be working both windows whenever I stop there.

Cheap, Fast or Good. Pick 2.

On paper, Taco Bell and KFC under the same roof seems like a teenager's wet dream.

In reality, it's the kind of disgusting that makes the Garbage Pail Kids look like supermodels.

In all fairness, these aren't exactly the best fast food chains in America.  The food from this location is pretty consistent with what you'll receive at other franchises across the country.  I've been back only because my mind craves it, despite how my body reacts afterwards.  And I've kind of made it a Super Bowl tradition to eat KFC.

I've been disappointed, though, in getting the wrong order twice -- most recently, I got a regular taco in place of a volcano taco -- and, yes, there is a big difference.

You're pretty much getting what you expect from here, so you shouldn't really be surprised.  The staff does a good job, given what they have to work with, and it's definitely a convenient location so I won't give them one star.

Two stars basically sums up the experience, since there is still an audience for this restaurant -- and, I'm sure, to someone this place is a small piece of heaven.  Just not me.
Quick and friendly service. Clean, so difficult to ask for more. Like their products.

I'm not sure why you have the help working the drive-through window when they can't hear anything you say to them. I've gone through a couple times lately and I have to repeat myself multiple times and even have to point out what's on the menu and explain what is in the taco to the person. This place is suffering!

I just started working in the Polaris area recently, and I usually love taco bell as a lunch option because all the other ones I have been to in Columbus are usually quick service, the staff is usually very polite and the food is great.  I usually order for all my co-workers and pick it up. 

This Taco Bell is a real swing and a miss.  Three separate times I have been to this location, and every time its the same experience but I always give a place a chance.  Everyone is entitled to a bad day.  But this is ridiculous.   The drive-thru girl is very disinterested or just down right rude.  She took my order with a very dull attitude, as if I was annoying or bothering her.  Then, when I got to the window, she said, "you want any sauce?"  with major attitude. I said, "yes, could I please get some Fire Sauce?"  and then she practically threw my bag at me, didn't give the sauce I JUST asked for and slammed the window on me.   The window was cracked, so frustrated, I asked "Can I please get the Fire Sauce?"  She grabbed my bag, threw my sauce in, abrasively handed the bag back and slammed the window on me again.
No "have a nice day" or anything.  
   As a person that works in customer service as a career choice, I understand how hard it can be and how frustrating it is to work with the public.  I get it.  I really do.  But this was unacceptable.  

I will not be returning.
A great location to dine at. Everything each time i,am here is always perfect and on point. I love this location...forever my favorite store.

Taco Bell is my favorite fast food restaurant and I eat there at least once a week and always at this location. It's right by my house. Service is always friendly but depending on the night can be really slow. Spent a good half hour in drive through tonight. They don't tend to mess up my order much so I let the wait go. I just assume they're short handed. No I be wants to work anymore. I was disappointed tonight they were out of empanadas and I really had my heart set on one. All in all Taco Bell is what it is and I will continue to go back cause it's cheap and delicious.

This is the best Taco Bell in pdx! The star of this place is Alaa. She was fantastic and the people that worked with her were great they all worked really well trying to figure out our order. I really like how they handle situations calmly and are positive to customers no matter what! That's it this is place to go from now on! You Rock Alaa!!
I just tried to go to this Taco Bell on my lunch break, and I was told that it was closed because no one showed up to work.

Worst Taco Bell by far. For whatever reason, they consistently are extremely slow,  and the employees seem particularly slow as well. I mean, seriously,  why does it take over10 minutes to get my food here when it normally never takes even half that time at any other "fast food" drive thru? One day I will remember not to come back regardless of the convenient location.

2 weeks ago i went to this location and ordered a nachos bell grande chicken soft taco w sour cream.  Immediately after eating about an hour i got horribly sick, Food poisoning. I called the location and they asked me for my name and number they said they would have a General manager call me.  My phone never rang.  Do not go there to this business.

They gave quick and friendly service at the drive-thru. The order was received accurately and we enjoyed our meal. The new Diablo sauce being offered finally came with the proper degree of heat that all fire dancers crave. Nice location...

I wish there was a zero star rating. Because that is all this franchise deserves. We have come to this particular Taco Bell time and time again and they've been open but not serve food because the store manager didn't show up. There have  been times we showed up after their opening hours and they weren't open because the manager never showed up. The service we get isn't always the greatest either. The food that they put together is not like the pictures. You get a Crunchwrap and all the sauce is at one end and all the eggs are at the other end there's no consistency.   The people that work here just don't take pride in what they do. If I had another option as close as this one to eat our breakfast I would do it in a heartbeat.
Taco Bell company needs to get this franchise in order.

I wish I could give negative stars...

This is the WORST Taco Bell I've ever been to, and sadly, it's the closest one to my house when we want Taco Bell.  I've gone there twice now, and it wasn't just the stupid girl in the drive through that ruined it the first time.  Apparently none of the employees are all that bright.

The first time I was there, this girl was chatting up an Asian girl at the window.  She kept talking about her brother and some situation.  She NEVER said ANYTHING to me.  Not even my total.  She just took our card since it was already in my hand... And then continued to talk about her brother's habits.  I think the Asian girl could tell I was annoyed and that this other girl was doing everything the wrong way, but it's not like she did anything to fix it.  I heard her tell the girl to ask me what kind of sauce we wanted, but the other girl was still talking about her brother, so I just told the Asian girl, "Mild and Verde."  Lucky us, they gave us two packets of each sauce for our three meals.

The second time, our three meals got three packets of verde and three packets of mild sauce.  So they're obviously sauce squaters at this particular Taco Bell.  And the girl at the window was alright.  She was decent in speed AND apologized for our wait... But then she forgot part of our order.

I had to go in to get the rest of our order because my biggest peeve about Taco Bell is eating it cold since it also instantly gets soggy.  I go in and this guy at the counter actually talks in slow motion. TALKS IN SLOW MOTION.  So while he's taking this girl's order, I'm standing in line angry.  This lady rolls up to the counter to complain about her empanada being cold in the middle, waits there for less than a minute, and someone from the back comes up and helps her, but pays NO attention to me... The person that was waiting there long before this lady.  Sorry I'm not in a scooter for being obese, Taco Bell, but I need service too.

Now Slow Motion Man finally gets back to me.  He didn't say anything, so I said, "I just went throught he drive-thru and you forgot part of my order."  So he's like, "Oh, what's do you want?"  And being a smart alec, I said, "At least the Taco Pizza I ordered."  Then he's like, "Oh.... Let me see your reciept and your bag." So he goes through my bag and reads my reciept in slow motion.  Seriously?  You forgot my order and now you're stalling even longer?  Then he went to the back and tried to yell a new order at them to make a fresh taco pizza.  She just forgot it, bro.  Maybe you should go to the window where it's sitting.

The girl realized she had forgot it and brought it towards the counter when she was like, "Oh, I forgot this, is she here?"  Yeah, I'm here watching these idiots fumble around.  Talk about the worst gene pool in a Taco Bell ever, and that's saying A LOT.
Cheap Tacos are Cheap Tacos, but this place is cleanand the staff are great! I always stop here when I am in a hurry and craving "Mexican."

I don't usually write reviews for fast food (maybe one Sonic if I recall correctly), but sometimes it's necessary to give credit where credit is due.

I've eaten at my fair share of TBs over the years. Like other FF chains, you pretty much know what to expect from Taco "Hell" in terms of food quality, service, and price. Typically meh...we're not talking 5-star dining here after all!

However, after living in the area for over two years and visiting this Lakeway TB about a dozen times or so, I can honestly say "It's as good as it gets!" [taking into account the fast food factor].

Never an incorrect order, always super, super friendly employees (maybe that's why a few others have stated the staff are "weird" because they're not used to seeing smiling faces at joints like TB - lol - alien), and they take care in preparing the grub correctly.

Icing: location was just completely remodeled; not that I ever thought it needed any TLC in the first place.

So, snaps for Lakeway Taco Bell! I might feel bad about eating the food afterward, but am always a happy camper when making the trek home to munch and crunch in front of the dumb-box. :D There's a reason why they stay open late...and thanks for the spiffy wetnap and mints included in the bag...very much needed about that time!

[139 in 2015]

I just went through this drive thru and was helped by the most friendly employee. I don't know her name but she was a white lady with glasses and she was literally the most friendly person I have ever had serve me in a drive thru. She put me in a good mood just by how nice of a person she was.
Started out new back to old habits not clearing the tables dirty bathrooms. Just like the old store dirty dirty not cleaning up anything sad to trash a new store.

Nice and friendly and the food was fresh. I don't like how the cashier didn't ask me if I wanted to make a donation but she did to the Caucasian male behind me. I guess the old lady assumed blacks don't donate money to good causes.
Ever single time I have been to this location something is wrong...out of food, closed early, machines down...etc. Don't trust.
Every table in the restaurant was dirty!  Minimum wage employees trying hard to get out of doing anything.  But the food is good!
Not that great! My food wasn't assembled properly with meat on one side and veggies on another tasted like crap.! Might have to go another place with better reviews but this was the closet I had

I'll admit to my mistakes early on, yes I know Taco Bell isn't the finest of choices, and in that you get what you get; I don't need the healthy choices talk, I'm good.  Second, game 5 if the World Series was already underway.  But you see so many Taco Bell commercials, and sometimes you really just want a burrito.  So, off my husband went to the drive thru.  After several minutes, the text messages started; still sitting here.  Been sitting here for 3 minutes and boring is happening.  Been sitting here for 4 minutes, still nothing.  Five minutes... Six minutes.  So after the wait, theoretically it should have been amazing.  But instead, when I finally get my food, I pulled out an ice cold burrito.  To be fair, it probably didn't start that way.  But the unsolicited case of recently refrigerated sauces changed the whole ecosystem of the bag leaving us with a mess of congealed cheeses and hardened tortilla shells. And while the highlight reels will help recap the two innings he missed, it still isn't as good as seeing it live.
Was closed 5 minutes earlier than it said in the sign and they still didn't let me in. Didn't get to eat dinner because of it. Smh.

We were immediately greeted by Reese.  He has fantastic personality and was a great person to talk to.  He took our order accurately and he came out to check on the customers often to make sure everyone was doing ok.  All of our food looked great and tasted great.  We were a group of 5 and we all had a great time talking to the employees.  This is a great store and the best Taco Bell experience I have had in a very long time.

Been going there for  7 years and everything's been amazing. Delicious warm well cooked meal. But the staff as of the recent year have been terrible. They strike arguments with the customers as I've seen and also me. Trying to correct you by saying "you said quesilupa and you agreed" when in fact I didnt, you don't argue with the customer no matter what. And our food was awful, not cooked extra like we asked. Not cooked at all actually. It was still doey. They need new staff because I miss the old taco bell.

Had to downgrade the rating due to a poor customer service experience we received on a return visit a while ago. We visited this location several times with no issues except for the last visit. It was near closing time but we had 10 minutes left to order our food using the drive-thru. As the lady was taking our order, we heard the loud and whiney voice of a male in the background blatantly complaining on having to make our order.

When we pulled to the window to pay, you could easily hear the same guy in the back raising his voice about having to make our food and crying about how he didn't want to do his job. It was sadly pathetic for a grown man to sound this way. For crying out loud, it was only a few items. They told us the menu selection was limited as well. He was so obviously loud about it and we were made to be very uncomfortable. To make matters worse, they flicked the lights off with minutes left on the clock before closing time.  We won't be returning here again.

Taco Bell is always good!  This Taco Bell is jointly operated with KFC and I've never seen anything like it so I thought that was pretty cool.  What isn't cool is that Taco Bell leaves no sauce outside so customers can get as many as they need.  Instead, they hand you out the sauce.  This didn't make me very happy.  Another thing that I didn't like about the place is their restroom.  They don't have any paper towels are all.  Instead, they have a hand blower dryer thingy.  My concern is touching the faucet to turn on and off.  I don't want to be touching that dirty thing without a paper towel as it is dirty.  I don't want to touch the sink with my hands then touching my food.

In conclusion, I still like Taco Bell, but I think this store manager is trying too hard to save money or something.  That isn't good for customer service in my opinion.

I don't know why this place has so many bad reviews except for maybe the neighborhood. 

Actually usually have a pretty good experience here and have eaten lots and lots of times because I work very close.

Same normal chips cheesy goodness and sauce.

Ok, so Taco Bell is Taco Bell.  The food at this one is pretty typical.  But judging by my experience today, the management's attitude toward customer service is pretty lacking. 

I went to the drive through to get a couple of tacos for lunch.  I noticed that there was someone working up on the roof (we've had epic snow here in MA so a lot of businesses are clearing their roofs to avoid collapse).  As I pull up to the window I see the van in front of me getting snow dumped all over it.  POURED all over it. 

When I got up to the window I commented that they ought to tell whoever is on the roof to avoid dumping snow on the customers who are in line.  They explained that it was the owner/manager on the roof and they couldn't tell him what to do.  Throughout this conversation, massive quantities of wet snow were getting dumped onto my car and splattering in through the window.  I honked my horn and hollered up to inform him of my situation.  He evidently heard me because the snow stopped, but there was no acknowledgement or apology.  The staff at the window were polite and apologetic.  It must stink to work for someone like that. 

I'll go back because sometimes you need a cheap but tolerable taco.  But Seriously, the management needs to think a little more about the customer experience.

Worst Taco Bell I have ever been to by far. We pulled into the drive way 45min before closing. Plenty of time to expect at least average service. They turned off the fryer. Laughed at my order because they "are trying to get ready to close". And put NO BEEF on four items that I asked to have extra beef. I also pod for extra beef...and I received no beef. I would say it's worth it to get some food late at night if you're in the area but this just isn't. Find something else for your late night munchies. This place isn't worth it at all.

This is by far the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to. And I've given it multiple tries. For starters, their customer service is terrible. I've worked in fast food most of my life and I can't even describe just how TERRIBLE it is here. The staff acts as if they are there to chill and get paid. God forbid an actual customer show up! Oh and don't you dare ask for some damn salsa, because that's just pushing it. Last time I went the staff member rushed me to order like they were busy at 2am. Then whenever we got to the window, nobody in the damn store had on any type of uniform...AND the kid in the window was eating as he was accepting payment. Taco Bell kills me because they have time to answer bullshit replies on twitter, but not enough time to handle a legitimate complaint. My advice? Go to Moes or something. No cheap Mexican food is worth the pain in the ass that this place is.
