This is the worst Taco Bell I have ever been too. Between five of us ordering not one of us got the food we actually ordered. The messed up on every single one of us. Completely left out some items. One of us got a taco that was completely cold. When we went back to talk to a manager the manager could not speak English. I love Taco Bell, but this particular location sucks. Find a different location or a different restaurant. Not worth them scamming you on your order.

Do they ever get an order right?
  drive off and entire order is wrong.. my fault for not checking before i drove off, sorry for not wanting to hold up the drive through long line next time i will

For one I might have a little bias as I'm a pretty big fan of Taco Bell, the food is cheap and it's pretty dang hard to mess up. I don't think I've ever had a problem at this Taco Bell the staff is always friendly and they get the food out quick. Also from 2-5 is $1 frozen drinks, who wouldn't want that?

If you want cheap Tex-Mex that will have you hugging the toilet for hours afterward, spare your eyes and your vat of hand sanitizer and go through the drive-thru. That at least affords you the luxury of staying in your vehicle with your own germs. This store is the furthest thing from clean. I only ducked inside the doors once to use the restroom and even THAT left me wanting nothing more than 3-4 hot showers and a lot of scrubbing. The floor was so sticky and the restroom had grunge all over the place.

I feel like this is a pretty solid taco bell.  Guy in the drive through was - had a deep, booming voice and was quite friendly as I tried to re-live my drunken early 20s by making an impromptu drive through run.  They continue to switch up the menu, so he patiently waited as I tried to figure out what had changed before exiting with a crunchwrap supreme.

I'm not going to accuse them of evenly spreading the ingredients out or making it with excess care, but it wasn't sloppy like you sometime encounter.  And so it was - as you can expect - a pile of awesomeness wrapped in a tortilla with a flat, crunchy shell somewhere in the middle.  Itch scratched!

The drive thru service has not changed since it opened..SLOW!! Management needs to get involved apparently because I could have had a sit down meal at a restaurant in the time it took to get thru their drive thru!

I have low standards for taco bell, but this is THE WORST SERVICE I HAVE EVER EXPERIENCED. 5+ times I've come to this location an hour or more before they close and they ignore me in the drive thru and then come outside 20+ minutes later and say they're closed. Wow! Thanks for wasting my time. I have never been so livid and disappointed by any business in my life. They don't care about their job and it's blatantly obvious. Get it together. All of the worst fast food experiences in my life have taken place at this Taco Bell, at this location.

Restaurant was dirty. Nearly all tables needed cleaned. Trash cans were overflowing. One of the worker's kids were playing in the restaurant by throwing and hitting a taco sauce packet against the wall. Dirtiest Taco Bell I've ever visited.

Absolutely horrendous customer service, I'm still fuming.  I've worked customer service for nearly a decade now and half of that with fast food.  Yes it was rush hour, no it was not busy, there's no excuse for the level of rudeness from the drive-thru staff.  It was very much a "whatchu want" "anything else" experience.  The employee taking my order didn't say "Hi", no "Welcome to Taco Bell, may I take your order", no "how ya doing" nothing.  I had to sit and wait a few seconds in disbelief at the greeting I received, just to make sure I heard it clearly when he called on the speaker again. It gets better: when I got the food, the employee just closed the window and worked on the next order, no have a nice day, nothing.  I was so mad when I left that I didn't even notice til I got home that I was missing a drink from my order.  I called the store for the manager and was told she was "busy" for the next 2 hours.  This place is not worth your time, I've had some poor experiences, but this one takes the cake.  I'll stick to the Taco Bell on W Parmer from now on, never had a bad experience there.

I like Taco bell cause its quick and cheap however the last 6 times I have gone to this Taco Bell they have gotten my order wrong.  I say no beans and it has beans or its just missing all together and I have to go back.  Staff is "ok" they don't smile or even say thank you or have a nice day.  It's quick in and out ... better check your bag before you pull away!
The closing time for done in is 10 pm.  The doors were locked at 8:45 when I arrived.Not goin here again. This is not good customer service.

Rude Staff, Unwilling to help, and food is horrible at this Taco Bell.

I was thrilled that a new Taco Bell was built close to Dessau & Parmer cause I spend $35 to $45 a week on Taco bell and have to drive all the way to Parmer and close to Metric. At least at that location, the staff works hard to be friendly and the food somehow just tastes so much better!

I've been to this new location 5 times and I've finally had enough and will not go back! Each time they always miss some part of the order. Its always cold, they take forever to get me my food (wait an average 15 to 20 minutes from ordering) and they are rude when you tell them they made a mistake. 

The Doritos Locos Taco Supremes are always low on meat and the soft tacos are hard, yes I said hard. The food here just isn't worth the money! I thought all Taco Bells taste the same, nope! Not here. I miss the other Taco bell soft tacos with the meat so hot its so delicious. HERE? its given to you cold! I guess its because I always have big orders, but that's no excuse! I have a big family and spend a lot of money and expect a good warm meal. The other taco bell gets it done! Not here. 

Go to another Taco Bell, this place gives you small amounts of meat and isn't hot or even warm. I still do not get how this Taco Bell's taste is not good. I love Taco Bell and all others are so good. Why does this location lack so much with service and taste???!!!

Go elsewhere, you'll be ripped off.

I've never had a problem with the food at this KFC/Taco Bell, but the main reason I ever patronize this one is that the prices of every other Taco Bell in a 10 mile radius has jacked their prices ridiculously. Everything on this menu is about 30 percent cheaper than any other Taco Bell in the area. 

However, the service in this restaurant is about as consistently bad as any fast food establishment that I've ever patronized. It's always ridiculously slow or they forget something that you've ordered. If I don't have a bad experience with the service here, I always see someone else having one. It's really amazing how consistently sh--ty the service is. 

Granted, you usually have better luck with the drive thru. It's pretty fast, but sometimes you just want to have a seat in the dining room. 

All that said, I won't stop going here because the food is consistent and the aforesaid prices are good compared to others in the area.

I was so glad to see a Taco Bell in this part of town. I was on my way to Ironman 70.3 Austin race at Travis County Exposition Center last November. It was cold and I was hungry - not a good combination when I travel.

The restaurant has a large parking lot. I didn't have problem finding a space (well, who eats here at 9 on a Saturday morning anyway.) Odd thing was the doors were locked. I kept looking at my watch and the open sign. It obviously was open because there were people in there. 

So, I walked to the other entrance and inquired about their locked doors. The cashier brushed me off casually, "oh yeah. We know." Okay. Luck you, I don't live in Austin. I'd reported it to the corporate.

My breakfast experience was fairly pleasant. Coffee was steamy hot and delicious. I hope the doors are all accessible on my next visit.

This place is actually pretty decent during the day, They seldom screw up my order-- so thanks for that. At night its a totally different story with their drive thru "service". Rude people. Too stoned to be working people. Always some kind of problem. Tonight  I was informed they were making nothing that comes on a tortilla. I think that's at least half their menu. Total waste of time. Will be avoiding their drive thru after dark and going to the Bell down the road from now on.

Its fast food sorta Mexican and not done really well. Plus, this store is an absolute wreck. Pretty sure it hasn't been updated since it opened.

If you are looking for cheap food that you will regret later, well this is the place to be.

The lesser of all the evils, Taco Bell is the healthiest fast food you can get - if you do it right. It's also infamous for being the most vegan-friendly of all fast food.

My weakness - bean burritos ordered fresco style. They 86 the cheese & add a pico mix. It reduces the fat, eliminates all cholesterol, & makes it vegan. Another option is the 7 layer burrito, ordered 86 the cheese & guacamole (which isn't vegan.)

Smack in the heart of Midtown, this is the cheapest & healthiest fast food you'll find. For extra fun watch drug deals as you wait in the drive through line.

Taco bell on 1548 E. Parmer Ln Austin Tx 78754. I went to taco bell at 5/20/2018 at 12:49 am. I got a number 10 which was 2 crunchy tacos chzy gord crunch and cinnamon twist. The next morning around 8 am I woke up with a headache, diarrhea and vomiting all day. I went to the ER because I couldn't keep nothing down and also was giving a IV for fluids. The doctors ran test and ruled it out to be " Food Poisoning" the doctor sent me home with three different medications. I called the restaurant to let them know an the Manager Alex gave me attitude. I had to miss three days of work and on the third day I was still feeling bad.

Location: Off Ponce De Leon.

Fav Item: Fresco bean burrito & Baja Blast! 

- Positives: Taco Bell is definitely my go to munchie food. Once a month I'll indulge in a L Baja Blast and I always make anything off the menu Fresco because it's healthier! :)
- Negatives: None
- Overall: Service is great here they're short and sweet. Convenient location.

Look I know it's fast food and they get paid terribly. But When I'm in the drive through I still don't want to see workers chomping on tacos with their mouths open, especially without gloves. At least go to the back room to take breaks. Also, I've tried going at 10am and only after ordering do they tell me they're "only serving breakfast right now." If you're going to eliminate your entire menu just to serve eggs inside of tortillas which is gross, have some other options. Taco Bell is all the same ingredients mixed in different ways, it's not like other fast food joints which literally can't serve breakfast and lunch at the same time. Least they could do is tell us the hours when their actual menu is available rather than just being straight up bitches when you try to order it. These workers truly don't care. Either pay them more or prepare for your chain to go extinct. 

Update: I made the mistake of going to this location again. I ordered 2 quesadillas with diablo sauce and was only given 2 packets. When I asked for more sauce, I was told there is only one sauce allowed per quesadilla and the window was slammed in my face. Again, stop trying to be McDonald's. Their one sauce policy would be ridiculous if it came in a half full packet. I threw this food out since it wasn't worth it only having a few drops of sauce with it. , the sauce was the last good thing about this chain. Goodbye!
Go to the one by Hmart. Slow...Food is taco Bell...same everywhere. 40 minute wait. Last week was 50.
Pretty average Taco Bell with two exceptions: 1. They've never gotten my drive thru order wrong and 2. You get a decent amount of cheese on your taco. That makes them a 4-star in my book!

Be nice if they stop aiming to disappoint.  

Wheels my spoon that I asked for 2 times while being told is in the bag? 

Was not.  It is always a half service
This place is horrible always long wait over 10 minutes at drive thru whoever owns or manages this place needs to reevaluate the staff and operations as I type this 5 cars left without ordering

we love this Taco Bell- have never had a problem...they have always been courteous...unlike some of the rude customers I have witnessed

best cheap lunch- small drink & two soft tacos, doesn't break the bank...

it does get busy, but hey, deal with it, or go to the nasty one up in Sanford

They still have not disclosed what is in their "beef mixture". The CEO is being tacky by retaliation against lawsuit filed because they wont disclose. Do not eat there, no one knows what their "beef" is made of.

A problem with this Taco Bell is service. Either our order is messed up or it s slow. Tonight I ordered at 6:39 and it is now 7:09 and I have no food. Will drive the extra 24 mile round trip next time.
At the drive thru 8.44 PM. Lady on the mic is the rudest person I have heard. The gentleman at the window one of the nicest !!

If I could give this Taco Bell a zero star rating I would. I have been there on 4 different occasions and I have never had my order made correctly. I have never dealt with a restaurant that is so jacked up before. I will never be going back to this Taco Bell! Ever again!!!!!
Garbage. Ordered chicken got beef. Really guys, how hard is it? Seriously? Is it really that hard to tell chicken from beef?!?!?! Unreal. I hope you all get fired
Waited here for a friend who I thought was arriving at Orlando but was flying into Tampa instead!  Oops.  The cashier, Tawana, was unusually friendly and helpful.

This place is so gross I don't know why I ever went back. Every time I ate there I got sick, sometimes before even leaving and the bathroom was so dirty that you would never use it ordinarily but this has become an emergency thanks sickness you now feel from the food. Looks like you'll spend the rest of the day in the bathroom between using the toilet and scrubbing off the filth.
DO NOT ORDER ONLINE. They refuse to start your order until you arrive, If you are picking up the order for a group from work they want everyone's ID . The order is usually wrong.

prices go up, portions shrink, and the food tastes worse and worse
shame on you Taco Bell
you used to be cool
I just sat in the drive there for almost 15 minutes after I ordered. I finally got so disgusted I left without paying. I am sorry but I will not wait that long for Taco Bell.

If I could give ZERO I would. The service was HORRIBLE!! Sorry your headset is hard to hear out of, and we had to yell/repeat our order 6 times. Then to pull up to the window and have your sorry @$$ attitude, take our money and make us wait as 3 cars pass thru. I wish I got your name, but you were the fat guy with an attitude working the drive thru. Sorry we stopped here...not that it matters, but we'll never be back.
I agree why do they have bad reviews I went and they were super nice and quick, they were even closing for walk-ins and they didn't seem annoyed, they just asked if we could carry out.
They ALWAYS crush my girl's Mexican pizza even when I specifically ask them not to. C'mon, its not THAT hard.

I got three items but more importantly, the perfect amount of Hot sauce. Not too much where I feel like I'm hurting the environment and not too little where I hate my life. I got a spork in my bag to compliment my Cheesy Fiesta Potatoes. Before this, my girlfriend used to get mad at me for using my hands. Taco Bell is improving my love life. The Crunch Wrap was neatly folded which allowed maximum grip opportunity. I was able to bite and immediately fill with Hot sauce (which by the way I had more than enough of.) All the one star reviews below me are liars.

Two visits.  Same results. 20-25 minute wait for dine in order.  There were maybe 3 other orders during that time. Both times my orders were inaccurate.  Soft drink stations have wrong mix of syrup. The lobby was absolutely filthy the second time.  Staff does not speak clear English and are completely uncaring.  The food I receive is stale.  I will never visit this location again.  

The last time I noticed the owners were visiting. I took a moment to speak with one of the younger guys. It's a total money grab for him. He does not care.  Let's all stop letting this guy make money.  He is not a manager/owner worth my dollar.

I have to once again downgrade this Taco Bell to the lowest rating.  I was craving for the Baja freeze so I came here for my fix.  The employee that was helping me didn't know what the freeze was.  They had to go back and ask another employee about the product.  I guess I don't blame her because this location doesn't have the freeze.  I thought that was ridiculous.  She also mentioned that they don't serve breakfast as well.  

The floors here is still sticky when you walk on it and that's not very appealing.  So if you're looking for the entire taco bell menu, don't come here or you'll just waste your time.

This is consistently the worst location I have ever been to. Recently moved to the area, it is the closest Taco Bell and now we have tried to go three different times and left each time with no food. "All we have right now are items A and B, Sorry" "It's going to be a 15-20 minute wait" then sat in line for 25 minutes waiting to order before I drove off.

This Taco Bell has to be the worse I been to, ordered the chalupa meal and was given the cravings box this is the second time when I asked for the chalupa meal was given something else instead. Earl was the cashier yesterday and today we met with the manager Francisco and he was so fixated on saying that he wasn't given anything free in which we were not asking for anything for free that he could care less that he has incompetent workers, then a worker comes to the front of the restaurant like he wants to fight. Smh

In the morning time the food is good and fresh 
But there evening crew needs some help always out of rice cheese just the basic stuff , last time i went i asked for the chlopa supreme combo and thy always give old crusty burnt shell it took them two tries to get it right , i have asked them without the beef but thy both had beef in them so i dont know how hard is it to listen for the ingredient and push a button , late night shift is a joke because there is no adult preset to keep the 18yr olds. Just sad

Worst Taco Bell ever. I've been stuck in the drive through for more than ten minutes now and it's made so you can't back out. Last time I came they gave me watered down sodas. Two times I've been here, both times suck. Run away!
Update: ordered supreme tacos, received standard tacos. Also, the soda was watered down again. And after my 10 minute wait, the guy at the window couldn't be bothered to offer me sauce.

I'll prefect this by saying the food is usually decent. 

That being said, this is one of, if not the slowest Taco Bell I have ever been at. Dinner rush drive thru line is usually 15+ cars. Go inside, 15+ minute wait for the simplest order. I don't know if it's just terrible management (which is very likely) but this location seems as if it's ran by children with zero knowledge of food service. That's odd though, as there is always a "manager" on duty. 

This is easily one of the worst locations to order food at if there is any likelihood of 3+ ppl going to be there. Absolutely terrible.

The customer service here is always great! One associate in particular takes very great pride in his work. However, sometimes the food isn't as fresh as it could be. One night my shell was hard and Mexican rice wasn't nearly as good as usual. I say that to say, this Taco Bell can be a hit or miss.

It is 5pm on Thursday.  I realize there is a labor shortage, but oh my!
Will someone please figure out who is working the drive thru window and give them some training.   Please don't act like the customer is a pain.  You need customers.   Please have a halfway pleasant personality.  Smile at least once.  Please don't act like the job is a pain.  Please be sure you give me all of my order.  If I pull up and wait and the lady in back of me points out that I am waiting, do you think it might be because you didn't give me all of my order?!   Since now there is a big line, I'm not going to wait in it , so instead I'll just express my unhappiness this way.  Someone train him.  Ok I'm done.

Chances are you either love or hate Taco Bell. I'm firmly in the "love" camp. There are three places along Avalon Park Blvd to get tacos - Taco Bell, Tijuana Flats and Margaritas. Each one serves a distinctly different version that I crave at certain points. 

Taco Bell, of course, is the cheapest and the least authentic. That's ok though, because it's reasonably tasty and super cheap. Most of the items are "ok", and have only a moderate amount of flavor at best. The saving grace, to me, are the "volcano" selections: tacos, burritos and nachos. Finally, something with some kick to them and some distinguishable flavor. 

Being a chain, the food is pretty much the same from location to location - but service is another matter.

Service here is iffy. They're friendly enough - but they can be slow to come up to the counter leaving you standing around waiting. I could forgive that if my orders weren't wrong at least 1/4 of my visits. Either they give me someone else's order, add in (and charge me for) extra items (3 tacos instead of 2) or just give me a wrong item. 

For lack of accuracy and lack of remorse when I point such things out, I have to dock their stars.

Like a lot of people, our fast food guilty pleasure is Taco Bell.  This location is by far the worst we have ever been visited.  1. The seating area is filthy and covered in food(we didn't see until after ordering) 2. Register worker was the slowest we have ever had anywhere 3.  The shift manager or manager was loudly rude and critical of the staff 4. It took 35 minutes for a small order with no other visitors. 

We will not be coming here again, we recommend that you do not either.

The worst!
Man I love taco bell.  Food is so fucking good, unfortunately after I eat taco bell I feel sick for hours and fire comes out of my butt for 24 hours.  Not really worth it.

The staff is always surprisingly friendly to me. For being Taco Bell its pretty good too. Of course its not 5 star good food, but I am giving the rating to the staff, especially in the drive thru. respect!!

As others have said this location is the worst. Went today at 1:00 pm busiest time of day for places like this. Pull up to the drive thru, o sorry we are closed. What do you mean your closed? Everytime I come here they are either closed, computers aren't working, can't process online orders, ran out of something, there's always an excuse. It's pathetic. Idk who the franchise owner is but if it were me I'd like to know that I am losing business due to poor management

Edit: Went by again today and guess what?? It's closed! 3 hours after opening not a single person in the building. It's honestly unreal how poorly a business could be run.
Much better than my previous visit. Service was fast, order was correct, and food was what I expected. Even asked how many packets of hot sauce. I will return.

Ok these guys are wizards. Crazy swamped, I came in with an online order and even though it took a little longer than I anticipated, they got it perfect! Hot fresh potatoes, delicious quesadilla and Gordita crunches! Will totally be back, maybe not on a Friday night though!

This Taco Bell MUST be experienced if you live in or visit Atlanta, but you must carry with you a sense of humor, a little street smarts, and maybe a friend because in order to basque in the full Ponstitution Taco Bell experience, you have to go after dark. You also have to go through the drive-thru. Don't expect your order to be correct or for them to care. Instead, I want you to go with a sense of adventure. In the dozens of times I have run for the border, I have witnessed the following: Transgendered hookers arguing with their johns, being picked up by their johns, running across the street as fast as their shiny white go-go boots can carry them, drug deals, a body rolled out on a gurney across the street, a crackhead pop up from behind the menu sign, crackheads peeing in the bushes...and many more. Lock your doors and have fun!
Could go to three Taco Bells but Lakeway's the best @ keeping it weird. Fun staff, and if something's wrong, they make it right. Nicole and Sean, you rock!

My wife was getting off of work and me and my daughter wanted a late snack so we asked here to stop by taco bell and get a box of tacos. We live about 2 min away from this restaurant so it did not take her long to get them to us but by the time we got them they were saugy almost like when you pour a cup of water on a peice of bread
No breakfast menus at drive thru..... Wow Taco Bell
Rude cashier got order wrong and charge me extra gave back and left won't be coming back
Currently waited in line to order for 20 mins then got past the ordering and waited another 20 mins to get our food terrible service and the people that work there have horrible attitudes.

In case anyone is wondering, they haven't increased their speed or accuracy. Our food is all cold because it sat while he waited in the drive thru. The special requests for our order were ignored. And they won't answer their phone.

MY FOOD WAS CONTAMINATED AND I GOT SICK IMMEDIATELY.  EAT HERE AT YOUR OWN RISK.

I generally am fine with Taco Bell...  I don't even really care that their food is often made sloppily and often doesn't have the all of the ingredients mentioned in a product (eg. No cheese in a cheesy rice and bean burrito).  This is fine, it's cheap and I was very pressed for time and money.  What is NOT ok is how it made me sick afterwards.
Almost immediately after finishing my food, I felt some flu-like symptoms and they have gotten worse today.
In my nose, my nasal passage and throat, I feel a raw, dry, stinging, have a runny nose and it hasn't stopped no matter how much water I drink.  I've never gotten flu-y from food before and I don't have any allergies...  This was just such a huge surprise.  I mean, I know they don't care and nothing is probably going to change but this seems kinda messed up and I figured I should warn people.

Ok, ok...now I know it's not cool to like big chain fast food. TB always seems to be the butt of many jokes. Drunk food, stoner food, whatever...

The truth is...I like TB. Now, given choice and convenience, I'd prefer a little taqueria...but for the price and convenience, I'm cool with the Bell.

It takes me all of 5 minutes from house to Bell back to house. Enough grub to satisfy me for under a fiver. 

Feel free to judge away...I'm sure you have been known to things you are less than proud of. Stand tall. Stand proud. Embrace your vices!

It's your regular great taco bell food but they neglect the drink machine everything was just carbon water and a bit of syrup...the tea is bad every time and the staff is nice but over worked because speed is a hit or miss. You could be in and out or there for 30 minutes depending on the time. All in all a good experiences despite the few setbacks

Our favorite Taco Bell! Super on-top-of-it employees in the drive through- we have 8 kids, so we usually have a large order and they get it right, fast, and with a smile! Need to change that? NO PROBLEM! The taco are stuffed, the burritos are full and hot, the drinks come with straws! Always friendly people.

I frequent this location and it seems they get my order right only 50% of the time or my food is a mess when I get it. Tonight my food was cold, I asked for no tomatoes but there was a lot of tomatoes on my food and the girls working the drive thru were acting silly while taking my order. When I got to the window, they were laughing so much they couldn't really talk to me. Very unprofessional. I understand it's Taco Bell but there are other places I can spend my money when I am hungry. Tonight was just icing on the cake. I'll be going elsewhere from now on.

They used to have Baja Sauce for the chalupas and now just stinky sour cream what's the deal with that Taco Bell you used to be cool 

(Not anymore)

I love some taco bell every once in a while. The location is very nice now, but the management is horrible. They are often very slow and literally about 85% of the time they forget something or mess something up with my order. It's a running joke with my family. I hate to sound rude to the workers but it is to the point that I always ask them at the drive thru to double check the order or do it myself if we go in. The management should be hounding the employees to increase speed quality and accuracy. It's not that hard. If it is, develop a system to make sure orders are right. Good price, food is usually good and hot but getting an order correct when a customer pays for something is important!

2 stars for the friendly staff! Negative 2 stars for the filthy restroom! I know it's Taco Bell and you shouldn't expect much, but please clean your bathroom. Feces on the toilet seat no TP except on the floor! Lost my appetite once I entered.
The worst!!! To busy talking to friends to take my order. Acts like shes doing me a favor by takeing my order. On her phone rather than expedite my order. I will not be back

Until management changes hands, I won't bother with this location. The last two times I've visited were bad experiences. Once, at the drive-thru, around 9:30 or so, I finally made my way to the speaker (there were about 5 or 6 cars ahead of me), and the guy actually suggested I go elsewhere because "we're really behind and slow tonight." Thinking he was kidding, I asked if the wait was going to be 10 minutes or so. He said "No... Longer. It'll be more like... I wouldn't even order ma'am." What the what...?

The last time, my family was walking toward the door to dine in, and the couple ahead of us was met at the door by an employee who said they weren't serving because enough people didn't show up for work. He proceeded to lock the door. It was 2:30 in the afternoon. WHAT. THE. WHAT?!

I called Corporate, and they are passing my issue on to the field office, not the store manager, since the problem seems to be WITH that person.

They're renovating so the store looks a mess from the outside, which was a good enough reason to go somewhere else, but my kids insisted on having tacos for lunch... we ordered a taco party pack and received tortillas full of lettuce! (all 12 were made this way) ...unacceptable!!!!! :(
Every table was dirty and service was extremely slow. The place is empty and the drive thru is slow. Food all over seats as well. Bad management.

This place is horrible, they have a low health department score and I only ate here late nites as my last resort when I dont feel like driving far since I live very close. Every time I order the grande meal taco pack I always get tacos with very little meat inside. I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy. Just drive a lil farther and find another spot. I been living in the area do many years and haven't ate here in a long time now.

I am not a big fast food person unless absolutely desperate.  I have to admit that Taco Bells new Dorito Taco's are really good and give a new dimension to the Taco. They offer a nacho cheese and cool ranch shell.  The nacho cheese Dorito one is the best to me.  It reminds me of when I make taco salad and use nacho cheese Dorito's for the chips.

This was a miserable experience. I went into the dining room to get food to go. I was ignored for several minutes before an employee who was working the drive through finally came to take my order. She tried to log into the register, than stated she didn't know who the drawer belonged to and went back to the drive through. I was ignored for a few more minutes before a manager logged into to the register, told someone it was okay, and after a while, someone took my order.

The real kicker came when I tried to pour myself some iced tea.  The spout came off and tea started shooting everywhere--over me, over the floor, over everything. I yelled for help, and an off duty employee who was hanging out in the dining room rushed in to stick his finger in the spout. He told me to tell someone what happened. I called for help, and someone did come to rescue the guy's finger from the iced tea container. I then went to the counter to ask for iced tea figuring they had some by the drive through, and considering the circumstances, they would be willing to at least pour me a cup.  The guy asked me if the tea got all over me. Yes, it did. I asked if I could get iced tea from the drive through line. I was told no.  No apology, no tea, no offer of help of any sort... just no.

So I was ignored, and I got drenched with iced tea. There was no apology or even an offer to pour me some from the drive through container, and basically nothing.... I do appreciate the fact an off duty employee saved me from my iced tea shower, and another employee did fill my cup with what she was emptying from the defective container.... but I do think my experience could have been much better.

I threw out my iced tea drenched receipt, so I won't be able to fill out my survey, but I will probably contact corporate because this was ridiculous.  But whoever stuck his finger in the iced tea container should be thanked.  He told me it was the second time today the spout came off, so get that thing fixed!

I was driving by and I was starving. 
So, I found myself inside this Taco Bell.
Terrible. 
At least their prices reflect their quality.

All-star Taco Bell experience!

I've passed through here several times now while traveling on 71 and the service is always very friendly, fast and accurate. I've had the woman at the drive-thru rearrange my order into a combo in order to make it cheaper, and my water was served in a medium-sized cup. It's the little things that make it such a great experience!

Took a total of 30 minutes to receive my food. Definitely not fast food!  And when I got to the window the lady offered no apology for the wait, she just stuck her had out and gave me the total of my order. I will not be going back to this place. I could have made my own bean burrito in that time.
Forgot one of the crunch wraps and charged me for it. By the time i got home I had to go somewhere else to get food. Staff is really fucking rude too.

I CAVED, after months and months I caved in... I guess I had just seen one too many Doritos Locos Tacos commercial, lol, so I was like eff it... let's see what the hype is about.

Initially, I wanted to go to the Taco Bell off Howell Mill, since it has slightly better reviews, but traffic was kind of bad so I went to the one on Ponce, which is closer

I go through the drive-thru, order my taco, "one doritos locos taco please" "yes, just one sir, no, not the supreme" "mhmm, that's all" "thanks". I ate the taco as I drove back  down Ponce to go home, and I must say it was pretty darn good. Hot, crunchy, and the cardboard wrapping for the taco was nice b/c it kept the taco neat and easier/less messy to eat. 

In fact, I went again the next day and ordered the regular crunch taco (99 cents) and the doritos locos taco (1.39) to compare. And again they were both hot and tasty. (Not much difference in taste btw, except for the Doritios one is just a little cheesier and crunchy). The second time around there was a line, which made it sort of slower, but I didn't mind since I was in no rush. Plus, I think they might be taking the advice of their customers and making the items fresh b/c everything did taste quite fresh. I didn't feel bad afterwards or anything... a taco bell taco is definitely much better than a burger from mickey d's (which always leaves you feeling like crap). 

SUMMARY: All in all my two consecutive experiences were pretty good. The people were nice, food was fresh, price is good, the line can be a little slow, but I think its because they make it fresh. I will add that I've only gone during "after work" hours  (3:30pm-6:00pm), so I don't know if that makes a difference in service and food quality or not. I went into it with little to no expectations, besides I'm a Willys/Chipotle kind of girl so I knew this would not compare.... to my surprise the tacos were good. I'll definitely come back whenever I want to grab a cheap, semi-healthy bite to eat!

Worst. Second time I've been here and they said they were closed early for maintenance. Then what the hell are you doing in the window!?? Fire these people. Your hours are your hours. Sick of driving out to this place and they act like they are closed 15 to 20 minutes early. What a waste...
Remodel and take pride where you work. This place  needs cleaned. Management should be embarrassed

(3/8/2018)  Had a hankering for some Taco Bell for lunch, our usual neighborhood one was closed for some odd and unexplained reason, and so we came to the next by proximity.  Wait times were very long and there were a lot of people.  Got orders to-go.  Meximelts were full of ingredients, but not warmed through enough, cheese shreds were still in their solid state, we expect the Meximelts to have melted cheese.  Otherwise, sufficient.

This is 5/5 stars for a Taco Bell - it's still a Taco Bell with the same sloppy, barely-beef offerings as any other. The high rating is for the service... I stopped by during a rush around 2 or 3 and had to wait at the last window for longer than usual. I didn't care because I wasn't in a hurry, but the lady at the window was super apologetic and offered to throw in some free items. (I declined, but appreciated the sentiment.) She was telling other employees in the kitchen to hurry it up, that people in line were waiting. I really appreciated her level of customer service.

Food is good, service is fine.  There's still a couple things that bothered me.  I don't think it's a good idea to let your employee take a break with his head down on a table here.  Also, the place smells funny.  I did some research and discovered this restaurant was built on an ancient hobo cemetery, so that explains that.

I'm a vegetarian and handicapped commercial driver who frequents Taco Bell restaurants. I used their bathroom facilities and stood at the counter for eight minutes with five employees working behind the counter. There were no other customers at the counter. The one employee kept taking drive thru window orders. No employee would take my order and I feel they are prejudice. I left the business and will never buy anything from this place again!

Came here for breakfast and I was surprised it was open because how early it was. I tried one of their new egg wraps and 2 hard shell chicken tacos. Yummy hahaa. Quick and easy service to get my morning started before work!!! It definitely beats breakfast at McDonald's that's for sure!!!
I went through the drive thru tonight and it moved fast. I wanted to comment on the friendliness of Darian H. He was upbeat and has a soothing voice with a great demeanor. Food was typical Taco Bell.

This particular Taco Bell location is awful! On two occasions I've had terrible service. I went one evening through the drive thru about 9pm and I was told that they were closed because no one showed up to work. Really?! Then just last week trying again at the drive thru, I'm told that there is a 30 minute wait because they are out of beef, when I expressed my disappointment , the person on intercom said that I could substitute steak or chicken so I placed my order for 3 tacos and it was $11. He did not tell me he was going to charge me for the substitute! When I saw that I told him forget it! They really need to get their act together.

I just experienced one of my best meals at this Taco Bell!! They were short staffed and the food was excellent and we received it in less than 4 minutes!!  All 3 workers were engaged with us and all the customers while never slowing down!!  All fast food restaurants should take classes from these three!! Great job!!! Visited between 1 and 2 Sunday, January 28th.

This is THE WORST TACO BELL EVER!!! They are constantly out of key ingredients and fountain drinks. The drive-thru takes forever and they always seem to get some part of the order wrong. If the only thing you want from Taco Bell is a cup of water and a bad attitude then this is the place for you!

I should've read the Yelp review before I got in line to literally the slowest "fast" food restaurant ever. I've been stuck in the drive-thru line for more than 25 minutes now. DON'T BRAVE THE DRIVE-THRU unless you have an extra 40 minutes to sit in your car, because there's no way out!

The place is good, not great but good. I live around the corner, so I go here all the time. The day staff is great, but the night staff is lacking. It is almost like a different Taco Bell, honestly. They are all very nice, but not necessarily fun. If you are trying to have fun and be goofy, they just kind of stare at you. I don't suppose it is their job to be entertaining, but a smile would be cool. Anyway, as a whole this place is pretty good.

Really, I like Taco Bell. Once upon a time, I even wrote a poem about my love. (seriously.)

So. It's Friday night, around 12:30. We had just left some bar and were looking to fulfill our midnight craving for... something. We weren't too sure. So stumbling onto this Taco Bell (we were actually headed for the Majestic), made us realize, yes, omg, this IS IT! It was almost akin to meeting your soulmate. We just knew that we had to eat here, no questions asked. 

Of course by midnight, only the drive thru was open. In fact, its open until 500am on Friday night/sat mornings. Anyways. I order my usual (it's really weird): 2 chalupas, but no meat. And no beans. Yes, all i want is the lettuce and tomatoes and cheese and so on... 

Very nice staff here. When we decided to obnoxiously demand that we get no less than 20 Fire sauces, they didn't complain one bit. As for the food, I was a little disappointed... my meatless/beanless chalupas had like, literally, maybe 7 shreds of lettuce inside. Like seriously, they could have upped the veggie content a bit... Oh, and minus a star because they forgot one of our burritos. So make sure to check!

It's in the middle of the night, you want taco bell because it's cheap and easy and the place absolutely isn't in a rush... and they still manage to screw up your order, four times in a row.

It's not rocket science. It's taco bell. It has pictures and directions for every item on the menu, and you still can't remember that cheese goes on a taco, that I ordered a ranchero taco, or that tortilla strips and, you know, lettuce, go on the salad? Come on.

This place ALWAYS messes up my order. 100% of the time. Tonight was especially terrible. I ordered "2 of your 4 packs of Cinnabon delights" and I received 2 bags of 2?! That's not even an option on their menu.

Awful! The service here is awful. Not only did the manager get an attitude but he proceeds to tell us "remember when you're at a restaurant we have control over your food and who makes it" Dakota I believe his name is. Never will I return there... The new building is just the makeup over an ugly face!!!

I have ordered from this location through Door Dash a hand full of times and every single order has arrived wrong in some way. My quesadilla has arrived undercooked, cinnamon twists come with out cinnamon, and this time my bean burritos came with onions after I specifically left instructions for them to be left off due to an allergy. This location is careless and I will not be ordering from there again.

This Taco Bell is pretty decent, and I've definitely been to a lot of them. The service gets a little sketchy past 9 pm though, so be sure to check your bag to make sure everything is in there. All in all there's nothing terrible to be said about this location. However, it's a terrible idea to try and eat more than three orders of the Cheesy Fiesta Potatoes. Won't be making that mistake again.

Place was closed 30 min before posted closing time... When we pulled in to the parking lot one of the workers was inside sweeping the floor and when he saw us he ran in the kitchen and did not come out even after knocking.
I think a turtle crawling up hill has better speed of service than this drive thru . Every car in front of me had messed up orders and you guessed it so did I.

I go here a lot. Well would a lot more if it didn't take forever.. it's super slow like 80% of the time. I'm at the point where I don't even go there if I don't have a lot of time. They would get so much more business if it wasn't so slow. I see cars leave the line allll the time. I have probably 3-4 times... anyways. Food is always right (hence the star) but if youre in need of a quick bite this isn't the place for you..

This review is only in reference to the drive through- I've never been inside
They have the best nachos and the most awesome burritos!And kown for their Tacos.I would recommend it for all u mexican lovers out there this is the place

It's been years since I've eaten at a Taco Bell but my wife got me hooked on their $5 crunch wrap special so I've been in a few times recently.  The double crunch wrap special is very good and is a good value and this is what brings me back. Based on the food - this would have been a 3 star rating.

However, the staff at this particular location is not customer oriented, not pleasant to deal with and verges on being rude.  Based on the staff at this Taco Bell - a 2-star rating is the best I can muster and even this is a stretch.

Sometimes you just want to put shit in your body knowing full well of the ramifications of doing so (side note - that also involves shits later). We go to Taco Bell once in a while, maybe 4 times a year. I need you guys to have all the ingredients on those 4 days. Come on guys, out of cheese? Really? The 3-cheese blend missing chapula did hit the cravings spot but still left a spot empty, the spot reserved for the 3 types of cheeses i was so wanting! Service was fast and friendly.

I go to this Taco Bell twice a week or more for breakfast and they mess up my order almost every time. They don't fill drinks up all the way and it seems like they don't know their own recipes. If you request a special order like no tomato or sour cream, they will add it anyway. I don't like being mean on here, I just hope they see this and try to fix the problem. In the meantime, I'll be grabbing breakfast somewhere else.

I don't usually take time to write reviews unless something stuck out to me, good or bad. I visited this taco bell for the third time last night and it was the last. The worst customer service I've ever had all three times. The employees were unfathomably rude and the food took way to long to cook, and it wasn't even good. Get your act together guys.

Just confirming what everyone else on here seems to say: over 20 min wait in the drive thru is a common everyday experience. I have been to this taco bell multiple times, and I mean multiple, to wait at least 15-25 minutes. I've tried going inside, still a wait. This is not your spot if you are in any kind of rush at all. Today I waited 15 Minutes in line, and another 10 at the window after I paid. Staff literally left the window, and I wasn't sure anyone was even there. Meanwhile I saw the lady behind me have her order completed and set up front about 7 minutes before I even got mine. It was one combo meal that I ordered. New management or time schedule definitely needs to happen. Please someone, help this Taco Bell!!

ONLY come here if you're drunk, stoned, or poor... otherwise you're better than this...don''t sell yourself short!  

What Atlanta needs is Taco Bueno, the Midwest answer to Taco Bell....look it up...it's AMAZING..

FRESH salsa bar....
not that disgusting mystery sauce you hand out in little packets...

We need to start a petition to bring Taco Bueno to Atlanta!

This is literally the most average Taco Bell in existence.  Let's go through a typical visit. 

The wait is usually about 5 minutes--nothing bad or crazy, but hey this isn't Chick Fil A.  The staff here are capable--they know the menu, but they're not going to blow you away with some extra Diablo sauce they've been saving for you since it was discontinued.  The food comes out relatively quickly, but your head won't spin--again, not Chick Fil A.  The food here is your typical Taco Bell food: it's awesome when you want it, but why else would you be here?  I've never been craving Taco Bell and been disappointed in this place... but then again I've never been to this Taco Bell and been overly impressed either.

Taco Bell on Ponce is neither "ew, THAT Taco Bell" nor is it "yo, THIS Taco Bell!"  It's simply, "hmm. Taco Bell."
We've lived by this Taco Bell for 2 years and they've been awesome. Then the old crew left and they got tons of new people and they suck basically lol. Never get our food right but whatever

What's up with this place? Taco Bell is usually our #1 drunk-pick choice, so we'll hit the drive thru at 1, 2, am. However, the last two times we were there during those times, they would forget several items! The first time it happened, we figured it was just a fluke... and then it happened again, leaving one of my friends with just one out of three tacos. Unacceptable, because they most definitely charged us with all items. 

Man, I love you Taco Bell... but if this keeps up, I'm gonna have to find a new drunk buddy. Sorry!

I've been to this location several times, and it isn't like other Taco Bell's.  The food isn't up to par. Tonight, the bean burritos were on old hard flour tortillas and hardly had any beans.  The nachos were okay, but was missing something. I would suggest avoid this place.

We've eaten here 3 times.  Three times I've gotten sick!  I've called Multnomah County  each time I got sick.  

The reason why we went for the 2nd & 3rd time?  We live in the hood, and I'd like to give them a chance to improve, but 3 is all I'm taking!

No more!

This is the absolute worse experience you will ever have in a Taco Bell. The wait is unfathomably long, the management is rude, they frequently leave food out of your order, and they are unprofessional. I'm writing this as I have waited in the drive through line for 20 minutes without moving an inch. Do not waste your time here.
Slowest service ever. Don't bother... I stopped in to get my bro his Nacho Bell Grande and it took nearly twenty minutes to get through the drive thru.

This is my second time having this issue. NO MEAT! The first time I came they took 15 minutes to get me my food and I had to return it because on my crunch wrap the meat was sparse and only on one side. I had them make me another one and they apologized so fine. I did their survey and said yes they messed up but that they were nice and took care of it for me. Just went through again and had even less meat this time, I tried opening it and spreading it out but there was nothing to spread.

Came in here once, but ended up selecting as my favourite location. convenient location with nice ambience. Food is tasty and some times if we are not happy with the food we got, they are ready to listen and correct it. Good staff excellent food. clean and neat all the time. I respect the guy on the counter.

Occasionally, I go to Taco Bell if I'm hungry, just need a cheap snack, and a Taco Bell is really nearby.  Today, all three of those conditions arose while I was at Eastport Plaza so I went to the Taco Bell located there.  One thing I find interesting about Taco Bell is their frequent "limited time only" special menu items, so whenever I do go, I try to get one of these special items.  Of course, most of their "specials" just use their same everyday ingredients in different configurations. . .usually either chicken, ground beef, or steak with either soft or crunchy tortilla, different variations of lettuce, tomato, cheese, sour cream, or beans, etc, etc.  But, still, it's always kind of amusing to see what they come up with!  Today, the current special was the "Loaded Taco Burrito" with "Double Beef". The picture of it on their menu board looked good, so I ordered one.  Well, mine turned out not to be "loaded", didn't have "double beef", and it certainly looked a lot more meager than the one pictured on their menu.  OF COURSE, I expected this because rarely does any food item look like it's picture in a menu.  Besides, it cost only $1.49, so it was still sort of worth it.  Taco Bell did serve its purpose for me today.
The sweetness guy just made me a coffee 3pm in the afternoon with cream and sugar. Sweetheart. Thankyou. You get all the stars.

Made us drive around 3 times for separate orders. Didn't have time and missed my doctors appointment to remove a mole. My wife left me because she hates moles. Now I'm stuck with 3 kids who aren't even mine. Thanks bell.

We went here twice. The first time was to get a quick meal during our stay at a friend's house since we couldn't cook and the second was to get a corrected order from the first trip. They messed our entire order up the first time and then the second time the food we got was terrible anyways so I guess there is just no way to win at this Taco Bell location. Our order wasn't fancy and it also took a very long time for a pretty simple order. Five crunchy tacos and four bean burritos shouldn't take ten minutes to get ready, right? I mean .. our order was multiples of two menu items. :/
Wtf is wrong with this place? Their drive thru is always a dozen cars long and a 30 minute wait - especially late night. Hire some damn employees already!

Worthless, go to any of the other Taco Bell locations within a 3-mile radius. Waited eight minutes in the drive-thru, didn't get the pico or guac that I was charged for in my taco salad. Manager very unapologetic and unprofessional about the wait and had sour cream all over her forearm when talking to me... Gross! We won't be back.

I absolutely love Taco Bell. I swear by it even. I'm mainly reviewing this Taco Bell because despite it indeed being a slow location as others have mentioned, from what I have seen, they do one thing right: The cashier at the counter has been letting customers know BEFORE they order of the wait time when it is 10 minutes or more. You don't normally see that. I also don't know what the wait time in the drive thru is like or if they let them know. But this stands out to me. Also, any time I come in I'm always met with a smile and positivity. I would give it 5 stars if the speed was a few minutes faster.

This is one of the worst Taco Bells. 
It's slow even when there are only two cars in the drive thru. They get part of your order wrong more often than not and they are constantly out of something. 

Like taco shells! Taco shells?! No tacos at the Taco Bell tonight.

Fuck these assholes. The damn "immigrant" strike bullshit is ridiculous. I'm going to see to it that everyone who didn't go in today gets fired. You pieces of shit better fire these fucks who didn't go to work today. I'm personally calling the GM and will complain until either the GM is fired or all the fucks who didn't work today. I just wanted 4 fucking tacos. Took my money elsewhere and will do so for a long while. I have money to spend and I guess I'll find a business with loyal Americans working there to patronize.

This is the worse taco Bell I've ever been to!!. Every single time they are so slow. I am actually sitting in the drive through I have been sitting in for 10 minutes and there's still two cars in front of me. This is the last time I come here. Absolutely ridiculous and it's 8:30 at night.
Can't complain, it's what you expect but they could be faster.   It's 7:30pm on a Thursday night and they only have 3 people working.  Waited 13 minutes to get my order.

This is the slowest Taco Bell EVER! I keep coming because I love taco bell but believe me  when I say you'll be waiting for a while. It took nearly 30 minutes for my friend to get her food and all she ordered was 2 tacos! The tea is ALWAYS soured and the other drinks are just syrup. I don't know if it is staffing problems or what (which the staff they do have is nice) but be prepared to wait around at this place!

WARNING!

Check every part of your order before departing the premises....several times now we have had a portion of our order STOLEN by the employees.  We have reported the thefts to the corporate office but the problem persists.

Eat at Zaxby's next door, perhaps their employees aren't thieves.

The slowest TB I've ever been to, every single time I've gone (which isn't more than a handful because of how awful they are). Get ready to wait over 20+ mins in the drive thru, regardless of day or time. You'd probably get faster food driving to the Polaris location and back. If I could give zero stars, I would.
Very very slow and inconsiderate staff. I don't recommend coming here unless you want to wait an eternity for them to fix your order they most likely will mess up on.

This Taco Bell is always the clutchest for being open so late. But that DOES NOT mean you get to lack in service. If I ordered 5 things, why do I only have 3 in my bag? And not only did I have to turn around to come back to the store, but I had to GET BACK IN LINE which had at least 10 cars in it, when YALL forgot to give me MY SHIT THAT I PAID FOR.

When I get back to the store, of course I pull in and walk to the door. Because there's three people in there. One could bring me my missing items. But no, they signal to go around. To get into the line. so I sat for another 20 minutes, when THEY COULD'VE JUST GIVEN ME MY THINGS WHICH I'M SURE WAS UP THERE READY BECAUSE IT WASN'T IN MY BAG. And finally when I get to the window, the woman has this STANK ASS ATTITUDE. Why? You have one job. You messed up. Be apologetic dude. I work in the industry. Shit is ridiculous. Meanwhile, she's sitting there listening to her music out of her headphone in one ear. THAT'S PROBABLY WHY MY ORDER WAS WRONG. Since she doesn't wanna pay attention. Lol the best part, while I walked up, another car pulled up because they were missing things. Ridiculous. 


Get it together Taco Bell. Hire some friendly people. Lose the attitudes. That's the type of woman that people throw the tacos back through the window to. Just saying.
Soooooo slow! Drive thru will take at least 15 mins no matter how long the line is. At least I had time while waiting to write a review.
This is absolutely the worst place I don't think they have ever got our order right you don't expect a lot when you go to Taco Bell but they will surprise you

We went through the drive through around midnight on our way home from karaoke at a bar last night.  

It was your typical Taco Bell food. I always get vegetarian, beans instead of meat. I think everyone knows Taco Bell meat is some of the sketchiest fast food meat out there.

 I can say for the first time in about 2 years I went to a Taco Bell that actually gave me what I ordered correctly the first try! I don't eat fast food that often, it's usually only after being at a bar. Next time I'm in the mood for some late night grub I'll keep this place in mind. 

Side note: They are a Taco Bell/Pizza Hut combo. I've never tried their pizza, but they were Taco Bell long before Pizza Hut moved in.

Lets be real..It's a fast food chain that everyone wants to knock on however I love Taco Bell. The service maybe slow sometimes but as a regular customer they always treat me with respect. There have been many times where they are very close to closing but they always seem to let me order my food and it never really seems to taste that old or unfresh. It's a given everything comes out of a bag but as long as it taste good and looks good that's all I care about when eating my 10 tacos in one sitting. BTW when the service team knows your name and knows your order it's not a bad thing. Maybe I go there to much but at least they pay attention
Pretty fast and def friendly. I've only had to sit in line once. Mexican pizza wins everytime :)

Was out of multiple different things, but  Rob did not give up. Was extremely nice and great at customer service. Did everything hey could to make me laugh and keep me happy. I'm just as happy as I would have been if I got the food I originally asked for because of the great service.

This Taco Bell "claimed" they liked the door and was closed. But they didn't. I walked straight in the front door and rang the bell for service. The blue haired female said "how did you guys get in here" then I said "I walked in the door". She said "oh I thought I locked that". Then they kicked us out for no reason. I have been here so many times and they fed me well but this time they didn't. Overall I will still go here occasionally but not after 10 because it's closed. They just lost 20$ oops. #getrealhair #ilikethebell #iwalkedinthedoor #oopsies

This was a great place, with great people. Something has changed. The food has often been a little iffy here, but the staff made up for it. The order/window staff are still stellar, but whoever is managing this place has severely dropped the ball. The last three times in a row that I have been there the drive through has been 15 minutes plus to get food. It is the type of entry that once you get in you can't get out so you are a prisoner once you make the mistake of getting in line. It is so bad that people are honking horns and turning off their cars and this is in non-rush times as in my last visit was at 2:45pm on a Sat. not lunch, not dinner, and didn't get out until 3pm. It is all on the crew responsible for making the orders and I have been told they are short staffed now (for weeks).

The food quality has dropped again (it sort of goes up and down here from my experience over the years) the beans taste bad like they have changed something on them or in them. Not spit it out of your mouth and get sick bad, but bad enough that on my last three orders I haven't finished one of the bean burritos I've ordered. In some cases I have thrown full burritos away because the first one was bad enough I tossed it so that I didn't even want to try another bite of the second one.

Eons ago I worked at a Taco Bell, so I know what they go through, and I know how long it is supposed to take and what constitutes a "rush" of customers/orders. I know what the food is supposed to taste like. This isn't on the window guys, it is up to management to adequately staff and train the food prep crew. They fell down on this and I can't recommend anyone go here at all unless they make some serious changes to get back on track. If they don't get their act together they are going to lose their best people and that will drive away regular customers. I'm not coming back until I hear about them making a change to fix whatever they broke. I can get served faster in any of the sit down Mexican restaurants around here and get better food. That is what I suggest you try or hit up one of the other Taco Bell locations and try your luck there. This was once a great place to visit, but not now.

Old review below- When I rated them 5 Stars
They are actually good enough that I feel like I should take a star off for setting an unreal expectation for other Taco Bell locations. I normally go during the day to evening and use the drive through. I don't know how they manage to keep hiring such great people! There always seems to be a good energy every time I get to the window.

The food is the food. For a while there was an issue with the beans not being cooked right so some were crunchy. The service was so good I kept coming and it has been over a year since I've had any food quality issues. I have called their corporate office more than once to compliment them. This place is like therapy, if I'm having an off day I can count on them to have a genuine smile and do their part to make it a great fast food experience.

Fast food is normally thankless and often involves dealing with customers that are rude and condescending. I hope this store has weeded out the bad customers by now because they really are that good. It really does spoil you for going to other locations because you are lucky to get average service from average workers that are just doing a job. Customer service and the way you treat people really does matter. I have been coming here for years and the quality of people has been the constant that keeps me coming back and wishing all fast food places had staff like this.

It was pretty good for the most part. The food seemed fresh and it was made quick to order. The server at the window seemed nice and great at his customer service. The diablo sauce tasted really good like ghost peppers hot sauce i tasted in Panama City Beach. Thumbs up!

Having visited several dozen Taco Bell, I am giving this one the "worst TB in the Northeast" award. The server was rude, would NOT order our food the way we asked (he basically ordered for us.) I ordered my usual crunchy taco fresco. Yuck. The meat was so drenched in orange oil it dripped continuously, the lettuce was limp, and, worst of all, the fresco (chopped tomatoes and cilantro) was entirely rancid tomato. Never eat here. It's terrible

I love Taco Bell, however this one in particular is garbage! The drive through can take over 30 mins sometimes and they even ran out of beef once. And by the time I get my food it's usually assembled very carelessly. Out of all the Taco Bell's I have been to, which is a lot, this one is easily the worst run. Please get new staff or a new manager or something because it is the only drive through Taco Bell near me and I still enjoy the food in general.

The drive-thru employee in the mornings is so sweet and remembers you by name. I don't know of many fast food places that take the time out to do that. Most places are more worried about getting you out of your hair. Great customer service.

Went through the drive-thru, as I was leaving I noticed my food was made incorrectly & also, without care (sloppy, half wrapped) I traveled back to this location went inside asked for my meal remade & at this point - the 'manager' Dakota sets off the worst attitude denying my food was incorrect - opening it up with his hands flinging food around &  asking what I expected from him.. at this point; I want a refund because this isn't at all what I signed up for. I was denied a refund because I said 'what the fuck, why are you being such a dick' and Dakota then THROWS MY FOOD AWAY alongside the receipt & says he has right to deny service when a customer uses 'curse words'. -- okay but Dakota, you don't have a right to throw the food I paid for away regardless-- the best part from all of this; is when Dakota reaches in the trash.. pulls the food out to GIVE BACK TO ME & when I don't take it.. ask for my receipt instead.. he laughs.. goes in the trash, pulls out the receipt & crumbles it in his head demanding me to leave the store while he calls the police. 

Brilliant hiring. Don't waste your energy at this location.
Its a tacobell. Not quite mexican food. More like quik tacos or burritos. But is it real meat?? Probably like 10% if that. Lol neverthe less its cheap, good, and fills u up.

BEWARE of the cups!!! I got a cold drink today 3/2/16 and the black ink came off of the cup to my hand, and my clothes. Is this why you're having the happy hour ...to get rid of these cups??? Female manager said she'd not received any complaints about this...really?!

Nice remodel just done in the late summer of 2012 to the eating area. I uploaded a couple pictures of it. There was a sign that said free wifi was coming soon. 

The food is still the same, after all it is still a Taco Bell with the 100% pure (cough) beef. Employees were nice, quick and efficient. Drive through has always been good for the late night munches.

It's fast food. It's Taco Bell. You know the deal. 

Here's what makes this place better than the rest - we pull up after a brewery outing. Y'all know how it goes. I want food and I want it now. Shit was fast. I ordered a big box - whatever the special is right now. Something about ghost pepper sauce. (Can you tell I'd been drinking?) Something something I only paid $5 for three different food items and a drink, all packaged in a sweet ass box. 

They did not put lettuce on any of my food, as requested. WHAT. Yes, you read that correctly. They follow special instructions. There was not a single, nasty little shred of iceberg lettuce in any of my food and I was so happy. 

We asked for fire sauce and holy shit, they hooked. it. up. I have so much fire sauce now. SO MUCH FIRE SAUCE.

I rarely eat Taco Bell, but y'all done made me a customer for life because this location knows how to make dreams come true.

Tell me why I go around 8:30 pm and order a quesadilla meal so you would assume that these people know how to do their job and know dam well that a quesadilla is hot. Well that wasn't the case after getting home and seeing that the cheese wasn't even melted just pissed me off how are you going to give someone raw food? So you know obviously I went back to the store and politely asked for a refund and for my order to be remade. The manager said he can only do one thing either redo my food or give me my money back since it's against "company policy". I told him no you're gonna make my food again this time hot cause that's not my fault you guys couldnt double check before giving out raw food and you're gonna refund my money. Now I wasn't rude. I didn't cuss or get loud. I got my money and my food after all the dam employees kept looking at me like how about doing your job instead of looking to the lobby to see who's there. So when I'm leaving the MANAGER ON DUTY decides to say a smart ass comment as I'm walking out and tell everyone in the kitchen loud enough for me to hear on how much he hates his job.  I turned around and told him boy you hate it here so much maybe you should go apply else where. Ghetto, retard, and still wants a better job. Sorry but this place gets 1 star and that's only because Yelp doesn't let me give y'all 0 stars. Next time don't waste other people time and maybe we won't have to come back.

You know when you make your order, then roll up to pay and ask for an extra item that could be made quickly (with only one car behind you)...ever did that?..do you get your extra item? more times than not you do. WELL not here!!

I ordered a bean burrito and a 7 layered nacho off the value menu...I roll up and ask for another burrito, the cashier looked confused (what...this never happens?) he goes to make the request for it and the cooks tell him no..

wait, what??

So I'm thinking he was kidding and made the request again. He apologized and said that they (the cooks) weren't kidding. So I go inside and ask for the manager.

The GM was helping someone else at the register (thee were like 3 people in there eating) and he comes over and I tell him the deal, he apologizes and states that he didn't make that rule, but the DM did ...and that person quit THAT day...the guy looks a little exhausted to be honest but he made my burrito and didn't charge me.

Was also told that a string of DMs have come and gone...that location needs some serious attention, obviously morale id in the crapper and its just a crap ran taco bell. I reflected these same thoughts at tellthebell.com.

The food? the burritos were decent...wait, the one the manager made was...and those 7 layered nachos? looked more like a blob of cheese smacked onto broken chips...awesome.

I got a "Maverick" badge for eating here..guess that's what you earn when you eat at a sketchy place.

win!

I wish there was a zero star rating. Any time we've gone to this location they ALWAYS get our order wrong. Every. Single. Time. Today was the last time we'll be there. I know we can't expect munch from a fast food place, but how hard is it to get an order of 3-4 items wrong? Today they were "out" of Mexican pizzas. Then they didn't put two of our items in the bag. We had to drive back around for the missing items and wait in line again for the items (there were no customers in the restaurant at all- the two other employees in there who were wiping tables could have easily brought us our food). In total we sat at the drive thru for 20 minutes. Absolutely ridiculous. I don't complain about fast food often, but this is ridiculous. Get your employees together, managers. We won't be back.
Classic Taco Bell food. Always good and what you'd expect. Burritos were kinda skimpy, that's the reason for 3 stars instead of 5

The guy at the drive-through window was very friendly.

Having said that, I ordered the rattlesnake burrito.... I didn't really pay attention to what it was.

It has french fries in it. 

Whoever's idea this was should be shot and it should be taken off the menu forever.

Late night drive-thru. Service is fast, friendly, and prompt. Taco Bell food was made to order and served hot and tasty. What one would expect for a late night drive-thru trip. During the week I believe they're open until 2:30A.M. This location will remain on a go to list when I'm in the area.

Horrible!! Worst experience ever. We waited in the drive-thru for 30 minutes. When we got home to eat our food was all wrong. My husband ordered no lettuce on all of his food. It ALL had lettuce. My burrito supreme had beans on it but I ordered it without beans. Everything we ordered had so little meat--it was ridiculous. Our receipt was correct. I guess they just don't care.

Avoid this location at all costs. The ordering process was a nightmare. Half the drinks on the soda machine were out and completely no ice, had to ask for it. I got like 4 cinnamon twists in my bag totally uncalled for. The employees were even smoking cigarettes in the bathroom - insane.

I like Taco Bell, usually. Ok, I don't go here because I want something healthy, I go because I want something tasty that reminds me of home or is at least familiar to me.

This location is staffed by retards. Not the kind you see on leashes being led around the mall early on a weekday afternoon but the kind they don't take on those outings. The kind that wear helmets and bite through their tongues without their mouth guards. 

How hard is it to put the freaking tortilla filled with cheese on the surface of the industrial sized Foreman Grill and close the lid AND leave it there long enough to melt said cheese? Apparently really fucking hard.

How hard is it to count to TWO quesadillas? Near fucking impossible apparently.

And how hard is it to just listen and take the right order? Take a guess.

I've also. by going here, discovered where all the stale tortillas from all the other Taco Bells go before they finally get thrown in the trash, they land on Ponce and get picked up by the retards that are obviously walking to work.

I'm currently listening to a radio program where they are talking about Ebola and the outbreak in the mid 90's and it's leading me into one question, how many monkeys does it take to make a quesadilla? The answer may never be known but it certainly takes more than there were working at Taco Bell last night.

This is the third time we have stopped here and they have "been out of meat". Clearly
Don't care about the customer. We will not be back. The single worst Taco Bell I have ever been to.

This is the worst place I have ever been too. Not only are these some of the dumbest people working here, they are always extremely rude. I honestly don't understand what is so difficult about their jobs. I was over charged, all of my items were correct but they were so incorrectly made I couldn't even eat it.

Look I know it's fast food and they get paid terribly. But When I'm in the drive through I still don't want to see workers chomping on tacos with their mouths open, especially without gloves. At least go to the back room to take breaks. Also, I've tried going at 10am and only after ordering do they tell me they're "only serving breakfast right now." If you're going to eliminate your entire menu just to serve eggs inside of tortillas which is gross, have some other options. Taco Bell is all the same ingredients mixed in different ways, it's not like other fast food joints which literally can't serve breakfast and lunch at the same time. Least they could do is tell us the hours when their actual menu is available rather than just being straight up bitches when you try to order it. These workers truly don't care. Either pay them more or prepare for your chain to go extinct.

Ok gang, so this is legitimately a two star place, but it's Taco Bell so it gets the bump to three, because what did you expect when you pulled in here?  They mostly have the bugs worked out (there seem to be a lot of interpersonal conflicts among the staff, but who cares) and are now hastily churning out food that is fit for dogs but sold to people.  I hate myself every time I eat here because I'm almost 40 and why do I do this to myself, but sometimes you just need a couple tacos and 96 ounces of Mountain Dew.  I swear whenever the guy hands me one of those giant cups I can actually hear my pancreatic beta cells contacting their attorneys so as to begin getting their affairs in order.

(6/14/2018)  Sufficient Taco Bell near work.  Had a coworker bring me something since she was going anyway.  Beef Meximelts were sufficiently heated (so that the cheese melted) and was quite full.  Nachos Supreme also adequately dressed.  The drive-thru pattern is tight and not well-organized so there's always an awkward clot of cars in the drive-thru, driveways, and narrow parking lot.  All in all, it's fine.

I wouldn't normally review a Taco Bell, but holy hell is this place bad! I walked in and was immediately greeted by the filthiest rugs I've ever seen. The tables were dirty throughout the dining room; one of them was even broken in half and taped back together! 
The staff all seemed to be in pretty bad moods, including Tracy, the GM. No "hi, how are you", no "what can I get for you". Just blank stares. My tacos were stale and cold so I wanted my money back.
No apology from Tracy. I told her I thought her store was dirty. She just said "ok".
Now, I know, it's Taco Bell. But sheesh, show a little pride in what you do. This place was just a house of sadness.

We just waited 25 minutes (after ordering!) to get three tacos and two burritos.There were three other people waiting who were all just as confused about why staff didn't inform us it would take longer or even apologize for the crazy wait. At one point we waited at the counter for several minutes to ask for a refund so we could just leave...but no one ever came to the register or acknowledged us. To not apologize or offer to give us our food for free after such a ridiculous wait seems pretty unprofessional, even for Taco Bell.

This location is like a mini Taco Bell.  The interior is kind of small and mostly stools and counters.  The entrance is kind of a cluster to get in and out of (like most things in this area of Parmer).  The staff was friendly enough.  The food is what you expect from Taco Bell.

******WARNING********TERRIBLE TACO BELL
after a long day, I was in the mood for some tacos. drove 20 minutes out of my way for Taco Bell -- worst decision of the night. I'm not too familiar with the menu and Taco Bell but the lobby was closed which is understandable. However upon me going to the drive thru there's NO LIGHT FOR THE MENU!
