The woman taking my order was extremely rude and upon waiting for 10 minutes at the drive thru window.. I received my food thrown in a bag and my soda that pretty much water .. terrible experience will never go back. If I could give a zero star rating it was definitely deserved here.

Worst Taco Bell experience ever. Took them 4 tries to get 1 burrito right. First they added something they weren't suppose to twice, then it came back burnt. Finally on their fourth try, it came back decent. Not to mention, the manager was the one screwing up the burrito. Also, the guest sitting next to us had to send their burrito back 4 times. Terrible customer service.

5 stars simply because of the person at the drive thru was the most professional and nicest employees ever! Taco Bell in general is a joke when it comes to Mexican food but because of the service this employee gave in less than 3 minutes of interaction it made it all great. Wish I could have a better description but it was a skinny male lol

Has to be the slowest "fast" food service in Lake Mary.  8:30pm on 2 consecutive MondaysFirst visit sat in the drive thru for 30 mins. Decided to shake it up and order inside the 2nd visit. Another 20+ minute wait.  Get much faster service at any of the local sit down Mexican restaurants. Never again!!!

The woman working the counter was very rude. She then got our order completely wrong and when we went up there to tell her she argued with us saying that we ordered what she "heard" we ordered.

We pretty much order the same thing every time. She rolled her eyes and fixed our order but silently stuck the bag on the counter without saying it was ready. 

Just terrible place to go overall.

This place is horrible! 3 times I've been here and each time they managed to screw up my order in some way. I order a large freeze drink, the girl screws it up and Gave me a regular while charging me a large one and it wasn't even busy. I order a chicken cantina bowl,they somehow made a chicken Catina burrito instead. I order a chicken cantina bowl and the guy who made it didn't even add the cheese and the guacamole. I mean come on now, how can you screw up on an order? You have the ingredients and a picture that shows you how to make it. I'm never going back here again. This place lack customer service and a Management That can lead his or her team the right path. There has been other times I came in and the staff is busy taking and not even tending to customers.  This store is not going to make it without a leader who knows how to lead.
Love this place. It's fresh, clean and tasty. The staff is amazing. They get super busy. Which to me is a good sign.

The pinnacle of fine dining. The other weekend I was perusing Atlanta magazine's top dining destinations for 2015, and I didn't see this TB included on their list. Though I'm hardly an expert, I sent an email to the editors of the magazine to inform them of their mistake.

I was given a quick reply. It seems the Crunchwrap Supreme was, in fact, a serious contender for dish of the year. The editors acknowledged that Taco Bell's innovations in burrito-folding supremely enhanced the dishes they made. Since this trade secret was protected by patent law, I wasn't surprised when the editors told me their folding technique couldn't be replicated without inside information.

I moved on to tacos. I bit into a 'meat' taco and chewed away at the rubbery tortilla that was most certainly based on hundreds of years of Mexican tradition that the company prides itself on. I'm no history buff, but I'm pretty sure that their sauce packets include ancient Aztec proverbs. It's a nice touch.

The last 4-5 times I've gone to this Taco Bell they have messed something up. First two times the potatoes in my loaded potato griller were so I hard I literally could not even bite them in half. The last trip I ordered a crunch wrap supreme and there was maybe one bite of the whole wrap that actually had meat in it. Today when we went we waited five minutes for our change. Then we were told he still had to wait on his manager to get the change. It was only 60 cents so we said don't worry about it. The guy working the counter/cash register was very nice. When we got home we were missing the crunch wrap supreme that was my dinner. So needless to say I will NOT go back to this Taco Bell.
Worst and slowest service I've ever experienced. Rude staff. Deserves zero stars. Will never come back here
Fast, and convenient. Food is consistent, and the meat taste really flavorful here! If you're in a rush I strongly suggest!

I frequent this Taco Bell at least once a week.  I love their Baja steak Chalupas!   The service is always super FAST and friendly, even during the lunch rush, also I've never felt ill after eating here, they keep the place very clean.

Consistent: Consistently Bad. I like Taco Bell and was excited about it coming to our area. Visited this establishment several times. In hopes that my experience this time would be...different...better. They have consistently disappointed. Why? No one is in the dining area, yet every table is dirty. The floor has food and trash everywhere you look. I've brought it to the attention of management several times. One time, that I complained they actually sent someone out to clean. I give up...

So I went to this Taco Bell because they serve alcohol. I ordered and paid for my phone on the touchscreen tablets and also ordered my alcohol from there as well. Got my food fairly quick but still no drink. I went up to the front to wait about 10 minutes for the manager to come out for her to tell me they don't have there liquor license... and instead said I have to just add my own alcohol to the frozen drink... weird. The food wasn't special just messier than I have ever received it from Taco Bell. I got a cantina bowl and two burritos and instead of putting the burritos in a separate container they laid the burritos on top of the cantina bowl where all the beans were so the burritos got soggy. 
Ehhh sorry but I'll never come back

Had a wonderful experience today at this Taco Bell.  Both Aaleeyah and Monique made our visit very special. Visiting Orlando for the parks we made it a point to visit our first TB Cantina and we weren't disappointed. Food and service were A+ and the restaurant was pristine looking. Thanks ladies for the great experience!!

Supposed to open at 10:30. Stood at the door for several minutes then called the store to tell them we were outside and there was a car in the drive thru. A man answered, I told him, he hung up, nobody came to the door. The car that was in the drive thru finally pulled around to the window and a worker talked to her. That customer was nice enough to pull around and tell us that the worker said they were running late and not ready to open yet. Still nobody came to the door to tell us, so we left.

This Taco Bell is the worst. Hands down. There is only one person that works here that is remotely customer service oriented, the rest are very short with you. The soda tastes musty like they don't clean the machine and in addition to that they insist on asking for a specific number of sauce packets, and THEN when you give them a number you'd like they answer with "I'm not allowed to give you more than *ten fewer than you asked for* THIS DOES NOT MATTER THE NUMBER YOU SAY. Don't come here.

you get average food, like any taco bell, but the drive thru is Stoopid long wait.  maybe it's just me, but when I go to a fast food drive thru, I don't want to be waiting for 10+minutes with only 4 cars ahead of me.  the time of day doesn't seem to matter, it's happened 2pm and 10pm, then just now at midnight.  speed it up.
All doors were locked customer let us in were told they were short staffed then someone put a sign on the doors "closed short staffed"

The emotions I experience after taking my first bite into a lavish quesorita parelells agape mania. The ingenious burrito-like creation transports me to another era. An era of real, affordable Mexican food that allows me to feel like I am part of an authentic experience. Thank you Taco Bell, I'll be back. Until then, I sign off wanting you to know how I feel about you. It's not goodbye. It's see you later.

I always like Taco Bell. Good food, great price. My wife and I just ate here and we both ate for 12.00. That's a price that almost nobody can beat. Back in the day subway was better, but now they raised their price a little, and Taco Bell has a little bit better pricing

Upon walking in, we were not greeted although we were seen by the staff.  We waited attached he register with no service or acknowledgement.  Taco Bell is Taco Bell but the service  (or lack thereof) was ridiculous.
I pulled up at 2:30am and they were very nice and fast. Best overall taco bell experience, food and service.

I gotta say this Location has never disappointed me until tonight there was only 3 cars in front me by the time I got my food it was almost 20 minutes I noticed when I first pulled up after ordering I noticed three of the employees goofing around in the back I won't be back at night anymore

Fast. But.

A little family time with tacos. My Mom and I wanted the Nacho Fries. First. The Nacho Fries are tasty. The Velveta Cheese Sauce is decent and a fair amount.

The Nacho Fries Portion= Lame. You get a $1.00 worth. They think its about 8 fries. Nothing like the advertising. The one that shows fries filled to the brim! Nothing even close to that portion. Everything else was great, As far as T Bell goes.

Sorry---I'm like the rest of the people giving their review-----this is the SLOWEST FAST FOOD ever!!! Was here tonight ---it took me a total of 35 minutes from ordering til I received my food! Totally ridiculous!! It's true it seems no one wants to work anymore BUT that's why u have supervisors and mangers-----u should be there helping ur employees with our orders!  I like the food ---but I guess I'm just going to have to unlike ur food!
Rude slow slow slow slow service. Waited 26 minutes because they forgot our order. Got sloppy food when complained. Did not want to refund money. Worst service ever in a Taco Bell.
Horrible service!! Takes forever to get your food. ALWAYS check your order as they ALWAYS forget to include something. Very unhelpful in replacing forgotten item. Best to avoid this location!!
Its taco bell.  The food is average but the amount of kids that hang out at this location make it pretty noisy.

I'm not a avid Taco Bell customer. Today I had an odd craving for one of their chicken quesadillas.... Did you know that they charge extra to switch from a crunchy taco to a soft taco? Yeah I didn't either until I saw my receipt.

Doesn't it seem reasonable to mention to customers "hey, it's going to be a .10 up charge to get a soft taco. Is that okay, or do you want to stick with the crunch" 


NOW I KNOW ITS ONLY 10 CENTS. But it's the principle of the thing. You shouldn't charge extra and not lot people know. .10 isn't going to break my bank but the lack of service combined with it is appalling. 

Oh, and two cars in the drive thru and it took over 15 minutes to get my food.....
Ordered two different types of burritos. One with chicken one with beef. Neither burrito had any kind of meat in them.

"Don't forget the extra meat!"

-An inside joke my friends and I have now due to a scary encounter David had here at 1:00 am when a trans-sexual woman asked my friend to order a beef challupa (extra meat!)  for her because they wouldn't allow her to walk through the drive-thru. After agreeing to order the chalupa, she pours $2 in pennies on my friends passenger seat to pay for her food and screams "don't forget the extra meat!"
Oh, the characters that hang out on this corner!

Probably the scariest fast food in Atlanta. However, I can't tell you how many times I have eaten there at 1AM! 
Thank God for 69 cent hard shell tacos even if there's a late night "show" to go with it!

The wait was a little long, but the food was fresh and the service was great.  They didn't fully understand fulfill the order the way it was ordered, but it ended up working out fine either way. If you get the chance try the new Wild Spicy Naked Chalupa with Queso Dip on the side (two should suffice) - you'll thank me later!

It took me 20 minutes to get through the drive-thu line with only 3 cars in front of me... It's called fast food for a reason - it's supposed to be fast! Once you pull into the drive-thru lane, you must continue through the drive-thru. I would have left if I wasn't blocked in. The service was terrible as well, but I didn't expect much in that department.

OMG, Horrible!!! This is the nastiest of fast food restaurants in all of Columbus!! Lets start from the moment you park your car.(yep, I was getting carryout)..As soon as you walk in the door there is an overwhelmingly nasty smell of cigarette smoke (I honestly believe the employees smoke in the alcove where the restrooms are). Trash is always overflowing from ALL trashcans. Soda / Tea machines had one drink...ONE...that actually wasn't water and that was MD Blast and that's nasty! The inside is DIRTY with food and trash everywhere!Food order was not only wrong but everything was cold! One girl working window AND counter which explains why there was 11, yes 11, cars in line that were not moving and about 6 orders in line on the inside. One girl walked in rubbing her nose with her bare hand and then proceeded to touch the fryers and throw a bag of Cinnabons in the grease! My family loves TB and the closest one besides this one is a good 15 minute drive but I will be making that drive from now on. Whoever owns / manages this establishment, you need to get it together!!
We came here for breakfast and the guy who took our order was extremely nice and patient and the food was hot and delish!

Eat here only if you like hair in your food and crushed chips.

I normally love Nachos Supreme no tomato, but I will never ever ever in my life order it again from this or any taco bell. I will NEVER eat again at Taco Bell either, but this location is the worse by far.

I ordered my usual - nachos supreme, no tomato while going through the drive thru. Nothing eventful. It was about 8 or so at night on a Saturday. No line, no wait, no issues...until I began eating.

Why were all my tortilla chips crushed? It's like someone took the last remnants of a bag of chips, crushed it several times over, then dumped them onto my tray. I was upset that I couldn't use these chips to load up the dip, meat, beans and sour cream. So I grabbed a fork because I was determined to have some nachos. After my third bite, I noticed something stringy. Since TB doesn't use real cheese on nachos, I knew it wasn't stretchy cheese. As I ran my fork through the food, a long blonde hair emerged. Problem? You bet!!!! 

I called and explained the situation to the employee on the phone. I hear her tell the manager, eww, gross... When the manager got on the phone, she said I could stop by and they will remake it for me. Not going to happen! Who wants to eat the exact same thing they just found hair in? Not me. I asked for my money back. I won't be returning to this Taco Bell, nor any other, EVER!

I wanted some rolled chicken tacos. So I order them and she said we're not serving them yet. I ask what time do you start serving them she says 9 o'clock. I look down at my clock 8:58 are you kidding me. What ever happened to serving the customer?

Food is usually cold and sloppily put together. 

PS you guys don't deserve $15 an hour. You should be getting half of that   You guys have no skills and no education. What makes you think you deserve to make as much as me when I've been working hard the last several years getting job knowledge.
DO NOT Eat here unless you have 40 to 45 Minutes to wait for your food!  Dirty!  No one with any work ethic.  Tables dirty, floors covered in trash.  Every table had people sitting waiting for food.

Hey, I have to stick up for this place!  I see the 1-star reviews, but I hit this place up often enough to know it's an above average Taco Bell.  They are always extremely nice at the window and the food is always hot.  It's Taco Bell, so you should expect Taco Bell food!  If you like Taco Bell food, you'll like this location.

Oh dear, oh dear, this is my first and last Taco Bell experience. This Taco Bell competes with lots of fast food type places in the food court within the Florida Mall: it serves up industrially manufactured, highly processed, and cheap food at its worst; no thank you - I had the soft taco option and there were three of these things in a portion, each was individually wrapped in its own little paper bag and all placed inside a bigger paper bag. The diet coke served up was flat. This food had no discernible smell nor did it have any detectible texture. It was lukewarm food too. The bits of grated, orangey cheese were rubbery and completely devoid of taste, I mean cheese is meant to have a taste, the sour cream was served in a tiny paper pot and priced at 59 cents was  more like plain yoghurt and the guacamole also at 59 cents served in a small paper pot just tasted metallic, it certainly didn't have an avocado taste. I suppose the only positive with Taco Bell is that it's cheap. The server was courteous and the food was presented up very quickly.

Avoid this location unless you have a half hour to wait for a simple order.  They are so short handed they keep the doors locked and only have the drive thru open.  You literally wait in line longer than it would take to drive to the grocery store, buy taco fixings, go home and make them yourself.  It is utterly ridiculous.  If you are that short staffed then close the restaurant or get new management.
Usually EXTREMELY SLOW but the foods usually good which makes it better than most fast food places. I recommend going here but make sure to turn off your car in the drive thru to save gas!

Ummm, yes, I love Taco Bell.  It is my one fast food weakness.  This location isn't too bad.  I also love the mild sauce, I can't get enough of it...

Chicken quesadillas, triple-layer nachos, beef burritos, volcano tacos... oh my!

Proud Bell customer since 1989.  My oh my and it looks like the same decor is still around... but some of the new locations look like a Moes restaurant.

I go to this location a lot and let me say they price gauge like crazy. They overprice the usual cheap items and the people there are lazy and just slop it all onto a wrapper. I got the nachos and after eating I found a large clump of hair at the bottom of the to go bowl it looked like someone cleaned their shower drain then put it in the nachos for extra flavor. I am disgusted. Last week I had the misfourtune of ordering a taco. SLOP. I will be going to the Taco Bell/ KFC in Framingham from now on

Ordered a grande scrambler with a side of cheese and it was absolutely delicious for the $3.00 I spent.  The clerks were extremely nice and helpful.  I would invite anyone to have breakfast at Taco bell-i think they would be pleasantly surprised

Wow. So I have lived across the street from this location for at least 15 years so i am sure there have been multiple cycles of management within that time frame. I order the cheesy gordita crunch, which on most occasions very delicious! However, unfortunately they have forgotten to put the sauce on before; so since then I have requested extra sauce to ensure that they do not forget to put it on. This time, I really am not sure what happened, maybe when I said extra sauce they thought I said extra spice. The sauce quantity was the same as when I usually order extra sauce. However, it was at least 4x spicier than normal!!! Not sure if it was a different sauce or they messed up the recipe for the normal sauce. It was so spicy I almost could not even eat it and had to throw it away. Typically highly enjoy my experience here but really quite disappointed this time.

I love this place! I live a few blocks away so it's my go to spot when I need a quick, inexpensive bite. This is one of my favorite fast food options because I don't eat meat, and generally I end up with nothing more than a side of fries or a small salad when we do fast food. Which gets old, and I'm young and often find myself in these situations. There's always something on taco bell's menu I'm excited about! And I've gotten stuffed on $3 before.. Can't beat it! 

Also the staff is very nice. They always seem to apologize even if you waited a minute or two at most. Once I was waiting in line, and April walked in the door and didn't even put her stuff down before she got my order in! She also suggested I get an item grilled... Now I throw that in with my order everytime ;) (She was right. And she's a good up seller... Bc now I spend an extra dollar every trip.) my only gripe is I can't specify this in my online orders- to grill something- but that's nothing to do with the store- just the app itself. I've never gotten service here from anyone that was mediocre. Keep it up!

So Taco Bell was NOT on the ball tonight. Pulled into drive-thru at 6:33pm, finally got to order at 6:40pm. Got to the pay window at 6:57pm and pulled away with food at 7:07pm. For those not wanting to do the math, that's 34 minutes it took me in the drive-thru with cars behind me so I couldnt leave. Best part... There were 3 crew members just standing at the window instead of jumping on the line and helping. I've worked a few fast food jobs and I'm well aware that sometimes you're short handed and shit happens, but 34 minutes??? Ugh
Although, I'm giving 2 stars because even with the wait, they got everything right for the first time in quite a while.

This Taco Bell is the most Taco Bell Taco Bell i've been to. Since 1989, this Taco Bell has been a Taco Bell. When they remodeled 10 years ago, they made it a Taco Bell/Pizza Hut combo. Apparently it was bad enough that they had to go back to being just a Taco Bell. It just goes to show how much of a Taco Bell this really is. They have every item a Taco Bell has, and yes, that includes tacos. Tacos come with every meal. It's the best fast food restaurant in Lake Mary, and it's the only Taco Bell between Sanford and Casselberry. It's the best Taco Bell in a 10 mile stretch, because it is the only Taco Bell.

 They are a Taco Bell, so expect typical Taco Bell fare when entering this Taco Bell. It's pretty far compared to the other fast food resturants in Lake Mary, but it's a Taco Bell, so there's that. If I put every Taco Bell in a blender, I would have something like this Taco Bell. I can't say that this is worse or better than any Taco Bell, because Taco Bells are always the same as every other Taco Bell, but because I've been to this Taco Bell before many times and can compare to other local Taco Bells, and, I'll rate it 4 Taco Bells out of 5, because it's not the best Taco Bell, but at least it isn't as bad as a mall Taco Bell.
The crispy tacos are deeeee-LISH!! But I can only give 4 stars because they insist on stocking the "Baja Blast" flavor of Mt. Dew. WHATEVER HAPPENED TO CODE RED PEOPLE!?!?!?!? jeeeeeez
The general manager Jonathan Harris and Taco Bell Corporate  were extremely quick on fixing an error in a order. This Taco bell has excellent customer service.

Go through the drive through, order my tacos and chalupas beef and cheese only. Get the order, has sour cream on the chalupas. Go back through the drive through to fix this and they try to tell me to go inside to fix the order. They end up fixing it but not without an attitude as if I'm inconveniencing them. New chalupas are as hard as a Virgin at a strip club. One has tomatoes in it and the other has some lettuce in it........how hard is it guys, get it together

If I could give zero stars I would this place is trash always a long wait always mess up orders and the attitude of the employees is a shame places like this shouldn't ask why they can't be paid 15 an hour you don't deserve it honestly have had so many issues from this establishment

Slow service every time. Today, there was a handwritten sign on the door stating the "lobby was closed". It's 6pm. I even ordered ahead on the app to avoid the dreadful drive thru at this location. So much for that idea...

One word, wow. I went to his restaurant without any great expectations but I was blown away. I got the #8 which is three soft tacos (with my own little twist of no lettuce ) and it was fantastic. Add a little bit of their renowned mild sauce and you'll think you died and went to heaven. Would recommend to anybody who has a palate for high end Mexican food! 11/10!
Worst taco bell I've ever been too. Every single time it takes at least 15 mins to get through a line of 3 cars. Been to this location 3 times and today was the last time. Waste is time.

Taco Bell you owe me a tank of gas, I must of sat in the drive-thru almost 10 minutes, completely unacceptable, I've worked in drive-thru's, and they are number one, there's no reason someone should be sitting in the drive-thru longer than 2 minutes, I ordered 3 burritos, not 20! But having said that, I like cheap Mexican food, so I guess I'll go back at some point.

Uhmmm, I got kicked out of this Taco Bell with no food on Christmas Eve because the cashier decided to have a meltdown and kick everyone out an hour before they were supposed to actually close.

I witnessed a grown ass woman throw an extreme, child-like, temper tantrum at this store and I am uncertain how someone like that is able to maintain employment. She was in the front taking orders and then made an announcement to everyone in line, "we're only serving chicken right now, and we may not have enough chicken for everyone in line" 
I thought to myself, alright cool, I just want a couple bean burritos anyway so this shouldn't effect my order..... She goes on to say "well it's Christmas Eve and we close in 10 minutes, so I don't know if there's time to make food for everyone in line, plus were closed tomorrow so we arent going to prep food to throw it away".

That's when it started to become obvious that this chick just wanted everyone to leave...... The current time was 6:10pm and Taco Bell actually closed in 50 minutes (at 7pm) & not in the 10 minutes that this lady quoted, so I thought I was in the clear... I mean BRUH I even called like 10 minutes before I got there to verify that they were even actually open, but whatever.

It was my turn to order and the lady taking orders disappears into the back, out of sight and straight up starts yelling to her co-workers. She said, "Today IS BULLSHIT & I'm fed up that people keep coming here tonight. Don't these assholes realize its Christmas and that I just want to be at home with my family".

I look at my husband in disbelief and some young kid who clearly works in the kitchen comes out and awkwardly says "looks like there's no more food tonight" and he shrugged.

He gave me a cup for a soda and as I was walking out he handed me a coupon for a free taco on my next visit.... As this was happening, I could still hear the woman throwing her tantrum, insulting everyone in the store and I just shook my head, sipped my soda & walked tf out..... But like seriously wtf just happened in there? Why you gonna have a meltdown one hour before your shift ends and then scream at people? Girl, it's not that serious its still Christmas EVE and you have all of Christmas day off..... Why are you so upset that you feel the need to insult a bunch of people for simply entering your place of employment and trying to buy food. 


Get it together Taco Bell.


I ended up getting Popeyes instead and the dude working gave me a discount because "it's Christmas"!
I like taco bell. We went there and the tables were dirty. Not enough meat on my husband food. They need someone better to run this place.
Taco Bell rocks. Not the prettiest one I have ever been to, but open late, has the promotional menu, and polite staff. Drive through and ample parking as well.

The best Taco Bell I've been to. The food is correct, the people are nice- if I order something supreme it actually doesn't look like there's a tomato/sour cream embargo. Also really like the outdoor patio. Perfect place to spend my lunch break.

Slowest service I've ever had.  Went to drive thru and nobody answered so i went to see if they were open and they were but the door was locked bc thru lobby closes at 9:30 but I could see the 2 employees inside.  I motioned to the young lady and pointed to the drive thru and did a "what's up" gesture and then went to the drive thru.  I go to the drive thru again and she answers this time.  I order my food and literally waited about 15 minutes for them to complete my order.  When I finally got to the window, the young lady didn't remember my order and had to ask me what I had again.  I finally got my combo and she forgot to give me my drink.  I waited for her to come back to window and she asked if I needed something and I told her, "Yeah, my drink!" She then stated that she was tired and couldn't wait to get off.  Oh yeah....she overcharged me for my food.  My combo should've been $5.99 but i got charged $7.09 instead.  I was just so ready to get my food and leave that I didn't even care enough at this point.  Won't be back here and will probably contacting corporate.

I wish I could give this POS place zero stars. We pulled up at 1:43am and these people would not answer the drive-thru, so we pulled up to the window. We waited at the window and attempted to drive back thru. Nothing. Then they waited until time sprang forward at 2am to 3am and they turned the light off in the drive-thru. I will never visit this place again. This is not the first time we have had this type of issue with the lazy employees at this taco bell. Fire your night staff.

I haven't really been back to this Taco Bell, even though it is close. But how many times can you screw up an order, on several different occasions? None of the employees really seem to care about anything. They can be quick at getting you your food, if they don't screw it up, or forget something. I don't think it matters what Taco Bell you go to either. Guys, just make the extra effort to find a Taco Time instead...

great quality food. would suggest to vegans. i love the way i digest this food. it really turns me on. the way my butthole burns for this restaurant is incredible.  peace peace love jesus.. peace peace grilled cheese.

Long wait at night but everything seemed in order. There are always those times where you just need some Taco Bell - usually in the middle of the night. Personally I just got for a soft taco and a crunchy...maybe a Mexican pizza...ok, definitely a Mexican pizza. Lots of food for cheap.

Like previous people have said, it's the slowest fast food place I've ever been to. I've waited multiple times well over 20 mins in the drive through. It feels like they literally have one person working the whole store. I'm writing this as I'm sitting in line because I have a ton of time. This will be my last time coming to this Taco Bell.

Severely understaffed for rush hour, placed an order online and i was only instructed to come through drive through however when i arrived he refused to give me my food because i didn't tell him over the intercom...and told me to drive around and get back in line... i love taco bell but this is the last time i visit this specific location!

The line for the drive thru was extremely long, I timed my wait, which was about 29 minutes. While I was stuck in the line, there was a man off to the side of the cars in the back of the parking lot, he was missing most of his teeth, and messing with some pipe looking object in his hands. Another man rolled up to him on a razor scooter holding a chainsaw and smoking a marijuana cigarette. I could smell his joint even with my windows rolled up. He was standing next to the man, revving his chainsaw even though there wasn't anything to saw nearby. I couldn't wait to get out of this place. By the time I made it to the window, the girl who was working the window didn't apologize for the long wait, or give any sort of reassurance that the food was coming. I sat at the window for another 7 minutes waiting for my food to be ready. I looked inside the store and the two other workers I saw were moving at a snail's pace with looks of disdain on their faces. She handed me my food and wished me a good night, but unfortunately, my night had already been ruined. I arrived home 5 minutes later, ready to eat. When I unwrapped my food it was sloppy, and smaller than usual. I guess I won't be back...

They were out of all sodas.. ground beef.. chicken... and nacho chips.. found out about the soda and chips after I paid. And the cashier used a racial slur while informing me about them being out of Pepsi. I give 4 thumbs down to these scrubs.
I am always having to return and complain about an incorrect order because the people making the food are spaced out and not paying attention.
If 0 stars were an option that's what it would have been. The employees here have no motivation whatsoever!! And you'll be lucky if your order was made right :/

what can i say.  it's taco bell..    yo queirro.

if you get tacos only, it gets surprisingly expensive.

After a long day at the airport from LA, my family and I were starving and checked to see for what was open. We settled for Taco Bell. The gentleman taking our order was very polite and even gladly repeated our order as we requested. When we got to the window, we specifically asked the blonde Asian lady for hot sauce then repeated it once more before departing. She responded in a less-than-polite manner, "It's all there." To our disappointment, there was no hot sauce in our bag. The lack of sauce would've been overlooked if that woman at that drive-thru didn't present a displeasing attitude.

Decent enough place. Employees are always friendly and nice and drive through service is usually quick. I've had a couple burritos poorly put together, but I guess that should be expected. Tastes like Taco Bell. Can't complain!

I heard this new Taco Bell cantina was open, so we satisfied our taco cravings and ordered online for pickup. There's no drive-thru, so you have to wait inside with all the dine-ins. We got there and I immediately noticed the beer taps. 

We advised the cashier of our online order and she printed our receipt, handed me my drink cup, and said she would send the kitchen our order...WHAT?! I was expecting it to already be assembled! So we waited 10 minutes for our food.

I got a Double Decker with steak, Meximelt w guacamole and sour cream, and nachos. We customized our food online and luckily everything was right.

Maybe one day when I return we can dine in and have some beer.

Breakfast time

So this morning I came to this Taco Bell location and their not open yet, and they supposed to be serving breakfast but they have a sign on the drive-tho order saying "sorry we are until 830" my thing is how y'all have breakfast don't open until 830 most and many ppl are at work by this time so what's the point of advertising that y'all have breakfast but start so late and plus on the yelp said y'all are open but y'all are not open ???

Came in for lunch. Tried to new quesalupa with beef as suggested by the cashier...it was horrible. Next time i think ill try the chicken..you can order with chicken, beef or steak.
I had the fiery dorritos taco, was good. Also ordered chipotle chicken roll up thing..wasn't that good either. 
Lastly ordered nachos and cheese,  and that was good..always consistent and that's what i am for.
Cashier was very polite and nice. Very clean inside. Not bad for a taco bell.
I was amazed with how dirty this restaurant was. I woner if the health department ever visits this location?

I ordered 4 items in this store thru drive-thru and I got the whole order wrong. we realized that after reaching home and we drove back as it seems like an honest mistake. We have to go to drive-thru again as the dine-in is closed. We told our tale and a guy named Mike asked us to pull-over and wait. We did the same for 30 minutes and no one showed up. We tried to go in and it was locked. We had to walk to the drive-thru window and confront them. He said we are waiting for us to give the wrong order but he didn't mention that before. They never apologized to us about this incident at all. We had to wait at the window for 5 minutes before they took our order again and 15 mins to make it. This is my worst experience at any store and I will never be back to Taco bell again and I would never recommend it to my friends. I am ready to post this wherever I find viable. Bad staff ever. One guy said we cant refund the money whatever you do. We just expected an apology.

Stopped by this Taco Bell this afternoon on my way home. Not only did the Gentlemen at the window ask me to wait a second and then proceeded to have me sit in line for another seven minutes before I finally asked if I could order. I got home to open up my bag and found that a lot of my taco was on the outside of the wrapper. Extremely poor customer service and quality control. I will not be eager to return.

Half hour wait. Lol.  Customers saying they waited over a hour when I walked in then reading the receipt and seeing over 30 minute wait and the staff saying loud enough for customers could hear "I tried calling ----blank in" omg no.  It's fast food. It's 5 minutes or I'm gone and now way will I wait a hour for food from here when I only eat out a few times a year.  Ha ha ha laughable
Hey, you know the menu, and you're either a fan or you're not.  This franchise is clean, friendly, accurate, and newly-remodeled.

Food is mediocre but don't  expect what u want at 1:30..they never have black bean burritos late.. God forbid you go past 2:00 they will b pissed they have to serve you.. Will no longer be my late nite go to... This place kinda sucks except the big dark skinned manager is friendly that's all they got.. Sorry but you lost my business to the other places willing to serve you without attitude.. Guy made it a point to tell me they were about to close soon.. Yeah I'll take my money elsewhere goodbye

we were waiting at a table for our food for 15 minutes when an employee came out and shouted that everyone had to leave because they were short staffed. a family was mid meal and had to take their food and leave... we ended up waiting 20 minutes for "fast food" lol disappointing even for taco bell
The people here suck because they can't even run a Taco Bell correctly. Food is taking forever!!!

It's a shame that this taco bell location is the closest to my house... and that is the ONLY reason I shamefully continue to frequent this spot. I know what to expect from a typical fast food restaurant, but this is worlds worse than your typical "slow service" or "slightly wrong order". I typically order a cheese quesadilla and I have started to, after many times of not receiving it, asking at the drive-thru, "please make sure to not forget the creamy jalapeno sauce that comes on the quesadilla." A cheese quesadilla from taco bell comes with shredded tri-blend cheese and a slightly spicy, creamy sauce called "creamy jalapeno sauce". You'd expect that with only two ingredients aside from the shell, this is the least likely order to mess up, right? Wrong. 90% of the time I receive a horrendously burnt quesadilla with maybe 40% of the shredded cheese that should be on there scantily filling only the middle two slices of the fold. It's fucking gross. Like, how lazy must one be to forget an entire third of the ingredients of a quesadilla? You can also expect, if ordering more than one item, to not receive an item or to receive an entirely wrong order about 50% of the time. Driving back around a second time to correct the order is not only time consuming because they have such slow service, it's also REALLY ANNOYING because good luck trying to explain to your half-competent drive-thru attendant about the order they messed up a mere 5 minutes ago (if you're lucky to get through that quick). Most of the time, the "corrected order" they give you has some problem of its own, is given to you with the worst attitude, and comes only after a hassle of an argument during which you hopelessly try to convince the person at the window that you are right and they are wrong. Seriously unless you're a common customer here and know how to swing the ropes of dealing with their bullshit, just steer clear, because you will likely leave with a high risk of anger induced stroke and may certainly have one after ingesting your greasy, burnt order. Also would like to note, I tried to contact Taco Bell customer service about this location but was unable to voice my complaints. This taco bell really is the butthole, hell's end of all of the Taco Bells across the country. Also a few years ago there was a credit card scam at this taco Bell (perhaps at the fault of a thieving employee if I do remember correctly) and ever since, I only pay with cash here. I'd also like to add that on several occasions I have been propositioned for drug deals while sitting in this drive thru.

Currently in line. Just pulled up to the speaker to order. The order taker was kind enough to explain that they are short staffed and that there are only 2 workers. He also explained that the car in front of me placed a big order so that it would even be a longer wait.

I honestly wouldn't give this store a star period just went less than 20 mins ago ordered 2 steak nacho plates and 2 5 layer burrito. Also Ordered a watermelon freeze and two apple impinadas they forgot our impinadas and my watermelon freeze. My 2 burritos had barely no meat look like they took a baby spoon and called it alright to serve. It was mostly cheese bean and sour cream very dissapointing. I called to say there was no meat in my burrito and the lady didnt apologize for the mistake and ask what I wanted to do. With a very unpleasant voice. I'm a local customer who goes in there a lot and always got a unhappy meal shut this mf down.!! I will be calling the store owner!!

I would give you negative stars if I could.  Every single time I go through the drive thru, they mess up the order.  I just had them miss items even after I asked them to double check it and told them it was missing an item.  They gave me such attitude and told me it was in there and I was wrong!  Came home and sure enough, it's not in there.  They were so rude!!!!  I realize it is Taco Bell, but come on!!

Never fails... this place has gotten worse and worse the past year. Came here for lunch with my wife and kids and my order was messed up 3 times. Then we're ordered something else and we waited over 15 minutes for it.

Terrible... we placed a rather easy order and the person taking the order sounded like they had no clue about Taco Bell items.  They were unprofessional and forgot to turn off the microphone after she told us our total. We could hear her complaining as we drove towards the window. To make things worse, they forgot one of our menu items. We couldn't turn around because we were on a time crunch, but we called and informed them of the matter.  I don't think I'll be going to this location anymore.

Taco bell disappointment, part 2
After leaving the taco bell which apparently didn't need to take orders, we drove a mile away to the nearest taco bell.
Got into the LONG line for ordering.
Ordered what I was going to have to settle for - because the good stuff has been taken off the menu.
Drive up to the window. Pay the person. He asks if we want any sauce. We say "Extra fire sauce". Our bag is received.
As we drive off, the bag checked.
No sauce whatsoever.
FAIL.
Too frustrated by the evening failures of Taco bell to go back and say "hey, we told you we wanted EXTRA fire sauce, and you gave us NO sauce. That is NOT EXTRA."

As a former worker of The Florida Mall, Taco Bell (at the food court) was a pretty cheap way to get a meal on break. I wouldn't say that the staff is very good at what they do (something I've noticed about almost all the places in the food court). The last time I was there, the girl filling up my cup didn't even fill it all the way up. While I was waiting for my food, I noticed, and asked a girl from the back to fill it up all the way, she said, "I can't. I'm wearing gloves", and then got a sleepy looking cashier to do it. If customers aren't making a good line, they'll call over whomever is paying attention, causing "line jumping". After you order your food, it usually takes about five minutes to get it. Staff members from the back bring a bag out, and call out a number, so you better figure out your number! I'm not pleased with the service here.
Cleaner and newer than the average Taco Bell. The electronic touchscreen ordering was a breeze. They also serve alcohol, what more could you need from a fast food Taco Bell?

Dec 14 @ 5.45 PM the young black girl who was servicing the drive thru was so careless, disinterested and rude that it baffles me ! She almost dropped the food handing out ; closed the window while I was still grappling with her hand over. 

Seriously why would such a person be in anything customer centric ?
Pretty standard Taco Bell food. But the staff is really nice and when there was a mistake with my order they fixed it without any issues and gave me a free dessert!

There food is great tasting but leaves you with a bit of a  stomach ache also every time I go there for a freeze they never have it and when they do there is more ice then flavoring we my FAM is going to a different one good luck oh and I'm super angry because they took out that BLT thing  oh and there food leaves you on the potty all day #exlax

When I rated this location a year ago, I gave it a 2-star rating. At the time, I said the food was good but the staff left something to be desired.

Well, it's a year later and a 2-star rating is being charitable.  The food is still good and the staff is still not very customer focused. At 1:30 pm, over half the tables needed to be wiped down, the beverage machine was leaking onto the floor and the paper cup they had put under the machine was overflowing.  Water from the machine had soaked the walk off mat in front of the machine and was leaking out onto the main part of the restaurant floor.

Food was decent and hot, and was served promptly.  It's downhill from there.

Oh lord, what has the world come to?

Am I this american now that I give a "mexican" fast food chain 5 stars and leave completly satisfied having had a wonderful lunch with my family?

Not what I was expecting, at all!

We were off to a late start to the day, the stress of moving getting to us, we were famished and I could not possibly hold off to eat any longer, this strip of E Broad being closest to home on our way out my husband suggested lets go here he could get 10 for $8.90 tacos since every penny counts before our massiv roadtrip to LA.

I was not in for an argument and no idea what I wanted other than FOOD and NOW so I went with it.

This location is new, very clean and has the best service I have ever come across.

They were offering the neu chef inspired Cantina Bell menu and after having the super patient lady at the register explain the difference between the regular taco salad and the new cantina bell salad with citrus-herb marinated chicken, flavorful black beans, guacamole made from real Hass avocados, roasted corn & pepper salsa, a creamy cilantro dressing, and freshly prepared pico de gallo, all served on a bed of cilantro rice I was sold.

It was so fresh and tasty, especially the roasted corn salsa, actually charred and smoky tasting, and the cilantro lime rice better than at Chipotle!

I loved it so much I was about to order another but it was actually filling and at just over $4 a steal!

The manager came by our table and asked how we are enjoying our meal and another worker came by and thanked us for dining with them and brought some mints, as welll as our food was brought to us.

What a suprisingly nice meal, I can recommend this location to anyone for a cheap, fast and filling lunch without the grimpy fast food joint feeling.

This Taco Bell location is pretty bad. The workers work about as fast as the sloths in zootopia. The workers could not care less about serving people their food. After 30 minutes , I had cancelled my order and left due to the slow & careless service.
The slowest drive thru I have ever been to. At any given time, waiting at least 10-15 minutes for order. Pretty ridiculous.

Zero stars.  Horrible.  Rude.  After waiting in the drive thru, trying to place an order for 10 minutes we said can we get any service?  To which they responded, "we will put you on hold as long as we want".

How stupid can the people who work there be? Cant make the food like it supposed to. Want sour cream? Hope you want it to be your entire first bite and no where else, if at all but you'll pay for it. Forget your items all the time. 2 hot sauce for 6 things. This place needs new management and get in line. The workers there right now, maybe one nice and the rest completely unpleasant. I dont expect a lot from fast food but maybe the items I paid for and workers who dont look at you like a complete nuisance, and maybe only partly a nuisance.

I'm sitting in the drive through currently and have been for the past 40 minutes. I ordered 4 things. It first took him about 15 minutes to even acknowledge that I was at the drive thru speaker, and I should have left then, but i'm hypoglycemic and nauseous and didn't want to have to drive somewhere else. Now i've been sitting here at the window waiting for 25 minutes while there is NOBODY in the dining room and, until about 10 minutes ago there was nobody else in the drive thru. What the hell are you guys doing in there.
Need to stuff burritos fuller. Today I ordered a double stuffed burrito and all I tasted was tortilla. Most of the time it isn't an issue but this Taco Bell is very inconsistent.

I don't know how you mess up pre packaged, frozen, corporate, low stakes "Mexican" food, but somehow they manage.  The soda is always flat.  The drive thru is always slow.  One question about my so-called Cheesy Gordita Crunch...Wtf is this in my picture?  Literally infused with the paper.

Good stuff! Fresh, hot, gracious amount of toppings. My Gorditas Supremes were great. 

Service was polite, fast, efficient. Good stop.

The slowest Taco Bell in the Portland metro area! Tonight they closed early due to short staffing. We always wait over 15 mins at this location. And tonight it's closed! Just crazy for a newly remodeled location! We are driving an extra mile to the other Taco Bell in Gladstone! I'm done with this taco bell!

$1.00 grillers after 2PM.  Yow-sah!  Yow-sah! Yow-sah!!!  I seldom review fast food places, but  if you are looking for something inexpensive and are on the go, you really can't go wrong with Taco Bell.
Taco bell rules! Why aren't there more of them? Like why do I have to drive to woburn to get a Doritos locos taco? Also why don't they have a menu?

Due to this Covid environment, I went thru the drive thru & got 6 items totaling about $13.  Instead of the most expensive item of the order ($3.69), they put a cheap $1 taco in the bag instead.  Once I got home I discovered this convenient rip-off!  Needless to say I would not recommend this place if you don't want to be cheated!

If I could I would give them zero stars
 Ordered 40.00 worth of food.  Order was all messed up . Missing items,tacos soggy and falling apart. 
Calling corporate officein the morning. Attempted to call the location no answer . Stay away from this place really has gone downhill.

Well just waited in the drive through window for 10 minutes. No one came, so we pulled up to the main window and legit was watching the guy walk by and we were honking and were ignored. We even made laps around the restaurant to try and get their attention and NOPE. Definitely not impressed

This is Taco Bell at its worst. Rude service in the drive thru and the food looked terrible. I ordered three soft shell taco here is what I received pictures attached. This is not edible at all. I know that the location of this Taco Bell is not in the best of neighborhoods but it should not determine the quality of the food.

Worst Taco Bell in the area hands down. The order is commonly messed up. No extra effort given to mark items with no onions, sauce, etc... Recently, they have started with their own hours of 9am till 8pm. Either they are having a difficult time maintaining employees or they are busy enough that reviews and their actions don't matter as they do not need the business.
Horrible service and very slow. I'll drive an extra 10 minutes to take my business else where.

Went here with my 11 year old and have way though our meal she noticed trash under the freeze machine, it was obviously swept under there.
We both nearly puked. If this is in plain site, what must it look like in back?

This Taco Bell is trash. We ordered in line at the drive through and the man taking the order was super pleasant but they forgot my two desserts and refused to bring them out to us and insisted we wait in a 5 car long line to receive the items we should have been given in the first place. This place sucks

Very poor service. Staff ignores you because they want you to use self-kiosk. Sorry but my grandmother is visually impaired; How disrespectful.  Also, this location is extremely slow but I don't expect much from fast food employees these days. Especially Taco Bell.

if i could give them no stars i would. the service here is super slow. and there was a hair in my food and i asked them to remake it and it took them 10 minutes. then there was also a hair in my friends food. not happy.

Shut this place down. Was advised I'd be helped in a moment but that was clearly a joke. Just waited in the drive thru for 15 MINUTES. All I wanted was a drink but that didn't happen since drove away thirsty. Wish I could have went in to share my feelings but this establishment is not a handicap accessible place (FYI I'll be calling the department of labor). Mark my words, I will never turn to another Taco Bell/ stupid KFC.

This review is based on the assumption that everybody knows that Taco Bell is a giant fast food chain offering mediocre Americanized "Mexican" food.  Their fare is typically very inexpensive, and most locations get your food out to you very quickly.
This particular location has been a hit-and-miss endeavor on speed and and service, but more often than not, they do just fine.
I've been particularly impressed with their speed, professionalism, friendliness, and handling the COVID-19 protocols (thus the extra star).

Terrible customer service. The woman at the window kept touching her face and hair the entire time and didn't look at me to return my card. Another woman didn't look at me to give me my food. Didn't even speak to us at the window at all. To busy talking in the back. Won't be back.

Always slow and today was the worst. Cars were pulling away because of it and with one car in front of us it took 10 minutes to get our food. I overheard the guy working there said they're backed up because only two people are working there. Clearly it's a management problem because these two guys were pleasant and trying their best. I will not be coming back and I hope corporate takes notice of the low reviews and fixes it.

So confused why this Taco Bell doesn't run normal hours. I went to this location my first ever time going to TB about 6 years back and it was a pleasant surprise. Now whenever I go there at night all the employees are sitting in the restaurant doing nothing, and the person at the window says the system is "restarting and they can't take orders for 20 minutes". If I wasn't actually hungry I would have waited but instead I had to go to the shitty McDonald's across the street, which gets less and less shitty as time goes on and The Taco Bell on Ponce continues to disappoint. But somehow they were open on New Years?? Extra star for being my first ever Taco Bell, but if I hadn't had that one positive experience, the countless negative experiences would make me want to give negative stars. 

Update - location is open late on week days. Seems like the workers fizzle out the weekend.

So confused why this Taco Bell doesn't run normal hours. I went to this location my first ever time going to TB about 6 years back and it was a pleasant surprise. Now whenever I go there at night all the employees are sitting in the restaurant doing nothing, and the person at the window says the system is "restarting and they can't take orders for 20 minutes". If I wasn't actually hungry I would have waited but instead I had to go to the shitty McDonald's across the street, which gets less and less shitty as time goes on and The Taco Bell on Ponce continues to disappoint. But somehow they were open on New Years?? Extra star for being my first ever Taco Bell, but if I hadn't had that one positive experience, the countless negative experiences would make me want to give negative stars.
What's not to like? Faster service than I'm used to at other locations. As usual Tasty fast food!

Food here is good. I don't have much to say except that I haven't had any bad service for any of the 3 times I've been here. Taco Bell always has a different cheesy taste to their foods, and it probably has to do with their recently revealed secret ingredients that they use. They state that they always use fresh ingredients, and I believe them. Customer service could be better I guess. Not big on the smothered burrito.

I came here on a Saturday night yeah a busy day to come to a drive thru but they should of been prepared, the drive thru line was not only slow but it was long and waiting to get your food and pay took for EVER. 

Worse part is I asked for an 89 cent burrito and got some crap with chicken and rice but not just all that made the night bad they were out of BEEF..how can you run out of beef on a busy weekend? specially  when everyone will be there late at night with the munchies.

 I don't think I will return to this location but will try another Taco Bell nearby, only reason I gave it two stars was because the staff was actually friendly.

Downgrading my review by 2 stars. 
There seems to be a HUGE contrast between the drive-through and walking inside to order at the counter.
   The young lady greeted me as if she had been well rehearsed. She took my order and offered little more. It took a good 8 minutes for them to make 2 soft and 2 hard tacos. It was not busy inside and I only knew there were two orders in front of me because their orders came up within 20 seconds after mind. 
   I was three steps towards the exit with my order when the guy hollowed at me to come back. They had neglected to put one of my four items into the bag. 
Can't you count before handing an order to the customer who's already waited too long for a few simple basics to eat?

AND WHERE'S THE DOLLAR MENU?  There is no evidence inside. 

Considering the other yelp reviews for this fast-food place, someone at corporate should kick some ass!
Ordered online and 8 minutes later I picked it up. Order was perfect and the staff was super friendly! Best Taco Bell experience I've had in a long time.

Is it me or is this the worst Taco Bell ever.  They closed the doors 15 min early then said it would be 15 min to get order in let alone the food.  I have had multiple bad things like this before and hit up corporate and they have never responded.  They may as well just close imho.

I stoped here on New Years Eve and ordered food and they screwed up the order and shorted our food and I went back to get it fixed and the staff was very rude and told me that I had to pay more for there screw up and still messed up my order even after i came back the second time i told them i was going to complain to corporate and they replied the where a franchise so they didn't care

Just tried to go here at 8:55pm. Posted hours say the lobby is open until 10. Door was locked. Tried the door again... it opened. Was stopped by a kid about 12 years old that said "it's closed" and then he yelled at someone behind the counter they hadn't properly locked the door. The drive thru was packed.

no...meat! apparently ran out of meat on christmas eve. your try explaning to your stepson that there's no meat...very, very disappointing. however, the lack of menu meat DID lead to a delicious discovery. cinnamon twists and diablo sauce are actually REALLY GOOD! 3 stars for effort.

This is the typical run of the mill Taco Bell.  Most of the time, service can be good.  It's the occasional hiccup that resulted in me docking this place a star.  The sit-down part of the restaurant closes at 10 PM during the week.  I've noticed that the employees like to lock the doors around 9 PM from time to time when I go here.  If you're going to close the sit-down part of the restaurant an hour earlier, wouldn't it make sense that you'd change the signs on the door as well?

Slowest Taco Bell I've ever experienced. We waited in the drive for 30 minutes--why I don't know--probably because I was too lazy to go inside. It was 9:20 on a Wednesday night and took absolutely forever. Also, they ran out of mild and green sauce which are my two reasons for eating the low quality ingredients they put in a hard shell. Oh well, you know what your getting with Taco Bell. This location could just step up their game with timeliness. The empanada deserts did hit the spot though.

This is at least the 10th time I've been to this Taco Bell and every time they do not give my complete order!!!!!! I even ask and look in the bag and it seems full ( drive thru ). I am so sick of these ppl not giving my entire order! Another night I don't get dinner due to poor customer service (:

MORE LIKE TACO HELL!!!! I am currently sitting in line going on half an hour now!! There was only 3 cars ahead of us!! How is a fast food place so consistently slow?! It's been this way for years ‍ don't come here unless you have 12 hours to kill

This is one of the worst Taco Bell that I have ever been to. The man at the counter would not greet to customers, and hr looked depressed with stern face not smiling. I ordered one combo meal, but it was charged $3.00 more than I would have paid at other Taco Bell.  I would not go to this crappy shoppe again. No Way!!

I don't know if the restaurant manager knows how 
 rude the staff is, he doesn't want money for his 
Shouting at customers and nasty faces  wf staff
Typing this as I wait 30 minutes behind 3 cars...horribly understaffed not worth your time

ABSOLUTELY the worst Taco Bell I have ever been too. The service is the worst of every resultant I have ever been too. None of them would even make eye contact with me when they were speaking to me. When I received my food they were missing multiple items and when I confronted them about it they told me I was wrong and in must represent if I want my food. They continued to refuse to give me my items so I end up giving up. The guy that looked very intoxicated mumbled under his breathe "shut the fuck up" after I asked if he could give me the other food I ordered after receiving my first item 15 mins before. I will never be back and I hope nobody else gives this place their money. Every employee was absolutely disgusting and my friends and I horrible service. I hope this male employee with black hair about 6 foot gets fired. He was so rude to us and has caused this Taco Bell to lose our service.
Sooooooooo slowwwwwwwwww. We walked in at 9:45 and got our food at 10. Then they told us the dining room closed at 10. Go to the Lowell Taco Bell!!!!

I came through the drive up today and before starting my order, the person said, we do not have chips and we do not have lettuce!  Well Ok then I ordered 2 taco's, they did not even put tomatoes on them.  Also, instead of giving me regular napkins, they gave me paper towels like they were from the bathroom!!!!   Really, what kind of management is this!  This place is run so poorly, not going back ever again.

If there were a zero star, I would have picked that. This place sucks! The workers are ignorant and threw the food in the bag and it wasn't even wrapped. It was soggy and leaked all over my car. It was the wrong order as well. I have been to many Taco Bells but this place really sucks! Do not go there. I ended up throwing the food in the trash.

Great drive thru experience today. Alex was so nice and upbeat taking our order. We got the food right away, we were in the drive thru less than 5 minutes total. I haven't been here in well over a year so I'm glad it was such a great experience and the Crunchwrap is better than I remember! The skittles freeze is also amazing, way better than the old starburst one. Love this location, we will be back!

Employee who was working drive thru around 10pm last night was super sweet and friendly! I can't imagine I would be that kind if I had her job. Really appreciated her positive energy. Food was also great of course.
Just went through the drive through and got the smallest soft taco ever mostly lettuce and the hard taco was the same but at least it didn't take more then 5 min to get my food lmao

I wish there was a negative star for this location. The last few times I've gone to this location around 3pm the door has been locked. 
Even when it's open the food is just a pile of crap in a tortilla. No taste you have to add the salsa just so you taste something.

Went to the drive thru today for lunch and I asked for Diablo [djalo] it's not that hard to understand, not sure why I got everything but what I asked to the woman at the window and gave me Hot and Mild  and the people at the window are now extraordinarily rude, wouldn't recommend coming if you want a nice friendly staff while gov take a break for lunch.
Taco Bell is the same everywhere. You get what you pay for. And I love paying for my $5 cravings deal. Literally cannot be beat. It's amazing. Bless you, Taco Bell.

I had this massive order of like 50 different items with 10 different payments. 
I was in and out within 20minutes.

They didn't get a single order wrong.

10/10 would eat again

We went through the drive through and everything went very well. Not only was the guy that took our order friendly,  at the window he caught that the kitchen had missed an item. 
Good service and a smile.

This is the absolute worst Taco Bell Order have ever had. Nacho fries came basically EMPTY with no cheese. Burrito was put together so poorly there was literally rice and beans falling out all over the bag. Crunch wrap was soggy and barely had anything inside. Mostly just moist tortillas. Sauces requested of COURSE not in bag. Cheese quesadilla again.... basically just two tortillas stuck together. Looks like whoever made this order literally just doesn't care about their job at all. Food was just inedible and disgusting. I called and the woman manager was rude. She then handed the phone to the male manager who was more polite and offered to remake the order next time I visit but based on this experience I don't even want to go back. Absolutely disgusted with this order. Never again.

Consistently the worst Taco Bell I've ever been to.  Incorrect orders are annoying.  Worst thing, though, is that they frequently aren't open during the hours they advertise.  Twice in two weeks I stopped to get the sausage flatbread quesadilla, which is a tasty $1 bargain - but even at 7:25 (scheduled to open at 7:00 a.m.) they were closed.  One time it was 7:20 and the staff was hanging around the parking lot.  One explained they were waiting for the manager to arrive.  He hadn't called - just didn't show up.

Currently they seem to be closed ALL the time - drive-thru is blocked.  Dining room has been closed for a couple of weeks.  Open on time or close.  But at least put something on your website to let people know you're closed during regular business hours.

I went here to get a bean burrito and a coke and they were incredible rude. I'm always nice when talking to people but the girl that was talking to me on the speaker had such an bad attitude towards me. When I got my burrito it wasn't even half wrapped  and falling apart all in the bag. I will never come here again.

This Taco Bell is a decent one in the area. I had a good experience with very friendly customer service. Our order was 100% correct even with the modifications I asked for. They were a little stingy with the sauce packets, we only got about 5 when we had several items. I had to wait a couple of minutes at the window but there was no wait in the drive thru so that was acceptable. The food was hot and seemed fresh. I would revisit this location again.
Location was closed at 10pm on a Friday night. The week before it was closed at 11pm on a Sunday. This is a frequent occurrence.

I didn't know there were so many low ratings for this location. I never yelped a taco bell before. Being a flagship store,we've gone there often, and usually they give us ample portions, and don't forget  what we ordered or most of it. It's not like the sky is going to fall if they forgot to grill my soft burrito. Or if they skimped on some extra's I willingly get  charged extra for.
This stuff is petty and not worth sweating over.
However, today, when we walked in for a light something after swimming across the street at L.A fitness, the computers were down, and the lady ahead of us just happened to be paying with credit. She was never asked to pay with cash. Or if she could step aside for the next customer until the terminal came back on line. Apparently, the cord had been disconnected somehow to the cash register.
I assumed they were going to keep the line moving in the lobby, so I ambled over to the next terminal and began ordering. I almost got to my third word, and I was informed they were out of shredded chicken. I didn't ask that. I wanted to know if we could pay with cash and continue on. The drive through was lined up with cars.. We chose to come inside to order.  Five minutes go by, ten minutes go by....
 A total stand still.
The tall manager was gruff with us.  We didn't know why the line had stopped moving...So, I asked, and he said I'll have to wait my turn, I am not done with 'her' yet.. Fair enough do finish....  but, then, he walked away from sight, stomping off into the back room. We didn't see him again. 
Was he defecting, on the lam? 
Or maybe he got on the horn to central command to whisk him away in the private helicopter to his new religion. 
All I know is something was off, plus, nobody was getting food orders in..
.At first he moved his hand in a sweeping, dismissive motion for me move away from the counter,
 like I had disturbed his holy sanctuary. 
 He made no effort to resolve the cash out issue.,since both check out lines weren't functioning..
 He did tell me they were out of shredded chicken which was something in my dismissed order I wasn't going to get served. The sign mentioned how they had run out of six listed and popular ingredients and items. Not a good start. But, we weren't stressing. After a long 10 minutes I  blurted out, are you guys open anymore? 
The perky, bright eyed, young gal 
who had been one of the pall bearers at the check out machine, 
said, oh, yes, we're open!.. 
She proceeded to explain to us what was already patently obvious already. We were going to be eating elsewhere since there was no happy pitch man with a T.V. cameraman coming forward to reassure us we'd been pranked...

My wife Made me wait a while until I calmed down to write this review. I went to Taco Bell Lakeway to get my wife's favorite, steak quesadillas and my favorite, crispy super tacos. When I got home (15 minute drive) we opened the package and noticed there was less meat in the quesadillas than normal but even worse, my tacos were soggy and almost totally meatless. 
I have never taken back a meal before and was even more reluctant considering the 15 minute drive but this was RIDICULOUS!!
I actually measured the meat and it was less than a teaspoon. 
I took the meal back and when I spoke to the manager through the drive thru and told him the problem., he asked how long ago I purchased it, which was now about 45 minutes. When I told him, he and the other employees laughed and he said that is why it's soggy.
He then opened the bag and said, "I can see a little meat."
I told him it was less than a teaspoon and he replied, DUDE.... I would love to give you a FU..ing handful of meat but this is FU...ing TACO BELL. He actually used the profanity. 
I responded, I am NOT your DUDE!
He responded, "yeah I don't OWN you.
I'm still trying to figure out that response. 
Another maskless employee, one of two who was not wearing a mask, who was the one who served originally served me, came to the window and glared at me. I'm a former cop. The attempt at intimidation  didn't work. 
I have been to other Taco Bells previously and subsequently and haven't had a problem. Those Taco Bells actually have friendly, non gangster employees and actually give you meat in your meal.
These employees don't represent a credible chain restaurant and should be fired

The burritos were wrapped in the wrong paper so it said they were a different kind from what they actually were. The guy at the window was inexperienced and wasn't very good at his job. Service wasn't too slow but we did stop by at 12:30am to acheive that. Everything tasted alright though.

If there was another option than one star Taco Bell on Wilson Road would get it. That is the absolute nastiest location ever!  This is how I received my Mexican pizza after waiting 10 minutes. DISGUSTING!!!

I meant to add that not one single person in the drive thru had on a mask.  So no,Taco Bell is NOT taking precautionary measures to ensure anyone's safety.

Breakfast served 7-11. Hot and fresh. Fast friendly service. 
The only bad thing is its just impossible to get into this place if you are driving on the opposite side of 99. And you can't just drive around the block.
I think they would have done much better business if they had kept the old location on the other side of the street that is now a coffee shop.

This place must be confused about what fast food is. I could fly to Mexico and have a nice Mayan couple make me a home cooked meal and then fly home and it would still be faster than going through the drive thru here.
Steak Quesarito barely had any rice. This was all I received. I also asked for no sour cream (which I already tried to take out before the photo)

Lemme start by saying I love Taco Bell. Ive come to this location before and it used to be a good Taco Bell. I came here today and got the chalupa cravings box. I always get this but this time it was NASTY. The cinnamon twists had no cinnamon on it and the sour cream tasted extremely expired.

The slowest Taco Bell in the Portland metro area! It's like they have no staff. You will wait 15-20 mins at a minimum for your order to be taken and your food to come out. The workers seem super irritated that you are even there. They recently remodeled but it didn't change the service. I almost want to drive the extra mile to the other Taco Bell! Tonight my order wasn't even correct!

As Taco Bells go this one was okay. The store was clean and the food tasted good. I got 3 Doritos Locos Tacos and they all fell apart when I tried to eat them. I had to finish them with a fork which was disappointing. Overall it was a fine visit.
Good mexican fast food. I usually order the chalupa and maybe a taco as well. Most time the food tastes pretty good. Sometimes it is a little dry though.

So this Taco Bell Cantina just opened up around here recently. It got a lot of buzz because it serves booze, so we went in to check it out. It's in the middle of a strip mall underneath a huge building of student apartments. Good location. The inside is moderny and divey and it's got a neat feel to it. Definitely different from traditional Bells. 

So there's booze. But the food isn't all that different. Pretty much the same. Well, there are three different options for Taco Bell tapas for the table to split, but they're lame things like cheese and jalapeno burritos and cheese quesadillas cut in half and called nachos. Not very impressive. 

I will say that I really liked the open kitchen. We could watch our orders get made from start to finish. A nice touch. I also like the TV's. There are only two of them, so it's not very functional and wouldn't be useful on game day, but it's still an interesting touch. 

Overall, it's not bad. If you want booze, come here. If you don't, there's another Bell about 3 miles down the street.

The food here is usually accurate and tastes as Taco Bell should. However, the service is the slowest ever in the "fast food" industry. I ordered online and have been sitting in the drive thru line for 24 minutes as I type this. Still haven't received my food. It is a systemic issue that needs to be fixed, just read the other reviews. Unbelievable.

This place deserves 0 stars. "Your straw is in the bag"....NOPE. Missing items, no sauce given. The taco I ordered wasn't even able to be picked up and looked like a taco someone shit out and wrapped back up. Burrito was the same way. The Crunchwrap supreme was barely folded and started to fall apart when I attempted to eat what was edible in my order. ROMAN took my order at this location and I'm assuming (since I went back for my refund on the missing items) that the crew must've been getting off work and just didn't give a fuck. I know it's fast food and none of these people have any real life skills, but seriously???? Like wtf man. At least give me the items I paid for. I don't give a shit, spit it in if you want. Just make it taste good and look edible.

Owner was an absolute JERK.  Ordered $25 worth of his garbage food asked for a cup of ice for the bottle of water I purchased.  He told me no. 

Are you kidding?  That guy had the personality of a zit. 

He clearly has no clue what customer service is!
Great drive through experience this evening! Everything in the order was correct, food came out hot and fast.

I was one of 2 people dining in. I'm writing this review as I continue to wait for my meal to be brought up. I've filled my soda, grabbed 6 napkins, and picked out my sauces. My friend and 2 others who have come in after me have received their meals as I continue to wait and have enough time to write a review on the slow service. One of the worst Taco Bell's I attend on a regular basis. 

Update, the quality of food was on point, though.

The night shift for this location is absolutely amazing they're always friendly and the managers are always niceI've only had a bad experience one time here in the morning with a sort of lady working the shift.
Ok so I was eating a burrito and it started to taste funny and it freaking happen to have not just one but multiple rubber bands in it!??? Wtf bro!
Been here maybe 4 times since moving to this area. Two times it took 20+ minutes to get my food and one of the other two times my order was wrong. Possibly the worst Taco Bell ever.

Well, ordered through UberEats. The menu was great, however if requested items aren't included, it's useless. Specifically asked for utensils, Fire & Hot sauces packages...none included.  Can't blame Uber, they just pick up and deliver. Not worth the hassle, so blast Taco Bell's incompetence on Yelp!!

My dear friend, who has impeccable taste, had been telling me about this great authentic Mexican restaurant for ages. So I had been dying to go for a while.
