I went up to the counter and was simply overwhelmed by all the choices - tacos, softs tacos, nachos, burritos! In the end, I decided to go with the beef chalupa: a soft, fried doughy exterior filled with savory and mysterious beef, cheese, lettuce, sour cream, and delightful tomato-flavored cardboard. I accompanied this with the fire sauce, which was excellent. I asked the restaurant for the house's finest Baja Blast. "I want your best 2005 vintage. What year is this Baja Blast from?" I asked the lady behind the counter. She looked at me very blankly for a whole 3 minutes. Then, I went back to my table and enjoyed my meal. I would definitely go there again!
This Taco Bell is trash. The hours are not at all what are shown online. They are also always out of something.. Today is the slush/freezes. Service is also very poor.
Best Mexican food in the east Orlando area! Spectacular! Great service. Good quality food.

Usually not a bad location...but today was crazy. Went into this TB around 2pm. There were 2 people sleeping in the lobby...customers..laid out..laid across multiple seats. There were 4 back packs in a corner and the lobby was a mess. It looked more like a day care center than a restaurant.  The long unshaven guy at the counter never asked if he could help me nor did he give me the correct change back, until I asked him to recount it. Just not a good day at this TB.

Wish I could give 0 stars. Last night we tried to go at 1 am and they didn't give any attention to drive through, once again tried the next day and were "closed" over an hour before closing time once again. Drove through the window and they looked right past us and went and hid. I've worked restaurant/ customer service the last 8 years and have never had this kind of service. I will never be back to this location again.

Went through drive thru ordered a 5 layer burrito $5 dollar box got to the window paid took 10 mins for the food got home they gave me a bean burrito and my taco had no tomatoes like I paid for , went inside they are going to ask me how I got a bean burrito in my box very bad customer service. Shouldn't have ratchet black people wokring in avalon

Absolutely worse wait times in the world. I have been in the drive through for over 20 minutes and only 1 car has left and I'm stuck in here with 12 cars in front of me and 2 behind so now I can't back out and will be only making it back to bedtime at this rate! Absolute joke with the wait times not sure how they're even stating in business. There's another Taco Bell off hwy 99 the wait is just as horrible

This place is the dirtiest Taco Bell I have ever been to. The girl who helped us kept saying God under her breathe and rolling her eyes. She was very rude. She forgot one of our drinks and we politely asked her for it and she looked at my husband and said one second with her finger, and continued to take another order while rolling her eyes and saying God under her breathe. when she was not even finished with us. Then slammed the cup on the counter. We had four people in our party and ordered at the register because we did not want to use the electronic order screen. If you don't like your job then find another. Very disappointed! The dining room has not been cleaned in I don't know how long. It was gross! The cashier/order taker was what seemed to be a 16 year old with a chip on her shoulder. She also treated the guest that were next very poorly. Sad that a franchise would allow such begIf I were the manager she would definitely be fired for treating my guest that way!

Seriously sitting here with folks at three other tables, and I will say is there are probably four cars in the out side line... But how is fast food fast when we sat here for 13 minutes before our food came out... Pretty unacceptable on a lunch hour...

Very slow Taco Bell and they limit how many items you can order to items per order.  They only allow 8 items per order through drive thru. 
 This is a rule the workers made up since they cant.keep up with all the business. It is not.a Taco Bell rule.
Refused to provide tap water when requested. Despite seeing customer coughing severely. Would only sell beverages.

The absolute worst Taco Bell on the planet. The reason is not just that it looks low rent from the outside. It's that they don't even honor the prices that Taco Bell advertises.

Today, I drove half an hour out of my way to take advantage of a new item on the value menu that Taco Bell has been advertising, and which is clearly shown on their app. (Nach Crunch Double Stacked Taco for $1).

I get there, get up to the window, try to order it and the unpleasant woman on the other end tells me "We're a franchise and we don't honor those prices. Take it or leave it." I left it. I left. 

And I will NEVER, EVER, go back to this Taco Bell. 

Way to run your chain, guys. 

To everyone else: This is the trashiest looking Taco Bell on the planet, they're unfriendly, and they don't honor their prices. Do yourself a favor and go elsewhere.

Parking lot was site of double murder April 7, 2019, 10:30 pm.  Car with local university students was also hit by bullets while waiting in drive through.  Check Atlanta news websites if you need more details.

This is the cleanest Taco Bell I've ever been to. Most friendly staff, all positive attitudes. Big thanks to Micah and Sandy for making this a pleasant visit. Not sure what's wrong with other locations but this one was top notch, even the cooks/preps looked happy.

I don't really do fast food all that much, but I will fond myself in Taco Bell here and there, honestly, late at night. By the way, remember, Taco Bell coined the phrase Fourth Meal (or at least made it popular).

Probably my favorite thing on their menu is the Doritos Locos Taco, one of those guilty pleasures. They have a few other items on the menu that whisper to me, as well.

Is it Mexican? Not really. But Taco Bell has become a part of the American landscape and their food is something that I find myself craving from time to time (often after a night on the town).

At this location, always check your food BEFORE you leave the parking lot. I ordered a quesadilla and smelled a burnt smell when I  finally received my order. Looked in the bag and the quesadilla was black! Surely the person who prepared this has eyes and could see that the quesadilla was burned but sent it out anyway.

When I took it back to  the drive through window, no apology. He simply said, "we will remake it." I know you will! He said something to the person in the  kitchen and that person sounded like a kid. If the owner reads this, you may want to do some surprise late night drop-ins to ensure children aren't  on the grill. I see another review that mentions a child, and I'd like to think that no  adult would have sent out an  obviously burned quesadilla like the one I received, but ya  just never know.

The worst fast food ever.  15 years I've gave this place a chance.  It's obvious.  Everyone working there hates their job.  Please end this crap shoot of a restaurant.   I haven't had one good drive though.  Un happy employees. Bugs in food.

This Taco Bell has no direction or leadership. The gal that took out order was friendly but unprofessional. Chomping on gum that practically fell out of her mouth. Acting a little sloppy and goofy. We waited about 20 min for our food and it was not busy at all. Come on Taco Bell!!

Updated Review

7/8/17

Man.... this place is a wreck! Who runs this? I'd  LOVE to talk to the owner....for like 5 minutes

We were the ONLY customers in the building. We waited for over 5 minutes at the counter. We could hear employees talking about how we were "up front," but no one ever came. Finally, someone walked behind the counter, looked at us, said "Jesus," and then kept walking back to where we couldn't see him anymore. Obviously, a small family trying to place a small order is far beyond this Taco Bell's capacity. After the "Jesus comment, we left, without food (or an acknowledgement of our existence.) Crazy.

This Taco Bell is run by people who don't know what they are doing. I tried to order the drive thru and upon the greeting I was asked my payment type. Odd but okay. As I proceeded to order I was asked to stop my order several times and as I was telling her the modifications she asked me about sour cream which doesn't come in my item. I let her know that sour cream isn't a condiment in my taco and she told me she was refusing service. I wouldn't waste my time.
Go elsewhere, anywhere but here. Rude service, long drive thru wait, incorrect and cold food. I don't even wanna taco 'bout it anymore.
This Taco Bell is the most decent one I've visited so far in Massachusetts. They actually know how to properly prepare their tacos and burritos and of course their nacho cheese fries are to die for!

This is the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to. I went there September 10, 2019; Got a $5 Chalupa Box, everything was stale, the beans tasted burnt, the lettuce was all wilted, (ALL OF IT), the cinnamon twists were the worst of all, why does your fryer oil taste like that??? Left the most awful taste in my mouth, and the Sierra Mist was lacking Syrup? I got told to come back in today, to get a free meal and it was still stale, wilted, and the oil still tastes really bad. I'm literally never going back there. Ever.

After placing my order I had to patiently wait 20 minutes for my food to brought up... placed my order ahead of 5 drive thur cars an 2 inside orders...just seems this place rather catch up on socializing then getting certain orders out...

I never thought I would write a review on a Taco Bell as my standards are pretty low when it comes to these places, I don't expect much. I haven't hit up a Taco Bell in over a year, I'm have better options for real food near me and the experiences have gotten so bad at Taco Bell's, I simply stopped trying. My craving for junk, cheap, convenient food got the better of me tonight...unfortunately. I repeated my order three times and they still only entered 2 of the 6 items I ordered. Got to the window to pay (knowing they only took a third of my order but wasn't given an opportunity to correct it), the girl at the window barely opened it far enough to take my card, ignore me, give me back my card and ignore me longer while I waited 5 minutes for my incomplete, stale AND incorrect order (1 of the 2 items that they actually did order for me was wrong). I've seriously never encountered such incredible neglectful service...granted I only paid $8 for this terrible service but had they taken my order correctly in the first place it would've been triple that ;) Never again.

Four orders in a row they have wasted my time, messed up our orders, used meat on vegetarian food, and even the third try they screwed up after the manager supposedly remedied the previous two. She put chicken on a vegetarian cheese item and then argued over the phone that she didn't. I hope they go out of business and we will never go there again.

The slowest Taco Bell in the Portland metro area! It's like they have no staff. You will wait 15-20 mins at a minimum for your order to be taken and your food to come out. The workers seem super irritated that you are even there. They recently remodeled but it didn't change the service. I almost want to drive the extra mile to the other Taco Bell! Tonight my order was even incorrect!

I went to this "Cantina" with daughter because we wanted to check out the new "Fancy" Taco Bell.  I had such high hopes of some fast casual hybrid restaurant with a new menu and higher quality ingredients.  I imagined snacking on chips and guacamole while waiting on my order to complete.  Such a let down.  It has kiosks to order from, a fresh look, and an open kitchen.  They have a few appetizers and some alcohol, other than that it is Taco Bell. The staff was friendly during our lunch visit but we were underwhelmed overall with the Taco Bell Cantina.  Not really anything special unless you need to have beer with your Taco Bell instead of Taco Bell after your Beers.

Went through and everything I got was wrong. So pissed I don't even want to type. Thanks for nothing, was starving and just wanted a couple tacos and some nachos. Nothing but idiots working there I guess. Dope. Thanks for a waste of my $11, I'm glad I got some homeless people out front their food though. I hope theirs was correct at least. Idiots.
Who doesn't like Taco Bell?? Love that there is one so close to my work. But, if you come between the hours of 12-1 (lunch time) the wait can be pretty long. Love the cravings box!

Ordered 7-Layer burrito. I don't eat meat and I had reg amt of chicken in the burrito. I also excluded sour cream and cheese. Added black beans.
I asked the lady if there was chicken in this. She replied yes it comes with chicken. 
I got the manager and explained what I have in my burrito. 
He was not attentive at all. He asked me what my order was again and again. I told him the burrito. 
I told him you are not listening to me. He said I couldn't hear you. 
Eventually he got pissy and said you know what just leave I will give your money back. 
I said no you already had the chicken killed. While I was leaving the manager said this why you guys are not liked because you're all pretentious.
I replied yes I am when you do not listen!

I love Taco Bell. More than any human should. However, THIS Taco Bell is not good. 

Their food is wildly inconsistent. Sometimes, it comes out great and sometimes, it seems like the stuff was made by a person with their eyes closed before being left under a heat lamp for hours. The lettuce is often still frozen in the tacos. The bottled water is almost always a solid block of ice. It's the only Taco Bell in the state that doesn't do online ordering through the app. 

There are so many issues with this place. However, since it's the closest Taco Bell to my house, so I keep going back hoping things will be better. They usually aren't. 

Their best crew seems to work the weekday lunch shift, so that's probably your best chance of getting well-prepared food. Any other time, you're probably better off staying clear of this place, which as a huge Taco Bell fan, that pains me to say.

Step up your game, guys. I'm really hoping that you get better.

Side note: they recently remodeled and the restaurant looks much nicer on the inside than it used to.

This place is the dirtiest Taco Bell I have ever been to. The girl who helped us kept saying God under her breathe and rolling her eyes. She was very rude. She forgot one of our drinks and we politely asked her for it and she looked at my husband and said one second with her finger, and continued to take another order while rolling her eyes and saying God under her breathe. when she was not even finished with us. Then slammed the cup on the counter. We had four people in our party and ordered at the register because we did not want to use the electronic order screen. If you don't like your job then find another. Very disappointed! The dining room has not been cleaned in I don't know how long. It was gross! The cashier/order taker was what seemed to be a 16 year old with a chip on her shoulder. She also treated the guest that were next very poorly. Sad that a franchise would allow such behavior. If I were the manager she would definitely be fired for treating my guest that

I really like this place because the hot sauce packets are out by the drink machine so you can just grab as many as you like. Other fast food places make you ask the person at the counter for packets and they do not give the sauce up easily. It's like, when was ketchup or sweet and sour such a high priced commodity? Just give me the packets! In my view, it's one packet per bite, and I'm glad Taco Bell gets that. 

Endless sauce, always.
Service Always ROCKS here!!Food is ALWAYS HOT!! Best little taco bell in the area!!keep up the good work yall!!

Food quality is as good as taco bell gets, staff are nice, never have an issue with an order missing an item, and the line goes through quickly. Really appreciate their discount for healthcare workers at this time, helped me throughout the covid-19 lockdown since I'm not much of a great cook for myself. Would recommend

5 star customer service served with a smile! A minor mistake was more than fixed-- the staff went above and beyond to let us keep the yummy entree (Power Bowl that just wasn't quite what we ordered, then prepared us a hot and fresh new meal exactly to our specifications! Even though we could tell the cashier was new, they had a great attitude and you could tell was trying to learn. Nothing wrong with training new staff, in fact it was a sign that Taco Bell Lakeway is improving. The manager was there too and very kind, even threw in a coupon for a free taco! We usually have Taco Bell once a week so we'll continue to come back!
best taco bell ever!!! i am a vegetarian and they never get my order wrong!! 10/10 would recommend
The worst Taco Bell I think I've ever been to they were out of several items even though they're on the menu it took forever super slow not fast food

I have been here several times and I love it. Sure, The Bell and KFC are not formal dining but it is a great place to sow down.  I recommend doing a "mash up" -combine Double Downs and Nashville Hot from KFC with tacos and stuff from The Bell. The service has been very fast, and if you love junk food, this combo hits the spot. I try something new each time I go and the selection is huge.  I would however stay away from burritos from The Bell as they are very soupy and quite slug-like in texture.  The Steak House Nachos are great from The Bell and KFC Double Down is a secret menu item from KFC (two pieces of fried boneless chicken with cheese and bacon twixt the two)  and they are made to order and are pissah tasting. I always dine inside this puny place. The atmosphere is grim and the workers aren't always friendly but the food is why I come here.  If you are starving and want to be stuffed to the gills with energy-laden caloric food then come here!

OKAY, dont get this review twisted y'all... This is not a 'OMG I LOVE TACOBELLLLL' this is a chain review.. and you review basic things like staff, regional pricing, cleanliness, and location... so this is a 5 star... why? well first off it on the way home from the gym.. So that is one star... the service is quick, lets slap another star on there... it is taco bell, so it get s standard (2) stars... so where are we at? 4 STARS! why the 5th star?

Their Dollar Menu is a legit dollar. The other places have the burritos for 1.39/1.59 where here it is a straight buck. I mean even the other Portland locations charge that bit of mark up... So really, this is a 5 star Taco Bell... So deal with it!

Felt very rushed and like I was an inconvenience to them at the drive thru while TRYING to order my food.. At window you just heard the chaos.... customer service training is needed! Oh just got home.... after making sure my order was taken correctly at the window , they still got it wrong!

I ordered the 5$ chalupa box and ask what about the borito. Turns out they put up the advertismem early, this was a year ago and I wanted to compliment the people at this one store. Yelp won't let me move on until I finish I guess.

This has historically been the most screwed up Taco Bell/KFC for at least 20 yrs. 

The light up drive thru menu is hard to see as there is either filth on the plexiglass that hasn't been cleaned in years or that the plexiglass just needs to be replaced from wear and tear. The most screwed up part of this drive thru is that they moved the box where you talk to the person inside to the other side of the menu so its behind your car. And its dimly lit. 

The other night we pulled up and a guy said I will be right with you. We said ok. We waited and waited and waited. The person behind us in his car was like where did the guy go? We waited a few mins more and thats when we realized that by craning our neck like an owl, in small writing on that dumb squawk box it says the store hours. We showed up right when they were about to close and none of those idiots inside the place told us we are closed. We got a be right with you ....

I love Taco Bell, but this is the worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. The Drive Thru is the worst of it. It's suppose to be fast food, not wait in line for 10+ min to get your food. The whole staff is pretty much a bunch of high schoolers who could care less about their job. I'm curious to know who the manager is because the manager freaking sucks. Almost every time I've gone there they're always out of specific drink cups. Last time I got a freeze they put it in a medium size soda cup because they ran out of the clear cups they normally put it in and the other time I wanted to upgrade a medium drink to a large drink and they were out of large drink cups. Apparently the manager doesn't know when to order more product. Don't waste your time with this location, go to another location as I plan on doing from now on that hopefully has better service.

Waitied in kind for almost 20mins. Wasn't even that busy. Staff is lack luster. Could care less. Called to inform them of people peeing in their parking lot. They literally said "oh they're just drunk, we're not worried about it"
My boyfriend got his normal meal from this Taco Bell and got food poisoning. Do not eat here
Quick, fresh and a pleasant staff.  You can always count on this Taco Bell to measure up no matter what time of day and what a nice thing for someone to smile and say "thank you". HvPP

This location always has a line around the building for the drive through. We went inside to enjoy the $5 double chalupa boxes!

We also got a side of refried beans for our daughter for 50 cents. She loved them and also enjoyed the cinnamon twists!

The taco was nothing special but the double chalupa was great! The cheese sauce on there added flavor that the taco was just lacking. 

The store was empty when we arrived but several more people came in while we were there. They have both regular tables and bar height tables, which is pretty cool. Also they had a couple high chairs, so that was good.
Omg couldn't event keep their story straight if the manager was there or not after a order was done wrong.  This is laughable.

We tried to go in to the dining area and they are closed at 645p on a Monday. We went to the drive thru and the woman at the window was so rude with her tone, and a very nasty attitude. Ofcourse she also messed up our order and we had to go around a second time. Not a pleasant experience at all!

Some of the best food atlanta has to offer. Other places on yelp are triple the price and have better reviews, but the common yelper just doesn't understand good food like I do. This taco bell is everything you need, and the only place I'll be eating at for the next few years!
Won't eat here anymore after they stopped selling the steak stuffed burritos!! What a dumb thing to do.
The grill worker at the front wanted to fight my friend and I because he thought my friends name was offensive. Tall skinny Hispanic guy working grill at the  very front. Stay away from this location

Not too great. I mean it is a taco bell, but they always getting my orders wrong, or the sauce wrong. I just get tired of it after a while. The place looks dirty if you go inside, like no one's cleaned it for a while.

The lines seem like they're always slow, no one is working particularly hard or really trying. I might be asking for too much from a fast food place, but this one on airport stuck out to me because it's just really, really bad. Drive down the block and go to a different taco bell.

I read some really awful reviews of the TB closest to me (also on 99, near King City), so I specifically have been avoiding them. I was pleasantly surprised when I went out of my way to visit this one instead. Their $5 boxes are actually $5, and I received prompt and friendly service. My order was also 100% accurate. I will drive out of my way again to visit this location, and skip the one closer to me.

I gave 2 stars every order was correct but parking lot was dirty and manager was not professional with last guests that came before we left. They guests should respect her postion and acted accordingly not like we outside of work and she allowed it. Before then she was very professional.
Had a small issue with my order ....the manager Robert fix it....went out of his way to make things right....I will highly recommend the visit....

Came here because it was so close to UCF.  We walked in and realized that there was no drive thru and the name had "cantina" with it.  

We were not sure what to expect. As we drove in the sound parking right away. We walked into the store immediately she didn't tell that it is not your regular taco Bell. The decoration, feeding, and counter weight difference. 

It was not what I expected. Did you walk up they had different station in which you could order your food on on a touch screen. And pay for it as well.

Then they called your name and you go and pick it up. But your food is not wrapped up in the taco Bell safer. Instead it is served in a little basket. Making a look as though you are not any regular taco Bell.
As I said before it has a modern and slick feel about it. They serve beer. The seats are communal, set up with USB an outlet on them to the students computer work. there are also TV screens all over to watch any type of sports of the TV show. And most importantly they serve beer and wine. Hence the name cantina.

This is my neighborhood Taco Bell and I have gotten some exceptional service at this particular location on multiple occasions. One time, the guy making my girlfriend's food (who had a couple modifications on the Crunchwrap) got off the line to personally ask her how she wanted her food. Then as we were leaving, we decided to get some watermelon freezes to take with us. My girlfriend just wanted a small since she's never tried one and I guess the guy thought I was being an asshole by getting myself a large and her a small and decided to just make the small a large on the house. In conclusion, this is the best Taco Bell in Atlanta.

This Taco Bell has been regularly bad for me and mine.  We go to movies at the cinema close by and when we are running late but need a meal this has been the spot we go however they get the food wrong almost every time.

One occurrence had me stoping in for a quick meal before a late night flight and I was short on time to get to the airport.  Got through the drive thru with what I thought was going to be my dairy free combo burrito and took a big bite as I was driving after smothering it in hot sauce.  Ate the bite and thought it tasted weird.  Took a look at the next light and sure enough, cheese and sour cream....  I had a miserable evening on the plane due to my lactose intolerance - I was bloated and had a killer ache.

Today we were going to a flick and stopped in to eat inside as we had half an hour.  We stood at the counter waiting to be served for 5 minutes while the 3 team members cranked out drive thru order after order.  Finally we got helped and placed our very specific dairy free order then had a seat.  10 minutes goes by so I went to the counter to see what was up, watched them continue to crank out drive thru order after drive thru order.  

I was not the only dine in patron waiting, as several other orders were taken after mine.

Seeing me standing there with a hungry mob they finally start on the dine in orders.  Another 5 minutes goes by and my food is handed to me - cold but we got it.  Gotta eat it in the fly as the movie starts in 10 minutes do we now get a bag to have our food on the go.

Get in the car and I start handing out the food to discover mine has dairy and my ladies food is not at all what she ordered.  No time to go back so the food went uneaten.

I won't be back as they get the orders wrong about 75% of the time.

I was on my break and wanted to dine in and the dining room was a mess it there was dirty tables and sticky floors and I told the staff about it and they laughed and noone came out to clean the mess but claudia was nice enough to come out and clean the dining g area and take people orders as well as mine the food was great just bad customer service.

I visited this Taco Bell this past Saturday and I intended to go through the drive-thru but their systems were down. I don't have a problem with that so I went inside. It was a normal experience till i was about to order and i noticed a child run behind the counter, and originally I thought it was a child on the loose lol because I saw the assumed mother running after him. However, they stayed back there... like they were supposed to be back there... they weren't wearing any workers uniforms just normal clothes. Then I noticed that there were several random people back there. I have never seen this before and I was baffled.. BUT what really got me was that these people had paper plates and we're going around by themselves making plates of food for themselves. THATS SO UNSANITARY!! All of this happened while talking to workers in the back as if it were completely normal. There even was a guy who had a phone call so he walked out to the lobby to take the phone call and then once it ended he walked back into the back with the workers... This all was absolutely crazy but what really bothered me was that the workers were so distracted they took forever to get orders out, getting orders wrong, and not putting complete effort into there work. There was a huge line gathered waiting for food. Then, they got orders wrong. PLUS watching them making watermelon freezes and literally pouring the seeds to the bottom and filling it up and putting it out. DURING ALL THIS !! the guy who was putting out orders was throwing the trays down carelessly and yelling names so arrogantly. I love Taco Bell and have always been happy with their food and service BUT WOW !! i could not believe how unorganized, terrible, and poorly that restaurant was. disappointed.
Like this location, especially during the night. My food always comes out hot! The workers are always super nice !
This is like the worst Taco Bell ever lol. I ordered a crunchwrap supreme, and two doritos locos tacos. What I got was a taco pizza and two regular tacos. They messed it all up.

I hate that I love Taco Bell. I don't think I have ever gone thru the drive thru and actually gotten the right food. I have always had to go back in complain and then again wait for my food after I had already waited 10+ mins in line. I have never been to a slower fast food location and each time have a poor experience. Will not be returning
I Had A Good  Experience Here. I Went Here for breakfast And The  cashier was nice to me and Also gave Me a free Drink. The food Well its normal taco bell food. Also Our  cashier name was  Julius

I've been here many times and generally it's always the same...long drive thru lines and a fair amount of people inside waiting. The wait can be long at the drive they but they are generally faster if you order inside. It's extremely easy to order using their self-serve kiosk. Also, it's always clean inside the restaurant, even the restrooms. They require a key from behind the counter to use same. 

The neighborhood isn't the best so you will get some homeless people around asking for things, but no different than other parts of large cities and particularly, Atlanta. My order is correct 9/10 times so I can't complain about that. The reason for 3/5 stars is due to the wait. It seems like they are always short staffed and the employees are always talking and chatting while 5-7 people are waiting for food. It's slower than many other location and that's why they lose 2 stars. Overall, it's still the closest location to me and I will still come here, but not when I'm in a hurry.
Terrible service. Stood in line with no one else in the store while a worker just stood there counting change ignoring me. I get it, it's Taco Bell, but still. I'd give zero stars if I could.

Customer service was good but quality of food was yet to be admired. It was nothing like the picture. I ordered a buffalo fries burrito and it was all bread and hardly any filling. I've had .99 5 layer burritos better made than this. Won't be returning

I only ordered Taco Bell because I wanted nacho fries. Taco Bell is literally 6 miles from my house. The Uber driver waited forever to pick up the order because it was not ready and when I got the order the tacos were soggy and fell apart. The only reason I ordered was for the nacho fries and they did not even come. I also ordered 3 taco supremes and only got 3 regular tacos. It sounds petty but I paid extra for the sour cream.

Long wait just for them to say they're out of tortillas. Really? I asked if they had any tortillas and they said yes. I asked if they could use the tortillas they had (small ones) to make what I had ordered (quesadilla). They said no. Guess now I remember why I haven't eaten at a Taco Bell in so long.

I never go to TB. I was hangry didn't eat bf and came from the gym before work in the morning. I wish I got names but I was greeted through the drive through by the most friendliest person I've ever met. It quickly turned my hangry into a smile. Next window, yet again greeted with a nice smile, friendly comments and sugar and spice and everything nice. I was so caught off guard that I had to stop and appreciate the friendliness.
Steak taco meat tastes like dog food. Two starts cause my dog likes it...YUCK YUCK YUCK YUCK YUCK YUCK YUCK YUCK.

Worst taco Bell I have ever been to. Evertime I go there it's always a long wait, the employees are rude, but this last time I went I got soft tacos and a crunch wrap supreme they were cold like they been sitting out all day. And  then when my boyfriend brought the food out when we got home I found a black hair in my food. So I called and told the manager and she was mad that we called and complained. She told us to we can bring it in and exchange it. So we took it back and left the hair in the taco she didn't even look at it or anything she just told us that they would remake it.  So we obliviously didn't want them tacos anymore so we said just give us the money back. She kinda rolled her eyes and got us the money. I still said thank you and she just walked away. I will never go there again it needs to be shut down!!!!! It ruined taco Bell forever for us!!

This location should be closed down for unsanitary reason.  I walked into this location after my 20 minute wait in the drive through, and the amount of food on the floor where the workers worked was unbelievable.  The pop machine looked like an emergency room  with the amount of liquid that was overflowing the pop machine I called to complain but BUTCH the manager was off tonight and they don't know when he is coming in.   no worries me smart employ I will report you to the health department first thing Monday morning.
Favorite fast food in the area! Always good service and prices. Company owned, not a franchise so quality remains more consistent. The fountain machine is now fixed!

Favorite fast food in the area! Always good service and prices. Company owned, not a franchise so quality remains more consistent. Only con is the fountain machine is missing a part so flow is to high and can make a mess... be careful.
This Taco Bell is probably the best in the area. My order came early I had barely got out of line to my order being done already. The manager Maria is so friendly.
I have never had a more positive experience at a Taco Bell in my life.  Tone was so helpful and nice, we had a car full of complicated orders and everything was executed perfectly!! 10/10

Would not recommend, ordered late night in drive through, 5 minutes later got a call that my credit card had just been used to buy 80 dollars at an online store. Hadn't used all day so something fishy going on at this location.

Thisbis the 3rd time that I have waitednin a long lkne and finally get to the order screem and am told "our system is down" then seve is down. Then a few kinutes pass and all the staff come outside to smoke. Kind of convenient, I work nearby and find it very annoying having to drive away for food when I want taco bell. Once or twice MAYBE, but 3 times and each time its 2nd shift and the same people. Absolutely not acceptable.

Went in last night to grab food before heading home. Placed order with a not so friendly cashier then the shift manager was walking back and forth screaming the F word barking orders at everyone else instead of pitching in and being a team player. This shift manager is way under qualified to be in such a position. Managers are there to guide and lead a team not play drill sergeant. I myself am a manager of a multi million dollar company and would never ask my employees to do anything I myself am not willing to do or that I haven't done myself many times before.

9/20
The food is fine, as fine as Taco Bell can be but the service is terrible. I've been waiting 40 minutes now, trapped in line. There was about 6-7 cars in front of me. This is unacceptable. Time and time again when I come they always are short staffed or un-trained staff. The food is simply not coming out fast enough. 

Update: 11/19
Seriously a bad problem with with slow wait times and under staffed. Their ticket times are terrible. Don't bother going to this TB if you can avoid it.

Just came through their drive through 40 minutes before close and was met with silence at their window...
Drove around, saw people working...tried to go inside, they'd locked their doors more than a half an hour earlier than their listed closing time. 
This is the 3rd awful experience I've had at this new location...
Come on y'all, get it together. I won't be back. McDonald's is right there, and they have people that actually work...

Hello,

I frequent this Taco Bell at least once a week.  I constantly have issues with this location. Nacho supreme orders for instance, come with bottom of the barrel chip slivers. I order the frito burrito and it has almost zero beef sometimes. I've paid for nachos supremes, no sour cream add extra nacho cheese, and I've had to have them remake it not once, but 3 times because they keep forgetting. (Now I have to pay for and order it on the side so I know I'm getting it).  I've had very long waits as well. Sometimes up to 30 minutes. 

For tonight's order, I decided to order through your app. Order: 906018
I waited approximately 18 minutes. My food was once again hit and miss. The frito burritos had maybe a teaspoon of beef, and I know this because I order them without Fritos and no rice. The nachos had almost no cheese. 
I continually asked for sporks and was not given any. After waiting for 8 minutes I did ask for a drink. The manager Gerri said NO because I didn't order one. Then handed me a small cup of water.   I hope these issues can be addressed.
Not bad, not great. I don't believe the location has been there a long time but it looks a bit worn and needs a deep clean.  Food was good,

I am rating my last visit to Taco Bell with one star because I was not pleased with the service I received. on May 5th the afteroon, the drive-through worker was very flustered and very rude, demanding that I insert my card, then quickly jerking it out of my hand and then threw my card in my truck. Second, I did not receive all the items that I ordered. My order was missing a burrito and chips and queso that I ordered. My personal opinion is that employees should try to be more pleasant in these hard times. I'm giving this review a one star even tho it deserves zero stars.
Slowest drive thru in the history of drive thrus. Always get orders wrong. Bottom of the fast food barrel

Our first time eating at this Taco Bell. The restaurant looked nice and clean, however my first stop to the bathroom started my disappointment as there wasn't any paper and the bathroom was unkept. The service was terrible.  The employees didn't even seem to care we were there.  The food came out like pig slop.  We will not be eating there again.
They suck. Always out of everything. The system is usually down after 11pm. They just don't want to work. They should just close down and let a good business take over the spot.

General Manager is not a friendly person , as usual order is incomplete General manager not once looked at me had his back towards me didn't acknowledge customer service. Will not return to this location whatsoever. Management is horrible. Shift leader Sharmae should be General Manager she was the only positive person who acknowledged customer service.

I am writing this because I had exceptional customer service from the guy who took my order and gave me my food today.  He was very friendly, pleasant and made me want to come back.   Just wanted to give kudos to him!
Worst Taco Bell I have ever visited.  Ride staff never told me my total or smiled.  Just looked at me.

Last time I came to this location. The only location in Atlanta they were struggling in all areas. Not tonight. Food was fresh, quick, and they totally served me after they closed.  I don't know if it was the exhaustion on my face or why you guys did such a small but amazing favor, thank you so much. The border has a solid crew at the moment, so eat up while you can. We all know if they don't take care of these guys they'll leave us like all the other good ones.  Then it's long lines stale chalupas, and ground beef that's dried out 4 times and had water added.  Thanks guys, hope mgmt knows you two are solid

Please don't let this guy run the drive through again  I'm impressed how wrong he got my order.  I'm always respectful, when ordering from here. I'm sure they catch hell on the weekends.  Didn't matter this time. I wanted a Dr Pepper. Got a Diet Pepsi. Asked for fire sauce got none. Looks like he have everything a good squeeze loading the bag.  I have to admit. Compared to the usual 5 min it takes to get the correct order. He had me out in maybe a min.  Hopefully he was trying to go to the bathroom and was in a hurry. Bc if everyone's getting this I won't be the only frustrated person. That this is the only Taco Bell in town unless you're on the west side.

Wow.. I have no words.. I saw all the bad reviews but I still decided to give this place a try. Going through the drive thru the guy taking my order seemed annoyed, and when I drove up to take the order he wasn't polite or friendly just took my card.. paid and stuck the bag out without saying anything. No "thank you" or "have a good day" just so depressing. After I got the bag inside no ketchup, fork, or straw for the drink... worst place I been to.. never coming back to this place.

Great location. We have one that is closer, but we drive out to this one because the staff is friendly and they also sell Cinnabon bites after 10:30am. (The other location near us says it's a breakfast only item now.)
This location is really good about the accuracy of the orders, and the food is hot and fresh. 
No soggy tacos.

Taco Bell also has an app.

I was there lat night, I saw the Hispanic female employee (dyed light brown hair, in her 40s probably) rubbing her nose with the gloves she's wearing, then kept on making the orders, flapping the large tortillas on her hands a few times. Poor customer I don't know who got that icky burrito. Very gross! She kept fixing her cap with the same pair of gloves. While I was eating I also saw her eating in the kitchen with the gloves on. I wish I got her name but she was in the kitchen the whole time.

They served me cold stale tacos at 11am. Were these from the night before!? They also had me back up my vehicle in the drive thru line, and then pull back up so their "timer could restart" which seems very suspect. Wack.

The floor was covered in food and cheese with wrappers on the floor, Every single table was filthy, as arriving no clean tables were available had to ask them to clean it. All of their garbage cans were filled to the brim, during my meal one of my guest found a hair in her food as I brought it up they said 'you ate some of it' with an attitude and offered free cinnamon twist but I requested to re make my meal. As leaving I wanted to speak with a manager to discuss my experience and he sent out an employee asking 'what do you need' and when I asked for him again she seemed as if she made up a reply and she said 'his legs broken'. For this being a brand new establishment it should not be this filthy and ran this poorly.
Yikes.... temper your expectations. Taco bell is obviously terrible but this one will definitely make you hate yourself even more

Everyone seems to hate working here, food sucks and they always don't have anything the menu offers and just kind of shrug their head. Not to mention when you asked them a question they just go huh. I get it college area, what do you expect

Seems like the place to be for drug deals. Homeless people hanging out next to the doors. Try to substitute one sauce for another and it was said they have to have a button for it, so I start asking for "easy creamy jalapeño" - there's a button for that. It worked for a long time. But not tonight. I was charged an extra .30 cents for a griller that costs $1.59 (used to be $1). 19% extra for substitution?! Super crazy...if the screen says add but it's a substitution, it's not adding people. No extra sauce is provided. Should not be that difficult. There was no budging either. I also order a chicken quesadilla with no creamy jalapeño sauce usually for my daughter. Even though I won't be back to this Taco Bell, if I ever come across this again, I'll just get it on the side. Elena was not a helpful manager.

"Can I get..." I take a brief pause, not really knowing wait I want. 

"Uh... A crunch wrap supreme, 2 chalupas with beef, and a nacho bell grande." well I guess the same old fall back is great.

"Pull around to the window."

"Thanks..."

I drive up to the small and opening that will finally help my soul feel complete after the week of hell I just endured.

"What sauce do you want?"

"I don't want to die."

I should really stop using drive-thru's as confessionals. 

"I'm afraid I'll never really make an impact on anyone. I'm going to die and no one will care about it."[1]

"What hot sauce do you want sir?"

They seemed unfazed by my musings.

"Hot, Mild, and Fire please."

As if anyone or anything can faze me at this point. 

"No one deserves to live. No one deserves to feel pain. Sentients is lost on us, no one should be aloud to suffer. It's not worth it."

I get handed my bag of joyful delight. 

"Thank you."

"You're welcome."

If only I had known that is was such a large spiral down from the top to the bottom, I might not be in this mess right now. 

----------

[1] The normal reaction to feelings of helplessness and vulnerability is often a need to regain control through a series of "If only" statements.

Myself and my Son went to this Taco Bell for dinner and we went into the dining area and made our order. For some reason the amount was taken out of my account but the cashier told me that it was not paid, I told her it was taken out of my account but she insisted that it was not. At this time another employee named Anthony came over and intervened stating that he wanted to see my phone so I could prove that it was taken out. I refused and tried to speak with the cashier but Anthony called me a thief wanting free food. I then requested that Anthony please allow me to speak with the cashier about the matter and when both the cashier and manager asked him to start with the orders he refused saying that he won't make food for them (my Son and I) I then requested that someone else please make my food because of the looks and attitude I was getting from Anthony. Anthony then told me he would take me outside and discuss it like men, I of course never backing down from a challenge told him "let's go outside" Anthony refused to do any work while I stood there and at one point started to give my 13 year old Son looks.  The other workers where trying to do there job but Anthony was so worked up about this that he wouldn't listen to anyone even his manager. Several people where in the lobby and witnessed this exchange which caused them to get really behind. While we ate I did get a message from my bank that the charge had been reversed. I saw this and promptly went and spoke to the night manager who had come in and assumed duties for the evening. I explained to her what happened and offered to pay for my meal which had been given to us on good faith. She told me not to worry about it because of the trouble Anthony had caused. I did insist on paying but she said no. I did thank her, then my Son and I departed. The only reason I gave them a Three is because of the other employees who worked really hard to do the right thing. I have been to this Taco Bell many times. Will I return? Not while Anthony is working. One of, if not the worse dining experience I have ever had, but I do thank the other workers who know what real customer service is all about.

Good not great. I mean cmon guys it's Taco Bell. Their Drive thru is awkward and the drive thru menus in a bad spot. The people there are weird/fine and give 90 packets of taco sauce but like what do you go to KFC Tacobell for anyway. Exactly meets but does not exceed my expectations

SKIMPY AF! Ordered food @ 7:15 Sunday 9/9/2018. This the third time we have come home with to find skimpy portions with just about every item. If you are trying to save on food costs you're only going to drive customers away. Asshats!

I can't say too much about this place, partly because of my limited visits there while at the Florida Mall, and partly because, let's face it, this is fast food here, and Mexican at that.

For my most recent visit, I had the burrito supreme. It wasn't bad, but I wouldn't stretch it as far as "supreme." The counter person was nice and the burrito came up within five minutes. I probably won't go back due to all the other choices available at that food court, but it seems to be standard fare for a Taco Bell.

This review is especially to the guy who took my order..... Yes you did not include all my order. Quality Control.. I even asked you if it was all there. You confirmed.  I had to go back for the missing items while you smoked your cigarettes!  Maybe not your fault, they had it in a warmer?  WT....
Ordered on the app, they claimed they never recieved it. Even after showing the confirmation recipt, refused to give us the order. I wish i could give no stars, because i never recived my order.

I have been here twice in 2 weeks and both times, I have seen multiple kitchen employees not wearing their masks appropriately! Most are pulled below their nose and mouth. Absolutely not okay with this at all

This location shares with KFC as most do now. Their speed is slow and slower. Whether going inside or drive thru. Extremely slow. Drinks tend to be watered down as they prepare the drinks first and then give you your food when you are ordering through the drive thru. Never seems to have enough help at this location. You get a good value for your money and we all crave some taco bell tacos every now and then. This is the only location in the area so they have the market on it. If they were retrained I feel they could definitely get a better  rating. The politeness with the staff is present and the restaurant clean it is the follow through they need help with.

The irony of a foodie reviewing Taco Bell!  I have been going to this place for many years and currently live right around the corner.  Every once in a while I stop here to grab a quick bite when I'm feeling too lazy and dont feel like waiting in line at chipotle or getting out of my car to get Qdoba.  I never have any problem with the service here.  They have a guy that works at the drive through that should be on radio or tv, awesome voice lol.  Last time I had a Cantina bowl with chicken and it was very tasty.  Plenty of rice, lettuce, cheese, beans, and chicken.  It didnt fill me up as much as I thought it would but a great value for like 4 something.  I can always rely on this place!

DRIVE ANOTHER MILE TO ANOTHER LOCATION YOU WONT REGRET IT!

I waited for 24 minutes for less 5 bucks of food. All the tables were dirty and some even crusty looking of sauces. Plus they had 4 homeless guys sitting. Right out front of the door asking for food and beer money.

I ordered 5 regular tacos. What can I say I was hungry.  All five had a strong line taste to them. I eat these all the time an never had this taste before it was as if someone spilled lime juice on the cheese or shells. We love Taco Bell but someone needs to fix the issue. 

Order # 358780

Taco Bell is Americas interpretation of Mexican food and quite bluntly it's not as bad as people make it out to be.  For starters, it's cheap and can be quite tasty when the mood strikes.  And for whatever reason as of late I've been in the mood for some Taco Bell.  Since it's a chain everyone pretty much knows what Taco Bell is like.  The differences are more related to the friendliness of the cashiers, the cleanliness of the store and of course the bathrooms.  Well two out of three for this restaurant ain't too bad.  First the bad, when I went here I decided to use the restroom before I ate.  The place was pretty dirty, not in a gross way but mostly in a "small strands of unused toilet paper everywhere on the floor way".  They were also out of toilet paper as well.  

Going out into the restaurant however I noticed it was very clean from top to botom.  I was waited on quickly by a very friendly cashier who took my order and explained the new Quesarito, which was the primary purpose for my visit that day.  I decided to try the steak one and got my fiance a beef one to eat later.  The food came out quickly and my order was accurate and my food was hot.  

I really loved the steak Quesarito (check out my pic, it was awesome) and also really liked the cashier so much I told her manager she needed a raise.  She also took care of the bathroom situation right when I told her about it which I respect.

You can't go wrong here at this Taco Bell, especially if you try the new Quesarito, which I hope they make a permanent menu item!

Still ghetto despite gentrification.....I clearly state I'm eating food in restaurant, yet they toss brown bag at me....Hire people who CAN LISTEN AND FOLLOW INSTRUCTIONS.....where's the damn tray etc....all of the sauce packets stuck together with residue...Smh...

I visited this location a week ago while on vacation for holidays.  My other family members decided to go somewhere else to eat in the food court.  I choose Taco Bell.  I ordered my food with a friendly female cashier, who fixed my drink.  As I was waiting, I noticed people that had ordered after me, getting their food.  Still, I was being patient, afterall it's the holidays.  After 10 minutes, I asked the guy handing out food if mine was about to be ready (by the way, several times just calling out names and handing bags to wrong people because he wasn't looking in the bags after calling names. At some point, I noticed what might look like my food but I don't know because I don't work there!!!). He asked what I ordered and said, "he got me".  I wait another 5 minutes, then tell him that if it's not being made, please cancel my order. Also, told him I thought I seen what looked like my order but someone else grabbed it when he called her name. He said, "why didn't you say anything?" Again, I don't work here!! How would I know!?! He goes back to the left side of kitchen and tells the lady expediting what the issue is, this time where I clearly see he does. She's asked me, "what did you order and where is your receipt?" My receipt was behind the cups, that was behind the register. After ordering it fell so I just left it there.  I told her where it was and she didn't grab it. She said, sternly "your food is almost ready."  I said, "really at this point I just want my money back." She made it clear I was getting my food. At this point, we are 20 minutes in. The rest of my family was almost done eating.  I wait another five minutes and no food. This time I told the female expeditor on left that I demand my money back! A lady from the right side of the kitchen, I'm assuming the manger comes out and says "what's your problem here?" I explain to her how long I've waited and just at this point I want my money back! She asked me for a receipt, I told her where it was. She asked, "why is it over there!" Really?? What does it matter at this point, just grab it and look. Anyhow, after a 10 seconds of explaining why, she grabs it and says is your order " tostada and what sounded something like about 'potatoes"? I had a tostada but idk what the potatoes is, she said I can't give your your money back without receipt. I asked her can I look at the receipt, she said, "what exactly did you have on your order?" I told her again and she said yea this is your receipt but your food is almost ready!" By the way another five minutes goes by and my food isn't even in a bag. I made it clear again, I just want my money back!! My drink was on the counter, I had my hand on it but not a grip.  She snatches the cup away from me (grazing my hand btw) throws it in the trash!!! WTF JUST HAPPENED HERE?!?!(normally, I wouldn't cuss on a review but really, wtf did she just do!?!) I said, "that was rude!" She states, "well, you wanted a refund, right!?! I made it very clear by choice words that was unacceptable!! 

What should have happened because I waited over 25 minutes and because it was such and issue....I should have left there  with my food, my money given back to me and my drink refilled! Or I would have accepted just my money back, no food and to not have my drink snatched from me!! I worked in the food industry for over 25 years!! This is unacceptable!! The woman who snatched my drink to trash it, be glad my kids were there and your not worth jail time! Walking away from that counter with tears in my eyes because I was so mad and praying to GOD he give me the strength to just keep walking was definitely his grace working. I'm not even a believer! This particular Taco Bell should be ashamed that they allow someone like you to represent their corporation in any type of manner. I did call corporate and trust me, my little two five dollar coupons aren't worth the fact you snatched a drink from me and by doing so, touching me. I will be contacting the general manager/area manager as well.  Probably, nothing will be done to you but I believe in karma.

I ordered a #8.  Since she didn't ask me whether I wanted crunchy or soft tacos, I told her I WANT THE CRUNCHY, NOT THE SOFT.  She said, don't worry, it comes crunchy unless you request soft.  Even after this discussion, she gives me soft tacos.  And no receipt.  Not sure what it takes to get an order right here.....you have a 50/50 chance of anyone listening and executing an order correctly.

Customer service is horrible. The hispanic lady in drive thru is so rude to customers i let it go the first time but the second time i complained to the manager and he ignored me i asked for their names to report to corporate and they lied about their names too. I will never go back to this establishment i rather drive a bit further.

Pretty good service and they almost never mess up my order.  However, if you come during dinner or lunch rush you can bet that the soda will taste bad because they forget to change out the syrup (has happened to me more times than I can remember).

This is a decent Taco Bell, I have much more positive experiences at this location since I moved to Longwood than I used to at the Altamonte location. Workers here are friendly and I have not had any issues with poor attitudes. There are wait times at the busiest times of day but I think they are pretty efficient. I also have not had any issues with food. Everything has been prepared well and to specifications as ordered. Once in a while they forget to give me the sauce I request but luckily for me I keep a bottle in the fridge. Presently the nacho fries are back and they are one of my favorite things about Taco Bell. If you haven't tried them yet, do it! I also enjoy the Doritos Locos tacos (nacho cheese flavored, the hot are WAY to hot for me). Chalupas are another favorite, and I also like their Fiesta Taco Salad.

I am writing this as I am currently waiting on food... and have been for awhile. I tried to use the new order system and it said breakfast was all day.... it isn't. So, I ordered and then had to reorder. They were kind about giving my money back and providing refills for the freezes for my cousins. The food took forever.... the chips are stale... IT IS SO HOT IN HERE.............. definitely will not be returning.

This was the absolute worst taco bell i have ever been to we waited in drive thru for our food for over 30 mins then when finally getting it half of it was cold and they forgot one of our cheese roll ups so of course i told them they forgot it then while still in the drive thru about 5 mins later the lady comes to the window and says r u sure its not just in the bottom of your bag in the most snarky voice possible as i take everything out of the bag again to prove its not she just walks away without as much of an apology for making us wait or forgetting our food finally 5 mins after she walk away another employee goes and take our cheese roll up out of her hand throws it in a bag and rudly tosses me the bag just for us to get a cold burrito i will never go back to this location again and i recommend no one else does either until they get some better employees

Very good taco bell compared to most. Never had any major issues with the online ordering, I have had issue before but we're quickly taken care of and with no hassle. Would recommend this one 100% over the one on pecan st.
I don't expect much from Taco Bell, but why forget to give us forks after we ordered chicken bowls? The night crew must've been half asleep.

Maurice T  is by far the best cashier I have ever had at a Taco Bell. He should be promoted immediately. The food was delicious and eating my shredded chicken burrito was like being in a dream (because I'm pregnant and very hungry these days). Because of Maurice T.  I now want more taco bell and now I know which one to stop at.

PMy kids think taco bell is the greatest place on earth! Unfortunately this taco bell rarely gets their order correct and the side of rice my son orders (always) routinely contains less than 1 tsp of rice in it. That makes the rice more expensive than some caviars. Ridiculous and I am sick of it! We bought our last meal at this Taco Bell. I would avoid it to prevent yourself the same frustration.

I arrived to this location with intention of ordering food after using the restroom. I have a medical condition and was in serious need of a bathroom. There was no sign stating the bathrooms were closed. I do not have her name, but a woman wearing glasses behind the counter began yelling, "You can't use this bathroom!" I explained to her several times this was an emergency and I intended on ordering food after. I walked into the bathroom and she followed me, pressing hard on the door as I attempted to close it. She grabbed my arm in the bathroom and stated, "You can't use this! It is state law!" I told her I couldn't believe she just grabbed my arm and left. I am astounded that one of your employees would grab customers arm and attempt to pull them out of a bathroom. This is inexcusable. If it's state law to not allow "restrooms" without clearly posting signage, it is ALSO state law that you CANNOT grab someones arm, as that is physical assault.

Updating my review from three to five stars. This place used to be the worst Taco Bell in town. But lately when I stop in it's really nice! (I come in late night after I get off work.) last night Kale and Eric (I believe) were very kind to me. Thanks!
This location isn't anything special. They do sell like 4 beers there. Food and service is the same as any other Taco Bell, but I love Taco Bell so yay for me.

Definitely NOT closed but they should be. Don't get me wrong the quesadillas are amazing but The wait for a single quesadilla is 20 minutes. Not sure what the issue is. But they don't know what speedy service is.

If I could give it negative stars I would. Their service is ALWAYS BRUTALLY slow whether I'm the 7th car or 2nd like I was today. Ordered the #2, Steak, mtn dew to drink. Took 5 minutes ornsonfor the truck in front if me and when it got to me the guy at the window wasnt familiar with my order and when I received my food despite his multiple assurances there was steak in the burrito I opened it to find to my (non surprise) no steak. Wont be coming back here either the one on 23 by Planet Fitness is MUCH better.

This review is for the freestanding Taco Bell located at the corner of Ponce De Leon Ave NE and Charles Allen Dr NE/Parkway Dr NE. While the food I had at this Taco Bell was okay (by Taco Bell standards), I do not recommend visiting this location. For a better, safer Taco Bell dine-in experience, go to one of the next nearest locations. I suggest the store at 1761 Howell Mill Rd NW.

My friends' parents were mugged in the parking lot here. Also, when I was waiting for my order, I watched several neighborhood kids walk into the store, with various sized empty cups, and steal soda from the fountain machine. They snuck out with huge grins on their faces. I'm not sure if the employees saw or even cared and it didn't look like it was the first time these kids had done it either. The neighborhood immediately to the south and east are historically known for high crime and drug activity, so the aforementioned incidents didn't surprise me in the least.

I grabbed my lunch order to go. It consisted of my old reliable Taco Bell favorites: soft tacos and chalupas. Since the Doritos Locos tacos came out, Taco Bell's taco lineup has ballooned to over a dozen different tacos. Soft, crunchy, beef, chicken, double decker, etc. Through the years, I still prefer the taco I loved in third grade: soft taco with beef. In third grade, I could eat six of these in one sitting.

The soft taco with beef comes with seasoned ground beef, shredded lettuce, and cheddar cheese in a soft flour tortilla. There's also a soft taco "supreme" option that adds diced tomatoes and sour cream, but I still prefer the plain version. I like to add about a pack of "fire" sauce to each soft taco. I'll finish one in about four bites.

Taco Bell's chalupa is like a soft taco on steroids. I prefer the chalupa over the gordita because of the chalupa's crispier, tastier (and greasier) shell. The chalupa comes with seasoned ground beef, shredded lettuce, three cheeses, diced tomatoes, and sour cream. Not surprisingly, it packs a bigger punch than the regular tacos (and about twice the calories).

Service I experienced at this location was fine.

I just made an online order from this Taco Bell. I was not too happy. I was excited and hungry to finally get my food. But when we got home and opened up the bag I saw that they completely messed up my order. They didn't put in one of the tacos  I had ordered. The rest of it was something other then what I had asked for. Not even close!  THey gave me a crunch wrap. The crunch wrap was soggy and the crunch was missing. Who wants a crunch wrap without the crunch. I mean if you are going to get my order wrong at least make THE crunch wrap crunchy, lol! Oh by the way I also realized my drink was missing as well. Yeah I really wasn't amused.

Absolutely awful service. Waited over 20 minutes just for them to take our order. I feel bad for the worker as she is the only one taking orders for the drive through and the counter. This place is disgustingly understaffed..

stopped in today for the Double Chalupa box.  

Taco Bell is pretty good and dependable fast food tastiness.

The store was a bit dirty and empty when we placed our order, but since we are so cool the place started to fill up soon after we sat down to eat.  I'd like to think we had control over that haha!

The taco was nothing to write home about but that double chalupa was super tasty and hit the spot.

I loved the mango brisk iced tea, very delicious!

I can not say e-nuff good stuff about this particular Bell. I have eaten here dozens of times and it's always mental. I always "dine in" here and I have never had a wrong order or delay in my food. Often times, I order/pay and sit down and literally my order is ready after two minutes or less. The food is MTO and hot AF, bro. It must be magic. How TF do they make it so fast? The food is also cheap AF here, bro. I usually start with the $5 Dollar Cravings Box and then keep ordering items off the dollar menu until I feel sick. You can't beat this Bell, bro. The manager is very good. She runs a tight ship and QAs TF out of the place, big time, bro. Total recommend. TB 4evr! It's the GOAT!

This is a terrible place to work and eat.  As of wednesday last week i was told not to come in for a shift.   On thursday i was told u was being punished and written off the schedule for a little while.  I normally receice my direct deposit in my checking account on sundays.  That has stopped the GM maria now wont take my calls and her boss big tiff thompson wont take my calls.  These people should be shut down for bad practice.  Who cares what the reason is if you need to fire some fine, but to mess with them is.so ridicolous    What a shame.  Pay up Tiffany, you guys owe me a final paycheck.....

Terrible service and dirty. I walked in Sunday April 13, 2019 at 2am. (After a long night and trying to make it before close). Midway placing my (to-go) order on the machine. The employees just yell from the back of the counter "we're out of food". No explanation, no apology.. just "you can't order cause we're out of food." This was extremely unprofessional from the crew working. They were just being lazy and rushing to go home. Never going back there again.

45 min in the line outside . Absolutely ridiculous all my food was cold . You should fire everyone

Do y'all just fill your tacos with sour cream and no meat ? Asking for a friend.
Usually takes about 20 minutes to get through the drive-thru. Went last night and it took 30, insane. I should have just made tacos at home haha

I know this is Taco Bell and expectations aren't very high, however, this location is doing it right. I drove to Westerville to eat here while there are 3 Taco Bells closer to my home. Service is friendly and fast here while the food quality and quantity is excellent! I now know how bad those 3 locations have been screwing us on food quality and quantity! This is pur go-to location now!
Staff was all very friendly and accommodating. Encountered 3 different employees all with smiles. Thanks

Not a bad Taco Bell at all.
They have been reliable for years and years for a fair food for a fair price.
Good owners, good food, good location.
Come here a couple times a year no complaints!

Ate here the other night and have been terribly sick ever since. Haven't been out anywhere else during this time and now my doctor has sent me to go get tested for COVID...causation and correlation... to be determined.

This place is hit or miss. On this visit, the food was not good and not prepared well. Totally sloppy and thrown together. 7 Layer burrito is typically good, but the rice was dry and all the ingredients weren't added in a way where it was enjoyable. 

They're also getting sloppy with the tostadas and everything is ending up in the middle. It really depends on who is working, so take your chances. I love TB and may need to drive to a different location.

They did make me an alternative item after taking the 7-layer burrito back, which was nice. I had to argue to get it though.

These worthless retards can't even get a single order right. Every single time I order something I have to go back and make them fix it because they screw it up. Monkeys flinging poop could do a better job than these morons

Not too bad.  It's Taco Bell- it's fast food, it's cheap, it's quick- hopefully.  That's what I needed, and that's what I got.  Drive-through service was friendly and fast.  Prices are cheap.  The food?  You really want to know?  It's a bit more than edible.  There are even vegetables in some things.  Mostly, beans, cheese, tortillas, of course.  I got a beef burrito- menu says "New!!!!"  But somehow I doubt that.  The menu is limited nowadays, and they've lost some of my favorites.  

I also had a chalupa.  Bad idea, on my part, to try to eat that in the car.  Sloppy, open taco.  But, tasty tender beef, and the aforementioned veggies.

Drink?  Mountain Dew Baja Blast slushie.  Because that's how I roll.

I don't normally bitch about fast food but when I get a A burrito that's pretty much just a grilled tortilla With barely meet, chips, and cheese in it is 
completely ridiculous! Like who makes this and thinks anyone in their right mind is going to be happy!

This is fast food so no surprised but it's poorly managed and most of the staff clearly don't give a damn. I usually drive out of my way to go to a different location. If you get here earlier in the day it's not too bad.

Line was extremely long. She kept leaving things off our order even after we repeated multiple times. We get to the window the other employees are yelling and cursing. I just got home, I ordered a nachos box and got taco box
1 star is not low enough. this taco bell had no fountain drinks available, no toilet paper, and my order took forever for no reason.
I love every Taco Bell. They all get 5 stars. Starting to piss me off with taking things off the menu though

Why am I reviewing a Taco Bell? Is this Taco Bell magically better than other taco bells? Yes, in one way.  The food is the same, but difference is the people at this location are consistently nice and competent.  It's refreshing and worth mentioning when people exceed expectations (albeit low expectations).
This restaurant is really good! I recommend the 5 layer burrito it is so delicious. This is the best fast food place in tucker.

Ok so forewarning stear clear from this place. I went here recently, and well in short I ended up with food poisoning. I've been here in the past several times and well I've had problems but never this bad, yeah taco bell has good food when your craving it, but this place has never been to kind to me, whether it be the employees having a bad day and being rude and such, messed up orders, giving wrong change, or bad food that will mess you up for the whole week. I recommend steering clear and taking your business elsewhere (theres a few other taco bells not too far from here)

I would not recommend this Taco Bell to anyone. The only good thing I can say about it, is that for some reason it's cheaper than other Taco Bell's. I've visited this location three times and the only consistent thing that you can expect is to wait 15-20 minutes for "Fast Food" & you will most certainly find that your order is incorrect. I'm not sure if the employee's even know what a supreme taco is.

If I could give this place negative stars I would. Literally that past three times I've tried to order food here 'their system has been down' not to mention that if the systems are up they have 'run out of beef'. AT A TACO BELL. Ran. out. of. beef. Not to mention when they can take your order it's way below sub par (the double crunch wrap. I've had bigger, regular crunch wraps than the disastrous attempt they made at a double crunch wrap) If you can stand to get past the 20+ min wait time to receive the incorrect order than by all means this Taco Bell is for you. Enjoy at your own risk.

Okay went there Sunday evening before the ravens versus pats as I have been there once before. The first time was okay in the drive thru only because 
No one was there. The second time I went inside to order. Bad idea. I waited a solid 20 minutes for 3 tacos and a supreme burrito. The drive thru lady was doing nothing. There was only one prepper doing these massive orders for the drive thru only. 
Everybody inside ( the place was full ) were still waiting for there orders. So basically no one was
Making the orders for the people inside. Finally the black guy came out who has a terrible attitude and helped with the orders inside and outside. I don't think I'll be back as they don't even have enough people working and they are as slow as molasses. 
I understand there were like probably 10 cars deep and many waiting inside but still.
I only come to this location every 6 months just to see if they can finally get my order correct and not miss any ingredients. Better luck next time.

Ordered 7 items and only received 5. Guess I should ALWAYS CHECK MY BAG BEFORE I LEAVE THE DRIVE THROUGH. Not the first time this has happened. Probably won't be the last. Do your job. It's not that hard. And your phone doesn't even work bye.

I had a great experience today!! We went at 7:30pm 1/9/21
They were so nice and food was great and everything was in there! They looked like they were working their butt off! And everything seemed so clean! Thanks guys!

I have had good experiences here in the past but the last several orders through the drive through they have either forgotten 1 to several items. Today though, I went through about 20 minutes ago and ordered 2 tacos, a burrito and chips and cheese. And when i got handed my order on the receipt it looked correct so i assumed. I drove all the way home to find out i did not have a single item in my order AS SHOWN on the receipt of food that I ORDERED. Please make sure before you package the food it is correct. I personally also work food and this is not okay. I would get fired for such a mess up. Now I will have to go my 13 hour shift with no food so thank you. Was hoping for fast food but what I got I cannot eat.

I don't usually take the time to review fast food chain places but just wanted to do a quick shout out for this location because of the super nice guy that took my order... the one who has a radio-quality voice. I'm sure they know who this is, I just don't know his name. And then Maria at the window was super friendly too! The food...well, it's Taco Bell so it's good if you're in a hurry and starving. Haha
Rude, cold food, order wrong and no sauces. How can you eat Taco Bell without their hot sauce. It was at dinner time but not a rush. Makes no sense. Think twice about going to this one

Tonight I spent $29.70 for food items substituting meat with black beans since we are vegetarian. I also asked for lots of hot sauce  and was given 5 packets ten food items. Instead my 6 challupas all had meat and were not eaten. So from the entire order we were able to eat 2 burritos and 2 nacho fries. I want my money back!

I really like this Taco Bell location and I've never had any issues any time I've needed my Taco Bell fix. :) 

On my most recent visit on 6/1/2019 my daughter & I ate inside and not only is this Taco Bell location very clean but the employees are very friendly. 

Shout out to employee Alexandra, who was so patient & very friendly with me when I was trying to figure out what to order and she did a great job of explaining the $5 Taco boxes to me & is what we both ended up getting.   

I totally recommend the Taco Boxes, which come with 5 items, including a drink and cinnamon twist. 

See you later Taco Bell #030263! 

-Rebecca our
