Order chicken parmigiana and they gave me a chicken roll up with cheese sauce was very disappointed that they didnt offer hot sauce

It's Taco Bell, nothing crazy. They definitely don't give me enough meat on my "meat filled" tacos  but what really set me off was the fact that they had an AWFUL version of John Legends hit song open your eyes.. smh Uno Star

Ate here twice. Got stomach flu the first time, and food poisoning the second time. Learned my lesson. To better understand how I feel about this particular taco bell, please google how one gets the stomach flu and you'll get the whole picture.

I placed a large online order with them for an event, and it was such a smooth process! The food was made well, and from me walking in when the order submitted to leaving with my food was less than 10 minutes for 50 tacos. I was very impressed! They made it happen and made my students very happy :)

A new low. Driver through people need to listen much better. I ordered 5 items, it looked correct on the screen. I drive forward and tell the gal the sauces I want. She is busy for a bit, and is back at the window to repeat my sauses. She was wrong, so I repeated myself. She disappears while they take too long to get my simple order together and a new gal appears and asks me what sauces I would like. I REPEAT MYSELF A THIRD TIME.
They got the sauces right but not my order. Stupid is what stupid does.

I personally love Taco Bell but I don't like the workers because they're rude as hell. I went there today and my boyfriend and I were looking at the menu and the lady was hurrying us up in a rude way. By that time there weren't any cars in the drive thru. The only thing I got to say is that don't expect for someone to be nice if you're rude, that's not how life works.

Ok it's Taco Bell, how good can it really be? I'd have to say this one is better than most in my opinion. They seem to not skimp out as badly on portions like the other locations in SE Portland and the food seems hot and fresher than most. Service is decent/competent too. I've been here 20 plus times and been bummed out like once. Compare that to the crappy 50th and Powell location which is more like a 50% failure rating or the 82nd Eastport Plaza skimp fest, I'd say this one out shines. They must have read their corporate manual on how not to suck. Like I said it's still Taco Bell.....

This place is the dirtiest Taco Bell I have ever been to. The girl who helped us kept saying God under her breathe and rolling her eyes. She was very rude. She forgot one of our drinks and we politely asked her for it and she looked at my husband and said one second with her finger, and continued to take another order while rolling her eyes and saying God under her breathe. when she was not even finished with us. Then slammed the cup on the counter. We had four people in our party and ordered at the register because we did not want to use the electronic order screen. If you don't like your job then find another. Very disappointed! The dining room has not been cleaned in I don't know how long. It was gross! The cashier/order taker was what seemed to be a 16 year old with a chip on her shoulder. She also treated the guest that were next very poorly. Sad that a franchise would allow such behavior. If were the manager she would definitely be fired for treating my guest that

I've been sitting in the drive-thru line for 30 minutes, with only two cars ahead of me and one car behind me. I don't know if I need to say anything else, I could have gotten faster service at a restaurant.

I am writing this review for the dude at the drive-through window at 1 AM on 07/16/14. I went to Taco Bell that early morning because I was craving a Mexican Pizza. I was informed that there were no more available. This was really disappointing since I usually never go to Taco Bell, and when I do, I get the Mexican Pizza. The guy at the window  was really apologetic and offered me a free drink. Even though I don't drink soft drinks, I really appreciated his customer service. I will definitely be coming back!

Btw, the new quesarito is awesome! Get it +beans and +red sauce.

I just have to say, this is my favorite taco bell in cbus. I don't write reviews often, but I come through the drive thru here regularly, and the employees have some of the best fast-food customer service I have seen. They are always super positive and kind, I have not once had my complicated vegan orders messed up, and I've never had a bad experience here, which I can't say about a lot of taco bell's I have been to.

double check your items!!!!! This place is notorious for forgetting items. They're always blasting music in the night hours which makes me believe they're not fully paying attention to what they're doing.

Super lame, the people there are always rude and standing around talking ignoring customers. God forbid something be wrong, they will get a attitude with you about fixing it. I always pick dine-in on the touchscreen, but then they stuff my food in a to go bag. They have beer and wine, but I attempted to ask for a twisted freeze and they informed me they dont sell liquor there? Uhh.. this is Taco Bell cantina? Isn't that the whole point. Sucks, because this Taco Bell could be so much more but it's obvious people just dont care

Literally the worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. Have lived in the area and always try to give this location a shot (for FIVE YEARS) but its always dismally disappointing. Don't go. It never works out. They'll mess up your order, be out of menu items, or say they're only accepting cash (and who carries cash these days). THE WORST.
This place smells of mildew, and the dining room hasn't been cleaned in who knows how long there were no clean booths and there employees are standing around.

Worst taco bell I've ever been to. Cashier was rude and could barely count, our order was wrong multiple times, food was of poor quality, and the nacho fries were under-cooked with barely any seasoning. Pretty dissapointed.
Slowest Taco Bell ever!!!! I'm literally writing this whole I sit in the drive thru line. My son and I have been sitting in the line for over 20 mins. Ridiculous!!!!!

With their new reduced hours because of Covid 19 don't plan to come here for breakfast until 10:30 unless you just like to waste your time.  I have been at this taco Bell multiple times and each time they cannot seem to get their act together to open up at their scheduled reduced time.

The absolute best Taco Bell I've ever been to! Not only are the staff extremely friendly and accommodating, but the food actually looks like the photos on the menu! Oh, and let's not downplay how awesome it is that this location serves BEER AND WINE! The beer taps fill your cup from the bottom, so a word to the wise: Don't poke the magnet on the bottom of your cup like I did... Let's just say the hand dryers in the bathroom work well on clothing, too. Lol 

The lovely ladies that took my order let me order off the SECRET MENU! I got the Chicken Enchirito. It was glorious! This place is awesome. That is all.

I'd give it no stars if I could. Got the spicy potato tacos , fresco style. They were filled with nothing but lettuce, & the potatoes in them were inedible. They were stale and as hard as rocks, and each taco was cold. The only positive thing I can say is the manager handled my call accordingly, but will never return to this Taco Bell again. My husbands order was a potato loaded griller where there was literally only 3 potatoes and the rest was filled with sour cream and cheese. I don't know if they ran out of potatoes , gave us stale, old potatoes, or were just too lazy to cook some more, but it was ridiculously made.

The food is fine, as fine as Taco Bell can be but the service is terrible. I've been waiting 40 minutes now, trapped in line. There was about 6-7 cars in front of me. This is unacceptable. Time and time again when I come they always are short staffed or un-trained staff. The food is simply not coming out fast enough.
Went in, got a couple tacos and a quesadilla. Quesadilla was fine, but all tortillas were old and had that stale crunch to them :/
The service today was terrible at the drive-thru window... waited for more than 1 hr for my order

Not to be confused with Tinker Bell, which is a fairy, and tastes way better.

As I've said before there are some bad things to eat in the Natick Mall and there are some really really bad things to eat and the Natick Mall and this is one of the really really bad ones. I can't stand Taco Bell and I don't understand why my traveling companion rates it.

I've always been a loyal Taco Bell customer back home in TN so I decided to try this Ohio location and was pleasantly pleased with the same consistent economical food, I was accustomed to. 

The staff was friendly as well.

My only disappointment was that they don't brew their sweet tea, the way they do back in TN. There is nothing worse than tea or soda from one of their fancy machines. The flavors never have the correct taste and often taste like diet drinks.
trash customer service stupid employee and what i have to say more they Do Not Deserv one satr even

Went there tonight, they forgot to give me my 2 chalupas and two nacho cheese supreme tacos, called the store and told me to get in line again. Keep in mind their drive thru line was SUPER long. I waited in line got to the window and they gave me my food. I didn't bother checking it because I would assume it would be right this time. I get home and my nacho cheese supreme tacos were missing the sour cream and tomatoes. And our food was COLD. This is the second time they have messed up my order.
Good location. They were nice and fast. One of the last few places actually following appropriate covid guidelines. Way better than the horrible zaxbys next door.
Worst taco bell ever. Slow as hell and willl get at least 1 thing wrong every time. Seriously slowest services ever! Always a long line that's takes 20min to get through!

05/16/2020, Order 352272, 6:48:49, Cashier: Azael C, $21.62. We are vegetarian and my wife has never eaten meat in her life!! I requested that all meat be substituted with refried beans. Instead you loaded her quesarito with filthy animal flesh. I hate buying anything from Taco Bell, because too often you make gross mistakes. I'm a first responder and have little personal time to enjoy with my wife. Tonight you have ruined our dinner and I'm seriously considering having our attorneys file a lawsuit against Taco Bell.

Great food.

Great service!

Great atmosphere! 

I've never been to a better Taco Bell than this one!

Great place for a quick meal or just to get a bite to eat with friends!
It's Taco Bell. You either love it or you hate it. The location is nice and you can order on a touchscreen which is cool! They have few alcohol options, but overall it's pretty nice!

Had the worst experience tonight at TACO bell. They ran out of beef and we waited 40 mins for food and didn't apologize. The girl basically threw the food at me and didn't seem to care. Seem like they were skimping on the portions, I asked for more tomatoes and sour cream and they said that was the normal amount they usually give. Never again. I rather go to a drive through Taco Bell.

Had a decent drive through experience! The staff were super friendly and patient while we ordered. Average service speed. Tacos/burritos were not really filled to standard amount that is typical for the menu items. The items we wanted were all in stock at the time of our order.
I think i had two birthdays from the time i ordered my food to the time i got it and i was the only one in line...

I was disappointed that I was the only one inside at noon today.  It was nice that the cashier gave me a discount on my burrito, since I was a senior citizen. The burrito was just warm and not as hot as it should have been.   The dining room was very dirty, floors, tables, glass doors, wooden plank across counter.  I had not been inside this restaurant for ten years and was disgusted by the uncleanliness.  Most of the patrons were going through the drive-through and I could see why.  They need to clean the place.  I never saw it like this before.

One of the slowest Taco Bell's I have ever been to drive thru wise.  Got a couple of cars in front of you? Expect a good 15 minute wait, no I'm not kidding. The food is usually good and comes with a decent amount of meat. It's Taco Bell, not much more to say. Seems clean inside and out and appears to be somewhat new, but I could be wrong. Also has what appears to be nice outdoor seating area that is covered.

I will never come here again. constantly waiting 30+ minutes in line and our order is always wrong. we keep coming back anyways but this time was the last time. I understand it's just Taco Bell, but a job where you work in customer service, you better at least fake your customer service. After waiting in line for so long and pulling up to the window, the two girls there just stood there with the window open talking shit about the customers in front of us in line and cussing like crazy. At least close the window or wait until your customer leaves! and no receipt and no change. At that point we didn't even want to argue it so we left. Don't come here lol

I went to this Taco bell today and gave them my order.then another group of people came in and were given their order before me even though I ordered first. I mentioned that and they pretended to be surprised. Also, I clearly stated that it was to eat in but it was prepared as a take out order.

They place was dirty, prep area was a mess. The very small tiny building space is shared by a KFC. We ordered two different gorditas, they wrapped them in the different wrapper but only gave the regular gorditas. We ordered the Dorito tacos but then when we got home they were all regular flavored tacos. So the entire order was just completely inaccurate. The food we did get upset my spouse's stomach. Whoever owns this branch needs to show some stewardship and tend to this franchise.
Spent 40 minutes in the drive through only to get my order wrong and still had to pay full price. Shit.
It's Taco Bell, so you generally know what to expect. I went through the drive-through with no problem. Everything I ordered was in the bag, with sporks and sauce. Got home and it was tasty enough.

I had a terrible experience just placing an order at the drive-through.  While giving my order I was consistently interrupted by the staff and had to repeat my order several times over. Although this is sometimes something that will happen while placing an order it was clear to me during my talk with the staff that it was simply because she wasn't paying attention. Her tone of voice lacked any friendly vibe and it felt as though she just didn't want to be at work. I get that Taco Bell is a shit place to work at but no one likes a sappy individual that immediately comes across as "Oh God, another order I gotta place". I didn't even end up ordering because she stopped me mid order after repeating it already. I just backed out of the drive through and left.
Whoever was working the window tonight around midnight was super sweet and professional. Thanks!
service is so slow, I've been in the drive thru line for 25 minutes. Site is also under construction so that was annoying

45 min in the line outside . Absolutely ridiculous all my food was cold . You should fire everyone. Not to mention they coughed all over my drink & non of them wear gloves . Calling the health department of food and safety to report .

Can anyone really hate on Taco Bell?  When the location opened, they had some growing pains which is normal for ANY restaurant on the planet.  They are way better now and in their groove.

There's one guy on the drive thru.  Nicest guy ever.  Always hooks me up with taco sauce and a smile!

So I was pretty hyped for the Toasted breakfast burrito that apparently you can put Cinnabon on based on a Facebook video(https://www.facebook.com/watch/?v=239878513841112), so I hyped myself up to drive through this Taco Bell - a place I have not set foot in for 2+ years. For the beautiful combination of cheap & hopefully tasty treats.

Needless to say, the hype died down pretty quickly for 3 reasons:

1. The toasted breakfast burrito is not an available item.
2. You cannot request to put cinnabons inside the burrito
3. The reason why No. 2 happened was because they most likely pre-made their burrito. My burrito came out way too quick, and was lukewarm.

You also had to ask for sauces, which was kind of weak (weak sauces, and in limited quantity). And yes, the inner fillings looked quite sad. But it is Taco Bell, so I guess I should know what I got myself into. The taste, after I forcefully jammed the cinnabons in, was surprisingly decent.

Thank you, Taco Bell for the reality check. I will see you again when I believe in your hypes
The girl with the pink hair was a straight bitch. Very disrespectful and gave horrible customer service.

I clearly asked for sour cream on the siiiiiiiiide! I swear this damn taco hell needs to be shut down. They think they know what they are doing so well, that they fuck up damn near everybody's food! Literally! I want my damn food made right. I can bet that no one will reach out to me because franchised establishments don't give a damn about their customers! Ugh

Yea this is the last time I'll go to this T-bell. I get not giving a f**k when you don't get paid the money you deserve and working through a pandemic, but also same. The last 3 times they I've gone to this specific location it's like they just close their eyes and put stuff in a bag. I've gotten multiple missing items, wrong orders or dietary restrictions not acknowledged. I also never got my receipt those times and since all the bags are closed with a sticker now and handed to you in a plastic bin out the drive thru window, I know it's not because I just didn't ask. And I've ordered online and my receipt wasn't in my bag, so it's genuinely just not being givin us. I wont call and nark or say nothin cause I'm not tryina mess with someone's day or get someone in trouble but daymn. Just give me my crunch wrap and cheesy gordita tho.

I'm upping my rating to 5 stars during the pandemic as I've been ordering online lately and when I walk in, they look for "Joe's Bag" and smile (I think) and give it to me.  Everyone is friendly and gracious that I'm still visiting since eating Vegan foods and just ordering a crap ton of bean burritos.

#ThankYouThursday to my first true love.  You stuck with me through the good and the bad and have always been there to comfort me.  After the flu when you get that "I need some G.D. food" feeling, you were there.  When I couldn't decide which of the 3 new pizzas I should order when they were introduced, so I ordered all 3.  You were there.  (And shame on you for Zero Pizzas now, but I still love you).  31 Years now since my parents went through a drive through in California and I was amazed such lusciousness could be ordered through a speaker.  Even as an infant I loved this place... lol

Keep up the good work and I won't hold what Corporate is doing against this restaurant.  Yum!

P.S.  Heat your leftover burritos in the air fryer for a crispy delicous "better than fresh" burrito.  I haven't tried this with a taco.

CNA here coming off of working graveyard, waited 10 minutes in drive through watching emps with no response and finally decided to leave at 8:10 in the morning. I see this isn't the only late open review.

Everytime I come here, I never get exactly what I ordered. For instance I order a Doritos Locos Taco and either get a regular hard shell or nothing at all. Also things tend to get swished and break with hope they pack the bags. Not too many bright customers coming in as well, but that could be only the area.

This is one of the worst taco bell locations. I ordered two quesadillas with 2 sides of creamy jalepeno sauce (the sauce that comes inside the quesadilla). When I pulled up to the window they told me they didnt have enough sauce to fill the side order but had just enough to make the quesadillas.  

I was skeptical but said ok. To no ones surprise the quesadillas had zero creamy jalepeno sauce on them.

The employees were just blatantly lying about having any creamy jalepeno sauce and making quesadillas without it. Which is explicitly why I order it on the side. 

Honestly I am more mad at myself then anything. I really just need to stop going to taco bell.

I was here yesterday and ordered 2 items. I went inside as I hate drive through. 
   They have nobody taking orders. Its Kiosk or you dont eat!  No money changing hands.   One of the 2 kiosks is broken so you wait your turn to order on the only machine.  
   I have eaten at many Taco Bells all over and while not the best, its generally acceptable to me providing it is somewhat decent in quality and delivery.
   This place though has gone downhill bigtime!  
   I went to a different Taco Bell to try the new grilled cheese burrito you see advertised a lot and I liked it. I thought pretty good, I'll order more of these. Ah...but at this taco bell, it is no resemblance whatsoever to what I got at the other taco bell. Just a mess no grilled cheese and loose cheese and goop a total mess. I also order the double shell taco with the soft cheese between the 2 shells for a $1. That is a new special item and I never tried it before so harder to judge but what I got was a mess and no visible cheese seen. It didnt look anything like the photos, nor did the burrito at this location. At this time I already left. You cant eat there. 
    However this is not the worst of it. Im 65 with conditions and I  CARE about covid. There were 4 people who you can see right there making the food you are going to eat with masks around the neck!   Nose and mouth exposed and generally have a loud lively conversation which requires a lot of lung use!  They have your food in their hands! I expect there is noone who would enjoy seeing this!  

I probably should have left but I had already paid and the money  isnt going to come back to you out of a kiosk. Not only that the kiosk  doesnt ever print a receipt in person!!! Yeah you can email one to yourself but you dont think your going to need it. I guess from now on you better! 
     The lady who handed me the bag had a mask on, but the folks behind her had the around the neck trick thinking maybe I will only pull it up if people complain? or if I get caught??? Im not sure what the thinking is.  
   The chairs are also all down and no sign, but if you sit down they will tell you you cant. Ok no indoor eating is  understandable, but most places put the chairs on the table, rope it off, or put up a sign but none of that here. I guess your just supposed to know. I would think we are just supposed to know we should have a mask on to but I guess I hope for too much. 
  There has been a rucus between the Mayor and Governor on masks but the mayors most recent proclamation reads they should be wearing one in ANY building in the City of Atlanta. Unfortunately there is no enforcement otherwise I would have reported it already.  
   I live fairly near this location but Im done with it!  However I will continue at times with other Taco Bells as other locations operate SO MUCH  better than this one and my health im sure is not nearly so endangered at other locations.
   I will post a pic of one of the four with the mask around the neck trick and a photo from corporate on what the 2 items I ordered are SUPPOSED to look like and what I actually got.

25% off!  Taco Bell is introducing loads of new items. Hooray for that, but just how many are worth it??

    Before I go on, the 25% off is something you get if you get a Taco Bell account. You go online and enter a credit card. You create an account. You place the order online. I thought....really?  Oh well for 25% I'll try it!

    I place my order, and it was easy. It said that they will start making up your order unless you reply to the email and say otherwise. ?  Well I didnt want it to sit and wait and get cold so off I went!  This stuff doesnt take long to make, so why do they do this I thought.  It said just tell them you ordered online. 

   I get there and no, it wasnt waiting, (thats good). I said I ordered online. She hits a button and says oh, they dont pup up until you tell us. (at least at this location). Good. I was the only order there, she didnt need a name or to see a credit card. Very shortly its ready!

   Overall I like some of the new products yes, especially the smothered burrito. This week I had the Quesalupa they promote so heavily, the fiery Doritos locos supreme taco, and Steak Cantina power burrito.  As so often the case, most dont look as good as the pictures!  Yeah I know...what a surprise huh!  Or what were you thinking!!!  

  When I signed up for the taco bell account it said the 25% off is good on every order for the rest of the month, and since it was March 3, I see I can get it all month. Thats good!

  The online website though doesnt have the cheap items!  Ah ha!  I like the value menu, especially the spicy tostada for $1 and that wasnt on the online order form!  Online is the other more expensive items and the new products and the new drinks. 

  This quesalupa they promote so much with the cheese in the shell isnt at all like the ads. Had I not know to hunt carefully for the cheese I would have missed it. That photo of all this white gooey melted cheese??  Well it's just not like that.  So the food is average but it wont look as good as the pic. I love the 25%. The help is nice, I like new products, but still hard to give it more than a 3 star.  Not only that they wrap each product but somehow theres pieces of cheese, lettuce and tomato all loose in the bag too. Since what I get isnt as large as picture, Id prefer not to loose any more of it!
Update: things have gotten better seems like they figured it out, drive thru is faster and employees are nicer.

This location doesn't open at the time that their website says they do. I arrived almost 15 minutes after their opening time and absolutely nobody was even there. Ive had issues with employees here in the past so this doesn't really surprise me. Still disappointing to say the least.

This place is the best in the world. Your mouth will never stop watering for the cheesy taco chicken goodness that will bring you pleasure of all kinds. Indulge in the american culture that is taco and chicken together. you could say that this is a miracle and you would be right :P Lick your way through the five layers that is the cheesy five layer burrito and finish with a bang of extra crispy breast chicken that is. yum yum got to get me some. :D Peace
I ordered a number 6 and I got a number 4 instead and when I showed them the receipt that the charged me for a number 6 instead of a 4 and I asked for a remake they said no and Argued

Thanks to this girls for a great service. They're all extraordinary and this TB can be a good training model for others. There's very seldom anybody not willing to go the extra mile. Awesome service. They crew ALL today fixed my order in a snap. The girl in the drive thru window wasn't happy but seems she's in training. Keep up the great work!!!
Please bring back my favorite- taco salad and tostadas...

I'm giving this Taco Bell a two-star within the context that it is fast food Mexican and because of THIS visit. The food is never "spectacular" for this type of restaurant,  but it is what it is.
   Today I walked inside for an order to-do. I ordered two double decker tacos, a bean burrito with green sauce no red sauce extra onions (my wife's favorite) an enchilada and a gordita chicken (thinking crunch wrap but said the wrong thing)
   When my number was called there was one of those twisted cinnamon things sticking out and I said, "This isn't my order I didn't order that cinnamon thing (a Churro)."
I then had the guy who took my order, who I hate to say it but his English wasn't very clear, argue with me looking at the receipt that that was in fact my order. In fact he said that twisty thing is your gordita and I said no I thought the gordita was something else not a cinnamon twist thing I guess its my bad I didn't know what I was ordering I was wanting to order that circular round thing thats wrapped up and has all the stuff in the inside. He says, oh a Crunchwrap I'll get that for you. So I got that for free and took it all home. 
   Well, sure enough on the receipt there is the churro and a gordita special order with chicken. I have a gordito and it's NOT the swirling cinnamon thing and there isn't an enchilada anywhere!?!  I wasn't charged for what I didn't get but I was charged for that twisted cinnamon thing that I didn't order! And I got a free crunch wrap minus the charge on the twisted cinnamon thing that I didn't order but was charged for.

How screwed up can an order get? Oh, and my wife's special bean burrito, it had sour cream on it and they're not supposed to come that way that she minded so much it was just weird.

Really Taco Bell, really?

This was probably one of the worst Taco Bell experiences I've ever had. I had a pick up order through door dash for the first time and drove to the window to pick up the food because I didn't know I was supposed to go to the speaker first. I pulled up to the window and politely explained that I had a pick up order for door dash and this was my first door dash order and the lady was VERY rude. She screamed at me and said  "I hate door dashers. Next time- if you don't come to the speaker first I'm not serving you at all!!" I was very shocked and disgusted and this particular Taco Bell has lost me as a customer indefinitely.

Guy who handles the cash at the front also makes the tacos in the back. Didn't see him change his gloves...other than that, prices are expensive considering its fast food and not professionally made by a chef

Hello service!! My family got a 10 pack of tacos today. I have one kid that can not eat sour cream. The lady was so nice she said it was no problem to get two without sour cream. Then i always order rice with cheese. This was the first time i was told no problem. Most of the time they tell me it's not o.k.  She repeated our entire order to us. She said she wanted to make sure our food was correct. We got to the window, my husband started to drive off. She said wait! She gave my son some cinnamon twists. She was smiling! Fast food that was fast and correct!

Well it's been years since I've been in this Taco Bell and this was just another reminder why.

We arrived on a Saturday afternoon around 2:20 and they were obviously backed up inside with people waiting for their orders and a group of the slowest ordering people I've ever had the pleasure of being near making multiple orders at the counter.
We stood around for several minutes nothing happened for us so we turned around and walked out.

Some the dumbest mofos on the planet. Pull up to first window, pay, pull up second window and they try to give me someone's order. 

Guy says let me talk to my manager cuz I didn't see an order for you. 

Manager: "when did you place your order? 

Me: Literally two cars ago. 

Manager: okay we don't have that order. 

Me: okay then what did I just pay for. 

Manager: what did you have I'll bring it out to you personally. 

Me: number 3, no tomato 

Me: pulls around as instructed to wait after 10 minutes walk to door. Gets wrong order and wrong drink. Still. 

I mean what do you expect from a Taco Bell, but sweet mother of Neptune's beard oil dripping from a stick. lol
How incompetent can you be?!?!? 

Never again.

I got my biscuit at KFC and he decided to order from Taco Bell.

The food took forever to come out because we were forgotten about, but when the cashier realized how long we had been waiting he got the food out as fast as he could.

His food was hot when it came out (unlike my biscuit) and the tables were clean so we stayed in to eat rather than venturing back in the ice storm outside.

I'm sure we'll be back because it's so close by. I'm not a fan in the slightest, but it gets the job done when the power is out and you need calories ASAP.

Holy Jesus, can this place get some backup please?!? I don't have high expectations or standards for fast food places, but isn't it reasonable to think I'd have to wait for less than 30 mins to get my $5 nacho box?? Seemed like there were plenty of employees, but they all seemed so preoccupied in conversation with each other while customers are sitting there very unhappy with the wait. This lady in front of me also waited approximately 30 mins, only to have the bottom of her taco box blow out and drop all her tacos on the floor, couldn't the employees at least offer her a refund for the double wait time? And once I received my nacho box, it was quite dirty, with oily finger stains all over it. Get it together, cmon y'all.

I guess after all the hype I was thinking this was a version of Taco Bell that maybe had table service or a different menu or something. I couldn't really find a lot of info online, so I guess that fact that it's basically just a normal Taco Bell with a few different menu items AND wine and beer options was why. I am still, however, giving them 5 stars, mostly because I LOVE Taco Bell. It's consistently good and I know what to expect. The other menu items I mentioned above are some shareable items. Then have mini quesadillas, chicken chip baskets, and one other item that I can't remember; something with jalapeño. They also have those cool draft systems where your beer gets filled from the bottom of your cup. Either way, I plan on coming back to try some of the shareable items and have a beer or two. I'll update my review then. Can't wait to come back!
The worker at this branch was very nice. They know their menu items and specials well. Thumbs up!

Well the food was hot. That's got to count for something right? I waited like 3-5 minutes at the counter before even being acknowledged. That's the kind of Taco Bell Service I'm used to. Totally crap. It's not expensive though so I guess you get what you pay for?
If there was a list of shittiest Taco Bell's in the state this location would be top three. 15 minute wait with the only entertainment being employees taking cigarette breaks beside your car.

Worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. Cashier was unprofessional not paying attention to my order. Went home and realized my order was wrong. Called the manager and he told me to come back and that's all he said.
This is literally the worst Taco Bell I have been to. I've come here at least 5 separate times & they've either messed up my order or the quality of food has been so terrible.
The current hours are now 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. I don't know if they are going out of business? The lights are off half the time. Strange for a former, very busy location?

Second time this week I've driven by here and all there lights are off as if they're closed before they are shown to be on their website. This time I tried going through the drive they and it turned out they still were open. All I ordered was a drink, chips with cheese and fiesta potatoes. I literally got fiesta potatoes, my drink and no chips.. The only good thing I can say is that the lady who was helping me was much more friendly than the horrid employee that is usually there at night.

this doesnt even deserve one star. i ordered 2 of the steak double stacked nacho tacos which is supposed to have nacho cheese in between the soft tortilla and the hard tortilla. there was no cheese whatsoever. we drove all the way back to re order them and the manager rolled his eyes as hard has he could. when we were given our tacos back they were beef. so of course we reordered. im typing this message while sitting in the drive through getting nasty looks from the girl at the window. all i wanted was a cheesy taco. i do not recommend.

The person working the drive thru on Sunday that looks like a young skinny boy with a female voice should by fired for being a rude, mouthy and antisocial worker. He took the order wrong, mouthed off, corrected the order, said does the screen look correct and closed it immediately, gave me half of our vegetarian order, then arrogantly stated that he didn't prepare the order, walked away, another worker took over, then we got our order from a worker who knows how to be a human being. Jeeeezzzzzuuuuss!!!

The soda machine was broken, but no notice was posted before entering the drive-thru. The girls in line before me paid for my order as an act of kindness. This is the second time that no napkins were placed in my bag, just like the location on SE Division last week, which makes me wonder if this is a trend. A slippery two stars.

I have a love/hate relationship with this Taco Bell.  It's probably because I love love love love Tacos, but despise Bells (with their ringing and then silence).  This one is hit or miss, but lately it's been more of a hit than a miss.

Since adopting a vegan diet, I've been coming here a lot more often.  They have a lot of choices and it's easy to customize them by ordering Fresco Style, which eliminates the cheese, sour cream, and guac (not sure why), and adds Pico de Gallo at no charge.  Their vegetarian menu is great too, but I'd be paying for ingredients they'll just remove.

I've been ordering off of the dollar menu and getting (all fresco) bean and rice burritos, potato soft taco and spicy tostadas.  I'll also get a regular crunch taco fresco style and sub black beans for the beef.

The cashiers have been patient with me as I ask questions and customize my items.  I live close so it's an easy stop when I don't have time to make lunch at home.

Thanks to everyone here over the past few months for improving the consistency and accommodating my customizations.  They have all been correct too!  Not once a piece of cheese or dollop of sour cream.  Keep up the good work.

This was the absolute worst Taco Bell experience of my life. I would give it zero stars if I could. I came at around 12:30 AM and sat in the drive thru for close to an hour. During that time, me and the other parties with me discovered that the hold up was because there were TWO people running the entire restaurant. We pull up to the order screen, and we're told that it would be another fifteen minutes before we could place our order, and by that time, it was too late to leave. It was during that time that we told the other cars behind us our situation, and they all left. I expressed my frustration to the two young ladies working, and they were very apologetic. They explained that they've been running the restaurant by themselves for a month. I am truly disappointed that the management at that Taco Bell would set its employees up for failure, and I think that big changes need to be made with management in order to make this restaurant worthwhile again.


UPDATE: I just got off the phone with the manager (Alicia), and now I see the problem clearly. She was incredibly rude to me and tried to tell me that there were more than two employees working, even though we SAW the two in the restaurant. She then tried to argue with me about how to run the restaurant. I hope that her superior sees how she's running this operation, and she is terminated.

This location always has the worst service. Today I ordered and I asked the lady if I could pay with cash. She ignored me and turned her back and started talking  to her coworker, who was on the phone. Then after I paid she told me that I had to back up to the pole. Then when my food was ready she had me pull up which took less than two minutes from the time that I backed up.

Unbelievably bad food cold, mini portions, old lettuce, not wrapped tightly, just THROWN in bag, incomplete order TO BOOT!   Rude personnel.  Paid for upgrade meat, gave us regular.  Written list was given, so no misunderstanding!  Just plain BAD

The location is McCoy road, Orlando,  Fl.

Customer service sucks, didn't even get to the food. From the reviews I wouldn't want to try it anyways. Stood in line for way to long, for no reason. Made eye contact with multiple employees, just to be told to use the kiosk ordering station. Already contacted corporate, can't wait to hear back from them. That's how you want to treat a Vet. Gotchu. Stupid manager told me I would be trespassed if I ever came back. You couldn't pay me to go to this Taco Bell. Throw the whole thing out and start over. This location is trash

Seriously the best tacobell I've had in a long time. Probably ruined every tacobell from now on by giving us piping hot super crispy tacos, fries and sauce. Good job guys, the drive thru dude was super friendly too

Just Ghetto so after you pay for your food you have to pull back to wait to only have to pull forward once your food is ready but why and they keep yo change like wtf I'm so done with this Taco Bell y'all funny so you don't want me to y'all make my food or some shit never again

I have went to this Taco Bell for three years now. I've been a vegetarian for six years. It's always been awesome how they provide options for alternative lifestyles, I very much appreciate that. Unfortunately, when I ordered my usual black bean Crunchwrap (off the veggie menu on the app, and many times at the speaker) I received a Crunchwrap with beef. I took a single bite and proceeded to vomit. I have not eaten meat in six years, if made me sick sick sick. However they do give plenty of sauce.

I ordered a 12 taco party pack, quasadilla, and a quasaritto. The quasadilla was missing cheese, quaso, and barely had any chicken. It also wasn't cut at all. $5 for an empty tortilla. The quasaritto was lacking most of the chicken. And the taco shells were completely shattered in my party box (also disappointed by the amount of meat). I will go out of my way to avoid this taco bell.

My husband and I just flew in and after a 6 hr flight we were craving Taco Bell. For a Friday night we weren't expecting the best service considering it's a Friday night and who looks forward to working (you know) but to our surprise the team working tonight we're ON IT and not just pumping food out but quality service. Especially the girl Kealy, man she was doing an incredible job, service was A1, very friendly and had a great attitude. Not to mention she was insuring the preparation area was clean and neat in between orders. I wish I would've gotten the rest of the teams name because they all were doing such a great job!

We spent $40 in the drive thru for a family of 5.  The order was wrong, the food was made wrong, we were missing two items, I got an eye roll when I asked for sauce and no receipt, so going back to have the order fixed didn't seem like an option.  Tried calling but the phone has been busy for the past hour.  This location is always stressful to me because I never know what I am going to get, despite what I ordered.  It's also about 4 updates behind all of the other Taco Bell's in the area.  I'm never going back to this location.

Total lunchtime fail. Received the wrong order. All that was in the bag was cold with two of the three wrappings were wet and well just a gross mess. 
Lunchtime ought  to be HOT or at least warm. 
Should have checked the recent Yelp ratings before breaking a 6 year ban on this location. 
Taco Bell use to be cheap fast food. Now its simply overpriced "chow".

You are "rolling the dice"  here IMHO.

So help me to understand the advantage of the paid online order option if you are going to make the online customers wait in the same drive thru line -which is usually at minimum 10 cars deep - to pick up an order that's already been paid for? With the dine-in section closed, wouldn't it make sense to convert it into an online order pickup area?

The food at this branch is a 1 star experience. Half filled burritos, and they never grill your burrito when you ask. On top of this they are constantly out of hot sauce and Baja blast. Just bad management in the operations aspect.

Not sure if I've ever actually been to this one before, but I am nearby often, and Mom wanted a snack, so we swung by.  Odd entrance to the drive-through from the back lot, so be careful.  Menu looks pretty normal, but they might have limited a few items.  They left an item out of our order, so I had to go inside.  They were apologetic and quickly made it for us.  Service was friendly, inside was clean (no chairs down.)  Cash only the day we were there.

It's Taco Bell.  Beans, tortillas, and other stuff, in various forms.  It's fast and cheap.  I had a seven-layer burrito, my go-to.  Semi-healthy.  Expensive for what it is, but most items are super cheap.  Come here hungry, or drunk, whatever, for me it's an occasional guilty pleasure.

This is the most hit and miss Taco Bell in the entire city of Columbus. One time I got a meal here and I almost wept true tears it was so good. Sometimes their workers treat me like their own family! And then at other, random times, you get the worst, most disgruntled humans that  end up messing up every portion of your meal. Sooooo odd. No pattern at all!

They almost always get some part of my order wrong. On the latest visit I said KFC FRIES and got a KFC PIE. 2 stars because generally they have very friendly drive thru workers. Otherwise I guess it's what you'd expect from fast food...

This place is GROSS and NASTY!!!!!!! I just ordered food, and I was waiting for my order at curbside and witnessed a worker drop the food on the floor, and then another worker saw it and ordered her to pick up the food from the floor quickly then looked around to make sure no one was watching them picked up the food from the floor and put it back in the bag, Then they gave it to the customer. That is disgusting. Don't eat here. Who knows what they do in the kitchen.

This Taco Bell was very fast, and they took my order outside. I was very surprised that they had removed potato's from their menu items. They said they would be replacing them with fries soon, but for now they have either. They need to have more vegetarian offers. I went to get soft potato tacos and ended up going to McDonald's downs the street.
The ladies that work here are gorgeous and have the most flawless lashes I've ever seen. As for an actual review- idk, it's a Taco Bell.

Have you had the Toasted Cheddar Chalupa?

It's the iconic Taco Bell Chalupa with a six-month aged cheddar toasted shell stuffed with beef, lettuce, cheese, sour cream & tomatoes.

Yes please! It's so good I have eaten it twice this week 

There is also a vegetarian variant that subs black beans for the meat.

Order
Toasted Cheddar Chalupa box (toasted cheddar chalupa, crunchy taco, cinnamon twists & a med drink)

They took our cold onion rings back after we came back through the drive through even though you aren't supposed to take it back due to covid. But she literally took them back and it was really gross. Just overall not impressed.

This location thought it would be a good idea to have someone standing out side in the freezing cold to take peoples orders, so they can be more interactive with the customer during covid and the dead of winter? Literally the dumbest thing I've heard all day
Taco Bell is the only fast food place I like, but this branch is HORRIBLE. I would say maybe only 50% of the time do they get my order right. Today they got the order wrong and the food was terrible.

This is a decent Taco Bell, I have much more positive experiences at this location since I moved to Longwood than I used to at the Altamonte location. Workers here are friendly and I have not had any issues with poor attitudes. There are wait times at the busiest times of day but I think they are pretty efficient. I also have not had any issues with food. Everything has been prepared well and to specifications as ordered. Once in a while they forget to give me the sauce I request but luckily for me I keep a bottle in the fridge. Presently the nacho fries are back and they are one of my favorite things about Taco Bell. If you haven't tried them yet, do it! I also enjoy the Doritos Locos tacos (nacho cheese flavored, the hot are WAY to hot for me). Chalupas are another favorite, and I also like their Fiesta Taco Salad.

This Taco Bell is absolutely the worst Taco Bell ever I always get mini chicken quesadillas substitute the shredded chicken for grilled chicken with no sauce. And they wanted to up charge me and on the screen it said substitute beef or chicken additional two dollars. That is wrong and the little smart ass manager wanted to argue with me. I will never be back

Messed up my order twice, but they owned the mistake.. apologized profusely.. and replaced my item with TWO of what I ordered, as well as a cinnamon twist! Probably the best Taco Bell I've been to in 20 years. Keep it up guys

I'm a bad Mexican for eating here, I know.

But hear me out: I was drunk, needed greasy food, and going to high school in Cali conditioned me to want this in such moments.

I always try to give Taco Bell another chance and be like "hey maybe it won't be bad this time" yet every time I go there I'm reminded of how absolute trash it is. The food is never as promised with low quality ingredients and bad taste. I wouldn't pay for it I wouldn't take it for free Taco Bell is a s***t establishment please don't eat here. Go to Wendy's or Popeyes or Chick-fil-A but please don't waste you money here for god sake. I want you to take you hard earned money elsewhere. Please I'm begging you don't go to Taco Bell it's easily the worst restaurant I've ever eaten at. THE MEAT IS SO FAKE THE CHEESE IS SO FAKE I HAVE NO IDEA WHERE THEY GET THESE GOD FORSAKEN VEGETABLES IT'S SO AWFUL. PLEASE GO SOMEWHERE ELSE ANYWHERE ELSE. i care about you and your money. Please.

I never leave bad reviews anywhere. But I have worked in fast food before and understand what fast food workers go through, and I always go out if my way to be very polite, and yet still the woman taking my order was very impatient and seemed annoyed that I was ordering food. I ordered 3 grillers and was only given 2, they also messed up the person in front of me's order. Disappointed

The drive thru workers are EXTREMELY rude and disorganized the past three times i've gone something has not gone correctly in the drive thru process. I will not be going to this taco bell literally ever again.

Honestly I never do reviews (shocker) but my order was terribly done. I was missing one of my items, and I work in the service industry and understand things happen, but the food I did receive is very skimpily made. Also I asked specifically for no sour cream and ended up with sour cream in both items. Heavily disappointed.

I've never had issues with this Taco Bell location. They always move quickly and the orders are always accurate. The quality is consistent with Taco Bell. This location usually has the proper amount of toppings and the food tastes freshly made. 

I usually hit this spot if I'm having a late night craving and have never been disappointed. Sometimes you just have to indulge in a guilty pleasure like Taco Bell!

I would give no stars if I could this is the closest Taco Bell to my house when the family decides to have it we come here it is by no means fast food we have never been lucky enough to have our food in less then 1 hour it's  unbelievable the food is great never had an issue with it just how long it takes I would be better off taking them to a restaurant and sitting down for a meal it would be faster

Piece of advice, don't waist your or money at this location.  Food is half done and the service is really slow - 28 minutes from order to receiving food.  We ate and was on the way out of the restaurant when the guys behind us had finally got their food - 6 regular tacos smh

Literally witnessed the manager mistreat a special needs person who soiled themselves for not stocking paper in the bathroom and telling the caretaker he did (lied), also told another lady to take her business elsewhere. I offered to treat all guests In the restaurant to dinner next door at Hardee's. In his defense, the comp were down and he couldn't use a calculator, poor guy.

Me and my girl got the Munchies after work and taco bell did the job



5 stars for quick munchies
Poorly ran average of 20 minute wait in the lobby or the drive-through. They cannot figure out how to get food out to customers & when they do the order is not correct.

When I'm in the mood for authentic Mexican food, where do I head?  Taco Bell of course!  Nothing says "El sabor de Mexico" more than America's hometown favorite.

The food is always hot and tasty. Their prices are competitive.  The service is quick and usually pretty friendly.

The only negative is their lot is pretty small and it's especially tight in the drive thru lane. So, if you are driving a land yacht, you might have some trouble navigating around the building.
Drive thru order. Quick and easy. Cashier was on point. Wasn't constantly asking if I wanted anything else. In and out in 43 seconds.
FYI if your a vegetarian they now deep fry chips and hash browns in the same oil as the chicken. Major epic fail for Taco Bell.
Almost every time I go here something is messed up. It is pretty annoying when the recipe says the right thing but getting the wrong order is pretty ridiculous

This place is a joke. I'd usually not review a fast food chain restaurant but this was too terrible to not warn others. Believe the other one star reviews and proceed at your own risk because you absolutely will wait for your "fast food" (lol) for far too long (about 30 minutes this time) and it'll inexplicably still be cold and probably not correct either. This location is a bummer for sure.

The staff has been really good times I've been here, food has been fresh and good. 

The only thing I find uneasy about this Taco Bell is the drive through, (find myself extra cautious making the turns through it; tight fit).

I really like going here. The workers are quick and efficient and able to handle everyone's needs. I've never had to wait more than ten minutes at any one place or time. The workers are friendly, and they know what they are doing. I liked the decor as well. Very well done.

Kind of hard to screw up American-Mexican cuisine so I give it a thumbs up. It's never failed as an option of late night hunger. Apple empanadas has always been my favorite. I microwave them when I get home and atop them with vanilla bean ice cream. Absolute perfection with help from my freezer.

Over a 20 minute wait time in drive thru with no explanation. Apparently they closed over an hour early while employees were coming in and out taking smoke breaks. I will not be back and I suggest you don't visit either. Maybe when they replace their management.

Idk what happened to this place, but I spoke too soon I guess on the perfection of this store/location .... I knew it was too good to be true that a Taco Bell was doing it right finally! They've switched up the employees the last few months which you can tell has hurt the line in the back as well as the quality of service. They last 4 times I've gotten the chips with cheese, they've forgotten the chips. 3/4 times I double checked and of course the chips weren't in there. Simple things such as a straw with the drink has been forgotten. They've been adding onions to my burritos which is a serious matter for me since I'm slightly allergic to onion........ Sad day for this location that I won't return as often. Those little things do but don't matter at the same time. Mainly the food allergy issue. It's super important to make sure, even in fast food, that you read carefully what an order is requesting. Or even for dietary needs. I would give it 2 stars for the onion issue mainly due to my allergy, but that's not something they are responsible for, and normally I do enjoy this location. I understand I choose to risk eating somewhere other than my home, just something to think about.

As far as Taco Bells go, this one is pretty nice. We were greeted right away and got our food within just a couple minutes of ordering. And it was nice and hot! Restaurant was clean and we experienced zero issues (which isn't always the case with tbell). Will be back!

I've been to this Taco Bell location twice now.
So far I've encountered nice staff and received my order in a decent amount of time and accurately.

Went in there last night and the new black employee had a fight with three other black guys over sour cream on a taco. Screaming yelling throwing punches over the counter, I don't know how it ended because I left. #Ruined

I go here because it's the closest one to my home. Tomatoes and sour cream left out of my Taco supreme 10:30 pm and the only person in the drive thru so there should be NO excuse to rush or mess up orders. On top of screwing up a taco supreme they also managed to mess up the nacho cheese chalupa by forgetting the nacho cheese. It's always something every time I come here. Get it together and hire staff that isn't stoned out of their minds.

I was visiting Florida with my family when I came across this Taco Bell in Kissimmee. While the vibe of the place was good we were disappointed by the overall experience. Our order for four Bean Rice and Cheese burrito got delayed because another customer was unhappy with their order. Once we got our burritos we all felt like it wasn't the usual taste. Then we started coming across bunches of uncooked rice which were so hard that they were difficult to chew. Very unhappy and disappointed with the whole experience. If a fast food place can't cook properly something as basic as rice then they have no right to be in food business. Please avoid this place!
Employees attitudes are the worst because they messed up my order. Got my money back and drove across town to another one.

Went there tonight and picked up half Taco Bell and half Pizza Hut food. The Taco Bell stuff was very hot, fresh and really good. Only took 2 minutes to go through the drive thru.
The Pizza Hut breadsticks were decent too and the sauce was really hot which was great. The pizza though had to have been made at least an hour prior to my visit and was maybe one of the worst pizzas I've tasted. I took 3 bites and threw out the rest. Don't order the pizza!

Yes one star.  Taco Bell serves one stinking purpose on this planet of ours.  Is it to serve quality quasi-Mexican food?  No.  Is it to dazzle me with fast service?  No.  Is it to dazzle me with friendly service?  No.  I don't care if they use robots.  The ONE THING, your one reason to exist, Taco Bell, is to feed my fat, hungry face after midnight.  I pull through the drive thru tonight around 12:30 and they are freaking closed.  What added insult to injury is that all the parking lot lights were still on, giving me the impression that I was going to get my grease and sodium fix. Why did I ever even think to forsake you, White Castle?

Just left after being their first customer and the young man that helped me was unbelievably courteous. He advised me of my wait and offered me a drink and even insisted when I refused! Then, he mentioned he threw in an empanada in my bag just for the trouble. Unbelievable customer service, that guy deserves a raise or at least a promotion! Completely satisfying experience!

Took over 40 minutes for an order, then it was not prepared correctly. It took 2 minutes to get another one made correctly. Got an apology for the wait, but no retribution prize.(free empanada for my trouble??) Seriously, people; train your hirees. They're nice, but need more help and training. There are a few workers working hard, and others who look like they don't know what to do at all. I really like Taco Bell; too bad the managers are sending it down the tube.

My husband stops here after work to pick up food for 3 people. $50 later, those starving people look into the bags and realize that things are missing from the order or are totally wrong. So he jumps back into the car after a 14 hr day of work, and all they do is give him the missing food and a free soda.

We won't ever go here again. How the F do you mess up a $50 order? I mean come on. It blows my mind. It is also gross to spend $50 at Taco Bell none the less!
Newly remodeled location,  clean and fast.  The driveway and intersection here is a pain though

Ok I think I am done with Taco Bell.  Their customer service is absolutely horrible. What these people need to understand is that there is absolutely nothing convenient about their service.  I would almost be willing to pay a little more to get a better customer experience, but their service is so absolutely fucking atrocious, that it behooves me why I keep going back.  I love the taste of their food, but the fact that I cannot even feel secure in the fact that when I have to walk in EVERY fucking time and tell them that they did not get the order right, something is seriously wrong.  
      So I go through the drive-thru to order 2 bean and cheese burritos, 1 mexican pizza without tomatoes, and 2 volcano burrito's with extra meat and 10 fire sauces.  I had repeat myself to the lady taking the order literally 3 times to make sure that they got it correct.  Well the way Taco Bell Drive through works is that they do not give you the actual receipt till they give you the food and it is included into the bag.  I never quite understood that as its not like they are not supplied with computers to help them facilitate the oder.  But for some reason the receipt was never given until the food is given to the customer.  That being said, I paid for the food and of course did not get 10 ft before I found out that they did it again!!!  They put tomatoes on the Mexican Pizza.  On top of that they only gave me 1 bean and cheese burrito, but then again they only charged me for 1 bean and cheese burrito.  So I go into the store and walk up to the counter with the issue.  There was this very heavy set woman going behind the counter when I asked her if she was the one that I spoke to over the comm.  Her reply was, "Do I look like I am wearing a headset?"  I said, "Fair enough" and I asked for the person I was speaking to at.  She came out, and she really didn't say much as I was pretty heated at the time.   The cashier came out, looked onto the receipt and advised me that I never placed the 2nd burrito order.  Also that their sauce on the Mexican pizza comes with tomatoes into the sauce, which BTW when we ordered it without tomatoes, and the fucking sauce did not come with it in it.  Either way he took the pizza back and made another one without any sauce at all.  I mean no sauce!!  Then they gave me an extra bean and cheese burrito and did not charge me for it which was fine, but the fact that they got the order wrong every time is just absolutely baffling.  I mean even based on statistics, they would have had to get it right once maybe every 10 times or so.  That is just not the case.   On top of that they took the receipt from me so I had a serious time just complaining about it.
     So my wife calls when I get back as I was so pissed off about it, that it was best that she call.  She gets the manager who states that there was no person that came in to complain today to them about this.  It's not like I did not even exist and was refusing to give the number of his supervisor, but at the end of the call we were able to obtain it.  My wife spoke to Eddie who was the supervisor over the store and explained the circumstance, which in the end he just wanted to provide us with free food.  When we complain about something, we do not ask for free food based on the fact that it feels that we get something for nothing.  So she politely declined and explained that when we complain about service, it is not about free food, it is about the customer experience that went so horribly awry, that we felt that we had no other option but to complain to someone about this experience that can do something to change this.  But to be honest, I do not feel that anything in the end will ever change with Taco Bell.  I know it is Mexican food, but the fact that they cannot get one person that can understand or comprehend mathematics or english for that matter is amazing to me.  I apologize that I force them to pull out the ESL (English as a second language) courses, but what is the point when they work in a predominantly English speaking country and cannot comprehend the use of the numeric system in English or what you are actually saying except for key words.  It creates a language barrier as well as a poor customer experience overall.  I hate even bringing up the language barrier, but if there is one in a country where people are supposed to understand English, than why is this happening?
     I am so fucking done with Taco Bell in Texas.  I love the taste of the food but the serious lack of customer service as well as the lack of consistency from store to store is just horrific.

It was so nice having a Taco Bell just down the street... and it was awesome the first week, but ever since it's been a huge disappointment.  They always forget items and the food is always sloppy with bare minimum of ingredients.  We now drive an extra 15 minutes to Sunbury Road just to get decent Taco Bell.

I went in there looking to get a GOOD QUALITY CHICKEN QUESADILLA but did I get one?... NO.! All I got was an uncooked chicken quesadilla with NO HOT SAUCE I also did not get good customer service I can't believe I got treated like this therefore please do not go here ever again thank u for ur time

We walked in and immediately wanted to walk out. Floor was sticky, dining area looked messy. We waited to get our order taken for about 10 minutes and no one came to serve. We decided to then proceed to the drive thru to see if we could expedite our order that way. When we finally got our food, the taco shells were stale tasting. I got a rice bowl and a burrito as well and the rice wasn't fully cooked. I'm talking barely even boiled, right out of the box. I'm talking crunchier and harder than a pile of rocks and I've had my fair share of rocks. The bowl was also soupy so I guess that was their soup special of the day. I need to see a dentist after biting into the food. I might also need some serious vaccinations in attempt to get cured from whatever diseases I picked up. As I am typing this, I'm slowly feeling symptoms. Web MD says I'm either pregnant, HIV positive, have herpes, or diarrhea. Diarrhea is for certain.

I am currently sitting in drive through at this Taco Bell at 10:50 in the am on a Friday. I've been waiting here in line for 27 minutes. Stuck. I can't get out or I would leave and never come back. This is NEVER acceptable for any reason. What a joke. I could have eaten at a sit down restaurant with good food faster than this. I won't be back. Avoid this place like the plague.

Worst Taco Bell/ KFC EVER!!!!!  Was there last night and they ran out of plasticware..Really?????  What are people supposed to eat their mashed potatoes with?????  I told myself last time I was there (couple months ago) would be the last time.  I was desperate last night.  *sigh* When will I ever learn :(

This is fast food I don't expect greatness but I do expect my order. If you have children check your orders. Over the last couple of years I have gone here off and on, the kids really love it. Unfortunately the food is different every visit. Sometimes it's gross and runny and unrecognizable and sometimes it's fine. I can't prove it was taco bell but sometimes i get a little sick after eating here.  Sometimes a Mexican pizza looks like some one relieved themselves on  a tostada shell and sometimes it looks like a Mexican pizza. The quality of the food is hit or miss without a doubt. How you can screw up beans from a can is beyond me.

I pay extra every time for sour cream, but you could flip a coin on whether or not I'm going to get it. I don't like getting ripped off but when you short me on orders for the kids and now I've got upset kids because someone is missing a couple of tacos, then ripping me off becomes a big problem. Will I still go? Yes, begrudgingly but I will check each and every item, and I will go in...no more drive through because you guys have consistently proven you can't be trusted. 

I've lived for quite a while with taco bells close to my places more than once and I have to say this is the worst taco bell ever. Avoid it and steer the kids elsewhere if you can help it or be diligent and check every thing in your order. If it looks like diarrhea chances are that's how its coming out too.
A Typical Taco Bell, but this location has never given me a problem nor has it ever gotten my order wrong, watch the crub in the drive thru.!

Best customer service ever thanks to a young
 lady named Tia. She gave exceptionally outstanding service! We felt as if we were in a sit down restaurant and I appreciate her for all her help, asking if we were okay. She even brought our food to the table! Thanks Tia keep up the great work!! :-)

It never fails every time I come to this location the drive thru takes FOREVER I've literally been waiting 30 mins in line with 3 cars in front of me! Never fails they always take forever!!! Save yourself some time don't come to this location just drive on down to William Cannon & Brodie or South Park Meadows!

I should start out by saying that this local Taco Bell really messed up for a while and started moving people through the drive thru very quickly.  It nearly took me two months to learn how to read through my manual on how to tune up single-engine planes while sitting in their drive thru waiting for dinner.  I mean seriously now, how can you expect to get ANY reading done in five minutes?

I'm glad to say that times have changed again and they've substantially reduced the number of staff in their stores so that the lines are back to twenty or thirty minutes.  Just this last week I learned basic Polish grammar AND how to crochet, all while waiting for a taco.

Better yet, sometimes they get the order wrong so you get TWO trips through the drive thru, although there was one time where I just gave up and ate  it anyway.

First time at a taco bell. Got the chicken taco and a frozen baja blast. The taco was good besides the fact that it was very difficult to get the toppings in the same bite as the chicken! The baja blast was too syrupy at the beginning, but good by the end. Kinda made my stomach hurt, but not sure why. Service was pretty decent.

I can say that this place is consistent, the staff have always been super friendly and the food comes out in a reasonable amount of time.  We use to go here as our after church lunch stop on the way home because it was on the way along Slaughter and the entire family could go in and eat what they like for well under the $20 price point. The best part was that we didn't have to worry about cleaning or washing dishes after. We would get home and it would be nap time.   Unfortunately, we found out just how unhealthy chicken burritos from Taco Bell were and we have now taken it off the regular foods list... Oh well, ignorance was an ok bliss.

Place sucks 

Always a long line in drive thru. Probably because they're constantly fixing orders. Haven't has one correct order in 5 or 6 visits. Hoping one day you'll get it figured out.

Doesn't clean prep areas. Obvious because my last order contained zero lettuce. But lettuce was found in EVERY item. 

And seriously quit serving burnt to a crisp items....
Cheap and fast food  simple as that if your going here expecting a 5 star dining experience I don't know what to say to you

Ok lets get one thing straight, I LOVE Taco Bell in the US, its probably my favourite fast food joint (along with Jack in the box). 

However TB in Canada  is a different story. Why does my crunch wrap supereme taste like a donair? why is there so little filling, but so much bread. Why does the tortilla taste like lavaash instead of tortilla? Why do they not carry "FIRE" sauce, the only have "HOT"... unacceptable. 

Tried this location twice, this is not Taco Bell, some weird canadian version of it.

don't expect to be able to get pizza here even though it's called taco bell/PIZZA HUT. the last 4 times i've been here, they "ran out" of pizza. on top of that, if they do have pizza, it's only sold until midnight. so annoyed won't be coming back

Went through the drive thru and placed our order. They order was missing an item, so we had to go inside. Once inside the employees were pointing fingers at each other and trying to pass the blame. 

After we got the order resolved, we heard a female yelling at someone. Thought it was a mad customer but instead, it was a disgruntled employee. She was complaining about her schedule. She was swearing and obviously didn't care if everyone heard. Very unprofessional and if she were my employee, would have been fired on the spot.

I started eating this stuff when the Taco Bell in Grandview was Zantigos(sp?).  Back then then called chili-cheese burritos "chilito.  I loved these things, but any more they seem to forget to put the cheese in the chili-CHEESE burrito.  Seems like every time they put something on the menu I like, it's gone in a few weeks....like the Volcano nachos.
Oh well, pretty much all fast food sucks these days.  And these people want $15/hour.  Yeah.  Right.
Love this Taco Bell, literally the only one I'll go to now in Orlando, great staff always

Grabbing a quick bite to eat...wrong. Long wait, orders incorrect this was all on the inside. The drive thru line was horrendously Long as well. This is the kind of service we all like to avoid...this was supposed to be fast food.....I got fooled. Then I made the mistake of ordering a dessert while I waited for my original meal. That was my fault...a longer wait after that....lol

I used to work at a Taco Bell so i get how difficult it is. EVERYONE should have to work fast food.  That said, Waiting 15 min for 2 taco supremes is a bit much. The 2 guys working the line did not know what they were doing at all.  Slow, wasteful of the products and could not track the orders.  When I finally asked when I would get mine, the guy told me I was 2nd in line now.  Every order they made before me was WRONG so those people kept coming back up to get them fixed. One came up 2x!!!.  So, when I politely asked about mine, the guy said he was the only one back there.  Unless I have double vision, he was not the only one.  His smart ass answer made me think I didn't want the food he would make me so I was going to ask for my money back.  The lady at the counter was useless so I just told her to keep my money.   
Send me a refund for 4.96.......worst run TB ever.

You really can't beat Taco Bell.  Quick, easy and you always know what to expect.  It's not gourmet dining, but it will do the trick in a pinch. 

If you are over 50, ask for the Senior drink.  FREE!!!

I went to the drive-thru an hour and a half before closing time, and they wouldn't serve me because they "already put everything away".  

This was bizarre. I had to drive to another Taco Bell because I'd already told my pregnant GF I was getting her a crunch wrap. Don't go here.

I am not one to usually complain about fast food restaurants because I do get that society typically treats them lower than they deserve. Also I understand that they have a lot going on and some people just suck to deal with. With that in mind, this location has given me multiple incidents or poor behavior. 

This current trip was at 11:45 pm on 9/10/2015. Now, I understand that they close at 12 I get this, but, I work late and do not get off until 11 and this location is close to my house. I pulled up to the drive-thru and am greeted accordingly. As I begin to give my order I can hear a male voice yelling in the background "no, no you can't have it" and laughing every time I asked for something. It was hard to even hear the guy I was speaking with because of this person. 

On top of that, they were out of everything I wanted. Chicken, beef, beans and chulupas, I do get that it was the end of the night, but business's have scheduled hours for a reason and as a food establishment you should be able to provide your "food" inside those hours. 

They were not polite  (I get it last customers before you close) I'm sorry I was hungry I just got off work. I didn't want to but, my stomach overruled my decision to just go home. I finally just told them never mind and left. This is just one of many occasions that they have not got my order correct or they were just completely incompetent.

I find it hilarious when fast food is in a richer area. How are employees of Taco Bell going to be condescending to customers?

Like dude... you work at Taco Bell.
Obviously you made garbage decisions... don't take it out of customers. I don't eat this stuff but witnessed people definitely working at a minimum speed and manners.
Waited 25 minutes here for three items that weren't even hot or fresh when I finally did get them .. if I could give them negative stars I world ! Wont be back to tho location .

BAD BAD BAD BAD. I just got 4 tacos and 2 bean burritos. There was only one tablespoon of meat that would be better described as greasy dog food. Hardly any lettuce and almost no cheese. This was not an accident because all four tacos were the same. Also the burritos were just as devoid of substance. I've eaten at taco bells for decades but with the prices being higher than ever and the portions insulting I am done. I spent almost eight dollars and honestly wouldn't of paid half of that. I don't care if this happened because of an angry employee or uncaring shift supervisor or a greedy owner, this has forever ended my ever going back to ANY Taco Bell. I would rather go hungry.

If I could give a negative star I would. Had to repeat order twice. Was not given cinnamon twists I paid for. Taco salad was ordered with extra sour cream. I received no sour cream and no salsa, but did receive a cup of BBQ sauce. I had to take the chicken burritos back because the rice was so burnt and crunchy it wasn't edible. 

Hey at least the place was clean!

I called to make sure they would be open if I drove 15 min out of my way. They did they were open till 1 am. It's 12:45. I'm sitting at their drive through. No one... What was the point of answering my call and lying to me?
I've never been to a fast food place that has superb customer service as this place. Taco Bell is taco bell. Can't expect the food to be 5 stars fresh food. But the service is awesome!

This place is ridiculous. Waited 10 minutes in the drive-through not receiving a greeting other than "hold on a minute, sir". We had 3 different people say that. One person even shouted a long winded "YESSSSS?" so we asked if they were ready to take the order and he said "hold on a minute!" Definitely will not be returning here. And they wonder why people don't think they  deserve $15/hr.

There was a long drive up line when we arrived, in fact we couldn't even get in if we tried, so we decided to order in for our take out. They were not remotely busy inside, yet 10 minutes passed, into 15, 20, and we started asking where was our food. They said they were short-handed. Yet car after car after car left the drive through. At that point the manager locked the front door. So 20 minutes became 25, 30 and finally THIRTY-FIVE minutes later we got our order.
