We could have gone to a real Mexican restaurant and got food faster. So before we left I suggested the manager give us some cinnamon twists or something. Oh no, they can't do that, but we can give you some coupons. The next day I looked at the coupons and they were EXPIRED!! Really? Your customer service is that bad and that is how you compensate customers who were patiently waiting for their food. It's just appalling! I just think it is poor practice to let drive thru take all priority while dine in orders lag, for 35 minutes. It is just not right and totally unfair.

Let me begin by saying I give it a 2 star because I like Taco Bell food and I know other locations do their job right. This particular one is just terrible but mostly just at night. The cashiers are really rude. When you get to the speaker you can totally hear them having another conversation while you're ordering which results in having to repeat your order because they're not paying attention. I've even had them shove the food in my face, as in they reached in my car window and put the good in my face. I'm not even exaggerating. To top it off the last two times I went through the drive thru it took almost 30 mins to get my food, and not just me but everyone else in line, and the way the drive thru is built you have to go through the drive thru window in order to get out so I couldn't leave the line. And no I'm not lazy I don't have a problem going in except the inside was closed. I also understand some things take time but nobody wants cold food and that's what you get after a long wait in the line. After today I will no longer be going to that Taco Bell, but I'm still a Taco Bell fan so I will take my business somewhere else. Please take my advice and the other unsatisfied customers and avoid this location.
Not open at 7am like the hours say. I got there at 7:10 this morning and the place was closed up.

Taco Bell = hell 

Yes it's cheap but in my gordita came out a nice long black hair. I went back to the counter and the worker said are you sure you didn't put it there...y response was "honey, I have blonde hair..." never again will I go there again! They looked at me like I put on a wig or something! Change the parking lot and speed bumps while you're at it!
If you are into extremely long waits, rude staff, and consistently being let down by your already low standards, this is the spot for you!!
Although the faces here change. The quality of their food never changes. It's the best Taco Bell in Portland.
Quick service, tacos pretty well stuffed and presentation on fleek. Everything was super hot too so that was nice. Tacos are life.
You did it again Armando ! Thanks to you and your special crew. We look forward to dining in soon.  Chuck and Patricia
Good Location but thank god Richard works there. I've been coming here for over a year but only like when he's working. Such a hardworking sweetheart. The rest of the staff needs to step up.

Seriously, Saturday morning and you are out of eggs? You can't plan for that? Drive through is always slow. Excited when they went in but disappointed each time. Seem to be without management/supervision. No organization. Always end up driving to Hamilton Road location where the people know what they are doing.

I get it. It's Taco Bell. Low expectations. I was trying to grab a quick bite something for my daughter's lunch to take to school. This place is totally mismanaged and slow. We missed our lunch. Service horrible. I've learned my lesson once and for all: with all of these awesome places to eat tacos in Austin it's time once and for all for Taco Bell to go extinct.
Best Taco Bell I've had in a long time. I ordered the #6 which is 2 chalupas, a crunchy taco & everything tasted so fresh even the chalupa shells which most time are mediocre at best.

Terrible food quality. I went through the drive through and got a smothered burrito, fiery Dorito taco supreme and a side of rice and beans. The beans were obviously leftover from an old and overlooked batch of beans. The rice was dried out and old, too. The taco was soggy, barely anything in it and definitely no sour cream. The smothered burrito was dry and cold. The cheese looked like it had never melted to begin with. 

Taco Bell is never a top tier dining experience, but usually you can count on some tasty junk food. I couldn't even eat the food I got. 

Go to another location or go to Tijuana Flats around the corner.

I went to this location not too long ago, the service was great and the employees were very friendly. I ordered one of the burritos off of their dollar menu. Little did I know what was about to happen. Within the next 24 hours I had noticed my stomach starting to ache. Then, it hit me a force unlike anything I've ever felt before. It was my burrito but it wasn't in the same enjoyably satisfying form as when I first had it oh no, quite the opposite. It was like fire and the beans fueled the flames of fury. I tried to run to the bathroom but it was already coming out like lava and I knew there was no end to this misery in sight.

They really take the fast out of fast food. They are slooooow.... And more concerned about the conversations they are having about their new apartments, and weekend plans, than they are about doing their jobs.

Worst service ever was waiting for more than 30 min.Once i finally got my food it looked like shit like a 3 year old  preparing it, i asked for my money back i wasnt going to eat the food it was all messy inside the bag alot of ppl were leaving because they were taking so damn long dont come here they cant run a business that slow.

Waited 20 minutes for my order as walkin.

When received, there was no apology for the wait, I was told my order had been bumped.

Manager was present, and said nothing.

I refused order, requested refund, and wrote this review.

Do not allow your hunger to make you accept subpar service, there are other places to eat!

This location used to be good when it was managed by someone else. Now the only people that work there are drugged up and don't know proportion sizes or how to wash their hands. Definitely do not recommend coming here if you actually want what you ordered in under 20 minutes. It's always freezing and messy in the lobby. Never been to a worse Taco Bell in my entire life and I've been to a lot of Taco Bell's. Also the employees treat you like it's an inconvenience to help you.

Most disappointing Taco Bell EVER! Walked in at 8 pm and was promptly informed that the location was "out of food." What does that even mean? They said that the morning shift did not prep for them, but this is FAST food for a reason. Shouldn't it be fast to prepare?
Hey taco bell...you make my stomach hurt and I think your food is made with horse. But still...soft tacos will always help a hangover. You have a good drink selection I guess.

So we had gone into a different taco bell and the food was horrible, and the staff were rude. After speaking to the manager he gave us some coupons to so that we could have our meal replaced for free. Upon entering this store tonight the guy running the cash register (who could barley speak English) tell me that i can only use one and only if i bought something else along with it. I explained the situation and he still refused. To which i asked him to show me where on the coupon it said that a purchase was required to redeem the coupon? He wouldn't even look at it (BECAUSE HE WAS WRONG AND HE KNEW IT!) and told me that i could only use one at a time and, again that was only if i bought something. 

Upon calling the store back the manager who happened to be the same person who told me i could not use the coupons again tells me (very rudely) that i could only use one coupon at a time, only one per person. Let me ask you a question? How many people have kids? How many of you don't go like to go through a drive through because when you do they mess the order up and maybe you have a food allergy to onions, or maybe your kids do? How do you know that i don't have a wife and four kids outside in my car? 

Needless to say i will be calling corporate to file a complaint and we will NEVER be returning to this location despite the fact that we live less then two miles from it and we have spent countless dollars eating here.

Literally the worst Taco Bell I've ever encountered. I was a tried and true Taco Bell lover in college, and since becoming pregnant have been CRAVING a crunch wrap. 

All the ingredients were in a small clump on ONE SIDE so my pregnancy dreams of the "meat" covered in "cheese" were dashed as I bit into a taco she'll wrapped in a tortilla. What. The. Hell. 

I will NEVER EVER EVER go here again. Complete waste of time. I'm actually going to call Taco Bell corporate and ask for an investigation to the fraud.
Clean. Short wait time. The older woman that took or order was very nice and friendly. Good came out exactly as we ordered. No complaints here!

I just had an excellent experience at this location. It was clean and well stocked but the best part was the woman running the register. Her name is Donna and she greeted every customer brightly, made sure everyone got their orders and anything else they may need, and had a generally pleasant and welcoming demeanor. She alone would make me return to this particular store.

This taco bell used to be great with friendly staff now it's just a bunch of rude punk kids who always get your order wrong. As convenient as the location is I'll never go to this one again. If you're going to hire teenagers at least make sure they don't act like pre schoolers...

Taco Bell food is the same everywhere; so you always know what you're getting.  ...or do you?  At least not at the drive-through window at this location!   Several times my drive through order was incorrect.   It wasn't like we got someone else's order.   No - they generally got it close but not entirely correct.    Usually a missing or wrong item; but, hey, we once got a bonus burrito. 

I don't know why I keep going back there.  I guess I'm an optimist.  ...or a gambler

Little worried our food would be bad since it was right before close but our food was fantastic and exactly what we ordered for a large meal they even threw in some cinnamon twists great service #comingback

This is perhaps the slowest Taco Bell I have ever been to.  Pray that they can handle any deviation from the normal menu. Its pretty clean inside, though. 

It's really hard to turn West on Broad Street. From the store. Be careful.

I am speechless.  I tell myself every time that it's a mistake and once again I sit in a drive through line longer than a line waiting for a home loan!  It has been this way for years.  I don't know what's worse, the fact I make this decision every time or that this Taco Bell can't get their act together.  Worst fast food place ever!

I typically love Taco Bell but on more then one occasion this location drags their feet with service. Unfortunately, I spent 15 mins in the drive thru line before getting my food and the attendant did not apologize for the wait. I have tried this location on three different occasions with same outcome. I will not be returning
I live locally and there is an older T Bell down the road we prefer. This place, no matter time of day, can handle more than 2cars. Always a buzz but not hometown proud.

I'm a pretty easy going person. I understand human beings make mistakes but this is the WORST Taco Bell I've ever been too. I've been here 4 times and every time, the orders have been wrong, they have forgotten things and this time my food wasn't even cooked all the way through. I went back through the drive through to get this corrected and I was argued with. That 'it's not possibly to not be cooked right' but I pulled out the food and it was cold, cheese still raw, not even melted. 

I'm disgusted with this place. It's one thing to get my food wrong but to tell me I'm wrong after I showed you the food wasn't even cooked, not right. I didn't appreciate the sass I received.

There's a look. It's a facial expression. It's mild dread. It's German Village Taco Bell Employee Face.

When a worker (who obviously doesn't want to be there but has checked Instagram 16 times since you made your order) hands you your food from the drive-thru perch, his or her confusion says, "I'm sorry. Maybe?" with a nervous energy that is almost palpable. No words are exchanged.

If you get everything you ordered, it's a success. That look - the confused gaze they give you - seems like they just reached into a trough (see "NOTE" at end of review) of Taco Bell food slop and threw random items into a brown paper bag and have their fingers crossed behind their back just hoping against all hope that some of the things they grabbed are things you ordered.  

There is a mathematical formula when it comes to waiting in line at this drive-thru. Every car (including your own) represents seven minutes of waiting time and ... I've been waiting to use this line ... it's not exactly ... if you've seen 1980s movies where making out in closets happened at every home in a suburban neighborhood you know what's next ... seven minutes in ... yep ... heaven. 

Let's say you pull up and you're the only car in line. Whatever you order (be it three tacos and nachos or simply a Mountain Dew Pepsi Freeze Cool Breeze Chiller) you're going to wait seven minutes for your order. If you're pulling up and you see three cars in line (this includes the car at the drive-thru window), you're going to be waiting 28 minutes (three cars and your own ... that's four).  

I don't like reviewing fast food places because judging a place that hires high school kids is patently unfair - but the contrast between this Taco Bell and the Wendy's across the street is stark. Wendy's (whose commercials remind you of annoying people who are looking for excuses to double- and triple-text you like we get it you can be funny but relax for five freaking seconds dude) actually does everything right when it comes to German Village fast food options. Service is impeccable, the drive-thru line moves quickly, it's easy to pay for food (read that again and marvel at its noteworthiness) and you always get everything you ordered.

The German Village Taco Bell has to be the most horrendously managed fast food place in the country. I get it. Every community has a "worst" fast food place that people love to rip on, sometimes unfairly. Not this place. All complaints are warranted. I've lived in German Village since the mid-2000s and this place has remained THEEEEEE worst during that entire period. I'm not entirely sure what is going on. Before writing this review, I noticed some people gave this place positive remarks. These individuals must be actual Taco Bell employees or relatives of management. 

You know how you will sometimes go to a place (German Village Chipotle or German Village Taco Bell) and want to WRITE THAT PLACE A LETTER about how awful everything about it is? Obviously, no one ever actually does that but German Village Taco Bell has pushed me closest to the brink. I just cannot - for the life of me - get over how terrible this location remains. How on earth has there never been a reality show made about fixing this place up?? It's THAT bad. The only thing worse is when you got stuck with a partner who didn't use deodorant or tooth paste in sophomore chemistry in high school when you were SO close to being the guy paired with the hottest chick in the class. It's awful. 

Like there should be a show with The Rock (I don't know if he has any fast food experience, I have never read any of his biographies) and The Rock goes into fast food places and gives pep talks and everything turns around and one of the employees turns his or her life around and someone cries at the end during an emotional TESTIMONIAL.

We all remember December 2015 as the month when "BOSS NACHOS" from Taco Bell were all the rage. Will and I used to love going to bars and making an order for "BOSS NACHOS" and just seeing what they served us (I miss the nachos at Eddie George's on campus ... too much sour cream, yes, but the overall presentation and taste hit every spot imaginable).

The Boss Nachos at German Village Taco Bell came in a gigantic garbage-bag looking thing. 

Trash. Yes.

NOTE: I had to look up the spelling of "trough" on Google and the first thing that popped up were urinal troughs. They are like $1,700 for a low-end model. Seems like money not well spent. Surprising.

Lately I have been reading how robots will one day take over some of human jobs. For example, fast food workers will one day be replaced by robots. 
Honestly, was all for this; with the mentality, "at least they'll get my order correct".

Today that feeling changed. For the first time in a LONG time, I had a wonderful experience at a fast food joint. 

I am a pretty picky and particular person. I had an odd request and the lovely cashier Erica (whom never stopped smiling), went out of her way, spoke to the kitchen to make sure they understood my request before placing the order and she was so sweet about it. Mario (kitchen attended, possibly the manager) was very humorous and popped a few jokes while he was asking me to make sure he understood what I wanted. Jose (cook) made my order after Mario explained the order to him. Mario brought me my food, made sure it met my expectations. 

I am a very shy person who is easily misunderstood. This experience was uplifting and put a smile on my face. 

The staff is fantastic and actually care about guest satisfaction.

 The personal interaction was a great feeling and I hope now that robots don't take over jobs like this. I find interacting with others important, especially one as pleasant as this one was.
You can grow old and die in the drive thru.  It is literally the slowest Taco Bell I have ever tried to go to.

Staff and management is very friendly. GM refuses to allow poorly made food go out. I also had a tricky customer service issue that many would have ignored. He took care of it without a second thought.

It is a Taco Bell/KFC hybrid. The service can be lacking and slow but it is a Taco Bell/KFC so the expectations are not really high. Food is as ordered but make sure to check your bag when going through drive thru.

This location has been remodeled, and the current management is great. The inside is well kept, and the staff is really nice and helpful. The food is carefully prepared. The drive thru is always busy, but that is due to the location.

The key to any restaurant is quality and consistency. I ordered the steakhouse burrito with chips and queso. To be to the point, barely any steak in the burrito, like what you see in the pic is it sticking out of the food. All of the ingredients are just wrong for this and it reminds me of just stuffing leftovers from the fridge into a tortilla and giving it a name. Not impressed. The queso was way too spicy and I like spicy foods, cannot see how anyone else with a sensitive palate would like this.  

For $6.29 just go to a taqueria. 

Step it up TB. Seriously.

Taco bell is better than anyone gives them credit for. ..






So I gotta do it I guess
I've been sitting in the drive through forever. The person taking my order was really hard to understand. Mumbling and apathetic toward me as a customer.

Came here for lunch today, and was sorely disappointed with this places service. It should literally take these people SECONDS to make these "tacos" and yet you always seem to wait 10+ minutes every m.single.time..ordered a quesadilla combo with a cheese roll up and a mango tea..simple enough..pull up to the window, get handed a Baja blast MD...I explain that I ordered a mango tea and before I could even finish, some woman sticks her head out and says "just keep it, well make you the tea"..ok...the other woman then hands me my change, my drink, and my food without saying more than three words..I literally had to ask for my total..are you kidding me? It's no wonder this place gets horrible reviews, the people who work here look like they need some anti depressants..very disappointing

I know this is "just" a Taco Bell but I found this particular location somewhat subpar. It took quite a long time to get a crunchy taco and chili cheese burrito to go and several people were waiting for similarly small orders. Perhaps they had just finished up a rush.....?

Taco Bell is one of my favs when it comes to fast food but this location makes it even better. The staff is bubbly and courteous. Every time I have ordered through the drive thru I get what I ordered, which is awesome! Even the details like "extra crispy" or "no tomatoes". 

Keep up the good work guys!
This is the slowest Taco Bell I've ever been to. 20 mins to wait for Taco Bell is too long. They always screw up your order. Do not go here if you are in a hurry.
Every time I visit this taco bell my order is wrong. This last time my food was cold. Also, they don't have verde on the line. I'll never go back.

This is some of the slowest fast food service on the island. The food is OK, I have never gotten sick here.

I drive by without stopping here 90% of the time because I usually can't wait 15-20 minutes for fast food. Checkers and McDonald's are way, way faster. Kitchen staff need replacement for sure, manager likely needs replacing as well.

I think if they had a higher pay rate they might attract less apathetic staff, and would definitely increase revenue.

This used to be a really nice Taco Bell, used to have super friendly staff who were quick and efficient. Nowadays, when I do a mobile order they don't show it on the screen or read it back to me to make sure it's correct, nor do I get a receipt. I have dietary restrictions and when the past few times I've gone they've either put on what I requested to be left off or completely given me something I didn't order-- really makes me question what the staff is doing in the kitchen. 

Last time I went there was no one in line and still switched out my chips with a taco?? Like how is that even close? I'm glad I checked before driving too far since other times I've been screwed over by the time I get home. This time the guy at the window was nice enough to throw in an apple empanada but unfortunately I couldn't eat it.

Long story short: go to the Sunbury Road location and maybe avoid this one on Friday and Saturday after 9 PM. I'll come back to this one again eventually and if there's been changes I'll be happy to update this review.

This is a 3 star review ONLY BECAUSE I LOVE TACO BELL. Unfortunately, this is the slowest location I've ever been to. Generally I'm waiting about 10-20 minutes for food, and most of the time; I am the only person there! What could possibly take them that long to make a burrito, 2 tacos and a churro ?!  

Okay, I'd give the store 4 stars if that was the case, because the food is delicious. But I had to deduct 1 star for the manager. Several times I go there, and I see the manager (a taller brown guy) yelling at his employees really rudely. He one time picked up a bowl and said "which of you idiots left this a your station ?" An employee said "sorry, I forgot.." And the manager interrupted " know your station" and threw the bowl. 

If you are the manager and you are reading this... Your employees don't get paid enough to put up with your asshole attitude, if they do something wrong then you politely remind them. There is never a time when you need to embarrass them in front of co workers and customers. If you don't have the patience to be more professional and have more respect for your hard working employees, resign. If I see this type of behaviour again, I WILL go as far as reporting you to HQ, and with my professional past. (AM for the source, Owner and Operator of a successful business, sales associate AND former McDonalds Worker)  I assure you that  something will be done about it.

Sorry about the rant, just thought I'd stick up for the hard working and (unfortunately) underpaid employees from their bully manager. 

-Adam Gullason 
Owner & Operator, Up 'n' Adam Web Design
God help the people and location.  They need it.  4 people in front of me just walked out.  Don't understand how these people are so slow.

Two staff at 10am we're the most efficient and professional as any high end place. Locale was clean and drive thru flowing flawless. Food consistently prepared on time and value as expected. Favorite locale in Vancouver
This Taco Bell is the slowest place I've ever been. It took 40 minutes to make 3 tacos. If you have 40 minutes, enjoy!

Your standard Taco Bell, although this one did not give me food poisoning. Bonus! This place is good for what it is - Taco Bell. 

Their customer service is quick and efficient (at least at the drive-thru). No complaints!

I love this taco bell! The people who work there are so friendly and accomodating. Certain Taco Bells (I call them the gourmet taco bells) have better tasting food and this is one of them. I always order my food meatless and no dairy so there is a lot of substitutions and they always get my order right! And they never skimp me on the sauce. I wish I could eat it every day. I love you taco bell MLK!
This Taco Bell is by far the best in the nation it's always clean. The food is always fresh and flavorful. My orders are always right. Keep up the excellent work Armando.

I wanted a change-of-pace, so I stopped at Taco Bell for breakfast this morning.  I was surprised by the weight of the bag when they handed it to me.  The Grande Scrambler Combo was a lot of food, priced very reasonably.  I'm not crazy about the Tropicana OJ, but the meal was quite satisfying and the service was immediate with hot/fresh food.  No complaints.  Would recommend.
A low 4.  I never had any issues with location.  Service can be anything from average to very friendly.  I love the 80's music they play in the dining area.
One steak taco, and a old soured medium tea.. almost $5. Just awful.. won't be back to this location.

If I could give this place a negative rating, I would give it a negative 5. 

The order took 20 minutes for our food. When we started eating, we realized we had no napkins, and the napkins were behind the counter.  Took an extra 10 minutes for napkins to be given because the staff does not pay attention to the front counter.  

The same happened to another customer, who waited 15 minutes for his food and another 10 minutes for napkins. 

Their pop machine was out of order in the front, and the pop from the other machine was flat. When trying to ask for a refill, I was ignored by the front counter staff. She looked at me and pointedly ignored the fact that I had been standing there for 10 minutes, my boyfriend got mad so he went up to complain and he got help right away. 

There were 4 people working,  one who seemed to be the manager, and 3 other staff who seemed to be flitting from the front to the back. Bad management and bad service.  Stay at the front to help customers, if you're  supposed to be at the front. 

Do not go here if you can go to another place to eat. The food was OK,  but the service was the worst.  Never coming back.

This particular Taco bell  is VERY VERY late on completing an order!  Also notorious  for WRONG order completions!!!  I will NEVER again frequent this TACO BELL!  Bathrooms are dirty, and the dining area leaves a lot to be desired!!!

First if they were out of nacho fries. Then the credit card machine declined my card twice! So then after being on hold for fifteen minutes with my bank, they tell me my card is fine. It's taco Bell machines. The tables were dirty. I had to ask for a straw, and napkins because they weren't stocked. I don't suggest going here.
It's Monday night at 7:45pm and the doors are locked with customers inside.  What the heck???? I'm so tired of this Taco Bell.  Is it really that difficult to operate?  Get your crap together!!!
Very unskilled management with customer service that doesn't even come with a smile. Really shows lack of customer care and the food doesn't seem to come out to what's it's supposed to be.

I went through this location and they have a new black bean burrito and I asked the guy how it was and he said "personally I think it's nasty" which made me laugh.  Much to his surprise I ordered it and he said good luck with that, lol.  The service was fun and fast and the food was good for Taco Bell.  I actually really liked the Black Bean Burrito and would order it again especially from this location.

Usually you would have to wait for a long time in the drive through even if there are no cars. Today, there was a long line of cars, but I got my food in a minute, thanks to Sebastian's work ethic! He also provided the best customer service. Thank you

Been coming here for years. I see alot of new faces now. Looks liked they cleaned house. Service has gotten much faster. The quality has stepped up alot. Lunch will always be busy though. Theres an extremely nice staff there now only getting better. The night manager very impressive. Puts a smile to my face every time i come in. Hes a comedian which nakes my visit through drive thru and very fun experience. Im very impressed.

Worst Taco Bell ever !!!  Mess your order I'm every time and drive takes forever. Literally 20 mins !!! Can't believe the owners allow this to happen. Then hey give you no apology or anything . Like they do it all the time and it's ok .

I go to Taco Bell way more than I should-- I usually have a pretty good experience. Yesterday was awesome though. My mom mentioned that the last time she visited Taco Bell they didn't give her two drinks that were supposed to come with the meals she ordered. The cashier gave her the extra drinks, no questions asked. I thought that was super nice. 

Another thing I especially liked was for the 7-layer burrito I ordered the tortilla was crispy, like they had toasted it, instead of just warming it up. 

Other than that, it was a typical Taco Bell experience  those two things just stood out to me, so I wanted to shout out the restaurant.

I'm going to go ahead and give this location 5 stars for two reasons: I've been coming here (off and on) since I was in high school (over 10 years) and they've never messed up my order!

TB is TB (not to be mistaken for tuberculosis lol) but you get what you get and when you're under the influence This food is heavenly!!! 

Always hot, always consistent and that's the most important thing to me, CONSISTENCY!!!

At like 2am we're feeling ourselves and come through here to satisfy a craving! The drive thru guy was nice and patient (and we were difficult lol) and even with a car full of people our order was correct!!

Some had nacho bell grandes, others chicken chalupas and Mexican pizzas but everything hit the spot for quick and satisfying! 

If you have a late night craving and you're somewhere nearby then you might have a nice and simple fast food experience too!!! I don't have many pictures because I ate while driving, but this review tells it all!

Happy Yelping...

We live closest to this location but they repeatedly do not give you all of your order and we don't find out until we get home. I called this time because they actually only gave us one of our two nacho bell grandes (how can you miss that?). We even asked "is that it?" and she said "yes" quickly but as to get rid of us asap and move on. Even the nacho dorito taco requested was the fire one instead. Last time.. a burrito supreme.  I spoke to Leslie the manager (we think it was her at the window) and she said she put me down on the list to receive a bell grande and a burrito supreme and something else at no charge for our repeated inconvenience. I then asked her if she'd like my actual 'name' to put on the list so I can actually 'be on it'. Ridiculous.  I'll be going out of my way to Parmer or Lake Creek from now on if I even decide on Taco Bell anymore. Not going to worry about going back to get these things. Fix this about this location please!

The worst Taco Bell I have ever had and that is saying something. Taco Bell isn't known for fine dining but this one takes being sub par to a whole new level. Long waits and some how they make the food here even worse than Taco Bell is known for usually. I drive 5 extra miles to the Hilliard Rome rd one if I am really in the mood for Taco Bell.

What the hell is going on here?!?

They gave me like 6 packs of sauce for the 8 items I bought. I need atleast 3 per item, I'm not on a diet dammit, give me more packs. This is the second time there done this. STINGY!!!

I'll add images, but question, is it me or are they also stingy with the meat?! I had nothing in my crunch wrap or the new grilled stuff nacho. I have proof too!! Images will be posted!!

Ordered and paid online to pick up in drivethru. They even repeated the order back when he picked up the food. Got home to find out food was missing. Seriously??? Whoever manages this Taco Bell should look into WHY this keeps happening. After reading the other reviews It seems this happens way to frequently at this particular location. My tacos were also cold and it's literally a 2 minute drive from the pickup to home.
Slow AF took 30 minutes to get food 2nd person in the drive through line then the guy didn't give us napkins/sauce and didn't even ask if we needed any would most definitely avoid if possible...
This is seriously the slowest Taco Bell we've ever visited. Even when my order was being taken the process was slow. I ordered 6 soft tacos and 6 crunchy tacos. I've been waiting for over 20 minutes.

Fool me once..... so the saying goes. Did I learn from my previous visits?  Noooo
No more - Absolutely no more will I give this place my money!
I ordered a steak flat bread and its chicken.  I ordered a steak Gordita - it has barely half a scoop of meat! 

I use to work for Taco Bell, I know the portions I should be getting.  To say this is to make more profit is an understatement!  R I D I C U L O U S

I'm done - stay away - even for a cheap place, you should be ashamed!
Why would anyone write a review for taco bell? It's about the same as choosing between 7/11's or a red garden hose vs the green one. They are all the same. By the way, this is not food.

We ordered 4 items.  A taco, a bean and cheese only burrito, and a beef and cheese only burito.  Got home with a taco no cheese, bean burrito stuffed with onions, and some concoction that had rice, fritos, and something else that I could not  tell what it was.  I called to request a refund only to be told they could not do refunds, She asked if it was a boy or girl that took our order, I told her we were just there, and it was a female.  She then hung up on me.  I think they must have been closing down and just gave us more than what we asked for.  I know good help is hard to find, but this was ridiculous.

Out of hot sauce, out of ice and warm soft drinks, out of tomatoes. And not told about any of this till picking up order at drive through window. Should have handed it back and got a refund but didn't. Not sure who's managing this place but I wont be back.

This is, without a doubt, the slowest "fast food" restaurant I have ever encountered. Abominable service; horrendous customer relations, and nonexistent management. How this place continues to function as a business is beyond my comprehension...

I will preface this by saying that we know it's a Taco Bell and what that gets you. However, I thought it would get me more than one ounce of nacho cheese in a two-ounce cup. 

When we brought this to the manager's attention (along with the missing chips and taco -- all of which were flattened and stale), they said it was standard to serve the container half full. 

They replaced the missing items but only a after they refused to give a refund as we no longer wanted the subpar food. We will be giving our patronage to Taco Cabana from now on.
Not only is this fantastic place the closest fast food to my house, I don't have to make anything but right turns to get my late night snack on.

Let's get this out of the way.  Taco Bell is the cheapest of the cheap food options in Happy Valley, so my expectations are already pretty low.  Still, it's my go-to fix when I'm craving some of that fast-food flavor we Americans hate to admit that we love.

Here are some of the amazing features you'll find at this particular Taco Bell location.

1) If you eat here, you can claim to be vegetarian.  This is very hip in the Portland Metro area, and the incredibly small amount of meat they put into their food (even by Taco Bell standards) doesn't count enough to qualify you as a carnivore.

2) It's a tremendous time saver.  If you're lucky enough to travel with a barber, you can get a shave and a full-blown haircut while spending 20-30 minutes in the drive-thru line.  Alternative activities include becoming fluent in Polish, or studying to become a nuclear physicist.  

3) You don't have to bother complaining.  The fact that they don't respond to email-based complaints, or essentially ignore concerns raised in the restaurant means that you can get home to shower off all of those loose hair bits instead of waiting at the counter for a manager to show up.

4) It's lower-calorie food as well.  They're usually out of one or two ingredients, so the caloric intake from your meal will be considerably less.  They usually let you know that information after you've paid as well, as opposed to when you're placing your order.  That keeps you from adding additional items that might add to that waistline you've obtained after sitting in your car in the drive-thru line. 

5) It also saves you money.  If they were faster or cleaner, I'd probably eat here more often, which would put a small dent in my pocketbook.  Their abysmal customer service keeps me away until that craving for a taco becomes too strong to ignore, and that feeds the bottom line.

Worst Taco Bell on earth. Staff your restaurant. Poor people are swamped. Owners fault it doesn't run smooth. Clearly a cheap corner cutter, 
No hot sauce.......
Seriously 
Out of hot sauce.......

Don't bother tonight.  I got here at 5:40, and I'm still waiting in the drive they one at 6:05.  The cashier sounds high, and the line is down the street.

This place has GOT to figure out what's wrong with its staffing model.  It'd be faster to drive to the TB I'm Gresham!

Taco perfection
I go out of my way to go to this place, its always superfast
And the order is perfect. I'm still stuck on the Doritos taco 5 box
Its cheap and comes with a drink . O yah and taco bell  has some 
Okay treats . To cap it all off the staff was fff great .
This is my taco bell

When you can get through the drive through in a reasonable amount of time, it's what you would expect from Taco Bell. However, when you sit what seems like forever in the drive through, you end up pulling out of line and spending your money at Wendy's, across the street. Honestly, it's the same 5-9 ingredients in 4-5 different containers. How much time and how hard should it it take/be???
Slowest Taco Bell ever no matter what time of day it is or what day of the week.  And 99 percent of the time your order will be wrong

This is based on 3 visits to this location and every time it's been when they were slow.  1St time food was all old and cold. 2nd time we got the wrong item for him and my burrito was cold and beans tasted burned and dry. Today I went inside and ordered the cantina burrito and she charged me for the bowl which is $2 more  and I didn't feel like waiting for her to go get her manager to fix it-  I wanted the burrito so I could eat it while waiting on the bus. When I got home it was for sure cold, but tasted okay. I feel like 3 Times in a row is enough bad experiences for me and I will not go back. If I want taco bell that bad I will just go to Georgesville rd their manager runs a happier more efficient crew
After awhile I forget why I never come back here until I do. Awful service here. Location good, food good, service very bad.

I've about had it with this location.  They used to be really good.  Polite, the food was made properly, and your order was right.  The last two time, definitely not.  Still polite, but first time they forgot an item.  Today they gave me the wrong order completely.  When I got home and started eating the hard shell taco was broken into several pieces (kind of hard to eat since you know..they're supposed to be intact) and the chalupas were over cooked.  I worked at a Taco Bell when those suckers first came out and I know what they're supposed to look and taste like.  Whether I go back or not is only going to depend on whether I want to take my chances or not.

I love bean and cheese 

And there dollar cravings menu is nice
I love have they always have there own special taco mtn dew flavors Baja blast is awesome















Good Burritos

Clearly, everything at Taco Bell is not 5 stars, but, I really feel like the crunchy ground beef tacos are 5 star, fast food tacos. I always get them Fresco Style so they skip all the dairy & pile them up with lettuce, tomato & onion in sort of a cilantro lime sauce. They're almost always hot, fresh and crispy. For less than $2 each, I 'd say that's worth 5 stars. I am sad that they have discontinued the Verde green salsa but my Fresco tacos come in a similar sauce anyway. I rarely eat fast food but when I do it's often crunchy Fresco tacos or the Doritos crunchy loco tacos. Try them you might be surprised!

So I keep my expectations pretty low when it comes to any Taco Bell in America, mostly because its really hard to mess things up but for some reason the people here have no idea what they're doing. Taco Bell is one of those fast food chains that can make most things with beans instead of beef but somehow the people here always get my order wrong, which is tough because I am vegetarian. Every single order I get I always have to recheck, and then go back in or drive thru again so they can replace it. This is so stupid because I always get my order to go, why should I have to double it all the time? 

Someones being incredibly lazy here. The only reason I didn't give it one star is because they gave me free desserts one night for messing up my order.

If it was possible I'd give this place no stars. Sat here for 20 minutes and my order was STILL WRONG, cold and was missing items. Management does not care and the other workers are always too busy chatting it up Instead of doing their job. I wish this was the first time that my order was messed up unfortunately it's probably about the 10th. Working fast food is not rocket science.

Clean, efficient, and same quality as any other Taco Bell that I have been to. I finally tried the new dorito taco shell. It was ok...light in flavor but fell apart too much compared to the other style shell they have. Convenient location and reliable. I'll be back for a quick cheap meal.

The manager hassled me for a water cup like the couple pennies they lost out on was coming out of her pocket. .. she's a horrible person. That's no way to treat a customer 






I hope it was worth the 1 star review

The food here is always fresh and crisp like I would expect. What stands out the most is the customer service. No matter the time, they're always very friendly and helpful. One night, I realized I was there within 10 minutes of closing and I thanked them for their time, explaining I didn't want to order so close to closing time. They nicely argued with me and insisted I needed my fourth meal. Great customer service!

Boooo.... I have been to this location many times. Some days are good some days that are bad. They totally skimp you on the food inside the tortilla!!! I always order the contract supreme no sour cream. They get the no sour cream part right, but sometimes they get the no meat, no lettuce, cheese, tomatoes. I just wish that they would give you the amount of food that all the other Taco Bell's wood. I don't get skim to any other Taco Bell but this one! 

Dear Taco Bell, 
If you're reading this, PLEASE WORK ON THE AMOUNT OF FOOD YOU ARE GIVING YOUR CUSTOMERS! 

Thank you..
Even by Taco Bell standards they're awful.   Can't even keep the dining room open.   Drive through only today.

The last time I was here, they told me they ran out of straws and my food was cold when I ordered through the drive-through. I was the designated driver this evening and I was trying to grab food for everybody, but 30 minutes before they are supposed to close, everything is shut down including the drive-through. Very poor business....

Update: Tonight, drive through on my way home from second shift. I gave them my card, then same one I always use, and the lady and the window told me my card didn't go through. For $7, that's not possible. She said it was my card and when I asked what the computer said, she said, the host is not responding". I advised her that was a computer/internet connection issues, not a problem with my card. She replied, "i'm sorry, but if you don't have the money, there's nothing I can do.". Wow. That's all. Wow.

Great food. Cheap price. Fast service. Helpful staff. What's not to like? Seriously, this has been one of the best Taco Bells I've been too. It's not packed, and the staff are really friendly. I really appreciate the staff here and the hard work they do.

Yep! Every time I try to give this place another chance it's the same story! Employees laughing and playing around instead of taking your order and if you stay long enough to actually order you'll wait forever for your food!

Very slow service after 5pm. Waiting nearly 20 minutes for my meal. The other times I been there I waited more than 30 minutes and ended up asking for a refund because I had to be somewhere. Management must keep the restaurant staffed on evenings.

My wife loves Taco Bell. She is not a fan of any other fast food, generally the only exception is the Bell.

So, with that being said it is rather embarrassing to admit that we frequent the drive through here, often... 

This is one of the better Taco Bells in the area, that's why I give it 4 stars. Not because it's a 4 star restaurant mind you but, they do what they do well here. We usually change up our order, no tomatoes or guac and being fast food I generally do not have very high expectations. These guys and gals come through with the an unexpected consistency in regards to order accuracy.

Mi quiero Taco Bell!
Pretty lousy management and staff here. Very slow service - expect to be in line for 20+ minutes.

This is the worst Taco Bell I've ever been to. I went here twice and they burnt the tortilla. How do you do that? Unacceptable. I don't know how they stay open. Whatever you do don't come here. If I could give this Taco Bell a 0 star I would. Please upgrade your standards of good service.

This is the most disgusting thing ever!!! My boyfriend wanted their breakfast "taco" that's on a biscuit. I got it and it was completely frozen. I take it inside and there's a line of people returning their cold breakfast. They said it's the bacon that coming out cold... Ummm this disgusting frozen "food" only needs to be microwaved. There's no cooking going on, just microwaving. How do you mess up microwaving this garbage??

It's Taco Bell so you already know to adjust expectations. Is the food prepared reasonably well and served in the proper temperature? If so, they pass. Unfortunately, there have been numerous times when the food has not been heated up properly so loss of marks there. I will say however, that the professional behavior by the staff at this location is really warm and welcoming every-time I have gone inside this location. Truly a pleasant surprise!

Dude. This Taco Bell is the best Taco Bell in the world, including the original Taco Bell which overlooks the Pacific Ocean in Pacifica, CA. It's also better than the Inwood Rd Taco Bell in Dallas, TX, which was my very first Taco Bell experience. The food here is rad, I love the people who take my order in the drive through- they ask gently and never pressure me. They are patient saints. Also, I watched a guy multitasking talking to me about sauce and also taking an order from a yelling guy in the drive through at the same time- that takes skill that I literally do not have. I was amazed. 

They never judge us when we are drunk, they laugh at our jokes, I don't feel bad about ordering a zillion lbs of food. 

My roommates love Taco Bell so much that we have a picture of Taco Bell taped to our fridge. This Taco Bell, the pinnacle of all fast food franchises, has the nicest staff. They should work at the White House or something. They deserve love and flowers and job satisfaction.

I haven't gone to this location in a LONG time because of the service. Recently have moved down South again, and after much consideration I decided to go back......boy was I glad. We normally visit late night and go through the drive thru. I'm very unsure of the man's name, but he was THE BEST Taco Bell employee we have ever encountered. Not so much that he went above and beyond, but he was very friendly and made sure the service was up to par.....even though we went through the drive thru! Once I figure out his name, I will update this review but he was amazing! We have been greeted by him the past 2 times and I hope to see him soon! Please visit this Taco Bell for the amazing service!

Not sure who runs this place ... if anyone. Last time I was here I ordered a combo that includes a large drink.  After I pay the cashier tells me they are out of large cups ... now I either get jipped or ask for a refund at the SLOWEST 'FAST' FOOD JOINT *IN* *THE* *WORLD*
Parking lot is a nightmare and service is slow in the drive through... BUT they always get my order right and it's always fresh compared to other T Bells
Awesome. My go to taco bell. The kfc food tgere is good too. Its a hidden gem. The food is always fresh

I entered the drive through at 6:20pm on the dot. I was about 4 cars back. I did not receive my food in hand until 6:59pm. 39 minutes, I complained about 30 minutes in and got some dessert for free, but that was after I had asked if I could just get the money back on my card since I'd been waiting so long. They also got my order wrong at first. Longest fast food of my life.

Good gods this parking lot situation is a horror. If you're coming from one direction and the drive thru is busy, you can't get in at all. If you go to the other side it's the same issue, it's just less likely for the cars to line up back there. If you park and the drive thru gets busy, since the drive thru goes through the teeny parking lot, you can't leave! It's madness, MADNESS.

That being said, we come here late at night where this isn't too big of an issue, so we've only watched it happen if we pass by during busy hours. Our orders are usually taken very quickly and the staff is quite a but more friendly than most late night places are. So far we haven't had a single order wrong, so this is a huge bonus considering the nightmare of the lot. In all, I'm happy this is close by and will keep coming for late night munchies.

I'm fed up with this location and will not be back. I gave it more than a few chances before i reviewed it. The menu prices are totally different from the price they ring up. They never ask what sauce you like. I went there for the LAST time tonight and they didn't even put napkins in my bag. Management needs to retrain their current staff. Also ordered a chalupa and its super dry.

Got a one only because you can't go on with a ZERO!   This place is getting more sorry by the hour!!  The girl who took my order acted as though she was overly medicated and was wanting to sleep.  She didn't pay attention to what I had ordered and rang it up wrong! The manager came to correct a part of it but didn't pay much attention to how the crew was acting..  Got food home and it was even worse!! The tacos were half ass put together and wrapped OH and let's not forget cold as s@!t.. The chicken looks as though it's been sitting around for not hours but days!! DONT GO HERE!! Hey health department you REALLY NEED to look at this place with a powerful magnifying lens...

Why do I continue to come here?!  They are always short staffed and it takes FOREVER to get food, especially at lunch time. This is when they should have the most amount of staff there! They need to take a look at how Chic-Fil-A manages the high volume during lunchtime, especially when it comes to the drive through. I've even had my food comped because I was waiting so long. If it wasn't for the convenience I would rid myself of this place. Horribly ran by management.

I hate even having to give this place 1 star, yep, that bad. Not only do the employees go out of their way to be as unhelpful and frustrating as possible but when the managers and owners don't seem to care. They don't answer emails about rude and horrible service and don't change anything about how this location is run. I can't believe it's still open at this point.

The last time I was here, they told me they ran out of straws and my food was cold when I ordered through the drive-through. I was the designated driver this evening and I was trying to grab food for everybody, but 30 minutes before they are supposed to close, everything is shut down including the drive-through. Very poor business....
Food was cold, they shorted us food and gave the wrong drinks. Never going back again. There is a carls jr and green burrito right down the street that is MUCH better.

Never know what to expect here, but I can tell you that the majority of the time either the food is created incorrectly or there is a missing product from the order.

I work close and this is my go to spot for food when I am budgeting and because I like Taco Bell.  Today when I went to get lunch, the place was pretty slow, only me and one other in the dining room. I placed my order and they immediately - the woman - who may have actually been wearing a manager shirt - started to make my food.  

Right off I noticed, when she was making the crunch wrap slider, it stuck to the top of the grill causing it to open up and spill out all the contents.  Now Ok, I know this is a $1 item and therefore not much too it, but I then saw her scrape a little back in the tortilla and then put in the bag with my order.

When I got my bag I opened it up and pulled that out straight away, it had like a tablespoon of all the ingredients in it - was mostly a tortilla - I didnt order a tortilla LOL.

So I asked that it be remade how it should have been and wooooaahhhh - thought I cut off her arm or something, she gave me a look of pure hatred.  Look - I paid for it, I want what I paid for.  I watched you do this, scrape it in there and then you expected me to take it home???  No- bad bad customer service.  I understand the bottom line, inventory and such , but that was just ridiculous.

As for the rest of the order, definitely below average for even Taco Bell.  So, this experience prompted to me actually put a review on Yelp.  I have called a few times over the last years to report incorrect or missing product from my order and its just crazy.

I know it can be busy - this time it wasnt - but if you dont like your job - get another job.  When you work in customer service, your job is to have good customer service skills and when you work for a company such as this, your food and you represent it.

I am not sure if its a training issue or just unlucky hiring folks who dont like or care about their job, but I think its time to get this fixed. Dont you?   I know I cannot be the only one who has had issues with this location.  Ive been too other locations who are happy to work there and their product shows it.

The only saving grace in this location is the smiling happy woman who works the counter, an older lady who is a grandma.  I wish I knew her name because she deserves recognition. She is basically the only reason I keep coming back spending my money here.  Thank you!!
Stopped by and it smelled like a dumpster. We turned around and left after seeing how dirty it looked behind the counter. This place needs some serious cleaning!

DO NOT GO HERE

waited at the drive through speaker for 7min and nobody asked me for my order after I repeatedly said Hello. 

Had to place my order at the window instead and the lady was SOOOOO RUDE and had no idea what she was doing.

10min later I got my food and guess what Amy order was wrong!

Never coming back

It is what it is.  It is the same Taco Bell you'll find on any street corner, USA.   If you're in the area, drunk, and the line at Whataburger is atrocious...this place fills a void in your tummy.   

  You will prob not feel too hot the next morning after throwing a #5 on top of 15 beers.   I didn't.

I have never in my life gone to a restaurant were no  one was willing to help customers. This location closed early without anything being posted. There were employees there but they wouldn't help anyone. This is the worst place I have been and they obviously don't care if they are in business. This place is HORRIBLE. Don't waste your time.
My family stopped by and we were given excellent service. I've never been to a Taco Bell with such nice staff. Will continue coming back.

I couldn't find the Johnson creek location but its the worst fucking taco bell in history its so busy and they always have a lot of staff, but they send like 8 people to break at the same time And last time I was there there was only 1 girl preparing food for the drive threw and people in side. I sat there for 30 min for 2 plain tacos and I watched 3 girls standing around doing nothing talking about how they got laid the previous day so unprofessional.

1 star is too many for this location, simple orders are screwed up at least 80% of the time.  You expect some wait in a drive through but it takes at 20 minutes most of the time.  People working in there are always friendly but clearly there are not enough of them working at any given time.  Note to management stop being so cheap and properly staff your store.
WOULDNT LET MY WORST ENEMY COME TO THIS TACO BELL. This location is inaccurate, slow, disgusting, and ALWAYS forgets at least one thing from your order. If you do anything, stay away

Based on other reviews, I must have been lucky. I had a great experience  at this location.

I ordered the Naked Chicken Chalupa, and it looked and tasted just as good as the poster suggested. I recommend the mild since the chicken already has some kick provided by the marinade they use. The wild would probably be ridiculously spicy.

My wife ordered two fresco tacos. At most locations she has to pick bits of cheese out of it. Here I think she only found one piece. A significant improvement compared to other Taco Bells. The only negative was that her taco shells were very fragile. They didn't stay in one piece for long.

I wouldn't hesitate to come back here. One caveat: The drive thru is walled in on both sides, so once you're in there, you're committed for the long haul.
The newest and worse Taco Bell. Order 2 hard tacos and a Mexican pizza and you'll get a burrito,  a soft taco and churros. The employees seriously don't care about you... at all.
Food was terrible and the place smelled like cat pee! I ate outside to get away from the smell but the vent outside made the area reek. I had to leave because that smell was just making me sick.

An Ode to Chicken Grilled Stuffed Burritos.....

Driving to school after an eight hour day,
my tummy growls, The Bell is calling. 
Joy! Rapture! I pass one on my way! 
I place an order and my burrito is grilling.
I drive to class, anticipating that first bite.  
Marinated chicken, rice, and beans,
pepper jack sauce, salsa, and cheese.  
Grilled to perfection, the tortilla is toasty and cooked just right.  
I park my car, restrained no more, I know what goodness means 
Taco Bell, may I have another grilled stuffed burrito please? 


OK...... so not EXACTLY an Ode, but hey what do you expect for fast food?  The drive through staff was not rude, but not friendly.  They were just doing their job. One thing is for sure, with all the Taco Bells I have gone to around town, I have thoroughly enjoyed my Chicken Grilled Stuffed Burrito every single time! How can you go wrong with grilled meat, beans, rice, and cheese? The pepper jack sauce is creamy and adds a nice touch. For me though, it's the fact that the whole thing is grilled that REALLY makes it good. Mmmmmm, toasty tortilla......

I think everyone knows what they're getting into when they get Taco Bell. If you're in the mood for a quick guilty-pleasure, this Taco Bell meets the uniform franchise quality. The service is fast and friendly enough.

I don't know why this location has a few bad reviews, our order is right every time, the drive through is speedy and efficient, and the kids working are courteous and friendly.    One of the nicer Taco Bell's I have been to )
(And it's been a lot lol).
Just had my first breakfast experience at TBell and it was pretty delish!! It helped that after a long night at work the two employees I interacted with were both quite pleasant. Service was great.

I love Taco Bell and my mom just moved to Marietta, so we thought we would go grab some lunch. We ordered ice water to go with our food and the cashier asked if we wanted bottled, and we said no, just a courtesy cup. We paid for our food and when he didn't hand us cups, we waited for the food to ask again. The food came and we asked for cups to which he replies, there is no water on the machine. We asked if he could get us water then and he says they don't have any and that is why he offered bottled. We are dumbfounded. He did not say this was the only option and we say that. We ask to speak to a manager and he says, she will say the same thing. She comes over and we explain to her that when we asked we were not told bottled was the only option. Why didn't he tell us that? She says he was probably too shy and they didn't have water , because Pepsi brought them a new machine without water on it and they would have to charge us for a soda for water. The level of customer service was non existent! A restaurant cannot run without running water btw. The manager btw was a middle aged, heavyset, black female and semi tall if any corporate people don't want one Taco Bell ruining it for the whole company. I will never go back to this location based on the lack of customer service.

I give two stars for the food, the service has gone to crap. The last 6 months has been a steady drop in service and now the wait times are 20 minutes when there is an empty parking lot and 3 cars in front; tired of hearing that 'employees just walked off the job' forgetting that they've been saying that for a couple of months due to the delays.  Management has it all wrong, the people on day shift are as slow as slugs, night shift just is never there.

When will this one go the way of Taco Cabana - bad staff eliminates the customer base. Call it a day and end it.

It's Taco Bell. It really doesn't need a review.

This location does a solid job of not messing up your order. However, that's about all the positives I can add.  This should be a *desperation only* store.  The drive thru line is always packed.  The inside dining room is usually really messy.  I won't call it dirty, because it's usually just cluttered.  I believe it's the customers, not the employees... however, they aren't wowing anyone by fixing it either.

I'm a TB fan. This location is NOT on my approved location list. It also is NOT on my avoid at all costs list.  I really have lists of Taco Bells. Don't hate.

NO BLACK BEANS AFTER 11 PM?

OH, I'm sorry, do vegetarians/vegans all die at 11?  No but seriously, do the beans turn into gremlins after 11?

Okay okay, seriously seriously...  Dumb.

Anyway, this Taco Bell routinely misses at least one item on an order, never has all the sauce selections (usually out of mild), and slaps their stuff together pretty badly.

But hey, considering it and Denny's are the only late night options...it's hard to be picky.

First time and last time. 8 people after me got served before I did. When asked, the meal prep didn't even know about my order. It shouldn't take 30 minutes to get 5 tacos. Management needs some serious changes.
Not open 24/7 like yelp says it is. I don't partake in. Fast food often so this is definitely a bummer
This location is terrible! Every single time I go here, my order is wrong. Whether I go through the drive thru or go inside to order, it is ALWAYS wrong in some way.

Its so bad for you, but it tastes so good! Now that they have the Taco Bell app for mobile and it makes the experience even easier than it was before! Cheap, quick, fast food, taste good not, authentic at all, but I would never give it up its my addiction!

This is the worst Taco Bell ever!!! Every Time I go to this location the drive thru time is ridiculous! Order is never right and I swear everytime I order anything with meat whether it be a taco, chalupa, enchirito, nachos. There is so little meat and so much bean even when I say no bean. I have never had any of these problems at any other location. I think they are rationing the meat and using beans as a filler gross!!
For a taco bell, I'd say this is as good as it gets. It's a clean location, friendly service, and consistently good food.

Taco Bell is still evil.

However, the burritos were slightly larger at this location last week.

The meat of the tacos tastes like there was bug spray it in. I always order from Taco Bell by where I work and I came here for the first time. The meat smelled and tasted like there was bug spray in it I ended up eating half and throwing the rest away. Lady also had my drink wrong I ordered a Diet Pepsi and she gave me sprite. Also no straws or napkins. Horrible service the lady when she gave me my order was rolling her eyes when I told her she gave me the wrong drink. And I went home there was no straw. Never going back to this location again let's see what happens to my stomach after eating half of that taco....

I have never ever had a problem with this taco bell

David who works the front counter is absolutely the greatest guy in the world, honestly he's a friend to me now and that's through his great service!(even if he is a Laker fan!) 

Clean location, not overcrowded, 

only complaint i have is that one of the managers is an absolute jerk

This place consistently screws up my order and is constantly out of ingredients. I have complained on the website a few times and have never been responded to. 2 stars only because the beef XXL stuffed burrito is delicious...when they manage to make it right.

Negative star. This is a combination Taco Bell and KFC. Cashier ignored me for two or three minutes before grudgingly asking 'melp you' while looking beyond me into space. I had to repeat my order three times: six crunchy tacos. She kept thinking I was saying 'six soft tacos'. She really seemed like she was someplace else mentally. They got the tacos made fairly quickly, gave it to me in a 'to go' bag, even though I said it was for 'here'. I sat down to eat. The soul/R&B music was cranked up about 50% louder than it needed to be. There was no condiment stand for hot sauce, etc. That is usually a sign that there's a ghetto nearby because hungry 'po people' often visit fast food restaurants and clean them out of any freely available condiments: hot sauce, ketchup, salt, mustard, honey packets, you-name-it.

So I had to go back to the counter, wait to attract someone's attention because they were all carrying on about something funny in the back kitchen. Finally, a guy saw me and I asked for six mild sauce packets. He came back with a fistful (at least 20) of HOT sauce packets, none of which were mild. OK, so I can eat a taco with no sauce at all, I guess.

I sit down again and open my bag of tacos, and there's only four. I checked my receipt: I paid for six. Again to the counter I went, and this time I didn't bother to politely wait to be noticed. I just loudly called back into the kitchen that I needed two more crispy tacos because they didn't give me enough. A lady came out and I repeated the problem. She nodded in understanding and then waddled back to the kitchen. I told her I was siting near the exit and to bring my tacos out to me. Five minutes later I still don't have my other tacos, so again I go to the counter and another employee is blankly staring into space instead of asking if I need help. I told her I was waiting for two extra tacos and then another lady realized that my tacos were just sitting next to the register. Nobody even thought to bring them out to me. I open up the bag to check and sure enough, another mistake: they were soft tacos, not crispy tacos. I dropped them right back on the counter without a word and went back to eat my last taco. I thought surely some manager would come and ask me what the problem was. Nope. 

By the way, the tacos were terrible. There was only about half the expected amount of meat, lettuce and cheese, and whoever made them slopped meat sauce everywhere on the shells. The shells were cold and somewhat stale. And they wrapped them sloppily so that the contents spilled out.

If these people can't get make a decent taco to company specs, can't get a simple order right, and don't understand the basics of customer service, why in heck are they employed here? I dealt with four different people while trying to get customer service. Not one of them looked me in the eye. This was the worst Taco Bell I've been to in my life. I should have gone to Panera. They don't hire these kinds of people there. I miss the old days when fast food workers were conscientious and tried hard to please.

I gave them one more star. Come on, the lady was trying hard and she doesn't have to take her job seriously, you know. They were also fast, although I did get there early. I tried The Nacho Fries Bell Grande. A taste double dare? I don't think so. I eat out too much. I'll probably end up going for another wack at it, as well as the smaller Nacho Fries. It was good, though. I just keep waiting for the burger places to come up with a hot dog burger or something.
Slowest taco bell & worst service ever. Either the staff are very inexperienced or their staff are super slow. Half of the time my orders are messed up.

I just waited about 15 minutes in the drive-through of this Taco Bell after I ordered... and then when I received my order the girl spilled my drink all over the inside of my car and on top of me and I finally ate my food immediately after I got it while I was driving and it was cold

I'd have to say this was the worst customer service I've ever come upon. Not only were they rude, they were inconsiderate and apathetic about our order. I would never go to this location again or recommend it to anyone.
The absolute worst Taco Bell. Takes 45 minutes to get your order. Staff is rude! Absolutely will never go to this Taco Bell again!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!'nnnnn

The last time I was here, they told me they ran out of straws and my food was cold when I ordered through the drive-through. I was the designated driver this evening and I was trying to grab food for everybody, but 30 minutes before they are supposed to close, everything is shut down including the drive-through. Very poor business....

Today, my Mexican Pizza is two tortillas with refuted beans inside and salad on top. NO cheese, NO tomatoes, NOTHING! See picture.

Update: tonight I ordered a combination meal that should have a Mexican pizza and two tacos, and three additional taco Supremes. But I actually got was a burrito supreme with three tacos and nothing else. It's unfortunate that I'm not more of a careless driver or I would've realized this sooner.

If there were literally anything comparable in the area, this would cease to be my last option.

So here's a neat update; I ordered on the app and sat at the drive-through for 10 minutes and when nobody answered I pulled up to the window where I was blatantly ignored. After several minutes of sitting there, because I had already ordered and paid for my food, I honked the horn and still nobody answered. Another several minutes later a female employee and her manager came to the window, which I have on video, and told me they were closed. It was well before closing time, almost an hour, and there were people inside. They refused services even though I already paid for my food. I have it all on video, this place has the single most incompetent failures in employees that it's disgusting. One of the moms of one of the employees tried to harass me for taking a video of their refusal, and was combative to a fault. That's exactly the kind of classy behavior I would expect from the mother of an employee at this location! She seemed like she would probably have been more aggressive if I wasn't also videotaping her, nothing I did was illegal and this place has officially been reported to their corporate office. I can't wait to see how many people get fired over this....

I am so grateful for the crew here. After working the late shift, I know I can count on them for an upbeat finish to my day. 
Thank you!

I just sat in your drive-through line for 21 minutes before I gave up and drove away. Only five cars progressed through the line during that time.  Your food is not that complicated to prepare. I'm assuming the problem is management? I guess when I need my taco fix, I will be heading down to William Cannon and Brodie.

I didn't understand why the drive thru lane was wrapped around the building,  & the people standing in line was out the door.....  well, they didn't have any $1 bills!   What a joke!   I wonder which manager was slacking & didn't get change for the registers on a Friday night?

I have to admit that Taco Bell is one of my guilty pleasures.... But this particular location is one that I try to stay away from, which is sad because it's the closest one to my house.  

I will say that I have had more terrible experiences here than I have good experiences, and really how hard can it be? 

Let's start off with the fact that there is always something that they are out of for the night. Now I'm not talking at 1am after a huge rush of people going home from the bar, I'm talking at 9pm on a Friday or Saturday. And these are not ingredients a Taco Bell can survive without. When you are out of ground beef, chicken, beans, and cheese, you might as well shut the place down. My sister and I went 3 times and every time there was something they were out of. 

Second, the orders are normally wrong, and if they arnt consider yourself lucky. I once stopped on my way home and did not check the bag because honestly you shouldn't have to. When I got home 15 minutes later I realized half the order was gone. I drove back up there and let them know this was the case they made me my "missing" items. By this time I had learned to check the bag after pulling forward, and immediately noticed that the order was still not completely there. I pulled back around and sat at the window (inside was closed) and finally, after 5 minutes, someone came to the window. I asked for a manager to personally make my last items as I figured they would at least try to make it correctly.

Which brings me to my last point. The staff is rude and incompetent. The manager that I spoke to just asked "Well what do you want me to do about it?" I wanted to try and be nice because everyone knows a horror story of someone spitting in food, but at this point I was just irritated. I told him that honestly I just want what I payed $20 for so my family could eat dinner. He gave me the rest of my food and lucky for me, provided me a lovely little flier for a "free" breakfast item. After reading the flier I realize it's just a normal event they were doing to promote the items and that was for everyone. Gee thanks sir. 

So it's safe to say I will stay away as best as possible until corporate takes action.... Which I seriously doubt they will since everyone in my family has called multiple times to complain and it still remains just as terrible.
Consistently the shittiest Taco Bell experience. Can't even make a quesadilla. Won't be going to this Taco Bell anymore.
Takes forever to get your food. It's also crowded most of the time. In my opinion it's the worst Taco Bell location. It's also dirty.

Clean and fast. More expensive than some of the other Taco Bells though. The area has needed some fast food for a long time. It sure is nice to have. Considering that it is a taco bell I give it a B+. Service is good for fast food and you can tell they make an effort to keep the restrooms clean. I hope they keep it up.
Food is good but this has got to be rhe slowest service ever.  20 minutes wait in the drive thru is the norm.  Seems like they are always "short staffed" and training.

Honestly if this location wasn't so convenient for me to go to I would never come here again. Every single time I've gone through the drive thru here I'm in line for a good 20-30 mnts. I don't know if they are short staffed or just extremely slow, but that's just ridiculous for a drive thru fast food restaurant. Not to mention the customer service is awful, they don't apologize for the absurd wait time or anything - always unfriendly, and unprofessional. If you can, I'd try to avoid coming to this Taco Bell. Unless you have time to kill.

Why is the Taco Bell portion of the menu stuck way off to the right, behind the pop cooler where you can't read the Arial 10 font text?

The service & food is "good" (hey, we're talking fast food here), but I can't read the far end of the menu.

Very slow!  I ordered at 7:20 pm for carry out, and received my food at 7:41

There are 6 people working the kitchen, spinning their tires.  I could have ordered and ate at a steakhouse.  Too bad I paid when ordering it I would have left.

lucky to even get 1 star.  rude people that work there and charge for sauce.  manager hung up on me.  should be shut down and people that work should not even
have a job.


Still don't know why this location is still open.  Drive thru people always have an attitude.  They throw your food in the bag and don't really care after that.  Someone from corporate really really needs to figure this stuff out at the location.

First off I want to say I'm a big fan of Taco Bell BUT this location needs some serious improvement.  Every time I come here it's ridiculously busy and not in a good way for business.  The staff must be seriously inexperienced or just plain slow.  

To management:  As a consumer (family of five) I would spend more of my money here if you would improve your turnaround times. Just saying....
LOUD rap music with tons of obscenities. Children standing around. Staff acting unprofessionally. Food was great. Typical Atl experience!

I work nearby and come here way more often than I should probably admit. Everyone here is always super nice and polite and happy! I always leave with a smile on my face. It is actually super refreshing to deal with genuinely kind employees at a fast food place.

One of the better taco bells I've been to, which is strange because it's downtown. People have been great for years, though I think they have hired newer folks in past year. 

Food is always fresh and hot. Gets slammed at lunch and dinner.
Showed up at 8pm and they said they were not taking orders. Staff was just hanging out in the drive through. Will never come back. Person in the drive through was rude and condescending.
