Everything said never is true. While I stand here waiting for my food I can see the sadness in everyone's faces. 'We already paid for our foods and now we can't leave.' -sad people. 

Expect a 15 minute wait time for this hard to make food.

The last time I was here, they told me they ran out of straws and my food was cold when I ordered through the drive-through. I was the designated driver this evening and I was trying to grab food for everybody, but 30 minutes before they are supposed to close, everything is shut down including the drive-through. Very poor business....

They don't open till 7, but the breakfast crunchwraps are addictive! It can be difficult to get in and out of the parking lot and the drive thru. The remodel looks very nice. Still the cheapest fast food around.

This is the closest taco bell to my house and it is open late so it is the natural choice to head here when I am heading home from the bars and need something to soak up the drink. 

It's cheap, it's fast, it's Taco Bell. That's really all you need to know.
They screwed up my order, then gave me attitude when I showed how they charged me for things I didn't order and requested my money back. A bunch of drop outs with a bad attitude working there.

Horrible late night customer service. No indication the Taco Bell was closed except nobody taking orders thus backing up the drive-thru line. Once we arrived at the window we were greeted by a disgruntled employee giving us a sign of being closed by using his hands showing we were cut off. He opened the window to say we're closed, closes the window while I was talking, turned and flipped me off. Nice way to represent your employer, jerk!

Extremely slow every time I've been to this location, currently sitting at the drive thru, have been here for over 30 minutes. The employees seem to be playing around in the kitchen, paying no mind to customers.

Not the fastest but the new grilles and slides are a good quick bargain.

Strongly advise that you avoid the drive thru as it tends to get backed up and the wait can be a bit rediculus.

I wish that I could give them negative 10 stars, PLEASE I AM BEGGING YOU NOT TO GO HERE!!!!! This is by far the worst place to go in the entire world and the are my two favorite restaurants! The first time I went the food and service was horrible but I decided to give it another shot including the fact it is Taco Bell/KFC! Never again! Today was the worst experience I had in my entire life! It started with the smart ass working the drive thru, then when we got to the window it was awful, then when we got our food it was 100% burnt and horrible horrible horrible, pulled out the Drive through and realized the dumb Bit** at the window did not even give the debit card back, so when i confronted her she had the nerve to say i told you you had dropped it on the ground, EVEN THOUGH SHE SAID NOTHING NOT 1 TIME!!!!!  So then I decided to go in and speak to the manager and I waited for 20 minutes asked for them 3 times and they still never came, so being on my little 30 minute lunch break, I cancelled the card and I just left and called them, so when I called they knew exactly who I was and laughed about it, said to call the police and said they did not even have a corporate number that they are privately owned!!!!! ARE YOU SERIOUS!!!!!!!! WELL OWNERS SOMEONE HAS TO RUN THIS SHIT AND I HOPE THE PEOPLE YOU HAVE WORKING HERE IS NOT THE ONLY CONTACT IN CHARGE BECAUSE IF SO YOU ARE GOING DOWN!!!!!!! INCLUDING THE FACT THAT I WILL BE CALLING THE COSUMER AFFAIRS DEPARTMENT ON YOU AND Well listen as I sit here at work a few minutes after looking for the owners number which I will find please do not give this location 1$!!!!!!!!!!!!! Go down the road....iF YOU WNT TO talk about ghetto and HOOD THIS IS IT!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! THEY ARE NOT WORTH 1 MINUTE OF YOUR DAY!!!!!

I WILL NEVER COME TO THIS TACO BELL AGAIN!!!!
I video recorded my experience but I can't upload it.

 Hello I am writing to you guys because I had a really bad experience at your restaurant I waited in drive-through for over 30 minutes I ordered the two Chalupa combo Non supreme.  After waiting  for 30 minutes I got my food I was patiently waiting until I get home I live five minutes away from the Taco Bell on Buford Highway  Ga.
 The Chalupa bread was completely hard I was barely able to eat it I was so mad that the Chalupa had tomatoes and wasn't fresh it's like they gave me a meal that's been sitting out for a while !!! The only thing I ate was the hard shell taco.  I was so annoyed that I didn't get to enjoy my meal so I drove all the way back and waited 22 minutes in the drive through again.
 After waiting in line I spoke to the manager Darrel  and explain to him my issue I was hoping he would give me a full refund for the inconvenience of giving meal a cold meal.  He asked to replace it and I didn't want to cause I've lost my appetite.  After he only said that he could only replace one Chalupa And Gave me a refund for one!!!!  I was very disappointed I left mad and he didn't care.  if there's anything you guys can do please provide me my full refund for the meal !!! Thanks

Normally a passable experience. 

No clue what the hell happened yesterday.

I can't even with this review. Check out the pics posted and I think that speaks volumes.

Out of taco meet at 8:30 on a Saturday night. It's not like they were busy. No customers were in the restaurant when we came in. We stood at the counter for a couple of minutes before someone came out from the office area. There wasn't even anyone in the food prep area. The only reason why they got 2 starts was because the manager came up and corrected the clerk before we paid.

This is the WORST WORST WORST Taco Bell I have ever been to. It doesn't matter what time you come here or how many people are in the drive thru, you will wait 20 minutes to an hour for FAST FOOD. If there was another location close by that was even a smidge faster this place  would probably go out of business. I could probably actually drive out to the Clackamas location on old 82nd and be back faster than this one a mile from my house. The reason people come to this location is because it's the only one around and convenient so I guess that's why the people that run it can run it so poorly. I don't understand why the owners/managers think their service is at all acceptable when there is so many complaints about the same things.

Went there late night to get my girls, niece, and myself something. I get there and the lady says we don't have no beef. So I ask her to sub it for what they had. Why did she charge me 80 cents each taco she sub the meat on. Then on top of that I still paid the extra 80 cents each and I ask for sour cream on my tacos. Guess what? No sour cream when we got home. Plus my daughter tacos had like 5 small little pieces of chicken that I paid 80 cents extra for.

Needed a late night pick-me-up meal.

The food is not great but it was filling, tasted good, reasonable price, and the service was good. 

Definitely worth stopping at. It meets what you expect a Taco Bell to be.

The last time I was here, they told me they ran out of straws and my food was cold when I ordered through the drive-through. I was the designated driver this evening and I was trying to grab food for everybody, but 30 minutes before they are supposed to close, everything is shut down including the drive-through. Very poor business....

Today, my Mexican Pizza is two tortillas with refuted beans inside and salad on top. NO cheese, NO tomatoes, NOTHING! See picture.

Update: tonight I ordered a combination meal that should have a Mexican pizza and two tacos, and three additional taco Supremes. But I actually got was a burrito supreme with three tacos and nothing else. It's unfortunate that I'm not more of a careless driver or I would've realized this sooner.

If there were literally anything comparable in the area, this would cease to be my last option.
This place sucks cause I ordered a burrito and they gave me 3 taco's instead and the Taco's were terrible would recommend to no one unless to people who want a messed up order

The worst kfc/Taco Bell ever. The dining room is rarely clean. They're always out of something. Short staffed quite often. They're extremely slow in the drive thru and dining in even when it's not busy and 90% of the time I can count on them getting my order wrong. I wish I could give u a negative number
I'm sitting here eating right now and it just hit me...This is by far the friendliest, cleanest, most well kept Taco Bell I've ever been in in my entire life. Pretty surprised....

I've driven off from drive-thru at least 3 times after the person was rude for no reason.  I will not pay a business that is not respecting me and automatically gives me attitude instead of welcoming me.  This is by far the worse Taco Bell around me.  I believe managers should really look at reviews on yelp or any other website and make a change.

About 10 years ago, I worked here. We had a great crew with Julio, Santos, Lupe, Saul, Simeon, and Tamila and a few others. I just remember their nicknames. I enter their names on Facebook but it comes back with about 100 or more choices. I miss those guys!

Closest one to my house and it varies each visit. By far my favorite drive through person is the sweet stoner girl who always gets our order right with a nice smile. Otherwise service is ok besides tonight where we for some reason went inside and waited 30 minutes to get our order and the staff was very grumpy and unfriendly. 

Murray and Allen TB is about the same time and even though it's walk in only they are on point every time with amazing quality!

Every single time I go to this Taco Bell the employees are freaking incompetent. I keep trying it again, but always find myself leaving after 20 min of waiting to order/get my food. Drive through or inside. They need new management.

This place is normally good. But lately the quality is getting lower. I ordered tacos and 3 Burritos and all my tacos are broken on the bottoms, and tasted like they been sitting out all day. They really need to work on there quality control. I'm not happy about wasting 20$

The worst Taco Bell I've ever been to, which is a shame since it's in such a nice area.

Three separate occasions spring to mind when I think of this location.  On the first, probably about a year ago, I went fairly late to pick up some dinner.  The girl working the drive thru window was very nice, but as I was waiting for my food I witnessed her bend over and proceed to projectile vomit into a garbage can.  I get that people can get ill, but doing it right in front of the window was a little alarming.

The second issue involved an online order using the Taco Bell app.  I submitted an order and then called the location about five minutes later to verify that it had received it and if the food was ready to be picked up.  The person I spoke with informed me that they hadn't received any orders.  I placed the order again and called back shortly after; same response.  I then checked my bank account online and saw that I had been charged for the order (once).  I called this location back asked to speak to a manager, who apologized and said I would be refunded immediately.  I waited three days or so and still no refund, so I eventually contacted Taco Bell Corporate, who finally granted me the refund.

Lastly, this third issue was just last week.  I was on my way to work and stopped to pick up dinner.  As soon as I pulled up to order, a female employee rudely informed me that "We're out of lettuce, so if you order something with lettuce you won't get any lettuce on it."  Very nice.

It took three strikes, but I won't be back.  I'd rather drive the extra way and give the location in Stoneridge my business.

So Bad It's Good, Part 749: 

Me: Mexican pizza? Spicy chicken crunchwrap supreme? 

Angel: Well, the crunchwrap is cheaper. And there's potentially more food in the wrap than there is in the pizza.

Devil: Or Mexican pizza AND spicy chicken crunchwrap supreme and less than $5 spent?

Me: Sure! How can that be wrong?

TWO HOURS LATER

Me: Urghhhhhhhh. Pain.

Angel: Told you so.

Devil: Mwahahaha. T-Hell strikes again!

Me: Shut up. Both of you.

Wow. I cannot express how long I sat to wait for fast food. It convinced me to continue eat salads and smoothies and try to eat healthy. I waited nearly 20 minutes before leaving without food. I would not recommend this fast food no matter how late into the evening students!!
Donna is the best cashier server I've ever experienced in fast food. She is energetic, smiles, acknowledges customers and really shows passion in her job. Kudos more could learn from her.
Service is always so slow. I don't think I've ever waited longer at a TBell. Even when there's no one here it's slow.

You know that Taco Bell is hit or miss. 

I rarely go to Taco Bell. I have been twice in 6 months and both times my order was missing an item. On 08/18/16 at 12:00PM the teller enters the order correctly, the line making the food not only forget an item again, the food was also poorly made. When you don't care than no care is taken when making the food. I will not be back to this location. I think the consensus is in. This location is not worth your time. Unless you don't care than this is the location for you!
My order was correct but I was a little uncomfortable listening to a worker argue with a customer through the window. I dont know what it was about but it didnt sound professional.

I typically do not walk in and eat at Taco Bell. I usually go through the drive thru. 
Today I decided to walk in and I'm glad I did. We were greeted by Bryanne. she was so sweet and welcoming. Thumbs up to her!! She definitely made my bad day amazing.

The long wait here is absolutely ridiculous. It doesn't even matter at this point if the food is good or not. What I am wondering is if I will make it through the drive-through before the sun comes up tomorrow. Never coming back here again.  They should be embarrassed to call themselves fast food. I could've had my food brought to me in a sit down restaurant much faster than this drive-through.

Been coming here for the last couple nights and experience an awesome employee. He rememberers my order and he is real nice in fact tonight i was a few minutes late upon closing and while he could have easily turned me away he happily took my order. His name is Talon. Sorry if i mispelled your name. To your bosses: promotion in order excellent customer service

I wish I could give this location less than a one star. It's the closest location to me so I usually go to it more than often. When I order my food not only does it take forever but most of the toppings are missing. Last time i ordered a cheesy Frito burrito and the only thing that was in it was a tortila, cheese sauce and rice. No meat or fritos. Fuck this taco bell and all the dumbass who work there. Good luck at being successful human beings in life when you forget the Fritos in a friros burrito.

lucky to even get 1 star.  rude people that work there and charge for sauce.  manager hung up on me.  should be shut down and people that work should not even
have a job.

Went thru the drive at about 10pm on a Saturday night. They had 2 or 3 people working with nobody else in line. I ordered two items and a drink. The girl taking my ordered sighed into the microphone after each item I ordered. Then they purposely gave me the wrong sauce. I know it was on purpose because the guy asked and repeated back what I said and immediately stuffed 20 packets of the wrong sauce in my box. This may not sound like a big deal but then I thought about what if they messed with the food. As a retail store owner myself, I know that gaining/maintaining the customers trust is paramount, and now all trust is gone and I will never go back. It doesn't make sense to me why people work at a restaurant but don't like it when people come and order food. If you don't like the job, quit. Maybe retail/food service is not your thing. It takes patience, and sometimes the ability to fake it, even on a bad day. I guess I should've expected this type of behavior from high school kids getting paid minimum wage. As the saying goes you get what you pay for.
Too expensive for what you end up with. I live right down the road and have been going here for like ten years, the amount of food you get for what you pay has gone down seventy percent. Just don't
Tasted old and the tortilla was dry almost flakey. Out of green sauce also. Been coming here but this is the first i have had this issue.
Taco Bell is good. The service here is slow. I get a tiny cup when I ask for water. My orders or wrong 20% of the time. No one is rude. They seem to always be hiring and have a lot of turnover.

Welp, today was my last day as a customer at this location.  Once again, closed at breakfast.  Inside lights were darkened and when you pull up to the speaker, you get a recording that says they are closed. Between the poor management, continuous 20 minute food waits, out of food, out of ice, and sporadic closures during breakfast hours when they should be open, I've finally had enough.  It's too bad because it isn't failing because of customers.  It's because the workers and management don't care and are driving business away because of their poor efforts.  If you aren't open to take business, you can't make money for your franchise owner.  I'm sure your franchise owner thinks it's because there aren't enough customers to draw business and not because of how poorly run it is.  This area is growing exponentially and fast food restaurants are few and far between and lack in variety, so there are plenty of people to patron this location. Taco Cabana failed in our area due to poor management.  This Taco Bell is on it's way to the same fate it seems.  It's unfortunate.

HORRIBLE customer service,
I like Taco Bell food and that's the only reason I would go here.  They laughed at me when I tried to open the doors after hours and hid under the counter and Bella (the drive through attendant) told me, and I quote "please don't come to Taco Bell again" when we went through the drive through.  Also, who makes someone drive around the building three times for three different orders?  It's not fast food when it takes us 20 minutes just to get a couple of burritos in the middle of the night with no business and six workers.

Like I said, Taco Bell food is great, but if I were to give this one a rate 1-10 based on customer service i'd give it a solid 1.  If you really love Taco Bell and can deal with crappy people, go here.

What can I say - amidst all the rumors and allegations of meat additives, I still am hooked on this place.  The Supreme Beef Chalupa is my favorite.  I usually order it along with Cheesy Nachos and a free senior drink!  The CrunchWrap supreme is good too!

Stop by to have something quick to eat, well is called fast food. Yeah right!!!! 
Took 15 minutes to acknowledge me however meanwhile we are moving slow and the line outside and inside keeps getting bigger. Personnel don't smile or say good afternoon. I'm typing this and still haven't gotten my order. Took pictures checked in yelp and posted comments. 
Guess what still waiting. 

You wait on a typical restaurant 1/2 hour for your food still waiting. Something needs to change before

This Mexican food trailer is located on the Valero lot at 3419 Slaughter Lane. On the other side of the lot today were a sno-cone trailer and a corn on the cob trailer. Taco Bella has been located here for the past two years, and had a steady lunch business while we were there.

I noticed them this morning when I stopped at Valero to pick up a cup of coffee, and saw that they serve breakfast and lunch. I decided to come back for lunch. Their soft tacos, with your choice of meat, are $2 each, while the Quesadillas are $2.50. Soft drinks are $1.

Lea and I tried a sampling of their menu: 4 tacos; Barbacoa, Carnitas, el Pastor, and Bistek, and went back for 2 Quesadillas; Barbacoa and el Pastor, each of which came with your choice of a verde sauce or a mild pepper sauce.
Each of them was delicious, with generous amounts of cilantro to take the flavors to the next level.

The two gents manning the trailer were super friendly and helpful. There is a picnic table under shade trees right next to the trailer, which we took full advantage of. This little trailer is one of the good ones, and I am comfortable recommending them. They are open till 2 pm Mon-Sat.

This is the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to. Some of the female staff are ghetto and incompetent. The female manager acts like she can't control her employees. I will no longer be going to this specific location. And yet fast food people want $15/hr give me a break you don't deserve it if you have a nasty attitude. Oh and I recently went to this location and I recorded the customer service and a fat woman sitting on her behind was texting and asked me why am I recording her and that she was doing her job. First off, you have the right to record anyone in a public area read the laws and second she should have went elsewhere where she couldn't be seen if she wanted to sit on her behind and text on her phone. Nothing but unprofessional people that work here!

I'm not really a big Taco Bell fan ...btw, those Doritos tacos are ass.  Straight booty.   Anyway, they were doing a special on steak nachos one time.  They were actually good enough that I went back another day to get it one more time.

I love Taco Bell... Always have, and hopefully, after some time, will again. Last Sunday, my wife sent me out for dinner and I came back with something tainted. I've never had a bad experience at this restaurant before, so we weren't expecting anything this time. Almost immediately after eating, my wife was not feeling well, and within hours was hugging porcelain. I'll spare the gory details, but we got food poisoning. Both of us. Not sure what it was that we got it from, but it wasn't fun. It'll take some time to regain trust, but just beware.
Customer service was horrible here, guy said he couldn't hear me then come to the window to hear him blasting his music and then proceeded to talk rudely. Not a fan of this location.

I frequently visit this location as it's the nearest one to me. Over a period of months they have gone downhill. 
Every single time they forget something in the order even when it's only a couple things. 

Just tonight, they forgot a taco after I realized it I was already back home. So I had to go back.

Upon the return loud, rap music full of curse words was blasting. I doubt that's suitable for a restaurant especially when a manager is present. 

So I get the taco and go home. As I begin eating a mini quesadilla I find a piece of black hair. Then I further go through the quesadilla and find more. 

Absolutely disgusting.

This is the worst Taco Bell that I have ever frequented.  We live just down the road on Brodie, and being a Taco Bell lover this is a convenient stop on our commute.  I've lived all over (IN, CA, KY, TX) and have been eating Taco Bell at least weekly for 20 years.  I've had the pleasure of great Taco Bells near me, and a few bad ones.  Most are very predictable.  But never have I encountered a store like this one.

I would be up all night if I were to detail all of the sub-par experiences we've had at this place, so I will just provide some complaints in aggregate.  We've been to this Taco Bell over 50 times in the last year, to give you some context.

Napkins - This is probably the funniest complaint, but it is also sad.  Every time we go through the drive thru, they only give us 1 napkin, even though we order 6 items.  Maybe on 5 occasions we have gotten more than a single napkin.  Since this is always the case, I can only surmise that the manager instructs his employees to skimp on napkins.  There is no way that by chance all of the employees could just be that lazy or careless.

Missing items - On approximately 1 out of 5 visits, you will get shorted at least a single item.  Sometimes we catch it before we leave the window, sometimes we don't.

Inconsistent food - The quality and size of the food varies greatly with each order.  Very rarely it is made huge.  Much more often you get items that are only half the size they are supposed to be.  They have very lame skills with the sour cream gun as well.  Usually sour cream is only at one end of the item.

I know you are probably thinking "What do you expect from a fast food drive thru?"  It's true that these are common problems, but I have never seen an extreme case like this where these problems so consistently happen.  It's more than carelessness.  I can laugh off the occasional problem, but when there are issues every time, it is hard not to Yelp just a little about it.

Tonight we got shorted for the 3rd time in the last 4 visits ("Where's my beefy 5-layer?").  My recommendation to you the next time you want a supreme whatever is to drive up Brodie to the Taco Bell on William Cannon or go to the one at Southpark Meadows (which is one of the better Taco Bells in town).

Please, Taco Bell gods.  Fix this Taco Bell.  Change the management.  Beat on the employees.  I'm not sure what the fix is, but I shouldn't have to drive 4 extra miles to get my Taco Bell fix.  It's a really annoying first world problem to have.

The food here is fine, the issue is the amount of time it takes the people working to make the food. It's fast food yet you end up sitting in the drive through for 10-15 minutes every time. It's ridiculous, they need to either hire more people or an entire new staff.

The cashier seems to want to rush you even when you're the only one in line, food came out cold, taste unsatisfying. After I threw my food away, and headed to the restroom, I noticed the restroom was either occupied or the door was just locked. After waiting a few minutes, and noticing no one was using the restroom, I left knowing this taco bell/pizza hut did not care about the customer. Also, they didn't have what I wanted or offered a dessert.

If you are enticed by the TV ads, just know what you get will be a mess of sloppily built and smushed together ingredients.  It IS, after all, fast food. And there is nothing Mexican about it.  But if you are just hungry and need something quick, then you should do alright.

One of the reasons I believe my sister and I remain single is our unhealthy obsession with the musical stylings of Elton John. 3/4 of the year we manage to keep this under wraps, but when the weather gets nice, the windows go down, and Bennie and the Jets get pumped it's no wonder that would be suitors in adjacent cars hit the gas a little faster when the light turns green.

Today our adventure took us to Taco Bell for a quick dinner.  We decided to cruise down Andresen and 4th plain for this store as it's one of the nicest and most prompt in the area.  It's the typical menu, nothing really to write home about, but worth the extra driving to ensure that our order is right the first time, the food hot, and the wait short.   

Veggie burritos acquired and on our way back home, we turned the radio on searching for something good.  When we landed on our favorite Rocket Man the volume instantly went up.  And much to our luck sat an otherwise decent pair of fellows with the typical "huh?" look we're used to... So Amanda, in her typical bubbly manner threw a big thumbs up and shouted "K-LITE BITCHES!" as we drove off...

They shared a puzzled look, we giggled, and as I reached for a fiesta potato, once again noted that Mom will never get grandkids.

Love this location. They've mixed up our order a few times but it's usually when we have a VERY large order so I don't blame them. They always fix if right away and give us extra food while letting us keep the incorrect order. Even when it's 12am they seem to be in such a great mood all the time! The food is like any Taco Bell food so I don't know how much better it can get. Perfect for munchies though!
They constantly get our order wrong. Regardless of if the order screen is correct, the order is almost always incorrect. This location is pathetic. Don't EVER go there

HAHAHAHAHA. Lordy, this place is a MESS! Workers will ignore you at the register, fight behind the counter whilst not making your food, etc. and I've seen this while a cop waited 15 mins inside for his food. Taco Bell is my heart, but I just cannot justify frequenting the German Village one anymore
God help the people and location.  They need it.

"Once it hits your lips, it tastes so good!". Yep. 

Mrs. K. and I are in PDX tonight so we can fly out tomorrow morning to MSP. We have stopped in to Andina for happy hour, dropped by Olive or Twist to see Sam and have a couple drinks, stopped by the airport to get Cordelia K. (the Pekingese) checked in for the flight tomorrow morning. We're on our way back to NoPo to crash at a friend's for the night before the really-f'in-early wake-up call in the morning for our 0700 flight -no, I'm not joking).  So you're between PDX and NoPo and you need some mildly-buzzed food, what are you going to do?  That's right - Taco Bell on NE MLK, bitches. 

First of all, I don't really understand how they can have our (not huge) order ready for us in the time it takes us to get from the order/menu board to the window (about 25 feet and 10 seconds).  But I supposE ours is not to wonder why...

The food itself was particularly good for a Taco Hell location. The 7 layer burrito was oh so good and the nachos bell grande (sin carne) was top notch. I used allthe (6) Fire sauces and 1 Hot sauce they gave me and it was about perfect for mytwo dishes (and I use that word loosely).  Mrs. K. Enjoyed her hard-shell taco, so all was right with the world. Now if only I could ensure that my airplane trip (with previously mentioned Pekingese dog and 25 month old niece) would go as well as my delicious foray into MLK Blvd. Taco Bell, I'd be pretty stoked. Stay tuned.
This Taco Bell is horrible. The drive thru literally takes 35 min no matter what every time. And we went today to get some at 1am. Literally no one was there. Horrible place.

After waiting 90 seconds for someone to acknowledge me standing at the counter to give an order I left. Same thing happened two weeks ago when my wife and dropped by for a Mexican food fix. We were only customers in store and there were two cars in the drive thru.  Five employees with three of them just standing around.  Everyone in plain sight and not a "we'll be with you in a little bit".  

Went down the road to TB on Willian Cannon & Brodie and received great service.  Slaughter location has serious customer service issues.  No more Slaughter Lane stops will go on down the road to William Cannon location.
Did not ask if we wanted chicken or beef. Gave us beef & we wanted chicken. Slowest service I've seen in a loooong time. Talked to other people while taking my order. Just dreadful. Won't go back.

We have a huge group come in Monday nights and this Taco Bell is always very accommodating, fast, and friendly. Kym, the manager is also super gracious and prepares her staff for our group. My other experiences here have been just as good! Excellently ran Taco Bell!

I primarily visit the Bell drive thru in order to snag a tall cold Pepsi. Other than the occassional taco, that's pretty much it. I don't consider them 'mexican' food... just another snack.

I would like to say I like the newer sauces they've come up with!

So this wasn't a terrible Taco Bell experience, but I've definitely had better. It only took us about two minutes to get from the restaurant to my friend's house and the food was already lukewarm. Service was also pretty slow. Though the staff was really nice and apologetic for that.

Service and Quality are terrible.  Countless times I'm given the wrong drink, watered down soda, no fork, and attitudes from the staff.  Boycott Taco Bell and go with Uber Eats.  Just had the most delicious burrito from Uber Eats and it was delivered with great service and a smile.

This is my favorite Taco Bell! It's really close to my house and I always get great service and my food is always hot. Unfortunately Taco Bell has a reputation for being not very nice and bad with food handling. I've definitely been to a few of those but I've never had that experience here. How often do you get fast food service that not only was patient while you decided what to get and then ordered something complicated but also asked how my day was when i got to the window?! They seem to have a good time working here too. One time a girl saw me looking at the hiring poster and started telling me why it's worth it to work there. Most fast food places the people look like they hate their life but I haven't seen much of that here. Even when I'm not in the area I make the effort to specifically come to this one because I know I can trust them.

I was treated with a lot of disrespect by the cashier. They wouldn't change the soda syrup due to laziness. They only provided the option for a different soda but it was soda water as well. Now I am home and they are not answering the phone. It is unfortunate that management hires such low class workers at this location. She snapped at me twice and did not say anything after she handed me the food. I had to wait and ask her if that was all. She just nodded her head and gave me a dirty look.

Customer service is spoor and it's the slowest Taco Bell iv ever been to. Had to leave twice before. I'm in line now actually lol only reason I'm waiting is because cars are continuing to leave the line making it slightly faster. Glad this is my last night working in German village because it's the only reason I come

Update: 25 min later and I'm trapped against the building and a wall. The guy at the window has been here for 15 min and he just left without receiving his food and only a drink I'm pretty sure. Everyone's faces in line seems as though they might start to riot. People yelling. Ppl want their tacos :(
Company ordered a variety of foods from this location for a lunch event, out of all orders my one order is missed and nothing to reimburse this. Simply giving it one star because of this.

this is the third time where my order is messed up within the month. missing nacho fries, cinnamon twists twice and of course never giving the right sauces. i get it, not to expect good customer service but at least get the food i paid for.

The last time I was here, they told me they ran out of straws and my food was cold when I ordered through the drive-through. I was the designated driver this evening and I was trying to grab food for everybody, but 30 minutes before they are supposed to close, everything is shut down including the drive-through. Very poor business....

Today, my Mexican Pizza is two tortillas with refuted beans inside and salad on top. NO cheese, NO tomatoes, NOTHING! See picture.

Horrible! Glad to see I'm not the only one that noticed the prices are different than what the menu said. I got a taco salad, no drink , yet it ran up the price of the meal. When I asked about it, she had no apology or oh, we are changing it tomorrow or any explanation - she just looked at me crazy and said well, that's the right price ok. Well you need to change your menu. So I ask to buy a cup of jalepenos on the side, and she said no we can't add anything at the window. Which is  understandable b/c some places are like that. I didn't think grabbing me a little cup would be a big deal and I had my change out to pay for it , but it was more her nasty attitude and eye rolling that bothered me. But I'm petty, so I let her finish ringing me up then handed my card right back and got a refund. This is my third time giving them a chance, and it's my last-Will not be coming back!
Over 1hr wait trapped in drive thru and then a SNOTTY food service girl to boot!!!!!  Never again!!  Don't waste your time or money

Ok I love Taco Bell.  The food is cheap and it is something I have always ate.  That being said let's move on to the issue
If I order for me I never have an issue
but when I send my wife to order or I order for the family there has not been ONE time where they have gotten the order right.  Depending on when I go it is one of two issues.  Either a serious language barrier, or incompetence at their job.  I do not know nor understand the reasons why they fuck up the order all the damn time but it is really pissing me off when they always get it wrong.  And one would say why dont you go to another Taco Bell.  Trust me, if there was a closer one I would, but where I live it all depends on the direction you are going to determine whether this Taco Bell is convenient.  I always hope they will change but than again, I guess it would be insane  behavior for me to keep going there when every time I do nothing actually changes, yet I expect a better experience every time.  

Either way, I am done trying at this location.  
incompetent and horrible service.  
Question, how can you ask someone who live 3 miles away to have the order brought back to make it right when it should have been right the first time?

Guess I am just upset thinking about it, but I did wait 24 hours to write this review to see if I would change what I felt.
Always get the correct order and the food matches the standards of other Taco Bells.
I have always had great service here! Anytime something has been wrong they fixed it quickly and easily with no complaints.

This Taco Bell easily has double the customers than any other Taco Bell I've been to. At any given time there are at least 8 cars in the drive-thru line. This naturally leads to excessive wait times for food, both in drive-thru and dine-in, especially in the evening. Today was probably my shortest wait time - ordered inside instantaneously and got my meal in another 7-8 minutes. Why still come? There aren't any other Taco Bell's nearby (and there probably should be). And sometimes you just crave a mediocre taco.


Bottom line: slooooow service, kind employees, clean restaurant and the food quality you expect from a Taco Bell.

We love that this Taco Bell is brand new and close to us (we live nearby at the LC). However they changed their hours on weekends to close at 1AM after a few weeks of opening. We now have to usually drive to Sunbury Rd to eat food after 1,which is annoying.

So unprofessional! Encouraged to use the "easy & time effective" order on line option, I had prior with surprisingly successful results in correct order and indeed was amazing in time efficiency!! So mentioned to friends here for the day as now everyone seemed ready to have a quick bite before heading home. Two of had immediate vetoes in my choice of venue due to prior experience with disappointing results several times, thus resulted in their non patronage for a long period of time. I explained my success with setting up account, the ease of ordering, including the "customization" ability in each item & the efficiency of time, so they agreed to give it a try as sounded as possibly workable! 
I easily went through each order on the very consumer friendly application and yes, it WAS going well? Until I hit the checkout prompt. Entered pickup as restaurant saved prior and immediate was flashed with "location unavailable- pick other location" and there it stayed.. until cancellation with rather disagreeable feelings.  Look, I do understand things happen, equipment goes down, other than that I can't really pose other situations causing unavailable processing?  But I had an account from "login" and related to only that location as I live in Merritt Island? Why would I choose another location from my account? But possible I guess, however even placed with the possibility of choosing another location should not from a professional standpoint have a blurb opt up allowing the information to be presented PRIOR to order? I tried to call to see if possibly that message was in error? Funny, their phone does not except calls from phones w private IDs.. AGAIN, I would understand if they offered a "to go" from a phone position? Nope.. just don't..
Overwhelmingly bad situation with unprofessional choices made from management resulting in loss of customers.. not that I think they would care if they knew.. but no more running for the border on Merritt Island, next time I would like efficiency & professional service with a pick up order for American Mexican food? My choice will most definitely be with Tijuana Flats.. Adios Taco Bell.

Five stars for entertainment purposes only. If you're looking for a Yelp review of Taco Bell food and service, I might question your ability to use this app to it's full advantage. It's freaking Taco Bell.

However, when I get that occasional idea in my head that I need to destroy my digestive system with a chicken quesadilla, I pick this Taco Bell cause there's always something amusing going on.. (disclaimer.. I have a twisted sense of humor, normal people may not see these things as humorous) 

- employee arguments going on in the back where you can always hear the latest trendy street slang first

- the Brookhaven PD performing a search at an active crime scene in the back of the lot.

- people in the dining area who haven't slept in days dancing to their own music.

Hey, it's a fun thing to do in Brokehaven if you're easily amused!

I used to live close by and frequented this joint on Friday nights and I never had a problem, but I stopped here last night half way through a 6hr drive from Seattle to Eugene and got a burrito with some type of foreign contaminant (I presumed it was glass at the time).

I inspected my burrito and pulled maybe 7 pieces of small square clear and hard pieces out of it and my mouth. It looked and felt like glass to me so I called the location right away to tell them to stop serving the beans! 

The gal who answered was beyond rude; she was condescending, inconsiderate, and apathetic to my situation. She told me that it was impossible because they don't have "glass products" and that it was "probably just lettuce". I asked to speak to a manager and she proceeded to tell her side of the story while on the phone with me to her him. 

I was NOT looking for free food or any type of compensation; I wanted to ensure people's safety and I was treated like garbage. (I still do not know for sure what it was in my burrito)

do not! i repeat do not eat at this taco bell its dirty!!! and they dont stuff their tacos like literally all the other ones ive been to in orlando ( & surrounding areas ) the customer service at this location is ridiculous! theyre super rude for nooo reason!! i do not recommend anyone!!!!!!!! to come here!!!!!
Worst Taco Bell. If you come here during dinner hour expect to wait 30 minutes for dinner

It's a a Taco Bell. They are all consistently good. A negative review from someone that simply doesn't approve of junk food isn't really a review is it?
Service was quick, pleasant and the food is inexpensive. I love their Fiery Doritos tacos

I drive out of my way in order to go to this location, as the Reynoldburg location is terrible. I've never had an issue here, they always are very fast and professional with preparing my food/ taking my order.

First of all I must apologize for this will not be a very complementary review. I am totally stunned. I have always had excellent service when I come here. Unfortunately today I don't know if the girl working the drive-through window was having a bad day it is now 1:24 PM and it is March 20 and I'm really stunned as a matter  of being treated so rudely. I am not sure if it's because all I  money that I had was in change.  did not realize that paying in change was so wrong.  unfortunately it's all I had in the world at this time. In fact I could not take any money from my account or I would have. In between pay periods is kind of rough. Anyways, I had silver mainly quarters few dimes and nickels and then three pennies. She was not happy. And again I am so sorry. But it is all I had to scrounge up until  my paycheck would come in and I was very hungry. Anyways the woman very angrily told me here's your order  and here'sYour drink. Shoved them to me. Then slammed the door just so angrily looking at me. I didn't realize when I did it was so terribly wrong. And I feel bad for Taco Bell because this was my favorite place in New Albany to go I lived here for many years. I was just passing by because it was on my route. Again I am very upset to have posted such a low rating but I think No one should judge someone circumstance just because they paid with  change. Again I am stunned this is always been a wonderful location. Someone needs to teach their Employees how to treat customers with respect.

This is the most awful "restaurant" on the island. Unfortunately, it's one of the few places open at midnight. After waiting at the drive-through for about five minutes someone comes to the speaker and says "I'm sorry we are closed for about 15 or 20 minutes". There are two people in line in front of me getting food and there are another two cars behind me. At other times, they have never given me my food while standing in line inside the restaurant. After asking where the order is 10 minutes later, they have claimed they already gave it to me, even though I've been standing at the counter the entire time and have no food. It is an atrocious restaurant with horrible service. Apparently the owner could not care less.

Love Taco Bell but I avoid this one when possible, which is hard, bc I live in the area. Every time I visit this location my items are sub par when compared to other Taco Bells. Not sure what the deal is. Just always not satisfied. And I've also received the wrong order on multiple occasions. Also, not open late night. Bummer!

I can tell you that it took nearly 20 min to even get my order taken. I get up to the speaker, she sounds high as ever. Ok so be it. But it takes another 20 min to get up to the window. Fast Food? Really? I wanted to smoke while waiting but didn't out of respect for the other people in the drive through. Not worth the money, as little as it is.
So the food is typical Taco Bell but the service here is so polite, friendly and helpful that I had to give them 5 stars!

You guys have to teach your drive thru to have better customer service. I know it's not a high paying job but they should at least have manners while taking your order and giving you food. Just a little respect is all.
Just forgot about my order, the lady before me went up 3 times to get hers remade, will never come here again
This Taco Bell is such an ace place to go for a late night snack. My girl Britney in the drive thu even offered us some waters! 10/10

Ingredients count:
Seven Layer Burrito. 
Warm and soft in hand.
The service is so slow. Very disappointed... just do better Taco Bell. It's fast food and not a hard concept.

Poorly ran average of 20 minute wait in the lobby or the drive-through. They cannot figure out how to get food out to customers & when they do the order is not correct. 

12/26/17- no change in service here.  Actually waiting in line again because kids want TB... regretting this decision!  Did it to myself

Wow. Taco Bell out of meat and anything resembling something to eat. They told us to come back in 20 minutes if we wanted to be served. Not the optimal outcome especially with a car full of kids that were hoping for the Bell. We took our business elsewhere.

You have got to be kidding me!! Wrong ordered like holy crap! My fiancé had to drive back to get it figured out, and still came home with the wrong food!!! It's not a hard job! Screw this location, we both work in the food industry, but if a manager can't get things right, then someone needs to get fired! It's fast food! Wtf!! Is all I need to say! Corporate look into this location! We will not be back! It's Texas so many other options around especially for Mexican food!!!!!!!!!!!!! Not to mention your system sucks as well probably because all of your complaints at the moment, and don't think I won't say something to corporate they will hear from me!

Yelp insists this is a food truck (or cart as we call them in Portland), it fits none of the criteria for said category other than the presence of edibles. The quality of those edibles, does not rise to the standard of the worst food cart I've ate at.

Awful. I went on November 5th 7:30pm.  The two guy workers were rude and sassy. Didn't catch their names but had high, squeaky voices. Two hard tacos were completely smash as if they did it on purpose.

This taco bell gets at least one order wrong, like today, we ordered a chicken griller and got "mini shredded chicken ques" whatever that is, but it came in foil instead of paper wrap like other burritos, which was a red sign, but maybe they ran out of wrap, but come to find out, it was the wrong order, what else is new. STEP IT UP

If you're considering going here, don't. If it's a Tuesday at 10:30 pm or Saturday at 1:37 am you are likely to be spending 30-45 minutes waiting in line for your grade d "fast food".  I'd rather have someone individually rip off each one of my finger nails and toe nails before ever visiting this Taco Bell again. If you don't heed this advice, please know that this is time you will never get back. I wish I would have just gone to bed hungry.
I had a mess up with my order today and I spoke with the manager Travis and after I told him he fixed it and when I came in he memorized everything and got it perfect thanks Taco Bell

Okay, so I went to this taco bell this morning and I just want to say to anyone reading this JUST GO TO ANOTHER TACO BELL OR TACO RESTAURANT. Customer service was awful, and I will tell my story here:

Sunday April 28, 9:30/10:30 AM. 
I pull up to the drive through and see NOBODY in the parking lot or drive through. I am greeted over the speaker by a woman, and since I have never been to taco bell for breakfast(I know, I'm lame) I ask her "do you guys have a protein bowl?" her answer "no." That's it, just a blunt "no" and then silence. So I ask "is there a way I could add egg to the power bowl or maybe substitute for something in the power bowl? Her answer "I mean...you can add egg on the side." After that, silence. I then say to her "there isn't anyone in line behind me, do you mind if I have a second to look at everything?" and she doesn't even respond. Typically, I would think a "sure let me know when you're ready" or something along those lines would suffice. But instead, she immediately replaced herself with a different guy. Literally maybe 10 seconds after I asked for a second, I hear a male voice say "what can I get for you today?" So at this point, I am feeling rushed and I just order random stuff off the breakfast menu that I didn't even want. I pulled up to the window, gave the young man my money, and then was told to wait at the pit for my food. Seconds before I drove away, I looked through the window and literally saw the lady YELL at this guy "come on! hurry up!" First of all, that is NOT how you treat your employees. You do not need to yell at them like they are in a sweat shop. When he came over, I asked him what had happened? Because she didn't even give me a response, but just put him on the headset instead? He then told me that she was "in a bad mood because of stress from the night crew." I then responded to him with the fact that I too work in a stressful, fast paced environment and have to deal with hundreds of angry customers in my face daily. Just because you are stressed or having a bad day DOES NOT MEAN YOU TAKE IT OUT ON CUSTOMERS. Also, there was NO ONE in the drive through or parking lot, so it's not like there were a bunch of customers inside or out. I wish I knew this lady's name but her attitude was so awful and I promise you I will just go to the taco bell on 620 in Lakeway instead because they are always very kind and hook it up big time for me with the power bowls! Again, I wound up ordering random stuff I didn't really want. I wasted money and time, and I probably should have just driven away. I hope you can hear me Taco Bell at Four Points, because I am very upset with the way I was treated today. What's funny is, I am never that person to go on a tangent like this unless I find it very necessary. I can't believe this chick is a manager. I will leave with this--the young man whose name I didn't get was a tall brown haired white guy with colored eyes I believe. He was very nice and did nothing wrong. Another time, a young lady with long blonde hair (Chelsea I think?) was so sweet and got my order right! So my one other time going here was not so bad, but man did this one specific time just ruin it for me.

Honestly I just feel bad for the employees, it's clear that their general manager or even district manager is absent and not giving the workers the tools they need to succeed. 40 minutes is the most time I've clocked in the drive through, most times it averages 20 minutes or so. The people are entirely understaffed, no problems with employees, but the management should get it together.

Nothing but issues from this location. Very nice building in a very profitable area of Clackamas. I've made multiple trips and have had every bad experience you can really come across. Most recent is simple, but includes the fact that they did not provide silverware, took forever to make everybody's order and then to top it off, 8 sauce packets for 8 larger items. We were asked which sauces we wanted via intercom, we received one of three flavors requested and hardly enough to cover half of the items. We will not be spending money at this location as they DO NOT CARE about the quality of customer service. The OLD location off of 212 will be the one we travel to, at least the window people and intercom people have some personality when performing their duties correctly and give you more than adequate sauce to cover your items. The best part, it's even the flavors you ask for! That's awesome! How crazy is it to do the job correctly?!?!so so crazy, that's how crazy.

Drive thru was closed already at 12:00 am with cones up.  If it's closed, update the hours. If not you gotta do something about the lazy employees who just don't want to make anything. Four cars pulled in, and all left disappointed for not getting served.
Slowest Taco Bell ever. Plus made critical mistake. I asked for no meat, beans instead. I've never had a problem with this request before until this Taco Bell. I ended up with a meat taco.

Whenever I go to the taco bell across from dairy Queen they are always under staffed, cantina bowls stop serving at 10:30pm when it's supposed to stop at 11pm. The dine in area also closes a half hour early rather then 11pm forcing everyone to go through the drive through and waiting 30 minutes to order there food to find that they stop serving early. Then half my order is messed up. This location isn't efficient, nice, or even following what times they're supposed to have. The tall, skinny, short red-haired girl always gives attitude and seems to be running the show after 10 pm she even forgot to give us a receipt probably knew the survey would be a bad one.

This Taco Bell always gets it right from the order accuracies, flavor profile, and portion.    I live in Cocoa Beach but drive here when I am in the mood for Taco Bell because it's so much better.   I know, lots of bad reviews, but many of those are looking for free.  The short staff reviews are legitimate.  Welcome to Brevard.  We have a lack of people to work low wage jobs so this happens at most all fast food, quick service, gas stations, and even my business - the medical field.    Perhaps if their were people willing to enter the country and take these jobs we wouldn't have this issue.

I would give less than one star if I could. When this spot 1st open it was great! Went down hill in the last year or so. Always understaffed 2 people cant run a fast food chain at dinner time on a Friday night. It was so busy and overwhelming for them one night they locked the doors and said they couldn't let anyone in because they couldn't handle drive thru/make orders/and tend to customers inside. Drive thru was wrapped around back into the street towards Providence. It became a Jack in the Box night.
( 2 PEOPLE WERE WORKING).
 I waited in drive thru once for 20 minutes. I was stuck couldn't go anywhere. The worse part the last 3 times I went there. There were issues with food. 
1) tacos no cheese (forgot)?
2) burrito barely wrapped insides all over the paper and bag.
I could continue but you get the point. I rarely post reviews but this one had to be done!
Someone (Owner) anyone needs to know whats happening.
If you go here be prepared to wait and check your order before you walk out the door.
Even though I live around the corner if we want taco bell we drive much further to another location. Better service.

Taco Bell is my teen sons go to place when we are out. What is it about that taco bell taste? Today we tried Chicken Chips, because, I mean rally, what is a chicken chip......I had to know. So a chicken chip is pressed chicken in the shape of a dorito about 1/4" thick. The order comes with chees and reminded me of Tyson chicken patties. At this location, I can actually hear the speaker at the drive through. My orders are always right, the service quick and friendly, and generous with the sauce....but ya gotta ask.
35 minutes to get through the drive-thru at 9:30pm on a Wednesday. And the food was still cold. Terrible.

Aside from the manager yelling at customers, waiting 30+ minutes for your food, refusing to give refunds, cold food (when you finally get it), disgusting bathrooms, this place is almost paradise (sarcasm).

I even had to dispute the charge with my cc company because they didn't give refunds and wrote Taco Bell directly to give them a piece of my mind (no response).

I don't know if Taco Bell is franchised owned or what but this location needs to be burned to the ground to start fresh again. 

Do yourself a favor and Keep driving by.

Tried to come here around 8:30 for the last two nights. Last night, we came around the building, saw cars in the drive through but pulled up to a sign that said they where short staffed and the drive through was closed. Tonight the line was a bit longer, but we were assuming they where opened, until an employee walked out saying that they where closed and anyone that hasn't ordered yet had to leave the line. At 8:30? They are supposed to be opened until 1am?? What the hell? This Taco Bell needs to get their shit together. If it's really short staffed, then FIX IT.

In terms of other taco bells in Columbus, this one rates pretty good. The service is fast, food is consistent, and the price is cheap. If I get a hankering for taco bell, I'm glad that this one is the closest to me.

The only tough part is that during a busy lunch rush, the narrow lot and drive through makes things pretty congested.
Could not rate this any lower. Took 18 minutes to get ONE Taco. Go anywhere else. Literally. Anywhere.

So went to this location this morning at around 7:20am.  The sign in the window stated that the store opened at 7:00am and I saw cars in the parking lot so I assumed it was open.  Sat in the drive thru for about 5 minutes and crickets.  Then pulled up to the window and still didn't see anyone.  Finally gave up and drove away, and as I did I saw someone standing behind the counter.  So I guess Taco Bell is training their employees to ignore customers now.  Ended up going down the street to McDonalds, which I will continue to do from now on.
I went to this location at 11 PM they tell me Taco Bell is closed but the sign says 1 AM explain to me how you are closed

Lethargic employee took my order like she was doing me a favor. 
Decent tasting meal but I miss the chirpy high school kids that are at least friendly to the customers

I was impressed with this location! I did the drive through on a weekend, in-between running errands. There was no line. Yay! The staff were super efficient, with a smile on their face. Generally the building, people, and food seemed really clean and cared for. It's definitely one of the nicest locations for this chain. I plan on frequenting this location often, if out and about.
I would give them zero stars if it was possible!!  After being trapped in the drive thru for over 1 HOUR only to be  greeted by a SNOTTY food service person. NEVER AGAIN!!!

Hours on the door and online show 7am and I just drove up and they were not open. There were some lights on inside but the drive through lights were all off and the sign out front was off. A little disappointing this morning.

The drive thru employee guy was friendly and personable on 7/30 at 6:57pm. 
Regular hard tacos, Beef Meximelt steamed twice and Mexican pizza add pico de gallo tastes the best!

Don't bother. Go to the one up the street. The extra 3 minute drive is so worth it. Have come here twice to an empty drive thru line and no one responds. When you say "hello?" after being there for 5 minutes, the guy just says "just a minute" and then just doesn't ever respond. 

The guy working drive-thru on Sunday, November 4th, 2018 at 8:30pm is literally the rudest employee of any restaurant. How is it that you somehow make a customer feel unimportant while they're the ONLY ONES THERE? 

Management, this location is consistently a disappointment and the staff is rude, ALWAYS (every single time I've come) gets the order wrong, and service is ridiculously slow. Train your staff. Fire yourselves for doing such a terrible job. 

Worst Taco Bell ever. Go to any other. It can't get worse.

I hate to be "that guy" but this location is quite possibly the worst run fast food place I have ever been too. It's Taco Bell so I'm going in with very low expectations to start. I've tried this location twice, first on a lunch run and 2nd on a late evening craving cure, both times I sat in the drive thru for nearly 45 minutes. 
What makes this even more irritating is when I pull up to the window to get my order (which is literally 2 items) I look inside and see 4 teenage kids just standing around.......why is the line taking 45 minutes to get through if you have time to stand around and do nothing! 
I was apologized to by the 12 year old running the drive-thru window and was their fix for taking so long was to double my order and throw in cinnamon twists.....well buddy, you really should just comp the 2 chili cheese burritos I ordered because I really don't want 4 of them.
I don't eat fast food often but this will keep me from going back to this location ever again. 
I'll chalk part of the experience up to the lazy ass "me" generation growing up now who lack responsibility and need a trophy for showing up
Probably the most friendly Taco Bell that I have ever been to! Sharon helped us out at the register and was very nice! She was very personable and funny! Thanks Sharon!

This place has good food and service when they get it right, and they have a great deal to learn about how to make it right when they get it wrong. I ordered a 12 pack of soft taco supreme without tomatoes and they put tomatoes on all of them, when I called the manager told me to bring the food back when I told him I didn't have time he argued that he made the order right and told me I needed to freeze the food and bring it back with the receipt. Frustrating!!!

Went there tonight and the food took over 25 min for $5.00 worth of food, kid making the food was rude and then we couldn't get out of the parking lot due to the poor design, literally stuck because it's one way and the line of cars waiting in the drive through were blocking the exit.  I don't mind waiting, but half the crew was nice while the other half seemed like they just hated their jobs.

This is one of the slowest drive thru for fast food restaurant.  I think Tijuana flats down the street can serve food faster.  Unfortunately I'm stuck in line writing this review.  Still waiting after 20 minutes...
I'm not a huge fan of Taco Bell but when the wallet it wheezing from a lack of funds, well you compromise. I went through the drive through and the service was very friendly, and fast.

Not entirely sure how but I managed to wait in the drive-thru line for 15 minutes despite there only being about 2 cars in front of me. Food was fine but if I knew it would take that long I would've eaten somewhere else because that's insane. I know most fast-food places have timed expectations for how long they need to have customers gone by so I'm a little confused.

"Aight, men. We have our mission: Infiltrate enemy territory and destroy. Infiltrate and destroy. That IS Taco Bell. That IS our mission. Any questions?"

"Yeah. Sir, they've got a kid. She's just a kid!"

"Well, pissant Soft Taco over here took care of that - Leaked intel that he contains "salad" - shredded lettuce. Kid won't touch him now. She's a smart one. We'll have to wait til her first college hangover to get her. But we WILL be victorious!"

"Captain Burrito Supreme... what are the odds we'll make it back alive?"

"GODDAMMIT LT. DOUBLE DECKER! Don't go soft on me now or else why the f**k did we reinforce you with that crunchy shell! There are LITERALLY a BILLION of you - You don't matter, you're replaceable. All that matters is here and now and that we get IN THERE and WRECK SOME BOWELS...

MOVE OUT MOVE OUT MOVE OUT!!!!!!!!!!!"

********

"Alright Ma'am, here's your order: Two Burrito Supremes, two Double Deckers, two soft tacos. Your total is .14 cents... and may God have mercy on your soul."

I absolutely love Taco Bell, it's my go to when I've had a good night. This particular time and this particular TB played the hell out of me. I walk in and I'm waiting to order for about 6 minutes as people are walking around in the back doing what they are supposed to be doing. Two people happen to see me, 1 nodded and the other kept doing whatever it is they were doing. I even hear someone say people are at front cash. Out of nowhere a girl comes up and says jokingly we're out of food. I don't crack a smile, she notices and immediately says the lobby is closed. The door was still unlocked and when I got in there lobby hours were not over. I just wanted a cheesy potato griller.

PROS: no rodents or insects in food
CONS: you were out of Mountain Dew. C'mon!

This place has TONS of napkins. 5 stars!

Pros:  This place usually has good Tex Mex at a reasonable price, however tonight was totally off.  The place was clean and the employees were nice, but the food and attention to detail was awful.

Cons:
- This was a drive thru order with multiple issues.
- They were out of Caramel Apple Empanadas.
- The Chalupas were soft and doughy.
- They forgot to put sauce in the bag, and tacos aren't tacos without the sauce.
- I ordered Cinnabons, however they weren't in the bag either.
- I had to drive back and fourth a second time, so literally 40 minutes in the car dealing with Taco Bell this evening, and I still haven't had dinner.

People:  Good
Process:  Fair
Product:  Fair
Quality:  Fair
Quantity:  Good
Value:  Fair
Cleanliness:  Good
Ambience:  Good
Timing:  Awful
Attention To Detail:  Awful
Quick service - I went in.  The decor was very relaxing.  I could see sitting and having great conversations with others here!
So I order a taco salad it's missing half a bowl of ingredients like what the f. I'm hungry and drove 20 min out of my way cause I had a craving for taco salad and this is what I get.

I will give this Taco Bell 5 stars any day !

They always are consistent, always nice, food is always hot and best of all, never a wrong order. 

It's always a plus when you go to a Taco Bell and they get your order right. The line always moves quick also, maybe one time out of the 56 times I've been to this location was the line slow. 

There's a gentleman that works at night who is always really nice and super patient, you think after going here for so long and mainly at night for 4th mean, I'd know his name.

Foods always fresh, never soggy or not enough red sauce. I literally get the same thing every time and it's delicious with lots of extra red sauce, every time. 

Consistency is key. This locations got it
Been sitting in the drive thru line for 20 minutes and still don't have my food.  Quesadilla and burrito.  There are only 5 cars in the drive thru

You'll spend your entire lunch break waiting in the drive thru line or even inside. Every time I come here it is absolute chaos and I don't even get my food in time to eat it. Steer clear of this dumpster fire.

I frequent this location at lunch time since it is close to work. It is very clean and the cashiers and other staff are friendly and provide swift service. I haven't had to wait long for my order, and it's never been incorrect.

Wow,All I can say is Imani is The reason I now come to this Taco Bell out of all of the Hundreds in Town,She made the Whole customer experience at Taco Bell change like I have never seen before,She made sure I was Greeted at the Door and Made sure I was ordering what I really wanted,She made me Save 42 cents and Now they have gain a Customer that's always loving to share the positive experience.

I ha e given this location so many chances because I live right beside it. My last time visiting I had to come by 3 times just to get nachos. I came back the first time it wasn't in the bag, second time churros were in there. Third time I had to walk in. The cashier knew what it was, didnt say a word to me and got the manager. She gave me the nachos and I left. The crew here is horrible and ALWAYS takes forever. I now go to the location 10 min away.
This place must be the Oregon Duck alumni center, their grads are always working here.

This review is for the Taco Bell KFC food chain close to the Chapters store near Pinetree Way in Coquitlam, so I hope I got the right location on Yelp. TOTALLY 1 STAR. Holy cow. Ok. So I had to use the washroom really bad and went into there since I was just passing by. The washrooms were locked. Ok, no biggie. There was a girl staff there, tannish skin, black glasses, wearing a hair net, around 17 - 25 (hard to tell) who side-eyed me when I did that. Sheesh, what's the attitude? 
Anyhow, I went up to the counter and nicely asked, "I have to buy something to use the washroom right?" She looks at me with this total "you are an idiot" face, no smile and replies, "Yeah." I hate fast food but whatever, I'll buy something. I get that it's policy. But yo, don't have to give me side looks and rude b*tch face, you know? Lol. Anyhow, nothing I like on the menu, so I nicely said, "I'm sorry, I don't really eat fast food, sorry." And she looks at me, says "yeah" and rolls her eyes. Then turns to her colleague and says something rude about me while I exit. I walk around and discover that there is a Chapters to use the bathroom anyway, nice! I'm not mad at Taco Bell or KFC chain for the washroom policy. I totally honor and respect that. But the chick with the glasses and hair net and goofy looking face -- she needs an attitude adjustment and no need to act like a total stuck up cow. Wipe that sullen look off your face and smile at your customers! You could just smile at me (even if it's fake) and say, "Sorry, washrooms for paying customers only" instead of eye rolls and "yeahhh" in a rude tone. I get that it's just your summer job, but girl, if you can't even work an entry level job with a good attitude, I worry about you for your future career! 
KFC and Taco Bell, are you sure you want her crabby face representing your brand? I forgot to take a photo of her to upload here. I'll do it next time if I'm in the area again.

Idk why I keep giving this place a chance! I guess it's due to my kids and myself being hungry and this is our only option since I didn't have my car today. But they get something wrong every time and barely put meat in the tacos. I will stop spending my money here.

It's Taco Bell!!! I do have to say I am quite the Taco Bell connoisseur. This location gets the job done with the same and desired taco food quality. They do a great job preparing the food and I rarely have anything wrong with it. Drive thru is one of the more faster taco bell drive thru's that I have been too. Customer service is the reason behind my 4 star. I have been through the drive thru multiple times and the only words said to me by the worker was okay pull to the window. Once arrived at the window no words were exchanged.... Now I expect to hear your total is..... Any hot sauce today..... or at least hello. Now I understand people have bad days but in fact I had the same worker the next time I went and it was the same way! 

I have been to this location many times and the customer service is superb 80% of the time. That is why they get a 4 star review.

Best tacobell around. Gave me a coupon for a free biscuit taco on Cinco de Mayo. They are kind of stingy with the fire sauce packets. You gotta ask for salsa and syrup for your waffle taco (see pic!). I AM A BREAKFAST DEFECTOR!!

Rude and unprofessional customer service, will never come here again. Was trying to order through the drive thru and the car in front of me had not moved up far enough for me to order. When I finally got close enough to order the cashier was irate and yelling at me, I think she was irritated because she didn't understand why I wasn't ordering. I tried explaining to her that I wasn't close enough to the window and she just kept ranting, so I left. This is not how you treat customers. I can't rate the food because this was my first time here but as far as customer service goes- awful.

Just spent 35 minutes waiting in the drive-thru. This was at 8:30 PM on a Sunday. It wasn't even very busy. They offered to knock a single taco off our bill to make up for the inconvenience. 35 minutes.... 35, freaking minutes.
This location doesn't exist. I followed my GPS and drove down Brodie and Slaughter but only found a gas station. So disappointing!

This review isn't really for the fast food joint itself, Taco Bell is fast food though. Not great, you get what you pay for. But the drive thru customers, if you're going to be picky and act like you're one of the stuck up Chipolte customers and be all difficult please take your rich behind inside. Don't waste us drive thru customers' time with your indecisiveness. Unlike you, we know exactly what we want. With or without cheese. Ha

I went through the drive through.... it's always such a long wait.  Then I got no hot sauces, no fork or napkins..... ugh.  I just wanted something fast & tasty after a long day at work.  But I love Taco Bell food just the same
Absolute worst taco bell I have ever been to. Everything was somehow soaked with grease. Tried multiple times thinking it was a fluke...it was not.

Service at this Taco Bell used to be good, it was polite and fast, the food has always been...well, Taco Bell lol. Now it is garbage. Went by 6-7 weeks ago, was told it will be 20 minutes before I could order because it was only the manager and 1 other person there, went else where. Tried again maybe 4-5 weeks ago, ordered a #3 (3 crunchy taco supreme's), asked for no tomatoes, the manager told me that it did not come with tomatoes, only the taco supreme's did... I left. Tried again tonight, Pulled up to any empty drive through lane, employee came over the drive through speaker to tell me that the drive through was closed. Well 3 strikes and you're out. Lost my business for good. I'll go to the Bell up the street at 183 & Pecan Park from here on, hopefully that one will have competent employees that show up to work.
The plain hard taco shells were rancid; crumbling and reeked when we stuck our noses in the bag. Next time we will inspect them before we leave the store.

Decent most of the time, but two weeks in a row (Sunday night ~11:30p) the staff was right outside the door, sitting on the curb, and stopped me, saying "their systems were down." And I could come back in 15 minutes. Save yourselves some time, and just go to the Georgesville Rd location.
They have some of the best night crew around super polite and always gets my order perfect  thank you guys !!
Not sure what goes on at this Taco Bell. But, I waited over 15 minutes for three tacos. With two cars in front on me, and this was the 3rd time this happened. I will never come here again.

Didn't really care for this location. Went there the other day and didn't get a chance to review it, my cell phone was at 4%. If I order a Mexican Pizza without the beans, why would they still put it on the pizza? If I order a few of those beef burrito with cheese & sour cream and I order without sour cream, why would they put it in all three of them? Also, 3 hard tacos with no cheese and they did leave that out but overloaded the lettuce to where  I could of made a salad out of all three tacos is a waste and very dumb to have that much with as little meat they put on it anyway. I'm ordering for multiple people, I'm not a pig.

I have been through the drive thru twice usually after nine when everything else is closed. The first time the food was tossed together. The burritos were barely rolled and they were missing ingredients. I had ordered a taco supreme and all it had was meat and cheese. My husband had a Mexican pizza and it was so thrown together and the tortillas were crushed. We thought OK they had a bad day. NOPE the same thing around the same time a few months later same thing. The employees don't care what the customers think or how the food is presented. Where is the management in this store better yet the owner. Don't go here it is awful.

So i frequent this place, and i have noticed that there is a lot of variation in the food. During the day the food is night and full, by which i mean that my burrito is actually filled to a point that i end up with stuff on the wrapper trying to eat it. However after about 11:00 pm Hitting up the drive thru and my burrito is like half full. Which makes me a little bit grouchy, on more then one occasion I've driven back through to request that they actually make my food right. 

Never the less the food here is always hot! Which if you are a fan of fourth meal you know the food is typically warm, but hot! I was amazed! Overall the staff is very nice and the place is always pretty clean. I give if 4 outta 5 considering its fast food and all its pretty good!

Okay. So if I could give them 0 stars I absolutely would. Every single time I go there they tend to mess something up. And I get it I'm a very understanding person, accidents do happen. But I just left Taco Bell trying to give them another chance. WRONG. I should not have went back. 


When I pulled up to the drive thru the woman at the window was very nice, asked me how my day was, and making polite conversation. Then I saw the kitchen staff laughing and giggling. The woman at the window handed me my food. I was skeptical of the giggling so I pulled forward and checked my food. I was not prepared for what was in my bag. 
I ordered a Mexican pizza and a chicken quesadilla. And I had gotten half of a crushed Mexican pizza, a crushed hard taco( that I didn't even order) and then it looked as if they had crushed my quesadilla in their fingers because there was finger marks imprinted in the cheese.
