Angered I brought it back inside. But as I explained to the manager this was not an "oopsie" accident. They intentionally messed my food up. When she had taken my food back I heard the kitchen staff complaining about remaking my food and being super nasty towards me. Definitely not impressed. 

The floors on the inside and in the kitchen are completely gross. It looks as if they just throw unwanted or incorrect food ok the floor. And it smells like a portajohn. I would definitely avoid at all cost.

- Gluten Free Menu: Yes - On-line
- Size of G Free Menu:  limited but at least they are aware
http://www.yum.com//nutrition/allergen/allergen_tb.asp
- Waiter Aware of the Gluten Free Menu/Options: I wouldn't bet on it.  So come prepared.
- Food:  It is Taco Bell..  What do you expect.  But it is good to see they are thinking about people with food allergens, sensitivities, and intolerances.  So they get an extra star in my book.

They have the following suggestion 

Suggestions for Wheat and Gluten Sensitive Individuals
 - Tostada
 - Chicken Fiesta Taco Salad (order without the shell and without the Red Strips)
 - Chicken Express Taco Salad (order Chicken instead of Beef)
 - Zesty Chicken Border Bow®l (order without the Zesty Dressing and without the Red Strips)
 - Southwest Steak Bowl (order without the Creamy Jalapeno Sauce)
I am not sure why they say to order without the Creamy Jalapeno Sauce.  According to their ingredient statement it should be OK to eat.

- Other:  Stay away from the Fire Hot Sauce, the normal Mild & Hot Sauce is OK
There is a posting of their ingredients
http://www.yum.com/nutrition/documents/tb_ingredient_statement.pdf

This Taco Bell is consistently good. My usual is the crunchy taco supreme and caramel apple empanada. Those are always good.

I recently tried the rolled chicken tacos (which are really just taquitos) with the nacho sauce. They were really good! I was surprised. Just $2 for a pair with one dip. They also have guacamole and spicy ranch dips. The guacamole is okay, but I prefer the cheese since the tacos otherwise need salt. I've yet to try the spicy ranch. 

The service is fast, and the food is almost always hot. Aces in my book.

Thuggish unwelcoming customer service, using expired food products and unsanitary practices, this Taco Bell is probably one of the worst in the country.  Also, the inside design is still from the early 2000's!

I'd give this place zero stars if I could. Went through drive through thinking line was short. Wrong. Two cars ahead, still took 40 mins. Person repeated my order, I paid, and then she forgot my order and couldn't remember my drinks....alreasy saw that i was irritated, didn't seem to care. Slow workers, not worth it. Go to another location!

The service is very slow. About 4 people walking around the kitchen doing nothing. It took about 10 minutes to get the food even though the restaurant was empty. We had a very simple order. The cashier ( Estes) was very slow, hard to hear and not focused on the order or the customer. Was looking at everywhere but us. She also took the wrong order for my son

I ordinarily like KFC & Taco Bell well enough - but this place is the PITS!  Aside from playing loud hip hop/rap music constantly - the staff here is just flat out awful.  They could care less if you get your order in a timely or correct manner.  They just kind of stumble around getting most things wrong and looking completely bored.  I work nearby and have given them numerous chances.  I finally just decided that I'm DONE with this place.  I shouldn't have to put up with incompetent and downright hateful acting employees.

Taco Bell is just one of those things that is so bad it's good - and cards on the table? I crave a 'crunch wrap supreme' from time to time. Unfortunately - scratch that - fortunately, my last visit to Taco Bell, I think, has killed any future TB hankerings. 

We came in on a late Friday night - drive thru - and it was very busy, it took several minutes to come round to the order station, another 5-7 minutes to get to the window, and another 10, almost 15 minutes to receive our order; which was relatively small: a crunch wrap supreme, two loaders, a steak gordita, and a Doritos loco. Now, here's a life lesson for you kids: Always double check your order, after going through a drive-thru, before leaving the premises. Normally, we do, but after almost 30 minutes in a drive-thru, we were in a hurry to leave. 

When we arrived at our destination, we discovered one of the combo meals and the loaders were missing from our order - which we were charged for - not only that they charged us for two extra tacos, which we also didn't even receive!

Besides the "kerfuffle" with the missing food, what we did get was just plain disgusting - the crunch wrap was soggy, salty and borderline mashed. This was definitely my last visit at this location, and probably Taco Bell in general.

Taco Bell is one of my fav fast food places. I was excited to have one less than a mile from my new house. Fast forward a year and a half later and I have finally given up and will not be spending money there anymore. The location by my house is TERRIBLE. in the last year and a half I have never gotten my food faster than 15 min in the drive threw. Yet I kept giving it another chance. This past Saturday was my last straw. We got right up to the place to order (this rarely happens and I was excited). We order and then don't move for 20 min. Finally me and another passenger had to use the restroom. When we got inside we saw no one in lobby placing an order but 6 workers inside standing around!!!! My friend used the male restroom and the urinal flooded everywhere on him! He told the workers and they didn't care. Said that it keeps happening. We went back to the car and it still had not moved in the drive threw line. I gave it another 5 min and we still did not move. Finally we left the line and you guys lost out on a $25 order. Wendy's got our money and our food out in 5 min. I will not be revisiting this Taco Bell ever again and since the next closet one is 5 miles away I guess Taco Bell will be off my list. Not only does this location has terrible service but a sanitary issue in the bathrooms they don't care about!
The service was fine. The food tasted ok, but I got sick off of it, and that's a deal breaker for me.

This is the worst Taco Bell I have ever been too. It was around 10pm when we went here on a Sunday, we were starving and the line wasn't moving. When we finally got to the speaker we sat there for 10 mins saying "hello" before anyone came to the speaker. We wanted to leave but we were stuck between to cars so we couldn't. It was a mess. When we got our order and made it to the hotel, we checked and they didn't even give us any napkins.
I feel that this taco bell is not one of the good ones... I have been to many. Im not sure how they managed to mess up an order that was just consisting of value meals... but they did...

How does this Taco Bell have 4.5 stars?
I eat at Taco Bell more than I can admit in a public forum and this was pretty close to the worst one I've visited.
I ordered 2 double decker tacos and a medium diet Pepsi. I got to the window and the two girls seemed to be having a 'spat' I paid what I thought was more than average but have noticed the prices seem to differ from location to location and change regularly.
A few minutes later I was handed a huge box meal. I told her that it wasn't what I ordered and she seemed wholly unimpressed. A 'manager' woman came over and seemed almost as annoyed.
I eventually got my right order (and the right change).
They tasted weird...a little off almost so I was worried id be in 'Taco Hell' later...maybe they spit in it...I don't know...
So thanks for ruining last nights guilty pleasure guys!!!!
The best food option to have tacos and something cheap.all time favorite place and would recommend it anytime of the day.

I went here at about 10pm on Friday night and after placing our order they notified us that they were out of beans. Seriously, more than 80% of their menu requires beans!! Needless to say we cancelled our order and needed to find some other options in the food desert that is Lakeway after 9pm.

This Taco Bell is the worst! They always have long wait times only Because of their own incompetence. At the drive through they now let people know there is a 25 minute waiting period. At 2 pm on a Wednesday. When they aren't waiting for glaciers to melt before serving you your food, the order you receive is normally INCORRECT and the employees couldn't give a shit. Even for a Taco Bell, the standard is low. In need of new management for sure

Rude employee on the evening of 2/20 at the drive thru window. Lady wadded up my receipt before giving it to me, and also slung my bag of food out of the window onto the top of my door and I'm glad I caught it because she just let go and went back in the window without a thanks or anything.

Rude customer service......meal was good though.

Possibly the worst taco Bell I've ever been to!! Line in the drive-thru is never quick it's a insane wait if u want food! Then when u get ur food it's usually always wrong sometimes someone else's food even! I have stopped eating here and do not recommend.
I love this Taco Bell it's the best and thy server the best tacos. THE WORLD. Please go here when you need tacos and are TOO DRUNK TO FUCK.

Upon arriving there wss a truck at the window that seemed angry and yelling.i was unfortunately stuck between to cars forcing me tk remain in line for a long time with 4 vehicles ahead of me.  I ordered my meal including an apple empanada. Then slowly work my way to the window.  Pay $10.46 for my meal, the girl dissapears.  Then minutes later a man comes to the window saying they were out of empanadas.  I was told it would be a 10 minute wait, already late.  I took what they had and left no refund due to time.  What upsets me is why when a worker sells down to 1-2 dont they put down a batch to cook.  And the main thing is it was 10 minutes between ordering and getting my order.  It wasnt 3 minutes left or something.  They didnt realize they were out until even after running my card.   Communication, organization, and direction are non existent at this location.

I feel like they have one cook that is missing both arms and blindfolded. Expect to always wait 20 minutes for your order. Take the extra 5 minutes to drive to London Groveport Rd and use that location instead.

Horrible.  Ordered ahead online.  Screwed up our order and took forever.  What is the point of ordering ahead.  Have to agree with the other reviews.  This location has no idea what they are doing. Never again!

So I lied and I've given this place a couple more chances just because it's close to the house and convenient. I'm pleased to report it has gotten much better last couple times he orders of been correct and the food is been hot and the people at the restaurant seem to know what they're doing.

Needed a quick snack one afternoon.  I chose to use the drive-through.  Even for a car, the drive-through lane is very tight.  I ordered a couple of burritos, and the clerk inside suggested their new hot sauce.  I took him up on his offer, and enjoyed my two burritos with their new hot sauce.

Good service, and typical Taco Bell food. No surprises here.

I don't care what ya'll say about Taco Bell but you know damn well that they've been there for you when you were broke! You were ballin on a budget when you ordered here! I always had their back! I think the ones who talk about having the runs are the ones who've never been through the struggle... All in all Taco Bell continues to amaze with all the new things they keep coming up with. Their Cinnamon Delights Are Da Bomb!!! But weird that you can only choose between an order of 2 or 10. There's no in between.  lol. Just get the 10!!! Lol. Other than that. My go to from there are Cheesy Gordita Crunch with the Doritos Nacho Shell Instead, Tostadas, and their Nacho Bell Grande with lettuce on top. Feel free to give them a go!

Definitely one of the slowest Taco Bell's in Oregon.  Possibly in the USA.  On some late nights you can expect a 30 minute wait in the drive through.  NOT KIDDING.  Not sure if it's understaffed or what.  The people working don't seem to be in a hurry at all so it's probably just that.  Pretty insane tho.  

But, can't say too much bad about the employees.  They were nice and the order was correct.  But this Taco Bell sucks.

this is the worst taco bell on the planet honestly. i waited 7 minutes just for someone to take my order as the only person in the drive thru, then they asked me back to back up at the window to reset the timer & then my order was wrong after all that.

Horrible.  Ordered ahead online.  Screwed up our order and took forever.  What is the point of ordering ahead.  Have to agree with the other reviews.  This location has no idea what they are doing. Never again!

Best experience of my life. The nice girl at the counter smiled as soon as we walked the door. We had plenty of substitutions and the changed everything for us in no time. When we left she told us to have a good day and then cleaned immediately after. Definitely a step up from other times we've been here. Things are finally starting to change

What is going on with the food industry lately. The owners think they can just serve you up anything and we have to buy it. I will definitely be yelping before i eat anywhere. This taco bell is so bad. Slow and super cheap  trying to penny pinch to make a buck. Ive never had such a sad taco supreme before.. i should have taken a pic of the soft taco as well. Lettuce cheese is almost non existent. Seriously a joke.
I went inside the restaurant to pick up the order, I didn't know It was open for drive-through only, here it was a surprise, I can't believe how dirty it is

Absolute garbage... Spent $15... My burrito Supremes only bean no meat... My Frito burrito no Frito no meat only bean...Got home 20 minutes later I was throwing up ...oh yeah and the guy that was taking the money and handling the food rubbed his hand all over his face and hair repeatedly no gloves... Absolutely disgusting
This was the worst Taco Bell experience. My Wife had hair in her Mexican pizza. Had to throw away the whole order. No mask worn by staff at the window.
One of my favorite Taco Bells. The service is extra friendly, and typically very fast. I usually come here in the morning for breakfast (Taco Bell breakfast is amazing, btw!).

I wish there was a way to give 0 stars to this location and still leave a comment!  3 trips in a row, all with the same order, and every time the most expensive part of the order is wrong!  It's simple, I always order a number 7, chicken quesadilla with no jalapeño sauce, make the taco a soft taco, and Pepsi no ice for the drink... this is not exactly the cheapest meal on the menu.  3 trips ago, the quesadilla was loaded with jalapeño sauce, they replaced it as I found it in their lot.  Two times ago it looked great but I got home to find the bottom side black as could be and tasted terrible... I threw it away and wrote off my losses... now today, same order, checked at the window to be sure it was not burned and got home to find it was again loaded with jalapeño sauce.  I refuse to spend so much time going back to get it right because of their incompetence... finally complained to corporate... satisfied with the corporate response... but until changes are made I would not suggest this location... I get human error happens, but every time?  Seems they need to get it together or close up shop.  Also had another time that it was loaded with jalapeño sauce and I went back... took me a 20 minute round trip... never have ever gotten anything for the inconvenience until calling corporate today... we all love Taco Bell... this location is just not with it...

Worst Taco Bell out there, do not come here, employees do not care, I've been here multiple times and 7/10 times they screw up my order. Fix this Taco Bell, every other Taco Bell That I've been has never messed up my orders which is why I'm never going here again. I've talked to Taco Bell about this and they tell me to talk the the managers which don't do anything.

Extremely disappointed in this place and since I can't give negative reviews they get 1 Star.. my husband went to pick up dinner for our family tonight and they were in a hurry to close down because registers were not working apparently..we ordered food and of course half the order was wrong..EVERY time we go to both locations of Taco Bell they get the order wrong fully or partially..there is NO EXCUSE for this sort of thing..if you are taking money from a customer you are expected to get the order CORRECT EVERY SINGLE TIME!  It's not hard to make sure orders are correct. Incompetent teenagers are employed there and it's not right.. no excuse ever! And free food won't make up for the mistakes because we would put you out of business just on free food that's how bad you all SUCK at getting orders right!!

My wife and I rarely go inside a quick service restaurant like this, and this Taco Bell reminded us why we don't. 

When we walked in, there was loud rap music playing in the "kitchen" area which continued throughout our visit.  At times the language was so bad i could not believe it. 

Our food was a mess. The drink station did not work. 

When we left, there were two employees smoking outside the front entrance to the store.

I went there the night before Thanksgiving to grab a quick bite to eat . After I ordered an older white male ,without speaking quickly handed my food through the takeout window, and when handing me my change dropped 50 cents in change past my hands down to the ground between my car and the building.Then he just closed the window and walked away. After I ate the food I immediately felt intense stomach pain , and ended up vomiting , and crapping for 24 hours along with going between sweating, and shivering. I wish I could give them the negative stars.
just got my food and i am utterly disappointed. The food is awful, taco was soggy, made incorrectly and all around bad. #nachobestfood

Taco bell is what it is.. Even heard the NIck Swardson joke on this place? lol.. You should google it. 

Anyway. I like their crispy tacos, and their Cheesy gordita crunch. That's about it.

Not much to say, not much of a review and I am sorry for that.. 

Till next time.. "Go get you sum"..

pretty fast for our current situation with it only being drive threw but employees being rude when being corrected on a order or saying "ugh my god" when adding to the order and then giving us shitty slimes tacos and forgetting to add sour cream and tomatoes
after charging for supreme tacos ....

This Taco Bell is the worst restaurant in the history of America and Hass to be closed immediately... Slowest drive through on the planet and they got everything in my order completely wrong seriously shut this restaurant down immediately

Yoo this has way too little meat, I get that it's fast food and honestly my expectations aren't that high but come on, all I taste is tortilla with lettuce and sour cream.
Do better than this, every other location I've been to have done way better.
Very clean and good customer services,I will recommend it..very friendly as well..very good team player!

I used to love going here and will drive an hour from the city to get my Taco Bell fix but over the years they've really turned into a dump. I work in the service industry so I understand just about everything but it took me 45 minutes to order / get my order when there was only 2 people ahead of me with orders of 1 or 2 items. The poor girl at till clearly needed some guidance but no one was there to help her just aimlessly walking around. They got my order wrong even though I made sure they understood everything and I even repeated it back to her; but ordering was too painful to go back and ask for them to fix it. Last but certainly not least all of the lids at the drink station were sticky and covered in a brown syrup yikes. The one star goes to the pleasant looking older lady who actually was making all the food behind the counter! Guess It's really not worth it anymore.

Food was okay, but service was horrible. I should have been tipped off by all of the customers standing around the counter. While they are quick to take your order, they are not quick getting your food to you. I waited over 20 minutes for my food. When I walked out of the restaurant, the drive-up lane was wrapped around the building and spilling onto the road. If there was a manager on duty, they were hiding in the back.
Works are very respectful! Great experience for a fast food restaurant. Opened late while many other places in Orlando area close early.

I love Taco Bell but this location always forgets to put meat on my crunch wraps! Every time I order the crunch wrap it contains no beef or little to no beef clumped in various spots not evenly distributed. Yet again I love The Bell, eat it at least once a week, but just fair warning when it comes to that item.

Went into taco bell for breakfast. The lady who spotted us waiting at the register to order was a shift leader. We asked to have our order placed politely, she proceeded to tell us she had to make the food and yelled to the back for another associate to come up. (Okay. Sure.) 
We placed our order while the shift leader then went to stand by the drive thru window and not make our food. Watched her berate the cool about something while he was preparing our food from the dining area. 
Food was not prepared correctly either.

There is black girl that works the drive thru at nights she has an attitude problem. Talks real fast and is very sassy no respect for that customer. If she hates her job that much she need to find something. Went there the other day and the lady had an attitude problem. So, I left those types of people are better to avoid.

Real rating - only based on the fact that I come thru on a night that they had a little rush going on (July 9th 10:30pm). I ordered at the speaker and forgot something. So at the window I asked to add a potato griller seeing at the lobby is closed so I couldn't come in. The drive thru person stright denies it and says we are no longer doing add ons because we are slammed. Being a former TBell employee that's bullshit. The rush was super small and I know for a fact that you can't deny a customer any food for no reason. This has just really pissed me off. Don't know if I'll keep using them.

Currently sitting in the drive through AT 8:11 PM!!! NOT EVEN LATE! There's about 3 cars in the parking, probably workers, and about 8 cars sitting in the drive through. It's been about 20-30 minutes already and more cars are lining up and it's literally forming all the way to the entrance. This fast food restaurant is supposed to be open till 1am-2am but the work here seems to be done. I've been at this exact Taco Bell many many times and LITERALLY EVERY TIME it takes forever to get our food. 

At times we went through and they would greet us and not order our food. I I figured it was some technical issue BUT THEY HEARD US but wouldn't take our order. There was also a time when they said their gas line wasn't working which was probably an excuse. 

We have called corporate, we have called the managers on duty, we have called the store and NO ONE has even given us a solide response.

I did have a friend working at the same exact store and he told me the only reason why they say "gas line broken" or don't answer at all is because they're smoking cannabis in the back room. I would believe this is very very true because every time the person who takes our order greets us, they sound stoned out of their mind.

I heard Taco Bell was named number one Mexican restaurant- I would think otherwise. If you wanna get fast food, please help yourself and go somewhere else. I can't say anything about the morning crew because I haven't gone to Taco Bell in the morning but nights are bad. We are only having this store open because we keep on going and buying their products. 

(I also see a huge line forming inside)

Sad sad burrito here. Depressing lunch break

$5 box definitely not worth it at this Taco Bell

Stopped by at 2:30AM on Friday 11/23/19.
Upon entering the lot I saw two workers inside (the drive thru is open until 4am).

The second I pull up to the ordering screen, I get no answer for 5 minutes even with me talking. I then pull up to the pickup window in case they must have not seen me. Empty. No one standing by the window to serve any customer for the drive thru. I wait again for another 5 minutes.

It was then clear to me that the two night shift workers were deliberately hiding. This is pretty strange...  As I exit the drive thru I see that the two workers are hiding in the kitchen. There are zero orders on screen. 

Another car attempts to go through the drive thru and they experienced the same thing. No answer and no service. This TacoBell is open late for the drive thru yet they have employees on site that refuse to actually work?

What kind of joke is this?

Management needs to fire the two employees as they clearly are on shift yet are refusing to do their own jobs.

If you are going to hire workers that don't even work, just close the whole drive thru and store down.

I come here very now and then but more often than not I order breakfast from this location. I don't know her name yet but she always greets me at the window with a smile & is super friendly! She also told me about adding a second hash brown to my breakfast crunch wrap=amazing!! Keep being awesome

I walked into the kfc/taco bell location and asked what comes in a seven layer burrito. I was told "I don't know I don't eat it" i than asked for a different Taco Bell item as I heard a MANAGER from what seemed to be the drive through line say "WE NOT TAKING NO TACO BELL ORDERS" and when I asked why the reason was "the girl who do Taco Bell  is on break an I can't do Taco Bell unless you want a simple taco or something" mind you this was a MANAGER informing me that due to poor scheduling and inevitably poor training an ENTIRE MENU is off limits ? This can't be good for business smh. I sat there for 15 minutes listening to them turn down customer after customer. The lack of customer service is baffling regardless of fast food or sit down restaurant the business is made of PAYING CUSTOMERS and this is just inexcusable laziness .

So I'm probably one of the hundreds of thousands of people that are really getting tired of the constantly changing menu. I'm writing this review while waiting in line. I came in with a specific order but that order had to change because once again we're dealing with a whole new menu and I ordered from it and in return, I'm waiting in a 30 min line. Not because of a lot of customers but because of slow service.

The team is like a family here, you forget your at a fast food corporate establishment. I always eat inside, and I will continue to come here until the chalupa box exist no more. Anyhow, I always order from the Self order kiosk, so I take a seat after I email my receipt. I get to hear and see Interactions but the cashier knows almost everybody, or is very personable if he doesn't know you, always willing to accommodate the guest if they mess up behind the counter.. Taco Bell is Taco Bell, you love it or you hate it.. my order is always right, and always ready. Don't forget to fill out the survey.
False hours posted, poor customer service by doing so. This type of business practice is unacceptable.

We came in about 6pm on a Sunday with a group on our way back from FL. Our first orders came out about 20 minutes after we got in, and our last order finally came out an HOUR later. This is unacceptable for a fast food restaurant, and needs to be fixed immediately. We will not be back.

My husband and I will only come to this Taco Bell in Pickerington, Ohio. Why because it is beautiful, well kept, the staff is amazing, it is well managed, & the food portions actually look like the menu board pictures and commercials. 
They go above and beyond . The staff is friendly, helpful, and professional people.  They do not make you feel like you are bothering them like a lot of food service employees do at other places. The Pickerington store has a very friendly & caring management. It is so nice to see a manager with such professionalism. Our favorite employee prepares our food. Her name is Jackie. She is a rockstar. She is upbeat, happy, and does her job to the upmost. When was the last time you went to a fast food joint, unwrapped your food and said quite honestly 'Wow this looks just like the picture on the board!" We did! And Jackie is consistent too. The store is beautiful and well kept. It is so nice to see hard working people who take pride in what they do. I'd give this Taco Bell a higher score if I could. 

We have a TB (Canal Winchester) that is closer to us but the service sucks, the food portions are terrible, and they give you the feeling that you are bothering them when you go there. 

We don't mind the extra effort it takes to go to the Pickerington Taco Bell because they make going there a pleasure and well worth it.
Purchased a grande meal yesterday the lettuce in the soft tacos tasted contaminated with chemical solution very discusting...

The cash register girl wasn't very knowledgeable of her own menu and I tried to essentially recreate the double chalupa that she says doesn't exist anymore and ended up spending $12 for 3 tacos and a burrito. This Taco Bell has a very bad rating and I understand why I should fire the management and retrain the staff.

Not as good as I remember. 

I used to drive to Bellingham just to go to the Taco Bell off Exit 255. In those days, there weren't (m)any Taco Bells in the Lower Mainland. But, I don't remember the food tasting as bland and being as small as they are now.  I used to spend $10 and walk away stuffed. Now, I'd need to spend $25. 

The problem that Taco Bell faces now is that there is a proliferation of authentic restaurants serving spicier, tastier and even cheaper Mexican food. There is also fast-food competition from Taco Luis which makes burritos that are twice as large for much less money.
We come here all the time. But you would think there might be a little more lettuce in a taco salad?  Perhaps time to consider another place for dinner.

This is the most frustrating drive through in Austin 

Ive lived in this neighborhood for 4 years, and,the staff here is beyond ridiculous. They regularly do not serve customers or claim they are out of ingredients, one time they claimed they were out of every ingredient on the menu.

I do not know why every 6 months I give it another shot, its never changed, and every time I have to drive to William Cannon instead. 

Below is a video I took tonight, I sat in line for 5 minutes before they acknowledged I was there, the first time they talked to me was when I started the video below. I asked multiple times if they were there before recording to no response. 

https://youtu.be/zUcmm9aNxtg

This place has great customer service!!! we made a mistake in ordering and they were so kind!!!
Mike and Michael were amazing
Every time I come here I'm amazed at how much slower they are than any other Taco Bell anywhere. Might as well go to sit down restaurant.

I've lived close for 8 years and have endured 8 years of terrible experiences. If you like gambling, this is the place for you. I'd say it's a flip of the coin on whether your order will be right, but that would mean there is a 50% chance that it might actually be right...and that isn't a realistic number. I should probably just keep visiting when I'm drunk so I don't care if they mess my order up or wait in the drive thru line for 20 min. That's my best advice. Visit when you are drunk.

Worse Taco Bell ever!  If I could give them a negative rating I would.  On 5/3/2020 around noon, they Wanted to charged me for putting the cheese for the taco on the side.  When I told them that I've never been charged for it all I got was bad attitude and that I could either pay for it or not get it.  I told them that I've never had to pay for them to put the cheese I didn't get on the taco and have it put in a cup instead.  She told me the have always charged for it.  The manager backed up the extremely surly young lady at the window.  The attitude I got was unbelievable.  I have never been charged at a Taco Bell for this.  They didn't charge at the end but after 10 years, I will never do business there again.  As I drove off she still had my card and demanded To see ID before giving it back to me to add insult to injury.  The amount of the money was insignificant but the attitude was inexcusable.  During the lockdown we do business with local establishments to help them out but forget these guys.  It's to bad too because the food had finally started to get better for once after going downhill.  There are other better choices.  The Taco Bell at Brodie and William Cannon is a little further away but the food is better and I don't get this kind of crap from the employees there.

This is by far the SHITTIEST Taco Bell i have EVER been to. I live in the area and this is the 3rd time they have fucked up this month. The first time i contacted corporate and they sent me a coupon for 2 free items. The manager who works late nights declined my coupon and said I can't use it at this location because there was no button for it. Fast forward tonight, same shitty manager working there accepts my coupon but knows what i order and in the picture shows how FUCKED up this order is. For my free items i got what i ordered previously ordered which was supreme Doritos locos taco with no lettuce because it's disgustingly soggy and probably has ecoli lingering on them from the employees that have shit and didn't wash their hands. But this taco has only fucking meat and cheese. It's suppose to come with sour cream and tomatoes on them as well. Please just save yourself the fucking trouble and go to chipotle or better yet chop up ur own shit and make it at home. The crew is shit and rude as fuck
Customer service was horrible, NEVER COMING BACK. When we asked for taco sauce they LAUGHED at us and didn't give us any.

Wife and I went in the drive-thru last night. When we got our order it was evident that it was hastily thrown together and the quality of the food was just awful. Called the manager Michael to make our complaint and he was very kind and assured us we would be taken care of when we went in the following day...
Following day comes, we go in expecting either a refund or a new order, and as Michael had promised the night before some coupons. Instead we were greeted with a manager, Dalia, who from the jump was giving us a less than friendly attitude. While my wife spoke to her about the incident it looked like she didn't care. My wife and I are colored, and by the way we were treated it felt like we were profiled "black people trying to get something for free". She kept repeating "I will not be issuing a refund" and each time with more attitude. We weren't asking for anything specific, but we demanded that the situation be remedied for the subpar service we were given the night before. And to be frank Dalia made my wife and I very uncomfortable and upset. 
Don't go here, we saw a woman trying to go in last night with an order that was wrong, it's evident they have no sense of care or customer service here.
This place sometimes takes over a half hour to get your food.  It's incompetence is staggering.

Worst Taco Bell ever. There were 7 cars in the drive through and about 6 people inside. Currently it has been 22 mins since we ordered our food inside and we still do not have our food yet. I thought this was supposed to be fast food. I will definitely not come back to this location.
The food was so scrumptious that I literally couldn't contain it all as I walked to the bathroom

This is the best Taco Bell I've ever been to. I'm unashamed to say I've probably been here 50 times, and they have NEVER gotten my order wrong. I almost always do drive thru, and the people are so nice that it shocks me. I often do separate orders for my friend and I and they have no problem with it (some places are annoyed or get confused.)

I've also ordered on the app lots of times to do complicated orders. They always have my order ready when I get there, and again, it's correct, regardless of how complicated it is. Overall, this is a solid Taco Bell.

After they somehow lost my order and the awesome cashier was trying to get my food with limited success I kept trying to get the manager to come over. She would ocasionaly look my way but just kept wiping the assembly area down. I guess cleaning up a few bits of lettuce is more important than customer service. June 28 11:30 am.

Omg words can not explain how badly my diarrhea was that I got from this place.  The food there was so amazing at first but then 8 hours later your anus will be crying.  I've now learned to not eat so much junk food at once because it will later come back to haunt you.  What I have to say is, if you want to eat somewhere, go eat at Mcdonalds or something because you will not have to experience something like this.

I've tried to give them the benefit of the doubt. Wait time is horrible, customer service is even worse and when you mention anything you get attitude. The food is NEVER made to my asking. Just avoid all together.

It's Taco Bell so what do you expect.  I ordered 2 Taco Supremes and if you enjoy lettuce tacos then this is your location.  Everything else that I ordered was fine so maybe they were running low on meat.

Waited 30 mins for our food. They kept ignoring us whenever we tried to get them to tell us how much longer. Then they got the order wrong and the rest was disgusting. Waste of money and waste of time. Awful management and rude workers. When they handed us our cups they touched the inside of them leaving whatever was on their hands behind. If this was my store, I would shut it down. Should have asked for my money back.

This is without a doubt the worst Taco Bell I've ever come across. We usually drive the extra mile or two to go to another one but I ordered delivery. Entire order was messed up. Constantly broken drink machine. One time on free taco day they locked all the doors during business hours and we couldn't even get food. Several times their card readers broke and they told us at the window instead of in line to order. Absolute mess. Go to Hoffner.

This used to be the best Taco Bell but honestly the last couple of months have been so disappointing for this location, I have an issue there every time and my food is poorly prepared so I won't be coming back to this location, sadly considering it's the closest to my house

I wish I would've gotten a receipt so I'd know the girl's name who was working the drive-thru (she did ask if I wanted one... I declined)...‍. She was the NICEST!! I don't normally write reviews but I also don't normally get nice employees to write about at this location so I'm a little excited and just want to boast about her. To the speaker box to the window, she was just so sweet, upbeat personality and just sounded happy to be there. And patient! If she's not in management, she should be!! (I mean, really she should be killing it in sales somewhere else cause that personality is MONEY!)
Its 10:30pm on Friday, May 22nd... whoever you have working that drive-thru... she deserves a raise

Never again will I order food from this location. Like once a year I crave TB, but the service is horrible. Staff is rude. This is just a reminder why I don't need to eat crappy food because of crappy service and it's just not good.

I frequent this Taco Bell often as I live really close by and it's my favorite fast food restaurant. Well I've noticed the last six months or so that the workers are extremely rude. Tonight was by far the worst! While ordering through the drive through the girl kept interrupting me and just had a bad attitude. I knew I should of just off. I'm getting all four of my wisdom teeth removed tomorrow that being said I wanted a high calorie meal since I won't be eating eating for however long. I got two separate orders; one for my dad and one for myself and my son. The chola wannabe girl at the window was even worse than she was over the intercom. She gave me one bag of food. I figured it was all in there. I make sure to check my bag every time before I drive off. My entire order for myself was gone. I had to wave this girl down at the window and tell her my food was missing. She pretty much mocked me to whoever she yelled at in the back " The nacho supreme is missing!" Some heavy set lady came to the and handed me the bag and said " the first bag was the first order and this is your second order". She had a crappy attitude as well but not as bad as the chola girl. I told her that the other girl handed me my first bag and shut the window and walked off. So I assumed all my food was in one bag. Anywho, I told the heavy set lady that I do come here often and that the other girl is very f***** rude and that I would be contacting the manager! She just shut the window. I was not rude to these people so I don't understand why I was treated terribly as a paying customer. Well I got home and opened my bag of food two soft tacos and a nacho supreme. There was lettuce and cheese all over my wrapped tacos. It was obvious this was done on purpose. Well once I get healed up I will be making a call. To corporate. I'm pretty sure the crappy employees are a reflection of whoever manages this Taco Bell. I don't know what happened to all the nicer employees that worked here. There is some decent ones that work day shift. Well I will not be bringing my business here EVER AGAIN!!!

I come here pretty often. I love their food. And I have to say, their fire sauce is pretty freaking amazing! Never had a meal from here that I didn't want to order again.

Just make sure you check your bags on occasion. Sometimes they forget things, but other than that I intend to keep going back. As with every fast food joint, you'll encounter occasional long lines, but if you're going here, it's worth it.

This restaurant is a complete embarrassment lmao no joke. Waited 20 minutes in the drive through at 10pm and when I pulled up to the speaker, they tell me they won't have beef for 30 minutes. Like what kind of taco joint doesn't have beef??? It's your main ingredient?? Not to mention, last time i came here, they charged me for a $4 burrito which 1. I did not order and 2. They didn't even put it in my bag then said they would put the money back on my card and guess what.. they didn't. No surprise there. You'd think service would be faster at night since you know, less people go there but this location will blow your mind. Their drive through time is not ever considered. Would be quicker burning it down and rebuilding something else than waiting for your food. All i wanted was a beefy nacho griller lmao like how the hell are you out of beef. Bullshit.
Slowest drive through I think I've ever experienced.  Horrible, horrible, horrible. Just horrible.

This is the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to in my life. There was seven people waiting to be served inside and a lady walked up and said will be right with you and everybody just left and went back to cooking most of the people were staring at us like why were even there in their restaurant. We had to go through drive-through just to get my daughter something to eat.

My wife and I came to this location, as we always do, we've never had a problem until this evening, when we encountered what seemed to be the manager "Ernest" while we were waiting in the drive thru line deciding what to order he kept coming on the mic and rushing us, when we received our food, when we asked for extra hot sauce he pierced his lips, rolled his eyes back, and gave my wife attitude. 
He was extremely rude, and very unprofessional.
This is a normal example of quality. Maybe get bags that fit your products so you don't smash them in on their sides? The KFC side is ok not the best I've been to though by a long shot.
I really like this Taco bell, its rarely messes up my oder, the lines aren't that long too. The service is also great!

Terrible customer service. No common rules of engagement upon ordering, and repeated halfa**ed orders. I came to this location twice within the same month in the drive thru and speaking to the same worker, could not understand the order with an insane amounts of dead silence. I'm not sure if the telecom is broken or they aren't using it right but talking down to customers is a quick way to lose business (I was quickly ticked off and not amused). 
Also: Usually when you drive to the window you're greeted and when you leave are given a farewell. Neither happened but did feel the need to mean mug stare at me both times which was very uncomfortable. Both times I've ordered here, BOTH orders were wrong. Being vegetarian and specifically saying "vegetarian 7 layer burrito", confirming with the worker, the worker repeating it and gives you one with ground meat in it. Needless to say I won't be back to this Location.

Can't give less than 1 star so congratulations for this 1 star review. The smell in this restaurant is off putting. Smells moldy. Dirty mop and bucket by bathroom. Ladies bathroom had no soap. By no soap, I mean no soap dispenser, not just an empty dispenser. There was a broken antibacterial dispenser laying on top of the toilet but no soap at all.

OHMYGODTHATWASSUCHAMISTAKE

I might be dying, I'm not sure yet. 

This might be the last review I ever write. Death by Taco Bell.

Someone, tell my children I love them.
The food was good but nearly 20 minutes for a simple order on a weekday afternoon. The service isn't terribly friendly.

Every single time I've gone to this Taco Bell they mess up my order and I'm over it, get a manager in that location that knows what they are doing, train your employees to NOT ONLY make food correctly, but LISTEN when they take orders. Also when the man working the drive through offered me the survey his boss told him not to say anything about it because there was an issue with my order. It's unacceptable for the manager to decide to decline my possibility to do a survey just because they want to control their scores. My food was served inedible, ice cold and pieces of foil stuck in it. 

The manager simply doesn't care and it shows so much. Poor training and a HUGE lack of integrity. I couldn't be more disappointed with a business.

This is the worst Taco Bell/kfc I have ever been to in my entire life. Every time I've come here (4 times) it's always something. The food is stale, not enough toppings, ALWAYS out of baha blast, foods cold, never put forks or napkins in the bag, foods dry, terrible customer service, nobody speaks good English. This is my first time I've left a review somewhere. Will not be returning

Extremely disgusted by the way I was treated by Haley S tonight, I wanted the $5 nacho box, she said they were all out. I didnt quite understand so I said, "well, can you make the meal and just put it in a bag because I didnt want to spend more than $5 plus tax. Then she tells me I can go to another taco bell. Hayley's tone of voice was very disrespectful and turned it around on me to make me feel bad. I think Hayley would be better off not working with the public. I've actually heard her curse while taking my order shes whispered "shit MF," You guys should've put a sign out saying "OUT FOR THE NIGHT" or something. So I had to spend almost $10. She said she couldn't put the $5 box in a bag because of corporate. And the tacos I got, they were the saddest looking tacos I have ever seen, even my roommate said so. I can't believe she would say for us to go to another taco bell. And I told her I didnt want diablo sauce and I got almost 10 of them. I think she did that to spite me. Cuz I said no diablo please just fire hot and mild and Haley S said, "ill see what I can do." In a super rude tone. Like what is that supposed to mean? It means I didnt want the diablo sauce cuz I dont use it but she gave it to me anyways, pretty much just throwing away money from the company. I checked my food for spit or anything else before eating it. It was easy to check cuz you would think a supreme crunchy taco would be loaded right? You pay the extra money for it, theres like, 6 little tomatoes and I could barely find the sour cream, the taco wasnt even halfway full! This isnt the first time this has happened at this taco bell, sad crunchy tacos that is. I really dont want to drive an extra 3.5 miles to another taco bell but I guess after this last time, it was the last time. Haley S and Samantha,  it doesn't matter if you're having a bad night, leave your problems at home at put on a fake smile on, that's what my managers always taught me. Very dissatisfied and disappointed with Haley S and samantha,  haley and samantha, if you're not happy with your job, then quit. because if you ladies make yourself tacos I'm sure they would be loaded. Your job is to make food like you would want to eat it. So zero stars for haley and samantha.
But tonight we went in and the AMAZING Kiana was so helpful and understanding and compensated our order, Kiana apologized and said that she would speak with them. Thank you Kiana for your kindness and the extra taco, Kiana went above and beyond and I hope the next time we go she will be able to serve us. Thank you Kiana for being an a phenomenal person and an outstanding employee. Kiana get 5 stars, more like 10.

It's been a long time since we've been back here ... and now I remember why ... by far the worst service  - 1 out of 5 stars is being generous.  Staff were more concerned bout drive-thru customers then dine-in.  Only took the guy manning the cashier just under 5 minutes to acknowledge us (whatever happen to, "hey, welcome - I'll be right with you" ??) at the counter only to have walked back and forth 3-4 times (should have taken this as the first indication to take our business else where). The quality of the food has declined - not a word of a lie, the 2 piece meal chicken drumstick was the size of a large drumette (what you would get when when you order chicken wings) and the hard shell tacos were a little more then half full .... in a nutshell, don't waste your money and time at this location - somethings just never change ..... hey Corporate, do something bout this will you??

The customer service here is amazing! The employees seem to really like their jobs, I'm always greeted with a friendly smile, which is kind of surprising since it's not he best part of town. I've never felt rushed to order, and it I had a question they've always been patient in answering it. This is my favorite taco bell in Vancouver, the service is excellent!

Overall Taco bell is just Taco bell but in my opinion I feel like this Taco bell gets my order correct nine times out of ten where as other Taco bell's get the correct one out of five. Tacos are usually hot well filled and tasty and don't forget the Baja blast freeze it's a terrific drink in this hot weather!
Slowest god darn Taco Bell in the world. Don't be surprised if you get stuck in a line for 30+ minutes. It is sooo bad and it just gets worse every time.  Do not go here. They should fire everyone
Wait time sometimes is 20min. With 4 cars on drive through.  Really.  And NOT ONCE.  ITS THAT SLOW

I'm vegan so going to taco bell is very convenient and fast for me. I usually just get a taco salad and change the beef to beans and ask for no cheese or sour cream but lately they'll cheap me on everything and give me a lot of lettuce -.- The staff know me semi well so they tend to try and have a whole convo with me which annoys my dad and other customers cause he/they want to leave...

I don't have especially high expectations for the Bell, but every so often you just want to get down on a Chulpa, some cheap burritos, or some tacos. 
That said, this location.... SUCKS. It's not all their fault. There's things like the cleanliness of their dining room that they could be a bit better about. The service varies from OK to just plain dismissive. The wait times vary by time of day. They do seem consistently understaffed.
The worst thing about this place is the SMALL dining room and the terrible parking lot and drive through arrangement. The location is terrible, hard to get in and out of. Whomever approved this location and building/lot design should really consider the customer experience before they open up another store...
I came here today with my family and we got the worst service ever. Waited 30 minutes for the worst food I've ever eaten, and rude people too.
Poor service.  Asked for a side of rice, this is how the container was filled. Absolute joke.
I used to love taco Bell; this taco Bell with it's awful service has made me forever and always HATE taco Bell.  I will never visit one again because of them.

Lazy, rude, and incredibly slow. If you go inside forget having someone take your order, they actively ignore you in an attempt to force you to use the kiosk computer, but the kicker is many items cannot be found on the kiosk computer including the quasiritto and the grillers....don't expect to get in and get out of this toxic hell.

I was hungry after just arriving in Florida and needed a quick snack! This drive through was very quick and efficient and the staff were friendly. Order was as expected and tasted good as well, just about all you could expect from taco bell. Thanks!

Better than expected for a taco place. Huge menu with some unique items and drinks. Young vibrant kitchen workers and did I mention FAST?  Smell was great. Nice friendly family spot or quick stop on way to movies. To top it off they serve breakfast too.

I had a messed up order toward the end of the night. It happens, we're human. I went back and Chris H, Chris J, and Chyanne D took such good care of me that I wasn't even angry. Everyone makes mistakes and the workers at this location are so willing to make it right that I highly highly recommend them. I'm also I cook and server and they went above and beyond. They all deserve a raise and I hope that the company keeps people like this. It is the only fast food I'll be getting for a long time just bc they cared and showed why I love Taco Bell and the workers they employ. If I could give you guys six stars I would! Three thumbs up!
Line always takes forever... My order always misses something!! It's pathetic! I give up on this location

Best Taco Bell I have been too! I don't know where these other reviews came from but my food is always made fresh and looks good! I've been coming to this location for the past 3 years and have never been disappointed. Definitely give the staff and management thanks.

I've tried to give this location the benefit of the doubt for a long time, but they make it impossible to want to return. This last trip had a list of complete failures, from 
customer service to food quality. 

After finding a large, black hair on the rim of a cup, which they didn't manage to get the lid on all the way, we asked for a new one. The drive thru attendant was pretty obvious in rolling her eyes at this request and did not bother to apologize for the very gross mistake. 

I wish I would have checked the bag after this poor interaction. We were missing two items from our order altogether. The taco shells were obviously stale and appeared to be thrown together haphazardly. The Mexican pizza also seemed to have been thrown in the box as well. 

Skip this location if you know what best for you.

I've been coming to this Taco Bell location for a few years now, and while it started out rough, it has most definitely​ improved in the past few months. There used to be times when you'd show up at 2PM and they'd be closed for no reason, or they'd stop serving breakfast before the cut-off time. I never understood why people complain about food quality from taco bell - you pay for what you get. But if you're hungry and broke, $8 can get you a long way here.

That being said, they've greatly reduced their wait times and their staff has​ been much friendlier in my recent visits. I'm not sure if they're under new management or what, but it seems to me that they're on the way up!

This Taco Bell is quite possibly the worst restaurant in the area. It's always disgusting, horrible staff, extremely rude, and full of incompetent people. It needs to shut down. I was in the drive thru and ordered a fiery taco supreme, which includes sour cream. I check my taco, and there is no sour cream. We then sit in the car and wait for about 5 minutes because they are purposefully ignoring us. They only opened the window because we knocked on it. We then tell the lady what happened and she said they will fix it. The next taco I received had sour cream FALLING out of it. It was all over my hands and the whole taco was falling out of the shell. Definitely will be reported to corporate. This Taco Bell does not even deserve a 1 star rating.
I order two burritos and got none but two tacos. The people here don't care about their job or quality of work, just small paychecks.

Pulled up to the drive thru with nobody in line. I ordered 1 chalupa cravings box. I was told to pull to the second window and pay. After paying, I'm immediately sent to a parking spot and told to wait on my food. I waited 26 minutes before getting annoyed and went inside to ask for a refund and was told that they were waiting on me to come in and grab it. Why would you send me to a parking spot and tell me that you will be bringing it right out out to my car? This place is ridiculous, never again!!

The problem with this Taco Bell isn't the food or the staff. The food is usually hot and fresh and the staff is courteous and friendly and my orders are accurate 99.9% of the time, even when I customize items. The problem at this location is the panhandling going on outside on a regular basis. There's normally at least one, sometimes two, panhandlers hanging around TB's block, sitting or standing in the grass with signs. You also have the occasional older lady (like today) waving down cars to hand them information (most likely about churches or the 'word of god' or whatever the heck they're pushing). There has been more than one occasion that I'll want TB, but will bypass the place and go somewhere else because of the beggars hanging around outside (and they sometimes make their way inside as well) or the church ladies peddling their information, asking for donations.

Today, however, was the last straw for me. I was sitting in the drive-thru about to place my order when I was accosted by some guy who came up to my passenger side window, first assuring me he wasn't homeless or a drug addict, but needed money for gas. 

Until this Taco Bell location does something about the panhandlers hanging around the place, I won't be back.

Worst Taco Bell I've been to. Employees are disrespectful and the woman I spoke to who was the manager didn't seem to care it took them 56 minutes to make a $10 order. I'm a really laid back person never wrote a "review" in my life.  This place is garbage.
Before, the customer service wasn't really that good.. they'd get my order wrong or were rude. Mel is super nice and friendly!

This is the best Taco Bell I've ever been to. The food is really fresh. Who would've thought a Taco Bell could be described with the word fresh? It also serves Pizza Hut food which is a huge plus because my roommate usually wants pizza hut, and I usually want Taco Bell. The staff is really friendly, and the place is decently clean.

Just visited this fine establishment and wasn't greeted at all. Stood waiting to give my order and made eye contact with at least 3 employees but no one came to take my order. Won't be making a return to this place for anything but a quick pee.
terrible customer service very rude workers & manager, made me feel like they were better than me

I have a new theory: there is a black hole of suck centered on the 620/2222 intersection where the majority of places fall into the meh-awful zone.  My other reviews will bear this out, as the farther they are from this intersection the better things tend to get.

This Taco Bell falls on the 'awful' side of the zone.  Like the other places in the area, it's understaffed and the staff that does bother to show up seems bummed out.  I've had bean burritos that were watery, and quesadillas which have been rimmed with burned cheese.  Everything else is as dispirited tasting as the staff looks.

This place gets a 1 on the 'CTJ Scale' as noted below.

5 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Jesus good. Would be OK passing on after finishing a plate here.
4 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Mary good. Would be OK being seen eating here by Mother Mary.
3 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Joseph good. Would be OK having a beer here with Jesus' Dad.
2 out of 5 stars: Come-to-the-Apostles good. Meh. Wouldn't have my last supper here.
1 out of 5 stars: Come-to-Nobody good. I wouldn't have my penultimate supper here, either.

Went through the drive-through today May 26, 2019 at 5:46 PM ordered 10 items spent $25.60.
Missing an item which was a crunchy taco supreme with extra cheese and no tomato ($2.49)
So I'm at home now, everyone is eating( only two of the 10 items were mine) I call the Taco Bell to see what can be done, no one picks up I guess because all I hear is a fax sound after a few rings I figure maybe they're busy wait a couple minutes and call back and get nothing.
Also the two soft tacos I did receive were ordered with extra cheese which we all know cost money and they did not have extra cheese so I myself am missing a taco and two tacos that were ordered for someone else didn't even get the extra cheese that was paid for.

Today I ate meat for the first time in 15 years. Did I want to eat meat? Nope, I sure didn't. But I got beef in my burrito, when I had asked for bean. Even after having a discussion with the dude behind the counter about how I'm vegetarian, and if the beans are not vegetarian that I wouldn't order it(some places put a meat stock to make it taste better).
I was assured the beans were meat free.
Beef however, is not meat free.
Now, if there had been a line up, I could see the order getting confused, but I was the only one there.
Either way, I still would have been pissed, because I ATE some of it.
He apologized, out of duty, not cuz he actually cared I could tell, and made a new one, but there is still part of a dead creature in my stomach.
Won't be going back there any time ever again.

So yesterday around noon we passed and the place looked empty closed abandoned. Around 8PM looked closed empty abandoned. No lights on in the dining room no lights on the sign so I called to see if there was a recording On what's up because we had just been there and this was weird. Websites all says it's opened. Wasn't expecting someone to answer. I wouldn't have called had I not done my homework to find out. The lady who answered wasn't friendly was snippy at me gave me no info without me prying. Still don't know much other than drive thru is only for three weeks then it will be closed down. She said no more so I said what do you mean closed down. It will be closed down! For good? No not for good! Okay.... she said for remodeling. Oh ok well thanks. Rudely Hangs up. I said to my spouse wow she wasn't very nice which the reply was, no she wasn't!  I have no idea how long it will be closed after it closes nothing and wasn't dare asking anymore. I hope the attitude changes with the remodel.

Been a huge fan of Taco Bell since the 80's.  Nope, I'm not obese.  If you are from Austin then you get it. If your not from here then you won't understand and we won't miss you when you leave. Love my fire sauce and the service.

I have to agree with a lot of the other reviewers here, I would be hard pressed to think of a time when they DIDN'T screw up my order. They almost always forget something. And the wait here always seems longer than anywhere else (Taco Bell wise). Which makes it hard to correct your order if you forget to check it before driving off, and it's late so the dine in is closed. Whelp, looks like I will just eat the cost of that gordita that they shorted me because I am NOT waiting another 20 minutes in the drive thru. Frustrating. Almost worth driving a little further to the other Taco Bell on 82nd dr.

I've been to this location two times within two weeks and both times they had a sign about a tortilla shortage so they couldn't make burritos or certain tacos but I'm like, you're "Taco Bell", how can you not have tortillas??! My final visit resulted in an employee just flat out saying, "we don't have burritos!" What a complete disappointment... SMH!

I am almost 9 months pregnant. I waited in line for 10 minutes. Saw they forgot half of my order. Pulled around and went to go inside and the doors were locked. However a guy was standing there and said he wasn't an employee but they were closed. I said they forgot half of my order did I have to wait in line again? Mind you, all the employees were staring at me. They said yes. I wait another 10 minutes in line and when I pull up, the girl is extremely rude and asks where my receipt is. They never gave me a receipt. They made me repeat my order. They were all staring at me giving me dirty looks and finally the manager (I'm assuming) opens the window and hands me a bag with the food. No apology, nothing. We will not be going back.

Had a late night experience where the dude at the drive thru said they were closed at 10pm because he was quitting. Absolutely no replacing him, he was denying all the customers because he didn't want to work. Really speaks to that area though, such a shame

Haha this really is the worst Taco Bell out there. I'm still going to keep going back- it's right by my house- but when it comes to it's issues it's something different every time. If you're looking for good service, I would probably suggest their dealers.

I go to this Taco Bell all the time! About 3 times a week and today I got my order and my burrito was half empty, my taco was completely crushed I had to eat it in half. And we asked for mild sauce and got not a single mild sauce. I am really really disappointed with tonight

Someone needs to canvass manager every time I go here it's always a I did you such a big huge favor and basically you owe him I showed up here 10 minutes before closing and by the time I got up to the front desk which even the receipt I have says 258 he sits here and tells me and make sure to make a point of it that he did me a favor after hours and then I should be so lucky it's a larger white guy manager and it's nothing but problems with him every time and I've also heard it from my friends I'm seriously sick of it you always act like everything's an issue it's such a hassle to go there and makes me not even want to come here anymore I've always said and told everybody this is the best taco Bell around and this guy makes it the opposite
Hit the drive thru earlier got the food quickly with friendly service and tasted great like usual with TB
Do not go to this location. I've been here 3 times and every time they screw up my order and are very rude.

First off they messed up my order by not putting what all I paid for in the bag, and when I went back they were just going to give me the food that didn't come in the bag!! Like I want it all remade and fresh just like it was supposed to be when I first purchased it. Now when I got my remade food, the tacos were so skimpy. The tacos barely had any meat at all.
Nastey burnt did takes forever I wish I can give this a negative review. This ruined tacobell for me

Awful. I never leave the drive thru with what i ordered. I had to repeat myself 3 times for each item to the guy in the drive thru and he still got it wrong. He was obviously high once i saw him. I ordered a fresco style spicy potato taco, cinnamon twists, and a large dr pepper w no ice. I had ice in my soda, i had cheese and chipotle on my taco, and they gave me cinnabon delights.

Having Taco Bell within walking distance makes late nights the best of times and the worst of times.  Charles Dickens would understand--and we would eat Doritos Locos Tacos together while sobering up.

This is by far the worst Taco Bell in the area I have been to. I live in canal so I'm close and keep telling myself that maybe the next time will be different, but every time the food is horrible. Recently I got 2 chili cheese burritos and there was literally about a spoon full of chili and Cheese on both of them. It was just a shell, and this has happened at least 4 times. The wait time is at times crazy, even when there is barely anyone in line. I've been to the Taco Bell in Whitehall a few times because I work there and they are so much better. They actually put chili on their burritos, and the service is so much faster. I'm really hoping they put some managers in place at the gender road location that know what they are doing and properly train there employees to make food that will encourage their customers to return!

Apparently this location is suppose to be open until 2am on the weekends. I got off work and pulled up to the drive thru at 1:35am and they told me we're closed. This is the second time that has happened on a Saturday night. Just wants some tacos lol

WORST TACO BELL EVER. We went in for a remake because our entire order was incorrect the night before and we contacted the store and was told by Micheal come in to have our order corrected or refunded. Dalia was extremely rude to use for the moment we said we were there for a refund/remake. She explained that the notes only had 2 items incorrect and we stated well if it is too much to remake we would take a refund in which she kept saying "I will not give you a refund," which makes so sense as I AM THE CUSTOMER. If i did not want the food remade i should absolutely have the option to have my money back. If she simply looked at the ticket and spoke to us like adults rather than some hoodlums that were trying to get free food we would have happily explained our drinks and ONE item from the night before was correct. Instead she had a horrible attitude the entire time made us feel as though we were in the wrong for not only wanting the items we already called about but for also saying we would take a refund. I could easily tell she was judging us based off the color of our skin, I don't know about her but $20 of Taco bell isn't breaking my bank and we literally only wanted our food. She made us feel uncomfortable, unwelcome and honestly uneasy the entire time.

I am a regular here and I use coupons to get my tacos. 
The taco bell app doesn't allow me to use more than one coupon in one order so I have to make two separately orders.
Today the ladies asked me rudely why I do that
The tall lady that makes the tacos in the back was complaining about it to her coworker and I heard her. 
It doesn't cause that big of an inconvenience but it was rude that they made me feel bad for wanting to use coupons.

Awful! No customer service, I had to the kiosk! Then I stood around for 10-15 minutes and when I finally received my food, the worker tried to scurry away without giving me my drink cup. To top it all off my burrito came with hamburger instead of steak! You got to be kidding me, get it together!
DONT GO THE FOOD IS NASTY! Never changes the cooking oil my food tasted awful just threw it in the garbage it was so bad and tasted just awful. Never going back there and now I have the runs gotta go

This is probably the worst Taco Bell i've been to. The first time coming here, i ordered at maybe 11:30 and when I got my food the chicken wasn't even warm. Not only that but they didn't include my entire order. The most recent time coming, I pulled up to the window at about 10:30 and the worker kept saying the computer was down and they were closed. I rolled past the window and having previously worked in the food industry, i could tell the computer was signed into and awaiting an order. The workers are too lazy to simply do their job. Lazy Scum.

Nopeeee. Bad during the day, night and afternoon. Just incompetent employees. Food ordered during the day is the soiled old crap from the night before and the food served at night takes wayyyyy too long. Ordered food at night, the while drive thru experience was 25 minutes. The guy in front of me was getting frustrated because I could hear him talking to the employees from the drive thru window. I came today and ordered triple layer nachos...all I asked for was the nacho cheese to be on the side- side by the time I get home it's so soggy from the cheese. So I get the nachos with red sauce and cheese. And I said the cheese wasn't on the side and the beans weren't there. They take it back, but give it back to me and say we don't want to waste it so just take it. They give me a new triple layer nachos "with cheese on the side" and just give me a container of chips with red sauce on it with cheese on the side -_- still no refried beans! Ughh this place never gets it right

This Taco Bell slaps. I have been to 2 others in my area but neither of them do Taco Bell like this location. My black bean crunch wrap was thicc. My black bean quesorito? Also thicc. Spicy potato taco? Loaded. This last trip was *chef's kiss*. That being said, I think this is the last time I'll be going for a while, since Taco Bell is getting rid of the beloved quesorito and potatoes as an add on. RIP to cult favorites.

My tortilla was stale on my beefy frito burritos, and to go on top of that so we're the Fritos within it, oh and strike 3 for the win the chips on my triple layer nacho were....yup you guess it stale as a muhfucka, fix these problems, there's only so much mild sauce can fix

I came for a quick bite near my office, & have had good experiences before, but this was a big exception. I've worked in customer service over 10 years, work for a tech company, & received the worst customer service in my life. 

I had difficulty processing my credit card on the self-serve kiosk and encountered various errors (apparently it didn't like my Google Pay). I stood openly discussing this with my colleagues as several workers looked at us from the kitchen. No one came to a register or offered to assist us or the group standing next to us for 10 minutes. 

When I did get my food, it was THROWN down, & the worker briskly turned & walked away. They prepared it Dine-In & didn't give me my drink cup. I said excuse me, a worker looked directly at me, & continued preparing food. My colleague basically yelled for help to get someone to acknowledge us. When someone finally did, the worker said, "Just a sec", then handed me a bag & quickly walked away.  I had to get their attention AGAIN to ask for my cup. They then forcefully gave it to me & walked away. 

It wasn't THAT busy. I know the difference between being overworked, and simply not caring. No one showed a hint of care.

Great location but poorly staffed.  Customers waiting at counter without any acknowledgement....finally staff said its better to  use computer kiosk to order a simple taco since it appeared no one was taking orders at the counter.    Waited a lengthy time for order and then the staff just left it on the counter without a drink cup so had to get someone's attention and wait again.   Taco tasted cold even though the order was accurate.    Eating area was dirty...garbage was overflowing.    Not a positive experience for someone on a quick lunch break.    Management issue requires attention to regain community trust.

Waited in line at the drive through for 19 minutes AFTER placing my order. I could see people in the lobby getting their food when they'd ordered after we did. Ridiculous. I could have got a REAL Mexican meal faster than this. If they hadn't already charged me, I would have just left. When I finally did get my food, it wasn't even hot. Got home and the food was so tiny.

Going to give this location 5 stars because they don't deserve their current rating. When we first moved to the area this Taco Bell was awful. They must have newer management because the help is always very friendly and the food is always fresh and hot. Try not to eat too much fast food but when we do this is a place we enjoy going to.

Edit: Crappy again

Can you do 0 stars?

Drive thru teenager walked away from drive thru twice without saying a word.  Once as I was handing him my cc and the other as I was leaving.  I live in the area and avoid this place since it opened.  It was time to see if they had improved.  No they haven't.  Managers, you can do so much better.  Check our some of your other East side locations, like the one near mall 205.  I'll try again in 2021 and see if you've fixed it.  ----a neighbor.

I literally do not understand how you can be this bad at Taco Bell. I've been here multiple times and every single time it has been a complete disaster. 

Wrong menu items, stale taco shells, out of beef, card reader is down. There has never been a time I went to this location and there wasn't an issue. It's almost as if they are TRYING to be the worst Taco Bell in history. It honestly seems intentional. 

This past order I got a steak quesarito. The "steak"  they gave me was straight up dog food status. I am not exaggerating. I took a bite and the meat was so dried out that it was crunchy. My wife paid extra for her hard Taco to be supreme. She got a soft taco with no sour cream, no tomatoes, no cheese. The tortilla was also stale, it felt like cardboard. 

Who in the LIVING FUCK is the manager here?! Is this a prank? Is Taco Bell doing a market study on how completely abhorrent a location can be and still stay in business??

Please find somewhere else to eat. Literally ANYWHERE else!

Every. Single. Time. I go to this location there is a problem. Once, a 45 minute wait (you read that right, the whole drive through line ended up leaving), other times, forgotten items, only given one kind of sauce when asked for more, super stingy with sauce and portions, just everything you really don't want in a good Taco Bell location (I would know I eat a lot of Taco Bell) but today I am pissed enough to leave a review, why? Because HALF OF MY ORDER WAS LEFT OUT OF MY BAG. HALF. SERIOUSLY. I had an $18 order and got about $10 worth of food. The manager himself was the one who checked my bag and handed it to me, 30-something Hispanic man who apparently doesn't give a crap about his job, because when I called he barely apologized, put me on hold, and took no responsibility for it, clearly trying to get me off the phone as quickly as possible. 

This place is a joke. Needs new management and new employees (they all pretty much suck too from what I've experienced)
Ordering ahead seems pointless with the lobby closed. You have to check in at the drive thru order kiosk before they start to prepare your food.

After a twelve-hour road trip, I was starving. I had no idea where to go. I just exited and tried my luck - turned out I wasn't so. 
Some Taco Bells are open 24 hours, some are not.

 It was close to 3am last night and I pulled up to the drive thru because the sign was lit up.
I get to the speaker and the girl on the mic said, "Sorry, we're out of food and we close in two minutes."
