I thought, okay, I get it. I've been in that situation before. I hate it when a customer walks in, with even 5 minutes to close, expecting service.
I was at the speaker, window down, cold, hungry, when I asked, "Do you know if anything else around here is open?" 
The girl replied, "McDonald's is across the street and they're open 24 hours." I said, "Thank you" and went on my way.
This Taco bell is on a corner so, I drove around the other three corners and no McDonald's. 
I checked Google Maps. The nearest McDonald's is 2 miles away. 
Huh... What a...

I went to Jack In The Box which was open 24hours and the guys were smiling and happy at 3am.

Adios Taco Bell @ 8715 SW Hall Blvd

Slowest shittiest service ever. 30 + minute waits every time in the drive thru. Went inside to order on a Saturday night at 11 and it look over 25 minutes for my order while the drive thru line was empty. Get your shit together and figure out the issue.

I just left this location 30 minutes ago. I ordered a Buffalo Chicken Nacho Fry. The girl at the window was VERY rude, but it was late so i let it slide. The girl repeated my order to me at the window, so i didn't think to check my bag. I just got home(i live 30 minutes away but this location is by my job) and saw that i received a regular nacho fry... I just tried to call twice with no answer so bad yelp review it is.

We were heading out of town on Labor Day and thought it would be a good idea to eat something before spending 3 hours in traffic. Taco Bell is open for Breakfast so we stopped in right at 7am as they opened. I'll give them an extra star just for being ready and open exactly on time. 

Service was good, the food was made quickly, hot and fresh, exactly as ordered. 

Just what we needed.

Yesterday was my wife and I's 2nd wedding anniversary and wanted to go get some authentic unauthentic Mexican cuisine. My friend recommended taco bell, so I said "why not."
We got there at around 6pm and had to wait a measly 2min to order, I ordered the crunch wrap supreme, a 7-layer burrito, and the cheese potato thing burrito. THEY WERE DELICIOUS! My tongue still quivers with delight just thinking about such beauty! 
My wife and I were actually going through a rough patch, but I can say with 100% certainty that Taco Bell has glued us back together with their cheese sauce. Some say when they think about their wedding they can still hear the church bells, well I hear Taco Bell.

So slow and horrible communication. 

We waited in drive thru for 20minutes for 4 tacos. 

This place is a joke and the staff is slow and sloppy looking. 

I wouldn't come back here unless they make a huge change.

Crunchwrap supreme 2 beefy frito burritos and 2 chips and cheese took them 30 minutes on Saturday night. 20 cars wrapped around the drive through. I was dining inside and could hear the employees cussing about customers orders! A total shit show. Never will return. Their staff should be considered for qualification in the special Olympics
Never been the best Taco Bell but the last few times I have gone it has taken 30+ min to get through the drive through at different times of the evening. Should proly avoid it.
Slowest service ever! Thought maybe it was a fluke but repeat visits same old story. Won't be going back to this location.

They only gave me half my order. Check your bag because they like to rip people off. They even confirmed they forgot it and remembered the order and still refused to refund unless I found a way to get back there before the end of the night shift (maybe they pocketed the cash at the end of their shift) I should have known it was a shady place when I seen a huge rat run across the drive thru.
Decent drive through. The speaker quality is good and the service is quick. The order was accurate.
This location rocks! I have never got a order that was not warm & fresh nor wrong. Keep up the great work.

Went there for lunch last Wednesday, the three tacos I ordered had 1/4 of the toppings that they should have. The portions have gotten tiny. 
I've eaten there for years and never had a problem. I suppose a new manager is in charge and trying to increase profits.

We used to order from this Taco Bell a lot because it's convenient for us as it's right around the corner and our kids and my husband love Taco Bell! Like love it so much that my husband and the kids used to order from here at least once a week. Unfortunately, today's visit will be my last visit to this location. Why the low star rating and why will I never return? 

There is ALWAYS a long line at this location. Not because it's busy or during prime hours, but because it takes so long to get the orders out. I'm talking about waiting in line for at least 15 minutes regardless of what time you go there! We have sat outside for a maximum of 30 minutes before (yes, we timed it!) I have tried going inside to skip the line several times and you wait just as long. Let me include that if I'm the one stopping through, it's usually only for my four year old daughter whose order is a soft taco (no lettuce) and an order of cinnamon twists. Not too difficult, right? Well today they messed up that order (usually our "family orders" are the ones that they ALWAYS mess up...wrong items, missing items, etc), but today...they messed up the soft taco and cinnamon twist order and that was my last straw. 

When I've gone inside to place our orders in the past, I've also noticed that several people are always in line due to incorrect orders as well and the staff seem like they've become accustomed to it. 

I also show the location is open until 2 AM, but when I've arrived around 9 PM in the past, the front doors are always locked. I don't know what the hours are for the dining room, but that has been a frustration in the past as well. 

The only thing that this location has going for them is the wonderful staff that they place at the drive thru window. I have never had a poor experience with interacting with the drive through person and they have always been so friendly. 

Unfortunately, I will no longer return to this location! Best of luck to the staff here!

This was a great place until tonight. The food tasted like rotten fish, there was no lettuce in it like usual, and they just threw in a cheese empanada in there after the girl at the drive thru told them I was vegan. Really disgusting food tonight. Also a guy answered the phone and lied about being the manager. I've never had a problem at any Taco Bell until tonight. Really shocking..., esp.after years of having gone to Taco Bell....
Dirty, old, smelly, unclean. Food made me sick. Worst Taco Bell ever. Where are the adults?

One out of ten visits my food is made correctly the first time. Constantly having to send most of it back. Then I get eye rolls and attitude. Most of the time I'll arrive when I know there will be few customers and quite a few of these experiences I was the only one ordering. I discussed this with one of the managers and he said they just hired a bunch of new people. They either need to train better or make sure employees can read their screens. This location is one of the worst I've visited in my life and I love stopping to get their food!

Taco Bell as well as other restaurants don't  put emphasis on "cleanliness" any longer. 
I watched the dining room take on 3 customers in 40 minutes. In your mind like nice that should be plenty of time to clean the dining room. Nope, not 1 person came out and cleaned. That's 0 cleaning in one hour during lunch. That is a reflection of what is going on behind the counter. Hopefully I don't get food poisoning from the lack of cleanliness. But food was good as it's Taco Bell! That's why we go back. Lol darn it tacos !
I've never had a bad steak quesadilla at a taco bell. I literally had to pull out grisly pieces out of my mouth

Normally I use the drive thru, always fast and friendly. Went inside, busy and dining room was a mess and only one register being used, seemed to be 4 people in one line making food. 
If I was rating on my drive thru experience alone I'd say 5 stars all the way. 
Cantina menu has made me change my thoughts on Taco Bell :)

Usually like the simplicity of the cheesy roll ups when in a hurry and need a quick snack. Buttttt I don't really love cold shredded cheese in a tortilla. Which is what I got today.  luckily the cinnamon twists & a strawberry freeze I got are pretty hard to f up.

This place is disgusting and I felt sick when I walked in. This location is not in the "safest" area in Orlando if you know what I mean. I wanted to try the nacho fries (cheat day) and the drive thru was backed up! So I decided to walk inside. Oh gross!!  Place reaked of old oil and the place was under construction. I wasn't greeted and the employees didnt seem to be having their best day. Every employee was moping around and walking very slow. I felt so sick I just ordered a drink and decided to get the hell out of dodge! Dicey! Sketchy! I didn't feel safe or clean. PLEASE FIND ANOTHER LOCATION. This one was the pits! Wont be back! #pissed

THE WORST.  The longest wait times...we ordered 20 minutes ago and we are still in the drive thru waiting for our order that they made INCORRECTLY.  We ordered our Party Pack with NO sour cream.  And Guess What??  Made with sour cream.   No surprise there because most of the time we come here, our order is WRONG.  I guess that's shame on us for thinking that this time would be different LOL.  While they should be correcting our order, we are watching the cars behind us roll by with theirs.  This place is an absolute joke.  Just tear the whole thing down and start over with a new staff that actually care about their jobs.  *UPDATE*. They never actually started our order.  So they were just serving people and hadn't even began to rectify our wrong order!!!  After 25 minutes, we got a refund.  They suck.  DONT GO THERE!

An open letter of love to Taco Bell:

I knew of you for so long, and over the years we shared those curious glances, but I resisted your temptation. Then my flatmate told me of how if you existed in Ireland her love of you would lead to her eventual morbid obesity, and I had to try you.

At first I walk in shyly, not even knowing what you had to offer aside from a standard taco, but your menu was divine. What caught my eye was your cheese gordita, and then was when the real attraction sparked, so I ordered.

I sat down in your clean seating area, and I must say, it was love at first bite. You showed me everything I was missing over the years of eating only my normal homemade tacos - a hard taco, covered in more cheese and and flat bread? It was messy to eat, and I felt dirty yet strangely satisfied after the gordita was done. 

Then I had your Original Taco, and I usually don't do two rounds but to you I couldn't say no. Then I had your Cinnamon Twists and they were lovely.

Oh Taco Bell, my Mexican Mistress, how could I have waited so long? You will now lead to my eventual down fall my my need to run an extra 30 minutes a day... but I am yours.

Had to wait to get order taken. The wait until the food came out was about 13 minutes. Food was Luke warm. The radio is too damn loud. I want to eat tacos not be in a club.
This is a combo taco bell and kfc. The kfc food seemed to be quicker that taco bell to come out. Also given my food to go instead of dine  in. Not impressed.

This place is so slow, I constantly think about getting a job here just so it'd be faster. To the people that work there you'll never get anywhere in life with the work ethic and attitudes y'all constantly have.
This place has turned it around!  Last two times drive thru-  efficient, accurate and friendly.  I can only give 3 stars though - it's Taco Bell.
Slowest KFC / Taco Bell I've ever been to! Sat in line for over 20 minutes before giving up! Certainly not "fast food." Drive past and go somewhere else!

Got in line at 6:20. Got to speaker box at 6:25. Had to repeat order four times. Person in front of me just backed out. Must of decided to long of wait. Currently three cars ahead of me. 6:29 still at speaker box. 6:31 moved one car length. 6:32 moved another length. 6:37 moved to window. 6:38 money taken. 6:39 change given. Order confused do to customer in front of me pulling out. Order we three soft tacos. 1 nacho cheese and chips. 1 nacho fries. The lady at window very nice but when it came to preparing my she did nothing but stand at register. Got order at 6:41 pm. Food ya usual good at this location it just takes to long to get it. Fast food do they get it?

I mean.. Taco Bell is Taco Bell. But to be honest the location off the 205 and 212 is noticeably so much better. Recurring timeliness issues along with the hair in my food this time has convinced me to use other locations. Eeek.

Wow. So you give me the nacho cheese sauce for the less than par chips, but you forget the chips in the bag???
How dumb do you have to be to work there?  I'm speechless.

This is probably the slowest Taco Bell I have ever been too. Waited in the drive through for literally over 30 mins, yes I said over 30 mins. I couldn't even get outta line because of cars and cars behind me. Forced to wait for FAST food for as long as it would take to actually sit down at a full service restaurant! Someone needs to see what the hell os going on here and fix it!!

Never know whether food will be great or pretty awful. Today was the awful with thrown together burritos and very, very salty nachos.  Cooks need to be trained, or many this was just another "bad" day there.

Today's meal was cooked by opal, besides me going through the drive through and to come home to find out I payed extra for the missing sour cream on both burritos, the quesadilla was hard, felt like the tortilla was old, and was burnt.. it was not edible. Seriously... the chulpas crust was cold and also super hard... if it's old THROW IT OUT. Don't serve people food you wouldn't want to eat! In the trash!
Can you really say anything bad about a Taco Bell?  The service is probably going to be mediocre, and the food is going to be horrible for you while tasting oh so good!

The female manager that worked on 7/30/19 at 10:30pm was extremely rude and hateful. I could not understand what the man on the speaker was saying because he was mumbling so she spoke loudly and slowly, mocking me. She spoke to me like I was intellectually disabled. It was extremely offensive. My son is special needs and children have spoken to him that way to make fun of him. I asked for different kinds of sauce at the window. The man said he'd get it. The woman in the manager (plaid type) shirt came to the window and refused. I said I just wanted an assortment of sauces and she rolled her eyes. She bagged it up for me then handed it to me. I said thank you and she gave me a hateful look and walked away. I definitely will never go to this location again. That woman should not work on a position like that if she is so hateful.

If I could give this no stars I would, came here bc rome Hilliard is closed for remodeling. Only eat tbell once a month if that so I expect decent quality. This suuuuucked!! Tasted terrible, messed up our order and the nachos were so nasty. Save your money and go else where!!!

This place has gone downhill, hiring rude and lazy workers who could care less. Make sure you check everything you order here because there is a 90% chance it's wrong and overdone/underdone. Ordering online is also a joke, they just ignore what your customizations are.

I was close to giving a 1 star review. I visited the drive up window at this location. There were a lot of cars at the window, since it was lunchtime. The person taking my order was very friendly and asked how my day was going. I answered his questions and ordered the crunchwrap supreme meal. When I finally pulled up to the window, I was handed a Pepsi that was warm and had no ice. I should have handed it back, but I had a Tervis cup with ice, so I poured the Pepsi in it. I left the store before checking my order. The hard taco shell was mushy on the bottom, like it had been sitting in the store for a while due to the grease from the taco meat. The crunchwrap supreme was pressed too hard in the press and the meat, cheese and lettuce were coming out. It made it difficult to eat without making a mess.

I will never visit this Taco Bell location again, especially after reading other reviews.

Normally, this store doesn't do me dirty....until today. Ordered through the app and it told me to go thru the drive thru to get my order. Then at the drive thru, I'm told I have to go inside. That's fine. I'll do that. Inside, I wait for a bit to get my order, get in the car and go home. At home, I notice I'm missing 3 things. One being a shredded chicken toasted cheddar chalupa. I call the store, they apologize and ask if I want to come back today or tomorrow. I decide I'll use the gas in my car to go get the most expensive item I ordered. Show up, go inside again, they have it waiting for me, I say thanks and they apologize again. All fine. I get home and it's NOT THE SHREDDED CHICKEN ONE! So essentially my one order was wrong on multiple levels. Wasted gas, wasted time and now I'm just going to drink my wine and hope the rest of my order isn't screwed up

Went through the drive thru last night and was told as soon as I got the speaker. "Only 1 order per car and no more then 5 items, what do you want?"    Is this what we have come to for customer service???

I understand that this is a fast food restaurant. I'm not expecting 5 star service. What I am expecting is to get the food that I pay for. I've visited this location a number of times, all of which I have been given an incorrect order or not received all of the food that I paid for.

Totally f-ed up the order we sent on the app for pick up. We thought this must have been on purpose because of just how messed up it all was. Plus it's always the slowest moving line in the history of "fast" food.
do not get this taco bell. so disgusting. i was thinking about making myself throw it up after i took a few bites. so gross.

I get that you're busy, and perhaps understaffed, but it took 46 minutes to get our food at 9pm tonight, and that was pretty standard for anyone inside or in the drive-thru.  If it happened once, fine, but this location is notorious for 15+ minute waits.  Taco Bell corporate really needs to step in and find out what the issue is.

Not the fastest service, in times when the lines are long. But still simple goodness. I always get the same thing - no matter what location: Grilled Chicken Gordita Supreme. 

Chicken, lettuce, tomato, cheese and sour cream. Pretty easy. Like the soft, slightly chewy, slightly thicker taste of the wrap. Generally always have friendly workers at the window, too.

I would give a ZERO rating if I could . Disgusting place, DO NOT go there even if you are starving! I would rather dumpster dive before I gave them a second chance. 2019 and reading the previous reviews, not much has changed in years. I was stuck waiting in the drive -through lane for 30 (!) minutes , when I finally got to the window they proceeded to tell me that they were out of shredded chicken and it would be an additional 30 minutes to wait for them to make it. (  they did not know this 30 minutes ago when I placed the order ? There were only 3 cars in front me in the line, I guess they ALL must've ordered shredded chicken burritos ...) I opted for regular chicken instead and the employee tells me it will be more money for regular chicken. Customer service hello? You 're really going to make me pay after all the inconvenience?? Is $0.50 worth  loosing a customer?  (Similar thing happened at McDonalds and they gave me a couple of free apple pies ). Anyway, it's still not the end : even with the regular chicken ,the order wasn't ready so they  asked me to go inside and wait, there went an other 10 minutes. After I got home ,the entire order was messed up .Only 1 item was what I ordered. Originally I ordered 5 different meals and they just threw various items in the bag, whatever was ready and available I wont even mention the quality, that would be for  an other novel. Manager, owner does not care about this location at all. It is pure chaos ! Please visit at your own risk, but only if you like: long waits, poor customer service, and to not get what you want.

Rude slow morons work the night shift here. 
Don't order online! There's no point they just wait til you get there anyway.

They were out of nacho cheese.  No big deal I say.   "Go ahead and just put shredded cheese on the 3 items."  They told me they would have to upcharge the difference for EVERY single item in my order.  Are you ____ing kidding me.  You want me to pay for Erica the manager's mistake.  It's not our fault you're out of cheese, Erica!!!!!!  The nerve.  This place is now the worst ever.  Ridiculous!!!!!!! I'll never go back, and with so many Taco Bells in the area...you shouldn't waste your time or money!
Missing a drink, and a burrito also asked for hot sauce and the lady said its in the bag.. No sauce in the bag. Wasn't the first time my oder has been wrong.

Honestly this is the longest drive thru. They are really slow and sometimes they cut my crunch wrap in half (like I ask them to) and other times they refuse to. Today they said they don't have a knife in a food kitchen??? Strange how do you cut the veggies? Anyways order came out in like 15 min

This is by far the worst Taco Bell i have ever been to in my entire life!! Visited the other day at 0930 and no one came to the window even though there were no less than 5 signs saying the drive thru was open. This happens a lot at this location. They close early all the time. And if you decide to go through the drive thru...expect to spend 15 mins if you are the only car in line! If there are more cars....half an hour easily!! And make sure you check your order before you leave. I have never left with a completely correct order while going through the drive thru. It's also funny to me that the 5 star ratings on here are so specific with employees names! No way they are real reviews!! I'm now done with Taco Bell!

This is by far the best Taco Bell I've been to. I have a complicated order and they always get it perfect. The care and customer service here is unparalleled in the fast food segment. I will definitely keep coming back.

Had a problem with a drink at the drive-thru.  Told the girl at the window.  She just looked at me, with a smile on her face.  I said something else.  Same smile.  No comment.  I got home and got more upset.  I called, and asked for a manager.  A woman said she was ABOVE the manager.  I started to explain the problem.  She basically called me a liar.  THEN, without any prompting, told me I was more than welcome to call Corporate.  Because, she didn't believe me.  Extremely rude.  Will NEVER go there again.

My boyfriend and I went through the drive through today, ordered our food like normal. We paid and he asked for hot sauce, to which we were asked to give a specific number. He said 10-15. We received our food and as he was driving away I was double checking it. We were missing two chicken quesadillas and had two grilled chicken cheesey melts. We went right back through, waited our turn, and spoke to the same woman again. She insisted that we ordered the melts, and have to pay the $6 difference for the quesadillas. When my boyfriend was clarifying, asking if she was telling us we had to pay the difference because she made a mistake, she went into her 2nd, 3rd, and 4th time of literally doing the math. Not a single apology. She asked us to pull up to the window, we did, she continued with the math. This is when I spoke up and again- math. She then said she would only charge us for one quesadilla, which my boyfriend paid as we were getting nowhere, and slammed the window shut. We asked for her name, to which she stated that she won't give it out and she was not wearing a name tag. I asked if that's a new policy at tacobell, and she said no but she won't give us her name. 

Hear me out. I know it's only $6. That really wasn't the issue for me. The issue was that she spoke to us as if we were kindergarteners learning math for the first time, had a condescending tone, and then refused to give us her name. 

My boyfriend and I love tacobell, but will not be back to this *new* location.

Since the management change I've noticed big improvements! A or more friendlier service and in the mornings/early afternoon the speed has improved but whoever is working nights either needs a vacation or to find another job... this place has ridiculous drive through times at night time and employees who don't seem to care about anything.. always goofing around and unwilling to help. The place is usually super messy and unkempt wish they would carry their awesome service from the day time over to their evening rush.. for not I'll just come before dinner time starts!

This Taco Bell location is in my TOP 3 worst TACO BELLS in the USA. One of the other two isn't too far away from this one but, that's another story. I'm not quite sure how this place stays open when they seem to have more people working than any other location I've been to aside from the Vegas strip location and the wait is still over 15 minutes long. I should mention that I absolutely love Taco Bell but, as I am eating my food and writing this review, I'm starting to feel like I am getting food poisoning. No matter how bad you feel like you need to make a border run, just save it for a different border. This one is broken.
4 years later ....still sucks. You would think that they would give enough of a crap to change. $24 for our meal. It was terrible.
Don't bother. this place is dirty, staff are dirty, and I got sick the day after eating there with stomach problems. Bad!

This Taco Bell sucks. My biggest complaint is the long wait it takes to get "fast" food. It is consistently a long wait. And when you end up getting your food, it is not very good. It's not hard to see how there needs to be new management here.

If I could give this negative stars I would. No level of hangover could make this delicious. Beans were burnt. Dreams were shattered. Even the nacho cheese could not fix- and nacho cheese literally fixes everything. I still ate it, but out of sheer desperation. I don't even know what to say, I'm very disappointed. How do your workers sleep at night
I hate to say it but Taco Bell is my "go to" frugal mans lunch run. If I want something inexpensive and consistent in quality I default to Taco Bell.  Have be eating at "The Bell" for over 40 years.

SLOWEST EVER. 25min in a drive thru.. really? Ordered a beefy gordita supreme and 2 orders of nachos with cheese dip. 

Well.. My order had no cheese dip, just emptied out chips everywhere in the bag.
and my beefy gordita supreme was a soft chicken tacos. 

These.people.are.morons.

Snarky service and messed up orders. After me being polite... 
Not what I need after a 14 hour hospital shift. 
Grow tf up you miserable little turds.

It was hard to believe maybe a consequence of the current generation...but the manager something with the name of v i v....
was chastising the young employee for helping us at the cash register instead of making him make us go to the iPad computer... Which we were very uncomfortable with.... The employee was trying to help us an answer questions which the computer and every cut the manager was definitely out of line with the employee I'm not saying he was a model employee I'm just saying it is now an employee that'll leave prematurely.... This location already has an unfavorable review for very slow service.
The food was fine the restaurant was clean and all other respects everything was fine other than the management.

Stopped at this Taco Bell today after work. It's the closest to my house on the way home and it just went through a complete remodel. Boy was that a mistake! I never have high expectations when I order fast food, but I at least expect to get what I ordered. Spent $19 and not only was my order wrong (missing a taco) but the crunchy taco shells were stale and I asked for 20 hot sauces when asked how many I wanted. I know that may sound like a lot...but Taco Bell isn't the same without the sauce. I got 3 Hot Sauces and 4 Fire that I didn't even ask for....not to mention they weren't friendly. Different taco Bell next time!

Zero stars if I could. The food was AWFUL. My order was made incorrect, it was cold, and I had lettuce all in my steak quesadilla. I absolutely cannot stand lettuce and everytime I tried to take a bite there was lettuce in my food. Items that don't even require it. 

So frustrating. 11.00 down the toilet. Never again.

Wow! What an experience that I've had at this particular Taco Bell.
So I think we can all agree, it would outlandish to expect great service from any Taco Bell. I've never been at a Taco Bell where I was wowed by great customer service, a clean restaurant or having my food come out good or the way I ordered it. However, this particular Taco Bell... WOW!

So I placed an order through the app, because it's save not only me time but the employees when they can just look up the order without having to type and change everything. I go through the drive thru, get my food and pull into the parking spot because very rarely is my order correct. To no surprise to me, the order wasn't made correctly. It was close, the Gordita Crunch was made with the wrong shell which is an easy mistake but my Potato Griller was made outrageously small. I almost laughed in my car when I showed my friend it, because there's no way someone can think this is normal.

So I went inside, where a gentleman from the front desk immediately asked "Was there something wrong with your order?" I said yes, took out the two particular items in question, explaining that my Gordita Crunch was supposed to be made with the Doritos Nacho Cheese shell. I then explained that the Potato Griller was laughably small. I took it out of the wrapper to show that it's literally the length of my fingers and very thin.
The manager comes over to look, and informed me that the Potato Griller was made correctly and that is the size it's supposed to be.

I just smiled and said that's fine. I just figured I would take a picture of the burrito and ask the public if they think this is acceptable. I also was going to send the picture to Taco Bell and see what they think. I'll post the pictures to my review.

Here's my version of expectations vs reality!

Morning staff there are great, very friendly and efficient. Your order is correct and fast . However the evening staff not so good have had to wait 15 minutes for my food when eating in . Food is always good though.
i wish i could give them 10/5 stars. incredible service and wonderful people. love them xoxo

Even in a city like Austin where taco choices are abundant, sometimes you just want a little Taco Bell.  It's not exactly the greatest Tex Mex, but it reminds me of childhood days.  Not to mention it's got the uniform taste so you know that whichever Taco Bell you hit - it's going to taste exactly the same.  But honestly, we drench it in Fire and Diablo sauce, so really what we're doing is just eating sauce.  

I tend to stick to Taco Supremes cause they're basic.  But occasionally I like a tostada, and the guilty pleasure of a Dorito taco (why didn't they make these sooner?).  I also like nachos b/c chips and cheese.

If you're going to ask drive through customers to pull around front and wait for their food, can you please not forget about them? After waiting out front for 20 minutes, I was finally able to flag down an employee who was bringing food out to someone else that was parked. I had to remind her what I had been waiting for, and then she forgot items in my order when she finally brought it out. 

As you can imagine, after having my food sit on a counter inside for 20 minutes, once I finally got to eat it, it was completely soggy. The crunchy tacos fell apart and the nachos were more like a gross tortilla soup.
First time here since the remodel. I ordered the nacho party pack... It was as good as the commercial made it look! The crew was fast and friendly... So happy this one is open again!

Went here the other day and OMG it is really nice, granted the store just opened recently. Yes this location moved from 650 to 1536 Georgesville Rd. 

The staff is nice, regular taco bell food you would get from any location. The new store is worth the visit.

Food is usually fine. But the wait is outrageous. Spent 25 minutes in the drive though on this particular occasion. There were 7 cars in front of me to be fair, but speediness is not something I associate with this location.

My review went fro 5 to 1. Idk what the hell happened this last year but I've gone twice now in the last two weeks. I had to go back more than twice each time and it still was incorrect. I don't get any extras, I don't get special orders, I got regular menu items and they could not get them right after twice each time so it isn't worth dealing with. Couldn't get a refund because I would have to go back AGAIN only for the refund. They aren't hard orders. 3 regular soft tacos, I soft taco supreme, 1 cheese Gordita crunch supreme and 1 nachos and cheese and it was NEVER right, even after I went back specifically for those missing or incorrect items. Pathetic. Don't waste your time or money

Ok, it's Taco Bell.  You know what your getting as far as food quality.  Food here will taste the same at any other location.  
I don't go to Taco Bell very often, so maybe this is an issue elsewhere, but everytime I've gone to this location over the past 6 months, the drive thru has been painfully slow.  
First time, over 30 minutes.  And it's not like there were many cars in line.  
Second time, there were maybe 8 cars in line.  I turn around from the line and park, go inside, order my food, which took about 5 minutes, got in my car and saw that the line had only moved up one car.  Similar experience the third time.
Fourth time, only 1 car at the window.  Can't be that long, can it?  10 minutes between ordering and getting my food.  And I'm not ordering a lot.  Usually just a griller or two.
Bottom line, if you come to this location, don't bother with the drive thru.
Very fast service considering there were many cars and they were very very generous when it came to giving us sauce. Also very friendly customer service :)

I asked for two number five boxes and a quesadilla meal with no chicken .... they gave me two number fives and a quesadilla with chicken instead and then I had to wait about 20 minutes for them to give me the correct order ;( 

There was also a lack of care in the way the crunch wraps were wrapped. Mostly tortilla instead of filling. ;(

Not only the slowest Taco Bell I've ever been to, but slowest 'fast food' restaurant I've ever been to. I usually don't leave negative reviews but when you've tried to go to this location at different times of the day, and different days of the week and you ALWAYS spend at least 25min in line then something is wrong with either their employees or process. 
Tonight we pulled in to a line of 6 waiting to order. And decided to go across the street to Wendy's due to this places history. As we pulled out, with our food in hand, we saw that a car that would have been 2 cars ahead of us (AT&T truck) STILL hadn't placed its order.
Literally no excuse, this place refuses to be and do better. It's not like their making food from scratch or gourmet meals.
They ALWAYS underfill tacos.... Just lettuce and cheese. And they rush you when you order. Rude and LAZY!!

The posted hours at this Taco Bell say that they are open until 4am. I just went there at 3 am and they claimed they could not serve me any food because their "whole system just shut down."  I said I would add up the amount of my order for them, since they were telling me their cash register wouldn't work, and I could pay cash.  They then told me no, that all their food was cold because of this shut down.  I said I didn't believe them because if their system "just" shut down then the food would be still be hot.  I said, okay, sell me my burrito cold and I'll heat it up at home.  They said they couldnt' do it because it was against the law.  

As someone who has worked in fast food before, I can tell that these guys are lying to me, changing their story, because they want to shut the store an hour early.  I'm very irritated and plan to call the city to tell them the posted hours are not being met.  They also claimed that they had placed a call to "headquarters" to try and get the system restarted, and that headquarters said that they would call them back.  I don't know why they think anyone would believe such a moronic story.  I have never in my life witnessed a fast food establishment that could be shut down (or turned back on) by some magic button at "headquarters."  BTW, if you are management of this store, this happend on the morning of September 28 at 3am, just so you know who is ripping you off by not keeping the store open at posted hours.

While most of the food I ordered was fine (four crunchy tacos).  The one big item I ordered was the new Grilled Cheese Burrito, which is supposed to have a layer of cheese grilled and crusted to the top of the burrito.  What I got instead was a burrito covered in cold shredded cheese that looked unappetizing and unappealing.  I'm very surprised that the person making this item actually believed this was a serviceable food item.  Disappointing...
Taco Bell is...well, you know. But the staff at this location is always courteous, respectful, and fast.

This location is the worst. They are SLOW AS HELL. One of the girl that's allegedly a manager is rude as hell. Have on multiple occasions closed early for no reason.  Or get to the drive thru and when arriving at the order box are told they just closed, at like 11:30pm. Hours posted are until 2am. And rarely got our orders right. Have stopped going to this location after giving them chances. Cleanly service was not getting better and no one higher up seems to care.
Last trip waited in line got to the order Box and was told I was gonna have to sit there for 15 minutes before I could even order. And when I asked why it was a 15 minute wait when there were only 2 cars that had bothered to order and not left the line in front of me I was literally told "take it or leave it". 
Don't give these a holes your money.  Go to Whataburger next door.  Or drive down to William cannon if you're that in need of Taco Bell

FOOD POISONING ALERT!#!#!#

Absolutely disgusting. First there were two managers on duty that were causing scenes
 Yelling obscenities  at there workers because they were taking to slow. They did have 6 workers and it took us 10 min to get food (no apology) it was dead.

Then they Screwed the order up. This isn't even the worst part. I'm going to report them to health department. This was the dirtiest  fast food restaurant I have ever been to. I guarantee they haven't cleaned this place in months. I'm 33 and in my entire life have never seen a worse managed and disgusting place. That's counting inner city places.  Still not the worst. Me and my fiance decided to eat in our car since the seats were crusted with filth. .....we got food poisoning!  Do not go here!!! They need shut down before the kill someone.

To be honest I think every Taco Bell is the exact same. Some of the time the service is really good and some of the time the service is extremely horrible. Some of the times the food is really good and some of the time the food gives you diarrhea. Specially when it comes to the Happyvalley location seems like it's a hit or miss with the food and the service is good. Obviously every time I'm going here and I'm not coming here for the service I'm coming here because I just want to quick bite to eat and I just want to go home. I've never ate inside before but I always to go everything and go through the drive-through. There's always a line because this is the only Taco Bell and Happyvalley and the other one is all the way down on 82nd. Again nothing special.

OK, first of all... I know Taco Bell is not authentic Mexican food. I also know it's not even very good food. However, every once in awhile, you have to give into your knowingly slutty cravings and dive head first into some truly heinous fast food. When that mood strikes me, I head straight for "The Border."

While I don't expect "The Bell" to be a culinary experience, I do at least expect it to be edible. Sadly for me, my Mexican pizza turned out to be anything but. Now I know there are some of you who are probably smugly grinning that I've gotten exactly what I deserved... but this was new levels of awful. In fact, saying it was awful would be an insult to awful food.  

From the unfortunately pliable tortillas to the woefully flavorsome sauce, the entire experience was about as enjoyable as scaling a mountain of dung. A mountain of dung covered in burned salsa sauce and a thick sheet of unmelted plastic cheese. I could go on, but good taste and decency prevents me from doing so. I even tried feeding it to our office intern and he turned it down. When the starving college student turns down free grub, you know there's a problem.

I know every Taco Bell isn't like this, so I'll save my cravings for times where I'm around the locations  I know. But please... for the love of God and your stomach lining, avoid this branch. I would have been better off licking the bathroom floor.

Y'all literally put no meat in my Crunchwrap what the F? 

I guess I gotta add more words to make this a review
Ordered one meal with three regular tacos and one mea with three supreme tacos... got five regular tacos and one supreme... thanks.

Our order was taken inaccurately, and we were charged for items we did not want. Additionally, there was no Baja Blast.

When asking to get the order corrected, we were told 'no refunds' since the manager had told them 'too many refunds'. We were given some free items instead, which we didn't want.

We will not be returning to this location.

While speed isn't their main concern, in the past, the staff has been friendly....until last evening. I went through the drive through around 11:15 pm. It took about 15min to get to the order speaker with only one car in front of me. I am vegetarian and order my food without meat. I ordered five soft tacos but asked to substitute the meat with beans. This facility has never had an issue with this....until this evening. The man on the microphone didn't know how to properly silence the mic and I heard everything. He was obviously not too happy with my order as he said some profanity about the custom order I gave him. Instead of substituting the meat, he took the meat off but tried to charge me extra for beans. When I told him it shouldn't be extra, he said that facility doesn't offer that. When I told him I never have a problem ordering it that way before, his response was "'Then how do you do it?"'in a very negative way. He then thought his mic was silent and I heard him cuss more about the order.' I told him to forget it and pulled away. I will NEVER return here. Thanks Taco Bell. You have lost another long-time customer. Please do yourself a favor and AVOID this place at all cost. It's certainly not worth the money or time to be treated like that.

Approximately 30 minutes I waited for 4 burritos on a Sunday night. There seemed to be some sort of lack in team work, communication, and leadership. I hope the staff doesn't get punished for the poor leadership, or lack there of. Save yourself sometime, go elsewhere to eat or come before you actually hungry.

I don't normally go out of my way to write reviews for fast food places, but upon seeing how low the reviews for this Taco Bell are I just wanted to leave my thoughts. I have had nothing but positive experiences at this Taco Bell. The staff are always very friendly and pretty quick even when they are busy. On my most recent visit the gentleman at the window gave me a few peppermints and said happy holidays. :)

I love this place my food is always made very well and I get my order very good and some people hate Taco Bell but I'm in love with Taco Bell . 
There is very good service there there was this lady who complimented me and she made me very happy because it was the day my uncle died and ever since that day Taco Bell has been my to-go place. Thanks you Taco Bell for being there and making the best place in Texas for me that my be the place I start my career because I'm still in school . I tell my mom to take me there when I get money because I love Taco Bell and when I go out with my friends we always end up going to Taco Bell because of me . So thank you Taco Bell for everything

This location has gone way downhill. I stopped by today for lunch and almost decided to leave before I even got my food. I placed my order in the drive through. I ordered a Nacho Fries Box with a large Dr. Pepper. A simple order with nothing extra. I pull up to the window and was met by a very uninterested girl. She hands me a large Mountain Dew Baja Blast. I politely stated that I had ordered a large Dr Pepper. She then rolled her eyes, pours out the wrong drink and proceeds to fill up the same cup with Dr Pepper. She didn't rinse out the incorrect drink at all. I wanted to have her remake it but decided that the backlash I received from her first mistake would have only escalated further. 

The food was hot and seemed to be ok. The Dorito's shell was stale as was the burrito tortilla. 

Now I understand the 91 health score. 

I will not be back to this location.

They can literally never get an order correct. I asked for the grilled cheese burrito with chicken instead of beef. As always they charge me for the chicken and give me beef anyways. Usually rude customer service as well.

I know drive thrus aren't the greatest experience in general but this is the worst one I have ever been to. It's Thursday night at 9:27 and I was in line for 20 minutes. The employee told the person in front of me she didn't know anyone was there. Mind you there's 7 cars...oy

The guy who took our order was a total bro. I told him I'd write a good review on yelp for his outstanding bro-ness, and goddammit thats what im going to do.

Allow me to paint you a picture. 

Austin, Texas. 
1:15 am. 
Approximately 4.5 million degrees.  
The sound of cicadas and unnervingly-close gunfire permeate the torrid night air.

Contrary to what television and those stupid pictures you see every ten seconds on facebook would have you believe, one can not buy groceries with swag, which we have in nearly criminal amounts, thus our apartment is nearly devoid of all food. 

After about a week of failed attempts at finding ways to cook and eat swag, we decided we better eat something tangible, as the hunger hallucinations seemed to be getting worse by the hour.

We braved the gunfire and bird-sized flying insects and made a frantic, flailing sprint to our vehicle.

Safely, thanks for asking.

We arrived at this Taco Bell, emaciated and disoriented, but alive, having survived on the a fore mentioned swag alone.

The man taking our order was very patient as we struggled through the daunting task of trying to order tacos while hiding hungerections caused by the excitement of being so close to real food for the first time in weeks. If that sounds awkward to you, try being in the car at the time. Moving on.

Minutes (or possibly hours) later, we successfully communicated our desires to the magic food dispensing talking box, which told us to drive up to the window. 

The guy at the window was incredibly friendly, and I briefly considered asking him to be my super best friend, but I then felt that may have been too much of a commitment this early into the relationship. Baby steps.

He told us our total, and with doe eyes we held out a wad of crumpled bills and some sweaty coins and asked if this was enough to make our stomach hurts go away. 
"Yes." he said, voice shaking ever so slightly. "Yes it is.", and cupping his hands together, collected our humble offerings, disappearing into the fluorescent food  palace of salvation.

It was at this moment that I noticed the huge poster in the window of the Doritos Locos Taco, and because I have the mind of a child, I'm all "Oh hellz yeah, gotta get me some of that shit!"

So as our Mighty Taco Lord came back to give us our change, I ordered one of those too. He wasn't annoyed at this in the slightest, suggesting that either he has kids, or maybe he's actually, for realzies, Jesus. I'm thinking Jesus, because not only did he get me that taco...he said it was on the house, if I just did him a solid and took some survey. 

I think thats how Scientoligists get people, but whatever, free taco!

Our order, including my last minute addition, were made exactly as we asked. No tomatoes on my taco, no ice in our drink, everything was perfect. Not only is Taco Jesus super nice, he's also a good listener (ladies).

Not only was everything made to perfection, it was also ready very quickly. Like, seriously. Ninja fast. Everything was done before we even knew it started (uhh...ladies?)

So would I recommend this place? I'd recommend you thank it for making sunny days and pretty girls every night before you go to bed, fool.

I hope Taco Jesus the Mega Bro reads this so he understands the difference being nice to one person can make. I wish I would've remembered your name, dude. 

P.S. That was my first Doritos Locos taco and it was fucking amazing. 

--------------------------------------------------------------------Stay Rad,
                                                                                                Charlie Spleen
I can't do it any more. Slowest drive thru ever, 24/7. Though it's convenient, I would rather drive to a different location that understands fast food.

Have loved Taco Bell for years tonight my gf and I got chalupas, both of which had a human hair inside the food and then when I called to get a refund the manager says well I see everyone wearing a hair net, I said I didn't call to talk about hair nets I want a refund, he continued to go on about hair nets. I hung up and now leaving this review... this was the Kirkman rd Taco Bell next to kfc in Orlando Florida, I will never go to this location again!!!!
Food is always great quality  and correct. the staff is nice & friendly. Most other Taco Bell's  don't put in as much effort as this one!

I am APPALLED. I stopped at the drive through on my way home and ordered a supreme Doritos locos taco. Doesn't sound like a hard order, right? Thankful I still checked because of course and not to my surprise, somehow the order was wrong. I was given a Doritos locos Taco with ONLY lettuce and some cheese in it.......?! 

Things only get worse. I now have to waste my time going back through the drive through to have them fix my order and when I get to the window the manager is there. I politely explained that my Taco only had lettuce and cheese (still not sure why). With no response the Lady shut the window in my face and came back 3-5 minutes later with another bag. I said thank you and left thinking maybe she just had a bad day but thought it was nice of her to make me a new Taco and let me keep the other one.

Well, I didn't check the bag this time. I get home to find that not only did I not get a correctly made taco, but she gave me a side of sour cream. That's ALL that was in my paper bag. A SIDE OF SOUR CREAM?! There was absolutely no one in the store at that point and there was no one in line. Pure and disappointing laziness that they couldn't even remake my single taco correctly and instead just gave me a side of sour cream (which still doesn't complete my correct taco order). 


I am at utter disbelieve that service can be that poor. Especially since my dad has worked for the Corporate part of Taco Bell for the last 5 years. You'll be hearing from us soon, you picked the wrong person to stiff on a taco.

I ordered cinnamon twist with my order. I didn't get them. I asked for hot sauce. Didn't get any. Not even 1 napkin to accompany my food. Now, I'm home with an upset child because I promised her cinnamon twist. Thanks guys! Oh, and it was not even close to be being busy.

This is the worst Taco Bell in this area. Terrible service and terrible food. It looks dirty and no one in the restaurant cares. I won't be back. The chips were stale! The cinnamon twist were stale!  Hopefully I don't get food poisoning! Plus it's raining and you close the drive thru. I swear they can't get right!

We were reminded this week about why we don't go to Taco Bell that often.  Could it be because they don't hire anyone with the capability to carry on a basic conversation, much less take an order?  Probably.  It could also be because they are slow, and consistently make mistakes on the orders.  It took my wife nearly twenty minutes to complete her transaction...for a to go order.  The employees were extremely slow and inaccurate, and actually wasted her time by not trying to solve concerns without getting all the information first.  Then to top it off, she brought the food home and it was cold.  For an area with several more restaurants to choose from, this location definitely shouldn't be at the top of anyone's list.

The 7 Cardinal Sins of Yelp: Taco Bell on Lee Road Edition

Lust: After a few hours of rigorous Valentines day shopping I had a burning desire in my chest, deep in my heart, to shame eat some fast food so I could make it home quickly and not have to stop for actual groceries.

Pride: I arrived at this location and pulled it up on Yelp but didn't check in... I couldn't let all of my new Yelp friends know that I was dishonoring the essence of an Orlando foodie by debasing myself to this level with my poor dining choice. 

Gluttony: As I look over the menu quickly, deciding whether I need not only one but two cheesy gordita crunches this evening, I suddenly realize that there are four employees behind the counter standing around and blatantly ignoring me. I was fascinated by this and became so perplexed that it wasn't until a 5th employee showed up (about 3 minutes after I was standing at the register with my wallet out. No one else in the establishment.) that I realized it was more of an inherent problem at this location and not just me. Which brings me to

Sloth: This is literally the only word I can use to describe the woman who was my cashier. She slowly sauntered up to the register while texting on a huge android pone and stood there for another two minutes texting and completely ignoring me. I am not exaggerating. She literally stood less than two feet away, at the register, as I tried to make any sort of eye contact, texting, for two entire minutes. When she finally put her phone down and took my order she got everything into the computer and, before taking my credit card, picked the phone up to send just one more text.

Envy: Typically I would have walked out after the first 30 seconds of being ignored by the texting wonder but I knew that the story for this Yelp review would be well worth the envy of my colleagues.

Greed: I filled out the survey on my receipt to let Tavo Bell know about the abysmal service I received and then greedily filled out the sweepstakes link to win $500 for my response. It was fulfilling to know that my ire may all be made worth it with my entry into this contest, and I was suddenly pleased and satisfied. It also could have been the gordita. but I digress.

Wrath: This review is the 7th of the cardinal sins of Taco Bell on Lee Road. I have exacted my vengeance through an open and scathing review and can now say that I will definitely never return to this location again. Ever. Unless I am a little more hungry than usual on my way home and forget that this all happened.

This place is not only beyond cheap, but messy as well.  It seems like every item on their menu has shrunk in size and gotten more expensive.  And its pretty disgusting to look at food laying all over the floor as you wait in the drive thru.  Don't think I will be going back.
Closing six hours early due to "technical issues"? That's what you have I.T. & maintenance for: to fix your issues to maintain business. Seems like a cop out just to not have to work.

This location couldn't even meet the low expectations I have for fast food restaurants.  I ordered the soft tacos combo with no lettuce.  The tacos are supposed to be supreme so even without the lettuce i was supposed to have tomato and sour cream in them.  All of my tacos came with only meat and cheese.  I also ordered the electric swirl raspberry drink that they have been promoting.  The man on the window hadn't been trained how to do it so the sour mix wasn't dispersed through the whole drink it just sat at the bottom.
This place needs a fresh review. I've been coming here on my work breaks (7 pmish) for the past 3 months and this crew is fast, courteous, patient and professional. Food always turns out great

As a former employee and normal costumer at this Tacobell I feel undermined by this whole situation. Not to tell a elaborate story so I'll keep it brief. I walked into the lobby and was trying to see my favorite employee, after being told that he's busy I sat down. After 10mins the GM Vinay, tells me that it's not okay for me to be in there if I'm not ordering, which okay so I left. After walking out the door I wanted to use the restroom, walking back inside I am followed into the restroom by the GM confronted and asked "What are you doing in here" "What are you a f***ing faggot" being a former employee and a respectful person I don't believe this is a way any establishment based on costumer service should operate...

This Taco Bell location has been drastically going downhill. The late night drive-thru staff are rude, and are idiots. Especially the most recent crew as of 4/9/19. I had a mobile order of 8 items for my family, spent 30mins in the drive-thru only to receive 3 items. Then they tell me to pull around again, waited 10mins to get to the order box and they tell me "we have your missing 2 items" I told them "3 and 2 does not equal 8, I had ordered 8 items". After this is was another 10mins to get to the window and another 10mins wait at the the window for the rest of my items and to top it off, the guy didn't apologize for the inconvenience and gripped when I wanted the first 3 items remade as they were now cold. The order still wasn't correct after an hour of dealing with them. I'll be visiting the Hilliard Rome or Georgesville location from now on.

Ordered inside to eat in the resturant and it took 13 minutes to receive four tacos and two burritos. Tacos came already broken in several pieces. Burritos were luke warm at best.. Staff was standing around on phones and chatting it up. I enjoy Taco Bell, but I'll never go to this location again.
Big portions of affordable, mediocre Americanized Mexican food.

Messed up my 2 vegetarian burritos I ordered al fresco. They gave me a steak and a chicken burrito. I drive back to the restaurant after getting home to replace my burritos. 
The person at the window insisted on inspecting the burrito and made me give them my already purchased burritos back through the drive thru.
They didnt seem to believe me like I was trying to scam them out of two 3 dollar burritos. 
They told me I was confused, that the meat was actually beans. This was hostile treatment just over me wanting to get the burritos I ordered.
Check your food before you drive off maybe even record yourself ordering as ridiculous as that sounds. One star because I cant give zero.

Worst Taco Bell ever. We stopped coming here a few months ago and have been driving 15 minutes out of our way to visit a different location but because it's right around the corner from home, we decided to try it again. Big mistake. The Mt. Dew had no ice, was warm and flat, like it had been sitting all day and the ground beef tastes like it was left over from last night. For as much as they have raised their prices, you would think that you could get some decent food. Never going here again.

Elizabeth F was our cashier, & she was so nice & so friendly .. I actually left wanting to be her friend lol. Treat that girl well ! She deserves it , seriously this is coming from a bar manager. I would hire her just by our brief encounter. Thank you! -from the girl w the hand sanitizer:) lol

Terrible!!!! I'm disappointed every time I go. Service was slow and my order was burnt and soggy. The food is gross. They need to check their food before serving it to people. They gave me old hard potatoes. I will not suggest this location

The worst. Every. Single. Time. 
Every time we wait for at least 20 minutes in the drive through. Every time there's something if not, multiple things wrong with our order. The workers are painstakingly slow and if you dare to ask for something that you ordered that they've screwed up to be corrected, you will get a stare down and attitude like you've never experienced. How Taco Bell is okay with this franchise existing is beyond me.

This place was horrendous. I eat Taco Bell once every 3 years or so, and I usually enjoy it. Not only did I wait in the drive thru for 10+ minutes, but when I got my chalupas, they were cold and stale. When I went inside to get my food exchanged for fresh food, it looked as if the place was burning down with all of the smoke lingering in the air. I've wasted enough time writing this, so I will bid this review adieu. 

Two chalupas down.

We were just here 10 minutes ago and we ordered three hardshell tacos, a crunch wrap and a bean burrito and asked them to substitute the meat for refried beans on all of them. Not only did all of our tacos have meat on them, there were no napkins and none of the sauces we asked for in the bag. Before we pulled away we asked for straws and the young man there affirmed they were in the bag. They were not. The Crunchwrap was soggy and falling apart, but that really didn't matter because it had meat in it and I could not eat it. My partner, who has been a vegan for 26 years, was horrified to find ground beef in his taco after he bit into it. If you go to this location you have to be very specific and check your food before you drive away.

Still no apology from Taco Bell or the manager. A guy by the name Roger, emailed me saying next time we stop in I can get a free meal. No apology and an offer to eat at a place that caused food poisoning. Who is running this place! I emailed corporate 2 times and still no response. 

I'll keep updating
Not great. Slow service, dirty bathrooms. The food was alright. The only redeeming feature was the friendly crew members.
This place is the worst. Why do I keep giving it another shot? They mess up my order more than they get it right. I've been waiting on effing chalupas for 15 min.

Should be given no stars. Came in her yesterday for a few of their new boxes. The drive thru had some people in it, so I went inside to order (that was a mistake I later regretted). I ordered on their touch screen, and then I waited. (Keep in mind they had four people back there). 10 minutes gone by-- hadn't even received my drinks yet. 20 minutes gone by-- hadn't received my drinks yet. Almost 30 minutes gone by-- I finally received my drinks. It took them another five minutes to bring food out. I asked for some Diablo and mild sauce (that was a mistake I regretted), it took them another five minutes to even bring out sauce. The person who gave me the food looked sad as hell. I didn't get "a sorry for the wait", "Hello", "kiss my ass", "Have a good one", no nothing. I thought I was at the DMV there for a second.

Stopped by on Friday Jan. 8 2021 at 1140 pm. They were closed lights were off. I drove by Jan 9th at the same time and a full line in the drivethru. Some consistency there right. Had my last two mobile orders wrong. Just won't go back there anymore.

AVOID THIS PLACE AT ALL COST!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I went there last night at 9:10 it took 4 times to order a taco and 2 burritos.  Finally the woman acknowledged my order after having to repeat it 4times/  I pulled behind one car ahead of me, it was obvious that the people at the window and the occupants of the car knew each other they were laughing and joking.....I'm not against saying hello to friends or relatives but, after 20 minutes I backed up and left.

It's Taco Hell for goodness sake not a gourmet restaurant.  I thought that the Fast in Fast Food meant you'd get your meal in a timely fashion.  I should have known better these guys could screw up a one car funeral, I've been here many times before they get your order wrong and when you point it out to them they make sure to let you know you are being a bother for expecting to actually get what you paid for,

They are combined with a KFC and owned by Yum Brands, I can't imagine the franchisee would like what is going on there but they probably don't care because this place has had bad customer service for years.

I'm so confused by this locations low rating! This is the nearest Taco Bell to my house so (sadly) I visit often. Never once have I had an issue with my order,
Missing items, or a rude worker. In fact I'm always super surprised by how polite and pleasant the people in the drive through are. My orders have always been correct and tasty, all items included and in good shape. Sometimes I believe that the key to getting good service is... wait for it..... treating the workers with respect! It's controversial I know, but I've had no issues implementing this practice in my own life and think other people would genuinely profit if they did the same.

I swear they try to get your order wrong at this Taco Bell. I have yet to order from this location and have all the food be correct or edible. Taco Bell is great, but this location obviously does not care. Find a different one
If you're constipated, this food is sure to save you with some diarrhea.

I feel as if every time I go to this location at night something is wrong. Last night they told me the order will be at least 30 minutes so I decided to leave and many other cars did as well. The time before took forever for my food and when I finally got my grilled cheese burrito it was pathetic and way smaller than the one I got from another Taco Bell. They're hardly any times I go to this location where I'm not disappointed.

This place cannot he asked to get orders right at all and with no way indoors during a pandemic to correct this in person you are basically screwed if you don't take the receipt. Do not bother with this place.

I swear they always messing up my order... I ask for Diorite  Loco taco supreme and 
Chalupa beef supreme ... didn't get ...
Just picked up an order that I ordered online in the food was very mediocre and they forgot my crunch wrap supreme which I ordered and paid for do not recommend this place.

Taco Bell I'm confused as hell... 
I pulled up to the window and was greeted very nicely but when I when I asked to order a quesarito they told me I could only order it on the app. I even clarified "so if I back up and place the order online I can order the item?" She confirmed...
I honestly don't understand the logic here 
I wanted what I was craving so I backed up and ordered it online in the parking lot and came back thru saying I was here to pick up. 
The biggest disappointment turned into how my chicken quesarito ended up being beef...
This location needs to get it together

After many drive thru visits here, I'm over this location of Taco Bell. Taco Bell is usually a great late night or fast food craving of mine. It typically helps after a long night out or the Sunday scaries, but this location has continued to disappoint me. The service the during my past two visits has really opened my eyes to a decline. Getting a bag of cold food tonight really put the chill to the icing on the cake. The service was extra slow tonight (Maybe, there were not many employees working at late night). The cashier that greeted me looked angry, and I did not get a receipt. I could be a little over protective mom when it comes to things like receipts, but it's a huge pet peeve of mine to pay with my card and not get a receipt. Too much anxiety going to this location now that cold nacho fries can't cure.
Worst run Taco Bell in the country, 30 min waits in the drive through are the norm, trash everywhere.

Having lived in California, New Mexico and Phoenix, this is the worst managed Taco Bell in the US!!!!, I have been in the drive through for over 40 minutes on several occasions just to get the wrong order. and the workers are consistently rude and indifferent, needs new manager and GM that cares immediately. The Taco Bell at 212 and old 82nd or the one by Clackamas Town center is worth the drive to avoid this location at all costs. Why Taco Bell does not shut this location down is a mystery.....,,,

Order placed: four crunchy tacos with sour cream added and a supreme beef burrito. They were out of sauce. Received three crunchy tacos no sour cream and a bean burrito. Just lazy, mess up, "who cares" teenage bull shit. Go to Whataburger after the bar.  This place can't find their own ass. 

CB

Way back in the day when you got rid of black olives and chives I was disappointed. Not throwing up any road blocks or holding up picket signs or anything.  Then you got rid of the super discounted menu. Ouch. It was so fun eating a full meal of basically terrible food for $1.89. But hey times change I get it. 
But then the enchirito disappeared, and then the big beef meximelt. I thought how dare you Taco Bell! Are we  but mear slaves to your decisions as a corporation that suck and take away the reason we went to your crappy place in the first place? But then it happened. You took away the Mexican pizza!!!  What the Bell???? I and many of my friends now have zero reason to go and eat at Taco Bell. Yeah there's the Dorito taco but even those get old. And being as smart as you seem to be I'm sure they will be discontinued along with everything you ever served that was actually yummy. Shame on You Taco Bell, shame you to Bell!

The reason for this comment is because I went to this Taco Bell and I ordered the chalupa combo ,and my home from this place is like 5 minutes and when I got home I was ready to enjoy my chalupa and gave my first bite it was pretty cold inside and out I hope this comment helps the employees do a better job.

I wish I could give zero stars because I ate there tonight and now I have been vomiting and have had diarrhea 
 for hours ever since because they gave me the lovely gift of food poisoning. I thought I was getting some cheap great tacos and quesadillas but instead my girlfriend gets to listen to what sounds like an exorcism happening in our bathroom and can't even sleep in the same bed as me tonight. Thanks for the war zone of vomit that is my bathroom toilet currently. I can't even think about ever eating a chicken quesadilla again thanks to this Taco Bell location.
Very bad service, waited 15 minutes at drive thru and no response.

It's only good when good people work. Went back twice and the order was still incorrect. I'm so tired of going back to get a simple order without any special requests right (others on stringtown are the same or worse) but the managers are willing to listen and I'm almost sure they are the ones who I praised for their customer service and quick reliable orders, and they were really good and said they are training new employees so hopefully they can get things sorted out.

This location always skimps on the fillings. I'm not sure if they think lettuce and tomato are that expensive, but I've paid extra for "extra" lettuce and tomato and still received less than standard. 
The last time I went they managed to mess up every item that we ordered, including giving us some of the wrong items. The staff was rude and didn't greet us at the window or even make eye contact. 0/10, would not recommend and will not be back.

This location is filthy the customer service is trash. I sat in the drive thru for 20 minutes before giving my money OR getting food. When I FINALLY GOT MY FOOD I took a sip of my drink only to find out my Sierra Mist was nothing but seltzer water. I turned around because I had already spent majority of my lunch break in this one drive thru so I want what I paid for. I went inside and there were about 6 guests who had not even been assisted waiting to order. I asked the drive thru associate if she could give me a different drink and she did then I asked where the manager was and how to put in a corporate complaint and they told me to fill out a survey and the associate DESTINIE informed me the manager was right in my face, THIS BROAD DIDNT EVEN TURN AROUND. BULL SHIT I am a customer service manager as I know the ropes all too well I asked who the franchise owner was and no one wanted to give me that information I asked the manager whAt her name was and her response" I'm in the military so by law I don't have to give you that information" AGAIN THAT IS BULLSHIT WHEN YOU SIGNED UP TO BE A MANAGER AT TACO BELL NOT in corporate.  She then said she could help me with anything I needed so I asked for a refund and SHE ASKED FOR MY FOOD back !!!! Are you fucking kidding me !? I will be reporting everyone working on that shift and I will make it MY PRIORITY to speak with whomever is in charge of them. I did have a name on my receipt, I RECOMMEND YOU DONT COME TO THIS TRASHY LOCATION!!!!

First off I know Taco Bell is not Mexican food. Secondly I also understand that it's fast food which inherently is unhealthy and crap.
So why would I be motivated to write a review about a fast food restaurant? Well sometimes places just go below and beyond your lowest expectations. Yesterday was one of those times.
I ordered a steak Cantina Bell Burrito. Normally that is the only healthy thing on Taco Bell's menu. In a pinch, it's my go to meal if I really need sustenance. But yesterday, I experienced one of the most deplorable examples of burrito construction imaginable.
A year ago maybe more I was pleasantly surprised by the introduction of the Cantina bell menu. The food was almost and I mean almost authentic. It was made with seemingly real ingredients and it actually tasted good. Approximately a year ago I experienced a slow systematic decline in the quality of the Cantina Bell menu. I thought for a moment it was just a one off experience but unfortunately it wasn't,
Yesterday it hit rock bottom..... As I slowly un-wrapped the significantly undersized Cantina Bell Steak Burrito I witnessed an abomination. The ingredients upon first taste were utterly disgusting. The meat and vegetables were not fresh and the texture was mush. It tasted somewhat like I would imagine dog food tasting. It was assembled poorly and it was oozing upon first bite. What a load of filth..... To think, the Cantina menu actually tasted good once upon a time.
Well this morning I experienced the predictable of outcome to a most disgusting and vile burrito experience. Yep, what goes in as a mushy array of filth is disposed of in the same fashion. I'm through with you Taco Bell, not even once more.....

I have no idea who the employee was, but they were absolutely amazing. I've never had such a great experience at a Taco Bell. Just the nicest, most respectful and calm person I've ever seen at this location. Whoever is working the window 9/27/2020 at 3:35pm needs a raise, without a doubt.

How many of you have been ripped off by this store by not giving your drive thru order of cinnamon twists? 4 out of 5 times they missed putting it in my bag. I am beginning to think that this is a stinky company policy because I ordered thru UberEats at the Allen location and they "forgot" to put it in my bag too.

Lamb on ta day! Grabs my own ear & chant (Woosah Woosah)!

Listen folk, I love a good ol' taco bell (crack bell as I usually refer to it). Usually I receive my order and I'm happy. Today, of all days, I decided I wanted something quick on my way home from the grocery store. I know I should have cooked but that's beside the point. I decided to stop through the drive through and ordered what I thought would be a Nacho Bell Grande with no Sour Cream. In its place, I received a sorry presentation of food, no meat, & dried crusty beans.  

To makes matters worse, I got all the way home and discovered this monstrosity of food. If I could give a zero I would.

If i could give this place zero stars i would. Lady got our order wrong then gave us attitude when she realized she had given us 10 tacos instead of the only two we ordered. We definitely could've driven off with 10 tacos and she still probably wouldn't even noticed. Then after asking us to pull up to the front - she still got our order wrong.. long story short  maybe if you come to this location around 10pm you'll get extra free tacos cause the people who work there obviously don't know how to read .
Love this place. I want to be buried in the parking lot next to the dumpster when i die.

So going through the drive thru and uh you left your mic on. To hear they say i don't like these people while our kids are ordering. Then ask about it and they were like I was talking to my co worker. Uhm yeah about us we didn't say anything to warrant that. Yep if my kid wasn't hungry I would have left wont go back.

This is the ABSOLUTE worst Taco Bell that have EVER been to! They lost my business over a $1.29 shredded chicken quesadilla melt. The rude shift manager came out to my car to let me know his hands were tied over a $1.29 item when the had screwed up my original order. I had to drive back there after already getting home. Wow, I am in shock of how ignorant this younger generation is and it scares me to think what in the heck is going to happen to these kids. Totally unacceptable! I would give negative stars if I could!

If you want a lettuce taco this is the place to go. Do not go here if you are hungry. The portion of food is not just. On top of staying hungry after paying for a meal their attitudes are the worst when you bring it to their attention. The staff here will give you less food and an attitude to remember for unpleasantness. Taco bell you are trash. You false advertise for commercials but what you get goes far from what is being portrayed.

Forget about critiquing the food- we all know it's cheap junk food. But that's not my issue with this place. Rather it's the grumpy old woman who ruined the experience both times I've visited here. There won't be a third time.

Well, well, well... Sorry but Taco Bell is not getting better. It's getting worse, probably the business attitude of the younger generation who believes in fast service not good service. Pick-up: by the time my sister got home the food was way too cold, didn't have that natural beefy taco taste & texture. The steak burrito could have been done the exact way in the ad. Would not be recommended, twice a deep failure. When you tell them to put the sauce on the side, they still pit it on the food. They are certainly hard of hearing English/Spanish. I would send a picture but I would be charged for insulting the senses. What in tarnation happened? Clean up your businesses and re-train them "ALL" of them.
