Taco and burritos were very light on meat. One of the burritos was 4-6 layers of folded flour tortilla with a sliver of ingredients in it.. So little meat on the tacos we decided that even if it was a one time fluke, we aren't willing to take that chance again based on how bad this meal was.
The "Sealed for You" stickers they put on the bag just make it easier to conceal how messed up your order is.... after 20 minutes stuck in the drive thru.

They stripped this location to the bare minimum.

No breakfast menu.
New operating hours from 2 to 10 pm.

They use less quantities for your meal and barely gives out any taco sauce packets.

Food was average, as expected. That's fine, but the lady seemed so put off toward helping me and was just unfriendly in general. It really killed my mood. It's not that hard to be nice and friendly. Smile and be kind. It will make you feel better too.

I love Taco Bell, but this location frequently doesn't open on time, and if they even acknowledge your existence it's with an annoyed "we're not ready yet". It's about a 50/50 chance you can grab some breakfast in between 7 and 7:30am (they open at 7, supposedly). On top of that, they may be out of sauce at that time somehow. Pretty disorganized in the morning.

I went here on a Monday afternoon and through the drive-thru. It wasn't busy and there was only one other person in front of me. I wish I would've gotten her name, but the employee who was working the drive-thru was the sweetest. She started off with enthusiastically asking how my day was. I put in my order and waited for a few minutes to get to the window because I think the person in front had a big order.

After paying and getting my food, the employee was so happy and told me to have a good day and happy new year. She made my day! 

The food was good too. I got nachos and two crunchy tacos. She loaded up the sauces I asked for also!

I've also been here late at night and it gets busy!! The food was good then too :)

Specifically asked for hot sauce and straw for the drink and they forget. Horrible customer service and long wait at drive thru. Lobby isnt open so have to go through drive thru again just for the hot sauce and straw. Please train your employees! I wish I could give 0 star!

If I could give zero stars I would.  I tried to give them a few chances but EVERY time they forget food, forget the sauce, today it took 26 minutes to get to the window. Ordered simple bean burritos and they where half the size normal size.
The guy at the dining room counter was very rude & lacks any sense of emotion. Feb 4th @ 8:30 pm

First the lady in the drive thru Iesha barely took my order, didn't even give the total, just stated go ahead when your ready. That was it-I drive up. Worst place. The ladies in the drive thru were doing a lot. One playing with their hair, the other playing on their cell phone. More then likely. I will not be back

I am ASTOUNDED by the negative reviews that I have read thus far. I have to say I respectfully disagree. I have gone to this Taco Bell location at LEAST once a week (twice a week since the pandemic hit and my divorce, if I'm being honest with myself). They have never ONCE messed up my VERY complicated vegetarian order. The tattooed gentleman has a very dry sense of humor, and always makes me laugh after a long meeting with my attorney. He is so charming. They are alway efficient, even when the line is RIDICULOUS. They also have been following covid safety measures to the T!!! My second home. 5 stars.
This Taco Bell is one of the best in Austin always clean customer service is very pleasant I have not had a single bad experience coming here management is good turnout is great

We usually drive through this location and never had any issues.  Once or twice the order is incorrect because we always ask for no sour cream, but they're very good about fixing it.  Yesterday we decided to eat in, and the young lady behind the counter (I couldn't see her name tag) was extremely friendly...like- clearly enjoys doing her job-friendly.  
The dining area is clean, and has more of a modern decor than most Taco Bells. 
An earlier Yelp review mentioned flies in the dining room.  Our first few visits here approximately two years or so ago, we noticed this too, but haven't seen any in quite some time.  The current staff and management has been doing a great job.  
The food was delicious as always, I hesitate to call Taco Bell a guilty pleasure because I'm proud to say I enjoy it when it's done right.
They don't serve breakfast and I order breakfast from them online. They gave me my money back when I arrived to pick the food up.

Ricky and Mike were very accommodating despite having my complicated order. They were having computer problems and Ricky was calm and reassuring me that he is trying his best. And since I had waited for a while they compensated me for my time with some complimentary tacos. I was going for a late night munch so I cannot speak for other times and other workers.

I have low expectations when it comes to fast food restaurants. I just want the food that I ordered and nothing else. Unfortunately that's too hard. For the third time in four visits I tried to order coffee with breakfast. They had none and could not seem to figure out how to make more. On top of that on one of these visits they did not even have eggs so they decided they could not serve breakfast at all. I don't know who manages this location or trains the employees, but they are doing a terrible job. Avoid this place at all costs in the mornings.

Friendly enough, but its a crap shoot guessing whether or not they'll get your requests right. I like volcano burritos without sour cream. It fucks with me. The record is now 3/9 in getting it right. Feeling like I was fast becoming the idiot in this exchange, I moved on to plain crunchy tacos, the three taco meal. They gave me tacos supreme. WTF? They just have this obsession with sour cream and fucking up. But, again, it's fast food. How much can you expect?

This a review of the Taco Bell Quesarito. While the location was very clean and everyone was friendly it was time to finally sink my teeth into the Quesarito. I was actually surprised at how good it was. I went with shredded chicken, no sour cream. After a 4 month stint working at Burger King 34 years ago I steer clear of mayonnaise & sour cream.  
I ordered the Quesarito box which came with one of those Doritos® Locos Taco, which to this day I don't understand ayy the hype about a Dorito Taco Shell.
One of my favorite Taco Bell things is that most locations off Diet Mtn. Dew.
This is THAT fast food restaurant where you always have to check everything because they always mess something up in your order. Wish they were better.
Those guys can't get an order right to save their life. The one on San Raphael does it better

This is the BEST Taco Bell location in Vancouver, period. Their customer service is obviously a forte, they ask how the customers are doing, provide nice chat and always make sure your order is accurate. You never receive sloppy items. Always crunchy, hot, fresh and fast as possible. I've been here 10+ years, and will always go here from now on. Appreciate all of you here at this location!

First off, I usually eat at this taco bell without any issues. Today however, the wait time was egregious and I waited for over 20 minutes without receiving my 8 dollar order. When I asked the front counter about what was taking so long, I was told that my order was given to someone else. 

I also overheard the staff say that this was the second time that this has happened today. The staff asked if I wanted to wait, or take a refund, I accepted the refund. The "refund" was a piece of paper that I signed that said I would receive my money back at "some point in the future". What a crock of shit! 

Avoid this taco bell if possible during rush hour!

Taco Bell is fast food. I never walk in expecting stellar service, or 5 star meals. I usually set my expectations rather low. At this particular location, what I experienced today was nothing short of phenomenal. The young man working the counter is a superstar. He greets all that enter, and thanks all that are leaving. He works the floor like an experienced manager, checking on the patrons. He, in fact is NOT a manager. He's a regular crew person. I spoke to him a bit, and observed his interaction with others. He's a pro at customer service. Another customer sparked a conversation with me and let me know "Superstar"(as I will refer to him the rest of the review) was the main reason he chooses to eat lunch here. 

I'm a branch manager for a large company, and would love to have a person like "Superstar" on my team. I'm sure I'm not the only person that would try to recruit such talent. I hope Taco Bell management reads this review and ensures proper development of someone of his caliber.

This place absolutely has the worst customer service, that's cuz there is non we were waiting in fing drive through for 40 minuets!!!!! Does that ring any bells !!!! I could've gone and had a full course meal at Red Robin and been done faster. This isn't my first time either, every single time I come here it's like thisfreaking pathetic workers or something. And once you are online you can't get outhate this place now.

I went through the drive through and had a sticky note with everything my boss wanted for the sales staff. When i approached the payment window and handed them the note they confirmed that they put it in the bag. I checked the receipt and it said what was in my bag. I hurried to the dealership so the food wouldn't be cold to find that the 30 mild sauces were not in the bag. They refused to refund my money even though i was a drive through customer. Our food is now cold while we wait in line again to get sauce in the lobby. They refused to refund or redo the food because now it was cold. Customers in the store were outraged by what they were hearing. Safe to say our two businesses will not be getting food for our sales staff here any longer!

The dinning room is never clean. All of the carbonated drinks always taste flat. NEVER go through the drive thru unless you plan on going through again to get whatever they forgot or made completely wrong. Everything comes out cold and takes 15-20 minutes to get a simple order. Cashier will walk by you 4/5 times talking to other employees instead of taking your order and most of the time someone is yelling about something. Just go somewhere else...
Okay, this supposed to be fast food, a joke. Took entirely to long. I  still like ya'll, though.

I've been to a lot of Taco Bells. I l ike the bean burritos and the crunchy tacos. 

I went in here at 1:00 pm on a Monday. A man was sitting in a chair blocking the doors to both bathrooms, charging a cell phone. I stood at the counter for several minutes holding a $5 bill. One of the employees fumbled with the cash register, sliding a card through it and ringing up orders from the drive thru or something. I stood there awhile then just left. The crew at this Taco Bell needs better supervision.

Ordered a cheese quesadilla in the drive thru and upon getting home I noticed there was very little cheese and NO creamy jalapeño sauce which usually comes on the quesadilla. It's half the reason I order the quesadillas is for the sauce. Also the quesadilla was borderline burnt. It's as if someone who has never made food outside of a microwave attempted to make my food. The real problem is when I called the restaurant to let them know the issue, they let it ring and ring until the fax machine noise came on. I thought maybe they were just busy so I tried 10min later and once more after that and no answer. Horrible customer service and I feel ripped off. Will not return to this location.

Nowhere else on this block can you get an authentic Taco Bell experience. #liveauthentic #artisan #farmToTable #localvore #usa If you want a TBE (Taco Bell Experience) you go here. If you do not, you go elsewhere. You need to make sure you know what kind of experience you want. Don't shop around. Just know. Homeopathy is a lie.

Sat in line for about 15 min, food wasn't even hot when I got home a couple min later. They were out of large drink cups so only got a medium with my meal and no discount offered. When my daughter opened her burrito there was a sharp black plastic sliver piece on her burrito so we took a picture and called the store 3-4 times with no answer just sound like it's going to a fax. ( with the guy standing in the driveway asking people to do a survey was taking it after people got their orders. This is horrible.

Good for late night munchies... but still really gross. I am a vegetarian and they had ground beef all over their line that looked like it'd been there awhile as it was hard. I had to say something so my food wouldn't touch it and the manager cleaned it up. I am concerned that such a mess is normal here and honestly it's just a wreck of a restaurant kept unclean and disorganized.

I never write bad reviews, especially when I love the place. But this location has gone down hill. 

I worked in the plaza in its golden days (if there is such a thing in fast food). I ate there more often than any sane person would. It resulted in the awesome staff (Richard and the like) knowing me by name and noticing when I didn't come in for a while. They even knew my order by heart. 

I went back a few times after I left that company (2 months ago) and every time they ruined my order. Sour cream was out, fine. Creamy jalepeno sauce is out... Fuck all. So just a mini quesadilla?

I get home and its a beef soft taco folded in half. I'm super nice I swear. I RARELY leave shitty reviews. Let alone on a FF restaurant. But I hope management sees this and takes a page out of the previous team's book. 

I'm a die hard Taco Bell fan, but when I wanna eat fast food on my cheat days, I hate that y'all make me travel to get my crunchwraps... Shame on you.

Fast service. Friendly service. Doritos loco tacos. Baja blast. Nuff said.
Oh and the really njce lady called me baby. Loved it.

I normally love Taco Bell, but as soon as I tried to order, the woman taking my order was not friendly what so ever and didn't see to want to help anyone. After getting my food, the cheese in my mini quesadillas weren't even melted, but due to their poor service I didn't complain. A couple hours later, both my friend and I were feeling very nauseous and were actually sick due to the food we ate. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS TACO BELL ONE BIT!!!

I hope the owner of this franchise reads and takes to heart constructive criticism.  Your store is horribly managed, at least on the weekend.  I come in a couple of times a month on Sunday morning for breakfast, and it's not uncommon to find someone working the front counter who can't find a single breakfast item on the cash register (they say they haven't been trained to do breakfast) and have to get someone from the back to help.  Why is someone who isn't trained on breakfast working the register during breakfast? Today's visit was especially problematic (6/21).  I came in at about 10:05 a.m. to a mostly empty restaurant.  It took at least 30 seconds for the person manning the front register to get to his station -- he was in the back, for some reason.  After taking my order, he returned again to the back.  Meanwhile, more customers came in, and they also had to wait.  It took at least five minutes to receive my food; surely that does not meet Taco Bell quality standards for speedy service.  And when my food was finally ready, the person who brought it out mumbled a name and left.  She should have at least stayed there to verify the right person took the food, and that the order was correct.
Website says open until 3am. Wouldn't take my order at 1:45am; all lights were shut off and drive-thru didn't respond to my requests. Horrible customer service according to their orders of operation.

Normally, I wouldn't write a review for a fast food restaurant but I felt I should. I don't know how this Taco Bell typically is considering the reviews, but I went through the drive through at about 10 p.m. with my boyfriend and a girl named Elizabeth helped us. She was just awesome, she joked with us through the intercom, had our food ready before we got to the window and smiled the whole time. She was the type of nice that made me leave happy. Even working at Taco Bell, she had the attitude that she was happy to be there and happy to be helping. We left laughing and three days later I decided it was worth writing a review. Not to mention, the food was great...we got nachos and didn't have to eat a single dry chip, plenty of toppings...yay!!!

Uhm... Well what can I say it's Taco Bell.... Sadly this one just couldn't get it right for my second time visiting in the last 6 months .... I went thru the drive thru because that's what you do when you're on the go, only to have to go in(after I've checked my bag which I always do since they seem to get it wrong most of the time, and this time was no exception) just to show them the burrito I had gotten had been a bloody mess, the hot sauce was all over the entire burrito that I couldn't even unravel the wrapper and without even having to take the wrapper off mind you, there was a lovely hole which the sauce leaked all over myself and my car(the one day I decide to wear white which I never do I just so happen to be tan I wanted to show it off) go in , they fix the burrito, so thank you, but then get to the chips and cheese and literally the whole bag besides about 5 chips, we're all crumbs. The two times I've come here there's been a drastic mess up, last time I just gave them the benefit of the doubt it was lunch there wasn't a lot of ppl working m etc etc. but two times and this time was a joke. I'm sorry but I will not return, I will drive right by and go to a different location. The choice is yours !

I work as a server at Disney. I've been to Taco Bell on 192 and at crossroads and waited over 45 minutes before, because with the tourists they are slammed. And I love Taco Bell so I wait and complain to myself because I chose to wait. Went to this location tonight. Sat in line. Seemed long. No one took my order. The lights went out. I waited some more. Pulled up. There was a car in front of me at the window. I was posting on Instagram while in line so I checked my post and it was 18 mins ago. Another 10 mins and the car pulls off. When I get to the window it's open and a man I assume is the manager/supervisor in a checkered shirt is talking about "cleaning Shit" I'm an adult, I've heard Shit before, maybe he didn't know the window was open. Neither he nor the employee acknowledge me and continue their conversation. Finally they look at me. Not "hi sorry about the wait" but turn and look at me  UM OK! Hi, I've been waiting a while and no one said anything and then the lights just turned off so I didn't know if there was something wrong with the system or what. I would've been happy with a rushed passive, "sorry, what can I get for you" instead I get a defensive "that's not us the system does that automatically" then he turns to another employee and is asking what they have back there, then the employee next to him is pointing at the screen saying "this person hasn't paid" and they turn back to me. Um... I hadn't ordered. And neither of them still asked for my order. But when they failed to collect payment from the previous car then they noticed me. Usually this place is fine. I don't know what's up tonight. I can't even be mad at the employee because if they manager is in the window showing such a lack of basic communication skills and lack of customer service then what can I really expect from the team. It's ok. I went to the one on 50/colonial and got it there from a really sweet older Indian lady. Like I said, I work as a server for Disney. We see 40+ thousand people. They're annoying. But I wish I would have a guest come up to me and I just look at them as if they interrupted my conversation and why.

We only come to this location for the convince but after our last visit we're done. I think out of about 20 visits we have only had our order made correctly once, and to top it off the customer service is appalling even for fast food standards.

Worse taco bell /kfc I've ever been to. The drive thru wait times just get worse. I've now stopped going. Expect to spend 20 minutes in the drive thru lane and your food will be wrong. Many times while waiting you will see cars come out of the line then park and go inside with their messes up order. The last couple times I went I finally checked my food before pulling away which of course irritates the person at the window, but it served me right as the last order was in fact wrong. The food quality itself is typically fine.

Just moved to the area, glad to see that 4th meal was an option for me. Long drive wait after normal
Business hours but that's expected, I can deal with that,  but the food has been perfect, when I order bean w/cheese burritos 86 the onions and red sauce extra cheese it's always perfection for me. Keep it up

Long story short I just got yelled at by a kid name CODY with glasses. His customer service was horrible since I heard him yelling and calling me names from outside the drive thru. I work in fast food so I know how it is but dang all I asked was if I could get my 20 dollars worth of food I paid for because I was given 7 dollars worth of it. I was still nice to him even after I was called the B word. I just tossed my food in the trash and basically paid to get yelled at hahaha! Oh god this place is a joke and just from seeing the reviews of this place it seems like they hire people with anger issues.
Why does it take forever to get your food here? Also why is it every time there is a homeless guy sitting in the store with a table full of Walmart food eating every day?

As far as Taco Bell goes, this is actually a great location!

I honestly try not to frequent fast food, but when it happens we usually hit up this Taco Bell. 

Service is always friendly and fast and patient and I can honestly say I've never left with an incorrect order!!! (Something my early 20's partially intoxicated self would not believe lol)

So, as far as fast food joints and Taco Bells, it's a good spot.

Me and my boy friend stopped by this location and waited because the cash system was down but then we got our boxes with out any napkins or our receipt and the they didn't offer us any sauce. The cashier was nice so we over looked it but when our food was wrong as usual at this location so we tried to call 4 times but it kept saying it was busy so I stopped by when I got back in to town and was basically called a liar because I didn't have a receipt, then I tried to email the corporate office and it told me my visit date wasn't right.... I will be stopping at another Taco Bell from now on.
Not crowded. Clean. Great central location to my work and home.  Great food!  Busy during week.  Sunday at 2:20 is slow and perfect!!!  Needs more positive reviews!!!!

This is the slowest drive through I have ever experienced. This is the second time I have been in line for more than 30 minutes here! The first time I saw the line was long but it still took much longer than I expected. This time there are only 5 cars in front of me, yet in 30 minutes we have only moved 1 car length. Now there are 5 cars behind me and 4 in-front, so I'm trapped waiting! I will avoid this location at all cost!!!!!!

Taco Bell is Taco Bell.  Duh.  I'll just throw out some observations for you. 

!.  The drive thru line can be ridiculously long.  
2.  Inside is hardly ever busy.  
3.  People are lazy and don't want to leave their cars, even if nobody's inside.  
4.  People are weird.  
5.  Sometimes the food takes a while. 
6.  Sometimes it doesn't.  
7.  75% of the people that work here, that I've dealt with, are super nice!
8.  I like nice people.

We pulled up at 10:30 pm and were told they were out of food. Not out of something specific. Just that they were out of food, generically, and that they were closed for 30 minutes. How does this even happen?

I have lived in this neighborhood for over three years and this is the closest Taco Bell in the area. I would willing drive 10+ miles out of my way to avoid this place. The last few times I've driven through here there was not a single time they didn't mess up my order, sometimes to the point it's inedible. Everyone at this place needs to be fired.
When your short on cash until payday and cant even stand the thought of cooking its good to know this is in the neighborhood!

Cashier Carson provided excellent customer service when customers were being rude and business was crazy busy. Not many can stay calm during pressure. I love Taco Bell, but his demeanor and respect for others should be acknowledged. One of my favorite locations :)

If you want service with an attitude this is the place for you. This used to be one of my favorite places now I won't even go here. Mike the manager is the most sorriest excuse of a manager I have ever seen. Do yourself a favor and drive the extra 5 minutes to the one on Hiawassee trust me.

Oh hell yeah, sometimes I gotta have honest to Jeebus JUNK food.  Taco Bell fits the bill nicely.  

I'm rather annoyed that this Taco Bell is no longer open 24 hours.  Sometimes on drunken Saturday nights, one must have a couple Nacho Cheese or Cool Ranch Doritos Crunchy Taco Supremes, ya know?  

I'm terribly disappointed when Taco Bell is closed at 4AM and I have to resort to slumming it at McDonald's a few blocks away.

Ah, but when our hours mesh and I get my Taco Bell fix, all is right with the world.

Review # 113 - PDXYelp 100 challenge
I had to wait a little for the food but it was so worth it. Amazing as usual Taco Bell, amazing as usual.

Honestly, I try to be fair with places and try them multiple times (in this case three visits) but I have been equally disappointed each and every time I have visited this location. It is as if there is no quality control. I usually like TB but this location continuously either messes up orders or uses old, stale, and dried out ingredients (chalupas, hard taco shells and chicken). When employees are making food they should ask themselves "Would I eat this?" before serving because my answer, after all three visits, has been an absolute no.

Everytime I come to this Taco Bell, my order is perfect and they always load everything up. Large portions for the normal price. All the ingredients are fresh and service is fast. Yes it's Taco Bell so it is what it is but this location is the best by far in my experience.

This place is easily one of the slowest restaurants that I've ever been to. The drive through always seems to have less than 5 cars but still manages to take 20 minutes. I've actually consistently gotten my food faster ordering inside which seems backwards. Will I go back? Yes. Cause where else am I gonna get fried chicken with a taco as a side? Will I be happy about it? Doubtful.

If I could give zero stars I would.  After waiting in the drive through for 10 minuets backed out and ran in figured it would be quicker, wrong. Walked inside 5 people waiting to order 6 people waiting for food. This place has no management and the workers have no idea why they are there. Saved my money and left so did a couple other people.

i was refused service hers yesterday because i was on a bike. i was told i would have to come inside. this meant that i had to continue thru the drive thru (doing so i would like to note that i did not die or become injured in any way) to get back to the front doors at which time i found no bike racks. this meant that i then had to haul my bike and all my shopping into the restaurant as i was not gonna leave it all sitting outside not locked to anything. At this time of environmental awareness and in this city how can a business treat 10% of the population this way? i wrote to the corporate office and hope that something changes but i ain't holding my breath.

oh... btw...  the food was pretty good :-)

The service was slow and terrible. I was talked down to while ordering my food through the drive thru. The lady taking orders asked if the order on the screen was correct. I said no and corrected her. She proceeded to tell me my total and sent me to the window. I reiterated that the order was not correct and she said she gave me the total already. After I told her that she asked me to tell her if it was correct, she said nothing else but sent me to the window. There was such a backup that I left the line and called the restaurant. I let the manager know that if his employee is having a bad day, she should not take it out on her customers. I apologized for leaving the line, but I was not about to pay for food served by the same person who made me feel shitty. I work in customer service and know well enough that the customer interaction is key.

The problem with Taco Bell is the customer service. They mess up my order about 50% of the time. I  vegetarian so I order things minus the beef and half of the time the order comes with beef. This is particularly annoying because I am always driving thru so then have to turn into parking lot and go inside to get the order fixed. After being burned so many times by happily driving down the road several miles and then biting into my beefy mistake and being unable to correct the problem and then throwing it out - I now check my order before leaving the area. I have had some other problems that I emailed customer service about in their website but they NEVER respond. Oh well it is inexpensive and tastes good half of the time anyway!!

Please send help.  There are 5 cars in front of me, and I have been in the line for 35 minutes.  I could have driven 15 minutes to a different location and been home faster with my food.  This location generally gets my order correct and have not had an issue with that, but whoa..... 35 minutes.  That's an industry worst.
So I don't expect much from any taco bell, but this one took the cake.  My food was cold and they gave me the wrong sauce.

Never have a problem with my order here, and the food is always consistent.  Drive-thru line moves quick too.  They recently renovated, so it looks a lot better inside and out.  It's Taco Bell - some of the other reviews need to keep their expectations in line.

Friendly folks at the window for drive-thru but the order is almost ALWAYS wrong. Be sure to count the items in your bags and compare them to your receipt. Check for special order items BEFORE you drive away.
Extremely slow service. If you don't get a two hour lunch break you better go to one of the many other places in the immediate area
Fast and friendly. I come here late at night to skip the crowds. Its cheap and quick food, if you see anything wrong with your order, they'll fix it.
The service is very slow, especially for "fast food". Food is what you can expect from a Taco Bell.

ya thats right i'm reviewing taco bell

and i'm giving it four stars

here are my reasons:

its a 4 minute drive from my house
its cheeeeap as hell
its the best hangover food on a budget.

sometimes you are just hankering for that cheap ass taco filled with seasoned beef -- you don't want a fancy wrapped burrito for $8 you want that .89$ burrito with cheese similar to that found in a dispenser at a gas station that will inevitably give you taco bell belly the rest of the day. 

there i said it.  commence with the yelp stoning.
They can't get your order right and they are franchise and charge  $6 for a $5 box. Very overpriced for a taco bell.
Takes the fast out of fast food!!!  So if the term fast food makes you feel guilty then come to this location be there is absolutely nothing fast about it!  Find another location is my suggestion

Did you know this Taco Bell location gets consistent 100% scores on their Multnomah County Health Inspections?   

I've only ever been inside about five times in 12 years.  Drive-thru is the key!

Ten years ago, a friend and I used to sit on the sidelines of the drivethru after a night of bar/club hopping.  2:30am, drunk and hungry.  We'd wait for someone game enough to drive us through, since walk-ups are a no-no.  

Yes, Taco Bell is IT for post-drinking yummy-tummy lining.  Most basic items can be made vegetarian (say, "Minus meat, plus beans").  I stick to my fav's, a 7-Layer Burrito and a Tostada.  Sometimes a Crunchwrap--though, I overdid that phase.  Those things are hefty enough to bludgeon someone to death, let alone put you on the ground at the end of the night.  

Beware of the long drive-through line that threatens to shut down Burnside close to last call.  True, you won't remember what you put in.   But that really is not the point.

All good things here.... and get extra hot sauce packets.   FIRE!
Absolute worst drive through of them all. I have yet to get my order with all my food in it.
Extremely clean and the cashiers are always polite. I dont come here often but everytime it's always spotless and well managed.

Even for Taco Bell, this place is one of the worst. The interaction with the employees is just fine. No one is rude. However, the food is terrible (yes, I know, even for Taco Bell. But if you're reading this, you, too, eat there!). The beans are runny, the burritos are smaller than tacos should be, there is rarely any "meat" on whatever you order, the nacho sauce is always less than half filled, they get your order wrong every time ... etc, etc, etc. This is a Taco Bell location to avoid.

This location is ALWAYS super slow and the team does not seem to be as responsive as other locations.  This particular time we asked if they had sweet tea and was told they had just made some.  We were able to get our cup with our order and proceeded to sit and eat.  There was a container on the counter so we went to re-fill the cup and there was none out so I asked and was told they only has un-sweet tea or soda.  Normally we would deal with it, but I had 2 kids that just got done soccer practice and we don't drink sodas.  I would have just stuck with water and not paid for the drink (why I asked).  Crew member said sorry and walked away.

If your card machine is out of order and you know that your drive thru has no alternative exit then you need to prepare signage to prevent customers from entering the drive-thru. Not only was I not able to order, I had to sit in line until the cars in front of me cleared. It's 2017, no one carries cash. And the fact that you don't have an alternative to an electronic card reader is concerning at the very least. Bad enough that my experience at this location is nearly always sub par. I support a living minimum wage but something tells me these guys don't deserve it. Where is management? Owner? Ridiculous.
This taco bell is one of the worst ones I have ever visited I don't think they have ever gotten my order right... The only reason I still go there is it's a block from my house
Wow!! Slowest drive thru ever!! I'm still waiting to place my order...been over 5 min and no cars in front of me...a line behind.

Food was ok, I asked for Jalapenos, and I was given 3 slices ! and charged extra for them!!?? 3?  are you kidding...ok then we asked for Verde sauce and give 2..??? Then we asked for more, for three orders of food, they looked at us like we were from Mars. I mean are the employees paying for the condiments themselves?....
This is an amazing Taco Bell! I'm from out of town, and this Taco Bell had quick service, nice employees, and yummy food!
Absolutely the worst taco bell the meat was old and looked like rat meat. The restaurant was dirty and very unkempt and the workers did not wear gloves or hair nets while preparing food
It's a Taco Bell.  What else is there to say?  I always go through the drive-through.  The staff is usually friendly.  They've never gotten an order wrong for me.

Whoever was working last night was the worst I've had! I expect taco bell to have shit service but the attitude on the lady's working here cant get any worse not mentioning you have to beg them to take your order you could sit waiting to order and these lazy fucks wouldn't think twice dont know if there doing drugs in the back or what but they ain't workin. Remember ladys customer service is key go get a job behind a desk if you don't like customers.

Went to Taco Bell for a quick snack before heading back home to Ft Lauderdale after Universal. Jennifer M. Made sure that we were well taken care of, asking if we needed anything else while we were eating. The location was extremely well kept and clean. We were wished happy holidays by every employee! We will definitely be returning on our next adventure. Thank you Jennifer M and all the other employees!
3 soft chicken tacos service was good the order was correct very good job. Lunch for $6.07 awesome

I'm fairly positive that my boyfriend and I both got salmonella from this location during the great tomato scare of 2008. I haven't eaten at a taco bell since. 1 order of nachos supreme = 5 days of disgusting misery.

Run for the border? No. Just run. Get away from this place as fast as you can.

If i could give less stars i would. SO this place is the worst customer service I've ever dealt with. We were at the drive thru and The woman was so very rude. My questions were simple, i couldn't read the sign and I've never ordered breakfast from Taco Bell so i wanted to know what was in certain things on the menu. Her answers were rude, cut off and not very helpful. All i asked was "what's in the bfast burrito" and "what's in the crunch wrap" she huffed loudly on the intercom. When all was said and done, i got the Sausage bfast burrito and after paying went to leave  i said "thank you so much have a wonderful day" as i normally do, worked customer service and sometimes just a simple thank you with a smile can change a persons day, apparently not this woman's... she replied "yep" and slammed the window. I drove off in shock and was very glad i only spent $1.50 there. I went down the street to Burger King and was greeted with amazing customer service and a smile. I will never be returning to this location. Maybe a little training in customer service will help. It's not about what you do it's about how well you do it.

Great place to go if you enjoy the thrill of having your order screwed up, over charged, and then told they cannot print a receipt... So you can show them where it is messed up. Just gave the food back and got my money back. Don't waste your time with these jokers.
Bomb and bomb. Fast, nothing missing, tasted as good as a Taco Bell could be, and the people were fun in the drive thru window. What more could you ask for at 1am?!

Note to self: if in doubt of hunger, eat crunchy taco first. Chicken soft taco heats up much better than crunchy one!

So, Sam often delivers lunch from here to my work. It's a pretty sweet deal for us - I email Sam our orders and he brings us a tasty fast food meal! Plus I get to have lunch with my hubs (that's a pretty big plus).

Taco Bell is what it is. For me, it's food that will fill you up quickly and cheaply. The free chalupas from the Blazers when they score over 100 points are particularly nice because (1) they're free, and (2) they remind me of the fun I had watching the Blazers score 100+ points.

For lunch from here I usually get a chicken soft taco and a crunchy taco. This is an attempt to pretend to be more healthy. If I'm hungrier I'll get the old college standard[1] or I'll add on their cheesy potato things. If I'm not so hungry, I save my chicken soft taco for later and it heats up in the microwave quite nicely. Today, I tried to save, and then reheat, the crunchy taco instead - bad idea (hence the note-to-self). I was not impressed by the volcano taco, by the way.

What makes this Taco Bell stand out is that they always include a moist towelette and a mint along with the various sauces, receipt and plea for us to take their survey and win. My question is why only one moist towelette? I think there was only one time last year that we got 2... and we're usually getting food for 2-4 people! Do they think Sam is eating 3 crunchy tacos, a chicken soft taco, a double decker taco, nachos and a cheesy beefy burrito all by himself? Really? He's not a very big guy, nor does he have a tape worm.

So, it's not usually the best lunch of my week, but the coworkers are happy to have a cheap lunch of reliable (not great, but reliable) quality delivered. Thanks to you, Sam!!

[1] My college standard order was a Mexican Pizza with no beans and a crunchy taco. This was only achieved if mosborne would agree to drive my carless self there. Thanks, mosborne!
No issues it's Taco Bell not a 5 star restaurant - good is always fine and drive thru efficient

I'm not sure why the reviews for this place are so low. I know it's a Taco Bell, but i've been there four times so far, and I've always been treated great, and the food is as to be expected from Taco Bell

I'm actually pretty impressed with the cleanliness of the place, and the service is excellent.

We stopped inside at 702 for a 4 pack of the donut holes and vanilla dr pepper freeze. At 718 I have to ask. 15 minutes for this order? No one cares. Or listens.  I got louder. Saying my order shouldn't have taken 15 minutes.  Guy manager says ok.

I ordered a crunchy taco (at noon mind you) which came out flat as a pancake with barely any meat in it and no lettuce. The cheese was already melted, the shell was split down the middle and felt stale, and it wasn't even lukewarm. Just gross.

What the hell happened to this location. We used to come here and was always impressed by how clean it was. Well it was a mess on 2\2\18 both the dinning room and what little I could see in the kitchen.

They had like eight people working and what looked like one women making the food. The others basically standing around, including the manager as the drivethrough and the line inside grew. I stood there waiting on a simple order, drink, Doritos and taco. Hell all they had to do is make the taco. I stood there 20 minutes and finally gave up and got my money back.

Its a shame we used to love this location. I even own YUM stock long term.

Its apparent that the current managers can't do the work.

The people are always nice here but I feel like the food is a bit subpar compared to other Taco Bell's. This time our tomatoes were frozen on our tacos. Last week our chalupa Wrap tasted dry and stale.

The food is, or will be when it reopens, the same as every other Taco Bell. This is not a review of food.

I live across the street from this Taco Bell. Last year they ripped this location out of the ground so they could build a new Taco Bell. In the process of demolition they popped the freon on a large industrial a/c unit, possibly on purpose. They cut down most of the trees on the block, so they can put in a new sidewalk and plant "new" trees. 

On a personal level, they have been driving my wife and I slowly insane with their construction/demolition noises that have been going on since last September.

If anyone knows the location of the person that owns this Taco Bell, I'd like to spend the next year hammering in front of their house at 6am.

This Taco Bell is SUPPOSE TO BE OPEN UNTIL 1AM, so tonight I drove through the drive-thru at 12:45. When i got to the speaker, the automated message came on telling me that they were closed - which was not even true. Went around their corner to the window and there was someone getting food but when we got close to the window, the girl working locked the window and looked away until we were gone. Not impressed

My daught works at this location. Although she has told her manager repeatedly that she is not allowed to work past 9pm on school nights, they still continue to schedule her until 10pm. As a parent this is incredibly infuriating. The manager seems to have no respect for school kids and the fact that they have homework and school early the next morning.

I got INCREDIBLY sick from eating here. Our food was lukewarm when we got it, but the sauce I asked for on the side was hot, and had clearly not been refrigerated properly. Sanitation is a big issue at this place.
The worker was not polite and we didn't get our chicken quesadilla and we were still charged for it. The tacos were also not very nice.

Just waited over 25 minutes in the drive thru. Spoke to the manager at the window. She said there was nothing she could do. I left and drive to Chick Fil A next door. Ordered and received my food in 3 minutes. Go somewhere else. When you have a manager unable to manage you'll have poor service. I won't be back until I know she's gone.
Nice staff and quality but incredibly slow. Takes like 15 minutes for an order every time I go there when there are not much customers.
Yummy yummy and fast service too we eat there a lot and they are friendly too I would recommend this taco bell to friends

Terrible service. For the past few days (or more) the pink lemonade has been out. They literally gave me water in the drive thru and charged us for it, not to mention the girl taking cash in the first window said NOTHING to us. When I went back inside, they pretty much refused to change the pink lemonade syrup. I've worked in the industry. I know all about soda machines. It's laziness at its finest. 

The pregnant manager was extremely rude to me and didn't once try to resolve the situation. As a non soda drinker due to reactions with carbonation, I have very few options. 

I love Taco Bell. I really have had it with this shit staff! It shouldn't take 20 minutes in the drive through at 2pm to get this kind of "service"!
Rude service.  Took forever even at eight at night. Asked for sauce, which I didn't get. Also didn't get my burrito that was ordered.... Twice.

Just tried the Naked Chicken Chips today. Oh my goodness these things are yummy!! Nice bit of heat to them and they taste so good with the nacho cheese dip that is served with them. I hope these stay on the menu. I really like them!!
Worst, slowest drive-thru I have ever been unfortunate to be in. Wanted to back out but couldn't, 30 minutes on a Wednesday evening!!!!
I come here. It was not bad I got here early before customers arrive the cashier was nice and when people started to come the other cashier came and help her out.

Seriously, 4 out of 5 times this location gets the order completely wrong. It's either the drinks, the menu items, or the sauces or all three at once. There is only so much one can check going through the drive through, and I've had to drive back too many times to get my order corrected. Not fun when people at home are waiting for their dinner. I've filed complaints on the website too, with no response. I rarely give bad reviews, but this one is earned for sure. Please figure it out Taco Bell.

I never thought I would be writing a review on a Taco Bell. 
When I do decide to eat fast food, (which is rare) I eat here because surprisingly, they have vegan options. My issue with this taco Bell is that they ALWAYS forget things. Almost every time we have ordered from here, they have forgotten something. Not only that, but we always have to ask for more sauce, even after we have already asked for extra sauce. Ugh, get it together guys.

Have been in the drive through for over 30 minutes & there are still 2 cars ahead of me. This is not fast food. Recommend only if you have no where to be & are looking for a crappy way to pass the time. OH & NO STRAWS WERE GIVEN FOR MY 3 DRINKS!!

This is the most GHETTO and dirty Taco Bell I have ever been to. The place was completely dirty with literally lettuce everywhere and the cashier was loud and yelling to her manager! My food was prepared horribly and coming apart. The box of hard tacos my husband bought were old and sticking to the paper they came in. Truly disgusted by this visit!

Taco Bell is a great place to go get tacos I live right by it so it's great to go some times I get the Doritos shell or just get a regular soft shell I like to do Rito shell because it has lots of taste Taco Bell has a great selectionit's nice that they have a good selection do usually they have limited addition things that you can get

Best Taco Bell i've ever been to.

The customers were friendly; professional clean appearance - as well as the restaurant around them.

Food was fresh, hot and seemed just different from the average Taco Bells i've been to.

Rated 5 for freshness and good customer service.
This Tacobell is never open as late as the posted hours and frequently closes early. Then when it is open the wait is long and they mess up your order. I wouldn't recommend this location to anyone.
they seem to be understaffed at times but the ladies working here are always incredibly nice and understanding if an order is made wrong. they're just doing their best :-)

Had an issue where I was double charged due to a glitch in their computer system back in late March. The managers at this location were very friendly and went out of their way to accommodate me for my double charge. Great managers here!

For Taco Bell this is pretty darn good.
They were friendly enough when they took our order.
The food came fresh in a reasonable amount of time.
All the food was pretty good taking into consideration this is a Taco Bell and not fine dining.
The seating area was clean.
All was good.

How hard is it to make a bean and rice soft taco? Seriously? Just beans and rice, y'all screwed up the original and the remake. Beans and rice, that's all. How can y'all demand better pay if you can't even make a damn bean and rice burrito?
This Taco Bell always does something wrong every single time I go...they give me old food, take forever, and are very rude. Don't come here!

Worst service ever. This place is a joke. Idk y they closed down the other Taco Bell and not this one. My son wanted a quesadilla for his choice of dinner today. I sat in the drive thru for 35 effing minutes. Wtf r y'all doing in there? Not even an apology for the wait. Got home and the food wasn't even hot. Management needs to get a handle on this location asap. Last time this place gets my money.

"What do you mean we can't go through the drive thru without a car?!?!"

Ahhhhhhh drunken stumbling meets drunken eating. Ain't it grand? I'll say it is!

Honestly, there is no reason to ever eat at a Taco Hell unless you are wasted. Not just lightly buzzed, but shit-howdied wasted drunk. I say this because if you aren't in that state of being, you will realize how disgarsting the food really is. 

I also should add that if you do decide to partake in the nastiness that is Taco Hell and you're staying in a hotel, destroy the evidence before morning because there is nothing worse than waking up with a hangover to the smell of 6 hour old Taco Hell.

Blegh.

Worst Taco Bell experience I have ever had. Not that I am a frequent customer of fast food chain restaurants but this was definitely the worst experience. Ordered a salad and it was presented to me in the fashion of a shaken up bowl. Customer service was absolutely terrible. I ordered a diet Pepsi and was handed a diet Mountain Dew. They did not ask me if I'd like a diet Mountain Dew instead they simply handed it to me and said "we only have diet Mountain Dew so that's why it's not Pepsi but it's diet." If I am paying for a drink I expect to have what I asked for or at least be asked what would be an acceptable replacement. I hate Mountain Dew because it is super caffeinated. As I pulled away completely dissatisfied, I look in the bag and realize there is no silverware or napkins. I had to turn around and go inside to retrieve silverware. Once inside I asked the same employee who was at the drive-through for silverware and he asked me "for what?" I said for the salad that you just sold me that I am expected to eat with my hands. No exaggeration, he handed me a spoon and a knife. So to anyone who enjoys eating their salad with a spoon I would highly recommend visiting this location. Anyone that actually values customer service and getting what you pay for definitely steer clear of this one.

Is it weird to give an extra star to a fast food joint because of its landscaping? 

Each time I visit this Taco Bell, here's what I get:

- Inexpensive burritos and tacos.

- Quick service.

- A fresh round of inspiration on how to build our home's perpetually unfinished rain garden. Their landscape architecture is quite beautifully done. I've seen it in action, managing rainwater runoff from the parking lot, and it's both efficient and lovely.

Conversely, here is what I do NOT get from this Taco Bell:

- Good or safe parking/driving opportunities. The parking lot design sadly suffers as a consequence of its landscaping, and I'm pretty sure I'm going to get backed into while I'm waiting in the drive-thru line.

- Decipherable drive-thru speakers, which may quite possibly be related to the lack of:

- Consistently correct orders.

When it comes down to it, all I really want is to get in and out with some cheap food, and fast. 

So the moral of this story? Juncus grass is pretty and all, but it doesn't taste very good with hot sauce.

I was only person in the drive thru one employee walked back and forth from the building to the dumpster for 10 minutes and no one took our order. After the 10 minutes i pulled around and saw 3 people doing nothing so we just went to Mcdonalds

An otherwise fine Taco Bell, except for the flies! I could not go more than several seconds without swatting them out of my face or off my food. I can only guess the type of sanitary conditions that are causing this. Gross. 1 star.
One of the best taco bells I have ever eaten at. I used to eat here all of the time when I lived in east point. Every now and again I still come here if I am in the area. Always a good eat.

The service is great! That's mainly the reason why i go here. I just wish the manager would make sure they have enough in Stock. everytime i order they are out of something...this time it was beans...can you imagine a burrito without beans?? Me either. 11/3/2016

Update: 

Service is still great! I'm always shocked at how great the employees are! They haven't had issues with being out of stock of items in a very long time as well. Great Place!

Taco Bell sets a low bar in general, but this location manages to come in well below those low expectations. I had to repeat a simple two taco order three times in the drive through, and was told to pull ahead for my total. That's code for the person taking the order having extraordinary difficulty putting in an order for two standard menu item tacos. 

There was one car ahead of me. After ten minutes of that car not moving, I shut my engine down. Unfortunately, there is no escape lane for their drive through, and I was trapped. Over five minutes later, he finally got his order, and I got to pull up to the window. My no doubt cold two tacos were already waiting for me, along with an attitude that made me decide to just let them keep their cold tacos. 

Never again at this location.

Worst Taco bell ever!

About 20 minutes, from start to finish, only 6 cars ahead me.

I ordered a 3 taco meal with a baja blast. But when I finally got the window, the woman gave me a bag. I asked if I got a drink and she said "no. You ordered 2 cheese tacos." Really lady?!? I think I remember what I ordered. Plus I go to taco bell for the baja blast and not the tacos... well this time I guess I did. But two cheese tacos?!? REALLY?

Worst experience. Go to KFC or McDonalds. They'll get your order right.
I think it you are in a hurry and want something quick.  It is for you.  Not the place for long sit sown meal.

Just like many of the reviews, this place is a joke. They got my order wrong at 1 in the morning when there was no one else around, AND the employee has the stupidity to give me a dirty look when I correct her. What the fuck are they doing in there that they can't get a single order right. Beyond that, hire some regular person who obviously would hate the job but cares enough to get a fucking order right when they have nothing else to do.

We went here on Saturday.  We ordered the 5 dollar boxes and Mexican pizza. Well, what we got was nearly empty taco shells... minimal meat, lettuce etc.. it looked like a flat tortilla. The Mexican pizza had barely any meat on them both... very disappointing.  Will not be going back any time soon. After all, Chipotle is across the street

I've been going to this Taco Bell for some time now. The staff is friendly and they LISTEN when I order my food, as I don't always order the same thing each time. :) I'm a VEGAN, and I can say hands down that for fast food, Taco Bell is the easiest for vegans to eat at. They have SOOOO many options for vegans, I love it. You can substitute ANYTHING in your food. I usually sub black beans for my protein, instead of animal meat. Order ANY menu item as "fresco" and there will be no dairy in it (sour cream, some sauces, cheese, etc.) Easy to order, great to eat. :)

We get food from here maybe once a week, not because it's good, but because it is fast and very cheap (cheesy double beef burrito = biggest bang for your buck at a whopping $0.89).

It's usually pretty sketchy inside (the people, cleanliness), no one knows how to use the drived thru lane (it's the one on the right w/a stop sign... exiting traffic is on the left) and you can usually find someone asking for money outside one of the doors.  The drive thru exit is a tricky voyage as you're turning on to burnside 5 feet from a traffic light.

Quality of the food is consistent (make of that what you will) and orders are usually correct (we have some tricky ones, so good on ya, TBell).  On one occasion I got to my wife's workplace and realized we had gotten two extra volcano tacos.  Score?

It's Taco Bell.  That's about all I've got.

Like Wes O. puts it: it is what it is.

Quick, cheap and filling.

I frequented this location numbered times when I worked down the road at DPS and it happens to be the only TB in the central area! They do a decent job at this location and have never had any big issues. Other than the nasty taco cabana down the road this is about as fair decent tacos you will get in the area. On second note it's cheaper than T Cab and not as greasy with a more fresher selection and options to choose from. For lean fast food, this is where to start. The only thing that sucks is their dining area closes at 10, while most of the other locations stay open until 11.

Love me some taco bell. I shouldn't but I do. Great for a quick meal for the kids that won't cost me and arm and a leg and they will eat it. This location is also a KFC. Right on the main road of 192 going towards St. Cloud. This location tends to get busy for the normal school hours as there is a high school about a block away. As well there is the county school board offices. I have never had a problem with my order being wrong. The staff has always been friendly. They do tend to work in slow motion but if my order is correct I am ok with that. I for the most part go through the drive thru not the restaurant. Good values for the money. The parking lot and the drive thru have always seemed clean up to par from my vantage point. I know I will be back.
Longest drive though wait ever!  5 cars in line, 28 minutes to food. Long wait times becoming more frequent.

Who enjoys waiting in the drive-thru 20+ minutes for some "fast food"?

Not me. The whole point of choosing this type of restaurant is that you expect to be in and out within a matter of minutes. The bad part about this location is that once you are in line, there's no way to exit until you've reached the front of the line; they work as if there's no urgency. I've been to this location a few times, but today was my last visit. I rather travel a bit further and actually receive good service in a timely manner.

It never fails, when I see an ad for Taco Bell and go and spend good money, I get taken!
Do not buy the Triple Double Crunch Wrap.
It's just bad.
Does not even look like what is advertised!  The meat looked like dog food!
I went to the TB on 
Burnet Road.
I wasted $3.79 on 8-8-16.
Absolutely horrible....35mins to get through drive through....only 5 cars in line. As if the food wasn't bad enough.

Great help and exactly what you order if you go inside. If you go through the drive-thru, expect a wait, and expect errors in your order if you make any requests. Specifically, "no tomatoes" was on the receipt, and the order screen, but were all over my food. Why even ask if my screen is correct if the food isn't made the way I asked?

If I could give zero stars I would. My purse slipped under the booth and I forgot it. I called the place in a panic asking if a purse had been turned in. They immediately said no. I asked if they could please go check the booth I was in and she said nothing was there. My boyfriend and I drove back to the location and, wouldn't you know it, it was there. I asked to speak too the manager and she said she was the manager. I said threat it was unacceptable to not even check to see if a purse was still there. She began to tell at me. Then I asked for her boss' information and she refused to give it to me. So unbelievably upset. Worst customer service ever. Will never be back to this place. And yes..... Checking on things is your job.

People who work here are complete jerks. 
They took very very VERY long to take my order and when they did they were very rude. 
I'm never coming here again. Not even worth the food.

I can't say I've been a fan of Taco Bell ever but this summer was so unbearably hot and when they were offering the slushies for 'Happy Hour' prices, well here we are maybe 2-3x a month.  Since we've been here for the beverages I began picking up little things here and there like crunchy tacos and chicken quesadillas.  I also like the chicken cantina bowl which feels more meal like to me.  The other items are more snackish unless you're buying those huge combos that look like 'high-a-betes' on a platter.  The staff is also pretty friendly and polite.
Sitting in the drive thru for almost 30 minutes. Now late for a game. Gives new meaning to fast food. To top it off we didn't get our complete order.

***Best Service (by Krystal)*** At 10:00PM 8/28/2012
Even though this location is hidden and interior is not up to date. The service made up for that.
I got my usual 2 regular tacos and Beef Meximelt double steamed. She even asked how my Meximelt was since I made a special order. Who does that at a fast food joint? Well this location (Krystal) does ... It got real busy as I was eating and she still had a great attitude and concern for customer orders being made right.
I'll be back for more in the future because of the satisfied service I have recieved.

This location is pretty close to where I live and I often stop by here for a quick bite.  Personally, I have never had a problem with my orders. Say what you will about the food, (it's taco bell-what do you expect?) the service here is excellent. The people working here are the nicest I have ever come across at a fast food restaurant. Every time I go to the drive through (which is at various times of the day) the people taking my order are always extremely friendly.  If you're in the mood for a quick taco, this is the place to go.

This is an after the bars review. Five stars is just as hard to obtained, but the qualifications are different.

After sobering up after the elite event, I needed some Taco Bell. On a Sunday night around midnight there was hardly a line at the drive thru. The woman taking the order was extremely nice and made it clear she wasn't going to eff up my order. She didn't. Both of my specially ordered items were perfection. 

Stop your complaining and justifying people. Of course Taco Bell isn't authentic Mexican food. Of course you're eating dehydrated pinto beans and some yellow strips that no one in their right mind would call cheese. Still, it's always the same no matter where you go and it's pretty damn tasty. This location tonight highlighted the greatness that is Taco Bell.
This is my fave Taco Bell. Great staff.  Just recently remodeled and more open. Plenty of parking and in the Safeway shopping center

Okay. I love Taco Bell but the last few experiences have been HORRIBLE. Rude drive thru order takers etc. But this last time just did it for me. I got food poisoning immediately after eating my food. Needless to say I will NEVER go back there again .

This review isn't about the food or Taco Bell in general, but the specific location on Kirkman Road near Universal. Everyone knows what you're getting when you order Taco Bell, and I generally go to this location about once a week to grab a delicious, very unhealthy breakfast. I'm giving this location just one star because their service is consistently extremely slow. I've found that if there is more than one car in the drive-thru, the wait is at least 10-15 minutes. Most recently, I pulled into the drive-thru at exactly 10AM and didn't get my food until 10:23! I could see this being a one-off if they were understaffed or if something happened, but these wait times are normal. If you're in a hurry, avoid this location.

The food is always 5/5 at Taco Bell. I am just rating the service here. The manager was rude and very unprofessional. I had a coupon for any free taco and have always gotten any taco I wanted at other locations. At this location they insisted it was just a soft beef and soft chicken, which was wrong. Very dissatisfied.

Two words:
HELL
YEAH

The only thing more satisfying than a beefy chalupa after a long day at work is the Hell Yeah Hallelujah Choir manning this fine establishment. Cameron Road Taco Bell, your Doritos Locos Tacos fill my stomach and your Hell Yeahs fill my heart. 
And your Fiesta Potatoes fill my arteries. I probably shouldn't eat any more of those.

Waiting in line at the drive through. They are the slowest people in the world. It is 10:26 at night. One would think that I wouldn't have to wait 25 minutes in the drive-through. Find another Taco Bell if you care about the time you have left on this earth.

Seriously, the other reviews aren't kidding. Slowest drive thru ever. Without fail, every time, 15 to 20 min waiting. For what??? No idea. I used to work at Taco Bell it's not hard.

Update- they consistently make items wrong. If you get a steak soft taco with just lettuce cheese and steak ITs WRONG! I called the manager out on it and even said, well if you pull up it's ingredients online what you make is wrong. I'm not usually this picky, but I'm pregnant and crave very specific things lol like Taco Bell that's made correctly! 

Still takes 30 min to get through the drive thru. The drive thru person told my husband "sorry for he wait, but it's the Taco Bell side taking so long".........

Slow service, food was meh! I realize it's taco bell, I'm not expecting gourmet but when they hardly fill the tortilla w/ beans or ground beef and stack it with lettuce and tomatoes, bro?!. I had to literally search the crunch-wrap for ground beef. Maybe I'm spoiled by Taco Bell service in the burbs, eh whatevs.
I get places can get busy, but 40 minutes waiting in the drive through is a little much. If you know you have busy times then staff appropriately to keep everything running smoothly

Absolutely awful service.   Nobody including the manager could explain to me why they were charging me more money than the advertised price on their board.  The manager came up to the front counter extremely rude with his button up shirt UNBUTTONED HALF WAY DOWN FROM THE TOP.  I simply got my money back from the over charge whip making me feel stupid for wanting to pay $1.00 for an advertised item.  I will most DEFINITLEY NOT be returning.  I will also be contacting corporate about how these people are representing their company.

Ok. So I'm giving it 4 stars based on the fact that it's taco bell and I'm comparing it to other taco bells. This isn't a fancy establishment, there are no bells(besides in the name) and whistles. With fast food I have little expectations other than fast and accurate service and pray the food is "decent".
So with that said. This location meets expectations. 
The drive thru line IS long -go inside if your in a rush 
the orders are 98% accurate which is pretty good considering everyone's been "screwed thru the drive thru"
BUT THE STAFF: THIS IS WHY I BOTHERED TO YELP A FREAKING TACO BELL: the staff is always super nice. Chatty, funny, whitty, apologizing for a wait (if any) and they seem to actually enjoy their job. Which, I mean .... 

The food is mediocre, but it's taco bell. But if its late night and the feelings right, stop by this location for a little taco/burrito action and meet the staff.

i went to this taco bell few days ago and to be honest price and food is ok, but today i went early and the OWNER was there, i ask him if he has some breakfast combo, he told me very rude "no i have no breakfast here we open at 10 by the time everyone had breakfast already, if you bring me eggs i can fried it , now do you want to buy something else !" ( he said all this shouting) after that of course i did t want to buy anything so I said NO THANK YOU and before i finish he said "YOU DONT WANT ANYTHING OK BYE" putting his hand in front of my face and walking away absolutely rude he was shouting!! i feel sorry for his employees.

"Taco Bell is not real mexican food". It gets the job done for half the price, what's not real mexican about that. And in the case of the new smothered burrito, it gets the job done handsomely.
This particular taco bell was clean (looked to be recently remodeled), and not busy. One taco assembler on the line was new and didn't know yet how to make the food, but his trainer did so while it took a few seconds longer than usual all was good.
I would never eat fast food" places are not clean at most. young employees  could care less

Came here at 1:00 am after a looooong drive from Washington because I was starving and they were not open. I checked on yelp and it said it was open but NOPE! The drive through menu was not lit up and there was not a person in site!  Drove down the road to get food at Jack in the Box instead.
One of the best Taco Bell's I been too and I'm a snob when it comes to fast food. Customer service needs a little tweaking.

This Taco Bell surprised me with their speedy and diligent service. The location I've known longest has lost their A game and usually takes over 20 minutes for my simple order. Our $35 dollar - two tab order was all correct in less than ten. Restored my faith in 4th meal.
The people who work here are always so nice! Here and the KFC next door. They are just so polite and really pleasant!

The customer service is always great here, especially for a fast-food place. Other than that, however, it really isn't a great location. The drive-thru is the longest wait all the time. It's consistently over 20 minutes. If there's more than three cars in it I will skip it.

From one Taco Bell enthusiast to another this Taco Bell will not disappoint! Beware of the one way streets that access this Taco Bell but it is worth it! Went through the drive through and got my food correct and quick!!!  Eat with trust! Cure the late night munchies. 

Drive up, get your fix, and enjoy the art of Taco Bell!!

As far as taco bells go this one is decent. I mean it's a Taco Bell so your expectations aren't too high right? But typically this locations is consistent with their food quality and have never left anything out of my order. The staff is always friendly and even when there is a long line for the drive thru they keep it moving at a reasonable pace. I've only had an issue here once, but I honestly think they were having an off night and we hit them during a busy rush. All the food was cold and the taco meat was dry, and they didn't give me napkins or my drinks. I did end up calling customer service and the manager contacted me within a day and replaced all the items on my order for free and also hooked me up with a complimentary $10 gift card, which I really appreciated. Needless to say I've been back many times after that and haven't had an issue since. I will continue to be a frequent at this location, because honestly you just need 4th meal sometimes.

What can you say about Taco Bell?! It's a great place to get some cheap food. It is really good late night because not much else is open. This location also carries KFC and it's nice that you can order from both menus in the same order. 
The probably with this location is it takes FOREVER to move through the drive thru. They are always slow and it always seems that the car in front of me is waiting for something. Once you get in the drive thru you have no choice but to wait. I waited almost 15 minutes before I got to the window. The car in front of me waited almost the entire time for their order and when I got there of course mine was ready and not that hot anymore. 
I've never had an issue with the staff, the lady last night was very apologetic about the wait. That was the first time anyone apologized for the wait.

It's Taco Bell, so I'm not going to grade the quality of food. But I shouldn't have to wait 25 minutes for a burrito at a fast food restaurant, or have items left out of my order. I wish there was another Taco Bell nearby so I didn't have to go here.

This is the slowest Taco Bell drive thru around. If there are cars in the drive thru, I'd avoid it and go elsewhere. You could probably drive to the one in Tualatin and get back before you'd get through the drive thru here.

I get to Taco Bell and the line is huge for drive through but I wait anyway. It's my turn at the speaker and the guy comes on and says "we are not taking anymore orders" so I said okay... then another guy comes on and goes "I can take your order"... so I reply "oh so you're taking orders now" and he says "well if you want to give me attitude then you can get the hell out of my drive thru". So now I'm waiting stuck in this line to leave. This is qbpsulutely ridiculous and I will be writing many more reviews about this and would like a response as soon as possible. I myself work costumer service and would never treats someone like that.

literally the worst Taco Bell to go to ever. not only will you be waiting in the drive thru for about 6 hours cause they take their sweet time getting your order out, but you'll probably waiting about 5 hours if you go in. WORST PLACE.
They are always sold out how do you sell out of a taco?! Also their computer is always "frozen" after 2am don't bother going here, better locations than this one

Had a huge craving for many different things so I bought it all.  First off I was in Drive through and 1st in line.  After paying for the food we sat for 6 mins to get the food.  Only 5 items btw.  No special orders. So that wasn't good.  Then the steak quesadilla I ordered didn't have steak in the 2 ends. only cheese and sauce.  The middle had 6 piece of very small steak.  So I didn't get a steak quesadilla like I ordered.  Then got the Cheesy Gordita crunch.  Get this all the time at other Taco Bells.  It was so covered in there sauce that I had to let it all drip out and scrape it because there was no taste other than the sauce.  The Nachos were barely covering the chips and once I ate the small amount of toppings on the top, None of the nachos below had anything.  So it was pretty much just chips.  So another disappointment.  Ate this at home so thats why I didn't go back and say something but I don't think Ill go to this location if this is how it is here.

I never expect much frost a fast food joint but this Taco Bell is even worse than expected. I ordered 3 soft tacos, a drink with no ice, chips, and those new chicken roll things. When I got home all that was in the bag was the rolls. No chips, no tacos, and my drink which was full of ice was only filled up about 3 quarters of the way. The money you save by eating there isn't worth the years of your life you lose due to stress.
If you have breakfast, please put up a breakfast menu. If you have a drive through please have somebody who speaks clearly and loud enough to be heard.

Slowest Taco Bell on the planet. The idiots who work inside would rather be on their phones than do anything. Management sucks. Learn how to hire decent people. You are in such a great area with loyal customers. Why would you fuck that up?  The management here is beyond terrible.
Slowest drive through in the history of the world. Suggest you bring a book to read once your in the line up you are stuck!

This place was getting better, but that seems to have stopped and now it is going down fast. Today 4/2/2017,we ordered at 7:29pm. Got our food at 8:02pm. Some was cold, all of it was put together badly and some of it was missing. The place was filthy, food and trash everywhere. Most of the employees were talking to "friends" or on their cellphones.  All in all was the worst!

ugh, this location is going downhill extremely fast, service wise. no one cares and they always get my order wrong (all i ask is no tomato). they are very lucky i have no choice but to go there since they are the closest to me

Over a 30 minute wait from the ordering speaker to the pickup window.  WTF!  I was stuck and couldn't get out of line.  No compensation when I got to the window.  They said they were short handed.  NOT MY PROBLEM!  YOU SUCK!

Change your hours online so they are accurate. 
Turn off your menu, or put a cone in the drive-thru so people know you are closed. 
Answer the question when the customer asks at the menu if you are open rather than giggle into your microphone. 
Don't go to this Taco Bell.  Go somewhere where someone actually has a work ethic.
DO NOT GO HERE!!!!  I just waited 35 minutes in the drive through line.  Once you're in it, there is no way out! Beware!

Where to start? Tried to place order, lady taking order was sarcastic and rude.. told me my order was 500$, kept mocking my choices, and laughing in the background making fun of my order. Had to repeat my order several times. Told me to hurry up. Complete and utterly disrespectful and rude. No customer service skills. I honestly think this place is run by mentally deficient kronenbergs. Or she's high on PCP.. either way don't eat here. If you do they will surely spit in your food.

Okay I can understand how she heard fiesta potatoes when I say grilled stuffed steak burrito with no fiesta (no I can't). So I returned the burrito because it has Fiesta sauce and tell her no fiesta and wait and wait and wait and wait and wait and then finally just asked for my refund and there's no manager, and wait and wait and wait and wait and wait finally got my money back. Screw this Taco Bell.
Oh adding to the review they don't have the chicken roll ups either they ran out isn't that a brand new thing on TV like the last couple of days?

Since they reopened the quality has improved drastically, now instead of 100% certainty that the chalupa flatbread will be cold and not toasty like all the other Taco Bells in town it's more like 50% chance that they will be good, I was so shocked when I went back and the chalupa was just perfect like the first time I had them 13 years ago in Chicago. Obviously something happened and they are under new management. Service is better too.
