Run away run away run away from the drive thru. I think I am still in the line and once you are in the line you can't get out of it--there literally is no way to get out. 30 minutes plus in line for fast food. Who cares if the food is even good after waiting forever

So I've been going to this sub-par Taco Bell for the past year only because it's the only one close to our new house. I'm a Taco Bell fanatic, as lame as that may be, and I've dealt with this locations idiot employees for as long as I can take. I have finally been been pushed to my absolute limit with these elementary school dropouts. I can't even begin to count the number of times I have checked my order before I leave and consistently find something missing. After my most recent trip I finally have to say something. Ordering $26 worth or food and asking for sauce I'm met by a rude (and stoned) looking girl at the window who refuses to give me more than 6 packets of sauce due to them being low for the night. I try to explain how this is not my problem and I still require sauce for my food. She then refuses  to give me any more. I park my car and walk inside to again be greeted by this rude employee only to be told again that she cannot provide me with any more sauce. I ask for a manager who very reluctantly hands me 3 more packets. I ask for more and she looks at me like I'm trying to steal her first born child. After a very aggravating exchange, I leave with a total of 8 packets only to find I was so frustrated with this whole ordeal I forgot to count my items and I'm missing 2 tacos. This is by far the WORST Taco Bell on this great big blue planet. I will gladly drive any distance or favor my T-Bell from another location before going back to this shit hole.

Fast food is fast food but man the drive-through is the slowest I've ever seen. But for the most part decent  fast food, mostly friendly staff. Probably would stop by here more often but usually don't because of the waiting line at the drive-through!

What a pleasant visit! No sour cream, no mild sauce, or napkins. When I informed them they forgot my cheese roll up for my hungry child (the reason I went!) They were very rude. I will not be returning to this Taco Hell.

The food was good service was outstanding manger on the. Day shift had workers in order place was clean dinning room was clean . customer service was fast I HAVE NOT BEEN TO A TACO PLACE SO PERFECT. would tell others to come here

I pulled up to the drive thru at this Taco Bell at 1120am and had the following conversation.

Drive thru: we aren't open yet.
Me:  What time do you open
DT: Whenever we get everything ready

The posted hours for this location have it opening at 1030am.  Discarding the apparent fact that this location does not appear to serve breakfast, how is it possible that you cannot manage to get a Taco Bell open by lunch time when you are supposed to open an hour earlier?
the only taco bell that never screws up my orders!! they're nice & polite over the intercom and they do not make you feel rushed. the only taco bell i'll ever go to!

This Taco Bell screws up my food every time. Today is the last straw! My order was correct on the order screen. When it came out, three of the four items were made wrong. We stopped in here because it was much closer than The Chipotle in downtown.  It will be a blessing when the the new Chipotle opens up a couple of blocks away!

Food/service exactly as expected from a taco bell.

The drive-through line layout is really awkward, it should definitely be revisited. I've had to go back around once or twice because they forgot to give me the hot sauce I requested (a problem at every taco bell).

Otherwise, it is open late and fine.

This location has trouble getting orders correct AND in a timely manner.

Grr.

No one should have to wait 25 minutes for a Nacho Bell Grande (which came out incorrectly).  It's un-American.  Even on July 4th.

Nice and clean Taco Bell. The guy that took my order was just a nice guy and very cool. He took my order and it came back to me without anything missing. I ordered a Mexican Pizza which was crisp and as perfect as I have ever seen. Tasted great. The meal came with two tacos. Both steak supreme soft tacos. They didn't shy away from providing me a large quantity of steak. Kudos Taco Bell cooks. The taste was really good. I downed my thirst with an icy refreshing Pepsi. You impressed me fast food chain.

Obviously you shouldn't go to Taco Bell expecting fine dining. What I expect when I go to Taco Bell is decent food served at a decent cost decently quick. That's what I get when I come to this Taco Bell. I most recently ordered a breakfast quesadilla sub fiesta potatoes for meat. My quesadilla wasn't sad and underfilled, there was plenty of all of the ingredients and it was very tasty. I also appreciated that they didn't charge me any extra for the substitution. That's one of my least favorite things about fast food as a vegetarian. It seems you usually end up with less food for more money. I love that Taco Bell is so willing to cater to substitutions to make things vegetarian friendly.

Not only do you have to wait for a ridiculous amount of time at the drive thru, but they often mess up on our orders like today! Very annoying, its worth going down colonial to the other Taco Bell, the drive will be equivalent to your wait time at this garbage location
worst ever bad service and the guy making my food through the garbage out in the dumpster and didn't wash his hand before he started making food...

Man taking our order in the drive thru was speaking Spanish very rudely and offensively. He was not professional and was trying to be funny. It was not funny, it was offensive. We choose not pay or eat the food we ordered. Friday Aug 4th at 11:20pm. Fire this guy!

This is the most disguisting food I ever ate. The 5 dollar box with soda was horrible. The chalupa and the other two tacos broke into pieces upon me picking them up. The flavor was horrible, and the soda was flavorless, pure seltzer. If they keep hiring these little kids to prep food then be ready for closure. My dog eats better tasting food than this. Next time your in the mood for tacos,  just go a few miles yonder for some real tacos at DEL TACO. 
Never going back to this place. Yes it's clean but I'm not there to evaluate them for cleanliness. I'm looking to have a meal with some flavor and not scrap food.I have to give them one star.

in my opinion, this was the worst taco bell i've been to. my sister and i ordered simple orders, a quesadilla and burrito and our order numbers were 163 and 164. we wait there for awhile and notice they skipped our numbers and started calling other numbers after us such as 165 all the way to 174. so i go up to them and they say with an attitude "that order was called like 20 minutes ago" and we haven't even been there for 20 minutes. and then they ask for our receipts and we give it to them and they BARELY start making our order. terrible service and terrible workers. no wonder they need new workers with all the "NOW HIRING" signs all over the place.

Fast food is always a last resort and I try my best to avoid it but when you're hungry and in a hurry the only option is horrible food that is over priced. Why can't corporations serve healthy food instead of foods that are bad for our health?

We all know majority of fast food places are goo to make mistakes. Especially if their entire menu is very cheap and they stay open late as hell.
But let me just say, Amber, one of the managers at this Taco Bell, treats her customers like her Taco Bell is a gourmet steak house. Absolutely fantastic service and personally made sure everything in my bag was correct. I mentioned a past order missing something, and she did everything to compensate for that mistake. 
Never had a manager treat me so well in my life. I'm definitely a happy customer. Thank you, Amber! You are the best!
Why does it take forever to get your food here? Also why is it every time there is a homeless guy sitting in the store with a table full of Walmart food eating every day?
All Taco Bell drive thrus are horrible. You obviously know your going to be busy late at night so please staff more people!!!! This review is only for the lack of help in the drive thru!

Worst "fast food" service I have ever experienced. We entered the drive thru with no one in line whatsoever and ordered as normal. We reached the window and paid as we normally would but then we ended up waiting almost 24 minutes before we received the food we ordered.

Same Taco Bell food with some great friendly staff. I am a huge Taco Bell fan and honestly I visit this location far more than I would like to admit over the 8 year I have been living and working in this area. The staff here is mostly friendly, helpful and cheery with an occasional grumpy gus, but generally speaking I don't see those grumpy people for more than a visit or two. One of my only qualms with big food companies is the fact they generally make errors on specially ordered items but this location is pretty spot on with any special requests we do, and when you have a very picky eater like my fiancé, that is something that I really hope for.

I generally use the drive thru because I have two very rowdy small kids so I can't say anything about the inside of this location. However, in my experiences the employees are very friendly, never forget to ask if you want a drink and the service is quick. My food always tastes great and the one time it took a little longer then usual they gave me cinnamon twists for free (they did this on their own I did not ask or complain) which was unexpected and very nice.
The customer service here is foul. Find another location. If you're gonna have to deal with bad attitudes, at least go somewhere you dont have to wait 20 minutes on top of it.

It's Taco Bell.  You won't be surprised.  The tacos aren't creative.  They don't challenge the palate.  But they don't disappoint.  No they don't serve fancy ingredients.  If you want that, don't expect to be able to drive through in your car.  You'll have to actually use some energy to get out of your car.  Walk in, sit down, order, wait, ponder, sigh, tap your fingers, chat with a friend, and then maybe eat.  At Taco Bell you drive up, you talk, you drive a littler further, some money is exchanged, goods are transfered, and you drive away.  

The End. 
By Me. 
Age 26.
It took entire to long to get our food here.  The tables were not cleaned off and we had to ask for the straws to be refilled.
Worst service.  Soo slow....seems like every fastfood restaurant that we've been to in this area has a 15 to 20 minutes wait and tons of people inside.waiting..

People were rude and snippy. Bean burrito was not right(seriously...). My little cherry limeade sparkler was good, sonic is better drink wise. 
Otherwise it was taco bell. Didn't make me sick!! :D
Five star review for keeping your bathrooms unlocked and also five star review for having a perfectly designed parking lot and drive thru

The food isn't bad when they don't run out of something which is quite often on the KFC side.  Today I waited 15 minutes for 3 tacos.  Slowest service on the planet no matter what time of day you go.  :(

"On Oster, On Waring, On Hamilton Beach..."

There is the occasional frijole, grain of rice, or scrap of vegetable that narrowly escapes the clutches of the blender, but they are few and far between.  Don't bother looking for the meat, because they are still chasing it through the woods behind the restaurant.  I think if there ever would be a market for Taco Smoothies, this place wouldn't have to change any of their food prep to add them to the menu.

The place is really not that bad, it's just that the food barely passes for, well, food.  And, when you peel back the wrapper and open the tortilla, no matter what you thought you had ordered, the guts inside are pretty much all the same mushy goo of ingredients.

When it comes right down to it, all the Yum! Brands franchises are very much the same in terms of quality and satisfaction.  You eat there because it's fast and convenient, not necssarily because it's good.  I shouldn't take it out just on this location, but it's the closest one to my house.
They said they closed at 1am. I showed up at 12:50am and they would not serve me. Not keeping the time advertised. I'm disappointed.
Their food is expired and the girl at the intercom is the biggest a**hole!!!! I don't know why they won't fire rude people?!?!?!?!?
Literally the worst possible service ever. Kitchen is disgusting as well as the lobby. Waited 16 minutes for raw chicken. Demand a refund or leave now.

This place sucks, most Taco Bells in Austin forget one of your items when you get it through the drive through once in a while, but this location does it consistently, I would guess that it happens 80% of the time. If you go there beware and always check the bag thoroughly before driving away.
This taco bell is such a hit and miss.  The last time i went i was in the drive through for 30 mins. Smh.  Customer service isnt any better.
I have no shame.   It was a cheap, filling snack of three tacos and a Pepsi.  What can I say?

Always good, always empty, always clean. Went in for long john silver, we usually don't get LJS.

But the cashier told us of a good deal they have a feast for two for $12.00

We got a lot more food with the deal then if we bought meals.

Three planks, (chicken of fish or mix), drink, 2 sides, and hush puppies. For six bucks good deal. They have a few sides to pick from.

Have been to this location many times always good, and decent prices.

Why did I go here? There were only a couple people in there when I went in. I had a small family in front of me and they ordered quickly. After they ordered we walked up to the counter and the cashier disappeared for almost 5 minutes (without saying anything to us). There were at least 5 people prepping food, none of them are trained as cashiers?

We finally placed our order: 3 calupas and a drink. It took almost 20 minutes to get our food. I wasn't even going to eat there I wanted it TO GO. The food tastes fine, but it shouldn't have taken 20 minutes, even the people in front of us were waiting for ever. 

No one stayed at the counter and people coming in were stuck waiting there for at least 5 minutes. One kid was standing there for almost 10 minutes waiting for someone to come forward. Absolutely terrible.

Always a very long, unnecessary wait for your food whether you go through the drive-thru or go inside. Tonight I ordered a beef quesadilla and got a mess spewing out of a folded tortilla instead. Pretty sure inside that goo was chicken, not beef. I can't even fathom why it would take 10 minutes to make this... Never again.

Every single time I have been here they have screwed up my order. They have given me the wrong thing multiple times. It took me 45 mins to get through the drive though one night. And I still had to go inside and fix my order. Today I decided to give it another chance after a couple months of not going and there was cinnamon on my cheesy potato griller. I have never ever had a pleasant experience here. Ever.

The girl in the drive they was very rude I asked her for green salsa and she said they don't carry it when I get it all the time at Taco Bell, she than proceeded to stare at me in a very Uncomfortable/aggressive manner then handed us our food and than slammed the window at me
This Taco Bell location is great! The staff is always friendly and fast, the food is packed in the bags with care, and I never have had an issue with my order being wrong.
An ordering miscommunication was fixed immediately. Prompt and professional! Great clean place with friendly employees!

Staff isn't the friendliest and service is slow (although it has gotten better over the past few months), but my orders are always correct. The dining room is relatively clean, but I usually go through the drive thru because it seems to not take as long. Not the best Taco Bell, but it satisfies my frequent burrito cravings.

This is the worst Taco Bell! I am always between Oregon City, Wilsonville, Gladstone and being a huge Taco Bell consumer I always stop and get 2 chicken soft tacos with the grilled chicken instead of the shredded (like they use to be a year ago) and this store is the only one who charges me $1.00 per taco to simply have them put the original chicken on it! 
The staff is rude almost consistently and the last time I got my over priced tacos the chicken was rock hard when I got home. Which was really shitty after what was already a difficult day. Seriously I'll never eat here again. 
This Taco Bell sucks!!!

Size of everything went down and the price of everything went up. Join the ranks of Dairy Queen on manor. See you in the trailer park dawg. Seriously, used to be like "I want this and that and this" and spend $6 like a Taco Bell champion. You've sent me spiraling back to rookie year with your jacked up menu. Love y'all but come on. And your breakfast looks like McDonald's came over and crashed and made breakfast for everyone the next morning. Booooooo.

Please help. I'm trapped in the drive through. It's been 25 mins (literally) and I still have 3 cars ahead of me. No exit lane. 

(This taco bell is normally pretty good but c'mon... it's gonna be 45 mins by the time I leave)

This place needs to take a lesson or two from other drive-through's and the surrounding area. When it takes 25 minutes to even get up to the drive-through window-what's the point. And then when you get up to the window and comment that it's taken 25 minutes to get your food order at the window, the person behind the windows only response is "yeah I completely agree with you". No offer of how to make your experience better, or comping any part of your meal. Really Taco Bell - step up your game.
This taco bell is always slacking! Waited 10min for my food on a drive thru and when i got it, 2 items were missing!!
This location either screws up my order or doesn't have the products to make it. I always wonder how they run out of cheese, tortillas, or whatever item of the day is missing.
Terrible terrible terrible customer service from the girl working drive thru. I should of just left the food there cause it was terrible will NEVER go back and she should be fired

Unfortunately this is the closest Taco Bell. And I really shouldn't be eating here since I'm Mexican. But they have those captain crunch fried bite things and starburst flavored frozen drinks. So I'm here at least once a week. This location is pretty awful. Slow service for fast food. And the nacho cheese here is not to be trusted. Doesn't taste right to me.

Not impressed and feeling a lil underwhelmed! terrible service, portion control is way under specs and employees could use a lesson in hygiene and appearance NOT going to give another try tired of being disappointed by a fast food hopeful.
Well its Taco Bell.  The food was avg and service was good.
I really do not like this fast food place me and my wife are really big fast food people and Taco Bell is one of are least favorite fast food plans do not recommend!

Yelp needs to get it's shit together. Hours are wrong. Open til 2am daily. This review is for yelp. Yelp sucks. No consistency,  no real filter for bullshit. Yelp is only about making money by charging businesses to remove bad reviews and provide current information.

The person working right now is completely incompetent. I sat in the drive through for 5 minutes without any kind of greeting so i drove to the window. She gave me several excuses like it was my fault I wasn't greeted. Then she forgot to give me a drink. Once I asked for it, she partially filled it, so i handed it back and asked for a full drink. I drove off and realized I was given the wrong order. I ordered a 10, and was given an 11. Now I'm back in line, where I wasn't greeted for longer than necessary. And it's taking FAR too much time off the road for me. I am losing money by them wasting my time. Seriously frustrating. I work for rideshare and this isn't acceptable. And now!!! I'm editing it because when they finally "fixed" my order... they literally put a SLIVER of meat in each thing. And the cheesy Gordita was basically nothing but lettuce and loads of sauce. At this point I'm just pissed. We don't have many options for food late at night with this job. This is one I've been to many times and truly the worst customer service tonight. Oh!! And NEITHER bag had napkins. So I got a Gordita filled with sauce and no napkins. Freaking rad.

23 minutes...that is how long it took for them to give me my food from the time I paid for it...let that sink in.

I went to this KFC/Taco Bell combo store on a Friday evening about 7:20P.  The drive through lane was full and not wanting to appear lazy, parked and walked into the store instead of blocking traffic.  I walked in and no one was at the register.  Someone came up, apologized and asked for a moment as they were cleaning up the bills in the register and dropping them in the safe.  Fair enough.  
I placed my order @ 7:27 and waited... and waited some more.  The manager on duty (Alex) apologized and made an effort to get someone on my order.  But he didn't seem to have the respect of the employees and made excuses but didn't actually attempt to rectify the situation.  He acted as though I should take pity on him because he only knows the KFC side of the house and knows nothing about Taco Bell and blamed management for not training him.  
I had to keep asking...and then I got a little ticked as people that ordered their KFC got it and went out the door.  People that ordered small Taco Bell items after me got them and left.  I didn't have a big order (4 total things which for Taco Bell is probably average) but I waited...23 minutes.  The only reason I got my food is because the same young lady that took my order actually went back and made it.  She even attempted to rectify the situation by offering a free drink. I appreciated it but declined.

The store was a mess and no one collected the trash at the bin/tray drop for a while and it was piled up onto the counter.  

I would expect a little delay during a lunch rush or on a Friday evening, but waiting as long as I did took some patience and keeping cool.  I mean the reason we go to Taco Bell is because it is cheap and generally quick to produce.  Get in, get out and hate yourself later (whether reflecting and/or on the toilet).  
But if you want Taco Bell on a Friday night, find a dedicated Taco Bell store and stay away from this combo joint.

Just went to Taco Bell and was told that they were closed for the night with hours online show that they are open to 3 AM and their lights are still on. If you were close why do you show that you are still open and why are you advertise that you are still open. Been to this establishment many times before And have had many orders messed up so to show up and to be told opened and to be told closed is very unprofessional. Seems like the staff does not want to work.

I try not to go inside this particular Taco Bell. Once while eating lunch inside, I witnessed a confrontation between a patron and a dude asking for money. It fell a few inches from a fist fight. I don't even want to talk about the dude with the cup-o-noodles (deemed cups) that frequents this location. However, I will say that drive-thru success has been much higher. Don't expect customer service at this location. If the cashier asks you what the F*** you want then just go with it.
Ate here every night during our stay in Atlanta. Affordable, yet delicious. Friendly staff and delivers food into my hands within 5 minutes. This is how all fast food chains should be operating.

Nice and clean. Low wait time with good customer service. Plan on going back soon. One of my favorite fast food places. 

Only downside is I love CocaCola not Pepsi.  Still good  for eating in.

I can't believe that I am writing a review about a fast food restaurant but this place is run very well, in fact one of them told me that they were in the top 10 of the region and I believe it

They hire very cool people who are fun and friendly and do a good job

It's hard to believe you're at the far end of town

They are the only fast food franchise that I ever remember them at the drive-through suggesting ways I could save more money and letting me know what things are on sale at the time

I'm serious, I actually enjoy going there

When you can fill your belly with something that is neither sugar nor bread for $1, there is very little room for complaint. 

That is what I do, frequently, at this and other Taco Bells around Orlando. I'm not proud of it, but maybe I should be. For a dollar you can get refried beans, rice, and some sundry vegetable matter wrapped up in a flour tortilla. A dollar. A complete protein. You can do the math. Actually there really isn't any math to do here, unless I gave you the grams of protein and some metric for enjoyability. But even still, divide some number by $1 and I think you're getting a pretty good return.
I mean who wouldn't give Taco Bell 4 stars. You're kidding yourself if you say you don't like it.

"It didn't make me sick"  haha, I love it!  Just what you want to see in a food review.

Exactly, Michelle and Michael, if you live in Austin (or honestly anywhere) then you have literally no excuse for eating at Taco Bell.  With delicious taco stands on every corner at all hours of the night, the only thing sickening about it is how addicted you may become to these affordable AND deliciously authentic treats!

Last night, er this morning, I found myself in my car driving to my old neighborhood haunt for some al pastor and puerco verde.  I woke up smiling today, and none-the-broker!  And hey, no hepatitis!

This is the best Taco Bell in Clackamas/Portland area. They are all very friendly even though they are constantly busy. On Halloween I was craving a brisk half tea half lemonade and the guy working bought it for me! I work at a restaurant and do that for people sometimes but never have had it done for me. It was very nice!

It's fast food so what can you expect, but I waited at the counter for 5 minutes for someone to take my order, finally a lady came up and brought the biggest attitude, I get it, this isn't the best job, but don't take out your frustrations on me. It was a good wait to actually get my food but at this point I could've guessed that, my order was wrong, didn't try to get it corrected as I was just done with this place.

I have a deep, long, loving history with Taco Bell. We go way back. Remember when you could get a Mexican pizza with green onions? Oh yeah. I'm an OG.

This Taco Bell is pretty good. The food is always good and the restaurant is always clean! I loved the old staff a lot; they were personable, nice, and just really good people. It's different, now, which is why I'm giving this location 3 stars. 

Tonight, the girl taking our order was rude. She stood at the register with an "Are you going to order or what?" look on her face, instead of asking if we were ready to order. This is becoming a thing with people lately. I might be getting old; where are their manners? I digress. (Another phrase of the Elders.)

I told her my order, a steak cantina bowl, and she typed it into the keyboard and just stared at me. I looked at Husbae, because I was done with my portion of the order. As he began to answer, she kept looking at me and interrupted him by rudely saying, "Is that it?" 

It was a very awkward experience. The food was good. I just miss the old staff.

Manager was taking my order gave him my order but decline soda drink instead ask for cup for water, he pointed to fountain machine but no cups I ask him again for cup for water he said no cups. Tried to keep it healthy by getting taco salad. Basically he was a jerk, I frequent this location since it's close to work, guess u won't be coming here again. It was the white guy with big muscles and mustache.

This is probably one of the worst Taco Bells
I have ever been to.  They frequently mess up the order, once they ran out of beans and the tortilla taste like they have gone bad. Have given this place many chances due to proximity but it's just plain awful. Needs new management

I went there today and ordered dinner for two people none of our order came out correctly the worst part when I bit into my burrito was it had guacamole in it I am highly allergic  to it and became very sick when something was said to them they acted like they did not understand.

When I lived in Goose Hollow for ten years, I ate at this Taco Bell outlet perhaps two or three times.  At one time they had shamed me out loud for not knowing they only took cash and not debit or credit cards.  I could have scooted across the street to US Bank and gotten cash, but I was so furious that I made them keep their food.  Later on they did decide to start accepting debit and credit cards and I did eat there a couple of more times, but the customer service was still pretty sketchy, i.e. they were about as friendly as unhappy rattle snakes.  If I had been a Yelper at the time, I think they would have gotten one star.

I was back in the neighborhood this afternoon and a crazy longing for the Taco Bell Burrito Supreme and a taco overcame me - one of my fave combos from back in high school.  I abandoned all my reluctance and entered into the rattle snake den to feed my longing and craving.  I was very pleasantly surprised to find that the former rattle snake den has been remodeled a bit and looks much better and had some newer and nicer employees.

I was greeted pleasantly and even chatted with by a most personable counter person.  She made sure my order was correct and knew where I could pick it up.  She and the kitchen staff had excellent communication and seemed to get along well and work as a team.  When things weren't busy at the counter, this nice woman came out and wiped down tables and talked with all the customers.  Everyone responded well and seemed to genuinely like her.  I hope they know they have a gem in this woman.  What a difference!  I enjoyed my food as I always do when needing to feed the craving.

It's really likely I might not eat Taco Bell for awhile; it's not something I can eat often, strictly an occasional treat.  What's important here is the difference in behavior I've seen and will certainly have positive things to say in the future.  Customers don't often see this kind of improvement in a former problem location of an old favorite, but I'm very pleased to have noted it in this review, and hope that you might consider stopping by if in need a run for the border.

We thought of driving thru would be a great idea for dinner, over thirty dollars later we were disappointed with our order, we will not be eating from this Taco Bell again, my son was shocked at what little was in the Tacos, we were shocked that in everyone of the Tacos were less then a table spoon and a half of Ingredients, most of it was lettuce, and the rest of the food was nothing like Taco Bell we have eaten in SW Portland, and Beaverton. Not going back

Breakfast review: sausage burrito,  meh.... not terrible but not awesome. The eggs were buttery and fluffy. There was more potatoes than sausage. The cinnabon bites were too greasy. Big surprise there... the guy who took my order was really nice and pleasant.

I showed up about 5 mins before closing. The staff was very quick and accommodating. They got me exaclty what I wanted very quickly and didn't complain. The date was sunday January 3rd at 355am.  So congrats to all those employees for making some awesome Boss Nachos  :)

Omg WTF!
Don't worry folks, I'm not rating TB food, we all know it's cheap & delicious....
I'm rating my terrible experiance at this particular location.
NO BUENO!
The girl behind the counter was SO RUDE!!! I effing hate that! I won't bore you with my rant & rave but it is just unbelievable this woman still has a job! (Or I guess that's why she can only find one at Taco Bell..?)
Anyway, there's plenty of TB's in Portland & plently of great, cheap Mexican-ish style resturants too, so don't bother with this place.
As Craig Ferguson would say, "What a shite-heap."

5/11/17
Every time I go here I expect the unexpected, I don't know if the place is haunted or if the GM only hires morons 
Either way this place is cliche terrible 
A given is you will wait at least 5-7 minutes in the drive thru (10-15 if it's busy) and you better check your food before you pull off because you have a better chance of winning some money off a scratch-off next door at the gas station than you have of these people getting your order right 
The one time I didn't check my order, a simple order number 6 BEEF chalupas, they come out chicken chalupas. I went back after my friend drove to mcdonalds for her food. I was not mad or anything because it was expected, you know? Like that's MY bad. I am the one that forgot to double check! They said they mixed up a beef order and a chicken order and they would make me mine. After 10 minutes of standing by the counter and being told "your food will be out shortly" about 4 times, they finally handed me the bag with the 'beef' chalupas. I get in the car and my friend starts driving away, I sit back for a while just getting my legs some rest after having to stand there and wait so long for the chalupas. I finally open up the bag and take my first bite. First bite was all shell and sour cream and lettuce. Ok whatever that happens sometimes nothing out of the usual. Second bite tastes not like beef. THEY GAVE ME ANOTHER CHICKEN CHALUPA !! ;( I was so upset i was already too far away and my friend wasn't going to turn around so I had to eat !them. But how do you mess up the order twice the same exact way after you knew what the order was and I told you it and you only said beef like 3 times ‍
They always mess up on my orders 
I can only imagine how many orders they mess up or take too long every day

If anyone in Austin visits Taco Bell and orders the new "Cantina" tacos, please send in your Austin, TX citizenship card.

Mine is in the mail. 

The carnitas "Cantina" taco was a soggy piece of crap. Seriously, just go to one of our many taquerias. 

And Justin, Taco Bell cashier, here's how it works. I come up to the counter, you stop whatever you are doing and greet me with a friendly "Welcome to Taco Bell! May I take your order!" or something along those lines. What you should not do, is glance at me, say nothing, walk to the back, and when you return give me a creepy yet vacant stare while holding the cash register with both hands. That's how people mistake you for a sociopath! Got it? OK, great. Work on those people skills, buddy.

Two stars because I am forever enamored with the bean burritos + extra onions - my college drunk food of choice.

Its Taco Bell you know what you are in for.
was on my way home and was hungry so I stopped at this location. good service. place was busy.

Update; visited again unfortunately. I ordered a large order when I got to the window after 15 minutes of waiting they handed me a small small order so I knew it was wrong. Took them another 10-15 min to fix the problem all the while I'm asking what's going on and was ignored. Then they give me a cinnamon twist for messing it up. I get home to find yes a extra cinnamon twist but half my order not in the bag. Called to speak with shift manager and was told she refused to speak with me because she was on a break. Unbelievable how rude they were through the whole experience. What gives Taco Bell. You used to be at least nice. I know it's not gourmet but being polite is free.
I've been sitting at the wondow,  only order,  for 15 minutes. They just told me they are out of steak. We'll see how long this lasts.

I've been in this drive thru, I cant get out of, for 11 min and STILL have the same 2 cars ahead of me.  I also wrote in to Taco Bell about my experience ordering 3 tacos inside and having to ask for a refund after 20 min with NO apology from the manager that people were getting chicken family dinners before I could get 2 tacos. They never called or wrote back. This Taco bell needs HELP!  Someone needs to call their franchisee and see what they are doing wrong.

I am a Taco Bell fan.  The food was at the top of the line from all my thousands of experiences but what caused me to write the review...the service.  They are stepping it up.  They call your NAME.  My nine year old grand daughter was soooo impressed.  She knew this was not the usual Taco Bell service.  The crew today, around 4 pm were on their game.

They weren't very friendly for being in customer service. No smile or gentle greeting, and we always buy the boxes of taco's, mainly because we have four boys, but at this location we just got all our taco's thrown sloppily into a paper sack! Not really feeling like they give a crap about the customer, so we aren't going back to this one, sorry.

Always have had great experiences with this location. It's usually quick and easy and right by my work. The service has never been great enough to write a review however today the service was bad enough to write a review. 

Bad service and incompetency. Period. 

Two people at the mic took my order bc it sounded like they were crazy busy. All I ordered was a Mexican Pizza and a Bean Burrito, no onions. 

I pull up to the window and don't get a greeting or even an acknowledgement. Just, "Any Sauce?" And I told him "Verde." 

A couple of minutes later, "what sauce again?" "Verde." 

Then I am thrown my bag without a goodbye or a thank you. 

Got to work, ate my Mexican Pizza. It was clearly thrown together. Then I bit into my "bean burrito" to notice I chomped into lettuce and tomato. I thought that it might be some scraps that made their way in my burrito but after I ate bite after bite, I quickly realized I was eating a Burrito Supreme. My receipt even stated that I ordered a bean burrito so I don't understand how with an order of two items, only 50% was correct. 

Pathetic. Won't be back in a while. Not worth my time or money.

This is the Taco Bell located inside Altamonte Mall food court. Overall, it's a standard menu selection. The staff are so so, and show little interest in what they're doing. That being said, my order is usually correct, and they are made fresh to order. Don't expect seller service and you won't be disappointed. There are several other dining options available there, but this was the only one serving tacos that day. What can I say? Sometimes you just crave tacos. Don't judge me...

Great clean location, crew members are friendly and quick. Taco bell has meals for $2.00, in this day of high inflation it's an excellent deal. They also have a great tasting apple pie.

Some of the entrees are low in fat and calories and taste great. They also have Long Johns but we don't go there.

Horrible service here.  Waiting in drive thru for over 20 minutes!!!!  Store manager should be fired.  Completely unacceptable with only five cars in front of me.  The guy at the drive thru was doing it all on his own.
Much like any other taco bell, tacos, burritos, nachos. The staff here calls Baja Blast "blue drank", so if you feel like havin some fun order some. Other than that nothing to spectacular.
First, I ordered online and they went ahead and crossed off my order without making it. Second, my boyfriend came back and I was missing my drink and another Crunchwrap.
So slow every time. Zero lack of energy. No consideration of the customers time. Years ago it was fast. Bad management!

Any kind of burrito you order from here will fall apart on you instantly because they don't know how to wrap it.  Be sure it get a fork with your order. 
Avoid any food item with potatoes in it. What you get is really old rock hard chucks of potato.  I used one of the potato junks to stabilize my desk at work.  Seems be holding the weight and working just fine.

I have been in drive thru for over 15 mins stuck!!

This is ridiculous!!  I am not normally one to leave bad reviews but I have nothing better to do!!

Terrible!!

No mild sauce either!!'

Worst Taco Bell ever!
So confused they say they open at 7am but when I tried to open the door at 9am it was locked and no one was inside...??? If you change your hours put a notice online or somewhere!

I'm not expecting gourmet food when I go to a Taco Bell, generally I'm here for speed and convenience.  I really never thought to review it even though I probably went here a couple times a month.  This last visit on Saturday changed that.  I found (by biting into) a ten inch strip of plastic in my Taco Supreme.  It looked liked it came off a plastic bag of some kind.  The really disturbing part is it does not appear to be something the employee would miss due to size, leaving me to think it was out in the food intentionally.  Totally disgusting and the last time I eat at any Taco Bell.  I filed a complaint with the city and saved the remaining part and non-food item in it.  When I called and reported this to the manager he told me, "Come back and we will remake your taco." No thanks dude.  I also emailed Taco Bell on Monday but they did not respond.  Avoid, folks, unless you like eating things that are not food.
This Taco Bell is always "out" of whatever it is you're ordering. Why can't you make more beans? You don't close for another 2 hours!
This place sucks drive thru bad attitude never going back to this location i use to like it here but never again

Just opened up my order from this store.  I am not exaggerating when I say the tacos are empty taco shells also the the double Crunchwrap 
Supreme empty as well.  
I'll never understand why people do this.  It would be much better if they let you know from the drive thru microphone they have no intention of making your order - then we could just both go on our way - I'd eat somewhere else and they wouldn't have to go through the motions of faking an order.  It wasn't even close to closing time so they weren't even being passive aggressive so this one will puzzle me.
The slowest Taco Bell, service was lousy. Had to wait in line for 25 minutes for 3 tacos!!!!!

We stopped in for a light lunch, and ordered off the dollar menu. I had a pair of their spicy tostadas, while my date had one too plus the cheesy bean and rice burrito.
Add two ice waters and we spent only $4 
No hot sauce needed on the tostadas, as the spicy smoky sauce is sufficient. I didn't know this beforehand and dabbed some HOT sauce on them. Ended up with a good head sweat for my troubles. 
Free WiFi here, excellent friendly and helpful customer service, fresh fast food. 
This Taco Bell sets the bar high for others in this chain.

I ate here one night after many, many years of not having been to a Taco Bell.  It was fine.  I didn't get sick from the meal.  I wish the ubiquitous sour cream wasn't included by default.  If you don't like sour cream, ask them to leave it out of your order.

They seem a little overpriced for fast food.

The location is very visible and convenient right off Burnet Rd as you approach the Anderson Ln intersection.

Sorry. Anyone who gives me a chalupa at 2am in the morning and I am drunk as f***...

Five stars all the way.

Commandments of Taco Bell:
1) Don't expect creativity
2) Always get sour cream
3) Eat with Fire Sauce
4) If you think you might want two... get three
5) Crunchy tacos and chalupas are ambrosia for a drunk

I visited this location tonight, as I do many nights. The first guy we talked to was friendly and polite. He told us they were short staffed and it would take about 15 minutes for our food which was okay with us. However the second lady we talked to was rude, short,  and unfriendly. Our food was tossed to us and no offer of sauce was given. Upon driving home we noticed that the Baja blast was all soda water, no flavor and undrinkable. Once we got home the crunch wrap supreme was missing half the hard shell and the cheese was all on one side.

I was in drive though for 15-20 minutes just after 1 pm on Sunday afternoon, Nov 20, 2016. How awful it is to have to be in a hurry and get trapped in a nonescapable drive thru, you ask? Well, pretty bad, considering all you want in a fast food joint like Taco Bell is fast service! Once I reached the drive through window, the guy in here barely moved, acting dazed and confused. Asked what days I wanted. One min later handed me my order with no sauce. And, the steak taco salad looked half size than usual. Pretty bad you guys....

I've been here multiple times - I've only left happy once. I've gone in and stood around, and then sat around, and spent 25 minutes waiting for food. If I wanted to wait, I'd go to a sit-down restaurant where a waiter comes to my table. 

I've started going through the drive thru so i can at least choose the music selection, and because it's a tad bit faster. 

Maybe 1 person knows how to take orders without sounding like a complete arse. I've never seen an employee here smile. I'm starting to think this is a franchise location and corporate can't do much, because I've complained plenty to corporate and they just send me a coupon. There is something wrong with this location. I've been to many Taco Bells in my lifetime..and no Taco Bell as disappointed me as much as this one. I feel bad for the workers - they're clearly unhappy. 

Not only are the people depressing or abrasive (pick your poison I guess?), but they really skimp you on the food at this location. Expect your taco to have half of it's normal filling, cold, or to be missing a few ingredients, or all of the above. I've been handed a bag that was cold in my hand and I figured the sauce was at the bottom and they gave me a lot. NOPE. I got a taco straight out of the freezer. I had to do the most horrible thing you could ever do to Taco Bell food: [re]heat it in the microwave. 

So I'm a huge fan of Taco Bell, but I prefer to drive to the one on Burnet near 183 - they're super friendly, my order is usually at least semi-correct, and they don't get cheap on you with the ingredients.

Big Taco Bell fan but this is the most incredible drive thru experience of my life. Got the veggie crunch wrap supreme and Doritos locos and have never tasted flavor like this before. Truly amazing. Will drive out of my way to hit up this TB again.

Where's Taco Bell ever if you want your orders to get messed up every time they go here I've been calling and calling and no one picks up who the hell is a manager here if you don't like your job go somewhere else never fails

People there are friendly, but they really need to work on the meaning of fast food.  Been 3 times and nothing has changed.  Started driving out of the way for a different Taco Bell now.  There service wait time is minimum of 15 mins or more.  Doesn't matter if busy or not.  I ended up turning my car off in the drive through because I was there for 12 mins with only one other car.  Second 2 times we went inside and sat at the tables.  Good food but not worth the clutter of vehicles in the drive through or waiting all day.

Seriously? I pull up to Taco Bells drive thru to see the car in front of me smoking pot... Okay no problem, drive thru attendant accepting the pipe and taking a huge hit!!! Cool that's fine but this guy getting stoned at 1:03-1:05AM messing up my order that has 4 items not cool. Come On!!!? What is this garbage? I pay for my meal and get half of what I ordered... That's stealing from me! 
9350 SE Stark St
Portland, OR 97216
Check your cameras I want my money back.

This place is by far the worst taco bell ever. I went there two days ago(order 303162) I ordered a quesadilla with baja sauce, soft taco, cheesy potato burrito with lava sauce and cheesy fiesta potatoes,. The whole order was wrong. The sauces were all wrong and the soft taco was a hard shell taco, and the potatoes were half full. Crazy right. So I called and talked to the manager Rosa and she told me she would replace the meal. So I went back to day for the comped meal and she told me she would only replace the quesadilla. So i kindly reminded her of our conversation and so she finally replaced the whole thing(seeing as the whole meal was f***ed up). So now I place a new order for the new xxl steak  burrito(order 304633) with baja sauce. I get back to work and the damn burrito had no steak or sauce on it. How in the f**k do you mess up a new order when i am there to replace one you already messed up. If taco bell was smart the would fire the whole damn crew and start fresh with some english speaking people to start. The End....

Welcome young yelper'snappers, to a West Burnside tale. To a whole new world of yelping. To a tale worth telling.

Today as I walked along Burnside, I saw a middle aged man passed out in the blossoming landscape surrounding Taco Bell. As I walked by, two Taco Bell employees were timidly tapping his foot -- but to no avail. This guy was out for the count.

The sirens started less than a minute later. (They must have those guys on speed dial!)  As I left Skinnidip, fresh fro-yo in hand, I saw the flashing lights outside and decided, against my better judgement, to head for the border...you know, in case any of the EMT guys looked like they stepped off Grey's Anatomy or something. (it's true.) 

But before I could get there, I had to cross the drive-thru of death. 
And so did another man, however he was in an electric wheel chair...

...dramatic pause...

While we were crossing the crosswalk, a large unmarked van pulled out of the drive-thru and was blocking the pedestrian walkway in attempt to turn onto Burnside (which was essentially blocked by the now parade of ambulances and fire trucks). 

This did NOT bode well for Electric Wheelchair Man. He decided to take matters into his own hand and steer his way onto Burnside in front of the van, where he proceeded to stop and vehemently cuss out the van driver.  

However, with one wheel on the street and the other on the lip of the drive-thru, his wheel got jammed, his tires were spinning, and I was expecting to see dark smoke start spewing out of a number of orifices at  any moment.

Needless to say, about 3 steps behind Electric Wheelchair Man, I was in a rather awkward position. But come hell or high water, I was going to help this man! I dropped my yogurt (with a tear) and rushed to, well, I'm not sure what I was going to do because before I could do it, Electric Wheelchair Man GETS OFF his chair, picks it up, and carries it to the other side of the drive-thru!  He then demanded that the driver step out of his van and fight. The wheels were still spinning on the tipped over wheelchair, and the brawl was ON. 

Wait, what?!?

I walk by in shock, timidly scooping up the remnants from my *sniff* fro-yo, and pass by Mr. Pass-Out.  (Remember him?) Just as an EMT comments "blood at .21," I hear a fight erupt behind me, and one of the EMTs rushes to the other side of the parking lot. 

After witnessing all this, I just had to go into Taco Bell as a customer and enjoy a fresh batch of cinnamon twists to truly absorb what just went down. Yup -- those crispy twists of puffed corn really did the trick. 

Perhaps a well staged marketing gimmick? Crafty Taco Bell, crafty. 

(RIP Mexi-nuggets)

So, I dont usually do this kind of thing, but I feel like I need to warn everyone. I know Taco Bell usually gets a bad rap for being rough on the stomach, but this is ridiculous. Ever since my late night snack at this location last night, I've been married to my toilet. 

Seriously reconsider stopping by late at night, as its pretty obvious proper care wasn't exercised with food safety on my order. I've never had a case of food poisoning this bad.

I've been coming here the last few years and this location keeps getting worse. I asked for a number 6 and got a number 1 and all the cashier FANTAYSIA S at the register says is either eat it or throw it away that's your options.

Awesome service . 2:30 am and was AH-mazing.
We even got the cinnamon twist & they were fresh and crunchy. Just perfect. I even ordered the double decker shredded chicken & it surpass my expectations. Deft coming back. Shalene was amazing as well. Super nice .

Nicest guy works there at night. No more or less expensive than any other taco smell. Great fast, cheap food in a strip mall. Leaving 5 stars to counter the one star left by "poor me, I need a drive thru" guy.

This Taco Bell is located inside the Altamonte Mall, the food looks like it is old and made so fast they just throw whatever in there. I orderd the 99 cents nachos and cheese and a plain soft taco for my nephew and the nachos barely had any cheese and had any tortillas the taco looked alright but over all it was cheap with a large tea only $3 bucks. 

It's Taco Bell, quick and cheap but always gives you stomach aches. This particular location had a lot of people and the inside were the employees work looks tiny. 

If you want something quick at the food court in the Altamonte Mall then stop by in here but if you want something better I would suggest another place to eat at the food court.
Not a great location for this franchise. The drive-thru is pretty slow and my order was not that great. Find something else to eat late at night... That would be my suggestion honestly.
Never had a problem here. Friday and Saturday, late night/early am, the drive through gets busy.

Literally the worst Taco Bell I have EVER been to. Every time I go here my order is wrong. Judging by all the other reviews for this location they clearly don't give any shits about customer service. Word to the wise - expect NOTHING and lower all standards. Beware of Taco Bell on stark street, make the extra two min trip to a different location. 

PS - If no stars were allowed, I would give a negative one.

I went there last night through the drive thru and was rushed as i was trying to give my order then when i got home i checked my food to see that i was given the wrong food. No more taco hell from this place!!!

I havnt gone to a Taco Bell in a long time because I was tired of being disappointed. But my sister and I stopped by here because we were starving and only had a little bit of money. We laughed and were surprised when the girl in the drive thru said she "guaranteed our satisfaction"! HahahHa! But it was REALLY good! Even just their $1 bean rice and cheese burrito, and mini quesadilla! THAT is the kind of Taco Bell that you say "you know what sounds really good!?... TACO BELL!!!"

This place can't seem to get anything right. Asked for 9 supreme tacos and went home only to find none of them were supreme. We went back and told them to remake them and in return we get several tacos still not supreme and cold tortillas.

Meh. Long lines, floppy, sad and what I'm assuming 
(hours) old food. My poor Crunchwrap wilted in my hand like a dead flower. It was supposed to be a supreme...it didn't even have a dollop of sour cream and maybe 3 tomatoes. If I wanted a tortilla I'd of just stayed at home. I could go on but it just to sad. 
The only good thing to come out of all of this was the service. I didn't catch his name but he was in a fantastic mood. Took my order prompt, read it back and chatted at the window until my food was ready.

Went to our neighborhood Taco Bell just across the street from the apartment. Needless to say the service has gone to complete and utter chaos inside. Employment was horse playing in the kitchen messing up orders. There were at least 5 other people inside the waiting room still waiting for there order to come together. I decided to get my money back and take our business someplace else.

Probably the worst Taco Bell I have ever been to. Charged me $6 for the $5 box and never explained why. Service is terrible, cashier can't even do his job correctly and the tacos were all crushed or soggy by the time I got it. Never going here again.

I thought I was getting fast-food when I went through this location's drive thru.  I was wrong.  Dead wrong.  I waited so long in this drive-thru that I turned off my car.  I'm disappointed in you Taco Bell.  They weren"t even busy.

The only redeeming action was hooking up dat fire sauce. ;)

I know, I know... It's processed and bad for me, but a crunchy taco takes me back to being a kid. It's kind of reassuring.
My experiences here are nothing like some recent ones I've read. That could have a bit to do with when I'm there. It's the spot I hit often on the drive home from my night shift tending bar. I always get the same thing, no substitutions and less than 5 items. Never received a mismade order and the change is always correct.
The wait seems determined by the complexity and size of the order placed before mine... the drunkenness of the customer with the big crazy order definitely factors in too. 
The staff is always super nice to me, but I'm guessing by the tone of some reviews, a lot of patrons forget these are minimum wage workers, putting up with drunks and jerks all shift long -- without the possibility of tips. 
It's Taco Bell, if you want the same level of service you get at a table-service joint, go to a place that offers table service.
If you're drunkenly hollering 5 different orders out of a car window, you may want to cut the people dealing with you some slack. If I was on the window, I'd be taking down plates and reporting drunk drivers all weekend long.
NEVER go here. They give u stale food! Then they argue with u after u go back to their customer service desk.ahhhh!!!! Very stupid

Taco bell is taco bell. The food came out good. Order was all correct. But ladies and gentlemen..if you work in the food industry..PLEASE make sure your teeth aren't stained with black marks., uniform is filthy and finger nails arent dirty. It's disgusting and truly makes one loose their appetite. Presentation and a sense of cleanliness is always important.

I love this Taco Bell, a review from another reviewer triggered another review from me here. You know its a taco bell, you can get a taco, drink and chips for $2.19  It used to be $1.99 but its still a good deal. they also have Long Johns which is inexpensive.

i know this is going to kill some folks, but when I go to Tijuana Flats I really cant tell the difference. I guess from what i read they use a filler in some of their beef, but you can get chicken or steak as well. Nothing wrong with their meat IMO. the media blows things out of proportion just to make a joke.

The only thing i know is there isn't loud music playing in the background and long lines. I also never go to Tijuana Flats on a day other then Tuesday. I am not that big a Mexican food person to pay over five bucks. Lately TF has been skimpy on the meat anyway. it varies from week to week, but there is very little meat in the tacos.  They used to fill those suckers up but not no more.

What I love about this Taco Bell is the employees are great, they also get the food out fast and keep the place immaculate. It still feels like a new store even though its been there for over seven years. After a long day of work and going to a kids concert or game this location is refreshing. Prices are affordable, in this high inflation time, there's nothing wrong with that.  I swear its the cleanest restaurant i have ever been to. The managers and owners should be proud. We always ring the bell when we leave.

in my opinion, this was the worst taco bell i've been to. my sister and i ordered simple orders, a quesadilla and burrito and our order numbers were 163 and 164. we wait there for awhile and notice they skipped our numbers and started calling other numbers after us such as 165 all the way to 174. so i go up to them and they say with an attitude "that order was called like 20 minutes ago" and we haven't even been there for 20 minutes. and then they ask for our receipts and we give it to them and they BARELY start making our order. terrible service and terrible workers. no wonder they need new workers with all the "NOW HIRING" signs all over the place.
Incorrect orders nearly every time. It's not rocket science. If your employees just listened to what your customers ask for, they could get the orders right.
The food wasn't too bad, but the fact you get a fee for using a card - in this day in age - is absurd.

Out of the 5,604 Taco Bell's in the United States I think it is safe to say this one is the worst. No matter what time of day it is I know that I need to block out at least 30 minutes if my boyfriend is able to convince me to go here... and then it's a gamble if you're actually going to get what you ordered. It's ridiculous.

The food was fine.  No complaints about that. I also have nothing to say about customer service.  But....  Every time I come in when it's after noon there's never a clean table in here.  The floor is dirty with food all around.  It makes me wonder how clean it is in back where they make our food. I've been in here for about 25 minutes and during the slow moments you'd think they would clean,  but nope.  Just in back shooting the breeze. 
Don't know if I'd come back.

One star is generous for this Taco Bell Location.  We have stopped here three times and all three were disgraceful to the Taco Bell name.  

They ran out of taco shells first trip.  How does a place named Taco Bell run out of Taco Shells?  They offered to give soft tacos in place, but sorry you should have told us prior to ordering.  

This is a 2 in 1 location so KFC seems to take priority.  Chicken orders were coming out quickly but Taco Bell purchases were a 30 minute wait.   

Manager was disrespectful to several patrons.  Several patrons complained to the manager and he got in his cell phone and walked off during their confrontation.  Totally unengaged and had to consideration for the purchasers if their product.

It's just another ordinary Taco Bell; nothing to special to say.  It is kept very clean and the employees are friendly.  

The only negative thing is they consistently forget something which you've ordered.  So, if your'e going through the drive-thru, check to make sure you have everything you ordered before driving away from the window.

This is a taco bell I am aware, but this is a five-star taco-bell. Whoever that guy with the gingham shirt working the drive-thru from 12:30-12:45am on the 25th was super patient with us absolutely brain-dead college students. Like we were horrible customers, I just wanted to say thank you for bearing with us and I hope that man is recognized for his endurance.

The service at this location is always amazing! The staff are kind and the orders are always correct! There's a wonderful cashier Catricia that's a total doll! We have a location closer and drive to this one cause we know the staff is super!

I hate this Taco Bell. It's around the corner from my office, so occasionally I make a run for the border if I'm super busy and hit the drive through. 

This is the 2nd time I have ordered off of their new diet/fresh menu and it's the second time I have received the wrong order. 

I just wanted 2 crunchy tacos, but instead I got two bean and cheese burrito supreme. 

And oh gawd, What Is That SMELL! 

I took two bites from one, then tossed in the garbage. Opened the other and saw some sort of meat product in there, so took a couple bites of that too. It joined the other. 

I think I may hurl. 

I was charged for two crunchy tacos, but did not get two crunchy tacos. 
Grrrrrrrrr.

I needed a quick snack, and this was handy.  Clean inside, friendly service, and the usual cheap filling food.  I tried their chicken rolled tacos, which come with dips.  Crispy, with good chicken inside.  The dips weren't bad either.  Nothing amazing, but for a few bucks, I didn't expect gourmet.  

To me, Taco Bell is its own thing.  Not real Mexican food, but not bad for cheap, tasty, quick items.

Taco Bell is good food that is very unhealthy but delicious. The staff is always cheerful and helpful. They have messed up our order and in return we got a free thing of Cinnamon Twists which are delicious. Definitely not authentic since it is fast food. Last time I went there, a table had food and trash all over it. Not the best taken care of dinning area. Service is quick and prices are cheap.

So I'll give three for a his store cause the employee's are nice but this is for the regional manager to see. How you going to advertise nationally advertise free los tacos for world series stolen base but the employees have to say regional said we can only do regular tacos. Now it's free so harder to complain but do what you say and advertise. I want my Doritos taco.

This taco bell might be the worst one I've been to. Ordered a bean burrito with jalapeno sauce and chicken quesadilla. They asked what kind of sauce I wanted and I said mild. "No problem pull up to the first window."

Bean burrito is filled about half of what it usually is. Quesadilla has less than 10 pieces of chicken and no sauce. 

After paying for my food, I go to the second window, grab my bag, open it up to find no sauce at all. "Can I get mild please?" "We're out." COOL. THAT WOULD HAVE BEEN NICE TO KNOW BEFORE I PAID FOR IT.

I just stated working on the area and normally love Taco Bell but in the 3 times I went, all 3 times my order has been wrong. I called manager to let him know and he apologized and offered to exchange for the right order but at that time I was near by. I said that wanted him to be aware and the I probably will not continue visiting this location. He just thanked me for letting him know but did not seem to really care, in my opinion. I think you should take pride in what you do and this location does not..
It's actually kind of a skill to mess up every single order I've placed there. Youd think they'd randomly get one right.
Not much to say, minus having a drive thru I would not plan on having a quick in and out. Slowest Taco Bell by far. Not much else to say.

Would give no stars if I could. Oswaldo who's a manager. Locked the door on us before we could walk in. And it was only 8pm. Dine in closes at 10pm. We got in because someone who was eating opened us the door. He locked it right after we got in and told the customer to not open the door for anyone else. He wasn't going to take our order and he said we would have to leave. He then said they were open through drive thru. I said we didn't have a car and this was our closest option for food. As a business owner I would be mad if they denied customers to enter my restaurant because they were "short staffed" lol what a joke of a place. Will never return here. Horrible service!!!

Service was friendly, but SLOW. It took over 12 minutes to get our order, and it wasn't very busy. The store was also pretty dirty with a lot of food bits on the floor and uncleaned tables.
The one plus was the food was warm and tasty when we finally got it.

It's Taco Bell - if you are reading this review then not sure where you have been. It's what I need for when I need Taco Bell.  The service is good, the food is the same it's been for decades.  This location probably gets a bad wrap on service because it is a super busy area.  

I think the service turn around time could be better, but it's not awful enough for me to stop coming.  It also shares service with KFC which I could see adds to the delays.  

Enjoy at your own expectation.

Cashier seemed to have an attitude looked like she was miserable and hates her life.....The food i ordered the 5 dollar box with the nacho fries the tacos where soggy like they heated them up in the microwave and the soda had literly 2 ice cubes or it was sitting there for a long time the only thing fresh where the nacho fries.

It's true; this place does suck. Been here multiple times and I freaken love Taco Bell, but it took an insane amount of time in the drive through and no one was inside and no one was behind me. I only ordered three little things. That blows. To top it off, they forgot to give me the hot sauce I requested! Lame to the max.

Food would've been fine, but it was accompanied by a gross side of sexual harassment. The man working the drive thru Saturday night kept making unwanted, disgusting advances on my sister and myself. We left feeling unsafe and gross. Wouldn't recommend going here whatsoever.

Good old fashioned customer service at the drive-through window --  this girl is pregnant, cheery, patient as hell!!!!

!!!  you go Taco Bell

Customer service was lacking I walked in and the person at the register didn't even look up to greet me or anything. I couldn't tell if the other people waiting were there ordering or just waiting for food. I think a little eye contact at the very least would've made this a lot better.

First negative Taco Bell experience. Our regular Taco Bell location was closed to we drove an extra 15 minutes for Taco Bell. Service staff were really nice but half the food I paId for isn't in my bag. Extremely disappointed. Wish I could get my money back 
OH, and the crispy tacos were soggy and THERE WAS NO CHICKEN IN THE CHICKEN QUESADILLA. Worst Taco Bell experience ever.

OK, so everyone knows fast food isn't good for you but when we do want fast food, Taco Bell is our choice. We are residents of Lake Oswego and had a Pre-Christmas craving. 

Employees change often so I'm not saying we would never go back but It sure wouldn't be for a long time. I couldn't understand what the gentleman was saying at the speaker despite asking him to repeat it a couple times. Still not understanding his speed of voice, I said I would pull forward. I got a death glare & a nasty attitude. I wasn't trying to be difficult! I honestly could not understand him! We still wanted the food so I went into the restaurant to order. I asked for a manager just so I could make sure and have it handled properly, for fear the man might spit in my food. The lady (Whom I don't think was a manager.) was extremely rude (not what one would anticipate) and so I asked if there was a GM I could talk to. At this point I wanted to complain AND still get the order. He was the most unprofessional person I could have encountered. He began to argue with me about the voice of the person taking the order rather than doing simple protocol of 'hey, I'm sorry for that. Can I take your order?' and gave me a facetious 'Merry Christmas' after I had enough and was walking away. All I wanted was good fast food with convenience! I left the house in my pajamas for heavens sake! 

Both my husband and I are business owners and would be terribly disappointed if we had employees who represented us like that. Not okay.

PS, If the owner wants to review the monitors, this occurred on 12/24/18 about 11:20 AM.

This store is an absolute joke! Why would I pay EXTRA for steak, & get less steak than usual! I ate almost half of this not even knowing if I actually got steak at all. Absolute f**king joke of a store. Unfortunately do not have time to go in again, but will be letting the manager know how much of a joke this is. Do NOT go to this taco bell!! Go to the one on 82nd by Eastport plaza or further down 122nd. Shame on this store.
10 minutes drive thru for 2 tacos and a sprite at 10:39pm. That should tell you all about their service.

Ordered combo and it was placed on tray with all other stuff. Ended up unwrapping all the tacos in order to see which were the supreme. Ordered nachos and they were disgusting the cheese had a bad taste told the manager and I asked if he can exchange them for cinnamon twists he did there were 5 cinnamon twist in the bag and they too tasting horrible. Seems like their dryers need clean oil and need to be cleaned out. Not coming back to this location. I love Taco Bell but this location sucks.
Customer service was good, food came out fast and hot. Bathroom was extremely clean. Good experience.

My food order cost 20% more then any Taco Bell I have gone to in Portland.  When I asked why, I was told it was a franchise, so they charge a little bit more.  I do not agree that 20% more is a "little".  I was not aware this was even legal....
Closed on the inside 2 hours before supposed to. With no signs, but drive through open with a long line

Subpar Taco Bell, I mean you get exactly what you're expecting but we all love the talk about they give you more than your expecting and this is not one of them.
The prices are not increased for no reason like the other one in this area though

I love the remodel. But we were here at 2pm it was pretty much dead and their dining room was filthy. Couple people just standing around who could have at least washed some tables. Also when you order from the screen it takes forever to get your cup. The food was ok but super slow and came out luke warm(the cheese in my five layer burrito wasnt even melted), and someone who ordered the same thing as me but after me, and got his first.
I got sick eating delivery from here, gross! I hate germs.
Never been asked to hurry because there is a long line behind me. After being at the speaker for maybe 15 seconds (my daughter couldn't decide).  Never going back again.

I order from this restaurant with the Uber eats app. I get a phone call and they say they don't have enough meat. I say well if I cancel the order they're going to charge me for it anyway. So you have to cancel the order. The girl tells me there's no way that she can cancel the order and instead she goes ahead and sets it up in the system as she's preparing my food. I try to cancel the order. I get charged $21 and some change and now I have to wait 3 days for it to be returned.
The wait time is soooo long and they skimp on the ingredients for the potato soft taco. Go to the one by Norwood or on Airport.

HORRIBLE. Ordered a 5 layer burrito and I got a tortilla with literally only cheese and onions. Check your order before you get home!!! Not to mention they were very rude.
**update****
I called to speak with a manager and it just so happened to be the woman who I placed my order with. She told me that I was wrong and actually did not order 5-layer burritos, she said that I ordered bean burritos...WITH NO BEANS! Ha! No wonder why I got a tortilla with onions only. I asked her if she knew anyone that would order an onion tortilla...why wouldn't she double check the order?? And instead of admitting she heard wrong she wants to say that's what I ordered and didn't bother offering to give me what I actually ordered. CAN SOMEONE AT TACO BELL PLEASE START HOLDING YOUR EMPLOYEES ACCOUNTABLE
Really good. I enjoyed it you should definitely go to this place good tacos. Best tacos
I am basing my whole review on the very ugly, icy, cold decor Taco Bell has done.  Contemporary at its worst.

This Taco Bell is conveniently located just outside Walmart and because of this location it can certainly become very busy. The staff certainly isn't anything to write home about, you're lucky if you get a smile. Conversation is short and to the point. Unfortunately orders being correct can be hit or miss...leaning more towards the miss. That's ok because regardless what's ordered it's your standard Taco Bell so you always know what to expect. Of course on my most recent trip my order was wrong but on the bright side I found something new on the menu I enjoyed! You wouldn't think to come here for breakfast but their bacon A.M. Crunchwrap with hash browns, jalapeño sauce, cheese, bacon and egg is to die for!

Pshhht. Don't let these other haters fool you. 

The experience at this Taco Bell is just like every other Taco Bell I've ever been to: 

Sh*tty. 

It's fast food, people. Get your chalupas and get out. Unless you find a finger in your Mexican pizza, there's not really much you can fault a mall food court Taco Bell for (the lowest of the low of ANY restaurant).

This Taco Bell is so disappointing. Currently I'm sitting in the drive thru and there were a few cars ahead of me when I came. It took about 25 minutes to get to the window and I've been standing here for about 15 minutes. The workers seem as if they don't care about their job. Rude to me as the customer and just so unprofessional.

Probably the worst Taco Bell ever, this location forgets items every single time or happens to confuse your order with someone else's.  Not to mention you have to wait like 45 minutes to get your food when it's supposed to be "fast food".  I've submitted multiple complaints against this location because the employees that work there are the most useless people on this planet.   They try to make up excuses that they're so busy but yet you're one of three people waiting inside and two cars in the drive thru.   I love Taco Bell but everyone that works at this place is a joke including management.   It's not that hard to make a damn taco or burrito.  Get your shit together...

You all know what the food is like. This is the most disgusting Taco Bell I've been to. Garbage and food on the floor and in the kitchen. Five people 'working' only
One doing anything. Not rush hour. Nobody in the drive through. Nobody willing to take your order. Have to use the kiosk in store. Still takes over 20 minutes to get our food. Pass this one by.
Do all the employees smell like weed??  As strong a this place smells like Weed they have to be smoking in the back!! OK, it might not be ALL the employees, but at least 3 of them reeks of it!

At the drive-thru late and order two special menu items, "oh we don't sell those." Sign is still up, okay then, recalibrate order. "We are out of beef, chips and shredded chicken." So like your entire menu? Was here once before and they were out of flour tortillas. How is that even possible?

I am not too certain,  but everything tasted like hand sanitizer.   My friend said it tasted like they were eating perfume.   I know what I am getting with Taco Hell generally, BUT.....   This order was beyond horrible, did not even eat one full item out of 6 altogether.  The taste of something fragrant and chemically mixed into, the food spoiled this whole meal essentially.  As much as I want to take another bite, I can not physically do so.  It is like someone sprayed a bottle of lysol on everything.   Completely bullshit.  Good day.
No naked chicken chalupa last two days despite it being "back" on the menu. Why even advertise?

I'm impressed. Lol 

Not a long wait in the drive through, friendly and great service with a smile and my food looked and tasted great! :)

I never had the mini chicken and beef quesadilla and I liked it! I will definitely order just the chicken as it taste better!
A very hilarious Taco Bell where they will flat out lie to you and tell you they are out of food when they're not and they just don't wanna serve you.

I don't eat fast food much well..let me rephrase that...I'm trying not to eat fast food as much, but when I do, Taco Bell will do it right for me.

I only had $2 left in my checking account until payday, my stomach was cranky and all I could do was surrender myself to the God of fast food. 

I walked to the counter and ordered one Chicken burrito for $0.89 and one Cheesy fiesta Potatoes for $0.89. Surprisingly, they tasted delicious. I was surprised, I like the chicken burrito. Usually I'm always leaning towards the beef and red meat, but today chicken made me happy.

 I was thrilled that I only spent $1.78 and pretty much I had $0.22 to spare until payday. Thank God, payday is only two days away. 

I luv ya, Taco Bell. Please don't change, I like you just the way you are... cheap and delicious.
