We got there just about 15 minutes before closing time. We ordered a 3 taco supreme combo and a cheesy Gordita crunch combo. When we got home we opened the bag and found; 1 bean soft taco, 2 bean burritos, 2 breakfast tacos, nachos, quesadilla and 2 bean gorditas. ‍
Fastest Taco Bell drive through! Been going to this particular location for years now, and I am never disappointed! Excellent staff!

Pulled up to the drive-thru, only to hear "Thank you for coming to Taco Bell. I apologize for the inconvenience, but we are out of tortillas right now."

How do you run out of tortillas at 9PM on a Tuesday? Last time it was beans... This place is a joke!
Really rude girls at 3:00 o'clock 3 people walk out because they didn't even say hi or anything they just have the poor people standing

I feel silly for writing a review regarding Taco Bell but my service tonight was mediocre at best. 
I Usually go to this Taco Bell since it's pretty close to my house. Tonight I was asked three different times for my order, which every time I property replied with my order. Then she's say oh can you hold on. This went on for like 5 minutes I was honestly so annoyed. My order was incredibly simple, a number 10 with the tacos upgraded to the supremes, it cost like $1.50 extra. She put it on the screen, order was correct blah blah. I went to get my order she was not even coherent she didn't seem busy and it didn't seem like her first day, she just didn't care about anything. She handled off my food didn't say anything just went on to talking, I had to tap on the window to get her to give me my drink that she forgot. I was nice, it was an embarrassing encounter for a service industry person to have with another person in the industry. 
That was annoying.. until I got home and the drink was tasteless (not her fault) and I did not get the upgraded tacos I paid for (eh, could be her fault.)

Oh well. That's what I get for ordering Taco Bell
Very bad location. Food was cold, didn't receive sauce or sour cream. Bad experience. Cheese in quesadilla wasn't even melted.
Took 55 mins to get our order. Didn't even get a sorry for your wait. Then our order was wrong..... We stayed patient and waited it out, but man they have some horrible customer service.

This has more to do with the staff, and not the food. Around closing time, someone comes into building, and starts shouting at the crew, and called out a tall Hispanic with tattoos on his arms about respect. The guy who walked in was shouting at the staff in prison terms. The staff handled it very well, and calmed down the situation. 

I ordered 2 bean burritos there, and was entertained. The bean burritos came out good.
Love Taco Bell but this one isn't the best. Makes the messiest quesadillas of all time & didn't give/ offer any sauce. Tacos with no sauce is painful.

The worst experience, so i have a set of twins one does not prefer meat and the other one loves it.  i went to this taco bell location ordered my meal and  came home, when i got home i noticed that my order was not right at all, so i called and took it back. When the i arrived the young lady who took my order the first time was leaving so i spoke with another lady.

 I asked to have all 3  my Nacho boxes replaced, two were not made as i ordered them and the one was super cold by the time i got back to taco bell. The cashier told me that the 3 boxes were too much to replace and that i had to be charged for another Nacho box if i wanted to replace the 3rd one, after i just spent $26.90  in the drive through. 

To make matters worse the Nacho Boxes they did replace were given to me with the lightest portions of actual meats and cheese it was i ever saw on a "loaded"  Nacho box, it was unbelievable. i will be calling the store and their corporate offices in the morning.
Faith was so sweet had to leave a review! Great service :) & love that they had sweet tea at 2am!

Usually passes as a Taco Bell but since the beginning of the month, 2 out of the last 3 times I've gone I've been told the "system was down and it'd be a 20-30 minute wait."

Keep in mind both of the times I heard that was at around 11:30 pm and today and 10:30 pm (close at 1am).

Odd how frequently the system goes down here, always at night, and the guy also knows when the system will come back on. 


Edit: changed to a one star because guess what 2 more times I've gone and their "system is down" 
After a long ass double on a Saturday sometimes I just wanna pick up a few tacos. I get you just want to clean and go home but there's still an hour left of business and this is always the excuse. Now they don't pay me the big bucks to run a restaurant, but if they did, I'd recommend.. idk.. getting a new system?

The food is always great and the service is ok. They've always get my order correct. I do recommend you pave your drive through. I feel like I need a 4x4 to get to your window. It feels like a roller coaster.

On this spot used to stand an aged Taco Bell, it was Formica everywhere and it was big with lots of parking and worn tables and chairs, but it was comfortable and it was familiar.  Then a few months ago a cyclone fence appeared around it and ominous construction equipment appeared around the old building.  Soon a sign appeared, "Coming Soon: Taco Bell"  But wasn't it a Taco Bell before?

Today I found time in my ultra busy high profile life to pay a visit to the newer, more colorful and much smaller Taco Bell.  I almost didn't.  Why?  Because I pulled into the parking lot and I couldn't readily identify where to park my car.  You have to pull in but wait watch the spaces on the left, they are car and van pool parking (?!?), to the right is for handicapped and maybe there is one space in there.  So I drove forward a bit and passed a skinny entrance into a parking area that forces you to walk across the drive-thru lane.  Or you can park past the drive thru entrance way up past the building.  Awesome planning!

I hiked back to the building and found the front door.  Upon walking in my senses were dulled by earth tones and then assaulted with accents of bright yellow, very southwestern.  I ordered with the nice girl at the back of the place and took a moment to notice that even though the building is smaller there was probably more seating in this configuration than in the old one.  

While I waited for my order of run for the border I walked up to the soda vending contraption.  Lots of buttons so my hopes were buoyed that there would be some new diet options.  16 options and if you count water and unsweetened iced tea there are three options for diet oriented drinks, and only one diet soda option.  When will they learn?

It's cheap, it is edible, it doesn't upset my stomach and I have never got food poisoning from them, that makes it a viable quick lunch option that is possibly a little healthier than a burger and fries.  End rant.

Who is running this place? Waited in drive thru line over 15 min to find out they were out of what I wanted. Got to the window- they forgot my sauce which I had asked for and a spoon. Had to go inside to ask for spoon, which I had to wait for since there was nobody running the counters inside. Finally started to eat and they gave me a bean and rice burrito instead of 7 layer. Really?
I food was terrible and burn . Thanks for bad experience ................. the pictures said it all

Party packs are the best! quick drive thru order and lots of sauces to go. 
Drive thru is currently open.
Inside dining is closed for renovation. Just a heads up!

This particular Taco Bell is the worst. First of all, they close early every time I've tried to go late at night. I went tonight and they were closed 45 min before they're supposed to, maybe longer, who knows. Sometimes I go by when it's not even that late and they don't have chalupa shells and tell me it will take like 20 minutes just to get me to leave because they're too lazy to actually do their job. It's always the same tattooed prison looking guy who I guess is the manager and I'm not trying to say negative things about people with a record but could you just do your job please? It's not hard to throw a chalupa in the deep fryer. Get it together people.

I've eaten Taco Bell so long that I can remember the huge Taco Bell Grande's from the 1980's. Those tacos were my goto until they did away with them, which made me sad ;). Then they come out with a 12 pack Nacho Supreme taco's that turned into my favorite! 

Now the reason for the low rating was my visit from 2 weeks ago. We came back from traveling and I purchase the 12pk and there was only 9 Tacos. I called the store and asked what happen and was told they were left out of the box accidentally. This store is always having some type of issue... either they forget to count the tacos or they check-out and your lacking filler in the tacos.. i guess I'm done paying full price for only have of my food. I can make cheaper tacos at home.. and make sure I get everything right.

I wanted to leave a review for the customer service. It was really great and they were very kind. The line and wait was long but they were apologetic and professional. I would definitely come back here again just for the customer service.

Bruce BRUCE Bruce he's the man, if he can't do it no one can ! Ha ! Needless to say he was amazing, you go into a Taco Bell drive thru around midnight and expect the least, he exceeded our expectations ! Super welcoming, answered my questions about a taco and the supreme difference. Asked what sauce, we got Fire, there was a lot in the bag, which is what we asked for and what we needed, we EAT IT ALL! 
Thanks so much team that worked tonight ! We will be back, as you made our Taco Bell experience great and we will be back ! 

Xxxxx

Reading other reviews, I seem to be far from alone. I pulled into this Taco Bell at 11:24 PM. It is now 11:58. Why am I still in this line? Why hasn't this line moved? These are the questions I'm pondering now instead of larger life altering questions. This stinks. Be better. Care. Or, shut down and find people that do. Awful. This is my literal last time giving this location my money. PS. It is now midnight.

It took us about 5 mins to order because the self-serve was glitching. Then we wait patiently for our food for about 10-15 min. I paid $8 dollars for this pizza and this is what I get instead. I could've gone to dominos and gotten a medium pizza for less. I used to love going to this Taco Bell but anymore. Please don't let this happen to anyone else. That's money I'll never see again.

Haven't ate Taco Bell in a while, more than a year and today I remember why. The food tasted like a day old, very dry and not fresh tasting. Employees told us to find out if the togo order is mine. Don't think I'll ever eat Taco Bell again.

My girlfriend and I waited for 30 minutes in the drive through line. When we got to the front, I realized I'd forgotten my wallet. Being that my girlfriend had to get up early and we were running low on time for the night, we begged the guy at the window to hold our order and let us come back to get it (we live very close). The guy at the window was kind and understanding, however his manager was not. The manager said that we'd have to re-order and sit through the entire line just to get the food we'd already waited for 30 minutes for at a "fast food" restaurant. This guys lack of empathy and basic human decency has assured that we will never be visiting this location again. A half hour is too long to wait for taco bell, but you expect us to do it again and make it an hour? You must be out of your mind Sunday night manager.

We came here after a cheer competition because of the location and we had a good experience here last year. Not this time! There was No ice. Fountain machine was out. Cashier was notified and nothing ever was done about it. Long wait for "fast" food. Order was incorrect. Biscuits was under cooked. NOTHING was pleasant about this place. Do not recommend at all.

I've never written a yelp review. I specifically downloaded the app and created an acct just to come here and say that this Taco Bell is fucking bullshit. Went through the drive thru for two items: a fresco style crunch wrap and Doritos locos taco. 

This is what I got. Shittily made. Barely any meat. The meat on the locos taco was so liquid-y, that the taco fell apart like you see in the pic. It made the tortilla soggy. 

$6 for this shit. This location needs to get their shit together. Retrain their staff or something. Very very upset customer.

Their food is not good. When you receive your food you can right away see and tell that they didn't care if they make it food or not or presentable at least. I've went here a few times already because I thought maybe someone new was working or it was busy or something so I gave them more than 3 tries and went there more than 3 times. The first time I order a quesadilla with extra jalapeño sauce and when I got the meal the sauce was almost all in one place in the middle with everything else like they scooped it and dumped it into one spot and put it to cook. So the next couple times I went again and I asked them if they could please spread out the sauce and everything and everything in the Taco because everything in the taco was in one spot in the middle. So I asked them the next time I came and still the same thing and they put barely any sauce when I paid extra for it and of coarse it's all in the middle only and every time I ate there and asked for them to spread the meat and sauce and everything around they said ok but still I got it all in the middle and it just taste bad and horribly done. If you can go to another do that because this one sucks with there food and customers requests even if they pay extra for it.

1 Star is too many! This location SUCKS!! The wait times are consistently ridiculous! Late night...expect to be in drive thru at least 30 minutes...and that's if you're at the order board. I would love to sit down with the DM of this location.

YUMM. The best Taco Bell I've ever been to. Quality food, service, friendly staff, and only twice did they not give my family the complete order, where all other Taco Bells we have to recount all of our food to make sure it's in the bag. Compared to others, This is Taco Bell heaven, while the others are Taco Hell.

You suck!!! If I could give 0 stars I would.  Burritos rolled with all of each thing in one spot.  Grilled stuffed burrito couldn't even be picked up you wrapped it so loosely.  Sadly if was the damn manager who was making what they want to call food.  I have never had a worse experience at a Taco Bell.

Being a six day a week vegan (Whole Food Plant Based) I have come to LOVE Taco Bell. It is very vegetarian friendly!

My favorites are the bean burrito which I love with the "Fire Sauce" and the Black Bean Crunchwrap, also with "Fire Sauce". I always eat the Crunchwrap first then a bite of the bean burrito and I am too full to finish it. The bean burrito heats up nicely in a microwave the next day.

The Crunchwrap can be personalized. They have an app where you can order ahead and personalize it.

Anyway five stars for consistently good fast food!
My sister and I went there last night and ordered taco salads and they failed to put the salsa in the bag not to mention, I found plastic in my salad and I had to pick it out.
Taco Bell is fast food right? Ive been waiting for 20 minutes and my food isnt ready yet. Wow.

Normally I am served by a guy with gauged ears who has excellent customer service. Upon coming in today  I was given horrible service by an impatient dark hard kid with a bad attitude. he had a beard and mustache. Unless this guy gets fired I won't be coming back. Having a condescending attitude while being in fast food industry is kind of ironic. I make more money in a day than he prob does in a month and I still am approachable and kind to strangers.

They never get my order right. I ask foe extra cheese on my taco's. And I never get extra cheese and they still charge me for it.  Tonight I got 6 taco's ask for extra cheese didn't get it but got charged  $2.70 for extra cheese I didn't get. And when I called to complain no answer. I called 4 times. It rang til it hung up. I strongly suggest that your team and management get things together. Basically you're stealing my money everytime that I go. You charge for extra cheese and yet don't give extra cheese. And sometimes there's hardly any cheese in the Taco at all come on really cheese in this is  essential to make a taco come together. If you don't get your act together you will lose a very good customer.
Worst Taco Bell I've been to ever. They give you all lettuce and cheese. What you are serving isn't even meet to begin with, then you're going to skimp us too?

I've been coming here for 10 years and never really had any issues until today. Juan, the manager, was SO RUDE! We ordered 7 items, and when he asked if I wanted hot sauce, I replied yes please lots of hot sauce. When I saw he only put 5 packets (not enough for one per item, and honestly I love 3-4 packets per item, that's my preference) I asked if I could have more. he said he already put A LOT in the bag (is 5 a lot for 7 items? Not for me) I said it wasn't enough and he asked how many more I wanted. I really wanted 10 more but I could see he was annoyed so I just asked for 5, and that's when he rolled his eyes and gave me dirty look. I asked him why he made that face at me, and he replied "that's just my face". Since I go there 1-2 times A WEEK with my kids, I decided to march inside and give that cheap man a piece of my mind. I hope he gets fired. I mean, are they bonuses on how many packets of hot sauce they save? There are plenty of other people who would love to have his job.

Bad customer service, what kind of business tells you to go back thru because they "have a line" ?? I just wanted to add a dollar item (twists) to my order and was told "NO, we got a line" you gotta go back through. Seriously??? With 3cars behind me...  I had exact change and everything... Taking my dollar elsewhere.... smh ...not to mention my chicken quesadilla was swimming in the sauce... couldn't even finish eating it , it was too much sauce...
Piss poor customer service! Had to ask for a bag for my Chalupa box, then couldn't open it. Manager finally came by to open it. After 5 mins of trying to open it

AWFUL.. we picked up our order, missing a Mexican Pizza, missing a 'green apple freeze' food was cold, it was put together messily and 'COLD' considering I live 3 minutes away.. They put 12 tacos and and a taco salad in a small bag and the bag ripped. Forgot all condiments. I didn't order anything 'special'. Overall I wouldn't recommend it. Make sure you look through your order, this has happened every single time!!!

This is a horrible place to get food. When we arrived there was 4 orders ahead of us. While we were waiting we see two cooks, a young white female named (Hannah) and an older Hispanic male just standing around not prepping food while we were ordering. When we sat down after ordering, the female was on her phone answering calls while the Hispanic male was starting to prep food. For some reason the female was leaving and we hear the Hispanic male yell out, "Hannah get your ass over here." At that time we were completely over it waiting for about 20-30 minutes to receive our food while they (3 people) cussed and laughed in the back. Our order was a crunch wrap supreme and a $5 box that had nacho fries, a burrito, and a taco. When we got home we started eating the food was cold, after a few bites of the burrito I found a plastic piece inside. We decided to drive back to get a refund and explain the issue. The Hispanic male came to the register and didn't think to apologize or look at the issue. He had an attitude throwing the box away and handing our money back ($5) No customer service. Employees need training.

i went here before a movie for my homies birthday and i got a supreme crunch wrap and usually they are awesome, but at this specific location i literally got a sack of cheese with lettuce and tomato. it was a crunch wrap with no crunch. If you're in the altomonte mall and want taco bell don't even go here i was sick on my friends birthday from eating here and i had diarrhea while watching the movie good boys. And it was not very pleasant. You've been warned...

I usually go to the clermont location but I was next to this one so I started to go. They failed to put the sauce that goes on the Gordita crunch an they shell was stale. I'll never go to this location again.. it was the middle of the day with no line my food should have been right and also fresh.

I just had the worst "fast food" experience ever at this Taco Bell location. We ordered at 11:20. My friends got their food 20 minutes later. As I watched them eat, still no food for me. At 12:00 after my friends had finished eating, I finally asked for a refund, with my food nowhere in sight. The manager that processed my refund was extremely rude and seemed put out that I was disappointed. I tried to give her the change that I had received so the I could get back my $6 without coins and she said, without even looking me in the eye, "I don't want that", and proceeded to give me even more change. No apology, no nothing. Needless to say, I will not be back. Taco Bell might as well just close this location or hire all new staff. I've never had an issue like this at any Taco Bell.
Taco Bell is 88% awesome. If you've been there, you know it :)
Maybe I just felt bad for the people that work here and get a bad rating.  My food was fine, the people were nice. It's Taco Bell, I got Taco Bell.

Absolutely horrible!!! I mean obviously we know Taco Bell is on a high class restaurant but what I encountered in this particular location was beyond bad!!! The service is horrible! Workers are super rude! The restaurant itself was dirty, I don't know when was the last time they cleaned it  and the food.....well, let me say this.... I won't even feed them to the dogs!!
STAY AWAY FROM THIS LOCATION!!!

Literally the worst Taco Bell ever. I used to frequent this location all the time but recently stopped coming. My last visit they overcharged me by $7.21 because they gave me my order and someone else's order after waiting in the drive thru for over 30 minutes and my order was still wrong! The lady working the drive thru doesn't understand anything (special requests) even though she's worked there forever. Never again.

- 30 minutes waiting for our food in the drive thru line.
- Asked for half unsweetened tea with half lemonade, that had to be fixed 2x and still wound up with an orange flavored drink. 
- ordered a double crunch wrap and got some thing that resembled a deconstructed burrito.

I could have driven to the Taco Bell in Smyrna, gotten my food, and driven back. Frustrating and disappointing, will not be back to this location.

Well... when did Taco Bell change their menu? They didn't have at least half of what we wanted.  We came in 20 minutes before closing but still heard them tell a customer they were closed. Make TACO BELL GREAT AGAIN.

Wow! I usually have no issues with Taco Bell, and almost always am entirely satisfied. Tonight convinced me that I need to rethink this. The young lady who served me was great, but man, the tacos were terrible. This location apparently doesn't even try when the drive-thru is busy. I ordered a 3 crunchy taco meal and received three of the poorest, least filled tacos I have EVER received in my entire Taco Bell experience. I am NOT a Taco Bell hater, and usually am happy to run for the border" when looking for fast food. Probably won't do it again here. So not worth it. Check out the photo of a very sad taco. The other two were just like it.

My first review just to share that this was the worst customer service I've ever experienced. The food was poorly put together and the drinks I ordered were not filled. Just wanted a good lunch for my break and I got half assed service all through it. Honestly if you're viewing this, go ANYWHERE ELSE.

I orderd two potato tacos . they were so sad, i dont understnd how the person making the food can look at the OLD,HARD, COLD potatoes and say you this is totaly eadable . What is the protocol when serving food how old does it have to be before it's too old.  I bit into my taco and almost broke a tooth.  This is not ok.   
Also this place was an absolute mess. Trash everywhere.
Same as usual for Taco Bell but that's a good thing. I know what I am going to get and I like it.
I drove thru the drive thru and they couldn't even have coffee to provide! Vary unprepared service!

I go here frequently and usually they get my food wrong. It's ok because it's Taco Bell but if I ask for nachos I'm not wanting chips and cheese. Today the lady asked me if I wanted nachos...I said yes...loaded (in other words with meat , beans etc) she gives me a kids nachos. So I went back and said I meant nachos bell grande. She said "I'm not a mind reader" ok. Just give me my food. I will be back but next time apparently you have to break it down for them.
Came though the drive thru on Saturday around 9:30pm and one of the guys sounded irritated with poor customer service and I had to repeat myself 4 times for my order.

The worst customer service I have experienced at a Taco Bell. Stood at the counter and had multiple employees continue to walk by without acknowledging anybody. Finally they tell us that we need to turn around and order at the kiosk behind us while there was a line forming behind us. The man who told us had so much unnecessary attitude and there were no signs telling us that we needed to order at the kiosk.

They are always fast and efficient, it's a corporate location so you get the specials you see advertised on TV. Unlike the franchise down the street so a 1/2 star added for that;) I've never had a problem with any orders the drive through can back up in the afternoon something horrendous. But the workers are always busy here if the place gets slow I always see someone come out and do table touches which I love because it assures me everything is clean. Easy access to the freeway and they are open for breakfast so a great grab and go location.

Went to Taco Bell for maybe the first time in 10 years to eat my feelings and wallow in sadness as there is a pandemic, the entire west coast is burning and my friends are losing their homes. It's just too much to handle. All I wanted was a Crunchwrap supreme to make myself feel a tad bit better. Unfortunately it was forgotten. I am not sure how much more sadness I can handle in 2020. Also it was like 6 bucks, which is a bummer.

This is now 2 times in a row. The service is horrible. I ordered 3 large drinks. And they gave us one small glass.  Had to argue with them to get the large cups. They don't seem to understand English and how to read a order slip. Next time I come here. And this same group is working. I will just walk out.  Definitely not worth coming here. 14 June 2019. 11:10 am.

Went here 12/5/2019.  The were very short in staff.  Only 3 people working at the time.  The drive through was slammed.  I ordered and waited 25 minutes, and no food was brought out to the people waiting inside.  I asked for a refund.  The refund took 10 minutes to get because it took 5 minutes to talk to someone and 5 minutes for the manager to figure out how to issue it.  I don't blame the workers at all.  They were doing their best being extremely short handed.  I blame the operator.

I came to get some lunch here at this Taco Bell. When I was ordering my food I saw the kitchen filthy employees were walking on trash. The area where  they were prepping the food was filthy. Two of the employer were smoking next to the entrance and the smell of the cigaret were coming inside. I won't never come to this Taco Bell again.

I hate driving down Cameron road, but occasionally it's worth it for a quick stop at Taco Bell's drive-thru.  It's not somewhere I go all the time, but I've probably stopped here about once a month ever since I moved into the neighborhood several years ago.  And all but one of those times, the service has been excellent.

Though I've gone inside a couple of times, I mostly just go through the drive thru and then eat when I get home 3 minutes later.  They've never messed up my order, even though I always stray from the basic menu, asking for extra this and none of that.  The only thing they sometimes get wrong is the number of hot sauce packets I need, probably because I ask for about twice as many as most people would use.  But I keep a bottle of their hot sauce from HEB at home anyway, so it's not a big issue.  

The people working the drive-thru are always pleasant -- they're even extra sweet to my old dog, who's often hanging her giant head out the backseat window.  Sometimes their drive-thru line is a little long, so there's a bit of a wait, but I can't really complain about that, since they're clearly working as fast as they can.  There was only one time the wait was unbearably long, and I'm not sure what was going on.  But when I got up to the window to pay, the manager popped into view and gave me a 100% discount, so I got my food for free.  I hadn't even complained or been unpleasant about it; all I'd done was hand over my credit card.  But she just said I'd had to wait too long, cleared the total from the register, and I didn't need to pay.  Now that's amazing service!
Is 9pm Sun March 3rd 2019 my Orlando commute just turn into 1hr 30mins because  I decide to stop at the drive thru Unacceptable beats the whole purpose of Fast Food!

Look, we like Taco Bell because it's quick and easy, and this place was a total let down even for fast food customer service. It's not like we expect a lot anyway (no offense). 

First and only time at this location and will be hesitant to return. The kid at the drive-thru was nice and all but claimed "their speakers were old and didn't work well". Basically we had 5 items on our order, 3 of which were the same thing but he entered them incorrectly (the cheesy Gordita crunch with the nacho cheese shell - ordered exactly that way, but were entered as if I ordered nacho cheese on top of them). When I tried to correct this, he asked me to repeat multiple times and said he didn't understand so I said never mind and moved onto the window. 

Tried to explain to the kid at the window what I meant and he took our card and swiped it, acknowledging what we were saying and then taking the next customer. He STILL rang our order up wrong and claimed it was extra to add the NC shell (we didn't care - this is how it's always been ordered) and then didn't give them to us anyway. Plus he charged us for adding the nacho cheese sauce (??) but not the shell when that's what we asked. Oh - and we ordered a large Baja freeze and got just the soda instead. AND we asked for Hot and Fire sauce and only got 4 Hot sauces.

Essentially our entire order was wrong. I never leave reviews for fast food places because I try to give them  the benefit of the doubt but come on. :/ thoroughly disappointed in this whole experience.

**UPDATE**
I checked the bag for the receipt because I wanted to fill out the survey to let them know how they did. Nope. No receipt! Are you kidding me! Probably so we can't show them where they messed up. Smh I'll probably never go to this location again even though they're closest to my place, you can catch me driving twice as far to another location if we really want Taco Bell.

I'm sorry. This Taco Bell needs to be shut down until further notice. Is Taco Bell Executives realizing their investment is running into the ground? Or maybe they don't care. I have not had Taco Bell in Months (in NY never this location)and was so wanting some today for Taco Tuesday. What a disappointment. I ordered a Power Menu Bowl. I couldn't get it Bc they have no bowls?? Are you serious? I probably know why. Bc they use the covers to take your money. Foolishness!! She Fl gives me my food in a box and a bag with napkins and a straw for my drink. I ask for sauce. She says we don't have any mild. Now I didn't even ask for mild. She gets irritated and gives me 3 more bags.  One bag had in Diablo sauce the other Fire. Now if they were smart. Just put 2 of each sauce in each bag. What a waste of bags that could probably buy the bowls. I ended up with the Grande Nachos Box, what a waste. Barely any meat or quac or salsa. Tasted blah! Never again?  So disappointed for Taco Tuesday! I hope management reads this. But then again not Bc all their reviews are bad and their still bad.

Definitely improved since the last time I reviewed them. I went through the drive thru while I was in the area and got the $5 box. It came with a burrito, which hasn't always been one of my favorites, but thought what the heck. 

I don't know what they did, but whoever made it is good! For once I enjoyed it and wished I had another. 

Service was quick and friendly. Next time I'm in the area, I'll get another burrito supreme and hope that person is still making them!

The manager at this store at thet dinner @ 6:15 was very rude & incompetent when giving prices of particular menu items!  I will contact the owner and complain about his behavior.  When I  complained to him about this, he said "if you don't like it, you can just leave, etc!"  The owner will here about him & his name!  Don't buy from this Taco bell at this time shift!

Fast and friendly even late at night - managed my order ok and all. Great in a pinch though this is a pretty harrowing spot to stop in...super dirty and be mindful driving in and out because there is a crazy number of crazy folks wandering in front of cars because...well....crazy...
The wait times here are horrible. Twice in one week I waited roughly 30+ minutes in the drive through line.

Worst experience with the manager himself. I asked for four black bean tacos and it was beef. I returned to the counter and informed I ordered black beans. So, he made them again and they were refried beans. I give up. Gave them to the table next to me and walked out. Dont waste your time. The manager gave me attitude and doesnt listen. I'm hungry.

extreme red tacos
leave red fingers and stomach
a brick, craving more

24 minutes. 24 minutes to go through the drive through on a Sunday night at 6:45. We had to ask for our drink at the window or he wouldn't have given it to us, and when we got home with our food, our order was wrong. He also didn't give us the mild taco sauce he asked us if we wanted and we told him yes. Last time we were there (a week ago) it took 20 minutes. We need to just stop going here. People were backing up out of the drive through and leaving.

Rude staff.  Slow service.  Cold food.  I will never come back.   I was so pissed off that I left immediately after.  How people like this that deal with the public get away with such bad service and stay employed.

I use to love going to this location. So I decided to go yesterday. I ordered a Nacho Fries Bell Grande and 2 supreme tacos. This is the 1st time the fries were cold. Couldn't finish it. Then I opened one supreme taco (barely anything in it) the other was full but was missing the shedded cheese. So I took it back to the counter and asked them to remake it. The cashier who was very sweet informed the guy who prepared it and he said, "portion control." I understand portion control but that was more like toddler portion control. Never received the tacos so I paid for 2 supreme tacos without having it fixed. They pretty much stole from me. I went to the cashier and she gave me 2 large skittle slushies. The old crew is who I loved. They weren't greedy. This new crew just don't care minus the cashier.

This location sucks. My siblings always want it and we have been here a few times and it's always the sane girl at the window. They ask if you want hot sauce. Well don't bother answering because she repeats what you ask for and never gives you any so you either go without, drive thru again or park. When you go in or drive thru again they laugh and don't care. It's nothing major but super annoying and rude. How hard is it really?... salmon creek location is way better.

Open late, which is great. No drive thru, which sucks. Service rates between so-so and poor. I stop by at odd hours and often have to wait for anyone to notice I am waiting to order.


Staff doesn't always understand English very well. Can make ordering a pain.
Quick to get through the drive through during the day.  The wait is usually awful at night

I don't usually write bad reviews, but I signed up on Yelp, just to write this one. 

I had the single worst drive-through experience of my life at this Taco Bell location. I take my kids for breakfast at 11:15 this Sun morning. Was told they had stopped serving breakfast. Okay, kids asked for smoothies, told the machine was broken. All the while the surly TB employee is telling me he can't hear me even though I'm only inches away from the mic, but I hear a lot of noise in the background from inside. He says he has to check on the smoothie machine, says we can have one. My daughter orders a taco and I order a coffee. Then he says he might be able to give us one more smoothie. We pull up to the window and he hands us the taco, then the smoothies and finally the coffee. As he hands the coffee to me, the lid pops off and I'm covered in scalding coffee, it goes all over my bare hands and arms, my seats and dashboard and shift console and (I find out later) shorts out the gearshift. The employee's only response was to toss me a bunch of napkins. The employee was a big, mean looking guy who looked like he wanted to take my head off when I complained. As I type this my fingers are still hurting from the burns.

I am never setting foot into any Taco Bell again.

I want to give this place -5 stars. It has 1 star because you have to click on it to enter a review. I ordered the food I wanted. 3 tacos supreme, 2 chalupas and 1 steak quesadilla. I paid also for all those items to have extra meat in them too. Simple order. I get the food home and when I open the items, every single item has no meat in them at all. I'm like WTF... You got my money and I got no food. How the hell is this place still open??? All the comments on here all says the same thing. BS workers who shows the reason why they work in a place like this. This is a kids type of job and with all the adults that work there just shows you belong in a place like this. Hate your life for a reason because you can't do anything right in your poor excuse life is the reason you work at a kids job. Worst of it all, the owners and managers prove they are BS people too. There employees prove the higher ups are just as bad as there employees. You all that is part of this poor excuse of a establishment should be shut down and closed for every and unemployed, because you all suck at what you do. Smh... Unbelievable. 

You know that button they used in the staples commercials, that was easy, big red button. There should be a button like that and when you mess up in this would, I press it and you mess up in this world, then your gone from this world. You FU@* up in this world, goodbye.

If you go, go through the drive thru and not dine in. We stopped in one morning.  There was a small line at the drive thru so we went in.  We were the only ones inside.  Great! Except we were totally ignored while they only served the drive thru. My girlfriend finally had to literally call out for them to help us. 

After ordering, I went to get a drink only to find the ice machine totally empty. We had to get their attention just to ask for ice. Then when we got it, we were only given a few cubes in our cup. We had to hand it back again to ask for it to be filled. 

The inside just looked totally neglected. Hardly any napkins left and most tables had not been wiped down.  I think the manager realized we weren't happy and came to check on us. She apologized for the service and brought us some cinnamon rolls.

I want to share my appreciation for the staff.

I came by during a Friday night, and the drive thru was really backed up. When I pulled up to the cashier, the employee seemed stressed. We had a quick conversation while she was running my payment.

The team was two people short, and they were working frantically to fulfill all the orders. The young woman was polite and kept her composure while getting my order ready.

I don't think these people get enough appreciation for getting through unexpected circumstances. Thank you!

Their food is not good. When you receive your food you can right away see and tell that they didn't care if they make it food or not or presentable at least. I've went here a few times already because I thought maybe someone new was working or it was busy or something so I gave them more than 3 tries and went there more than 3 times. The first time I order a quesadilla with extra jalapeño sauce and when I got the meal the sauce was almost all in one place in the middle with everything else like they scooped it and dumped it into one spot and put it to cook. So the next couple times I went again and I asked them if they could please spread out the sauce and everything and everything in the Taco because everything in the taco was in one spot in the middle. So I asked them the next time I came and still the same thing and they put barely any sauce when I paid extra for it and of coarse it's all in the middle only and every time I ate there and asked for them to spread the meat and sauce and everything around they said ok but still I got it all in the middle and it just taste bad and horribly done. If you can go to another do that because this one sucks with there food and customers requests even if they pay extra for

Rudest experience I have ever had in a drive thru. Will not be coming back & hope they learn how to handle customer service situations better, absurd attitude at the window when I handed them my payment.
We went through Taco Bell we gave them a very special order they got it all right I loved eating a taco and sucking the sour cream !  Love TB BABY

During the day this location is okay .. late night drive thru , forget it. The employees will close up early before time advertised and will turn you away. So don't get your hopes up or waste your time trying.

This is the worst Taco Bell I've ever been to, and I have been to many Taco Bells. We have never had an experience that meets our expectations here. This location does not meet the standards of other Taco Bells across the city/county.

This was the Taco Belliest taco Bell I have ever been in. For starters, they were out of tortillas, and therefore unable to make tacos. That struck me as odd given that taco is right in their name. I did not inquire as to whether or not they were out of bells as well. Their soda machine was also broken, and they neglected to give me any utensil for the salad that I ordered in the drive-through. When I went back inside to fetch one there was no apology and the place looked about as clean as a frat house after a bender. Just disgusting
Stopped by this location recently. Service was awful and rude. Got the wrong drink and wrong things in the order. Typical.

I'm a frequent customer at this location but lately in my opinion the inside appearance is starting to look shabby. The tables aren't cleaned after people leave and  the trash cans are full to the top and the condiments aren't fully stocked. I hope this is a fixable problem because I am a cool ranch taco junkie.

Today, as I sat and ate my lunch. I got to enjoy a crackhead-picking at his head over the table. He wasn't eating anything. I got the wonderful view of his entire butt since his pants didn't fit and his entire butt was exposed for all to see.
Yummy to see while I'm eating lunch. No one that worked there didn't say anything. I work near by, this entire area is complete cess pool.
Won't be going back. EVER !!!
Awful, food was poorly made, workers were extremely rude and refused to give me sour cream. I will travel extra distance just to not go here now.

We came here about 4 days ago the morning shift was rude didn't offer any deals and when I found the deal she say " here you go changing everything" we received food with an attitude and rudely . And still received the wrong order !!! How !!!
Poor food, even worst service. They ran out of beef, on a Sunday night. I wish there was an option to give 0 stars, Taco Bell should not be in business and they don't deserve your money.

A few of us ran in here to grab breakfast before going to MegaCon last weekend. We went inside to order and the cashier was really patient with us making our decisions. The inside is interesting since it's decorated with posters of comic books. Something you don't see typically at Taco Bell. While my order was correct and came out in a reasonable amount of time, my friend's order was not. We were the only people inside and they gave us regular burritos instead of the breakfast version we ordered. So I guess it's just your typical Taco Bell with nothing special to give.

Worlds slowest Taco Bell. Constantly says they are short staffed. Tonight I ordered inside with only one person in front of me and it took 15 minutes for a grande nacho box and soft taco. Then when  I got the order it was wrong. (Ordered no sour cream) when they fixed it, new nachos was half the size of the one they added the sour cream to. Drive the extra couple miles to salmon creek, even with the drive time it should be quicker.

I have been to this location one other time before it every time I come the line is so long and the person at the drive-thru window is always very short and doesn't sound very pleasant on the other end. They'd have terrible customer service skills. They just handle your card and your food and your receipt and they just closed the window. Don't even say anything. I will definitely not be coming back to this location again if I have to wait a long time for food to come out. This location could do a lot better
It's fast, it's efficient and they're friendly. Convenient location if you're traveling downtown.

Can we just shut this Taco Bell down and redo it from the ground up? Today (like every day) there's always something. They were out of hard and soft taco shells, they were out of burritos or the wraps for them and neither one of their ice machines were working for the drinks! They were also already out of the nacho fries. This Taco Bell has to be one of the worst ones around because they're always out of something or messing up somebody's order or having the wrong thing at the wrong place etc etc.
We waited 15 minutes for our food for it to be completely wrong from what we ordered. The tacos that we got were a complete mess. Not mad, just disappointed.
Great food. Great deals. Delivers on time. Love the skittles drink  and the Mexican pizzas
Insanely slow.  Sure it's busy but staff not working like it's busy. Omg. Will Re-think ever coming here on a week night

Expect to wait for the wheat to grow, they have to still butcher a cow or two, and then to send out that last text.
I would give negative stars if I could.

Staff has Horrible customer service and ghetto to the max. Made my  food sloppy took back in for a refund and all them started talking hot at the mouth. It's none of your concern if I wasn't talking to you. The manager came and refunded me back my money. Lost me

I'm always disappointed at this location. 1. Their drive thru is always full- fine but they are so slow with service and 2. Their system is always down/ closed but KFC's system works fine. I don't get it.

Some of the people working here couldn't give a damn and it's a bummer. I know from personal working experience that these kinds of employees make working difficult for other employees that actually try and deserve better. 
Management should know better than to provide no support for every employee. If an employee is falling behind, it's your job to support them. It probably (definitely) goes higher than store management itself, so if you're the district manager reading this, get it together. Your employees shouldn't be falling behind like this and it's all on you.

My husband and I went there the other day. We like Toco Bell and said this will be a easy lunch. We went to the drive thru received our order .We sat in the parken lot as we were trying to open the  Cheesy crunchy Gordita they were stuck to the wrapper you can tell they were old. The shell was all broken on all of them they were pre made and have been in the warmer for a while.. We took one bite and it was gross never again will we eat there..This was the second time there and no more we will stick to the one by our home in Windermere..

Usually passes as a Taco Bell but since the beginning of the month, 2 out of the last 3 times I've gone I've been told the "system was down and it'd be a 20-30 minute wait."

Keep in mind both of the times I heard that was at around 11:30 pm and today and 10:30 pm (close at 1am).

Odd how frequently the system goes down here, always at night, and the guy also knows when the system will come back on.
Always nice to be yelled at that I can add a side of spicy ranch at the window. This Taco is definitely the worst in Orlando.

I have always been enamored by my flexible will power that strengthens me at some times and is non-existent in others.  I swore I would not fall for gimmicky food, limited time food items and yet here I am at a Taco Bell with an order of Black Jack Tacos on my tray.  I am not sure what they are trying to attract with this Taco, is it the official snack food of the EMO crowd?  Is it the new designer food of the Goth kids?  Taco Bell says that it is a celebration of pepper-jack.  Whatever.

After trying one I just was not sure about what to think.  I tried the black shell alone first but could not discern any different or new tastes, it was just... black.  The innards of the taco (yes, innards is an acceptable word) was your usual swath of re-hydrated beef and lettuce, but they used a pepper-jack cheese and a pepper-jack sauce on it.  It was actually quite tasty.  I had a few where the shell split and a few days alter I found that they didn't travel well as the shell stuck to the paper wrapper and broke while I was trying to free it.  However it still tasted good, what I didn't have to lick off my hands.

Good for Taco Bell to find a way to make the Taco a little more interesting.  A Black Soft Taco would be nice too; but you know what I miss?  They used to have breakfast at Taco Bell, and it was decent.  For now this will have to do until the once again re-invent the Taco.

Check your to-go order before you drive home. They did a great job with Covid, but I didn't check a bag and they forgot about $6 worth of my order. We're super disappointed for not double checking their quality control.

Ok so I guess I got someone else's order. Umm I ordered nacho grande and I got 3 small bags of chips and 2 small containers of chees.‍I  actually ordered online as I usually do. And I was trying to get back home and beat the storm and I didn't feel good so I just glanced in the bag and left . Sigh...

In these nutty COVID-19 times, I've relied on food delivery a bit more than usual as many takeout options have understandably limited hours. As much as I enjoy grocery shopping, I do get tired of preparing &/or eating 100% of my meals from home--thus, there's been a few late Postmates delivery nights. This is not my neighborhood Taco Bell, nor is it a place I'm likely to visit to dine in if I did happen to be in the area (it's not a slight--we simply don't dine out much & when we do it's not for fast food & we don't drive, so there's no drive-thru convenience factor for us), but I'm quite grateful for this particular location's late hours (they're open until 4 or 5 a.m. every night currently), their vegan-friendly options (the Black Bean Crunchwrap Supreme, 7 Layer Burrito, & Bean Burrito are my three favorite Taco Bell menu items--just ask for them fresco to remove the dairy), & their preparation accuracy & efficiency. If you're looking for quick, viable late night delivery, this Taco Bell by way of Postmates has yet to disappoint!

Burp. Fart. Poop. Lettuce. Tomato. It all goes in the same, it all goes out the same. One of the kids working here called me a boomer. I said I am not a boomer I am a citizen of the United Stares. He was a little baby Yoda boy who loved berries and cream.

Got literally my entire wrong. The steak in the quesadilla is dry/stale and there are things literally just missing from a burrito  (red strips and Fritos). It's not like they just missed modifications but just the general order. Even when I pulled up to the drive thru they didn't know what was going on. No one knew what was going on.

This place is super gross and dirty .
 Not just trash but disgusting, service was appalling and they totally over charge for terrible food. They wouldn't unlock the bathroom for my child after a $10.00 order and waiting an absurd amount of time for the order of 6 value tacos. Yes, 6 VALUE tacos cost $10.00 here!! 
Don't do it, get an order to-go from Sherries across the street. It will be faster, close to the same price and they gladly let you use the restroom in their Clean restaurant. 
If you have to have Taco Bell, the one on Hall is your go-to.
They love to play the 'nobody is home' game in later hours. Honk all you want, they won't answer.
I waiting in the line for 15 mins and they didn't even have what I wanted. Once I got to the window she was being a bitch. So I left

Horrible customer service. We waited 15 minutes at the speaker box to order and nobody still didn't attended us!!! On top of that when we get to the window we have the cashier get the manager to tell us that he could not attend us at the speaker box because the system was down so, we asked if we could order at the window. The manager kept making excuses refusing to attend us. I would not recommend this Taco Bell at this location to nobody.
I didn't eat here. I checked in because I needed to use their clean restroom. Thank you Taco Bell. I recommend using the restrooms if you need to make a quick pit stop to Wee Wee.

Ordered Uber eats and got $50 worth of food! The delivery was amazing but the food was not. We were missing an item and the food was not up to par to other Taco Bell's that I have ordered the same items from. The cinnamon twists had an after taste of plastic. I would not recommend.

Worst taco bell in portland. Went through the drive thru at 10:19 am. Tried to order breakfast. Employee answered were not serving breakfast. I replied "What time do you stop serving breakfast?". Their reply was "Around this time". Of course this was a stupid response so I followed it with an equally stupid reply. "I wasn't asking for you best guess, what time does Taco Bell stop serving breakfast?" They replied with "sir I do not need your attitude, ya know what I'm refusing your service have a great day." This is the problem with entitled minimum wage employees who don't even know the basics of the job they're doing.

So many things wrong with this Taco Bell. 1) I had cash and didn't want to use the self-automated kiosk (which I believe if I use, I should get an employee discount since I'm doing the job of an employee). I stood in front of the cash register while the employees (all young), laughed and joked, just out of view... For over 10 minutes! I tried calling to them, but they couldn't hear me over their own conversation. I got a call, which I took whole waiting for them. I called out again when I saw two of them walk toward the drive thru, I finally got the attention of one of them. 2) He couldn't sign in and had to wait for the guy at the drive thru window to log him in. 3) I paid my bill and the guy taking my order had the audacity to ask me if I wanted my change because (and I quote, "it's only 20 cent), 4) They didn't have register tape in the machine to give me a receipt, 5) Come to find out that they don't carry Dr Pepper, the guy tries talking me into a root beer instead, and then acted upset when I requested my money back since I only stopped there to get a Dr Pepper... The two tacos were an afterthought. I don't understand why there are Taco Bells that don't carry Dr Pepper - it shouldn't be allowed! Especially since most of them do carry Dr Pepper... Keep the same options or don't open your doors! Marked this fast food stop off my list - will never visit, not one part of this exchange was worth the money or wasted time!
Fast & Friendly! Can't get better then that! However food was a little cold and meet could use a little more seasoning & be less dry thanks for the laughs keep it up!
Don't come here if you are In A hurry and want to eat.!!!!!! Check your bags for items . Drive thru is worse .

11:00pm myself and my family left a Orlando pride game and wanted to get something quick prior to going home. Ofcourse Taco Bell is the #1 option!!! 

Well??? Maybe not!!! . . . 

As we approach the drive thru, the person, who was a young girl that was suppose to take out order was completely rude from the start. Not a "hello" or "what can I get you." Just a quick "TB" and than mumbles something to her friend "I would assume" inside.l The Taco Bell. When I followed up with an "excuse me" Cause I didn't understand her she than replied "you know your at Taco Bell!?" What!!!???? Did that really just happen? 

So when I ignored it and continued my order for my family I heard nothing on the other end. I asked if anyone was there with what she replied with mumbling something about a drink. I asked again and her time was completely annoyed. We Did not  feel comfortable ordering my food from here so we left right across the street to the Burger King where they were every welcoming. 

Very sad because Taco Bell has always been a great corporation and chain, but this has definitely turned us away from this establishment. 

If I could rate this with zero stars I would!!!

UPDATE: This place redeemed themselves. We live in the area about 6 months and went there all the time. The kid who worked there no longer did and there were always the same people there after who had great customer service. And no - their speakers didn't have any problems after that one time.

Jaqwanda was very rude to us. We ordered a burrito without cheese. When we received it, it had cheese. We asked for one without, then she tried to charge us for it. We asked if she wanted the old one back and she snipped at us to just throw it away. She gave the young kids in front of us attitude because they wanted to pay with cash and she didn't have change. So we paid for their meal. Otherall, we did not need the attitude from Jaqwanda for their incompetencies.
Love the food, but this one is constantly run by idiots that can barely do their job.

This Taco Bell has the best Vegan 7 layer burritos (fresco and add potatoes). Robert is usually in the drive thru late at night and is always so friendly and helpful. Always open until 5am and 6am on the weekends. Thank you for providing me with some late night munchies.

This is really one of those places that leaves you thinking, "what happened to real mexican food?" I came here asking for a Bean cheese burrito, but all I got was a migraine and a balled up fist. Things have changed around here, and not for the better. I will be going back tomorrow for a full refund

As of late, this Taco Bell/KFC has really dropped the ball. The other day, I came by and wanted a bottled water. I was then told that they were out. Fine, but my second choice was Pepsi. They were out of Pepsi. Great. Thankfully, they had root beer.

Overall, this is what you'd expect from Taco Bell/KFC. It's a convenient location which is high volume considering it is in a big shopping center. Unfortunately, half the time my order is wrong even though I check the screen. I still love my Taco Bell/KFC, but the line in the drive-thru is a high turn off.

Decent... not life-changing.  My order was taken quickly and correctly.  I'm not sure what it was... maybe it was because the establishment was inside a mall? I just didn't feel the quality was up to par versus other TB meals I've had at different locations.

Unfortunately this is the closest Taco Bell. And I really shouldn't be eating here since I'm Mexican. But they have those captain crunch fried bite things and starburst flavored frozen drinks. So I'm here at least once a week. This location is pretty awful. Slow service for fast food. And the nacho cheese here is not to be trusted. Doesn't taste right to me. 

1/9/16
Sadly I'm the duke of this establishment on Yelp. It won't last. It's getting harder and harder to justify coming here. After waiting in a fairly short drive through line for an usually long time, I then waited for someone to come to the speaker for at least 5 minutes. When he came on I could barely understand him. I started to give my order and he gives me a total. I said that's not all. I listed another item or two and he gives me another total. I again said, that's not all. What happened to asking if you wanted fries (or in taco bell's case, beans) with that? After I gave one more item he asked is that all? And I just said yes. It wasn't going to be all, but it is now. So long kingdom of Taco Bell. I was your duke for a day.

Just went there, ordered 4 steak power bowls and added chicken, they added the chicken alright but removed the steak!! And still charged me the extra $5 for adding chicken, nothing I can do about it now since I live 45 mins away and they're closed, but check your order before you leave, this place sucks!!

Since when does it manager leave their store and Chase a customer down and assault them. How dare you ever threaten a customer. I hope Taco Bell takes this very seriously as you are not allowed to do that. I hope they fire you on the spot Because that is what you deserve.

This one is close to me so I always just order online. But this time my Taco was a disgrace and they didn't give me my lg drinks, only one. The drinks are a hit or miss cause half the time they just taste like seltzer water.

Juan, the Manager, is totally incompetent. 40 minutes after ordering I asked for my money back and he became extremely agitated and rude. Juan should not have any job where he interacts with customers. Worst Fast Food expierence I ever had

This is the only TB that is conveniently located to us, so we kept giving it a try, but today was the 3rd time over the course of two months that they did not have tortillas or rice. How can a Taco Bell not have tortillas, and on more than one occasion?! The young guy in the drive-thru is super nice though! I wish the management would get their stuff together so we could enjoy the TB yums, and so the staff wasn't often put in an uncomfortable position of sharing the bad news. I'll be surprised if this location remains in biz for much longer.

The worst customer service and efficiency ... it all comes down to the pool management... A pumpkin could run this place better... And a pumpkin doesn't have a brain or a spine ... worst of all... When you call the number to complain no one calls you back... Ever! ...

New to  the area.  Have been to this Taco Bell twice.  Haven't had issues with the service at all. I do take issue with getting home and finding my order is incomplete. Both times I've gotten home and I'm  missing an item.  No cinnamon twists the first order and tonight no cheese for the nachos.  Very irritating.
Kept trying to order but they weren't able to approve the online items after 3 tries. Seems like they need to update the online menu or fire the teens working there who refuse business at night.
This location is located off of Main Street. I go through the drive through typically and the customer service is really good surprisingly.
The clerk was fast and courteous, however it took like 15-20 min for me to get one taco and one burrito!

Well I ordered food thru Door Dash and they messed up a simple order. How hard is it to take and make an order online?? They suggested that I go and get my order corrected. I ordered online so I don't have to leave home.

A pretty typical location. I have always had good service here. I think I have only been inside once, but I use the drive thru all the time. Even when there is a line they still move at a good pace. The food is pretty consistent and the employees are always friendly.

This is the first time I've been here.   We came after your daughter's piano recital.   We regretted our decision immediately.   The service was great.  The food was typical.  BUT THE AC WAS ON IN NOVEMBER!    We all sat bundled in our coats with chattering teeth.  When we said something to the staff, they said, "Yep, that's why we always wear sweatshirts to work."

So we got hungry one day and decided to figure out where the closest Taco Bell was to our new apartment. This was it. So we decided to use our Christmas gift cards and go to town on this place. We show up and get into the drive-thru. We order like six things and go on our merry way. 

So, this is a Taco Bell, a fast food chain restaurant. It only has to do so many things right to get a good review. So, first of all, all of the items were in the bag. That's step one, and this place got it right. Check.

Second of all, and most important of all, is the consistency in the flavor and the quality of the product. Most of it was A+ Taco Bell. The $1 premium burritos they are offering now are super good. They have some different flavorings going on that's different from the same ol' same ol'. I recommend trying them. 

But the nachos we got were absolute garbage. There were more chip crumbs than there were chips. We definitely got the handfuls from the bottom of the chip bag. Also, we paid the 80-cent upcharge for the steak nachos, and we literally got three pieces of steak. I know a lot of people say that and they lie, because people like to blow things out of proportion, but I counted the pieces of steak. Three. I think the managers are telling the line workers to skimp us on the premium products. 

Overall, it was about what you would expect. Don't avoid this place. It's fine.

Long time Taco Bell supporter (yes, I know when the 7-layer burrito used to be $0.99, $1.29, $1.39, etc!); I also know when the "Cheesy Gordita Crunch" first came out (possibly an embarrassed admission?! Lol).  Used to know the manager of this store, who advanced to District, then Regional, and now beyond (Rick - you were da bomb!).
All I can say as of today is: STAY AWAY from this Taco Bell! I don't know who's in charge, but not only from this day's attempt but also a former attempt that resulted in incorrect order and seriously poor food quality + underweight in size.
If you are doing the drive-thru, be sure you check your order BEFORE you drive away. I'm 2 for 2 in receiving an incorrect order of only 2 items! Didn't complain before because I didn't notice until I arrived at my destination. This time, I waited thru the line again and didn't even get an apology.
This location has taken a serious nose-dive in every aspect. Oh, but they still start the drive-thru question with, "How are you?" (Um, doesn't matter how I am and I know you don't care - I'm just here to place an order... Sorry, if that's a Taco Bell "thing," but I find it annoying when all I want to do is order). And when I end my order with, "and that is ALL," WHY do you come back with, "And would you like to add a drink with that?" I don't care about scripted responses: one should LISTEN to the customer!!!  Frustrated. But more angry with 2 consecutive incorrect orders and no apology when I had the time to go back and get what I wanted, ordered, and paid for.
I'm absolutely dying to hear a reply from this manager or regional: I think y'all "need" to - this location currently SUCKS!

The guy who took my order apparently couldn't hear a word I said even though I've been there multiple times and never had any issues. Seemed very annoyed I made any changes to my order(taking off beans). The young man who took my money and gave me my drink was very friendly but he got called away to help with the inside register. I got 3 mild sauces in my bag and when I asked the guy who had originally taken my order if I could have a few more he hands me ONE sauce packet. I ended up parking and going inside so I could have enough sauce for my order. Maybe he was having a bad day but you shouldn't take it out on customers!

This spot is rude refuses customer service and says I'm rude and I treat them all with respect call them ma'am sir and all pull up to the window and tell me they are not accepting my service cause I was rude to employees who have an attitude have gotten sick from they food a couple times me and my girl and my roommate and her daughter all got sick

I came, I saw, I conquered.

We ordered a ton of food here and everything was made correctly. Got nachos, a steak quesorita, tacos, and burritos. The Baja blast was delicious. The fire sauce should have been hotter.

Worst Taco Bell ever. 
Ordered our food had to have it fixed when I checked it at the window. My nacho supreme had no cheese 
My Gordita crunch, was cold and had no cheese between the folds. Worst service ever. Very immature and no customer service

These guys are complete liars. I asked for bean and cheese burritos and they said they were out. How are you out of refried beans? And how are you that unprepared? This store should be shut down solely based on the laziness of their employees not wanting to serve.

superb. all you could ever want from a taco bell! i go here often and am pleased every time. one time i was choking on my own spit and actually died for 3 min in the drive thru as i was waiting for my food but thankfully one of the employees was CPR certified and brought me back to life so i could enjoy my black bean crunchwrap

Let me start by saying, I rarely eat fast food, mostly due to the lack of nutritional value as well as the quality of both the preparation and the "food" itself. When I do though, I tend to go with Mexican or a burger, depending what's most convenient and how much I've had to drink.

Having been to this Taco Bell a few times, with the same unfavorable result, I recently found myself craving a good ol' fashion crispy taco. Upon arrival to the drive through, as usual, my eyes instantly become bigger than my stomach as I viewed the menu and realized I could get so many items for so little. But then I instantly am reminded that the food NEVER looks as it does on the menu board. That being said, you at least expect to get the items you ordered ie: chicken on a chicken bowl or cheese on a combo burrito, both of which we realized we didn't get after we returned home.

Unfortunately service here isn't much better than the food. Taco Bell management needs to take a trip through a Chick-fil-A or Bush's Chicken to understand what I'm talking about.

Again, I realize it's fast food and not a Michelin Star restaurant, however give a smile, act like you appreciate my business and give me what I paid for!

I waited for 30+ minutes multiple times at this establishment. Very unhappy with their service and they made me wait to get my drinks for another 10 minutes after I finally got my food. I cannot express my fury with Taco Bell and I plan to file a complaint to their management.

More of a PSA than anything if you have a car. Not sure what management is thinking to change this, but they have the longest lines of any Portland area Taco Bell at every time of day and the staff always seems exasperated so much that I feel bad for ordering a crunch wrap. Might be worth hiring a few more people.

The worst service of all of the chains, was there tonight, waited 8 minutes in the drive through and no one waited on me, finally drove around to see another car sitting in the window with lights out and someone inside looking down at phone, no one visible inside, another vehicle behind that leg like they also got tired of waiting, backed up and left. I am not coming back to this location, you will waste your time! 1 star was too much for this review!

This Taco Bell has improved. I ordered the new grilled cheese burrito and it was served hot. My last 10 visits or so the food was always Luke warm and cooled to quickly. I have complained a few times. I'm glad they finally are getting it right. Last nights drive through was served perfectly.

Twice in a row their card machine was down and they were accepting cash only. I get that you need to update systems occasionally but both of these times we're during peak lunch hours. Highly dissatisfied.
This location feels it is okay to close before their advertised times. Not good business. Worse customer service.

Normally I only go to TB 2 times:  1/  When I am feeding large amounts of teenage boys (son & friends) as they can eat pounds of RUN to the BORDER nastiness for next to nothing.  2/ When it's 2:49 am on Saturday night, er, uh, Sunday morning.

Well F all -  everyday can't be upscale/fun/interesting in my Yelping world.  

To wit - there is a Taco Bell next to my gym and today post workout I bopped on over on the much advertised allure of a 'chef' involved in this fast food giant.  A chef with a Hispanic sounding name.   Si~~

Good news!!  I ate something at Taco B that didn't taste AT ALL like Taco B.  

The chef lady salad thing was sorta good - not good like a chef made it, but good like I dunno, like something made out of fresh lettuce with real toppings (guac, corn salsa, pico) and the chunks of citrus chicken.  I could actually taste the chicken.  I didn't know it had a black.beans & rice base layer.  Next time Ill ask for no rice. 

I didn't hate it.  I didn't hate myself for eating it. 

I wasn't even intoxicated.  

I guess I'll end by saying, it's not on the value menu, but if you are in a Taco Bell and want to eat something that isn't like Taco Bell, try this stuff.  No cheese wiz, black taco shells or nuttin!

I'd like to give a bit of leeway in a COVID world, but the assistant manager on the clock at the time provided a ridiculously bad example of customer service which should serve as a warning to anybody considering this Taco Bell.

We placed an order online through my wife's account, under her name, but had the pickup name as mine (important later). Upon reaching the store, we followed the instructions of the email to pick up in store and were directed (somewhat abrasively) to drive through the drive thru instead. When we made it to the window, I told the woman at the window the order was under my wife's name and she said she hadn't received it so I responded that it could also be under my own (which I told her). She said they didn't have the order and called the assistant manager over to help. Before he came over, I confirmed that we were at the right address, just in case. When he arrived, things went off the rails.

J, the assistant manager, came over and said they didn't have the order yet. I showed him the email from their site and it had an order id, which I gave to him. He said that they didn't have the order yet and I would have to wait until I did (mind you, he never turned around once in this conversation to check on anything). I pointed out that it showed as having been made in the tracker and was ready for pickup and he said this was the nature of tech (WHAT?! I grew up on the internet, this is not how it works) and they couldn't give me food without the order coming through. I asked if I should issue a chargeback through my credit card, what was my recourse here, and he said I should take it up with my credit card if needed, but giving me the food would be the same as giving out free food.

(As reasonable as that might sound, that's what an assistant manager at a Taco Bell with a customer with proof of ordering and a relatively small order should probably jump to first, instead of opting to save the company a few dollars in materials which would be offset by the cost of a chargeback anyhow.)

During this time, J is hanging out the window and ignoring the staff behind him. I hear them asking "what name did they order under?" and "what did they order?", which J just ignored. He didn't turn around to answer the question, he just kept looking forward and saying they couldn't do anything. Whichever intrepid employee took initiative to figure this out, good on you. It wasn't until one of them barged in and said "we have their order" when J finally backed off and was all of a sudden apologetic.

During this whole process, J ignored his employees, didn't even bother to check if my order id was available and blocked our ability to talk to anybody who *could* help. There was no "let's figure out how to make this work" or even the slightest hint at J trying to reconcile the situation. he didn't try to figure out if our order number matched up or even try to get any clarifying information. All J did was stonewall the entire conversation and work to keep a paying customer from getting their food.

Thanks J, you made this a magical experience.

This Taco Bell is in a strip mall and cannot be easily seen from the road. It has a very open concept. 

My experience here was decent. The customer service was nice but slow. They got my order right but the quality of food is what you would expect at Taco Bell. 

I came here for a quick inexpensive meal and that is what I got.

Slowest Taco Bell I have ever been too. Only reason we give 5 stars is because we love Taco Bell. This one always takes minimum 10-15 mins to get your food. I have been in here with no line and it took over 15 mins to get our $9 order.....

Wish I could give Zero stars.

I went in for attempt to get my lunch, 1 tostada. Waiting over 7 minutes still never got it-asked for my money back. They were only helping people thru the drive through. One gal prepping food.
Guy taking my order kicked a bucket of water behind their counter-never cleaned it up.
Also right in front of the door was huge pile of water & ice, I said something to 2 people. NOT ONE OF THEM CLEANED IT UP.
I said someone is going to slip and fall. They could give a F$*&.
All over the pop area, multiple cup lids lay on floor.
3 other people ahead of me. They were still waiting when I left there store.
RUDE, RUDE employees !!!!!
I am calling corporate office. The place is just GROSS !!
Do not waste your time & money here, Ewwwwwww

Never thought I'd be rating a Taco Bell, but yet here I am. This location is a disaster. They cannot get an order right, ever. We constantly have the wrong item or items missing. And the tacos are mostly tortilla. The filling is like a dot in the middle. The manager is unbelievably rude and uncompromising when it is their mistake to begin with.  We do frequent this location since it's by our house, but we know there will be long waits in the drive thru and will need to check our order every time. It's absurd that they can't figure it out. The owners need a complete rehab of management and quality control at this location. OWNERS PLEASE READ.
