We came to grab a rare 'fast food' couple of tacos and fiesta taco salads, no 'Drive Thru light was lit but a huge line in the drive thru so we parked thinking we scored with inside service as sometimes happens and got out and there was a sign on the door that said written in pen on a white piece of paper ' due to short staff our lobby is closed' ( wonder how many hours that has really been there ) a group of boys were in there looking like they hoped to not move at all and get us all to turn around. Within 10 minutes the 9 cars in front of us hadn't moved at all and so we turned around and left. I have worked in fast food to high end food and we all know there may be an hour or two where you have to 'Care' and try hard for others even though it's not pleasant and it looks like this location can't handle one late night rush from 9-10:30 , just huff it like the rest of us hard workers out here too late to cook - we're going to Arby's .

I'm not afraid to give a fast food place 5 stars but this wasn't it.  Food was good and the employees were nice.  Service was really slow, they were out of chicken & all fountain drinks at lunch hour (I'm not even dinging them for that since I didn't order that but they told others), and they call customers "guests" which loses a point right there.
Third time in a row now I figured I'd review. Every time I ask for "No Cheese" they repeat the order "no cheese" and I still get cheese. It even says no cheese on the receipt.
Ordered my kids the nacho boxes and when I got to the win do they were on their side. So when we got home they were a mess. I had to ask for a bag because the boxes even had food all over.

So far I haven't had a bad experience with this TACO BELL location. Our food is aways up fast and everything is correct. Since covid it's take out or drive thru only . Take out or drive thru both move fast

AVOID THIS LOCATION. One of the seediest. It's a haven for vagrant junkies that makes it an extremely unpleasant environment to be a customer. I've seen one male transient bragging to another male transient about a pair of shoes he shop lifted right outside the door. It is obvious that unlawful possession of controlled substance is probably happening based on blood splattered from hypodermic syringes on bathroom ceiling and walls from time to time.

God this place has gone to shit ever since online delivery. They are running this place with two people, one of which  is a socially awkward male that just stares down at the counter top in between customers (not working) while the girl slaves in the kitchen. 

30 minutes waiting for a 3 item meal. Fantastic service there.

Three stars based solely on the customer service and not the food. The girl behind the counter not only was warm and welcoming but managed to handle the register, plus the dining room. If only the food matched the quality of the service this would be a much higher rating. My food was cold and the taco shells were stale.
Booooo! Grub HUB you suck with Taco Bell!!!! You can't even deliver a simpler order in a timely manor let alone send a notification OR ANSWER YOUR PHONE?! What a joke! Both or you!
Very rude. Poor customer service. Recently been here twice and they didn't accommodate a group of friends and I, in the proper way
Looking for a quick vegan option? Get tacos with rice, black beans, lettuce, and tomato. Sure, there are healthier vegan options but if you're in a pinch for time, this will do the trick.

I can't believe I'm reviewing a Taco Bell but I just have to. They are always SO kind and cool at this location. Very friendly, accommodating and sweet to my pup. We went just now and my boyfriend accidentally dropped his card during the hand off. My boyfriend put the car in park and began to open the door to go grab it, but before he even could the employee reached all of the way out of the window to get it for him.
I have worked in many customer service jobs and it's so easy to get jaded, but everyone here is always friendly.

The service was ok and the food was ok. My main issue was to hear the manager berate his employee(s) while customers were still dining. I have been a Supervisor and know that employees may not always be fully capable, yet common decency is not embarrass employee(s) in front of each other or the public. We are all human beings that are adults whom should all share common respect towards one another.

This Taco Bell is horrible they can't admit to ruining an order completely. They also charged us for items we didn't want when we went back to get the food that we paid for and did not receive. This location is terrible and needs new management, the current manager Joey did not do his job correctly and was not able to admit that he not only spoke to us through the phone about the charge issue but played dumb when we walked INTO the store to receive what we needed. And then gave us a receipt with additional food that we were charged for but that we were never given.

I'm patient,  I am kind....  I work in the restaurant industry.    

You want me to wait in a freaking 15 minute line just to completely give me the wrong order.
Can't justly give me correct change from 11.65
Language barrier so understands are wrong
When I call just to give a heads up, because whatever random food is in there will have to do, I have a hangry family....  "Derick" on the phone first says, just hello...
After talking to what feels like my 3 year old on the phone...  I over hear him telling his co workers...  "I'm trying to  correct this broads order, can you please just take care of it."
No...  I won't come back to get my correct order after your hair brain demanded $15 an hour employee can run my food through the gutter..  
It's taco bell..  I get it..  but fuck!, c'mon!!!

Whoever the f was working at 3:30 pm today was the rudest drive through man I've ever seen. He is beyond lucky I am saved cause if I have you again I promise you i will snap the f out on you. Stop being so disrespectful. Get your attitude in check cause you had the wrong one on the right day.

This is probably the slowest Taco Bell that i have ever been in my life. 25 min waiting for my order and when i asked about it they said: your name is not even on the screen we have a lot of big orders pending. WTF so i had to ask for a refund of my money.

I had some late night cravings for nacho fries and came here. The drive through line was long and a little on the slow side. I ordered my nacho fries and a Mexican pizza. I've had the Mexican pizza many times before, but have never had one turn out so bad. The toppings weren't evenly spread on the top, and the worst part was the fried tortilla they used to make it. They somehow did something to it to give it an overpowering bitter taste, making it inedible. I ended up throwing it out. Fortunately, the nacho fries were good.

You did it again Taco Bell. How is this possible to get worse than before. 

If i could give less stars i SO this place is the worst customer service I've ever dealt with. We were at the drive thru and The woman was so very rude. My questions were simple, i couldn't read the sign and I've never ordered breakfast from Taco Bell so i wanted to know what was in certain things on the menu. Her answers were rude, cut off and not very helpful. All i asked was "what's in the bfast burrito" and "what's in the crunch wrap" she huffed loudly on the intercom. When all was said and done, i got the Sausage bfast burrito and after paying went to leave  i said "thank you so much have a wonderful day" as i normally do, worked customer service and sometimes just a simple thank you with a smile can change a persons day, apparently not this woman's... she replied "yep" and slammed the window. I drove off in shock and was very glad i only spent $1.50 there. I went down the street to Burger King and was greeted with amazing customer service and a smile. I will never be returning to this location. Maybe a little training in customer service will help. It's not about what you do it's about how well you do it.

I love Taco Bell but this one here is by far the worst one! The cashier Leocadio was rude, disrespectful and has horrible customer service skills! I let the manager know and she had the nerve to tell me that she knows he wouldn't be rude and wouldn't do that. She doesn't even know because she was cleaning the Lobby!! I had to go thru the drive through 3 times because first they forgot something that I ordered and then I went back through because a combo I order was all wrong and the third time was because I wanted to let the manager know what happened but that didn't do any good so I asked her for the district manager's name. I get it if the cashier was having a bad day or it was busy all at once but you dont treat your customers like shit! This is why I give this Taco Bell 1 star

This is the worst Taco Bell ever, seems like everyone here is on something. Very unprofessional service, burritos are not wrapped properly. You could tell they just half ass everything. Messed my order EVERY TIME. Never coming here again

Sometimes I have business that takes me to the Northwest 21st and Burnside Neighborhood. This Taco Bell does it right. Usually, there are many people working here... and most of them speak Spanish... I practice speaking Spanish with them. This is close to Downtown Portland, Oregon... so there are Certain people that you should avoid. You know,... the smelly and rude people. Not all of those people are without Homes, you know. There are a few TriMet Bus routes that will let you get close to the front door of this Taco Bell. And, yes for the amount of funds I spend at this Taco Bell... I am rewarded with really, really Good tasting Tacos. Did you know... not everyone likes to eat Mexican foods. Although, Taco Bell is more American style foods... in case you were wondering. I have tasted the Baja Blast drink... it's sooooo Deeelicious. Also, there is usually some Orange Juice if you are eating your Breakfast here. And, if you need any Pepsi products for your afternoon Choice of drinks... you can get a cup to go here. Finally, if you need a Pink Lemonade buy it here.

Worst Taco Bell out there. Slow slow slow in the drive in. Went three times in two months both times out of taco meat and was told all three times it would be 30-35mins. The last time the manager Lily stated she could stretch the meat to make the 12 taco party meal.  So you don't have enough but can complete my order with out enough meat. Oh did I said slow slow slow.  The young girls on the drive in mike was rather rude.
One because I can't give a zero. Asked what sauce we wanted and then gave us none, also gave me a beef quesarito when I ordered a chicken one. Terrible service.

Have given this location multiple chances and every time they seem to have the utmost difficulty of getting a single order right and there always seems to be an issue with the drive through. The last time they gave my vegetarian girlfriend food filled with beef which happened to be our last straw. Save yourself the trouble and go to one of the many other locations.
Worst Taco Bell ever. I felt sick after I ate my meal. The Mexican pizza was stale and the bean burrito had old beans. Do not go!
I can honestly say that this is one of the worst tacos bells I have ever been too.  Can't do that place again.  If you have the time to wait they have plenty of time to make you waste...
The food was disgusting. What a waste! They got the order wrong and just threw the items in the bag.  The meat was so dry and hard to chew. Everything was a sloppy mess!

i just like taco bell and the $5 box is the absolute best.
more food than i could eat by myself.
if you are on a budget, this is a good buy.

PRO:
- Lots of fun people work here! They tell me stories.
- I've never had problems with the food here.
- Close to Dutch Brothers Coffee.
- Freeze machines work!

CONS:
- Tricky to get into parking lot if you need to turn left.
- Sometimes homeless people approach your car.
- Drive through exits onto Burnside so it's hard to leave safely when the street is busy.

Taco Bell is dependable. Every time we go, we know what to expect. We usually order from the value menu & switch up what we get from their. The service is great. The store is not the cleanest but the prices are good.

every damn time!! i ask for no tomatoes and u see them ring it up right but who i ever is making the food just can not get it right. do they not know what "no tomatoes" stands for???  every damn time!

I'm not necessarily leaving a review for the food (although it was good), but rather my experience. I stopped in here today with some coworkers for lunch, and the guy who took our order was just a genuinely nice guy. He was friendly and sociable while taking our order, but he really showed that he is a truly caring person when a lady came in asking for a free taco because she had no money. They were speaking in spanish, so we didnt understand everything that was going on, but we asked him as we were leaving and he said he bought her something to eat with his money. I wish we had gotten his name, he was a Hispanic guy. He said he has only been there for 2 months, but He deserves a raise and a promotion!

It's Taco Bell...at it's worst. Unfriendly and aggressive. The ingredients are old and stale tasting. Cheese in quesadilla not completely melted, Chalupa bread cold  old not heated up..etc..pretty pretty bad...

I can't believe I'm reviewing a Taco Bell but I just have to. They are always SO kind and cool at this location. Very friendly, accommodating and sweet to my pup. We went just now and my boyfriend accidentally dropped his card during the hand off. My boyfriend put the car in park and began to open the door to go grab it, but before he even could the employee reached all of the way out of the window to get it for him.
I have worked in many customer service jobs and it's so easy to get jaded, but everyone here is always friendly.

This Taco Bell is Aweful!! I just ordered and they gave me the wrong drink, no plastic wear to eat mashed potatoes, no napkins, and worst of all there was this big piece of plastic I just found in my bean burrito-disgusting! Don't go!

Each time I've gone my order has been wrong. They're all extremely rude and they close an hour early most nights but stay in the store until they're suppose to leave. They say there registers are down as an excuse to close early but it's every time.
Everything was super fresh tasting, and they were packed full of all the fillings, not just lettuce like some locations. Probably one of the best bean and cheese burritos in a very long time!

This is the fourth time coming here for lunch.All four times my order has been wrong.Today for the second time in a row my cheesy bean and rice burrito didn't have rice.Dont even know how that's possible so consistently.
Horrible horrible service. Will never go to the Tualatin Taco Bell ever again. They always manage to mess up the order.
Not only did they get rid of the only good things on their menu, but it took 25 minutes for 3 burritos that were 90% rice.
Vinchenzio in the morning shift team taco associate gives A+ customer service . I'm a regular customer and he takes care of my orders with a great Personality .

They should hire somebody to put a sign on the door that says that there's not enough staff to serve anybody and that's why the drive-thru is wrapped around the block and the lobby is not open. If I were the person franchising this Taco Bell I would fire everybody here and replace them with the staff from the neighboring Fred Meyer.

We started going here for their veggie bowl with taco meat and extra cheese minus rice.  It meets my diabetes diet and food tastes good.  I can order and pay for it on my iPhone and it's ready when we get there.  It's tasty, fast, cheap and we get to eat in our car.

I've been to this tacobell multiple times, and it's definitely an average tacobell. It really manages to capture their generic flavor, and rarely messes up my order. Now of course, I've been there a few times where they'd be out of something ridiculous like lettuce or beef, but it's proximity to my house and kind staff members really make up for the inconsistency. All in all, poor management, but not worth avoiding.

This is a horrible location, don't come here. I literally waited at the drive thru for thirty minutes. There was no workers there, very bad attitudes and the food was cold. I tried to leave the drive thru but I couldn't due to the small lane.

Prior to this recent visit, I haven't had Taco Bell since the early 2000's. Now I remembered why it took me this long to return. And after this past visit, even frozen dinners are better than eating what this place passes on as "food."

The online ordering system is great, as they have expanded their menus since my last visit, 1-star. You can order online and go through the drive-thru to pick-up, rather than trying to figure out what you want while you're at the drive-thru. We ordered:

- Nacho Cheese Doritos Locos Tacos Supreme
- Meximelt 
- Mexican Pizza
- Nacho Supreme
- Burrito Supreme

It was as gross as I remembered. Not only was all the food room temperature, it was mushy and disgusting! I would never subject anyone to eat here unless you want to punish them. Yes, it's that bad and expect to 'make a run for the "toilet"' afterwards. This is the perfect reminder that life is too short to eat crap like this!

Gone here multiple times and I would say 95% of the time they forget the sauce that they charge 50¢ a piece for. Ordered two sides of creamy jalapeño sauce and it wasn't in the bag. Drove back through the drive thru and they had the nerve to just give me one after I had paid for 2 less than five minutes ago. The employees don't care about the business or providing great customer service. Probably won't go back as they forget something every single time I go there.

My order was wrong and I went back through the drive thru to advise of the mistake. They took back the quesarido and took out the steak and replaced it with beef instead of making a new one. This is during the pandemic. Never will I ever visit this Taco Bell!!! All these young kids working should be fired!

2 STARS FOR THIS LOCATION??? MORE LIKE 5
STARS. I went to this location on my way home from the movies, & I typically ask for "a lot of mild sauce... like a lot A lot". When I get home, it's 7 measly packets & the butt end of my burrito is dry EXECPT FOR TONIGHT.  I asked for a lot of mild sauce at the drive thru, as per usual, then proceeded to ask for "hella mild sauce" when I got to the window bc today was hard enough & I just wanted two bomb cheesy bean & rice burritos to finish my day. I DONT KNOW WHO WAS WORKING THE WINDOW (cute girl, white shirt with Taco Bell sign raining rainbow on back- maybe a manager??- Around 9:45 Pm) BUT ALL HAIL. I could tell she was annoyed at my request (as would I, a fellow over-qualified earth-angel  stuck in the service industry,) but did she not throw this dog a bone! Love this location- in proximity to my house, there is a closer Taco Bell, but I will remain loyal to this one.

Rude issue #1
We were delayed with no one waiting behind us in line so that an employee could have their meal behind the counter rung up. It is very rude to make the customers wait. 
Rude issue #2 The gal behind the counter steps out and grabs a mob, and gets the whole floor wet right between us and the drink station 4 steps away. No "sorry" and no safety cones. Rude and dangerous.

The cheesy rice and bean burritos were only so-so

I come to this location often cause it's on my way home and it's quick and convenient after a long day. 

It's a hit 'n miss here. From getting good customer service to even getting all of your food the first time around. 

While it's been better lately, I've had multiple times of miscommunication and had to come back.

Their hours are 7am until late in the early morning.

No drive-thru. More expensive than other Taco Bells. And impressively slow. As of typing this (after logging into the site, getting to this page) they have taken 2 small orders. Wow.

Also, they hide the sauces so you have to ask for them. And then give you 2 packets total.
Older Hispanic guy was rude and acted annoyed when I let them know my order was wrong on the drive through display.

Benjamin K. was great! The food was awesome - got 2 fresh Doritos Locos tacos & a loaded nacho bell grande with a perfect Baja Blast drink! Don't let the horrid reviews steer you away! I'm new to the area & will definitely be back. Thx

Intensely unfriendly, slow, and unhygienic. Wouldn't help at all with questions about the app, took forever to fill a small, simple order, and people working in the kitchen were wearing masks below their noses. It's cheap food that could potentially come at a grave cost. AVOID.

Folk, save your money and "dine" elsewhere. We used to pick up food here quite often, until the other establishment opened up. Customer service, with one exception (Lilly), is simply lacking. I pick my daughter up from after school practice and often pick up a snack for her. The wait has become tedious and seems to be getting longer and longer. I really think they should make this a drive-through only restaurant as that is where the focus is...not on the clientele that chooses to eat at a table rather the front seat (or back) of their car. I have placed orders and the waited even longer, and over the past several months, get home only to find the order was filled incorrectly. Folks, if fast food is your choice, there are other locations that will actually fill your order correctly, and do it with a smile and kind word.

I visited the drive thru yesterday and the food was  awful. It looked like it had been sitting for hours, it was completely deflated and the lettuce was mushy so it's obvious it wasn't freshly prepared. Severely disappointed especially because it wasn't busy or anything so they definitely had time to make it fresh.

We dropped in on a cold crisp Wednesday early evening I ordered an Enchirito and a double decker Supreme taco and both were excellent. 
Service was reasonably quick but they guy that took our order was a little stiff and maybe wasn't having a good day. 

I'd return.

This place screws up the order every time. If you want sauce you better check the bag. What the heck is the point of asking if I want sauce, if you're not going to put it in the bag. Just avoid this place.
